reviews.review: Great transport alternative. The ferry service in Sydney is great. As well as getting you from A to B you get a visual explosion of views no matter where you travel in the harbour. The ferries are old but clean & reliable. They run to a strict timetable & are easily visible with their green & yellow colour. They are well used by locals & tourists alike. It was not expensive either for the convenience, rather than taking your car.

Short ride. Always get a ferry or two when visiting Sydney.This trip was a week day from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay.Good way to see main sites, changes to Harbour area and rest our feet.Very easy with Opal card. Ferry staff very friendly helping tourist take photos with the usual iconic landmarks.

A great way to get around. Sydney has an outstanding ferry service to get around the harbour area. We used it to quickly travel to meetings and dinner around the city. Other cities with harbours should look to Sydney for tips. The service was always on time, was fast and efficient, and really inexpensive. Even without guides, it is still and good way to see the sites.

60th birthday. Syd-Manly-Syd - our beautiful harbour so convenient to meet with friends at The Rocks or Opera Bar. Visited daughter & back on train to Central station & then on home using Opal card - fantastic - great weekend
Great ferry from Mosman Bay to Opera House. Great views, cheap ferry, very affordable and quick way to get around with great views. they only seem to be very 30/60 mins

Low cost enjoyment. Sydney ferries are part of the public transport system and are cheap to use. They will take you virtually anywhere on the harbour, including Taronga Park Zoo, Darling Harbour, Doyles at Watsons Bay and the River Cats up the Parramatta River to the historic suburb of Parramatta. Photo opportunities everywhere.

Best mode of Transport for sightseeing. The ferries are very affordable and bring you everywhere in the harbor so you can take tons of great pictures of the Opera Hous, the Harbour Bridge and the Sydney skyline. And we even had some dolphins following us what a great time. At $15 max for a whole day of crusing with the ferries, buses and trains a real bargain and no need to pay for tours.

Great views, rather affordable, a must: circular ferry trip. This time it started raining when I went to Sydney for an outdoor activity with two young grandchildren. We decided to take the ferry at Circular Quay for a round (circular trip). Great idea! Sydney is always beautiful, specially observed from the water, even in a rainy day. Great views! As the ferry is part of the public transport, this is an as affordable solution. We had transportation cards.
Windy but great!. Took the ferry to Taronga zoo - was quick and efficient despite being a windy day - wasn't too crowded....
Easy way to get around. . Very easy way to get around and see the Sydney harbors attractions. Great photo opportunity. Relatively cheap way to travel around too.

Syney Harbour ferries. Best harbour in the world for very inexpensive and extensive amount of ferry trips...only get the government ferries and river cats (up to Parramatta) my favourite is the Manly ferry ..40minutes ea way and run constantly...the Watsons Bay ferry is a good trip out to the Gap and Doyles seafood eateries.

A must-do... for everyone travelling to Sydeny. Took the ferry to Manley from Sydney Harbour. A wonderful and memorable trip sailing out alongside the iconic Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Beautiful views on both the northern shore suburbs and the Eastern suburbs on the way out to Manley. Manly is well worth a visit too. It has a lovely 'village' feel with great beaches and a fabulous seafood restaurant opposite the Manley terminal (see review for Garfish) I think it is a must-do for anyone visiting Sydney, as the city is all about the harbour and the estuary and this is the perfect way to experience it..

Cheapest way to see Sydney Harbour. You can spend 6AUD for a one-way ferry trip that will take you out into the Harbour where you'll get fantastic views of the Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House. Depending on the route you choose you'll get a chance to see Luna Park up close, visit Taronga Zoo or any number of the attractions at Darling Harbour (Madame Tussauds, the aquarium and the Maritime museum to name a few).Just make sure you check the timetables as they don't run 24x7. You'll need an Opal card. They can be bought at the airport, Circular Quay and many newsagents, post offices and supermarket. If you have a smartphone you can download the app and register your card, keep track of the balance and top it up wherever you are. Two important points though, make sure you swipe your Opal card when boarding and again when disembarking or you may be overcharged for your journey. There are signs everywhere reminding you. Also if you need to top up your balance then if you use the app there is a 40AUD minimum top up per card. If you use one of the top up machines at Circular Quay or any of there other ports then you can top up with a minimum of 10AUD per card. And you can register all Opal cards for the family on the one smartphone account.

Relaxing. With two bad backs between us, we needed a quiet day and the two hour return from Circular quay to Sydney Olympic Park did the trick. Friendly staff, smooth ride and great views and very cheap. Loved it.

Relaxing way to get around Sydney's waterways. Great way to get around Sydney. Love the relaxing ride on these old girls of the harbour. What a great way to get around and see our Beautiful Harbour! It's amazing the sights you see that you wouldn't see normally.

A day on the water. Meet your friends at circular quay, jump on a ferry to manly... a lovely relaxing 30 minute trip.. pop into the Stein hotel for a drink and fish and chips, or get takeaway and go to the beach...... grab and ice cream and take the ferry back to the quay.....such a nice way to spend the day in Sydney..
Crew were great. During our visit all the ferries were on time, the crew were all professional and helpful and the view from the ferry is fantastic.

Brit couple travelling Oz. Sydney has it all..! . Great service.. Took the public ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour earlier today. Various stop off's along the way, interesting mini harbour cruise.. can hop on/off for no extra cost as ticket valid for the whole day. Had to purchase an Opal travel card from resellers or authorised agents prior to boarding, 1 per person, have to load it up with $20AUD min but NO cash. Opal card also valid for public transport that includes the public buses. All in all a great service..

PERFECTION !!!. The reliable ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. It never changes which is terrific. On time, so cheap for 30 minute trip across the beautiful harbour. On a busy Sunday at midday and returning 4 hours later after lunch both trips were great. The new Opal card to pay the ferry is efficient and fast. The staff at Circular quay were very pleasant too.Fantastic !!!
Cheap way to travel and fun. We went to Balmain by ferry via Darling Harbour. The ferry ride was very good and Balmain is a hidden Gem, a lovely suburb steeped in history.

Easy fast and convenient . Sydney ferries are a great way to get about town...
I often take the parramatta to city ferry then on to Watson Bay or Manly
Parking available at Rydalmere if you need it

Cuts travel time. The quickest way to visit most places along the harbour. Staff are very tourist friendly and patient. Opal cards can be purchased at the airport, visitor centres and other places throughout Sydney. Credit top-up machines are located at almost every ferry stop. The Manly ferry gets pretty busy on a weekend. Once a ferry load of passenger has tagged through, the gates close and remaining passengers have to wait for the next ferry. The operators are also very strict about the gate close time and won't open them. Plan your trip and arrive early so you don't get locked out and don't abuse the crew because you get locked out and miss the ferry; they're doing their job and adhering to safety protocols. It's a great service.
Ferry to Manly Beach. Very efficient ferry crossing. The commentary on the boat was excellent. Manly Beach lived up to expectation & the leisurely lunch at the Boathouse was excellent too.
excellant way to travel. the opera house and the bridge wonderful from the ferry passing the coastline and seeing the sea gulls following the ferry also passing Fort Denison a wonderful sight

Best way to get around in Sydney and suburb!. Sydney Ferries is the public transport network for the hole Sydney incl. suburb by the sea! It's easy, fast and even cheap especially on a sunday, all day $2,5!
On time, efficient and fun.. Great rides to Manley, harbor in general and just for the experience. Probably smart to get some kind of a daily or multiple day pass, which we didn't.

Absolute must. Top up you Opal Travel card and go anywhere and everywhere you can by Ferry. It is truly tge best way to see this city by day or night. A ferry to Watsons Bay followed by walk across to the Gap Heads walkway for spectacular VIEWS , picnic in the park, fush and chips on the wharf or high tea on the verandah of the historic homestead is perfection. Or under the bridge at night in the direction of Balmain past a vibrantly lit Lunar Park ..all the exploring is amazing. Check final ferry times if you ard wanting returns. .I got caught out missing the last ferry back to Circular Quay at 4.45pm from Watsons. .but the spectacular bus ride back to central via Bondi was just as much fun. LOVE THESE FERRIES.

Great mde of transportation. The Sydney ferries are a wonderful way to go to various places throughout the area. We took the ferry to go to Manly, Darking Harbour, and to simply view the city from the water. It is clean, comfortable, has Wifi, and is reseanably priced.

Great Fun. Let me start by saying I was a tourist and not someone who commutes using the ferries. However, if you are in Sydney on a break they are a great way to get around. WE went to Mossman one day. Manly Beach on another and even had a trip to Cockatoo Island one evening. Iconic views of the Bridge, Opera House and the city skyline by day and by night and all for around $6 per trip. We loved them...

See the harbour like the locals - and at locals rates!. I mentioned in my review of the Coogee to Bondi walk that Sydney's best two attractions are also it's cheapest. Using Sydney's ferries are the second to none in showing off the city's most famous and attractive asset - the harbour. Whether it's the ferry between Circluar Quay to Manly, which takes you across the heads, or simple a scoot across from the city to an inner city location like Milson Point or Balmain, there's no better way to experience the harbour just like a local - and just for the cost of a normal commuter trip, covered by the handy Opal card.

Took it to Manly. Easy, and relaxing way to get across the Harbor from Sydney to Manly. Beautiful at sunset! The ferry from leaves every 15 minutes and takes no more than about 20 to get to Manly which is a great spot to explore

Great way to see the sights. Whether its is for a short trip across to the Zoo or out to Watsons Bay or Manly the Ferry cruise gives you a way to see the harbour and the houses big and small interspersed by tiny beaches and areas of bushland. A myriad of little craft zip out of your way and even the occasional kayaker. Restful mid hours or busy in peak hours as many people commute into the city to work via the ferries.

Sydney Ferry Ride. A ride on any one of the many different Sydney commuter ferry journeys is definitely a worthwhile experience to gain some insight into the magnificance of Sydney Harbour. Whether it just be a round trip to Watson's Bay, or to enable you a visit to the fabulous Taronga Zoo or simply across the Heads to the three surfing beach areas at Manly, (Manly, North Steyne and Queenscliffe now known as Freshwater) a "ferry-ride" is a must-do item when visiting Sydney.

Best way to travel in Sydney, for all visitors wanting to see the harbour and its waterside attractions... The only way to travel, if your destination is anywhere near the harbour side of Sydney, or up the Parramatta River.
Best way to see the harbour for cheap. Iconic Sydney ferries. Go on a Sunday to Manly and see the harbour for $2.50, though it is often packed with tourists.
Trip around harbour. The ferries are a great & enjoyable way to get around our great city & as pensioners very affordable
Kings Wharf to Circular Quay best $4 wind down therapy. Get on this service at sunset to see the evening settle on the Opera House. Stunning way to wind down the day.

great way to see the harbour on a budget. We have travelled the ferries often taken interstate family and friends on a trip try the manly ferry for a day trip or go to Watsons Bay and have fish and chips or do the coastal walk all ferries offer excellent views for a fraction of a tour just read up on sydney sights or take a guide book they even have wifi
A relaxing journey. A relaxing way to get around the harbour and enjoy the sites, easy on off , and great staff a must while in Sydney

Sydney Ferries - The perfect way to get around. Sydney is built on the water and Sydney Ferries offer a very efficient way to explore the whole area. They run on a regular basis and really should be part of your vacation. In general the conditions are very smooth so unlikely to feel motion sickness.A few years ago you could buy tickets for a fixed period of time which was very good value. Now it seems you have to preload a card called Opal and each trip is subtracted as you scan the card when you get on and off. Trips seem to cost around Aus $7 each time. Would be nice if tourists were offered senior rates where applicable but these seem to be unavailable. Would also like to see weekly discounts reintroduced.
Sydney Ferries. You can take the train to Circular Quay station. When you het off, you will see 5-6 piers. I chose to go the zoo. It was very convenience, nice view.
Most efficient. I preferred riding the ferries over using the transit buses. Great views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. They go to all the main points of interest quickly.

Fun and Cheap!!. Road the farries from Circular Quay to the Zoo across the harbor. Was a good way of seeing the city of Sydney and there were many photo opportunities of the City, Bridge and Oprah House. The ride was fast and there was no wind so the harbor was not choppy. Is teh best way to travel from down town Sydney to the Zoo both a must while staying in the city.
Ideal. Just what we needed to get around.All the ferries we used were on time. They were tidy and got us to our destination safely and in good time.

Tourism in Sydney . While visiting Sydney my wife and I used the harbor ferries regularly for various trips to Manly Beach and Darling Harbor (the Aussies and Brits spell this as harbour). The ferries run regularly to many points and are enjoyable to use once you figure out the schedules and fares. The captains maneuver the ferries like they are skiffs - amazing! Get an Opal card (the fare card) available in most convenience stores, start with about $20 and add funds to the card as needed depending on your travels. We used an "add fare" kiosk at the ferry terminal. The Opal card can be used on trains, ferries, and busses.TRT

where to stay. find a place to stay near a ferry stop and travel around Sydney becomes dead easy. I f the ferry doesn't take you near where you want to go they all go to circular quay where you can get a train or bus to your destination.
Sunday all day free. Sunday all day free ride where you go , so I and my children went to all over .one after another we change ferries, It was fun ride on .

Excellent way to get around!. Sydney's ferries are extremely efficient and operate very timely. Relatively inexpensive but you should pick up an Opal Card and load your money on it. You need the card to swipe at the entry to the ferry. We ended up not using $6 AUD each on our cards and I don't know if you can get a refund but doubt it. It's a little bit of a gamble to try to figure out how much you need to put on the card. There are machines that you can add more funds, so it's not difficult.

It a most when visited Sydney!. For your eye pleasure, make yourself a favor an take one of the ferrys around Sydney harbour. We took the one to Five Docks and on the way back the wiuvs of the city where worth remembering our visit there.If you take a trip plane to have meal at one of the restaurants in all destinations, pub food is very good in Australia!

Great transport. Great transport links around Sydney. It's quite intuitive to use the payment machines. The ferries are comfortable but more importantly they go regularly and they go to the main non CBD attractions which is what matters. Don't waste time on taxis. Use the ferries!
David Lyttle . Get yourself an Opel card first at the quay . These ferries open the bay to you . They are frequent and clean and run well into the evening

You can make yourself a great tour.. Walking in the Sunday accident we decided to get on the first ferry. We get off at a random stop, where we found a museum.
Then we got another random ferry and hid myself again on a random stop. We found a beautiful park. And again and again.

Great way to see the harbour. Spent Sunday on the harbour getting on and of Ferries and all for $2.50. Stunning value for money, a comfortable and relaxing way to look around Sydney harbour and see so many different things and still take time out to walk around some of the stops. With their Orb card, getting the train back from Parramatta was al part of the cost and all so easy. Best day out we have had for a long time and didn't even have to drive.

The only way to go. Fast and fun way to get around beautiful Sydney harbor to travel to the Zoo, Darling Harbor, Manly Beach, and just about everywhere. Don't get these confused with private ferries (Captain Cook, FantaSeas, etc.) which are more touristy and expensive.

Still a good trip. Whilst in Sydney, we always include a ferry trip from Circular Quay out to the beach town of Manly. It is still a great way to see the Bridge, Opera House, the cruise terminal and a major part of the outer harbour. The last trip we took was marred somewhat by the lack of ticket agents who had just been replaced by ticket machines that worked erratically and had long queues. Single trip becoming a bit expensive but were advised to get a travel card for unlimited travel around Sydney. Still a must do in Sydney but allow time for the dratted ticket machines.

Very Impressive. Took a ferry ride from Breakfast Point to Circular Quay. (First Australian ferry ride in 18 years.) I was really impressed with everything. They are run very efficiently. Very fast, very efficient helpful crew, clean ferries. Very nice views of everything including the Anzac and Harbour bridges from the ferry. Everything perfect. No complaints whatsoever. Highly recommended.
A bargain for a tourist. It is an inexpensive way to tour the harbor. Take the ferry to Manly and return. Very scenic. And we liked walking around Manly on the sea side.

Great transport network. We took the ferry from Olympic Park where we were staying to Circular Quay. The journey has spectacular views at numerous points of the trip, as well as views of some incredible houses and villas. The highlights were visiting Darling Harbour and coming up to the Sydney Harbour Bridge
Great value tour of the harbour. Sydney harbour is one of the top places n my bucket list and seeing it on the ferries is wonderful. Go to Watsons Bay and chill

Convenient but often times crowded. Most of my experiences with the ferries have been good. But a couple times I've gotten to the wharf early and tapped on to ensure a spot on the ferry, but people just start cramming toward the entrance. A couple weeks ago a friend and I tried to take the Watsons Bay ferry. We go there 20 min early to ensure our spot, but so many people started coming and pushing and cutting their way through that we didn't even end up getting on. It would've been another 30 min till the next ferry and who knows if we would've been pushed out of that one too. Ended up going on a random other one. Very disappointing.

Buy your Opal Card!. I guess seeing Sydney by ferry is a fun way to explore the city! They are a part of the public transport and my favourite. Also, they are little bit pricey but worth the ride. Sunday is probably the best day to use them because you pay 2.50 $ once and everything is for free the rest of the day. Once again, in order to use the public transport in Sydney buy your Opal Card at every 7Eleven.
Great way of getting around Sydney. Going by ferry is a fantastic way of getting around the various attractions Sydney has to offer and the views on the harbour are magnificient.

a nice trip across Sydney harbour. tickets were hard to get not having an opal card. ticket machine wasn't working and missed our ferry waiting for our tickets.luckily ferries to Darling Harbour run quite frequently so wasn't too much of a problem. sitting outside upfront in the sun was lovely

fun on ferry day. Excellent way of seeing the harbour, make sure you get an opal card and tap on tap off. So much fun hoping on and off these professionally run and reliable ferries. Lots of interesting stops Watson Bay nice pub on the waterside. Manly great for shops and safe beach for swimming.
Best way to travel. Loved travelling around Sydney by ferry! Great way to see the harbour and makes so many places accessible. Opal pass is the best and easiest tag on/off payment system I have used.

Great way to see beautiful Sydney Harbour. We recently used the ferries for some sightseeing around Sydney. Our favourite trip was from Circilar Quay across to Manly - the trip was about 30 minutes and only cost approx $2 one way - what a bargain. There are many other destinations to choose from. They are fast and comfortable. Toilets are onboard and I think the ferry that we were on also had a snack bar. The ferry services don't use paper tickets. You need to pirchase an OPAL card and put some cash on it then just 'tap' on and off the ferries and buses. For the tourist the cards are valid for 9 years. You can get any left-over credit refunded back to you if you register your card.
Good sevice. Went to Manly by ferry and it was a very quick tripAnd a very pleasant trip across the harbour, was good to be back on the water after all these years away

Water taxi. Love the old ferries around circular quay it's such a great way to see the cityWe took one to manly and loved it, it's such a busy stretch of water with numerous sizes of vessels on the water for pleasure and commercial use and it's beautiful in the darkness of night when you have the city a glo with lightsThe ferries are old but safe and have a cafe and toilet facilities

Very cheap and efficient services. Used these a few times to get to the north shores. No hassles at all. The opal card for touch on/off is great and there are maximum daily rate caps and cheaper to free routes on weekends.
Great little ferrues. Love riding the ferries. Sad one can't buy a glass of wine on way back home after a busy walking day.

Easy and fun. Caught the ferry to and from Manly Beach. Really fabulous photo opportunities for the. Ridge and opera house. Sat on Manly Beach for a couple of hours, had lunch by the water and headed back.

Staff and view top notch WELL DONE "GAVIN". We caught the Ferry from Darling Harbour to luna park and back.The trip and views was awesome and fun but the highlight was the staff on the ferry.A member by the name "Gavin" deserves a special mention, he went around the ferry asking any one if they would like him to take a photo on their cameras of them with the view behind them, brilliant fellas. We got a great Family photo in-front of the Harbour Bridge couldn't have had everyone in photo if "Gavin" hadn't had taken photo.He really went out of his way from greeting everyone coming on board, taking photos, being a positive character and thanking people when they got off - WELL DONE GAVIN WELL DONE.Would we use the ferry again?YES and are looking forward to doing so again
Great viewing trips. Take a ride to Manly and enjoy the sun, coast and fantastic views. The return and the views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House are simply the best.

World class performance, old school look. This is good this is very good it's nice here and water there in a boat it looks old it runs well you can see lots of stuff it's nice you go under the bridge you can get a nice little areas please have a nice time

Great way to see the city. Get an Opal card and they are great value and frequent so no long waits :) A lovley way to see the city and the harbour. We went over to Manly for the afternoon - lovely experience.

Pleasant walk from Milson's Point wharf to the Kirribilli Club. Caught the ferry from King St Wharf across the harbour to Milson's Point and then walked along the boardwalk past Wendy Whiteley's beautiful secret garden at Lavendar Bay to the Kirribilli Club for lunch. A most enjoyable picturesque stroll.

Great public transport. Grab an opal card and hop on a ferry We took the ferry from the maritime museum to circular quay, and also the ferry from the quay to Taronga zoo. The ferries are easy to get on and off(in good weather) as they use a ramp. Circular quay is also right next to the train station so easy access.

Great experience!. Hands down the best way to explore Sydney at its finest. Tired of walking? Tired of crowds of tourists? Tired of paying ridiculous amounts of money for food and drinks? Pack a bag lunch and head to Circular Quay. Buy a day multipass or any multi3 pass if you are staying more then a day. Pick any Ferry and take it roundtrip around all of Sydney's different harbors. It is great for taking photos of yourself with the city as a back ground or just taking photos from the water of the Opera House, the skyline, and all the different ports. Great way to spend any day, or multiple days exploring Sydney, Plus you can get off at any stop you want and back on whenever you want. My favorite Sydney experience for sure.

Don't waste money on harbour cruises,use the ferries.. Sydney Harbour is one of the best in the world, and the Sydney ferries help add to its character. Don't waste money on harbour cruises.... travel everywhere by ferry, Luna Park, Opera House, Manly Beach and heaps more. 10/10

Cute and with the opal system . I regularly use the ferries. I love the ocean and it takes me to Manly and other nice places. It's a different feeling, it's like sightseeing and it's connected to the opal system so you dont have to buy separate tickets to it.

Sydney Lover. This is a must on your first trip to Sydney.Lots to choose from including trips to Balmain,Hunter's Hill,Taronga Park Zoo,Watson's Bay,Paramatta and Manly.Do a little research.If you have limited time Manly return with a walk is probably the best,closely followed by Watson's bay with a walk and lunch.Try and stay outside and enjoy the views.

Very confusing ticket system. Being from darwin we found the ticket system very odd and confusing. We were told that we had to go to central station if we wanted to get a concession ticket but to get there we had to buy a single trip ticket. So in the end we ended up having to get 2 single trips each to get to the toronga zoo. Should be more information available for visitors and more signage so your not running up and down the dock to get tickets from different areas.
Swift journey. Great reliable service. We used them a couple of time to go to the zoo and to manly. Ferries r very vlean and plenty of seats with the option of going outside on some of them.

Great way to see the harbour. Circular Quay to Watsons Bay has to be one of the loveliest ferry rides in Sydney. Goes past Opera House, Rushcutters Bay and sees some of the most expensive real estate in Sydney.
What a great way to get around. The ferries are an amazing way to get around but also an awesome way to see much of the city. They are the best view of the Opera House and Bridge.

Great way to get around the most beautiful City in Australia. We use the ferries on all our Sydney visits. they are a great way to get around in a relaxed manner. they are always on time, clean and efficient.

Ferries. we used the Ferries several times, excellent, efficient way togo. A card, called an Opal Card is now used to pay forthe Ferries, Buses and Trains in Sydney, Most convenient storeshave them, you load cash on them and then just swipe to travel, as you enter, and leave, so the correct amount is withdrawn.The ferry was clean, on time, and a fun way to see the harbourand sights,
best way to get to the zoo. comfortable and very affordable ....great way to get to the Taronga Zoo .....school holidays, so a bit crowded, but not a long wait until next one arrived
Good views of the city. The boat is normal, nothing special, but you get a good view of Sydney from the ocean, so its nice to bring a camera.

Good trip took for ever to get a ticket to get on tho. Was a good day loved the trip to Manly although i had to wait for over 30 minutes to get a ticket as they have no one serving so you have to line up to get your tickt and they have only one machine running which is terrible

Fun Fun Fun. What a special treat , so many attractions around the harbour from the amazing taronga zoo , to fort dennison which is a popular tourist destination and the ferry ride in it self is great love our ferries x

Easy to understand, Even for tourist. The ferries are Easy to travel with and you get to you destination fast. Great scienic view of Sydney skyline. Pretty cheap. And the consept is Easy to understand Even as a foreigner. And i love that.

Cheapest way for amazing sights. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour - should have gone to Manly but we were short of time! The route takes you right under the Harbour Bridge and past Luna Park on your way back into the CBD. Superb views of the Harbour and it's really cheap with an Opal card.

Too easy to get a cheap and stunning ride around Syndey's harbour. Sydney Ferries make getting around the harbour cheap and easy! Anywhere else you'd pay a fortune to tour about on this stunning harbour, but you can tour across the harbour and up the Parramatta River for a few dollars. Plus you get to photograph this very photogenic city from another angle.A ferry to the Zoo is all part of the experience and we also caught the ferry to Watson's Bay to explore The Gap and have lunch at Doyle's. Ferries leave regularly and run on time. Check the timetable on the NSW transport for information on stops, departure times and which wharf at Circular Quay they depart from.
Fabulous way to get around. Very efficient and cost effective way to travel the Sydney waterways. The facilities were clean & staff courteous.

A Sydney Institution!. The ferry's are a charming aspect of Sydney's way of life! They are relatively expensive given other public ferry services in other cities! But they offer some great views of the city from the water. We took one to the taronga zoo and one to the darling harbour. The second one was the better one as we went under the bridge in that route! I would recommend sitting on the upper deck. You'll have better views!

Great way to see Sydney. Definitely a must do in Sydney, reasonably comfortable, very inexpensive (especially for seniors). Wonderful views and many iconic sites. Love the names of the ferries, many are named after Aussie sporting legends. Shane Gould, Marjorie Jackson, Louise Sauvage etc.

Fantastic . We caught a Ferry to Manly and it was simply fantastic, I would highly recommend this to any family, the ride up and back was very smooth and the view was spectacular. The Ferries leave right on time and are only 30 mins apart. Highly highly recommend.

Parramatta to Sydney . I used the Ferry all the way from Parramatta into Sydney. For 8 Dollar you get almost 1.5 hours of boat ride and See a lot of Sydney by the Waters. Make sure not to miss the last one, but there's also a way by train back to Parramatta. Manly Ferry by night is the best Panorama Picture of downtown.

BEST HARBOUR CRUISE VALUE. SYDNEY FERRIES are the public commuter ferry system servicing SYDNEY HARBOUR , If you are a local or a visitor Sydney Ferries are the best value for money to see SYDNEY HARBOUR. you can pay big money for a harbour cruise with a private company or do it your self on a public ferry, you see exactly the same thing.Ferries operate from Circular Quay and cruise all around the harbour, up the Parramatta river or even accrossto Manly.. Ferries operate 7 days a week but Sundays are the best Value for money when you can have unlimited travel on public transport for only $2.50.Does not apply to express ferries. Sit out side for the best view. LOVE SYDNEY FERRIES

Cheap and enjoyable way to see the sights in Sydney harbour. Even a short trip from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay will give you great views of the city, Luna Park, harbour bridge and opera house all for only a few dollars.

Not to be missed!. The ferries may look a bit tired but they are a great way to experience harbour and view all those waterfront icons of Sydney...not to be missed is Darling Harbour to Circular Quay route as it passes under the Harbour bridge. We avoided it due to hordes of tourists but if you are hardy sort, Sundays are best bet as your cost is restricted to $2.5 for the entire day no matter what transport you use.

A must do. Visiting Sydney for a short while, hop on one of the ferries which take you to numerous places along the north coast. Spectacular when the sea is a little rough but also great when the suns out

Great way to travel. We stayed at the Pullman on circle quay so this was perfect for us to get to all the attractions. Very organised and run very promptly, you buy a opal card which is easy to top up. These can be picked up from almost everywhere and you can use on all transportation. Perfect and Gd price
harbor ferries. these ferries ferry you across the harbor saving a lot of time and dollars, the average trip costs 7 dollars by ferry where as by taxi it is at least 30 bucks

An imressive way to view the harbour and the CBD. Being able to use your Opal Card, or tourist pass makes this form of travel a must, where to the North Shore, Luna Park or Darling Harbour, sailing under the Sydney Harbour Bridge and seeing the Sydney Opera House and Bridge in the same frame is wonderful.
Very enjoyable.. Just catching a ferry from place to place in the harbour is so relaxing and a fantastic way to see the sights of Sydney from the water.
First timers. The ferries are a great way to see the sights of Sydney. My kids didn't want to travel any but the ferries if they had a choice.
Friendly and efficient . On time and efficient. Friendly staff members who are always willing to help and lend a hand whenever you ask.
Get an opal card . Buy an opal card while you are visiting Sydney and top up as you go. Be sure you know where you are going. No matter where you sit you get views. Catch the ferry to lunar park

Circular Quay to Manly Beach.. Fabulous leisurely cruise to Manly Beach on a windy day on the most beautiful Harbour in the world. Great photo opportunities of Fort Denison, Sydney Opera House, Shark Island, Luna Park, Sydney Harbour Bridge.....the list goes on and on.If you like a bit of an adventure DO choose a windy day and sit/stand outside on the lower deck (bow end) as you travel toward Manly. The adventure outside on a windy day as the ferry passes through the somewhat notorious " Sydney Heads" (the land points of North Head and South Head) gives the brave travellers a good soaking (great on a very hot day but not so great on a cold day) and provides other indoor travellers with great amusement and laughter, along with many oooh's and aaah's. It's advisable if participating in the adventurous lower deck fun to NOT be drinking a hot beverage and /or munching on a doughnut either, unless you really love the salty sea water taste of the waves crashing over the decks and onto your food & drinks. Lots of fun though whether indoors or outdoors and whether windy or not.Highly recommended.
Out of harbour. We used this ferry to get round to manly bay.A pleasant cruise through the harbour viewing the sights on the way before finally arriving at Manly.

The Best. Great and cheap way to get out on the water in Sydney. Have used these many times when in Sydney, loved getting up the river to Paramatta - have lunch and then come back. Or get great views of the Opera House on your way to Manly or Watsons Bay.

Fast return. We took one ferry company out, and another back. Both were fast, fun, and efficient. And inexpensive in US$. It was a sunny, cool day, and we travelled with another couple over to Manly Beach. Had lunch there. See review of Bluewater Cafe.
Trip to Sydney. Take the Harbour City Ferrie from Milsons Point Wharf to Darling Harbour to have a view on Harbour bridge from sea-side

Convenient!!. It is the best & convenient to ride on the ferry. 25 minutes and we arrived Manly. The ferry has open decks in front and rear for guests to enjoy sunshine and breeze. If you want to read, it is easy to get a very quiet seat among the double-deck. The ride is always too short for me. :D

Fantastic Ferries. The ferries are an outstanding way to get around Sydney that not only get you to your destination efficiently, but with great views. Buy your Opal card and use it on the ferry, the bus or the subway. We bought ours at the airport and then refilled it at Circular Quay (there are also shops where you top off your cards). They were getting away from single ride tickets so get the refillable card and enjoy the absolutely wonderful public transportation system.

great transportation to see the city. This was a great way to see the city from a distance. Plus a quick way across the harbor. This place is beautiful and this is a great opportunity even if you don't need to go to the other side, its just great perspective even for kids.

Parramatta Ferry. We had a trip into the CBD by the Parramatta Ferry. For visitors the scenery was spectacular and can not be seen driving on the highway. The trip was smooth and onboard staff were very pleasant.
Cost effective and expedient. It is worth getting the Opal card to negotiate travel but all the staff at Circular Quay were very helpful and informative.

Ticketing system is presently a nightmare . Ferries are great but allow 20 minutes for single trip tickets to tourist popular destinations. Ridiculous situation with one ticket machine available per dock. Missed our ferry and dropped half hour.

Heaps To See. This is a great way to see the Harbour and its attractions. There are great views of iconic landmarks and Sydney Harbour homes to take in. There are lots of stops or stay on and watch the world slide by…
Wow. So amazing to jump on a ferry and go from a to b. Highly recommend it to anyone that travels. Is also great going from b to a.

Nice staff and helpful. Easy peasy to head over the harbour to wherever you wish to go... Balmain, Manly ETC
Friendly staff and cheap / good value

Sydney Ferries - A Perfect Way to Go. As a 'older' person, with a wonderful Seniors Concession Card/Opal - I enjoy using the ferries as often as possible. A trip to Manly or Watsons Bay for lunch and a walk is a great day out - and if you time your return to Circular Quay at the right time - you get to witness some remarkable sunsets - don't forget your camera. Another favourite is the Darling Harbour 'cruise' - past Luna Park, McMahons Point, Balmain, Darling Harbour - sometimes Cockatoo Island - and again - timing is the thing - try to catch the Sydney skyline lighting up for the evening - twinkling lights on the water. Third favourite - the River Cats up the Parramatta River - historic buildings, plenty of things to see.

Quick, got me where i needed to be.. It is old but it is what it needs to be. It got me where i needed without delay and was clean. The ride was smooth and you can see the sights without paying a lot of money

Beautiful way to see Sydney. I had spare half day in Sydney and decided to travel around by ferry. I took a morning ferry from Circular Quay to Double Bay. The catamaran was fast and smooth. I sat out on the top so that I could enjoy the view - hard to beat.After a bus trip to Watson's Bay I returned to the Quay by fast catamaran - about 11 mins fast trip down the harbour. Despite the white caps on the water, the ride was smooth. I stood up on the front part of the boat which was a great pleasure. highly recommended way to enjoy a sunny spring morning.
Fantastic . Great way to get around Sydney to other parts and to nearby islands. Not too costly and we found the service to be on time. I would suggest arriving 5 or so minutes early for ferry ride
Way to go!. This is a great way to get to work or just to see Sydney from the harbour. The deck crew are generally polite and professional and helpful with directions for visitors.
Manly to Circular Quay. Great way to get to the seminar in George St Not your average commute for a Melbournite. The ferry is always comfortable and using Opal card is simple way to get on and off

Reliable, efficient ferry service. Sydney ferries are an effective way of travelling around Sydney. You can get a free Opal card from a convenience store or somewhere like Woolworth and you load it with money. It gives you a discount on the fares and you tap in and out You can easily add money to it at the machine at any Wharf. It works like the Oyster card in London. The ferries are comfortable and very punctual. You can download a free app called Trip View to get the timetable from the variety of Wharves. The free version of the app does not stay on your screen so you have to do the search for it each time but once downloaded, it comes up very easily.
Efficient and on-time. Easy way to commute and visit Manly. It was efficient, easy, and a rather pleasant ride and good view of Sydney Harbour.

Flawless way to travel around the bays! . Fast, accurate and comfortable. Sydney's ferries were one of the better transportation services I tried! We took the ferry to both Marly and Taronga Zoo, they were right on time, quick and the staff was friendly. In one word, perfect.

Rivercat is the way to travel. This was my second day in a row to take the Rivercats to the city from Rydalmere. Again it was on time, both ways. Clean and comfortable and a great way to see the houses and apartments near the river.
Some Places to go in Sydney. For something different take the river cat from Circular Quay to historic Parramatta orGo to Manly Beach or go to Watsons Bay they are all great destinations.
A Ferry is a ferry. Quick, clean and comfortable. Friendly staff and leaves every 30 min. Tickets are to be bought in advanced. Machines a bit slow.

Best was to see our beautiful harbour . I had an international guest who had limited time in Sydney so I took him to manly on the ferry & ofcourse a walk around the quay upon our return. He got to see our most iconic landmarks from an uninterrupted view & the photos from the deck were spectacular.

Best value in sydney. For the day price you can explore the whole harbour. Go to Manly., Parramatta., taronga zoo, balmain, vaucluse. No road traffic ...just smell the salt water. Well worth the trip...highly recommended for tourists.
Leisure trip. Went from Circular Quay to Manly on a Sunday afternoon. It was a very pleasant and relaxing "ride" in spite of the crowd and some strollers blocking the aisle.
great way to see Sydney. Had a relaxing ferry ride to Manley and back to Sydney. You see some characters but that's makes for a great trip

Cheaper than captain cook cruise😁. We wanted to take the captain cook cruise at first but decided to do this instead. Definitely cheaper, probably not as scenic, but it is an alternative if you're on a budget.
Very comfortable with nice view. We purposely took ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour to get the nice view and photoshoot of Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge.
Good service. It is the best way to get around especially go to Taronga zoo or Luna park or simply sight seeing around the harbour. Purchase a all day ticket from darling harbour, is worth it.

Awesome transportation . What an awesome way to get acrosa to Manly & other locations surrounding.
Love the concept, good for traffic flow & tourism. Would recommend this type of travel 😊

Ferries are great. The one to Manly was efficient, on time with great staff. The opal card NOT AT ALL EFFICIENT. The opal card system would work a whole lot better if there were enough ticket outlet machines. The queue was long and the system time consuming. They would be useless if English wasn't your first language. A multi card did not suit us and the single ticket machine takes for ever. Please put more ticket machines in.

Abysmal Ticketing System. Without a doubt the Worst Ticketing System on The Planet!!!Only Two machines for the Whole Harbour to buy tickets on the day and one of them was only half working and did not take cards: ( They have closed down All the staffed booths so you are Forced to use their dreadful system. At busy times allow At Least An Hour!To add insult to injury you can on but Two tickets at a time so a family of five has to do 3 transactions!A nasty cynical way to Force people into buying their stupid plastic Opal cards. I can't believe the idiots that enforced this are still in there jobs.Garbage!Once you finally get on the boat, if you don't give up in frustration they are fit for purpose but don't expect to be able to buy a beer or glass of wine.Save you time do something else.

Ferries take you all over Sydney. . Love the fact how ferries can take you all over Sydney. Why do it by train when you can relax and see all the sights of Sydney this way. The best way to see Sydney for a tourist.
Relaxing ride. Went to Manly a couple of times on the ferry it takes about 30 minutes and is a really unique ride also try the other ferries well worth it
Great trip from Sydney Rowers to the Quay. What a great way to get around. Pity we didn't stay in a hotel nearer Circular Quay. Next time we will! The ferries/hydrofoils are far more reliable.
Efficient. Trip to Cockatoo Island via Darling Harbour. On time, efficient and affordable. Pleasantly surprised with the efficiency.

Convenient and quick way of getting to Manly. Decided to take a day out to Manly Beach and the ferry was a great way to see Sydney from the water. The ferry is fairly stable and the adequate comfortable seats made the ride enjoyable. I manage to take some great pictures of Sydney's landmarks and their schedule are quite accurate when I took it. The bus ride would had taken much longer due to the city's geographical characteristics.
great experience. this is a fantastic way to get around the harbour, and to give you a different perspective of the city, only took about 20minutes to get to Darling Harbour

Great basic transport. I used the ferry to cross over to Manly and it was fine, Got me from A-B safely.I went on a sunday where the travel is only $2.50 return using opal which is fair and on other days it is overpriced just to cross over.coming back was a mess though , there were hundreds of people all being rallied like cattle and having to stand in a crazy big crowd to wait for the next ferry.
Great way to travel and see the harbour. Love Sydney ferries shipping me all over the city.. lovely ride, friendly staff .... always a highlight of my Sydney stay

You may not beat Qld in the footy but you beat us in regard to the transport system NSW. Comparing the transport systems in Australia, you have a great system NSW. Friendly staff, sure made it easy, when you had no idea where to go via the train/ferry system. Costs were low compared to other systems. Lovely day out on the Ferries. Caught the ferry over to Manly, and enjoyed a great day.

Poor service. Having been advised by our hotel concierge to request a zoo pass from the ferry staff en route to Taronga, I was told in no uncertain terms to "get with the times...we don't do these anymore". Unacceptable service and a very long queue of confused patrons missing the ferry thanks to his rudeness to me and others.

Great for harbor viewing and getting around. Sydney has a very active ferry system for public transport. I would recommend them for both sight seeing and picture taking vantage points but also as a way to move up and down the coast from the harbor.

Great way to see the sights. One f the best ways to travel around Sydney price isn't too bad either . I got the opal card probably a bit too late on my return journey but the Terry's are so frequent and good value.

We used the ferries all the time when we lived in Sydney. The ferries are very useful to use around Sydney although they do get very busy on some routes like circular quay to manly, But Sunday is so cheap and other days are very reasonable, just get a opal card. The ferries that go in parramatta direction (west Sydney ) need improving as they are to infrequent, use the trains for west

Not just transport.. A great way to see the sights of the harbour. Get yourself an opal card which covers all public transport the grab a ferry to Watson's Bay for fish 'n chips then walk to the top of the hill for a great view of the heads.
Nice and comfortable ride. It takes about 5 to 10 minutes to travel from Circular Quay to Sydney Harbour. Not very cheap price but affordable.

A great way to see the Harbour. The ferries are an excellent way to see the Harbour. Do a round trip further up the River past Meadowbank. Stop at Milson's Point to Luna Park and Wendy Whitley Gardens in Lavendar Bay.

Love It. There's something romantic about sailings on the Sydney ferries. When you choose to sit outside during Spring, with the crisp air blowing as you look out into the harbour. Amazed by the majestic Harbour Bridge, look into the waterside residences, mesmerised by the curved rooftops of the Sydney Opera House & the life at Circular Quay.A trip to Sydney will never be complete without a ride on the yellow-green Sydney ferries.

Harbour Cruising. We caught ferry to Taronga Zoo and then on to Manly and back! Great way to see harbour-including Bridge and Opera House from the water and commentary was great with history of Sydney!

Great way to travel. Ferries from circular quay go from there to everywhere across the harbour .. so manly beach , Milson point , tarunga zoo, rose bay, fort denison , darling harbour pyrmont bay etc .. in a nutshell I can avoid sydney peak hour traffic if you're intending to travel by bus or taxi. If you're at walking distance it's all good . But certain destinations outside city centre have to be reached by bus or ferry . Staying close to the quay is a good idea for easy access

Save money on sightseeing trips. I recommend that you get an Opal card which covers all transport in Sydney and the maximum you will be charged in a day is $15 regardless of how many trips you make. My husband and I used the train to get from our apartment to Circular Quay then used the ferries not only as a mode of transport but as sightseeing vessels too. Most lines have 2 ferries per hour and you get amazing views as you travel by water.
Amazing service. Fast, friendly, efficient service. Staff always helpful. Love the inexpensive fare and time saved getting to and fro.

Good way to get around Sydney. If you are looking for a good way to see some of Sydney's famous sighs then The ferry is a great way to travel. The Manly ferry is a wonderful ride and takes 40 minutes. When you alight from the ferry walk straight across at the pedestrian lights and head down The Corso, a pedestrian walk then when you reach the surf beach walk to the right and that will take you on a scenic level walk to Cabbage Tree Bay. You can have lunch at the restaurant there or coffee and meander past a few shops. When you are ready to go back you follow the same path back. There are many eateries to sample Fish and Chips or try one of the many pubs for lunch - we often eat at the Ivanhoe Hotel you can sit upstairs on the balcony and watch the passing parade on the Corso. Return to the wharf to catch the ferry to return to Circular Quay. Enjoy!

Sydney Break. Travelling to the Zoo, Watson Bay, Manly, etc what a better way to get there than using the ferries. So easy from Circular Quay to cross over to any other sight within Sydney Harbour. Great Value and Service - Love the ferry rides.
Ferry to Manly. We caught a Ferry to Manly, what a great experience. The views were fantastic, we had to wind in our hair & totally enjoyed our trip.

Love the water transpoert. Even when we had the option to walk somewhere we mostly chose to use the ferries as travelling out on the harbour is amazing. You get the best views of the bridge and opera house etc from out on the water. The cost is reasonable, especially with an opal card, and they always seem to keep to schedule.
Charming little treasure. I loved the charming old look of the ferry. It is a great way to explore the harbour in a short trip. The view of the bridge from the ferry is magnificent. A must Do!!!
great way to explore sydney. the sydney ferries are a cheap option to explore places like manly / luna park.. if you have an opal card , its a 2,5$ cap on sundays...

Sydney Ferry Tours, Sydney, AU. Sydney Ferry Tours, Sydney, AU can take you to all sorts of wonderful places and give you history if the area in the process. There are numerous ferry trips you can take and there is even an 'hop on, hop off' ticket that lets you come and go as you wish. It's a great way to see lots of Sydney (& avoid the vehicular traffic). A great way to spend a day or two with lots to see at each destination.
Cruise stop. Fabulous ferrie service just walk off the ship and over to where the ferries dock buy a ticket to wherever you want to go and enjoy.

A fun way to see the Harbour and beat rush hour traffic.. We were ending a day tour when rush hour traffic looked to delay our return to Sydney.  Our bus driver suggested we consider the ferry which would deposit us at Darling Harbour. It was with in walking distance our hotel and added to our visit in Sydney.Sydney is a great city for walking to see the sights.

This is THE WAY. We stayed in Balmain for close to a month and so we took the ferries into the heart of the city on an almost daily basis. It's simply the best. Low cost, way more fun than a taxi or bus, and super super fast as well as punctual. These ferries rival German and Belgian train punctuality. Do this if you are staying in one of the old neighborhoods of Sydney. If you are downtown, you can also use the ferries to go to the zoo, and other attractions. Look into it as it is really worth it. You feel totally like a Sydneysider, which btw are 90% of the people on the ferry.

Ferries are awesome. Loved going from place to place on the ferries. Great scenery and the staff are very friendly. This was the highlight of my trip to Sydney. Anyone going to Sydney easy to use the Opal Card and use the Sydney Ferries. It is a leisurely trip around the harbour.

Wonderful trip across the harbour. Caught the ferry across the harbour to the Zoo. Buying a ticket was easy - friendly staff on hand if problems arose, none did. Ease of access - on and off. Wonderful to cross the harbour, looking at the bridge and Opera House and Circular Quay - good signage - timetables easy to read - wonderful experience

Excellent way to view the Sydney Harbour. The Sydney ferries are part of the state's public transporation system which integrates seamlessly with the busses and trains.Opal card either the prepaid card or single trip tickets can be used to pay the ferry fares.We used the ferries to travel from the Olympic Park to Circular Quay on the way home from the Blue Mountains, CQ to Taronga Zoo and Manly. You dont actually need to take the harbour cruise to view the harbour. The ferry trips are good enough already.

Very Ferry . A great way to feel the beat of Sydney is to take a ferry or 2 , good also for one way trips back to your hotel is your close to a ferry stop, we did this time and time again, relaxing and say, not always fast, a great part of Sydney

A Great way to visit all points........ Ferries will take you anywhere around the Harbour + the Rivercat to Parramatta.
Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Taronga Zoo, Manly, Luna Park, Darling Harbor, Watson & Rose Bays to mention a few.
This is a lovely way to get a great overview of the city.

Relaxing way to see the harbour. Nothing better on a beautiful sunny day. Great way to see the harbour and go visit the zoo or Manly Pier. Just do a round trip to Mosman for great views. Always a friendly atmosphere
Best way to Manly Beach. The Sydney Ferries were a fast and inexpensive way to get from the Circular Quay to many other areas ... and you can't beat the views!
Great Public Transport. Once you got the Wharfs sorted, public ferries was a breeze, you can travel to just about all the major tourist destinations via ferry

Push me pull you boat. It's a very long time since I have been on the Manly Ferry and we were fortunate to be at the front of the queue when it came into Circular Quay which enabled us to be first on board and grab a seat at the front, I thought. So much for being a smarty pants, these boats are pointed at both ends and we actually were seated at the stern but this turned out to be to our advantage as we got really good views of the bridge and the Opera House as the ferry pulled away from the Quay. Tip for anyone, if you can board the ferry and find seats facing the railway station you'll get a good view from this position, fantastic for taking photos. However, you'll have to change seats if you want to see were the ferry is going.

Sydney's Seaborn Sightseeing. A great way to get around some of the best sights in Sydney. These ferries encompass a great many different locations to visit and of course are used by some of the Sydneysiders to commute to work on a daily basis.They are cheap, fast , reliable and efficient. Highly recommended

Sydney the beautiful.by river cat. Starting at circular quay take the river cat to parramatta it's a slow pace cruise a cross the harbour & moves along the parramatta river showing the beautiful homes built along the shoreline, there are many stops which offer picnic areas close to the wharf, on reaching parramatta you can take the free bus around the city area where eatery's are plentiful, the return trip their are express options, a full day or half day either are a must.

Sunny Sunday. We decided to travel over to Manly on the ferry . Sat inside next to the window .Lots of happy people on board, with a mixture of locals and tourists.The harbour was beautiful . On our return we stood outside at the front of the ferry and the views where totally amazing. We live in Sydney and love going on the harbour on the ferries. We would recommend all visitors to Sydney ride on a ferry

Sit relax and let someone else do the work.. Enjoy the relaxing way to travel.Enjoy the water the scenery and let someone else take the responsibility for travelling on our waterways while you sit and relax

Do it by boat . The Manly ferry is one of the best trips and the cheapest. For travelling on water...you will see the harbour, the Sydney Harbour Bridge bridge, the Opera House, Fort Dennison, the heads (which is where the ocean waters come into the harbour) and finally end up in approx 40 minutes to the famous Manly Beach. The beach is a leisurely stroll down The Corso ( a 500m stroll past many shops) grab an ice cream and spend half an hour just sitting, recharging during your break. Take a jacket as it can get a bit cool on the ferry especially if you're outside on the deck.  Enjoy... Sydney

Ferry to Double Bay. From Circular Quay some of the Ferries to Rose Bay and Watsons Bay stop in at Darling Point and Double Bay. It is a great experience to get off the Ferry at Double Bay and walk the gentile tree-lined streets to the Double Bay shopping area (noted for its quality shopping) only two blocks away. Take heed of the time-table when planning your return ferry trip to Circular Quay or onwards to Rose Bay.

Sydney Harbour ferries. The harbour cruise has commentary on historical Sydney Harbour as well as Harbour mansions and who owns them which makes it an ideal trip for locals as well as visitors to Sydney

Great way to see the bridge. They are prompt, and efficient way to get around the harbour. Buy your opal card at any convenience store and use it to get around. We went to Manly, on one of the big ferries. It is busy and people shove and push to get limited seats outside. It takes about 30 mins to get to Manly. Beautiful views along the way.We travelled on a smaller ferry to Darling Harbour, under the bridge and to the North side of the harbour before turning into Darling Harbour. Took about 20 mins to go 3 stops. Took a direct ferry back (12mins). The smaller boat meant that we could sit outside in the sun and really take in the views. Excellent

Great way to see Sydney. Unfortunately the ferries are very old and need to be updated.Although it is great way to see the harbour if you have limited time.We took the ferry back to Parramatta this is a scenic way of seeing more of the harbour.We have found that you need to pick the time of day, Sometimes it seems that ferry moves faster than other times

Sydney Ferries best way to travel on Sydney Harbour. Sydney ferries a wonderful way to travel when wishing to see what Sydney has to offer from the water. They provide scenic transport from Manly to Circulay Quat and then from Circular Quay to Parramatta and a real joy to travel on especially for Pensioners. A really great day out.

Suday $2.50 day with Opal card. We do this most Holidays. Catch the Rivercat into the city then crossing the harbour all day. Lunch at Mosman Rowers is great with ferry to the door, Best harbour cruise you can do. Visit Balmain, Darling Harbour, Mosman Bay, and finish at Watsons bay for sunset and drinks at the bar right at the ferry pier,
Very fast and efficient mode of transport.. Love catching the ferry to Manly for the day, or just exploring the waterways. Take the time to enjoy a ride while in Sydney.

Such a great means of transport!. I love the ferry ride to Manly! The ferry really gives going to places a "day trip" kind of feel! It's fantastic and very affordable especially on Sundays.The ferry really adds a dimension to public transport around Sydney. One hardly needs a car.

Great Views Friendly Staff. We went on the older style ferry over to Taronga Park Zoo to watch Vivid. The views over the bridge and the city were wonderful in the setting sun.In the way back we had the newer style ferry which was fast and very stable. The captain slowed right down for quite a while as we passed the bridge and Opera House giving the passengers a great view if Vivid.The guys were very friendly as we got in and off the ferry which made for a pleasant experience.

Best way to see Sydney. To really discover Sydney ferries are the only way to go. The network is extensive. They run to timetable and outside of peak hour are rarely crowded. To experience the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and Sydney's skyline from the water gives a unique perspective. A trip to Watson's Bay to visit the pub for lunch is a wonderful experience. Longer trips to Parrammatta show a totally different side to Sydney, as does the trip across the heads to Manly.

Great and cheap on Sunday. On Sunday the public transport in and around Sydney (except the airport) are capped at AUD $2.50! Means you can take scenic ferries around the harbour and explore different neighborhoods by the metro for next to nothing.
best ride. the ferries is the best transport to get to go to place's that not all ways trains or buses takes you

THE GREEN AND CREAM FERRIES WOW... I wish we could have them in Perth ,The ferries are so easy to access as a tourist, on one onto another to visit yet another wonderful attraction in the worlds best Harbor . We love the freedom of moving around the cites without the need of a car or Bus Tours ..... A GREAT SERVICE

Easy and beautiful. Sydney ferries are a tourists dream. Beautiful, comfortable, spacious, on time .... Mostly unless there has been a storm. Put a tiny bit of effort into looking up the timetable online, and importantly note which dock you need, as there are multiple entries. At least they're all in one place. We're a friendly much ... Ask if you can't work it out. Cafes and bathrooms on board, the hot chocolate is yum. Not cheap but worth it if you're desperate for s coffee hit. You can see out from any seat, though of course window seats are nice, but not claustrophobic at all... Take your camera especially if you're taking the circular quay to manly run. That's one beautiful, scenic experience - and what's not to like about manly??

FERRIES with Dinner and Dance troup. FERRIES takes you for a round of Sydney showing beautiful glittering city in night with Dinner, Drinks followed by the Dance program which include Hindi number too. Overall good experience over the sea.
Best value in the world. These trips offer the best views of the best harbour in the world including the Sydney Bridge, Opera House, North Head, Watson's Bay, Parramatta and everything in between.

Excellent way to get around the harbour. I love taking a journey by ferry in Sydney. It is such a beautiful harbour. From Mosman to the city takes about 15 mins. On the left is the Opera House and on the right is the Sydney Harbour bridge. Ferries are well appointed and the harbour is generally calm. You can sit outside or inside. Outside is nice on a fine day and a beautiful way to travel.

Take the ferries for great harbour views. The ferries are the best way to see the harbor and to view the Opera House from different angles. I found them easy to use and comfortable. You can use the Opal card on buses, trains and ferries so it's really convenient.

Ferry to Watson Bay. The worst thing about taking a ferry in Sydney is the chaos to board it!! Once on the ferry it is a lovely ride to Watson's Bay. The ferry we caught was quite new and the ride very pleasant

Perfect way to get around Sydney. The Sydney ferries are a wonderful way to get around Sydney, particularly between Darling Harbour and Circular Quay. As a visitor on business, accompanied by a work colleague who hasn't been to this city in many years, the ferries provided a unique view of the city as well as a comfortable and interesting way to move between destinations. The whole experience was made all the more enjoyable thanks to the invaluable assistance from Linda in one of the ticket offices at Circular Quay. Thank you for your help and advice.
super easy to use and convenient!. Used it for travel within Sydney on vacation, and it was so easy to use, much better than public transportation in our city in the states!
efficient and on time!. efficient and on time. they never disappoint. friendly and helpful staff. reach few minutes early to the wharf and avoid last minute rush. No paper tickets. get you opal card!

"Wonderful to just go for a ride". We love the Ferries in Sydney, they have so much character. You can see Sydney Harbour from the water this way. We find if it's a rainy day this is a great way to spend your day seeing where they all go to and it is also very relaxing.
Brought Back Memories. Haven't been on a ferry since forever, was still as good as I remember as a youngster. Crew are great, ferry was on time, clean, all was great.

Picturesque. The best views of Sydney are from the ferries. The same Opal card works on trains, bus and ferries. The standard route is Darling Harbour to Circular Quay but the best I liked was Darling Harbour to Paramatta. A long ride but a very scenic one. These are well maintained and very courteous staff.

A nice day out. As I had the day free, I took ferry ride to Manly. The ferries leave Circular Quay every half hour. This is always a really nice trip with spectacular views of the city skyline and harbour bridge. It takes 30 minutes from the city to Manly. It's a pleasant walk along the Corso to the beach. There are plenty of places to buy food and drinks. I enjoy playing tourist in my own backyard. This is one really good way to spend the day.
Always reliable. I am a regular user of ferry services on Sydney Harbour and they are always on time, clean and the staff are efficient. It is my favourite form of transport in Sydney

Must do in Sydney. Very few cities have the facility to beat the traffic on roads and crowd in the metro to give you an alternate option to get across. Sydney ferries are one such!I walked across the Harbor bridge from Circular Quay end to the other and took a Ferry ride from Luna Park Wharf back to Circular Quay, the ride being less than 5 mins. Your Opal Card will come in handy here (Opal card is a multi-transport tap on/tap off card) or else it's costly.
Great way to roam around Sydney. Wonderful experience to travel via ferries. It is also one of the convenient ways to hop over to different places in Sydney.

Excellent ferry experience Parramatta to CQ. Have read on these forums, tourists praising the Parramatta - Sydney and reverse Rivercat experience, so decided to try.
Caught the ferry in Parramatta - early part of the journey was all mangroves then reach civilization with many river/harbourside mansions then finally the Bridge.
Excellent 1 1/2 hour trip - understand why held in such high regard by os tourists.
Ferries Galore. There are plenty of ferries. We took the one to Manly and enjoyed ourselves, as we watched the surfers. We sat on the beach. It was a relaxing day.

Relax & Enjoy. The best way to get to the city from the East, 10 minute travelling time from Rose Bay to Circular Quay, beats the traffic, much quicker and plenty to see and do in all weather conditions.restaurants ,shopping and cinemas there when you alight from the stress free journey.Travel to Manly in 45mins from the Quay, not only is the ride brilliant to see the harbour and historically sights, but also many attractions await when you get there.Travel on a ferry if you can around the Harbour and even out to Parramatta in the West.The journey will set your day up in a positive way.

Great way to get around Sydney harbor. The Sydney ferries are fast, easy, comfortable, abundantly available, on time and inexpensive. I loved being able to "tap" on and off the ferries with my prepaid Opal card (no tickets or cash), wait, generally, a short time, take a fast, beautiful trip through Sydney harbor to Taronga Zoo or Manly or Darling Harbor, etc.Opal cards are available on-line or at numerous local shops or at the Transit shops... Just check on the Opal website for locations. The card can also be used on the trains and buses.With so much public transportation available, I personally found it unnecessary to rent a car in Sydney.
Very convenient way of travelling in Sydney. One of the most efficient and smooth water transport services you will see in today's world, you will breath taking view of the city

Nice views of the opera house and the harbour. By using an Opal card (available at the airport), you can get a good view of Port Jackson, the Opera House, and other sites. This also allows you to skip the tour boats.

So Easy to get around Sydney. Get yourself an Opal card & you are away! You can get them at any little stores. You click on & off. You can go anywhere, it really is a beautiful harbour. Going under the bridge is just such a sight with the opera house in the background.

Fast and perfect. We had a 45 minutes trip with a suitable ferry from west to east in Sydney. We really enjoyed, although could not hear the guides saying perfectly. One ferry trip is necessary for each tourist in Sydney.

fun way to get around. Whenever we are in Sydney we try to jump on one of the old ferries and get out on the harbour and it's always a nice experience. This time was darling harbour to the quay. about 20 mins or so on a nice sunny day.

Feeling to travel in a yacht around the most beautiful harbour in the world ......champagne taste on bier budget!,. Every now and againI travel from one part of Sydney to another by ferry; it could be going to work or just for pleasure and as always the service is friendly fast and with good sense of humour from the wharfies; the ferry is a Sydney icon !clean no pollution and being able to cruise around very quickly avoiding noisy traffic , packed trains and always there is a seat! Hopefully never ever they will be taken away from our life! Tourists from around the world visiting Sydney love the ferries as much the locals!,Long live to the ferries!!!

Great way to see the harbor and surroundings. Inexpensive way to view the harbor down to the ocean and the surrounding bay side landscapes. Opportunity to explore community at each stop. I chose to sit outside to take photos but went inside later to get warm.

Love the Ferry, hate the ticketing system. Staff on Sydney Ferries are courteous and professional, and the trip to Many never ceases to make my day. But the ticketing for visitors? One ticket machine to buy a single trip ticket? Come on. I am not there often enough to purchase an Opal card but lining up for 30 minutes to buy a ticket is silly. Come on Sydney Ferries, don't be so cheap!

Manly Fast Ferry . I wanted to see friends who live in Manly. They suggested taking the ferry and grabbing a bite at one of the nearby establishments. This particular ferry is a commuter artery that connects Manly folks with their jobs in Sydney. It was easy to get a ticket. Don't forget to ask for a return. When I was there the last fast ferry left from Manly around 930pm.

Wonderful Whale Watching!!! . We went on a whale watching trip and had a wonderful time! We was lucky enough to have a pod of whales come up next to our boat that stayed around for a while, did a tail splash, an eye spy and a breach. I would fully recommend Sydney Whale Watching!

Fantastic way to get around!!. I'm a local and never take the beauty of our city for granted. Today a friend and I took the Rose Bay ferry to the Rocks markets, another beautiful thing to do on a sunny spring day. On our way back it was twilight and the view from our ferry of our iconic opera house and bridge took on a different look again. Great thing to do on a perfect spring day!

Sail Away to the Zoo!. An easy way to get to the Topanga Zoo from Circular Quay is to take the ferry. It is about a 10-15 minute ride and is very economical. Plus, you have the opportunity to see the Sydney skyline, the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House from different vantage points while on the water.
Manly cruise. A trip on the Manly ferry is a must when you visit Sydney. Cruise to Manly and enjoy fish and chips on Iconic Manly beach as you relax and take in the beautiful scenery.

Travel on the waters of the great Sydney Harbour. So easy and well priced and such a great way to get around and enjoy the vistas of Sydney. Take the ferry to Manley and stroll along the sea front and enjoy the cafes and eateries.

Ferries. A must for getting to the more distant parts of Sydney.Very reliable and cost affective.Toilets available on all ferries for some of the longer journeys. And of coarse they give wonderful views of the harbour bridge,opera house and cbd.
Awesome way to get around the city!!. Very convenient and easy to navigate. The crew members are always so helpful and always willing to answer questions.

Sydney Ferries. Whilst the view is great, they run on time and they are very clean, the staff need a wake up call. Their tolerance for first time, infrequent or users with slightly low English skills is shocking. Deck hands...wake up! You are delivering customer service in one of the biggest tourist centres in the world. Please have more tolerance for people or even go the extra yard and try to help people a little. Your repeated snears and looks of being fed up with passengers that don't know the rules are not helpful.

Good experience. When I was in Sydney in 2011-12 used to visit Manly or nearby area such as Kiri-billy by ferry.45 min ferry to Manly was really good experience.Nice sea view and experience. Service was on time and good.

Visiting Sydney ? Don't miss the ferries. Even if you have a rental car, or prefer to Uber around the city, don't forego the opportunity to cruise across the bay on one of these ferries, making multiple stops along the shore. I paid just $6.25 AUD for a 30 minute trip, with plenty of great picture opportunities.

Use Sydney Ferries for visiting Mosman Bay and Mosman Rowers Club. Looking for a relaxing short harbour trip and lunch, take Sydney Ferries to Mosman then the short walk around the bay to Mosman Rowers Club for lunch (book in advance) and then return to Circular Quay.

nice alternative to travelling by train. We took a ferry from Parramatta Wharf to Circular Quay and had a good time! The night view from the deck was nice and relaxing! It was quite chilly when we did this so we were a bit bundled up. We used our Opal card so it was convenient.
smooth sailing. an Australian icon - the terrfiic ferries and ferry persons who control the Harbour; well done to you all
One mode of transport . Ferries are regular. Not badly priced either. Good views across sydney harbour. Good to see old fishing knots being used

Get an Opal card and see the sights. We found the ferries very easy to use to visit a variety of different locations and get great views of the harbour.The staff were helpful and explained the whole Opal card system to us, which we had somehow managed to miss in all our research. The staff directed us to where to get these cards and, once equipped, we made frequent use of the ferries. The trip out to Manly was particularly enjoyable by ferry and coming back late enabled us to see the harbour lit up - spectacular!The ferries are not luxurious but they are clean, drinks can be purchased on board and there are outdoor and indoor seating areas plus they followed the timetable

Very good Ferry to visit Taronga Zoo, Manly beach, and other place.. The ferry is OK to looked around the Sydney Harbor. During the trip, you can see fantastic view of the Sydney Harbor to your destination, like Taronga Zoo, Manly Beach, etc.

Marvellous Sydney Ferries!. Now living in a regional area of NSW and visiting Sydney occasionally, the ferries have have become a " Must Do " each time. The ferries are regular and reliable, seating comfortable and a wonderfully inexpensive way to experience beautiful and fascinating Sydney Harbour. Using our Opal card makes it very easy to commute.

Use Opal - cheap and definitely worth it!. Stayed near the Olympic Park so ferry was an option to travel other than the train, hence opted to ride the ferry as well. An alternative way to experience scenic Sydney. Tip: use your Opal card!

Travel anywhere with an opal card. Visitors need to know in advance that you must have an opal card to travel on any public transport. We did not know this and could have got a concession one at the airport or central station. Can buy standard cards at news agents.
