The idea is to load money onto the card and tap on and off as you travel. Normal ones are capped at $15.00 per day whereas concession ones are capped at 2.50 per day

Wonderful Public Transport. The best way to travel Sydney Harbour. Very easy to find the best ferry to catch, and wait time between ferries is minimal. Can travel all of Sydney and great views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House from the ferry.

Water taxi for have fun!. It is very convenient and nostalgic to spend a time for a short trip with this lovely ferry. Besides, I love to see the morning rush hour that local people ride for heading their work...it's Sydney!

Good to see the sights. The ferries provide a good way to see the sights of Sydney. Especially so after dark returning from Manly when the Harbour bridge and Opera House are seen illuminated. A very good price to organise your own cruise of the Harbour.
Easiest way to travel. IT is a cheap and easy way to take in all the bays of this magnificent Harbour. IT is so relaxing. There is a mixture of older and newer ferries and they are very frequent.

Best value....in the world ?? !!. Travelling on a Sydney is unbelievable value , you get to see one of the worlds best cities and interact with the locals -if you want to!A trip to Manly for the seaside beach culture -no problems.A trip to Taronga for the zoo ,no problems. The hidden gem , a trip to Parramatta -the geographical centre of Sydney. This is where you get to see a real cross section of the locals -not a tourist trap!Some of the ferries may be a bit weather beaten ,but its all part of the value deal!

Lovely way to travel around. Really enjoyed using the ferries to travel around the harbour- the only issue was that the machines we needed to use to top up our travel cards were quite temperamental and had we been short on time it might have caused problems. However the actual ferries were great- with toilets, refreshment facilities, indoor and outdoor seating, regular times, cheerful staff.

Enjoyed the ride. We took the hop on hop off on Captain Cook and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Never expected the speed at which we were travelling so it was really exciting. Stopped at Manly Bay for lunch and took the last both back at 04:45. Enjoyed the sunset and even saw a rainbow. It was just beautiful. Of course we took lots of pictures.

Really Interesting cruise up the river. I took advantage of the discounted fares on Sydney Transport for seniors ($2.50 for all day travel) by taking a RiverCat cruise up the Parramatta River. Really good! The staff on the ferry were very helpful to tourists. Manly would have been good to go to also, but I ran out of time.

See the Harbour on a Ferry not a commercial Harbour cruise!. Tourists - save your money and take a Ferry instead of paying for an expensive Harbour Cruise!!!! I know, I was an American tourist, but, now have been a Sydneysider for over 20 years!Go to Darling Harbour or Taronga Zoo or Manly or Watsons Bay, doesn't really matter, just get out on the water in a Ferry.Enjoy our most spectacular Sydney Harbour!!!

Beats walking. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling and back right at dusk. The lighting on the Bridge and Opera House was amazing. Coming back it was dark and we could see the lights of the city. It is also not very expensive.
Ferry Kissing Point to Circular Quay Sydney. No better way to travel to the city from along the River.Lift your head and watch the suburbs go by.

Circular Quay to Manly. Easy trip, with Opal card. Ferry ride is always different both in terms of people, weather and the sea. From watching seagulls accompany the boat at night catching fish to the gathering of tourists on the back deck getting that final selfie of the Opera House and Bridge with the setting sun in the west.Great journey comfy seats and wifi
Enjoy the trip. We took ferry from circular quay to darling harbour in the Saturday night. Enjoy the breathtaking view under the bridge as the sun set.

An easy way to see the harbour.. We took a ferry from the opera house around to darling harbour. It was a cheap, easy way to get around. Great for families wanting an affordable way to take the kids on a quick boat trip. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Love the Ferries. In Sydney for a weekend getaway and used the ferries to get around as often as possible.If your going to Manly, Tooronga Park Zoo, Darling Harbour I strongly reccommend the riding the ferry.

Manly Ferry. The only way to travel from Circular Quay [which is of course, rectangular] to Manly. Chieffly Square is half round and Australia Sq tower is, of course, completely circular.But Manly is Manly; I always meant to steal the sign to 'Manly Girls High School' but never did. Is it still there?The other ferries to take are to Neutral Bay, Cremorne and Taronga. been on them all in my time.

From Darling Harbour to Sydney Olympic Park. Clean ferry, friendly staff, perfectly on time. What a great way to see Sydney Harbour! Only $7 each way. Easy to use timetable. Don't forget your Opal Card!
Sydney Ferries. To go the Sydney ferries there is a charge and you need to purchase a card and put money on it, great way to get around to circular quay, darling harbour, zoo and Manly

To and from work daily. Using ferries at peak hour has it's downs - jam-packed, often have to stand (Rivercat), and some crew leave the doors open on freezing, cold winter days. Extra rivercats needed for peak hour to/from city

Great Experience !!!!. My wife and I took a ferry trip from Circular Quay to Manly......well worth it. Great service and the chance to easily visit other areas. The return trip was complimented by a beautiful sunset with Sydney opera house and the Sydney harbour bridge silhouetted in the distance - fantastic !!!!!

Short trip from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay.. Took ferries from Darling Harbour to Pyrmont Bay to Balmain East to Luna Park to Circular Quay, A short Trip but you see a lot of the main part of Sydney Harbour, all for around $6.

Football weekend . We did a round trip from circular quay To darling harbour including under the harbour bridge which was an amazing sight
The ferry was on time it was clean and tidy
we got lots of pokemon which made our trip all the more exciting

Like a mini cruise. The Sydney ferries are very reliable and wherever you go offer a great and cheap way of viewing the city. Tip: Take the ferry to Manly and return at dusk to see the city in lights, amazing.

Great mode of transportation!. The ferries are a great way to get around, or just to sight see! Get an Opal card, maximum daily charge for transportation $15 six days a week, $2.50 on Sundays! Unbeatable value!

Ferry to Manly. Regular ferry to Manly is as good as more expensive "tour" cruises. About 30 min each way, sit on uppe deck out front for best views but be warned, it gets cold quickly from the wind. Takes you around the Opera House and you have nice unobstructed views of the bridge.

So cheap and simple. We took the ferry to Taronga zoo and it was good. Runs every 30 minutes and we got a day pass for only $20 so we get on and off all day and we also were planning on going to manly. We didn't make manly because we spent to much time at the zoo.

The best way to spend your Sunday!. I live near Meadowbank Wharf so it's very convenient to take the ferry to city. The scenery in Parramatta river and Sydneyharbour is wonderful. A great way to take families to travel, hop on hop off in Cockatoo island, Catching pokémon in Circular Quay/ Opera House..esp. only $2.5 on Sunday...

Must do. Get an opal card and jump on ferries trains buses the ferry rides are awesome can get great photos went to darling harbour and the manly ferry they run often so if you miss one you only wait 15 mins for the nxt
Great Way to get around. The ferries are frequent and make it easy to travel around the city, clean and efficient and more interesting than a taxi or other public transport
Good way to travel. Very reliable way to get from one side of the harbour to the other. Would definitely recommend if going to the zoo.

Excellent way to get around. Bought a weekend pass and travelled all over Sydney ... the ferries were great and easy to access. Directions on how to get around were equally as good. Great way to see the city.

best transportation for the whole city. Sydney has the best transportation for the whole city you can hope in for ferry’s any time but must go for the opal card its expensive if you purchase tickets every time …must try it when go to Sydney some different experience ………..

Very helpful. The harbour ferries are one of the great ways to get around and see sydney. Not only are they essential for a city split by so much water but they are also great for tourists. Would recommend a trip out to manly or mossman bay for the tourists. We did find the opal card a bit difficult as some of the infrastructure was not working.

Circular Quay to Pyrmont Bay. Many people take the Manly ferry - a wonderful experience. However, to have a lovely view of the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House, Barangaroo and Darling Harbour, take the ferry from Circular Quay to Pyrmont Bay. You can go the opposite direction if you prefer; or alight at Darling Harbour. Whilst Darling Harbour is a favourite tourist destination with some new buildings about to open, it is possible to do a flat walk from Darling Harbour to Paddy's Market (open Wednesdays to Sundays) and Chinatown. From Pyrmont Bay, walk to the Fish Market or visit the Maritime Museum. You can have a full day out with this simple ferry ride.
Interesting . What g great way to see Sydney Harbour we to a ferry to Parramatta return from circular quay you can get on and off wherever you like.
Outinh with grandaughter. Ava wanted to go on the ferry we went to watson bay the staff were very helpful andthe ferry was clean
Why take a cruise ?. Take a ferry to Manly and another to Parramatta and you have seen most of the harbor for very cheap.

Laze the day away.... The Ferry is a great way to see Sydney Harbour. There are longer trips such as the Zoo, Manly or head to Watson's Bay for lunch. Even a trip around to Darling Harbour gives a good view of the Opera House and the Bridge from Circular Quay over to Luna Park, Balmain and surrounds.
Expensive. It's really nice to take a trip by ferry from the harbour beside the Opera House especially in a sunny afternoon.
Expensive. Great way to travel but not cheap. Best way to go is use up 8 opal journeys on the bus's & trains then after this all your journeys are free within one week. Lovely views of harbour

Best form of transport in Sydney. The absolute best way to manly Beach and shark diving aquarium BUT essential. OPAL CARD Needed before getting on the train once you leave airport to head to your destination. Poms are great lovers of Manly and Balmain. It's the most common accent I hear and is the best place to experience old Victorian architecture and pubs but don't stay in Balmain crap. Try for cheap but clean Harris ST pub $92 a day recommend by a local.
Cheap Harbor Tour. Don't pay for one of the overpriced harbor tours. Just experience it like locals do. Cheap enough to do a few different trips in both the day and evening.

01 3 Words : Summer Level 281-290 Answers leonora collado. Any ferry trip on Sydney Harbour is magic. The old ferries have a great ambience andit's the only way to see the many inlets around our harbour. The Kirribilli Club at McMahon 's Point is worth a visit and a short trip from Circular Quay. The restaurants around Circular Quay command great views and a stroll from the ferry terminal.

Relaxing economical way to see Sydney's best attraction. We used the Sydney ferries several times during our recent four day stay in the city. They were efficient and good value. The Opal card system is easy to use, taking out the need to queue for tickets. We went to a number of locations, including Watsons Bay, from where you can walk to The Gap and South Head, and to beautiful Manly. Sydney Harbour is a stunning natural attraction and the ferries are the best way to see it.

Quay to neutral bay.. Great way to see Sydney harbour. I travelled from circular quay to neutral bay. Seniors cost $2.50. With opal card. Sit outside instead of inside in the good weather. This trip is only a small part of Sydney harbour, you could travel on to manly for a longer trip. Good ,if the waves aren't too rough. Good photo opportunities coming back to circular quay, see opera house for a different view. I like to travel on the ferry each time I come to Sydney ,especially in the warmer weather.

Great way to see the Harbour!. Not quite an original title but its so true! Tap on and off and you can use a network of routes to achieve so many vantage points throughout this marvellous city Harbour. If you catch the ferry from Darling Harbour round to Circular Quay, be sure to get that shot of a lifetime of Luna Park, the Bridge and the Opera House. Use an iPhone on pano mode. Thank you Grant, the Sydney ferry crew member, who took the shot for us!
Ferry trip. An good cheap way to take a trip on the harbour avoiding the more expensive tourist trips. Make sure you have repaid card first.

Great way to get around. If your going to Sydney purchase an Opal card, which you can use on certain ferries , trains and buses. Once you hit 15 dollars in one day you can travel around for free. Cheap way of getting around the harbour and great views of bridge and opera house

Amazing value and fantastic views as well!. We didn't arrive in Sydney in the best weather, so we included a couple of ferry trips into our holiday as it's just so cheap to do. Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves even if the journey to Manly was a bit choppy!
Best way to see Sydney Harbour. Best and Cheapest way to cruise our magnificent Harbour, they are well run clean and cruise all day and night long
Rivercat to Parramatta. The rivercat was on time, the staff were professional. Interesting transition from the harbour to the marshes river. A must do experience

Useful to get around. Cheaper than getting the cruises or tour ships, these go frequently around the Bay, connecting places like Manly, Circular and Darling Harbour. Once you master the Opal Card, getting around is simple. The Opal Card is a top up card for travel on the ferries. Get one at the information desk at Quay 5 (not a convenience store - rip off) - different ones for adults and children, buy with A$20 and A$10 respectively, swipe at the gates, the most you pay on any one day is A$15, irrespective of how much you travel! You will not get any help or advice from any kiosk or ferry desk, only from the information desk.

Sydney Ferries.. Took a walk across the Sydney Harbour Bridge to a kiddies playground called Luna Park , then a ferry across to Darling Harbour , seeing the city and harbour via a ferry from a different perspective was awesome.

Dreadful what they have done to get a ticket now.. There is no buying tickets from the window any more and way too many people lined up to buy tickets out of one machine. Nearly decided to just drive but had company from the US that had never been to Australia before so had to take them on a ferry. Never will again unless they start selling tickets like they always have.

An unusual way to see a city. Sydney ferries take us all around the city and along the Parramatta River to Parramatta. In all we have spent many hours on so many journeys. The usual way to see a city is by land - we see the "front" of everything. Viewing the city from the waterways has given us the "rear view" of places and activities. From the heads to the harbour and Manly, around the many harbour coves and beaches, the harbour islands, the Zoo, then the Opera House and spectacularly under the Harbour Bridge, more islands and on to Sydney Olympic Park and the Homebush Bay precinct, then on through the eery mangrove waters to Parramatta. It's impossible in a day. So take a day or a week of days, relax on board the ferries, of many shapes and sizes, from calm waters to rough seas (sometimes). Of course fireworks always look fabulous from the water. We really enjoy the ferry trips.

Best way to get to the city. Coming from the Eastern suburbs to the city now is such a pleasure with the newly upgraded ferry terminal at Rose Bay as well as a more frequent service. Later services back from Circular Quay in the evening mean that you can come home from the city later than previously.Comfortable, always get a seat and the harbour views are fantastic! Easy walk from the Circular Quay to all the attractions within that area as well being able to access the Botanical gardens and Opera House.

See this fabulous harbour , and cheaply!. Buy a day travel pass and spend the day on the Sydney Harbour Ferries. The ferries will take you under the Harbour Bridge, to the Zoo, to Watson's Bay, Rose Bay, and the best trip - Manly: the manly trip takes you across the Sydney Harbour Heads and you have the excitement of the waves in the mouth of the heads. It's even more fun if it's rough!!

There is no better commute!. Get on a Sydney Ferry now. Circular Quay is a buzzing place at any time. The Manly ferry trip is pretty special and only 30 minutes but really any trip on the ferries is great. The staff are super friendly and taking a ferry home at night from the city is spectacular and a good way to end even the toughest of work days. Get involved.

Timely. Punctual, clean way of travelling. A must do in Sydney on a nice day for visitors.. Either to taronga zoo or watsons bay.. Or even manly.
Staff are efficient and helpful.
Travelling with kids.. You can get smaller buggies on board..
Can be expensive as only downside... But if you travel on Sunday's it's family day and cheap

Cheapest harbour cruise. This is by far the nicest and cheapest way to enjoy beautiful Sydney Harbour.
Wait for good weather and bring your camera.

The Best Harbour in the World. Visitors to Sydney, do yourself a favour and make time for a Harbour Ferry ride, you don't have to go on the Fancy Shmancey ferry with a dodgy Buffet, but the good old inter harbour ferry. From the Quay(said Key) to Manly will be a highlight for years to come, great in all weather, better when its fine, to see the Bridge, Opera House, Fort Dennison( Pinch Gut) the headlands serve as a vista for all to see, the sailing craft, what can I say but its magnificent.Then there's the Quay To Balmain, under the bridge, seeing a once working harbour now being restored. For a minimal cost for maximum bang for your Paso, Just Do It.Regards.......Sydney Scott...PS don't forget the camera,
Sydney ferries. Great day to travel around the harbour by ferry when the weather was a little bit overcast. We were able to get off at varying stops along the way to shop and grab a bite to eat.

Great way to see Sydney Harbour. The Sydney Ferries are a great way to see Sydney Harbour. There are endless places to stop and explore including Watsons Bay, Darling Harbour, Cockatoo Island, Manly and more.
Great way to see Sydney and Parramatta River. Loved our experiences on the Sydney Ferries and Rivercats.So much fun for the adults and kids and a great way to see beautiful Sydney.
cheap boat cruise. most amazing harbour and a very cheap way to see it. Great for the whole family. Lots of history in the old ferries as well.

Day trip to Sydney. Walked and took in exhibition then caught ferries around to take in various locations and have lunch . Fabulous views of the harbour, regular departures and fresh air. Service all harbour areas eg Manly, Milsons Pt etc
Great way to experience Sydney Harbour. I took a relaxing Circular Quay trip to Watson's Bay and return using my seniors card. Trip was on time and staff very very friendly and helpful
Travel around Harbour. Very impressive transport around harbor.runs on time.great for tourists. Time saving transport.we love it.
Great way to see Sydney Harbour. Fantastic trip on the Manly Ferry across to Circular Quay. Great way to enjoy the harbour & see the sights and Opera House from the water.

Transport with Views. One thing every traveler to Sydney should do is see the city from the water. Instead of an expensive tour cruise, just hop on one of the little ferries that tootle around the inner harbour, or better yet catch the larger Manly ferry for a half hour trip past the heads to the lovely beachside suburb.

Easy way to Travel. The ferry service is a great stress free way to travel around the Sydney Harbour area. Buy an Opal card if you are there on a Sunday. For only $2.50 if can catch any Ferry, Train or Bus and make your way around all parts of Sydney without the Traffic hassles
Sydney by Water. Hop a ferry to Manly great way to see by water they leave every 30 minutes from Circular Quay every day

Excellent way to see Sydney Harbour . The Sydney ferries are just as much an icon as the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. The normal ferry services give you a great view of the Harbour and its waterside suburbs. They are easy to get around on. We use them at least once when we visit Sydney.
Sydney icon. One of the 'must do' attractions on beautiful Sydney Harbour. The perfect way to see all the sights!

Best public transport in Sydney. My family and me caught our first ferry from circular quay to manly on a beautiful Sat afternoon. The opal cards make public transport really easy in Sydney and it was no problem getting on the right ferry at the right wharf. We had a stroller with us and it was no problem getting on and off. Also plenty of room on board to sit. They have a cafe and toilets on the ferry. Really great public transport and an awesome way to see Sydney on a sunny day.
"GREAT TRANSPORT ". Enjoyed the fresh air during my travel . gave an amazing view of Harbour bridge and Darling harbour .
Anaversary weekend. . Made it very easy to get around Sydney. With great employees working with you to make it a satisfying experience.

Great transport option . We took a fast ferry to Manly. It wasn't much more than the other ferry and I would definitely recommend spending that bit extra. We enjoyed having a beer on board and watching the sights go by.
ferrys in \sydney. You must get an Opal card to travel on here thy don't accept cash, ferrys are clean, quick and the best way to get about.

Great to get around down. First off ! Make sure you got an opal card, otherways traveling around sydney on public transport is a nightmare.
Ferries are a great way to commute, no traffic jam and always on time.
Sydney Ferries. Sydney Ferries is an amazing ferries. You can have rounds of Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge & Sydney Darling Harbour from here.

Great, inexpensive way to see Sydney. The Sydney ferries are the best way to get around Sydney Harbour. They are relatively cheap as you can travel all day for only $15. They are comfortable and efficient. Best way to travel in Sydney to avoid the notoriously bad traffic.

Great Views. A ferry ride is a must when in Sydney. The children love it and the views are great. Good time for the kids to use the toilet facilities also. Buy an Opal card instead of individual tickets. Opal cards can't be purchased from the ferry stop, only from certain convenience stores & you can choose what amount of $$$ you put on the card. These can be used on the buses also.

Sydney Harbour Ferries. I have been using these ferries since I was a young commuter in the 70's.Now retired I am back to using them for pleasure ... getting around the beautiful harbour is so delightful, whether it is a trip to Manly for lunch and strolling around, to Taronga Wharf to walk from there to Bradleys Head and beyond, to Parramatta and all the wharves in between or just cruising around the Harbour.
Great ferry. Great ferry doesn't cost to much and runs all day, it's a great little taxi across the harbor to get you around and one of the best ways to get to manly beach
Great service.. Go anywhere on the harbour and get to see the suburbs. See the city looking back from a ferry - a good way to see more of Sydney.

Efficient water transport. My wife and I went to Manly beach from sydney via ferry on a beautiful mid day in august and experienced an enjoyable journey.The sydney harbour port is very clean and organized, the ticket machines user friendly. You get a very good view of the opera house on all angles on board the ferry. It was a relaxing and smooth ride.Ferry departures and arrivals on time!Truly hassle free.

Best Way to Travel. The ferries were frequent always on time, and it was another way of seeing the Opera house and bridge. The trip to Manley was slow but the views were good. The down side was they were not always clean.

Sydney Ferries run frequently.. It is the most pleasurable way to travel long or short distances. These are frequent, spacious and tidy. The views are amazing where ever you sit. It is so peaceful compared to the trains!

Take the unrushed ferry. Why would anyone take the faster ferry. You can never get a better view of Sydney harbour without whip lash and time to take as many views and pictures of the best harbour in the world

Watch or Climb Aboard!. The ferries constantly run into and out of their slips near the Opera House. They are fun to watch from near or from a hotel with a view, lighting up as the sun sets. Or you can climb aboard and get a spectacular view of the harbour from sea level and a ride for very little money - I think it was about $7 and if you just stay on you don't need a return ticket. Lovely fun!

An enjoyable experience. I took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and back. It was really enjoyable because one could take in views of the harbour, waterside homes, yachts and islands with amazing rock formations.

Amazing Views. To ride these ferries in such a pristine harbour is just glorious with the view of the City, Harbour Bridge and Opera House at your disposal, sensational, its a must do for everyone, enjoy.

Transport with a view. The best way to travel around the Harbour. It allows you great views of all the iconic landmarks and buildings. An Opal card allows you to use the ferries. The ferry system is very organised and easy to use. A must to experience if you are visiting Sydney.

A good ride. We took the ferry to Manly Beach and it was the best decision we made. The ride was comfortable and good. We had a good view of Sydney from the waters. Manly Beach was a good spot to hang out for the rest of the afternoon!

Excellent Service. Loved the servi3. Staff were informative and friendly. Ferries were clean and could provide seats where you can view all the buildings and monuments with ease. Very fast service. An awesome way to get around.
Good service on ferry. Using the service for the first time in Sydney was great,nice helpful staff,friendly people to talk to as well.

Great ways to see the beauty of Sydney. After a long walk from Macquarie st, botanical garden, operah house, the rock we completed our journey to explore river in Sydney using this ferries. You can see all the best view of Operah House, Harbour Bridge, Luna Park from different angle.And the best part is no need to pay just use your Opal card to use this ferries.

Circular Quay to Manly a must. This is probably going to be one of the best ferry trips ever. Viewing Sydney from the water is just an amazing way to experience this beautiful city. Manly has many nice cafes and restaurants so it is worth the trip.

Excellent: Quick, Cheap, Easy and Fun. Fully accessible using the OPAL pass these ferries range from effectively long cruises over to Manly and up to Parramatta, to short hops over to Tarnaga Zoo and Darlings Island.They are fully integrated into the bus train and light train network so they are convenient for getting anywhere in the city. Circular Quay is the main Hub.They are used extensively by commuters so if you are a visitor please keep that in mind in terms of time of usage.Full details on the Opal card are at the Transport New South Wales website

A wonderful way to see Sydney. This is such a fantastically relaxing way to get around Sydney. We caught the ferry from Watson's Bay to Circular Quay, then around to Darling Harbour. Quite inexpensive and so much less stress than driving. You get to see the Opera House & Harbour Bridge up close.

Fast and great views. We took the ferry a couple of times to cross to the other side and thoroughly enjoyed it. It was always on time and since the weather was beautiful we sat outside enjoying the views. It's really fast, you avoid traffic and enjoy the ride.

Quick trips beautiful views. The Sydney ferry system is definitely the quickest, most efficient and cheapest way to get to many locations in and around Sydney. You just have to buy an opal card at the ferry terminal and put money on it and use it instead of cash to ride the ferry. The kids loved the ferry and the ferries also make for great opportunities to take amazing pics or Sydney's most iconic sites like the bridge and the opera house.

Great day out for not much dosh. Well if you don't have a lot of free cash and want to impress the family this is the way to play the game! Board a Sydney ferry at Circular Quay and it all starts straight away, the kids loved it we had a picnic onboard BLISSThere are a great many places you can head to the Zoo, Manly, Balmain but make sure you choose fine weather,

Brilliant way to see Sydney and its harbour. The ferries run from both Darling Harbour and Circular Quay and will take you to just about anywhere around Sydney Harbour, though it can be fun just to use them to cruise around and get wonderful views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. Get your free Opal card and then load it with the appropriate amount of money and you can tap on and tap off to your heart's content.The fact that the cost of your travel with an Opal card is capped at A$60 per week means that you can get some remarkable bargains. We traveled into Circular Quay by train, then by ferry to Taronga Zoo where we got a bus up to the zoo entrance, and completed the return journey all for free as we'd reached our weekly cap!The ferries vary considerably in size and age, but all have more than adequate seating and you can always go on deck to admire the view. And they manage to keep remarkably to time, given the fact that they have to contend with the vagaries of the weather and other boats.

Sunday Ferry - Parramatta to Circular Quay. This is an all-stop service on a Sunday morning. Very busy although a leisure travel to the city via the waterways. A great way to see the waterfront properties and suburbs - great sights! OPAL card is a must. Relaxing trip and staff are always reminding safety first policy to all passengers.
To do !!!. It's to make if you're passing through Sydney, manly to the CBD with an amazing view of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge !

The best way to travel in Sydney. In addition to being the best and quickest way to travel in Sydney. By ferries has wonderful views of the harbor, the Opera House , Bridge and Darling Harbour . Single trip is 5,70 AUD and is possible only with the special card - OPAL.
Good way to transport. Sydney ferries are the best way to get to the further points of Sydney, such as Manly, Darling Harbour, Watsons Bay... enjoy the view from the ferry and relax!
Ferry trip to Manly. Buying an Opel card for visitors was difficult. The ferry trip was efficient & enjoyable. It was a great way to travel to Manly.

Fun Way To See Sydney Harbour. Sydney offers a range of Ferry Services - Commuter, Tourist etc. Trips are inexpensive and a lovely way to take in the beautiful Sydney Harbour. Highlights are trips to Manly (40 mins), Watsons Bay (40 mins), Darling Harbour (10 mins), Taronga Zoo (10 mins) and if you have the time a trip to Australia's second oldest City, Parramatta (90 mins). There are also Coffee Cruises, that are great value. Ferries are not luxurious but they are comfortable, many offering Snack Bar facilities. They offer indoor and outdoor seating. They, like most Sydney attractions, are Wheelchair-friendly.

Rivercat to Parramatta. . We finally took the Rivercat from Circular Quay to Parramatta and back. It's a great trip on a number of levels. The boat is pretty comfortable and the journey west and back reveals just how much Sydney is being transformed. We might not all agree on the direction, but it is educational. There are plenty of places to eat along Church Street and Parramatta is full of history. Catch the last ferry at 4.35pm for a gorgeous Winter sunset.

Easy and enjoyable way to see Sydney!. The ferry system in Sydney is very good. You can see a lot of Sydney by spending the day on different ferries. Just download the ferry timetable and you can enjoy a great day out, hopping off for lunch or coffee. There's a great cafe on Kirribilli wharf (not sure about other wharfs). Highly recommend and very cost effective!

Best way to understand Sydney Harbour. If your a visitor or a local this is the best way to get around the harbour cheaply and in comfort. Locals will often find a coffee shop or cafe at the end of the trip well situated near the wharf or, in some instances a great club. The Rowers at Abbotsford is one such club. Visitors are welcome. Go for lunch and catch the rivercat.
Beautiful. I took the ferry to Taronga Zoo and had a wonderful view of the Opera House and the Bridge. Very nice trip, worth it

Leave the car take the ferry. Great way to travel around and the views of the harbour are breathtaking. You can't go wrong. We ferried our way over to Taronga Zoo and Manly on numerous occasions. Great fun for the kids.

Brilliant way to cover large areas. THe ferries are amazing, you can get across to so many places and the fares are pretty reasonable.. you can also choose between fast and slow depending on your own plans , they also let you see the harbour area from a different perspective
Clean and punctual. The ferries were great. They ran on-time, were clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. Couldn't ask for more.
Easy to use and cost effective too.. We ferried from Circular Quay to the Toronga Zoo and to Darling Harbour. Fun to ride, great sights and quick and easy too. Best way to travel where you can!!

The best public transport you can think of. The Ferries of Sydney are part of the public transport and my favourite. They are little bit pricey but worth the ride. Sunday is probably the best day to use them because you pay 2.50 $ once and everything is for free the rest of the day. Tip:In order to use the public transport in Sydney buy your Opal Card at every 7Eleven.

Great value sunday family outing. We often use the $2.50 all day public transport on our Opal cards to take the ferry around the harbour. The ferry between darling harbour and circular quay includes a stop at the iconic luna park (the kids always ask to get off and we don't let them) and under the great harbour bridge.Unless there is a special event on, the ferries aren't crowded and we get a seat either upstairs or outside. A shout out to the ferry staff who are almost all fabulously friendly. Last ride we watched one of the crew teaching tourists how to take panoramic pictures of themselves and the opera house and harbour bridge on their phone.

Efficient, friendly and great value. What a great way to sight see Sydney harbour - whether you take the 30 minute trip to Manly or just hop on, hop off and walk/explore between ferry stops. So many directions to go!

Sydney Afloat . The Sydney Ferries system is just simply the cheapest and best way to get a look at our Wonderful Harbour. Make a day of it and Catch the ferry from Circular quay across to Manly. Have a day of sun and sand and then catch the ferry back. Great views and plenty of time to take them in and enjoy being out on the water.

Visit the zoo. Take a ferry from Circular Quay to the zoo at Mosman. This has got to be one of the best zoos in the world. Fifteen minutes from the city. On arrival take the cable car to the top then work your way down to the bottom to depart.

Nice ride. The ferry is a great way to get around. The only hing I would change is we waited around and made sure we were there early and missed out on the best seats as we did not know what gate would open to get on. They could make it more clear for those that come early for the best seats.

Sydney's Best. Sydney ferries are an everyday glory, and the most beautiful 10 minutes you can have in this endless spread of metropolis is the ride from Circular Quay to Luna Park. The views of the Opera House and the bridge are magnificent from a harbour dotted with sea vessels from majestic liners to sole kayakers. Get out at Luna Park, and if you have brought your swimmers have a dip at the public baths next to the ferry stop, or stroll along the bay, all the way to Macmahons Point if you like. The only problem with Sydney ferries is there are not enough of them, so check the timetable before heading out to plan your trip back.

Couldn't ask for more. Being pensioners we got reduced rail travel and so it turned out free travel on the ferries. The trains were a delight as we traveled off peak and thus always had a seat. The ferries to Manley we very frequent and a great experience on a windy day. We travel to Australia every year as we have family there, traveling by public transport is easier than driving. We look forward to our next trip later this year.

Great way to see Sydney. Catching a ferry to Manly is a great way to enjoy Sydney Harbour. You can get off and explore a gorgeous seaside suburb. If you have time to spare catch any ferry and just enjoy the views. Grab an Opal card at Circular Quay and just hop on any ferry, get off at the other end and explore. Go up the Parramatta River, over to Watsons Bay for the best fish and chips, across to Balmain or Darling Harbour to see different sides to this beautiful city of Sydney. Or take the family over to Milson's Point to visit our Luna Park. And best thing is travel within Sydney is capped at only $15 a day (only $2.50 per day on Sundays) so if you have the opal card you can travel all day in busses, trains and ferries much cheaper than private tours. And if you are planning a visit to Sydney and are a senior check out the opal website and pre-apply and it will only be $2.50 every day!

Great transport. We love travelling on the ferries. Get yourself an opal card, put money into it and your ready to travel on the ferrys, bus and rail. Always found the ferries to be clean and on schedule. Staff very friendly and it is the best way to travel around Sydney. I am amazed by the crews rope skills when pulling into the wharfs. Must do when in Sydney.
It's a "must do"!. Great value for money.Timely serviceClean ferriesEasy to use (use your Opal Card)Fast and efficientGreat viewsTake a trip and see where you end up!
Easy way to get around from the Circular Quay. Take the Ferry to Manly Wharf and the short walk to Manly Beach... and snap a photo of the Opera house on the way past!

Iconic Ferries are a must.... Take a ferry across to Manly and spend a few hours meandering around the beach and great little beachfront restaurants. However don't try to by a ticket in a rush as the machines for single trip tickets get backed up and there are no staff selling tickets in the evenings. If this happens just jump across to the Manly Fast Ferry where there are lots of helpful staff - it's not as iconic but it gets there quicker and is friendlier.

A great Sydney experience. All visitors to Sydney should have a trip on a harbour ferry high on their list of priorities. Last week we took a ferry to Manly and return, sitting up front and outside, despite the wind and showers. Truly exhilarating! We even enjoyed the rock and roll as we passed the famed Sydney Heads. For a quieter ride was also took a smaller ferry, heading under the bridge and up the harbour to places like Greenwich and Woolwich. A beautifully scenic way to enjoy the city, and thoroughly recommended. The only problem: the bureaucrats have made it almost impossible to buy tickets. Why does it have to be such a slow, frustrating and difficult process for visitors? At one stage we almost gave up. It was as though the authorities who run the ferry service have systematically tried to discourage tourists from travelling with them.

Great way to travel for visitors and locals alike. I'm new to town and love the ferries. They are timely, clean, comfortable and the crew are always friendly and courteous. The view is always lovely on the water and it's a relaxing way to travel. As mentioned in the previous person's review, you need the Opal card which can be bought at many small convenience stores etc. My sister visited from interstate and bought a card and will hang onto it until her next visit, so it won't go to waste. She had to get to the airport to return home and it was super easy to go on the ferry to Circular Quay and then just up the escalator to the train station above the Quay to catch the train to the airport. The trains run very regularly (around every 15 minutes or so?) and the airport is only a short few stops away. All in all the ferries offer a great alternative form of travel in Sydney.

A Great Way To Experience The Harbour . We had a great day of exploring while in Sydney, using the Ferries to get around and see the sights. As paper tickets are no longer accepted we had to purchase an "Opal Card" which we then used to touch on and off at each stop. The card itself initially had to be loaded with $20 minimum and we did have to top it up another 3 times over the course of our weekend as we only topped up $10 at a time. The most expensive ferry trip was over to Taronga Zoo... $5.45 each way (10 to 15 minute ride, no stops) Most other trips we took which included a number of stops was around the $3.50 mark. The ferries themselves were clean with lots of seating upstairs and down. We chose to sit outside at the front to get the best views and photo opportunities. Overall i think the ferries are a fabulous way of seeing the harbour and all the sights along the way including The Harbor Bridge and The Opera House....there are photo opportunities at every turn.

Great way to travel. Sydney ferries are the greatest way to see the greatest Harbour in the world. It is so much more relaxing jumping on a ferry, rather than sitting in traffic trying to cross the bridge. The ferry will take you across the harbor as you take in the sights. Most ferries connect with buses if you need to travel on.you can take food & drink on board and the Manly ferry has a kiosk. Circular Quay is the main connection point .Relax, enjoy the ferries.
Enjoy the trip. We took the fast ferry to Manly and took this one back to town. It is an older vessel but still very tidy. We enjoyed the time on the boat!

Great way to get around. For the visitor in Sydney the ferries are a terrific way to get around and not difficult to organise your trips with a bit of planning.Use an Opal card, load money onto it and away you go, available in lots of outlets and daily maximum spend is capped. Sunday 2.50 AUD max.Really nice trip on a good day is to take the train to Parramatta, have a look round Parramatta, walk to the ferry via the river walk and enjoy the river ferry trip back to Sydney.Sit outside at the bow, not too breezy as speeds are low down the river with frequent stops. Gives you a different perspective of Sydney suburbs.

Basic but stable ferry ride . The boat was basic but the ride was quite stable. We took it at night and could see quite a good night view of the Harbour Bridge. Public transportation so pricing was reasonable too.

Under staffed- Sunday discount tip. . The ferry service itself was very good, efficient. We visited on a Sunday we met a staff member who was so helpful and tried to save us money on our trip to Manly by buying an Opal card. If you travel on a Sunday it was £2.50 to travel anywhere. We wish we had known this before then we could have planned to go further afield. We had to queue for ages to get an opal card and the staff although really helpful they seemed overwhelmed by the amount of visitors.

A great way to travel about Sydney. This was so much fun! a great way to get around and reasonably cheap,and the views from the ferry are excellent. All the staff were very polite and helpful and there was never a long wait between ferries.
Ferry to Taronga Zoo. We decided to take the Ferry.Fares are little confusing when to scan or not. Overall a fantastic experience.

Iron Men !!. Just wonderful to step on board take a seat - in fine weather (often) one can sit out side and just admire the views, the beauty of Sydney shore line , the icons - bridge and opera house, the magnificent houses, the sailors and yachts, the coves and bays, - you could actually just spend a whole glorious day on the water hopping off where you wish and back on to one of these majestic iron beauties on Australia day they actually race ! now this is really great fun! especially if you are lucky enough to be on one - as I wasHighly recommend you use this means of transport for at least one of your go to destinations around the city and beyond.!
Cool breezes on old school transport. The best and most authentic way to get around the harbour, catch yet another perspective on the Opera House and Harbour Bridge and out to Manly etc.

Superb!. Took a ferry to the Taronga Zoo, and was pleased with the punctuality and efficiency of the service, and the cleanliness of the ferry. Can sit inside or stand out to enjoy the views, and the wind in your hair!

Rivercat to Parramatta a great experience. Depending on time of day it can be quite crowded on the Rivercat, but it is a smooth ride from the City to Parramatta and a great alternative to bus and train!

Good way to cross the harbour. I used the ferry to cross to Taronga Zoo and found it easy to use and very efficient. It's a great way to see the Opera House and Harbour Bridge from another angle and get great photos.
Efficient. Took the ferries several times over our stay. Very scenic and well-worth a little "cruise" around the harbor.

Excellent and reliable service. The best way to experience Sydney is from the water and what a better way to enjoy this lovely city than taking one of the ferries departing from Circular Quay, jwith services to North Sydney with its lovely houses and manicured lawns to Manly beach or Darling Harbour, do not forget to take your opal card with you !

Day trip . Went on one of the ferries at Circular Quay , wow !!! , wish we had these in Melbourne 😳... soooo fast and quick to get you where you want to go . The weather was great , so that was a bonus to sit up on top deck . Very efficient and fast , and very impressed , ...

Good short trip to get good photos and see sights. Circular quay to Darling harbour aboard the Sydney ferries is an excellent short trip to get good views of opera house and under the bridge and around the corner and into Darling Harbour. Great to go before a meal and enjoy all the restaurants on Kings Wharf.

Dont miss this when you have overseas visitors!!. This is the CROWN Jewel of Sydney!! The cheapest way of cruising the Sydney Harbour on a glorious day. Get the ticket from the circular quay. The ferries are very regular. You get a fantastic view of the Harbour, as well as the South Head and North Head guarding the GAP! The view on the northern coast as the Ferry hugs the coastal line is just breathtaking! On a glorious sunny day, you cannot imagine any place on earth that is more beautiful and impressive than this experience on a public ferry that costs so little!!At Manly, you spend the day working around and have a delightful seaside seafood lunch, do the Aquarium etc.Then back again on for the cruise back to Circular quay. Not to be missed if you are a tourist or if you have overseas visitors. Showcase Sydney Harbour at the cost of a cheap public transport ticket!!
Feel the ocean . Get to harbors and wharfs using very cheap ferries. Enjoy feeling of traveling in the ocean through the rocks of the shores around. Perfect view.

Used the Zoo Ferry. Timely, clean, inexpensive great views. The ferries run on time, well marked for destination, clean, inexpensive and you can use your Opal pass on it. The ferry that goes to the zoo has outstanding views of the Sydney Opera House and the Sydney Bridge. No food or drinks avaiable. Short ride. Visitors must check out these. Would go to Cuckatoo Island tonight.
As always spot on during current visit. First rate, fair price, on time and a great way to see the harbour. The ferries are something I miss having moved away.

Purchased the all-day ferry ticket. We purchased an all-day ferry ticket, to give you the flexibility to hop on and off at various points, we went at our own pace to visit Manly beach and got a nice tour around the harbour.

Are minded me of Auckland. We went over to Manly and back. Very calm crossing. Nice clean ferry, friendly staff. Enjoyed the whole experience. New Opal tickets were a bit confusing, you can't buy a one day return ticket. Plenty of food outlets each end.
Love it. We always make sure to have a ferry ride or 5 when we are visiting Sydney. Great way to just sit back and relax while looking at Sydney Harbour.
Best way to get around/. The Ferry system is Sydney is fast, inexpensive and reliable. The easiest and nicest way around Sydney
Brilliant Transport. We love to use the Sydney Ferries. Our favourites are Manly and Parramatta. The River Cats to Parramatta is a 45 min – 120 min sail and that for just AUD 7,60.

An Iconic Trip. On Sundays for two dollars fifty cents on your Opal card you can travel all day on the Sydney transport. You would be hard pressed to get better value than to take the Sydney Ferry to Manly. With the Opera House on one side and The Harbour Bridge on the other this ferry also crosses The "Heads" where the harbour opens to the Pacific Ocean. A better trip to see the Iconic sights of Sydney from a different prospective is hard to imagine. Thoroughly recommended.

Bargain touring!. We did have a beautiful, relatively calm day for our Manly trip. It takes a bit less than half an hour one way and the scenery of Sydney Harbour is gorgeous! We had the added bonus of seeing three of the tall ( sailing) ships coming home so that added to the magic. The cost is reasonable at $15.20, and with an Opal Transit card, that makes the rest of your public transport free for the day. The seating is comfortable and there were plenty of choices. We travelled on a week day so a weekend might be a bit more crowded, but the ferries run every half hour. We also used the Darling Harbour one and that actually goes under the bridge, so you can get an interesting perspective. Really, you can tour the harbour and river for $15/day which is a bargain!
Cheap Reliable Transport. Regular crossing and reasonably priced plus a great way to see the harbour and all the hustle and bustle that goes on there.

Great way to get around Sydney and see different view points. When we are in Sydney we always catch a ferry to 'somewhere'. Very efficient service and lots of choices. The new system of 'tap on/tap off' was great and easy to use.If you love being on the water, soaking up the sun/breeze and seeing Sydney from a different view point, then I thoroughly recommend this way of travelling in Sydney!

Smooth rides and on time!. I had several rides including during raining days. It was more or less on time. Smooth rides. Good services. The folks are professionals. I took a ride to Darling Harbour and Cockatoo Island. Some are locals who reside/work in the islands. Tips: See the timetable from the screen and look out which wharf you need to visit.

Budget friendly sightseeing. We took two different ferries on the harbour on a perfect winters day. The ferry wasn't overcrowded during the day so we were able to get good views as we travelled. The Opal card made this a very efficient way to see the Sydney Harbour

Another trip across the Sydney Harbour. It is always restful to use the ferryThe increase efficiency in the past years has made the service great to useI just wish they would use the Fish Market as a destination.

Great ride, great views all the way to the zoo!. The ride to Taroga Zoo crossed over perhaps the most beautiful part of Sydney Harbour. On the way we sat downstairs and I also ventured to the upstairs open air deck of the boat, too. (This was a slow process as I walk with a cane). But the view from up there was spectacular! It was a fun ride and very reasonably priced, too. I was happy to see there was a very adequate ladies bathroom on the main floor, too; I only wish there had been a toilet in the waiting area on Circular Quay, too. Otherwise, taking this ferry to the zoo was a fun way to further celebrate what the beautiful city of Sydney had to offer!

A nice ferry ride giving a different view of the harbour. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly, Watson Bay or the Zoo will give you a chance to see the Opera house and Harbour Bridge at a very nice able. The ride is under $6 for a return fare. The length is about 15-20 minutes depending how many stops in between.
A ferry is a ferry. Not much to say about the ferries, they were clean, and on time. Spectacular views of the Harbour, its definitely worth getting on one, just for the photo opportunities!!

Easy professional transport . The Sydney Harbour ferry transport system is World Class. The main attractions along the harbour are easily accessible.
I would highly recommend using this easily accessible transport system.
Great activity when in Sydney.. Ferry to Manly is a great way to experience being on the harbour. At Manly can see the harbour side and ocean beach side. Many eateries.
Good value. This is great and inexpensive way to see Sydney from the water. We went to Manly and the Zoo on the ferry, which was quick and easy..

Used the ferries to get around and beat traffic. Sydney is a modern city with a large central business district close to many attractions, so, guess what? traffic. The ferries are very reasonably priced and reliable. they also bet fighting traffic

Always on time and great for visitors. Can't think of a better tour to do w friends and family that come to visit. Been taking the ferries for over a year now in Sydney and I don't recall once they weren't on schedule. These ferries run like the German train system; highly punctual! Circular quay to Manly is always a fantastic way to spend $10 on a "harbour tour". Pick up an opal card at any news agency or 7-11 (they're free!) and drop $20 on it.
Take a ferry to Manly Beach or to other beaches.. Beautiful smooth ride to Manly beach. Cost AUD 14 round trip with Opal card. They sell snacks on board. Seating inside or out. A lovely voyage.
love a ferry ride. ride across the sydney harbor to manly or other places. great price and ride is smooth. snacks avaliable to purchase on board.

Sydney ferries are a bargain. Sydney is an expensive city. As in any major international city, many things cost an arm and a leg. The ferries are a bargain I recommend taking the ferry to Manly. Midweek, there is hardly anyone on the ferry and the beach.is practically deserted..The fare is very reasonable. Sydney is known as the Harbour City and the ferries are one of its best features.

The Way to go. So much of Sydney is water-based, due to the massive Sydney Harbour, that the Sydney ferry system is an essential and convenient transport mechanism for the locals. But it's also a great way for visitors to get around too - like the Star Ferry in Hong Kong. You get to see all the Sydney sights from the water, but at public transport prices rather than tour prices. The Manly Ferry is a good choice (see separate review category).Make sure you try one out when visiting Sydney.

Breath taking beauty. A trip from Manly to the city and back or the other way around is a must for every one. Spectacular Sydney harbour with all the beaches is a sight worth seeing. Take the regular ferry and sit back and enjoy!

Remarkably calm crossing!. Even though the weather was breezy and a little chilly (it was of course winter time!) the crossing was refreshing and calm. Take a camera or IPad etc so that you can capture those special moments of the seas and scenery around you. You may want to pack a hat!

Great way to travel around sydney. The Sydney Ferries are a fun, inexpensive way to travel in Sydney. We took the ferry to Manly from Circular Key. It was easy to find, buy tickets and you get a great view both leaving and coming back to the Quay.
Nick60. Plenty of them to take you all round the Harbour, and good value for money too. You don't have to wait too long and there's lots of room
Do not miss a ride on the ferry. A must do to experience Sydney Harbour you can pay with you Opal card which is convenient , timetables available that tell exactly when the boats leave

Too much fun. If you want to see the best of Sydney harbour, you have to go on a Sydney Ferry ride. It can take you past some of the best and most expensive houses in the world, all on the best piece of waterway in the world. Very cheap and a must do for anyone. You can access the zoo, seaworld and also a great theme park, or go on a lunch cruise and just take in the sights.
travel. busy, regular, good value on OPAL transit card best way to travel to & from Luna Park, Taronga, Circular quay, Darling Harbor, bondi & Manley

Amazing views of the harbour. I love the Sydney ferries, especially the ones that go to Manly and Watsons Bay. Unfortunately you always have to go back to Circular Quay before taking a ferry to another destination
Sydney Ferries. A great way to get around and check out what Sydney Harbour has to offer at a reasonable cost. Also very relaxing on a lovely sunny day.
Great way to get around. Great way to get to see Sydney - recommend just for the trip and the photos !! Best to use knuckle when using ticket machines....... can be temperamental.
Best travel bargain in town. Sydney ferries offer the best and cheapest travel bargain in town, by a day pass and go from Parramatta to Watsons Bay and more.
Cheapest way to visit the harbour. Taking a trip on Sydney Ferries on a sunny day is a great way to see the extensive harbour. Especially Saturday afternoons when multiple sailing craft are racing.

Much better than a cruise. Took the ferry to Manly and back again. Stop off at Manly for an ice crea, ocean swim, stroll along the mall or walk out to the quarantine station. Much cheaper than a cruise and you can tailer the activities at Manly to suit your interest and time.
Sydney Circular Quay. I enjoyed these activities very much! I loved doing the ferry at night, the harbour is so beautiful.

Good way to travel. Sydney Ferries are a good way to see Sydney Harbour. Buy a ticket and then let yourself explore. It doesn't matter if you happen to "get lost". In fact it might be the best thing you may end up doing.

the best ferry services in Sydney and Australia. This is a one of a kind in the world. You can travel all other the harbour and the river by well serviced ferries
Always or mostly on time and great connection offered.
also a fantastic and cheap way to see Sydney’s water ways

Included in your Opal public transportation card. By now Sydney also has a card used for all public transportation. You buy the Opal card at any convenience store, and add funds to it also at the convenient stores.It offers a wonderful deal for us tourists, as you have unlimited rides on trains, buses and ferries for a maximum of 15 Australian dollars.I took the ferry to Manly beach, from wharf #3. It was about a half hour ride each way. You get absolutely stunning views from around Sydney Harbour and a close up look at the bridge. You also get wonderful views of the Sydney Opera House. Manly beach was beautiful! If you're lucky enough, you might be able to see whales migrating, during the month of July.
affordable and enjoyable. As a tourist taking the ferry will give a similar experience as the Hop-on Hop-Off but by sea. Worth trying it.

Cheapest way for the best view in town. This is the cheapest way for the best view in Sydney. Boats are aplenty and they go everywhere around town and they offer the most stunning views in the city - at the most moderate rates!
Enjoy our harbour & rivers. Travelling by ferry is traffic free and a wonderful way to see so much of Sydney and beyond. View the spectatular houses along the way.

MOSMAN by Ferry. In July I went by ferry to Mosman. It is a very "civilised" way to travel without the hustle and bustle of the city traffic. You board the ferry at Circular Quay. The sights along the way are notable, particularly the Opera House. Once I got to the Mosman wharf a bus was waiting to take you up to the Mosman shopping strip. Mosman was delightful with all its variety of shops from fashion to food. I got a bus back to Circular Quay . An interesting way to spend a day.

Very convient location. You can catch the ferries from Circular Quay to many locations but one of the bestrides is from Sydney to Manly. On a sunny day it is great to see the Bridge, the Opera House and sail past Sydney Heads. Much better value than paying for some of thecruises.

Ferry travelling of my childhood!. I was excited to be back on the ferries, not having been on one since my Grandmother took me as a young teenager from Circular Quay to Manly.My brother & I were off to visit Double Bay, tickets purchased & we were off! A slight swell making the ride even more memorable. Locals & visitors alike all were able to sit on the seats provided or like me - camera in hand & taking photos of points of interest! Lots of fresh air blowing around us, certainly makes the trip clean out any snuffly or stuffy nose!There was never a dull moment the time I was on, before too long it was time to get off, explore the area & then delight ourselves again on the return trip!

See it as a local. One of the best features of Sydney is its ferry service. It is fast, cheap and easy to use. For instance you can get a smartcard, add some value to it and you're off. The card, Opal Card can be picked up at Circular Quay. One of the best trips is to take ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay. Have lunch or breakfast there. Then take a bus from Watsons Bay to Bondi Beach. Walk around there and jump on the bus again to the city. Cheap and covers some great spots. Enjoy

Great Ferries. We used the ferries a lot as it is the cheapest way to travel round the huge harbour. Buy a family ticket and get on and off at different stops. The Ferries are free on Sundays when you get families out enjoying themselves.

Cruising - Never Snoozin'!. First rode the "Manly Ferry" to Taronga Park Zoo from Circular Quay when I was 7 years old. A must do trip for any visitor to Sydney. Best way to see the harbour & surrounds - on the water. Cheap at the price! Public transport after all. Don't miss the Aussie eagles fly when the zoo hosts an ornithologists smorgasbord at aviary. Show time is in an open forum overlooking Sydney harbour. Take your camera & have it set for "sports"!

Great way to see Sydney Harbour. Catch the ferry from circular Quay to Manly and have lunch there.Or catch the ferry to Watson's Bay and have lunch there. It is a wonderful trip and shows Sydney at its best. Well worth doing and such fun on a Sunny day.
hanley to circular quay. they have fixed the terrible jetty we had in henley now its amazingeasy for elderly peopleit even has a lift now for the disable
Views amazing. No matter which ferry you take there is something for everyone. Worth the ride for the views alone. Very efficient and courteous staff.

Economical access to many beauty spots aournd the harbour. We always use the ferries when staying in Sydney. It's even fun to ride them and see all the stops (without getting off) We have done much exploring this way using our Opal card. Go to the Zoo....go to Manly....go to Watson's bay, do a walk around, have lunch and travel back to the city. It really is the best way to get around.

An interesting way to see Sydney. Being a local I travel on the ferries all the time. I live near Parramatta and catch the them every time I go to the city. Sydney Harbour is the most spectacular harbour in the world and yes I am biased but I am well travel and therefore also qualified to say this. You can catch a ferry to Luna Park; a fun park on the shores of the harbour and a 5 minute ferry ride. Of course you can also walk there by crossing our famous Harbour Bridge but if time is of the essence a ferry ride is perfect. You can catch a ferry to the Zoo, ride the condola up to the top and then walk down and catch the ferry back to the Quay. You can catch the ferry to Manly Beach for lunch and then back again. That is about a 45min voyage and a beautiful one. Whilst in Manly you can just wander around; there are hundreds of cafes to choose from along the beach front or go to the North Fort display which is a Defence of Sydney display with gun implacements and tunnels used in WWII; and a Memorial Walk of Commemoration for our Soldiers in all wars. There is also a lovely Cafe for lunch and walks with amazing views of our spectacular harbour. You can get there by bus.You can catch a ferry to Parramatta up the Parramatta River. This was the first area settled after they realised the ground of Sydney Cove was not good for growing food. The farms at Parramatta saved the colony from starvation. In those days they used to row a small boat which also had a small sail. Whilst at Parramatta you can see the Old Government House, where the gate house is now a lovely Cafe; Hambley Cottage, lots of small colonial homes that now are now occupied by Law firms, accountants, architects, and medical rooms but the outside of them are original. Parramatta is also a very cosmopolitan city in it's own right and well worth the visit. There are many restaurants alfresco or inside. The ferries however, don't run as frequently to and from Parramatta and you will need to ask when boarding what time they will be available to return to the city. This has a lot to do with the tides in the river. If the ferry is not available the trains or the buses will be. I hope when you come to my city of Sydney you have a wonderful time. It is a beautiful city. The best times are from March to November unless you like the heat of Summer. If that is the case you will enjoy our city all year round although it can get cold, wet and windy in Winter. June, July August. Happy Travels.
Convenient way to get around and to use for sightseeing on the harbour. Great way to experience all the sights and sounds of Sydney Harbour. Also very easy to use to get from one place to another.

Ypu can't beat this for atmosphere and nostalgia. The old ferries are so easy to get around and they rock and you can lean over the edge and enjoy the spray from the water or remain safe and warm inside. The Manly ferries offer the best view of the harbour and Manly is a fun place to visit with both harbour and ocean beaches and lovely scenic walks

Great way to see the city from the water. We took the Manley Beach ferry on an afternoon and it was a great experience. Maybe the weather was part of it (sunny and warm), maybe the time of day, returning from Manly to Sydney harbour late afternoon. The light on the Opera House and city skyline was awesome, the water bright blue. It doesn't get any better than that. And all for just a fistful of dollars!
Sydney Ferries. This is the most economical way to see our great harbor, you can also do the jetcat up the Parramatta River from the ferry terminal.

Ferry to Manly. I bought the wrong ticket at the self-service machines which was really difficult to navigate, however the staff let me travel both ways as they could see my receipt was for today's travel. Good service, clean ferry though obviously very busy. It might be better to have a more controlled boarding process to help disabled or families with strollers / buggies but other than that it was a reasonably priced, fast service.

Iconic Views!. WOW ! These ferry rides are a MUST when visiting Sydney... especially taking one to Manly..just the gorgeous views of all the iconic places in sydney...they beautiful harbour and the breeze.. take the best pictures.. then to walk along the mall and enjoy the shops...and eat fish and chips ON the beach.. then take a nice leiursely stroll on the beach.. take a dip in the ocean too.. even as an aussie..when I visit Sydney.. this is always a must do for me.. take an afternoon and enjoy...also buy a kilo or 2 of the mixed lollies at the ferry ... they are to die for.. reminds me of when I was very little eating those same lollies..

Great fun and free with transport card. We used the ferry loads of time. Frequent, clean and comfy. Plenty of staff and good safety precautions. The toilets were clean. Sesting in and outside. Great views on route.
Great way to get around . Great way to get around sydney.and island hop. Seeing the views from the ferries is a must. Run to time. Clean and friendly
Ticket please. Fast, efficient and enjoyable. Reasonably priced, and a great way to see Sydney. Had some great weather, so a rather cruisey experience.

Great Service . Took a Ferry to Manly and found it a fantastic way of seeing the great sights of The Harbour Bridge and The Opera House. Used an Opal Card to pay and found this ticketing system very efficient and easy to use. Staff were very nice and the cafe onboard was quite reasonable in price.Definitely a must to do when in Sydney.

Just a Great way to get around Sydney Harbor. We bought an OPAL Card a the nearest newsstand and put $20 on it. We then took the Ferry to Watson's Bay for Lunch which goes right past the Opera House. So great pic's from the Ferry and then took it back to the Quay after and nice lunch. We then walked the Sydney Bridge and took it back to Darling Harbor. Very nice rides and great way to get around the Harbor. Recommend it to everyone that really wants to see the sites.

Great ferry to Manly. We took the ferry to Manly last week and it was great, it took about 30 mins but was nice and leisurely. We were able to take some great photos of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House and take in the amazing sights. We sat/stood up the front of the ferry. It was such a lovely sunny day, which I'm sure helped too. It is also very reasonably priced. They leave every 30 minutes, on the hour and half form Circular Quay and quarter past and quarter to from Manly.

Ferry trip from Parramatta to Circular Quay. Must do to gain an overview of Sydney on a ferry ride. No tour guide so expect a leisurely ride to see waterfront homes and take the best photos as you ride up to and under the Sydney Harbour Bridge and past Luna Park and the Opera House.Only recommendations. Phone ferry information from Parramatta incase tide is too low, take your own water as only water fountains onboard, sunscreen if you plan to sit on ferry outside deck.

Sydney afloat. A great way to view Sydney from a different perspective. The ferries which criss cross the city are efficient, clean and generally punctual. Seating is plentiful and available on deck and inside, under cover. As an occasional tourist from the UK I can say that the ferries are relatively inexpensive and provide good value for money as a pleasant alternative to traffic and taxis, particularly at heavy road use times. From 1 August 2016 it appears that you'll have to buy tickets in advance of travel as paper tickets are being discontinued. This means buying an Opal Card which covers all public transport (except taxis).

Super Way to see the Sights!. Use the ferries to travel around Sydney. Opal card covers the use of the ferries, and is super value for money. take the trip to beautiful Manley well worth the scenic half hour trip.
Dream trip on harbour. Darling harbour to. Circular quay brilliant ride under bridge magnificent in all weather on Sunday's only 2.50 for day ticket even better !!!!

A Trip to Manly. Would highly recommend doing this as you got to see the Harbour Bridge and up close to the Opera House. The kids loved it and there is so much room. We went outside to get the whole experience. Has a toilet which was handy. Also had a shop/ café on board which was great to get a coffee or ice-cream.

Low cost, excellent view. I enjoyed the ferry ride from Darling Habour to Circular Quay. It was a fabulous and sunny day, sitting on the deck gave us a wonderful view of the bay as well as several iconic attractions such as the Darling Habour Bridge, Luna Park and Sydney Opera House.

Sydney from a unique perspective. Sydney can be experienced form so many perspectives - land, sea and air. Each has its own special characteristics. The ferries are always an option, and must never be discounted. They criss-cross the harbour and along the Parramatta River transporting office workers on their relaxed journey to or from work, as well as tourists. Views from the ferries are often spectacular, and give an opportunity to see the expansiveness of the harbour foreshores, as well as some of its magnificent homes. It is a very reasonable cost to have this special view of Sydney's magnificent foreshores.
Great way to see the sydney . The best form of public transport in sydney and the most comfortable way to get anywhere. Take advantage of the chance to see the city from the water.

Beautiful scenery and easy to get around. Sydney ferries are a great way to see sydney: whether it be a short hop across the harbour, a cruise up the parramatta river, or the longer drag out to Manly. The most cost effective way to do it is buy an opal card. You can do this at the newsagency at the ferry wharf.
Convenient. I had no idea of the efficiency of the Sydney Ferries. They are on time, well-run and very convenient. They are also great for self-tours of the Harbour.

Amazing and cheap.. When visiting Sydney, you can go on these every day for a week and still not see nearly everything on the harbour. Using the Opal card, MUCH better than the stupid Melbourne MYKI, makes travel a breeze in Sydney.

Great way to get around other attractions. The most central location to get to many of the other attractions: Taronga Zoo, Luna Park, Manly Beach and more. It is also great way to see the city, get awesome views of Sydney Opera House, the Harbour Bridge, the skyline and if you know where to look: PM Malcolm Turnbull's house.

Used regularly. A must do when you visit Sydney, stunning views for the tourist. But as I found at $5 for a 10 minute trip form neutral bay to circ quay it becomes quite expensive if you do it regularly.Any journey on the Sydney ferries cost the same expect manly and parramatta which are the two routes that can cost more.

The best way to experience Sydney harbour. Sydney ferries have been the favourite way to travel for habourside residents and visitors for almost as long as Sydney has been a city. It is very hard to beat stepping on a ferry to travel to work in the city with the sun up on a fine morning. Similarly for visitors there is no better way to enjoy the beautiful harbour and surrounds than on a ferry. Services are regular and largely on time. Don't miss a run to Manly and back.

Great for residents and visitors. We have been on all the Sydney ferry trips, including the "long distance" ones to Parramatta and Manly. They are a marvellous and efficient way to travel and a very easy way to find your way around many of the sydney suburbs. Now you must buy an Opal card first, available at convenience stores and newsagents all over the city as well as at the ferry terminal and main train stations; these Opal cards can be used on all forms of public transport in and around Sydney.

Great view of the harbour. The Sydney ferries are a great mode of transport around Sydney harbour. I caught the ferry this trip from circular quay to cockatoo island then a ferry back to darling harbour. The trip was pretty quick and provides a great view of the harbour. On previous trips I have caught the ferry to Luna park. Reasonably cheap and great mode of transport.
This was how we got around daily.... The schedule was very user friendly and we traveled around every day easily. We would definitely recommend this way to travel
Great views . I took the ferry to manly. It's a great time to get out on the water, enjoy the air and sun, and see the harbour. It's not very expensive, either. I really enjoyed it and recommend it.

Must do in Sydney. You absolutely have to take the ferry while visiting Sydney. The paperticket times are over and you should buy first an Opal card. Once done, you are free to take any public transport. We loved the ride to Manly beach and the Zoo.

Go the ferries. We took ferries every day over four days - to Darling Harbour, to explore the Harbour, to admire the Vivid Light festival - they are just wonderful boats. A great, efficient system of travel. And such character
Good trip. Trip out to manly. Good traditional trip to take. Was overcast but still a good trip to take. Ferrys in Sunday very cheap at $2.50
Sydney ferries are great. We were travelling with our daughter and grandson. We used the ferries quite a few times and had no problems. Very professional staff
Convenient and not too expensive. Get an Opel card. Great value and you can travel most places on it. We bought $40 worth of travel though could have had more for a 4 day visit
a nice way to experience sydney. weather permitting, this is a nice way to explore sydney. take a short trip to manly, enjoy the breeze and take in the view.

A great way to get around the harbour. Sydney harbour is enormous and many parts are accessible by ferries. My favourite is the ride over from Manly to the city as it is a stunning trip. Decent coffee and meals are also available.
Hong's Family Trip 2016. Ferry looks old but well taken care inside, nice experience when sailing to Manly with beautiful photography Sydney Opera and the Bridge from a distance.

Nice service. You can sit/stand outside or sit inside. It was a nice and relaxing tour with an amazing view of the harbor bridge. Recommend travelling on Sunday as there is a $2.50 cap on all travel options for the day!

Don't miss it. Sydney ferry provides great service and links you to most tourist attraction points, especially Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. You could also see Opera House, Harbour Bridge and the city from different angles.

Great way to take in the sights of Sydney & it harbour. Hands down - the best way to take a quick look at all the main sights of Sydney Harbour & surrounds for very little money & even less physical effort. Depending on which ferry you take you will travel passed some of Sydney's most well known places - Kirribilli House (Prime Ministers residence) - Bondi, Garden Island Naval Base etc. The views of The Coat Hanger & Opera House are absolutely not to be missed.
Good value. Get the Opal card and use it lots. Especially on a Sunday as the fares are $2.50 maximum for the day.

Great value. Sydney Ferries are cheapest way to tour around the Sydney Harbour. Always bring visitors from overseas hop on and they usually mesmerise by the beauty of the water view, Opera House, Harbour Bridge.ThanksSharky

Delightful. The public transportation card, opal, covers the ferries, too. The service's regular & punctual. The ferries are clean, accommodate a lot of passengers with seats for all. The'yre a scenic mode of transportation.
Sydney ferries . The ferry was clean and spacious. Loved the trip and scenery. The staff could have been more friendly though
