enjoy some time on the harbour or just watch them coming and going. the green and yellow people movers are worth watching just ot see the life of hte harbiour - even better, get a day explorer and jump on and off and see the harbour in its true working form
Darling Harbour - Circular Quay. Excellent option to see some great landmarks of Sydney Harbour, Good value, and weather permitting outside seating, great photo opportunities

Watery trails to adventure. How often do you go to a new city and take a ferry to a lunch stop. Not so often I would say. Even locals don't trail blaze around the Sydney Harbour, so much. But there are a few exciting destinations you can visit on a Sydney Ferry. Like taking the ferry to Taronga Park Zoo and having lunch near the exotic animals or taking a ferry to Parramatta and visiting Old Government House in Parramatta Park. Sure there is a little bit of walking involved from the wharves, but well worth your exploration. Take a ferry to Manly for some fish and chips at the ocean beach, or to Balmain East Wharf for a historic walk up Darling Street to a nice shopping strip with some nice cafes for lunch or dinner. It is really nice to have that Titanic moment when you stand at the bow of the ferry with your arms stretched out and the wind in your hair. Be adventurous and ferry to some new horizons. Great for families and couples alike.

Ferries are an iconic feature of Sydney Harbour. Life in central Sydney revolves around the Harbour. The traditional cream and green ferries are one of the easiest ways to get around the significant points on the Harbour.There are four main types of ferries, the largest are the Circular Quay to Manly ferries which go the length of the harbour, it's a great way see the spectacular waterfront houses and little bays. Some trivia about the names of ferries, Manly ferries tradionally are named after the Northern surf beaches - Narrabeen, Freshwater or Collaroy for instance. Next in size are the Lady Class (named after the wives of Governors). These work heavy usage inner harbour routes like the Circular Quay to Tarronga Zoo. The "First Fleet" class are named after the ships of the First Fleet that brought the first convicts and settlers to Australia. These are the backbone of the inner harbour fleet and go to places like Neutral Bay, Mosman and Darling Harbour. The fourth class are the sleek, low profile "Rivercat" class, named after Australian female Olympians, they go under the Harbour Bridge and up the Parramatta River to places like the Sydney Olympic venue. Nearly all the ferries run to and from Circular Quay, at the end of the main streets of Sydney. Get advice about ticket types and timetables either at Circular Quay or on the transportnsw.info website. One favourite trip for Sydneysiders is taking a ferry to Rose Bay for a drawn out seafood lunch and swim. No need to worry about parking and the ferry ride back to Circular Quay combats the effects of a fine lunch.

Great way to get around. I used the Ferry to go to Manly beach and Tay handyronga Zoo.You can purchase your Zoo tickets at the Ferry terminal now which I found very handy.The ferries are a great way to get around and are adequately priced.

Lovely trip, getting tickets can be tricky. We went to Manly beach by ferries. There is a display board showing the warf names and ferry timings. Ticket machine was tricky when international credit cards were used at the Circular quay. Be there a few mins before the scheduled departure to secure a place in the ferry to watch scenic Sydney icons such as Opera house and Sydney harbour bridge.

A day in Sydney is not complete unless you see our harbour from a ferry. Select any ferry destination at Circular Quay and you will get a great look around the best harbour in the World. My first choice is to Manly closely followed by Darling Harbour and or a River Cat. An ideal day tour with overseas or domestic visitors.

Great experience on Sydney harbour. The ferries are a great way to move around Sydney, especially between Darling Harbour and Cicrcular Quay. Great views of Sydney Harbour bridge, the Opera House and the city skyline.

A must do in Sydney but timetables often incorrect. We do love the ferries and often use them when in Sydney particularly the Quay to Balmain run (Balmain was a fishing village in the early 1900s & still a vibrant village with cafes, restaurants, history etc). So why the "average" rating...as mentioned the timetables are often incorrect but the other problem is the unfriendly staff when you ask a simple but perfectly sensible question. Even if it was a dumb question - the staff need to be understanding that tourists are trying to sort it all out...we heard some overseas tourists being spoken to in a very abrupt manner. Really no need for that! However, do take the ferries - we took our grandchildren (6 & 8) all over the place (now get a Senior's discount)...not only Balmain but Manly beach, Taronga Park and the City Centre (we stayed in Balmain). They spotted Luna Park and the pool so we've promised them a return trip to Sydney in Spring.
Great experience. The ferries are both cheap and very accessible. Use your Opal card to pay for the trip which you can use on all Sydney public transport.

Great way to commute!. Don't know what I would do without the Sydney Ferries? I love Sydney and make it a point to stay around the Circular Quay/Harbour area as it is right in the heart of the City and easy to get along. The Sydney Ferries are the best way to commute from one place to another. I love going to Manly for my fish and chips and Watson Bay for a good meal and all these commutes are made so easy by the Ferries. The Ferries are safe, clean and timely. Try sitting on the upper deck if you are returning from Manly in the evening and look at the Sydney skyline from far -- it is amazing!?

Rivercat from Parramatta. Took a leisurely 1.5 hour rivercat ferry ride from Parramatta to Circular Quay. Completely wheelchair accessible, hence a great way to travel with wheeled luggage if you are not in a hurry. Unforgettable Sydney city views from the ferry.

Who doesn't love a boat ride ?. While most of the ferries are essentially buses on water, they do have one of the most beautiful vistas to work in. There will be many who use them as a commute, but this can be an excellent way to see the harbour whether your a local or a tourist. My favourite is the Manly ferry - about 35 mins long, a great ride through a lovely part of the harbour and the fun of traversing the heads (be warned - really bumpy during windy/inclement weather). Your destination of Manly is like stepping into a far away seaside town, with so many fun things to do.

Manly ferry trip. On time, friendly staff, reasonable price, lovely views of the harbour and Opera house ,Harbour Bridge. Every visitor to Sydney must do the trip to Manly or at least to Darling Harbour. Staring at Circular Quay or Darling Harbour or Manly Wharfs

Superb, wonderful, amazing- don't miss the experience!. We never cease to marvel at the wonders and beauty of Sydney Harbour and the best way of exploring it is vis the ferries that leave from Circular Quay. If you are a senior you can uses as many ferries as you want (as well as the entire city bus and train system) for a maximum charge of five dollars a day. A wonderful bargain. The ferries operate in all weather conditions and its one of the nicest things you can do when the weather turns foul. There's plenty of cover in the inside ferry cabins. Don't bother to pay the ridiculously high price charged by private boat and ferry operators at Circular Quay. The good old fashioned municipal socialism of the ferry system's public transport operator is good enough.

Good value and great for views. We were staying in Glebe so a convenient walk to Darling Harbour for the ferry to Circular Quay. We used this return service in consecutive days and also took the fast ferry to Manly.Timetable was spot , ferries were clean and the staff friendly. A great way to travel and beaut for the views and photo's.

Super Way to Get Around. Sydney Ferries are the best. I lived in NSW for about 1 1/2 years, it was the best, cheapest way to get around. If you've ever parked (or considered parking!) in Sydney you'll understand this! Not only that but you get a totally different view and it's absolutely stunning. I love NSW!
Cheap on a Sunday. Take the ferry on a Sunday for only $2.50, and go to Manly or Parramatta or any of the inner harbour ferry stops.

Skimming over tranquility. The Sydney Ferries are the only way to truly see and feel the beauty of Sydney Harbour. They are reliable, the staff are friendly and value for money. Take a trip to one of the many wharves dotted along the harbour, take a walk and then resume your ferry trip. Just a delight.

Relaxing way to explore Sydney's waterways. The depot for Sydney ferries is Circular Quay, located at the Harbor end of the CBD, next to the Opera House. There are ferries going to different areas on the northern side of the Harbor, including to the Zoo, Mosman, Neutral Bay, Kirribilli (where our Prime Minister's official residence is) and McMahon's Point. Ferries also head west going along the Parramatta River. Thousands of Sydney siders go to work by ferry so they run more frequently during peak hours, less regularly at other times. There is also the Manly ferry. Taking different ferries is a great way to see different areas of the city and there are daily ferry tickets available.

Good service weather permitting . Not a bad service have caught ferries in Sydney numerous times. When friends or family come down good way to take in the harbour, opera house harbour bridge Etc and parramatta river. Sight seeing catch the river cat from parramatta to circular quay change at the Quay for the Manly ferry to Manly beach try and time your day in Manly so that on your return journey it's coming on dark so when you approach the harbour quay it will be all lit up. Cheap way to see a lot of the harbour sights and lights
Great cost & benefit. What a charming, yet inexpensive, way of getting around Sydney! From Manly to Circular Quay, from Circular Quay to another wharf.

The best way to see Sydney Harbour. Ferries are a cheap and easy way to see Sydney Harbour. With all the different routes you can get to see many different parts and the ferries go into small bays and coves as well and give a closeup view. There is also a 'river cat' that is an excellent scenic trip up the Parramatta river starting from the harbour. Generally on time and fast and efficient too.

Best way to see Sydney harbour. Forget expensive cruises.. I have lived in Sydney for 47 years. I came from the uk. I have always lived near the harbour and the ferries are such a great way to see Sydney from the water and a great way to get to and from work. Unfortunately they are an expensive mode of transport now but well worth it. So much more to a trip than a bus and ferry. Beware though in off peak in their wisdom the timetable is limited to about one an hour.

Easy way to get around Sydney Harbour. I didn't realize the ferries were a popular thing in Sydney but they are. They are very convenient and not that expensive to ride. You can get some great photos of the Sydney Bridge and the Opera House. They're worth the ride.

Cheap, get opal card. Ferries are relatively cheap and easy way to get around Sydney. Taxis are very expensive. Uber is another alternative, but still not as cheap for the long distances. If you can spare the cost, it is a must stay near. In Sunday's max charge is 5.00 AUD for all ferry/train use. 15AUD all other days. Half that for kids. It is a little difficult to figure out the ferries at the wharf, but once you do, it's fairly simple.
Bondi for lunch. Grabbed the ferry across to Bondi to enjoy lunch, always a great site to see from the ferry across the harbour

A love since childhood. I have ridden the Sydney ferries since I can remember. I love it. If you are visiting Sydney, these commuter ferries will give you a great view of Sydney Harbour at a small price. Take the "Manly Ferry", a classic ferry ride, and see the length of the harbour. Lots to do in Manly before you jump back on. The trip will take you past the harbour bridge, Opera House, Pinchgut (Fort Denison in the middle of the harbour), past places like Taronga Park Zoo and past the grand North & South Heads of the harbour. Make sure you take the older ferry, it is cheaper and a great experience. There is a fast ferry for a few more dollars. This is fine if you are a commuter or in a hurry. BTW, if the weather is a bit rummy, you may find the Manly ferry a wild ride near the heads. If this sounds a little too adventurous, there are lots of ferry options in safe waters near the bridge. Another great option is to take the cat (ferry) to Parramatta and see a completely different view of the harbour.

Great way to see the harbour sights. Love the ferries to see the harbour and visit the sites. Had s trip across to Manly and return. An easy way to get around and very relaxing. Can recommend the ferries as a smoke and affordable way of seeing Sydney from the water.

The only way to travel. If there is a better way of getting around Sydney without stress and tearing your hair out in traffic jams, then I've yet to find it.From the airport (or other destinations in NSW) simply catch the train to Central station then get on any of the City Circle line trains for a quick 3 stop trip to Circular Quay and you will see the Ferry terminals a few minutes walk away, with the Harbour Bridge to your left and the Opera House to your right.By far the most popular route is the famous Manly Ferry, which always seems packed with tourists no matter which day of the year you travel on it, but if you have time to spare sailing around on the Harbour, try a trip to one of the other beautiful places, such as Watsons Bay, Neutral Bay, Darling Harbour, or my favourite (apart from Manly) Mosman Bay.If you want a longer trip just to sightsee from the Ferry, then a trip to Parramatta is a good way of passing the time of day.There are various ticket prices ranging from concessions to return trips so it's advisable to check with Sydney Transport about your options before you go.

Destination Manly!. I really enjoyed catch the very to Manly for a few hours. Saw so much and Manly was beautiful too. Great value for money and the ferry itself was lovely and so well maintained I thought.

Must do tourist experience. While the ferries could do with an upgrade, remember they are public transportation, and they're a great way to see a lot of Sydney in a short time. Make the most of this exceptional, cheap, sight seeing opportunity.
See Sydney from the water. Personally I allways enjoy takeing a boat to look at the city from the water. It looks different. Nice 'ride'.

Wonderful view of the Harbour at a cheap price. If you don't care about having points of interest and only want to see the Harbour, grab a ferry at a fraction of the price you would pay for a cruise. The views are just as good. Our visitors were very happy to travel to Manly as I pointed out some of the more obvious things to them. If you want and out side seat, you need to be one of the first on to the ferry to grab those few precious spots. The windows slide for photo taking as well.
a great part of the transit system. we paid with our 'OPAL' cards, the card used by all mass transit in Sydney, and got a wonderful tour of the city.

relaxing public transport.... ... If you are not taking it on a crowded weekend. It is also a slow-ish public transport, so do be prepared to give it some time. Otherwise a delightful way of getting around the city.

Sydney ferry. Is always nice to travel by ferry around Sydney. Even if the ferry is busy , I always have a pleasure to travel . The onboard staff are always friendly. I hope you will enjoy a trip on Sydney Ferry.

Ferry ride to Manly. Bought a ticket to Manly. Vintage boat, clear skies bit slightly choppy water.Nice and relaxing alternative to get to Manly instead of the bus. Do note the timings, they depart once every 45min
enjoy public transportaion. well best public transpiration…just pay attention to the schedules and gates of departures, overall fun times…

Best way to travel around Sydney.. If you want to see the sights/attractions of Sydney, the Sydney Ferries are a fantastic way of visiting them. The tickets are reasonably priced and they run regular and on time too! Each and every trip was different. The harbour and surrounding areas are always busy so there is so much to see. This included boats and ships of all sizes including some amazing Cruise Ships. We never tired of passing underneath the Harbour Bridge and past the Opera House. If you visit Sydney, book your ferry tickets, then sit back and enjoy the sights. We did and loved every minute of it.

Very cool!. Its really easy to get into one, just get the card and then get into one ferry. Once youre there, the view is amazing as the breeze hits you (if u sit in front) but if u sit on the inside then its nice and warm. Got a charger for phone, wifi, cafe and restroom, absolutely amazinggg!

Help the tourist!. Might just have being my experience but the ferries are totally set up for commuting (and rightly so, I've done and greatly appreciated daily boat commuting in SF ) but as a visitor, no machine would issue me a ticket, nobody was in the ticket offices and no officials were around to ask what the hell I do to get on the boat!

Awesome but way overpriced. I love ferries and go on them every time I visit Sydney but they get more and more expensive every time. Boo. Public transport in general in Sydney is ridiculously overpriced. Makes me not want to visit.
Great and comfortable . Had the pleasure of going to Manly. The staff and crew were friendly and helpful. Good and clean on board.

great travel. travelling with my 12 year old son we bought two opal cards as you can use these for ferry, bus and train well worth it and can be topped up if necessary, we took the slow ferry over to manly approx 30 minutes and took the fast ferry back approx 10-15 minutes paid extra as opal card does not cover this trip but well worth it for the fun experience.

The call of the sea.... The boats bobbing up and down as the sea breeze blows is a sight that will always remain. Most boats are so tastefully painted. The trip to Western Sydney is etched in my mind.

Easy to connect. It's worth to travel from one side to another part for example from opera house to harbour ....u can really enjoy the bars in darling harbor to madam Tussauds,sea aquarium,and even sky walk...so I love to travel with ferries,nice time,nice view,people are nice,nice connections,so worth to travel,and nice to make some nice pictures

Pleasant and efficient way to see another side of Sydney. At Circular Quay, the ferries provide an alternative way to see the City. Find out where you want to go, the check out the destinations listed on the lighted board and the dock where the ferries can be found. People are always helpful if you still don't know what to do. My favorite is the Manley ferry to try the varied restaurants and cafes of the area, check out the beach or just walk around town. It is stunning at night as well. The ride back to Sydney at night is absolutely delightful. Imagine a panoramic view of Sydney wit all the iconic landmarks of the city all bathed in light.
Parammatta Ferry. A great relaxed trip , especially if arriving back on sunset with the Old Coathanger , Opera House & Sydney town lighting up.

Always take a Ferry Ride. The ferries are an excellent way to get places in Sydney and be able to take in the views around the city. There's nothing like chilling out while taking a ride over to Manly, you can sit inside or outside and all the ferries have free wifi while you are on them. A visit to Sydney isn't complete without a ferry ride

Good views!. We took the ferry to Taronga Zoo. The boats filled up quick but they worked hard getting another boat in quickly. The ride was smooth and brought us great views of Sydney Bridge, Sydney Opera House, and the Harbor.

A true Sydney experience.. We travelled on the famous Manly ferry in the evening during the Vivid festival which I believe is held every May/June. We went in the evening because we wanted to return after dark to see the opera house and other buildings lit up. It was fantastic. The ferry is very comfortable with outside and inside seating and a café, the trip is about 30 minutes I think from memory.
Harbour ferry. Efficient, affordable and fast. Pleasant experience. Really good way to see the Opera house and Sydney Harbour bridge from the water. No need for a fancy tour. Used our Opal cards.
Caught one from Watsons Bay to The Rocks. Fast and smooth on the water. Didn't take long. Clean. Sounded like a large aircraft as it runs down the runway for takeoff.

Great and Easy way to see Sydney Harbour.. The ferries run for most of the day and are very reasonable cost, we found the best way was to buy an Opal card - travel in Sydney is capped at $15 per day so you can use all the ferries and also trains and buses. It is the best way to see all the different Quays around the harbour. Best and relaxing way to spend a day touring around.

Great way to get around and see the Highlights - Views. One of the best ways to get around the harbour - and inexpensive. The Ferries are punctual and clean. staff very accommodating. Go to Manly, Watson Bay and Cockatoo Island - all good day trips.

a beautiful way to travel. so simple and affordable with breath taking views. minimal waiting and lots of indoor and Oisin seating. thru 8/16/16, can pay cash for one way or round trips. after that, will need an Opal card.
Excellent way to see Sydney harbour. Get the ferry out to Manley from Circular Quay. Great views of the bridge, opera house. Get on quick and try and get a seat outside, weather permitting!
Relaxing way to fill in time. Lovely way to travel across the harbour or just fill in some time. No matter what the weather there is always something to look at and enjoy.

Fantastic Service . My wife and I utilized the ferry service to get around the harbour area of Sydney. Prices were reasonable and the staff extremely friendly. I would highly recommend this way of manoeuvring through the city's many coastal areas

Only way around the harbour. Why would one pay a private Company for a tour of the harbour when you can catch a ferry using an Opal Card - travel in Sydney is capped at $15 per day and $2.50 on a Sunday. A trip to Manly is a must do.

Sydney Harbour Ferries.. By taking the ferry, it is an easy cost effective way of seeing all the different aspects of the beautiful Sydney Harbour. On a sunny day, nothing can beat the ride from Circular Quay to Manly. My only criticism is that there is not enough outdoor seating and has to rush to get one of these seats.

Excursion . Great way to see Sydney Harbour. Jump on and go to many destinations. No matter what the weather its always a great sea andventure. If there is a high sea take the ferry to Manly crossing the Heads with a splash and a roll.

Best deal in Sydney! Use the Opal Card. If you're visiting for more than three or four days, I'd really recommend the Opal Card and the ferries and subways. Use the Opal Card, be careful not to put too much money on your card, because after eight trips, they stop charging for the rest of the week, though Sunday. We loved touring by ferry, hopping on and off. Taking the long ride out to Manly and strolling along Manly beach, or taking the ferry around the harbor and hopping on and off at places like Luna Park, which is a very unusual 50's style park, with no admission charge, and lots of things to see. The rides can be a bit pricy, if you can't justify the very reasonably priced season pass, but it's a fun place to stroll. And from there, you can take the ferry or the subway back across the bridge. The trains and the ferries are fantastic and a really great deal. There's no better way to see Sydney!

Faster Trip to Go Across The Water. Went to Watsons Bay by ferry. They now use newer ferries than what they used more than 6 years ago for this route. As it passed Opera House and traveling near Harbour Bridge, the open deck can be the best spot to capture pictures of those.

Sydney's amazing ferries. Whenever I go to Sydney a harbour trip on a ferry leaving from Circular Quay is a must. Ferries range from small, traditional ships to ultra modern high speed catamarans. My favourite is the short trip to Kirribilli (past the Prime Minister's and Governor General's houses), and Neutral Bay. Others go to Mosman, Taronga Park Zoo, and further still to Manly, the latter on large or very fast ferries. This trip I took the catamaran ferry to Parramatta, up a river changing from wide stretches with urban frontages to a narrowing river lined with mangroves. Definitely recommended for all ages.

Take a trip to Manly from Circular Quay. This is a wonderful trip across the Harbour to Manly which lies on its northern shoreIts only a half hour trip but thoroughly worth it .You pass Fort Denison and then all the palatial homes of the Eastern Suburbs and then past HMAS Watson and across the heads of Sydney Harbour.On a fine day there is no better place to be.
It's hard to beat them. One of Australia's largest & deepest harbours & it's a 10 minute trip that brings back memories of visiting as a kid.Circular Quay to Luna Park & return!

Public transport boats!. Ok so we all caught a boat to go from darling harbour to the quay we tapped on and tapped off was the most amazing experience the boats are old but still plenty of room to enjoy yourself it took around 30min to get to our destination but it was so worth it. I would do it all again. If it is raining you can sit inside or just sit in the rain it's up to you if you go to Sydeney take the ferry at least once.

Def go this route . We used the ferry system from circular quay. It was soooooo easy and convenient. Buy the opal card because it is cheaper and very easy to use for transportation (ferry, bus, train).
Must . I travelled a lot on ferries from Darling Harbour to circular quay, Manley Beach, parramatta etc. Ride is very smooth and inexpensive.

Fantastic transport. Definitely the way to see the harbour and experience the other little communities around Sydney harbour. Easy to navigate the schedules and the staff are great. Take a harbour cruise for sure.

Lots of Fun. Going on a ferry is a must for families and visitors to Sydney. Going under the Harbour Bridge is aways a thrill. The ferries are run by friendly staff and there is lots of seating for those that want to sit. There is also lots of room to stand outside for those that want to.

Best value in the world. . Having spent many years visiting cities all around the world, Sydney Harbour is the best in the world. A sunny day delivers blue sky, blue water and little haze. The city, the Bridge and the Opera House are distinct and inspirational. Sydney Ferries provide an economic and accessible means to enjoy this exceptional waterway. the trip to Manly is a great way to spend an hour. The lower North Shore routes are relaxing and a great way to commute. For variety the Darling Harbour and Parramatta routes demonstrate the variety for this great city. There are many pricey cruises available but the ferries go where you want them to at a fraction of the cost.

A great way to see both the harbour and the city. The Sydney Ferries are a great and stress free way to see both the harbor and the city and you can choose to return either by train or bus depending on where you visit.

Great way to see Sydney Harbour. Sydney Ferries offer a great view of the harbour along any line, though the best are the F1 (Manly Ferry), F2 (Taronga Zoo Ferry) and F4 (Darling Harbour Ferry) for a quick trip and photo opportunity on the harbour. Best of all is that when you use an Opal Card you can travel on these services for no more than $15 (Adult), $7.50 (Child) per day Monday to Saturday and for only $2.50 on Sundays! Certainly recommend taking a trip on the ferry :)
great service. Since ownership was shared with a french company, service has greatly improved. Ferries run on time, staff has been trained in Customer Service(rare in Australia) and prices are fair.
Best way to see Sydney. Cheap if you buy the opal card as you don't spend more than $15 a day. So easy to use and great fun. Highly recommended.
Take the Ferry!. By far the best way to get around the harbor. Check out all of them as they are each different with different prices.

Get an Opel Card - Max $15 per day unlimited travel!. The Sydney Ferries are great! I would advise sitting outside and getting the full effect of the beautiful and uninterrupted scenery. Why pay big bucks for a cruise when you can pay $15 per day on an Opel card (purchased from any Newsagent or train station) and travel on any public transport all day as many times as you want!

Eco hopper economical and lots of time choices. We went from Circular Quay to Taronga Park zoo, Manly and Darling Harbour with the eco hopper . Since the Manly hi speed ferry is included in the price it gave us lots of options for zipping around the Harbour in a timely fashion
wifi on a boat!. cheap, efficient and free wifi! use the opal card. ferries every half hour. great views seeing the opera house from the water and as approaching manly.
Good for a trip arround.. Good for a trip around Sydney. Though they are overpriced for public transport. Definitely worth it though if you are a tourist to Sydney.
From the ferries you see most of Sydney !. I always spend a lot of time on the ferries and visit many places with the hopp on, hopp off system (Capt.Cook) love the views

Manly beach by ferry. Have been to Manly many times in the past, always found it a great place to go to - away from the city - just a half hour ferry trip, which is so beautiful and enjoyable as you get to experience a fair bit of the beautiful Sydney harbour - for visitors from interstate or overseas, you definitely have to visit manly before you leave Sydney.Anyways haven't been to Manly for many years, so while my husband and I were spending a weekend in the city (Sydney) for Vivid - we took the ferry trip to manly beach, was so beautiful loads of restaurants, some shops, and an amazing quiet beach to relax. Next time we spend a weekend in the city we are going to end staying at Manly.We are so blessed to live in this beautiful part of Australia Sydney.

Quick fast transport In Sydney. We decided to us the Ferry from Circular Quay to the Taronga Zoo. The ferries are an efficient way of getting around. It was a short and scenic trip to the zoo and back. Please check the quay from which your ferry departs.

Always a pleasure, never a chore. Always on time, at least in my experience, and the best way to get quickly around the harbour and beyond - it's fun getting the Parramatta Ferry just for the ride. I never tire of the site of the Opera House and Bridge as my Ferry approaches Circular Quay.
Manly ferry . An easy and cheap way to view Sydney harbour views. Spent a few hours in Manly having lunch and a sit out on the wall. Lots of food and shopping.
Beautiful views professional staff. Always on time. Always nice and clean. Friendly and professional crew. And the views are just amazing

A Personal Tour of the Harbour. Taking a ferry from Circular Quay to Taronga Zoo, Manly or Watson's Bay is the perfect and affordable way to tour Sydney's iconic harbour. Passing by the Opera House, Fort Denison and Shark Island gives you a seagulls eye view of these historic landmarks. I prefer the older ferries to the hydrofoils as the trip is slower and allows passenger the advantage of riding on the outside deck. For me rough weather is a bonus but if you dislike getting wet stay in the cabin.

A great way to spend time in Sydney. If you are in Sydney the best way for you to have a couple of hours to relax and unwind is to take one of the many Sydney harbour ferry trips . There are many types of trips . From lunch trips to just sites seeing runs . All are worth wile doing as this is the best way to see our beautiful harbour . After all it is one of the most beautiful harbours in the world . If you want the Manly harbour ferry run is well worth wile doing as it does all the east side of the bridge .

Floating Serenity. As a long time resident of Manly, Australia, I have over the years used the slow Manly Ferry to get me to the city of Sydney. This is a delightful half hour of bliss, just chugging across the harbour, watching the scenery slide by. Of course, the most exciting section of this iconic ferry trip, is crossing the Heads, which is where the entrance to Sudney Harbour is. Sometimes the swell coming in through the Heads can turn a placid harbour ride into a wild, bucking, rolling ride for that 5 minute section across the Heads. So for anyone visiting Sydney, head to Circular Quay, wharf 4. Your ferry leaves every half hour to Manly "seven miles from Sydney & a thousand miles from care".

Lovely ladies of the harbour . I love traveling on these beautiful, old 'ladies' of the harbour. I love their history. Ride on a little ferry to Darling Harbour or one of the largest past The Heads to Manly. Enjoy sitting outside to get a great view of the beautiful Sydney Harbour and all its foreshores. There's nothing like the smell of salt water and the wind in your hair. If you travel on weekends be prepared for crowds and queues. Arrive early for your trip. Enjoy!!

Convenient Alternative transport system . Rapid and reliable - there are a limited number of stops along the harbor circuit, but enough to be useful.
Indispensable for the trip to Manly Beach.

can take ferries from Parramatta or circular Quay to Manly and other destinations. can take the ferry to manly from Circular Quay or Parramatta river to circular key or visit Denison islands or Watson Bays and have fish and ship at watsons Bay restaurant best fish and ship in Australia

Good! . Good systems in place, good timing for ferries although the PA system could be louder on the boat as it was very hard to hear being on the top level and if someone else was talking I didn't know which stop was where.

A great personal tour of Sydney Harbour. Taking a trip around Sydney Harbour is a must for all tourists, unless of course you get sea-sick.The Sydney Ferries are part of the Opal transport card system. Buy one per person at a local Newsagent or a major train station, and then you can travel on a local (NSW State) bus or ferry or subway/train anywhere in greater Sydney.You can take a ferry to the Taronga Zoo, then to Manly for a full day trip, as we did. And as long as it's not raining, you can sit outside and enjoy the fresh sea breeze of the Pacific Ocean as it rolls into Sydney, between the North and South Heads.There are many commercial floating wine and dine cruisers, but taking making your own simple local adventure can be fun too.When the height of a Sydney Summer hits, we often take a ferry around the harbour just to relax, cool off and enjoy the sunset views over the Bridge and the Opera House.

Great trip to Parramatta. Love taking the ferry to Parramatta very relaxed way to travel and as a pensioner travel on all ferrys $2-50 per day Love to go to Rosehill Gardens racecourse via ferry travel.As a older Person ferry travel feels safe to me. This kind of travel also lets you see more of Sydney Harbour and the suburbs around it.
Great transportation option with awesome views. Must travel by these when in Sydney. Tickets are pricey but Sydney is not cheap and it is totally worth it for the views that you get!

Affordable way to get around Sydney. Great way to see the sights of Sydney. We traveled Darling Harbour to Circular Quay then Circular Quay to Manly (and back).Tip: Get an opal card and travel on a Sunday. You only pay $2.50.

Nice cheap way to get out on the harbour. Love the Manly ferry trip - if you time it right you can head over to Manly in the afternoon, spend some time there and then catch the ferry back to town as night descends and all the lights come on.
Great way to get around. I always like to go on the ferries when visiting Sydney. A trip to the city is not the same without passing under the "coathanger"

Great budget sightseeing. What a great way to see the harbour without spending a fortune. Especially if you access a Opal seniors card before your trip to Sydney. Day travel trips capped at $2.50. Fab.

Famous ferries of Sydney.. Punctual, clean and serviced by friendly staff, ferries are a cheap, efficient way to transport around Sydney's magnificent waterways. For a local ( I once was) a relaxing, way to travel and for a tourist, an outstanding experience to be on the harbour and have a different perspecitive of the city. Even in huge events ( including the Olympics 2000) the famous ferries of Sydney weather the storm!
Nice & Relaxing. Took a ferry to Darling Harbour to have lunch at a wonderful restaurant right on the water. It was a very nice ride. Although, it started raining, it was worth the trip.

Convenient service but rude ticket office staff. Took the ferry a couple of times. Very convenient way to get across to Manly. Easy to understand the routes and timetables. The ferries were clean and well maintained.The staff onboard were lovely and chatty. Thought the idea of a mobile phone charging station with every possible charging cable was inspired.The only gripe I have is that when we went to the ticket office at Circular Quay on Tuesday 21st June. The lady who served us managed to dispense the requested tickets without looking at us once, cracking a smile or uttering a word. She was far too busy searching the internet on her mobile phone, I could see through the glass she was on Toni & Guys website. As a manager of a small office, if one of my staff was so rude to a customer they wouldn't be working for me for much longer. It might seem bit petty but I found it exceptionally rude.

Best way to see Sydney. Sydney's greatest asset is its harbour and there is no better way to explore the waterways than on a Sydney ferry. My favourite trip is to catch a ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay, have lunch and walk around the Gap, then return to Circular Quay. There are enough routes going east to Taronga Zoo, Mosman Bay, Manly or Watsons Bay, or west to Paramatta to reveal Sydney in all its glory. A lovely short trip is from Circular Quay to Neutral Bay for brunch at Thelma and Louise cafe.

Great trip to the zoo. We were all ready for our ferry ride to Toronga zoo but there was a technical problem with the ferry and they bumped into the wall. They let everyone know what was happening and a replacement ferry arrived within ten minutes which i thought was excellent. The ride over to the zoo was fantastic and it was such a great trip both ways. And it is better on Sundays as travel is cheap with your opal card which was a bonus.
manly ferry. Great ferry ride across to Manly. Scenery is beautiful & even on weekends regular schedule doesn't have you waiting too long to get a ferry.
A Great Service. What a fantastic way to get around! The ferry trip to and from Watson's Bay (with a lovely meal at Doyle's in between) really added to our night.

Fun way to visit Manly beach. This is a fun and cheap way to see the famous Sydney Harbour and visit Manly beach for a swim in the surf. You get spectacular views of the harbour and surrounding coast;lines as the ferry makes its way to Manly from the city. Other ferrries will also take you around the harbour. You can go to Watson's Bay for the famous fish and chips.

Best way of seeing the city. An easy trip and great value for those exploring the harbour and or travelling to and from work. Great way of enjoying the beauty of the harbour suburbs.Was horrified during VIVID to see the hundreds trying to climb on board but the ferries took it in their stride and transported the masses to a great show.

Fabulous Ferries. Sydney's famous Manly ferry is a very pleasant trip. I takes around 30 mins from Circular Quay in Sydney to Manly wharf in Manly (don't forget to bring a camera as you get a great opportunity to get photo's of the bridge and opera house). Also available are ferries to countless locations around Sydney harbour including the river cats up as far as Parramatta. All of which are a nice relaxing trip. All at very reasonable prices.

Harbour ferry trips. The best, and cheapest, way to see Sydney Harbour. Take the ferry to Manly, walk through The Corso, have yummy fish and chips. You can also go toLuna Park, the Zoo, Watson's Bay, the list is endless.

Always on time. I love traveling on Sydney Ferries, they are always on time, the staff are friendly, helpful and efficient. The views are great, even in bad weather. Much more relaxing than traveling into the city by car.

LEASURLY ON THE HARBOUR. all day cruising on Sydney Harbor -on the ferries its great no rush lots to see and i expensive,just change at circular quay and go to other destinations criss cross iong the Harbor -unbelievable on a nice day- a way to make it special

A good way to admire Sydney from a different view point. There are quite a lot of ferries leaving the very heart of Sydney (Circular Quay) and going everywhere. So, instead of taking a train or a taxi why not look first if one of the many ferries goes there and you would experience a quite different perspective of this wonderful city. At night the experience is just as great as during the day.
Sydney harbour ferries. Best way to go and enjoy the views. No parking issues. See the city from the water in the most relaxing enjoyable way. Ferries always on time. Pleasant services

Safe and clean. Using the ferry to get around traffic congested Sydney is fast cheap and fun, very relaxing trip around harbour with great views. Friendly staff !Get yourself a Opal card for easy payment,

Always good. Sydney ferries are very safe,there is only one fare.There is no extra costs for tourists.It's a great opprtunity to see the harbour bridge,opera house and the harbour itself.Nice and relaxing travelling to Watsobs bay or even Manly.If you wanna come back night time,take your camera and lots of photos.They always run in time as per timetable.Enjoy.
sydney vivid light event. took a ferry trip around sydney habour during sydney vivid light event, really enjoyed it with all my families and friends.

Iconic, and for a good reason. The best way to do the sydney harbour ferries is on Sunday, it is $2.50 all day with your Opal card and you can go on as many ferries or other forms of public transport as you want. The journey from Circular Quay to Cockatoo Island is particularly beautiful.

Heavily discounted travel on sundays. Plan your ferry trip (or any public transit) and you will pay as little as $2.50 on Sunday's with an Opal card. Take the green ferries for a slower trip to Manley or any other destination. Beautiful views. Excellent after dark.

Wonderful ride. The roads in Sydney are congested and can make your journey cumbersome. One of the best ways to avoid the mad rush is to take the ferry. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Taronga zoo. The ride was very refreshing, had beautiful views and most importantly, was extremely cheap.
This is for sure a 'MUST-TRY'!!

Sails ahoy. A rough ride today but a lovely panoramic view of the harbour and surrounds.
Easy way to cross the harbour to get to the zoo
Always a great trip into the city. Always a great and relaxed way to get from the northern beaches into the city. Totally worth the fifteen dollars return fare..
Sydney Ferries. Ferries is an economical way to travel than expensive cruises. Its covers lots of attractions. Go tp Circular Quay. You can go anywhere

Great way to see the Harbour and avoid traffic. The ferry network is reasonably extensive with wharves being upgraded all the time. Although the most expensive way to commute around Sydney, for my money it is certainly the most pleasant. For visitors to Sydney it is absolutely the best way to spend lots of time on the Harbour without having to pay for specialty cruises and tours.

In this congested city the ferry's are the way to get around. With so much water around Sydney the ferry's are the most efficient way to go around significant parts of town and the sub urbs. When the weather is fine, sit outside and enjoy a beautifull and low cost cruise. The ferry's are generally clean, and run on schedule. We have used them daily for 2 weeks, got the most beautifull pictures of the landmarks, specifically the Sydney Operahouse and the Harbour Bridge. What i strongly suggest is to get an Opal Card prior to coming to Australia, or to pick one up at one of the authorized service centers. Do a Google search for "opal card". With such a card you will get free travel after 8 trips in one week across all different travel options that accept the Opal Card. The nost unbeatable deal I have seen anywhere. All trips start and return eventually at Circular Quay.
Easy way to get around. This is a great way to see the harbour , the ferries have toilets on board , they are not always on time and some can be dirty .

The perfect way to see the Harbour and to get around. The Sydney ferries are an efficient way of getting around to parts of the city that can take hours by road. Manly is always a favourite, passing by the heads on the way, also the ferry to Watson Bay to get fish and chips ( or more exotic seafood) at Doyles cafe or restaurant. The ferry to Taronga zoo is also a good day out. The ferry that links Darling Harbour to Circular Quay is a good way of getting from one landmark location to another, and you can link with the trains at teh Quay and the light rail at Darling Harbour. Others worth the time are a ferry up the river to Parramatta, and the ones to the inner city spots like Neutral Bay and Cremourne or to Rose Bay.
Best views of historic Sydney!.. Great value especially using theOpal card. All vessels well maintained and staff helpful. You can visit so many historical sites.
Clean and on-time. All the ferries use the Opal card, so it is very convenient. Plus on Sundays you pay $7 in total for all the ferries, buses and trains you want to travel on. An excellent deal.

Cheapest way Sydney to Manly. Taking the Ferries from Circular Quay to Manly is the best way & cheapest, traffic hassel free. Sydney traffic is a night mare in peak times. Saturday's just as bad. So sit back & enjoy the harbour ride on a Manly Ferry. One of the best Harbours in the world. Breath taking on a sunny day. Keep your eyes open may see a fairy penguin.

Cheap way to cruise.... We hopped on a ferry from Circular Quay to Rydelmere, for $15 per adult return, which was a two hour return trip. I sat outside where the air was refreshing and the views amazing. We thoroughly enjoyed our ferry trip and highly recommend it.
Used to get to the zoo. Super easy to use, on time, and fun to use going around the harbor. We used it to go form Circular Quay to the zoo and it worked like a charm.
Great service. Took manly ferry great service very reasonably priced an asset to the city very well ran more cities should learn about public transport from sydney

Great way to get around!. The ferry system works as a well-oiled machine. The pick up and drop off is very quick. There is no question on where you are going. There is a ticker to notify you of arrival and departure. And this is a very good way to get around especially if you're going from harbor to harbor. Not to mention the sites! We took a ferry that took us under the Harbor Bridge at sunset. Breathtaking!

Great way to take in Sydney. Boarding at Circular Quay, the ferries go all over Sydney, connecting the city with the north shore and beyond. They can get a little crowded but are a cheap (especially if you have an Opal card) and reliable way to see bits of Sydney you'd otherwise miss

Cheapest way to see the Habour. Order an Opal card online before you come, look up Nsw transport for general informationGetting a variety of Ferries means you can cover the Harbour just as the commercial tourists boats do but without the costTake a good guidebook One good trip is to get the Ferry from Circular Quay to Hayes St Wharf Neutral Bay , a public bus will meet you there ,get the bus up to Military Road and walk for three minutes along Military Road to the best Beer Garden in Sydney "The Oaks"They have either a casual restaurant option or you can BBQ a Steak and they are very good qualityAfter lunch walk out the Oaks into Military Road again and catch a bus to Milsons Point and from there you can walk across the Sydney Harbour Bridge for free to the Rocks area in SydneyIf you are running short of time you can get a bus from the same stop on the same side of the road as The Oaks Pub to SydneyThey run every few minutes Another Ferry ride worth getting is to Parramatta its takes about one hourYou can either catch the return ferry to Circular Quay or get the train back from Paramatta back to Central ,Town Hall or Wynyard stations in the CBD of SydneyAnother Ferry to catch is to the F7 Eastern suburbs service to Watsons Bay One stop that service makes is Double Bay and at that stop is Sailing club on that particular wharf which you can enjoy lunch or dinnerAnother trip from Circular Quay that goes right under the Harbour Bridge to Milsons Point is the F4 Darling Harbour serviceGet off at Milsons Point and see one if the most iconic sites of Sydney right there by the Wharf itself After get a bus up the hill or a three minute walk to Milsons Point StationWalk through the station tunnel to the other side where Kirribilli village is and cross the road and walk down the hill in Broughton street where the shops are and you will see Mcdougall Street on your right Walk down past the Park and you will see the Sydney Flying Sqauadon where you can enjoy a cheap meal right on the Harbour It's a seven minute walk from the stationOn Saturdays you can go on the Club Ferry and watch the Skiff races on the Harbour I think it costs only $20 from memory

great fun to watch. Particularly from the Cruise Bar just across from the Opera House. So much coming and going, and somehow the boats don't often hit one another. I can sit and watch it all for hours!
Wonderful Views. Take a trip on the ferry even if you are not going anywhere. The views of the city is well worth it. Especially now during VIVID.

Great public transport option. Love that the ferries are accessible through Opal cards like other public transport, reasonably priced and a cheap way of seeing Sydney from the harbour without paying big bucks for a cruise. We just took the Darling harbour ferry and that was enough to get a good view of the waters, the opera house and the bridge and really the best way to get to Darling Harbour anyway. One of the best things about Sydney.

extraordinary, relaxing, comfortable, well-organised, affordable.. Using the govt ferry service there are So Many Habour Ferry Journies to Choose From to get around Sydney Harbour that extends for many kilometres in every direction. It is extraordinary, relaxing, comfortable, well-organised, affordable.

very helpful. You are able to get to a lot of places by water the ferry is onbe of the cheapest and efficient way to do it, just sit back andf soak up the view and harbour. one of the best in the world.

A best way to see Sydney and it's outer suburbs. With an Opal card in one hand and a ferry timetable in the other you have Sydney at your feet. From Darling Harbour to Circular Quay, Tarronga, Manly and Watsons Bay it's the quickest, cheapest and most picturesque way of visiting all the sights you could wish for. With the Opal card $15 daily cap and $2.50 on Sundays it's a bargain you can't beat and you can use it on the local buses and trains as well !!!!.

getting around during vivid festival. We travelled from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay on a ferry during the most recent vivid festival and how spectacular this experience was, upon leaving Luna Park we slowly went under the bridge and past the opera house, there were great vantage points to take photos and although the ferry was full people were generous in sharing their space.

Great way to see sydney. The locals told us this was a do not miss way to see Sydney. They were right. The views were great and the cost was very reasonable. This was the best and fastest way to get to Manly beach. Runs very frequently..... And easy access. Don't miss this ferry ride.

Darling Harbor to Circular Quay. We took the ferry from Darling Harbor to Circular Quay to experience VIVID. It was relaxing and enjoyable. We used to always take the ferry to Manly when the boys were young. They did still ask to do that, but we didn't have the time.

Ferries and VIVID. Used ferries in Sydney many times from Cirular Quay to Manly & back & to & from Parramatta the last time was an extremely busy time (VIVID)& still they were clean, ran to time, staff were polite. A good service
Vivid. Clean fast & very helpful staff. The ferry to the Zoo was fun, inexpensive & offered great views of Vivid from the harbour

A must do it experience with singular views from the bay.. Some of the best views of iconic places can be spotted from the Ferries, keep in mind that is a public transportation, therefore not a luxury trip, affordable and reliable, the staff is very kind and helpful. I love take the ferry from darling harbor to circular quay.

An Easy, Convenient means of transport.. Whether out of Circular Quay or Darling Harbour, the ferries are a great means of transport around Sydney. I think the main thing in their favour is that they help avoid the congestion of road traffic. As a tourist in Sydney I would highly recommend the ferries.

Vivid Experience!. Took the ferry from Circular Quay around to Pyrmont Bay - next to the Maritime Museum - during Vivid Sydney 2016 and were rewarded with great views of Vivid on the Opera House, the Quay and the Museum of Contemporary Art and of course the magnificent Sydney Harbour. Highly recommend taking a ferry on Sydney Harbour especially to Manly or Taronga Zoo!
Boat trip to Parramatta. Take the cat trip to Parramatta it takes one and a half hours each way....you see all the Harbour side houses on the other side of the bridge
Sydney ferries. The Sydney ferries are a great way to see the harbour day or night. A good trip is from darling harbour to circular quay to see all of the main Sydney attractions.

Great way to travel in Sydney. Getting on the ferry is a fantastic way to laze around and travel especially if you have the luxury of time to do so. Gives one a very different perspective of the city especially when viewed from the water.

Convenient ferries at reasonable cost. We travelled on the manly ferry and the Watson Bay ferry. Both were reasonably priced, on time and clean. the seating was spacious and both trips were much enjoyed.

Great way to get around. Visited Vivid walked all around the Botanical gardens and the quay and caught the ferry back to Darling Harbour. A very pleasant experience from tapping on to arriving at the dock at Darlingg Harbour.

Relaxing . We took the ferry to manly what s not to like courteous staff who had answers to all questions. Definitely new their stuff. Pay booths were easy to understand there were plenty of information boards. Seats on ferrys were comfortable and spacious. Very happy

Show boats is a must try experiance. Food was amazing - Indian Food.The show was icing on the cake. The performaers were extremely energetic.You could also experince the cool breeze and the waves of Sydney lake by standing at the deck of the boat/cruise.

Cheap Harbour Cruise. The cheapest way to see Sydney Harbour at its best is via the many Harbour ferry trips. The best known and most popular is the Manly ferry but there are many others that travel to Darling Harbour, the Inner Harbour, the Harbour Islands including the former penal colony on Cockatoo plus Parramatta River. Ferries depart regularly from Circular Quay. It is as spectacular at night as by day.

Must do. A fantastic and cheap way to experience Sydney harbour! Particularly the manly ferry on the return trip to circular quay when the ferry rounds a bend and opens up the amazing vista of opera house, harbour bridge and city all at once!
Very convenient . Ferry is a good way to travel around the Sydney and darling Harbour. Fun too! We took the ferry to manly island its a smooth ride. Recommended way of Travelling!
good value. the ferries are good value and get you to the destination by the most direct way, they are so much nicer than the buses, the harbour is so nice. clean and efficient

The BEST way to see Sydney Harbour at the BEST price!. There's no better way than public transport to get to most places in most cities.
And the best way to see the magnificent Sydney Harbour is on a Sydney Ferry.

View Sydney Harbour on the Cheap. Take the Zoo ferry to the Zoo wharf and in lieu of visiting the Zoo, turn right and take the bforeshores bush track to Bradley's Head, feast on the vista across to Rose Bay and the eastern suburbs. Feel like walking further, continue on around to Chowder Bay and even along to Middle Head. Try to see the Land of the Long White Cloud peering through The Heads. Backtrack to the ferry and enjoy cruising past the Opera House and The Bridge
Ferry from darling harbour to Luna park then to circular quay . Sydney ferries are the best way to see the harbour and a relaxing way to show the kids the sights of Sydney without the crowds

A wonderful way to spend time in Sydney. Travelling around the harbour on the Sydney ferries is the most wonderful way to see Sydney. We purchased Opal Cards before we arrived so didn't have to worry about tickets. Each trip was about $7, with a maximum of $15/day. We travelled from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay, Milsons Point and Manly - all wonderful trips by day and night. Travelling around on the ferries is a wonderful way to see the magic lights of the Vivid Festival.

Excellent way to travel. I have used lots of different ferries on the Sydney Harbour and they are wonderful, not very expensive and such a great way to view the spectacular harbour. Take the trip to Manly or up the Parramatta River to Parramatta. We travelled to Taronga Park Zoo this time and it was lots of fun.
Enjoyed vivid trip. Nice experience to get an on water experience of vivid- very much enjoyed being in fresh air to enjoy watching the light show

Sydney Ferries. Sydney ferries are a great way to get around on a nice sunny day. Hop on at Circular Quay and head for Watson's Bay. There is a pub at the landing where on Sundays they sometimes have live music and BBQ happening. Otherwise buy some fish and chips and sit on the lawn under a tree for some relaxing time. The ferry will also take you across to Manly where you can stop for a wander around the mall or visit the Manly Sealife Sanctuary. Catch a ferry back to the city or take a bus and enjoy the scenery. Ferries also take you to Darling Harbour, always full of activity, Parramatta and Homebush. Opal cards can be used but not on the Fast Ferry which is privatelyowned. The government is negotiating. Enjoy.

Cheapest and best way to see Sydney Harbour. Jump on the Manly ferry, spend a few hours there what a brilliant way to see the harbour.For a more intimate look at the harbour suburbs get a return ticket to Mosman Bay. It'll take 30-40 min but the best few dollars spent.You'll realise that if you were going to stick a city somewhere, Sydney Harbour is a great place to put it! The ferry's run on schedule are generally tidy safe and clean and recommended. You'ss soon be envious of the people who commute using Sydney Ferry's.

Use the ferries! The best way to get onto the harbour in Sydney and up the river.. simply the very best way to get to places near the water or to connect with other public transport. They are marvelous and sitting up front is really amazing. Take it all in and have your camera ready. During the day they have a regular and on time schedule. At night it is a little slower. If you don't do the ferries, you would miss out on an extraordinary experience. The staff are courteous and pleasant.
Cheap to get around .... The ferries are quite dated and could use a makeover .. But apart from that they are on time fast and efficient !!!

If you don't try it you'll never know.. A must do when next in Sydney. A ferry trip to anywhere or to a specific place like Manly or something special like the Parramatta River should please the most discerning visitor. I just love the ferries.

Cheapest trip onto / into the Harbour. If you'd like to see some amazing views of Sydney Harbour then buy an opal card, set aside a few hours, and hop on a ferry. If you're here on a Sunday then it will be extremely cheap (As of 2016, Sunday travel is capped at $2.50 for all ferry, rail, and bus trips you take). Top recommendation would be the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly as it takes you through some of the most scenic parts of the Harbour including around the Opera House. A short walk in Manly and you can find restaurants, cafes, coffee, and beaches. Hop back on the ferry to return to the city. A short blast ferry trip would be the F4 line. It is a loop that will take you from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour and back. This means you travel past the Opera House and under the Harbour Bridge. This will get you to Darling Harbour in about 30 minutes. You can either walk back through the city to your next destination, or stay on the ferry another 30 minutes to return to Circular Quay. If you plan to visit the Zoo, then the best way from the city is the ferry anyway - and you'll get great views of the Opera House and middle Harbour on the way.

Such a great way to see Sydney!. Took a few trips on the Parramatta river from Abbotsford to Putney and also Sydney Olympic Park recently near sunrise and sunset, and was reminded on the trip how amazing it is. Sydney Ferries have done a sterling job in the past few years making it a comfortable trip for residents and visitors to this beautiful city. With free wifi on the Rivercat, clear signage and display boards, upgraded pontoons, great and comfortable seating right at the front of the craft out in the open air, it's perfect for when you have a bit more time to take in the scenery. Just remember to check the tides and timetables if you are planning to head all the way into Parramatta that at low tide they will make you board a bus at Rydalmere to make the last leg of the journey. Here's hoping they deepen the channel in future!

Best way to travel around the Harbour. I found myself stabding on the edge of the Harbour near North Sydney pool, and had the urge to go into the city. My companion immediately thought "get in the car and drive over the Bridge". I had a much better idea....get on a ferry! We only waited a few minutes before the ferry arrived and within a very short while we were alighting at Circular Quay. When we were ready to reclaim the car,we just caught another ferry back. Staff are always helpful and friendly, even when this infrequent ferry user asks what might seem like silly questions, and seeing a more elderly person, they are always willing to offer a helping hand for me to board and disembark....one lad assured me that it was much easier to help me because of the paperwork he'd have to fill in if I fell into the water! I love the sense of humour!
Get on the water. A great way to get around and see Sydney from a different angle , fares are good value , efficient service and fun - go enjoy.

Get around town and maybe discover new places!. I took the ferry around to Luna Park and the Opera House and Botanical Gardens. What a gorgeous cruise, and the sites of Sydney are show to their advantage. With the Opal card and capping on Sunday, it is a steal!
Fantastic service. We bought an OPUS card which enabled us to jump on and off buses and ferries and was excellent value for money.;

The best way to get around.. Just the best way to move around the Harbour and take in the million dollar views. Once you hit $15 of fares in a day, you don't pay anymore. Also you can travel all day, anywhere on a Sunday for just $2.50. The downside is that thousands of extra people turn out to also take advantage of the $2.50 all day travel. Personally, I'd rather pay the $15 max on Mon-Sat and not deal with the crowds.

Great way to get in and out. I like to ride the ferries into and back from the city. It's a peaceful journey with great views. I prefer the slow ferry but only because I don't think the fast ferries are worth the extra cost.

Great way to experience the Harbour at minimal cost. Want to experience Sydney Harbour? Take a ferry ride. Anywhere! It won't cost much and you will love it. Take the Manly Ferry for the longer trip and spend a few hours there before returning. We take all our visitors for a ride on the ferries and they love it.

Trip to Manly. Only used Ferries once due to short visit, chose Manly Express Ferries, This is a super ferry to take, as it gives you plenty of photo oppurtunities of The Harbour Bridge, and Opera House, Manly is worth a visit for Beaches, Bars , Shops and very pleasant walks, Ferries run frequently and are quick and smooth. would suit all types of visitors. This ferry was direct and took approx 40mins.

Cannot be more convinient. This is the perfect way to move around the city.The view is awesome at anytime and you will have the opportunity to do some nice photo by sitting on the deck.As any public transport, it's also operated during raining time, only the view may be covered ;-)I recommend using the Opal card as it also work for all public transport in Sydney.It is an electronic purse that can be topup at any station or convenience shop.The Opal card itself is for free.

Drummoyne to Sydney CBD. If you wist to travel by public transport from Drummoyne to the Sydney CBD, Sydney Ferries is by far and away your best choice. Comfortable, safe, quick and scenic, what more could you ask for. Highly recommended
The best way to get around. The ferries were far better managed than the so could hop on and off boats as they did not over sell.

must go...cheap thrill. At AUD 5 plus per pax mister and I enjoyed ourself thoroughly from Circular Quay Darling Habour station. It was beautiful and we managed to catch the beautiful sunset. Great view of opera house and Sydney harbour bridge at a different vantage. must go for anyone who is visiting Sydney!
Trip to Manly. Great crossing and easy access to the terminal. The price of the return fare about $10.00. The ferry was clean and tidy on both trips and goes every half hour.

Parramatta River!. Catch the ferry up the Parramatta River and pass, Roselle, Goat Island, Drummoyne and lots of wonderful properties and boats. Enjoy the time to yourself and sit outside taking in the view and fresh air or inside chilling out, a must do activity to enjoy the majesty of this wonderful Harbour.
Best cheapjack way to cruise the harbour!. Catch any ferry ... and enjoy the vista ... get off wherever and havva nice feed and drink ... then cruise again ...

On the ball for Vivid. We took the ferry to Taronga Zoo for Vivid. There were very frequent ferries and buses, so transport management was excellent. There were lots of parents with prams so not all could fit on the buses but staff were most helpful. The ferry is a brilliant way to see a lot of Vivid. Well done for the "guys" running the ferries!
Affordable . The ferries are a affordable way to get around and very good way to get amazing photographs. You don't need to spend $$$ for tours.

Oldie but a goodie. When we go to Sydney we always take a ferry ride. It is the best way to see our amazing harbour and surrounds. Ferries are old but well maintained and this is the attraction - they are like olden times. The jet cats are faster but not as leisurely. Best way to get around.!Would recommend to any visitor to Sydney.

Easy to Ride. We took the ferry out to Manly which run every 30 minutes. It was a very pleasant ride. Very large boat and a smooth ride. Ride inside or out your pleasure. Hint if you want to set outside be one of the first one on and head you front 2 nd floor. Or go to the back where it easy to find a set.

Relaxing Way to Travel. WE caught the ferry from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay and then to Taronga Zoo and back. This is a relaxing way to travel and also see the beauty of Sydney Harbour. The ferries are clean and run on time.
Loved the experience. Its so great to move around in ferry to go to manly per example. It's well explained and comes frequently a must do
Best way to view the city. Very efficient, not that costly. Best to get an Opal card to save a bit of money. They leave often and go everywhere.

Great way to travel. For a few dollars you can see the sights from the water. I used to use the ferry for the work commute when we lived in Sydney. I never grew tired of coming into Circular Quay with the bridge on one side and the opera house on the other. So easy to use with the opal pass.
Ferry to view panoramic view of the Harbour. Use the travel card to check in to various ferry destinations from the harbour. Good if you take a day tour and also night tour to view the city glamour.
Ferry Good. Got the Ferry to Taronga zoo today. The Lady Northcotte. beautiful old ferry. Great journey over to the zoo, staff on the wharf and on the ferry very pleasant and helpful

Way to Go. My wife and I have found Sydney Ferries to be one of the easiest ways for a tourist to get around Darling Harbour and all of the tourist spots on Sydney Harbour. If you have a pensioner concession card the ferries are very cost efficient too.

Reliable, stick ot the time table and helpfull staff. From the ticket booth to the deck hand to the skipper, the crew at Sydney Ferries are just people, have a fun day out on the harbour for a pittance.
Fast Ferry to Manly. We chose to take the fast ferry to Manly, the views are so good and we loved journey in the sunshine.
Fantastic Experience.. If you go to Sydney you have to have a ferry ride, the views of the Bridge and the Opera House are amazing, we took the ferry to the Zoo and made a full day of it.

Wheelchair Accessible Manly Ferry - Wonderful trip. Got onto the ferry to go to Manly and even though I travel by wheelchair the whole experience was easy - the views along the way were absolutely stunning and as much a part of the trip as Manly itself. Well worth the return price and would travel by ferry instead of taxi, every time if I could.
Great way to get around and not to dare. On time servies. The wharfs are clearly marked where they go. Clean inside and has space. Can stand or sit outside to watch the views. Staff are helpfull.

Manly-Circular Quay -Darling Harbour. On your Sydney trip, must add a ferry trip from Manly to Circular Quay and then to Darling Harbour. You will have breathtaking views of Sydney city, Harbour Bridger, Opera house, Rocks, Taronga Zoo and even might catch a glimpse of Australian Prime Minister sipping cup of tea in his backyard at Kirribili House.

A Great people mover. Not much has changed in 50 years since I first traveled through out Sydney Harbour. In fact I think we were on some of the same ferries. Very well run and on time. I suggest you look into getting the OPAL ferry pass. We did and saved quite a bit of money. Available at many little stores at the QUAY. If you pay by credit card they charge you a dollar surcharge.
Love this. My baby really enjoy this ferrie ride.dont miss the opportunity to take a picture when sydney opera house is right your back! The view is more awesome if u ride this at night

The Only Way To Travel. It seems chaotic at first, but when you get the hang of it there is no better way to get around and see Sydney.Buy an Opal Card and use it on all forms of transport, including the ferries. Make sure you do the trips to Watson Bay and Manly Beach.

Great way to see the harbour and surrounds. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour at twilight. It was lovely standing at the back of the boat watching the city light up at night.We passed key landmarks like the Sydney Opera House and passed under the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Fares are cheap.
Way to see the Harbour. This is a gorgeous way to see the harbour. The fares aren't too expensive. You do require a travel card which can be purchased at a near by news stand.

A nice experience. It was a nice experience for me. I had been in few other ferry rides however this was one of the best. You get to see the other side of Opera house on your way. One tip try to find seats which are located open in air and also at front side of the ferry for a windy ride. I loved it.

Best way to see our beautiful harbour. Highly recommend trip from circular quay to Taronga zoo and circular quay to watsons bay. It's a very cheap option and the best way to see our beautiful harbour.

Great views of the harbour. We are pensioners and can buy a ticket for a great price. We went to Darling harbour Taronga Park and Manly all on the same dally ticket and what a perfect way to see the harbour and all its views. Even if you aren't a pensioner it is a very cost effective way to get around a must for tourists 8/10

Good, reliable & cheap ferry. This is a public ferry payable via opal card. The ferry from darling harbour to circular quay costs around $5/ pax. Very economical compared to private ferries & timings are very reliable. Service is what you would expect. You can take the ferry in the night & catch the vivid lights display on Sydney opera house & Sydney harbour bridge. Very scenic & beautiful. Would recommend sitting outside to take good pictures if it's not too cold for some . Lovely to take this ferry in the day as well as night for different perspectives. A must include in your travel itinerary

Ferry to Manly. The ferry to Manly is a great and inexpensive way to see the Sydney skyline from the water. We just went there and came right back although if we had had more time it would have been nice to explore Manly more.

Great service. We had a lovely time catching the ferries in Sydney for the Vivid 2016 light show. Great service with friendly staff. Plenty of ferries on each route too. We travelled to Watson's Bay and around Darling Harbour. Gorgeous views of our beautiful harbour.

Easy to use. We found the Sydney ferries easy to use with the Opal metro card and quite affordable for our trips around the harbour. The ferries come and go quite regularly and have estimated wait times on tv screens.

Ideal Mode of Transport. Circular Quay is the hub for the Sydney Ferries Network and is ideal, subject to weather conditions, for trips across the Harbour to the likes of Manly, Taronga Zoo, Luna Park and Milsons Point, etc. A relatively cheap and quick mode of transport and popular with commuters, residents and tourists alike.Captain Cook Cruises are also available which provide lunch and dinner cruises around the beautiful Sydney Harbour offering stunning views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, The Opera House, the CBD skyline, North Sydney, etc.I am a regular user of Sydney Ferries.
loved it. what a grea t way to get around so scenic. the harbour views are spectacular. so easy to use .loved going home to darling harbour using the ferries esp at night what view

Great views not so great service ticketing or schedules. The ferries are a great for ease of transport and to see an amazing Harbor. On this visit we had constant issues with the Opal ticketing system which delayed us and frustrated both us and service personnel. They did admit the system had faults. We missed a return ferry by minutes (our fault) but went early for the next one. That was fortunate as two different departure times were advertised on the boards on the pier and the ferry departed 15 mins earlier than the earliest stated. Getting it right would help.

Punctual, clean and fun to be on. What a great service in Sydney Harbour. Quick, easy and the staff are pretty friendly. Just watching the harbour go by is relaxing and it's a really efficient way to travel to the various points

Lovely and super cheap. If you get yourself an opal card when you arrive in Sydney the ferries are so cheap! You can go to manly beach, watsons bay, cockatoo island and lots of other closer places. Highly recommend a day ferry hopping

Go to beach with Ferries in Sydney. Take a Ferries (cheaper) go to the beach in Wales, see the Harbour and Opera House inside the boat, and arrive in the wonderful place with stores, restaurants and music.

Great cheap way to see the Harbour. Jump on a ferry and have a cheap way to see this beautiful city from a different perspective. A day pass or family pass allows you to hop on or off and explore the various and different parts of the city
The most versatile way to go around harbour. I used this many times to travel around the harbour to explore & visit many exhibits such as the Zoo & Luna Park & found to be all at reasonable prices.
Great way to explore Sydney . We used the ferries regularly during out stay in Sydney. Good priced, ran on time and friendly staff
Amazing at night. There is absolutely amazing view at Sydney especially during night - the view at Opera House is just unforgettable...

The best way to see Sydney Harbour sights. Instead of using bus transport to explore some of Sydney's top tourist spots, we took the relaxing mode of travel and sat back and enjoyed the ferry trips to Darling Harbour, Manley and Watson Bay in brilliant sunshine. A great way to see Sydney Harbour.

Cheap & Best Harbour Views. Not a regular user of the system but when I do, I have found them to be both efficient, clean & on time. They run like clockwork and are only troubled by the rare foggy days when the whole Harbour closes in. The best run is to Manly with the views on the way or the short runs to Darling Harbour or Luna Park/Milsons Point. I can also recommend the trip to Watsons Bay for the Gap , Doyles & the Pub , a great way to spend a lazy afternoon and let someone else drive !! Get down to Circular Quay (pronounced Key) and jump on a Sydney Ferry & Enjoy !!

Best Harbour in the world. First thing to do when you hit Sydney is buy your Opal card , available from most newsagencies and convenience stores.this gives you access to all forms of public transport,ie Bus,Train,Ferry, and its outstanding value. Sydney ferries have a large fleet and cover a multitude of interesting places on the Harbour. from Manly to the north to Paramatta out west the Ferries open up one of the best harbours in the world. a great way to explore Sydney

Forget the harbour cruise and takea ferry to Manly and back. Why pay a fortune for a harbour cruise with average food when you can take the ferry to manly or Taronga Zoo, get off and explore at the other end and then head back. Most time and cost effective way to see Sydney Harbour from the water.
A common Sydneytransport. It was good experience on the ferries from both Circular Quay and Parramatta River. Ferry timing was accurate and service staff were polite too.

Good service. Had the opportunity to use the ferries a couple of times, to & from Manly Beach & back from the Darling Harbour. Easy to use as the Opal card is good for both trains and ferries. By far the best way to get around the expanse of the Harbour. Comfy seating in or outside depending on weather definetly the way to travel
