Great way to see the harbour. The ferry's are clean and on time and the best way to get to Manly. The views going to and from Manly are some of the best, and everyone know this. You will definitely have to elbow your way around to get that perfect picture!

Ferries in all directions!. Ferries in all directions!. Used daily by workers and tourists alike. They run often and are very cheap..great boat ride and viewing of the Harbour Zbridge and Ooera Zhouse from the water.
clean and maintained. easy to go to shopping and silent , run by many companies cheaper way to travel than on other public transport specially if you go from harbour to the DFO

Love our Ferries. Our harbour and Sydney generally would be the poorer without our Ferries. They provide hassle free, easy transport if you are lucky enough to be close enough to use them. Staff are friendly, seating is wide and comfortable, the views provide automatic sightseeing while trips can be taken all over the Harbour, under the bridge to Cockatoo Island, other islands and all the way to Parramatta or to Rose Bay. Some of the ferry terminals are quaint - a favourite of mine is Greenwich up against a rocky peninsula.

Fun to ride!. The ferries are so organized - they leave exactly on time - are clean inside and personnel are very nice. No bars or food concessions so bring your own water to drink. Sit on the top for the best views or out on the deck if you like wind. Spectacular ride - goes right past the opera house and under the "coat hanger" bridge on way to Darling Harbor - where else in the world can you get a ride like this for around $6.00 u.s. money. The best value in Sydney. Don't miss it!

The best way to get around. Ferries are a brilliant way to get around and also give you the best view. They come along regularly, are inexpensive, can fit a lot of people and are suitable to travel in any weather.

Ahoy!!. This a great way to view the Sydney Harbour.......it's the way to get to Manly Wharf too!!! WiFi is great on the ferry and there is indoor and outdoor seating.....get the opal pass and it will be cheaper....
Short trip around the harbour. Easy access and quick way to travel around the harbour you an pay on the ferret or you can pay fir your ticket at the ticket office. We found the staff very helpful

Another mode of transport for sight-seeing. Watsons Bay is a good location for a short visit. It was a smooth sailing by catamaran.
You can take a hike to South Heads from Watsons Bay.
If time permit, take the ferry to Manly.
Go upriver to Paramatta. On a sunny day, the scenery is beautiful. Look up at the majestic Sydney Harbour bridge as you sail under.

A wonderful trip to Cockatoo Island.. On our recent trip to Sydney we took a Ferry to Cockatoo Island as there was an arts/media festival happening. This island has an amazing history which we enjoyed in conjunction with the festival. Our experience with Sydney Ferries was totally positive in booking our tickets for the day and knowing which terminal we needed to be at to catch the ferry.

Gets you around . On time and good at announcing what the stops are which helps you know where to get off. One of the staff at circular quay was very unhelpful, he told us to catch the ferry to Neutral Bay to get to Luna Park... luckily i knew better, thanks to modern technology (Opal app & Google Maps).
Fast, efficient transportation. We used the ferry for transportation from the Taronga Zoo. Very efficient and on time. Would definitely use the ferry system again.

A memorable ride on rainy day. We had a ride from circular Quay to Manly and it was a good half an hour ride either way I will recommend you to sit on the outer benches to have better viewing Oprah House.
loved the ferrys. we spent alot of our time traveling around by ferry. Its quick convenient and fun. Using the opal card you can hop on and off wherever you like. We just got on for the ride.

Easy cruising. I cannot think of an easier way to see the harbour with so much to see like the Opera House and the Bridge. Catch a ferry from one side and go to Manly to the Aquarium or go to Darling Harbour, there's no end to things to see.

Suppressingly excellent wifi. Loved travelling on the ferries in Sydney always on time a place where you could happily sit and people watch, when you get bored of the views of each port of call. We love it., also there was always free wifi on board, which was widely also available around the streets of Sydney really puts us in London to shame.

Mr. Ferries are on time and passengers are well organized .
The harbor area is beautiful and being on the different ferries allows you to visit all the bay's.
Our favorite is to go to Watsons bay for fish and chips. Beautiful walks and very good views!
Easiest way to get across the bay!. Reasonable prices, fantastic views, a decent frequency of services and shuttle times that aren't too long.

Best way to view the harbour. The best way in my opinion to experience the harbour on a budget. Visit various tourist attractions (Manly, Taronga Zoo, Cockatoo Island etc.) via a Sydney Ferry. It is relatively cheap and on a nice day, nothing beats the wind in your hair and experiencing the harbour on a ferry.

Best Travel Experience around Sydney. I had the opportunity to travel by Ferry from Neutral Bay into the City and it was an outstanding travel experience.The ferry was right on time, it was well presented and really clean and tidy, the deck hand was doing his job efficiently and greeted passengers as they boarded and exited.The cost was very reasonable and of course, the best part were the outstanding views of the best harbour in the world. What more could you ask for?Well worth the time to take a trip and enjoy the experience.

good value. The Ferries are always good value for Seniors,it interesting to watch them go across the Harbour with the interesting animals, in lights, on them. We used the one from Darling Harbour back to the Quay at 10.00pm. Felt very safe.

Short Ferry ride on a beautiful Sunday Morning. Staying at The Grace Hotel we walked to Circular Quay, Caught a ferry that went via two stops before letting us off at Darling Harbour where our Breakfast venue was right at the Pier. From there a short walk up the hill and we were back at The Grace Hotel. Lovely way to start the day - walk/ferry/breakfast/walk! For when you don't have time to do a longer trip on the harbour.

Great Transport in Sydney. Great way to go around Sydney with great view of Harbour Bridge, Opera House and other scenery. Would recommend to buy the opal card if planning to use ferry for few trips as it might be cheaper with card.

Magical visit to Vivid Sydney by ferry. Catching the Kirribilli Ferry to Vivid is a magical way to see the caleidoscope of colours and patterns of the Sydney Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Museum of Modern Art and Circular Quay. You can catch the train to Milson's Point train station and walk down to Kirribilli Wharf. You are required to purchase an Opal card online or at an outlet such as a supermarket to tap on and tap off to get on and off the ferry. During Vivid 27 May-18 June the ferries are lit up with colourful animals such as rhinoceros, turtles and platypus. We deliberately took an indirect route to Circular Quay to see the harbour. We stopped at North Sydney, Neutral Bay, Kurraba Point, Kirribilli again and then Circular Quay. Best viewing is outside at the front of the ferry. You get a wonderful view of the brilliantly lit up Harbour Bridge and Luna Park. The ferry deliberately detoured to the Opera House to spend some time soaking in the magnificent indigenous patterns,colours and sealife. After seeing the visual feast at Vivid the return journey is by Circular Quay. Waiting for the ferry gives you a fantastic view of the Opera House without the crowds with a seat. A magical night!
Amazing view. Get ticket easy. Comfortable and amazing view. They were always on time.good values . Food and drink available on board

Wonderful way to travel locally. A very convenient, easy and economical way to travel around Sydney. Good timings, good connectivity and what views.
Fantastic for tourists also.
Absolutely the best way to get around. Prompt, clean, convenient. Great views. Love them! Used them every day during our stay. Wish we had them at home. Get an Opal transit pass
Great way to see Sydney. Get an opal card and jump on the Sydney ferries to see the city from the seaside. Great mod of transportation and a great way to relax as you see the iconic sites pass by.

Ferry ride is a must to see the views. For 12 $ per person the ferry takes you around all the important places upto darling harbour and back and let's u absorb all the views of the harbour bridge opera house Luna park botanical gardens the city and the darling harbour go for the ferry ride wen the sunset approaches and you will enjoy the views just sit back and relax

Always an interesting experience to take the public ferry. Take the ferry to see the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House from a different angle! Bring a good, image-stabilised camera. Best to take the ferry during sunset so that the light is cast beautifully on the Opera House!

Uninterrupted Viewing. We took a ferry which served us delicious buffet. The spread was lavish and very well organised. During lunch they took us around many interesting attractions which can be seen uninterruptedly. Loved the food and sights.R

The best way to experience Sydney harbors and beaches.. Cheap and classy, the ferries take you everywhere. They are fast, frequent and cheap. Staff is friendly and trained. You'll enjoy Sydney like in a postcard!
Great. Easy to navigate, comfortable & great views. Get an opal card and ride away. Trip to Manly is a must!Great way to see many areas of Sydney.

So easy and on time!. Never seen a public transportation system run so well as these. They're always on time and the views are amazing. They connect you to every part of the city and sometimes quicker way to travel.

Reliable and Regular. Passenger only. Can sit upstairs or downstairs, inside or outside. Main outlet is at circular quays. Steady but not fast. Comfort is standard. Food and drink available on board. Good value.

A real treat!. Excellent for Seniors and pensioners!Sign up at Central Station, show your cards and ID to get an OPAL card....This entitles you to unlimited travel on $2.50 a day on Ferries, rail and buses all around Sydney and more!...we travelled to Katoomba (Blue Mountains)...Two hours travel by train!Ferries are frequent, run smoothly even in bad weather, and take you all around the harbour and beyond!...Great for seeing the sights the Harbour has to offer!

Great views of the city!. Getting tickets was easy. We lined up, told the man where we wanted to go, we paid and he handed us the tickets.We lined up again to board the ferry. Make sure you pick the right side though, depending on what time of day it is. For us, the sun was very hot, so we made sure that we where on the side with the most shade. We took a quick lap of the bay, and had lots of opportunities to take photos of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and Luna Park. Plenty of tourists, so be first in line to get a good seat. Upstairs is indoors, so if it's raining, it might be the place to sit. Would definitely recommend catching a ferry to get to the other side, or just to take some photos.

I love this city! Thank you Sydney Ferries!. Whether you are exploring multiple points surrounding Sydney or just taking a hop between attractions, a ride using this service is so wonderful. The view of the harbour is amazing! Several spots are within 30 minutes away from Circular Quay, including Manly, Taronga Zoo and Darling Harbour.Tips for tourists - Take this service on a Sunday using the Opal card to enjoy unlimited rides for just $2.50. Use it while this Opal benefit is still on offer.

Best value in Australia!!!!. We got the Pensioner ticket and from then on Ferry was our way of transport the car didn't move from apartment!!!We went across to Manly, Darling Harbour, Parramatta across to the Zoo.You are right on the Harbour and don't really need to do a tour as you see same thing on your trips around harbour.

Buy and Opal card and you'll have access to all of Sydney's transportation.. The transportation system in Sydney is fantastic and you can get on the trains and ferries just using the Opal card. The ferries feel like an attraction and yet are inexpensive and very easy to use.

Best way to see the harbour. We have reviewed this under Sydney Harbour but we believe the ferries are the best way of not only viewing the harbour but also getting around from place to place, i.e. the Olympic site, the zoo and Manly , just to name three. The fares are very reasonable and on several routes there is also the Catamaran .
Best way to see Sydney's coastal towns. The ferries run ontime. The schedule is very generous. You can go to Bondi, Manly, Watsons Bay, Greenwich just to name a few. The best way to get around.
Great service . Opal card. If you don't have, get one. You'll save a fortune. We saw most of Sydney on the Ferry today, wonderful view and it saved our legs. Recommend

Convenient and relaxing travel. Very easy way to get around town. Relaxing and affords great views and unique vantage points over this amazing city. Not super cheap although with the Opal card it is a $15 daily max. Worth it.
Inefficient in peak times. They cant manage crowds. Ok for non peak times but on festive times or long weekends when there are crowds they are totally inefficient.....no planning or management.

Efficient way to travel to various destinations on Sydney Harbor. We had occasion to ride the carries several times from Darling Harbor to the Circular Quay, to and from Watson's Bay and to several other locations. The ferries run often, are reasonably priced and are are attractive transportation for both residents and tourists. The harbor is the central feature of the city and many of its attractions are best viewed by water.
Great convenience at low cost. Great to travel to and from Manly beach. Space for bicycle at not extra cost. Try and get to front of ferry for good views
Great way to get around. I took a few ferries to get to different parts of Sydney and it was a much cheaper way to get around and see a bunch of stuff along the way.
Pleasantly surprised. What a fantastic service these Ferries provide. We just loved using them during our stay and hopped on and off all the time.Returning to Sydney again soon.

Most convenient transportation vehicle. Easy to get, convenient and cheap !!!Just need to down load the app on your smartphone and all information u need is there already. Also, the timing is very exact

A must do!!. This Is A Must Do Activity,now that Vivid has started.Catch a 6pm Ferry to anywhere in the Harbour and watch Lotsa buildings being Coloured in by Hi tech projectors,from the water.Not to be missed on foot,either.

See the harbour on the cheap. Sydney ferries are primarily for commuters but they also offer an inexpensive way to see the harbour - best to get an all day ticket and take a few trips both east & west of the bridge. Watsons Bay and Hunters Hill are two of the best.
Great experience. We used the ferries to get to Manley, clean and efficient ferry services with accommodating staff. Good value and what a fab way to cruise the river!!

RTW trip. The ferries are the quickest, cheapest and most fun way of exploring the whole of the 13 mile stretch of Sydney harbour. the operate from circular quay, between the opera house and the bridge
A breath of fresh air. Just love using the ferries to travel in a relaxing way and just watch the life on the harbour. My first thing to do when I get to Sydney
Excellent. The ferrys are great in Sydney and we just loved getting out onto the water. Reasonable prices. .. ..

Don't waste life - move fast. It's a very good and comfortable way to get to many places from Cirqular Quey. Only 30 min - and you can reach Taronga zoo or Manly beach. They go on schedule every 30 min or so. As a bonus - you'll get a nice view of landscape all around - have your camera ready! ;-)

The way to go. Get an Opal card and the days are yours to travel the Sydney Harbour. The ferries are frequent and efficient. All staff are helpful (well maybe the odd one having a bad day) Take a bit of time to plan your route and work out what you want to see, talk to the guys in the travel information shop at Circular Quay and they will set you right. Have a great trip.

Great way to travel in Sydney. We thoroughly enjoyed the ferries. Toured Sydney harbour and went to Manly Beach which is beautiful with a good tourist shopping area. Friends went to Bondai as well, but liked Manley better.
Wonderful experience. Took our first ride on these amazing ferries and throughly enjoyed the experience. It is a great way to see travel around Syndey.
A great way to travel. The ferries a great to see the sights via the waterways. Great photos of the opera house and bridge. A must way to get to the zoo.

ICONICALLY SYDNEY. Taking a Sydney Ferry is much a great way to see the harbour at a fraction of the cost of the organised cruises. Also you can get on and off at your own leisure. You can buy a one ( or more ) day pass which works on all public transport. I partic ularly love the old ferries. Manly is a must and you can then go onto Taronga Zoo.

Nice and relaxing. Must do this if visiting Sydney, went with my family with few elderly's. They all enjoyed it. Go around 4pm and come back again around 6-7pm so that you can enjoy night views of the harbour.

So easy. Such a wonderful experience using this form of public transport in Sydney. As a bonus we got great views of the opera house and harbour bridge while aboard. It was easily accessible with the baby buggy. The service was easy to get tickets for, was on time and simple to use.
always fun. been many times and always catch a ferry somewhere...either the old plonkers or the new ones, a must for any visitor and you get to see more!

Cheaper than the Cruisers. We wanted to experience the Sydney ferry which is cheaper than the Cruisers and boarded at Circular Quay heading towards Manly beach and calling in at Watson's Bay. The ferry is reliable but very busy and good value for money. Great views from the river and easy way to get around.
Friday night service packed. Service reliable, ferry packed but good trip. Easy way to get around sydney especially for visitors..
Take a Sydney commuter ferry and see the harbour. No need to take a long harbour cruise. Take the Mosman or Darling Harbour Ferry and see the sights. Cheap and very cheerful.

Easy, fast travel. We bought a one day pass and first visited the Taronga Zoo. Then we visited Watson's Bay and Manly for a late lunch of fish and chips. Boarding the ferry again, we went past Luna Park, and stopped Darling Harbor for a full day of sightseeing before returning to Circular Quay.

A good and relaxing way to enjoy the sea breeze. Travelling on the Sydney ferries is a favourite activity of mine whenever I am in Sydney. It is so relaxing when you get to enjoy the cool sea breeze or wind, while taking in all the sights around Sydney harbour. You get such beautiful views of the harbour bridge, opera house, circular quay, darling harbour, luna park, botanical gardens, naval base and the Sydney skyline. A slow leisurely trip on the ferries, particularly at sunset and at night is such a good tonic for your mind and soul. Don't miss it.
Cheap way to see the harbour.. Very convenient way to see Sydney Harbour day and night. Just hop on a ferry to Manly or Darling Harbour [ at night] good value.

Very Cheap on a sunday! $2.50 with an opal card!. Worth taking a trip to Manly! Lovely boat ride and boats are really easy to use. Just pick up the boat from the harbour and off you go! But don't miss them as the don't wait!

Cheapest way to see the harbour. . This is the best way to see the harbour for the cheapest price. Hope on any ferry and you will see spectacular views of the bridge and opera house. Grab and opal card and u will get unlimited travel on trains, bus and ferries for a set price per day.
A pleasnt way to see some sites.... A great way to get around. See the sites from the water. Getting around Sydney in general is easy and trouble free.

Fun and good experience to travel around . we took ferry a few times using our Opal card, to darling harbour and taronga zoo. On the way to darling harbour, you can take a closeup view of the harbour bridge and good photos for both the harbour bridge and opera house, and Luna park as well. the trip to taronga zoo was amazed with Sydney cbd as background. Recommended.

Our trip to Manley. Lovely crossing in the warm sunshine and we managed to get a seat. Sometimes the view was spoilt by people taking photographs and got in the way. But I am guilty of that as well. I didn't realise how big the harbour was and how long it would take to get to Manley. Well over 30 minutes.

Great way to get about the Harbour!. With the opal Transport Card System, just tapping on and off Sydney Ferries, trams and Buses, this is the easiest way to get about Sydney, The ferries go from darling Harbour, Circular Quay and Luna Park just to name a few. Cheap and with great views of the Harbour it is a great place to also grab a photo or two too.

White Bay to Circular Quay. Very handy ferry from White Bay Passenger Terminal to Circular Quay and return. Fast and inexpensive.Just check return times from Circular Quay back to White Bay.Easy to find.Best way to get to and from.
Great way to see the quay. Fabulous way to see and feel the city. No congestion route great to be under the bridge. Tickets very easy to book from circular quay

great way to get from Parramatta to Circular Quay. Forget trains and take the ferry from Parramatta Wharf into Circular Quay. They are roomy and comfortable and although they might take a little longer than the train, it's a more pleasant trip by far with scenery you just won't see on a train

Love using them! . The ferries are a great and easy way to get around Sydney.. In fact they aren't favorite feature of Sydney's transport.Bee sure to get a Opal card and be on your way. You can go just about any way & the staff on board are always happy to help. I recommend sitting outside to enjoy the view.

Good for spare time and see different things. we had a morning to spare and got on a ferry and went up river. got off at drummoyne. not thing there except some really nice houses so we wandered and got to a main road with some shops and coffee and turned around and went back to circular quay on a ferry. had a relaxing time and say how the other half live.

Regular Ferry vs Guided Tour. Had an opportunity to talk to regular visitors and/or commuters.For new visitors to Sydney, a guided tour would point out features. However, for people familiar with Sydney and Harbour, the Ubiquitous Great fun.

I Never get sick of this. Fabulous photo opportunities, affordable, safe and clean. Best to get at the front outside if the weather is good. They run to schedule and frequently. Do yourself a favour....

Cruise like a Commuter. Sydney Ferrys are part of the city's public transport, but are a wonderful way to get around, and you can see harbourside sights for a fraction of the price you pay for a cruise. Manly is our favourite destination, but getting from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour is the nicest way to get there. You can get off, have a meal near one of the jetties, and catch the ferry back, or get a tram back to Central Railway station from Darling Harbour. Of course the ferry is the best way to get to Taronga Park Zoo (with its great views over the City), and the Meadowbank or Parramatta trips are long enough to get a sandwich and drink, and sit back as you slip past the Western Suburbs of Sydney

Very handy means of transport.. Living in Sydney we often travel to the city via bus and sometimes need to cross the harbour to either visit the Zoo or one of our favourite restaurants "Sails" and we always make use of the excellent ferry service.The ferry service is an excellent choice for visitors/tourists in Sydney to get around and it is a relatively cheap form of harbour viewing without having to go on an organised tour (of which there are many).The ferry will take you from the City all the way to Manly Beach or the Heads lookout and I thoroughly recommend it as a cheap and easy form of public transport.

Waterways experience - calm ride.. A leisurely travel from Parramatta to Sydney Harbour with an excellent view of the homes and a glimpse of a nice lifestyle by the waterfront....beautiful all throughout. Make sure you have a reasonably good camera ready to take photos. Very calm ride and quiet...although a bit windy but pleasant from the outside. Sunday trips are cheapest fares for the family.

The best way to enjoy the beauty of the harbour. Whether it is the trip to Manly, across the Taronga Zoo or the round trip to Luna Park & Darling Harbour, the ferries are a comfortable & scenic way to enjoy Sydney! The staff are always friendly (in my experience) with advice & assistance when needed.
Good timetable - use Opal Card to pay. Frequent departures from Circular Quay. Pay with an Opal Card, especially on a Sunday when maximum deduction is $A2.50 as compared to normal $7 each way.

Awesome transportation.. The Sydney Ferry system in my opinion is one of the best ways to get around and also get some great site seeing of places from a totally different view. nice ride to Manley or Port Thompson or a nice ride up the Paremetta River to the Olympic park.

The only way to see SYDNEY harbour. It's cheap it's fast and it's beautiful...you can do many trips in all different directions but the best one is the Manly Ferry...when you get to Manly get off walk up the main arcade street called the corso until you get to the beach...in that mall on the right there is a fish and chip shop...order yours from there...sit at the beach and eat themNothing more Australian!!!Then head back to the ferry!!Perfect 3-4 hours spent in Sydney

Best budget sight seeing tours in shdney. These old school ferries are well worth the fare as even though they are still functional city transport they are a great tourist attraction for budget traveller and tourist alike. They will give you the best biews of the opera house and bridge at a fraction Of the cost of a more expensive tour. They also have great history for Sydney. Worth a ride for sure :)

Daily commute. A bit expensive (costs me almost $12/day for the round trip) but still the most pleasant way to commute in Sydney. And whilst a relatively expensive commute, the ferries are a relatively cheap way for visitors to get on Sydney harbour.
Easy to ride. The ferries provided an easy and inexpensive way to get around, in our case from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour. The ride was pleasant with nice views along the way.

Ideal For Getting Around!!. Sydney lives on its harbor, Circular Quay is the heart of all things great about Sydney....the Ferries are a transportation delight. Fast and frequent service through Circular Quay makes touring, site seeing and adventuring a part of everyday life for the Sydney Siders! A Funway to enjoy the sites!

Good all rounder 😊. Whether you're a local or a tourist, a trip on the Sydney ferries is an enjoyable ride. The Sydney to Manly ferry gives you ample time to enjoy an ice cream or drink whilst watching the scenery of Sydney harbour pass by. Sit outside or inside & enjoy the ride! ☀️👍

A terrific mode of transport especially to visit Manly Beach and Bondi Beach. A once in a lifetime chance to go under the Sydney harbour Bridge and travel as the locals do, around the waters of Sydney harbour.

Great way to see the harbour and get around Sydney. Thoroughly, recommend a ferry ride both to Manly and also up the harbour (under the bridge) to anywhere - Darling Harbour if you don't want to go far. It is the cheapest and best way to see the harbour both day and night.

Public transport at its best!. Coming from Perth I am constantly surprised how well other cities do public transport! I know we don't have the population and/or the tourists that Sydney does be we need to step up. The frequency and ease of using these services is really good.

Great value. Great sights.. What great value the Sydney Ferries are, Manly and Watsons Bay are my favourite destinations, a relaxing ferry ride then a stroll around the areas followed by a nice lunch at one of the fantastic eateries. Both destinations get my tick of approval, but there are other trips you can take.
Like a bus but it floats. These ferries are amazing, they're like a big bus but they float and take you from point to point. A truly remarkable experience
You can go just about anywhere. Sydney Ferries run very efficiently and always easy to catch one to where you want to go. Great way to catch wonderful views of the harbour.
awsome. these ferries are always are there on time and leave on time we were very impressed. They also were very clean.

Nothing Better than a Harbour Cruise. Get a daily ticket and travel around the harbour getting off and on at the various stopping points. There is lots to see on and off the water and it is a fun and inexpensive way to spend at least a day.

From the Harbor to the Beach. We took a ferry from Circular Quay, Sydney's Harbor, to Manly Beach. The views were breathtaking! So many things to see along the way. Enjoyed the beach, then ferried back.

You get to see Sydney's greatest assets for the price of a return ticket to Manly. This is the one thing I recommend to every friend that comes to Sydney. Get on a Ferry and go to Manly and back. You see everything from down at water level, the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House, Fort Denison. You go past the zoo, Chowder Bay. You see the big houses that line the shores of the eastern suburbs of Rose Bay, Double Bay and the like. You see the heads.I feel like going for a ride right now.This can also be a great trip on a day when the weather isn't great to do other things!

Manly Ferry. Had been advised to take the famous Manly ferry to Manly beach. Unfortunately it rained that day but we went late afternoon and returned after dark. Well worth taking the ferry to see Sydney by night from the water. Highly recommend it.
Ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly. A great way to spend a few hours. The trip took about thirty minutes each way and the scenery was absolutely fantastic
What's a trip to Sydney without a ferry ride. An essential for visiting Sydney. Make sure you do the Manly Ferry as well. Spend a day hopping through the harbour on the ferry, sightseeing as you go.

easy & low price. comparison to those cruise, the price is much lower. Personally i don't think the cruises is necessary to see the harbour views unless you want to have commentary and more detail about what you are looking at. To me, it's just need to have very nice pictures with the bridge, opera house. so ferry is good enough.

Peace and Tranquillity – a magical way to start and end your working day.. Drive to work OR catch a ferry? I have the choice of either. I always chose the Ferry (except when it is torrential rain and wind). With a coffee in hand I sit outside on my way to work. It is such a peaceful way to start the working day. Watching the ferries and during summer the cruise boats. During winter I rug up in a scarf and coat and still enjoy the warmth of the sun on my face and wind in my hair. At the end of a stressful day, the negative energy disappears over the harbour and I arrive back at Mosman Bay with a smile on my face. The Mosman/City Ferry is consistently running on time, clean and the other passengers are respectful and delightful.
Fine mode of Transportation. A small fee you can ride the Ferry or go to different parts of the City and view the beautiful waterways.

Awesome way to experience Sydney (& much more than "pleasant inlet") Harbour. To be lost on the harbour going anywhere on the harbour, to Manly, to Parramatta & everywhere in between. To The zoo, to Watsons Bay, Darling Harbour, all via Circular Quay.

Joy ride. It was a nice weather when we visited Sydney. The waiting time is fair and it isn't too crowded as well just enough for the ferry. The ticket cost is not pricey too.We had tour around and it was a fascinating overview and I was amazed by the structures and towers. We were even under the Sydney Harbour Bridge and it was really exciting for us.I would go back and ride again if we travel in the future.
GREAT WAY TO TRAVEL WHEN STAYING NEAR PARRAMATTA RIVER!. Friendly staff, easy arrangement and great to see the city on the way. Helpful and well oiled staff made this journey great.

Only way to get around. We travelled on the ferry service 3 times during our stay in Sydney and it is reliable and on time and priced well. The best harbour in the world and public transport prices cant go wrong

The best way to explore the harbour. Quite often when we have a spare weekend we will go to the city and take the kids on a ferry ride to many any or many destinations within the harbour. Most ferries take you to areas with a few shops and somewhere to eat. You get some great views of the harbour and always see something new or interesting like some navy ships or cruise ships.

Fast & efficient. We took the fast ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay on a Sunday. The ferry runs fairly frequently especially for a Sunday. It was about a 17 minute journey from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay with one stop at Rose Bay enroute. Just beware, not all queuing ticketed passengers were allowed to board the ferry so allow yourself plenty of time so that you don't have to wait for the next ferry. Safety was well considered on the ferry especially where children were concerned.

Convenient public transportation for the tourists attraction. Get on the ferry to travel like a local. Have the similar experience of "harbor cruise". If you don't have the "Opal Card" (the card for public transportation), you need to be patient when purchasing the tickets through the machine. ONE ticket ONE purchase.
Fantastic weather on the Harbour. What a great way to get across town. Easy and cheap. Plenty of seating inside and outside on the Ferry. Must do on a visit!

Great way to travel between the harbors. We loaded the Opal card and travelled between the harbors. If you plan to go to Manly beach, plan the evening return. This way you can see the Sydney at night from the harbor with all its glorious lights

Take the Ferry to the Zoo. We were late in the day - so would have only had an hour in the zoo - and it really is too expensive and large - for just an hour. What a nice surprise. There are great walking trails that allow a view of the Sydney Harbour from a completely different angle. Easy ferry ride - well worth it!

Sydney is all about the ferries. The ferries are a great way to see the city from different perspectives. We too one ferry to Watson's Bay. The view of the Opera House on the return journey is amazing. We also took a night ferry over to Darling bay just to see all the lights.

Stress Free Commute. I am enough to to travel by ferry to and from my office in the city. It avoids regular traffic snarls. Even nicer is that there is always something new to look at. That might be the occasional whale, dolphin or penguin, tall ship, racing yacht or ocean liner ( pretty often).
Easy ride and get way to see the harbor. Always on time. Reliable. what else can you ask for in a transportation system. The Circular Quay is the central location. We took it to the zoo.

Brilliant. These ferries buzz all over the place and are a good way to travel, its worth checking prices as some companies cost less than others, we didn't realise this til it was too late! Trip to Manly well worth doing, nice to get out of the city.

Great way to see Sydney. Although its not an attraction its the best way to see Sydney. Coming from a city without ferries yes its a novilty at first. Reasonally priced transport to head to lots of areas
Easy to use". Great to get around the harbour city and you get to see Sydney from a different view. Easy to catch and the transport card makes it so easy.

Cheap way to see all the sights.. We have been to Sydney a few times and this time we bought ourselves a pre-paid Opal card which allows you to use all the public transport including the ferries. The brilliant thing about the Opal card is that the maximum you will be charged for any one day is around $7.00. We went from Circular Quay to Manly the first day so got great views of the opera house, Fort Dennison and the bridge. The next day we took the ferry all the way to Parramatta which was lovely. (Although the last bit was through industrial areas). Then we caught the train back. That night we traveled from Circular Quay to Darling harbour which gave great views of the lights of the city. You can pick up the Opal cards at the main stations and at 7/11 dairies.

Financially affordable way to check out Sydney Harbour surrounds.. Hop on then hop off at one of the many stops around the harbour, Walsh Bay, Manly, Neutral Bay, the Zoo, Cockatoo Island, Garden Island. List goes on and on. Hop on again same day, same price at another location. Excellent opportunity to enjoy various city harbour & surrounds, the walks. Historic ferries still a delight in every way whether sitting inside or out, upstairs or down. Whether travelling as a visitor, tourist or business, person, with a pram, wheelchair or able bodied, service staff available, willing to assist. Comfort facilities on board useful. Can even stay on all day, sit back, relax. Amazing photo opportunities of some of our most amazing icons. Can't recommend a ferry trip enough. Have being doing so since a child, not a senior and still take grandchildren, also enjoy with friends, or just for on my own little adventures.

Economical way to see the beautiful waterways of Sydney. I have caught Sydney ferries (Rivercat) from Parramatta to Darling Harbour and back - this goes along the Parramatta River, Circular Quay to Manly many times, Darling Harbour to Milsons Point, Circular Quay to Taronga Zoo wharf. Reasonably priced services and a wonderful way to see the waterways of Sydney. Nothing better on a blue skied sunny day than the view from Circular Quay to Manly (views of opera house, harbour bridge, Fort Denison, Sydney heads.
Very good. Service was great. Someone jumped over board while we were heading back to circular quay from manly. Very well handled by crew.

CHEAP sight seeing! Go at sunset. So the Sydney transport system is amazing! Especially the ferry, buy an opal card and just bounce around the day away! It was a great way to see the harbor. Plus you can plan it for the sunset and see the opera house from darling harbor to circular quay! Such a neat trip, you also stop by the Luna park!
Extremely punctual and reliable. We took a return ferry to Manly.Takes about 30 minutes I think. plenty to look at on the way. Its a busy waterway. Used regularly by tourists and locals alike

Best and most economic way to see Sydney. Sparkling waters when the sunshine comes out, and amazing night time views. Many ferries have a great feel and old quaint feel about them, and they cost very little if you buy an Opal card charged in and out electronically. You can get across the harbour to the zoo, over to Manly, or along the Parammata river, so see the length of the city, and some cure beaches and hidden spots. Traffic is always busy, this is the most pleasant way to see and get around the city

What a wonderful way to see the city . We have visited Sydney several times, and still can't believe the ferries I'm thinking almost anywhere else in the world you would pay a fortune to travel around waterways, but in Sydney it's like catching a bus! The Sydney workers catch the ferry to commute to and from work , so the fairs are kept cheep, so us visitors get the benefit, we get fish and chips from one of the local shops and simply hop on the first ferry leaving, all the ferries leave and return to Circular quay so we enjoy our fish and chips while enjoying the sights of Sydney Harbour, I can't recommend enough checking out the ferries when you are in town .
Punctual and efficient. The best way to get around all the different place sin the Sydney harbour area. Boats leave and arrive on time, and its great to sit on the deck and drink in the views.

NOT TO BE MISSED. My husband and are Senior/Pensioner Card holders and were therefore entitled to the Opal Seniors Card. We took the Government run ferry up the river for the 2 hour trip and it only cost us $2.50 each!!! Superb....well done Sydney.

Enjoyable and affordable. Use your Opal card and save $$ from the express ferries. Enjoy the ride and scenery to Manly Island or down the Parramatta River. It's a nice way to see the areas along the coast, and isn't why you came to visit this wonderful City. It is a good way to see under the bridge or Sydney Opera House or coming into Darling Harbour with all of its various boats.
fun. very big boat to go to the zoo. My son has very appreciated to see the harbour bridge since the ferry
You Don't Need a Harbour Cruise. Sydney ferries are the best way to see the Sydney Harbour. It's cheap, laid back, and beautiful! Get an outdoor seat, sit back, and enjoy the view.

Average Ride. We intended to take the ferry from Circular Quay to Pyrmont, but we missed our stop and ended up going back to Circular Quay and taking a taxi to our accommodations. It would have been a nice change to go by ferry to our destination, but a ferry ride was not so enticing that we wanted to stay on it twice as long as necessary.

Sydney Ferries, A great and affordable way to get around!!. Enjoying so much of what you can see or visit in Sydney the Sydney Ferry services are more than just public transport. I think of them more like short cruises on the bay. Of course they will get you safely from A to B in most weather conditions. It is only logical if you wish to really enjoy the ride and the sights, travel with good weather and calm waters. Capture the views on your camcorder, camera. Guarantee you and yours will love it.

Best Harbour tour. They are just great. It is simply the best way to see the Harbour for a reasonable price. Its really nice to just take it all in without any background commentary. The scenery says it all, a real eye-fest. It has to be the best commute option on the planet. What a privilege.
Sydney Ferries. we took the ferry to the zoo, Manly beach and Cockatoo Island. very cool and even has free wi-fi, which isn't free in the hotels.

Best thing to do in sy. Do this - the 2 aud real ride into the city as opposed to the for the tourist joy rides near darling harbour, great way to absorb the city, get the locale experience. Will always do this everytime I get to Sydney.
Lots of Fun. Took the ferries to the zoo, Cockatoo Island, Manly. Ferries are clean and comfortable. But try to sit outside because you can see so much more.
Great way of travelling. We went over by ferry to Manley. A lovely place to visit. Tickets are quite cheap for the ferry and even though it looks busy they can fit lots of people on here.

Great for a daytrip out to Manly. Take the ferry out to Manly for a few hours and have lunch in Manly.It is good to escape the bustle of the city for a while and you can see the parks in Manly or the beach if you'd like to relax and read a magazine on the beach.The ferry has bathrooms and ice cream and sodas, the while trip there is about a half hour and is cheap.

All day enjoyment. As a "Senior", one can journey all day on the Sydney Ferries, Buses and metro trains for $2-50: where else can such value be found.For a lover of things nautical,one can scoot all around the Harbour, even to Parramatta to view Government House, over to Manly for fish and chips, or to Watsons Bay for lunch at Doyles. What value, and what scenery.

Only way to see the Sydney Harbor. Have been to Sydney a few times. Would recommend using the ferries to get around. My best trip is to catch a daytime ferry to Manly, and come back once the sun has set. Has to be the best value for money Harbour by night cruise ever !!!
Spectacular views. Hop on and hop off. Specially on Sundays when Opal is just $2.5. Circular Quay to Manly is the best ferry ride you can take.

Great value for money. We bought an opal card and it caps your trips at $15 per day and on Sunday the ferries are included as part of the $2.50 all-day public transit. Great Value. Lovely way to see the harbour.

Short and simple. Nice way to get around town, get fresh air and not having to breathe in the same air as everyone else like you would on a train. Staff seem to be more friendly on this form of transport and very informative and seem as if they can sense when you're not so familiar with the ferries. Even enjoy it for the sake of just the views and beautiful images you can capture whilst on it.

Views. This is the best and cheapest way to see Sydney Harbour and its surroundings. Regular services to all parts of the harbour, we used the ferries every day during our visit to get to and from the city and to visit Manly and many other parts of Sydney. You have to purchase an Opal travel card which are available in lots of shops and at all the various bus, train and ferry locations. We bought two and loaded them with 50 $ which is great value considering all the trips we made on all the transport system. You have to tap on each journey and tap off at the end on each journey. The reading machine give you a running status of the value remaining balance after each journey. It is easy to relaid more value with payment by credit card.

Great way to travel around Sydney! . Popped on a ferry with my mother and partner during a day out in the city. Although they're quite busy they're also quite pleasant and it's lovely to be out on the water. We travelled over to manly and back. Plenty of seating however if you want to sit outside up the front make sure you get in quick!

Scenic & Convenient. I went on the Sydney ferries many times I the time I spent on my trip and they never disappointed always a beautiful ride and if it ever rained there was a large inside area to sit.

Great inexpensive sunny day activity . The best way to experience the Sydney harbour on a budget. The ferry is fairly inexpensive and the trip to Manly is quite enjoyable with a spectacular view of the opera house and harbour bridge.

Helpful staff. we took the ferry multiple times and each time the staff were super helpful and friendly - one even went so far as to explain why we didn't get any decuction on our Opal card (exceeded the number of paid trips in the week so free travel after! Woot!).

Enjoy on Sundays!. Had a chance to take 4 ferries, one as part of a blue mountains tour and three on Sunday when they are included as part of the $2.50 all-day public transit. Best way to get view of harbour.
Fast. Theses ferrys are pretty good,run on time clean and you get a great view of the opera house and the bridge,worth using not too pricey

Convenient Transportation. Sydney Ferries is an extension of Sydney's public transportation. Though you would be able to take a bus or train, it is an interesting and convenient way to travel. You dont get the opportunity to do this in many places.

Sydney by ferry is Sydney at its best!. What makes Sydney a beautiful city is the harbour and the best way to experience the harbour is by ferry. Its good to have a destination in mind but really the journey there by ferry is the experience you cherish.

Efficient way around the harbor. The Sydney ferries are an essential way of transportation for the locals and visitors alike. They are efficient, well operated, on time, clean and staffed on and off the boats. For visitors, most ferries you need will leave from Circular Quay. There are 6 wharf and there is an electronic board, which tells you destinations, wharf number and time they leave. It is very easy to use. Buy an opal card and you can just swipe your card, no need to buy a ticket each time you use the ferries.
Cruise around Sydney harbour and take in the view. It is a cheap and fast way to cross the bay. Came here for a night cruise and the views were amazing. All the twinkling lights and dark skies.

getting around sydney. good for seeing the sights of sydney and getting around get a pass but remember to swipe on and off or it takes the money off your card up to the final destination of the ferry or bus

CRUISE ON THE WORLDS MOST BEAUTIFUL HARBOUR.. Enjoy a trip to manly,a great beach the other side of the concourse.Our wonderful harbour Zoo,a trip to fun Luna Park on the way to exciting Darling Harbour with its great shopping and Food Outlets/Restaurants.Venture a little further to Birkenhead point for Super Factory Outlet Shopping in a Gorgeous Harbour setting.

Sydney Ferries An excellent way to travel.. While visiting Sydney the ferries were not far away and were a great way to get around the city as well as many out lying areas. Combined with the buses and trains they are an important means of transportation in a city on the water. Circular Quay, the hub for ferry travel, is a terminal for most destinations by water and easy to make connecting rides.
Senior citizens from abroad discriminated. As a public transport facility the ferries provide excellent service. Too bad that senior citizens from outside Australia are not recognised as such

Relaxing journey with great views of the Sydney Harbour and Opera House. We were staying in an airBnb half an hour walk from Bondi beach and from here, we could walk 20 minutes down the road to Rose Bay. We took the ferry from Rose Bay to Circular Quay via Watson 's Bay and it cost $12.50 (£6.25) per person.You don't need to pay before you get on, you actually pay when you get off the boat at Circular Quay. Circular Quay is where to get off to see the Sydney Harbour, the bridge and the Opera House. It was a really nice ride with some spectacular views.We didn't get off at Watson's Bay but it looked like a beautiful place to relax on the small beach or to take a dip in the sea. I would highly recommend this to anyone wanting a cheap boat trip with views of the Sydney Harbour, the bridge and the Opera House.
Brilliant. On time cheap easy to use a fantastic way to see Sydney from the water take the time to ride the ferries you won't regret it!

Worth a trip. Take a trip...we went to Manly, but we hear that Watson Bay and Bondi Beach are great too. The schedules are all posted and pretty easy to follow. There are many people to assist you as well.
Sydney Ferries. We caught the ferry from Sydney Circular Quay to Darling Harbour. About 20 mins ride. Very nice, comfortable, affordable, and the view was sensational. Definitely a must.

Great way to get around. We started with a hop on hop off pass our first Day in Sydney. We used Sydney Ferries after that since we knew what we wanted to see. Fast and have a great schedule that is easy for a jet lagged Traveler to figure out

A great way to get around.. We spent several days in Sydney during our April vacation in Australia. Catching these ferries is a great way to visit the various areas around the harbor and inexpensive. We used our Opal card the same one we purchased to get around Sydney town on their bus line. There are several ferries at the various terminals near the Circular Quay which made it very easy for us. You can easily spend the entire day here just visiting the various sites. Highly recommended.

Fabulous Ferries. We took advantage of the ferry system that shuttles people across the harour. We went to Manly, the zoo and Luna park all using the ferry system, Easy to use and runs efficiently. Highly recommend.

Visited friends. Good cheap quick transport out of town. If you apply about a month before to OPAL. you will be able to travel very cheaply for your whole visit on the ferries and public transport. $2.50 per day on a seniors pass.
Best way to travel. Used the ferries regularly with an Opal Travel Card and the system worked brilliantly. The best, and more importantly, the cheapest way to see the area. Fantastic service.

Relaxing way to see Sydney Harbour. Did the 2hr Sightseeing tour of the harbour. This is a relaxed way of getting to see the harbour and getting around in general.
Would definitely recommend this mode of travel.

A great way to see Sydney Harbour. We had a great trip across the harbour with the family on a ferry. It was packed with people when we visited. We got to go under the Harbour Bridge. Buy your ticket at least 5 mins before departure, as they shut the gates early!

A great, afforadable way to get around. The open water, the sights up close and a very affordable way to see Sydney free different perspectives. The frequency of services and comfort ability is second to none, these guys know what they are doing. Day trip, casual water experience, a great way to get around. Total fun in breath taking views to be had, you'd be mad to miss it.
Great transportation system. We rode the ferries to and from many destinations, with the trains and ferries running getting around Sydney is very easy.
Cheap and easy way to travel. Went to Manley for the day and would recommend a visit. Ferries are plentiful and inexpensive and give great views of the Bridge and Opera house.

Explore with Sydney Ferries. During our week in Sydney we used the ferries to visit and explore heaps of places. They were always on time' clean and comfortable and the staff helpful and pleasant. Also if you qualify for a Seniors discount the OPAL card is amazingly inexpensive and very convenient. Had a great week

Scenic tour of this great harbour for just a few dollars. Recently took the Darling Harbor ferry from Circular Quay around to Darling Harbor via Luna Park and Balmain. Wave to the bridge climbers as you go. What a beautiful part of the world.

Great way to get around Sydney!. It's not exactly cheap but it's much faster than taking buses, trains or taxis to get about the city. It's the most relaxed and leisurely compared to anything else. You get a great view of everything in the harbour, which as a tourist it's terrific and gives you time to thing about what you'll be doing next. I suggest getting the pass card at the Sydney Transportation Office to save cost as each trip will be cheaper and much easier. Enjoy!

The ONLY way to view the world's greatest harbour and iconic sights!. Hopping on a public ferry is the best way to investigate the many secrets and surprises of the world's greatest harbour. And the best way to get some out of the ordinary photos of the iconic sights.

Great way to see the city and outlying coast line.. We use the ferries every trip they are fun if not a little busy at times. Went to Manly a good day out . Tip Sunday is cheap travel day . Get an Opal card for travel and save money on every trip.
good. you should go on a Sunday with an opal card as everything will be only 2.5 otherwise it is rather expensive
Value . Great way to photograph Sydney and to travel around Darling harbour .plenty of places to hope off , Amusement park at the pier across from Central quay looks a must for the kids .

Excellent way to get around Sydney Harbour and foreshores. Zoo trip and sight seeing.. This is the best way to see Sydney harbour on a budget. Purchase an Opal card and once you spend $15 in fares the rest of the day is free. Basically $15 gets you on and off public transport around Sydney for the whole day unlimited times. We caught the Sydney ferry system to get from Circular Quay around the harbour over to Paddy's Markets and to the Zoo. Both times we started at Circular Quay and it was extremely easy to understand the timetables, where to get the right ferry and any questions we had were fielded by the staff at the booths. The ferries go all over the Harbour and around the foreshores offering a cheap and effective way to see all the sights from the water. The ferries offer an excellent viewing of the big sights like the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House. The Bridge is amazing from the boat as it just dwarfs everything in the harbour. The Ferry system is also a good way to get to Lunar Park, the Casino and Darlington Harbour saving a lot of time on the roads. During busy periods (before/ after work) we noticed the ferries could be quite busy however we had no issues finding a seat.

Great service. We used the harbour ferries regularly during our visit to Sydney and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The ferries we travelled on we're always on time and the crew were courteous and efficient at their jobs. An ideal way to get about and to see great views of Sydney.

Nothing like a spin around the harbour. Well at least from Circular Quay to near Pyrmont. Lovely day, prompt and helpful crew. Gives you a look at the underside of the bridge, Luna Park up close and waterfront residences.

Excellent Transportation!. When we are in Sydney, we always get the Opal Card and take the ferries frequently. They are an excellent mode of transportation to get to Parramatta, Taronga Zoo, and Manly Beach and all places in between. We love to sat outside if the weather is good.

Too busy but very good. Got the manly ferry on a Friday afternoon. $15 return from circular quay. Really nice trip just too crowded outside. Make sure you get to the ferry early to ensure a good seat. Had good dolphin sighting too so keep an eye out.

Never tired of ferry rides!. I had a 24 hour on/off pass and seriously did not want to disembark! On both sunny and cloudy days, I enjoyed cruising the high seas in the Sydney neighborhood. A must for all visitors!

Take the ferry to Manly. Easy to understand the timetable. ferry quite busy, but enough seating for all. worth a visit to Manly beach to go where the locals go and watch the surfing. great beaches, plenty of spave for everyone.
entertaining kids. We did round trips to and from luna park to take up extra time and entertain the kids for a bit longer.

Nearly always a good trip. Great, except for the Circular Quay ferry to Darling Harbour on Sunday....make sure you use it early, especially if you have a show etc at Darling Harbour, as in middle of the day the wharf was crowded and ferry continually filled up with many having to wait. This became quite dangerous as many pushing. Maybe because this is family cheap fare day, with many, many, families lots of kids and strollers. I think there needs to be rails to line up in for this as many on the outer side just pushed their way through and those of us along the inside who had been waiting for two closed ferries could not get on.
Cheap way to see the harbour. Once tickets were purchased the service was efficient and ran on time. The ferries we went on look tired but staff on board were friendly and helpful.
Good way to see the Harbour. Check out the trips you can do by Ferry, Watsons Bay, Manly, The Zoo, even Fort Denison. Wonderful economic way to see the harbour from the water.

Sunday, Sunday, Sunday. We took the ferry to Bondi Beach for $2.50 AU per person. What views of the city. On Sundays, Sydney has "Family Funday Sunday" and all transportation (Ferries, Trains and Buses are $2.50 AU per person for the whole day. What a great idea and easy way to see the city and surrounding areas.

Great Value for Sight Seeing. We enjoyed the ferries, such a novelty when we only have trains that will take you around. Value for money, once you reach fifteen dillars spent in one day it is capped. The card costs nothing( unlike silly myki) and thete is no time limit on when you spend your balance, so you can use it when you go back on holidays next year. It can be a bit if a squash getting on and off, just like a train at peak hour and do be careful with young children. (We saw one fall in the water from a pier next to a ferry) However, if you plan your day you can have a magnificent time seeing all the harbourside ports of call. Don't forget to walk up to the gap lookout at Watson's Bay.. Doyles isn't the only attraction there. Cheers

Very efficient. These ferries are a great way to get around Sydney. Used them to get from Balmain to Circular Quay, another one from Circular Quay to Taronga Zoo. You can also buy your zoo tickets at the ferry office which saves time when you get to the zoo itself.Clean and efficient.

Fun way to see the city. If you want a relaxing way to see the city from the water, buy a round trip ticket to the ferry - these are readily available at the Circular Quay. Just be careful as to which ticket you purchase as the ferries go to many different locations. The Manley one is the best and if you go in the evening and return at the right time (depending on the season), you can even see the sun setting on Sydney Harbour Bridge.

A cheap alternative to a sightseeing cruise. Well worth the ride. The ferries are very cheap and you get exactly the same views as from the sightseeing cruises which cost a lot more! You get to experience places you never would have thought of visiting. A great way to get around.
Ferries very easy to use. We used 3 different ferries, Fantasea, Manly Fast and the standard harbour ferry. All were easy to access tickets for, were comfortable and were on time.
A great way to get around Sydney. We used the Sydney ferries often during a week in Sydney. We found them to be efficient, cheap and great fun.

catch a ride. These ferries take you to a wide variety of areas and we just travelled on them for about3 hours and got to see a wide variety of a scenery, trees in watery river sides massive houses and many different birds. travelled jan 2014

Cruise Sydney Harbour With An Opal Card. Enjoy Sydney Harbour without spending too much: AU$2.50 on Sundays and for free for the rest of the week after you've used your Opal for 8 trips (each trip should be at least one hour apart). Just make it a point not to ride during city workers peak hours so you can enjoy the view. Plan your trips. Hop on and off the ferry to Cockatoo Island, Darling Harbour, Manly, Taronga Zoo, Watsons Bay, etc. and cruise Parramatta River during the day. At night, take the ferry from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay, or vice versa (we did the round trip) the one that stops at Luna Park, for a closer view of the Sydney lights at night.

The Only Way to Travel . The ferries on Sydney Harbour are fantastic. If you can find the time board a large one and go all the way to Manly for sightseeing and a meal. If you decide to go to Taronga Park Zoo then you must go by ferry!They go all the way to Parramatta along the river taking in the olympic site at Homebush Bay along the way. If time is of the essence just take a short round-trip from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour and along the way take in Luna Park, McMahons Point, Balmain Wharf and Pyrmont Bay. Fares aren't cheap, but the views of the Sydney Opera House and the many harbour sights take on a new perspective.

Recommended. Would highly recommend using these ferry services. We bought opal cards and were amazed at how much we could use this. Get off a Central Quay and then head to ferry terminal. We went on one heading for Darling Harbour, sailed past Sydney Opera House, under the bridge, got off a Luna Park for a walk around and then back on another ferry and to Darling Harbour. We managed to get amazing pictures and all this on public transport. We then went back at night and done the same thing with more amazing pictures.

An excellent and cheap way to travel around Sydney. We bought an OPAL card for $20 Aus and it can be used all day for $15 riding to and from any ferry in the system. We were staying in the Darling Harbour vicinity so picked up ferrys there and rode to the main terminal (The QUAY) in central Sydney. You travel under the Harbour Bridge and near the Opera House and Rocks area. We then took a ferry out to Manly. The ferries are large, have nice seats and provide wonderful views of the Harbour area. With the all day OPAL pass you can also use trains and buses to move about. The Ferries and the OPAL card are a great way for tourists to see the city without renting a car and fighting traffic.And people were very friendly in helping figure out which ferry or bus to take to get around.An excellent extensive public transit system!

On Time Like Clockwork. The men and women who run the Sydney Ferries do an amazing job darting on time in and out of wharfs galore avoiding every form of moored and moving boats in all types of weather and water conditions. Kudos. Amazing. Thanks!!
Great experience. Great service and on time. Had the chance to ride several ferries to various locations. The ferries are on time, comfortable and clean.
👍🏼. Always good to take a trip to manly . Have lunch at the pub and a beer , and then a sit on the beach , but the trip back on the ferry specially on a rough day is amazing love the big swells 👍🏼
On time Ferries Let you see Sydney Harbour. We took the ferry to the zoo. They are relatively inexpensive and a great way to see the harbor and see Sydney from he water. Beautiful views all around!

Great way to take a trip on the harbour day or night.. Pick a nice sunny day of warm night & grab a ferry, take a trip to manly or somewhere else. It is a beautiful way to take in the harbour. You can take a train to Circular Quay then jump on a ferry to numerous locations. make a day of it.

Gorgeous. A beautiful very scenic ferry ride that is always on time and does not break the bank. Catching a ferry on Sydney Harrbour, there is always something new to see aswell as enjoying a front row view of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. My children love getting the ferry. It's a great activity for all.
sydney night ferry. got ferry from luna park back to circular quay about 11.30pm. after wedding at palais room at luna park. beau nite. easy with oral card.
Good Way to get around the waterways. We bought an all day ticket and had great fun hoping on and off these ferries. It made for cheap travel especially to Manley beach

The best way to enjoy Sydney. If you are in Sydney for a few days, purchase an Opal Card and hop and off these ferries all over the harbour. We have visited Sydney several times now and this is still our favourite thing to do.
A most excellent day out. Travelled on ferry to Abbotsford with friends lovely sparkling good to be alive Autumn day followed by lunch at Dedes restaurant . Excellent day activity.

great ferry service..so much to see!. We took the ferry over to cockatoo Island to see the art displays and to enjoy the scenery and walks there. The service is reasonably prices as part of the transit system's OPAL card which has a $15 a day maximum cost for any transportation. Our only concern was the they are so popular that they were super busy and noisy was a result--but that is not a bad thing. It is wonderful to see families and tourists mixing together

Sydney Harbour Ferries.. Sydney is situated on a beautiful,expansive harbour and is serviced by a great abundance of ferries going all over the place.The harbour waters are safe for navigation and everyone can enjoy it.Destinations range from Many.Neutral Bay,Taronga Zoo [great place] ,local harbour side suburbs and even way up to Parramatta,and hour or so away.Fares are very reasonable and the sights are amazing....Get onto a ferry to anywhere and enjoy a great day out.

Great way to see the city. Ferries give you a different perspective. Ensure it is not rush hour and travel to any of the multiple stops and walk through some lovely waterside tracks or into some interesting suburbs
Best part of our trip . Went there with work and they took us to the zoo via the ferry. It was really great seeing the sights and the ferry was extremely clean. An overall worthwhile experience

Great ferry journey to manly beach. We went to Manly beach for a day trip and took ferry. We used Opal card and it costed us a little more than $7 one-way. It was very easy to use and we'll organised. It was punctual and there was a ferry every half an hour.
Cheap fare and nice view. Took the route to Manly, it was very beautiful view of whole Sydney harbour. Must try once for all travelers.

good scenery. the scenery was great and those ferries do get you where you want to go --- but oh my goodness they stop every 5 minutes at another port -- but a great way to get around -- this is not a tour ferry:)

From Parramatta to City. I usually take the ferry from Parramatta to City, usually on Sundays to make use of the Sunday fun Day ticket ($2:50) Always reliable, on time, comfortable seating, and the ferries are in good shape. Takes just over an hour to reach the city from Parra. The only downside is when the tide is too low, if your're going back to Parramatta you'll have to get off at Rydalmere and catch the bus back to Parramatta.Its always a nice ride, especially when you go past the Olympic Park stop and onwards towards the City.

a great way to avoid Sydney traffic for longer distances. Sydney is improving its transit system, but the population growth has far outpaced infrastructure. New streetcars are being built, but for longer distances away from the CBD, the ferry is the way to go.

Amazing views!. These ferries are a very efficient way to get across the harbor and just sight see the city skyline. The views of the Opera House and Sydney Harbor Bridge are just stunning. On a nice day, sit outside and look at all the boats in the harbor.

Great way to cross the city. Use the ferries instead of buses and trains to move across the harbour. Even when it's raining the views are worth the ride. Fares are inexpensive and there are many ferries to choose from.

Nice views but crowded. Get in time if you wanna catch a ferry on a Sunday morning or a public holiday. I usually take ferry to go to manly from circular Quay and on Sunday it's for free with the opal card which is amazing.

If you like being on water transport, this is the way to go.. Sydnery Ferries are the cheapest way to travel on the Sydney Harbour and beyond, if you have the time.You haven't seen Sydney unless you take a trip on the Ferry of your choice.

Relaxing on the waves. I went from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour on the ferry . Even though it was raining it was calm and in the 20 minutes it took to get to Darling Harbour enjoyed the sights. The Darling Harbour ferry stops off at Luna Park. Good value trip for $7. Definitely the easiest public transport way of getting to Darling Harbour.
Ok. Ferries quite full of passengers. Gets one from a to b. Travels slower than the other catermerans that can be utilised. A little bit pricey.

a quick ride from darling harbour to circular quay. its cheap. the staff are really helpful... the machines are a tad tricky to work to get a ticket. the ferries were clearly marked and it was easy to know where headed.
ferry clean and on time.

Great Value for money to travel around Sydney Harbour and up the Parramatta River. The Sydney Ferries and the Rivercat are a wonderful way to see the sights of Sydney eg Opera House and Harbour Bridge, on the water. Cheaper than cruises. If you are doing a few trips in one day find out the best way to travel, it may be a day pass.Places to visit include Manly, Watson's Bay, Taronga Zoo, Luna Park, Cockatoo Island, Parramatta

Good for Exploring. Sydney Ferries is the best way to travel around the Harbour. Lots of different types available depending on length of stay. Start at Circular Quay. Easy to find your way around. Very busy on Sunday's due to very cheap ticket availability.

Great boats and a very efficient Service. Take a day ticket and have yourself a day on the water. get of Darling Harbour, Luna Park, and really any other stop to have a look around. Hop on and hop off.
Easy way to see harbour. On a nice day, even if it's a bit windy you get a very good panorama of the harbour, and to see the bridge and opera house from the water is epic.

Enjoy the harbour. Grab the ferry to Manly and have lunch. It's a great way to enjoy the harbour at it's best including the beautiful gardens and homes on the way. Don't go when its choppy. It can be a very rocky trip
Circular Quay to Manly. Great trip on a nice day to view the harbour and beat the traffic. Ferry facilities are good, comfortable and good value. Worth the effort to make the trip and enjoy the day.
Manly Ferry. A wonderful way to go to work or just take a ride to see the most wonderful harbour in the world. You can even take a coffee on the way.

Sydney Ferries. The iconic Sydney Ferry is a must do to any visitor to Sydney Harbour . A ticket can be purchased by State Rail that includes a ferry ride after your train trip into the city. Circular Quay station lands you right at the quay and only a very short stroll to the Sydney Opera House .Street performers, bats and restaurants are all around the quay and Ooera House . The ferries travel all around the Harbour and are gauranteed to drop you at many of the famous landmarks that surround the bay .
Excellent way to travel about. We used the ferries quite a lot with our trave!l ticket (Opus or Opal) used for the bus and ferries.Excellent timings
Catch the ferry to Manly or to the Zoo. Ferry = water bus. The arteria of life. Start at Circular Quay, pick a destination - and then arrival. Sit on the sun deck, sit below, but take the trip

Visit to Manley Beach. We used this ferry service to go to Manley Beach which takes approximately half-an hour. Lovely view of Sydney Harbour, the Opera House and Bridge. The ferry is not expensive and you can use an Opal card

Ordinary service but on the weekend there is no point doing it at all. . I use these services regularly. It's a reliable service during week days with free WIFI on board which is always a bonus especially for first time travellers. On the weekends I wouldn't recommended it and that is only because on many occasion we tried to get on the ferry to get to circular quay and all the ferries coming from Parramatta are always full so you could be waiting for hours until you board on one. Last time we went towards Parramatta exit in Homebush to go back to Circular quay because that was only option if you want to get to the circular Quay. The ferries itself are old but nice and clean but I feel they are bit expensive especially if you are traveling with kids. The staff are informative and helpful if you require assistance, while you are on board I would suggest stopping by in Cockatoo island.
All right. Too much crowd on ferries when we were there in Sydney. But still a convenience if you are around and could not find any other transport mean

Slow but fun to go in. The ferry took forever to reach one place to another but the whole experience was worth it especially peering out to sea, I loved the experience, and I hope to go on another ferry in the future. It's a great time waster. But be warned if your tryin to urgently get to another place. Don't take the ferrie
Circular Quay to Manly ferry ride. It is a pleasant trip. Can sit outside if you don't mind the weather. Can get a bit choppy out by the heads of the harbour.
Easy to use. Once we had found the ferry stop at Darling Harbour it was a good way to move around the harbour sights without walking everywhere. Good signage with departure times accurate.

Great method of transportation! . We took the ferry to Taronga Zoo and then went back to Circular Quay to catch a ferry to Manly. One evening, we went for a ride to the last station along the river. The rush hour crowds were sparser and at the end of the trip we had the whole boat to ourselves. The views were beautiful at night but would be spectacular in daylight! (we ran out of time...) Transit is a max of $15 per day and on Sundays it goes down to $2.50. What a deal! You can go anywhere and the system is very easy to use. Staff is also very helpful.

Great resource!. How lucky we are to enjoy the great resource of the ferries from Circular Key. We always do a trip, for leisure and pleasure with the destination proportionate to the time available.Good fun!

Efficient, reasonably priced and essential. . The ferries are as much a part of Sydney as red buses or the Tubes are a part of London. Sydney would not function without these workhorses buzzing back and forth and joining up all parts of the ria that is The Harbour. If you get an Opal card you can travel on as many ferries (and buses and trains) as you like for a maximum of $15 a day which is great value if you take several trips. We allowed ourselves 2 days of exploring the various stopping off points for the ferries and got a really good idea of the layout of The Harbour (s).
Cheap harbour tour. Great way to see the local landmarks from the water. Tickets are cheap, even for the trip from Watson Bay (about 15-20 minutes).

Cheap harbour cruising !. Took ferry to Cockatoo Island as part of a day trip around Sydney using Seniors day trip ticket ...$2.50 for 24 hours using any Sydney Transport including Bus , Train , Light rail , Metro and Ferries , excellent value

Fabulous way to see and get around. Super. Great views of harbour bridge and opera house. Went from Pyrmont to Circular Quays - the central transport hub. Easy from there to hop on a train. Will use it on next trip to go to Luna Park.
Very efficient. Good value, frequent and bang on time. We used it twice and have no complaints at all. There was loads of room for the many people that use the service every day.
A Great Way to Travel. An excellent fast service from Watsons Bay. Beautiful way to return to Circular Quay having been dropped at Watsons Bay earlier in the day.
Ferry to the zoo. Sydney has a great ferry system in place. It's a very easy and inexpensive way to travel. We took the ferry to the zoo enjoyed the beautiful ride.

Catching Sydney Ferries. I often use the Ferries in Sydney and find them easy to access. It is such a relaxing way to get around. I would normally catch the Rydalmere to Darling Harbour or to Circular Quay, but often catch a Ferry across to Manly and just relax on the foreshore or have a nice lunch in one of the many restaurants. There are also ferries to Watson's Bay, Balmain, Taronga Zoo and quite a few others. Just being on the harbour is like being on holidays. Payment is made at the moment either by purchasing tickets at the kiosk or on the ferry, but seniors must buy online or just use an adult ticket. Love doing Sydney Ferries jubeesydney
Love Sydney ferries. Get yourself an opal card and hop on and off Sydney ferries, Buses and trains. The Sydney ferries are a fantastic way to see the beautiful Sydney harbour.
trip to Manly beach. used this ferry to visit Manly beach and found its almost used like a bus service to visit other parts of the harbour and general bay area.

Sydney harbour on a budget. No need for expensive tours , the ferry services are cheap and will take you all over the harbour area to beautiful beaches and pleasant locations to wine and dine or walks along the cliffs with wonderful scenic views You can have long days out for very few dollars , also on a hot day the ferry is a great way to cool down , but can be crowded on week days at rush hour times .
Sydney Hourbour to Paramatta. Simply magnificent! staff is so dedicated and friendly. I love to take the ferry, thank you Sydney for this initiative .

How to see the nooks and crannies of Sydney Harbour. There are MANY ferry trips available on Sydney Harbour, most of which start and finish at Circular Quay.
