They are the best, and cheapest, way to get a glimpse of how many Sydney homes have "dress circle" positions around The Harbour. Start with the Manly Ferry, then the Parramatta Rivercat, then perhaps Watsons Bay. Not to be missed!!

no need to pay big bucks. what a great way to see Sydney - no need to pay big bucks for a cruise! of course it doesn't come with any commentary - but the sights are lovely and it's exciting whilst not breaking the banks. easy to understand time tables and maps as well

Wheelchair users - welcome. I supported a young woman who always uses a wheelchair. The ferry we caught travelled down the Parramatta River, into Darling Harbour, under the Harbour Bridge and into CIrcular Quay. The ferry is a 'Rivercat', a wide catamaran with windows on both sides so you have views all around you - spectacular. There were easily accessible spaces for the wheelchair and the occupant could see out both sides. The staff were fantastic and assisted at both ends of the journey which certainly took the strain off my back. They made us both feel very welcome. We could have gone up and down the river and around the beautiful harbour all day.

travelling aroud Sydney water ways. you can travel to so many places on the ferries ... travelling on sunday is a good option using the opal card as it doesn't matter how many times you tap on or off once you reach $2.50 the rest of your travel is free, you can see so much from the ferry, whether you just cruise the water way to view the sceenary or you hop on & off at various locations ... it is a must to do while in Sydney

Wheelchair traveller. Ferries are an ideal mode of transport for people using wheelchairs. The ramp across to the ferry from the pier is easy to use. There are sometimes steel lips of about 5cm at the doors to get over but this is easy enough. The slop up from the pier to the concourse at Circular Quay is steep but doable.I love using ferries on Sydney Harbour, particularly on a sunny day. Beautiful. The crew are always friendly and helpful.My only gripe is the electronic boards on the wharf . Yesterday, there was a crowd and the board said our ferry left from the right side of the pier so we positioned ourselves there. At the last minute the board said the ferry would leave from the left side so there was a crush of people all scrambling to get across . We ended up being one of the last to board with few seats left.

A must for tourists (and locals). Our ferries provide a great way to economically have a look at Sydney. We wanted our o/seas visitors to have a quick look at Sydney Harbour. So we took a ferry to Cockatoo Island where we had a stroll and refreshments. A great way to spend an hour or two.
Great way to get around and see the Harbour too. Usually on time and a great way to get around. Sit outside to get the best experience otherwise it's just like being on a bus
LOVE. I love Sydney ferries. Travelling by ferry is definitely the best form of public transport. Beautiful view, friendly and helpful employees, and fresh air!

The only way to travel in Inner Sydney. We went up to Sydney for a family weekend and stayed in the city. We decided to be real tourists an use all the public transport which I can say was great. We stayed at Darling Harbour (city side) . To get to the ferries we had a 5 min walk to Town Hall Station to catch a train to Circular Quay. You come out of a tunnel and the Opera House is right there its so lovely! TIP- if you buy an OPAL card your train travel can be paid using this and also your ferry trip (it is a marginally cheaper than just buyng a ferry trip) but the real bonus is once you have spent $15 all your travel for the rest of he day is free. A ferry trip to Manly return was just over $14 for an adult (and $11 tot he zoo) so all the rest of the travel that day was free. Quite a saving and much more convenient just tapping on and off as we went. The trip on the ferry on the harbour is so efficient, they run on time and the view is amazing. The only way to travel.
Great way to get around. The Sydney ferries are excellent you can catch them to pretty much anywhere you need to go and they are great value for money
Fun and Efficient. If you want to go anywhere in the Sydney area, you can take a ferry. All originate from Circular Quay.

Parramatta Rivercat. Get out of Circular Quay and on to the Rivercat - great things to see and do in Parramatta, plus fantastic food choices. Take the 'Cat up River, and stroll the Riverwalk to the information center - they are gorgeous there and proud of their city and will provide maps and many suggestions of things to do. Do not miss Old Government House - for the history and the special exhibits and the cafe and the gardens. It was a country town when I visited 15 years ago, but this week I found a new city, lovely people and the boat trip in itself is worthwhile - you can see so much, or read a book or.....

Good connection. Took the ferry to Darling Harbour, it was busy the day we travelled but was interesting to see some of the sights around the harbour before we docked at Darling Harbour. Pleasant ride aboard a clean ferry considering the amount of people using it.
Cheap way to see the harbor, bridge and Opera House from the water.. We took the ferry over to Manly Beach. It's fairly cheap and convenient to catch from the Circular Quay

So easy to navigate. . I loved travelling around the harbour areas on the ferries. Bought an Opal travel card online before arriving in Sydney, it makes it easy to use public transport, and after 8 trips in a week, fares are free. There's electronic boards at all ferry stops that tell you when and where the ferries are going. Trips to Taronga and Manly on the ferry were easy too. I wish we had them here in Perth. Ferry staff are great.

Adore theferries. What a great way to commute. Wish I lived here so this could be the way I'd travel 365 days a year.Never tire of the sights, day or night, from the deck of a ferry.Sit outside and up the top for the best views.It's hard to understand the system of how many rides a week until you travel free, so have a local explain that to you.Wish I had my 6 year old nephew with me, he would love this mode of travel and the variety of ferry craft.
Great way to enjoy the Harbour. Grab yourself an opal travel card and explore sydney using the ferries. Its a cheap, fast and magnificent way to see the amazing sights of Sydney.
Love em....ride ride ride!!. Get an Opal card, load it up and go everywhere that way when you can. See OZ from the H2O. Just can't say enough about this experience!

Hang-on, these really do take off!. Don't forget your Opal Card and to Swipe-On/Off at the appropriate points; if not sure, just ask as it is better than a Fine! Unless you are a regular, recommend sitting down as when these do leave a wharf, they don't muck around; crikey, they are fast!

They take you to so many corners of the vast Harbour. The Sydney ferries may not have the iconic status of the Opera House or the Bridge but they do allow locals & visitors alike to move around the vast Sydney Harbour & surrounding areas. So many places & destinations you could easily spend a weeks holiday visiting the many many residential, commercial, military & places of interest which surround the harbour. Probably worth buying an Opal Card for best value (in advance if possible). Excellent rates for Seniors whom the Ausies seem to hold at a higher level of respect than many European countries.

Opal card is the way to go!. Folks, use that Opal card to get around Sydney. The ferries, buses and rails all use the Opal card, which makes travel easy and convenient. Pick one up at the airport on your way into the city and you are set. $20 will get you through most of your travels throughout the city in a week.

On time! Such a great service! . Used an Opal card which was easy to set up.. Used the Ferry service daily .. Went everywhere- zoo, Luna park, darling harbour, all from circular quay .. Was on time an polite staff

Beautiful and Relaxing. If you're a visitor, you can't leave Sydney without experiencing the Sydney Ferries. We spent an entire afternoon just taking in the beautiful scenery and soaking in the sun on the upper deck. If you have a Pensioner Opal Card, unlimited ferry rides are included in your $2.50 daily maximum charge so it's an amazing bargain. On our next trip we're looking forward to getting off at different spots and exploring. The Ferries were on time, the drivers were helpful and the signeage and schedules were easy to understand.

Best Value Views in Sydney. Sydney Ferries can not be beaten for taking in the sights of the magnificent harbour and its surrounding foreshore. The Ferries travel to all parts of the harbour for reasonable prices. The trip to Manly is an obvious must but even the quick trips to Neutral Bay or Mosman give you plenty to take in.The river cat to Parramatta is 1 and1/2 hours but well worth it. A train back is speedier if 3 hours round trip is too daunting. The ferries are the relaxing way to go. Facilities such as indicator boards,seating and ticketing have all been improved in recent times..
Convieniebt. Easy to get where we were going. A good way to see the views from the water without spending too much money.

We took the ferry to Manly Beach. Got some great pictures of the Opera House and the Sydney bridge. We didn't know enough to snag outside seats when we first got on so had to squeeze out to get photos - it was no problem. On the way back we did get good seats on the Opera House side.

Sydney has the lock on public transport. The ferries are fantastic. We took the Manley ferry one day, and the Parramatta ferry up the river another. Both were great experiences. The costs are low, the service efficient and timely, and the Opal card made the whole thing a snap. Lots of shopping, dining, sights, within walking distance of ferry stops, and the ride across the harbor and under the harbor bridge is a terrific experience
Olympic Park. We travelled to Olympic Park by ferry and a great way to see more of Sydney and we did on a Sunday which was a bonus as on $2.50 .

Wonderful way to see the city.... On a recent weekend, I took my family into circular quay and we caught the ferry to Watsons Bay. A great scenic ride and plenty of opportunity to see the harbour and its sights.Had a wonderful lunch at Doyle's right on the beach, which has to be one of he best high quality restaurants where the sand is literally a reach away.We then headed across to Manly for some afternoon drinks and for the kids to play on the beach. Decided to stay a little longer and have lunch on the Corso at Manly and then headed back into the city early evening with the jet at ferry from Manly to circular quay.A thoroughly enjoyable way to spend the day and a much easier way to get around than battling on Sydney's bogged down streets.

Classic and best way to see Sydney. Like fine wine, the Sydney ferries get better with age. Make sure you ride the old, original yellow and green ferries for the true experience. Sitting outside allows for great views around the harbour.

A different point of view!. You cannot say you have seen Sydney at its best until you have travelled by Sydney ferries. First, it is a very fast and convenient way to reach the other side of the city and its neighborhood!!! Second, you can enjoy some of the best views ever. In fact, whilst you are travelling you can take wonderful photos of the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House, from a very special point of view!!!

Most Picturesque Transport. The Sydney ferries are the best way to get around to see the icons of Sydney's most photogenic urban skyline. Great transport to any of the waterfront locations and most refreshing to be out on the water

The only reason I'd live in Sydney (unless I had a 7 figure annual income). They're old and frequently smell of diesel. I'm sure they get quite wet and treacherous in severe weather, however they are a wonderfully relaxing way got get around the harbour-side bits of Sydney. Something about being out on the water with a delicious sea breeze makes for a most cathartic experience at any time. I'll never afford the amazing real estate I get to sail past but I can still enjoy the view for public transport prices... Who needs to pay for a Harbour Cruise?

There will be Sydney ferries in Heaven.. I make i a point of ferrying nywhere and everywhere in Sydney just for the sheer buzz. Even when its raining the views are to die for and quayside activity is fascinating. Seniors get a fabulously cheap deal. Take a cut lunch every day and grow old on the water!
$2.50 all day on a Sunday. As a family we took the Manly ferry + train + bus. Only cost $2.50 each. Fantastic value for money and it wasn't too crowded either.

Great system . Was a in Sydney for a weekend with my wife and we wanted to have a look around. Was amazed at the ferry system on the river that allowed us to easily experience all areas of the city.Better, it linked to all other transport options as well. Really added to our experience. Ale sure you use the prepaid opal cards - so easy.

Fantastic views. Two ferries you must ride.
F2 line to Taronga Zoo and back.
F1 to Manly.
Either ferry provides fantastic sunset views. Plan your ride so you will be returning as the sun sets.
Manly ferry. Plan to hop off and spend a couple of hours in Manly. Nice urban town and beach scene.

Ferrying the Sydney Harbour. We took the ferries from Circular Quay to Manly Beach and to the Taronga Zoo. We were able to use our Opal Cards which we purchased at the airport upon arrival. Opal Cards are good for the ferries, trains and buses. The ferries are clean, efficient and right on time! Traveling by ferry is relaxing and provides for fabulous views of the city and scenic harbour bays and beaches.
Ferries. ..not fairies . These were easy to get to, a bit busy to board but not terrible, fast rides thru the harbor but man so awesome

Got me where I wanted to go!. Both ferries I caught were on time and they got me where I wanted to go. And the staff had quite good knowledge of the area and when they could not answer a question they were happy to Google it!
Fast and efficient. Probably the best part of the ferry I took (Circular Quay to Manly Beach) was the view of the Opera House and the bridge.
Ferry spectacular. The only way to see Sydney from the water is by ferry and what a way to view this magnificent city via ferry for a very cheap and affordable price.

Best way to get around Sydney and area.. On our recent trip to Australia we spent 2 weeks in the Sydney area. We opted to purchase OPAL cards for the transit system. Once you reach $60 AUD per week, Monday to Sunday, the rest of the week is free. This card allowed travel on all buses, trains and ferries on the system. It also allowed for card use on the main connector rail lines that travel north, west and south of the city some distance. The ferries were great to move around the harbour, up to Parramatta on over to Manley Beach. Extensive transit system that eliminated the need for a rental car and all the problems associated with travelling in the city.

Sydney Ferries - a must do for all visitors. No trip to Sydney would be complete without a relaxing trip on the harbour on one of the many ferries that operate there. My wife and I took a ferry from Circular Quay to Mosman Bay on this trip and went for a relaxing stroll around the water's edge to rejoin a later ferry at the Old Cremorne Ferry wharf. The trips offer great views of the Sydney skyline and the harbour and are comfortable and inexpensive to travel on.

Harbour trip. Enjoyable trip,comfortable seating easy access both on and off ferry.short walk to Manly beach .Regular service from Cicular Quay and return.Good overall view of Harbour Pick up a harbour map to pinpoint landmarks.

great way to see all parts of sydney. ferries easy to use and get a beautiful view of the harbor, the north and south heads and so much easier to get to places that by car. easy experience can tap on tap off with the opal card and just breath in that salt air or sit inside and and view from the large windows. Can take you over to Manly or watsons bay or some of the other beaches for a great beach day or over for a nice sea food dinner on the water and view the harbor at night. many many options using the ferries.
Ferries to Manly. Nice expérience to be done with the Opal card ,very easy to visit Sydney with bus and ferries.Great place to walk and enjoy a brunch.
Terrific Transportation!. What fun and easy to use! We purchased an Opal card and enjoyed going to places around Sydney. Great and inexpensive

Great way to see the Bay. We took the ferry to Manly Beach. Great views of the opera house, lighthouse and the rock shoulder guarding the entrance to the bay. Wading off Manley beach great fun for the kids!
High Speed Ferry. Great value and standard of interior. We went to Manly twice and found the journey quick and trouble free...And it only takes 20 minutes !!

Great way to see stdney. On Sunday's there's a max charge on using public transport in the city - which makes a reasonably priced way of moving around the city an even better excuse to get out.
Ferries are always exciting for kids so great for kids to be kept happy while the grown ups look at the sights!

Best cruise on the harbour. What a great way to get around the city. The cheapest boat cruise on the harbour too! Take the Circular Quay to Manly for a longer trip past the harbour headlands to the lovely beach at Manly.

Good experience for kids. Lady at the ticket booth was rude. Rates were $30 return for 2 adults 2 children which was cheap considering the view and site seeing of Sydney harbor and surrounds. Crew were professional and safety conscious.

Wonderful sydney ferries ever inspiring. Sydney harbour ferries are without doubt the most magnificent ferry network in the world. I have used them so many many times over 26 years and watched them evolve to the exceptional standards of today. They are absolutely heavenly. My late mother and I travelled widely and I was recently back in my beloved Sydney. The ferries are the best gem of Sydney and often overlooked by tourists especially on short stay cruises. I cannot praise the ferries highly enough and they will always hold a very special place in my heart.

For Cockatoo Island. You can visit For Cockatoo Island. Cockatoo Island is a UNESCO world-heritage-listed island in the middle of beautiful Sydney Harbour. Hop on a Sydney ferry and explore the island for the day or stay overnight in the campground or holiday houses.Until 05 June 2016 you can also visit important parts of the Biennale of Sydney in the island.

A great way to travel. Friendly well maintained efficient on time and reasonable price - all the thing we are not so used to in the UK .....Using the ferries is a great way to see the city and its surrounding suburbs/ beaches and hot spots get an opal travel card it's even easier and cheaper to get around

Ferries, The Same All Over The World. As a tourist, you would be crazy not to take the opportunity to travel across the magnificent Sydney Harbour on a Sydney ferry. We chose a long trip to Manly on a beautiful Sunday morning, returning in the afternoon. You stand in a long line, get pushed when the gates open for boarding as people behind think they will miss the boat. The views are second to none, but a ferry is a ferry!

Best Way To Get Around. We got an Opal card which can be used on Ferries, Buses and Trains in Sydney. For a visitor the ferries are great, a good way to get where you are going and a cheap tour of the harbour while you get there.

Best transportation . We didn't want to commit to a tour of the harbor and read that the ferry rides give you just as much site seeing. Excellent suggestion, we went to Luna Park and also to Darling Harbor. Boats are included in the Opal card system, so very convenient.

Relaxing and scenic rides. We used the ferry from Circular Quay to go over to Watson's Bay. We purchased an Opal card to use on the ferry and train system around Sydney. It was very convenient and made travel less of a hassle. On the trip to Watson's Bay you go past the bridge and Opera House and get excellent views of the city. I recommend this mode of transportation to sight see and to get away from Sydney for a different perspective.

Great Views from Here. The ferry is a great way to see the Harbour. It was a nice trip over to Manly Beach and no problem getting on the Ferry. Great view of the Opera House and Bridge from the Ferry.

best and cheapest way to enjoy one of the most beautiful harbours in the world. Go for it, ride on the sydney ferries to every stop and enjoy the beautiful scenic harbour! You would pay a lot more for the private cruises with some commentary thrown in.Visit the Cookatoo island, Balmain, Manly, Watsons Bay, even all the way to Mosman Zoo. Let your imagination run wild and your adventure spirit explore
Great service, not cheap. The Sydney ferries offer a great service running regularly throughout long days. Definitely the best way to see the harbour!

Great travel. Took several ferries to Manley, opera house, Luna park etc.A cheap way of travelling but you see so much. The times are good as they are very frequent. In my opinion they are very reasonably priced and a must for anybody visiting Sydney.

Best In The World!. Cheap, quick, clean, timely... I can't say enough good things about these ferries. Definitely the best way to see Sydney. We enjoyed the government ferries and found them to be very cost effective. We avoided the private, commercial ferries.

Opal card. Found the transport easy to use and was able to switch between ferries ,bus and trains as we went to Parramatta ,Manly and BondiDefinitely need an Opal card to get around but found a lot of the top up machines for the Opal cards not working especially on the wharves .was hard for international visitors as we had to help many to work out how to use the machines and was frustrating As when you are on a wharf trying to top up in order to have enough on the card to be able to get off the ferry
Great way to get arounf. There are many ferries available and they take you all over the area. Inexpensive way to get from point a to point b without the traffic
Famous Ferries from hsitories pages. A must to travel on in Sydney Harbour. Many varied trips and cruises available. Iconic Sydney Harbour. Via Circular Quay is best place to board.

A way of Life. The ferry service is consistent and easy to use. Just what you would expect from a world class city with a harbor. There is hop on hop off ferry or just to one destination ferries. Whatever you choose, its all good.
Look up when you cross the bridge from under. Can't miss this ride. It's fun to see the Harbor from a ferry. When you pass the bridge from under, just look up!
Works like clockwork. Regular, reasonably priced with great views and comfortable. Used by tourists and locals so can't get busy at peak times.
Buy an Opal. You can use your Opal transport card on the ferries, loads to choose from and especially cheap on a Sunday. Efficient, clean and fast. Great views
Delightful. Great staff, very organised and clean. Love the sea breeze and the peace of the sea. I love catching Sydney ferries.

Perfect for Sydney. A must for Sydney.
Sydney is well known for its beautiful harbour and the Sydney Ferries are a cheap way to see the best harbour in the world.
If you're in Sydney this is a must. Especially if you are going to Manly.
Efficient. On time, efficient, comfortable and clean. The Ferries are a great way to get from point A to B with the least amount fuss.

Took it to the zoo:). Was a great ride! We took the ferry to and from the zoo:) Very courteous staff! Even a trip to the zoo made for a very scenic view of the sydney harbour bridge and opera house, felt like a short tour in the simple passage:) thank you!

The lids love it during summer!. Every summer i stay with the kids in town- they love the hotel experience. Further we do the usual ferry trips from Circular Quay to Milsons Point via Darling Harbour and back. The kids love it, its a reasonable and cheap trip for the kids and recommend it when in town with the family!
Great views. A good way to get around and see the opera house and harbour bridge from the water. We got a ferry to Manly and another one to Darling harbour. Really efficient and on time

Best way to see Sydney. I lived in Sydney for a long time. A ferry trip is a great way to see Sydney. Do try to get on the water - it is Sydney at it's finest. Grab a manly ferry. Go to Doyle's at Watson's bay for some fish and chips by ferry. Cruise up the Parramatta River and explore some history in Parramatta. JumpOn a little inner harbour, green and gold ferry to Cremorne or north Sydney. You will not be disappointed. Sunny day, ferry ride and a meal by the water - quintessentially Sydney!

Best way to get a feel for Sydney. We love these ferries but the crossing to Manley is definitely our favourite; it takes about 30 minutes without stopping anywhere on route and can get a little choppy when passing the heads (the entrance from the ocean into the harbour) but this all adds to the excitement. The ferries give you a good feel for the geography of the harbour and usually the quickest way to get from one area to another.

Great way to get around and see things. I highly recommend taking the ferry, even if you just do it to get to see the perspective of Sydney from the water. A trip right up to Paramatta is great. We took the public ferry to the zoo - best day to do this is a Sunday as it only costs $2.50 in total to travel on any transport for the day.
Ferry Nice! . Great value using Opal card and it's the best way to make the most of checking out Sydney Harbour and other places like Manly. Sit back, relax and take some awesome photos!

Bit dirty I might say, but great service. Buy an OPAL card before you go. If you don't get on at a major stop, OPAL cards are not available.Many travellers were talking to each other to try and figure out how to pay for their trips.... plan before you go. I believe they are available at some corner stores and online or at major ferry stops.There were toilets on all ferries we went on, so that is helpful with the kids.... BUT the ferries in general were quite old and dirty.The ferries in Brisbane are pristine by comparison, but I suppose they aren't as old as the Sydney ones.The service is timely and can really get you around Sydney.
Good way of enjoying Sydney. There are a lot of possibilities to go to diffrent places. Is a good way of watching the Sydney and its attractions from the sea. They are unexpensive.

Best Way to see the Harbour. No matter which ferry you choose, depending on length of time available, a ferry trip is the best way to see Sydney's beautiful harbour.All ferries leave from Circular Quay and give perfect viewing of the famous Opera House and Harbour Bridge - stunning on a sunny day.A Manly ferry crosses the heads, and you can swim in the surf or still water, walk the Corso, choose between cafe style lunches or fish and chips on the beach.A Watsons Bay ferry takes you to the Gap, where you can lunch at famous Doyles Seafood Restaurant, or Nautico a Greek restaurant, where we enjoyed Greek pastries and top coffee, just up the hill from the ferry wharf.A Taronga Zoo ferry takes you to our famous zoo - catch the chair lift up and walk via the animals back to the ferry.A Mosman ferry goes into Mosman Bay, scene of the first Sydney whaling station, now home to splendid yachts of all shapes and sizes.A Neutral Bay ferry sails past the Royal Sydney Yacht Squadron, see the whales jaw on the grassy lawn. A Darling Harbour ferry goes past the new Berangaroo waterfront with modernised wharves and old 3 mastered wooden ships.Or go up to river on a river cat, past Cockatoo Island, have lunch and return later.Any or all of these trips I can highly recommend - sit back relax and enjoy the harbour.All tickets available at Circular Quay, with timetables and length of ferry trips available.

The ferries are a Sydney icon, not to be missed!. After eating at Circular Quay, we decided against walking back to Darling Harbour. Waiting for us was a ferry. For a cheap fare we had an unforgettable ride past the Opera House towards and then under the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Great for taking photos!
Manly no worries. The Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and return was an enjoyable afternoon trip using convenient Opal Card.
Trip to Manly. Brilliant way to get there. Used Opal card, very fast and efficient would definitely use this service again
New experience. The best way to see the harbour, I walked from Darlinghurst to rose bay and went to darling harbour, great view at about $5.00

Very nice 30 minute ride to Manley Beach.. If you want some time to relax and take great pictures, take the ferry to Manley Beach. It is about a 30 minutes ride across the bay to Manley. Go to the front or stern to have a better view. have fun!!!

Excellent Service, Reasonable Pricing. Took the ferry from Circular Quay to Parramatta. Approximately 2 hour run up the Parramatta River with several stops. Nice way to obtain a different view of Sydney and suburbs. Had lunch on Parramatta's lovely Church Street and retruned to Sidney by the train. Both services accomodate the easy to use Opal card for payment.The combo ferry and train are a relaxing way to see more of the area.
Cruise to Darling Harbour. We took a tour from Sydney CBS to Blue Mountain on 28 March 2016 & back to Sydney via cruise to Darling Harbour. Enjoyed to see the Opera House from the deck.

Great way to travel around Sydney. Sydney Ferries are a great way to travel around Sydney. So easy to travel from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay, Manly, Taronga Zoo, Luna Park etc. A cheap, enjoyable way to get around.
A lovely way to travel. The ferries are a fantastic and relaxing way to get around. No traffic jams, what's not to like. Reasonable price too.

Sure beats buses and trains!,. From Parramatta out to Manly, Sydney ferries are a great way to travel to see this amazing city. Relatively inexpensive and the perfect mode of transport to take advantage of the many photo opportunities on offer!
fast and save . you can get tickets before entering or if you have OPAL card. you do not need to queue up to buy tickets at all! make sure to ask which gate goes to the destination you want to go to!

Take a ferry accross to Mainly. Sydney Ferries are a great way to travel around Sydney. We would recommend catching a ferry across to Mainly to spend the whole day. Lots to do for the whole family. Beach, shopping and restaurants a pleny. You will enjoy the day!

Best transport around this city. Fast and efficient transport around the city, several trips from circular key to manly, darling harbour and found boats to be always available. Best scenery that you can sit back and enjoy on your trip.

Trips on the Ferries. My daughter and I loved using the ferries on Sydney Harbour. With the use of the Opal card this made this very easy and econmical. The ferries we used were to Taronga Zoo, Manly, Watson's Bay, Parramatta and around to Darling Harbour from Circular Quay and over to Luna Park. These ferries are comfortable and timetables are very convenient. The staff at the ticket offices are very helpful. A great way to get around Sydney.

Great way to add more angles to your photo galleries. The city ferries are an inexpensive way to get to some great locations that provide unique angles for those extra shots you don't want to miss. They are prompt, clean and reliable, and can take you to other spots you might miss if you just visit Circular Quay. If you take the ferry to Darling Harbour, you get another beautiful harbour to visit (best to see lit up at night). The ferry drops you off right at the Maritime Museum at Darling Harbour and you should plan on spending a couple of hours walking around this additional up and coming development area in Sydney. For another one of a kind experience, you could check out a movie at the world's largest IMAX screen, located right in Darling Harbour. And after a meal in a great restaurant in this location, you can jump right back on the ferry to take you back to Circular Quay!
Great Transportation. Loved seeing the harbor from the ferry, especially at night! Great inexpensive way to see more of Sydney.
Fantastic. What a fantastic way of getting around. Most ferries go very regularly and I think they all go to Circular quay
Manly ferry. Took a ferry to Manly and found the experience great.They were on time and seemed very professional.
MUST DO. This is a great way to see Sydney harbour at a very cheap price as the ferries go to many locations night and day and you can get on and off all over the wonderful harbour.

quick and relatively cheap. quick inexspensive way to get to and from sydney to all the different bays around cost 8 dollars one way from manley back to circular quey and took about 15 minutes right up the mouth of sydney harbour

Fun and small cost to experience efficient and great trips. Stunning views with many services in all directions. You Need to buy an Opal Card, electronically loaded to gain even better value, and enjoy the most amazingly beautiful views in all directions, of this stunning Harbour. You can easily get sunburnt, or cool if the wind is high, but enjoy in rain storms or sunshine!

Prompt and reliable . Catching a Sydney Ferry was so easy and well priced. Promptly leaving on time, you can rely on their regularity. Friendly staff. Plenty of seating. A great way to view the amazing sights of Sydney or purely for transportation.
Awesome. The city fairies are great way to see the city. Prices are very reasonable around $6 one way. A return trip to circular Quay will give you an unbelievable view of the Opera House.
Time your ride so you get into Darling/Sydney Harbour at Twilight.... ...then you can watch the sun set over the Sydney skyline or over its iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge or Sydney Opera House.

Parramatta River Cat. Great way to get to Parramatta from the city. We stay close to Circular Quay so it's an easy walk for us down to the harbour. Great service on the River Cat & very friendly crew.

Wonderful Experience. It was a nice sunny day, we wanted to go to Manly Beach, so we bought the ticket from a seven eleven and went to the catch the ferry. It arrived on time and left on time. It was a nice ride across the harbor. I sat on the inside, then found a seat outside, it a was nice and smooth ride across. I enjoyed the sun and the light winds. They sold food and drinks on the ferry, they were okay. The bathrooms were fairly decent. I enjoyed the ride.

Best Thing in Sydney. There's no better way to see Syney Harbour and no trip is complete without getting on a ferry. Head to Manly ot Balmain, Taronga Zoo or Watsons Bay or up river somewhere - it doesn't matter. Just get on and open your tired lod mid to the fresh air and ravishing beauty of the old tart, Sydney Harbour. She never disappoints!
The Best.. Best way to get your head around Sydney. Get an 'O pal' card and that covers you for all your transport except certain ferries.

different stopping places to Manly ferries. As with all the modern ferries, these are very comfortable and clean, always on time and excellent for sightseeing. They go a different route to Manly and give a different perspective to the area. They also stop on both sides of darling harbour instead of manly's one.

Ferries upon ferries. Being a water-locked city, there are plenty of ferries to take. The costs are around $20 per person and take you just about anywhere you want to go. Service is pretty consistent with at least 2 per hour on most lines. There are a number of private options as well if you want to do a hop-on, hop-off experience. The boats themselves are not super fancy, but there are snacks and drinks on board most boards in case you forget to bring your own.

Excellent connection to Manly and other destinations. The ferries operate on an half hour badis which is very convenient and no long waiting time. Can recommend to every tourist, visitor to Sydney. Safe and with excellent view to Sydney Skylines, opera house and other attractions.

Great & Cheap way to see the sights. Best way to travel in Sydney...get yourself an Opal Card!! Then just take all the ferries around...you see the most beautiful sites of the Sydney Bridge and Opera House!! It is the cheapest way to see them if you are on a budget!

Amazing commute to work!. This beats sitting in traffic every morning, what a fantastic And inexpensive way to get about whilst in Sydney. Ferries are on time, clean and plentiful, a really great way to enjoy a boat ride, see some amazing scenery and, visit some fantastic places.

Convenient way to explore harbours!. The ferrie from rocks to north shore sydney or to manly is just fantastic! You can see the harbour bridge from different perspectives and enjoy the view of opera house from near and far!

Fun way to check out the scenery. Quick easy way to get around and see the sights. $2.50 all day with Opal card on Sunday's. A lot of locals. We took the ferry to rose bay, saw sea planes taking off and landing and loads of sailors including sailing schools.

Ferry from Parramatta to Circular Quay. Taking ferry from Parramatta to Circular Quay is a lovely experience. You will have a view of various kinds: serene lake with beautiful trees alongside, beautiful houses facing the sea, pretty boats, an island that used to be a base for ship manufacturing, darling harbour. And, the most exciting thing is when the ferry goes under the harbour bridge. Then the opera house will greet you elegantly.
Great service . Great way to see Sydney harbour without spending a bomb. Visit Watsons bay, grab some seafood and then head back to circular quay.

Pay with your Opal card!. We had been using public transport all day and decided to go on the ferries too. With a cap for the Opal of $15 a day, we basically had unlimited travel on the ferries. First we went to Manly, then back to Circular Quay, then in their her direction to Chiswick. A great way to see Sydney ons boat without paying too much!
Handy dandy. This is a great service and it's easy peasy to use. We have used it to head to Manly for the day and to the Taronga zoo. It's also such a lovey way to see the harbour.

Like clockwork!. We were very impressed with the frequency and reliability of service, especially how the buses always seemed ready as each ferry pulled in to wherever we went, and vice versa. We loved the way the ferries all thread in and out of each other and the occasional huge cruise ship!

This costs peanuts for the best tourist experience in Sydney.. Cruise the fabulous harbour all day viewing / photographing / stopping at many of Sydneys iconic highlights. You could spend one, two (even three days if you include the trip to Partamatta ) The bridge, Opera house, Government House. Pinchgut, Double Bay, Darling Harbour, Cockatoo Island, Watsons Bay, the Zoo.... on a beautiful day it's all quite amazing. Living on the Northern beaches my favourite way into town.... avoiding the exorbitant parking costs........ park at Old Cremorne ( free street parking, ferry stop 5 minutes ) or take a beautiful 20 minute scenic water side walk around to Cremorne Point itself and it's only 5 minutes across to Circular quay..... then nearly everything you could want to see is within walking or short bus. distance..........enjoy magical Sydney and it's harbour. If your'e an Australian senior and have an Opal card all this for $2.50.00 a day.

Excellent way to see Sydney and get around.. Highly recommend the ferries and the ferry system. Can't think of a better way to see Sydney, the Zoo, Manly and all the other sites. As we pulled away from the dock at Manly, a pod of dolphins was playing a very short distance away. The ferry faced the pod, then stopped engines, and the pod played all around the vessel for about 15 minutes. Great extra treat!

A ticket to ride.. Wether it's to Manly to taronga zoo darling harbour the sydney ferries are an excellent way to get around. With perfect views of sydney harbour and frequent on time sailings this is a good efficency way to travel.
Just hop on. I love taking the kids (and me!) on these easy to pay easy on and easy off a clean, cheap, fast and effective way to get around
Loved It. Great relaxing ferry trip across the harbour. Fantastic ride through the harbour, great sites and fantastic atmosphere. Absolutley recommend!

Varying degrees of helpfulness from staff. As a first timer on the ferries I needed some guidance while following the google map directions. The timetable was slightly different to that I was looking at so I just needed some clarification as to which ferry to board. Luckily I asked another staff member who was a bit more interested in my question. Thanks to him we were able to continue on our exploring.The journey was efficient and comfortable. A great way to see the harbour.
Easy way to get around. Easy to buy single tickets or buy an Opal card.Scenic and fun to travel on. Goes all over Sydney Harbour area

A must for any visitor. . Took the ferry around from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour on a lovely sunny day. Great views back towards the city and of the bridge. Short 20 minute trip and really inexpensive, especially if you use the Sydney transport system's Opal card.

A ferry to take you almost anywhere around the Harbour. These ferries have to be one of the best in the world: ferries to a wide range of harbour locations on a very regular basis, and down the Parramatta River. We used several: Cockatoo Island; Cremorne; Darling Harbour and Abbotsford. If you get an Opal card, the cost is minimised (and if you are a Senior it is capped at $2.50 a day!) You can get it online or buy at the airport train stations. Whichever ferry you choose, you will have a magical trip!

Ride, Ride, and Ride Some More. It's amazing how much one can see of Sydney and environs by riding the ferries in different directions. I used the ferry for commuting from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay almost every day. In addition, I went to Sydney Olympic Park in the far west harbour, Taronga Zoo on the north side, and Manley Beach near the harbour mouth. Beautiful trips, all, and quite inexpensive. Do get an Opal Card to use for payments, which are capped at a daily and weekly amount, which can save some bucks. I'd also recommend a ride to Watson's Bay for lunch and back.

Great way to see Sydney Harbor. My wife and I took Captain Cooks Harbor and Zoo tour. It is a Hop - on Hop -off tour. We left at 9:30 am and got dropped off at the Zoo ( by the way... Great zoo ) we then reboarded the Ferry and continued to other stops for about 2 hours Great way to get a narrated voyage of the cities surrounding Sydney. Highly recommend
Day trip to Watson's Bay. Good views of the harbour. A great venue at the end to have lunch and a few drinks while looking out over Sydney Harbour.
A relaxing way to see Sydney. Do take the Sydney ferries to get where you want to go. It's clean, cool, and a relaxing way to see the sights!
Trip to msmly. Lovely calm ride past all the sights of Sydney harbour. Unmissable views of the opera house and bridge along with boats, harbour side lodgings and plenty of birds.

Beautiful view. We went Manly by Sydney ferry. There is no traffic jam and have a beautiful view. Fare is bit expensive and interval for Manly ferry is every 30mins. However there are plenty of seats and very convenient to go around Sydney.

The occasional commute has become so reliable.. Catching a ferry home from work is something I used not to do very often. I have horrible memories of smelly boats, unreliable timetables and unhelpful customer service.But I can confidently say that this has now changed. The ferries are clean. They smell fresh and are obviously well maintained. They are reliable and timetables operate to schedule. Staff are friendly and helpful, and I get the distinct impression that the staff now like the 'office', arguably the best in the world, they get to work in every day.Well done to the staff, the workers and the management of Sydney Ferries - what a turn around. You've won me back, and I too get to the best view in the world on my trip home. If you could make it possible to enjoy a glass of wine or beer on the way home, then that would be even better!

Best way to travel. Using the ferries to access the harbour is fantastic and relaxing at the same time Gently bobbing along with spectacular views of all that is Sydney is amazingOpal card makes it so easy to travel around

Great way to explore the city, awesome views and super cheap on Sundays!. What a fun method of transportation to all the different areas within Sydney! My friends and I first ventured using the transit system on a Sunday, which includes the ferries and surprisingly found out it only costs $2.50 AUD to transit all day on Sundays. Not per trip, but for the whole day! The ferries were super fast and boasted some of the best views in the world. There was lots of space to sit, they are extremely busy yet very efficient.

Ferries, sights and sounds of adventure and places to go.... The Sydney Ferry terminal in itself has always got something going on. I'm been visiting here for over 40 years and never get tired of it. Whether it is the local 'Rocks' area or the harbour foreshore and the iconic Opera House you'll have a bit to see within walking distance. Last but not least take a trip to Manly or Watson's Bay and see the beautiful Harbour and places to visit without taking the car.

great. for a cheap harbour cruise get the eastern suburbs round trip ferry calling at garden island , rose bay and watsons bay .you will see great harbour views and can have great fish and chips and a beer at watsons bay before your return trip,
Sightseeing at its finest. Just take several ferry rides to see the magnificent harbour and its environs a one day pass will enable a full viewing!

Ferries are great! Beautiful sites and easy to access. We took the ferries a few times to get around. They are easy to use and cost the same as the train I think. The views are beautiful, but get a seat as they get crowded.

Great way to see whats across the water. Affordable and worth the money. We used the ferry to get from one end of the pier to another suburb. Also used it to get to luna park which is the amusement park across from the opera house.
Fantastic Sydney harbour views. Taking the ferry is not only a great way to get around the city but also affords great photo opportunities of the Sydney skyline and the Opera House.

Sydney on a budget with a BANG!. If you do one thing in Sydney, make it the Circular Quay to Manly Ferry and back again. Lunch in one of the awesome beachfront restaurants in Manly, pick through the shops and markets on a weekend for a quality handmade gift, then stuff a wine or icecream into an overfull belly before boarding the Ferry for the stunning scenic float into the harbour. Hold your breath as you round the headlands to reveal the Harbour Bridge and Opera House.... it's a 'moment'. You'll want to do it again and again ....
Holiday . Easy and cheap to get to bondi . Zoo . Darling harbour. Manly etc. All places you want to visit great scenery . Easy access Not long to wait . Very nice travelling in the harbour
Convenient and cozy.. It's a convenient and cozy way of travelling around various places hugging the coast of Sydney Harbour.Take the Opal card to access all the modes of public transport.

Away from the traffic. From Circular Quay you can catch a ferry to many of the suburbs surrounding Sydney Harbour. Go to Balmain for the markets when they are on, wander around Birkenhead Point and then ferry back to the city or go to Watsons Bay and wander up to the lighthouse, look over the Gap and finish with a Doyles fish meal. All of these places are also services by bus.
Great way to see Sydney. Buy an opal ticket and spend all day going from place to place around Sydney for a very small outlay. The ferries are clean and very efficient .

Great way to see Sydney suburbs. Used the ferries to visit Watson bay and on another occasion Manley. Fabulous service to both destinations. Purchased an Opal card (similar to our Oyster card). Great service easy to use and saw great views from the harbour of the bridge and opera house. On a Sunday the Opal card uses a maximum of $2.50 for any public transport. e.g. Sydney circular key by ferry to Manley, then bus to Bondi beach and then catch the same bus back into Oxford street Sydney. Regular service on the ferries approx every 20 to 30 minutes.

OPAL is the way to go. With our OPAL cards, were went on lots of harbour cruises which cost us almost nothing (had some left over) and enabled us to sit and watch the scenery go past. The only rolling and pitching was immediately opposite the heads but it only lasted for about 10 minutes. We went to Darling Harbour, Manly (Twice, ;loved it), Luna Park, every one the same olde worlde piece of history which are so well preserved and maintained they are not too far from new, well almost. Smart people made sure they were at the head of the queue so that they could get the "best spots" on the top deck with magnificent harbour views, Bridge, Fort Denison, the Heads and of course the Opera House. A great way to see all that Sydney Harbour ha to offer and it was amazingly low cost (especially with OPAL cards). This is definitely THE way to go, make it the top of your list when visiting Sydney.
Well run. Travelled to Parramatta and back. Lovely to see how much waterfront there is and all the beautiful old homes.

A great service. On a recent trip to Sydney we stayed at The Rock and took the Ferry out of Circular Quay every day. To Double Bay, Manly & Watsons Bay and each trip provided panoramic views of Sydney from a fantastic vantage point.
Completely recommend as one of the best ways to enjoy Sydney.

Great Way to get around. Either buy a ferry ticket, get an Opal Card, or buy a package to see the sights on your own. Ferries run from morning to night and take you to the other harbours, the Toronga Zoo, Manly, the Olympic Site, just to name a few places. Sydney has its transportation system together. Very enjoyable.
Manly Ferry. The ferry to Manly is only A$2.50 on Sunday and is a nice trip over allowing one to see the harbour and the ocean entrance. Takes about an hour

Great way to get around. We did the tour on the hop on hop off to Manly. It was absolutely fantastic! Plenty of room to move about, but what really made it was the commentary from the guide, thus lady had a great sense of humour and we were all laughing when it got a bit rough as she was making great fun of it! Amazing how much is round harbour and this was a great way to see it. Worth every penny!

Water taxis. The weather was great when we were there so the boats were a great and quick way of getting around the city, there were timetables for you to pick up and all our taxis arrived when they said they would, recommend getting the hopper option if sightseeing

Nice way to travel on a sunny day. We were heading to Luna Park with our little ones. They have never been on a ferry before. We got our tickets from a very helpful ticket booth person. Tickets were reasonable for return travel for 3, I think it was about $36. We didn't have to wait long for our ride.Kids had an absolute ball, plenty of room, our seats were on the side right at the front. Beautiful day to travel via ferry also.Ferries were clean. I recall when I was younger there was always trash on the ferries.

A great way to get around Sydney. We went on several ferry rides, one of them took over 1 hour to There are many routes around the harbour, the residents use the ferries as it would take much longer to drive into the city. We went for a ride to Parramatta a city west along the harbour and Parramatta River. The first part is in Sydney Harbour, with lots of stops at local suburbs, then into the river which has a 7 knot speed limit amongst the vegetation on both sides and many birds..

Australia; the place to be! Sydney Ferry leisure. Sydney Ferries are the public transport ferry service on Sydney Harbour in Sydney, Australia.We love the experience each and every time we go on it.It is much like riding on a boat on 'choppy' wave days where the ferry is not a smooth ride and gives you a wobbly feeling but if you don't get see sickness there is no need to worry.There is a lot to do around the Wharf and Harbour so plan your trip wisely not to miss out on things you might want to go to or see.Australian people are friendly, helpful and nice so if you're confused or need directions, don't be afraid to ask.In Australia they speak English so you will find it very easy to get directions. It's o.k to ask again if your English is limited. Most locals are great to recommend places to go to see, directions, eat or things to do so just ask. Australia is a beautiful country that is multicultural and a huge range of cuisine. Despite crazy news reports or youtube videos over the years what was shown was and is such a select minority that every country on this Earth has some degree of. I have had wonderful memories all over this world and some scary encounters but I bet those locals would have said their culture isn't like that so you will face many diverse people no matter what age or where you go.Australia is a friendly laid back fun filled country with beautiful landscapes from the city to the country with endless tourist attractions to go and see. Some 'slang' words that some Australians use are below not not everyone uses them so just English is just fine.Ambo : ambulance, ambulance driverBig Smoke : a big city, especially Sydney or MelbourneBloke : man, guy Bloody : very (bloody hard yakka) Bloody oath! : that's certainly true Boogie board : a hybrid, half-sized surf boarBrekkie : breakfast Bush : the hinterland, the Outback, anywhere that isn't in town BYO : unlicensed restaurant where you have to Bring Your Own grog, also similar party or barbecueCark it : to die, cease functioning Chrissie : Christmas Cockie : cockatooCut lunch : sandwiches Dag : a funny person, nerd, goof Doc : doctorDog : unattractive woman Esky : large insulated food/drink container for picnics, barbecues etc. Fair go : a chance ("give a bloke a fair go") Fairy floss : candy floss, cotton candyFlake : shark's flesh (sold in fish & chips shops) G'Day : hello! Good onya : good for you, well done Icy pole, ice block : popsicle, lollypop Lippy : lipstick Lollies : sweets, candy Lucky Country, The : Australia, where else? Maccas (pron. "mackers") : McDonald's (the hamburger place) Milk bar : corner shop that sells takeaway food Mozzie : mosquito Nipper : young surf lifesaver No drama : same as 'no worries'No worries! : Expression of forgiveness or reassurance (No problem; forget about it; I can do it; Yes, I'll do it) Not the full quid : not bright intellectually Pokies : poker machines, fruit machines, gambling slot machines Prezzy : present, gift Road train : big truck with many trailers Servo : petrol station Snag : a sausage Sunbake : sunbathe Sunnies : sunglasses Surfies : people who go surfing - usually more often than they go to work! Tea : supperTop End : far north of Australia Trackie daks/dacks : tracksuit pantsTrackies : track suit Ute : utility vehicle, pickup truckWhinge : complain Wog : flu or trivial illness Yabby : inland freshwater crayfish found in Australia (Cherax destructor)The currency is in Australian dollars.You can uses dollars, Credit cards such as American express, Visa and Mastercard but some stores charge a extra service fee so ask if they do.Australians do not tip each other but it's nice to show and tell them you respect their service and kindness, we all like that!​The temperature is measured in CelsiusLength measurements are in kilometers, meters and centimetersPower is 220 wattsThere are two time zones and daylight saving times so check where you are and what the time is for you.

Must do. This is a great and affordable way to see Sydney Harbour. The ferry to Manly and back to Circular Quay is especially good. Buy an OPAL card which can be used on trains and buses to get best value

Such a great to get to and from Darling Harbour!. As I was staying in Darling Harbour, I used the Sydney Ferries pretty much every day. They were superb, ran on time and what a great way to get fantastic views of the harbour :) My advice would be to get yourself an Opal card, top it up and then just tap in and out on the ferries, trains and buses - so simple!

Ideal Transportation. Basically a Mega Water Taxi - One of many Ferries that serve the Sydney Harbour and gets you places. So cheap and easier than trying to drove around by car. Works off of a similar system to the UK Oyster Card. Very easy transport and the jkids will love it..!!

Fantastic way to travel around Sydney. Our family visited Sydney over the Easter Break and used the Ferry Service to get to Taronga Zoo. It was easy to use and relatively inexpensive. The views were amazing, it was a beautiful day and the Ferry was relaxing for the parents and fun for the kids.
ontime and clean. the ferries were terrific. clean, on time and made our travel easier. The crew was couteous and quite handsome!.
Frequent user. This service is a cheap and easy way to see the city. i have used the ferry countless of times and it is highly recommended
"Ticket for the week". It The Best Way to bet the traffic in Sydney, off to the Zoo, Darling Harbour and or the beach, JUST The Best Way To be Transported around Sydney, we had a lovely week..

Unmatchable. What can you say about the various routes available other than they include some of the great journeys of the known world. Cruise along the southern shores of the Harbour to Watsons Bay at leisure, no congestion, no distractions, no fuss and view the wonderful cityscape; cross the Harbour to Manly by day and come back by night and get one of the most magnificent views anywhere, pass by the Heads where Europeans swarmed in and took over a continent, enjoy arriving in and enjoying another little separate part of Sydney across the waters, marvel at the preserved natural shoreline on the northside as you pass by; cruise west and sail under that fabulous structure that dominates the Harbour city, hop off and wander around deelightful Balmain or historic Cockatoo Island, then come back at night, under the Bridge again this time with everything lit up around you and have the Opera House suddenly loom up before you like magic. Priceless, at only the cost of an excursion ticket. And leave your cameras in your bag: just gape, absorb and remember.

Must Do!. We did the Manly to Circular Quay public ferry ride at sunset and got fantastic shots of the Opera House with the sun bouncing off it. I would recommend this to anyone visiting for that postcard shot!

Great way to tour the harbor for next to nothing !. Get an Opal card ( free) put 20 bucks on it, and you're good to go all day on ferries, trains, buses and you'll still have 5 bucks worth left for the next days train ride! We took the Manly Ferry, which goes all the way out to within sight of the harbor entrance, with great views of the bridge and opera house. And it's a short stroll to Manly beach, interesting in itself. Or you can take a ferry that goes upstream under the bridge. Or both on the same day for a max of $15.00 AU. A great bargain, and easy to use right out of circular quay.

Great wheelchair access and fantastic staff!. I regularly catch ferries, being a wheelchair user I always hope public transport is a stress free option in SydneyThe staff are always on hand and so helpful they make my trips super easy! When visiting Sydney if you are using buses trains or ferries you can guarantee a pleasant experience!

Great Service. We visited Sydney in March 2016 and travelled on the Ferries to Watsons Bay, Neutrel Bay and Manly. We went to Manly late afternoon so we could return after sunset and the view coming back into Sydney Harbour at night was spectacular. The ferry system is a great way to get around the Harbour, very reliable service.

Super service and easy way to travel.. These ferries run regularly and using your Opal Card, they are very cheap. They travel to every out-lying bay and beach and are extremely efficient and timeous. We used them every day from Darling Harbour and visited Circular Quay, Olympic Park, Watson's Bay, Manly beach and many other areas of Sydney. The crews are always friendly and happy to help and offer advice.

A cheap & great way to see City. Jumped on a ferry for a ride from Darling Harbour to The Opera House for just 2.50ASD as it was the Easter Sunday they did a Sunday Fun day concession for all Opal card holders (travelcard)Saw the Harbour Bridge, Luna Park & the amazing Opera House. Took some wonderful pics too. A great way to see the sites & would highly recommend.
Sydney Ferries. Just had a week in Sydney and used the ferries from Circular Quay. Great form of transport. Would thoroughly recommend them. Also they are always on time !

parramatta to manly. buy a day rover ticket, I catch a Katoomba train from Penrith to Parramatta then the government bus to Parramatta river, walk down along the river to the river cat and go to circular quay then go to the manly pier and catch the ferry to manly, walk straight ahead to the beach (ocean) there is a great fish and chips there on the corner and sit on the beach for lunch, bring water from home ,you can fill your bottle all over the place ,then you walk around the beach follow the path to the right to shelly beach ,you can walk from there to the International College of management and walk around there beautiful gardens and if you are late enough you might see if there is room for dinner in there dinning room it was the old monastery and church , you can walk from their out the gate ,down the hill to the ferry back to the city ,from Circular Quay to China Town and dinner and then walk up to central for a Mt Victoria or Katoomba train on platforms 6-8its a long walk need good shoes hat water and back pack, I have done this walk with my 6,7,9,10 year old children and grand children ,they have there own back packs with there food and fruit and water bottle, enjoy the walk regards Margaret S

Best way to see Sydney Harbour on a budget. The Sydney Ferries will take you to most every waterfront throughout Sydney's huge harbor. If you load an Opal transit card w/ $15 you can ride the bus and/or their ferries all day. Give yourself lost of time as the harbor is massive and there's lots to do at most every stop.I like the back of the boat as there is less wind. The ferries are clean and for the most part comfortable. Watch your hat though, as a sudden gust of wind might blow through at any moment.

BEAUTIFUL WAY TO EXPERIENCE SYDNEY. Taking an afternoon coffecruise with a VIP status is a really a great way to see this beautiful city.I do suggest the VIP service, because you get better treatment and some champagne and that can make your experience even more enhancing. My husband and I loved it"

Great way to see the city!. We took the ferry from Watson Bay back to the city with a stop in Rose Bay. Perfect decision! The views are fantastic. Many picture opportunities and dolphins were even waiting for us on arrival. Magical!

If you're new to Sydney just catch a ferry. It doesn't really matter where you go, just being on beautiful Sydney Harbour is excitement enough. However, the Manly Ferry is a classic, as is catching the Cat up to Parramatta, ot going all the way to Watsons Bay by the heads.

Well organised. A trip on the manly ferry will give you the best views of Sydney harbour for a few dollars. Try and grab a front seat to see the rugged and stunning coast line The ferries are punctual, clean and staff friendly.

Iconic ferry trip. I can never go too often to Manly by ferry. The ferries are old style and go at a leisurely pace. There are lots of great palces to sit outside and enjoy the stunning harbour views.

Always on time!. These are great. They are cheap and reliable and as well as getting you from a to b they are an enjoyable ride by themselves. Get on quickly and head for the decks for the views. Top tip.....be careful the wind doesn't blow your hat off. They get a bit choppy if you head towardsthe ocean but otherwise are calm. Use your Opal card to pay. Top up on the machine in the wharf, there is even one at Manly now. All the ferries we went on had toilets which was handy with the kids!

Reliable and affordable. A great way to get around Sydney and nearby places of interest. The ferries are inexpensive, speedy and reliably on time. The seating inside and out is comfortable with good views. Probably there isn't a better way to get around and also to see the city from the river perspective which gives you a great view without traffic fumes!
a great way to move around town. the best way to get around is by ferry, you can also see the bridge and opera house from a totally different perspective

A Sydney must do. I went from Manley to the city on the ferry and it is a fantastic way of getting around. It is superbly well managed and everything just works well, from the ticket office friendly staff to the very punctual arrival and departure times. I was lucky enough to get a front/back row seat so I had great views of the opera house and bridge for photographs.

Great way to see Sydney. If visiting Sydney, set aside time to "ride the ferries". This wonderful transport system in Sydney not only moves you comfortably from one spot to another but showcases the very best of the iconic Sydney sites.The Bridge and Opera House are best viewed from the water and are magnificent to behold.If you are a senior from interstate explore the possibly of getting an Opal Card. Fantastic value and incredibly easy to use

Many places to visit around Sydney by Ferry. Great cheap way of seeing Sydney. Take the River Cat down to Abbotsford and enjoy a sunset drink on the deck of the nearby Rowing Club. Catch the Ferry to Watsons Bay and enjoy a meal or a beverage at the Watson's Bay beach venues. Catch a ferry across to Cockatoo Island in Sydney harbour for a meal or a drink also or wander around the Island and learn of it's great history.

Easy to use and get around to other landmarks. The Sydney Ferries are so easy to use to visit other locations like Manly Beach, and run very frequently. Best to get the Opal Card as it makes it cheaper than buying paper tickets.

A must do in Sydney . Riding the ferries is the perfect way to experience Sydney. Start at Circular Quay and sail out to Watsons Bay or Manly to see the beauty of Sydney Harbour. Watch all the sailboats maneuvering around the ferries and cruise ships. So graceful and skillful. A pleasant time on the water

Thank you for common sense. young girl assisted me (Vikki?) when my carer was unavailable.Made my journey happy fast and I felt validated even though I was in a wheelchair that was playing up.So many people put a dampener on public transport but my experience has been totally positive every time. A few word of gratitude can turn even the grumpiest of workers.Sharon McAnulty

Safe and Fun. It was awesome to have experienced the Sydney ferries, good spot is at the further back on the second level open area where you can take photos in all angle. Though went to a long cue for the ticket, worth it though! A must try.
Great way to travel. Great fun hopping from beach to beach on the ferries. The opal card system is excellent and on a sunday one can travel anywhere all day for $2.50! If only i'd known!!
The only way to get to work. ... The reason I love the old ferries is that every day there is a photo worthy of my skill set just waiting for me to look up.

The best way to see sydney harbour. A wonderful, cheap and efficient way to experience Sydney harbour (and beyond). Whether it's the Many ferry to experience the beach, the inner harbour services through the beautiful coves and bays, or even up the Parramatta river, you can do it all. Best of all, it only takes a couple of taps of your Opal card (buy it from wharf 2 or 5 or from a convenience store).

Great way to see the Harbour and sights along the way. Very Professional and on time. Went over to Luna Park, Darling Harbour, and various other stops along the way. Make sure you get an Opal Card which pays for your train, buses and ferries in Sydney, these cards you just tap on and off and work great.

Wa great trip,from Circular quay to Manly. A must do,when in Sydney is to take a ferry ride over the gorgeous Sydney hour our where you aCan see so much more being on the water.Especially good is the ferry ride to Manly, where you can see so many inlets and beaches and stop over at Manly for lunch, or a swim at the magnificent Manly beach.

Sydney is my favorite city in all the world due to the ferry to Manly. Every time I am in Sydney I do not miss the opportunity to take the ferry to Manly as often as I can. it is a half hour ride on a very big boat - I stand in front and take in the fresh sea breeze. I have often taken the boat to Manly and returned on the same boat. Never has it failed to wash away all my worries, make me forget everything happening in my life, and enjoy life in the present. A joy beyond.

Take ferry to Manly beach. we took two ferry rides -- one from Darling Harbor to Circular Quay and the other from Circular Quay to Manly. Weekend ride to Manly was about 30 minutes, and you see a lot of the harbor. There were large crowds, and nowhere to sit while waiting for boat to arrive for the trip. Try to get a seat outside, or on the bow. Manly Beach is a 5 minute walk from ferry terminal. Frequent service.

Captain Cook harbour cruises. Delightful and most enjoyable reunion with friends . A day on the harbour, enjoying a delectable Seafood buffet luncheon whilst enjoying the view of our great harbour.This was a good choice by our organiser for the 60th reunion of the P. M.G. This is a beautiful Sydney attraction and simply the best way to view it, whilst enjoying the best local seafood Australia offers. Terrific day.

Great transport with wonderful views. There is alot of public transport in Sydney. Catching a ferry however is special because of the views. The Circular Quay to manly journey is especially scenic for visitors to the city.

Best way to travel around Sydney!. The Sydney ferries are a fantastic way to travel around Sydney. They run regularly and depart from Circular Quay which is a great spot. You can get over to Manley and Watsons Bay with ease and the provide great views of the Opera house and harbor bridge. Cheap as well and on a Sunday all travel is capped at $2.50 so limitless travel!

I've done the ferries countless times as I live here.Ro go across to Darling Harbour I use the ferry as it's so relaxing. Enjoyable n relaxing n Beautiful. It's the first stop tourists should go to when visiting Sydney. I use the ferries as often as I can.

Cheapest sight seeing in Sydney. We always take overseas visitors on the Manly Ferry. Wonderful harbour vistas at a very economical price. The seaside village atmosphere of Manly has great touristic shopping and lovely cafes and restaurants. If the seas are rough, the journey can be quite an adventure - an amusement park ride thrown into the bargain!
easy and great way to travel. Take it easy, and see Sydney from a different angle. I took the ferry few times and always discovered new places and new things to see.

Efficient service. Operating as a seamless part of the Sydney transportation network, the ferry network is extensive and easy to use. The public ferries are supplemented on some routes, particularly the run to Manly, by "Fast Ferries", that offer faster, more modern, catamaran vessels for a slightly higher price. The vessels range in size and configuration depending on the route and whether they are operating east of the harbour bridge or west of it in the Parramatta river.

Sydney Ferries. What a fantastic way to view iconic Sydney attractions from a different aspect. Even if you do not have much time, you can jump on a ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour for $5 and take in the bridge, opera house, Luna park and Darling Harbour. The Manly ferry is a good trip if you have time. If you are in Sydney during Vivid Light Show, you could take the 5.45 pm ferry from Manly and see Sydney Harbour in a rainbow of colours at night. Brilliant.

Great way to travel on your Opal card. Great way to travel in Sydney. You don't need to go on an expensive Captain Cook Cruise. Travel in a Sydney on Sunday, is $2.50 a day. Otherwise, Sydney transport is pretty expensive.
Best form of transport. Loved using ferries - the best form of transport. Ferries around Sydney is what adds to the atmosphere of a wonderful holiday in Sydney.
Travel by Ferry a must. Travelling by ferry was great at any time by day or night.Just make sure you get an opal card with sufficient money on it and don't forget to tap off at your destination.

Good service. The Ferries are a wonderful way to tour the harbours. They are easy to board and use and the prices are reasonable. We asked several staff members for help and all of them were quite kind and helpful.

Great way to get around with a view. Great way to travel as an alternative to buses or trains. Ferries always run on time, down to the minute. I highly recommend the ferry from Circular quay to manly! Only time I wouldn't recommend taking the ferry is if it's raining or if the water is really choppy (big waves can make you sea sick!)

Sydney Ferries. You want to know about Sydney Ferries?? They are awesome mate!! Clean, well lit, with plenty of comfortable seating too. Easy access for strollers and wheelchairs. Staff are helpful and cheerful too. Wander out to the outer decks, get your lungs full of beautiful fresh Sydney Harbour air and believe how fortunate you are to be on a Sydney Ferry.
Trip to Manly. Went to Manly on the Sydney ferry, was a great experience. You could see the harbour bridge and the opera house Manly was a beautiful place.
Great. Brilliant way to get around the various areas of Sydney. We got Opal cards that we could use on the light rail, trains and buses as well and found the transport links excellent around Sydney.

Low cost way to sail Sydney Harbour. Used the ferries to travel to Manly, its inexpensive and a great way to get a harbour view cruise without all the expense of going on a formal cruise. Frequent sailings

Sydney Ferries. A real wonderful experience to view Opera House, Harbour Bridge and its surroundings from the sea. We took this ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's bay. It's just a few minutes away, don't miss it.
Really nice view!. The ferries are practical, relaxing and just nice. Perfect to get to manly beach or wherever you want to. Crew members always help you out, if you're a bit lost as I was.
cheap and easy. If you want to have a good cheap option to see Sydney Harbour then buy an Opal Card. Regular ferries are in use and the views are stunning. Tap on and tap off, it is so easy.
Cheap way to cruise the harbour. An easy and cheap way to see Sydney harbour, the bridge and opera house. Especially on a Sunday as you can do all day travel on public transport for just $2.50

Need to get a bit more organisex. Great ferries and great Harbour but by geez they need to delegate a bit of responsibility to direct patrons and to advise what is going on when passengers are preparing to board. Its a bit of a rabble and it is possible to check in with Opal card only to find that too many passengers onboard and you have to wait another half an hour with no way of backing out once past the scanning breaks. They should count heads as they go through and prevent entry once maximum numbers are reached for the size of the vessel, giving a chance to cancel. Wake up Sydney Ferries, this is an international tourist destination.

Great views, punctual and crew is very friendly. Great for getting between north Sydney and the CBD or Darling Harbour. A bit pricey but during the weekend it's less then $5 for the whole day if you get the Opal card

Pleasant, quick option for reaching the beaches from Sydney. We ferried from Manley Beach on a Saturday afternoon. It was glorious weather for being on the water and there were lots of sailboats out. The trip was about ?20 minutes smooth. And uneventful. The boat has snacks, drinks for sale.

A great way to see Sydney Harbour. This is a super way to see Sydney Harbour with the Bridge and Opera House and much more. Take the ferry to Manly rather than the jet cat as you see much more. You can also take shorter trips to places nearer to Circular Quay. Also the river cat goes up the Parramatta River giving lovely views of the Inner Harbour and suburbs. Prices are reasonable. If you are visiting Sydney, then this is a great way to see around the harbourside.

Honeymoon. These are a fantastic way to get around and easy to use, the one thing no one tells you is on a Sunday its $2.50 to use on the bus and ferris , only thing is its min of $10.00 per card. So if your stay covers the Sunday get one the the cards first off to buy your tickets
Make the most of the ferries with an opal card. They're a great way to visit and relax.On a Sunday there is sometimes cheap travel, and the free Wi-Fi is handy.

Great way to see the harbour. A ferry is a ferry , but to have the amazing views around are awesome, to be visiting form across the land and to see Oz from a different way is awesome, defiantly worth jumping n the ferry, no to expens either
get your Opal card...!!. we picked up our Opal card put 20$ on and were off. It fairly simple to get around the city. Its nice that the card is part of trains ferries and buses. Awesome system.

Great way to get around. Just purchase an opal card.Maximum charge is $15 Mon-Sat.Only $2.50 on Sunday.The ferries will take you all over Sydney Harbour.I went to Manly beach, Watson's Bay, Circular Quay and Darling Harbour.
So easy . So easy. So much better than bus. Most come into circular quay so a nice view of the opera house and the bridge. Get an opal card for instant and trackable payment.
Very good transport. We used the ferry a few times whilst in Sydney. We went to Manly and the ferry was very quick and efficient. You also get lovely view of the harbour bridge and Opera House.
full of charm. definitely a great way to discover sydney as well as going to work! these old ferries are clearly a icon of Sydney's spirit
Spectacular views. It is worth to take the ferry and enjoy the different views of the Bay and the landscape of the city observed from the Bay

Easy way to travel. The ferry service is very efficient, quick and an easy way to travel to several different areas around Sydney. Their schedules are easy to follow so connections from Darling Harbour and Circular Quay were no problem. Best of all you get great views. I recommend purchasing an OPAL card which works on the buses, trains and ferries. The daily maximum charge for all travel is 15.00 which we though was very reasonable. The cards can be purchased at any convenience store or OPAL Kiosk for certain denominations and can be reloaded if needed.
Ferry to Manly Beach. A must for everyone on a sunny day. The boat trip takes you past the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge, as well as past the beautiful sailboats. The views are exquisite.
