Quick and Cheap. Great way to get around to other destinations around Sydney. Cheap too! Especially on Sundays when it's 2.50 cap for the day!!
Manly Ferry. The trip by ferry to Manly is recommended. Harbour views are great and manly is a good place to explore with surf beach and rock pools.
got to try thrm to believe them. this system of ferries can take you almost anywhere you need to go we took it to Manly beach, Taronga Zoo, Luna Park and Watsons Bay

Great experience crossing the harbour. I used the ferries across the harbour in two different directions on separate occasions. The ferries are not suitable for wheelchair users and can be very busy so get there early to get the best seats outside. It is well worth it. People I met said they had been across with dolphins at the side of the boat all the way to Manly.

Most cost effective way to see the sites!. Grab an inner harbour ferry for a few bucks and check Sydney out properly with the local residents. Forget over priced tourist cruises serving boring crap food and drinks. Take a ferry to a destination - get off, find a cafe, have coffee, food, get back on and repeat! Awesome. You will really see Sydney at its best - and as they should say 'all ferries lead to circular quay' you'll never get lost. They always come back to town.brilliant.

Ferries that take you lots of places.. Great servce to see attractions and to drop you off at the zoo or the Rocks or Luna Park. Quicker than by road and great views of the city and the opera house as you zoom past. Great photo opportunities

Sydney without ferries would not be Sydney. One of the best value excursions in Australia is the Sydney Ferries. Many passengers use them for transport to and from work, so travel off-peak if you can. I take the ferry to Manly every time I am in Sydney. The jewel in Sydney's crown is its harbour. Sydney would not be Sydney without its ferries.
Good way to get around the harbour. Using the piers at circular keys it is easy and cheap to use this service to get around Sydney Harbour sites. Especially to get to Manly.

getting a bit old but still good. i suggest taking the ferry for a ride over to the north side maybe to manly or luna park or the zoo.try doing it on a weekday as it won,t be as busy as the weekend.enjoy the ride and the sights

Harbour Travel. We love going on the Ferries on Sydney Harbour when we visit Sydney.
With the Opal Cards it makes traveling on public transport very easy- no changing or purchasing tickets for each leg of your trip. Just 1 card to cover everything. Love just getting on at Circular Quay & going over to Manly or Darling Harbour.

Sydney at its best.. Take a Sydney Harbour ferry to see what the city is like and avoid road traffic. Recommended trips are to Manly, Watson's Bay or Mosman. There are plenty of good eating places at Manly and Watson's Bay and delightful short or long walks at both places.

A cheap way to view the Harbour. If you don't want to pay for a full tourist cruise then a trip on a Ferry is the way to go. If you choose the Manly Ferry you pass a large part of the harbour and its islands and past the Heads that open out to the ocean . Be careful of sunburn if you sit outside. There are minimal outdoor seats downstairs which is an issue of you can't climb stairs . Snacks and drink on board to purchase .
Trip to Manley. Good way to see some of the harbour. 45 minutes on Ferry. Outdoor seating is limited. Regular ferries all day. Easy to find at Circular Quay.

great way to travel on a fine day. We used the ferry to visit Balmain from the CBD. Very convenient and fast and a fantastic view. After the visit we used it to go to Milsons Point to connect to the train. The ferry was efficient and on time. The view of the harbour was spectacular. It was a bit pricey at over $5 for just one stop but I would highly recommend for a day exploring this area.

A lovely way to get around the harbour for very little cost. Looking to see Sydney from the water cheaply?This is the ticket - costs not a lot and you can take any of the services that scoot in and out of the many bays either up the river or into the eastern side of the bridge. The trip to Manly and back is lovely and at the other end is a maze of cafes and shopping topped of with an easy stroll to Manly Beach.
Wonderful way to commute and see the amazing views. For the best views, get on these ferries. I travelled twice to and fro from Sydney Harbour to Darling Harbour.
So convenient. Sydney ferries are so convenient! They are usually on schedule and make it so easy to see the outer of Sydney! such as manly!

Wonderful, inexpensive way to see the harbour. The ferry system in Sydney is amazing, inexpensive way to see the beautiful harbour. Grab a seat up front to take in the view! You can purchase a ticket at the wharf, or most convenience stores sell the Opal card. We purchased these for the family, min $10 on the card for adults and $5 for kids. Once you have this card, your ferry rides for the day will cost just $2.50 - such great value. Take the ferry to Watson's Bay or Manly - you won't be disappointed. There is also a fast ferry to Manly, which is good if you have limited time - this is still good value, but more expensive than the public ferry.

Love these ferries. Try Manly, a harbour cruise, Parramatta River. to Olympic Park or Taronga Zoo. They are as cheap as chips with great personalities. They typify Sydney. What would our harbour be without these old girls?

A must for Sydney. This type of ferry has been on Sydney Harbour for 100 years. It's the best way to see the harbour, which is probably the best in the world. The best trip is from Circular Quay to Manly - about 40 minutes each way. If there's a big ocean swell, you get a nice roll going past Sydney Heads, but it only lasts for a few minutes. You can visit Manly surf.
Fast Easy way to travel. Great way to get around the different parts of sydney. Definatley worth getting hold of the opal card as it makes is super efficent to get around.
Ferries. We have been on quite a few, all over the harbour and beyond, still think the Manly one is best, but all great fun and reasonably cheap.

Very close to the opera. Great way to visit beaches around Sydney. Buy opal card and on Sunday you can travel for $2.50 all day using public transport in Sydney. Always remember to top up your card. From the ferry you will have grat view on Opera House - no need to buy expensive trips.
A great way to see the harbour. Rode the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour. TIP: get to the ferries 10 mins before departure as they close the gates early and you might miss your ride.

Transport at its best. Ferries by the score, get an Opal card and ride to your hearts content. Very efficient service, avail rush hour if possible. Don't stress if you don't get that special photo, there's always the return trip.

Great fun on an evening ferry from Manly to Circular Quay. We took a visiting student from Japan on an evening ferry ride from Manly to Circular Quay and back. She loved it and said it was her best experience in Sydney! 30 min journey each way with great night time views of Sydney Harbour. Best way to see the Harbour Bridge and Opera House.I was surprised at the cost though paid $38 for two adults and a child. Makes the $2.50 Sunday Fun Day tickets very worthwhile!

Get an Opal card and ride all day for $2.50. We rode the ferries from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay and Watsons Bay and back, with all the little bay stops in between. Grab a seat, sit back and cruise for a while. Lovely way to see the Sydney Harbour people watch and enjoy a nice day out on the water.

Great Service, Easy Schedules. The operators really get these boats loaded and on their way in smart fashion. We went everywhere on the ferries, most of which use Sydney Transit's OPAL card (same as the buses and trains). Very convenient, and a wonderful way to just get out on the water.

A perfect way to see Sydney on a beautiful day which was have many.. Sydney ferries take you around the inner harbour plus up the Parramatta River to Parramatta. The ferries give you an excellent view of some of the historical parts of Sydney plus shows off some of the beautiful houses along the river.

Sundays are a travellers delight!. We travelled on Sydney Ferries between Watsons Bay and Circular Quay last Sunday. The amazing thing about this, (apart from the fact that the service is great), is that we travelled all day on buses and ferry for only $2.50 each!! Sundays are family days in Sydney, and this sort of saving only highlights why Sydney works so hard at helping locals and tourists alike enjoy everything that this city has to offer.

Great not only for transit but also for touring.. When you buy the Sydney transit pass, you also have access to the ferries. If you take the ferry some time when you want to go from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour (or vice versa) - and you should - what a great way to view the Circular Quay, the Sydney Opera House, the Sydney Bridge, Darling Harbour and the harbour and shoreline in general. Or take a day trip to Manly, or the Taronga Zoo, or to many other destinations. The ferries run on time. It is not luxury travel, but the views are incredible.

Only way to go!. So easy to use the ferries, a bus waiting at the stops (we used Mosman bay) timed with ferry arrivals. The views are spectacular and is so relaxed and easy to use. Easiest way is to get an opal card if doing a few days travelling or purchase a ticket at circular quay.

Just so convenient. Unless you prefer to travel by other means of transport this is the only way to get around the rim of Sydney Harbour. Sydney Transport has a great site where you can plan your journey, shows fares and other connections with trains, b uses and light rail. We ferried to Parramatta and it was the cheapest, best sightseeing ride ever done. The staff are helpful and informative.

Cruise the harbour. Cheap and delightful way to view Sydney harbour from one end to the other. A day ticket is very economical and Sunday travel for families is the best way to go very cheap family day ticket available. Ferries are very clean and the staff are very helpful. You can hop off and one as you go along.

The way to travel. We used the ferries every day to go to different locations,they are a very cheap way to travel around Sydney,and a great way of meeting new friends,highly recommend the ferry service

Great way to get around. The ferry gives you a really good idea of the beauty of the city--Sydney is about the water--the bays and inlets and sea! I enjoyed travelling on the ferrys-it gave one time to relax and enjoy the scenery. The best views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera house are from the ferry that goes to Circular Quay. They seem to have extensive running times--although we did find the schedules a little confusing!.
Fun way to get around. Very unique, its rare to find a city where ferries are so nice and so easy to find, as well as really useful for moving around.

Better than harbour cruises. Take any ferry from Circular Quay to any destination, explore, go back... possibilities are endless and every stop around the Harbour is worth visiting. Get the Zoo ferry and walk east to the point, or the Mosman ferry and walk west along the coast. Or go up the Parramatta River and have lunch at the end of the trip. The fast ferry to Manly has a bar, and sunset on the harbour with a glass of wine is not to be missed. Even more exciting when there's a big sea as you cross the Heads! Enjoy!

Use an Opal card for all your travel on bus, ferry trains etc. The ferries are great to get to and from darling harbour to circular quay. Frequent and reasonably priced. Just scan your Opal card on and off for all your journeys. Remember to swipe off at the end.

Cheap fun. Great day out with or without a family. The Manly ferry is a good way to see the Opera House and most of Sydney Harbor. Get off at Manly as it is also worth a visit. If pushed for time do the Mosman ferry as it is a very pretty inlet which also go's past the Opera House. If really pushed for time then the Jeffry St ferry will take you across the Harbour ,under the Bridge to Lavander Bay and back to Circular key.A must do if visiting Sydney

A great way to get around.. The only bad thing I have to day about the ferries is that they got rid of the hydrofoil. Other than that, the remaining older ferries are a quaint and well purposed to for accessing the greater Sydney area. The larger ones are quiet and smooth and above all cheap to use.

"A different way to travel"!. During our time living in Sydney we used the ferries constantly to travel all over the place. When our family visited, travelling on the ferries was a highlight for all the grandchildren, who loved them! We used them to travel to sightsee, to go on walks, to get to places as much as possible, being on the water was fantastic,there was so much to see from the water. They gave a different view of all the famous places in Sydney and the service and efficiency of the staff was always spot on. We used them as a couple, with friends, or with family and young children. They are a highlight peculiar to Sydney not always appreciated by everyone, but part of the city as much as the Harbour Bridge.

Manly to circular quay and return top trip. Travelled on the Manly to Circular Quay and return ferry with our kids and our friends. We all enjoyed how relaxing it was, how much we could see and the fact that the cost was so reasonable. If you travel in Sunday you can travel all day for $2.50 each with an Opel card.
Best way to get around Sydney.. Going to parramatta, manly or eastern suburbs. This is the best way to travel by far. No traffic, no peak hour. Just a beautiful trip on the water.

Good Way To Travel. The Ferry System is a great way to travel around the harbour. Although you are not able to purchase tickets at each wharf, you can purchase a ticket at Circular Quay so you can exit the station
Great views. Great views and very quick to get around most of Sydney's suburbs and city including manly . Excellent for traveling to work from Partamatta to city Etc
Cheapest way to enjoy the harbour!. Get a ferry and go somewhere - anywhere - on a beautiful day. So many great places to go. The cheapest way to enjoy the harbour.

A must-do for every visitor (or local!). Why splurge on an expensive cruise when you can do what Sydneysiders like me do for 5 bucks or so? Take a trip on the harbour on a regular commuter trip - the most popular is to Manly, takes about 30 minutes, passes most points of interest and gives you endless opportunities for scenic selfies, once in Manly - there's one of Sydney's best beaches, shops, cafes and the relaxing trip back to look forward to. Another trip I'd recommend is to Watsons Bay - this is where I go to lay on the sand (great if like me you're not so keen on the waves - just don't tell everyone!) and you can enjoy most of the landmarks and photo opps as on the Manly ferry.

An inexpensive tour of the the Harbour!. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to any of several places and get a view of what Captain Cook saw as one of the most hospitable harbours in the world. Go to Manly and back taking time to see a beautiful beach and beachfront attractions, and select any of several other destinations, like the Taronga Zoo, or Mosman, or Parramatta. You will not get seasick and you will see Sydney and its environs from the water!

A great way to see Sydney harbour.. I love the ferries on the harbour and have travelled on them many times having lived at Mosman as a child and later on at Little Manly. They really are a wonderful way to see the harbour. They are part of the public transport system for Sydneysiders so don't have commentaries so do a bit of research beforehand , perhaps talk to your hotel people. My favourites are the Mosman ferry, about an hour there and back, the ferry to the Zoo, and the Manly ferry. If the weather is nice you can easily spend the day at Manly- have a swim at the surf beach at the end of the Corso(pedestrian walk from the ferry to the other end of Manly), have some fish and chips, wander around.

Cheap and (sometimes) cheerful. Ferries are the ideal way of seeing Sydney Harbour relatively cheaply: best trips are Circular Quay to Manly or Circ. Quay to Watsons Bay. If You're a traveller get a day card and do several rail, bus & ferry trips. Trips west of the Harbour Bridge are less interesting but the ferry to Parramatta is still the best way to travel.

Great Way To Travel For Tourists And Locals. It is definitely a very convenient and relaxing way to travel to the various places in Sydney from the Circular Quay with the very smoothly run Sydney Ferries. It is my favorite way to do my sightseeing as well!
Best way to see Sydney Harbour. This was a very easy way to see around the Harbour and, although it was New Year's Eve, the staff coped very well with the crowds.

Sunday Funday cruise, best value for money. We went on a return cruise from darling harbour to parramatta last Sunday after a long lunch. Some of us stayed inside and had a nap, some of us went outside to enjoy the beauty views from the parramatta river and some of us stayed inside having a good chat ;)It took nearly an hour to get to parramatta. We went for a short walk then went back to the ferry 30 minutes later to catch the same ferry back to darling harbour. We went outside and were treated with a beautiful night view of Sydney harbour. The total trip took about two and a haft hour. It was relaxing with beautiful views and cost only $2.50.

Relaxing and Fun. Everybody should do a ferry ride. We rode the ferry from Sydney Harbour to Darling Harbour and the ferry made several stops in between and it was so nice and relaxing. The sight seeing was wonderful. The temperature was wonderful and the breeze was great. Everyone should definitely take a ferry ride. It's very easy to get from one place to the other (like to the zoo or manly beach etc.). Also it was very affordable. We started on the ride in the day time but came back at night so we saw a lot of nice lighted sights.
Efficient. Very easy to buy tickets and work out where to go. Gives a great view of bridge and opera house and much nicer than being on a train on a hot day

Brilliant . We went all over on these ferries very cheap taronga zoo was amazing very friendly people . You can get a ticket for a few days which is cheaper they run very frequently. Watson bay was fab and fish and chips from Doyles is a must .

Manly n zoo. Used ferries all good,quite quick transport,cheap to use
Good travel providing you get a good day
Get your sea legs my matey
Best way to see Sydney Harbor. Grab a jacket, some sunscreen and head on down to Circular Quay. The Manly ferry is one the cheapest and best ways to view Sydney from the water.
Ferries make it easy to explore Sydney. Ferries are economical and easy to figure out. They offer many trips daily to a variety of detonations, plus the scenery it amazing!
Love it!. The Sydney ferry system is great, with lots of convenient stops. You can use your Opal transit cards on buses, trains, or ferries.
Great value, great views. We took the ferry to Watsons Bay on a really hot day (38C) and it was really lovely and we managed to keep cool. These ferries are amazing value.

Great way to see Sydney on a budget. I reckon a trip to Sydney is not complete without a ferry trip. Being mobility impaired, the ferries have been a great way to tour the city from Parramatta to Manly and back. I love the fact these are part of the public transport system and the Opal Card gets you on and off.Down side is the queues and the rude people who push and shove for seating, I was obviously on crutches and no one offered me a seat on the crowded ferry.
Cockatoo Island. had a great trip from Darling Harbour to Cockatoo Island then to Circular Quay and on to Manly.The ferries were quick, clean and the stall were coutreous and helpful

Excellent way to get around. I took the ferry from Walton Bay Beach to the circular Quay. It was a Saturday in sunny. There were loads and loads of sailboats out in the bay in one could see all the surrounds. Coming into circular Quay, one gets a wonderful view of the opera house and Sydney Harbour Bridge. Wonderful trip for $6.20 Australian.
To the Zoo. What an amazing way to travel to a top tourist attraction. The scenery was a breath taking. The ride smooth.
Easy. Great way to get around in Sydney. Get an Opal card and use it for discounted fares. Weekends very economical, $15 cap on Saturday and $2.50 all day Sunday.

Ferries . A good option to go along and visit around. More expensive than the train but with a completely different atmosphere. Very nice to see around and take pictures, both day or night. Everyone are nice and can advise for any information needed. Cost around $6,20 to cross up to more, depending how long you want to go. Like other's its paid when you leave. Final travel destination. OPAL card is available in most of trains and ferries stations, where you can charge it. There's also a daily card. Just ask for and you'll get the information where to buy.

Relaxing way to see beautiful Sydney. Took many ferry rides on our week in Sydney. Always on time and clean, well run ferries. Even had free wi-fi...Great relaxing way to see the city from the water. Get an Opal card it's so much easier.

Why not travel by ferry on the best harbour in the world. You can travel reltively inexpensively from as far west as Parramatta to the beach at Manly using the great Sydney Ferries. The views are fantastic and ferries are clean working vessels with great and colorful crew members. Before you spend any money on organised tours spend a day exploring with Sydney Ferries. The trips to Manly and to "say" Olympic Park provide a great view of Sydney. Also do the Watson's Bay trip - not to be missed
Great Ferry service. Took several ferries around the harbour. All good and great views of the sites. Seem to run frequently and to timetable.

The throbbing heart of Circular Quay. Being one of the most iconic places not only in Sydney, but in Australia as a whole, this quay is incredibly well served by a myriad of ferries ready to take you anywhere and everywhere !!!!! They can be used to access anywhere in the locality as transport or there are numerous sight seeing tours with the likes of Captain Cook Cruises for sight seeing or scenic cruises. Simply inquire at any box office and anything you wish to do can be organised. They are cheap, comfortable and leisurely.If this is your first visit to Sydney, there is only one way to see it for the first time !! YOU MUST TAKE THE FERRY FROM MANLY TO CIRCULAR QUAY. IT IS THE MOST WONDERFUL TRIP AND GIVES YOU THE BEST VIEWS OF SYDNEY HARBOUR ON OFFER. IT IS AWESOME !!!! ENJOY.

Manly Ferry Ride. Hi,Whilst visiting Sydney last week, I took the opportunity, to ride a ferry from Circular Quay, to Manly.The ferry ride was fantastic, the water a bit choppy, but the ferry took it in her stride and the ride was a smooth as the conditions would allow.Anyone visiting Sydney, should at least once in their lifetime, ride a ferry on Sydney Harbour, to feel the atmosphere and the pure pleasure of the ride and the scenery. Fantastic experience!
Great way to see the harbour. The ferries are an excellent, low cost way to get around. Get the ferry to Manly for a few dollars as an alternative to the expensive harbour tours.

Such excellent service. The Sydney Ferries are one of the most efficient modes of transport in the world! In and out always on time, cheerful staff who are happy to help! Just a tip though- they do get very busy in peak times and weekends so get there a bit early to avoid having to,wait for,the next one- which isn't far away but if time is of the essence you don't want to waste time standing on a wharf! Oh and invest in an Opal card- makes Sydney transport even easier!

The best and cheapest way to get around Sydney Harbour. These ferries are not luxury cruises ... they are your typical commuter bus or train, found in any city, except on water ... so expectations should not exceed beyond that fact, they are there for the Sydneysider commuters! However, only the last 30 odd years, visitors to Sydney have found using this service great, especially for viewing the Opera House from the water. For some to say on TA, the ferries are expensive, not correct! Not when you compare the London Underground, Paris Metro, NY, etc. especially when you have the PLUS of seeing one of the most magnificent harbour vistas in the world. Travelling on them weekdays, outside commuter hours best, the weekend can be a case of "packed to the rafters" ... because Sydney Ferries offers reduced rates, particularly on Sundays p.s. I have the option of using a convenient bus to Manly, however, I always opt for going via the city to use the ferries

A Sydney icon. Sydney Ferries are reasonably priced and reliable so if you are staying in Sydney this is the best and cheapest way of travelling the harbour. Also get an Opal card as this gives the cheapest fares. Don't miss travelling by ferry from Manly at night to have great views of the CBD lit up.

Absolutely loved the ferries - destinations & journey both brilliant. We went to Watson Bay and to Manly and would have taken more trips if time allowed. Very easy and low cost trip with an Opal card, great views en route and just the destinations you want. Couldn't really understand why people paid more for slightly faster journeys.
Worst ferry in the world. Always late, very slow , bloody expensive fare, always very dirty...worst service ever, very rude on board staff, don't bother

The best way to explore Sydney. I can't think of anything better to do than hopping on and off Sydney ferries. I bought an Opal transportation pass which cost me $40 AUD. I used it for five days and still had a balance on it. Maximum charge on Sundays - $2.50 AUD. This visit, I took ferries to Taronga, Darling Harbour, Watsons Bay for the walk to South Head, Balmain, Mosman, and Manly plus other random stops. Riding the CAT to Parramatta is another great way to spend time on the water. I was, also, able to book a three hour harbor cruise on an old, coal-fired, steam ferry built in 1901. It's looked after by the volunteers at Sydney Heritage Fleet Ferries - brilliant afternoon.

Amazing value, fabulous views. Whilst we are a retired couple, we use the ferries frequently to just sightsee as there are just so many places that you can visit using the ferries. Quite often we will just get off the train there at Circular Quay and hop onto whichever ferry happens to be waiting there or due in next. We take our toddler granddaughter out with us on many of these trips and as we use a buggy for her, I have always found the ferry staff very helpful especially on the Parramatta run and the Double Bay run. I can't see why people would pay huge amounts to use private ferries and half day cruises etc, when Sydney Ferries covers all the places you would want to see. Admittedly as seniors we have the advantage of $2.50 all day trips every day of the week, but truly even when I paid full price before retirement I still found the Sydney Ferries to be an absolute bargain. The list of places to visit is endless using the ferries.

Timely transportation & sight seeing combo. Using Sydney's many ferries is a great way to combine transportation and sightseeing for one very reasonable price. Family friendly, a great option after the rush hour in the morning for seeing all around Sydney's harbors. I valued the ferries for pleasure and business transportation. I wish you the best on the ferries. J

Nice way to get to work. Most relaxing and stress free travel on Sydney. Sightseeing, open air and beautiful. Travel from harbour suburbs to the CBD. Alternatively, just take the best joy ride on the water for less than $6.
nice. Fast,fun,beautifull view,right price,would do it again Would love to eat while transiting..........................

Must Do in Sydney. One thing you must do when visiting Sydney is take a ferry from Circular Quay. Manly is a popular destination. It is about a half hour journey that offers fantastic views of the Heads and the old quarantine station reserve. There are coffee shops & eateries at Manly (see separate reviews)
Attraction & Transportation. Always a joy on Sydney ferries. Sunday is capped @ 2.50 all day, but be prepared to brave the crowds.
Worth a trio. Used this ferry to come back from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay.... It was good value and like a shortharbour cruise - worth a try

Manly Ferry. Always a must, to catch the Manly Ferry and enjoy the great old diesel motors purring along. So nice to be on board an old girl, rather than a plastic fast boat. Great ride and plenty to see from all decks. If you love a bit of history, these old vessels will really get you in. Having studied to be a Master V class skipper and worked as a deckhand, my old friend and skipper brought to Melbourne the Lady Cutler, who worked the "Harbour" for many years. I guess there is nothing like being on the water, and for a meager seven odd dollars, (One way)where else could you be entertained for that price?
way cool. had a great time on the ferries went to manly and the keys , had an opal card for payment and this is the way to go . cheap and fast travel and great veiws$2.50 all day sundays
took an hour to get picked up. missed my boat by a few min other company ferries refused to pick me up got sun burned waiting. so yeah not so fun.
Ferry across the Harbour. What an excellent way to travel across Sydney to visit different areas of the city. Jump on, jump off or take a round trip to appreciate the amazing Harbour

relaxed travel. Took the ferry to Taronga Zoo return. So easy, well signed and plenty of assistance for tourists unsure of the area. The Cunard Queen Victoria was in harbor when I traveled so really busy around foreshores.Taking the ferry is a quick but beautiful way to see Sydney from the water. Passing the Opera House, Harbor Bridge, Luna Park and just wonderful views. As an interstate senior, there is a great new Opal card that entitles seniors from all over Australia to travel for a maximum of $2.50 per day on all public transport. This is wonderful. Take advantage at train information kiosks and wherever you see the signs.
Travelling in the harbour. The best way to get around Sydney harbour. Good value everyday but especially on a Sunday when there is unlimited travel for 2.50 Australian dollars!

fab..........do it on a Sunday cheap rates. do the ferries on a Sunday one can get a 2.50 pass which means that you can do many of the ferry rides......dont just do manly there are other rides that are wonderful enjoy the harbour
Great way to see the town. The darling harbor ferrys give a great reveal of the opera house. The manly ferry has spectacular views. Goo to give you a feel for the layout of the city.

Manly fast ferry. What a perfect way to get to Manly fast! About $17 for a return ticket and around 18 minutes one way. Don't catch a cab. For a slower trip, take the slow ferry. Ver basic facilities but the best time and cost option from the city to Manly!

New Year's Eve Fireworks. It is well worth paying a little extra to get a birds eye view of the fireworks. It could have a been better organised but with a few fools trying to take advantage it was always going to be difficult. Despite this the fireworks were spectacular and the best I've seen. The jazz band moving between the ferries were excellent and made the waiting a little easier.
$2.50 all day on Sunday. Go early and enjoy Manly, darling Harbour and Balmain from the harbourThis is the best value for tourists in the world

Great at to see Sydney Harbour. An inexpensive way to get around Sydney Harbour and see the sights. Easy to use with an opal card, it's valid on local trains and busses too, they have a to be the way to see the sights from the water.

Sydney Ferries. As a first timer to Sydney it was very easy to get around. Grab a travel card from a convenience store. Hop on and off and see the sights of Sydney. Walk about and jump back on a ferry. Easy as.

Clean, pleasant and relaxing. I've used a few Ferries in the last 6 weeks and every time it has been a pleasant experience.Of course you on one the best waterways in the world so a comfortable ride just makes the day better.

Great way to travel. I loved the Sydney ferry. Ferries are running all the time we waited no more then 20 mins most time for a ferry lots of seats relaxing and stunning views they have a Opal card that you put money on you can use this everywhere trains light rail, and ferries so easy.

Fantastic Trip. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manley Beach. The woman at the tourist info gave us details and we followed her directions. It took about 30 minutes, a comfy ride and we were able to use out "Opal Card" ( transit card) It was an easy transit, we met people who were very friendly and gave us tips for the beach. Same on the way back, great transit! Wish we had something like it! I would suggest everyone use it!
Circular Quay to Neutral Bay return. A very enjoyable ride that gave us excellent views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House and many other landmarks along the way.
Lot's of fun. A great way to see many sights. We took ferries many days to take advantage of all the sights. The ferries run often so you have lots of time to sightsee.
Lots of Fun. Lots of fun riding the ferries to the other plaes in the area. They operate on time, polite and very reasonable to travel
Perfect way to get around. Perfect and inexpensive way to get around. We took ferry from circular quay to manly beach. It was relaxing and you had the best view of the opera house and the bridge.

Good trip. We used the ferry a few times for trips around the Sydney area. We went to Manley for the day and we were surprised at how busy the boat was. Whilst we always felt safe on the boat we felt uncomfortable at the way people rushed off and on the boat....it seems to be a Sydney trait! Marvellous views of the city from the boat.

Love the ferry boats!. Transportation I learned is so easy in Sydney! Everything uses the opal card that you can purchase in most convenience stores and gets you basically everywhere. The ferries run all day and come about every 30 min depending on where you're going. You get a great view of the bridge and opera house on your way out of the harbor too! I took the ferry to Manly beach, it was about a 25 minute ride and it was super easy and convenient!
Water travel on Sydney Harbour. Great service when we travelled. A different style of travel to busses or taxi. Would recommend this way to get around.
great way to travel. the ferry are a great way to travel around the harbour. You need an Opal card to pay for travel, this can be used on all transport in Sydney and can be topped up at most shops.

Great!!!. Used the ferry to get from manly to circular quay. Took about 20-25min. Was lovely views. Took my friend from Canada on here, Great activity to do with travellers. Would definitely use this again. Park in manly and get the ferry across.
Manley ferry. Really efficient but if you do it have an Opel card allow time to buy your ticket as fairly long queues. We ate at Manley Wine on the South side of the beach. Good salads
Concenient. Ferries are very efficient and run every half hour. The views from the ferry are fantastic. They are easy to board and inboard.
VFM. Used these ferries to get too Manly and Darling Harbour. Efficient and value for money! Pleasant helpful staff! Try out standing up front on the fast boat from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay!

Family day out in the Harbour. We had a great trip up the Harbour towards Paramatta. Smooth ride good toilets on board, busy but OK. Remember your sun block as you might want to be outside. Busy on a Sunday with lots of families and prams, but that's what you get when it's only $2.50 for all day travel. Great value.

Easy and pleasant way to get around. Another essential part of a visit to Sydney is a ride or rides on the ferries which reach out to virtually every place around the harbour. The ferry prices are reasonable especially if you purchase a prepaid Opal Card. the longest trip is to Manly which takes about 40 minutes but a very relaxing way to travel. Some of the larger ferries also have free wifi on board. Many of the ferries are also timed to coincide with connecting buses to other towns/villages in the area which makes travel very easy and convenient even for the novice traveller.

A very peaceful and scenic mode of transport for tourists. Sydney ferries are a great way to get to some of the outer parts of Sydney! It is so relaxing sitting on a ferry and just enjoying the views (and the views are just amazing). Highly recommend catching a ferry to Manly!
Excellent. We took one of the longest ride, and it was great, even though lot of passengers were there, everybody got choice of their seats and able to enjoy the ride, round trip was great

Easy travel with great views. The ferries from circular quay to Manly are cheap and provide excellent views of the harbour,bridge and Opera house.if you are there for a few days,an opal card is useful, and provides cheap travel on Sunday's .

Great ferry services.. There are, I believe, more than twenty ferry services in the harbor, all of which operate very efficiently. They appear to serve all points within the harbor, and generally are centered on Circular Quay, although there are very small ferries that operate at night from other locations.The ferries themselves were always clean, are personnel friendly.

Love the ferries!. I've visited Sydney a number of times and never get tired of traveling on the ferries. They are always on time and a great ride, although they can be a bit dirty inside sometimes. Definitely worth a visit if you come to Australia.
Great service. Great way to get around and see the sights of the city from a different angle. Fast, cheap and on time. Regular service and ready easy to use.

Love the Ferries - just wish they would run to time !!! . We travelled on lots of ferries over the past week, most were round about on time - but when they were late, they were terrible and never an explanation !

Best way of seeing Sydney. They may be old but they are a wonderful way of enjoying the best of Sydney - so much less stress than driving over the bridge and looking for car parking and you can enjoy the trip at the same time. No matter how many times i travel, always feel i am seeing something new.

Excellent service, wonderful Sydney tourist attraction as well as fresh air and viewing platform. Wonderful Sydney. Wonderful Sydney tourist escape from hard concrete and bitumen, space for dreams and viewing this lovely city.
Easy Access to Anywhere. We used the ferry to get to Manly Beach. I wish I had know about buying an OPAL pass. For a relatively cheap fee, you can buy access to buses, trams, trains and ferries.

When visiting Sydney, experiencing one of our ferries is a must.. Sydney is very much a harbour city, and I highly recommend taking a ferry during your visit. A few ideas... Circular Quay to Manly (to enjoy the beach), Circular Quay/Darling Harbour to Cockatoo Island (to enjoy the historic island), or Circular Quay to Jeffery Street Wharf (and then enjoy the walk back across the harbour bridge to the city).

Great Service and always on time. Visiting Sydney again and as always Sydney Ferries give a great service. Staff always friendly and nothing too much for them great service from Circular Quay to darling harbour and also to manly and all this comes with some amazing views from the ferries

A fun way to see Sydney & surrounds. Sydney Ferries provide the ideal way to get around Sydney & allows you to see the wonderful sights on offer. Whether it's a trip to Manly, Watsons Bay or Luna Park. We have even traveled all the way to Parramatta for lunch & then caught the Ferry back to Darling Harbour.
The way to get around!. Timely, clean, fast, and providing wonderful views of all the iconic sights! Take one to the Taronga Zoo.

reliable service enjoyable trip. Used the Ferry to travel over to Tarronga Zoo, on 30th December.
The ferry was busy and there was some confusion over which terminal it was leaving from but it was a very busy day to be travelling.
Wasn't too expensive and was a nice ride across the water.

A great way to see Sydney. You can spend a whole day ferrying from one part of the city to another.. We used the ferries extensively both times we've visited Sydney!! It's a wonderful, cost effective way to see various parts of the city, much better than driving a car! They even use the public transportation electronic card system! The views of the city from various parts of the harbor are fantastic!! On one occasion I could have sworn I was in the Med, near the coast of Italy!! And It's very easy to understand the routes and schedules..... and they travel on schedule!

Integrate a view of the harbour while travelling across it. If you do travel to Sydney especially for a leisure trip, make sure that you do complete some journeys on the ferries. They may be slow but they offer some very picturesque views of the harbour, which means that you must have your camera or smartphone ready to take pictures or footage of the views. The ferries that lead west of the harbour would give you that extra thrill of passing under that Harbour Bridge as you head towards or away from Circular Quay, underscoring what Sydney is about.The best way to enjoy a ferry trip is to be on the outside decks rather than inside the vessel if the weather is sunny.

Great views of the Harbour. We recently were staying at Darling Harbour and were attending a concert at the Opera House. We caught a ferry at the King Street Wharf just a short walk from our hotel. The trip to Circular Quay was lovely, stopping at Pyrmont, Milsons Point etc along the way. The return trip late at night was delightful, like a Harbour Cruise and seeing the city at night. Very enjoyable way to travel.

Best way to get around. They clearly mark which ferry departs from which wharf, Sydney ferries go to luna park,watson bay,rose bay ,manly and other spots, download their timetable online and go travel around Sydney .This is best way to see Sydney and harbour from different views

Cheap way to see Sydney from the harbour. We always use the ferries when in Sydney, they give you a great view of the CBD, Opera House and the harbour.
The Manly ferry is a great way view the harbour all the way to Manly and the mouth of the harbour.
Opal cards make transport very easy and cheap in Sydney

Fantastic. The staff on the ferries were awesome, my disabled son had the time of his life riding the ferries, the staff were courteous and considerate, even fellow tourists were considerate. Great job!
Excellent service. Great way to get around the city. The trip across to Manly is a good day out and a nice way to take in the sights of Sydney harbour.
A good way to get around. A very easy way to travel round Sydney ,to get to many various places in and around Sydney ,easy to get tickets with the information booths next to the terminals .

Nice experience to do . One of the best way to see Sydney harbour bridge and Opera House.
This is one experience you must have to admire the Sydney's beauties.
Get the Opal tickets it helps to save money on your trips.

Sightseeing . Travelling the Sydney Harbour can only be done on a ferry to get the lovely views of the picturesque house and historical sights. You are able to sit inside to avoid the wind or outside to experience the lovely aromatic air.

IT'S A BREEZE. Thoroughly enjoyed many relaxing trips on the ferry. Mainly to Neutral Bay. Lovely cafe at the start of the ferry jetty. Manly trip beautiful. Scenery excellent. Timetable great. displays excellent.

Fast transit between various Sydney locations. Purchase Opal card to avoid lines and get a discount on fares. Check Opal card web site for details. Traveling by ferries is fun and easy. We did not rent a car and public transportation took us everywhere we wanted to go.
Manly ferry.. Manly ferry is a must for anyone visiting Sydney. Amazing views of both the opera house and harbour bridge. Boat trip is very relaxing.

Sydney Ferries are the best way to sight-see Sydney Harbour!. Sydney ferries are an amazing way to explore some of Sydneys' best attractions such as the harbor bridge, the opera house, circular quay, lunar park, and Manly. Sit back and enjoy the breath-taking views from indoor or outdoor seating as you comfortably cruise around the harbor at a nice pace taking in all the views! i would recommend to any traveler wishing to see Sydneys' harbor scene!

Perfect and Fast Way into Some Great Places in Sydney. They work perfectly, timely and with the same Opal Card you use for the rest of NSW Transport System. It takes you over the Sydney Harbour offering great views, a moment to relax traveling over the water and a fast way into places like Taronga Zoo, Sydney Harbour National Park, Manly, Fort Denison, Circular Quay, etc. I loved to explore Sydney by ferry!
An easy way to get around. Took the ferry to Manly, departed on time which is good, smooth trip and returned on time. No fuss easy way to get there and return.

Opal Card Has Raised the Prices!. Used to get a tourist travel pass, good for the bus and ferry for 5 days. Now you need an Opal Card to which you have to add money. Was shocked to see a round trip to Watsons Bay is $12. Of course the ferry crew does not have to handle money now, which is an improvement. Ferry provides good service from Circular Quay to where ever your heart might lead you.

A great way to see Sydney is from the water. Sydney Ferries are not only a great way to get around, but it's an excellent way to do some sightseeing at the same time. Simply jumping on at Circular Quay and getting around to Darling Harbour gives you some great views of the City and the Bridge. The Manly ferry is a must for a day out in Manly and a great view of the Harbour entrance. Taking the Ferry to Taronga Zoo is also much easier than driving there!

Excellent way to cruise from harbor to harbour in Sydney. There are lots of public ferries in Sydney. You can check the routes and pick some of them and spend some time to take an economic cruise around Sydney. Just avoid a crowd and you can relax and enjoy the scenery, sunshine, breeze and wave the ships that passing by. Check L4 and L7 if you need some hints.
go for it. best way to explore Sydney and surroundings. It's always great to take the ferry. Easy and not expensive. And the views back to the skyline and Bridge….breathtaking

Great way to see the Harbor. We had a great time traveling on the many Sydney harbor ferries. Efficient, fun, and a cheap, fun way to see the sights. Why pay for the high priced tourist boats when you can do this?

Great way to travel. The Sydney ferry system is a great way to get around the Sydney harbor. They are fast and extremely punctual. You could set you watch by them. The boats are clean and well maintained. The crew are courteous and quick to provide service when needed.

Great mode of transport. We used the ferry several times during our stay in Sydney to travel from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay. A lovely way to travel and inexpensive - use an Opal card to get around the city.
Take a Ferry. We took the ferry to the Taronga Zoo. Its a great ride--you can enjoy the views. The ferry is clean, punctual and a lot of fun
Beautiful ferry to/from Watsons bay. The ferry ride was very scenic with excellent views of the opera house, harbour bridge and CBD towers and extremely good value for money.
Quick and very scenic way to visit Manly. Lots of great shop and restaurants to experience in Manly, try the fish and chips and sit on the beach front and enjoy the scenery

Ferries are the best way to travel!. I'm a pretty big fan of the Sydney ferries, mostly because I just love boats as a form of travel. These are great because they all come with wifi, are very clean, have a cafe kiosk on board and great spots to sit outside.
On the water . We decided to go on the ferry to Paramatta for the purpose of travelling upstream and back ! Was a great trip really enjoyed it! The views are spectacular! And it's cheap!

Cheap, reliable & convenient. They are so puntucal, affordable, reliable & convenient. Great way to see Sydney's beautiful iconic landmarks and many other bays and islands. Clean and friendly, helpful crew.

Reliable and clean. A great way to get around Sydney, simple route maps make it easy to get the correct ferry. Using an Opal card makes it easier to jump on and off without being worried about buying tickets.

Circular Quay to Manly Beach. We took Sydney Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Beach.
We enjoyed lovely view of Sea with Opera House and Harbour Bridge

The Ferries are a terrific way to get around. We used the ferries to get around to different attractions while we were in Sydney and they were terrific. They are reasonably priced and ran on time. They are clean and the staff are very pleasant.
Very efficient. Variety of ferries all good to hop on and off to see the beauty of Sydney and surrounding areas day and night

Good service and cheap. Ferries offer great views of opera house, darling bridge etc. If you travel on a budget, can get hold of a free opel card (tourist packet) and load with 20 dollar, It cost maximum 15 dollar per day and the rest of the day is free including ferries, buses and trains.

Fantastic!. This must be one of the best of public transport systems in the world. It is also a great way to explore the harbour and it is possible to combine walks around the harbour with ferry rides

See Sydney's beautiful Harbour from the water.. From the Circular Quay, just pick a ferry and climb aboard. The views as the ferry pulls past the Sydney Opera House and the grand old Harbour Bridge will enchant you. On a sunny day, it's like riding on liquid sapphires.

Never waiting long. We caught the ferry on Saturday night to go to Manly for a nice night out for our anniversary, the docks at Circular quay are well looked after and the ferry was well kept. Could use a bit of TLC in areas. Fast, efficient ride across the harbour even in rough conditions. Great crew!

Great way to get around!. My wife and I took the ferry from Circular Quay to Taronga Zoo on Australia Day. What a beautiful trip it was! The harbour was loaded with all types of boats and the ferry ride takes you right up to the Sydney Opera house providing you with views you can't get from shore. The Taronga Zoo itself also is a great sight to see with eagle eye views of the city. The ferries run fairly often and are very clean. You can get a tickets at Circular Quay.
Best value for viewing harbour. A flat rate fare no matter which ferry you take. If you have time take the ferry to Parramatta for a different view of the river and harbour.

Gret way to get aorund.. One of the best parts of our visit was to the zoo! Took the ferry there and that was an attraction in itself. Recommend getting an Opal card so you can ride the ferry (and trains and busses) during your visit.

Great transfer option to see the sites!!. I took the Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Island and the experience was great. Smooth ride, service was timely and the ferry had plenty of both indoor/outdoor seating. They even have a bar onboard to purchase drinks and snacks. Many locals take the Ferry as well so it is very safe and family friendly.

The Rivercat. Today Feb 28, 2016 we caught the Rivercat from Circular Quay to Parramatta .... Sunday fare prices using the Opal Card ... $2.50 each. The trip takes 1 hour 22 minutes, and it was absolutely fantastic. Departed on time (11:07 hours) .... called in a various wharves, passengers on and off, and the crew were great too. Announcing which wharf, helping those with prams on and off, and smiles all round.

Great way to Travel. Have used Sydney Ferries many times, they are a low cost way to access the Harbour, and the views aren't too bad either! Today I caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Milsons Point, the ferry was clean, on time and only cost a few dollars. A great way to travel.
Evening out . Used the ferry yesterday service was great. Went to a concert at Taronga Zoo so the journey to and from the venue was included in the price of the ticket which was great value

Always great value. Sydney Ferries are a must for any visitor, especially the Manly Ferry but do not ignore all the smaller ferries and their destinations. It is not really necessary to go on a harbour cruise, just us the public transport.

Really easy to navigate. Buy an Opal pass from a corner shop and you are good to go. This allowed us to hop on and off ferries for the three days we were in Sydney. Ferries are easy to use and punctual. The best way to get to central Sydney and Manly Beach.
A must-experience. Relatively very cheap with breathtaking views. Also quite a short connection between harbors, which makes it very convenience as transportation.
the world's most beautiful transit system!. it is the most beautiful transit system I've ever seen! take the ferry out to Manly or over to Rose Bay and bring your camera for the ride

Darling harbour at night. We took the darling harbour ferry just before sunset and returned at night. It was a beautiful perspective of Sydney on a gorgeous balmy night. The city lights, the Opera house, the bridge and Luna park were all lit up and looked so pretty. Do this trip at night and you won't be disappointed I'm sure. Plus it's cheap!
Good show for the price. Took the Eco Hopper ferry that went to every stop all the way to Manley and back to Circular Quay. A great way to see Sydney and they give a senior citizen discount also.

Fast Ferries. Take a trip to one of the many places & beaches from this terminal.
All of the ferries quick, efficient and not too expensive

very nice way to get around. we were impressed with how promptly and professionally the ferries were run. They were always right on schedule, and a pretty good bargain too. Using the opal card, they're only $2.50 on Sundays, which leads to large crowds of families, but it's still handled well.

Ferry to Manly Beach. We happened to take a ferry out to Manly Beach on a Sunday, which meant all public transportation was capped at AUD 2.50. It was a very relaxing and enjoyable ride to the Beach and back.

A great way to get around. We travelled to Manly, Parramatta (but there are more frequent fries to the Olympic Stadium) and Watsons bay, where you can walk to Macquarie lighthouse, single station, South Head and eat at the pleasant harbour view restaurant. your travel is by Opal Card, capped at AU$15 per day and as good as the harbour tour but without the commentary. Thoroughly recommended.

A great way to get about.... The Sydney ferry services are well connected by bus/train services
The main ferry terminal at circular quay you can get services to inner Sydney harbour and beyond.
Many of the ferry services accept the "Opal card".
The ferries offer alternative photo opportunities at a very reasonable price.
A great addition to Sydney's already well connected public transport system

How can you visit Sydney without jumping on a ferry!. I have visted Sydney over a period of almost 30 years and the highlight is ALWAYS the trip to Manly by the standard ferry. Now with Opal card this is even better value for money.
Cheap and Calming. The ferries run to and from just about every spot in the Sydney Harbour. They're a really nice way to see the city and are pretty efficient means of traveling.
Great way to get to Manly. Inexpensive and beautiful ride to Manly. Saved $$$ by skipping the tour boat and saw the same sites. Easy to purchase ticket.

Beautiful rides with familia . We had taken our sister and her family for a day trip to Sydney harbour where ferry was one of our modes of transportation. Was incredible and great fun, water was so beautiful, loved it.

Ticket madness. We caught the ferry from the Maritime Museum. Very new dock very smart. This is the place to make friends, as you all try and understand the ticket? procedure. It tells you to purchase an Opal card from nearby shops - don't try they do not stock them. We all got on board without tickets, and when we got to Circular Quay we cemented our new friendships by trying to sort our the mysteries of the ticket machine (buy one or you will become a permanent resident at the wharf). do we need Option 1/2 A or B. You have to solve this puzzle to be able to exit into the beautiful city of Sydney. As the will to live faded away we risked everything and pressed all buttons. Tickets spat out and we were free!!!! A couple of nice 'customer service' people to help us on our way would have been great. BUT my Christmas card list has now got a few more new 'friends'.

Always Love it!. I have taken the ferry quite a few times and it's always great. If you feel a nice sunny day and mood to have fun, the ferry will never disappoint you. I love not seating in this ferry as the views are simply magnificent to miss from inside. If you're confused what to do so you have fun? Get on the ferry.
Messing around in boats. A fantastic and the best way to see Sydney. Cheap and a very pleasant way to see the city as the city is built around a harbour. Best trip is Sydney to Manly.

Easy, On Time, and Affordable. Sydney Ferries are a great way to see the sights within the Sydney Harbour for a fraction of the cost of Sydney Tours. The ferries are typically on time and can take you all around to the Zoo, northern suburbs, Darling Harbour, and so on. You'll queue up to board, but there are always seats. I recommend some of the benches outside. Grab a coffee and enjoy the ride!

An excellent and inexpensive way to know Sydney Harbour . It's very simple to get tickets in the machines and board. You check the route, the dock number and the departure time and then you're there. Even you aren't going anywhere, you can board it and get nice pictures from Sydney's Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, the two main city's landmarks.
Commute. I lived in Manly for 5 months whilst living in Australia and to get to and from the city the quickest way was to take a ferry. Alwaysd great service and on time

Sydney Ferry Travel. Darling Harbour to Circular Quay gives great views from both side of Sydney Harbour Bridge. Manley ferry provides wonderful journey across Sydney Harbour from Circular Quay. Take the traditional ferry and enjoy the ride rather than rushing across on the fast ferry

Great service. Ferries offer fab services along with a reasonable price.
I travelled to Sydney zoo and Manley beach.

Felt like a cruise!!. We took the ferry to manly beach from Circular Quay and could not have been more pleased!I was surprised on how many ferries they had and each one has its own individual name.We were on the Narabeen and they even sold Flat white coffee,and doughnuts and sandwiches!This gave a great view of the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour bridge,and a very scenic relaxing ride to Manly Beach
Fun water trips in Sydney. There are so many ferries of different companies going so many different places that the harbor is always in motion.

A must do if you are a tourist. Just catch the local ferries. Sydney has many ferries leaving the quay to places like The Zoo, Luna Park, Pinch gut island. You can see a large variety of places by just using the local ferries much cheaper than tours. If you wanting good fish and chips 4 lunch catch the Watson bay ferry and get takeaway at Doyles. and eat on beach. Good cheap day out

amazing. Ferries were convenient to catch, inexpensive, they went everywhere you could possible go..Great places to eat along the water front. Sydney Opera House right there, great bar to sit and watch the big ships and ferries or just enjoy watching people.

uet another enjoyable experience. Whilst on holiday in Sydney we took the ferry on several occasions and totally enjoyed each experience, (inparticular the the visit to Manly).The ferries were punctual and clean and really good value.
On time ferry service. The ferry went from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay. It was on time and comfortable enough, the crew seemed to know what they were doing.

Showing overseas visitors around. We did Circular quay to Manly, Watsons Bay and Darling Harbour. A great way to see the Sydney Harbour for very little cost. Buy an Opel card from the newsagent /kiosk and go for it , its so easy.
Excellent Ferries. Excellent ferries, all leave on time and are of high standard, we used Captain Cook cruises as well and found the boats to be very quick and safe

Great ferry service. I got the prepaid card for the trains and ferry and visited Watson's bay and Doyle's restaurant and the trip on the ferry made it very nice and enjoyable looking at Sydney as we sailed past
Great way to see the sights. Used the ferry to go to Manly beach, ferries run on time and are cheap to travel on, recommended for any visitor to Sydney

Take Only The High Speed Ferries!. I bought a ticket on a regular ferry to go to the zoo. I sat through 2 ferries that were listed on the passenger board to be due to depart for the zoo in 3 minutes. However, without any further notice, the ferries arrived, unloaded the passengers, and then left empty, without boarding on any new passengers.The passenger board was updated for the next ferry arrival. Over an hour was lost waiting for the 3rd ferry, that actually boarded passengers to go to the zoo. After complaining about this to one of the locals, I was told to never take the yellow colored local ferries, but to only take the high speed, which look like a white catamaran. You have to go to any of the ticket booths that sell the high speed tickets.
Fabulous way to get around. So easy and quick - avoids all the traffic and a bonus of fabulous views. Go to Watsons Bay and walk up the track to the Heads - stunning views.
The sybaritic life. Just get on a ferry, go almost anywhere, and watch the light, the sea, the cityscape, and the miraculous Opera House. A million-dollar view.

Sydney Ferries are a must!. IF you go to Sydney, you have to use the Ferries. Sydney is awesome, but for me all the beauty and charm of Sydney is found in the Archipelago (if that is the right term). The extended Sydney bay is beautiful, with so many places to see. There are countless beaches, little towns, inlets, etc all accessed by the Ferry system. Unless you have access to a boat of your own, the Ferries are a must.
Great way to see the habour. We found the ferries in Sydney a great way to get around, explore many locations and do so at a reasonable price

Easy way to get around!. Once we bought the Opal card, it was all very easy to get around on the ferries, the bus and the train. We could see so much of the harbour, the Zoo, get to Manly and by ferry, this just made the trips more fun and exciting!

The best views of the Harbour . A friend advised us that the best views of the Bridge and the Opera house were to be had from the Manly Ferry. We only had an hour and a half to spare so it was to be a quick out and back and admire the views.  A fast ferry, with an open deck fore and aft gave us plenty of scope for pictures. A return ticket was about $15, (you have to be a card carrying Australian Pensioner to get a discount price) and the ferry runs every 40 minutes. It was a good way to see the Harbour and a pleasant break from the heat.

Sunday Cruise on Rivercat a must. Picked the Rivercat up from Kissing point and cruised to Abbotsford for lunch at Sydney Rowers. Was a Sunny day so really relaxing outside at the back of the boat. Very quick..we were there in no time. And cheap for the whole family...

The cheapest way to see Sydney from the water. I went to Paramatta and back on the ferry one sunday afternoon recently and was enthralled by the fabulous buildings and interesting scenery on the way. If you do the Circular Quey to Manly route the route to Watsons bay and the Paramatta route you will end up seeing much more than you would on a harbour tour for a fraction of the price. A wonderful way to spend a couple of hours.

Very efficient, punctual and views are a bonus. Ferries- another mode of transport in Sydney but very efficient when you travel from one harbour to another or bays. It includes pleasant views and very convenient as well. if you have time for just one or two ferry rides, you should take ferry to and from Circular Quay - Manly or Circular Quay (30 mins one way) or Cabarita/Cockatoo island (10-15 mins one way)

Amazing views. My husband and I took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. On the way to Manly it was daylight and the views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House from the ferry were amazing. On the way back it was dark so we could see all of the city lights. It was a relaxing, beautiful cruise to and from Manly. It got a bit cold on the way back so we just sat inside. I think every trip to Sydney should include a trip on the Harbour ferries.

A great way to travel. Got the ferry over to manly beach it wasn't the nicest of days, but the ferry ride was not to bad, stopped at a few places for people to get on or off, and the captain was very good at telling us all about the places well worth the money.

Great service. Great service in the most beautiful harbour! We had a couple of nice trips around the harbour on Sydney Ferries. The ride was great, staff were nice and views amazing. One of the ferry services was running 2 mins late. This was announced and apologies were given - great communication!

Convenient and regular. We used several of the ferries, often just for a pleasant ride, enjoying the views. We highly recommend going to Parramatta by ferry. Grab a coffee and croissant for breakfast and go shopping.

Great mode of transport. I catch a Sydney Ferry as often as I can, they are a hassle free way to get around and offer fabulous views of our wonderful harbour. I've used ferries to travel to the zoo, Manly, Watsons Bay and Darling Harbour and had good service every time.

A MUST experience in Sydney. One can take a casual trip on a Sydney Ferry and enjoy seeing the Opera House and Bridge from the water. Perhaps a trip out to Watson's Bay or Manly?However, I have a better idea!My tips for a super day out when you 'motor' past the Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge on several occasions (Sydney Ferries don't sail along or chug - they MOTOR throughout the harbour) are as follows:Research the parts of Sydney Harbour you want to see.Research venues in those parts where you can have morning tea, lunch & afternoon tea. Dinner if you wish.Research the ferry timetables in fine detail, allowing time for visits and connection times at Circular Quay.Get yourself an OPAL card for seamless access to the ferries.I guarantee you'll have a wonderful experience on Sydney Harbour - my harbour.OMG - I want to get on that beautiful harbour tomorrow!!
cheap fun on the water. Great to spend all day hopping on and off these as they go all over. Can take the whole day to tour the harbor area.

Best value for getting around or seeing the harbour.. TripView app will allow you to plan your journey and link it with Sydney buses and trains and give you advice on the next ferry,train or bus should you get interested and want to see or do more at a given locality

great mode of transportation. see the outskirts of sydnetp go to bondi or manley beaches by water with great views of housing in sydney and the sydney suburbs Great way to see th waterways and harbour.
harbour cruise to Manly. Family went from Quay to Manly and was an excellent service. Opal cards made travel a breeze and staff were so helpful
Great way to see the bay. Multiple routes to choose from with frequent departure times. Inexpensive, quick and easy boarding. Fun, relaxing way to see more of Sydney

A good service. On our first morning in Sydney we sat at a café in Circular Quay having breakfast as the ferries cruised in and out of the Quay releasing passengers on to the quayside and absorbing many more back on to hurry them on to their next destination. Later that same day we decided to travel to Manley and used the fast ferry. We had no problem buying tickets, the service was efficient and we left on time both going out and on the way back. We sat on the open deck on the way to Manley because it was warm and sunny. However, on the return journey the weather had turned and it was cold, wet and windy so we sat under cover.

A great view of the bay. A trip on a Sydney Ferry is a must if you want a great view of the bridge and opera house or to take a quick trip over to Manley for the day. The Ferries run regularly, are very cheap, and despite their popularity with tourists, not too crowded.

Great way to see the harbour. Buy an Opal card and see how far you can get on a couple of says on these babies. They do not hang about when they get going and they can take you almost anywhere in the harbour area. Our cards cost Aus$20 and lasted us two days of unlimited local travel on ferries and the local trains - check out the details at the tourist board places that are dotted around.

Get an Opal Card and explore. We spent a week in Sydney and used the ferries to head to Manly, watsons bay, McMahons point, Darling Harbor and other stops.The ferries are a great mode of transport, allow for great photo opportunities and run on time.... catch one at night and get some great photos. Not to mention a novel way of coming home from the Star Casino at 1134 pm.

Sydney to Manly. The Sydney ferry is a great way to see the Opera House and Harbor Bridge with the big city buildings in the background. We took the ferry over to Manly for a quick look around but would recommend spending more time in Manly. The ferry was clean and had plenty of room to move around. A little storm blew up on our way back to Sydney but the ferries are quite large and handle the changing waves well.
Brill..... Loved the ease of these ferries for getting around sydney..straight on and off with regular sailings...get the opal card lot easier....

Outstanding Views. Don't miss a chance to go anywhere on a Ferry. Manly Beach, Watson's Bay, etc. The views from the ferry of the villages, bridge, coves, and water are tremendous. Coming into the harbor at night is spectacular!
Love taking the ferries with my kids!. We usually take the ferry to Manly beach but the ride itself is gorgeous. It is a great way to see the coasts of Sydney!

The perfect way to see Sydney Harbour. This is the cheapest and relaxing way to see Sydney Harbour. There are plenty of ferries to choose from and lots of spots to visit on the harbour. Get away from the city

Too go the beaches . We used the ferries 2 times too go Manley beach the ferries were great they have good system plus they serve food and drinks as well restrooms on board it does take an average 30 min each way we were coming i thought was great service would use them again coming back too Sydney !

Impressive Logistical Feats. The sheer volume of ferry traffic coming in and out of Circular Quay is impressive. And the fact that they seem to keep everything on time is fairly amazing. We took a ride to Manly and returned, and both rides were flawless. I would happily take another ride to somewhere, given the opportunity.
Took a ferry from Circular Quey to Manly. No better way to travel than on the ferry. Fantastic way to see the harbour and get to the other side of the city all on the public transport fare.

Ferry hopping. No trip to Sydney would be complete without a ferry ride to enjoy the beauty of Sydney Harbour. There's no more scenic or peaceful way to travel to Manly or Taronga Zoo or Double Bay & Watson's Bay and anywhere in-between. And travelling on the Citycat into the Parramatta River and back, with Cockatoo Island to explore on the way, is a cheap day trip and equally scenic.

Great Time Waster or Transport. Not being a local I took my father from Circular Quey to Manly for breakfast and these ferries are much more than transport if you are tripping around, even saw some seals playing in the harbour.

Wonderful way to see our Harbour on a Budget!. Take a trip to Manly, Taronga Zoo, or anywhere else and soak in the ambiance of our wonderful harbour, especially if you're an overseas traveller. Even a trip up the Parramatta River is a great way to see our city.

Cheaper than a harbour cruise. We purchased the Opal card once we arrived in Sydney then used that to travel up and down the waterways. We decided on the Circular Quay to Parramatta journey, which took over an hour each way but we saw everything. We hopped off at Parramatta and had a walk along the river while we waited for the return ferry. I think all in all that cost under $15. Great value
Good way to navigate the harbour. Sydney ferries are a good way to enjoy the Sydney views.We took a trip to Manly and took in the great Zoo. Full worth a visit
Take a trip to Manly. Take the ferry to Manly, but when you get off you have to walk through the Corso to the beach, many don't and miss out. Where the ferry stops is not Manly Beach.

Great way to sight see. We took a couple of ferries and they were terrific. Good service, well managed. Fast. Allowed us to sight see en route then we wandered around when we got there.
Both days were hot and sunny and everything looked glorious.
We didn't want to drive in Sydney, so the ferries proved to be great.
Efficient and cheap. Its a great way to move around Sydney and its good value as well. Also the views from the ferry are so much better than from a bus!

A Good way to see Sydney. We were unlucky - it rained for almost all the time we were in Sydney, and the rain started whilst we were on the Ferry from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay. Yet despite that we could see just how attractive the city is.

Best way to travel between the harbours. I used the boat to get from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay and it was great. It was quick and allowed us to get awesome photos of the harbour bridge and the sydney opera house, very cheap too!

Interesting way to see parts of the Harbour. Yes you can pay a fortune to climb to the top of Sydney Harbour Bridge, but a much cheaper way to see the underside is to take the ferry. We took the ferry only one stop across the harbour, passing under the bridge, in the afternoon, and were surprised how expensive the journey was (in relation to the distance). 20 minutes later we caught the ferry back to Circular Quay and the return journey was much cheaper. All journeys are paid for with the Opal travel card.

A differnt view. Take a relaxing "cruise" in the harbor to see things from a different perspective. Very clean, cool, and quiet form of transportation. Several of their docks have many thing to do also.

night and day fantastic sights of Sydney Harbour. Love the night time ferry ride, amazing with the incredible lights of Sydney. Especially ride to Manly. Cool breeze on hot nights. always enjoy the trip.Don't miss the near 80 year old privately owned ferry from Cronulla to Bundeena. Particularly after a storm when half way, where the swell and currents intersect mid stream.. Big squeals from the girls. Fun!National Park to explore on arrival as a bonus. Harbour and boat rides are always enjoyed by everyone.

Exciting ride!. I caught the Manly ferry to get to the city from Manly as it's a much more pleasant ride than the bus trip plus it was a beautiful day. The waves coming thru the head lands made it a more exciting trip than normal! The ferry was bobbing around up and down, side to side and the funniest thing was watching the excitement of the tourists who had never experienced this before. Sydney ferries is a wonderful way to get around Sydney in one of the most beautiful harbours in the world!

BEST DO IT YOURSELF SIGHTSEEING IN SYDNEY. The ferry network is a great way to get out on the harbour and see the sights. There are sure to be day pass type tickets so donlt restrict yourself to the Sydney Manly service. Try also the Rivercat service to Parramatta, taking in all the upper harbour spots. Another great trip is the ferry Circular Quay to Watsons Bay. You can walk south to Bondi, but have a map handy as it is not possibly to "hug" the coast for this walk. Alternatively take the bus service Watsons Bay to Bondi. If you have time left in your day, now walk the coast walk Bondi to Coogee; takes between one and two hours with fabulous coastal scenery. Plenty of coffee shops and eateries at Coogee before you can bus it back to the city.
Inspect the Sydney Harbour. Best time is out-of-peak-hour. Sunset is great. CQ to Manly is very good with lots of attractions to look at in Manly. Harbour view are great!
most beautiful harbour in the World.. Best way to see and feel our harbour, so many historical stories of buildings etc. spring is the best time to appreciate our magnificent harbour

Ferry around Sydney. We booked a hop on/hop off ferry around Sydney, that took us from Darling Harbour to the Circular quay to the Zoo and Manly Beach, Watson's Bay and back.What a great way to see the sights around Sydney, if you're not into CBD;s and auto traffic! Captain Cook's tours are the way to go!
MAnly Ferry. A very leisurely 30 minute trip from Circular Quay to Manly across one of the worlds best harbours. A must for any visitor to Sydney

Safe way to travel the harbour, direct and avoids peak hour traffic.. The ferries are a great way to get to work, travel to events and just enjoy the harbour cheap. Take a sunhat and a few cool drinks, ( no refreshments on board) put on the sunscreen and enjoy a slow hour going round in circles from one side to the other. crowded in peak hours, but OK outside of them. I use them annually several times, most recently last year with children. Arrive early if you have a pram or walking stick and queue near the gangway or as close as possible.

Sydney does it right when it comes to public transport. I would take a ferry over a bus or train any day! Catching a ferry is the best way to see more of Sydney and the Sydney Harbour. The fares are quite reasonable as well.
Great way to travel. This is the best way to travel the harbour. Take in the sights and relax from destination to destination.

Manly Fast Ferry. It was a recommendation from a friend which made me choose the Manly Fast Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Wharf. The journey there and back was excellent - 18 minutes each way, quick entry and exit. The boat was very clean; the crew were great and it was around $8.50 each way.My only complaint is the lack of Opal Card facilities. It makes no sense at all that the only transport card in NSW is not accepted on these boats! Fix this and I would give you 5 star rating.

THE way to get around in Sydney.. This is the easy, reasonable way to get around in Sydney, the added bonus is you get to see great views. We loved standing outside and feeling the wind in our hair. Fun!

Relaxation time. I have been taking a ferry ride from Rydalmere to Circular Quay for quite a while, it is so relaxing and the most beautiful sights on the way, I get to Circular Quay have a cup of coffee or a wonderland wander round for a couple of hours then get the ferry back to Rydalmere where I parked my car without trouble.
