Great introduction to Sydney. You can really see things from the harbor. And the ferries take you everywhere. Great views and photos from the ferries. Avoid "peak" (our rush) hour if you can

Great Way To Get Around Sydney. What an organized city! You can take trains, buses and boats all from the Circular Quay. We took a ferry over to the Tarango Zoo. The ferries were always right on time and a great way to see the city.

The quintessential Sydney experience. The best way to see Sydney and the Harbour is by ferry. On a warm summer day what could be more relaxing and enjoyable than travelling from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay, Manly or up to Parramatta by ferry. The ferries are clean, safe and come at regular intervals. The views of the harbour side suburbs are great and you get to see how the other half lives! worth spending a few hours if you have time.

Cheap transport.. These ferries offer cheap, quick and reliable travel to every place around the harbour. The service is so punctual you have to keep looking at your watch to see if they are exactly on time.
Easy and cheap.. The ferries are easy and cheap to use and take you all over the bay. Lots of room. Lots of seats. Very quick easy cheap way to get around.
Travelled to Manly - what a great service. Loved the ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly. Great service and great price. I would recommend everyone do this

A great way to see Sydney and its waterways. My Wife and I recent boarded the Rivercat at Cabarita Wharf on the Paramatta River and travelled to Circular Quay before transferring for a ride on the Manly Ferry. Views were spectacular just a great way to spend a day.

The ferry system is ADVANCED. There are in total 7 routes of ferry traveling from Circular Quay. I've tried the one from&to Darling Harbor, Manly and Watsons Bay, and they were all WONDERFUL. The one from Darling Harbor to Circular Quay are good for taking pics of the Bridge and the Opera House.The one to Manly are cool because Manly is so wonderful.The one to Watsons Bay is also good but we got off in the middle, and took the bus to Watsons Bay instead because the houses on the East are GORGEOUS.
enjoyable. buy a opal card when you get there " clock on/off " always a enjoyable ride they take you anywhere you might need to go

Convenient way to get there. You can take a ferry to just about anywhere; while they are not necessarily a time saving (especially between Darling Harbour and Circular Quay, you could walk in about the same time), they get you there very comfortably.

Great ride . The many and varied ferries that we travelled on were fantastic. On time. Professional. Courteous. Well manoeuvred. The scenery was beautiful. We could have spent many more hours cruising around the harbour but we ran out of time.

Imaging travelling to work by boat. This is something that I still simply cannot get my head around, but that may have something to do with growing up in a city where the only significant body of water is a creek (or something close enough to one) running through the city centre. The Sydney Ferries are cool, and in fact can be one of the easiest ways to get some parts of Sydney that aren't serviced by a train (and honestly, who really wants to catch a bus?). You can even catch one that goes all the way up the river to Parramatta, but be warned - it is really slow.

Nice tour transport. This a must for 1st time travellers in Australia because you get to see the harbour of Australia ina different perspective. you also get to enjoy the breezy summer air(depending on the season) and get to take a photo of Sydney harbour bridge from down below. awsome!!!
Very easy. A great way to get to other islands! Buy your opal card and use it here! There are safe and very clean ! Always on time

Fun Ride. The ferries are a great way to get to Manly or the Zoo. I caught them recently for both those reasons after not going there for a while. Its awesome when there is a nice breeze and a mild day!

Most beautiful city in the world by ferry. I was born on the Headland at the Manly Hospital, so I might be biassed. I think that the harbour, beaches, parkd and trees of Sydney make it the most beautiful city in the world. Jump on a ferry and explore the gorgeous bays and coastal walks. Grab yourself an Opal Card at a newsagent (there is one at Circular Quay) and potter about for a day. Manly, Watson's Bay, Rose Bay, Cremorne, Mosman Bay or up river Balmain way. Anywhere you go will be beautiful. Then try a ferry ride in the Pittwater up near Palm Beach...endless delights.

Buy an Opal Card and enjoy your bargain cruises!. We bought Opal cards and hopped on and off ferries all around Sydney Harbour during our weeklong stay.The ferries run on time and they and the docks are very clean.Manly ferry on a sunny Sunday was packed but for $2.50 per person return trip you can't complain!
trip of a life time. The ferries are so good to get about the water net work which is cheap and very frequent. They take you around some great places on the trips to ports that they call at.

Fabulous cheap way to see the sights. Catching a ferry on the Harbour is a cheap treat.During the day they are a great way to see the sights and get places but the capped fares on Sundays make them exceptional value.Time a ferry trip to see the sun setting over the Bridge or Opera House in the evening; just fantastic.

Memories of Pam.. My grandmother used to take me "into town" for a ferry ride. Sometimes down the river, but usually from Circular Quay to Manly. Either of these journeys are still great, 25 years later.At the right hour, you will see commuters on the ferries, sat next to tourists. Don't ever become a commuter. They sleep through one of the best local journeys one can make in Sydney. Proof that work ain't right.And if it is the end of the week, you are more than likely to be riding for free on your Opal card. I still sit outside, even there is a bit of swell or wind. Coming back from Manly I always pickup a beer for the memories. To Pam.

Great way to see Sydney harbour. Cheap, efficient and regular. Basic seating with no air conditioning so comfort is not the priority but cheap travel especially on a Sunday gets you around the harbour area.

Great Value !!!. One of the best ways to see Sydney harbour is by it ferry system. You can spend a whole day just riding the ferries getting on and off at different spots which in most cases are cummunities. Restaurants, beaches and retail galore.

Great value, great views. The transport system (Opal) in Sydney is absolutely stellar. It links bus, train, ferries and light rail in one modern, convenient, easy to use system (IF you have constant access to the Internet). The wooden ferries add not only charm but a chance to see Darling and Sydney Harbors by boat without taking a tour. You can even travel by river to Paramatta (which I only discovered belatedly on my way the blue Mountains). In short, can't beat the ferries for an inexpensive way to get around and out of Sydney CBD

Great . Great way to get around and see remote parts of Sydney. The boats run on time and often. Sit outside on the open decks and take in the fresh air. They do need to update their self service tickets machines. I think they are running Windows 95.
fun fast slow, you pick. a must see and do in sydney. great transportation and site seeing venue. can be very sunny up top so bring a hat
Great way to see the sights. One of the forgotten jewels of Sydney, the ferry service is a fantastic I way to get around this busy city, day or night ( fantastic at night )

Wasted a lot of time queuing. Avoid using the ferries on a weekend!! We got to Circular Quay and joined a queue to get to Watsons Bay! People were pushing in and no information was given as to what was happening. There was such mayhem I walked to the front and asked a worker who sarcastically told me I wasn't getting on the next ferry and would be waiting for at least half an hour for the following service if I was lucky enough to get on it! We decided to jump on the next ferry to Cockatoo Island instead which was great! But upon leaving the island there were a few families already queuing and when the ferry arrived, they randomly stopped us and the family in front from getting on and the ferry left!! No explanation as to what was happening yet again until I asked and we were told we had to wait at least half an hour for the next one!! Certainly wasn't how we wanted to spend our limited time in Sydney....
A wild ride. I have regularly travelled by Sydney ferries from Manly to Circular quay. Coming out of the heads can be rough on a good day add some wild weather and it is a wild ride.

To Milsons Point!. It was short trip from Circular Quay(perhaps) to Milsons Point. Just around 5 minutes.We used this ferry to go to Luna Park. It was easy to access to Luna Park because the wharf is next to the entrance and cheap!!And view was very nice. We could see Opera house, bridge and big city.ルナパーク(入場フリー)へ行くためにサーキュラーキー(おそらく)からミルソンズポイントまでフェリーで行きました。たったの5分程だったと思います。ルナパークの入り口とミルソンズポイントの波止場が隣なので電車よりフェリーを使った方が時間を短縮することが出来ると思います。船の後ろ側に座ると丁度オペラハウスや橋、シティが見渡せます。とても綺麗です！ルナパークへ行かなくても、シドニーを一望できるのでフェリーに乗ることをお勧めします！！夕暮れから夜がお勧めです！

Great way to see other areas of Sydney. What a great way to visit all the different areas of Sydney, just buy an Opal card. Opal cards can be bought down by the ferry terminals and can have more money put on them as needed, they also can be used for the bus system.
Ideal public transport. The whole ferry system is excellent. A regular, reliable and affordable service. It is something that Sydney should be proud of.

Easy once you learn how to get around. As the title implies, it was easy getting around the bay area once we learned the system. Within a day, we knew what to do and the fare is reasonably priced. Buy an Opal card and the rest is history.

What better way to commute or sightsee?. Whether you are commuting from the harbour or riverside suburbs or would like to see more of Sydney but on a budget, then jump on a ferry. I take the Woolwich to Circular Quay service 2-3 days a week and never tire of the great scenery. Stopping at Greenwich, Birchgrove and Balmain you get a majestic view of the new city precinct of Barangaroo (Which used to be a retired wharf) and then under the coat hanger; aka Sydney Harbour Bridge and past the Sydney Opera House into Circular Quay. During cruising season there will likely be a cruise ship moored at West Circular Quay.Your ferry crews are friendly and helpful. Listen for their announcements at Circular Quay to get a flavour of Aussie Humour.Recently on a trip home from Circular Quay the deck hand who opens the gate to let you on gave his variation of greeting starting with "This is not the ferry to Portofino but it is going to Cockatoo Island, stopping at Balmain, Birchgrove, Greenwich, Woolwich and then Cockatoo Island".There are plenty of destinations to choose from; including Taronga Park Zoo, Watsons Bay, and of course Manly.You can't beat a ferry!
Cheap & Fun. its cheap and very reliable.. if you leave on the north side or just here for holiday, definitely get on the ferry to the zoo & manly.. they have package price..
Great way to travel in Sydney.. I caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Meadowbank. I loved the experience. Great crews, on time & spectacular views. Highly recommended to all.
Great staff on board!. Crew member came out and offered to take pictures of us in front of harbour bridge and opera house, was fantastic! Travelled outside boat with great views!

Good way to travel. Although many of the big cities have waterways but few of them are worth mentioning. Sydney Ferries are one of those fews. It nicely blends with the city transport system & move people to places. They are pretty fast too. As a tourist you will enjoy it more as it will take you to some places of interest more quickly than any other means possible. Make sure you have the Opal card(available at ferry warf convenient store) with right balance & know the timetable of the ferry from terminal. And off you go..

Clean, on time, efficient, inexpensive. Highly recommend.. We found the ferries a great way to get to the Zoo and Manly Beach.People from all over the world brought together and enjoying the incredible weather and skyline of Sydney.

Best and cheapest way to see the sights of Sydney Harbour. One of the best ways to visit everywhere within Sydney Harbour.Ferries are so frequent. Sometimes on a Sunday they are very busy but all other days are fine.

Good value. Took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly for the day. Cheap and very efficient and well recommended. Loads of seats for the views. There is a 'Fast' ferry which takes 18 mins (12mins shorter crossing) but we were more than happy with the normal ferry. Every 30 mins to Manly and takes 30 mins with excellent harbour views.
Take a ride.. Not only will you enjoy the ride but a great way to see the harbor and various sites including the Bridge. Always meet interesting people and visit as well.

Holiday. We were there a couple of years before and we were told aboutthe ticket you could buy and put on money so that every time you used it it deducted what you owed the card they use now is called OPAL card it can be used some buses some trains and The Green ferries which can take you around Sydney Harbour Highly recommended not to be missedFrank and Rosemary Devon UK

What a great harbour we have. Recently we took an overseas visitor on a ferry trip from Pyrmont to Circular via Balmain East, Mc Mahons Point & Milsons Point. She was "blown away" by the views of the bridge, the Opera House & just the harbour in general.

We enjoyed a quick ferry ride from Darling Harbour to Circle Quey. The ferry was clean and efficient way to get from one place in Sydney Harbour to another. The ferry attendants were very helpful and friendly. We were surprised by fireworks behind the Sydney Opera House and Bridge on our way back to Darling Harbour.

Ferries - A Great way to travel and view the Harbour. Various Ferries criss cross the harbour from very early to very late. It's a great way to look at Sydney from a different perspective, all at a reasonable cost. Easy to get to Circular Quay, Good to get to the attractions around and across the Harbour and a nice ride, wither inside our on the deck of the ferry - your choice.

Visitors to Sydney must ride a ferry.. Every time I have taken the Rydalmere ferry (both ways) it has been very simple,very easy, and a lovely way to travel. Taking a Circular Key Ferry to Watsons Bay or Manly is a MUST for any Sydney Visitor. Spectacular Views, our most expensive housing real estate on show, and the harbour itself, is a great way to showoff Sydney. The Opal Card has made a difference, in ease of travel between modes of Govt transport.

Absolutely excellent. I recommend to use ferries to discover the Sydney from different angle. Buy Opal card, it gives you advantages, when you use ferry frequently. We made some ways for free and we were suprised. We didnt understand the logic behind but we saved min 50 AUD in week per person. Manly ferryis fantastic.
A great way to get around. Always running on time throughout our whole holiday. We were able to see so many of the sights at a bargain price. A huge asset to the city.

Circular Key to Manly must be one of the best ferry rides ever. Great to do even for the views and photos if you are from overseas, great views from another side of the opera house, the other side in Manly you can eat very well and in expensive, check out the day trip tickets they are cheaper, great ferry trip, about 30 mins I think.
Great views. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to the zoo. Fantastic views of the Opera House and the bridge. A lovely and relaxing way to see the skyline as well.

Get an opal card. Best trips from the circular quay. We visited Cockatoo Island historical dockyards and lunch at the cafe. Then a nice day out at Manley. Easy to get Opal card at an Ez Mart and load value to use on ferries trains etc

Great transportation & tours. The ferry system in Sydney is easy to use. The ferries are clean & the staff polite & helpful. It is not difficult to understand the routes and use this system for transportation.
Ferry ride is a must. For me the ferry rides to different parts of town were excellent, especially enjoyed the trip to Manly

Love Sydney's ferries. Sydney's ferries are a great way to see this magnificent harbour. Get your map out a decide which parts of the harbour you'd like to see and then just look up the timetables. The city viewed from the harbour is beautiful. Take the Circular Quay to Darling Harbour loop and travel via Milson's Point, Balmain and Barangaroo or take a Riverboat up the Parramatta River or head over to the eastern suburbs or go straight to Manly on a fast ferry. The options are almost endless and the scenery is varied. My personal favourites are the green and yellow ferries - best ride and it's comfortable to sit outside and feel the wind in your hair.

Handy, Punctual and more fun than the bus.. Travel anywhere within the harbour on the green and cream ferries. As part of the NSW transport system their timetable is integrated with that of the buses so you get off the ferry and at most points will find a bus waiting to take you inland. Also, purchase of the ubiquitous Opal card means that you tap on and tap off for both transport modes so no need to worry about purchasing tickets - as long as you keep the card topped up! If you are using them to tie in with onwards journeys the terminus at Central Quay is a 5 minute walk from the main rail station.In addition to the practicality they are one of the best ways of seeing Sydney harbour and it is always a buzz to pull into Central Quay between the Harbour bridge to your right and the Opera House to your left.

Sailed from Sydney Harbour to Opera house. Although it was pouring down the experience was great. A ticket guy was highly amusing and so friendly helping us with the ticket machines. Great ferry, clean and spacious. Loved sailing under The Bridge. Cheap as chips to get around on the ferries and would thoroughly recommend this way of travel.

Great way to explore the harbour and its many beautiful sights!. Choose any of the ferries for exploring Manly, Taronga Zoo etcThey also can run fairly late too - 10pm from Many back to Circular Quay so you can make the most of days out!
Mind blowing ride. Had been on ferry for a ride with family and kids which was of around 45 min... Lovely sceneries throughout the ride.. Enjoyed Max!!

No better way to see Sydney Harbour. Sydney Ferries is not only the most convenient way to get around and across the harbour, it's a great way to really experience Sydney and the amazing treasure that we have in our beautiful waterway.Travelling on Sydney Ferries is a way to get a close up look at all that Sydney Harbour has to offer - and it's so inexpensive. Sunday is a great day to ride the ferries and enjoy all tat Sydney harbour has to offer.

Great scenery and excellent value for money. We travelled to the Sydney zoo by ferry, and enjoyed fabulous views of the Harbour, opera house and Bridge. Enjoyed a lovely sunny Sunday ferry trip to Paramatta for grand sum of $2.50 return, for a 3 hour return ferry trip. Use the Opal card and the total cost for public transport on a Sunday is capped at $2.50 what a bargain, for a great day out. You can take your own food and drinks on the ferry, or hop out at Paramatta and eat at a local cafe.

Value Transporter. You should definitely take the ferry in Sydney, after Istanbul and its water taxis this was a nice thing to find. The ferry ride going from Mosman or Taronga the views into Sydney are amazing....something to die for :)

A great way to travel. For a few dollars, a Sydney ferry will take you to fantastic locations north, east and west of Circular Quay. The ferries offer the best view you can have of Sydney, whether you're sitting inside or basking in the sun on seating outside, downstairs or on an upper deck. Kids love the experience.

Outstanding Service on Practical Transport on Sydney Harbour. The staff on the Ferries are exceptional. On our occasion to travel from Sydney Central to North Sydney, they actually had pulled up the gangplank as we were arriving. They dropped the gangplank so we could board and avoid a 30 minute wait.The ferries are clean practical transport mode around the waterways of Sydney

Great views. Most places are best viewed from the water if possible and Sydney is no exception. You will have a superb view of the Opera House and Luna Park this way, and can travel all the way along the harbour to Watsons Bay. Check the timetable at transportnsw.infoIt's very inexpensive and only $2.50 for all-day travel for seniors.

Great way to see Sydney Harbour and explore the ferry suburbs. The ferries are a fabulous way to get about Sydney, used by locals and tourists alike. They are reliable and cheap, and what is better than to travel on the harbour - its what Sydney is famous for.The iconic Circular Quay to Manly ferry ride gives you a 30min harbour cruise out to the heads for $8. Catch the ferry to Taronga Zoo, or why not hop on over to Balmain and have a mooch around one of Sydney's oldest and picturesque suburbs.There are a whole bunch of destinations to choose from, and I think every journey I take on the ferry is an experience in itself.

Great value way to get around, and get some amazing views. This is a really simple way to get around that's kinder to your wallet than taxis, and much better for your feet. There's plenty of ferries that go, and they are comfortable and reliable. Definitely recommend these to anyone.

Cheap cruise. I love our Harbour and again I say its great to see it all from the water. Its so cheap to use our ferries. When I travel to other countries I always use ferries if available to see a different perspective of the city I'm in. And its a great cheap way to get out on the water.

Convenient. Riding the Sydney ferries is a great way of getting from here to there. Especially on a Weekend when traffic can be bumper to bumper. This mode of transportation is timely, safe and except for the Sunday crowds easy. The reason I haven't given them a better score - they are uneven. Some are on the newer side and quite comfortable others are old and dingy and a bit dirty. So hope you luck out with the newer, cleaner model.
Best Way To Do Travel In Sydney. Great opportunity to relax whilst travelling in Sydney; try to do it daily if you can. Clean, relaxing, on time and a vista to die for.

Leisurely boat trip up river. The Sydney ferries are a fabulous way of seeing those out of the way places without needing a car. You can take ferries from the harbor to such places as Taronga Zoo, Manly, Cockatoo Island, as well as one we took round trip to Parramatta. The ferry stops along the way, but the scenery and time spent just cruising up and down the river is a nice way to spend an afternoon and get oit of the city a bit. Parramatta has lovely restaurants as well as a large Westfield mall. The ferries are a great mode of transportation alternative for visitors and locals alike.
Sydney trip. Absolutely fantastic this is the best way to get a cheap view of the habour and all the landmarks best views totally amazing

A very efficient way to travel in Sydney. Fancy travelling to work every day by ferry on beautiful Sydney Harbour.Or if you are a tourist, there is no better way to get around, than a trip by ferry. Whether it be to Manly to visit the beautiful beach and restaurants, to Double Bay for boutique shopping & dining, the zoo (spectacular), Darling Harbour, Watson Bay or many other destinations, this is a cheap, reliable and efficient way to go.

The only way!. Sydney Ferries, and the hop on, hop off open top buses, are THE only way to see Sydney, and get around the place! They really are fantastic! run very frequently, and are great value and great fun too! Very friendly staff! Excellent!

so much fun, best way to enjoy the harbour if u don't have a boat of your own. I love the ferries. They are iconic in Sydney and on a fine day, the best way to see our most gorgeous harbour. The best in the world. You must check the timetable, otherwise you could be waiting a while.

An Easy Way to Get Around. If you need to travel from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay or visa versa, the ferry is a great way to travel. On Sunday, when you use the Opal Card, you can travel by light rail, or ferry, or bus and only spend $2.50 all day. We traveled over to see the Sydney Opera House, and then traveled back to Darling Harbour for dinner at one of their restaurants.

Only way to Travel! . Loved taking the Ferries to attractions. Darling Harbor and the zoo, we're the two major places we used the Ferrys for. Fun just to use the Ferrys to get a great view of the city! Very relaxing
a ferry to Manly. This was an excellent way to get around the many harbors, convenient, cheap, safe and reliable. Better the a touristic boat ride
Great Way To Get About. The ferry is an easy way to get around. The run on schedule so don't be late! Very clean and inexpensive.

Just go across the Harbour!. As many times as I have seen events and TV shows in Sydney on my TV, I never realised just how enveloped by the Harbour Sydney is. There is water everywhere. It sorta makes getting around a little tricky. So, instead of walking around the water, just go over it! Sydney Ferries are a public transport system, which means that, like all other public transport in Sydney, they're very expensive (especially as Sydney only accepts NSW concessions). They're worth the price if you're able to do the Circular Quay trip, or if you're looking to head down to Manly (which is further away than I thought). Would definitely recommend these if you've got a little time on your hands while wandering Sydney!

BEST VALUE IS A SUNDAY. Remember: Sunday to travel all around Sydney whether by train, bus or ferry it is capped at $2.50/person all day on Sunday. So jump on a ferry off & on & will be the best £2.50 you will spend. This is on an OPAL card only.

A must do part of any visit to Sydney. Taking a ferry from Circular Quay to one of the other places dotted around Sydney is a must do on any trip to Sydney. Even if time is limited you could take the ferry across to Milsons Point to get a different view of the Harbour Bridge and then walk back over the bridge. If you have more time then lunch or dinner in Watsons Bay or Manly Beach would be a great trip.

easy to use. visited sydney for the first time recently and like anyone, being in a foreign place can be overwhelming let alone figuring out how to get from A to B. Sydney's ferries are so easy to use! we went from darling harbour to circular quay multiple times, whilst seeing the sights.
Best to get Opal and travel on Sunday. $2.50 to go anywhere on Sunday. Best way to go to the beach and other historical sites in Sydney CBD.
Very effecient. The ferries go all over the waterways of Sydney are very good. They are a great way to see the area with out paying for fancy tours.

How to get where you are going. The best and most fun way to explore the city, whether you are going to Taronga Zoo, Darling Harbour or Manly, just hop on a ferry at Circular Quay. Don't be afraid to use an OPAL card - very easy and cost efficient way of public transportation.

The only way to become a Sydney-sider, replete with shades and take-our capucchino. I have, as most Sydney-siders do as well, a love affair with the crushed sapphire liquid expanse of the harbour. It girds the city like a liquid lover, a staged tableaux orchestrated by the beauty of its surrounding suburbs. No trip to Sydney is complete without clambering aboard one of these picture-postcard, green & yellow ferries that ply their trade as they have for a century- and- a- half. Why not join me and the rest of the 14 million people who criss-cross the harbour annually, chugging out from mommy-central-hub of Circular Quay to head west up the Parramatta River (known as the Parra), or north on the legendary voyage to Manly or east to Watsons Bay. When the femme and i want to drink and dine in Balmain, shop in Double Bay, sight-see Taronga Zoo with the wee munchkins or glamp at Cockatoo Island, the Sydney Ferries are the way to go. Ditch the car. I am fascinated by the variety and array of ferries, all 28 of them, some stately old dames called "schoolers", others called First Fleet models, to the sleek, fast catamarans that glide the river and harbour... connecting all of watery Sydney with 29 wharves across 37 kms of harbour. So, put on your shades, baby, settle back on the upper deck, alfresco and soak up the cheapest , coolest and quintessetionally best local experience.Check out the following Routes: Manly. Known charmingly as "seven miles from Sydney, a thousand miles from care" is an easy target via the Manly ferry. It's a unique thrill... the soothing chug of the motors... the tranquil churn of the BIG BLUe beneath... the spectacle vistas passing by all encased in the smug serenity of knowing that only in Sydney can you make this run. If adrenalin is your mistress, then choose an inclement day fraught with strong winds and experience the roller-coaster ride to be had crossing infront of the Heads.Parramatta. Skip the congested 23 kms of noisy highway between the CBD and here by taking the sexy option of zooming from Circular Quay along the backwaters by a sleek, super-fast RverCat catamaran for a one-hour relaxed journey. Mosman.... Getting close and personal with this historic and beautiful enclave is best done with a ferry that glides past the gorgeous harbour real-estate, Cremorn Point, Taronga Zoo, South Mosman, Old Cremorn and finally the queen-in-residence, Mosman Bay. You will spot the difference especially seeing how the other half of Sydney lives. Its very posh, expensive and gloriously enriched by exceptional historic architectural piles of sandstone magic. Cockatoo Island.... Named after the squawky sulpher-crested parrots who lord it in the skies over Sydney at high decibel sounds. This is Sydney's largest harbour island, 18 hectares in size and boasts the premier glamping site in and hosts The BIENNALE while still out-wowing the art showings. The ferry ride is a wonderful glide past iconic places in Sydney. Pack a picnic and enjoy the bounty that this magic spot offers. Darling Harbour..... only a 20- minute riding under the beautiful Harbour Bridge across from the Opera House via the gourmet village of Balmain with its nexus of eateries , bars and cafes bringing you to the Entertainment Quarter, Imax Theatre, Sydney Aquarium Wildflower World, Chinese Gardens , Madame Tussors, and the panoply of restaurants in Cockle Bay and King Street Wharf. Watsons Bay..... this is the ride to "the long lunch" destination. Its the most refreshing experience by ferry in terms of passing beauty and the culinary options of fish and chips or a slap-up-do with wine to accompany this iconic kiss- of- beauty location. I would recommend a gentle walk apres your indulgences, to nearby Lady Beach, where wowsers beware: there is a legal nude beach. Always carry a towel my good mother advised. Enjoy.

Why no bar on board?. For service , efficiency, friendliness, cleanliness and value for money these boats are excellent.Why no bar on board? Given that most of the travelers are tourists going out for the day the experience could be bettered with a glass of something cold. Even the Thames Clippers which are far more of a commuter experience and run by local authorities in London have a bar selling wine and beer. Well just a thought. I guess they won't get any more travelers but they might make a bit more profit.

Nice change of pace.. I thought the ferries were a nice change of pace. The ride last from 10 minutes to 30 minutes depending on where you're going. The seats were comfortable and the ferry very clean.

Busy but handled very well. We were packed in like sardines to board the ferry but it was done so quickly professionally and on time! When we got onto the ferry it was very spacious. Staff were very clear concise ad friendly. Great job!

Super service. Jumped on at Darling Harbour and saw all the sights, Sydney Harbour bridge, Sydney Opera house and do much more besides for 6 Australian dollars friendly and fantastic service. No real need for more expensive sight seeing tours Australian transport has already laid in on...

Really good way to see the harbour. Cheap and easy way to cruise the harbour and take some great pics of the sydney opera house and harbour bridge.
I went to Taronga zoo for only about $7 so got to see the harbour before and after the zoo. Good value!
THE way to travel in Sydney. Get one of the new Opal cards for access to all the ferries and buses. After spending I think it was 10 dollars the rest of the day is free. So much to see

Manly ferry. but if you like us elderly take the cat to Paramatta $ 2.50 trip for seniors
good way to see and enjoy more of Sydney

Dont pay for a fancy ferry ride, get on these ferries and see the harbour for $3. Best thing to do is to jump on a ferry (platform 5) and get on the one that takes you around the harbour from circular quay, darling harbour, luna park, milsons point and back again. Its better at night but just as pretty during the day. I love doing it and better than those expensive, over the top boat rides being sold to tourists in the harbour.

Iconic and great value!. As a former resident and now a regular visitor I can't recommend Sydney Ferries highly enough! Whether it's the iconic trip to Manly, the newer route to Parramatta or a shorter journey to Watson's Bay or even Darling Harbour, the ferry is an inexpensive way to see many of the sights of Sydney right from it's magnificent harbour! Like the Vaporettos of Venice or the Star Ferry in Hong Kong, these are commuter vessels that provide an affordable way to see the sights of the jewel in Sydney's crown! Must do!

Great way to see the area. Travelled to Manly and Darling Harbour using the ferry service. They leave every 10 - 15 minutes and at around 6 - 7 dollars for single journeys they represent excellent value for money. You get excellent photo opportunities of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House.

Great way to see the harbour cheaply. Fantastic way to get to the zoo and Manly and get a harbour cruise thrown in for free !Part of the opal card system and with A $15 midweek cap they are good value.

Tour the harbor. We took the Captain Cook ferry for a sightseeing tour of the harbor and thought it a great bargain for the price. We didn't do the hop-on/hop off portion, but still had about a 2-hour tour to see the many bays and coves. It gave us a better sense of the expensiveness of the harbor and a brief look at some of the different beaches.

Still the best way to see the harbour!. The kids had never been to Sydney so a great chance to explore. The ferries are still the best way to see the harbour - all the sights, none of the traffic, and great value! Kids were amazed - still one of the most beautiful sites and sights in the world!

Pretty decent and great views. I have used 2 ferries. One to darling harbour (shorter ride) and the other was the Eco hopper ferry that takes you to different locations including the Taronga Zoo and Manly beach (beautiful views). Easier than taking a bus and refreshing ride to your destination assuming there is no rain.

Easy to get around. Taking the ferries allows you to cross the Sydney Harbor in a fun way. It was fun as a visitor to be able to see the harbor from different angles and to get on and off wherever you like.

The day we went to Manly. We had an Opal card which we used on the 40 minute ride over to Manly.Manly is a bit unique as it has a beach inside the Sydney harbour and a beach on the Pacific Coast. The ferry drops you in the harbour side and it is a short 500m walk to the Pacific beach.We ate Fish and Chips overlooking the Pacific. Wonderful apart from having far too many chips.The trip to Manly is well worth doing.

Circular Quay to Manly Beach great scenic views. We took the Circular Quay to Manly Beach ferry and returned about three hours later. It is a wonderful scenic view of the Sydney Bridge and the Sydney Opera House both coming and going as well as all of the beautiful houses and beaches lining the bay on the way out. Manly beach town is interesting to walk around for a few hours many restaurants and bars along the main walkway/Street from the ferry terminal to the beach. Definitely worth a visit!

Good Service. A great way to see Sydney Harbor without paying a lot of money. For tourist, purchase a Opal Card with unlimited travel (A15 a day) and all ferries are included in the price. You can travel from Circular Quay to Manly, Darling Harbor and for something different take the ferry to Parramatta. This is a great trip as you get another aspect of Sydney and see how many areas in Sydney border the harbor.

The ferry to Manly is the best cheap attraction in town.. The ferry ride to Manly from Circular Quay is a very inexpensive way to see the spectacular views of Sydney Harbour, the bridge, the city, and the opera house. I enjoyed it immensely. Definitely something you should do when visiting Sydney.
Eaay as. Great just for a trip around harbour. Easy to use and great for families. Cheap to use as well, we love doing the family manly trip

Fun ride!. I took one of the ferries with couple of friends in the evening it was an amazing experience during the sunset by the time we were back it was little dark so we had the sunset view and the night view too when lights are on for all tall buildings, there are ferries that take u far for dolphin watch too.
Love the ferries. Can spend hours on these ferries - great way to get about - plenty of trips to keep you exploring in and around sydney.
Relax and enjoy. Take a ferry to anywhere just to enjoy the scenery and peacefulness. Can get to so many places in Sydney using this mode of transport.
Good but a bit pricy . Good but is a little bit expensive! Lots of times though and different ferry options like Luna park and darling harbour.

Pleasant. The ferries, especially the manly one, are great and spacious. They are shaded so they cater to most types of weather conditions. They have free wifi and a canteen which is awesome. They could be a little cleaner however.

Breezy,mellow, and a nice way to travel. Worthwhile going on the ferry even if you want to cool out after having a wonderful day at the beach. Very nice trip, you may even see a few whales /dolphins whilst there.

Fast and comfy transportation. I liked to take the ferry as transportation method. It's really fast (depending where you have to go) and you have a great view on Sydney's skyline when going back to the harbour.

Easy. The ferries are an easy & convenient way to get around Sydney. Make sure you check the time your boat is meant to leave, but do not fret if you miss it, because there generally are multiple boats that go out a day.

Slow but good for views and taking photos. A bit worn.. Really enjoyed our ferry ride to Manly and back. It was quite hot inside and the ferries seem quite worn and old. But the trip is great, the views are amazing. One of my favourite things we did in Sydney.

Waterway travel.. With the new Opal card, we have been able to travel extensively for no more than $2.50 per day. It's so easy. Covers trains, light rail, bus & ferries. The ferries are such an easy way to travel around Sydney. As well as the ease of travel, the views of the famous Sydney Harbour bridge & Opera house are a sheer delight.
great trip to Manly. Great short trip to Manly on the ferry, A superb starting point for Sydneys northern beaches. Just half an hour will get you to Manly

Great Transportation. I get motion sickness easily, so being on this was great. I stood outside with the fresh air so there was no issues or feel sick at all. The ride was smooth and didn't feel like it took long.This is a great way to get to Manly Beach or the Zoo
Excellent . Excellent way to escape the city and very cheap to travel to the beaches get a return ticket or just stay at the beach eg manly beautiful place to visit
Transport by ferry. Best way to travel around Sydney - speedy, cheap and the views!!! You can get to anywhere and it's a treat as well as a practical transport option.

A great way to travel. Frequent, efficient, fast and regular, these ferries are used by daily commuters as well as visitors and tourists so they are well maintained, clean, efficiently run and easy to use. Accessible for disabled, well organised timetables, you can catch a ferry to pretty much anywhere from Sydney; our trip to Manly was very easy, we just turned up on the day, checked out the departures board and bought our ticket. No queuing, they are very well organised, no pushing and shoving because there are plenty of seats, it's a great way to travel.
great value. These ferries are amazing value for money and run everywhere and always on time, cant fault them.Highly recommended.

Expect to wait. The last few times I have taken the ferry, I had to wait approximately 4 services (which on two occasions was well over an hour!!) to eventually board a ferry that had space for passengers. It's appalling how the service operates. They should operate the service so that the ferry picks up passengers every two stops. That way, every second service should, ideally, pick up passengers. Once you're on the ferry, it's pleasant and clean. But you have to get on the ferry in the first place.

A bit pricy for mass transit. There is no denying that the ferries make getting around the harbour areas easy but at the end of the day they are mass transit which I ride elsewhere quite frequently. For that I find them on the expensive side and with time gaps between that are on the long side. It can sometimes take less time to walk the distance than wait for the next ferry. Pretty views if you do ride them though.

Convenient way to get places in Sydney. The ferries can get you to a whole lot of places quickly. It also doubles as a provider of beautiful views of Sydney Harbor. The boats are relatively fast and efficient with their scheduling.

Take a ride at night!. For the most part, the ferry is what you would expect from public transportation. Lots of school groups and business people during the day. Very busy. But the really gem is taking it at night! We took it back from Darling Harbor to our hotel next to the Sydney Bridge. Since there were so few people on the ferry, we were able to move around during the ride, taking in all the incredible views. Sailing under the bridge at night was spectacular!

awesome way to get around Sydney. We always catch the Sydney Ferries when go to Manly from Circular Quay even just to Darling Harbour. Fare is pretty reasonable and you can see the opera house and harbour bridge from the ferry. You can even just go around the stops in the city and such beautiful view during sunset

Workhorses of the harbor. As part of the public transport system in Sydney, the harbor ferries, decked in their green and yellow livery, take you hither and yon, bustling across the waves round to Manly, up to Parammata, across to Taronga. Tourists and working men and women alike travel in the most beautiful harbor in the world for a small price, and the best job of all must be to drive one of these back and forth.Good value for money and a great way to explore Sydney.
Manly to Sydney. Very crowded but it was Boxing Day. Always the BEST way to enter Sydney and get those postcard photographs. Really great value.
Easy and quick to navigate. Sydney has a wonderful transit system and the ferries are a great and cheap way to get a harbour tour.

Nice ride accross the harbour. This is the cheapest way to go on a boat on Sydney harbour.
Its a nice 20 min ride to Manly or just across to Taronga zoo.

Love love the Sydney ferries and Circular Quay. Some things don't change and some things don't need to. Case in point, Sydney ferries. I remember going on them as a child and the memories always come flooding back. Iconic Sydney harbour transport. The views of Sydney Harbour from a ferry can not be beaten. Slow and usually steady, depending on the weather. Cheap transport and outstanding views! Love love Sydney ferries

Perfect scenic way to get around Sydney. You can't visit Sydney without experiencing the ferries. We took the Manly ferry one afternoon and went in the opposite direction the next through Darling Harbour to the National Maritime Museum. A cheap and scenic way to get around Sydney and see the sites from the water

Travel by water. A very efficient and inexpensive way to get around Sydney. A trip across to Bondi is a must. We went to the zoo as well...besides all the animals the views of Sydney from there are worth the visit alone. We also went across to Watsons Bay for lunch one day..on a sunny day the views are spectacular...

A great way to see Sydney from the water ... and to go from one side of the bay to the other for a visit. On a beautiful sunny day, approaching downtown Sydney, and the Opera House, by water is gorgeous. I snapped to many photos as we made our way through the water. Everywhere I looked there was something special to see. LOVED IT!

Avoid traffic jams.... An extensive ferry network (7 different services) that crisscrosses the Harbour that we used to visit several tourist destinations (Taronga Zoo, Darling Harbour, Mossman, Neutral & Watsons bays) during our stay in Sydney... We purchased a stored-value Opal card so we could tap on/tap off during our various trips & stops en route... Also downloaded a map of the ferry network & schedules from Transport NSW website to plan each trip... This was an easy & economical way to travel around the Sydney environs... Just had to remember to avoid peak travel times as local residents use the ferries to commute to work...

Iconic Ferry Service. Took the ferry from Sydney Harbour to Manley, visited the beach but it was the ferry I was interested in. The journey took just about 30 mins, $15 return, great value and a must if you are in Sydney.

Great Supporter of This Mode of Transport. We have made many recent trips on Sydney's ferries visiting all of the suburbs that are serviced by the ferry system.We have always been treated courteously and with respect by the staff, especially when I was on a walking stick due to an injury. This service is cost effective and gives you a new perspective on the Harbour and Parramatta River.We recently took our three grandchildren with uis on a visit to Manly from the Quay and the three of them loved it, although we had to restrain the 6 year old from leaning over the rail! But that's just what kids do, I know I did it to my parents.All in all, a fantastic asset to the city and to the people of Sydney.

Sydney Ferry Ride Experience. It was a new experience for me and my kids doing the Sydney Ferry ride, it was just a bit of chaos at Circular Quay due to so many people. It would have been nice to easily find out which ferry goes where. It was great value being tourist for only costing us $2.50 for the trip however, we had to get an opal to be able to do so.

Our main mode of Transport from Darling Harbour to Sydney. Use the local Opal card. A contactless rechargeable card used on all buses, ferries and trains / trams in NSW including Sydney. Such good value. Buy from a 7/11 store and charge up (like a London Oyster card) the costs are small compared with most other countries. The ferries run to a timetable and keep to it. Excellent way to see the harbour for little cost.

Very Efficient & Best Way to get Around Sydney. If one wants to visit various far flung attractions of Sydney such as Manly beach, the ferries are the best option.Ferries are very regular, punctual, fast and cheapest mode of transportation. They are clean and well maintained.

Public transportation with a view!. You get to use the same card system as the buses and trains (the Opal card) because these ferries are part of the public transportation system. Go to Manly beach, Taronga Zoo, Watson's Bay, or any of the other beautiful areas in Sydney without hassle. They run on schedule and are safe and reliable. What more could you ask for. Oh yea, the beautiful views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House are NO extra charge!!

Very Cost Effective. We were in Sydney for six days and used the ferries extensively. You can get great photo's from the ferries. We found that the Opel cards were such good value for money. You can travel on Ferries, buses and trains with these cards and never get charged more than $15 a day for unlimited travel.

An interesting way to see the harbour. Sydney harbour is a labyrinth of bays and inlets, and the city surroundings must rank among the most picturesque in the world.The Sydney public ferry system is well run, clean and punctual. You can visit many interesting places on these boats. The crew members are polite and helpful and the boats are safe with ample emergency equipment.You can of course get magnificent views of the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and other waterside attractions from the ferries. The cost is reasonable although not cheap and the boats are very skillfully maneuvered. Many of the ferries start and terminate at Circular Quay and you can pick up a timetable there or search online. Look out for the distinctive yellow and green coloured boats.
it is worth the money and the trip. you get to see many places thru a ferry. it is so relaxing. our children love the trip. we even learn some history about australia and some trivia.
cheap and quick. cheap and quick, perfect views make sure you get a place outside. its very good in terms of seeing things.

Efficient, cheap and the best way to see the sights. Admittedly, some of the ferries are somewhat dated but all are spotlessly maintained and their old-fashionedness adds to their character. The ferry landing stages are all very modern, with state of the art systems that ensure smooth running and pretty good punctuality. During my time in Sydney, I used the ferries on a regular basis to get to the north side and to visit Parramatta, Olympic Park, Manley, Darling Harbour etc. Being in the middle of Sydney Harbour bobbing up and down with one of the best 360º views in the world, will forever be one of my most cherished memories of Sydney. I recommend using them as much as possible.
Good to use. Take a trip out to Manly in the morning and enjoy a great beach for the day. Plenty to eat along the walk to the beach

Get your Opel card before boarding. New travel system, buy a opal card from any convenience store, use the card to tap on and off the ferries which arrive like buses. Easy to use but keep an eye on your card if your credit is too low you cannot get on without topping up your card as they have just gone ticketless. Ferries really easy to use, choose your destination see when the ferry is departing on which quay and jump on and off. Best news is any journey on a Sunday is fixed at 2 dollars 50, the same for the buses. So if you are going to visit places further afield like Manley go Sunday. The ferries are very reliable and come on time with quick turnaround. Seating is inside and outside perfect for the tourist photos of the harbour bridge and opera house. We used the ferries for Manley, Watsons Bay and a quick trip to Darling Harbour. The Opel card you purchase for the great ferries can also be used on the bus services to Bondi etc.
Best way to get around the harbour. Best way to get around sydney harbour. Take the ferry to other city locations including. Luna park Taronga zoo manly beach and much more.

a millionaire's trip by public transport. We took the ferry from circular quay to Abbotsford. The ferry staff were courteous and very helpful suggesting lunch at the sydney rowing club right at Abbotsford Wharf.We dined on beautifully prepared fish and salad washed down with sauvignon blanc all the while drinking in the magnificent view. We the continued to Parramatta for coffee at the wharf and then back to sydney by ferry.You could not afford a day as delightful as this any where else in the world. Well done Sydney Ferries.
Great way to see the city. Took the night ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour. Got the most amazing view of the bridge, opera house and Luna Park. Was a beautiful finish to the evening.

The Sydney Ferries are an easy way to get around Sydney. We travelled on the Sydney Ferries many times during our stay in Sydney. We caught trains to Circular Quay and made our way to many destinations via the Sydney Ferries. The staff and crew were always happy and helpful. We think Sydney has the best transport system in the whole of Australia.
Quay to Darling Harbour. Sydney Ferries should run every 10 Minutes to Darling Harbour to help both visitors and businesses. This would relieve the long queues

Cheap way to travel to the Zoo or Manly from the City. The locals take these old ferries for granted as they are used for public transportation on the Opal Card system and plenty use them from little piers and the big Manly pier to get to work at Circular Quay and nearby. So if you avoid the rush hour crowd, and you are not unlucky to get a big swell or pelting rain, sit outside and enjoy the view as you go past the Opera House and Harbour Bridge and visit a jetty or a pier. The frequency of some services, including the one to the Zoo, could be better but simple planning will fix that. The view coming into Taronga Zoo is fabulous and the skyrail up is just great and that part is free until you want to enter the zoo itself.

A lovely way to see the harbor (when it's not raining).. Took the ferry from Circular Quay to Mosman Bay, Birchgrove & Watsons Bay. Short trips but provide lovely views of the coast line & different aspects of Sydney downtown. The ferry staff haven't quite figured out how to deal with the surge of humanity that try to all board the ferry at the same time - but that's typical of government workers isn't it? Best to arrive at the boarding gates 10-15 minutes before departure to avoid the crush, especially in rush hours or sunny weekends.

Best way to see the sights. Best way to see the opera house, Sydney harbour bridge and Luna park, and fun way to get to Taronga zoo with no parking worries. Don't forget to get a free opal card for discount tickets, and ease of getting around. Sunday has $2.50 all day travel on ferries, buses and trains.

Love ferries. Love going on a ferry, loved the fact it was on time (take note state rail), loved the fact is goes on top of the water, love the fact it did not stink and love the bit where the wharf fisher man had his line in the propeller and subsequently lost his nice looking rood reel and tackle to the depths of the harbour. only one issue 0 thise stuping one at a time ticket machines and no where to buy an opal card!!
A fun way to see the Sydney skylight. A great, easy way to explore some of the islands and beaches around Sydney and the views of the Harbour including the Bridge and Opera House are fantastic
Great value for money. Fabulous value for money and you get all the views of the harbour from the water. Every time we used them we met someone with a connection to home - bizarre!

Best Way to get Around!. It is truly a pleasure to go about Sydney on ferries to so many attractions of interest. Beautiful breezes, picture vantage points. The experience of a lifetime! Get pix of you and family/friends on board ships, at reasonable cost...

An alternative vantage point of the Harbour Bridge. One afternoon we decided to go to Manly and take the ferry. We got on at Circular Quay. I really enjoyed my view of the city from the ferry. Make sure to get seats outside (preferably on the right side) so you can really enjoy seeing Sydney from the waters. I especially loved when we were about to cross the Harbour Bridge as it towers above you, giving you a really nice vantage point.

lovely ferry ride. we went to manly on the ferry last week it is a lovely hours trip away. you get great views of the opera house and bridge and on the way back we got some great photos of the city skyline as the sun was setting. these are very efficiant ferries running every 30 mins.

Off to Manly in ferry!! Eh!. Yes! We were at circular quay and took ferry to reach Manly! Very nice experience and with opal card with 8 trips completed becomes a free ferry travel! What else you want!!

Great practical way to see the harbour. A very convenient way to not only get around Sydney but also a great way to sight-see the main features of the city. For not much money, you can spend some time out on the water and get across from the Quay to the north part of the city where it's a little more laid back but still plenty to do.

Great way to get across from Manly but a bit pricey. We wanted to go across to see the Opera House / Jet Boating etc. We had a car but seeing we were staying in Manly we thought it was a treat to go across on the ferry. We asked for 2 adults & 2 kids tickets to go across to the harbour. They charged us for 2 adults & 1 kid (as 1 kid rode free - not sure why) which was around $40. Whlle we were there we thought we would go and see Luna Park (thinking the tickets would give us a few hours of ferries) after getting back from Luna Park we realised that the tickets were just for up and back. (different system to Melb) anyhow we paid another $20 to get home. Pretty expensive, 2 ferries were on time, the other one was 20 minutes late. Next time I would probably drive

Manly Ferry. Lived in Sydney many years and never took the ferry!We did so for the first time recently to Manly.. it was fun! We left in the daytime and you get a spectacular view of the city/opera house which was great then coming back during sunset/nightime the view again was A+ with the city/opera house all lit up.I would reccomend you do try it out :)

Great way to enjoy the worlds most beautiful harbour city. A relatively inexpensive way to enjoy the amazing scenery of Sydney Harbour. There are lots of routes to choose from - Taronga Zoo, Cockatoo Island, Manly etc. Great to sit on outer deck area and enjoy the fresh air and awesome scenery.
Unique & effective. Why doesn't Sydney utilise ferries more? They're a fantastic way to travel! If they ran more often, more people would use them, surely.

Great staff! Amazing views!. This must be new but what a great addition to the ferry trip ....I had friends over from Perth and wasn't sure how to show them the best of the harbour. Instead of walking through the city, we decided catch a ferry from darling harbour to circular quay for their first glimpse of the opera house. IT WAS GREAT!! A member of staff saw us taking turns snapping photos of each other as we were coming up to the harbour bridge. Not only did he offer to take a photo for us but changed positions and took a few, not only on my phone but my friends camera too. When we got round to the opera house he was back and did the same. We now have fantastic photos of the 4 of us with a drop back of the bridge and the opera house. He really made our small ferry ride amazing, I wish I knew his name to add to his praises! Great staff, fantastic views, thank you!!
Good. Good services. If you like sitting outside on the ferries take a jacket because it can be nippy. Just use your opal card and youll be sweet
Very good view on water.. It is a very good experience to take a ferry to take a close look for Darling harbour, harbour bridge and opera house. And it's cheap!
EXCITEMENT ON WATER. One of the fastest and convinient ways to travel between the zoo n the many drop off points within the beautiful Sydney Harbour.

Best value activity in Sydney along with some great beach and city walks. Seacat is the passenger ferry that goes from Circular Quay West along the river via a few islands. For $10- $15 this is the best money you will spend in Sydney. While the Manly Ferry is great and takes you to a beach this ride gives you a different perspective of the city and the waterside homes. Get a seat out the front put on some sun block and enjoy the great views, coming back to the city and going under the bridge is great view and feeling. We went to Abbotsford to meet friends for a picnic in the Quarantine Park and came back worth every cent.

Always a relaxing trip on Sydney Ferries.. With various destinations such as Manly, Parramatta, Darling Harbour and its attractions-we always look forward to enjoying a realaxing and interesting time with grandchildren on the ferry.

Need to get Opal card. You now need to get what's called an Opal card to travel on ferrys,buses,and trains it's like a swipe card valid in NSW Google search where to buy . Also found here maps ap good for train times for smart phone
Lovely way to travel.. Took the ferry to Darling Harbour, Zoo and Watson Bay. a relaxing way to travel and see the harbour from a different perspective. Using the Opal Card made it easy

Love Sydney ferries. Buy a train, bus and ferry day pass and let the fun begin. you can ferry hop around the harbour all day get on get off.. there are no limits. My grand children love the ferries and enjoy not only the hustle and bustle of the harbour but all the wonderful sight seeing as well.Do yourself a favour and give them a go.

wow what a cheap way to travel. OK - so you need to figure this out quick. Walk in to a convenience store and ask for an opal card. They will load $20 on it. We went through around $40 pp in 8 days. This card allows you to go through a gate by tapping your card, you then travel to wherever, and then tap off as you leave. You get charged for the journey at the end but if you forget to tap off be warned you will pay the full fare. From Darling Harbour you can get to anywhere. A few trip you will decide to do are only accessible from Circular Quay but the Darling Harbour ferry will take you. In the height of Summer there is a stampede as many foreigners do not realise they fit on may people and panic. So be warned with young children and get there 15mins before the ferry.

Cheap way to view the best harbour in the world. I think the title says it all. Whenever our family comes to Sydney we always get on a ferry to somewhere. The Darling Harbour to Milson's Point is particularly good for getting a happy snap of the bridge and opera house,

Cool ride. I love the Sydney ferries. It's a great way to visit many places which are along the waterside eg cockatoo island,zoo or the Central coast. They are efficiently run & the views are great while you travel. We loved to feel the wind on the face.

Manly ferry. Achieved one of my bucket list to travel on a true sydney harbour ferry
Easy to use cheap and great service as well .the rest of the world you need to learn from the best .

A great way to move around. I took the ferry to get from circular quay to Manly, it was really a nice trip on the ferry . It is a huge one which can accomodate more than 100 people in each trip, it has a cafe' inside, and has outside seats for anybody who wants to enjoy the view and take good photos of the bridge for the Sydney opera house
Sydney Ferries. The Sydney Ferries are one of the best things about Sydney. They are always clean and smooth and good for the kids. The best public transport ride to go on.

Quite expensive during the week but so many advantages. It is really quick if you aim at going at Manly (and its beaches) as the roads are really busy.On sundays the price for any transportation is reduced to 2,5 dollars if i am not wrong... Anyway you have to get an OPAL CARD. You put some money on it and never pay over something like 15 dollars a day even if you get on many trips that worth each something like 6 dollars...Short distance are costing something like 3 dollars...Generally no change available at the bus driver and please never ask him something when he/ she drives !! That's not Paris

Great way to see the City and Harbour. There are so many different ferries you can take, both for sightseeing and to get to a specific place. If we were down by Circular Quay we would take the ferry round to Darling Harbour as it was a much shorter walk to our hotel from there. Prices are reasonable, ferries are frequent.

Love Sydney Ferries. Almost without exception, when in Sydney we catch a ferry. If you travel on a Sunday and use an Opal card you can travel for $2.50. That includes train and bus travel. If not staying in the CBD, you would be crazy to take your car as you can jump on a train or bus and not have the stress of traffic and parking and enjoy the day out at minimal expense.

See the city from the water. Lots of ferry destinations , good time to go is after peak hour rush and if possible in good weather so you can sit outside and take in all the views. What ever the destination , plan to get off and have either a look around ,swim at some points , shop in others, or just walk some of the tracks , then have lunch and the back to the city. Most points like the Zoo will take all day , Parramatta is also an all day trip> Manly ,the beach ,Watsons . bay is the Gap and walks , Balmain , shops and restaurants, Milsons point ,shop and Luna Park. Darling harbour is a short trip under the bridge to shops and food area around the harbour front.

Best ride in Sydney. If you want to take a look around the major attractions surrounding the Sydney harbor , then this is the best way . Clean and safe with timely and comfy travel these ferry owners deserve a pat on the back!
Way to go. Excellent way to get to a lot of places fast. The ferries go to quite a few places we took the one that goes to the zoo. Great sight seeing experience as well, very good value.
Pleasant Ride. Our family rode the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Beach. We enjoyed the views, especially seeing the Opera House from the water.

Excellent transit system. I love taking these ferries around Sydney and over to Manly. Regular services, always free seats even at rush hour and free WiFi to boot. Add in the spectacular scenery, I'm jealous of commuters who use these daily.

Best views of th Harbour. While the ferries arent the fastest or most economical way to get around Sydney, the views are hard to beat. You wont be at all upset at the extra time it takes to get to where your going with by far the most scenic mode of transport in Sydney

Great Value. Very cheap via Opal We went to Mainly
Can be very busy at times so plan your times
A great way to take photos of the bridge

Best harbour "cruise" on offer. By far the very best harbour "cruise on offer in Sydney. On of the world's great public transport offerings. No cliché filled commentary, no watery coffee and rubbery chicken / seafood buffets BUT....multiple locations to visit, interesting routes to take and all at a cost as low as $2.50 (Sunday day rate). Marvellous experience for the interstate/international tourist and Sydney-sider alike. No paper tickets post 1 January 2016, so get an Opal travel card and enjoy the trip.
Easy to get around. Very useful to get around, especially easy to get to Taronga Zoo, Luna Park. Great views from the ferry and stress free due to no busy city traffic

Excellent. We stayed at Madley so used the ferry often. A great way to tour the massive inland waterway which is Sydney Harbour. So much going on and many things to see. The ferries are part of the general transport system so the cards are use able on all ferries.

Great way to get around. We took a couple of ferries during our Sydney escapade and I thoroughly enjoyed them.The only negative is that there is NO airflow inside the big ones! It was terribly warm on our trip and the tiny windows did nothing for airflow. If you can get a seat outside, it's brilliant.
Perfect way to enjoy the harbour. Spent a day getting on and off the ferries, on a Sunday it's only $2.50 all day to ride as many ferries (and other public transport) as you like. Loved it.

Best way to see Sydney. Coming from the Puget Sound, I know ferries. Sydney has a great system that could even serve as an inspiration to us.The ferries not only serve as a good way to get to the Beach, but you get a great view of the Opera House and the Harbor.While these ferries are passenger only, they are quite frequent and the system works well. My only compliant is the crowd control--watch out for a human crush on a Sunday trip to Manly Beach or the Zoo! Just stand aside while others go on board and get on after the pushing has stopped. These boats can fit a lot more people in than you'd imagine.
Practical, scenic and airy!. Took the ferry from Circular quey to Darling Harbour on a sunny day. Was outside the whole trip. Great views!

Quick transportation around the Harbour. Ferries run frequently and are a fast and reasonably inexpensive was to visit the many areas around this large harbour. Offer great views of the Opera House and Bridge.
Incredible service. A great way to explore Sydney Harbour and the best way to get to Manly in the most relaxing circumstances.
Very rare did you wait for one..... Excellent service...to and from anywhere to any place...there's always one you can catch...all staff were very friendly and made conversation ....
Why are they so cheap?!. A great way of getting around the harbour. Frequent, fairly quick, and whichever route you take, wonderful views.
Trip to Luna Park. Very punctual and easy to access, cheap and hassle free way to get around Sydney and to see the sights.

Great way to Harbor area & bay towns . An excellent way to see the many harbor towns. Get an Opal Card ($10 minimum) & on a Sunday spend only $2.50 for the emits day getting on and off the ferries & trains in town - great deal with great views (look for bridge walkers on the arch).
If your from out if town a good way to see the harbour. Always a good way to see the harbour if your from out of town. If your traveling to the zoo or Manly than it is a good form of transport.

The heart and soul of Sydney. It wouldn't be a trip to Sydney without a trek on the Manly Ferry. Been traversing the same route for years and they still do it in style. A real experience and a wonderful stress free way to see some amazing Harbour and city views.

Great way to see Sydney while on a budget. Travelling on the various ferry services gives locals and tourists a water side view of one of the most picturesque harbours in the world. And... it's cheap.
Love the manly ferry. I never tire of the manly ferry trip. It's only 15 minutes but the scenery is breath taking. You see the main sights and the boats on the harbour.
Nice harbour crossing opportunity. This is a great opportunity to check out Manly and its beaches or just cross the harbour sighs and make picture of the bridge and the opera.
Superb!. The same Opal card in Sydney works for all public transport i.e. trains, buses and ferry. We took the ferry to circular quay. Quite a different experience.

Enjoyed our trip from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay. Quick trip from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay. We sat out on the deck and enjoyed the views immensely. I reminisced about childhood trips to Luna Park, and I am almost envious of those who commute to work on the ferries. What a glorious city and harbour. Also discovered Blues Point Tower, which I had to research when I got home. This was just a short trip at the end of a weekend away in the city. Next time we will have to take a longer ferry ride. Opal card makes getting around the city so easy. And because it was Sunday, and we were almost at our $2.50 cap, the ferry only cost us 40 cents each!
Efficient and quick. Took the ferry over to Opposite side of harbour to do some more sight seeing, ferries are old but still in very good nick, quick and to schedule

A bargain cruise. The most wonderful way to see Sydney. The magnificent harbour is a highlight but so are trips to riverfront suburbs such as Hunters Hill and Drummoyne and even as far west as Parramatta.

One of the best ways to explore Sydney. Since the introduction of the Opal card and travel apps, we integrate ferries, trains, buses and light rail to visit the hundreds of destinations in Sydney. Sydney Ferries offer the ultimate transport for sight seeing on the harbour and connecting rivers and beaches. Get an Opal card and download a trip app and enjoy the beauty Sydney offers!

Good value, great way to get about. The big Manly ferry is speedy and even has a bar for a drink during the 30 min ride, the smaller boats hop around the Harbour and afford great views of the bridge, city skyline and Opera house. Great Value but even better with an Opal smart card as this caps at A$15 a day.
Travels across the water . Always the best part of sydney on the harbour / rusty rails need taking care of though old ferries working hard all day
A ride never to forget. How the children loved this roller coaster ride on the Manly Ferry... It was a rough journey but boy did we have fun, something the kids will always remember..

Harbour City. When you get out on the Harbour or look at it from a good perspective - you see why it's rated one of the best harbours in the world - and how the City has been built around it - and the Ferries after many years have it down pat on how to service it very effectively it's easy to get around and what a great view

Manly Ferry fantastic.... Again and again when I visit Sydney I try to make time to take the Manly Ferry on a nice day. You cruise through the Sydney Harbor with all its sights and great views. You get a fantastic view of the Sydney Bridge and the Heads. This is one of the best ways to soak the Sydney Harbor atmosphere...
Jalous. This is my favorite way to travel when the sea is not to rocky!! Its easy to get around, fast and affordable. The Oz goes to work with the ferry. Manly beach is 30 minutes from Circular Quay.

A public transport with a view.. Although a little bit expensive ( but on par with the rest of the city ) it is very worthwhile to go on ferry for example up to mainly beach, you will have stunning views of the Sydney harbour and Mainly itself is a real treat.

Visit to acoustical sacred city. No yep to Sydney is compete unless you catch the ferry to Nowhere. Fun? Yes. Great way to see this magnificent city from the water. Circular city to darling harbour for dinner. Quick but very pretty And cheap way to see the city
Interesting way to discover the area. We enjoyed to tour the area via the ferries. It's easy not expensive and relaxing - as soon as you got a good seat on the deck outside.
Just kove a sydney ferry . Sydney has a great ferry service.Always on time abd always clean and comphy.You can spend a whole day tripping to different areas of the harbor.

Best way to see Sydney. We took the ferry to Manly and to Darling Harbor. From Darling Harbour you can walk to Chinatown past the Chinese Garden of Friendship. The Harbour views of the Opera House, bridge and skyline from the the water are hard to beat. Make sure you take the regular ferry to Manly, not the fast ferry. It's a hoot if the water is choppy. The ferries from Circular Quay provide access to much of the city at a very reasonable cost.

Welcome to the chaos . Abandon any concept of a timetable and just turn up! Our ferry from Circular Quay was cancelled then reinstated with one stop. Further stops were added according to how many people boarded. Ferry back was better but made an unscheduled stop. We got there in the end so all was good

Hop on, hop off. Great service to get you around Sydney...although be aware that the timetable seems to be a guide only!
We used an Opal card, most ferries, buses etc now seem to be cashless, but its really cheap to travel about

Love this method of transport. It's such a Sydney experience you can't miss it. There are numerous places you can go travel to and from and it doubles as a sight seeing experience. We had a little one with us at the time and it was no hassle manouvering with the pram.

Taronga to Circular Quay and back... Brilliant. We often catch the ferry from the Zoo (members), and back again... pop over to the city for lunch, after spending the morning walking down the Zoo hill, and then back up to our car on the cable car back - this works for us, as we are Zoo members, so Zoo access is easy both ways. The ferry is reasonably priced, a great trip for my 4.5 year old son, and usually very clean too. We would not hesitate to recommend to anyone to get out on the harbour aboard a Sydney Ferry. Best way to view our beautiful city, on the water. 5 stars, well done.

Nearly Ferry Good – but sort out your Sunday Service Guys. This did not start off a good experience. It was a Sunday and we thought we’d take a Sunday morning ferry from Drumoyne into Circular Quay. Er no. Despite the information boards saying that a service was due in a few minutes, the reality was this was a Sunday, the sun was shining, it was holiday time and all the boats were packed. So two services decided to miss out our stop and we only found out when we pressed the Information Button and spoke to an operative that was unaware of the problem.Worse was to follow as we decided to head “up stream” to Paramatta, after all we were travellers and it seemed like a good idea at the time. Indeed the journey inland was good, only to find when we got there, that the next two ferries were full. We were given boarding cards and told to wait an hour for the next available service.We caught up with a guy from Lancashire and had a bit of banter and eventually arrived @ Circular Quay three hours later than we intended. BUT the fantastic views from the front of the CAT as we came through Darling Harbour and underneath the iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge, made up for the delay.We did use the ferry service during the week and no problem what so ever. The boats were on time and had plenty of room. So if I was to give you any advice it would be to expect problems at weekends when half of Sydney, plus tourists like me decide it would be fun to mess around on boats.

Great value. Travel like to locals...great value for a quick trip out on the harbour. Circular Quay to Darling Harbour ride lets you experience the best of Sydney. The bridge, opera house, North Sydney, Luna Park, Balmain and Darling Harbour. Grab an Opal card for $15 ride all day or single trip $12.60 adult $6.80 concessions/kids.

Sydney Ferries - A Must!. Sydney is all about its harbour. Unless you have access to a private boat, your next best option is a ferrie ride. Experience the way many sydneysiders travel to and from work every day. It's a quick and easy alternative to a long drive in traffic to get between many of Sydney's greatest sites. I use ferries regularly to go to Manly from the city. It is also a great day excursion to go up the Parramatta river for lunch at Parramatta.

GO TO MANLY or Cremorne. The ferries are the best way to see the harbor.Go to manly and walk to the beach. Go get lunch. Wonderful way of exploring the area.Or take a ferry to old cremorne, walk up a short hill and go on the trail of cremorne point -- incredible view of the harbor.

Travel on Sunday to enjoy max $2.50 cap . We went to Bondi and Manly beach on a Sunday to enjoy the maximum fare cap at $2.50 by using an opal card. (One of the benefit of opal card is Sunday's fare charged are cap at maximum $2.50 for all public transport ride include ferry, train and busses)Going to Manly is purely just to enjoy the scenery overlooking the beautiful Sydney city view when the ferry on its way back to circular quay.
