Travel to bondi on a Sunday is also good as traveller can visit Bondi Market at the morning, and visit The Rocks market at circular quay before 5pm when back at circular quay.

A great way to see harbour without taking an expensive tour.. The ferries operate to a number of locations but the most popular is the Manly ferry. It is a great alternative to an expensive tour. Once in Manly you can enjoy the harbour beach or walk along the Corso a walk of about 200 metres to the breathtaking ocean beach. The ferry offers spectacular views and you can sit outside if early enough to grab a seat. It is a smooth ride generally barring storms etc.

Excellent Means Of Transportation. Thanks for the excellent alternative means of transportation service provided by the Sydney Ferries. It is also a great way to admire the breathtaking Sydney Harbour views for tourists.

Sit back and enjoy Sydney Harbour. As a tourist attraction as well as for Sydney siders this is a gem of a way to travel in Sydney. Forget the overcrowded over land transport.
Most of the services are on time, no traffic jams and cancellations only due to bad weather.
I wish I had discovered this years ago

What a great way to travel around Sydney - from the city to Manly and Parramatta. Always loved Sydney and its waterways - the best way to experience Sydney is from the water, take a cruise on a ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay for lunch or Manly for an evening meal and wine on the Wharf or visit the Beach. A quick visit to Taronga Zoo to see the attractions or Fort Denison for lunch or dinner.
Excellent mode of transport . Used these to get around whilst on holiday. Get an opal card as ferries included and cheaper as the journeys mount up. Reliable and comfortable.

Fantastic views of the harbour. It's easy buy a ticket and the boats are like buses, visit Manly, Tarronga Zoo,Darling Harbour or a number of other places. Ok the boats are old but in someways that adds to the charm. There is no better way to spend my a sunny day viewing the Sydney harbour bridge, Opera house and the city skyline. If you want to travel fast. I don't know why you would, there are fast ferry sea cats as an alternative or private water taxis.

Best and cheapest tour and most beautiful commute in the world. When friends come to visit Sydney I always recommend a day on the ferries as the first introduction to Sydney. The caveat is it has to be on one of Sydney's beautiful clear blue sky days. It really is the best and cheapest way to get a feel for the unique nature of Sydney life hugging the shores of the harbor. You will fall in love with Sydney and never want to leave!It is also a convenient mode of transport for many Sydney-siders to get to work. Although not so pleasant on stormy days!

Great value! See the city from another angle.. A ferry ride is almost mandatory for any visitor to Sydney who wishes to gain an authentic feeling for how this city started, developed and continues to breathe life into its inhabitants. There are many trips to choose from, but the trip to Manly is arguably the most impressive, offering a lengthy ride almost to the heads of the harbour and swimming opportunities at the other end. The old ferries are still in use and give a taste of how Sydneysiders have travelled the harbour over many decades, for work and pleasure. Don't forget to give yourself time to buy a ticket or top up the Opel card that is now increasingly used by commuters for public transport in Sydney.

A working harbour. Sydney ferries to any destination is always fun whether a long trip to Manly or a quick trip across to one of the local suburbs. These are working vessels delivering Sydney siders to work, the city, or local harbour beaches.

Best way to experience Sydney by sea. Forget about expensive tour boats, all you need is an Opal card and you experience Sydney from a totally different perspective. Cruise the harbour or the Parramatta River til your hearts content. Bring your camera!
Great way to travel . I loved travelling by ferry in Sydney both for short trips across the harbour and the longer journey to manly. Certainly makes a nice change from London Underground!
See Sydney cheaply from the water. You can buy an Opal card from newsagents and do Ferries without the need to queue for tickets . Its a must do and its very relaxing out of rush hour .

Fast and Easy Way To Get Around. This is the way to get around as it is very fast and convenient. Ticket booths are along the Harbour. There are several different ferry services so make sure you check each one out to make the right choice for what you need (some ferry service stops earlier than others!) We used Captain Cook Cruises which included our Taronga Zoo tickets and a 24 hour unlimited ferry pass to go to and from all their stops. And make sure you look for coupons in visitor guides etc.

Nice ride in over aged boats. The reason people love to take ferries over the Parramatta river is because of the views it has to offer. The harbour Bridge, Oprah House, city skyline and the twists and turns of the river make it a wonderful experience on a sunny day. The Ferries on the other hand are quite a let down. These are old, overcrowded, look dated and regrettably medieval looking. Over the past many years I have not seen any change in them. It would be a breather if we were to see some cleaner, crisper, more novel ferry options.
Get an Opal and off you go. The perfect way to see the harbour and get to some of the less accessible places, sit outside and be a tourist

Fantastic transportation links. The ferries are regular and punctual, using the Opal card system makes it a fast and affordable. Every route has an amazing view and for savvy Opal card users those views could all be for free!

Beautiful!. We took the ferrie ride when we were in Sydney October, 2015. It was very worthwhile to get the views, be out in the harbor, and be able to get fantastic pictures of the entire area! It was just your typical ferrie ride--nothing fancy, but did the job, and was fairly priced.

Amazing possibility to see from the water. It's one of the things you have to do in Sydney - there are many agencies offering a harbour tour - but you can do it very easy and cheap with the ferry also !

First timers. Our first experience of the Sydney Ferry service was appalling at best. Little did we know that it was a cheap Sunday deal and every one in Sydney (just about) was using them. Very confusing experience for us as we figured out how it all worked. Staff however were very helpful and patient with us. The behaviour of so many fellow passengers was disgusting as they pushed to get on. We have never experienced such rudeness when using public transport. Our 11 year old son was squished near to being frightened as the people behind swelled to get on board. It was frustrating that Sydney Ferries does nothing to manage this when obviously it was needed. Other passengers also visiting were equally alarmed and concerned. It was outright dangerous. Surely it would not be so hard to install temporary measures and more staff to manage the large amount of passengers on these special days. Having said that, our other experiences once the crowds had settled down were easy and as expected. It is a lovely experience to ride the waters to move around the Harbor. In our time there we took a Ferry to Watsons Bay, Manly, Cockatoo Island, Darling Harbor and Lunar Park.
Not just Transportation, an experience. Used this service several times during my last visit to sydney. Very useful, economical & enjoyable mode of transport.
Better to have an Opal Card. The ticket booth was broken so we had to run around town trying to buy Opal Cards.Trouble-free travelling once we got that organised.

Transportation with a vuew. My husband and I used the ferry services both days we were in Sydney. On the first day we stayed close to Sydney and darling Harbour. The views were unbeatable and it was great to just sit back and see it all. The next day we took the ferry out to Manly and again had a great experience. By far the best way to get around Sydney!
TRY THE NEW MANLY FAST FERRY. Took the new fast ferry to Manly ! Cut the time in half with approx. 15-20 minute travel time. They also serve cold beer. Adult $8.60 one way / Child $5.10 one way

Trip from the harbour to Manly. The ferry trip was as amazing as i had imagined. We were even lucky to see two dolphins which was a total surprise but they came really close. The view from the outside deck was worth the stand and we didnt see the 30 mins ride elapse. A must for visitors😄

Great service to go to zoo. We had great experience with the city run ferries going to the zoo and thought the plus a harbor views and seeing Sydney from water was great...do not see paying the high price for the private ferries personally

Sydney Ferries. Definitely a must do. Experience public transport with fabulous views around Sydney. Be sure to obtain an Opal card which are available at convenience stores and top up either in the local stores or at the wharf.
a great day on the harbour. At the very least you must take the Manly ferry on a day trip to the well known beachside suburb. It is cheap public transport at its very best. A fantastic day out.

Great Service. The ferries are a good (and sometimes the easiest) transport option to get to some places in Sydney. Always on time - delays are very rare - the ferries are comfortable and able to carry a bunch of people - all sitting. The crew is very friendly and likely give you instructions and any information you ask for. The price is fair for the service offered.

Awesome services. For a very low cost tourists can travel on these ferrries to Manly, Watson's Bay, Paramatta, Darling Harbour to name a few. Brilliant low cost service - see the harbour bridge and Sydney Opera House from the water - awesome!
The only way to see the city. The ferries around Sydney are the best way to see the city.Really cheap way to travel but the best way to see the stunning views!A must!

We live in the bush, what a great way to get around. Nervouse about using the new Opal card, once we got that organised we were on our way. We had a fantastic time getting around the water ways of Sydney, at some points the information is a bit limited but... we got to where we had to go and it was by far and away the best way of traveling. The Opal card is pretty good, once you get used to it.
On Sydney Harbour Waterways. Either for fun or business, riding the Sydney ferries is scenic. On very wet and misty days, these are cancelled.

The perfect way to get around, especially to Manly. We took the ferry to Manly from Circular Quay. The ferries are clean, reliable and perfect for getting around Sydney. Value for money. Tickets purchased at Circular Quay for an away day adventure.

Dangerous Mass Caualty Coming Soon!. Probably the worst experience of my life!While the ferries are good, the scenery amazing and the costs reasonable... THE LOADING AND CUEING ARE FRUSTRATING AND DANGEROUS! - A management problem!There is no cueing; no organization; and waaaaay to many people on the dock at a time.. ALL pushing and shoving toward the gangway... THEN... that ferry is full and EVERYONE 'en mass', heads to the other side of the dock to await the next ferry. Barging in, bumping and pushing!I was in a power wheelchair which obviously made me "invisible". I WILL NEVER DO IT AGAIN!I even had one lady, literally, throw her 3-4 year old child in front of my wheelchair to stop me so she could barge in front of me getting on the gangway to the ferry. UNBELIEVABLE!This is a mass casualty waiting to happen!
A beautiful way to travel. The ferries are comfortable, travel regularly, are on time and are easy to negotiate. An excellent way to travel.

Iconic symbol of Sydney. Getting around by ferry is one of the must do things in Sydney. They're efficient and just such great fun. The view as you come up to the Harbour Bridge from Woolwich is amazing. It just has to be done.
Cheap Sunday Experience. Not much better value than spending $2.50 on a Sunday and spending the day cruising the harbour on one of the ferries.
Cheap sight seeing. Occupied a chunk of a rainy afternoon by taking successive ferry rides from Circular Quay to Neutral Bay and Mossman. Was a very good move.

Love the ferries. On all our visits to Sydney, the best bit is on one of the ferries going anywhere around the city. Best trip is over to Manly and a walk along the beach. others go to Darling Harbour or Greenwich. You have a lot of choice. Tickets are easy to buy and you can get a day rover one with your family.

Cute & timely. Iconic little ferries providing cheap travel in timely manner around the Harbour. Try the ferry ride to Manly beach for fish & chips with the seagulls and viewing the magnificent homes along the harbour shorefront. In the other direction a great ride up Paramatta Rivet is fun. Ferries to Luna park r also fun and Darling Harbour area as well. Use an opal pass for best value as it us also used on trains & buses. Very friendly ferry staff.

Use these ferries whenever possible!. The ferries are so much fun and affordable. Get an Opal Card and use the ferries to Manly Beach, Darling Harbor, Watson Bay, etc. Always very cool views along the way, and fun.

Darling Harbour to circular quat. Took the kids on the public ferry from Darling Harbour to circular quay. Only got charged for 1 child so very economical. Awesome views of the bridge, opera house and Luna park. Lovely to sit outside on a sunny day. Definitely recommend.
Manly. Took a ferry to Manly while on holiday. What an awesome way to use public transport. The whole experience was great!!

Superb. We did a ferry from Rydalmere to Circular Quay which was around 1 hr 30 mins. The same opal card for metro works for the ferry too. Quite a good experience. Must do at-least one ferry route if you visit Sydney.
great ride. bit windy the day we jumped aboard and a bunch of screaming kids...iphone and earplugs! B ut still give a bumper view of the city!

Great, low cost way to sail in the Harbour. For only $6-odd you can take a trip from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour (or vice-versa) and take in full views of the Harbour, pass under the bridge and see several sites including Luna Park & the Opera House.
Great services. Take the Manly fast or slow ferry for a great view of major parts of Sydney Harbour. Lots of ferries but queues can be long at peak times.
Cruise to Shark Highland, Darling Harbour.... The most efficient Ferries i have used. great vies as you cruise and very affordable fees. i would use them again when in Sydney

A must do experience for anyone visiting Sydney. If there were only 3 things I had time to do in Sydney it would be 1) walk across (and over if your budget allows!) the Sydney Harbour Bridge 2) catch an old Manly ferry (the yellow and green ones) from Circular Quay to Manly and back. And 3) visit the magnificent and unique Sydney Opera House. Catching the ferry gives the viewer a sense of the beauty of the city, the harbour, boats and houses. On a stormy or windy day there is sometimes a bit of swell as you approach "the heads" (the opening of the harbour to the ocean) and Manly but it doesn't last long. Once in Manly, cross the road and walk along the pedestrians only Corso to one of Sydney's most beautiful tourist and locals beaches, Manly beach.
Pretty boring... Manly beach super weavy and overcrowded. Harbor it's ok, no big deal. Beach overcrowded. too weavy to swim. You can ony wet your tail in a 15meters strip. See pic

20 minutes to Taronga Zoo. Worthwhile ride from circular quay to Taronga Zoo. Ferries are spacious with both indoor and outdoor seating. Get up and close to the harbor bridge and pass Kirribilli house along the way.

No ticket, no problem - pay at other end. We got the ferry back from North Sydney and although there are lots of notices about having an Oyster-type card, one of the locals we asked said that we could just pay at the other end, which we did with no problem. Wish UK public transport was more like that!

Easy to Use. Used the ferry a bit on my trip. They are a little on the slow side but the ferries come regularly and the views in the harbour are definitely worth a look. Went to Watson's Bay, Luna Park and Star Casino on ferries and enjoyed the trips. Information was very helpful and we had no trouble getting from A to B

Cruise to manly. Jumped on the ferry to go across to Many on a very hot day. Rushed to get a front seat on the outside deck only managed a deck seat. Gee you have to be quick. Once we left Circular key the cool harbour breeze cooled us off until we got to Manly

Ferry surfing on a sunny day - perfect! . I thought it would be nice to go to Manly on the ferry in late December - but so did thousands of other people so I decided to take the next ferry that left any of the wharves down by Circular Quay. It was really busy and a beautiful sunny day so I went on a ferry that went to Cremorne and back. The whole trip was only about 30 mins but I stayed on for another 2 round trips back to Circular Quay.A beautiful way to enjoy the best of the Harbour on a gorgeous sunny day. $6 very well spent
A must when in Sydney. We love to get a day ticket and take the ferries around to look at the harbour and its surrounds. Staff have always been helpful

From Parramatta to Manley. This is our fourth visit to Sydney as our son lives here. We love the Sydney ferries and hope they are not replaced in our lifetime as to us they are like an institution. They provide a great opportunity to see many interesting places around the famous harbour

Stuck on Cockatoo Island. Was among a group of visitors to the Island on Sunday who were caught out by the downpour. Drenched, we all marched to the ferry terminal to head back to mainland only for two ferries to stop and only pick up 2-3 people. A group of American visitors behind me were becoming extremely agitated. Why bother??? Eventually, an empty ferry arrived an hour later which we all boarded. Apart from this, Cockatoo Island needs some love. Have the buildings were closed, as was one of the main cafes.
Great to get about and low cost too. Used Ferry service from circular quay to Manly, efficient service even at the busiest times, buy an Opal travel card and save even more money on the fares
Manly Ferry is the Best. We caught the Manly ferry and it is the best and cheapest thing to do in all of Sydney. You see so much of the harbour.

Been on all the ferries manly river cat to parramatta entertainment centre. The ferries are a lovely place to see the Sydney harbour it's wonderful views lovely to see the scenery the best view in the world . Watson bay double bay manly zoo and bennalong point

Best way to get about and see the sights. These Ferries are busy for a reason. They are the best way to shuttle around this fantastic Harbour. Going across to Manly or round to Darling Harbour Circular Quay is the link pin. Look out for Dolphins on the manly trip
Rivercat. School holidays the ferries are full in the mornings and it makes it very difficult to go to work.the rivercat should add extra services during this time of the year.
Best harbour trip. Enjoy unlimited travel on a Sunday with the family for only a couple of dollars each on the ferries, trains and buses! Sydney ferries are the best value way to see the harbour

Best on a Sunday. Excellent way of getting around the harbour and sight seeing at the same time. Make sure you buy an Opal card for all Sydney transport. It will save you money! Best day to use the ferries is a Sunday as all transport in NSW is only $2.50 for the day!The yellow harbour ferries also offer free wi-fi. Collect time tables from Circular Quay and make the most of your day!

Efficient Transport. The only way to avoid congestion across the coat hanger if you're going north for the day. The services are fast and frequent and you get must-have views of Sydney harbour - a must for every visitor.
Good way to get around. these can be a good way to get around the harbour sites such as Watsons Bay and Manly and Taronga zoo but can get very busy in the summer.
Wet Summers day. Great afternoon out on a darling harbour round trip with the kids! Plenty of seating and views to photograph! Staff were very friendly!
Harbour trip. This is always a beautiful day out, even when the weather is bad.The scenery is fantastic and multiple destinations would suit everyone.

Great ride with places to see on the way. We had to buy a travel card called Opal to travel on this boat.i reccomend buying it before you arrive at the quay as the queues can be very long. You can buy it from newsagents in most places. Even though the queues are very long to board the boat it goes down very quickly with great organisation. I went to manly which took 40 minutes and you get to see the bridge and opera house from a view of the water too. Great way go travel.

Fun to take the kids at night for the harbour lights.. Took the grandkids for their first ever ride on a boat for an hour. They had such a good time. The water was so smooth which helped them enjoy their selves. They loved all the holiday lights on the buildings and harbor bridge.

Ferries are the way to go in Sydney. Definitely recommend the ferries in Sydney. They can take you just about everywhere you want to go. I recommend that hop-on hop-off ferry, so that you can do visit a number of places all in one day.

Great way to see Sydney Harbour. My recommendation is to get an Opal card, try and travel via public transport on a Sunday from wherever you are in Sydney, and hop on a ferry to either Manly (preferred) or Parramatta. Hopefully a great sunny day and have your camera ready. Its a fantastic way to see the harbor, and the service is great.

Just the best way to see some of the best views in Sydney. Get an Opal card and this really is great value. So many places that you can get to for day trips. Staff were courteous. Was easy to get on and off with suitcases too.

Sydney and ferry rides to anywhere. The excitement of a Sydney visit is the chance to travel by ferries. Even with holiday season and crazy crowds, such good service from staff and timetables well managed in locations travelled. Opal card makes life so easy. Look forward to next visit and ride on new ferries. A great story of Sydney from any ferry.

Ferry to Parramatta. Great way to see Sydney and all the things you miss when driving; so much more beautiful by ferry.We tapped out Opal cards and off we went, sighted multiple sailing clubs, rowing clubs, aero clubs, marinas, parks and multiple new developments.The ferry stopped at approx ten locations along the way . It was a comfortable trip and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The ferry was very clean, no rubbish, no graffiti and no hooligans. It was a great experience.

Amazing Manly Trip. A wonderful way to pass a half day or full day while in Sydney is to take a return ferry to beautiful Manly. There are shops, walks and the beach to enjoy at Manly. We happily sat watching beach volleyball for a couple of hours. It's lovely to actually be on the lovely Sydney Harbour and see Sydney from the sparkling water. The ferry ride was very smooth. From memory, I think it cost just under $50 for 3 adult return tickets (December 2015)

What a great way to see Sydney. Get and Opal card and see Manly, McMahons point, Watson's Bay, Parramatta, Taronga Zoo and dozens of other great locations on this well run public transportation system. Love it.

Great cost effective way to see Sydney. Loved jumping on the ferries. The short trips can really provide you of fantastic views of the city. If you have an opal card and reach $60 in a week, the rest of the week the travel is free. So we kept on jumping on the ferry from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay under the magnificent Harbour Bridge.

A trip to Mosman Bay, Neutral Bay , Watson Bay or Manly. We took the ferries to Mosman Bay, Neutral Bay , Watson Bay and Manly on 4 different trips. Felt like we were with locals going on a day long holiday. Sydney is so beautiful and the ferries are essential to experience the suburb neighborhoods. Just Beautiful
Trip to Doyle's - quick and easy.. We had lunch at Watson's Bay at Doyle's. Ferry very quick and easy to/from Circular Quay. Helpful staff at Circ. Quay.

Amazing Fireworks 2015!. Went to see the fireworks on Dec 31, 2015 with my daughters. Great time, but lots of people on the ferry...I thought there were going to be less because of the price. Enjoyed thoroughly...an experience of a lifetime.

fab service to most beaches. The ferries are a great way to get around to the Zoo, beaches, Rose Bay etc. We have friends in the Rose Bay area and in 20 minutes we were on their doorstep. Really a great service that run pretty late into the night too!

Love them. So easy to get around.. The ferries were great for us as we were staying in Darling harbour. Cost was reasonable. We used them to go on all our outings as the kids enjoyed them and they pretty much all took us to where we needed to go. Great service. Hope they are around for many years to come.
Perfect way to travel.... The ferries are a quick and easy way to jump between areas and give a great view of the harbour, opera house and surrounding areas.

Convenient. Took a ferry from circular quay to rydalmere and thoroughly enjoyed hour and half ride... The ferry also takes u from circular quay to the famous Olympic park in Sydney..Tickets available at the wharfs..Though recommend taking the opal pass that is valid for all public transport.. Very convenient..You can also do a short ride from darling harbour to circular quay..Clean and convenient way to travel in Sydney

Good alternative to Taxi.. It's nice to take ferries for a change but AUD5.5 for a single trip per person from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay would be rather expensive for a family. Taking a cab would be a cheaper option as it would cost less than AUD10 for 4 persons.

Great way to get around. Another icon that is Sydney and another unique experience for all tourists and Australians. You get some great views and good photos from the ferries. Kids will love the experience and so will the mums and dads. Easy to use and hard to forget. Try it now.
Great. The Ferries are a fun and convenient way to get to many of the exciting touristy places in Sydney. Buy and Oyster card as it is the cheapest way to access public transport in Sydney.

Great way to see the sights. Get yourself an Opal card and hop on a ferry as we did from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay. We then had a walk around and a drink before catching the ferry to Watsons Bay. Great photo opps the whole way.
Ferry to Manly - just great. We took the ferry to Manly from Wharf 3. It's punctual, efficient, relatively fast and cheap. It's an enjoyable ride that one must do.
A highlight. We loved the Ferries. It was the best way to view Sydney. Kids loved just chilling on the ferries. :)

GREAT RIDE. When we visit Sydney the first thing we do is head for the Ferry.
As a visitor to Sydney, for us, there is nothing better on a NICE day than jumping on a ferry and travelling around the most beautiful Harbour in the world.

Cockatoo Island Trip. In order to travel to Cockatoo Island you must take a ferry, and it was a pleasant experience. I had to travel with a few bags, as we were going there for a photo shoot, and there was ample space and the sea crew (staff) were very helpful.The information provided on the screen was valuable such as arrival times, etc, and it was a smooth ride.The only let down was the cleanliness, but it is public transport in Australia.

professional public transport and some of the most scenic views at a low cost. The ferry services used thus trip - Paramatta Rivercat, Taronga Zoo, Manly services.Always a safe and enjoyable trip with Sydney Ferries, providing uninterrupted opportunites for wonder harbourside photos of landmarks and city skyline, dawn, daylght, dusk and night time. Services are reliable and depart ontime and all at the low cost of an Opal public transport fare each way.So easily affordable and the kids found it a treat!

Ease of Transport. I was so impressed with the ferry service. On time, efficient, enjoyable and relaxing. The weather was great which helps but I just loved being on the harbour and having the opportunity to get around with such ease. Well done Sydney. I purchased an Opal pass which I put $40 on for public transport which included the ferries. After 8 trips the rest of the week was free for public transport. Worked well for me. Check it out it could be the answer for you too.

Cheaper way of seeing the coast. The ferries are great, cheap and frequent. If you use an Opalcard remember total on otherwise you get the default fare and this can be expensive - as I found out! Otherwise excellent value for money would recommend to all.
Great way to have a ride on the harbour.. The view is great from the ferry, the service is great and is on Opal price (public transport)......

Great way to get around Sydney. We have used Sydney ferries to get Taronga Zoo, Manly, Watsons Bay, Luna PQafk and a kings Wharf. Highly recommended for of transport either from Circular Quay of Kings Wharf.

Great way to get around Sydney. The ferry service is cheap and efficient and a wonderful way to get around on the water.TOP tip is get to Circular Quay early and buy a weekly pass, which also works on buses and trains. Otherwise the queues can be horrendous to buy daily tickets.The ferries run regularly out to Manley, Watsons Bay, the zoo and down the Parramatta River, and the views of the Harbour are wonderful.Not a bad thing to stay on board and just cruise around the harbour- and they sell decent coffee on board too.

Love the ferry . Having lived on the beaches forever the best way to get to the city is definitely the manly ferry, its the most relaxing chilled out way to travel. You get to enjoy the beautiful view of the harbour and get there stress free. I look forward to going on the ferry every time.
No better way to see Sydney Harbour. There is no better way to see Sydney Harbour than to catch a public ferry to Manly, Darling Harbour, Taronga Zoo or any number of great stops.

Pleasant way to spend a couple of hours. Took the return ferry Dawn Fraser from Circular Quay to Sydney Olympic Park. As it was not crowded was able to get good window seats and enjoy the magnificent harbour. There are many places of interest where you are able to hop on and off to have a good look around including the very interesting Cockatoo Island. This ferry is quite old but clean and staff are informative and friendly. A lovely way to see the sights around the harbour in comfort.
Great service . Visited Manly during the day and was a really nice trip. Sydney is very fortunate to have such a great ferry service for locals and visitors alike

New Year's Eve on Sydney Harbour. On the ferries is our way of spending a day on Sydney Harbour. We do this each New Year's Eve! This year a short trip from Greenwich to Circular Quay. Then ..... the next available ferry seemed to be the Rivercat to Parramatta. On board and collected from Darling Harbour, on the way, were those who were going to camp at Cockatoo Island for the night. Others on board were families, tourists and commuters. It was wonderful to see and experience the trip west to Parramatta. Variety of sights were manyy.Upon arrival one is greeted by many who wish to return or go into the city of Sydney. Lunch was enjoyed at the wharf, then return trip into Sydney brought different views, from different perspectives.A truly restful and enjoyable day after the final return journey to Greenwich.

Great way to see the city. Had a four day stay in the city. The ferries were a great way to get around. Run very frequently and are clean and well managed. The Opal Card service is also great as you can use it on the ferries, trains and buses which we did.

A 30 minute ride to one of the world's famous beaches, Manly. My first trip on the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly is one that will stay with me forever. This is one trip where a camera is a must. Taking photos of the world famous Opera House and the magnificent Sydney Harbour bridge is a must. The constant movement of sailing boats with there crew as they quickly pass by. On the foreshore magnificent houses and blocks of apartments where the rich and famous or is that infamous live. One can only imagine. Then crossing the Sydney Heads where thousands of immigrants from all over the world saw for the very first time Sydney. Arriving with a suitcase of hope and great expectation in their hearts for a better life. So if you are a visiting tourist riding the ferries for the first time or reliving that first time on a ferry. It is a ferry trip to remember forever. Quick where is the camera!
Nice.. We took the ferry to Manly, ferry ride offers great view of the opera house. Ride can be a little bumpy at times, but generally smooth ride.
Essential. When I go to Sydney I park the car, and travel around Sydney by ferry and/or train. I use the car only when I go home again. That says it all. It's great way to see the harbour too.

Great way of commuting. The ferries are a very scenic mode of transport. Very convenient, affordable and runs to a decent schedule. An Opal card is the easiest way to jump on and off the ferries but you can still purchase paper tickets around circular quay.

Glorious Sydney Harbour. What a great way to check out the fabulous harbour sights. We purchased an OPAL ticket from the Railway. The ticket cost $15 per day and provides unlimited access to all of Sydney's transport. ( rail, bus, light rail and ferry) They told us we could travel to the Blue mountains or Wollongong on the ticket also. So the cost to travel on the harbour was fantastic. We used the ticket to access Taronga Zoo and on another day all the way tp visit Manly. So we were sure of great visual of the Opera House and Fort Denison and many other sights on the harbour.
A must experience!. We travelled in evening from Circular quay to Darling harbour, the trip was fun and gave us great views of the harbour bridge,opera house, darling harbour and Luna park.

Opal Card is a must. From 1 January, many paper tickets will not be allowed on the ferries. This is not a problem. You can purchase an Opal card from many retailers (we got ours at a local seven eleven store) and can top it up with however many dollars you think that you will need. We averaged out at about $10 a day each. You tap the opal card on at the start of a journey and off at the end (you don't need to tap off on the Manly ferries) and the amount of the journey is deducted. If you spend over $15 a day - the amount is capped at $15, On Sundays, the amount is capped at $2.50 which makes Sunday travel especially good value. You can use the cards on all of the public transport - not just the ferries. But the ferries are particularly great value as the views of the harbour are so good.They are very well run; efficient and a great way of getting around. One word of warning - when we were on our way back from Watsons Bay it was really busy. There were people still in the queue and spaces on the ferry but the gates were shut and people appeared to be left behind. It seemed that being on time was more important than taking everyone who was there!
Excellent Sydney Views. Wonderful way to see Sydney from the water. Seniors can spend all day on a ferry for $2.50 which is remarkable. Highly recommended.

A must. Great way to travel, especially on a beautiful day. Just tap your opal card and go. Easy and convenient way to visit a number of places including Manly and the zoo. Cafe on board. Plenty of seating choices inside and out, upstairs or down.

Efficient. . Visited after Christmas when the crowds were huge and the ferries and staff were very efficient, caught the ferry from darling harbour to circular quay and one of the crew was asking people if they wanted their photos taken which was a nice touch, and thumbs up to him. Great way to see Sydney day or night.

Great way to get about and to also see the fabulous Harbour.. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay. Only takes about 20 minutes as its a fast ferry and gives a wonderful view of the harbour and its bays. The return trip was running late due to the huge number of people around, but that doesn't matter when you're on holiday!We've also used the big ferries to Manly and back - they are wonderful 'old ladies".

Love Sydney Ferries. Took the ferry over to Taronga Park Zoo this last Boxing Day. Love these little trips and for this one (timed to perfection) we passed a large contingent of competitor yachts making there way to the start of the Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race. For us country folk we just enjoy being on such a well run service, across the harbour to get the best views of the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge and the foreshore on both sides. Clean and comfortable. Well done.

Do it. We didn't do one of the harbour tours but this is a great way to see the harbour and only spend a few dollars. You can take this to many tourist spots.It's clean and it's efficient! Went back and fourth to manly a few times and it was great!

Efficient and besutiful. There can not be a better view than from one of the ferries at night. The opera house, harbour bridge and city lights are the perfect backdrop. The ferries are a great way to get around and pretty quick especially if you are organised and know the timetable. Pretty clean and hassle free.

Great way to see Sydney. The Sydney ferry service, operating from Circular Quay, is a great way to see Sydney.During a 4 night stay we used the ferry service to visit Tarronga Zoo, Watsons Bay, Manly and Darling Harbour - all worth a visit for different reasons.We found the ferry service reliable and reasonably priced.

Perfect to Visit the Harbour. If you are wanting to see Sydney Harbour on a budget you will not be disappointed in catching a ferry. There are plenty of ferries to take you to plenty of places giving you a different perspective and show you the sights of Sydney from the water.

Nice ride. The ride itself was nice and fair prices for snacks to feed the kiddies. However on both journeys the ferry was late...seemed frantic and disorganized for entry. Disembarking was better. There was an emergency on our journey and crew was nowhere to be found.
Good service very dependable!. We took the ferry on Christmas Eve to go from Circular Quay to Darling Harbor. The ferry service was good. It was clean and on time.
Great way to travel. These ferries are great for travelling around the harbour area and for going further up into the harbour. Great sights all around you and prices are reasonable.

Cheap way to see the sights. Locals recommended taking the ferries as a great way to see the harbor and see the sights from a different vantage point, and I would recommend the same. They weren't very expensive, and there were lots of different trips depending on your budget and time available. Very nice!

Not to be missed. As Aussie Seniors we qualified for $2.50 day tickets on all ferries. What a bargain ! But even if you have to pay a bit more this is definitely the way to get around and see beautiful Sydney Harbour from Manly to Bondi. Give it a go, just avoid commuter hours.

The cheapest way to experience Sydney harbour. The ferry service on Sydney harbour is brilliant, not only for getting around and seeing the sites , but also just to actually pretend to live the life of the rich and famous.
A must for every tourist bucket list.

Love Sydney ferries. There's nothing quite like hopping on and off a Sydney ferry to get around this wonderful city and harbour. Buy an Opal card, load it with whatever amount of money you think you might need (I think the minimum is $20) and all you have to do is tap on and tap off and you'll get balance of funds everytime you use it. It's easy to top up with credit at any of the automated kiosks using your credit or debit card. We were lucky enough to be "held up" while we waited for a big cruise liner to be tugged into position - always a good opportunity to go out on deck and take lots of photos

A great option for traveling around Sydney Harbor. We used the Sydney Ferries several times during our multi-day visit. They were cost effective and an efficient means of travel to different tourist attractions around the harbor. The staff were very helpful assisting my husband to get my wheelchair on and off the ferries even in the rain.

trip on Manly ferry. As an ex-Sydney sider, when visiting a must is a ride on the Manly ferry, I just love it, prefer the older slower one, but still only takes half hour. The sparkling water and boats everywhere, the bridge and layout of the harbour, fantastic.
Convenient way to access the city. Cheap, convenient way to access the city. Lovely view of Sydney Opera House from the water. Check timetables, especially at night as waits can be long.

Our visit tosydney ferries. We enjoyed it thoroughly. Relaxing But a bit crowded. Stopped briefly at each bay picked few people & moved on. So each family could go around once. A bit cool & breezy but enjoyable.
Sydney Ferries, Sydney. Sydney Ferries are a very beautiful for enjoy the see water and pure air you take Ferry and see many good place near Sydney like Cockatoo Island

Great service and local view of the Harbour . Took a short ride after lunch from Circular Quay to Watson Bay. Had great view of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, behind us and on the side respectively. Watson Bay was a great place to take a coffee or fish and chips break before heading back to Circular Quay. It was Boxing Day and the line was super long. It began to rain and the Ferry company was kind enough to arrange for a special ferry to reduce the line - that to me reflects very well on the highly responsive customer service of the company. Kudos!

Efficient & Reasonably priced. Very useful, almost a must if you want to visit Manly beach, Taronga Zoo or Luna Park. These ferries are worth a visit even if you want to have stunning views of the Opera House and the Bridge. Best part- the Opal card (prepaid smart card for traveling on Sydney's public transport) works on ferries too, apart from Metro trains and buses.
Nice way to see the harbour. We use the ferries as transport but they are a more than just a service - they provide a nice way to see the harbour and the kids love them

Good way to travel around the city. The view is great. It's a good way to travel around the city and see the sights at the same time. It's especially great when you're on your free rides since it's a bit more expensive than traveling by bus.
great way to travel. they are cheap and reliable, mostly very clean, staff friendly and helpful. You can travel to lots of different destinations,

Convenient. Ferries are a great way to view Sydney from its prime asset - the harbour - as well as offering a convenient means of exploring more of Sydney's numerous attractions. If intending to take a number of ferry and other public transport journeys, investigate purchasing a day pass.
A great way to travel cheaply on Sydney Harbour. Lots of different places on Sydney harbour to visit and always lots to see. It's a cheap way to travel around the harbour and well-organised.

On time and well used. The ferries are an excellent way for the tourist to get around the city and see the different sights and experience aspects that you would wish to look at. They provide an added attraction to the getting around.

Free Harbour Cruise. Took the Manly ferry as an extension of a bus and train ride. On the Opal card this is just an extension of the journey and is at no extra cost. Ferry was clean and Manly is amazing. Try meusli with yoghurt at takeaway/cafe at the right hand end of the beach from the main shopping road.
Great way to travel. Caught a ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour, the ferry was on time, clean and not crowded. Great views of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and Luna Park along the way.

See the Magnificant harbour. Catch the Sydney Ferry to see and access the Sydney harbour.
Doesn't where you catch the ferry to it is all god.
My suggestion to catch it to Manly, such a good ride and plenty to see.

See the Harbour. Easy access to Circular Quay and all the ferries. Watson's Bay and Doyle's Seafood Rest. Manly and its attractions, the Zoo via the Mosman Ferry, and just sailing around on a nice day - perfect way to see the Harbour at it's best

Love the ferries!. The Sydney ferries are wonderful and a joy to ride. They go all over Sydney Harbour to the various communities along the numerous inlets. On a clear day, the blue waters twinkle and sparkle while dotted with all manner of boats and ships and in the distance rise majestic structures like the Sydney Opera House. You can do one trip, like the one to the Taronga Zoo, or the longer one to Watsons Bay on a faster ferry or do several trips. Sunday's, no matter how many rides you do, it will cost just $2.10 for the entire day. Travel around what has been described "the most beautiful" Harbour in the world and have an indescribably beautiful experience that you will cherish and remember always.

Harbour Icons. We rode the ferry from Darling harbour back to Circular Quay on this particular day and the service was terrific. The weather was awful but the staff were great. They even held the ferry for us so we could board as my vision impaired husband had been caught up in a bunch of people disembarking from the previous run and we couldn't get through the turnstiles.

scenic and fastest way to get to Manly Beach from Circular Quay. There are many ferries in Sydney, connecting downtown to other residential areas. You can go from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay, from Circular Quay to Manly or to many other places. The hop on hop off bus offer also a hop on hop off ferry, but I just wanted to get to Manly Beach and the regular ferry is cheaper. If you have time after a cruise, you can deposit your luggage, go to Manly by ferry, come back, get your luggage and catch a train to the airport from Circular Quay. If you have time before catching a cruise from White Bay or Circular Quay, you can visit The Rocks and then board the ship at Circular Quay or catch a ferry from Circular Quay to White Bay to board the ship there, depending where it is docked.

Great way to explore the harbour. I live in Sydney for 23y after I and my young family moved up from Melbourne in early 90'sWe often used the ferries as our local tour with/without our visitors to run around to Manly The Zoo and Watson Bay The services are slow but very enjoyable during our spare time and not rushing anywhereSlow means we have time to enjoy the views and snapped lots of photosJust recently I tried some night shot from the Manly ferry with Sony a6000 it was fun and managed to snapped a few good oneOther service like the river cat to/from Parramatta worth a trip too

Time For An Update. Travelled on the Manly ferry middle November 2015. It is always nice going over to Manly on the ferry on a nice day out. But geez its certainly time for an update, the Sydney ferry are so grottie, Really nothing appealing.You have to search for the garbage bins, and if one should dare buy any refreshments be prepared to pay the $$,otherwise take food and drink on discreatly. They really are good for an old Tug Boat.

Convenience with a great view. The ferries are very convenient and cost effective and they offer a great view of the harbour during your journey. They can get very busy at peak times obviously. The schedule is easy to understand at the counters to get your tickets are easy to locate.
An excellent form of transport. Really good value and fast way of getting around. Have done nearly all of the routes , had a well and lunch then returned to Sydney .

Magnificent Views of the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. I catch a ferry every time I am in Sydney and I never tire of it. If I have lots of time, I go to Manly. If I don't, I might go from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour. It is always enjoyable. If possible, sit outside and up the front. If you have an Opal card, you can catch as many (public) ferries (and trains, buses and trams) as you like in a day for $15 (or $2.50 on Sundays). Fantastic value.

Great transport and views. What a great way to travel around the Sydney harbor. Scenic, comfortable, and much cheaper than a tour boat! And you pay for it with the same Opal card you use for buses and trains.

Fast and great views. With less than a full day in Sydney, every minute counted! I picked the Ferry (destination: Taronga Zoo), because the lines were short, the trip was short, and the views were said to be excellent. True on all counts.I recommend going to the top, outside, at least if it is a pleasant day. There was plenty of room both directions for me up there, and I found it easy to select a seat on the aisle. If you sit facing left as you depart the harbor, you'll get a stunning view of the bridge ... a little hard to photograph depending on the shutter speed of your camera, given boat motion, but not impossible. I did not get wet although signs warned of this.If you are likewise going to the Zoo, keep an eye on departure times. The Ferry will not wait! And when you get off at the Zoo, go right on in to take the Sky Taxi (Ferry ticket includes entrance fee) to get in ... consider leaving from the Harbor side of the view instead of waiting in the long lines at end of business when you depart.
v good experience. Just had A return trip around 20mins each. Nice view from almost anywhere on the boat. just need to be aware that the gate closes 2mins before departure.

The best way to see Sydney harbour. We took the ferry to Manly and were able to see so many of the Sydney harbour features. The price alone is worth the trip. Once in Manly we explored a lovely shopping street at the end of which there is the beach. The beach was so clean and our 4 year old loved the experience of the shallow waters and sand to become creative. Highly recommended for everyone, no matter the budget.
Great job!. Sydney ferry is best way to see sydney harbour and surrounding suburbs..great job. Happy to be commuter on sydney ferry

Sydney ferries. The ferries are very comfortable and if you sit outside you get a great vi ew of the harbour. All the ferries go from circular key. I took a ferry to darling harbour. They go every half an hour. You can use the opal card which is equivalent to the Oyster card in the uk which has recently been introduced. You get a great view of the Sydney opera house and bridge also the Anzac bridge. Great way to travel. This ferry I took dropped us a short walk to all the main attractions such as Sydney aquarium, wildlife centre and Madame Tussaud's. Good value

Manly Ferry. An excellent, value-for-money way to view Sydney Harbour. Plenty of choice routes. We chose to go to Manly for the day. Ferries are frequent, clean and efficient. Sit inside or outside & take in the fantastic views. Plenty of places around to grab a bite to eat & drink both at Sydney Harbour and Manly. Well worth a trip
So organised and such helpful staff. Our first visit to Sydney and we were so impressed with the work force of the ferries. What a pleasant team. Even the rubbish was cleared frequently.

You waterway pass. Get your Opel card and travel travel travel!
Go to Manley, Watsons bay, and so many other places. Plenty of seats and not expensive. Worthwhile and a must. See sailing boats and have a wave and take some amazing pics! !!

9to5explorer: 5* sightseeing, DIY. The best way to see the amazing natural assets of Sydney is to pick up a day ticket, and see where the ferries take you. Sure, the Manly route is the best, but don't miss out on heading under the bridge and visiting the smaller less known drop off points, inlets and Islands. It's also a good rainy day activity!

"A Life on the Ocean Waves!". Not really on the ocean waves unless you are doing the popular Sydney to Manly run and the southerly swell blows spray over the bow. Sydney ferries are the best way to explore this huge harbour and you can catch a ferry, have lunch at a "pub", wander around the area and then return at your leisure. The majority run from Circular Quary, accessable by train and are cheap and regular. Take the ride to Parramatta past the 2000 Olympic Stadium and explore the suburbs to the west of the CBD with a return trip included in the cheap price. Enjoy the ferry ride to Taronga zoo, then catch the cablecar to the top of the hill and spend the day walking downhill through the zoo and back to the ferry home. Sydney ferries are really good.

A brilliant way to get from Sydney to Manly. If you are a tourist, there are many ways to get around the harbour, but for the cost of a local ferry (a form of public transport here), and even using your 'opal' transport card, you can get a local ferry, sit outside in the sun, and have a glorious harbour tour while also getting to your destination. The ferries run frequently, are easy to find, cheap, and if you take the ferry back to Sydney around sunset, you even get a sunset harbour view! So worth it!
cheap tour of sydney harbour. Manly is a must for any tourist to Sydney. Take a map to identify the many attractions including Rose Bay ,Watsons Bay, the Zoo, and many more
Great service and regular. Wanted to reaquaint ourselves with Manly, these ferries do the trick! They are reasonably cheap still!
fantastic. The ferries are amazing cheap lovely views of the bridge, opera house. Good way to get to places fun

Ferry from Double Bay to Sydney. We stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel in Double Bay and took the ferry to the Sydney Opera House. It was a short ride but we enjoyed wonderful views of the Opera House and Sydney bridge...lovely city view from the water.

Decent, fairly clean, but somewhat slow transportation. I had two experiences with the ferry. I took the Circular Quay to Manly ferry as well as the Circular Quay to Taronga Zoo ferry. The ferries are a bit on the slow side, but it serves its purpose for visitors who wish to take pictures of Sydney Harbour. The ferries are stable though and do seem to be on time. The ferries themselves are old and could definitely use an upgrade. The ferries did seem to be fairly clean though. The restrooms/toilets were clean.Food options are horrible though. There is an on-board station that sells food, but it looked like the pies and other food items have sat there for days.I would definitely suggest taking the ferry to Taronga Zoo as it gives you a great view of Sydney Harbour and it drops you off extremely close to the entrance of the zoo. The ferries probably won't be the best option for regular commuters, but it's a great choice for tourists.
Easy travel. Buy the all day ticket as u can travel on ferries buses and trains with the same ticket works out cheaper by far

Great Way to Get Around. We were visiting Sydney and decided to catch a fast Sydney Ferry to Watson Bay for lunch. The ferry stopped at Garden Island before continuing to Watson Bay. We sat outside and watched the great views over the harbour. The ferry ran every hour so there wasn't a long time to wait, it was clean and the staff were friendly and helped in the boarding of the vessel.
Sydney harbour ferries. A nice way to see the harbour of this beautiful city. It can become crowded in the peak hour sessions and it is considered to be a bit on the expensive side.

Relaxing on the harbour. Unhurried peaceful trip immersed in all the wonders of Sydney Harbour,the Harbour bridge,the opera house,Circular Quay,Admirality Houseand all the great Harbourside homes and yachts and ships on the water.

Great way to see Sydney Harbour. Having lived in Manly I used the ferries daily and at weekends nightly. Its a great unwind at the end of the day to just sit back and relax while taking in the views of the harbour bridge opera house and the rocks. I used to enjoy the rougher crossings. Just make sure you don't miss the last ferry home or its a fair wait for the first one the following morning.

Fun different way to see Sydney. With the nice splash of water and breeze on nice summers day this is a wonderful activity remeber $2.50 all day sunday to go any where in public transport conditions may apply.

They're All Very Good. All ferries are of high quality, offer very good service, their staff are very helpful and courteous, the rides are enjoyable and offer good value for money. For the tourist, this is another of Sydney's many must-dos, very easy to understand and use, and very enjoyable.

'Trip of a lifetime". Jump on and go for the best ride of your life!!!!!!Sit and admire our beautiful Sydney whilst enjoying our waterway.Take a deep breath because you will have the wind knocked out of you at how beautiful Sydney is!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Good Alternative Mode of Transport. Taking the ferry is an alternative way of enjoying Sydney esp.on a great weather.On your way to Circular Quay you'll get to see the Opera House on a different angle. Great for taking photos. Some ferries even have free wi-fi.

Manly Ferry. The Manly Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly is a good way to see some of Sydney Harbour. You can spend time at Manly, walk through the town to the beach, have lunch at a pub then return. The return trip gives you the best view anywhere of Sydney Harbour Bridge. The ride is comfortable - you make up your mind if you want to sit outside or inside.

Scenic boat ride. Definitely should ride the ferry at least once when you are in Sydney. The ferry ride is very scenic and you can enjoy the beautiful view all around while heading to your destination. Can be packed at times especially during peak hours but it is worth while. Just remember to get off at your stop as you can be engrossed taking photos!

Most enjoyable Way to Tour CBD, Sydney. Get an OPAL pass for unlimited ride on Sydney Ferries and Trains for 24 hours; Enjoy all the Ferry rides originating from Circular Quay to visit 3 different destinations towards Zoo; Luna Park and Darling Harbor; In the comforts of your ferry rides, you will see exceptional views of the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House during sunrise and sunsets; Ferries run almost 18-20 hours a day;

a wonderfull experience. I love the old ferries and hope they never replace them with new style ones. I think l have done all the ferry destinations from Circular Quay and the Rivercat from Parramatta as well. Staff always friendly and they are always on time.

Day out with sister in law. I had my sister in law from the Philliplnes with me we went to Taronga Zoo by ferry .She got all the photos she wanted from the ferry.Great photos of the Opera House Harbour Bridge. Then on to the Zoo a fantastic day out.

Manly Ferry. The Manly ferry travels from Sydney city to Sydney's premier surf and Harbour beach, Manly, where there are many great restaurants to suit all budgets and ages as well a beautiful selection of surf and harbour beaches. The ferry is a most affordable way to see the best of Sydney harbour, the Opera House and Harbour bridge. It runs every half hour from very early in the morning till very late at night, has on-board food.

Fantastic way to see the harbour.. Most visitors will probably catch the Manly or Darling Harbour ferry. If you want to see other parts of the harbour take any of the other services such as the Mosman Bay or Balmain ferries. You will see some fantastic views and a chance to see other parts of Sydney. Most economical way to use the ferries is to buy an opal card.

beautiful harbour. getting on a ferry to Manly from Circular Quay is just so good to see our beautiful harbour view from the ferry. Once you get to Manly there is plenty to see and of course you can relax on the beach worth a day trip, enjoy
must take. do take the ferry to enjoy the beautiful city views and the views of the quay, harbour bridge and the opera house, also a good connection to reach the casino
My everyday public transport - irreplaceable!!!!. Easy, cheap, no traffic, always on schedule transport, great views and peace and quiet ride. I prefer it over any other public transport.

The Old Salties of Sydney Harbour. I live in the harbour town of Balmain. I wake to the sound of lorikeets and magpies. And go to sleep to the sounds of seagulls. There's no crashing waves upon a nearby beach simply because there isn't one! It's a harbour village complete with four operational ferry wharves. Balmain is actually where Sydney ferries end their shifts and dock for the night at Mort Bay, home to Sydney Ports Authority. Unbeknown to the thousands of ferry commuters using their services each day, their history harks back to Sydney's first years as a fledgling settlement when much smaller ferries were essential to move workers as well as cargo between the numerous rocky outcrops of this burgeoning trading town. Our ferries have changed according to this harbour city's needs over the years. But still play an essential role in it's every day movements of todays' workers.

Ferry good ferries. The cost is included included in a rail ticket. It is a nice run to Manly, you can get some good shots of the bridge and opera house. Also took the ferry to Darling Harbour where there are shops pubs and restaurants. We walked along to the Pyrmont Bridge crossed over and caught a light railway train back to Central.
Love the ferries. Brings back childhood memories. Well worth the time going across to Manly on a ferry, good experience for children.

An attraction by itself. Taking the ferry is an attraction by itself. The harbour is just stunning and the ferries give you the best view! I like the trip to Parramatta. It starts in the Harbour and goes through Parramatta river. It's a beautiful trip. At Parra you can have lunch, do some shopping and take the train back to the CBD.The ferry to Manly and Watson Bay are also great trips, but a lot shorter :) make sure to check the weather before taking the ferry- especially the one to Manly gets cancelled when there is heavy rain and storm. (but you probably dont want to be on a boat then anyway) Also check the return times, especially from Watson Bay; it's a hassle to have to take the bus back, and the ferries dont go till very late....

Unbelievable variety of destinations. We enjoyed four wonderful ferry rides and they all showed a different view of the city and lifestyle. Our first trip was the compulsory ride across the heads to Manly and all of it's wonders - pedestrian shopping precinct, local pubs, restaurants and of course the beach. The walk around to Shelly Beach was a hidden gem.Next we went to Cockatoo Island and discovered an insight into the convict days, some grand old houses and the best placed tennis court I have ever seen.The next day found us on the harbour again this time on our way to Watson's Bay to enjoy a wonderful lunch of fish & chips at the local pub. The view of the houses facing the harbour were amazing. We explored the walk along the coast on the other side of Watson's Bay and saw the amazing view of the Gap and the cliff face. You also get a good view of the heads from here.Our final trip was an entirely different flavour. Even the ferry was of a different variety - a catamaran because it was to take us up the Parramatta river all the way to Parramatta. It was amazing to see just how big this harbour is and all the bays and inlets along the way. The lifestyle afforded to the residents along the way was very enviable indeed, while Parramatta was an interesting destination in itself. The only negative is that the quay could be a lot nicer, it's a bit tired and desperately needs an update. However most of the ferries are in good condition.

Fantastic transport. Loved using the ferries, so easy and close to our accommodation. Circular Quay to Luna Park, Taronga Zoo, Darling Harbour. Purchase an Opal Card at newsagents, so easy to tap and go...

Best way to travel around Sydney. A must for anyone coming to Sydney is a ferry ride on Sydney Harbour. As locals we are indeed fortunate to have the ferry as our regular means of commuting to the city and what a wonderful way to begin and end the commute. A one way ferry ride from Circular Quay to Milson's Point with a return walk across the Sydney Harbour Bridge is a beautiful outing, so too is a walk to Darling Harbour and return on the ferry to Circular Quay. Take the Watson's Bay ferry for great fish and chips at Doyle's on the pier, takeaway on the beach or if money is no object the a la carte restaurant is beautiful. Dunbar House at Watsons Bay is also delightful. Of course no trip to Sydney would be complete without a return ferry trip to Manly and if you plan a visit to Taronga Park Zoo, the ferry is a great way to begin and end the day.
Great Transport system. It's a great way to get around Sydney, staff are very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend using the Opal card as it works on all public transport

Take a scheduled ferry route. Dont pay for a special cruise. I live in Sydney and get the ferries all the time. They take very scenic routes around the harbour with normal fare.It is not necesary to pay for expensive cruises

The simple pleasures of life. Sydney Ferries going east or west of the starting point at Circular Quay are one of the great simple pleasures of life to enjoy the beautiful Sydney Harbour. We enjoyed relaxing cruises to Manly and a walk over to the ocean beach and also up river to Parramatta, where the waterway narrows and the ferry takes you right into the heart of the city. Manly is the best of the best though. And we'll be back to do it all again. Get a visitors Opal Card. We did and it was good for ferries, buses and trains.

Best way to get around. Clean, inexpensive and convenient way to get around all the while giving you amazing views of the harbor. They have indoor and outdoor seating and the cool breeze is welcome on a hot day. I used the ferries a lot during my week in Sydney and really enjoyed the experience.
The Manly Ferry. Love catching this ferry to Manly and back. Worth the ride and the view, especially if you sit outside. Once at Manly explore the beach, then get the ferry back.

The way to go for the tourist!. Ferries are the way to travel on the Harbour for everyone and esp. the tourist. Cheap harbour cruise or a chance to relax on the water. I grabbed a coffee before embarking and took a trip to Mosman, enjoyed the harbour sights, consumed my coffee,relaxed in the sea breeze on the outer deck,stayed on the ferry and returned to Circular Quay a better person.

a relaxed and inexpensive way to get around Sydney. After experiencing an 1.5 hour cab ride from the airport to Parramatta and the expense associated with this, we opted to take the ferry from Parramatta to Circular Quay, for just over $7 each the ease of the ferry and the scenery to take in was far better than the stresses of the busy roads.
Ferry to Manly. Love this ferry - a perfect view of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera house. Manly is beautiful and lunch at Hugos Manly is not to be missed.

A great way to enjoy the harbour. Forget the expensive harbour cruises. Get a ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay or Manly or go up the harbour to Rydalmere. These are economical and having a few stops along the way is actually a plus. Make sure it's a nice sunny day.

Ferry good.. Great friendly service, usually on time, clean and... well, i wouldn't recommend fishing off the back of the ferry. Last time i did it - i got kicked off at cockatoo island. There are no taxis or buses on cockatoo island as it's a rather small island. So i had to wait for the next ferry. Buuuut - great service none the less.I'd recommend the circular quay to Taronga zoo fairy. I like animals.

Rivercat. A great way to travel, for us to parramatta. A 1.1/2 hour trip that lets you see a lot of the high class areas of sydney you can't see sny other way. Because of track works on the rail lines we took this as an option rather than the red bus!!! $3.80 to parramatta snd a 20 min free bus ride to home from there. Great staff on board ask all on board if the next stop is theres and no attitude from staff or clients. Unlike the trains unable to understand any announcements and a worrying trip at the best of times in the evenings! Well worth a trip to see the city from thd river.
Love the harbour. When the sun is shining, there is no better place to be than Sydney Harbour. Just jump on the see where you end up. Great adventure

A cheap way to view Sydney Harbour. Sydney Harbour is one of the most beautiful in the world and must be seen from the water. There's a lunch cruise that tours around the harbour and provides a buffet lunch. This is pret good value but the cheapest way to view the harbour is to take one of the various ferry rides. My favourite is the ferry to Manly which swings past the opera house and Lady Macquarie's chair and Garden island but also provides views of the bridge. And it takes you to Manly for all it has to offer. Take the train or bus to Circular Quay and the ferry terminal is there. Walk around the quay and enjoy and ice-cream and the buskers, too.
Great ride!. We waited until the sunset to go on the ferry from circular quay to darling harbor, where we stayed. It turned out to be a great choice!!! A must do in Sydney!!!

Always a hit with the kids and friends from overseas. The ferries are always a great way to see the sights of Sydney Harbor, no matter the age. Fun is had by all and with so many stops and places to get off and explore.The Ferries are always clean and comfortable

Fun to Do. Someone suggested for us to just get on ferries and ride everywhere! Then explore. Our time was limited but we did go to Manly on the ferry. The ferries go from the Sydney Harbor and travel on a timely schedule to various places. They are clean, large and comfortable. The prices are fair and you can get an unlimited riding ticket for the day as a tourist. Schedules are posted and there are food and drink purchases available. Sit inside or outside, but we got splashed sitting in the front. This is a must do!

Spectacular for public transport. We got the ferry from Watson's Bay back to Circular Quay after a day walking the coastal path. For a tourist this was perhaps the best way to see the iconic harbour as we rounded the corner at the Opera House and sailed in to Circular Quay. There weren't any ticket machines on board so we payed when we got back to the Quay. For public transport it's pretty impressive and we will be using them again when we come back to Sydney
Wonderful harbour experience. Travelled from Circular Quay to Pyrmont Bay and return. This provided a wonderful view of the harbour, which was particularly spectacular at night.

Seven Minute Crossing. It takes precisely seven minutes to cross Sydney Harbor from the north shore at the base of the Harbour Bridge to the pier at Circular Quay on one of the ferries. The boats are roomy, clean, and well run. There's an upper deck and outdoor seating along the side of the boat for viewing harbour activity on nice days. There are clean toilets on board.The best part is the price - $2.50 (one-way) for seniors. A regular priced adult ticket is $6-7, depending on how far you're traveling.

A great way to explore Sydney harbor. I bought a day ticket and set out on the ferries. On a hot day the breeze is lovely and the sights are marvellous. I hoped on and off for the better part of the day. Be careful when you go up the Paramatta, it may take you quite a while to get back. One has to get off the boat at Paramatta and then wait for the trip back.my recommendation would be to go as far as Olympic Village and then take the next ferry back.
Good option to travel to islands. 4 stars because the yellow colour of the ferries doesn't look that good but if you take the watson bay ferry its more faster and new.

Convenient way to get to distant points.. The ferries are not very expensive, and are a great way to get to Luna Park, Darling Harbor and other points, while passing under the Sydney Bridge and getting a nice view of the Sydney Opera House. The area immediately around the ferry station also has a subway stop that goes all the way to the airport, as well as May other stops, and there was a local craftsman selling digeridoos and beautifully decorated boomerangs just to one side of the ferry station.
great way of seeing Sydney. they are comfortable, cheap, well maintained and run and a great way of seeing the city from another perspective
Lovely views. We made 2 ferry trips during our stay and they gave a fantastic perspective on the city and different views of the bridge and opera house

See the Harbour on the Cheap. This is a fantastic way, and relatively cheap way, to see the harbour and main parts of Sydney, Australia. It costs approximately $6-7 per trip (depending on your 'zone'). Our only caution is to ensure you double check with the ferry crew to ensure the ferry is actually going to the location indicated on the signage. There was a mix-up during one of our trips with the signage and it resulted in about 40 minutes wasted as we had to wait for another ferry.

Spend a day. We traveled the ferries to Manly and also up the Parramatta River really great scenery and views.Also took the ferry on our return from Parramatta ;the only hitch is that at low tide they supply a free bus to take you to the next stop Rydalmere as the ferry can't make it all the way up at low tide ,but no dramas .

Enjoying Sydney Harbour. Sydney ferries provide a cheap, fanscinating view of Sydney harbour life. From humble convict beginnings in the eighteenth century, European sydney has had a marine transport system. A ferry traveller can see many of the harbour islands including Fort Denison where daily tide readings are taken.. The most popular ferry is the trip from Curcular Quay to Manly. You cross the harbour in 35 minutes to a beautiful harbour beach that is linked to an ocean beach via The Corso. Other popular destinations are Watson Bay, Taronga Zoo and parramatta river. A day on the ferries is a must for all visitors.

Relaxing way to travel. Decided to travel by ferry from circular Quay down the Parramatta river all the way to Parramatta to visit a relative while staying in Sydney recently.A most enjoyable,relaxing,easy & affordable way of seeing the beautiful sights around the harbour & river.ferry goes & returns frequently.great day out
Great way to see Sydney. Hop on board an authentic old ferry and visit popular spots in Sydney. Although slower than the faster ones its a good way to enjoy the view...and cheaper

Try the Rivercat to Parramatta!. We use lots of ferries when in Sydney and they are all excellent, but the Rivercat up to Parramatta is one of our favourites. Not expensive and over an hour's ride up the river past lots of interesting things, much cheaper than a "cruise".

Fabulous ferries. I catch the ferry three times a week and find the trip under the Bridge spectacular every time. Most ferry hands are friendly and the ferries generally run on time. Beware if catching from Birchgrove as ferries won't stop if no one getting off so consequently leave the wharf sooner than you would expect.

Fabulous Ferries. There are so many ferries leaving Circular Quay to different locations around the harbour. My 2 favourites are the Manly Ferry, which is a half hour trip to a cosmopolitan centre with a netted harbour beach and a surf beach and the Cockatoo Island ferry where there are often interesting exhibitions and cafes and bars in the summer months..

A brilliant way to get around.. This has to be the best way of getting around the harbour area. The ferries are punctual,clean, quick and cheap. Buy an Opal Card. Expenditure is capped at $15 a day, so that once you have spent that, all other journeys that day are free. You can also use the card on buses and trains

Making the choice of going everywhere by ferry. Hosting a guest in Sydney, we made the decision of only using ferries as our mode of transportation around the tourist attractions.It was a hot week and being by the water was a real treat.The most we ever had to wait was 20 minutes, going from one pier to another in Circular Quay. Not too bad in a tourist schedule. The only down side? It was not cheap...

Quick convenient scenic way to get around. We tried on this occasion the ferry to Watsons Bay to enjoy a delightful meal at Watsons Bay. The ferry ride was fast and offered amazing views of the harbour on the way back and forward. They have ferries to lots of places and worth visiting all for the scenic views at least.
Watch Time Go By. You have to do a Sydney Ferry ride, get the Quay to Mosman ride, and walk back around to Cremorne Point (about 25 minutes) and get Ferry back at Cremorne Point.

Fantastic, affordable, scenic, frequent transportation. Wonderful way to get around Sydney area using ferries at Circular Quay (pronounced "key"). Great sightseeing views of the Sydney Bridge and Opera House at different times of the day and night.
Easy transport. These ferries make it easy to get around Sydney and there not expensive the best run is to Manly beach about 45 minutes on the most beautiful harbor in the world

Very easy to use and the views are wonderful. Really enjoyed using the ferries to get around on the water. Access was easy using the Opal card and boats were reasonably clean and had plenty of seating inside and outside. You can certainly tell that they are used regularly for commuters at 9 and 5. Never got seasick even when the wind was blowing, which is saying something for me. Highly recommend them
Manly Ferry. Great relaxing trip, takes around 40 minutes, plenty of places in Manly to eat or drink, Manly beach is spectacular.

Great visitor attraction. If you are at a loose end and in Sydney, Circular Quay ferries are something different to visit.Almost in the heart of the city, access to other attractions can be had via the ferries.Vibrant and busy but great to see.

Seemless. Travelling on Sydney ferries is a treat! They run to time, they are clean, cost effective and works well with bus services. Such a relaxing mode of travel and what better backdrop of Sydney than from our world famous harbour.

White Bay Ferry.. Finally. A great way to start and finish your cruise. Take a very pleasant approx 20mins trip on the Harbour there is a walk at present to the cruise wharf BUT the ferry wharf is being moved clers once the pedestrian way is finished. Buy your tickets from Capt Cook Cruises ferry from circular quay rerun and u are right there for connection to the train and ferry lines or the CBD hotels and attractions
Great way to get around. These ferries are a great way of getting around the sights of Sydney whether it be to Luna Park or to the beach
Love this!. I love the idea that the ferries are part of the public transport. We got a ferry from circular quay to parramatta and it was lovely!
Efficient and Attractive service. The ferries are a good way to get around if they go to where you want to go. Even a short trip to Rose Bay gives passengers a lovely relaxing view of the Harbour.

An Aussie Icon sight seeing adventure on a shoestring. I love it. Its hard to remember when holidaying that for a lot of Sydney siders this is is routine daily life to get to and from work.
