For most of us as a more tourist orientated its interesting to appreciate the demand on these vessels and how well they are maintained based on dealing with the abuse mother nature throws at them hour after hour
Nice and good transport system. Buy an Opal public transport card. Take the Ferry to any were. For a few dollars you can see a lot of Sydney from the water.Must visit Manly and Darling harbour.
Circular Quay. Fantastic views from the ferry while you travel under the Bridge from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour
Trip to Manly. Pleasant and comfortable on a nice sunny day. Easy to board at Circular Quay. Easy to get tickets from vending machine. Overall good.

Great fun. Very reasonable price to get around Sydney Harbour. Prompt service and very well maintained vessels. Great way to get from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour. Cheaper than the trains and less walking.

Stress free on board. The journey on the boat is relaxing and stress free. Sydneysiders are fortunate to have this form of convenient travel.Embarking and disembarking can be a hassle.Ticketing can be difficult for someone visiting the city. I needed only one short ferry ride on public transport but required assistance to obtain tickets at Circular Quay . The vending machine would not take my cash note. I could not buy 2 fares at once and had to insert a credit card twice to produce 2 identical tickets.
Worth a visit every time we are in Oz. Love taking the kids for a ferry ride around the harbour and seeing all the sites. Appreciate it even more now that we live so far away

Sydney Ferries. Go to Watsons Bay, Manly, Zoo, Balmain, Lavender Bay - just about anywhere with a wharf. Take any ferry to see the sights. Costs vary but who cares when you are out on such a beautiful harbour...close to trains and bus

The perfect marine highway to explore Sydney Harbour.. We have been regular users of Sydney Ferries for decades and never ceased to be amazed by the beautiful sights to be seen along the length and breadth of what is arguably the most beautiful harbour in the world. Whether it be a trip to Manly seaside or Parramatta riverside the journey is full of surprises. Explore Darling Harbour, Olympic Park r have a fabulous day at the zoo. The fleet may be a little long in the tooth but to us it simply adds character to this wonderful waterway. The services are frequent, on time and highly affordable. Go Sydney Ferries.

Jump on Jump off harbour travel. Sydney Ferries the only way to get about to the various places in the massive harbour,and enjoy the spectacular views of the harbour whilst getting to you venue. Good value and relative comfort for the trip. If the weather is good which it invariably is then you can sit outside and soak up the rays and the views bonus as we say 2 for the price of 1. The staff are friendly and don't mind if you acknowledge them. On one of our many trips we had the typical Aussie commentary which made us laugh. Direct and to the point but in a friendly way that just makes traveling in Oz a delight.

This is the best best best attraction in sydney beyond priceless.. i suffered deep depression for 10 years. and nearly everyday i was on that ferry. i was in crisis mode. i was very young. and had things so crazy happen to me it was crisis mode. but never wasted a day. and always always always was on these ferries.it fed my soul.love love love love love love love the ferries. can't say enough terrific things about sydney ferries. also catching a train to circular quay train station the view i was in awe. seeing the harbour. i'm tired bug day hope this makes sense.
sundays are the best. Great way to travel around Sydney especially on A Sunday when travel is only $2.50 for the whole day

The Best Public Transport Around. If you can get a ferry in Sydney to where you need to then do it.If you're a visitor then just jump on the Manly Ferry and get a great view of the harbour. If you get the ferry to Darling Habour from Circular Quay you will go right under the Harbour Bridge which is pretty cool.
great way to see the harbour. Always good fun, ferries or water taxi great way to travel and see the harbour. Day trips offer tea/coffee and cake good family adventure on the water

Take the trip to Parramatta. We had some time to kill in Sydney so we thought we could take the ferry to Parramatta. It is a great way to see the broader reaches of Sydney. It takes about 40 minutes to get to Parramatta and you can easily stroll around the Parramatta city centre before taking the ferry back into the city.
Iconic. These ferries are constantly in and out of Circular Quay, the plying their trade all day long. They are a regular feature on the harbour and are well used by the Sydneysiders.

More than ferries. Sydney ferries are part of the city'sp public transport system. But you can get a million dollar view of the beautiful harbour by taking the ferries. Even if you don't have any need to take the ferries to commute, at least try the one to Taronga zoo. You won't regret.
Charming Ferry Service. A fantastic way to see the Harbour and get around. Cheap, fast and generally I schedule, the ferry service was a great way to get to the neighboring harbors and beaches.

Cheap and effective way to see the harbour. Looking for a cheap cruise around the world famous Sydney harbour than Sydney Ferries is for you. Reasonably cheap, comfortable and using the perks of the opal system incredibly cheap (start and end at same point in under and hour).
Good hub. We used Sydney ferries a couple of times .. Fast and reliable .. Good way to see the harbour comparatively cheaply

Just Fabulous!. We had overseas friends visiting from the UK, who had limited time in Sydney, so the ferry was a great way to show off our beautiful harbour and Manly. The Opal card for all day travel on public transport was such a bonus, as the maximum per day was $15 each , no matter how many forms of public transport we used. The staff were all friendly, informative and efficient.We were all very impressed with the service.
Great way to see the harbour. Reasonable fare, clean and on time. Good way to see the beautiful harbour and get to lovely places like the Zoo, Manly or Luna Park.

Easy to use. Love the Sydney ferry system.It's super easy to use and is a lovely relaxed way to get around Sydney main attractions rather than relying just on busy buses and trains.Efficient and comfortable.You get fabulous views along the harbour as you travel.Get an Opal card if you are making a few trips.it's easy to use and load money onto and works out a lot cheaper than single tickets.You can use it on buses and trains as well as the ferries.The ferries are a great way to explore a bit further afield to beaches like Manly as well.
Really Enjoyable Trips. These are very reasonably priced. They take the city travel card (Opal) so easy to use. There is a little circular 30 minute route. We recommend the trip to Manly.

Great way to view Sydney harbour area. It is not very expensive to take a ferry (you can use their Opal card for boarding) and offers you a great view of circular quay and darling harbour area. You can go below Syd Harbour bridge and get up close to Syd Opera House too.

Ferry your way around Sydney Harbour. This us a fantastic way to see Sydney. Hop on any ferry and go on a round trip. Buy a ferry pass or opal card and you are on your way. You can get off and walk around at some stops or just stay on board till you get back to Circular Quay. Enjoy the beautiful harbour at a cheaper rate

A day on Sydney Harbour.. Wife and I often come to Sydney. With our Seniors Card we find exploring the waterways (and everywhere else) a great delight. Get a ferry from Circular Quay and stay on it. Last trip we went from the Quay to East Balmain then onto Star Casino, across to North Sydney and back to the Quay. Boarded another ferry to Watson Bay for lunch at Doyels pub and back to the Quay.

Number one thing to do in Sydney is take the Ferry to Manly. As a Sydney local for 25 years I still love the ferry trip from Circular Quay to Manly. Manly itself is a great tourist destination, but the journey there in the ferry trip is just awesome. Take in the majesty of the iconic Opera House and Harbour Bridge and pass by some of the great areas of Sydney including hectares of National Park within cooee of the city centre. Pass by Nielsen Parks iconic harbour beach, Watson Bay (Another journey worth taking) and past the heads which can be quite adventurous if there is a big Eastern swell coming through. If in Sydney you must get out on the harbour, and this us one of the easiest ways to experience it.

Beast way to travel. There is no better way to travel into Sydney from Manley, or back! Incredible views, comfortable (inside or out) and not bad value either. Forget the bus or driving, use the ferry!

Cheap way of viewing the harbour. We took Sydney ferries 4/5 times to go to different beaches. It was a great way to do siteseeing for cheap. Lovely view. Much better than taking taxi (which we did a few times too) to other beaches.

Breezy Views. Took the ferry a few times to Taronga Zoo and to Darling Harbour from Circular Quay both times.
The outdoor seating offered great views of Sydney Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House. It can get a little hot so going indoors might give you some respite from the heat.

Sydney by Ferries !. AAH, I love the Ferries on Sydney's waterways ! Its safe, clean, relaxing,- just wonderful,what a way to see Sydney's amazing surroundings !! We made our way on the lovely yellow/green Vintage Boat, off to Manly Beach in a romantic way, the views and sunny sparkling on the water with warm wind is divine, been back for a home visit from Queensland, my heart is in Sydney anyway. So, take a ride to all of the many stops on water ways, its not to miss, you haven't seen Sydney if you don't breath this City in from the boat :)

The best way to get about in Sydney. The ferries are surely one of Sydney's icons. They are relatively cheap, frequent on most routes and even have free wifi. An Opal card can be charged up close to most ferry terminals and is much easier than purchasing a ticket for every trip.

A GREAT WAY TO CAPTURE SYDNEY HARBOUR. Spend a day on Sydney Harbour the relaxing way, on the many ferry rides available and drink in the views. Hop off and explore. This is the best way to see the glorious, number one rated harbour in the world at very little cost.

ferry ride to manly. Recently spent the day at manly getting there by train and ferry. The ferry service wasn't too crowded for a Sunday and it was a cheap day out only costing 2.50 for the whole day. The ferry was clean and so were the restrooms.

Smooth Ride!. We took this ferry to reach Bondi beach. It was an amazingly smooth ride. I am apt to get sea sick when on the water at times, but did perfectly fine on this very smooth and beautiful ferry ride. You will have many photo opportunities with the array of backgrounds to include the Opera House and bridge. Well worth experiencing!

Catch the Ferry and Visit Manly. Catch the ferry from Circular Quay and go to Manly Beach. It's a very tradicional tourist attraction and worth it. Manly is a beautiful beach with lots of eateries and shops where you can feel how is the locas live in Northern Beaches.
My children enjoyed the trip on the ferry. Our family used the ferry to travel to Neutral bay as well as Manly. It is the best way to see Sydney Harbour.

Runs like clockwork. Sydney Ferries is a most impressive transport system. Whilst the Vessels look great and traditional, they are in great condition and kept spotlessly clean. They operate to time and offer a great choice of destinations - we used then a number of times including Manly, Pyrmont (Sydney Fish Market) and Watsons Bay. The Crew are friendly and refreshments are available on board. You purchase tickets at circular quay and the fare are great value

Nice to see the Opera House from the water. It was raining for days when we were in Sydney so we thought this was a good way to see the harbor and stay dry. Runs on time and plenty of space. Also really clean!

Great low cost option. My family used several of the ferries during our trip. The schedules are easy to figure out and they left in time. Our son always grabbed some French fries from one of the vendors before we hopped on.

No Better Way To Get Around. i visited Sydney for the first time in November 2015, and spent a week exploring. I took the ferry a few times when I traveled to Taronga Zoo and to Manly. Very relaxing way to get around.

Sunday Funday!. On a Sunday, if you are with a child, you can travel for $2.50 per person all day and on whatever you want...all the way to the Blue Mountains. Or get a ferry to Manly. Go to Circular Quay and walk around The Rocks. The craft markets are on both Saturday and Sunday.

See the city by water. The ferries are a great way to see the sites of the city. Be sure to get the Opal Pass. With the Opal Pass you can use the city buses, trains and ferries all day for a maximum of $15. Great service!

Wet and wild. Very efficient, on time and reasonable transportation all around Sydney. Definitely get an Opal card and load it with cash for tapping on and off the ferries AND trains, buses, etc. watch out for wild waters!

Great view of the Opera House and bridge. The ferry to Taronga Zoo offers a great view of the Opera House and Harbour bridge. Also the ride from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour provide you with a few of some nice houses at the various stops.Take note that on every Sundays, you can buy a day pass for AUD 2.50 and travel on trains and ferries all you want for the whole day!

Parramatta service to Circular Quay.... When I stay in Parramattta, and want to head into Sydney I always use the ferry service as opposed to catching the train! The fact that you are cruising along Parramatta river and all the sights and different changes in landscape as opposed to looking at train tracks and apartment buildings is in itself worth it. Once you get to Circular Quay its a short walk to the rocks and the CBD of Sydney and obviously other ferry services! If you are staying in Parramatta and require a save and pleasant means to get to Sydney, this is your best bet!

Affordable fun. The locals use the Sydney Ferries to get around so we did too. They're inexpensive and dependable and are used with the Opal Card, which also can be used on buses and trains. From Circular Quay, we visited Manly and Watsons Bay and it was an efficient, relaxing way to travel.

Easy to use transport. Recently I made my first trip to Sydney. I don't know the area at all but found the Ferries to be easy to use and able to get me to most locations. Very basic inside but really what do you need as it is for short travel only.

Don't leave Sydney without taking a ferry ride. We always take the time to get on a ferry (often we just do a round trip without getting off) and go for a ride somewhere around the harbour. It's such a lovely, memorable experience...and if you have a Senior's Card it's so cheap that it must be one of the value experiences to be found anywhere.

A very good place to transport and to see wonderful views of Sydney. Sydney Ferries is a public transport to move in the different parts of the Sydney Harbour. However, you can catch it to see an amazing views of the city. We catched it only once to go to Taronga Zoo at the other part of the Harbour, and the tour was great! You can see Sydney Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge, some emblematic skyscrapers and a lot of iconic landmarks of the city. It is a turistical attraction by itself.(thank you dad for this gift)

Very efficient way of travel!. By far the easiest and quickest way to travel across the harbour to places such as Taronga Zoo and Manly! We bought an Opal card and just topped it up as required and it was so easy, we just had to tap on and tap off with each trip!

I don't know why I avoided the ferries but I shouldn't have!. I have visited Sydney many times over the past 10 years and for some reason I avoided getting on a ferry. Silly move. Just get on one. Enjoy being out in the beautiful Sydney Harbour. Take photos. Lots of them! Even if you don't need to get to anywhere in particular, it is an easy way to check out the Harbour. It does just happen to provide a wonderful service to places like Manly rather than driving through the crazy Sydney traffic.

Good way to view the city.. The ferries are an excellent way to get around this busy city. We would recommend taking the trip up river to Parramatta which passes the Olympic stadium and allows you to view all the attractions from the water.

Take a ferry to see the harbour, great time and very resonable price.. We took the ferry to Manly, it is one of the best way to see the harbour and not have to pay a fortune. The ferry ride is under $8 a person for the 30 minute ride and you have great views of teh Opera House, the bridge and Mrs Macquaries Point. Once in Manly go and see the Sea Life Sanctuary, buy your ticket at the info booth just outside the ferry terminal, they sell them for half price. The sanctuary is a 5 minute walk down the beach from the ferry.
Convenient Ferry to Manley. Took the convenient ferry to Manley for dinner and it was great although the water was a little choppy on the way. Drinks available.

Like being on holiday. Living near mosman bay, we always use the ferry to go to the city. It's like being on holiday and today there was a cruise ship at circular quay and one waiting near the taronga zoo ferry terminal presumably waiting to dock. There is always something to see on the harbour and even though it's only a 20 minute journey in, it's the only way to travel.

One of the finest ways to experience Sydney.. One of the most family friendly ways to experience the city while obtaining access to great destinations such as the Tooronga Zoo, ocean beach at Manly, is to simply hop across to Luna Park at North Sydney.

great tourist thing to do!. cheap and takes you practically everywhere! do people use these ferries normally? is it an everyday thing??? we loved it! it was so much fun!it's only around 6-8 dollars per person. GREAT!

Ferries in Sydney - well worth the money. Great trip to Manly Beach via the Circular Quay Ferries. Lovely to see the Harbour from a different view. Ferry was clean and staff were very friendly and pleasant.
Quick cruise from Circular Quay to Manly. Took the ferry from circular quay to manly and back to have dinner. Quite practical, easy schedule and reasonably priced.
Easy and cheap way to reach different destination. Took the ferries several times, not only a good transportation but also a good way for you to view and tour around the city.

Efficient and professional service. Inexpensive and brilliant way to get around the city and see the sights.The staff are obviously all well trained and safety is paramount.The views are spectacular and you can just purchase an opal card and hop on and off all day.Sundays are especially good value

Best Travel mode in Sydney . Easily the best mode to travel along the harbour n Manly. Cheap n the most convenient. Darling harbour to Manly is nearly 45 mins ride. Ferries are really comfortable with lot of seating space. U can park ur strikers n cycles also inside. They stick to their timings which is very good. Tip: As a tourist, if you take weekends then the whole family pack unlimited rides is extremely cheap.

Essential for the Sydney experience. We had to do a ferry boat while here to complement our experience. It is fast and on schedule. It provides good views of the harbor and drops visitors off at destinations distant from the city.We went to Watson's Bay and did the lighthouse walk. Pretty, but not a must see. Doyle's restaurant is a tourist place with very average food. I would save the calories for better places in Sydney.

Fantastic way to get around the city. The iconic Manly ferry is a must for anyone wanting to travel from Manly to the City or vice versa. On our last trip the 5 big P&O liners were anchored in the Harbour and what better way to see them than from the Ferry. The use of Opal Card or day tripper tickets on Sydney transport means that the ferries which are part of this promotion are really easy to get onto a travel from one side of the Harbour to the other.

A must-do on any visit to Sydney. One of the best and most affordable ways to see beautiful Sydney Harbour and it's surrounding coves and bays. We took a taxi from the city to Manly which cost $65, on the ferry it was $7.60!My last trip was in horrendous weather but kudos to the Captain and crew who explained that we were about to get into rough seas as we went through the heads and advised everyone to sit down and hang on! Very professionally run operation, highly recommended.

Inexpensive way to get around with great views of the harbour bridge and opera house.. Took the evening ferry out to Manly, stunning views on the way out and back, had dinner in Manly, then a tour of three different bars and caught the last ferry back to Sydney at 1am. Fast and efficient service $7.90 return.

Relaxing as well as scenic.. Love getting on the ferry to Manly - incredible views and a very relaxing experience. Nothing better than a quick trip to Manly, a walk on the beach, a bit of shopping and, of course, some delicious fish and chips.
Nice Afternoon Trip. Tried the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour on a sunny afternoon. Great view. Love it so much. Will definitely do it again

See the city for $25. . Staying at Penrith (Sydney's far West) we got a day pass for $25 each. This entitles you to bus, train & ferry travel anywhere in greater Sydney on their network, till up to 4am (from memory) the next day. We jumped on a train to circular quay, departed & saw the big cities harbour by Ferry. The locals call them the Government ferries as there are other harbour operators who don't accept the $25 ticket.

SUN SEA AND SHIPS!. I had forgotten just how wonderful it is to travel in Sydney by ferry. It was just amazing as it was a warm, sunny day and 5 cruise liners were in the harbour which made it an extra special journey. There are few harbours in the world where this would be possible - fireworks in the evening made it an extra special day.
Great way to see Sydney at low cost. Why pay for a cruise when you can catch a ferry?Take a trip to Manly,the zoo,kirribilli for a cheap day out

Fast, Efficient & Right on Time. Can't beat this system for their truly amazing efficiency. Took the Ferry from Circular Quay to Taronga Zoo. The status board at the ferry dock indicated when each ferry would arrive and its destination. Like clock work! The crew is very friendly and helpful. Best way to get around and great views on the water.

NIce, cheap trip between the Bays. Take one if you don't want to spend fortune on excursion boats and want to go around the Opera House. It will take to you to nice places in Sydney withing 15 minutes.

best value cruise of the harbour!. I recently took a ferry trip from Pyrmont Bay to Circular quay via Milsons Point. It was a gorgeous morning and the view of the harbour, the smooth ride and the approach to the quay from the bridge was magic! All for the cost of a ferry ride !

Parramatta Ferry. This was a great way to see Sydney from the water, at a fraction of the price of the tourist boat. We were already in Parramatta, so we caught the ferry all the way back to Sydney Circular Quay. The price was only a few dollar, for which we got a ride of over an hour, ending up going under the harbour bridge and past the Opera House. Well worth the minimal cost.
Scenic Cheap and Efficient. For people with a seniors card you can travel for $2.50 a day and get the best views of the bridge, opera house and surrounds What could be better than that.
Love Sydney!. What a great way to get around, so punctual and professional. The ferries have been so well maintained,
Well planned. The ferries in town are an amazing way of getting around the city from the friendly staff to the quick journey all in all a simply must do while in town

Magic trip to Manly. Whenever I am in Sydney I make sure I have time to travel on the Sydney Ferries. I have just enjoyed a pleasurable trip from Circular Quay to Manly. It's always nice to sit outside in the sun on a hot day too.
Fun on the Ferry rides. Visited many places on the ferries. Very good value. Using my opal card I could hop on and off at various places to have a look around.

Convenient for travel. The ferry terminal provides transportation to many of Sydney 's greatest sites. Manley, zoo, etc. It is next to the Opera House which is an easy walk. SUGGESTION: buy a transit ticket in the office across from the ferry and under the elevated train. The transit tickets provide cheaper fares.

Excellent way to get around Sydney. The distinctive green & yellow ferries are very punctual and well run and give great access to all the major tourist areas.
They are the cheapest way to get out and about on the water.
Unique Public Transport. Take the ferries to explore the harbour...cheaper than a cruise...a trip to Manly is almost mandatory...a unique experience to savour...
A great and cheep way to see the harbour . As they say when in Rome do what 10000 of Sydney siders to go on a Manly Ferry or any Ferry going to any point in the harbour and save a bundle.

Convenient and inexpensive travel. As part of our visit to Sydney we took the ferry to/from Circular Quay - Taronga Zoo and Circular Quay - Manly.The departure information (wharf number, times, stops) was clear and easy to understand and the frequency of the ferries was good.Ticket staff and the ferry crews were polite and helpful.Taking the ferries also allows for stunning views of the Sydney skyline and sights such as the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge.

A great alternative to road or rail. Sydney harbour ferries are great, not simply for a way of getting from A to B, but as a haven on very hot days when walking around is difficult. The range of destinations from circular quay is impressive. In addition to the ferries to manly it is possible to take a ferry up the river to Olympic Park which passes many interesting locations in the hour long journey. Dont miss the Sydney ferry experience
Take as many ferries Sunday as you wish for only AU$2.50. Take your sweetie and your Opal cards for unlimited ferry rides Sundays for a paltry AU$2.50. It's the deal of the week in Sydney!

Sydney Ferries - Hop On Board!. Purchase an OPAL card and you are on your way. The public ferries are very inexpensive and a great way to see many of the major sights in SYD. The maximum deducted from your OPAL card per day is $15 - regardless of how many rides you take on the ferry, train (including the train to the Blue Mountains) and bus. On Sundays, the maximum deduction is $2.50, but the ferries can be very crowded then.For the SYD Harbor Bridge Walk - You can do the Pylon Lookout, then continue on to walk across the bridge. Have lunch at Ripples (water view restaurant). Take the ferry (or train) from Milsons Point back to Circular Quay.Or do it in reverse:Take ferry or train from CQ to Milson's Point. Walk across bridge to Pylon Lookout. Finish the walk and have lunch in The Rocks.It is a 6 minute ferry ride.Manley - Ride the ferry from CQ to Manley. It is a 30 minute ride. Taronga Zoo - Ride ferry from CQ to the Taronga Zoo. Then ride the Sky Safari to the Upper zoo entrance. It is a 12 minute ferry ride.Darling Harbor - Ride ferry from CQ to Darling Harbor. It makes quick stops at Milsons Point, McMahons Point & Balmain East. It is a 26 minute ferry ride, which can be done in either direction.The ferry from CQ to Milsons Point and also the ride from Milsons Point to McMahons Point provide great photos of both the bridge and the Opera House and are also excellent night time photos when both are lit up.All of these rides glide past the Opera House for good views from the water. The Manley & Zoo ferries pass very close to the Opera House.
Organized and easy. Sydney Harbor ferries are the way to go if wanting to travel around to Manly, Watsons Bay, others. They are always on time and the price is good.
Easy to use. This is by far the best way to get around Sydney whether to the zoo, Manly beach or Milsons point. Cheap and a great view of the harbour especially at night.

Holiday transport . A great system to get you all over Sydney. Now they have Opal card tap on/off system like Oyster in London. Works on buses and trains too. Staff friendly and efficient. No grouches like you often get in London.

Ride in the transport the locals use. I doubt that there are very many places in the world where the local transport provides such stunning views.We travelled across to Manly, where the beach is just a very short walk away from the dock. Stopping at the chocolate place at the dock is a must. Their food and drinks are to die for.If you want to get great photos, try to be one of the first on and go upstairs and get to the front of the ferry.A ferry ride is definately something you must do if visiting Sydney.Very few things are this cheap.

Friendly helpful staff. We visited Sydney and decided to have a trip around it's waterways. Unsure of what to do we asked a staff member on the ferry that approached. With their recommendations we had such a wonderful time cruising around a few places. Then an extra helpful terminal worker at Circluar Quay as we had touble with the ticket machines. So nice to have this type of wonderful experience in a big busy city. Credit to those involved!

See above review for Sydney Harbour. See above review for Sydney Harbour . Darling Harbour is good as well. Plus have a look at other places for the day to go the ticket office people are very helpful.

Makes traveling fun.. Great way to see the sights. You can pay a lot for organised tours but all you need to do is buy an opal card and get off and on the public boats as often as you want. The fare is capped at a max. of $15 per day. This also includes trains and buses.

A great way to get around Sydney. Buy an Opal card and tap on, tap off - use on all the various ferries to get you around Sydney. Avoid Manly Beach & Bondi Beach on Saturdays & Sundays - cattle herding comes to mind!
Nice journey. Such a good journey got to see aloe if Sydney and it is a breathtaking sight defiantly recommend this mode of transport and a reasonable price

Chilling experience. If you wish to have a good view of the Opera house and Sydney Harbour Bridge, you may choose to sit outside on the ferry, but it would be very windy as soon as the ferry start moving. There is a cafe on ferry too. Enjoy the ride!

Great way to afordably see the harbour. Sydney ferries are a great way to get across the harbour and take in the awesome views without spending as much on private services.
Services are frequent and cheap with almost all vessels offering outdoor seating
Take a cheap ferry trip on the harbour. From circular Quay you can take a ferry ride on the Sydney harbour for 30 mins with lovely views of the Opera House and the bridge.
Easy transporation to visit surrounding Sydney locations.. Super easy to use, clean, quick, departures to various locations all day. Wonderful views of Sydney from all areas.

fantastic Alternative way to get around the Sydney area. Ferries are included on an opal card so if you get an opal card for travel it is a great alternative mode of transport, enabling you to get around the harbour as well as over to Manly, rose bay, double bay, darling harbour etc

Best way to see the Sydney Harbout areas. Ferries are run frequently and are quite popular among the tourists specially on a Sunday. The ferries cruise along the harbour to take people to nearby locations and sight seeing trips. Quick, easy and reliable services are normally filled with families on a weekend with discounted ticket prices. Some ferries also offer snacks and drinks on board. Great way to explore the harbour of Sydney.

quick and fun way to travel around sydney. We took the ferry trying to get to Bondi beach. It was very quick ride but there were no taxis or buses at the connecting end.We had to walk a ways to find a cab.

So many to choose from!. A great way to see Sydney and many other areas accessible by sea or the river. Theses are a reliable, relaxing way to get around in Sydney, some ferries even have refreshments on board that you can enjoy as you travel.Ferries are accessed at Circular Quay Sydney, and are close to trains and buses.It is easy to access the place you want to go as all ferries are well signed and there are ferry staff to assist if you need them.If you are in Sydney for an extended period of time purchase an Opal Card so you can access ferries, buses and trains with an easy tap on and tap off system.

Great way to spend a day ..... Being from the west coast we don't have anything like these ferries, So we found these were great, either to get from one place to another or just picking the longest trip, sitting back and cruising the river system....And with the Opal card travel fees are capped at $15 a day soo you wont get any better value than that for your money...So weather your just jumping on for the 15-20min trip across to mainly for a swim or beer overlooking the beach or choosing the 3 hr Parramatta run... its all great fun..

Best Value Tourist Experience in Sydney. How can you beat a tour which takes in all of the highlights of the City of Sydney in one go. Take the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay. Not only are you on one of the most beautiful and clean harbours in the world, you cruise past harbour Bridge, Opera House, The Prime Ministers and Governor General's House, Fort Dennison, Taronga Zoo, the beautiful and expensive houses of the eastern suburbs, past the Sydney heads to Manly. Fish and Chips on Manly beach. Take a dip. Grab and ice cream and head back to the ferry for the round trip. If there is one thing you do in Sydney - take the Manly Ferry Trip!

A nice way to get from A to B. I generally use the ferries to commute and they are reliable and generally pretty timely. It's also a great way to get around for tourists and see some of the wonderful sights Sydney has to offer.

Ferry to Manly and back. We took the ferry to Manly as it was the cheapest way to get there, as we bought a OPAL card. Easy to board at the wharf, and there was plenty of room to wander about on the boat. We managed to get a nice seat outside at the front for our return part of the journey. I usually feel ill on ferries, but was fine with this one, even when part of the journey crossed some choppy water. The journey to Manly and back takes about 30 mins, and gives great views of the city and surrounding area

Essential. No visitor should fail to use.. The way to experience Sydney. Extremely cheap family day tickets on a Sunday, but fares are always reasonable. Frequent, fast, convenient, easy. The best way to get around Sydney harbourfront locations. Study the map then jump on a ferry and travel the harbour area. Excellent. Joining away from CBD, finding tickets can be tough - but you can purchase as you exit at CBD. Buying an Opal card from a newsagent is probably the most convenient approach, though - good for buses and trains too.

Great way to see the city.... We spent 3 days at The Rocks and surrounds. We had a number of ferry rides and saw pretty much all of the harbour. Watsons Bay was a favourite. I don't think there is a better way to view Sydney....

Friendly staff & beautiful views. The staff were very helpful and friendly, complimenting the spectacular views, even on a short ride. Ideally sit outside on the deck to make the most of it. Line up at the front while waiting, to ensure you get a seat on the top deck.

Watson bay to circular quay. We took the ferry to Watson Bay and back from circular quay. if you want a nice day just to chill, with some nice views our of the harbour and back - then great way to do this is use this ferry. Watson bay has a few nice places to eat. We ate at the Watson Bay Beach club restaurant (great size chicken wings).

The coolest ride on a hot day. . Take a ferry ride anywhere on the harbour and you'll enjoy beautiful views. My favourite is the quick ride over to Milsons Point where you can look back at the cityscape and then discover the vibrant Kirribilli cafe scene.
Great way to get around. We often stay near circular quay so the ferry is a great way to get around. It is cheap and easy and the maps and guides are easy to use.

Excellent way to check out Sydney harbour. Excellent way to check out Sydney as harbour. We found the ferries to be well priced and frequent. It's the best way to see the harbour bridge and the opera house.
Great mode of transport. This is an excellent and inexpensive way to get around and see different parts of the city. The ferries are clean and frequent and in my experience always on time

A very efficient way to get around. They Sydney Ferries are an excellent way to get around the city and to see many of the sites from angles not available on foot. We used the Ferry to get to Manly, Taronga Zoo, Luna Park, and Darling Harbor. Be sure and get an all day pass (around $17-20au) if you are going to several sites in one day. The deckhands even volunteered to take several photos of our group, which was quite special.

What a great way to arrive!. The Sydney Ferries are just amazing! They are quick and agile! They are comfortable and clean! They are on time yet not frantic!They are a real bargain for many people, for locals and visitors!Take a ride and see just how good they are!

First ferry trip in yrs.. Stayed at manly n caught ferry over n back too circular key too a concert. $2.50 for the return trip. Amazing value for money. Fast n no hassles. Ferries were clean n staff friendly.

Always worth travelling via Ferry. Travel to and from Milsons, Point while staying at Harbourview Hotel. Gives you a great view of the Sydney Harbour while travelling to the other side of the harbour.

Be a pretend Sailor!. I love ferries! The closest I get to re-living my childhood is catching the Manly ferry, sitting outside at the bow and hope not to get wet if the crossing is a bit choppy.. And if you want a different view of the Harbour, this crossing at night is, quite simply, visually stunning. The lights on the water, the atmosphere.. Magical! EVERYONE should do this at least ONCE in their lifetime.

So much to enjoy. Can either be for pure enjoyment as the best way to see the highlights of Sydney and the harbour or a functional way of getting to work from the suburbs surrounding the harbour. The ferries may be old but they have a natural charm and character and it is such a stress free way of seeing the city without sitting for hours in the city's traffic jams.

Best way to explore Sydney and beaches!. Explore as much of Sydney as possible on the Ferries - cheap, frequent and great views of the City, Bridge and Opera House. We explored Manly beach, Cockatoo Island and Watson Bay for Doyle's famous fish and chips all by Ferry. Max spend $15 per person per day if you buy an Opal card which can be topped up (bit like an Oyster card in London).
Harbor Tour. Fast, comfortable, reasonable, frequent Great views of Sydney & the harbor Makes a day trip to Manly practical/easy

The way to see the harbour.. Sydney ferries are an excellent way to get around and also do some sightseeing while on route. Inexpensive travel that can sometimes be unpredictable regarding timetables!

Get the most out of your Opal card!. Used the ferries to flit from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay... Quicker and cheaper than buses.Also ferry WiFi was an added boon to an international traveler without a data plan.
You have to try this. I normally stay at Circular Quay and take the ferry to Darling Harbour. It is inexpensive, comfortable and gives you incredible views, love it...

Seemless and Comfortable Way to Explore Sydney. The Sydney Ferry (including Buses and Trains) rock!
The ferries glide across Sydney's Harbour taking visitors practically near and far and if your destination is inland a bus is usually waiting which will complete the journey all under one efficient and economical pass- the Opal Pass. Buy it and cruise the world of Sydney. Highly recommended.

Great transport thats easy on budget, great on views and a relaxing break. Clean, on-time and complete with video displayed time table. Staff are supremely helpful. We enjoyed trips to manly, a first view of Sydney, and a relaxing return from the Opera house to our hotel.

Cheapest Harbour Cruise in the World.. Whether you go on a calm, sunny day and sit outside taking photos of the beautiful harbour (probably most people's preferred option) or go on a windy, rainy day and crash and roll your way across the "heads" to or from Manly, sitting outside with the ocean spray needling your skin or inside watching the water, then the sky, then the water... This is one of the cheapest and most scenic ferry rides in the world.You get to see most of Sydney Harbour's iconic landmarks and end up in the city at circular quay at one end or Manly at the other, either of which is full of things to do.It's roughly half an hour each way, you can eat and drink on board (there is a kiosk, but I don't think it's open on every trip?) and there's even wifi so the kids don't have to look up at the wonders passing them by.We are locals and this is our preferred way of getting into the city bar none.

Great mean of Transportation. on time and always available. the public transportation will be helpful to visit any of the attractions available in Sydney because they are readily available at any time.

Best way to get arround. These are well organised ferries with good time tables catering for the commuter and tourist alike. Busy at rush hour so I keep away then and leave them to rush about. Also a very good range of ticket deals to be had

Sydney Ferries--Good views, right price. Using the ferries to navigate around Sydney hot spots was not only easy, but well priced with some of the best views of downtown, the harbor bridge and Sydney Opera House. Sturdy yellow ferries transport passengers to and from Darling Harbor restaurants and the Maritime Museum, Circle Quay by the Opera House, Taronga Zoo, Fort Denison, Kirribilli, Manly Beach and dozens of other locations. They run on schedule at $2.50/person all day on Sunday no matter how many stops or how far you go. Some of our best photos of the bridge and Opera House were from the ferries, day and night. Plus the skill of the captains and deckhands in maneuvering and docking was a pleasure to watch in and of itself. If you are using an Opal card for bus, light rail and train transportation in Sydney, you can also use it to pay your fee for the ferries. (The maximum transportation fee total for any one day Mon-Sat on Opal-paid transportation is $15/person, whatever the mode of transportation and whatever the distance.) Be sure to Tap On AND Tap Off, so that the charge on your Opal smart card is accurate for the ride you took, especially if your total transportation fares any particular day will total less than the $15 daily max. Buy your Opal Card at any 7-11 store, and the store attendant can explain details further. Note that crowds are heavy on Saturdays and especially Sundays on routes to and from beaches. Plan to travel early and/or late to miss the heaviest traffic and get the most peaceful and picturesque of rides.
Enjoyable experience. There are a number of routes offered from Circular Quay, including to places such as Manly, and the zoo. Nice way to view the city.
Just a Part of Sydney. These little ferries are a Part of Sydney's character. A trip with Scarborough, Charlotte or Friendship is a must... :-)

Easy, convenient transport. The ferry service in Sydney is quick, clean & efficient (not to mention great fun to amuse the kids). Prices were very reasonable (we had a pass for the kids), so there was only one fee & we travelled as much as we wanted.

Cremorne Point for spectacular view of Sydney skyline and harbour. Rather than a long half an hour ferry to Manly or to Watson Bay, I would recommend a short 10 minute ferry ride to Cremorne Point, where you can take in a very peaceful and scenic walk along the Sydney Harbour and soak in the spectacular view of the Sydney CBC skyline, including a frontal view of the iconic Opera House, and the beautiful Sydney Harbour The only drawback is that that Harbour Bridge is partially blocked.

Fun and scenic way to see Sydney.. These green and yellow ferries are numerous and a great way to get to most anywhere of interest in Australia's biggest city. Buy an Opal card which is good for all public transit and is a convenient way to pay without standing on line to buy tickets.....works as a debit card.

Interesting but not a must do thing. If sydney is on your vacation map with at least 3 days in hand , you will need to go to the Sydney Harbour or the Darling Harbour to catch this ferry for a lot of things . 1 you will need to take a ferry ride to do whale watching you will also need this ferry to go to tarrango zoo you may also just take a ride from Darling Harbour to circular quay and back..Make sure to buy the opus card .. which makes for a hassle free ride since you will save some time from the long ticket queue. . Just tap on when you get onto the ferry and tap off when you get off the ferry

Fantastic Fun at a low cost. No reason to pay for an expensive tour when in Sydney. Buy a pass ($20) and ride the ferries and trains all day, one price. You can go everywhere. We enjoyed Manley Beach, and the entire harbour which is gorgeous from the water. The ferries are prompt, efficient comfortable.

The way to explore.. This is what I love about Sydney the Ferries.So easy with an Opal card.Ferries leave from Circular Quay- always on time and the choice of destinations is amazing. Clear signposting and timetables available on line to check.
Cheap way to travel. Fabulous views of Sydney and surrounds. Cheapest trip ever... just like cruising the harbor. Goes just about everywhere.

Best way to Darling Harbour/C Quay/Manly. Ferries on regular service between Circular Quay - Milsons Point- Darling Harbour. Great photo op for Harbour/ Opera House and Bridge. Don't miss this one. You can hop off at Milsons Point for photos of the city and Opera House from the other side of Harbor. Best time is just before sunset. If planning to visit Manly; ferry is the only enjoyable way to get there!! You don't want to be on public busses or trains!!
The way to go!. The ferry system in Sydney is great......so many places you can get to.The trip to Manley is a popular choice. Its certainly a good way to get around.
Easy way of getting around.. Great way of getting to places such as Manly Beach and Darling Harbour. We were lucky enough to see dolphins on the way to manly Beach.Punctual and good value.

Excellent way to get around. The ferries from Circular Quay take you all over the Sydney area. Your ticket lasts the full day and can be used on rail, bus or ferry. From 2016 you need to get an Opel card. Try Manley and Darling Harbour
Travel. A very fast and efficient way to get around Sydney. From a short trip across the bay to a longer trip to one of the beaches or under the bridge to Darling Harbour.

Best way to see Sydney city. Took Manly ferry and enjoyed the ride with great view of Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House.
Buy Opal card which will allow you to travel on bus, trains and ferries at only AUD$2.50 for whole day! Good deal. Or be prepare to pay $17 return on ferry per Adult on other days.

Public Transport with a View. Since the ferries are part and parcel of Sydney's public transport system they are a very cheap way to have a fantastic sightseeing experience of Sydney Opera, Harbour and Bridge. Especially the Manly Ferry is fantastic, costing you AUD 2.50 per person one way. Making for a nice stop to walk and explore Manly, all immediately around the Manly Ferry Wharf, and then have the ride back. I know people that do this daily as commute and still enjoy it every day after many years.

Great way to travel around Sydney. The ferries around Sydney Harbour are terrific value, and you see so much. If you are a Senior then it is even cheaper. Otherwise purchase a 3 day or weekly pass and this gives you unlimited travel on not just the ferries, but trains and buses.Hop on every ferry at Circular Quay top take you as far as Paramatta and the other way to Manly. More or less Hop On Hop Off if you wish.

Great scenic way to get around. Efficient, cost effective way to get around the Sydney area, comfortable, clean scenic mode of transportation, bathrooms on board, plenty of seatting. Just do it. If you plan to be in the area gif longer then a week buy an OPAL card, well worth it.

Great to go around and check out the beaches. Get an Opal card !!When traveling in Sydney, get an Opal card to use public transit, that includes the ferries ! Once you have made 8 trips (from Monday to Sunday) you can travel for free !On Sundays all trips are $2.50 maximum!Take the ferry out to the beaches such as Manly or Watsons Bay, I have made a recommendation of the top 10 activities in Sydney ! Check them out on my page or youtube at /watch?v=7WTDvASldcYLet me know if you have any question !
Nice boats. Even though I haven't been on one, it is nice to know that they go regularly, and that they are kept in pristine condition.

Great way to get around Sydney. We purchased a Opal card which gave us access to the ferries, trains and buses. We learnt the maximum cost per day is $15 so you could go up and down the harbour for only $15 cheaper than paying for a cruise. On Sunday's total cost is $2:50. The terriers were always on time and stress free transport.

Oh what a feeling! what a sight!. Ferry rides on Sydney Harbour are really enjoyable, especially on a clear day. We usually take overseas visitors on ferry rides and make sure we have our cameras ready. When returning to the harbour,the sight of both the Harbour Bridge and Opera House is breath-taking - took great pictures! The ride to and fro Watson Bay is highly recommended for sightseeing. Similarly for Manly Ferry.
a great way to see Sydney - on the cheap. Buy an unlimited day ticket at just AUD 24 (£12) and you can travel the whole network from Paramettar in the west to Manly in the east.
The only way to get to the city from Manly. Stress free clean and efficient. A great relaxing ride across our beautiful Sydney harbour. Enjoy the sights weather and relax.
EASYGOING. Such a stunning way to see Sydney Harbour...catching a Sydney Ferry from the city to Manly Beach...experiencing the views from the middle of Sydney Harbour..is priceless

Great way to get around Sydney harbour!. I live in lovely McMahons Point on the harbour and couldn't live without this:-Download the free Tripview App or Tripview Lite (doesn't save you trips) for all the timetables & wharf info. Easy just type in where you want to start and where you want to go to, easy because you only have to know the suburbs.A cheap and easy way to get around this beautiful city!

An iconic web connecting the reaches of the harbour. I live close to two ferry services - The Neutral Bay loop and the Darling Harbour loop. The little green ferries chug round providing not only easy transport but visual access to the beauty of the Harbour. In comparison the bigger ferries are soulless but service longer distances. The Darling Harbour service provides visitors with views of the Harbour Bridge and surrounds but also Barrangaroo and Darling Harbour. You can do the 20 minute trip to King Street Wharf or the 40 minute round trip back to the Quay or Luna Park. Stop off at Pyrmont Bay wharf and walk around the water to the Fish Markets, then catch the light rail back to the city. Or get off at Balmain East and walk 300 metres up the hill to the East Village Hotel, one of the better pubs in Sydney.

What a great trip to Watsons Bay. We jumped on a Sydney Ferries CAT and motored over to Watsons Bay wharf for lunch but you know I think I enjoyed the trip more than the lunch. Its like a site seeing adventure on Sydney Harbour, just cheaper, around $12.50 return for memory but check on the website and I would do it again any day.

One way but no returns. If you want to catch the ferry from Darling Point to the city to see an evening show or to carch up with someone for lunch, forget it. The ferry sails straight past from 10am. Thats right you can watch it go by. It could easily pull in and no time would be lost on the schedule. The problem is more accute now that they have taken the 327 bus to the city away. No bus no ferry we are land locked. Best bet is to walk to Rushcutters Bay for a bus or to Double Bay for a ferry. And why one asks?Why is public transport service getting worse?
Great way to see harbour at night. Returning from Manly to Sydney at night with the bridge and harbour all lit up is worth a trip. The ferry takes about 1/2 an hour and is a great way to end the day.
good value for money!. you can view sydney's different attractions at a very reasonable rate. their ferries also have outside access
Manly Ferry. Great way to spend an afternoon- we did it twice! Treat yourself to lunch at the Bavarian Bier Garden when you are there.

On time, reasonable price and a good service timetable. We had the MyMulti pass which allowed us to ride the Ferries as much as we wanted. We rode the ferries for probably 2-3 hours during our trip overall, so we had a good variety of experiences. Overall, the boats were always prompt, smooth rides, and a quick service with great views. Would definitely recommend.

Sydney Ferries. The Sydney Ferry system is a wonderful way to explore the various areas of Sydney. The ferries are clean, always on time, and a convenient and inexpensive way to travel around the harbor areas of Sydney. The ferries also provide you with a good way to view Sydney from the harbor area. They are a good option to viewing Sydney without taking a more expensive harbor cruise.
Local ferry transportation . Very popular local transport especially for tourists. Many routes available within and outside Sydney . City to manly is one of the more popular ones

A delightful ride on Sydney ferries. The service operated by Sydney ferries is always punctual each time we visited Sydney. We use the ferry every day from either Mosman or Neutral Bay to Circular key. The ferry is clean and staff polite with either a smile or greetings every time. The ride is comfortable and we can enjoy a very nice view of the harbour, Opera House a few Harbour Bridge. We were able to take ver nice photos which would otherwise be impossible if travelling by train or buses. Highly recommendable for people visiting Sydney.

Great way to see the sights of Sydney. This was the second time I have been on one of the ferries in Sydney. This time it was to go over to Watson's Bay. You get the most amazing views of the Harbour Bridge, The Opera House and Darling Harbour. The ferries run so smoothly and frequently and are great value for money.
our first ferry in sydney. recommended transport from circular quay to darling harbour, easy to get ticket in circular quay, recommended ride in sunset time form circular to darling

City and Harbour is best viewed from a Sydney Ferry. Research online the Opal card. It may be your best travel companion this Sydney visit. Opal card is very convenient for multiple trips on a bus, ferry, light rail and or train.Any or all harbour ferries allow you to take numerous excellent photographs.

Quaint old ferries, best way to see the harbour. Had the choice of the old ferries or the more modern catamarans and motorboats - easy decision. Love the look of the ferries and they're pretty stable, have travelled in rough seas on them, I often get seasick but not on these.Drinks and snacks available.
Best cruise experience with All Ocassion Cruise. enjoy the cruise with All Ocassion Cruises. Watch majestic sunset and enjoy cocktails party with your friends. Best romantic sunset, I may add!
Kirrabili to harbor. A great way to get around. You get a great view of the Harbor with all of its attractions/ restaurants.

Great way to see Sydney sights. Great way to see many of the top Sydney sights---Opera House,Harbor Bridge, Inner Harbor, Darling Harbor, Shark Is....all the while in a comfortable seat. Cheaper than the tour boats and you can hop on hop off when you buy the day pass. We took ferry to Drummoyne and walked to Birkenhead Point Outlet Center for some shopping. These ferries go just about everywhere--pick up a map and schedule and plan a day out in Sydney.

Must if you're in Sydney!. If you need to go somewhere with a ferry station near it, then I recommend you go there via ferry. Not only will you get there quite quick, but you'll also get to enjoy the great views of Sydney!

just love the ride!!! Love it. Its great, lovely, awesome experience.
Hats off to NSW ferry system, every 30 mins there is a ferry!!

Good way to get around Sydney Harbour. With the advent of the Opal card ( go online to see how to purchase one) using Sydney Ferries to get around Sydney harbour has never been easier. Ferries service most areas of Sydney harbour, you can even get a ferry that goes up the Parramatta River. For someone visiting Sydney for the first time it's a great way to see the harbour from the water. Most wharves are linked to bus stops or train stations, so once you get to your desired wharf you can then conect to more public transport to get to your final destination. Most ferries allow you to sit inside and out and also have toilets for your convenience. All in all a fun way to get around.

Ferries a great way to travel and see the sights. While in Sydney recently we used the ferries to go to Parramatta, Taronga Park Zoo, Fort Denison, Watson's Bay and Manly.The ferries are a great way to travel around Sydney and t see the city and suburbs from a different perspective.It's a good idea to check the timetables so that you don't waste time hanging about waiting. All of the ferries we used were clean, the staff were pleasant and helpful, boarding was easy.Tickets an be purchased at Circular Quay but the introduction of the Opal Card may change that. As concession holders we were able to purchase an All Day Excursion ticket fro $2.50 which could be used for bus, train and ferries all day. Certain ferries are excluded eg the Fast Ferry to Manly. It's a great way travel
Lovely ride . It's just a lovely ride like other ferry. Sit back, relax and enjoy the view in the middle of day that not too crowd of people.

Great places to visit. A short walk from the hotel is the ferry terminal. We tookferry to Manly and spent a few hours in this lovely seasidearea. Visited Opera House, botanical gardens and spendsome time around the rocks area which is near theHarbour bridge.

good Sunday out. with the introduction of the Opal card I use Ferries more than ever. iv always loved them but its expensive. but now with the Sunday $2.50 fares its a great incentive to get in to the city on my day off

River Cat from parra to the Quay. We have tanken the river cat ferry from parramatta to the quay and from meadowbank to the quay a few times. Always a nice trip. the crew are always welcoming and the trip is always a nice experience!

Easiest way to get to the beaches. Take a ferry to get to Bondi beach for instance. Enjoy the scenery and the fresh air.It also gives you an opportunity to take a nearly 360 degree look at the Sydney Opera House. From this distance it looks really pretty. Cool, ha?

An efficient way to travel and something different to do. We bought an opal card which was the best value allowing you to use trains, ferries, and buses. Once you reach $15 it is capped and no more is taken for that day. The ferries are efficient and the ride is smooth with plenty of seating. There are regular ferries during the day and is a great way to travel with many scenic/photo shot opportunity . We saw three cruise ships in the harbour which was special.

Cheap way to see Sydney harbour. Buy an opal card and get on the ferry to manly. Return will costs about aud14-15 so it's a cheap way to the Sydney Harbour and the Opera house and the harbour bridge upclose.Go to manly and have a nice lunch in one of their cafes and walk to the beach.Allow about 2hrs for the whole trip. 30mins to get there, 1hr to walk around and have lunch and 30mins to come back.Not a bad way to spend midday in sydney

star attraction of sydney. 4 days in sydney and 5 round trips of darling harbour , milson point , watsons bay , manly beach . Just imagine how convenient is commuting through sydney ferries......... awesum timing and very balanced schedule . its was jus an icing on cake for me as i was staying very close to circular quay and always made ferry as my prime transport way. loved sitting on the upper deck . Take 9 pm ferry from darling harbour to circular quay and you can enjoy fireworks on a saturday . was lucky to see opera house in the light of fireworks during the halloween evening........sydney ferries made my trip memorable..... full points

Such a great way to see the harbour. As a Sydneysider I still love the magic of riding a Sydney ferry from the Quay to Manly. It offers a beautiful perspective of the skyline, especially if you go around sunset. Something every tourist should do.

Ferry from Manly. Coming from interstate i have experienced some challenges in the past with sydney public transport but I must say catching the ferry from Manly to Circular Quay and back was a great experience. Ticket lady was helpful, staff were helpful getting on the ferry. Ferry was clean and tidy and most importantly on time!

Best views of the city and harbour and Parramatta River from the ferries. Catching the ferries is a great way to get around without sitting in traffic, you get great views from the water, and can catch a ferry to many points around the harbour. I catch a ferry to Circular Quay, then a train to the airport, it cheap, fast and easy. There are lots of walks around the harbour and when you get tired catch a ferry, plan your walk with a map so you can start and finish at a ferry wharf.
Affordable and stops every 30 min. Great service! What I liked the most was that it stops every 30min and the price is good. It takes you to the main spots around Sydney.

Fun, easy, and inexpensive. We only took one ferry-- to Manley from Cirrcular Quay. We did not purchase an Opal Card but it would be a good value for all public transportation. The ferry was inexpensive anyway. It ripens on schedule, it gives a great view of the Harbour. People are super friendly on the ferry. We didn't really do anything once we got to ananley-- had a drink and returned. A couple of hours on the water looking at the city in glorious sunshine.
The Manly Ferry. A visit to Sydney is not complete without a ride on one of the ferries . This time we rode the Manly Ferry, which is always punctual and regular and the views are magnificent.

If you can get to your destination by ferry, there is no nicer way to get there. Going to the Zoo, Manly or any other site that is accessible by ferry, you'd be mad to go any other way. Sydney Harbour is so beautiful and a ferry trip is a great way to get to your destination.

Tour the city like a local - fun, easy, practical and cheap. Fun, easy, practical and cheap...what more could you want. Get a MyMulti Daypass for about A$24 and travel as much as you like around the city, by ferry, bus, light rail etc. Best of all use it on the Sydney cream and green ferries to see the harbour city as it is meant to be seen, from the water.

Compulsory for every tourist. You cannot visit Sydney without at least a single ferry trip. A major part of Sydney's charm is its world record deep harbour. If you are in Sydney for more than a couple of days, the cheapest way to travel on the ferries is to purchase an Opal card from a newsagent (look for shops with an Opal sign). The Opal card will cost $10, but the local secret is that during a single week from Sunday to Monday, Opal will only charge 8 single trips (within an hour of each other), and the rest of the week is free. Sunday's are also capped at $2.50. Every day is also capped.With that in mind, if travelling after your 8 trip cap (or Sunday), ferries are extremely cheap. But even if you're taking several ferry trips using Opal, it is still a must for tourists.Recommended trips in order would include:All ferries depart from Circular Quay and trips I would recommend in order are:1. Manly return (visit Manly beach)2. Parramatta river return (soak up the view on the way - inner harbour is very different)3. Cockatoo Island or Taronga Zoo4. Watsons Bay

visit to manly beach. i went to manly beach taking a ferry from circular quay...the trip was wonderful...its the best way to see sydney opera house and the harbour bridge...best mode of transportation in sydney...

Harbour-City, take the ferry!. The harbour is the saving grace of Sydney. Use the ferry to go east (Watsons Bay plus;(NE) Manly plus; (North) Tooronga Zoo, plus; (West) Balmain, Greenwich, Olympic Park, Parramatta, plus.Plan a ferry timetable which may allow for stop-overs at some of the 'old-industrialised islands'. But they should not take priority as 'events' over the generous views offered by the general ferry trips. You don't get an ongoing narrative of your voyage, but its is cheaper. The downside is you need to plan to make sure you are not 'stranded' between ferry times.

Great way to see the Beautiful Harbour. Found the ferry system easy to navigate. We were impressed by Sydney's Public Transport System with regular ferries. Helpful staff made our ferry riding enjoyable.
What a great way to travel and see Sydney Harbour. These ferries are super fun, many folk use them to go to work good on a sunny day. Do try one or more if you have the chance.

Never thought it would be pleasant. My family and I love ferry rides. Every chance we get, we'd ride it. Most of the time though I'd get "sick" from the smell (HK harbor is very notorious for having this effect on me). So when we rode the Sydney ferry, it was surprisingly very pleasant. We took the public transport ferry. No need to get the hop on and hop off. Get Opal cards. There so many freebies with this card. If you use it a certain number of times during the week, the rest of your ride is free. So count the number of usage before you top off. Very convenient to top off also. All newspaper stands do it :)

Good sight seeing. jumped on ferry to get from Darling harbour to Circular Quay, easy and you get to see more of the harbour than you would by walking or road transport, when catching it back did not realise got to see more than we thought, did not realise stopped here and there so was nice
Fun for the family. We toured the harbor and saw the city from a water view. It's a beautiful city so glad to see it from another perspective. Also you get to go to the zoo which we enjoyed.

The best way to see the Harbour.. As Seniors the cost is fairly minimal (have to be some benefit to getting old to compensate for the extra aches and pains!). The network of Ferries is excellent. We went to Manly, Darling Harbour, and back from Luna Park after walking across the bridge. It really is the best way to enjoy the Harbour, although the view from the Cruise Terminal across to the Opera House is great (particularly at sunset), as is the view from the Harbour Bridge.

Best mode of transport. Best and cutest way to see Sydney. I used to get the fery eveyr day to work and I miss it greatly...The staff are friendly & importantly they always run on time! I guess there is little congestion on the high seas :)You can always get a seat onboard and feel spoilt by going inside or out...upstairs or down.

Fun with views that you will never forget. The Sydney ferries are so organised. Easy to work out times and destinations. The ticket office and information staff are very friendly and knowledgable. The trips are on time and fun. the Harbour itself is so clean.

Easiest way to get around the harbor and town. We loved the ferry system, which was very convenient to our hotel close to Circular Quay. The ferry system will take you anywhere around the harbor, and since the city is built around the water, you can get to many places quite simply. They have different ways to pay for your rides and the fares are pretty reasonable.Like a well run train system they come and go on time, which makes it even better.

Jumped a ferry to the furthest place I could find.. Great way to see the harbor and more of the city, I went from the harbor to a little beach resort town which took 30-40 minutes, then went back and took a ferry to the Zoo which was a blast. Highly reccomend using them if your goal is along the routes

Ferries. So convenient, frequent and a great way to visit some of the islands. Fantastic views of the Opera House and Circular Quay. Would recommend an evening trip the view of Sydney when you are returning is breathtaking.

Great way to see the harbour. A easy ride on the ferries is a must for every visitor to Sydney! Beautiful views of the buildings, cruise ships, the harbour bridge,government house and buildings lining the shores of this great working harbour. Also simply easy access from shore to the other of course, ,and don't forget the zoo! A pleasant relaxing journey any way you decide to go.

Better than cruise. Since you can ride the ferries with the My Multi Day Pass, this is the best way to enjoy the Sydney Harbour. You can pick one of several ferries and enjoy the beautiful scenery from the ferry deck.
The Ferries. We had an absolutely awesome Ferry ride from darling harbour to circular quay. Low cost and saw so many sights without having to walk.

The Ferries are great. Really great way to see Sydney. Lots of destinations and cheap way to travel. Scenery was brilliant and you get good views of the bridge and the opera house. Definitely worth using this mode of transport.

Best way to explore. Its just the most amazing, majestic view you get from Sydney harbour when you take the Ferry from Manly to the Stop next to the Opera. It is just breathtaking, you think wow, what a beautiful place and then within seconds it is getting better and better!

Ferries an affordable way to enjoy Sydney. Ferries here are affordable, frequent, and punctual. They offer a great way to be on the harbor and enjoy the views of the various harbors and bays. Take the ferry to Manly or Watson's Bay for a 30+ minute ride and nice scenery.
Fun, but in need of some TLC. The ferries albeit a fun way to travel, are very expensive and in dire need of upgrading and maintenance.

Sydney ferries.. Sydney ferries are a great way to get around the harbour and represent very good value if you use the ferries that are covered by your Opal card. A trip to Manly is a must do not only for Manly itself but also for the great photo opportunities of the harbour, the bridge and the opera house.
Great way to explore Sydney Harbor. Great Value and exceptional way to see the Sydney Harbor. Don’t miss the chance to explore Manly Beach or the evening fireworks at Darling Habor
S ydnay Harbour. This is a great way to see around our great Harbour in so many ways. Great reaxing atmosphere taking in all the majour sites and seeing our great landmarks from a different veiw.

Ride a ferry in Sydney!. We took the ferry over to Manly Beach, and had a leisurely stroll along the beach, and an awesome dinner at Hugo's. We rode the ferry back after dark and really enjoyed the lights of Sydney!!

I'm in love with these ferries. These ferries are so evocative and I love to see them zipping around the harbour, they are also a efficient way to travel. We went over to Luna Park on a ferry on this trip, and found it an excellent way to travel.
The only way to travel. I love the ferries, always on time, easy to navigate and at a reasonable cost. Ideal for families with push chairs too.

Soak up the atmosphere of a busy harbour and city. It's well worth getting a day pass and if you have the time, just enjoying a few rides on the range of ferry boats - some are the catamaran types. Great views of the harbour, the bridge and the iconic Sydney Opera House.
Best deal around. Great way to see the Sydney waterfront while making your way over to the various destinations the ferries serve. The ferries are clean and on time with friendly staff.

Quick and easy. Great way to get around so quick and easy especially if you have an Opal card. Even if you aren't really wanting to go to a particular place it's good to get on a Ferry to see the sights from a harbour view.

So so.... Sydney's ferry system has a significant mix of ups and downs. I'll start with the good stuff. Yes, the views are normally really good; yes, it feels awesome to travel into the city from suburbia by a boat cruising through the calm harbour; yes, it is also quite a reasonable network. But, before you head out to catch a ferry please beware of the following. First, it can get VERY crowded, so it's not necessarily going to be a picturesque cruising experience that many require, it's often like being on a train crammed together like sardines with a mix of tourists and office workers. The lines can be really long, even arriving as early as 45 minutes before departure and buying a ticket doesn't necessarily mean you'll get on the ferry you've bought the ticket for. Once you buy a ticket all that does is give you the rights to go past the barricades, if the ferry is full (they don't limit the number of tickets they sell) then you'll need to wait for the next one which can sometimes be up to an hour away, often meaning you've wasted your ticket money unless you want to hang around for another ferry (after already having spent heaps of time waiting for this one). That's happened to me on several occasions in Sydney, so if you're looking for a legitimate form of public transport stick to trains and buses. But, if you're in no rush and looking for a relatively cool experience then give the ferries a go!

take the ferry to Parramatta. we have done the ferry to the zoo and manly before but the ferry to Parramatta was a different thought - it is worth the ride - takes over an hour but very relaxing and scenic. Try it for a pleasant trip - would be good with a coffee - get the coffee before you get on board. Once there, we walked through Parramatta but there is a free bus. We caught the train back - the train back is about 30 minutes.

Best way to see Sydney on the Harbour. Don't look for 'tour' boast for a Sydney Harbour Cruise...take the regular Sydney Ferry and head to Manley with possible stop off at the Zoo or Watsons Bay! This is the perfect way to see Sydney Harbour taking in the Bridge, Opera House and beautiful harbour and beaches, city sights from the Harbour plus Sydney at night. A real treat!
Lovely way to get around. We took the ferry to Watsons Bay to have dinner at Doyles. Very enjoyable and efficient journey. Great views and lots of good photo opportunities.
quick n easy option. nice transportation option for a quick round to the nearby destinations. get on from harbour point and one and get down at any stop and hop on to the next ferry

Great Value. Buy an OPAL card for public transportation, hop on the ferries and travel to see all the areas around Sydney. A great value for getting out on the water and visiting parts of Sydney Metropolitan area

great trip around the harbour. we walked around Darling Harbour, then jumped on the ferry and had a great trip around the harbour going under the bridge and stopping at the Opera House, great views for the photo collection.

Super efficient and inexpensive. Recommend for a local-recommended cruise around the harbor. Sit on one side on the way out to a given stop and face the other way on the way back for a commentary-free spin around the area.

Great day utilizing the ferry system of Sydney Harbour.. The ferry system is absolutely the best way to visit Sydney Harbour. I left Circular Quay at 0730 bound for breakfast in Manly. Wonderful trip as the sun was just coming up and a gentle swell as we crossed the Heads. Returned to Circular Quay and joined a ferry bound for Parramatta. The ride was perfect and really go tsee the suburbs from another angle...a couple of school eights were on rowing practice. After lunch back to Circular Quay and off to Taronga Zoo for an afternoon with the animals. Finally back to Circular Quay and back to my hotel exhausted but satiated. If one does this ferry travel on a Sunday the cost is $2.50 AU in total.
Sydney to Manly a must!. Sydney to Manly a must! One of the best ferry rides in the world, although the ferries are in dire need of replacing.

The best way to see the harbour. Whenever we have guests from overseas one of the first things we do is take them out on two ferry rides, one across to Manly, the other a multi stop trip out to Watson's Bay.

See Sydney from the water. This is an easy way to go around and see Sydney from the water. We started at Circular Quay and from there you can reach several places. Take photos of the Harbor Bridge and the Opera house. If you have a question just ask the staff they are very nice and helpful.

convient transport - dated vessels. its a means to an end. Don't to a ferry ride for a scenic view of the harbor - its just transport. and dated transport at that.
spend a little extra and get yourself on a tour.

Captain cook dinner cruise. THe cruise took us past the Opera House & the Sydney Harbour bridge. THe sunset view was really breath-taking and we took lots of pictures The 3 course meal was appetising. and we had a glass of champagne with our meal.

Beautiful way to see the harbour. This is the best and most leisurely way of circumnavigating theater harbour. Charge your camera as the amount of postcards pictures you will take are astronomical. We took the ferry from Parramatta to Circular Quay in Sydney harbour. Lovely experience with my then girlfriend. These kind of experiences turned her into my wife. Great time to be had by couples in this beautiful part of the world.
hop on hop off. Good way to visit different parts of Sydney harbour and easy to use time table available good value for money

Brilliant way to get around, cheap and fun too!. The ferry system in Sydney is fantastic. Very cheap family rate on Sundays means that you can travel all day and see the city from a unique perspective for an absolute bargain.

Wonderful experience. . I rode the ferries from Parramatta to Circular Quay and it was a very pleasant experience. The ferry was clean and spacious and most of all it was timely running almost spot on schedule. The staff were friendly and helpful. The stops efficient and the vistas wonderful. I can't comment on any of the other ferries but this one was great. Relaxing and refreshing without the traffic....bonus!

Great cheap way of seeing the harbour. Well recommended this one as for a little over 5 dollars they will take you to all over the harbour and you can start or disembark at darling harbour or circular quay

Reliable and cost effective. We used the ferries to go to Manly Beach and Bondi Beach and despite rough waters, they were on time and comfortable. Frequent schedules help and although fully loaded, embarkation and disembarking went smoothly. The price is right.
