Easy trasportation. The ferry is clean although the fare is quite expensive. The services are acceptable. The duration is reasonable.

The best way to see our harbour take a ferry to Manly. Must go by ferry to Manly from Circular Quay. See beautiful Manly Warringar. After you get off the ferry walk through Mamly Corso to Manly Beach, there are lots of great restaurants to choose from.

Don't Miss These Wonderful Ferries. For $24Aus you can get an all day pass on most public transport; trains, buses and these ferries too. We took a few different ones including the longest, all the way to Parramatta, as far upstream as you can go. It gives you unique views of lots of parts of Sydney and with the all day pass you can hop off and on wherever you like. We wandered around Parramatta, did some sari (saree here) shopping and got the train back into town on the same ticket.The ferries are clean, quiet and most have outdoor seating for fine days. There are harbour tour companies, but I am not a fan of canned speeches, so this experience was more to my liking.

Easy way to see the key tourist attractions of the Sydney Harbour.. My partner has never spent a lot of time in Sydney. Taking a ferry ride was a great way to point out Sydneys harbour highlights. Floating under the bridge is amazing and from this little tour we pinpointed some areas that he wanted to visit. Its almost like being on a virtual map where you can get off at any stop without the stress of fighting traffic on the roads which is what they're designed for, very relaxing.

great way to have a Sydney introduction!. We were dropped off at Cingular Quay where the ferries are, then we switched to the Darling Harbour ferry. Great view of the city and an intro to the vast ferry network for getting around!

We rode the Sydney Ferries for FREE with our Opal cards:). After completing 8 paid journeys on our Opal cards on the Sydney trains and/or buses, the Sydney ferries were FREE for the rest of the week! The Opal card weekly rewards start from Monday to Sunday. Just remember to tap on & tap off every single time for the correct fare automatic deduction AND wait 1 hour before you tap on again. I wrote a detailed review about the Sydney Trains if you want more details. Trust me, Opal cards can save you money going around Sydney.

One of the ways to reach the beaches. An average time is a half an hour to reach a destination - the transportation is great, good organization, friendly people.Definitely, consider the ferry ride for one of your destinations.I used them a few times.

Great way to see the city for a song. Ferries are a great way to see the city very inexpensively. Easiest to get a pre-loaded card. Tremendous views of the city, Harbour Bridge, Opera House, and easy to get to beaches. Ferries are clean and comfortable, and run frequently.

Easy mode of transport and on time. Thoroughly enjoyed our ferry tide from Darling Harbour to Olympic Park. It's inexpensive - our tickets were around $6 each. I get seasick but was totally fine on the ferry. The only downside was our arrival at Olympic Park. We were going to Allphones Arena and didn't realise that it was going to be such a long walk (over 2kms). There was no signage at the ferry terminal to catch a bus and no taxis. This was nothing to do with the ferry service. We walked about a 1km and eventually (thankfully) found a bus stop.

Love riding the Ferries!. We had to go into town from Olympic Park quite a bit. The ferries are the only way to go considering the price of a taxi! They are very comfortable and it's just like a short sightseeing trip on its own. However, make sure you can catch your bus (if you are not parking at the ferry stop) because the buses do not run late evening.
A good way to explore Sydney. If you like to explore the city, this is definitely for you. And the ride is a relief after a tough day with different activities in and around circular quay.

Good way to see the Harbour & places of Sydney. As the Opal Card was 'down' when we wanted to purchase from a local supermarket, we got the 'all day ticket' instead.We caught the ferry to Circular Quay and from there we went anywhere we could fit in a day, including Manly. We love the ocean & aren't afraid of the rough waters near the Heads, but if you tend to get a little sea-sick you might want to check first before going to Manly.The rougher water doesn't last long.Great way to be transported and great service by all who work with the ferry system. Easy to access (even for people in wheelchairs), great sights, fresh air, sunshine, relaxing, occasional refreshing salt spray, chance to talk with people from around the world.Every chance we get to visit Sydney we always ride the ferries. Would highly recommend to anyone.
great value. if you wish to get around in Sydney you cant go past getting a day pass on Sydney Ferry this also gives you unlimited travel on NSW bus and Train services all for $26 per adult.
A great way to see the bay. Prompt, efficient, clean and friendly service make the Ferry System a great way to travel about Sydney.

Expensive and Dirty. Whilst the ferries are a good way of getting around the Sydney Harbour foreshore they are expensive. I found them dirty, and in particular Circular Quay needs a darned good clean up. Rubbish abounds. The multitude of passengers waiting to get on the ferries necessitates you get to the terminal a good 15 minutes ahead of time, and if you are looking to get a seat inside make sure you can push your way in on a rainy day. For what is an iconic part of Sydney the ferries leave a lot to be desired. They did run on time which was a plus.

Easy, affordable tourist transport. Although the primary purpose of the ferry network is to move people around, we have used them on numerous visits to Sydney as an economical way of seeing the sights by water. They run regularly, are very cheap and offer a great way to see Sydney and its environs from the water.

A great cheap way to see the Harbour.. The Sydney Ferries travel to many destinations starting from Circular Quay. The choice of destinations includes Kirribilli, Manly, Neutral Bay, Balmain, Parramatta, Olympic Park, etc. They are a landmark on the Sydney Harbour and allows one to travel to the various places conveniently by ferry. A great way to spend an hour or two.

The greatest way to travel . Enjoyed every trip I took from the warph. Just get yourself to the Circular Quay and then let the water to take you anywhere you wish , just like Aladins magic carpet. Zero stress and lots of sun will make you feel nostalgic to end any ferry ride. I truly envy all who travel from Maine to Sydney for work using ferry and made me think of Delhi traffic every day.

The Opal Card Makes It Easy. The Sydney Ferries and transport system is one of the best in the world. You can get anywhere in Sydney and the surrounding areas by train, bus, light rail and ferry. From downtown Sydney, the ferries leave from Circular Quay and the time tables are published online. The best photos of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House are from a ferry. An important tip is to buy an Opal Card online before going or at any convenience store after you arrive. They are good on the trains, light rail, buses, and harbor ferries, except the Manly Fast Ferry. The card must be purchased in increments of 10 AUD and as you use up the amount on the card, you can top it up online (a 40 AUD minimum top up), at kiosks in the train stations or at any convenience store in 10 AUD increments. There is also a 15 AUD per day maximum and when you have spent that amount using the card, all fares after you reach the limit are free. You still need to “tap on and tap off” but they will not deduct anything over 15 AUD per day from the card. Don’t take the train to and from the airport because there is a large airport fee in addition to the train fare. There is another post that will tell you how to get around the airport fee by taking a bus to connect to the trains but it’s more hassle than it’s worth. Just take a taxi to and from the airport. It’s marginally more expensive but worth the ease and convenience. Also, be sure to create an online account on the Opal website and register your card(s) just in case they are lost or stolen. The Opal Card system is the best transit scheme I have ever seen anywhere in the world.
A must do when visiting Sydney. Get on there early so you can get a good spot out on the foredeck - just make sure it's not raining or rough or you will get very wet!
Sydney Ferries. The ferries keep to a really tight schedule which is very helpful when you are planning your time on them. They are comfortable enough and get you where you want to go.

Wonderful ferry ride. We went on a ferry ride around Sydney Harbour. The ride we went on included stops at Rose Bay, Double Bay and finishing at Watson's Bay from where it returned to Circular Quay. The ferry is comfortable and has two levels and outside decks. So you can move around to get the best vantage points for taking pictures. To save on fares make sure you purchase an all-day travel pass called an Opal card which allows you unlimited travel on trains, buses and ferries.

Manly Ferry. I have been a regular traveller from Circular Quay to Manly and back for many years. Friends and I often travel to Manly for coffee and lunch, an ice cream before hopping on the ferry and back to Circular Quay. The ferry is a part of the Australian way of life, a must for visitors to Sydney.

Amazing way to get about. Caught first ferry from Parramatta but coming back they can't always get here late due to tides, so drove to Rydale and caught ferry there, about 40 mins ferry into Sydney, spectacular views of very nice houses, mangroves, Sydney harbour bridge. Buy tickets on board, our son at 16 was classed as a child so great price for a family of 4. Lovely way to get around and into Sydney
Wonderful experience. This is a must try! Spend a few dollars to have multy million dollar view of the beautiful Sydney harbour. Its also a great way to meet local people.

Great way to see Sydney Harbour. A really great way to see around Sydney and relatively inexpensive. You can go up harbour or across or down , such a fantastic harbour especially on the weekend when all the boats and yachts are on the water.

Definite must go! Manly is the best.. Good to see a river view of the Harbor Bridge and the Oprah house. The Manly ferry is only a bit expensive ($14) but if you use your Opal card, you can travel free for the rest of the day (Max $15 a day is charged on Opal card). It's a definite must go though!

Get the Opal card. $15 max per day!. Opal card is great value if you do most of your rides in one day as the fee is a max of $15. We took two different Ferries to get a rest from walking Sydney and to get great pictures across the harbour at the city. Ended the afternoon with the ferry to Manly and had a beverage at the Beach. We then rode the Ferry back as the sun was setting and lights were coming on in the city. Beautiful!

Helpful staff and a great way to get around Sydney. Travelled from Circular Quay over to Milsons Point to visit Luna Park. The staff were incredibly helpful and explained exactly how the Opal Card work's which really simplified things.Loved the journey over, especially going directly under the Sydney Harbour Bridge and being able to see the Opera House. Even though it was our second trip over it was still an awesome experience.

Avoid peak times and Sunday's . Sydney Ferries is a great way to get around the harbour and to see Sydney sights from the harbour. I would avoid using the ferries on a Sunday or peak times due to crowds and in some cases, inability to get on the ferry due to over crowding.
Fantastic transportation. We took the Ferry from Darling Harbour to Toronga Zoo & Luna park with the kids. What a great way to get around.

Must do. If you are in Sydney, than you need to take the ferry!
Take one from Circular Quay up to darling harbour. It's beautiful in the daytime and during the night.
Always nice to be on the water. Staff nice and efficient. Timetables respected almost all the time. Wifi doesn't always work but then the views are fantastics.
Great Way to Travel. The ferry has the best views of the bridge, harbor and the Opera house. Try to travel on Sunday when just $2.5 ticket can be used for the entire day.
Better off catching the Fast Ferry. On Sundays it is very crowded with lines for hours. The Fast Ferry costs a few dollars more but is quicker, less busy and has a bar!

Summer or winter, enjoyable, relaxing, all year round. Upstairs or downstairs, inside or out tis a very pleasant way to travel, enjoy your coming, going to work or play, with or without company for thirty minutes of your day each way.

Great trips. Sydney Ferries are great, taking you to many areas of the harbour at reasonable prices. I recommend taking the ferry to Cremorne Point before walking around to Mosman Bay. You can have a swim in MacCallum Pool and have lunch at Mosman Rowers before catching the ferry back.

Nice view of the harbour. Travelled on Sunday due to fare pricing on that day from circular quay to taronga Zoo. Got a good view of lower north Shores and eastern suburbs on the way and definitely worth the time.
TAKE A FERRY. You will not regret taking a ferry anywhere on the Sydney Harbour - it's one of the best in the world.

Opal Card has opened up new oportunities. We have always loved the Sydney Ferries but since the introduction of the Opal Card for public transport we now plan short adventures most weekends. After getting our 8 trips up during the week this makes any other travel free so we take advantage of a trip to Manly or Watsons Bay for lunch. We have even caught the train to Parramatta & caught the ferry back to Darling Harbour.
Very easy way to experience the city. Very affordable and a great was to make your way around Sydney to take in the sights. I would recommend trying various routes.

Not just a public transport. My family love to take ferry to visit all the surrounding suburbs which have nice trails from the piers. The extensive routes covered by ferry is amazing so you will not be short of idea where to board and when to jump to the next spot for fun.

The most relaxing way to travel. Taking the ferry from Manly to Circular Quay or from Neutral Bay is a very pleasant and relaxing way to get into the city. On a warm sunny day the breeze on the ferry is refreshing and the views spectacular. Plus you have no parking worries.

Great way to travel. The ferry are super, they run on time! They are an excellent way to get about. They form part of the Sydney transport system so you can use them in conjunction with buses and trains. The staff or should I say crews are unbelievable, they are so efficient and helpful, they have a great sense of humour, and endless patience when dealing with the public, they are a real credit to Sydney.

Fun day Sunday. We enquired about hiring a car for our ladt day in sydney but they wanted $120. Luckily we headed down to Circular Quay and found Excellent value for getting around Sydney on Sundays. Only $2.50 per person for an all day ticket for public ferries. We had a few hours to spare before heading off to the airport, so we hopped on a ferry to darling harbour.

A great way to see Sydney Harbour and its attractions.. Travel from Circular Quay to many places on Sydney Harbour and along the Parramatta River, Whether for a short "point to point" trip, or a longer scenic trip, the ferry system on Sydney Harbour from Circular Quay is amazing. If one is a pensioner or holds an Australian 'Seniors Card' be sure to ask about discounted travel.
We took the ferry to Manly to see the Jazz Festival.. The Ferries are a great way to get around Sydney harbour. They run very frequently, are reasonably priced and clean.
Great way to visit all the bays around Sydney Harbour. Clean quick transport. Prices are very reasonable. Easy to get around the bays in Sydney Harbour. Use them all the time when in Sydney.

Freedom. Buy an Opal and step in all public transport including the ferries. It brings you at the other side of town without walking that much. The vieuw on the Harbour, the bridge and the Opera house is worth it.

Great way to s the city and Harbour. Great way to see the city and harbour!!!! Ferries depart from Circular Quay on a regular basis to all different locations. If your not sure where to go or how there are staff that will help you. A Opal card is required, however this is very easy to obtain

Great way to see Sydney Harbour. Take a ferry trip from Circular Quay to one of the many attractions Sydney Harbour has to offer.You can take a ferry to Taronga Park Zoo. Another to Darling Harbour or Watsons Bay. The Manly ferry is another great trip where you experience the Harbour and Ocean Beaches. There are plenty of great place to eat. The Many Skiff Club is a pleasant place to dine.

Sydney ferries. We were in Sydney and decided to catch the ferry over to Manley, what a great experience. It reminded myself of being on the Mersey ferries in Liverpool when I was a child. We had a great day on Manley beach, the return journey was fantastic. As we approached the the harbour the sun was setting over the bridge, with the opera house over to the left what a stunning view. A memory that will forever be etched in my mind.The ferry journey takes around 30 minuets.

A must do but don't limit yourself to one route. Enjoy a few.. Take a few different routes and experience Sydney from the water and enjoy multiple experiences of what this fabulous harbour has to offer.

Still a great way to travel. Caught the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay - both trips there and back were on time.Embarkation and disembarkation were well organised and flowed well.the ferry was clean hand there was plenty of room despite the school holiday crowd.Use of the Opal card worked well.

Appreciate the splendor of Sydney Harbour by Ferry. The fascination of a Sydney Harbour ferry ride came back to us from earlier days. We recommend a day ticket ride to view the many amazing topographical points of interest on one of the most famous harbors in the free world. This is also a good way to visualise and appreciate the old and the evolving new town planning concepts of the city and the impressiveness of Sydney Harbour Bridge.
nice way. it is a nice way to get around , we cuaght the ferry to manly , rose bay etc and it is quick and convient with fantastic views , during the day allways something to look at on the harbour

Cheap cheerful way of seeing the harbour. Don't bother with organized harbour cruises. You can see everything on a cheap ferry. Also, great way to go from Opera House area to Darling Harbour. Not to be missed.

A great way to get around Sydney, sure beats bus or train!!. I love the ferries you get to see the bridge, opera house, giant cruise ships, navy vessels and the harbour. Slightly more expensive than bus or train, but so relaxing and scenic.
Sydney Ferry Experiences. Spotless!! Always on time. A great way to see parts of the Sydney suburbs from the water inwards. A superb way to view the harbor.

Exciting. A trip on the ferry was so long ago as a little girl and I am now 50. Ferry arrived on time and trip was just ahhhhhh and my have things changed. Sat watching a family with young children and the little ones were so excited.Its a must do if you are in Sydney.

Quick and useful. I love these ferries. They are no frills but they get you where you want to go quickly. We had a fantastic tour guide on one of them who told us all sorts of interesting facts. The views from the ferries are beautiful.

Sydney Harbour Amazing Sunday Family Discount. Travel Sydney by bus ferry or train with kids on any Sunday for just $2.50 per person all day long! We discovered this accidentally when staying in Sydney City one weekend. We expected to pay $50 or so for a family ticket and couldn't believe it was not only just $7.50 for four of us but that we could swap and change from any ferry to any train to any bus an unlimited number of times all day long. Fantastic way to see Sydney Harbour and surrounds on a budget. Its called the Family Fun Day Sunday Pass - available wherever Bus, Train or Ferry tickets are sold. One family member under 16 yrs needed to qualify all the adults from the same family for the $2.50 fares. Additional under 16 family members travel free!

Take the ferry to Manly - a great way to see Sydney and cheap day out.. a great way to see Sydney harbour, and low cost. Once you get to Manly there is also plenty to do, so you can make it a good day out. We live here and think it is best part of Sydney!

Great value on Sundays. We love riding ferries around the harbour on Sundays. It's a great day out, particularly on a Spring day. What a fabulous way to explore Sydney Harbour! The highlights on this occasion were a ferry ride from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour (king st wharf) and the walk back through Barangaroo, Walsh Bay and The Rocks.

See the sparkling harbour. Three best trips on Sydney Ferries are (all leave from Cicular Quay): To Manly (a beach side suburb) a 30 minute trip. Walk down to the ocean beach at Manly (5 minutes) and have lunch/dinner/coffee. Along the harbour towards Parramatta about 1 hour. Get off at Abbotsford and have lunch at the Sydney Rowing club roght beside the wharf, great views up the river. To Taronga Zoo about 10 minutes and visit the Zoo with its great views over the harbour back to the city.

Take a ferry ride to get the feel for Sydney. Even though Sydney's ferry fleet is getting a bit long in the tooth, there's nothing like hopping on a ferry and gliding across the beautiful harbour to lift your mood and explore Sydney. It's and easy way to get around and you can use your Opal card too. There's a little coffee kiosk on board for snacks if you need it, though you are better off buying from one of Sydney's fantastic Cafes or eateries when you get to your destination. Kick back, relax and enjoy the views.

Cheaper way of a Harbour Cruise. Sydney Ferries is a cheaper way of doing a Harbour Cruise, they take you to the Zoo, Darling Harbour, Luna Park, Parramatta, Manly. Great to take when Enlightened is on, good to avoid on New Year's Eve as they are too full.
Manly and Back. the ferries are on of the best and cheapest ways to see the full splendour of Sydney.Make sure you come back from Manly at night and see the lights.
Great way to see surrounding areas. Although very busy, the ferries are reasonably priced and frequent.Suggest you travel first thing in the morning

Great Service. Having spent a week at Sydney Olympic Park, we used the ferry service to get into the City. What an awesome way to get around.Apart from the awesome views along the way, the service run on time.We used the service to get to Circular Quay then onto Manly on one day then another day we went to Circular Quay then onto Taronga Zoo. Thankfully the weather was perfect so we could ride outside and enjoy the beautiful scenery.The only issue we had one day was that the ferry was full coming from Parramatta so had to wait for another service to come along - which also was full so had to wait again.It was the weekend on the NRL grand final so I guess had to expect loads of people around.All up this is the best way to get into the heart of Sydney.

Good way to see the city. My husband and I were advised to ride the ferry for an inexpensive instroduction to the city. We picked up the ferry and Circular Quay and road it round trip. It wasn't a tour, but friendly Aussies happily filled us in. Additionally, we were able to scope out places we wanted to visit.

Well oiled people moving. I love it that when I am visiting Sydney I can take the ferry to one of the many spots they frequent.
No hassle with traffic..... step on and step of and on the way take in the Sydney Scenery.
It can get pretty rough though during bad weather

Fantastic way to get to all areas of Sydney.. Travelling on the ferry is the best way to see most areas of Sydney. The view of the bridge and the Opera house is one not to be missed. You can hop on and off when and where you want and also avoid the heavy city traffic.

Ferry to Manly. A trip to Manly by ferry is a very inexpensive to see the true beauty of Sydney Harbour. Once at Manly you can shop, dine out, visit a micro brewery or just sit and watch the action on the beach.There is something for everyone in Manly, a tourists delight. You can even charge your phone on the ferry on the way if your battery level is low. One of the best ferry trips in the world so much amazing scenery and natural beauty to see.

Losing Time Experiencing Sydney Harbour.. Had a matinee show to see at the Opera House - we arrived early into Sydney and had some time to lose so decided to take the Manly Ferry to Manly and return. We always try to take the opportunity whenever we are in Sydney to either view, dine on, or travel on Sydney Harbour. The weather was overcast, but this didn't matter - there is always something to see or comment on when you are on the best waterway in the world. We boarded the ferry "Narrabeen" (named after one of Sydney's iconic northern beaches) at Circular Quay ferry terminal and immediately made a beeline for the on board cafe for a warming hot chocolate, a toasted sandwich and a chat with resident cafe server Yanni, who has been around Sydney in various hospitality roles for longer that he cares to say. (he also has tips on travelling in Europe) The trip to Manly takes about 1/2 hour and you can get off there and walk to Manly beach, shops and restaurants, or stay on board for the return trip (no extra charge)A great and inexpensive way to see Sydney Harbour and get fantastic photos of the City, Harbour bridge, Opera House, Fort Denison etc etc etc.
Easy way to get around.. Easy way to get to different areas of Sydney-The zoo, Manly, Darling Harbour. Also just nice to see the harbour. Good prices too.
Nice. Great views, really enjoyed the trip on the boat. Sitting outside was nice, and was a great way to see Sydney.
convenient and clean. The ferries are always on time. They are clean and the staff is very polite and helpful.The routes are scenic!

This is a have to do. You cant go to Sydney without riding on a ferry as the views from the ferries are amazing - makes you think how many people travel on them daily and not realise what such a wonderful journey they are undertaking

Unique way to see a fabulous harbour. Sydney harbour is world acclaimed for its beauty and the best way to indulge in the harbour is on the harbour ferries.. The main route from the city to Manly is a must do... It goes right up the middle of the harbour and you see the lot. However taking some of the smaller ferries gets you on an adventure of discovery or quaint jetties and small bays. Its well worth exploring this way and having an adventure.

Enjoy Sydney Harbor From The Water. It's hard to pass up the opportunity to travel the waterways of Sydney Harbor using the extensive Sydney Ferry system. What better way to observe the variety of waterfrontage homes, chat with the locals, and take a leisurely 'cruise' all at the same time. Make it a day outing!!

Regular, on time and scenic . Have used the ferries many times, most recently to travel to Parramatta up the river. The ferry left on time, and arrived ahead of schedule. The views in the harbour were spectaular - why pay for a harbour tour when you can see as much from the city ferries?

Efficient transport system. We used these to get to Manly. Crossing .'30 mins was efficient and smooth. Crew were helpful. Embarking& disembarking were done efficiently. At 15.20 AUD return it was well worthwhile. Manly proved interesting Witt its history of quarantine.
For a good city pictur!. Best thing to take if you want to visit the Zoo and at the same time to have the best picture of the city and the Sydney Opera House.

Cruise Sydney Harbour the cost effective way.. Buy an Opal card from any newsagent put some money on it and you are set to go. Tap this on the scanner as you get on and off the service and you will see the remaining credit left. This can be used on buses trains and Sydney Ferries for the cheapest fare available. You can cruise around the harbour visiting many wonderful places and get off and on as often as you like. The services are frequent so you won't be wasting time. The Ferries have ample seating outside so you can get beautiful photos of all the familiar landmarks. Certainly the cheapest way to see around the harbour. Don't expect a tourist commentary as this is the way Sydneysiders commute.
great Afternoon on Sydney Harbour. Went for a ride to Darling Harbour from Circular Quay. Great experience on reasonably calm waters. Will do it again I when we return to Sydney.

Great way to get somewhere and see the sights at the same time.. Since we were staying on the north shore, the best and most fun way for us to get into Sydney was th ferry. The boats run frequently and are easy to use. We never experienced much wait time and the schedules were clearly posted. Not to b missed.

Good way of getting around. Good way of getting around and seeing the harbour area at the same time.Ferries are very frequent but of course they take time to get from one place to another,I did think they are rather expensive given that they are public transport and not pleasure cruises.
Evening ferry with dinner. The evening ferry with dinner is s must. The opera house and the bridge are beautiful as the sun sets. The dinner was quite good and was served with wine.

Excellent value and beautiful view. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Beach and also to Taronga Zoo. Only 10 minutes wait and costed AU 15 round trip. Beautiful view of Sydney Harbor and Harbor Bridge, Opera House. We thorough enjoyed it. It covered the same route as expensive harbor cruises. We used Opal Smartcard. very convenient. use the same card for buses and trains.
Great way to see the sights. We took the ferry over to the zoo. It was so easy to catch from the Circulat Quay. The ferry was clean and on time. We took the ferry to and from the zoo.

Travelling for work or fun, wonderful on a nice day.. If you're a tourist any ride is fun, with Manly as one of the longest journeys.Watch the harbour pass you by and see the best views from a different vantage point.Best on a clear day with calm waters, but best avoided on a wet and windy winters day (unless you enjoy a bumpy ride).Think of combining a trip to Taronga Zoo and make a great day of it.

Best thing to do on the Best harbour in the World. A fabulous way to explore the Joy of Sydney Harbour. From Circular Quay to Manly ,to Parramatta ,to Taronga Zoo ,to Darling Harbour ,to Watsons Bay and many other routes . The ferries are clean ,modern ,quiet and run on time. If you are a senior buy the all day pass for $2:50 and use all the Sydney transport to travel on trains or buses from in a 200 kilometre radius around Sydney in 24 hrs. No better value !!

Get an Opal Smartcard - save money. I rode a ferry from Sydney to Manly Beach and back. Another ferry from Charles Street Wharf, Parramatta to Sydney Harbour. When I arrived at Sydney airport, I purchased an Opal Smartcard at the giftshop. My husband was on business in Parramatta so I was on my own. I rode trains, buses and ferries. At the time, I saved money over just paying as you go. The ferries were clean and a great way to travel. The ferry to and from Manly Beach was very full but I still had a seat. The ride from Parramatta to Sydney was beautiful and relaxing.

Nice way to view the harbour and its waterways. Took the Ferry from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay and back again. We sat in comfort and watched the comings and goings of the harbour. Great views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Sydney Opera House. Cheaper than taking a tour and you can do things at your own pace. Loading and unloading the ferries is a quick and easy operation considering the amount of people using them. If we had more time I would have gone to other bays and inlets, I went to Manly on the ferry as well. $24 for an adult day pass.
Ferry rude. If you have nothing to do in Sydney take a ride on a ferry. Better still if you are a Senior get the special all day pass for just $2.50.

Week sightseeing in Sydney. The ferry we caught to Manly was a lovely trip. Great views while relaxing. Frequent trips and crowds moved well. No pushing. Easy and enjoyable trip to Manly and back to Circular Quay.
Bets views of the harbour!. Must do if you are in Sydney. The boats provide one of the best views of the opera house and bridge.

The best and cheapest harbour cruise in Sydney. The ferries are part of Sydney's public transport system with some locals choosing to live where they'll need to use one to commute to work. It's a great way to start and end a working day.It's also the cheapest way to see the harbour. Yes, you can pay for an organised cruise with running commentary and catering if that's your thing but you can also save $$ by just joining the locals on any one of the great round trips. My personal favourite is the ferry that runs to Balmain because you get to go under the bridge and around some very pretty parts of the harbour. The Manly ferry is the well known route but this one is likely to be less crowded and offers you opportunities to hop off and hop back on again. For a real treat, check if the Balmain markets are on and jump the bus up and back to the wharf, or explore Cockatoo Island for a couple of hours and enjoy some military history.

Manly Trip. Multi 1 tickets don't work for this trip, so you'll have to buy one way or return ones at the wharf. Rather than use the money machine, go to seller's window (less confusing).Each way takes 30/40 minutes & well worth the sights from the harbour!!

The only way to get about the harbour environs. A great way to get about Sydney harbour to visit other parts of the area and also get a harbour cruise thrown in. The boats might be old, but are in good condition if a little basic.
trip to manly. best time spent on the ferry going to manly and the view was amazing.loads of pictures to be taken .so many things to do at manly.best part is sit on the deck and take in the view

very easy transport system. visiting Sydney this is an ideal way to see the harbour and allows you to get off at various places. The views are splendid , Opera house, Bridge etc are so much better from the water

Pleasant trip. We rode the ferry out to Manly for the day and walked to through Sydney Harbour National Park to the lookouts. We had beautiful weather and it was quite a hike. We didn't take any "rubber neckers" in the harbour and I don't imagine that they would have been better than the trip we took. Highly recommended.

65foodie2014. 8 travelling together took the train from Town Hall to Circular Quay for a trip to Doyles Restaurant at Watsons Bay on Monday 5/10/15... public holiday. Very impressed with both forms of transport. Both were prompt and efficient. Wish we had transportation this good in Brisbane.
Mint. Mint trip to manly on ferry. Beautiful night and meal. Easy travel option. Thoroughly enjoyed myself. Would recommend
Beautiful Harbour Ride.. Usually busy @ Circular Quay as you would expect - never had a problem, always prompt & friendly helpful staff ☺

A cheap outing. A great and cheap way to get around the City. The staff were very helpful and I bought a day pass on their suggestion. I went to Manly and to the North Shore. Both trips offered great views back on the Opera House and Bridge.

cheap cruise with a view. Yes some are old but what better and cheaper way can you see the harbour, most seats are good on the outside with photo opportunities and stay on long enough and you can get the seat you want. they do round trips so you can stay on for a cruise and end up back where you started.A good option to the bus or train

lazy day on the harbour. Great way to see the sights of Sydney. Spend a few hours floating up and down the harbour. Why not get off and explore Manly and eat in one of the many cafes.The notice boards tell how long a wait until the next ferry. Undercover if the weather is not great or too hot. Well organised.

Perfect mode of transport whilst in Sydney. Very reliable service and a great way to get around. Prices are very fair if one purchases the Opal card in advance. Don't forget to actually touch the "tap off, tap on" point with your ticket card in order to get the trip price properly calculated.

Unfriendly transport. The Sydney ferries I recommend should not be tried for a ride because there are no friendly staff I have seen because this service is owned by the government. Also don't go on the ferry if you don't feel well or just right after you eat because some to.we the heavy waves that hit the ferry can make you seasick.

Simply part of Sydney's character. During our last visit my wife and I used the ferries multiple times and each time we were amazed at just how great they are. We purchased a Seniors ticket and was absolutely gobsmacked when they told us it would cost $2.50 for an all-day pass. Good god you can't even buy a bottle of water for that! We used that ticket 4 times in the one day and would have happily paid $20 dollars. Please never let these icons of Sydney be replaced they are the best tourist attraction there is.

Sydney Harbour View. We were in Sydney recently and took the return trip from Manly to Circular Quay on the ferry. It is a wonderful way to see Sydney Harbour. We have often taken this ride and always enjoy the outstanding views of the Harbour.

Budget way to see Sydney. If you can buy an all day pass you can get access to all train, tram, bus and ferry services for a minimal cost. With the ferry services you can see much of the magnificent harbour without having to pay $100's to a tourist charter.

A great day out on the water. For a pensioner you can travel all day on the harbour ferries for $2.50 - brilliant and a great way to see the sights. Best photos from outside, but be prepared to get blown around and wet from spray.
great transport. easy system of transport highly recommended to get around see harbour and get where your going fast and on time!

Sydney views. Even if you are not going anywhere specific, this is a great way to see Sydney from a different perspective without spending a lot. We took the Ferry to Darling Harbour, which was long, but enjoyable.

a great way to view our beautiful harbour. These beautiful yellow and green ferries are a Sydney icon. A fantastic way to view our outstanding harbour be it a sunny or overcast day. Well worth the price of the ticket. In fact go to a few different destinations, get off and wander around. You will get a different perspective of Sydney.

Cheap & Cheerful. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly.Priced at $15.20 return, its a quick and easy way to get across the harbour.Although some of the upholstery had worn, the ferry is quite clean.It was a smooth ride both ways.Our trip took 1/2 hr each way, but there were plenty of seats so it was a relaxing journey
Best transport in Sydney. Great way to travel. Along with Star Ferry in Hong Kong 2 of the world's greatest & cheapest water experiences.

Nice. We don't go on ferries that often but on the occasion we have, which is out side of peak times, they have been relaxing and pleasant.We generally that the ferry from Parramatta to Circular Quay and has been great though I do understand that at peak times it's a bit rushed by passengers waiting to board and get home.Still a good experience by all and recommended way of travel just to do something different.
Love the ferries. They are efficient, and a lovely way to see the harbour. Great pictures too of the harbour bridge from the ferry.

One of the best attractions in town. A highlight of visiting Sydney is a trip on the ferries. How lucky Sydney siders are to have this as regular public transport. A great way to see the harbour, the bridge, Opera house and to visit some of Sydney's wonderful suburbs and hidden coves.

A must do in Sydney. A must do in Sydney. Such a cheap way to enjoy one of Sydney's best assets, the harbour. Take the ferry to Watson's Bay and cruise past some great harbour suburbs and enjoy fish and chips at the end of your trip. Or take the ferry to Manly. Either one is a great option. Hopefully you'll have blue sky which will make it perfect!!

Manly Ferry A Must. On any day where there's a bit if sun, jump on the Manly ferry, sit back and enjoy the fabulous views. Make sure you have plenty of space on your camera, as you'll be snapping away getting Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Fort Denison, Prime Ministers residence in Kirribilli all within 5 minutes of leaving Circular Quay!

Great, cheap way to get around and the views....wow. This is a cheap way to get around and see the opera house and Harbour bridge from a different perspective. The locals use the ferries to commute so they can be busy during rush hour. The ticket staff are helpful and are used to dealing with tourists, Don't be afraid to join the locals, jump on and enjoy. Much cheaper than an organised boat tour. Just head to circular quay and follow the signs, its as easy as that.
Good Ferry System in Sydney. Ferries are on time & cover all points of the fabulous Harbor.They are frequent & roomy. Also cheap way to see the whole Harbor
Great way to go. My husband and I use the ferry to travel to the city almost every time we go.such a lovely way to travel,always on time and very comfortable.
Sydney ferries. great selection of ferries , attractions and locations all day. great views from the ferries, giving a good overview of Sydney
Ferry to the Zoo. The frequent ferry services are very useful and not expensive. I used one to get from Circular Quay to Tarronga Zoo.
Day on the Harbour. My wife and I like to catch the Ferry over to Manly mostly on Sundays as with an opal card you get unlimited public transport for only $2.5

The way to go. One of the best ways to see the harbour city is by ferry. It's cheap, you can get around to all sorts of places and enjoy all sorts of vantage points of the harbour – the bridge, the Opera House and whatever else takes your fancy. It can be chilly if you choose to sit outside. Dress accordingly, depending on what time of year you go. The Opel card covers travel. So simple. Do it.

The Best Way to See Sydney. Sydney Ferries are an inexpensive way to see glorious Sydney Harbour without the cost of organized tours. Darling Harbour, Luna Park, the Sydney Habour Bridge, Opera House, Kirrabilly and Manly and everything in between. You even get a bit of commentary. Many of the Ferries are not swish but they are perfectly adequate with clean toilets and spectacular views. A great way to travel and enjoy the sights along the way.

Amazing. Love going on Sydney ferries . Some are quite different . And they are just the best way to get around the Harbour . Or just escape from a hectic life as I did one time and sat all day . Also coming into Circular Quey after dark .Spectacular

Great way to travel around area. Very affordable way to get where we wanted to go. Downtown Sydney to manly beach then return to darling harbour This is a beautiful and scenic way to get around. We have been to Australia now twice and have used th ferry to good us both times

Affordable choice to travel the harbour. Especially if you have an Opal travel card for your stay taking the Sydney Ferries is a very affordable way to see some different views of the city and enjoy the beautiful harbor. One of the most popular routes is to go to Manly Beach and then return in time to watch the sun set over Sydney, which is pretty magical if you get a good day!

Sit back relax and enjoy the views. The ferries are a good and inexpensive way to travel around Sydney Harbour. For the amount of travellers on these ferries per day they always appeared to be clean and well looked after. They run regularly and are pretty much always on time! I personally just sat back and enjoyed the beautiful views of Sydney Harbour.
Best way to see the Harbour. Brilliant service provided by these ferries. They are a spectacular way to see the Harbour. It is fairly cheap and very easy to navigate.

Manly ferry was the best. Great way to see the Harbour & explore the city. Used other forms of public transport to get around to places such as Watsons Bay & Darling Harbour then used ferries as quick way back to Circular Quay
Hit the water on the ferry, it's fun!. Take a trip to Manly, it's a great trip of the harbour and Manly is a good food and beach visit, sometimes markets on a weekend too

Scenic. The timetable is moderately accurate but these lovely old ferries are in need of a bit more tender loving care to restore them to their former glory.
The staff are only employed to do a job and lack enthusiasm towards visitors.
Ferry. If you want a new perspective on the city or just need to get across the river then the ferry in Sydney is a good way to travel. Fares are payable by Opal card so it's simple to tap in and go.

Great way to travel around the harbour. If only the other passengers would stop pushing and shoving to get on the ferry. Talk about frantic, one person even started to kick at and climb his way over a pram (with child in it) in his effort to beat everyone onto the ferry. Even when there is a toddler walking ahead of them they push past regardless. Rude.
Sydney Ferry. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly at sunset. Very efficient and clean and what a fantastic view for photographs
Views To Die For!. We took the ferry over to the zoo. The ferry was clean and tidy, and huge! we stood outside for the view of the bridge and opera house, really special!

"Tap on" to relaxing harbour and river exploration. If you buy an Opal ticket you will have access to all public transport in Sydney including ferries and after I think it is 6 "tap on's" of the ticket starting on Monday morning, the rest of your travel is free. You still 'tap on' but the machine does not deduct funds. I bought my opal card at Central Station and put $50.00 on it. After that I did not need to think about fares except to 'tap on & tap off'.It is fun to explore the harbour by riding on the ferries and the River Cat goes right out to Parramatta although if the tide is out and the river is low you may need to disembark before Parramatta. If this happens a bus will meet you to take you the rest of the way. I was on the last Cat to get through on the day i went and it was touch and go whether the boat would make it all the way. The driver was tentatively & slowly feeling the way through.The Manly Ferry is the longest journey and it crosses the 'Heads' (ie the point at which the open ocean has access to the harbout because it leaves from Circular Quay on the south side of the harbour and crosses to Manly which is on the north shore and very close to the North Head. Another interesting journey is to Watson's Bay for Fish and Chips at the Hotel or take away from the famous Doyles Restaurant. You can travel into all the nooks and crannies of the harbour either to the east or the west of the Quay. Take your time and have fun or go back for a different trip each day. You will meet fellow travelers and have a chance to swap stories and information.
Ferry to Manly. We took the ferry to Manly Beach. Enjoyed an excellent and cheap lunch. The walk along the beach was great. Unfortunately the weather was a bit too cool for a swim. Maybe next time.

Grandchildren to sydney. Ferries were really great, we caught he manly ferry to see the aquarium and to have a swim at the beach. The weather was a little blowy so we only sat outside on the ferry for a little while. Next day we caught the ferry from Luna Park to Circular Key, a very quick trip and a great way to get across the harbour quickly

Day or night what a wonderful way to see Sydney Harbour.. We locals take our harbour for granted. Shame on us. Spending time on the harbour is a glorious thing to do and if time is what you lack take a Sydney ferry from Circular Quay to Manly or round to Darling Harbour. If you take a return trip,get off, explore and and take ferry back or to some other destination on the route. Sydney Ferries - way to go!Visitors, buy your Opal Card at the airport or Newslink agencies around Sydney and enjoy the convenience it offers on ferries, buses, the light rail and train. In Sydney always have a very light weight rain coat and on the water a sweater if it is windy or cool. Even in the rain the ferry is fun. Open and covered seating is available.

Great way to see the harbour. Great way to see the harbour, sail under the bridge and a great view of the opera house!! good on time system got us from East Balmain to Darling Harbour and circular Quay

Sydney Serries - Sydney in all its glory!. Sydney Ferries are the cheapest and best way to see Sydney Harbour in all its magnificence.
Take a ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and see it all - past the Opera House, beyond all the gorgeous homes, past the Zoo and past Sydney heads - this is a trip of a lifetime.

Hop on hop off for spectacular views. Who needs a cruise? Pick up an Opal card and travel when ever where ever. Run frequently and quick embarkation and debarkation. Timetables freely available. Cremorne Point, Taronga Zoo, Manley, Watson's Bay all these icons within easy reach and drink in the great views as you pass by. Your Opal is linked to other public transport for very easy way to get around. Even better if you are a senior. All this for $2.50 a day every day. That's bargain!

great way to see sydney harbour. the ferries are a great way to get around sydney from circular quay to a lot of different locations including manly, taronga zoo and darling harbour.reasonably priced and very punctual, a very relaxed way to travel.
Ferry to Manly.. Took the ferry to Manly from Circular Quay and a great way to see the harbour. I would recommend this especially to get some photos of the Bridge and Opera House.

So efficient and reliable!. We used the ferries everyday of our 1 week stay. Embarking and disembarking was quick and simple. The whole system worked like clockwork. Really amazing to watch the ferries come and go..like a busy airport.
Sydney Ferry. Took ferry to the zoo. Really nice ride. Able to see sights from a different perspective. ie Opera House, Harbour Bridge, houses along the shore line.

Ferry @ the best. Excellent Ferry Ride in Circular Quay to Manly and another ferry ride from Circular Quay to Parramatta .... Must watch the waves dancing in the ride and excellent view from Sea.... Enjoy your ride with spending time outside Ferry and not sitting inside.

Great way to end the tour of the Blue Mountains...... Our tour of the Blue Mountains ended at a Sydney Ferry where we were taken to our final destination at Circular Quay which is located downtown Sydney and was perfect as we were staying the the Marriott Hotel in downtown Sydney. The ferry was very enjoyable but you need to stay focused because the ferry makes a good many stops and passengers are getting on and off frequently and the ferry does not waste any time at each of its stops. It was a very enjoyable day and ended on the ferry which once again was a great way to end our full day of touring the beautiful mountains and city of Sydney.

Awesome time. I have been on Sydney ferry a couple of times on our 1week holiday in Sydney . It was a convenient and relaxing way to travel to Taronga zoo, manly beach, darling harbour and allows great views both day and night of the Sydney opera house and harbour bridge
Manely ferry. very nice ride,the ferry is easy to catch, worth paying the money to visit such a lovely beach. Manly island view
punctual, efficient & sceni,c. These are an efficient and pleasant way to get from one place to another - and how wonderful it is, in a big city, to arrive at the end of a commute feeling refreshed.

Holiday in Sydney.. Excellent enjoyable way to see the Sydney harbor and get to where you want to go around Sydney,...would use the all day pass which is for/bus /ferry train as it much cheaper than buying a ticket for each trip.

SYDNEY HARBOUR FERRIES. The Sydney Harbour is one of the best in the world (if not the best) and the nicest and most convenient way to see it and all it,s attractions is by the ferries, they are clean, cheap and comfortable, the older ferries have the charm, but if you are in a hurry, you have the fast one,s, they run regularly and take you to beaches, zoo, luna park etc

Best way to see the harbour.. Don't book a trip just jump on a ferry to Manly.The views of the bridge and Opera House are great and the buzz on the ferry great,With a return ticket you can explore Manly at your own pace. Try catching the ferry up theParramatta river and view the bridge from the other side. Circular Quay is a great place with lots going on -

Super views and Super fun. No visit to Sydney would be complete without a trip on the Ferries, they provide an ideal way of seeing the Harbour as well as a very pleasant means of transport, there is no better way to enjoy the Harbour.
Float away. This is the best ever way to experience the best of sydney. Choose a trip to manly after dark to see the best of this beautiful city upon your return

$2.50 Sunday Sunday - Travel on a Sunday throughout the whole network.. We love checking out Sydney on a sunday for only $2.50 for an all day pass unlimited ferries, trains and buses. So many amazing places to see from the ferries. Worth checking out the Parramatta to Circular Quay one too (although watch for tides as sometimes it can't get all the way to Parramatta).
Opal card. Buy an opal card . So much cheaper than going on the tourist cruses. Be aware that on Sundays it will be a crush but its only a flat $2.50 for the whole day.
Beautiful views in comfort. The Sydney ferries are very good, they are prompt and can seat lots of people. If you want the wind in your face you can sit outside on most boats.

commuting home. I travelled on the ferry today and was very impressed.my only critic is that I was on the Parramata ferry stopping at a couple touristic venue so full of tourist traveling on the harbour on the chip. They are counting the number of passengers to boardso that the others can board in Darling Harbour well that is fine but when you are a local commuting that is not good at all specially when you can't get on and have to wait an other 30 minutes for the dam service. Cheap yes clean and a agreeable journey to get home.
Ride in Sydney Waters. Get a ride in a ferry.. beautiful view of sydney from waters.. if lucky can see cruize lines as well.. its generally windy while in waters.. amazing experience..
Ferry ride. We caught the ferry from the rocks to darling harbour. Very easy to purchase tickets and great way to see Sydney harbour
View of Barangaroo. Caught ferry from circular quay to milsons point via darling harbour great view of new park and all new construction plus the harbour itself for 50 mins . wonderful value

Efficient, easy transportation. Very efficient, on time, clean and fun way to get around Sydney Harbor. I took it to Manly (water can be a little rough) and to the zoo. The service was always on time and easy to get a seat.
A great way to get around. Using the ferry services around Sydney harbour is a great way to get out on the water and see the sights at the same time travelling to different destinations.
A lot of fun for the whole family! . Caught the ferry to Manly. Surprisingly good fun. You spend a couple of hours on the harbour and the views are terrific. Well worth it.
Sightseeing with ease.. Took a return trip from Darling Harbour to Manly via Circular Quay. A great way to take in the harbour and skyline.
Sydney Ferries. We used the ferry twice both time wonderful. It was nice to just jump on and pay at the end of your trip.

Sydney stopover. One of the best things about Sydney is the ferry system. Easy to get around and the ticket office staff are always helpful as are the crews on the ferrys. Easy to work out which ferry you need to get where you want and always seem to be running on time. Offering the best views of the harbour no matter where you're headed.

Could spend all day on these.. Now use Opal Cards. These can be topped up at any 7-11 just remember to tap on and off. Price capped to $15 a day or $60 a week Mon-Sat. Sunday is $2.50 all day. Wonderful way to travel and lots of photo opportunities. Opal card can be used on ferries, buses and trains.
Great public transport for Sydney. Always on time, fabulous views, going often so no problem at catching one when you want them. A slick professional transport. Wonderful, and also cheap.

Excellent value to see alot of the city from the water. Get yourself an Opal card and be there on a Sunday - all travel is capped at $2.50 for the whole day!I would recommend catching the ferry to Manly, Circular Quay and Darling Harbour - this gives you really great views of the city and surrounds - with STUNNING views of the bridge and opera house together (makes a great photo!). Ferries run quite regular and we had no troubles getting window seats on each trip. The old school ferries look really cool too :)
Nice . Great way to explore the bay! Gives you great view on the harbor, opera and bridge! Very affordable! I highly recommend it!

Cockatoo Island during the Biennale is the place to ferry!. I love getting on a ferry and crossing the harbour in the summer or spring great way to experience our beautiful harbour. Take a time out and sit back on a ferry as you travel around sydney finding new places to explore. Check out cockatoo island when the biennale is on and you will not be disappointed,

A great way to get to know Sydney. Sydney Ferries is a busy service for the harbour and the Parramatta River. The hub of the system is at Circular Quay. Plan your trip/s; there's a free bus 555 from central to the Quays. For residents living near to the Harbour, the service is the only really practical way to commute and so you might want to avoid rush hours. For the visitor, I suggest the following spectacular destinations: Manly, Parramatta, Taronga Zoo, and Darling Harbour. Each destination is worth a stop but obviously the Zoo needs a goodly amount of time and so should be a separate day out. It's a much better Zoo than Regents Park London and getting there on the ferry and by the cable car are more of an experience.Circular Quay provides access to another 40 wharves - from Manly at the northern end of Sydney Harbour to Balmain peninsula and Darling Harbour at the southern end. Trips both North and South are recommended. Manly for a day out at the beach, Balmain to see an old Aus town and discover the peninsular. I love the Harbour at night and so recommend a late night ferry from, repeat from, Balmain to Circular Quay.
Best spot to view the Harbour. great experience to take a trip to Manly on the ferry, clean, efficient and best view of Sydney! A must to do, if showing someone the highlights of Sydney...

Great ferries. Sydney has a wonderful network of ferries. If you are a local and have not utilized the ferry services then I advise you to do so as soon as possible. If you are a tourist then you wont be disappointed with the service(s), A trip to Manly is fantastic, a trip to Watsons Bay is first class whilst a trip up harbor to Cockatoo Island is glorious. Even the inner harbor services are beautiful, go to Mosman for instance.
Clean and timely. A very efficient public transport system which I highly recommend. A very cheap form of transport to see our magnificent Sydney.

A cruise not to be missed. When in Sydney, this is a must to do. The ferry ride is good value for money, considering the hundreds of dollars other private ferry companies charge. The shortest and best cruise is from Circular Quay to darling Harbour, when the ferry crosses below the harbour bridge.

Fantastic Experience with Great Service. We took lots of ferry trips on a recent trip to Sydney with my 10yo son. We visited during glorious weather so touring the harbour on the big yellow and green ferries and soaking in the sights was hugely enjoyable. We found that we only had to wait more than a few minutes once and that was on a sunday. We received above and beyond service from many of the staff on board the ferries. On the Sunday my son had forgotten his opal card and one of the workers hopped off at circular quay with us to let us though and ensure we didn't have to pay anything. On another trip one of the workers went around all of the tourists on bvoard taking photos for them in all the best spots with the bridge and the opera house behind - his name was Grant and he was such a friendly man. Travelling on the ferries made me very envious of Sydney's public transport system - well done!

The best way to get around. Definitely see Sydney by Ferry. The Ferry service is a great way to see so much of what Sydney has to offer. This hop on hop off facility is great fun and very relaxing too. From Manly to Sydney takes about half an hour and you have a wonderful view of the skyline and bridge.
Nice ferry _Cat ferry. Take ferry at CQ to get Manly beach~!There are 2 kind of ferry faster or nomal~!good to see some small rock over the ocean and opera house also

Especially recommend Manly and Darling Harbour trips. Allows stunning views of Sydney Skyline. Already reviewed Manly ferry but also recommend a short journey from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour via North Sydney. This journey passes under Harbour Bridge giving you stunning views of the city.
Sydney Ferries. Brilliant, these ferries going all the time, never long to wait, clean and on time, easy to get to, walk, bus or train to Circular Quay, signage very good and away you go

Brilliant day on the water. Whilst in Sydney recently, my wife and I took the benefit of being able to purchase a daily seniors ticket and travel all day on public transport, including the Dydney ferries. We started from Oately on the train to Circular Quay, boarded the ferry to Watsons Bay and had lunch before returning.However, it is worth mentioning that we would have been able to keep swapping ferries to anywhere around the harbour all day without any extra cost. Could make a whole day of it if the weather is nice!

A nice way to view Sydney - if you have the time.. You probably wouldn't catch the Ferry if you needed to get anywhere in a hurry or were time poor. THe ferry - especially to Manly provides a great way for tourists to see the Harbour bridge and the city coastline. A little over priced, sometimes over crowded and always, always LATE!

conveniant way to travel in Sydney.. while visiting Sydney we used the ferry service frequently , and found it a very pleasant way to travel , the buses are actually waiting for the ferry at the jetty and don't leave until all passengers are aboard . weekday time tables are frequent , but weekends less so ,and misleading time on Sunday morning eg. Sat. Sun. and Public Hols. 7.38am. but first ferry not till 9.00am nearly missed my flight.

Very efficient. what a great way to travel. I lived in manly for 5 months and the ferry was my commute to work. Seeing Dolphins and the amazing view of the harbour as you pull in to circular quay is definitely my favourite way to start the day. Very reasonably priced too.

Must-do. A bit pricey but it is worth a ferry trip from Blues Point Road to Circular Quay, or to Darling Harbour. Or from Circular Quay to Manly Beach. You get a very nice view of Sydney Bay with Opera House, Harbour Bridge and Sydney skyline

Nice alternative travel. On a Sunday we took the train from Redfern station to the Olympic Park. After spending the afternoon walking thru the park, we walked up to take the ferry back to Darling Harbour. It was a lovely way to travel back into Sydney and relax. The fare was reasonable.

Quick and efficient.. Took the ferry to Taronga Zoo. The ferries are not overly new, but they do provide an efficient service. It's something different and is quite inexpensive. The views from the harbour make the trips worthwhile.
Great Service . If you go to Sydney Zoo you can buy zoo tickets and ferry tickets at the same time the staff very helpful it's about 12 minutes to the zoo and easy to get into the Zoo

Feel the breeze on your face on a sun kissed day and enjoy.. What a way to travel for so little cost, Enjoy the sights of Sydney and if you have a Seniors card you can use the trains, ferry and buses for the whole day for $2.50.
Water heart beat of Sydney. Far best value on the harbour , zoo ferry tickets good value , like hopping on a bus , reliable as ever

Ferry from Darling Harbour to Manly Wharf and Back. We took a ferry from Darling Harbour around twilight and returned after an hour and a half. It was a great experience and the view of land across the waters in dark was very good. A quiet ride it was but a memorable one. Ferry ride is a must in Sydney. Ferries provide the cultural touch to your visit

One of the most spectacular public transport services in the world. For a minimal cost, you get to view one of the most spectaular harbours in the world. Use the ferries to get to a destination (such as Tarango Zoo or Manly Beach), or just enjoy the trip for what it is. A must-do visit from anyone in Sydney (whether a first time visitor or a long time resident).

Super service. We used the ferries three times, once to Watsons Bay for a seafood dinner, another time to Taronga Zoo, and once to Manly for the day. Each time the ferries were punctual, inexpensive, and operated smoothly. Many thanks to the crews and staff.
Best of Sydney Harbour. Traveling on the Sydney Ferries is brilliant you get great views of the sights without traffic problems and there is nothing quite like a sea trip when on holidays

Cockatoo Island Bar. Took a ferry to Cockatoo Island for a visit to the bar and walked around the island to learn about the history of the island. Ferry is very good. Staff very professional. We also continued on another ferry from the island to Parramatta. I use the Sydney ferries each time I am in Sydney and find them a great way of getting around.
Go anywhere. Great way to get around... ... $2.50 for a senior day pass is great value... get on and off all day and they can take you just about anywhere.
Well organized . Ferris are a must here in Sydney. They have so many islands to go to visit. They are so organized, all you have to do is decide where you want to go.

Ferry from Paramatta to Sydney Harbour. We took ferry from Paramatta terminal to Circular Quay, it takes nearly l hour. Wonderful view of the riverbank from Paramatta until we reach the Sydney Harbour front, where a great view of the harbour, sailed under the Harbour Bridge, across the front of the Sydney Opera House and the circular quay with beautiful highrise buildings such as hotels and offices. The view is lovely compare to train journey from Sdyney Central station to Paramatta.

Great way to get around. We used the ferry to get from Circular Quay to Taronga Zoo and back and it really was the best way to do it. The service itself is great with ample seating and a professional crew. The highlight has to be the views from around the harbour which are simply amazing. Much better value than a sighseeing tour, I highly recommend these as a way to see Sydney from a different angle.

Sydney ferries.. These ferries are often the best way to get from one place to another around the huge Sydney harbour The ferries are not too expensive, especially on weekends, and are punctual. To get to the many attractions, you usually have to change ferries at Circular Quay, which is always busy, but efficient.

A ferrytale way to travel. I caught the ferry from Parramatar to Circular Quay and from there took a Harbour Cruise. The ferry is a fast and fun way to travel as both a commuter and a tourist and provides stunning views not possible from land. A really great way to get out and about beyond the bustle of the city’s business district.

Sydney Ferries. As our hotel was very close to Circular Quay we used the ferries extensively They are great value for money and provide excellent views of the harbour We went across to Manly several times

Sunday Fun-Day. I love going for a ride on these things. Sunday fun-day is when my kids love to jump on the train and travel to Circ Quay to ride these beautiful boats. Go to Manly for ice cream then back on board one of the ferries for the train ride home. All transport on Sunday fun-day is $2.50

get a day pass for the commuter ferries - totally cheaper and you get to see just as much. a great way to see the harbour. If you dont want the tour guide then take the commuter ferries on a day pass - value for money and a great way to get to some of the outer suburbs like Manly.
On time and like old times. Easy to catch, clean, ontime with views all the way round of everything the harbour has to offer. Tickets can be purchased by cash or card.

So handy . Get off the plane out of the bus ot car and get an opus card and travel everywhere with Sydney public transport. We traveled on the ferries to Birkenhead outlet stores and milsons point. Beautiful harbour

Balmoral Boathouse for lunch at Balmoral Beach. We caught a ferry from Terminal 2 at Circular Quay to Taronga Park Zoo and got the bus to Balmoral Beach - fabulous. Cheapest way to get on the harbour!

Great Experience. Caught the ferry over to Manly from Circular Quay, really easy to wonder up to the booth and buy a return ticket (as long as you return on the same day) the journey of took 30 minutes and gave great views of the harbour, Opera House & Harbour Bridge.Wandered into Manly, had a beer at 4 pines brewery and walked around the bay to Shelley Beach which was an awesome walk!

To be enjoyed . This harbour like nanny others around tge world houses it's own ferries and river taxis. Cheap enough to go one and just enjoy the sight seeing or as a means of transport to get between areas. Please note while they run to a timetable this can often have problems caused by other harbour traffic. Drinks are available once on board as is the chance to enjoy a Local guide poi ting out all the landmarks you pass or Sydney gsrbour bridge the harbour gardens the opera house the local zoo towards the end of the ferry route and various other places if interest. Have your camera gang as many photos can be taken on these ferries with snakes from both coming and going and then the choice to pick out the best.

A different view of the Bridge and Opera House.. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay, using our Opal cards. They run frequently and it is quite inexpensive - a lovely way to see Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. The 555 free shuttle stops at Circular Quay - very convenient.

Fast ferry to Manly. Stuck for something to do on a beautiful spring day there is always the fast ferry to Manly. For only $8:50 you can be at Manly in under 15 minutes with no traffic worries and the best views in the world
nice harbor tour. easy to use and regular service, very close to Four Seasons hotel, great tour around the harbor, hop on and off as you like

A great way to see the city. I took the ferries to get to Manly and Taronga. I think they're a great way to see the city from a different perspective!Tip: get an Opal card to save on fares, and be aware that the ocean can get a little choppy as you get out past Middle and South Head.

Great view of the Ophra House. Taking the ferry gives you a great view of the Ophra House from the water. We passed under the brigde as well which was also a nice view. Easy and quick way to get around.

Great way to travel. Easy way to travel to main tourist attractions like the zoo, circular quay, darling harbour and the casino. We used the weekend family fun pass and the kids loved travelling right on the front of the ferry.

So handy . Get off the plane out of the bus ot car and get an opus card and travel everywhere with Sydney public transport. We traveled on the ferries to Birkenhead outlet stores and milsons point. Beautiful harbour

Balmoral Boathouse for lunch at Balmoral Beach. We caught a ferry from Terminal 2 at Circular Quay to Taronga Park Zoo and got the bus to Balmoral Beach - fabulous. Cheapest way to get on the harbour!

Great Experience. Caught the ferry over to Manly from Circular Quay, really easy to wonder up to the booth and buy a return ticket (as long as you return on the same day) the journey of took 30 minutes and gave great views of the harbour, Opera House & Harbour Bridge.Wandered into Manly, had a beer at 4 pines brewery and walked around the bay to Shelley Beach which was an awesome walk!

To be enjoyed . This harbour like nanny others around tge world houses it's own ferries and river taxis. Cheap enough to go one and just enjoy the sight seeing or as a means of transport to get between areas. Please note while they run to a timetable this can often have problems caused by other harbour traffic. Drinks are available once on board as is the chance to enjoy a Local guide poi ting out all the landmarks you pass or Sydney gsrbour bridge the harbour gardens the opera house the local zoo towards the end of the ferry route and various other places if interest. Have your camera gang as many photos can be taken on these ferries with snakes from both coming and going and then the choice to pick out the best.

A different view of the Bridge and Opera House.. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay, using our Opal cards. They run frequently and it is quite inexpensive - a lovely way to see Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. The 555 free shuttle stops at Circular Quay - very convenient.

Fast ferry to Manly. Stuck for something to do on a beautiful spring day there is always the fast ferry to Manly. For only $8:50 you can be at Manly in under 15 minutes with no traffic worries and the best views in the world
nice harbor tour. easy to use and regular service, very close to Four Seasons hotel, great tour around the harbor, hop on and off as you like

A great way to see the city. I took the ferries to get to Manly and Taronga. I think they're a great way to see the city from a different perspective!Tip: get an Opal card to save on fares, and be aware that the ocean can get a little choppy as you get out past Middle and South Head.

Great view of the Ophra House. Taking the ferry gives you a great view of the Ophra House from the water. We passed under the brigde as well which was also a nice view. Easy and quick way to get around.

Great way to travel. Easy way to travel to main tourist attractions like the zoo, circular quay, darling harbour and the casino. We used the weekend family fun pass and the kids loved travelling right on the front of the ferry.
Annual ritual. It's a yearly ritual to take the Ferry from Circular Quay over to manly and have fish and chips followed by a gelato. Always good.

Ferry cruise Parramatta River, Olympic Park, train to Sydney.. Cruise from Circular Quay on the river cat to Olympic Whalf. The 50 minute relaxed cruise gives a broader perspective of Sydney along this important waterway. Leave the ferry at Olympic wharf and catch the 526 bus from the wharf to Strathfield Station. The bus travels through Newington which was the Olympic Village, through the Olympic precinct, passes the large Discount Franchise Outlet Complex before reaching Strathfield where trains can be caught to the city or western suburbs.

Enjoyed the ride. I used the ferries on a Sunday, and found out that if you travel with a child, all tickets are $2.50 which you can use all day. It was great. The ferry was really clean, and luckily the seas were quite smooth, so it was a great trip. It was worth it just for the view of the bridge and opera house.
Great Sunday Value. $2.50 weekend ticket was a great (& unexpected) deal!Ferries were punctual and clean. We even had a staff member take a group photo of us .. a lovely gesture!
Easy trav. The ferries are a great and easy way to get around. We used them lots of times. They go to all the places you may want to visit and are cheaper than taxis.
Waste an Afternoon on the Ferry. Simply the best way to Sydney Harbor and surrounding attractions. Its cheaper and you will feel like a local,

Take the Watson Bay trip.... Sydney Ferries can be fickle and on popular trips you may have to queue and wait. We had such an incident in beautiful sunny Sunday arvo. It was busy and ferries came and went, while the crowds continued to grow. Luckily the Transit Authority took action and brought in another ferry. Luckily it was beautiful journey, abs it all ended well. It probably goes without saying that the best way to see the harbour .... is to be on it !

Travelling on the Sydney Ferries, not to be missed.. I had a couple of hours to spare before catching up with friends and being a very hot day, decided to do several ferry trips to and from Circular Quay. It was a delightful way to while away the time looking out at the Harbour, the Opera House and, of course. the Bridge.

Sydney Ferries. what a lovely way to see Sydney from the water! we discovered the ferries when we first went to Manley and after that just jumped on to discover the different locations. Its best to let the morning 'rush' finish and most have got to work, after that they have room to walk around, each of the trips we took were less than 1 hour

A leisure way to tour sydney. Taking the ferries is a good way to tour Sydney, ie. if you are not in a hurry. Most of the ferries start at Circular Quay. I like the one going down the Parramatta River (the F3). Costs only a few dollars but great enjoyment. Nice scenery. it's better than a cruise cause they are seldom crowded. From Parramatta you can take the train back to city.
One of my favourite things to do. Love coming home to Sydney and going around the harbour seeing the bridge and the Oprah house and it's reasonable price for the trip

Afternoon on the Harbour!. I hadn't had a ferry ride in ages....had lunch in Darling Harbour...and thought...well why not take a ferry ride on such a beautiful day our harbour was just glorious looking and the ferry ride was very pleasant...

A great mode of transport with fun. Well, I have taken few ferries in different directions and it just a different experience. A great way to commute with a feel of sea and water. One must enjoy this.

Sydney Ferries the cheaper harbour cruise. Sydney Ferries the cheaper harbour cruise, I always catch a Sydney Ferries to Manly, to get Fish and Chips, it is a relaxing way to see the harbour at a cheaper price, than a harbour cruise. Even a short trip to Darling Harbour to Circular Quay will take you under the Harbour Bridge.

Best way to see Sydney Harbour. Whether it is the longer ferry ride to Manly, where you can walk through the pedestrian plaza from the ferry terminal to the ocean beach, or shorter rides to many locations, it is just a beautiful experience. The ferry terminal at Circular Quay is right in the city, so every ferry going out from there gives you a fantastic view of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Well worth it.

Sydney Ferries....the best way to see Sydney Harbour. The Sydney Ferry service is an excellent and cheap way to see the harbour. They are safe and clean and have plied their trade upon the Sydney waterways for decades boasting an exceptionally good safety record.

Ferry to Manly. Sydney Harbour has got to be the cleanest harbour in the world.
