I've been travelling to Manly on the Ferry for fifty years and still not sick of the sights, the Opera House.Botanic Gardens,other boats and the capitalists living in their their million dollar houses over looking the harbour. View is even better at night with all lights from boats and residents.The water is so clean sometimes I'm tempted to dive in but would probably become shark bait. They have WiFi, it's a bit slow but most of the time it works. By the time I get to Manly I'm so relaxed I don't wont to get off and sometimes stay on for the return trip. They have other ferries as well to go to different places on the harbour like the zoo, but the best is the trip to Manly. Take the kids they'll enjoy it too especially on a rough day when they'll be sharing their breakfast or lunch with you. Dont worry they can fill up again once they get to Manly, Look Mummy there's Maccas! I feel better now. Enjoy it I do.

Best mode of transport. If you can get to the wharf easily, by all means, take the ferry. More importantly, during peak hour traffic, this is the best mode of transport. It can get you from the suburbs to the city in no time.

Beautiful cruise but cheaper. One of the nicest ways to explore Sydney Harbour. If only having a limited time, take the ferry between circular quay and Manly but make sure you sit on upper deck at the back when you leave circular quay. You will enjoy the view longer ;-)

Best day trip to Manly. The iconic Manly ferries are the best and cheapest way to see the sites of Sydney. From Circular Quay railway station it's a 1 minute walk to wharf 3 to catch a ferry to Manly. Cost is around $7 for adults each way but if you have a seniors card its part of the $2.50 fare. After leaving on the left you get an idea of the size of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and on the right you pass close to the Sydney Opera House. Several small beaches and an historic jail nicknamed Pinchgut are also passed before crossing The Heads, a gap between two cliffs that welcomes ships to Sydney Harbour. Finally Manly is reached which has a Corso of shops leading to Sydney's famous beach. There are plenty of restaurants and three hotels fir all levels of dining. There is also an Aquarium to your left as you leave the wharf. Overall the best day out !!!

An economical way to see Sydney harbor and wonderful mode of transportation. Our favorite mode of transportation in Sydney, we actually took several round trips just to hang out and see the view of Sydney harbor. You do not need to buy ticket ahead of time from home. Buy them there from the convenient store, shop. Load up the amount of money and it auto deducted for all transportation. You do not need to spend on a Sydney harbor tour, this is just as good, especially during slow time when the ferries aren't packed
For all overseas visitors. Everyone visiting Sydney must take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. A beautiful way to see our beautiful harbour. Then a 10 minute walk to Manly beach.

The best way to get around Sydney!. Excellent and relatively cheap way to get around. I took a ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour at sunset - fab!! Also a daytime trip Circular Quay to Watson bay - very scenic! Wherever you go I think this is the best way to get there if you enjoy water travel. Good service and timing information at Circular Quay - very easy for tourists to find out where and how to go.

Pensioners and Seniors - organise your ticket before you go to Sydney.. My hubby and I are both seniors and a $2.50 paper ticket gave us train, light rail, bus and ferry transport for a full day. Brilliant. The "Opal" ticketing system is terrific BUT be advised, if you're a senior and want an Opal (plastic) ticket, you have to log on to their website and register your seniors card number. It will take approximately two weeks to receive your card.The ferry - in fact all of the public transport - is a fabulous way to see Sydney.

IF YOU LIKE THE WATER THIS IS THE WAY TO GO. My wife and I enjoy our regular holiday from WA to Sydney to avail ourselves of the many ferry journeys that are available from Circular Quay. On sunny days or even inclement days you can go to Circular Quay and travel to the many destinations that the ferries go to and return.

Value cruise. It's a cheap and easy way to have a scenic cruise at the cove of Sydney. It will be really helpful and awesome to include a recorded or live broadcasting to describe the popular scenery and landmarks along the cruise to enlighten the tourists on board.

Sydney Harbour. we normaly take the kids on the ferry around the magnificent sydney harbour on sunday where you can have $2.50 ticket per person all day for bus, train and ferry in greater sydney. the longest queue is the one for Manly ferry very long during summer weekends. but overall a great experience
An essential part of your Sydney experience. I have used Sydney Ferries many times. You can access all the famous Sydney sites from a ferry and it is quite economical for families and couples.
Great way to get around Sydney Harbor. Take as many ferry rides on Sundays with Opal card for $2.50. It's a great way to see Manly and Cockatoo Island and other locations. Highly recommended.
Cheap Sightseeing. Buy a cheap ticket and ride all day. Great way to see the sites and get some pictures of the harbour.

great way to see the sights of Sydney. We bought a MyMulti3 week pass for our stay in Sydney. Used bus, train and ferries to get around and found all reliable, clean and manned by friendly & helpful drivers/crew. Took the ferry to Manly & the loop from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour. Best way to see the Opera House, bridge & cityscape.

Don't miss. From the iconic huge green and yellow Manley ferry to the little ones that buzz over to Mossman and Kirribilli, take a ride! It's a great way to see the harbor, get some sun and relax for a couple minutes.

easy to use and staff very friendly. This has to be one of the most economical ways to enjoy the amazing sights that make Sydney Harbour so famous. Easy to navigate and the staff are all very helpful.

Great way to see sydney harbour. Why pay to see sydney harbour when you can just pay for a ferry and get a trip around the harbour. We went to Manly by ferry which was reasonable at $15 each return. Manly is a great place to visit but it is also the furthest so you really get to see all the harbour via boat. Caught a late boat back and took a nice piccie of the bridge with the sunset

using the ferries. Great cheap way to see Sydney. The best way to get about and have stunning views .easy access for disabled .friendly staff. .we bought opal cards from newsagents and topped them up as needed .no need for cash
Worth every cent. I love the ferries, a thrilling ride thats a bang on your buck for the real sea experience (not recommended for those who are sea sick!)
Reliable method of traveling. Sydney Ferry system is very reliable. We rode the ferry on 4 different occasions and experience 3 different style of seacraft. Very inexpensive method of transportation.

great way to see the harbour. hop on hop off day pass on sydney ferries allowed us to sit back and relax 20 minutes from darling harbour to circular quay walk to The Rocks have breakfast then 30 minute ferry ride to Manly for the afternoon have lunch visit the beach, shops and take in the atmosphere on a busy sunday afternoon . Cost effective way to see the sights of Sydney Harbour and beyond.

Transport. My fiance Michael and I had enjoyed travelling around the harbour on Sunday. What a lovely way to see your wonderful city. Can't wait to come back so we can see more!!! Loved it. Coming back at night was just amazing. Best trip ever

Beautiful Winter day on the harbour. I love the ferry service. Have lived in Sydney all my life. Decided to walk from The Domain car park, through the magnificent Botanic gardens along the sea wall to The Opera House. Then after viewing the iconic Harbour Bridge we jumped on a ferry and went to East Balmain and walked to Birchgrove. Had a lovely lunch in a cafe nearby then reversed the trip. Beautiful whole day out taking in the sights. $2.50 for the ferry trip with the Opal Card and no queueing for tickets.

The best way to see Sydney Harbour at a low cost. When visiting Sydney just hop on and hop off one of the ferry services which criss-cross the harbour.Taking the Manly Ferry (the slow one) is a classic! But taking a trip from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour will give you a view of the Sydney Harbour Bridge from the underneath. And if there's a train crossing then you will be surprised at the noise.Food (drinks & snacks) is only available on the Manly Ferry.
on time, best way to get around. Cheap and efficient way of getting around Sydney and very reliable.Boats are clean and great views, particularly at night..

Another "must do" activity while in Sydney. Fun to do. A half hour trip to Manly. Good price and a great opportunity to visit Manly, whilst seeing the Harbour at it's best. Great photo opportunities on the way back of the Bridge and Opera House. Manly was a lovely place.

Summer Vacation 2015. On our recent visit to Sydney we took a ride on the Sydney Ferry from Circular Quay to Many Wharf and back. The views of the harbor and the Sydney Opera House were fantastic. The best location for a great view of the Opera House is at the back of the ferry on the left side when leaving the harbor and at the very front on the way back. Make sure to bring a jacket for the way back because the wind kicks a good chill in July.
Love it. During my stay in Sydney I used ferries a lot. They very tidy, safe, frendly staff. Always on time. Best way to explore the sydney.
Ideal transport. Ideal transport to get you around Sydney from Circular Quay to other areas such and Taronga Zoo, Watsons Bay,

Don't Make Waves. I hear people complaining about our public transport and every time I travel on it I find myself asking what are these people on about. Nearly every fortnight I take a trip of some description on Sydney public transport usually I start by bus from home and then the Rivercat from Parramatta (alternatively the train) to King St or Circular Quay and then onward by ferry to Manly or Watsons Bay. All the services are usually on time and well patronized though in off peak there is usually less competition for the seats and very rarely does one have to stand. I do find that some people are very competitive for position on boarding b it a ferry ,bus or train and have no consideration for elderly or incapacitated passengers. The staff are always friendly and informative if one has a question about the service or a connection . Our public transport in NSW covers a wide area and travelling to it's extremities is a fulfilling journey in comfortable airconditioned environment, except for those ghastly Oscar Trains to Wyong and Kiama which are just uncorftable seating for such a long journey but new trains to replace the interurban fleet are on their way so all is looking good. Get out there and take a trip especially on these sunny spring days you'll see so much more of our great city and surrounds and if you travel on a Sunday all the family can go for just $2.50 per head. Enjoy it John B
Great service. Very convient, very clean and very reliable. You can't visit Sydney without taking the ferry. We enjoyed every stop and scenery along the was. A relaxing and wonderful experience.

Great cheap way to see the harbour. Sydney Ferries are not only a great way to get around Sydney harbour side suburbs but also a site seeing tour in it self. They are clean, safe and cost effective. The Manly Ferry is a particularly good trip to take as it covers a long distance and you also have a chance to explore Manly as well. You can also take a ferry to Taronga Park Zoo. Don't miss this mode of transport.

Best way to travel. It was one of those glorious late winter days. Bright sunshine; blue sky. The best time to take the ferry to Watson's Bay and take the walk around to Camp Cove.So easy to use. Mostly on time.I would use ferries all the time if my commute permitted.

No visitors' trip to Sydney is complete without at least one trip on a Harbour Ferry. Providing locals with transport around the Harbour and related waterways, the Ferry Service is a great way for visitors to travel to the many attractions around the Harbour, including Manly, Tooronga Zoo, Darling Harbour, Luna Park, Double Bay and Watsons Bay, to name but a few. The range of ferries providing the services adds to the interest and experience when travelling on a speedy catamaran service or aboard a slower, historical ferry that has serviced the public on the harbour for many years. All services converge on accessible Circular Quay at the northern end of the CBD and beside the historical Rocks area. Riding the very reasonably priced ferries is a great way to experience tye splendour if the Harbour and its environment. Highly recommended !
Fun way to see the sights. A really great and inexpensive way to view Sydney Harbor. The ferries run frequently and on time and there are a variety of great destinations to visit by ferry.
The ferry run to time. Use the Sydney ferries often when in Sydney. These days they always seem to run to time and that is great. We'll done guys

just to be on the water. we needed to get across the harbour to the manly hotel for a meal so of course we chose the Sydney ferry. the ferry was on time, the vessel was clean and the staff were very helpful. the viewing areas were a bit small and thus quite crowded but if you looked you could find somewhere close to the edge to lean on a rail and gaze out into the harbour. of course the pod of dolphins seem to arrive on queue to really make the trip a highlight. the scheduling was just right as we were able to grab a lovely meal at the pub and catch another ferry back to Circular Quay. I think the old green ferries are a real bonus for the tourist industry and I hope they are around for some time yet.
Relaxed pace cruise. Great way to travel if you can not use Bus, Train or Taxi.... or just want to go at a slow pace on the water and site seeing.
Fantastic - Transport and Sightseeing in One!!. As far as transport goes this would have to be the most exhilarating. For a small fee you get a tour of the Sydney Harbour and other magnificent views
Great way to "cruise" around Sydney. Best way to get around town. No point renting a car when the ferries, trains and buses are on time, cheap and convenient!

Good value and great for sightseeing. Had many trips on the ferry and with the Opal card I certainly got good value. $2.50 to travel to Parramatta and back to Circular Quay, what a nice way to spend a Sunday morning.

A way to relax and enjoy great views. Not only a means of transport, but also a way to relax and enjoy a cup of coffee while passing through the beautiful surroundings.Have eight ferry rides on Opal transport card within a week, and rest of your ferry travels are free in that week.
An absolute must. It would be a real miss not to see Sydney from the water - skyline, bridge, Opera House. I suggest a trip to the lovely sesside town of Manly.

Best way to appreciate Sydney's fantastic views. The ferries are used by commuters and tourists alike. They are affordable, clean and regular. We took the ferry from Circular Quay out to Manly, which provided great views. We also took a ferry from Circular Quay around to Darling Harbour. You could walk the latter one, but it's great to go under the Harbour Bridge and enjoy the sights. Darling Harbour has great restaurants and night life. Riding the ferry is a better way to view Sydney than the Sydney Eye Tower.

The best way to see Sydney Harbour. Sydney Ferries are a comfortable and low cost way of fully appreciating the beauty of Sydney Harbour. This city is magnificent from the water!! Check out the special deal on Sundays when you can ride around all day for $2.50(??). Circular Quay to Manly is a must.

On the harbour. Spur of the moment ferry ride to Manly! Because of the beautiful weather, numbers for the ferry were quite high, so it was difficult to secure a seat outside on the ferry to enjoy the Sydney harbour. Be careful not to be the victim of sea spray from the ferry, as some of the passengers were drenched enjoying the outside seating!

Fun way to travel. I really enjoy using Sydney public transportation...so easy with the opal card. But the ferries are the most fun. I have taken ferries to Manly, the zoo, and to Cockatoo Island. Great way to sightsee. If you are going to Sydney and don't yet know about the opal card, read up now. It is a must for all Sydney travelers looking to see a lot and save money. The weekend train fares are the best!
always friendly and helpful staff - enjoyable trips. good service by staff - friendly and helpful. great trips on the harbour. staff willing to give tourist info to overseas visitors.

Enjoy beautiful Sydney Harbour. Fun way to see beautiful Sydney. I love catching ferries as it is a great way to see different parts of Sydney and you get a great view of key attractions, including the Harbour Bridge Opera House. Robyn

Circular Quay to Manly - classic viewing. Take the regular commuter ferry from Circular Quay to Manly for a magical (and economical) view of magnificent Sydney Harbour. At Manly, walk along the Corso to the ocean front. Enjoy fish and chips, followed by ice cream. If you go on a Sunday there are market stalls to browse.Then return to Circular Quay by ferry. If you're energetic, you can return by walking the 10km Harbourside walk from Manly to the Spit, then hop on a bus to return to the city centre.

So easy to use. By buying an opal card upon arrival in Sydney I managed to save myself a lot of money in travel as there is a cap of $15 on a Saturday and about $2-$3 on a Sunday. The ferries are very easy to use with large boards displaying where they are going and what times the ferries depart.n

The best way to see the harbour . A cost effective and relaxing way to see the harbour. The ferry trip to the zoo is a must, but there's also Watson's Bay and Milsons Point (Luna Park) which are perfect visits for tourists. The ferries now have free wifi which is handy and you get an amazing view of the bridge and opera house on the way in to circular quay. If you're lucky you might even spot some dolphins in he harbour.

Watson's Bay trip. Went across to Watson's Bay on the Ferry and walked up the path to look out over the head's. Then had fish & chips in the Wharf kiosk looking out over the bay and watching the rain and fog come down over Sydney.

The Best Way To See Sydney Harbour!. There is simply no better way to enjoy Sydney Harbour, particularly if it is a sunny day. My recommendation is the jump on a ferry at Circular Quay and head out to Watsons Bay. Be sure to sit at the back of the Ferry to enjoy the fresh air and light sea spray which is always welcome on the hotter days. Grab some fish and chips at Watsons Bay, eat them on the beach or in the park, and be sure to visit The Gap as well when you walk off lunch! Then jump back onto a Ferry to Circular Quay. What a great day!

No traffic jams and fresh sea air. Have you ever been dreaming to become a sailor in your childhood? If yes than you have to take a ferry. Travelling on Sydney ferries is one of the best and most affordable experiences in Sydney. You don't even need to buy a harbour cruise - just load your opal card and choose destination and voilà you are a sailor - well almost. Each time I take a ferry I feel like beginning a new story - especially when you are returning home from Circular Quay leaving all the stress of a big city behind you....
Manly ferry. I had not been on a ferry and we had a smooth ride over and more like a roller coaster on the way back. I loved it. It was great.

Quick trips across the Harbour. We used the Opal Cards to ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour and Luna Park. Kids enjoyed the mostly calm trip across the harbour and marvelled at the size of the Harbour Bridge.

Always reliable. Always reliable and now seem to have gotten quicker. I tool the fast ferry to Doyles in Watsons Bay and the trip is now less than 20 minutes. Makes the lunch ourting there even better.

Alternative view of the city. One of the top ways to get around, if you haven't tried the Sydney ferries then you have missed out on a different view of this great place and if you have tried it try it at night for a spectacular alternative.

The cheapest way of seeing beautiful Sydney Harbour.. Take a ferry from Circular Quay to all over Sydney Harbour, Manly for the beach, Watson's Bay for fish and a beer at Doyles Restaurant, Taronga Park for the Zoo and the River Cat to Parramatta. Prices are reasonable and even better if the are a Senior just $2.50 all day.

Sydney harbour morning tea cruise. The bay behaved beautifully the day I went on a tour of the harbour. the staff on the ferry were welcoming and the commentary was very interesting. All in all a lovely couple of hours.
Punctual. Used the ferries frequently on our recent trip - easy to use, run on time and lots of handy wharves.

Ride all day for $2.50 with the Opal card on Sundays. For visitors wanting a cheap day riding the ferrys - the opal card maximum charge on Sundays is just $2.50. That means you can ride all day on all transport and never be charged more than this specific amount. Ferry to Bondi, Manly, Mosmon - it's all fantastic. The ferries run on time and it's so much fun. The kids love it too!

Ideal for travel and site seeing. Whether it be simply getting from point a to b, or wanting to take in the breath taking sites of sydney harbour, this is one of the best ways to kick back and enjoy. Ferries run regularly and are well priced.
Great service. Excellent. Great service! On the harbour. Good prices. A must do for any trip to Sydney. Would thoroughly recommend.
Great value!. A great way to get around especially on a Sunday when families are charges at just $2.50 each! On time and easy to use.
Don't miss this in Sydney. Iconic Sydney ferries, so much history and so much to see when you get on board. I recommend the ferry to Manly, which is also well worth a visit.
Best trip. The Ferry to Manly lets you enjoy the bay of Sydney -- the price of public transportation! At deck, best you stand at the right side in front. You feel the sea!
super effecient. We were on a bicycle tour and grabbed a ferry coming back across the harbor. It was really easy to board with the bikes. Very quick and easy trip across the harbor.
A great ride. The ferries are clean and tidy and easy to board for handicapped people. We were intrigued with the swiftness of the loading of passengers and the general professional service.
Good way to travel. We found them to be on time and an easy way to get across to Taronga Zoo. Plenty of seating area (but then again we didn't use them at peak times).

Great way to travel!. The ferries are very reasonably priced and are an easy way to get around the city. They were always on time. Much better than a subway. We took the ferry from Darling Harbour to the Circular Quay and then on to the Zoo. You get a lovely view of the islands and the Harbour this way. Be sure to ride a ferry at least once while you're here.

Enjoyable. Took a ferry from Circular Quay to Paramatta and enjoyed so much along the way. It was in the late afternoon and we could see beautiful sunset lowering down to the river. It was worth an hour to Paramatta when you could be away from the crowd for a little while.

Great way to get a water view. Sydney is well known for its passenger ferry system. This is a vital part of the transportation system for the city with commuters, students, families, and tourists enjoying boat rides between points all around the harbor. I took the ferry out to Manly, a beach town on the ocean near the entrance to Sydney harbor. Leaving the central quay, we had great views of the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House, the downtown skyline, and the Botanical Gardens. Manly is a busy beach town with restaurants, shops and surfers. Other ferries will take you to the zoo, Darling Harbour, or other points. Riding the ferries is a great way to experience Sydney.(Tip: The OPAL card used for train rides can also be used on the ferry.)
Schmpangela. Ferries very convenient to travel on. Very easy for people with prams bikes etc. I like that they are very punctual when departing
Great harbour views. They were always on time, our guests enjoyed the travel on ferry to several destinations allowing them great harbour views
Best way to see Sydney.. We travelled from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay, very enjoyable trip just relaxing and watching other passengers and beautiful scenery.
Brilliant trip with excellent views. Excellent way to vistit the islands around Sydney. Excellent view of bridge and Opera House on the way out of the harbour.
The only way to travel. Brilliant way to get around. The staff are really helpful. The photo opportunities were twofold. Really resonable price.

A working ferry service. They get you where you need to go and they are quite reasonably priced. There isn't much else to say really. If you haven't been on a ferry before they might "make your day" but otherwise, there's no bells and whistles here (Well maybe there is when you're boarding).

Best possible view of Sydney. I have used Sydney Ferry to reach Manly beach.. Pretty good view of Opera house and bridge..Also, we have been to Zoo by Ferry.. The best possible way to reach Zoo and Many beach..
Well run ferry system. Well run ferry system - the ferry to Manly goes right by the Opera House giving great opportunities for photos of it and Sydney Harbour Bridge

Best Way to See Sydney. We had an hour and a half to kill before meeting friends for lunch and so did a trip to 'nowhere' and got on a ferry to Mosman Bay. There's no better way to see Sydney than from the water, so it was time well spent - and our friends were astonished how much we'd done in a short space of time!

Harbour Cruise. The best way to "Cruise on the Harbour." Use the ferries. We did a Trip to Manly which gave us a nice tour of the Harbour as well as a tour of Manly. Had great fish and chips lunch there. Another Cruise was to Parramatta. A great tour of the suburbs on the ferry..

Stunning. Simple. Cheap. My kind of adventure! . Cheapest way to see the harbour, bridge and opera house is to take a commuter ferry. Grab an Opal card and you can do unlimited bus train and ferry trips for $15 a day. Any of the ferry rides will give you great views. The darling harbour ferry will take you under the bridge or the manly ferry will take you past the heads and over to the north of the harbour. Stunning. Simple. Cheap. My kind of adventure!
tourists. Sydney ferries are a fast and convenient way of getting around many places, with regular services to many great tourist attractions
love the ferries. always on time great views cheap and clean .... love them will always use them weekly ticket is the cheapest

Simply the best. Whether you're exploring the coastal suburbs, taking a trip to the zoo, or heading for one of the many beaches, going by ferry is simply the best way to travel around Sydney. Ferries are punctual, clean, quick, and the staff are courteous and efficient. Sitting up-front outside as the ferry approaches Circular Quay, with stunning views of the harbour bridge, opera house and downtown skyscrapers, is always memorable.

Feel like traveler. Good way to see the harbour.. I live Northshore of Sydney and usually driving to everywhere. I sometimes park the car at Greenwich wharf and catch ferry to go to city. I always think what a great city I live in every time I catch ferry. Only one negative point is buying ticket at Circular Quay. The vending machine is still confuse me.
Ferries. Great service and always on time.Buy weekly tickets as they are better value than paying as you go along. Speedy efficient and extremely clean..

Adventoure is on the way. Either a trip to the heart of sydney or just enjoying the ride from port to port, ferry service is an great choice, smoothly sailing in the harbour just washed away your wearyness and prepared you for another adventure in other location.
Dr Gonzo. I tried to use the ferry from Rydalmere to the City this week. Only to find they were replaced with busses.

Ferries Galore. Spent 2 days just jumping on and off Ferries out of circular quay using the Opal Card; did Watson Bay, did Manly, did Parramatta, what a fantastic way to see Sydney. Each location spent a few hours walking around getting to see sights. Loved South Heads and the coastal walk cliff path to The Gap

Manly ferrie was great!. Good experience! $15 return ticket to Manly.
Good way for transportation and to see the bridge and the opera house from the water. Great way to kill a lazy afternoon and go to the zoo or Manly for coffee and an icecream.

Easy Sight Seeing!. The ferries are such a fun way to get around. Nothing like that where we live! The view of the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House are great from the water, too. A sunny, warm day would be perfect, but even the cloudy misty days were fun to see the sights!
Take the ferry!. The Sydney harbour ferries are frequent, clean, and reliable. Friendly staff are helpful and mostly cheerful. A cost-effective method of travel.

Efficient public transportation systems. Well the ferry looks bit "out of date" like something built in 70s but the fact is it is very efficient, on time, and fun. I think catching ferry should catalog into one of the "must do" activities in Sydney. You will have a deeper understanding how much benefits water brings to this city.

What else would you want. You can not beat being on the water in Sydney Harbour on a beautiful day and this is an affordable way to do it.You can purchase tickets at Circular Quay or use an Opal card. We walked from the newly opened Barrangaroo Reserve to Circular Quay where we boarded a ferry to Darling Harbour.We didn't have a lot of time so this short trip suited us fine. It had 3 stops on the way but we wanted to see Barrangaroo from the water which didn't disappoint.

Zoom zoom. It is such a pleasure taking the ferry from Balmain to Circular Quay. You zoom along, no traffic, no worries in the world, in an aging but solid boat in the best harbour in the world. I liked seeing Barrangaroo Park for the first time from this ferry trip.
Ferries. nothing to dislike at all excellent service all the staff were very friendly and helpful all the ferries kept really clean helped us see more of Sydney

Sydney Ferries and the public traffic with buses. The Ferries and the public buses are on time.Please use the App "TripView Lite" It was not easy to receive a card for a week - this yellow card for $ 56,00 Sydney offers until 31. Dec. 2015. Then you have to buy the Opal-Card (now you can buy it). Everybody gives different informations, even the information point was not updated..
Great fun. These really are the best fun way to visit around Sydney. Good value as well. The staff are helpful too.
A MUST for all visitors.. Definitely a must whether you are a first time visitor or not but remember to check the rates especially if you use the Opal cards.Safe and reasonably priced tours .

Great value way of doing a harbour tour if you are travelling around the water anyway.. Very helpful staff at Darling Harbour helped us obtain best value ticket for our trip to Watsons Bay. Also helped us when machine gave us the wrong change. Pick a slow ferry if you want to see all around the harbour or a direct one if in a hurry.

Awesome!. I had heard that the ferry system in Sydney is extremely good and it really was! As two people who had no idea what we were doing it was super easy to find, buy tickets and get around. Not to mention the view when you are out on the harbour!
transport. all ferries arrive and leave from Circular Quay which is great central meeting point. easy to get tickets

Most helpful staff ...great experience. The staff was so helpful and efficient. One told us that we did t have enough time to make it to the Zoo so we did the opera house instead . They are all very friendly. The ferry ran on time, the waiting area was clean, get the best view of the harbour on the upper deck .

Excellent way to travel. I love Sydney and I particularly love travelling on the ferries. What better way to see the magnificent harbour than from the water! I have found the ferries to be reliable, comfortable and reasonably priced. There seems to be a ferry to wherever you want to go! Well worth it!

Great way to see the bays. Awesome day out, grab an Opal card travel around the bays at your leisure. Pack up the kids and head out, 15mins to Rose Bay, 30mins to Watsons Bay, look around the Bay then pick up the next ferry back or onto the next bay.

Captain Cruise: Hop on hop off ticket. i bought Hop on hop off ticket and retuning cruise to talonga zoo, and manly beach. So reasonable price. The view from the ferry in sunset to evening time was stunning.

Great (and cheap) way to see the harbour. On my first visit to Sydney, I took some friendly advice and bought a Opal mass transit card and took the Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. As a tip, this trip is capped and very affordable if you just want to take a boat ride to see the harbour, Opera House, etc.The ferries had basic facilities on board (you can buy coffee and sandwiches) and were really more geared towards people movers. Nonetheless, it was a nice trip out to Manly with the "real people of Sydney" (opposed to with out tourists).Really, you can't go wrong and I'd probably carve out a couple of hours on my next visit to make the trip again.

Great Way to get around. My fondest memories are taking the Sydney Ferries around. A different way of getting around and s different view of the city. I frequented the ferries from Circular Quay to the Zoo a fair bit and cannot recommend enough.

Beautiful way to relax while sightseeing. A great way to see the Bridge and Harbor in detail is to go boating or take a ferry ride in Sydney! You can relax while you see a magnificent landscape of human activity. Definitely worth it!

excellent way to see the harbour on the cheap. For those having limited budget, this is a alternate way to see the harbour, chooseferry from circular Quay to the Zoo and spend the day, another day choose Manlyand spend the day .Try to take the ferry after 9.30am so that the ferry is not fullof commuters to work ,when you are on the ferry look towards the Opera Houseand click your camera ,and enjoy the view on a sunny day. get a ferry times. Anotherinteresting journey from circular Quay take a ferry to a place called Parramatta which is the last stop the journey goes along the parramatta river the journey is 1 1/2 hrs you will gauge how this city has expanded over the years, at parramattathere are very good cafes and eating places to have lunch and return back to the city.

Cheapest and best all day ferry ride on the planet. On any Sunday you can ride public transport in Sydney for $2.50 if you purchase an Opal Card at most newsagents. We started at the Rose Bay warf took the ferry to Circular Quay and then got onto the Manly ferry total time about 1hour to get to Manly on a beautiful sunny day, seas calm, the view on the harbour magnificent. Got off at Manly at 12noon walked to the end of the mall just before reaching Manly Beach and listened to an outstanding young singer ( busker) for 30 until she finished at 1pm. Ventured to some of the streets off the main area and found many cafes at more affordable prices. After lunch walked to Shelly Beach and returned to the warf at 3 for the return to Circular uay and back to Rose Bay. In summer take your swimmers and towel for a swim at either Manly or Shelly Beach.If you are in Sydney for a short time I would also recomend the Ferry Cat to Parramatta and return as well about 1.5hours to add on to the day.

Excellent ferry service.. The Sydney ferries are fantastic. Reasonable pricing, punctual as can be, and they go to all the places a tourist might want to visit. We were really impressed. Seating options vary by the type of ferry, but they are all comfortable, indoors or out. The trip to Watsons Bay from the Circular Quay was very quick and very smooth, with lots of great scenery.
Ferries for views and convenience. The ferries offer a great way to get Round Sydney Harbour. They offered a Sunday funday special with unlimited travel for $2.50

Fabulous views everywhere you look at you journey to your destination. I cannot imagine a more picturesque setting or gob-smacking views than those provided from the deck of a sydney ferry. They are clean, roomy and a great way to explore Sydney Harbour and proximities

Great views, awesome breeze, zen moments.. Its awesome to just take the ferries from one stop to the other, enjoying the brilliant harbour views. Ferries from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour or vice versa are perfect as you get the chance to go under the breathtaking harbour bridge..
My favorite mode of travel.. Comfortable mode of transport. Take the outside seat on a sunny weather. The frequency is less on weekends. During some festivals, there are extra ferries.

Reliable and Quick. Not often do you have a mode of transportation which can double as a great sight seeing tour. The great vistas from the Sydney Bay provide many opportunities to soak in the majestic landscape. And it happens as you are simply getting from one destination to another. The ferries are very reliable and timely. It is wise to get an Opal card, and travel on off peak hours if you can. The cost is very reasonable. In addition, as the ferries main port is Circular Quay, you can use the Opal card to travel on the city train as well. It allows you to go a variety of places with ease. Do remember to "top up" if your card is getting low.

A unique way to travel. Not too many cities where ferry is a viable option. Some places in Sydney it is the fastest and easiest way to travel as well. The ferries go to Manly, Taronga, inland to Parramatta, and so many additional places. Sydney Ferries do accept Opal Cards.

Dog in a bag. I just took my labradoodle puppy on the ferry. He was contained in a bag and when i asked the captain, he said not a problem. So impressed. And so convenient as i needed to drop my 10yr old off to kirribilli to get his school bus. Thank you sydney ferries

Budget view of Sydney by boat.. For people travel on budget you can take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. On the way you can view the Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House from different angle. In Manly you can visit the Manly Beach not the best by one of the best I have seen. A must try is the Fish n Chips Shop near the beach. Manly is more to local you must go if you love the seaside and fish n chips.

Fantastic Ferries. The Sydney ferries are a great way to see the harbour while getting to local attractions.Get a opal card and place $15 for a day for Adults to all public transport,Cards are free and available at circular quay

What a water blast!. This is the way to see the harbour, it's cheap, easy and so much fun. I would recommend this to any tourist - don't bother with planned excursions - these ferries take you anywhere and everywhere on the water. They are also good fun!

Easy to use!. We used the Sydney Ferries several times during our stay in the city.Easy to use and easy to buy tickets from the machines with cash or card.They were always pretty much on time to the minute, friendly staff and a smooth sailing.Would definitely use this service again, a must to see some parts of the area you may not really bother with otherwise.
It's a ferry. It's a ferry...nice views...convenient travel...as expected. It's cheap transportation. Good for pics.
Ferrys.. There are many ferry companys,all great to get around and see the sights to many of sydneys attractions. Some with dinner and shows included. Easy to use and not too expensive
So easy to use. Great value and very punctual, frequent and clean. Great way to travel and it gives you superb views of a lively city skyline as well as the Opera House and Harbour Bridge!!!

Sightsee whilst travelling to attractions.. simlple to use very frequent and reliable. circular quays seemed to be the main hud. i woulded recommend the use of an opal card for stays of 2 or more days as the the will save time and money.

A very cheap and beautiful way to experience the beauty of the Hrbour. in 1770 Captain James Cook, the English explorer declared Sydney Harbour "the greatest natural harbour in the World" He was right of course, so take a ferry for a few dollars and go the Tooronga Park Zoo, or just go to Manly and have lunch and come back to the Key, either way the views are sensational, enjoy!
Nice to take the ferry instead of the Taxi. You can access a lot of places by ferry it is very well done. Many places are accessible and you have many of them
Fantastic Way to see the Harbour. We bought an all day ticket and visited a lot of landmarks plus got a fantastic harbour trip. This was great fun.

You must take a ferry ride!. Even if you don't know where you want to go the ride itself is a treat. Tired after a long flight from LA we took the ferry to Manly and had a lovely lunch there. Watsons Bay is another great trip.
Enjoyable Rides to interesting places. One must enjoy the ferry rides to various destinations. Particularly to Many beach and Darling Harbour. The ferries follow a very strict time table

Wonderful sights by ferry. Excellent way to travel on this magnificent harbour , for a reasonable fare one can visit many destinations around the harbour, also take a catamaran t, west under the bridge to Homebush

Ferry Ride to Manly. Fabulous. Had forgotten how relaxing it is to sit back and enjoy the ride to Manly. Was a cool day but not very windy - perfect to have the window down. The harbour is magnificent and brings back great memories of sailing on the harbour every week for years. The Manly wharf is good - even have a Max Brenner there. Recommend it as a must for visitors to Sydney
Syney - getting around. Simple - easy - just a real great way of seeing andf getting aroundydney.Cheap -good signage and good, helpful staff

A MUST DO in Sydney. We took the Ferry to Manly as well as the Toranga Zoo. Super easy and great way to see the harbor. The ferry to Toranga gave us the same view as the Harbor Cruise we did. Had we know, probably would not have booked the Harbor Cruise.
They Are Ferries. Definitely the best way to get around Sydney, the views from the ferries are so good it's never worth getting the paid tours!
Cost friendly way to move around. I used the ferry to get to Manly Beach in particular. It was punctual, comfortable and a relaxed way to get there. So much cheaper than taxis for sure.

Love the Harbour. I always try and go for a ferry ride when in Sydney. Been riding the ferries for 50 years. So much to see and do around the harbour. Go over to Manly, to the Zoo or just get a return ticket and go for a ride. Sydney Harbour is always busy. Enjoy.
ok. on time great staff and great day just to see the harbour ,had a great time seeing all the sights with the grandson

Sydney Ferries offer low cost harbour views. We travelled on the Manly Ferry, Watsons May Ferry and Milsons Point Ferry. All offered wonderful views of the harbour. From Manly ferry wharf we walked through the Corso to Manly Beach. From Watsons Bay ferry wharf it was only a short walk to the famous Doyles on the Beach seafood restaurant. From Milsons Point ferry wharf we walked east for wonderful photo views of the Opera House and city skyline across the water. Then we walked west on the boardwalk around Lavender Bay. The walk starts on the waterfront next to Luna Park. Travelling on ferries to see Sydney Harbour is excellent value for money. All ferries depart from Circular Quay.
Ferry. caught the ferry to manly (and back) excellent service, friendly and relaxedEasy to use, ticketting system is good but remember to hold onto your ticket for the return trip!

Best day out. One of the best days out for a visitor to Sydney is to have a ferry ride, for spectacular views of our great city. So many places to visit - Manly to visit the aquarium or have a swim, or combine it with a visit to Taronga Park Zoo, Watsons Bay to visit The Gap and have a great seafood lunch or just enjoy the scenery and ride on different ferries. A day you mustn't miss!

Superb Ferry services. The ferries are great you really can get everywhere and run on time with big windows and outdoor seating so you really do get to see the sights and going under the bridge is cool and getting to Manley is so easy as is the zoo - busy waterway with so much to see

Ferry fun?. We loved the idea of exploring Sydney by enjoying the ferry trips. However it is not a very practical thing to do on an individual level as a tourist. Whether you go one stop or to the end of the line, you have to pay the full $6-7. Going to Manly cost us $15 each return. We ended up getting a Day Pass for $24 which meant as much transport as we could use in one day. This is very viable if wanting to get on and off the ferries. Not so for just a few train or bus trips. Our last trip on the ferries was again with a Day Pass so we could get on and off to enjoy a different route, that which went to Olympic Park for the Bledisloe Cup. We stopped off to enjoy Cockatoo Island and when we went to get back on, the captain called out, only 14 could get on. Lucky for us that most were heading back to Circular Quay. With a very full boat load there were many passengers sitting and standing out the front. We joined them as the inside area was full. This was when the captain of the boat decided to have a bit of fun with the plebs. A couple of faster, larger boats passed us, creating a wake which our esteemed captain, appeared to race into and over, causing a massive wave literally over the top of the heads of all of those standing that side of the boat. My husband was drenched from his head down and was not impressed. The fact that the crew and the captain were laughing their heads of indicates it is not the first time it has happened. Any other time you can handle a bit of water and a bit of a laugh, but not when the majority of the boat are dressed for an event in the middle of winter. It was a wet cold night for a lot of us and yes I have a picture of the crew and shall be following up with it. So just be warned for even though there is a sign stating that no liability will be taken for any electronic items that get wet, this was covered up by passengers leaning against the front. It is not a pleasant occurrence and as an Australian I was battling to find the humour at that time of year.
excellent way to spend a day. Well priced, reliable and the best way to see the harbour. Time tables are available on line and staff are informative and friendly

Don't pay big bucks. Why pay big dollars for a harbour cruise when you can jump on a ferry from Circular Quay to many different destinations. See more of Sydney for half the price while sailing on the best harbour in the world.

Best Way to Taronga Zoo. Our trip to and from Taronga Zoo was quick, pleasant, and less crowded than expected. We were able to get excellent views of the harbor. I think I would have gone on the ferry just for the views alone had I not wanted to see the zoo!

Fab ferries with free wifi. I love travelling Sydney by ferry. It is all worked out so when you dock there is a bus waiting to take you to your onward journey. The ferries run on time most of the time but as you are waiting by the harbour, who cares if its late? There is free wifi on all ferries and so what better way to check your mail than sitting on the outside deck of a Sydney Ferry! They can be a tad expensive but if you get an Opal card and use them regularly, after a number of journeys you get the rest of the weeks travel free !!

Great Harbour viewing platform. Always enjoy a trip on the Sydney Harbour Ferries. Full of character and give some great views. I always like the one back from Darling Harbour that goes under the Harbour Bridge!

Iconic .. and a fun way to travel. What's not to like - efficient, cheap, fast. No better way to see Sydney than whizzing about the harbour on one of these ferries. Take a fast-cat up to Paramatta; or just chug over to Manly for the day. Superb.
Inexpensive Way To See Sydney Harbour. I recommend using the Sydney Ferries to see Sydney Harbour. They run regularly from Circular Quay and are much less expensive than doing a Harbour Cruise.

Great way to travel! . Great away to get from A to B and explore the different areas of Sydney. Great service from all staff, easy to book and great views the whole journey once on board. You can sit inside our out and there was a bar with food and drinks if you wanted it! Good price to! Go at sunrise/ sunset - lovely views!

A superb Tour along a scenic river!. We took the Ferry service from Sydney Olympic Park all the way back to Circular Quay - it was a chilly crisp August Wintry evening - but not too col dto eschew sitting the the front bow of the Marjorie Jackson where we enjoyed the Paramatta river vistas that unfolded before our eyes as the ferry made its stops along the river back to town. Highly recommended as a tour unto itself!

Sightseeing on the cheap. For a thorough site seeing trip of the harbour take the ferry up the harbour and across the Heads to Manly, then, in the other direction, to Parramatta. Start early. Catch the Manly ferry from Circular Quay and have brunch or lunch in Manly overlooking the surf beach or the harbour. Back to Circular Quay and change ferries for a scenic trip up the Parramatta River. There are interesting historical sites and walks in Parramatta. Finally return downriver or, if time is short, catch the train back to the city.

Beautiful way to see the city. Sydney has arguably the prettiest harbour in the world and a leisurely cruise across the harbour to Manly is a scenic 30min voyage great photo opportunities of The Harbour Bridge, Opera house, even the occasional sightings of dolphins and even whales have been sighted along the way. Manly is a nice place cor lunch by the Ocean, the corso there has many nice eateries as well.

Good Ride. Pretty good ride across the harbour with many vantage points for photography. Especially the Darling Harbour to Circular Quay route. However, it is quite costly therefore a day tripper or what ever it is called now (unlimited travel on train, bus and ferry) is recommended.

Great service!. Great service between Darling Harbour and Circular Quay stopping along the way and places of interest, including Luna Park! Service was efficient and always on time with olenty of room. On the odd icassion a ferry was full, another one was just a couple of minutes behind. Highly recommend this service for sight seeing on the water and from getting to some lovely little places of interest around the coastline! Sundays is cheap day allowing you to hop on and off all day for AUD$2.00, other days is it AUD$6.00 for adults return journey.

Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. We took the ferry to Manly beach, its a good ride and takes about half an hour to reach from Circular Quay. If possible its a better experience to stand outside especially for those who feel sea sick.

The Harbour. Sydney ferries are a little expensive, but they are a wonderful way to see this city and harbour. Most tourists catch the Manly ferry, which is very exciting crossing 'The Heads' if there is any ocean swell, and it lands you at Manly with a 2-300m walk straight ahead to Manly Beach. But other ferries (Woolwich, Parramatta) take you to parts of Sydney most tourists never see. And Sunday is 'family day' (cheaper fares).

Great way to see Sydney Harbour and its surrounding. Sydney Ferries are a great way to see Sydney Harbour and the surrounding. Recommended ferry trips are the Circular Quay to Manly (for a trip to Manly Beach for surfing and great view of the Ocean) and Circular Quay to Watson's Bay (for a trip to the Gap for its stunning cliffs and great view of the Ocean). You will be able to see the Sydney Opera House and the Harbour Bridge from these two ferry services.

Great way to go to work!. I wish I had the time to go to work by ferry everyday. The day I went the weather was magnificent, but even on a rainy stormy day it would be good. The harbour is beautiful and there is always something to see, dolphins, penguins, seals and great scenery. If you have time, take the ferry!

Weekend Waves. Superb on the dot service.Love the schedule that ensures a brekkie with friends in Manly or a yum lunch ; beach strolls or even evening or nite experences.The ferries are clean with ample secure seating.Though I do love sitting up front outside for the view and salt spray.Amazing to take in the 360° views of the natural harbour; the swanky domiciles and sleek "little boats".A quintessential Sydney experience!
Best way to see skyline. What a fantastic way to view the beautiful city in a novel fashion. We used the ferries as our main transportation as they were so much fun.
Fabulous ferries!. Love floating around the Harbour on a ferry....relaxing and safe. Best trips are to Manly and Watson's Bay.

We love the ferries. Took quite a few rides on the ferries, and just loved the convenience of them the places you could get to, and the cost was minimal. Buy an Opal Card if you are in town for a week or two, much more convenient, Pensioners order yours online at least two weeks before going to Sydney.

Iconic. The best way to explore Sydney harbour and we do these trips often with the family. Our most recent from the quay to Manly with our granddaughter who loves the ferry. So many places to visit while enjoying the spectacle of the harbour and surrounds. If you are a visitor to Sydney this is a must. Manly, Darling Harbour, Taronga zoo, Balmain, Cockatoo Island, Watsons Bay. Opportunities for plenty of fabulous days out especially with the blue sky of Sydney. Timetable and tickets can be purchased online through Sydney Ferries website.

Iconic Sydney Ferries. A trip to Sydney is not complete without going on a ferry. They have retained the iconic "fairy tale" appearance of the ferries. A must is the Manly route. Board at Circular Quay in the Rocks Area of Sydney and cruise past the beautiful Opera House and past the Heads where it can get a little rough in stormy weather. Also a lovely route is the Manly/Cremorne circuit. It is really enchanting to do this around sunset or after dinner. Also board at Circular Quay. Make sure you come prepared with a jacket if the weather is cool and sit outside or outside up front. Even better outside up front if the water is rough. We were on it when the waves were breaking over the people standing up front. It was so exciting.
Good service. Used Sydney ferries numerous times, service is excellent and its relatively cheap. Ferries are a little outdated.

The very best way to discover Sydney Harbour. Forget the harbour cruises with average food. Travel from Circular Quay with a daily pass - better on Sunday's with a family pass.Travel to Manly or Toronga Zoo on the ferries and see the harbour sparkle.Take the ferry from CQ to Darling Harbour and walk south and link up with China Town via Chinese Gardens - end up in Sussex street and try the food at Hawker and Home (299 Sussex) restaurants.

great way to travel. Sydney ferries are like buses in Europe so easy to use and get around on the one that goes up the river to Parramatta is amazing and you get to see all the huge houses and scenery on the way the ferries are included in the price of $2.50 for the whole day on a sunday where you can travel on any bus ferry train for the day price if you use an opal card

Must do. Caught a ferry to Manly. I loved the Circular Quay area and had a pleasant day in Manly after a fabulous ferry trip across Sydney Harbour to get there. Can't recommend highly enough. Beautiful.
Beautiful ride at sunset. Clean, efficient and an affordable way to see the city skyline, which is especially beautiful at sunset.

Scenic ferry ride. We travelled by sydney ferry from circular quay to tauranga zoo. The ride is very scenic. The spped of the boat is comfortable and the seating is two tiered. Upper open deck and lower enclosed deck.
Great ride, but cold. Wow, and wow. Nice ride to Manly, was a bit cold though. Fun for all ages, loads for families. Enjoyed the view.
Sensational way to get around!. Took the ferry over to Manley Beach and it was better that a much higher priced Harbor Cruise. They run very frequently and you'll feel like a local!

Trip over to Manly. Took the ferry to Manly at sunset to see a bit of the harbor and also hSin a quick look at the beach. This is an easy and pretty quick way to get a glimpse of a lot in a short period of time.

Parramatta Here we Come. Enjoyed a relaxed trip to Parramatta on the ferry on Saturday morning, lot's to see, great company from other passengers and as always excellent experience from ticket purchase to end of trip.

Captain Cook Cruises-Coffe cruise. Fantastic. It was a lovely way to spend a Saturday morning cruising the harbour in the sun. The ferry leaves at 10 in the morning with a commentary by a very knowledgable person on the history and local current events. Coffee and morning tea served.

Ferries offer excellent services. Over the past few months I have utilized the Sydney Ferry service on a number of occasions. The wide range of services provided by the ferries allows resident and visitors to travel from as far west as Parramatta to Manly and many other harbourside suburbs. I have found the ferries always on time and staffed by obliging and pleasant staff.

A good way to tour the harbour. Well organized, efficient staff. You can rely on them to get from a to b on time, or simply to enjoy the harbour scenery. Instead of spending money in boat rides we simply went on the ferries to tour the harbour. They are clean, in good shape, iconic and perfect for tourists.

Sydney Ferries. We took theses ferrys all the time, dont waste your money on expensive cruises take the public ferrys. We used the ferrys to take us to Manly, Darling Harbour, Olympic area, they are safe, punctual and give you excellent views of the harbour, opera house and the harbour bridge when travelling back to circular quay. We arrived back one night at sunset and got wonderful sunset views of the bridge and opera house

Highly recommend; fun, reasonably priced and easy to use. We really enjoyed using the ferries to get around the different areas of Sydney. They were reliable, reasonably priced, not crowded and such a relaxing experience which allowed us to rest after walking about quite a bit.

Sydney Ferries. I live in Sydney, so can only give you a slightly biased opinion. Nearly all of the ferries are great to travel on, but there still are a handful of old ones, that probably need updating, or refurbishing. But all things being considered, the ferries are a very good way of getting fro A - B on public transport, especially if the destination is within walking distance of the ferry terminal, at either end of the journey.
The best way to see Sydney Harbour.. The best part of Sydney and cheap at the price - end up at Watsons Bay for the famous Doyles fish and chips at the pier.

Good way to get around and get a different perspective of the city. For a different way to get around Sydney, take the ferry. For a different view of the city, take the ferry. The ferries are pretty inexpensive and convenient and run regularly and reliably. The view of key landmarks from the ferries is unique and much cheaper than dedicated cruise services. There isn't a lot of outside viewing space so plan ahead and stake out a good spot for best results.

The way to travel in Sydney for local and tourists. Sydney has an extensive bay and often congested traffic so the way to travel by resident is by ferry. For tourists this is also a preferred way to see the bay, the beaches and g o to restaurants and attractions. The ferry network is extensive and the service is frequent: the hub is at Circular Quay, in the center of town, near the Rocks, where there is also connections to trains and buses. The must do ferry trips are Manly, Parramatta, Kirribilly and Double Bay. The tickets are rather expensive, as public transportation goes, but you can buy at a reasonable price a 3 or 7 days pass which is also convenient as most of the ferry docks don't have a ticket office.

Good service. Excellent service and regular trips to Manly pretty cheap too. Enjoy views of the Harbour Bridge, Op House, the Business Centre. Got to take your camera or tablet etc to capture the amazing views.

Informative and Excellent Sydney ferry transport. My family and I travelled to cockatoo island and it was very convenient with one day trip the ferry schedule. The ferry schedule is very flexible with many optional schedule. My family and I were very satisfied. Excellent

Wonderful Ferry Service. Should try ferry services, especially the one from Circular Quay to Manley Beach. You only have to pay AUD2.5 (round trip) only to enjoy wonderful harbour cruise on Sunday. Excellent view of Opera House, Sydney Bridge. It is much cheaper comparing to take a cruise/harbour sight seeing tour which you may have the same route!

Unbeatable Water Views. The iconic Sydney ferries are always enjoyable to ride in, whether it's to Darling Harbour, Luna Park, Taronga Zoo, Manly, or Watson's Bay. The views it offers are unbeatable in Sydney!
See Sydney by ferry. Very pleasant way to see the harbour. Regular ferries are great. Went on the Parramatta trip and of course to Manly. Very reasonably priced

Trip made easy. The Ferry system is very well run in Sydney, everything is clear and well sign posted. The ferries run on a regular basis so if you happen to miss one there will be another one soon after. The people on the ferries are approachable and it is well run. These ferries go to several destinations around Sydney harbour and are a good way to travel.
A Must Do event. The best way to get some phenomenal photographs of the landmarks and skyline. Cheap travel, efficient and friendly staff.
Send a grat time seeing the harbour. Buy a day ticket and spend the day travelling around Sydney harbour. Went to Rose bay , Manly and Parramatta. Tok the late ferry to manly and back. Great trip

Manly Ferry. Whenever we are in Sydney, we always ride on the Manly Ferry. i have travelled on several of the harbour ferries to various destinations but this will always be my favourite. The system is well run and the ferries travel at frequent intervals. This run has the best views of the harbour, sailing past the harbour bridge, opera house, Fort Dennison, lovely houses and bays then North and South Head.

Great way to see the harbour. Quite frequent and and a great way to see the harbour; go on a Sunday and treat it like a hop on hop off tour (the maximum cost is AUD 2.50); simply the best value for money tour in Australia.

Perfect way to travel in the Harbour City. We went to Cockatoo Island and Olympic Park station. Could not praise the staff enough, very helpful and friendly. I believe this is the easiest way to get around and using the Opal Card system is so easy and convenient.
Sydney Must Do!. Whenever I come to Sydney I look forward to travelling on the Sydney Ferries. What a great way to get around.

April 2014. We stayed on Cremorne Point so we took the ferries several times a day. They were generally clean and well-maintained. The best feature was the very prompt timetable they keep. A warning however, check the schedules before planning to be out late - the intervals between departures become longer late at night and some stops are not available after certain hours.

Great way to travel around Sydney. We stayed in Cremorne Point and used the ferry service every day to travel to and from Circle Quay. We also took the ferry to Manly Beach, from the Olympic Stadium and elsewhere. Very easy service to use and gives you a unique perspective on what its like to live in Sydney. Highly recommend using when possible.
Great eerience. Very helpful sailors who offered us to take a family picture as soon as they saw that we are on holiday.

Great way to get around Sydney . The ferries are a great way to get around Sydney. They are efficient public transport, and novel if you don't live near water. It is easy to buy cards and schedules are easy to understand. And it's a plus that you can get a view of the Opera House from the water!

A convenient transport method. Sydney ferries are a convenient way to travel fro both locals and tourists alike. Ferries are large and spacious, have outer viewing deck too. Ferry to manly can be a little shaky at times due to strong winds and waves of the ocean. This is unlike Singapore, so first time I was a little nervous but later it was good.
Great service, great value. Getting around Sydney is easy with good ferry, bus and trains. If you are visiting checkout the tickets available especially if you hold seniors card.

Ferry-go-round (Sydney). You can purchase a day pass for $24 from either the train station, ferry ticket kiosk or at the train station at the domestic terminal (airport). This ticket allows you to travel on any bus, train, ferry and tram from time of purchase until 4am the next morning. The ferry is a great way to sea(lol) Sydney and it's surrounding suburbs. There is also a ferry which can take you to Sydney's Olympic Park (host village for the 2000 Sydney Olympic Games). This is a big recommend for all travellers to Sydney.

Sydney Ferries Reliable and Easy to Use.. Efficient and on time. Most now use the opal card so you don't have to queue for tickets. The opal app gives onetime ferry information and taking the ferry to various points in Sydney saves many hours in traffic queues.

Not easy for tourist. using the ferries system is sydney is not easy for a tourist. Each time we tried to used it, either a dock was in construction and the ferries was not going to that point, either the stop was not in service for the choosen day.

Best way to see sydney. Wished id got an opal card at start of visit. You can get a visitors card at circular quay for $20. Everyday the maximum you spend is $15 no matter how often you use it (including buses & trains).I went to manly & had fish n chips on the beach while watching dolphins in the bay. To darling harbour, then waited until the sun went down to cruise back into circular quay to see the city, bridge & opera house all lit up.If had more time wouldve gone to more beaches & up to parramatta.The ferries are really easy to use, just look for the screens which show next departures etc. I didnt use ferry during commuting times so they werent full/busy.Sydney has a beautiful waterfront(s) & catching ferries is an awesum way to see the sights, wish we had an awesum service like this in Auckland.
Pretty Punctual!. We took several fairies while in Sydney and they were all easy to locate. And they were reasonably priced and comfortable! Those we took were all on time!

Great, cheap way to see the Harbour. Times can be a bit unpredictable but generally on time. Like everything but the smell of diesel. Public transportation in Australia is superior in general. Opal card is a must.
super. We took the Ferries to several places on diferent occasions. The Zoo, Manly and more. We were very content with the fast and good service. Very well priced
sydney ferry service. we usually take the ferry to watsons bay for lunch at doyles on the pier. we have never had any problem with the ferry service. it runs on time and without any hassles.

This local transport at its best.. What you have to remember here is this is local day to day life, not an attraction put on just for tourists.The boats are not glamorous they are perfect for the there purpose, transporting large numbers from one point to another without fuss.At certain times of the day it's a bit hectic as the locals make there way to and from work. But it's the views as you travel from one part of the harbour to another which make this a must do.Don't miss some of the smaller craft that go to lesser known calls, they can be the best. You really could spend a whole day just going backwards and forwards on them and wouldn't get bored.

Nice short ride from Darling to Opera House. The ferry is a good deal of you are simply going between Circular Quay and Darling Harbor. Otherwise, you might consider buying a hop-on hop-off boat ticket that takes you all around the harbor. It's well worth it.

Great way for a cheap cruise!. Highly recommend using the ferries to view the harbour at different times of the day, get yourself a multi trip card and go visit Manly Tonga zoo etc, have a look at the different routes and you'll get amazing views of the harbour.At night we got one of the last sailings to Tonga zoo and stayed on at the zoo and just came back again, we were the only ones on the boat for that trip so it was extra nice!Found the staff helpful and really nice to chat with!
Cheap transport. Cheap to travel . it just a public transport comfy and clean, Friendly folk service the ferries and usually good banter with them.
caught the the ferry to Taronga Park. What a divine experience! What a beatiful harbour we have, music on the ferry, loved it, take the ferry anywhere really, but take a jacket, get a bit chilly

On time. Took the ferry to Manly on a Saturday. Was very busy, but left on time at Circular Quay and again at Manly. Ferries appear old, but felt safe during the journey, was pleasant sitting outside in the sun

Pleasant and cheap way to see Sydney. The ferry terminal is easy to find, set very close to the Opera House. From here you can take ferries to various points of interest such as Bondi Beach, Manley Cove and Taronga Zoo. The trip is cheap and pleasant, and staff are very keen to help you.
Relax on the rib. We travelled by ferry to Parramatta which took about one and a half hours. The scenery was lovely and it was a very relaxing trip.
Cheap Fun. It is very cheap to travel in these ferries. Kills excess time and fun for the kids. Beautiful views of major attractions like harbour bridge and opera house. Must ride.

Iconic Views. Not to be missed. If your in Sydney you must take a Ferry Ride (or two or three) Each time you come into the main harbor your breath is taken away a little bit. The view is just that spectacular. Every. Time.

Merry Ferry. Sydney Ferries are one of the most important mode of travel in and around Sydney. There are frequent ferries to the places around and they are used by innumerous people and tourists. Its one of the cheapest travel options in Sydney and offers very fast connectivity.

Affordable, Comfortable, Safe and Reliable. Sydney Ferries is a fabulous way to explore the beauty of Sydney Harbour and its surrounds. You can travel the full length and breadth of the harbor from Manly to Parramatta and from Darling Harbour to Taronga Zoo.
Average. Not much to review really it gets you from A-B. It's clean and comfortable, nothing to write home about, just a form of public transport

Best way to see Sydney. Catch the F4 route from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour and back for the best views of Sydney! It's the same as going on one of those private boat tours, but for at least half the price. You'll get to see the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Luna Park, King Street Wharf and lots more of this beautiful city. Use the Opal card and it'll be even cheaper.

Different perspective!. Travel by ferry has to be one of the cheapest and best value for money ways to get a really good handle on the sights and sounds of Sydney from almost water level travelling in a relaxed and soothing mode with the waters of the harbour lapping the boat. Sydney Harbour is by far one of the most beautiful in the world. It is a wonderful, busy environment for working vessels and leisure craft. Some of the older ferries of Sydney exude that old world charm as they elegantly ply the generally smooth waters of the vast harbour. Relax and take in all the varied sights from harbourside mansions, city skyline views, Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Botanical Gardens, pretty suburbs, Harbour forts, Taronga Zoo and an endless list of other sights. Well worth a couple of hours of relaxed tourism.

A Sydney trip is incomplete without a ride on the ferries. Great views in and out of circular quay, Sydney harbour bridge and the opera house. Friendly folk service the ferries and usually good banter with them :)
Reliable!. Brilliant! They were on time, had plenty of viewing decks to look at the harbor from all angles of the ferry. Reliable!
Love the harbour!. A great way to see Sydney via the harbour and very reasonable! Many different options and the ferries usually run to time.

A fantastic way to see Sydney like a local.. We did numerous trips during our one weeks stay in July. It is a charming way to see Sydney & we have always found it to be a reliable service.We love taking the Circular Quay route (it is beautiful at night) when the opera house, harbour bridge & Luna Park are lit up. We take this route on a Saturday & get off at Balmain East-we walk up Darling St, enjoy breakfast in a cafe along the way & browse the shopping strip of Balmain. We walk this road further to Rozelle which has a market in the Prinary school every Saturday (this is a treasure trove & brings many moments of nostalgia for things past). The bus service also takes you up Darling St if you don't feel like the walk.Another popular trip for us is the ferry to Manly (near Sydney heads)' another beautiful trip.Definitely take the ferry to Taronga zoo, it adds to the experience. Some services have a kiosk, such as Manly route.Sydney transport now has the Opal card, which allows you to top up rather than buy individual tickets every time you want to travel. The card is free, but top ups are $20 increments & we were able to use these cards to get the train to the airport. At the conclusion of our trip we registered our cards, & if the money on the card is not used it is automatically credited back to the credit card you register on the account.I'm sure the morning / afternoon tea, lunch /dinner cruises on the harbour are great, but we love the Sydney Ferries-it just depends what type of experience you are looking for.

Harbour thoughts on a ferry. Went to manly from circular quay On a Sunday the service was every 30 minutes and took 30 minutes Lots of room .Best views of the bridge and opera house .Using the local opal card it cost 2.50 return great value

Always the highlight of a trip to Sydney. My favourite is the Manly Ferry which is a decent trip on the harbour for a very small price. All the other ferries I have been on have also been good, just not as long a trip. Hop off, get an icecream, wander around and get the ferry back. Brilliant budget tourism.
Best way to explore the City. See, feel and enjoy Sydney harbour. Buy yourself a ticket and explore Sydney from the water. Be sure – you will be in love with wonderful Sydney straight away!

gentle rocking on the manly ferry. yes did a trip over to manly on the ferry it was abit rocky on the ferry going over an even worse coming back but enjoyed the walking around on the beach at manly so was worth it
Come share our beautiful Harbour by Ferry. Always a great experience travelling to Manly by Ferry. See the most beautiful Harbour in the world from the water.

Cheapest way to get around the Harbor. You can buy a day pass for AUD12 which allows you to hop on and off the ferries all day. I went to Manly then up the Parramatta River. It was so relaxing and the man on the ferries was very helpful.

I love Ferries. If you want to get somewhere and you don't mind taking the scenic route, then taking a ferry is the way to go. If you can wait until Sunday it only costs $2.50 for the whole day. Go to Paramatta and have a long day out while stopping off at other wharf's in between for a quick bite to eat.

Fast Ferry to Manly. We caught a Fast ferry to manly. It was just Amazeballs. It took about 15mins to get to Manly and you even get to buy alcohol on board. A drink while taking in The Best Harbour in the world. The return trip was just overwhelming. The lights of the city and the Harbour Bridge all lit up was spectacular. A must for any lovers.

The cheapest way to enjoy your sydney harbour view. Not the most posh or romantic yacht, but not much yacht can sail the best harbour in the world. Get your outside place and just enjoy your $10 rides looking at majestic view. Go during the day the view are just better

Eight to nine years ago I had the best time of my life In Australia. I went to Australia about 8 or 9 years ago and I had the time of my life. A big memory was when I visited Sydney. Me my Grandmother, Uncle and Auntie all took one of the cream and green ferries across the harbor to Luna Park. I just remember going under the bridge with my disposable camera and trying to take a picture of the whole bridge haha. It literally brings a tear to my eye now. Sounds stupid but if you ever get the chance to take your child on a ferry through the harbor ideally under the bridge to Luna Park then do it because that memory will stay with you forever like it had for me.

Great way to see Sydney. I think the best way to see the Sydney CBD and surrounds is by water and this is the way to do it. For only ~$7 you can go from Darling Harbour to Sydney Olympic Park. Also worth doing after dusk!A must for travellers to Sydney.

A great way to see the Harbour. Easy to use, not bad prices, and a great way to see the harbour. We took the ferry to the Zoo and to Manly. If you do the Manly trip go on a Sunday (Sunday Fun Day) because then everyone rides for one cheap fare, and it saves you quite a bit of money than if you were to go on a Sat. For the Zoo we bought the Zoo Pass which is a ferry ride and a Zoo entrance, there as well you can save a bit of dough, plus you can ride the Zoo gondola up to the entrance, while those without the pass have to take a bus to the entrance. I wouldn't recommend the private companies, sure the ferry goes more often but your looking at adding another $10 to the price.

Great for a quick trip with the family.. The ferries are a quick way across the bay! Don't recommend being outside on a windy day and it can have a real chill in the air! great fun for the family as young kids seem to love it
Great way to see the harbour.. Great views of the city and harbour, without the cost of having your own boat! Plenty of routes with ample sailings through the day.
a must do. Most of the ferry's are old but they all have character, the big ferries do the Manly run and plenty of smaller ones all do other tours, they are cheap and run all the time, please enjoy

very convenient. I used the the ferry to go from cockle bay wharf to darling harbour. It was very convenient as it connects all the major spots in Sydney. The ride also has some really views of the city, which can be enjoyed by the tourists

very surprised. I travelled last Sunday on a ferry from Circular Quay to Chiswick to visit a friend and to my surprise this service was full of passengers with some left behind.This total journey is to Parramatta and taking 90 minutes from wharf 5.The cat service is fast, clean and taking a long the Parramatta stopping in Darling Harbour, Cockatoo Island, Sydney Olympic park and these are some of the stops.So if you are a tourist not a bd trip to do.
