A picnic on Cockatoo or camping over night after a good walk around Darling Harbour or simply take a grand walk to our Olympic areaand all this for a few dollars so why do an expensive touristic cruise around the harbour.You can take an other ferry to manly connecting in Circular quay. A full day of pleasant cruising.

Wave to go!. We took the Manly Ferry on Sunday,,,,,Have been a few times....it still is one of the most wonderful experiences one can have..A terrific view of all the wonderful buildings and a view that can only be had on the water..Pity there is no commentary...as most people would not know what a lot of the history of the harbour....and surrounds
Sydney Ferries. Great way to view the harbour and experience Sydney from the water. Travelled from circular quay to Manly beach.

good way to get around. The ferries are very much part of Circular Quay and any visitor to the city should take at least one journey on a ferry. They are an easy and convenient way of getting to places like Manly, Watsons Bay, Rose Bay, Kirribilli, the zoo etc.

Varied choice of destinations.. Ferries are so easy to use. Just look at the noticeboards, find your destination, and the board will tell you which jetty and how long to wait. Manly, Watsons Bay and Parramatta are all lengthy rides that are free with a My Multi 3 card (AU$65). Try them all!

See sydney on Ferries and be surprised.. Sydney Ferries are the best mode of transport when you want to enjoy the hidden treasures of Sydney and relax for the day. No hassle of driving around and parking. Sydney ferries would take you to Watson's Bay, Drummoyne, Manly, Rose Bay, Double Bay, Taronga Zoo and the list is absolutely huge and amazing.Best day to travel if you have kids and want to save money is on Sunday. You can buy a family day trip pass for $2.50 for train, bus and ferries operated by NSW govt.

Yes please. a must do for anybody visiting sydney. for me it is one of the most convenient ways to see and discover the city with its stretched vastness.always on time (thats my personal experience) and always friendly staff on clean ferries!

Take a ferry or cruise. Taking a Sydney ferry is a great way to see the city inexpensively. You can take the ferry over to Manly. I suggest the river cat quick ride, but you can go and come on different speeds of ferries. Also, take the River Cat out out to Abbotsford and see if you can go to lunch at the Sydney Rowing Club. This is a private club, but usually people who don't live there can get a "guest" pass to dine. The ferry stop is right there. And, you can continue on after lunch out to the site used for the Sydney Olympics in Parramatta. Also, you can take the Captain Cook 2.5 hour coffee cruise in the mid morning or afternoon. This is a great sightseeing tour of the harbor.

Essential Part of The Sydney Experience. Hard to see Sydney and not manage at least one ferry trip. We took trips from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay to Watson's Bay and Manly etc. It's a fantastic way to see the picturesque Harbour, The Opera Hose and the Harbour Bridge up close. The trips depart frequently. Just keep an eye on the last ferry time if you go to one of the locations further out. We missed the last one out of Watson's Bay but managed to get a bus to Rose Bay and returned from there.If you are planning a few trips buy a 10 trip ticket, you can use it for more than one person. I highly recommend this service.

Awesome cheap public travel. Ferries every 15 minutes to all the destinations. Friendly informative staff, cheap travel using the "Opal Card" catch ferry to Manly 30mins away, Lunar Park 15mins, Circular Quay, Darling Harbor, Love it, didnt have to wait long for the next ferry.

Great way to see the harbor. These ferries will take you to a vast majority of the places around Sydney.I took a ride around the Harbour that took about an hour and another to Manly.The ferries were punctual and clean.

A great way to explore Sydney. In Sydney earlier this year and used the ferries extensively. A day ticket will take you to so many bays so you can ferry-hop all day or spend a day going to Paramatta with an hour on Cockatoo Island, a former penal colony, on the way. Check return ferries when disembarking at Paramatta because, depending on the tide, the first stage of the return may be by bus. There are commercial trips but don't waste your money - this is the best way.

Inefficient service. I am a regular visitor to Sydney. In the last year, there have been half a dozen times when I tried to catch the ferry from Drummyone to the city. We would sit there patiently waiting for the arrival of the ferry for half an hour or so, only to be advised by a person on the PA system a couple of minutes before the ferry is due to arrive that it is full and will not stop at Drummoyne. Couldn't they advise customers as soon as they know the ferry is full (which would be at least a couple of stops before Drummoyne), so that we can go to catch the bus? Why make people waste time waiting? Who is to say that the next ferry is not going to be full again? Couldn't they put extra ferries on days when they should know that there is going a lot patronage. Disgraceful. They wouldn't how to run a crook raffle, let alone Sydney ferries.
Watsons Bay. Get a ferry from Circular Quay in Sydney City to Watsons Bay and have lunch at the famous Doyles Seafood Restaurant on the Sydney Harbour beach.

Quay to Zoo. Quick, efficient and on time. Was pretty crowded heading to and from the zoo so they may need to look at putting another service in or making the ferry on this route a bit larger capacity wise

great way to see the harbour. this was a great way to see the harbour and get some fantastic photos of the bridge and opera house from the water. Getting on at Circular Quay was easy and the information we received was helpful. We were first on ferry so got good outside seats for good viewing and photo opportunity.
fun. great way to get around and explore the area. Great photo opportunities! Beautiful city. You can buy tix right at the dock.
Reliable and quick. I often catch the ferry in the school holidays with family, especially on Funday Sunday. Great service and affordable transport.

Avoid Sunday. I love the Sydney Harbour ferries but trying to catch a ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour on a Sunday was a nightmare. We missed two ferries and almost the third as there are no queues and people just push, push, push. This is very scary when you are travelling with elderly people. It would have been easier to catch the bus.

A trip on their own. Having used the ferry system extensively I can say that they are worth every penny of the fares (which are pretty cheap)The different views of Sydney as you come and go are wonderful as they ply their routes around the area. The different stops are announced as one approaches just the the train system. The Opal card is also used on the ferry system making it easy to use. A wonderful experience and on the longer routes, drinks and snacks are available.
Great Way to see some sights.. A very affordable way to see some of the sights. I would recommend the Darling Harbor circle trip and the trip over to Manley (walk over the 2 blocks to the beach).

Model of Efficiency. Just love the fact that the ferries arrive and depart on time like clockwork. The staff is also always so friendly and helpful. Traveling with a family, they were always helping us get it right

Ferry to Double Bay. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Double Bay via Garden Island. On a sunny day this is a real treat to be on such a beautiful harbour, although the trip only takes 10-15 minutes you get to see some beautiful harbour-side homes on the way. Double Bay is a leafy harbour-side suburb with a beach, park, cafes, restaurants if you like to wander around and explore.
Great way to get around. Not the prettiest vessels but, when used with the opal card, greatly affordable, convenient and fast.

13$ for full sightseeing experience . You can cruise for 25 minutes from main harbour to darling harbour starting in wharf 4 (I think?!). You will start between bridge and opera, go under the bridge to luna Park and arrive at darling harbour. Which is close to Chinatown (nice lunch) , madame tussaud, aquarium and mini zoo.

Efficient and On Time. The ferries were very easy to figure out. They ran on time and provided a great view to boot! We took the time to speak to an employee in the booth to purchase the tickets and she explained how we could save money. She was very helpful!

LOVE the Sydney Ferries!. Such a great way to explore Sydney. We took the ferry to Darling Harbor, Taronga Zoo and Manly Beach. We enjoyed each ride, especially on $2.50 Sundays where it is $2.50 to travel all day with an Opal card. We consider riding the ferries in Sydney a "must do" activity. Scenic and lots of fun!

Great way to see the harbour. Using the ferries from Darling harbour around to the opera house is an excellent way to experience Sydney harbour.The transport system in Sydney is excellent , we got the opal cards which you front load with credit, its a tap on tap off system but the joy of it is that you will not spend more than twelve dollars a day as that is the max they cahrge no matter how many journeys you take, it covers buses trains and the ferries.

Sydney Ferries RULE !. I love going to Circular Quay and jumping on a Ferry. Doesn't matter where it's going sometimes, I just love getting out on the Harbour. My favourite place if I have time is to go to Manly by Ferry (have a wander from Manly Harbour to the Open Sea, grab some Fish & Chips and sit on the beach and share with the seagulls, maybe visit the local Gallery and/or Aquarium located on foreshore). If time poor, I like to get the Watsons Bay Ferry. This is a Fast-Ferry and often I sit on the top deck and dont even get off when we arrive at Watson's Bay, just stay on for return to Circular Quay. This particular Ferry goes to Double Bay, Rose Bay and Garden Island. If its night time, get the Ferry from C.Quay to Darling Harbour. This also continues across the Harbour to Luna Park before going back to the Quay -great night-time photos and views of Sydney. Then there's the River Cat which can take you all the way to Parramatta with an interesting stop at Olympic site at Homebush (from the water) - or grab a Ferry to Taronga Zoo - my advice is "get on the water" if your a visitor to Sydney - see for yourself why everyone raves about our Harbour and about our Ferries !

Great fun for all the family at a cheap price. You must go on one of the quaint Sydney ferries to get a really good look at the magnificent harbour. We sat out the back and you can enjoy the wind in your hair and take the best pics from there. I got some great shots of Luna Park when we pulled in there as well as the bridge (we went from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour where we were staying). I usually recommend people go to Manly on the ferry. You get off over there and it is an easy walk to the stunning surf beach.

Discover Sydney Harbour by ferry. The gateway to many of Sydney suburbs that look out onto the harbour. Workers and visitors take full advantage of the service. Manly, the Zoo, Balmain and even Parramatta are just a pleasant ride away. Try it!

Great way to see the magic of the city & harbour. The view of the city bridge Luna Park are magic you can get a river cat up the Parramatta river which takes you to Australias 2nd oldest city Parramatta.
Ferry across the Harbour (much better than the Mersey). A wonderful way to commute to and from work, much more exciting than a bus lots of exciting sights and sounds and smells, it's never boring.
The best ferries in Sydney.. Amazing views and tremendous getaway package in sydney. Lovely service and you can use the weekly pass to ride them.

A Great Way to get around. Enjoy views of the city that give it a totally different perspective. If you can get there by ferry then I recommend that you do. It is a far more peaceful way to travel than dealing with traffic on the roads.

Used it for Manly and Taronga Zoo. It's easy to use and a decent price. The boats are comfortable. We took the ferries to the zoo and also to Manly Beach. I think it was like $7 AUD to go to Manly one way and then less expensive on Sunday. They were always on a timetable and stuck to it.

The ferries are the best thing about Sydney Harbour. There are numerous ferries, all cheap transport options to see the highlights of the magnificent harbour. For a handful of dollars you can take a return trip to Manly, or under the bridge, or across to the zoo.

A must see view of this lovely city.. I highly recommend this activity for any visitor new to Sydney. You can choose from a variety of destinations. The views of the iconic landmarks (Opera House, Bridge) and skyline are fabulous. We had tickets for a private boat to cruise the harbor during Vivid Sydney, but missed it due to heavy traffic coming into the city. There were incredible lines for all the charter boats, so we got on a ferry instead and I am pretty sure we saw it all!

Great way to get around. NSW has put the Opal card in place which allows for easy access to all public transportation. Plus there are different cards for children and seniors and there are daily caps on charges. Check out the opal card before using the ferries!!! The ferries get you everywhere in a clean and efficient way. Manly, Darling Harbour, Toranga Zoo...so much to see.
Fantastic Scene. Magnificent views of the Sydney skyline and the Opera House you from the ferry to Manly. For the afternoon is the best time because of the light if you want to take pictures.
Wonderful and relaxing!. It is a must do to take the ferries! Enjoy the water, the view and relaxing atmosphere of being on the water.

A great way to get around. Get your card for bus, train and ferry - works like a London Oyster card - and you will be on and off the ferries visiting great locations or just enjoying the views for far less than the tourist tour boats. Some boats are slow; others speed across the water and you can sit with the wind and sun on your face.
Ferry :). The ferries are a tad old. But who really minds it add to the feels, I went on it as the sun was setting really good.

Watson's Bay. Caught the ferry to Watson's Bay. The conductor at Circular Quay could not have been more helpful as we were unsure if we would need a day pass or just return ticket. The service was on time. A delightful location not too far from the city.

An other view of Sydney. If you are a visitor to Sydney, a ferry ride should be on your 'to do list' . sydney is famous for its harbour, and the best and cheapest way to do this is to choose from the many ferry routes that operate from circular quay. with a little research you can plan your day's outing and marvel at the beauty of Sydney from the water. A ferry ride to Watson's Bay will leave any tourist or local gasp in awe at the beauty of the city skyline. Eating fish and chips or enjoying an ice cream under the ancient fig trees is a great experience. Check the time table for the last ferry leaves around 4pm

It's Easy to be good in a harbour city. The best mode of transport by far. You have a brilliant view of Sydney while getting from A-B. A range of seating both inside and out to allow for the days that aren't perfect, as well as polite helpful staff.
Great way to travel. Fast, efficient and clean service. A great way to view everything on the harbour. Went from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay only 24 mins.
Iconic part of Sydney. Iconic part of Sydney.A fast and efficient service at a reasonable price.Buy a multitrip ticket. Manley is the best place to go
Cheap and very functional. What a fantastic use of a centrally located harbour, ferries are a fast and very affordable way to get to a vast array of sydney attractions.

Spend the day travelling in the ferries.... Me & my wife purchased MyMulti 3 so it included ferry rides. The longest we took was from the Circular Quay to Manly. It was a pleasant experience & everything was on time.

Ferry ride Rydalmere to Circular Quay. A very leisurely and comfortable way to get into the city from the suburbs. Much better than road, rail or bus, if you have the time and can get to a wharf. A pleasure cruising down the Parramatta River to Sydney Harbour.

Punctual. We used the ferries just for the experience rather than as a regular mode of transport. We were happy with the punctuality of the ferries and the pleasant staff on board.Generally the ferry is clean and well-maintained (except for the one cockroach my daughter spotted with her keen eye for insects). I would recommend the ferry for anyone who can afford the time to take a slower journey to wherever they need to go and enjoy the relaxation that a few minutes of slowing down gives you.

sydney ferries .. WE stayed in Sydney right near the bridge ,It so easy to walk across the street and down to the ferry and go to Darling Harbour ,It was so nice to just get on board and not have to worry about the traffic , its a wonderful way to get around.

Ferry travel from McMahons Point. Having temporary accommodation at McMahons point while working onsite at Darling Harbour, the ferry was an obvious choice to get to and from. Schedules worked well (though a little late starting for my needs on Sat/Sun), and the ferry across the Harbour of a morning is a fantastic way to start the day.Schedules were maintained, route times exact and the whole process easy and predictable.Any ferry trip ona sunny day on Sydney Harbour is worth it.

SYD Ferries. What a wonderful way to check out the city! From the water. It is a metropolis surrounded by water. Buy a One Week Pass for about, duh, $65 or so, my memory fails me, but it is a great deal, because it also lets you ride the inner city trains and buses … which we did! All the cruises are interesting. We liked Manly the best. Go early for that hop because it is the #1 popular and gets crowded. Hop there train to Bondi Junction, then a bus to Bondi Beach, do the coastal walk to the south, awesome. Money very well spent because you will spend a heck of a lot more on individual trips. The AIRPORT train is NOT included in the One Week Pass, but pay for the airport to & from when you buy your pass. If you think the airport leg is pricey, it is a bit, but a taxi into the city will knock your socks off for $50-60!!! Enjoy.
Sydney Ferrie. I travel Sydney Ferries often, very reliable, clean. Always beautiful seeing the Harbour Bridge on the approach to Circulay Quay

Great sightseeing and very affordable. grap one of Sydney Ferries to see Sydney Harbour. There are 4 main trips, Manly, Outer Harbour, Inner Harbour and Parramatta. I love just to hope on the next departing ferry and going for a ride. What an awesome Harbour we have in Sydney and this is the best way to experience it.
Cheap, and best way to see the harbour.. For the best view of Sydney, take the Manly ferry, wander over to the beach, then take the ferry back again.

Cheaper option than a Harbour Cruise. Love the views and photo opportunities especially on the following routes :Circular Quay - Manly or TarongaCircular Quay - Darling HarbourBest times for photography - close to sunset

Manly Ferry. This ~30 minutes each way ride is a great way to get to Manly (excellent place) and back to Sydney. Reasonable price (~$15 round trip). You get great views of the Opera House and Sydney Harbor Bridge and well as Fort Denison.

Inexpensive way to get around with a view and without traffic. Best tip get a ticket on A Sunday you can go all the way around Sydney Bus/Ferry/Train on one ticket that is really cheap! Good way to get around for families to see Sydney

A Unique Sydney Experience. Any visit to Sydney is not complete without a ferry ride accross Sydney Harbour. I travel regularly to Sydney for work and enjoy the morning and afternoon accross the Harbour to and from Milson's Point.

Fun Day out. When sight seeing with kids keep in mind that Sunday is family day. You buy a $2.50 train ticket and it covers all ferry rides as well all over Sydney. You can catch a ferry up Manly then over Darling Harbour all on
the one ticket. The ferrys are reliable and clean.
A Fun Adventure. Took a ride to Manly Beach. A quick trip past the Opera House and Harbor Bridge and beautiful coastline. Lots of fellow riders and very easy to use with strollers and small kids.
Great way to travel in Sydney. This is a fast & cheap way to get around Sydney in style. Also great for photos depending on your destination. It can get a bit chilly but seating indoor and out!

Great way to get around. Not expensive and run regularly to all sorts of places around the Sydney area. We did a trip to Parramatta to see a friend. It's not a tourist spot, it's like a secondary business area for Sydney but we enjoyed our day. The boat trip took about an hour. We had a beer in a bar at the peer, had a walk, met our frind for lunch then walked around the park just in time to return to the peer bar for a quick pint before catching the boat back. A lovely way to travel.We also caught the ferry back from the Olympic Park following a day trip out and we took a ferry to Manly, a place you must visit.I would suggest taking a look early in your trip at all the destinations then go to and make a plan. Free timetables are available from the ferry kiosks. We picked up our timetables and sat having breakfast in a great 24 hour place watching the ferries coming and going. There is the usual rush when the gates open to board the ferry so if you have walking difficulties or young children with a pushchair I would try and get help before the ferries open the gates as they may board you first or at least give you a helping hand.It's better than walking and you see so much. Defiantly recommend.

Exactly what you'd expect.. The ferry trip went well to and from Taronga Zoo and we saw some stunning views. It was a bit of a farce that you could purchase tickets online but then still had to wait in line anyway to pick them up just like anyone else.
Get a day ticket. This is a great way to spend the day catching the ferries all around get to see wonderful houses and a great relaxing day
Fun ride. Was a quick and fun trip across the harbor got some nice photos had some fun times at luna park good time was had by all

Lovely trip to Manly. Always enjoy taking the Ferry across to Manly for a day's sightseeing, a little shopping and lunch in a local Pub. A walk down to the beach is a must. The Ferry is a lovely trip and offers great views around the harbour.
Nice Trip. My whole purpose of this trip was to see the Opera House from the water. Out to the Zoo and right back. GREAT view!! But next time I might just go the private boat way.
Must do when in Sydney. Catch the Ferry over to manly, in the warmer months you may be lucky enough to see dolphins ride the bow wave, so get up front!

Delightful Harbour Ferry Ride. We loved our Sydney Ferry boat tour. We spent part of an afternoon boating to Manly Beach, then Darling Harbour, and several other stops. It was very easy to buy tickets, board the boat, find comfortable seats, and view the spectacular scenery in front of us. It was a delightful afternoon!
Cruise to Sydney Zoo. Cruised the harbour one day & following day returned for a trip to the zoo. The crew very friendly & obliging. Great way to see the harbour.

love them. These ferries are VERY charming. Especially the older ones. These ferries are fun for both chrildren and elders. Personally I recommend that you just go on a ride in the evening on the mosman or neautral bay service.

Scenic and practical. The Manly Ferry is a practical and easy way to get over to this northern suburb. It costs around $12 one way for a tourist. The ferry is roomy and you can hang around outside if you want the views of Sydney Heads or the City. We always feel as if we've connected with the City and the Harbour when we travel on the ferry. It's a great experience for overseas visitors!

Ferry To Manley. We caught the ferry from Harbour and it was an excellent secure boat. I get sea sick but no worries with that. Just under an hour and to see the coast line and some of Sydney from the boat was lovely. You could sit inside or outside. Great value for the money.Manley itself is a fabulous sea side town with great places to eat and a delightful pathway that huggs the coast line as it moves through the headland along the shore.A great beach for the family to swim and beautiful to look at.Could easily spend the whole day terrific spot well worth the ferry trip which was nice.I recommend it for tourists and locals.

Such a great way to get around Sydney!. I absolutely love to take the ferry in Sydney. If you're looking to get some great views of the harbour bridge, opera house and the city, look no further than the ferry. They're always clean and on time. Even a chilly winter morning is enjoyable on the ferry. They cater for families with buggies or wheel chairs. An amazing substitute for a bus or train anytime! They also have free wifi!!
The best way to travel. Get an Opal card and ride the ferries to your hearts content. Visit the zoo, Circular Quay, Manly Beach and take a longer ride up the Parramatta River.
SCENIC way to get around. the ease of buying an all day ticket which is for ferries and trai ns,plus buses great way ro get around the city and suburbs

Morning tea Captain Cook Cruise. There is some great cruise in Sydney Harbour. The evening Dinner cruise, Coffee cruise, Vivid Cruise. Just a few. Any one of these a great. The Coffee cruise has your guide telling you the history and famous land marks and pointing out celebrity homes.

Efficient Service. Great for getting around the harbour. Always plenty of room on board with indoor and outdoor seating. The ferries always run on time. Great view of the Harbour Bridge as the ferry passes underneath on it's way in and out of Circular Quay. Great service, good safety features. Easy transport to the zoo, Darling Harbour, the Casino and Luna Park.

Rust Buckets. well they look like rust buckets, but I think that is the way they want them to look , old and very much loved. We used the ferries , and the staff and ferries are just fantastic , much nicer then the modern way around. love them
Great Transportation. Sydney offers great public transportation...Make sure to purchase an Opal card if you plan on staying a few days it is more than worth it!

Good service. The ferries arrived timely.
Very clear signage indicates the ferries schedule.
Ferries is clean, spacious and it is a good way to enjoy the view of opera house, Sydney bridge and Luna Park.
Tired. Found the staff to be fantastic but the ferries appear to be getting older and worn. Cost wasnt a problem as it came in my opal ticket free rides.

Great way to see Sydney. A fantastic opportunity to see the sights of Sydney from a different perspective, escape the city rush and casually cruise around the harbour. Choose the shelter in the ferry or sit outside and enjoy the breeze.

love these boats. so much fun to ride the ferry see all the sights of the harbour, thrill at the sight of the opera house and bridge arrive at your destination happy and carefree
the only drawback is the price for the ride compared to other places Sydney can be expensive to use public transport

A mobile viewing platform. The ferries are a great way to view so many different parts of Sydney Harbour from Manly, Watson's Bay, Mosman, Darling Harbour, Parramatta and Fort Denison. A wonderful way to spend a day.

Good Experience. I took a 1.5-2 hour ferry ride from Opera House. It took me upto Toranga zoo and returned to Darling Harbour. Docked there for some time and then started back for Opera house. Overall it was a very refreshing experience on a nice weather

A cheap way to see the Harbour and Sydney surrounds. The ferries are a cheap way to cruise Sydney Harbour and they connect to some great places to see. A favourite being Manly Beach or Toronga Zoo. On a sunny day the harbour is truly beautiful and you pass by the Opera House and see it from a different perspective. The ferries are really just public transport but are kept clean. If you are on budget this is your type of cruise!

A great way to see Sydney from the water.. I am always entranced with how beautiful Sydney is from the harbour, and the best way to see it is to hop on a ferry and head out on the water. Grab a return ticket to Manly and experience a view of Sydney you will always remember. a ticket to Neutral Bay to see some of the amazing harbour home. The Sydney ferries provide a great way at a good price to see Sydney from the water and believe me that is one if not the best ways to truly experience your time there. Grab day pass.

Must do whilst in Sydney!!. On a Sydney ferry on Sydney harbour on a warm, sunny day = one of the most beautiful places in the world! Your visit to Sydney won't be complete without a ride across the harbour on a ferry. Don't just do the stereotypical Manly Ferry (boring!), but take a ride to beautiful Lavender Bay, Darling Point, Balmain, Taronga Zoo or Luna Park as well! There are so many hidden gems within minutes of many Sydney ferry stops!

Different ferry trip options. Most travellers in Sydney take the ferry trip to Manly or Taronga Park Zoo.Two other less well know ones are to Watsons Bay and up the river to Parramatta also leave from Circular Quay.Watsons Bay is a beautiful spot with a nice swimming beach nearby and spectacular views over the cliffs at the Gap towards the ocean and back towards the city. There are a few options to eat there including the legendary Doyles as well as less expensive take away options as well as the Watsons Bay Hotel to sit and relax in the beer garden.The trip up the Parramatta river takes you to the west of Sydney where many travellers don't get to but it is an eye opening trip with many views of suburban Sydney.If you have the time I thoroughly recommend both these destinationsChoose a nice sunny day when the harbour truly dazzles

Harbour Highlights. Best day is SUNDAYS. Grab the family and cruise the beautiful waterways to Parramatta or the feel the ocean breeze on the journey to Manly. $2.50 Family Fun Day on Sundays. Best bargain for budget conscience families

Very Friendly. Easy access felt comfortable during our ride would highly recommend this way of transportation. Our family utilized this mode of transportation on our way to the Zoo we did not have to wait to long in either direction on the day we went to visit.

Great way to see Sydney from the Harbour Ferries. Whether you live in Sydney or are a visitor jump on a Sydney ferry for a great view of the city from the harbour. You can get an all day or three day or more pass which enables you to get on and off and to take several different ferries to various destinations.i.e. Ferry to Taronga Zoo or to Manly, Watsons Bay etc.

Transport to work. If I had more time each day I'd be catching the ferry everyday. The trip from Manly in any weather, but probably fine weather is best, is just amazing as you past the harbour beaches and take in the scenery. Don't have tour head down in your phone the whole trip across, takenin what the world has to offer!

One of the best ways to see the city.. Ferries run from Circular Quay Wharf and are frequent. We took the ferry to Darling Harbour and had lovely views of The Opera House, Luna Park and Balmain Wharf. Ferry to Manly is a great trip.

Manly Ferry. Take the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Wharf for the best value Harbour tour in the city. It's a great way to see the Harbour City from its best angle and definitely the cheapest! Even if you only have a few hours in Sydney you can take the train to Circular Quay from Airport take the ferry ride over to Manly and back and explore the harbour front and Opera House. A MUST for all visitors !

Manly ferrie. The trip over to manly was wonderful the driver was talking to us telling us all about the history and all land marks and was grate and the first time me and the kids had been on it I got more information on this ferry then I did on a tour guides one

See the Festivities from the Ferry. We boarded the Manly Ferry at Circular Quay at the dock, the staff were helpful and attentive. The trip over to Manly was exciting and exhilarating to see the sights of Sydney from the harbour and to see all of the hustle and bustle from the water. The ferry made a great way to get to a wonderful destination of Manly.

The hop on and off is terrific!. A fantastic way to see the entire harbor. A guide narrates during the cruise, and you visit a number of small ports along the coast. A great way to get to the Taronga Zoo!

love Manly always something going on there including good music good food good fun. as a senior I Travelled from circular quay to Manly on a Saturday ,as I had already purchased a train ticket ! I was very pleased to find my ticket was valid all day on Bus Train and Ferry. After returning to the quay I again took a ferry to darling harbour ... Too easy.

Great harbour and city views. Very easy to navigate, in my view best city and harbour views for a few dollars. The ferry system is very efficient and actually much better then taking the bus. Take the time to take the ferry to the city at sunset it will be worth it - some of my greatest photos of the bridge and the Opera House.

Good transport. We used the ferry service nearly every day of our holiday, a great way to get about the waters of Sydney, Manly to Circular Quay, we loved it. you can use a day travel pass on all the ferries.
This is the one!. Not only is this means of transport easy, convenient and safe it is also totally integrated into the rest of the public transport solutions in Sydney, and it works!

Fun way to see Sydney. The Rivercat is a fun way to see the city of Sydney along its numerous neighborhoods dotted along the coves and river banks. Plying on the Parramatta river all the way from Parramatta to Circular Quay is the longest ferry route with fascinating structures and homes along the way. The other routes are Manly cove and Taronga Zoo connecting the various coves of Sydney beyond the harbor.

Fantastic!. Used the ferry a number of times during our stay. Fantastic way to travel across the harbour, with beautiful views, particularly if you can get a seat on the deck. On Sundays they have a special family day where all tickets purchased are only $2.50. To be used all day on any bus, train or ferry service. Great idea for more affordable transport.

A short enjoyable trip to many of the main attractions Sydney has to offer.. The ferries were on time well co-ordinated and a cheap way to travel. I found some of the signage confusing, if you do ask a staff member, they were more than happy to help. We were able to get to may of the main attractions and Luna Park. You can sit outside or in and it is a very comfortable enjoyable trip.
Ferries are good. A greta way to travel the Harbour. Good way also of getting around the Darling Harbour vicinity. They are a good way too of taking good photo shots of the Bridge and Opera House.

To Manly and back.. Sydney Harbour, Wow !!
For just a few dollars caught the the Manly Ferry, had Fish & Chips on the beach front at Manly Beach, lots of interesting shops, and the return journy back to the Quay.
The sun shone and the Opera House glissened, the Harbour Bridge stood out in all its glory.

captain cooks highlights. best ferry trip ive ever taken....
had a wonderfull trip around the harbour. and saw all the great parts of the sydney waterside

Transportation on the Sydney Ferries. Sydney Ferries make it easier to get around, and the ride is a fun trip for the kids. There was also a canteen on the ferry to purchase drinks and snacks from which was handy for our hour long ferry ride with 2 children. The toilets however were quite dirty.

Fast, good value and not too sea sick!. Great service and the only way to get around the tourist attractions. We bought a return ticket and found out that we should have bought a day ticket, the ticket lady was wonderful, gave us a full refund of our day ticket and then we bought the day ticket, couldn't be more helpful.
Always on time and great way to get around.. It's easy to use and works quite well. Many ferries run on the half hour so there's little wait. And oh, the views.

Great harbour and city views . We found the ferry to be very easy to use and a great way to see picture perfect views of Sydney. We took the ferry to Manly and back which was lovely. We returned to the city at sunset which was gorgeous seeing the orange sky behind the Harbour bridge, the city lights begin to turn on and excellent views of the Opera House. We also took a ferry back from Watson's bay. Highly recommend it. You can use the Opal card which is so easy.

Sydney Ferries. Went to Clark Island via Sydney Ferries. Pleasant to be on the harbour. The ferries do the job and are part of Sydneys history...very basic. Not sure if there are any 'modern ferries'. A little bit of nostalgia as they are the only ferries I have been on since a child.
Easy way to travel. We mostly used the ferries to get around Sydney. We found them easy to navigate and convenient. Signage was good and using the Opal card was an efficient way of getting around.

Quick and Easy. The ferry system in Sydney is well organized and vey easy to use.The ferry's take you to various places including the zoo, and you get great views of Sydney Harbour and the Harbour bridge.
Great views of Sydney harbor. It is worth riding these clean, efficient ferries just for the views. Couple it with a ride to the zoo or one of the beach areas and it is a home run.

Very good service. Brilliant service. We came on family day and paid 2,50 aus$ per ticket. We could ride on all public transport all day. Fab idea and the ferries are very efficient to get you from one place to the next.
Cruise the simple life of Sydney Ferries. Love travelling on the ferries, to Taronga and Manly. Only the best in views and scenery. They just seem to suit, no matter what mood you are in.
Reliable and good for harbour trip. Took the ferry to Manly. Ferry left on time, good 30 min trip over. Ferry is pretty big, we had plenty of space, could sit in our out side.

Great way to get around, best Sydney harbour and Opera house views. Ferries are old school but pretty née, they add character to the Sydney harbour. Also with Opal card on Sundays you can travel super cheap with ferries as whole day on any transport costs only AUD 2.50 on Sundays. And with opal card you don't have to wait in line for tickets. I really like taking a leisurely ferry ride.
Traveling from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour. This was another good experience but we had not long disembarked from our cruise to Sydney so still had sea legs recovering:)

Relaxing...... I'm amazed how efficient the Sydney Ferries System transport by the hundreds of locals and tourist alike each time from one place to another. It was a pleasant and relaxing experience. You can view and take picture of your fav scenic spots too. Want to do it again if ever we go back to Sydney.

Cheap fast way to see Sydney. A day pass on Sydney ferries will get you to a lot of different Sydney attractions in a comfortable way and give you vantage view of Sydney harbor, Opera House and the Harbor Bridge among others. It can also be used on the trains and buses in the city and is an incredible steal at just $24 AED !

Like being a tourist in your own home. We fortunately live 5 minutes walk from the ferry which takes us straight to circular quay. We love coming around the corner to the sight of the harbour bridge and opera house. A wonderful experience- even just jumping on and off to see other parts of sydney is fantastic.

Cheapest Sydney Cruise you'll get . The Ferry system in Sydney is first class. So easy to use and during a long weekend away we mainly used a ferry between circular quay and darling harbour. As we don't live in NSW, we organised an Opal pass on-line had had them posted to us. They were so easy to use, tapping on & off as you got on & off the ferries. Most "stations" has a little screen with the next ferry & a count down to its arrival. The views of Luna Park, the Bridge & the Opera House as you are on the ferry are unbelievable. And considering you are only paying public transport prices; it's the cheapest cruise in Sydney.

Night Ferry ride. We had Seniors tickets for buses, trains and ferries and just for the fun of it we chose to go on the fery from Circular Quay to Mosman and back. Took some great photos of SHB, Opera House and Luna Park from the ferry and it didn't cost much at all.

Loved it!. We loved taking the many ferries across Sydney Harbour including the ferry to Darling Harbour and Manly. The ferries are well run, afford great views, and are relatively inexpensive. You can use your Opal card to get around (the Opal card can be used on other forms of mass transit as well).
Sydney Ferries - See the Harbour. This is a fabulous way to get around Harbour. Also a great trip from Circular Quay to Manly or visa versa.

Sydney Ferries. Experienced the ferry to Manly Beach and another to Darling Harbor both from Circular Quay.These were effective ways to travel with beautiful views. they run frequently and are reasonably priced.

Always a highlight of any Sydney visit. A trip on a Sydney Ferry is always a highlight of our visits to Sydney. We recently did one ferry trip to Darling Harbour and one to Manly. It is great value for seeing the Harbour and other Sydney bays and inlets. The trip to Darling Harbour took us under the Harbour Bridge to Luna Park and then on to Darling Harbour, which gives easy access to the Darling Harbour shopping precinct. It is great to sit outside on the ferry on a fine day and enjoy the scenic and ever-changing Sydney skyline, especially around the new Barangaroo development.
sydney harbor bridge on cheap. catch ferry from darling harbor to circular quay and get a great view of going under the bridge withoutthe price tag of expensive tour
What a Way to get around. some of the best transist service I have experienced. Just like other harbor cities. Easy to understand and manuver.

Ferries for a Quick Commute in the city. The best mode of commuting in the city! Right from Sydney Opera House. The best part is to travel on a Sunday Funday Pass which entitles all public transport on Sundays for a Family @ $2.5 where you can save a lot. The ferries are quick and well managed.
A day out with friends. We caught the ferry to Kirribilli and walked to the Kirribilli Club. What a wonderful way to,see Sydney and the harbour. A must for any visited to Sydney.

Low cost option for tourists to see the best scenery in Sydney. Low cost option for tourists to see the best scenery in Sydney up close. Ferries go all over and will take you across town in a few minutes while enjoying the views. Take at least one across the harbour to Bondi Beach so you can see the Opera House in all its magnificence from the water side, the Harbour Bridge, Circular Quay, etc.

Famous Ferries.. Sydney ferries are a really good way to travel around Sydney and are a less expensive way of touring the Sydney Harbour. There is a fast ferry to Manly and back to Circular Quay or the old ferry which takes longer but gives more time to see the heads and surrounding harbour suburbs. In nice weather an enjoyable way to see the harbour Opera House and Harbour Bridge.

You can never have enough of these ferries. The ferry boat itself is no big deal: it is a nice but yet ordinary boat. However the scenery is unique and the whole experience is incredible. I used the ferries many times when I was in Sydney and I enjoyed every time. Don't miss them!

Can't get enough of it... Best choice to experience the Harbour's spirit.. My family and I travelled on several ferries. Day an night times! Never regretted. They ran on time and it is a good way to see the Sydney Harbour and the surrounding suburbs closed to the Harbour. We travelled from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour, Manly, back and forth. Will travel again in these ferries for our next visit, for sure!

Brilliant service. Used the ferries regular to go to tarronga zoo, Manley and North Syndey, we also went on a night cruise around the harbour which was really good seeing all the lights of Sydney. Dislikes try not to travel in rush hour

Trip Down Under. Quant little ferries which are constantly on the go around the harbour. We had spectacular view of the bridge & Sydney Opera House from one of these. Also had a lovely lunch on board.

Sydney Ferries. We travelled on several ferries. They ran on time and it is a good way to see some of Sydney. We travelled from Circular Quay to Glebe Island on a ferry put on free for the Sydney Craft and Quilt show. The ferry was wheelchair and pram friendly.

Sydney Ferries. After going on so many of the Ferries a lot at Sydney I loved how fast it went going from Sydney Circular Quay to Manly and then Manly to Sydney Circular Quay was so much fun as the view is awesome.

Unique view. It´s a easy way to reach Taronga Zoo and the only one to Cockatoo Island.The timetable is punctual so it's easy to define your day trip.While passing through the waters you'll see a unique view of Opera House and Harbour Bridge.A must have point to go.

Great way to see the shoreline. We did this to see Watson's Beach. Doing this on a Sunday meant we could get a Family Funday ticket ($2.50 for travel on the entire network). The ferry gave an excellent (and fast) view of the seaside. We returned by bus (and this was a bit long) but did see Bondi beach.
River cat. Always on time, clean and a relaxing way to travel to and from the city. However a few more could run late at night.

Cruisin'. We bought a one week, one zone pass and got unlimited rides on the very, buses & inner city trains. We rode the ferry a few times everyday and went on every route. Very relaxing & scenic. The price is right, too. Manly was our favorite trip and we did it 3 times.Sitting outside in the sun and sea air is awesome, but if you are sitting by the bow to/from Manly beware of waves crashing over the bow and soaking you.

Great. Taking a ferry through the harbor is a great way to experience it! Much cheaper than a cruise along harbor. Plus you can take several ferries to various parts of the city saving time and money from buses/taxies etc. Well worth looking into. I took ferry to Targona Zoo...great ride with amazing views. You can stand outside as well.

Cheapest harbour cruise you'll ever get. Recommend taking the Manly ferry return trip. These are the best views of Sydney Harbour and surrounds your gonna get at rock bottom prices. Sunday the ferries are capped at $2.50 all day.
Handy . A handy service to get to Manly, taronga zoo and cockatoo island. Some a ferries are very old looking and add a little something special to riding one.
Very nice. It is a very nice way to travel, you can see amazing sights and as a person coming from Lebanon the whole ferry experience was new to me and amazing.

Great way to see the Harbour. Take a ferry to Manly, walk over to the surf beach and Shelley Beach, take a ferry back to the Quay. Take a short trip over to Cremorne Wharf and walk around to Mosman wharf. Take a commuter ferry to Rose bay and ogle the real estate, or a Rivercat to Parramatta and check out Sydney's vibrant second centre - with great Indian restaurants.

Sydney Harbour Sightseeing. A quick convenient, inexpensive way to to see Sydney Harbour is get on board a boat, take the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay. It's fun during stormy weather when there's a big swell coming through the heads. Manly and return, plenty of lovely walks and eating places, the return is spectacular with up close views of the bridge and opera house.

Best way to see Sydney! . As well as a convenient way to travel to the city, Sydney ferries offer the best way to see the city from the Habour! There are outstanding views of the Habour Bridge and Opera house from most ferry routes and the atmosphere aboard the ferry is great.
cheap. What a way to see Sydney Harbour. The ferries are really cheap and they give you a wonderful view of all the major sights of Sydney.

Circular Quay to Manly . I live in Sydney but Ferries are not my daily transportation. That's why I still enjoy the atmosphere it brings to me. I particular like the route Circular Quay to Manly. During weekend, you can see yachts and boats on a sunny day. Great for photo shooting from any angles of the ferry. You can enjoy the freeze if you sit on the deck, it's amazing. There is a part that the harbour water join the ocean near Manly. You can feel the waves that makes you feel like you are on a open ocean for 5 mins which is not too long in case you get sea sick. Overall I love Sydney Ferries and it makes difference for the Sydney tour
Comvenient and Scenic. Sydney ferries seem like a blast from the past. They a convenient and relatively cheap way to see Sydney Harbour with a bit of nostalgia from the majestic old ferries.

A slow harbour trip. If you want to have a relaxing ride on the harbour go on the ferry.
You may fancy a trip to the zoo, a beach destination such as Manly or just indulge in a round trip.If this sounds like you a trip by ferry is a must do while in Sydney.

day out in manly. A nice boat ride it was a pretty much calm day you go past lots of other places in sydney last time we saw a water plane land you can get photos of the harbour bridge and opera house and manly is a great place to visit

A nice ferry experience. It was an awesome experience to travel to Manly Island via Ferry. They are well connected and it will be a real picturesque experience. You need to get tickets from counter. On weekends the queue will be long. But the ferries are huge and it can carry almost 200 + paxs

getting around in Sydney. Just love the Sydney ferries. A great way to see Sydney from the water. The experience of just being on these ferries and getting around the harbour is amazing. The staff are very helpful in helping you get on the right one. A great form of transport

Cinematic. Half an hour of the most picturesque harbour in the world, is a great way to pass time and see much of Sydney's delights. From the Harbour Bridge, up past where the rich people live, round to the entrance to the Harbour, then gently into Manly Wharf................a must for not only travelers, but anyone who delights in spectacular scenery!

Best ride in Sydney. Take the ferry to Manly from circular quay and back. This is the best way to see Sydney harbour.
On bright sparkling day you understand why this is the best Harbour in the world in the best city in the world.

Value for money. Sydney ferries is a must for visitors. Clean, not expensive, well connected and you can choose from a river catamaran to a fair size, multi level ferry. Best of all, you get to view and enjoy the very heart and soul of Sydney, its harbour.

Nice scenery of sydney City. The best way to see Sydney is to jump on the ferry, just buy a day pass, and you can travel by train bus ferry all day, If I can remember day passes are around $22 AUD, and Sunday's they have $2 AUD all day family day specials.

Great way to get around Sydney. Offer's an affordable and scenic option for travelling around Sydney.
Caught the ferry over to Luna Park, most of the ferries are two storey with in/outside seating.

worth catching to get some views of the bridge and opera house. at the end of the day it's just a ferry ....they get very full as you can imagine for a tourist hot spot such as sydney.
however it is definetly worth catching the ferry even if it's just between Circular Quay and Darling harbour as the view is amazing and you get some great unobstructed views of the landmarks
Great Choice. Ferries are a great option to travel to numerous places: Luna park, manly beach or even just getting a return ticket and staying on the ferry to soak up the atmosphere.

Easy way to see the Harbour without the high price tag. Easy way to get around the harbour with ferries going non stop from the terminal. Very easy to read the timetable and work out which ferry to catch. Nice way to see Sydney.

Great ride. These ferries go every 10 mins so there is no rush, we jumped on and just cruised around and got to see the city from the water. The staff are helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend you go for a ride.
nice experience but not the best option for transport. theres heaps of whales out there n the ferries interrupt the whales n they even knock them off coz their going too fast so i would recommend it

A great way to see the Harbour.. On my recent visit to Sydney I took a trip on the ferry up river to Parramatta just to see another side of the greater Sydney waterway. This trip started at Circular Quay and Proceeded under the Bridge to Darling Harbour and then on up to Parramatta stopping at all the little landings, with a marvellous collection of names picking up and dropping passengers at each one. As we progressed we left the city behind and eventually arrived at Parramatta where I disembarked and had a nice lunch before getting another sailing back to Circular Quay. It was a dull day and I traveled on deck without sun protection. Result, a severely sunburned head. Beware!

A great way to see one of the world's most attractive cities. I took the ferry to Manly and back for AUD 15.20 - money well spent. On the way you will see all the great sights around Sydney Harbour, and feel the Pacific swell too. The same probably applies to the other ferries, but at Manly you can walk from the ferry terminal to the Pacific Ocean in just five minutes and watch the breakers and the surfers.
They do the job. They may not be very attractive but we did not have any dramas with the Sydney Ferries just sat back and enjoyed the view whilst travelling to the next stop

Busy little ships that are fun. You can take one of these old green and yellow ferries to many places on Sydney Harbour. Though old these little tubs are very efficient and ply the waters all day and half the night too. Though basic, they are comfortable and cheap and a very easy way to get to some of the beautiful beaches north of the harbour and all places in between. Just a short trip will take you directly to the zoo, fun park or Darling Harbour just around the corner from The Rocks.
taronga zoo visit. lovely teller gave us the ferry ticket and zoo ticket and great directions and service. She was very helpful to us tourists who didn't know there way around

Reliable and cost effective. We find the ferries a great way to see the sights of Sydney! They are always on time, the transport passes include them and they have protected undercover cabins to sit in when the weather isn't in your favour. I always make time for a ferry trip when visiting Sydney!
Go on some ferry, great views to Sydney harbour. Go on some ferry, lot's of great views to Sydney harbour, bridge and Opera house. Some of ferries are nice old boats.

A Sydney Icon. We recently spent 10 days in Sydney and found the ferry service a perfect way to get around. Always on time, its a very relaxing way to see the sights of the Harbour. If visiting for a week or so l recommend buying a pass. Its very economical with bus trips included as well. We travelled as far as Parramatta to the west and right through to Manly with the pass we bought.
Old, but gold!. Caught the Circular Quay to Manly at 6pm and it was great! Very wavy that at one point we were ready to swim, but unfortunately it didn't happen!

The best way to get to the Zoo. I took the ferry from Circular Quay to Taronga Zoo and it was a very pleasant experience. I got there 15 minutes early worried that I will need time to purchase the ticket and find the right ferry, but it all took less than a minute. The quay is very well organized, the monitors explain everything very clearly, the ferry is comfortable and the ride is very short, only 11 minutes to the zoo. It costs $12 for a round trip ticket, which is an excellent way to get to the zoo, preferable to driving.
Sydney Ferries. Get an Opal card at any news agency and you can get on/off with ease. The monitors are clear and easy to follow. Plus the ferries have THE BEST views of Sydney Harbour.

Cheap cruise, and effective connections. Being there for a week, the Opal card maxed-out at $60 per week or $15 per day, so load it up, cruise wherever and whenever you want, and don't even bother with a rental car!

Ferries. There is no better, cheaper, way to see Sydney from the water than by ferry. Pensioners can get a day pass for all ferries for $2.50. The best ride is the 30 minute trip from Circular Quay to Manly.

Secret way to great photographs of Sydney's iconic spots. This was my seventh visit to Sydney in the last 18 years. And I always tried to take photos of Darling Harbour, Sydney Harbour Bridge, Opera House and Circular Quay but there were hordes of tourists. I discovered that taking the ferries was the best way to take shots from different angles of these beautiful places. I suggest buying a pass for your stay and making the most of it for the trains, buses, ferries to save your painful feet from carrying photo gear -- even with mirrorless cameras nowadays.

Go sightseeing on the Ferryjl. The ferry system in Sydney Harbor, is an excellent way to see the area, use an Opal Pass and the maximum cost is $15.00 per day, $2.50 on Sunday. The Hop On / Hop Off Ferry costs $40 , you can do the same thing on the Sydney Ferry system. Buy an Opal Pass, I started with $20.00, you can recharge it as needed and it's good on Busses, Trains & Ferries in the Sydney system.

Best way to enjoy the city. An easy decision - drive to the city with all the stresses and parking problems or enjoy a harbour trip. A wonderful way to enjoy the best of Sydney and the variety of sights.Saw VIVID and all the changing colours of the Opera House light show from the ferry and it was magnificent.

"A great way to get around Sydney". We took ferries from Circular Quay to Manley Beach, Watsons Bay and to the Toronga Zoo. They are efficient, fast and reasonably priced with good schedules. It was only about 12 minutes to the zoo. There are great views of downtown Sydney, the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge from any of the ferries. Circular Quay was within easy walking distance of our hotel. This is a fabulous way of getting around to many of Sydney's attractions.

Great Transportation. You can take the ferries almost anywhere in Sydney and they are never late. The best part is that a lot of them offer free wi-fi for your trip. You can combine with buses for a day pass that is very nice too

Circular Quay to Star City. Great way to see the harbour, and get dropped off directly in front of the casino. It takes about 15-20 minutes depending on the crowds. Great to do on a Sunday for only $2.50
Easy to navigate. Completely unintimidating to figure out how to use the ferries to get to the several interesting communities nearby.
So handy to get around. Love all of these ferries. Get you all over the harbour from one side to the other and of course on a clear day you can take heaps of photos from different angles.

Fantastic way to see Sydney!. The Sydney ferries are a cheap and efficient way to see Sydney and its outer reaches. Just hop on and hop off any time with a daily pass, great in conjunction with the also very efficient train service!!

Ferries of Sydney. Another iconic element of Sydney. No need for a timetable. All you need to do is get to a departure point.They leave regularly, not a long wait. You can treat it like a hop on hop off bus travelling from point to point and see the sights all Sydney Harbour has to offer.
Fabulous way to get around.. Just hop on and hop off the best way to get around Sydney and its surrounding areas. And all so cheap!

These ferries are fantastic and cheap.. Spent a few hours traveling around Sydney Harbour in winter's sun. This is the best way to get around in Sydney if you have time to enjoy the beautiful scenery. The best way to see the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Also loved the whole thing.
Great View of Sydney. A great view of Sydney, service is pretty efficient but you need to ask people on how to get around or you may get on the wrong ferry.

easy and fun way of getting around. Ferries are boarded at Circular Quay . They get you to Manley Beach, the zoo and several other places. Tickets are bought in booths just before boarding and are not expensive. The frequency of departures is short and the boats are well kept. You sail under the bridge and have a nice view of the Opera house
Grand Trip. A lovely iconic trip with great views. Well equipped with a cafe and toilets. Sit back, relax and watch the beautiful harbour go by. A must do.
great way to see the harbour. the best way to see the harbour for the cost of a trip on the Manly ferry. If the weather is good get a seat outside up the front its the best view.

Nice. I nice way to see Sydney harbour without paying for a separate harbour cruise.
They travel at a nice pace so you can see a lots and they stop in many places for hop on, hop off every 20-30 mins.
Took ferry to view Vivid Lights. Went from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour and back again to view Vivid Light Festival. Was great! could get a could view of lights.

Fun way of getting around Sydney. Rode the ferry a few times while in Sydney, mainly between Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, and Manly Beach. Getting on it and paying couldn't have been easier. I used my Opal card (get one if you are going to use public transportation in Sydney) to tap on and pay. Not only did it get me where I wanted to go, it offered some cool photo ops of the Sydney Opera House (Circular Quay to Manly Beach line) and the harbor.

great service. the ferry services are a great way to get around sydney. we used it for manly one day and watsons bay another day. should get an opel card. it is sooo easy to tap on and tap off ferries, trains, buses and the lightrail. obviously the best views are on the ferries.
The Harbour Travel. Efficient Cheaper Transportation around Sydney .. most importantly it is not bad way to sight seeing
Lovely view.. The Manly ferry always has spectacular views when the weather is nice. The staff are a bit grumpy but it's a cheap way to get an awesome view of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House.

Rose Bay to circular quay. Not a regular but works well with great views. Ferries much better then used to be. Very convenient when travelling to the city. Opel card still not clear where to punch in and out as not well signposted.

Ok with great views. It can be excellent or really bad. I have different experience evry time I took the ferry. Sometimes its freezing cold sometime the air-con doesn't work. The views from the ferry are amazing.

Sydney Ferries are a better way of transport. On time, neat and clean, very well organised, this is a much better way to reach places like Taronga zoo, Manly beach and other tourist attractions in Sydney.

Family Bicycle touring towing trailer with 3 year old.. Caught the ferry from Darling Harbour down to Homebush Bay for some cycling. Easy to get on from main ferry terminals as the gangplanks are wide enough ad long enough to wheel my bike + trailer (Burley D'Lite) which is quite a wide load. Had assistance from helpful crew to pull it apart inside so it was out of the way for other commuters. (Handy hint: take an occy strap as you can easily tie bike to things as you travel). NOTE: when disembarking at smaller terminals the ferry uses an onboard version of a gangplank which is narrower. I could wheel my bike off, but the deckhands had to help me lift the trailer off the ferry onto the wharf. Ive done this a few times now and there are ALWAYS helpful Sydney commuters and ferry workers eager to assist. Ferries are a wonderful way to see more of Sydney and great fun for the young kids.

Get a Day Trip Ticket. More cost effective to get a day trip ticket and then catch a ferry around the harbor, back and out to towards Olympic Park and then a take a ferry trip at night across to Manly for dinner. We had about 4 separate trips in one day and saw all of Sydney Harbor. However, they didn't accept my sons' high school student card (despite coming from interstate) for concession rates which resulted in us paying an adult fares.

Captain Cook Came Through. We did the Sydney Harbour hop-on hop-off and we really enjoyed our voyages. We started late in the afternoon and were able to continue the next day because it was a 24-hour ticket. We had great weather and that certainly helped, but each ferry stop was great.

Always on time and great value public transport. When in Sydney you must try this way of site-seeing and moving fast in this every growing metropolis. Great trips can be planned. Also, when traveling with a bike you can ask to accommodate this on a ferry trip. Great value for money too, especially when using the Opal card.

Easy to navigate. The Sydney Ferries are so easy to find and navigate. They have signs to tell you which wharf to go to for each attraction. We took the ferry to the Taronga Zoo, it was quick and simple.
Rainy day. Staff very helpful explained the opal card to first time users. Sadly day very wet and grey but very easy service to use, clean boat service ran right on time

Comfortable and cheap sightseeing. Both Inner Harbour and longer cruises to places like Manly are a very leisurely ways to see the magnificent Sydney Harbour. The ferries are frequent, cheap, clean and relatively comfortable.

Ferries. Excellent service on the Sydney ferries , buy one of the opal cards and just swipe on and off as you board it's so easy , use for the buses and trains as well it's definitely easy to get around , manly balmain darling harbour cockatoo island are easy destinations to while away a few hours

Brilliant. What can be said about Sydney Ferries... Bloody fantastic!!! It's a fantastic way to see the harbour by day and by night. Everyone of the staff we came across were really friendly. It's a must for everyone who has the opportunity to get to Sydney.

We love the Ferries. Sydney's ferries are fantastic! You are soooo lucky to have such transport that can get you around the Harbour. Fantastic views no matter where you sit. We always make sure we go on a few trips on the Ferries, especially to Manly and Darling Harbour.

Great way to get around.. We bought two all day passes costing $48 to which we could use the ferries, trains,buses and light rail until 4am. We headed off on the ferrie to Darling Harbour getting off at The Star Casino. We walked through the farmers market and around to the other side of the harbour getting back on at Darling Harbour and headed back to Circular Quay . This is a lovely way to see Sydney's beautiful Harbour. The staff were very friendly and the ferries are very punctual .

Great way to see the harbour!. Sydney's ferry system is exceptional. Perfect way for visitors to Sydney to explore the harbourside, plenty of stops and very handy to other transport modes, such as the train system and buses. We bought OPAL cards on arrival, and found these to be indispensable.
Good way to explore the Harbour. Quite enjoyed the rides. The ferries are clean.Kids love it.Its a good way to explore the harbour with your family
Lovely trips. All ferries give you excellent views of Sydney & surrounding areas. Pick nice sunny days that aren't windy & you will thoroughly enjoy yourself.
Manly Ferry. Always a great trip, seeing the harbour etc.Had a bucket of prawns and some scollops at Hotel Steyne {hope i have spelt it correctly} and a couple of beers - Really good.
Easy sightseeing. A very relaxing ride around circular quay with alot of sights to take in before passing under the harbour bridge and docking just around the corner from the opera house

Harbour delights. Take a ferry or cat to Watson's Bay, Darling Harbour, the Parramatta River, Taronga Zoo or the mansions of Cremorne and Mosman.Go ashore, enjoy a walk, sip a coffee and breathe the unpolluted air, the clear and healthy waterways and the majestic sight that is Sydney from the water. Nothing compares, anywhere. And if you are a Senior, all for $2.50. Well done NSW government.
Relaxing on the water.. So relaxing to sit back & watch the world go by.very clean.easy to use wheelchair friendly.Many different trips to choose from.Great way to spend a day on the water.

Don't miss. Another not to be missed, reasonable priced, often overlook attraction. you don't have to go far, even a short trip in summer or in winter will give you an insight of commuter life in Sydney.
By the Great Coathanger. Interesting area where you can see the big liners at anchor and also the little ferries that zip around Sydney Harbour. This area is very popular and very crowded.

Great way to get around Sydney. We have been on family holidays to Sydney a couple of times and we have found the Sydney Ferries to be a fun and convenient way to explore Sydney Harbour. Whether that be the ferry to Manly, Rose Bay or a quick ride from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour, the ferries were a cost effective means of transport with fantastic views of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and other Sydney attractions.

Our ferry trip to Rose Bay.. Very easy to find the pier, the times and to negotiate the ticketing system. Ferry was super clean, roomy and comfortable. Enjoyable trip during daylight. Lots to see. Trip back in the evening was special because VIVID was starting up. That was a real treat!
a must in Sydney!. when in Sydney you must at least hop on a ferry once! Its great seeing them coming and going into Circular Quay.
Must do on every Sydney stay. I love the ferry !!!! I dont care where I go ,I take a return trip to see a different part of the harbour,especially good when the weather is good!
Hair expo and short break. Was very handy to catch ferry over to different places the sightseeing was perfect and very relaxing on boat and as for fare wise was quite reasonable

Personal public transport. The ferry service from Circular Quay to Luna Park and then onto Darling harbour is the only way to travel to get a great view of the city and the harbour at the same time. Ferry tickets are cheap, the boats are clean and the services are regular and reliable. This is a great way to travel the waterways and see the sights.

If you don't take a ferry somewhere, you haven't visited Sydney!. Ferries are as ubiquitous to Sydney as the New York subway, the London tube, and the Paris metro. Except on the ferries you get to get grand views of Sydney's massive harbor, iconic structures like the Opera House and Bridge, and the rivers that take you inland. And you can travel to Manly, Bondi Beach, Darling Harbour, and a host of other places. On a sunny day like we had, the boat ride is as much a part of the fun as the place you are visiting!

Fun Experience to get around Sydnet and see some of the sights. We enjoyed utilizing the ferries to go from Sydney Harbor to Darling Harbor. it was also a great way to see the Opera House, Bridge and skyline. Well worth the cost.

Love Sydney Ferries. But very busy for Vivid & often long queues to get on, if planning a trip, avoid busy periods, on our return trip, our ferry was full and had to bypass many wharves & leave passengers waiting

Reliable for transportation and for great views of the harbour!. I used the ferries a couple of times, and it was a very reliable method of transportation to get to where you want to go! There is wifi on the ferry as well!
Travel with frends. I like very much all around houses parks nice to be in such events of place not much to say you have to see b your self
Efficient. Took the ferry to Manly. The ferry was large, comfortable and had incredible views. The ferry TO Manly had wifi, while the ferry back to Circular Quay did not. No complaints at all.

A great way to see parts of the harbour. Sydney harbour is a gorgeous location and taking a ferry to WAtson's Bay or Taronga Park Zoo or other areas give a visitor a different perspective on the city.

Sydney by Ferry. Take a ferry to Manly for fish and chips by the beach, take a ferry to Taronga Zoo or up the Parramatta River for a day trip.
Its all very scenic, easy access, and a different way to see the city and its surrounds.

Fun Trip. We went on a trip aboard the "Narrabeen" ferry to manly. The ship had an over-priced cafe on board, however the ship was nice and relatively new with the furnishings, making it a great day out

Parramatta River Rivercat. Easter 2015 saw some absolutely wonderful weather. We took advantage of the beautiful Easter Sunday weather and jumped on a rivercat ferry at Rydalmere. We enjoyed a breathtaking view of the homes and parks along the Parramatta River all the way to Circular Quay. The Rivercat was packed with tourists, many of which could not speak English. Cameras clicked and everyone enjoyed themselves for the 45 minutes express ride.
A great way to experience the Harbour. Stayed at Watsons Bay and taking the ferry is a much more pleasant experince to get to the city than tackling traffic and parking

Exploring Sydney what a way to go.. Using the ferries must be the most economical and refreshing way to explore Sydney. Taronga Zoo is just across the harbour from the Sydney Opera House, Cockle Bay and Darling Harbour and The Star casino are just a quick trip under the Sydney Harbour Bridge and round the corner. Manly Beach is an exciting ride across the mouth of Sydney Harbour Heads. Or you can travel upstream along the Parramatta River to the Sydney Olympic Park to watch a football game. Or travel further into Parramatta itself. Great way to view this wonderful city.

Great way to travel. Used a ferry during Vivid to move between Circular Quay and Darling Harbour around 9.30pm on a Friday night. Such a beautiful way to enjoy the lights from the water. Service was fast and efficient. Deckhand on wharf was friendly and cheerful and obviously loving the increased numbers of people using the ferries at this time of night. Much better that travelling by road. Great work Sydney Ferry staff!!
Good Transport. There are no problems with Sydney Ferries. With an event like Vivid, some of the best views are from the ferries. I took this photo last Thursday night.

Experience everyone should try. The crossing across the harbour is wonderful and one of the best photo opportunities you will ever have the ferries are busy but everyone is friendly we were given ice lollies by a lady with her family who didn't speak English but shared with us her son gave up his seat for me on one ferry trip on another we met people from England now living in NZ a great way to meet people and see the sights a good cheap way to travel around

Great way to see Sydney. I took a $24 one day pass and saw all of Sydney harbour from Manly to Parramatta and had brunch at Manly overlooking the beach. It's much cheaper than a Harbour cruise and you can get on and off.

Essential experience. Just spend a day travelling on random ferries but make sure you do the Circular Quay to Manly. If your not staying in Manly take your swimmers & allow a few hours. Its a 3 min walk to from ferry to the ocean beach. Manly beach has minimal tides, is the most accessable sea beach
Economical and efficient . A great and easy way to get around Sydney with the Opal card and Opal App for phone. Nice views, restrooms and snacks all a plus.
Multiple trips. A wonderful thing about Sydney is the ferry system. The cost is minimal and it is very convenient. It made day tripping a breeze.

By far the best way to explore Sydney. I found ferry the best way to explore Sydney. You will save money and will have a a lot od fun. The ferries go almost everywhere. My favorite place on the trip was the Manly Beach.

Top Notch. Outstanding service. Hailing from Seattle, Washington, USA I am familiar with ferry systems. Sydney's passenger ferry system is incredibly efficient, reliable, and easy. Ferries run often, and the OPAL card makes payment easy.

Take the seven mile ferry trip to Manly. The trip from Circular Quay over top Manly is a must-do. One you have got your bearings at the Quay then take a trip to Manly on one of the iconic double-ended ferries. It's as good as the tourist cruises and is an authentic local resident style of experience. Once you get to manly take the short walk along the 'Corso' (the Causeway) through to the view out over the Tasman Sea. Then find somewhere with that view for lunch, such as the front bar of the Steyne Hotel.

Great way to see the Harbour. Used Sydney Ferries on a recent trip to Sydney. It's a great way to see the Harbour and is relative cheap. The ferries are clean and have a certain charm to them. Would love to use them again.
RR,S trip. Ferries on time and clean. The trip to Parramatta on the Cat is a worthwile experience.Wonderful views of many and varied sites both old and new on the trip.

CAR FREE. What a great way to explore Sydney. We were down for the Tottenham game, parked our car at our accommodation and proceeded for the next three days to travel by ferry to Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and the Sydney Olympic Stadium and to watch the vivid festival at night. A stress free weekend. Having the Opal Card was a bonus.

Great Service. Ferries always ran on time. Staff generally were very friendly and helpful, with just a couple of exceptions. You get wonderful views approaching Circular Quay at sunset/evening after a day out.
AT NIGHT RIDE ON SYDNEY FERRIES. I Will Suggest You To Take Sydney Ferry's Ride At Night.You Will Find Sydney At Its Best Specially Harbour Bridge And Opera House.

Sydney ferries. Buy a pass for ALL the transportation while visiting. You will save a lot of money. The ferries go everywhere and the buses do to. However the bus to and from the airport is an extra charge, but still the best way to get to and from Sydney.

Great way to explore the harbour. The ferries provide an excellent avenue to explore the harbour, during the Vivid festival, evening services were increased and the ferries were illuminated to blend with the harbour light exhibits.
Customer service was also excellent as all ferry personnel provided information on schedules etc,
ok. we sailed to maning island. ferry ride was OK. nothing to talk about the island was beautiful little treat. beach was lined with lovely cafes and parlours. worth a visit

Convenient to access!. We took the ferries to Manly beach, and another day to Taronga Zoo. It is pretty easy accessible. But the ferries queue could be very long on weekends (when we were on our ways to Manly beach). Expected to spend some time in queue. Overall, ferries services are good, attentive, clean and fast. A good choice of transportation in Sydney :)

Man Up and get to Manly Beach for a stunning view & lunch.... Every overseas visitor to Sydney must take a ferry ride on Sydney Harbour. If you have the time a good itinerary is to head to Manly and walk from the ferry terminal straight ahead up The Corso to Manly Beach at any time of year. Grab a bite to eat at one of the Fish & Chips shops at the end of The Corso and sit on the beach or the steps and watch the surfers and beach life pass you by...or choose to swim or surf yourself!

you must go for a ferry ride when in Sydney..
