Sydney has a beautiful harbour and it should be on everyones list to get on a ferry and see it at least once in a life time, no matter who you are and how often you do get on a ferry there is always that holiday atmosphere about the whole experience, the only thing that you have to watch out for is all the (sharks) that own the shops next to the stops , they are responsible for ruining a very good experience , so come well prepared

A really good way to spend an hour or two. One of Sydney's most attractive features is its beautiful harbour. The best and least expensive way to see it -- and the city and suburbs -- is to take a ferry ride or two. The ferries go to many appealing places like Manly, Watson's Bay, Parramatta -- at all of which there are appealing and varied eateries -- and the Navy Museum on Garden Island. You will also get a close up of the Harbour bridge from a very different angle. Ferries miss the traffic of course and give the traveller whatever dose of sun and fresh air you choose.

Great way to see the harbour.. Take a cruise around the harbour from circular Quay to Manly. Best views ever. Lots of shops to see and many things to look and do in Manly then catch the ferry back to Circular Quay. A good way to see much of Sydney.

Wonderful way to see Sydney Day or Night. We have lived in Sydney for 50 years, I always amazed at how lovely Sydney Harbour looks. Last Night we went on a harbour trip, it was so lovely to see all the colourful light at night, I had forgotten have nice it looks as we had not do a night trip for some time.Advice, ride the Sidney ferry during the day and then ride it at night, I think you will find the night is better,

Top Class Public Transport. one of the most efficient and reliable forms of Transport in Sydney, if the location u need to go is on the itinerary. a fabulous tourist attraction for those that want to get out on the water in sydney and look at the sites... and only $2.50 on a sunday... Win Win

Best way to get around the harbour. If you want to see Sydney from the harbour, then definitely get on the ferries to get from Circular Quay to Manly. Also get to Toronga Zoo if you're that way inclined. The Harbour is one of the best in the world and great to experience from the Ferries.

Ferries are the way to go!. Wow have Sydney's ferries improved. Nice way to travel and see the harbour at the same time. Lunch at Watson's Bay, catch a drink and pizza at Cockatoo Island or just enjoy a lazy day all for just $2.50 all day on Sundays with an Opal Card. Cannot see better value anywhere else. You come to Sydney for the harbour, so why not for just $2.50 on Sunday

Trip to manly. My wife and I have been lately spending our days of work doing little day tour to manly,parramatta to enjoy the peace and serenity of our world famous harbour and rivers and it gives you an energy boost,thoroughly recommend it.

Convenient Sight Seeing. Whilst in Sydney for the Vivid Festival we used these ferries to visit all parts of the Sydney harbour including Manly, Darling Harbour, Milsons point etc.They are efficient and have frequent services and an absolute bargain for Senior citizens as the cost for all day travel is only $2.50

Efficient and scenic. Sydney Ferries connect CBD with some wonderful sights and attractions. Don't miss Manly and Watsons Bay (see my other reviews). But the ferry offers more than that. The view from the water is terrific! The ferry is also very clean, comfortable and well-kept with both inside and outside seating. It's not too expensive either. What a great way to get around!

Very punctual. Clean, punctual and friendly ushers...
no lining up at pier and we had to fend off queue cutters ourselves.
Terrific service. We never tire of the wonderful ferry service on Sydney Harbour. They will take you to Manly, Luna Park, the Zoo, Darling Harbour plus a multitude of other great places.

A must on the water. A visit to Sydney is not complete unless you go on a ferry in the harbour. There are many to choose from but a short trip to Darling Harbour under the bridge and around the point is well worth it.

Sydney Trans link Services-Train, Bus &Ferry. My trip to Australia was amazing with this transport facility of Trans link card OPAL. Its like passport for my travel in trains,buses &ferries in the Sydney.My friends in Australia don't know this wonderful facility and i researched on the internet and bought this card. With this card i travelled 7 days hassle free in and around Sydney.Sydney ferries are great way to travel to Manly wharf and Darling Harbour. If you want see the fantastic view of Harbour bridge and Opera house sitting comfortably this is the best way to explore Sydney.Overall my experience with OPAL card is awesome..no need to stand in queues for tickets and you can roam as a local in all kinds of transport. And value for money for a tourist.Must buy this card then top up in any convenience store(7 Eleven)and enjoy Sydney without shelling out too much Australian dollars.
To Manly. Great service to go from the mainland to Manly. Leave on time. Comfortable seating. Staff help the elderly and babies on board.

Excellent and affordable way to navigate the harbor. The ferries are all ultra cheap compared to cabs and water taxi's. They will get you anywhere you want to go in a safe and timely manner! The sights you take in on the way are also splendid! Highly recommended!

Lovely Trip. I took a return trip to Manly on Sydney Ferries. It was a smooth ride, even across the heads before Manly. Punctual, too.There is a café onboard as well as toilets and a free facility for recharging mobile devices.An obviously, you get a fantastic view of the Bridge and Opera House. Vivid Sydney was on when I travelled and the view was excellent. The ferry operates at the right speed so that you enjoy the ride and get where you want to go in a decent time.
Fun. Fun way to explore the area, including the Quay, the harbor, and Manly Beach. Enjoyable, relaxing afternoon.

A must do in Sydney. Get out and explore the further parts of the harbour. The Sydney ferries can take you to so many places on the harbour. If you are in Sydney for several days, consider getting a weekly transport pass which gives you access to all the ferries, buses and trains. It allows you to go to so many exciting places without having to worry about a ticket.
Ferries. Operate on time, efficient - Manly. Clean and prompt. Very economical especially with seniors' cards or similar concession cards. Inboard café facilities, toilets

Great views but very pricey.. Although it is a lovely way to view Sydney City, the Harbour Bridge, Luna Park and the Opera House, it is an expensive way to travel. My friend and I wanted to travel from Luna Park to Darling Harbour, with a stop at Circular Quay. Needing to stop doubled the price of our ticket - $12.80 each.

Beautiful city . Drove to Sydney for the weekend. Used the ferries to get around between our hotel, Luna Park & Circular Quay. We found them clean & on time. Never had to wait long as they came in very frequently. Also caught one between Darling Harbour & Circular Quay whilst visiting the Vivid light show which took us to 4 stops, giving us the opportunity to see the lights from the our beautiful harbour.
fast. Convenient, fast, clean, knowledgeable and helpful staff, very secure and safe platforms, views of everything in the harbour!

A GREAT WAY TO GET AROUND. We took the ferries to several places. The Tarango Zoo, The The amusement park and other places. It was a great ride and very good price. I would recomment the ferry; but find out when the ferry stops at night.. That is very important. Have A Great Time
Great View. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour. This is a spectacular trip and definitely worth it for the small fee. Great views of the bridge and opera house.
They r great. We got a day pass. Great value. Excellent timetable and quick. No commentary but otherwise what u get from a tour but with the advantage of getting u where u want to go.
Best way to see the harbour!. This really was the highlight of my day on the harbour. Excellent views of the bridge and the opera house! And a bargain as you can just jump on using your opal card

Visitors or old Sydneysiders should take a ferry ride at any opportunity. This must be one of the best public transport rides in the world. Go to Circular Quay and hop on a ferry, any ferry, to see Sydney Harbour. On a rough day you may enjoy the Manly run with its five minutes of open sea and a walk to the surf beach at the end. On a fine day, do the Mosman route or Hunters Hill to see some of the Harbour bays. It's much cheaper than a tourist cruise, and you see some of ordinary Sydney life.

Hassle Free. Staying in Sydney we had some spare time and decided to hop the Ferry from Circular Quayand cruise the Harbour up to Olympic Park, just to see what has been going on.Great to see, very inexpensive for a couple of hours on the water well worth it for a look see.

Cruising. It's a must see and experience...The staff are friendly the cruise ships are clean and cater for everyone. We took two cruises and enjoyed them immensely, You can go just about anywhere you choose and there are so many options from Romantic dinner cruises to coffee cruises, and of course to travel to different locations. There were so many people taking advantage of these cruises and it was good to see lots of families come and go as well. It is a main attraction around the harbour.
Harbour trips. Love traveling on ferries to explore some of beautiful suburbs of Sydney. Manly, double Bay and Watsons Bay are my favorites. Amazing views from the harbour.
Get out of town the easy way. Forget cramped roads and trains, get across by ferry. Try the Manly ferry especially and then get out to the beach the other side of the town for fish & chips.

Relaxing experience.. We had a 3 day stay in Sydney during the Vivid Festival and extensively used the Sydney ferries to travel from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour. We found the staff helpful, friendly and willing to assist where required. The electronic information board on the ferry advised the next stop and also the estimated arrival time. As we are seniors our $2.50 all day fare was very good value, allowing us to travel on the ferries, buses, trains and light rail.

Must be done. Unless you get out on the water and have a good look around it is difficult to get a perspective on Sydney. Its location is unique and a few hours on the ferries will help you get the bigger picture

MUST Do. Most just use these as regular modes of transport, however there is enough touristy experience available too! I took the Manly ferry from Circular Que to Manly, and love the route it took, and Manly as a day trip!On a Sunday these are included in the $2.50 Sunday Family FunDay pass if you have kids with you, or if you are a Opal (Pre-paid Sydney Transport Card like Oyster in London, or Metro Card in Delhi) User. If you plan a day out, having Sydney Ferries included in the trip is a wise thing :)

Great service, frequent and excellent staff.. For $60 we bought a months travel using the ferries. They were great and got us all over Sydney to see the sites. The crew on the ferries were great and very helpful. Great service for a great price!
Very timely with great views.. Get the Opal pass. It includes all the ferries and is capped at 100 AUD per day. 2.50 AUD on Sundays.
Manley ferry. Travelled 3 times on this trip as we thoroughly enjoy visiting Manley. Very cost effective way to see the harbour.
Smooth sailing. Smooth trip and very relaxing with coffee and refreshments available for minimal cost while taking in the beautiful scenery of the harbour.
ferry rides. try the ferry to manly its a great experience and of course the ferry to toronga zoo the best real estate in the harbour

Great Ferry Service!. We utilised the excellent ferry service on several occasions during our recent stay in Sydney. Main services depart from Circular Quay which is in the Sydney CBD.Sunday is a great day to travel as its capped at $2.50. We travelled during the week and utilised the $15 cap hoping that the service wasn’t too busy then. As it turned out a great time to travel to avoid the crowds. We sat outdoors of the main cabin of the ferry where we had excellent views and allowed for many great photo opportunities such as the well known and iconic Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge and lots more. We also did a day trip to Manly, traveled to Neutral Bay and returned to Darling Harbour which was our base.There is something relaxing about being on a boat and on the water and I highly recommend using the ferry service.

Night time Ferry Circular Quay to Star City. While in Sydney for a family trip we decided to have a pre dinner drink at the Opera Bar, then catch a ferry around to Star City. The trip at night is just beautiful, looking at the harbour lights. The bridge, Opera House, Luna park etc look amazing. Ferry staff were great, ticket machine is easy to use and it's a very cheap ride if you're a pensioner too!
Ferry circular quay to manly. Everyone should take this trip, a great experience for very little outlay. Lunch at the pub then back on the ferry, great day for any age.
Smooth ride, great views. Take the ferry over from Circular Quay to the Taronga Zoo and take in the Opera House and bridge in full glory. Great service. Clean. Affordable.
ferry. there are quite a lot of ferries to different places not expensive and there is a good timetable very busy area but easy to walk around, the opera house is not far away.

Great Way to Travel. The ferries were a great way to cruise the Sydney Harbour. They are easy to access at Circular Quay and head off in many directions. We enjoyed a scenic return trip to Darling Harbour, passing Lunar Park and the Celebrity Solstice cruise ship. On a previous visit to Sydney, we had been on the Manly route and enjoyed that trip as well. The old ferry boats are a real treat.
A great way to see Sydney. Love Sydney Ferries. They are convenient, run on time and regularly and are a fantastic way to see Sydney and our beautiful harbour as well as getting from A to B

Very nice if the weather is nice. We have used the ferries several times, once to go to the zoo and another time to go to Bondi beach. the ferry trip is very enjoyable especially if the weather is nice. It is also a perfect location for photo shooting.
Economical. As pensioners we travelled on the ferry often at reduced rices, they were very comfortable, and Bit of pushing on the way on and off,

Sydney Ferries great. Sydney ferries were great. Love being on the water - gives excellent views. Easy way to get to the zoo. Recommend a weekly pass ($70, covered ferries, trains and buses plus small surcharge to airport trip).

Caught the ferry to Cockatoo Island. Interesting place to visit, a couple of cafes and some gorgeous views. Had a nice cold beer a one cafe and lunch at another. Lots of history and you can glamp there if that takes your fancy.
beautiful cruise. went on cruise to Taronga Zoo, cruise was fantastic, weather great, zoo was spectacular and well worth the trip.

Weekend in Sydney. Sydney Ferries are a great way to get around this beautiful harbour. We purchased a pass and so easy to get on and off. No waiting always on time. We went to Darling Harbour, Manly and Watsons Bay. Fantastic

Ferry to Parramatta well worth it, even for Sydney residents. The ferry ride from Circular Quay to Parramatta is an unpublicised tourist attraction, even for people who've lived in Sydney all their lives. This hour-and-a-half ride shows Sydney from a direction you can't see any other way. Who knew there was still a car ferry across the Harbour?At the Parramatta end, where the river gets narrow, there are plenty of birds, including several kinds of herons.

Great transport system. During my recent visit to Sydney, I used the ferry system daily. It is an efficient and reliable way to get around. I highly recommend using the Opal Card which was a great convenience. I bought mine at an IGA market. Using the ferries is a very cost effective way to get out on the Sydney Harbour with fantastic views. The ferry is a great way to connect from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour and Harbourside. I was very impressed with this transport system and highly recommend it.
Across to the zoo and back. It was my first experience on Sydney Ferries. A really smooth experience, no waiting no crowds, just a smooth trip over to Taronga Zoo and back.

Very pleasant ferry ride. We were in Sydney for two days and we decided to go for a random ferry ride. We chose the Mosman Bay ferry purely by chance.Any ferry ride on beautiful Sydney Harbour is amazing. The ride we chose was very scenic and took us to a beautiful area full of yachts and other boats moored in the still waters of Mosman Bay.The ferry was extremely clean. The seats were modern. The wharves were modern. All-in-all, a lovely little excursion.

Great way to see the city. We purchased a one day pass for the ferries which was better value than paying for the trips individually. We purchased our ticket from the information office in Darling Harbour then travelled from there to Cicular Quay to board the ferry to Manly ( well worth a visit). After lunch there we returned to CQ and then went out to Cockatoo Island which is where many of the convicts were sent after Hyde Park Barracks were closed. There is an audio guide available. We were planning to the go to Watsons Bay but ran out of energy. The pass also covers the buses and trains.

A wonderful way to relax, when southerly's are blowing the boats rock and roll great.. I went to Manly often last year, the ride over on the ferry was very relaxing. You can sit in the sun on the deck or inside if it is too hot, and see some of the beauty of Sydney Harbour. There is a food and drink shop on board in case you want something to drink or eat. We also get the ferry when there is a strong southerly wind blowing, as crossing Sydney Heads in the ferry at this time, you get the added bonus of going up and down in the big waves with the water coming right up over the front ,wetting everyone outside on the top deck, you can't beat this for fun.
faultless service. Always on time and links all the main coastal stops around Sydney. Used the Manly ferry several times and the guaranteed arrival time beat any form of onland travel available.

Efficient and reliable service.. I use the ferry every weekday to get to work. They are always on time,the staff are very friendly and it's more interesting than getting the bus. Only slight criticism is that they don't run as frequently later in the evenings and on a few occasions I've missed one and had to wait nearly an hour.
Efficient and great way to see the city from the harbour. It was a really fast trip to Watson's bay with only one stop at Rose Bay..well worth it to see some "Sydney" homes!

Trip to Sydney Olympic Park and return. Went on the catamaran on a return trip to Olympic park "just for the ride". The staff were excellent, polite and efficient, making each stop so comfortable. Good views from the window, which we enjoyed so much, as Sydney is such a varied and interesting and beautiful city/

The best way to get around. A little slow and slightly more expensive, but for giving you views of the Opera house, Harbour Bridge, Luna park as well as Darling harbour, I'd suggest jumping on to the ferries at least once a day.

Great way to see Sydney Harbour. take the ferry to Taroonga, so many sites to see along the way. It's amazing seeing all the different craft on the water and great views of the bridge and opera house.
Watch for storms though ;)

Get on a Sydney Ferry !. Ignore those over priced harbour boat tours just hop on a Sydney Ferry
Don't worry about where you go ,pick anyone and see what part of the harbour you will see
My favs are the Manly Ferry and Watson bay ferry
Get on them day or night calm day or rainy
Always fun !!

A wonderful experience. I always take a ferry ride when visiting Sydney. Public transport is our preferred option when visiting Sydney. The new OPAL card makes public transport even easier. There are also very good price concessions; on a Sunday ALL travel is capped at $2.50. Can you believe it! Multiple ferry rides or $2.50. And there is a weekly cap of $60. The Manly ferry is the most popular; one gets a magnificent view of the harbour and there are delightful walks from Manly as well as a lovely beach. The shops, however, are tourist traps. Another favourite of mine is to go to Parramatta. The ferry slows down as it moves up the river.
What a ride. Great ride. It was winter & windy but ride was superb.Ferry has all amenities like washroom, cafe , indoor sitting lobby, outdoor sitting lobby!!

Good Excellent. The Service is excellent and comfortably around the harbor to Zoo, and various other locations in a around if you don't have an optus card get one for convenienceTry the ferries its very good experience Cheers

Super convenient and reasonably priced. We bought the 7 day pass for busses, trains and ferries. What a deal ! We spent about $50. each and did we get our monies worth. We rode the ferries every single day. We loved Manley Beach, we went there twice. I could not get enough of seeing the Opera House and Bridge from the ferry. So So easy to get around and very well organized.

a wonderful way to visit the bay and Sydney. The ferry leave from Sydney Harbor, which you can reach by bus. It is also next to the Sydney Opera.Taking the ferries that connects various town around the bay is a great and cheap way to visit Sydney and see it skyline. Depending on the ferry you take, you may board for 2 hours. It is really worth doing that.
Take a day pass and enjoy this one. Just take a day pass and catch ferries to Taronga, Manly and a whole host of places - such a delightful way to pass a lazy day in Sydney
Perfect way to get around!. The harbour ferries are great fun with great views, and run everywhere for a reasonable price. They are brilliant for tourists and provide so many photo opportunities !

best harbor cruise in Sydney. I recently took the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and walked over the hill to Fairy Bower and ate lunch at the Cafe at Fairy Bower. Their food is mainly seafood but I had a steak which was just awesome - and I sat in front of the best view on the planet.The cafe is right on the walkway which is on the Pacific Ocean. Paddle boarders, swimmers, sunbathers, bikinis, are there and present a delightful picture. This is Sydney at its best, and the experience is cheap, easy, fun, and good quality.The ferries run all over Sydney Harbor, to Parramatta at one end to Manly at the other. They are safe, comfortable, frequent, and are the best way to absorb the beauty of the harbor at an affordable price.

buy an Opal card and spend the day on the water. You can book the cruises which cost a lot more, but if you use your Opal card you can go all day to a range of places on the water. My favourite trip is Circular Quay to Watsons Bay or Rose Bay. I catch the ferry to the city sometimes from Milsons Point just to get a chance to be on the water. you can sit outside or inside. the best view of the bridge is from Milsons Point to Darling Point, and you can get amazing photos. Go and do it the trip is well worth it.

Great way to get around. Going on the Ferries is a lovely way to see Sydney and to get to various places - much nicer than going on the bus. On Sundays it only costs $2.50 all day, good to take advantage of as many trips as possible.

Great views, great price, great fun. There couldn't be a better way to see Sydney than from a Sydney ferry. Taking ferries around the Harbour beats paying for a cruise hands down. You won't get commentary, but there's not much you'll want to know that you can't get from a guide book or by asking other commuters. Get off at almost any stop and you'll find a beautiful walk or a cute little cafe, and frequently both. You can explore the harbour-side suburbs, go to the Zoo, go to the beach, shop, walk, see a special exhibition or visit unusual spots like Cockatoo Island. And don't neglect the River Cat which will take you up river to Parramatta. It's a great trip and you can hop off at any number of great suburbs as well as Sydney Olympic Park on the way. For more information visit http://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/content/sydney-ferriesand there's a great network map athttp://www.transportnsw.info/resources/documents/maps/sydney-ferries-network-map.pdf
Great Activity. Great for the whole family and great way to see the sights. We did the manly ferry. Great with kids can be in or out and only like $8.00 one way

Public transport with a view. Sydney has by far one of the best public transport systems I've encountered. Getting around by ferry is easy, they run often and you get to sit back and enjoy the ocean views while you travel from place to place.

Loved it . The ferries are a great way to sit back and take in all of Sydney's Beauty. Great views of the Harbour bridge, Opera House and many other place that make Sydney a great place to visit.. Catch the ferries straight to the gates of Taronga Zoo which saves on travel and trying to find a park. The ferries will take you to Manly and even up the Parramatta river. Great relaxing day out. Highly recommend

Great views. You can't get a better view of Sydney harbour and surrounding neighborhoods at such a very reasonable cost. Buy a day pass and hop on / hop off to get the most of your experience. A night ride is also highly recommended.

Great way to see the harbor. We took the ferry to and from the zoo and the view was beautiful. A fantastic way to take photos. We took the ferry back after the zoo closed and dusk was the perfect time to photograph the Opera House. The ferry is comfortable and convenient.

Normal ferry ride, a lot more spectacular than expensive boat trips elsewhere!. Take the ferry from Circular Quay (central Sydney) to Manly. Preferably the slow 30 minutes one. It is most definitely worth it. While it is a "normal" commuter ferry, it doubles up as a tourist trip. Manly offers a lot of attractions, both cafes, restaurants and an amazing beach (where the first surfing world championship took place in 1966). But if you have a chance to arrive back towards the city at sunset, you will have an amazing, unforgettable view of the red sunset light projected onto the CBD buildings. Ah, and forgot to mention the Sydney Opera and the Sydney Harbour Bridge!!
Prompt service. Specially rivercat ferries I catch myself, they're very modern and very prompt with their timetable .

Good way to get around the harbour. Visitors to Sydney, we bought an all day ticket for $24 and took a few rides to explore the harbour. A return ticket from Circular Quay to Cockatoo Island would have cost $12 so we thought unlimited rides was a better deal. That ticket also allowed for unlimited bus, train and light rail rides too. Taking the ferries is a pleasant way to see the harbour, On weekends they seem to run about every 30 mins or so. The ferries are comfortable with plenty of inside seating, out of the weather or you can sit outside for a better view.

Good views no frills great price. If you want to get around Sydney harbour this is the way to go. Get yourself a good guide book so you can name the beaches - why pay loads more cash for an organised trip that will only give you commentary as an extra .

Great way to see more of Sydney for not much money. Get yourself an Opal card for travel on Sunday as it only costs $2.50 for as many trips as you like! We've been on a few of the ferries and always enjoyed the trip, and recently went on the Rivercat from Parramatta to Darling Harbour - if you've got a bit of extra time it's a great way to travel (takes about an hour as opposed to 1/2 hr on the train)
Great way to see Sydney. They run non-stop and take you to some fantastic places in Sydney that would cost a fortune to reach by taxi.
Harbour Views. Jump on a ferry to Fort Denison and get the best views of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and city skyline, and, enjoy a meal/coffee at the café, even help fire the 1 p.m. cannon.

see Sydney. The ferries are an inexpensive must do for Sydney sightseers. Get off the Sydney Trains at Circular Quay and walk to the ferry terminals. You can see them from the rail station platform. There are several options but take s trip to Manly to start with.

Breathe the Sea Air and Relax. A few hours of sailing on the ferries from Circular Quay to anywhere you want on the waterways of Sydney Harbour will calm your soul and invigorate your brain with the salt air. Do it alone or with a partner (very romantic) and RELAX away from the stress of your life. You will not regret it. All ferries are comfortably appointed and there are plenty of times from which you can choose.
you can go everywhere. Or most of the landmarks by using the ferry system. Get your transportation card, the one that can be used on ferries, bus and others. It is quite handy.

Cheapest quality tourist activity in the world!. A ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay is a pleasurable way to see the Harbour and the surrounding houses on the waterfront and is modestly priced. Watson's Bay is a great destination- fish and chips in the park and a walk up to the Gap cliffs is recommended. A further stroll around to Camp Cove Beach, and then on to the South Head of the harbour is a terrific destination.

Original small ferries the best. I love the small green and cream coloured ferries that chug around Sydney Harbour. The big Cats might get you wherever you're going but they definitely lack that atmosphere and romance of the original boats. All these are named after ships from the First Fleet.

A great way to see Sydney Harbour. Sydney Ferries is a great way to travel with breath taking views of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and the smiling theme park face of Luna Park. Sunday is the best time to travel with Fares $2.50 per person for each family member aged 4 or more for UNLIMITED travel all day on Ferries (also unlimited travel on trains and Buses). Darling Harbour and Manly are a must visits by ferries which leave regularly from Circular Quay (just below the train station).

Sydney Harbour Ferries. Whoever runs the Ferries these days is to be congratulated. Going back a few years the ferries were a disgrace ( and had accidents! ) but nowadays I have nothing but praise for their efficiency, cleanliness and helpful happy staff. I usually use only 3 routes entertaining my grandchildren but I have been impressed. So well done Sydney Ferries!

Price capped @ $2.50 on Sundays. Great for different view of Sydney and very economical on Sundays. $2.50 buys you (adult travelling with child OR adult Opal card holder) travel all day on any Sydney bus, train or ferry. Can't ask for more than that.Great for getting to Watson's Bay, Manly, Taronga Zoo or historic Parramatta.

Comfortable commute. Any form of commute that is so painless gets a five star approval rating from me. The ferries make it extremely easy to get around and make a welcome change from commuting by train or bus.
Great value. $A6 each ticket ferry ride from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay gets you 4 stops and wonderful photo ops of the bridge and opera house. And saves some walking for sure!
Lots of fun. We took the ferry everyday coming into Sydney from East Balmain. They ran on time and are lots of fun to be on. It is a must do while in Sydney.

Excellent. They run on time.....the ferries are very clean and the staff are always helpful! We had a few hours before we had to get to the cruise terminal so we thought we might as well take a ferry ride. The staff were very helpful in helping us pick the right ride that would take us around to show us some of the sights and still get us back in time to get to our cruise ship. The ride is very comfortable and a great inexpensive way to see the city from the water!
Use these as they are great. Cheap and cheerful ! Great way of getting about and easy to use. We went to manly and cockatoo island both fantastic and worth the money.

Great for New Years Eve. We have booked the Showboat for last year's New Years Eve and didn't regret it. Nice show, great food, cool people, friendly staff and an amazing view for the fireworks, right in fron of the Harbor Bridge!

A Sydney Icon - Must Do. We went on 3 separate trips to see a few different aspects of the Harbour:1. To Manly, to the east of the bridge.2. To Darling Harbour, from Circular Quay, to the west of the bridge.3. Night trip from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay.All three trips were great. The views from the water were spectacular. The crews were friendly and helpful. We used the Opal Card which enabled us to use the trains, buses, light rail and ferries.
Ferry services. excellent service on all ferries on a daily basis - timetables easy to work out and on time all the time.
Cheap, reliable and efficient. Great mode of transport. Numerous places to visit on these and very economical at under $5 a journey

Great views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Riding the Sydney Ferries is a great way to get a "poor man's" harbor tour with close up views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. We took a sleek, modern fast ferry to Watson's Bay to walk a coastline trail of a national park to see where Sydney Harbor meets the Pacific Ocean. Fantastic views.

The best way to see the city. The best way to see any city is from the water. Sydney is no exception. We sailed on the Manly Ferry, not to go to the beach but to gain a quick perspective of the city (we were only there for a short time) and view the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and the city skyline as well as a brief pass of the Pacific Ocean (!). Unmissable.
A great way to see Sydney Harbour. A must for all visitors to this beautiful city! And what an inexpensive way to see Sydney from the water. Thank God for the ferries!

Very efficient. One can watch the ferry boats large and small crisscrossing the harbor for hours and wondering how they can avoid accidents. At least I have never heard of serious accidents involving the ferries in Sydney Harbor.

Always pleasant & kids love it. Ferry is a great way to see the harbour. The kids always thoroughly enjoy it and its great going under the bridge on the circular quay to darling harbour route. If you go on Sunday with the kids, the Sunday Funday tickets at $2.50 per head for unlimited rides on trains / ferries / buses / light rail makes it super affordable.
Great way to get about. Reasonably cheap way of getting about Sydney harbour and some of the suburbs. Timetables clear, ticketing easy.

Great way to see Sydney Harbor!. No trip to Circular Quay, The Rocks and Sydney Harbor is complete without heading out on the ferry to Bondi or Manly on the other side. Enjoyed a seat out front taking photos. Lunch on Manly Beach. Back by evening with great photo opps of the bridge and Opera House. Be sure to find Max Brenner's chocolatier café for a coffee and decadent dessert.

A great way to visit the area. The Sydney Ferries are a great way to visit the Sydney area. They are reasonably priced and the staff are great about providing guidance. A great way to get where you want to go and a great boat ride.

Save the cruise money and take a ferry. Avoid the expensive harbour cruises and buy a ticket for a ferry instead. Take the opportunity to sit outside, relax and enjoy the view. Who needs a commentary. Can really recommend the ferry out to Olympic Park (Armoury Wharf from memory). Just do it.
Nice travell. Visiting Sydney you simply must have a ride on the Ferries, its not expensive and a nice way to see more of the Harbour and houses which are perched on the Harbour.

Great transportation. We finished one tour at the Olympic Park in Sydney. After a walk around we chose a different method of transportation back to Sydney Harbor. The ferry was a perfect choice. It was cost effective and very clean. We really enjoyed seeing this part of the city from this vantage point.

great way to travel. Take a ferry to somewhere like Mosman for upmarket shops or Watsons Bay for Doyle's for fish and chips and see a bit of the suburbs. Or just spend time on the water relaxing seeing Sydney harbour. Great view and photo opportunities for the Harbour bridge and Opera house.

Great way to explore other areas. We bought a My Multi ticket and used the ferry to go to Manly, Darling Harbour and Cockatoo Island. On time every time. This is a great service and a good way to relax in between and take in some outer city sights. The weather smiled upon us so all in all a good experience.

Brilliant transport. The ferries are easily accessed at Circular Quay and offer a great range of destinations. our favourite is to Manly where a good day out can be had. On our last trip we even went to Parramatta and thoroughly enjoyed the journey. The only one to do now is Watson Bay. The ferry is an attraction on its own.

Best water sight seeing in Sysney and the loveliest commuter experience. Sydney Ferries are the best way to see Sydney. I recommend the first thing you do when you arrive and want to sight see is jump on any of them. The Eatswrn Suburbs ferries are great trips as you can see the iconic Sysney Opera House and the skyline, and the hour prior to sunset is a gorgeous time to see the big sky full of changing colours setting behindd the skyscrapers.The Manyl ferry is the most iconic trio, with a walk to the beach and fish-n-chips an obligatory Sydney experience.Historic areas of Sydney such as Balmain are good jump off and on distances for walks around the Habour foreshore.All ferries have wifi so a great chance to do some free social media and photo uploads whilst travelling.As a Sydney local, if I have an hour to kill between meetings I often grab sushi roll, jump on the ferry, sitting outdoors to soak up the sun and invigorating fresh air.It is also a great way to cross the harbours and to Darling Hebour where conferences are often held.If planning a trip involving ferries and other transport such as trains, there is q fantastic online sevice to plan your trips at transport.nsw.gov.au which even includes how many minutes it takes to walk to and from the wharves and bus stops from your current location.You can use your Opal card on all ferries which makes travel so easy.Why people who live near ferries choose to use cars on congested roqds, when commuting is so beautiful on ferries is beyond me.The Manly ferry also has a cafe. Basic good reliable food rangingfromtoasted sandwiches and croissants to he lurid doughnuts and pasties hat children will love. Coffee is awful so grab one before you get on.

Best way to see the harbour. We jumped on a ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour on a recent family trip. It was very comfortable & I think the best way to see the harbour. There was plenty of room & you could sit inside or out. Nice thing to do...
Sydney Harbour. recomend going on a Ferri they have several harbour cruises from sydney go to Manly or up the river to Parramatta or a dinner or lunch cruise

Great and affordable way to view attractions. Taking the ferry was suggested by a friend who is living in sydney, and so we did. It was indeed a great way of looking at the attractions upfront. Especially when taking the circular quay to darling harbour route, the ferry will past underneath the harbour bridge, and you can view the opera house at a nice distance. When alighting at darling harbour, the SEA life aquarium is on the way.
So Easy on the Ferries!. We went to Watson Bay by ferry and had a great experience, great way to see the Harbour and the many attractions it has to offer!

Love taking a Ferry just for the heck of it. You could buy yourself a daily unlimited MyMulti Day pass and just take asmany ferry trips as possible and it would be a day well spent. Just avoid the morning and evening hours unless you want to watch commuters and may end up standing. This could be interesting though as well so don't rule it out. I am not sure if the MyMulti pass includes the Rivercats but if it does then you could combine multiple trips around Harbour eg Manly, Milsons Point(Luna Park) with a nice rivercat to Parramatta from Circular Quay which is particularly good. Get off and have lunch at Abbotsford at the Sydney Rowing club and you won't regret it but be warned though there is a steep walk up from the Ferry to the club. Best to not go on a weekend as it can get crowded or go a little early or late for lunch if do go on weekend. Food price is average but you can just get a drink and look at water and eat elsewhere. Further along the route to Parramatta,Meadowbank has a nice park and walk if the kids need to cut loose.There are BBQs in the park but they can be hard to find. When you leave ferry turn left and walk under the bridge. Almost immediately there is a set of stairs/path ledaing up on the right. You can walk up through the trees and away on the left are some BBQs and play area with swings. If you have bikes the park is great for cycling.
Such a good way to get around. What an awesome way to travel as well as see the sites of Sydney. Fast and regular and comfortable. You can't ask for more.

Anywhere Anytime. I gave up counting the number of ferries departing the Circular Quay. Given the Sydney city ferries and ferries from the private companies, you should never have to wait more than a few minutes to catch a ride. The harbor, the largest in the world, is best observed from the deck of a boat. We happened to be out when the sailboats were out in force. It was a blustery day but the views just don't stop.

Circular Quay to Rose Bay. My ferry trip to Rose Bay in the evening was a great way to reach my destination. It was fast, clean, convenient and the harbour sights including the bridge, opera house and Sydney night lights were spectacular.

Great way to get around. I liked the easy access to the ferries and there were ferries to several places we wanted to visit. The ferries were clean and a great way to get to where we wanted to go as well as enjoying the ride and the harbor views.

A different perspective. If you have 3 hours, like boating, and are curious to see Sydney from a different perspective, consider hopping on the ferry to Parametta. We took a mid afternoon ferry and returned to Sydney ablaze with evening lights. Simply spectacular!

Economical Way to Tour the Harbour. Avoid peak hour times as they can be quite crowded but off peak is a relaxing a great way to see what our city has to offer. Take the ferry to Parramatta, Watson's Bay or Manly if you want to get another perspective. Ferries are a cheap and an easy way to get around

Easy way to move around. Easy, cheap and fast way to go from one place to the other. And so much fun taking the boat. Went form Luna Park back to Circular Quay and didn't have a card. So we paid on arrival.

Fantastic tourist attraction. The ferry must be the best way to see Sydney from the water - and the cheapest.
Buy your OPAL card at a newsagent - load it with $15 - and away you go - so easy !!
Circular Quay to Manley, the Zoo, or Darling Harbour - all great with stunning photo ops as you go.

Very helpful. We had 3 very young children with us , 1 stroller, the staff were very helpful. The ferries were quite clean and tidy, and the service was on time. Had us where we needed to be at the correct time.
Circular Quay Ferries. Affordable ticket price yet comfortable and clean ferries that are fast enough to get you where you wanted, with ample time to enjoy the scenery.

Do not use OPAL Cards. Money chewed up. If you don't have the money loaded onto the card for the ferries, you are rejected from going through the gates. Avoid using the computer do it yourself.
Ferry services overall excellent. Went Quay - Taronga Zoo, Manly, Quay, Darling Harbour
Sydney Inner Circle Ferries. I trave on a regular basis from Woolwich to Circular Quay on a regular basis. I have nothing but praise for the service and the boats. The only way to travel.
how cheap. For $2.50 concession it allowed us to travel on any ferry,train,tram for 1 day. Excellent value. We decided to drive from Sydney to Manly thenback to Manly Agreat day out.

The View I will Never Forget!!!!. If you do nothing more you have GOT to take a Sydney Ferry that comes back after dark to see the Fabulous light display of the city. Between the Farris Wheel & park, the Sydney Harbor Bridge and the Opera House at night, it's the most beautiful city in the world. We took it out late afternoon to Manly Island and came back after night. We were in awww....freezing to death but the photo ops where to great for warmth. Take a jacket, hat and mittens cuz it's cold but worth the trip. WOW...a view I will never forget!! You can go inside and it's warm but being a photo nut I had to take in the view.

Great viewa of the Opera House and Sydney Skyline!. We took the ferry from the Rocks district to Manly. Great views of the Opera House and Sydney's skyline can be enjoyed along the way. Manly is a nice place to go for lunch and see the beach too.
Worth a ride just for the Scenery. Take the ferry to Manly for the wonderful scenery or stop at Taronga Zoo to see the most amazing Harbourside zoo with great views back to the Sydney skyline.

Excellant service. Fast, efficient service. Went on a round trip to Manly. Had a great time. The trip was comfortable . Clean and well maintained bathrooms on board. Food available on board but can't comment as we didn't buy anything.

Forget organised harbour tours use public transport. Great public transport and if you want to see Sydney from the water and get a look at the way people live take the ferry up to Parramatta. It is ridiculously cheap and about an hour and half boat trip. You get to see some very expensive houses and some lovely outlooks. We had a great day sightseeing and all for a very cheap ticket.

The best way to see Sydney Harbour.. All aboard. This is the best and cheapest way to see Sydney Harbour. Forget about all those extravagant Harbour Cruisers that cost you a fortune. Go down to Circular Quay and catch a ferry to Manly.You will sail past the major landmarks and some of the expensive real estate in Australia. Once your at Manly you can have a surf or go and buy a nice coffee or ice cream and watch the world pass you by.Or you can eat at the many affordable restaurants Manly has to offer. When you are done, get back on the Sydney Ferry and enjoy the ride back to your hotel or home. Great Value.Enjoy !
Transportation made easy and cheap. I spent around AU$6 traveling on this little ferry.Ferries were all on time and very comfortable to travel on. a great way to see the Harbor views as well.

Fun way to get around town!. Much less expensive than a water taxi and just as much fun! We enjoyed the ride from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour which stops twice along the way. Great way to see different views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge and to (fairly) quickly get around.

What better way to see the Harbour. Caught 6.20am Ferry to Manly on a still and beautiful harbour. Minimal cost - so worth the trip. Up close to our iconic Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Fort Denison and viewed a glorious sunrise as we passed the heads. Highly recommend.
Like a bus trip. Lots of little boats going out on regular routes. Nothing fancy, but amazing for us land dwellers to see something that performs like clockwork on the water.

When in sydney. You have to take the ferry out to Manley beach. Very beautiful scenery, and Manley is a lovely place to spend a day in. Good food and shopping and the beach is worth an ice cream and a sit to enjoy the view.

Best view of the Harbour. For any visitor, the Sydney Harbour ferries provide the cheapest way to view the outer or inner harbour.Travel by public ferry to Watsons Bay via Rose Bay to see the best views of the harbour side homes. At the end of this ferry ride, stop at Watsons Bay for the best meals on the headland at the Watsons Bay Hotel or the bayside fish and chip shop. Make sure you take the walk up the hill to the 'Gap' where many have jumped to their death over time.Alternatively, take the harbour ferry to Manly to enjoy a beachside suburb with fantastic surf beaches or bayside beaches with abundant restaurants and cafés.To view the inner harbour and to travel under the iconic Harbour Bridge, take the ferry to Darling Harbour which travels via Milson's Point and Luna Park to the entertainment precinct at Darling Harbour.To view the river system behind the harbour, take the 'river cat' from Circular Quay to Parramatta.Great harbour which can be seen cheaply by Sydney harbour ferries which depart frequently from Circular Quay. A must see and do for any visit to Sydney.

Amazing transport. Sydney would not be Sydney without the okd green ferries in the harbour. Enjoy a ride whether in rain, sunshine or hail. You will love it. The friendly boatmen will make it more enjoyable yet!
Great service why pay more?. It is a great experience to see Sydney from the ferry, they are always in time and there is really helpful staff...
Good Value on SUNDAY!. Please use this on Sundays to save $$$ ... please ensure you arrange your itinerary properly to enjoy cost savings. Nice way to see Sydney :)

A great way to get around the harbour. The ferries are a good way to see the harbour and get to destinations such as Manley etc.Many are old but obviously well looked after.Enjoy joining the Sydney siders and other tourist on you journey.
Sydney from the Harbour. Even on a wet cloudy day taking the boat out on the Harbour is awesome - we took the ferry the next day to the zoo and it was even more beautiful.

Very good for sundays. Its hood , nothing special about it, not cheap as well. But it's Amazing if you have the day pass or you are traveling on Sunday as its 2.5$ unlimited that can make you go everywhere for almost zero cost.

Harbour Up Close and Personal. As a local who uses Sydney Ferries every week I wanted to let our tourists know what a fantastic, relatively cheap method this is of seeing the harbour, the bridge, Opera House, Admiralty House, Balmain, Darling Harbour, Manly and the natural wonders of sea cliffs, birds and the occasional dolphin. Just go down to circular Quay and buy a ticket
Quick and Easy. Not only was the ferry to Manly Wharf quick and easy to manage, but the rides offer breathtaking views of the sights.

Wonderful watery way to travel. With the Opal pass having $15 cap per day ( $2.50) on Sunday trip to Manly from Circular Quay is great value as single trip without pass costs $15. An excellent way to enjoy the harbour and take in the sights. Trip to Homebush also pleasant if you have the time.

Cheaper than tourist boats. this is a great way to see the city from a different perspective. Don't waste money on the tourist boats . Take the ferry to balmain west via darling harbour for a great view of the bridge and city. Do this at night as well and get a different perspective of the city. Easy to buy tickets and there are special family tickets at the weekends.the ferry is a great way to get around and is more relaxing than the bus. Easy access to wheelchairs and buggies

GOOD ALTERNATIVE TO AVOID ROAD TRAFFIC!. Sydney ferries are a good way to reach part of the city without getting stuck in the traffic; I used them several times. When departing from Circular Quay, the view is breathtaking!

Good way to get to the other side of Sydney. I took the ferry to Taronga zoo. only 15 minutes ferry. Along the way, I had a perfect view of the Opera house and the bridge. took a lot of photos.to Taronga zoo is every half hour at wharf 2. easily get a return ticket from the wharf.
Manley. I liked the mix of people on board from commuters to holiday makers. The journey made my visit to Manley quite exciting and lovely day out
Easy way to travel. great and convenient way to travel. We brought the all travel pass which included ferry trains and bus. Excellent value.

Easy travel.. Easy, efficient way of getting around the harbour and sightseeing, over to Manly is a great trip and you can take the hydrofoil up to Parramatta, this is a good trip and highly recommend it.

Great way to travel. We used the ferries daily whilst in Sydney and only had one complaint. The ferries were clean. It was just the staff that were the problem. We found them to be not very helpful at all. When asked the question of what time the ferries go back we were just told go and read the board. Well we read the board and the ferries didn't match up to the times they were arriving. We assumed that the staff on the ferry would have an idea of how often they ran like every 1/2 hour or so but no just go read the board. Not very good customer service for inter state visitors.

Manly Ferry... If you want to get out to the outer part of the harbour but haven't the time or inclination to do one of the longer, meal included type trips then the Manly is for you. Very inexpensive and on the way back you can pretend that you arrived by ocean liner...

Cheap tour. Using the public ferries was a cheap and easy way to get around Sydney and to see the sights. An all day pass cost $A24. But don't expect commentary about the sights unless you get a friendly local. We used it on a rainy day to see the sights and stay dry. Very enjoyable

Sydney Ferries - What a way to travel!!!. This Melbournian had an awesome time on the Sydney ferries during a recent five night stay in Sydney. Ended up with passes for three different lots of ferries one day but hey you can't knock the choices or the prices.Caught the Eco Hopper to the Taronga Zoo and had 24 hours with them to ride the ferries. Just missed one back to Circular Quay so hopped on the public ferry and bought an Opal card at the Quay. Fantastic that this was an option and the ferry staff and Sydney transport guy were wonderful with the help. Hopped onto the next ferry to Manly to catch up with friends.it was so nice crossing the harbour, ferry was comfortable and the people were so friendly and gave me lots of advice on where to go and what to see.Caught a late ferry back from Manly and seeing the Sydney skyline at night was beautiful.Caught a ferry down the Parramatta River after being dropped off somewhere from a bus trip to the Blue Mountains.I was dumbfounded by what I saw on the other side of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Beautiful houses, bays and the James Cook ferry we were on was really quick.Also had a trip on the bus to Bondi Beach then Watson's Bay and back to Sydney.Public transport in Sydney seems much more efficient than in Melbourne but then in Melbourne I use my car for everything.Would have been nice if the ferry had of run later to get back from Doyle's in Watson's Bay to Circular Quay.Am actually looking forward to going back to Sydney so I can ride the ferries more on Sydney harbour.
Organised. Very well run, loved the scenery on the way into harbour a must when visiting Sydney, easy to fathom out

Must-do. To take the ferries in Sydney is very convenient and unique. You will have an amazing view around, the prices are reasonable and you can just relax as it is easy to find the right station to hop off and the right ferry to get in.
Very recommendable.
Ferry travel. The ferries run from early morning until late at night. I would reccomend the Manly ferry as this gives good views of the Opera House and the harbour.

Take the ferry!. We jumped on and just took the ferry around to all the stops. It gives you a great view of the harbour and the commentary is interesting. The staff are super speedy at docking and "undocking". Very pleasant.

Must do. A ferry ride is a must do on any visit to Sydney. You see the harbour from a very different perspective looking back to the shore. Riding the ferries is a great way to get around. So much more interesting, relaxing and picturesque than catching a bus or taxi!

Always helpful. The crews on these ferries show amazing patience with tourists. They are always happy to explain where the ferry is going( even though there are electronic signs at the wharf and now on the ferries to tell passengers) without losing their patience and frequently they roll,out the gangplank having just brought it aboard when passengers run down the wharf.As a way of seeing the harbour cheaply they can not be beaten.

Grab Your Ticket Now. Sydney Ferries offer the perfect way to appreciate the wonder that is Sydney Harbor.On Sunday's take advantage of the special day trip offer for the family.Depart from Circular Quay early morning with a fresh coffee and muffin and plan the day of travel.The all day pass allows you to take in the view of the Bridge and Opera House.Spend a few hours at Luna Park to allow the kids to have a fun day riding the many rides available.Grab a sandwich or two and visit Taroonga Zoo then travel to Watson Bay seeing the magnificent homes of the Rich and not so famous.Plan on an early afternoon return to the city and you have a perfect day for very little money.

Spur of the moment visit. For us, travelling on the Sydney ferries was one of the main highlights of our visit....all the different and beautiful destinations to discover within the best harbour in the world!....such a convenient and scenic way to experience just a part, albeit a magnificent part, of 'Spectacular Sydney'!
Sunday Travel. Excellent value on a Sunday with your travel card. See what you want to see and travel for a fixed fee. What more could a tourist ask for
On time machines. What's to say about the ferries. Awesome part of the transit system. Excellent way to see the city and get about.
Very efficient system and fun to ride but seems a bit expensive.. We wanted to go from circular quan to the darling harbour which isn't that long a ride but still costed us $12 each for a round trip
ferry to Manly. on time, clean, and great views. The perspective of the opera house is different from the ferry (than from the shore)

Manly Ferry. Can be crowded on sunny days, but a beautiful trip on a natural harbour, alighting at Manly where there are plenty of good restaurants to suit all budgets. The ferry ride is definitely a must do activity in Sydney- the harbour is a true jewel to Sydney, hence the nickname of the emerald city- a reference to the clear green waters of the harbour. A nice mix of natural vegetation and lovely homes along the way.

Great Ferry Hub. This bustling city ferry port is a cauldron of nationalities. The terminal is easy to use with lots help and information available for tourists out of their depth. Kiosks supply snacks and restaurants are close by for more substantial meals. Ferries are frequent and locals use them for their daily commute as well as the huge number of tourists all sampling Sydney's attractions over the water! We've travelled to Manly several times and Watsons Bay leaving Circular Quay in the morning sunshine and returning in darkness for fantastic views of Sydney by night. It's worth getting the ferry just for the photo opportunities of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House.

See Sydney's waterfront. This is a fantastic way to see the sights around the waterfront. The views were brilliant no we didn't have a meal on board but we didn't spend $100 all the ferry trips are an opportunity to see the sights.

Best way to travel in Sydney. Without doubt the ferries are the best way to see Sydney. Relaxing, and giving you a very different perspective from driving. Google sydneyferries for maps, timetables, and a good trip planning service, which makes it easy to get organised.
See Sydney on the cheap. Avoid the crowded roads and take ferries to many places around Sydney. Peaceful and relaxing whilst the rest of the city stresses

Brilliant. These ferries travel all over the harbour and are an excellent way to travel and go to most locations. We bought day tickets and went to most places. The boats are comfortable and the landings safe and easy. The crew were all friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the experience so much we went round the harbour at night just to see the lights. Good, cheap way to see Sydney.
Great . What to say, we used the ferries alot whilst in Sydney, and they are an ideal and great way to get across to various parts of the harbours etc and also to get some amazing pictures!
Cheap harbour cruise!. Something all visitors to Sydney must do is catch a ferry to Manly wharf and walk along the corso to the beach. We took our friend from the US and she had a ball!

I love travelling on the ferries,. I have spent lots of happy hours just travelling on the ferries to different locations around Sydney.I get on at circular quay and arrive back at circular Quay. Lots of. Places to visit my favourite one is over to Manly, and over to Taronga zoo. Ifyou like a village theme with lots of resteraunts try going over to Balmain. It's lovely.and in May there are the vivid cruises and you can see all the Harbour and the opera house in beautiful colours .

Sydney Harbour cruise. Many visitors to Sydney want to enjoy a harbour cruise and most cruise ships provide for this but at a HUGE cost, around $100 and more depending on the ship. A MUCH cheaper alternative is to take a ferry to Manly at around $10. Make sure you go on the ferry NOT the jetcat or hydrofoil a these travel too fast and you are kept indoors..instead the ferry is a wonderful 40 minute trip right down the harbour passing all the popular spots and you can walk around the outside of the ferry or just sit in the open soaking up the sun and views. When you get to Manly get out and walk around. go down the Corso to the surf beach. have a seafood lunch or snack and any of the multitude of eateries and return at you leasure. It is a wonderful way to see Sydney harbour and all it has to offer for a very small price

Talk about value. The cheapest ride for first class views and wind swept hair. Well worth it. The locals do this too, some to work and others just to enjoy the sun. Little kids love it too but careful not to fall in as my crazy toddler would surely have :) He loved it though and etched in his memory.

Great service and a fun way to travel. We took the ferry from Manly to central Sydney (the terminal is at Circular Quay) and had a very pleasant, relaxing trip. Beats all other public transport - it was more like a cruise on the harbour with the best views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. A few other things as well (the Australian PM's residence at Kirribilli House, for example). No guide to tell us where to look so you have to come with some info, but it is public transport and cheap!

Best way to see the harbour. The ferries are without a doubt the easiest and cheapest way to see Sydney Harbour and many Sydney attractions that might otherwise take longer to get to (and via a less scenic route!) e.g. Watson Bay, Kirribilli/Kirribilli House (the Australian Prime Minister’s house), Manly Beach et al. Get the Opal Card rather than a single paper ticket and you can travel all day for $15, or I believe $2.50 on a Sunday only.

Better than the bus. This ferry is slower than the others but is still ok. This is the better one if you just want to relax and chill out, the other ones tend to have more business people on-board. Great way of having a good look around the harbour.

Efficient, comfortable, and wonderful views.. Forget your "Coffee Cruises" and lunch cruises that cost a small fortune. For tourists looking to see Sydney, jump on a Manly Ferry (30 Minutes each way to Manly) or an inner-harbour ferry (such as the Taronga Zoo ferry, or East Balmain Ferry) which loop around the harbour for a fraction of the cost. No need to book - simply go to Circular Quay and find a route which suits. On windy days I would avoid the Manly Ferry though, as the surf chop from the Heads can make it slightly rough. My favourite is the East Balmain / Millers Point ferry loop, which goes from Circular Quay, under the bridge, to Luna Park, and back. Much, much better than paying $50 for one of those silly Coffee cruises!

A great ride. We used the ferries to get to the zoo. I highly recommend getting there this way. It is a beautiful view and enjoyable trip. Being out on the ferry was a different perspective and a fabulous way to start and end the days adventures.

Wedding in Mosman. We were visiting and needed to go from Circular Quay to Manly, the ferries are great value for money, relaxed travel and on time Great way to see the opera house from the harbour .....

Quintisential Sydney. What better way to get into the heart of Sydney? Locals and tourists alike take the ferry to Manly. Try to get an outside or window seat, so you can take photos. They have toilets on board, and it is wonderful for families, and people of all ages.

A lovely way to get around. On a sunny day it's lovely to take a Sydney Ferry if it's to Manley or Watson's bay or even Darling Harbour.
Another must when visiting Sydney.

During the day and during the night. I keep forgetting to tell visitors to Sydney that not only is a ferry ride across the Harbour an absolutely essential part of the Sydney experience, it should be done during the day (with the sun illuminating the Sydney Opera House) but it also must be done at night. Coming back into Circular Quay with Sydney's skyline all lit up is really beautiful and inspiring. Brave the wind and stand at the front of the boat. It's public transport so it's inexpensive yet something so beautiful, in another circumstance, you would be shelling out top tourist dollars for it.

Transportation made easy. They couldn't make traveling any easier. We took the ferry to the Taronga Zoo. bought our ferry and zoo passes all in one ticket. Ferries were all on time and very comfortable to travel on. a great way to see the Harbor views as well.

A bit Expensive but Great experience. I spent around AU$6 traveling on this little ferry from darling harbor to another side which I don't remember the name of that place. It was such a great experience. The fresh air, sea wave and spectacular view of Harbor bridge were so fantastic. Worth the price.
the best view. When we saw the ferries, they reminded us Istanbul... The best and cheapest solution to enjoy the view from the sea. Just take a ticket to Taronga Zoo or Mosman and return

Mini Cruise !. We took the regular ferry to Manly and it was well worth the reasonable price for the return trip. No need to book a harbour tour, this ferry just about covers it all with so much to see on both sides.

Sydney ferries offer sensational tourism experiences. During a short term visit to Sydney, I set out on Sydney ferries from Circular Quay to explore all that this city has to offer. To my delight, I spent several weekends visiting places as diverse as Manly, Parramatta, Cockatoo Island and Taronga Zoo all made possible thanks to Sydney's ferry network. The ferries also travel to the popular Eastern suburb venues of Watson's Bay and Rose Bay with each stop worth a visit for fabulous dining facilities and general sightseeing.
Took a ferry to manly beach. Lovely trip on ferry to manly beach, good value for money. Frequency of ferry very good and smooth journey, staff seemed friendly and so were the customers.

A great way to get around. On time & plenty of them - enjoy the views that you can get from them.Its also useful that they run late into the night, and when we returned to the Circular Quay from Darling Harbour we were given a roundabout tour of the central stops in Sydney

Part of what makes Sydney so unique.. Let's hope the Sydney ferries are never disbanded or modified - they are just great exactly the way they are. Oodling with character and charm, they are the best value tourist trips available - anywhere! Take a trip to the zoo or Manly Beach or just around the harbour. Sit outside and take the air - chill out and enjoy. I never ever go to Sydney without taking a trip on one of the oldest of the fleet.

Hop on Hop Off Ferries & Buses. These ferries are great value if you want to take a good look at Sydney Harbour. Take the Fast ferry to Manly and work your way back to Circular Quay. Fort Denison is a good stop for a mid harbour lunch or just coffee. Buy the bus and ferry pass for the best value. This will include bus tours of Sydney and Bondi Beach.

Sydney Ferries. A wonderful way to get around many parts of this great city, Best to travel on a Sunday with an Opal Card as for $2, 50 you have unlimited travel that can save you a packet. One of the central hubs for Sydney Ferries is Circular Quay where your journeys often begin.
like clockwork. like clockwork, lots of lines, good indicated, take a one day ticket and you can use all public transport for a day in sydney

The best way to tour the harbour. Compared to commercial operators offering a harbour tour the Sydney Ferries offer a better value for money and a way more expansive view of both the harbour and the Parramater River. By taking several ferry trips its also possible to plan an on-off route that lets visitors get of at any of the docks to stroll around get a bite to eat or go sightseeing.
Favourite way of travel. Lovely to travel into Sydney by ferry and see the Bridge come into view. Much better than by bus and also most relaxing way of starting your sight seeing.
Ferries. Fantastic, so easy to navigate . They were always on time, very clean. The staff were very helpful and very knowledgeable.

Paramatta River by ferry. On our last day in Sydney, we chose to take the ferry to Paramatta and it proved to be a great excursion by ferry from Sydney. From recollection, we caught the 10:07 and arrived at 11:30 (do check the times). The service was relatively fast, stopping at numerous points that made for an interesting ride up the Paramatta River; the trip was good use of our AUD65 7 day ticket. We enjoyed Paramatta and visited the Old Government House, 20 minutes pleasant walk from the ferry terminal. We returned by train to Town Hall Station (CBD) again making use of our 7 day ticket. If you are looking for a pleasant ferry ride, I'd recommend Parramatta as a great day out.
Simple, easy, fun. The best way to get around and see Sydney. Only $2.50 to travel all day on Sundays when you buy the Opal Card.

Travel for value on "Funday" Sundays. While holidaying in Sydney from New Zealand we found out about Funday Sundays. Each person paid $2.50 per ticket for unlimited travel for a Sunday. We were able to enjoy 4 ferry trips and night train trip across Sydney harbour and a bus trip to Bondi. Our family of 4 enjoyed a full day of sight seeing for $10. The services were timely and efficient. The train, bus and ferries were all well maintained and clean. To confirm we were in the right place and heading in the direction we sort help from several Sydney transport staff and found them very helpful.

Rode frequently often and a lot. We went to Manley Beach for brunch, another day for dinner and to another beach for lunch. These are a real value if you get the electronic card (after set figure all rides are free). These are not long rides, are pleasant, not too crowded because they leave frequently.
Does the job well.. Went to Manly Beach, was on time both ways. Free WIFI is good. Buy the full access train/bus/ferry ticket costing AUD 65 for 7 days, that will save time standing in queue.

The best nearly free tourist experience in the country. Forget the expensive lunch cruises or branded tourist boats - just buy a $7 ticket and jump on the ferry to Watsons Bay for what has to be one of the most scenic public transport trips in the world.
Trip to the Zoo and back. My daughter and i had a great trip on the ferry over to the zoo and back. great photo opportunities of the harbour.
great service. we used the ferries to get to manly beach on new years day,our ferry was on time,and fast,efficiant service,as was the return journey

On time and great views. What a great way to see Sydney and out to Manly. The ferries are clean, on time and are one of the best ways to see the sights of Sydney. Easy to use with smartphone apps for times. An added bonus is the $2.50 flat fee on Sunday's.
Ferry to Manly - too easy!. I ferry to Manly from Sydney for work sometimes. On all occasions I have found it very easy. This city has a fantastic ferry system. The trip is pleasant.

Eco Hopper. We booked the ferry called Eco Hopper with stops at Darling Harbour, Circular Quay (Opera House), Watson Bay and Manly Beach (among others). Totally worth it. They view of Sydney from the ferry is very relaxing. You will also have a sense of understanding the city - it's a city but with a very laid back attitude sort of a beach like culture because their famous beaches are just a few minutes away from the city center. It's very different from other countries where you have to travel far to see good beaches.
Great Trip. A good way to see the bridge and opera house for not a lot of money, fantastic views of the city from the river a must do!!

Great way to see the sights!. The Sydney ferries are a antastic resource for Sydneysiders and touists allowing them to travel cheaply whilst being able to enjoy the iconinc harbour views that Sydney has to offer. Easy to access and run on time - I couldnt recomend any other way to see sydney! Little tip - if you have an Opal card travel on sunday as your fare is only $2.50 for the whole day! Bargain!

Sydney to Manly and more. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and back then to Darling Harbour. The ferries were prompt, on time and real pleasure to ride, take the Circular Quay to Darling harbour run at night in order to get some great night shots of the city, Opera House and the 'Iron Lung'.
Great cheap service. Everyone who comes to Sydney should take the ferry to Manly and back. Inexpensive, easy to do and you get to have a. Great walk along Manly beach.

Best way to see Sydeny. Get a day tripper ticket and hop on the Manly Ferry for the best view of the harbour. Then if you've got time get on the jet cat to Parramatta and back - then you've seen it all!Only got time for half a day - pop to Mosman, Watsons Bay, Homebush - the list is endless and each destination has something to offer.We took my sister to Watsons Bay, got off and had a drink in the pub overlooking the harbour then got back on the ferry - back to the Quay then the jet cat return.Best way to travel and the views are fantastic. Ask anyone at the quay for help - they're all very friendly.
Best way to see Sydney. Forget the cruise boats, jump on a ferry to Manly or Cockatoo Island. It's a beautiful harbour and so nice to hop off and explore the villages. Cheap & easy.

Sydney Ferries. Ferries are very easy to access, they run on time and were very clean and efficient. They are very economical especially for pensioners, you must show some ID for the concessions. Great way to get around to all the outer areas of Sydney eg Bondi and Manly.
What a way to travel. The ferries are wonderful and the views of the harbour, bridge and opera house are magnificent from the sea. We did Sydney Quay to Darling Harbour - It was lovely

Great service and views. If you visit Sydney you need to take the ferry at least once. They are clean, good value and run very regularly and offer some of the best views of the city and highlights such as the Harbour Bridge and Opera House.Of course, they are also a very efficient and enjoyable way of getting around!
A fery ride to Manley. get on the ferry to manly have a drink in the new Brighton pub and a great meal next door in the Ivanhoe.

Poor form. Travel on the ferry to manly yesterday and do believe it needs a face lift the cords to charge your phones are all broken, you could hardly see out of some of the windows due to the filt, and they charge you a bomb
Excellent value to see amazing icons. Best way to see the harbour, Opera House and go under the harbour bridge, awesome. We paid very little and the ferries run every few minutes.
Sydney ferries great service. Used these ferries on several occasions while staying at an apartment on the cremone point . Great service very reliable and cheap and a great way to get around .

Train ferry pass great option. On a recent trip to Sydney my daughter, grandson and I bought the train and ferry pass day ticket. What a great option on and off the train and as many ferry trips as we could do in a day fantastic value for money.

Ferry, not across the Mersey, but Sidney harbour.. After seeing these ferries criss-crossing the bay, in films, and on TV it was really exciting to actually be on one, a really cheap, quick, and efficent way of moving around the waterfront districts in Sidney
Manly ferry. Great harbour views en route & a great destination.Obviously avoid the rush hour but at other times very relaxing

Captain Cruise Ferry. There are many ferries to choose from, and we used Captain Cruise on our recent trip to Sydney. We took the Ferry to and from the zoo, and it was great. Good customer service, frequent trips, and the boat wasn't too rocky. I definitely recommend Captain Cruise for your ferry needs.
the bay from the sea. take any ferry, relax, sit back, and enjoy the view. you will love every single moment of every trip
Manly ferry from CBD.. Get the fast ferry, as it is way more comfy than the bigger and much slower ferry. It only costs about 9 $ aus, and you get awesome views of the bridge and Opera House.

Always good value. This trip I went to Circular Quay from Balmain, for the first time. All ferries I have ever caught have usually been well on time. Easy to board and disembark and staff always helpful if passengers need assistance. What's not to like about travelling across a very beautiful harbour? Extra good for Aussie pensioners - you can travel on bus, train, light rail and ferries unlimited for $2.50 a day.

Taking the ferries was a great adventure!. A visit to Sydney would not be complete unless you ride the ferries. It’s a great and inexpensive way to see Sydney Harbour, the Opera House, the Sydney Bridge, the skyline of Sydney, and so on. There are passes available in convenience stores which allow you to take all forms of transportation in Sydney; the ferries, the buses and the train. Make sure you ask about the different types of passes at the information center.

easy to use but can get busy. easy to use with the opal card make sure You touch on and off and top up opal card easy to use but hard to top up have to top at newsagents or 7/11. be aware on sunny days they can get very busy lots of people so arrive early. Best trip to do is the Manly Ferry about 30 min both ways. Also the Watsons bay ferry to get Your sea legs great way to see Port Jackson cnt say any more really great thing to do a real must do

Great way to spend an afternoon. Take the ferry to Watson's Bay and you pass by the naval ships at Garden Island as well as the palatial homes of Point Piper and Vaucluse. Great way to see another part of Sydney, at Watson's Bay walk up to the lighthouse and view the Pacific Ocean, a great way to work up a thirst for a beer back at the Watson's Bay hotel. Now you can either take the ferry back to Circular Quay or the bus that meanders through the suburbs of Dover Heights, Vaucluse, Rose Bay and Double Bay. An excellent way of spending a leisurely sunny afternoon in April
Excellent way to see sights. Particularly love the Manly to city ferry. It's perfect for those postcard views of the city. Cheap way to familiarise yourself with the city
