Get aboard. Do as many as you can. Take them around. Seeing Sydney from the water is the best and ferries are fun and relaxing.
great way to travel. clear information and good service make these a popular transport option. In good weather, it's lovely to stand on deck and behold the views

Best way to travel and see Sydney from harbour. We were staying near Circular Quay and took a ferry to Watson Bay which we loved and Manly which was a wet day unfortunately. Another good ferry is from Darling Harbour which brings you under the Bridge, by the Opera House and into Circular Quay. A well run operation.
Brilliant way to see the harbour. We purchased a weekly travel pass which allowed us to get the ferry as far away as Manly. A great way to get around the harbour.

Travellers Delight. A trip to Sydney would be incomplete without a ferry ride to any destination from Circular Quay. Ferry rides from Circular Quay are an economical way of seeing a lot of Sydney, in comfort, and at a very reasonable cost.

A great way to see beautiful Sydney Harbour!!. We travelled from Circular Quay to Manly on the ferry in January 2015 this year...such great views of beautiful Sydney Harbour on your way and a very relaxed atmosphere. Great to see so many families enjoy this trip. We also travelled by ferry to Taronga Zoo last year in April 2014 with our children and grandchildren for a memorable day at the Zoo...our gorgeous grandchildren just loved the ferry ride and we loved seeing the joy on their darling little faces...would definitely recommend everyone to take a ferry ride!!
Old but Reliable. A great and cheap way to see greater Sydney apart from the city. The ferries are an adventure in itself. The Circular Quay to Parramatta Ferry is a highlight.
Great way to see the harbor. Even if you have no place to go and even if you do, this is a great way to get there. It is relatively inexpensive and pleasant.
Ferry trip to Manly. The ferry system makes it easy to travel to and from Manly, the Ferry was clean and comfortable and staff helpful
Good Experience. Its my first time in ferrie and i along with my family enjoyed our small trip. Rate is reasonable too.

Treat yourself to a trip. Recently I took a ferry to Cockatoo island. I had not been on a Sydney ferry for ages, and it was such a fun thing to do. The ride was excellent, with fantastic scenery on the way, including getting up close to developments at Barangaroo. The attendants were polite and helpful and the Opal card made entrance at the terminal a breeze. The only negative was that the interior of the ferry was looking tired and smelt a little damp from so much wet weather. New carpet and seat covers would greatly improve the atmosphere for tourists and commuters alike.

Great service, great view. Really convenient, cheap way to view the harbour and travel under the famous Harbour Bridge! Quick trip to Manly a nice change from the city, and a very easy day trip for some beach time.

The only way to travel.. We bought an opal card which enabled us to use the trains and the ferries at great value. The Ferries are just incredible....we went on them just for the pleasure of going round the harbour and seeing the sights.Great way to travel at a bargain price.

Sunset dinner cruise. Myself and my partner went for a sunset dinner cruise via Captain cook cruises and it was a good experience with the views of harbour and the opera house and the food was good as well!It was a 3 hour cruise and they drop you back at darling harbour.
best way to see the harbour. An easy relaxed way to tour the harbour. Regular time tables covering a vast area. Even on Australia day with thousands traveling.

Fun, cheap way to see the Harbour !. Love the fact that you can buy a ticket and spend the whole day sailing all over the harbour. Excellent information re timings but beware of trip to Watsons Bay...beautiful spot but our ferry was 20 minutes late and we almost missed our connection !

Ferry Across the Harbour. We took more than one ferry journey while in Sydney. All crews were friendly, the chairs are comfortable and the ferries clean. You can catch a ferry from both Circular Quay and Darling Harbour.

Buy the all you can eat Ferry ticket. We used the Sydney ferries to hit up Watsons Point and Manly in the same day. Very doable and you will not be rushed. I would recommend the ticket that allows you bus, metro, and ferries all day. It is around $24 AUD for an adult, $12 for a child and under 4 is free. Worth every penny and a gorgeous way to see the Harbor.
Only Way to Travel. The convenience, cost and views make the Sydney Ferries a MUST DO! It may not be the fastest boat but when you are on vacation it helps you to slow down.

Ok, if they aren't crowded. A tip to remember is that these ferries aren't just for recreational visits to the beaches and outlying areas. They are also used as a means to commute to the suburbs. So, if you're traveling during a peak time, be prepared to be stuck inside with no seat or a seat in the middle with no view. If you're taking the ferry to see the harbor views, you might miss out if you're on a crowded boat...

Great Views - Cheap. A great way to see the sights alond Sydney Harbour without having to pay the extra for the touristy cruises. Great if you are limited for time as you can grab one fo the ferries at your convenience.

Nice rides. If you have an Opal pass, most sydney ferries are include; day pass includes most of them; a ride to Manly beach is a must and you can walk through the cute shopping area to the beach and enjoy a lazy lunch before coming back
Great fun with the littlies.. Even though it was crowded out of its mind, everyone had a seat. Wonderful way of seeing the Harbour without paying a fortune for a Harbour cruise.
Must do. Great way of seeing the harbour and opera house in all their glory. Easy to use. Really cheap, especially on a Sunday!

Great way to travel. While staying in Double bay used this service to get to and from the harbour. Also took advantage of a day ticket to visit Manly and Parramatta. This was excellent as you see all aspects of the harbour the river and a great trip to Manly

Comfy but businesslike. Hopped on one of these ferries to get over to Manly for the afternoon/evening. It was a very slick operation, no frills but prompt and clean with enough seats to sit down on. Great for photo opportunities of the Opera House.

Love them. We used to travel to work every day on the ferries when we lived in Cremorne and it is still great to see them when we are back - busy with people as they travel to and fro across the harbour. Best way to travel to the Zoo and to Manly. Don't miss them!
Useful.. We took the ferry across to Manly during our short stay but I think they are very useful to travel to other local destinations.

Best way to Watsons Bay. The Watsons Bay ferry is one of the best trips in Sydney - interesting coastline from the Naval Dockyard to the homes of the rich and famous. In all weathers it is fast, smooth and delivers you right to the door of Doyle's Fish Restaurant at Watsons Bay.On a Seniors Concession ticket it is even better value! Staff are pleasant and helpful. If you miss the ferry back to the Quay the bus stop is not far away.

Must take on the ride!. Take a ride even if your accommodation is located in the heart of Sydney CBD and do not need to travel over the water. View from inside is quite amazing not only the opera house and Harbour bridge!
Great transport. Lovely way to cross the harbour and take in the views at the same time. Perfect for kids and great way to get across to Taronga Zoo and Manly etc.

Grabbed the Seniors $2.50 ALL DAY PASS.. Always a great experience criss crossing Sydney Harbour, surely the scenery is one of the best in the World. Loved the trip to Watson's Bay esp.you are able to have 3 or 4 drinks with lunch and still delivered back to the CBD safely.

Perfect. The ferries were a fun way to travel around Sydney. Easy access for prams. Plenty of viewing space. They come at regular intervals. Most pass sydney bridge and the opera house which is a perfect photo opportunity. The 'opal' card system is something to be questioned but that's not really anything to do with the service and experience of the ferries. Will definately come back.

Harbour transfer. I had forgot how easy it is to get around Sydney Harbour by ferry. Its also the cheapest way to travel as well as getting a pleasant cruise and sight seeing tour as well.Next time your in Sydney jump on a ferry from circular Que and go to Darling Harbour for about $5

What could be better on a beautiful day than travel on Sydney ferries to Watsons Bay or Cockatoo Island. Some of the ferries are old but have character and the Harbour is beautiful. Most staff are friendly and helpful and it is a delightful mode of travel.
DO IT. I got a week pass for $50 or so for the full week on whatever transport I wanted. Well worth it to get amazing views of the city and harbour
Great way to Sydney. Purchased the all day tickets which is good value, The ferries go to all the areas around Sydney, all the beaches and operate till late

Easy way to get around Sydney. When living in Sydney this was the most effective and easier options. It was fast and fairly cheap. An all day pass meant I could get unlimited ferries rides. The trip to manly was always nice. The ferries were always clean and tidy and gives you to option to sit either inside or outside.

Bad crowd management.. Thus should be a rave review having used the ferries several times on visits to Sydney. But this trip was like nothing we've experienced before. It was Easter and the sun was shining so they could have predicted high demand. Anyway, our return from Manly to Circular Quay was ok,good crowd mgt in Manly. But Circular Quay for the next bit to Darling Harbour was downright dangerous. Too many people on the wharf, and a last minute switch of sides saw two huge crowds trying to swap sides for their ferry. Some people didn't realise because the announcements were terrible, so they were trying to get off as others were swarming on. Terrible. People getting hysterical, terrible crush, no control. I was appalled and furious.

Great Views of Opera house and Bridge. we bought the ferry, sky tram and Taranga Zoo pass combination. The ferry gave terrific views of the opera house, bridge and the entire harbour. It took about 10 - 15 minutes to get to Taranga Zoo. The ferry gave a great overview of the harbour. The pass cost $55 a person, great value.
The Best Way to See Sydney. Jumping on a ferry is simply the best way to see Sydney Harbour. And as far as tourist attractions go, it's cheap.
Best way to see the City. The Sydney Ferries are the best way to see the city. Amazing views and a great transportation alternative to driving.

Famous Sydney icon - a must-do for every visitor. Relaxing on a ferry is the best way to see more of beautiful Sydney Harbour - take a seat inside or outside in the sun & air on a 'grand old lady' for quick ride from Circular Quay to Luna Park at Milsons Point (6min) for iconic view across the harbour to Opera House framed by the famous arching bridge; or Darling Harbour (20min) which takes you underneath the famous "coat hanger"; or to Taronga zoo (12min) & spend all day there, plus another stunning view from the top; or to Watsons Bay (17min) for fish 'n chips; or a medium trip to Manly (30min) to eat ice cream while walking to the beach; or a longer journey up the Parramatta River (not all the way - one direction to Parramatta takes a slow 1½hrs!) Enjoy the scenery whichever you decide!
Ferry to Taronga Zoo and Manly. The ferries are a great way to see the Harbour, they go frequently to all places around Sydney and are very well run.

Sydney ferries. What an awesome way to get around the beautiful harbour of Sydney. Just have your Opal card topped up and off you go. Very reasonable fares for An excellent service. Will definitely use them a lot more nest visit.

If only UK public transport was this good. Using the ferries in Sydney Harbour is a very efficient way of travel and they were always precisely on time. They also offer the opportunity to see the city from a different angle. Very cheap, great value for money, very efficient.

Get on and take it all in. The ferry system in Sydney operates VERY efficient. I can't say that it's always the quickest route from point A to point B but it's definitely an enjoyable way to get there. On nice days, get ahead of the line and try to get a seat outside. These are limited but are definitely a good way to take the scenery all in. Be sure to also get your return ticket when you buy your outbound, as not all stops sell them. You can also get an all day or multi-day pass.

Wonderful to ride a ferry on the harbour. You must try a ferry trip on Sydney harbour, you can do a short trip or or a longer one over to Manly or the Zoo. You just cant beat the views around the harbour just magic! I prefer the older ferries to the modern ones. They are usually on time, quite comfortable, I love to sit outside,

Took the ferry to Taronga, short trip worth the quick visit. Taking the ferries gets you amazing views of the Opera house and the Harbor Bridge not to mention your destination. As a visitor I recommend taking the ferry to Manly or to Taronga. It allows you to see a lot in a short amount of time.

No Better Way to See The World's Premier Harbour. Sydney's ferries weave an intricate webb around our magnificent Harbour. I can think of no better way to see every nook and cranny of this most delightful harbour than to spend a day, and night, traversing from North to South and East to West to enjoy the true beauty of this truly global city and its foreshores. The ferries vary in both shape and size, but each have their own delights. Take a picnic lunch, a thermos of tea or coffee or simply hop on and off and savour the local delights of Sydney's cafe society. Make sure you have your digital camera handy to snap a landing sea plane or a pelican soaring on thermals or skimming the water or view architectural delights or a square rigger, Luna Park, The Harbour Bridge, Pinch Gut Island (Fort Dennison) or the world renowned Opera House. View some of the worlds most expensive real estate on the way to Watsons Bay, hop off and enjoy Doyle's famous "Fish N Chips", take in the view from Camp Cove or imbibe Manly's vintage holiday atmosphere and use Sydney Ferry's free Wi Fi to see what Wiki has to say about various landmarks. Breath deep, relax and enjoy! The true beauty of Sydney Harbour is more than a place it's a state of mind.
Great trip to Manly. Forget the fast ferry and take the slow boat. Only $14.60 return for the 1/2 hour trip. Efficient on and off.

Best way to see Sydney Harbour. Get a MyFerry pass and spend the day in the best seats as you are sailing under the Bridge and cruising past the Opera House.No traffic jams!Trips to Manley where you experience the Pacific swells at the harbour entrance.Rose Bay a hidden gem that was the flying boat base- 9 days tp London!!Sail to Darling Harbour for great meal.Then do it all again at night with the Bridge and Opera House alight- spellbinding!!The best money you will spend in Australia!
Easy. The ferries are easy to use. If possible try the fast ferry, that will save you time and big waves. The are always on time.

Thrill ride to Manly. My son said it was awesome as the weather was blowing a gale and to paraphrase Gilligan's Island's theme song, "the little ferry was tossed!". Not dangerous but great fun was we hit the open sea swells between the heads and trying to turn for Manly saw the ferry sway and rock better than any Dreamworld ride!
A Must Do!. Even if you aren't going to Manley, ride the ferry.... the views of Sydney and the harbour are wonderful!
Overcrowded. We were caught in a crush of people coming back from Manly on Easter Sunday. We couldn't move for almost an hour. Quite unsafe

A must do. Anyone visiting Sydney would do themselves a disservice by not taking a ferry trip. This's is part of the heart of Sydney with trips to so many placs. We frequently go to Manly for lunch and on a nice day he trip itself is the highlight of the day.

great way to see the harbor. 15 AUD gets you a return (round trip) ride from downtown to Manly giving you great views of the Opera house, the bridge, and most of the harbor. Best deal in Sydney.When leaving downtown, sit in the back of the boat so you can see the bridge and Opera house without most of the people, they will be up front.

Sydney ferries nothing better. No better way to experience this wonderful harbour and surrounds. So easily accessible, clean vessels and so well organised. Something not too be missed a ride on a Sydney ferry. In all weather still worth the trip.

Great transportation. We took the ferries twice and it was great. They are always on time, clean, safe and so nice to sail on. The trip gives you a chance to have great views of the city and the terminals are wonderful and ordelry. People follow the rules.

Great way to travel. The ferries are fantastic to get to the Zoo and to Manly. The timing was great and made life much easier. Not much seating outside and as it was a lovely day they were taken up pretty much straight away.

Good transport. We bought a train/ferry and bus combination ticket for our stay and were so pleased. It works out very economical. The ferries were great, clean and on time, but don't forget the views, they are priceless

Amazing way to see Sydney. What a wonderful way to travel around Sydney. We travelled to Manly and Darling Harbour. Much cheaper than a boat tour and a great way to end an evening. A must do when visiting Sydney.

What better way to get to where you are going than a lovely scenic ferry ride?. Well ferries are found all over the world but I defy anyone to find the variety of destinations and an equally wonderful scenery! The magic of Sydney is really on full show from these ferries!
Young and old you will enjoy this ride!
harbour views. what a great way to see the city side from the water. do them all, see the other side of Sydney. dont forget to get off and walk some of the areas, amazing history

Great views and easy access. Easy way to see the harbour and get about, especially to check out all the little costal towns on the other side of the harbour. Pleasant trip, easy to find locations, docks all well signed and helpful staff.

Good but Double Check all the Options. A great way to see the sights take the regular Hop On & Hop Off to the various beaches. Manley, Watson's Bay etc and get Fish & Chips at Doyles!!
Just double check the offers as to what you get and always try asking for seniors rate if possible. Normally not allowed but try!

Clean tidy and efficient. Got ripped off when when using our card to pay for the service. First application declined the transaction and they gave us the receipt stating a decline. Second application went through. Next day we realized it had actually double dipped and then it took a week to sort out

beautiful experience. crossing the harbour in a ferry, for free!! (free opal card travel) and enjoyed free wifi too! Queen Mary 2 was docked at Overseas Passenger Terminal, fantastic photo opportunity!

fantastic experience. it is a fantastic experience to take the ferry, especially in the sunset. you may enjoy the opera house and harbour bridge from a different view. If you have time to have dinner and enjoy the sea view on the King Street Wharf after arriving at the Darling Harbour, it will be perfect.
Good Fun. We took a leisurely fery ride which included a buffet lunch to view more sights from the water.Also took a ferry over to Manly Beach-very easy to catch straight from Sydney Harbour.

Don't be intimidated if you're not accustomed to public transportation. Very easy to use transportation system, and what a great way to get views of the harbor and city! We went out the the suburbs and back, and over to Manly (A SYDNEY MUST-DO!) for a fabulous day. Try to be first in line and head upstairs for a spot outside.

Enjoyed the Ferries!. Staying in Sydney was wonderful and was made even better due to the chance to take ferries to other beaches and locations around Sydney. The Harbour is gorgeous and the ferry service wonderful. The price was right, the ferry very clean and there was free wifi. We really liked using the ferries and seeing the sights as we traveled to different beach destinations. I would recommend the ferry. It is relaxing and easy and always on time.

just Brilliant. The cost , the view and the surroundings . What more could you ask for . Forget the expensive tours . Hope on and off the ferry system. Every stop is well marked with times and costs.The staff are wonderful and go out of there way to help tourists.

The best way to see Sydney. The ferries are the ultimate way to get an unobstructed view of all of Sydney's famous landmarks. The Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Darling Harbour, Luna Park and Circular Quay are just some of the sights best seen from the water. The staff are friendly and the price is minimal.

Efficient Transportation, Beautiful View To Manly - Why Not?. I liken these ferries to the ones in Seattle. It's an efficient way to get to ones desired destination with an amazing view on a good day.We left at 8:40 am on a Sunday morning, and the crowd was minimal, view exceptional, 20 minutes or so to Manly.When we returned at 1:30 PM the ferries coming over were packed and pretty full returning.I would highly recommend the ferries.
Good network. Good service takes you to different parts of Sydney at a very affordable cost and you can absorb the scenic beauty on your way.

Anytime is a good time. The best money you will likely spend in Sydney. I LIVE in Sydney!Our harbour is spectacular. The Sydney Ferries go to so many places. To the Zoo, Manly (near the beach), Darling Harbour, and many more places. Views everywhere! Even in the rain, you are protected. Toilets on board, but better to go beforehand. USE sunscreen and take drinking water. Our sun will burn you. Take your camera. The memories will last long after your journey on our harbour. * Go to Circular Quay for the best place to take the ferry. Ask at Information, about the best tickets for your stay, and time you have available. GO, and have a fantastic time.

Very Disappointing. Caught a ferry from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay on the afternoon of Sunday 29th... asked one of the crew / assistants at the jetty for some assiststance and direction! He could not have been more unhelpful if he had tried and pointed to where I needed to go, then as it turned out it was the wrong place so he couldn't even point in the right direction!! Very disappointing Sydney Ferries.

Fast Ferry to Manly - delightful!!. We took the fast ferry to Manly and we were impressed with the whole experience. Clean, fast and friendly on the most beautiful harbour in the world!!! Awesome!!!! And licensed to ell alcohol for a relaxing drink enroute!
Good value. Easy to access and use,priced fairly,on time,clean. We used ferry to go to Manly Beach for the day.The ride gives you great photo opportunities.

Wonderful ferry trip around Sydney harbour. Sydney Ferries are not only a great way to get around in Sydney and some of the surrounding areas, they are a fun little activity for your visit wether you on your own or wth ur family .its g8 fun for everone.They run fairly frequently to most destinations covered by the ferry for transport and exploring / Adventure purposes. We take a brief ferrie trip from Cirqular Quay to Darling harbour these 2 destinations are fairly close together and we can easily stroll from one to the other or to each from many hotels in the CBD however this short ferry ride takes a scenic swoop trough Sydney harbour itself allowing FANTASTIC views and photo ops for the Sydney Opera House, Darling Harbour, The City Scape and The Sydney Harbour Bridge! Very affordable and fun treat!

faster commuting time. we tried the ferry service thrice, twice at the Parramata River and the other during our Manly Beach tour... Using the ferry was more convenient for areas where a river access is possible. Less traffic, faster commuting time and less crowd :) highly recommended ended :)

Great way to see the city and get around. Took the fast ferry to Manly. About a 20 minute ride. Cost of $9. Also rode the back to the city after the Blue Mountain tour. Quicker than staying on the coach and the scenery was amazing. The ferry system is a great way to get around

On Time and Affordable. We took 2 round trip excursions using the Sydney ferries. Hey are so scenic and fun. We went to Taronga Zoo one day and to Manly Beach another day. The ferries got us there with ease and beautiful views. We got OPAL cards to come and go on the public transportation, and the ferries are included in that. Great fun!

The best way to get around!. We took the ferry to Manly Beach early on a Sunday morning. Ferry wasn't full and we were able to get an outside seat. The weather was cool with a promise of a warm day in the air a little later.The voyage was enjoyable as you get a fab view of the Opera House and harbour bridge. I can't think why you would take a boat tour when the ferry is so easy, enjoyable and reasonable.In fact if you are a family, on Sunday you can get a family fun pass for $2.50 per person, that gives you access to all of the transportation choices in the city, all day long! Great value.
Pleasant Way to Discover Around. We found them to be mostly on time. Worth noticing was how clean they all were. Prices are reasonable too.

Inexpensive way to see the Harbour and surrounding areas. The boats may be a bit old, but for just a few dollars you get unparalleled views of the Opera House and the whole Sydney skyline. When we went there was also a sailing race going on, which added to the atmosphere.Costs just a fraction of the tours that are available and a round trip back to the starting point takes about an hour.

Cheap & easy with great views. We were in Sydney for New Year and the ferries still ran a great service, you do need to check times because they do stop running for a while on NYE but as long as you plan this is not a problem. Cost wise - great value.

Great Connectivity. Sydney Ferries are a gateway to The rest of Sydney harbors and bays. Get a multipass and you can go around Sydney economically. Rides are Picturesque, windy and fun. Good connectivity and frequency.
Great way to get around. Inexpensive and convenient. Easy to use. If you need help, ask anyone or check the transportation website

Well run - great way to see the opera house and bridge. Im staying in kirribilli. The ferries are every 30mins it's only about a 6 minute trip but with the opera house nicknamed "nuns in a scrum "and the Sydney harbor bridge nick named "the coat hangar"it's a quick trip but with a million dollar view.
Stunning ......another well deserves 5 stars "you rippa"
Clean and Punctual. I used the ferries three times and was impressed with the punctual service and clean interiors. A well run service overall.
trip to manly. busy ferry 40 minute sale to manly with great views of the opera house and harbour bridge,a must do is get on a boat in the harbour for a totally different prospective

Thanks. We had so much fun. The time schedules were very accurate in keeping schedules. One of the ferrys had a pilot on board gave wonderful commentary of what we were seeing and area we were heafed in to. The ferrys were very clean and comfortable. Enjoyed our time in Sydney.

Sydney Harbor Ferries. In March 2015 we took the Sydney Harbor ferry tour departing out of the centrally located Circular Quay. The ferry featured plenty of outdoor deck seating. We were also offered a nice selection of snacks with coffee or tea which was included with our tour. We could hear the informative and humorous guide very well, even over the bustle of the harbor. We highly recommend the ferry as an interesting way to experience Sydney's beautiful harbor .

Punctual and efficient. We took the ferry from Circular Quay round to Darling Harbour. It is a great opportunity to sail under the bridge and get some good photos of it and also the Opera House.The ferry stops at quite a few places on its way to Darling Harbour.

Roll the waves. to get to Manley beach, you had to get a ferry, it took about1/2hr,it was a very smooth crossing, and as I hate boats I was delighted to get to the beachThey had golden sands, beautifully clean, a great place to spend a few hrs
easy. We used the ferries to goto rose bay , an icedible scenic cruise and great shopping and restaurants everywhere .
Sydney ferries are a great way to see the sights!. We took ferries several days in a row. They are a great way to get around Sydney. They are clean and dependable.
Fantastic. Take the ferry that goes on a round trip under Sydney harbour and past the Opera house. Great ride and great way to see the harbour. Fares are reasonable. Great for taking photos.

Paramatta to Sydney CBD via ferry. What an awesome way to see some sights whilst relaxing on a ferry. Commentary, adequate seating, ventilation, window views Etc. We caught it at Paramatta and the only thing to flag is if there are not enough people on the dock you are directed to a bus instead. Whilst waiting and then disembarking at this point there is a fantastic bar and cafe to waste away 4 ok 6 hours

Not only a means of transportation. As a tourist, riding the ferry is a must. You get a beautiful view of the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge.It’s also faster than the bus (or a car ride) to get to some places, so that’s a plus. The ferry itself is super clean, there’s free Wi-Fi on board, and you can even have a snack (there’s a little kiosk on the lower deck). The staff is friendly and always willing to help. It’s also important to mention that the ferry is ALWAYS on time. You can definitely rely on the published schedules.
Fun on the Ferry. We loved this delightful short trip to Luna Park. Kids loved it. I enjoyed the views of the Bridge and the Opera House.
Great way to get around. Ferries run right on time. Great way to get out to Manly Beach, buy the day or 7 day pass depending on your length of stay
Sydney Ferries. This is a great way to wander around Sydney Harbour. We went up the river to Parramatta, over to Manly & to Watsons Bay

Not really attraction, but you should try. This is not really an attraction, it's more like a daily transportation for many people living in Sydney. but if you are a visitor in Sydney, you just have to try to take at least a ride between Parramatta Wharf and Darling Harbour, preferably not in summer. I just found the breeze and view relaxing. the best way to enjoy Sydney ferries is no to stay inside the cabin, walk around sit in the front, but stay safe!You can also get to Taronga Zoo through this mean (rather than driving there around longer road), and it's the only means to get to Cockatoo Island (check the schedule not always available).

Take a Trip!. Loved the ferries in Sydney. We got the Opal card which allows you to travel unlimited for an Aussie dollar maximum of $15/daily.Took them to Manly, Darling harbor, Watson bay and all the way to the west end. Can't beat the sites with the bridge and Opera house and beautiful homes surrounding the harbor.

Excellent way to get around.. We used the ferries several times while in Sydney. We took the ferry from the harbor to the zoo and the Manly ferry. On Sunday the ferries are a reduced price so the ferry to Manly Harbor had a queue of an hour and a half. We went to the zoo instead, choosing to go to Manly on Monday. There was not wait on Monday. You get good views of the harbor and there are several routes to choose from.

Great Way to Get Around. We took the ferry to Manley Beach (a 30 minute ride). Very scenic, but if you want to know what you are looking at, best to take one of the harbor cruises. Great way to get to Manly or the Zoo.

So Efficient and Easy to Use. The ferry system in Sydney, especially if you're in and around Circular Quay and the CBD is incredible. It makes is so easy and fun to get around to many of the neighborhoods and attractions in and around Sydney's beautiful harbor.

Fun way to get around. Sydney Ferries are great! Not necessarily known for their comfort (because they are functional and far from luxurious), the green and cream ferries are constantly churning their way over and around the harbour, taking people on their daily business but also giving the most spectacular views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. We were staying close to Circular Quay and hopped on the ferry a few times to take a leisurely cruise around to Darling Harbour and all its restaurants. Definitely the best way to get there.

Ferry to Taronga Zoo. That's the only ferry we took during one week stay on Sydney as we chose to rely on public busus and hire a car for longer journeys like to Manly. The ferry to Taronga Zoo gives you a unique view of the back side of the Opera House, everyone rushed to the side of the ferry to admire and snap endless photos. Ferry frequency is sometimes a pain. I liked the fact that there was a staff selling tickets at the ferry waiting area helping visitors to avoid the line at the Zoo entrance.
Worth a go. this is a great way to see sydney. It's public transport, but you actually get the experience at a very reasonable price. Jump on and off. Should not be missed.
Reliable. Good value.. Recommend them highly. Comfortable seating and stay on schedule. Don't be late! Easy to get to Circular Quay and ticket staff were very helpful.

Best way to get around. Love Sydney for there transport. Don't drive in Sydney go by train, taxi or the ferry. The ferry are going all the time. Be sure you pick the right one for you. As there are a couple of company's running.Google and see what time table is right for you.

The perfect way to travel!. This is the perfect way to get around Sydney. The Ferries are inexpensive, comfortable and will offer a view of Sydney that you won't get anywhere else. We love using them!
Well worth a voyage!. Some of the ferries are looking a little tired now, but still a great way to travel between Circular quay and various other places mainly northwards,

Fun fast trip to Watsons bay. It's great to sit upstairs outside on this small fast ferry. If you like the fresh air .Be warned though it gets very windy so don't leave anything on your head that you don't want blowing off. Downstairs outside can get wet from spray if the water is choppy so be aware. This ferry is faster than the many ferry and a fun trip to lovely Watsons bay
A great way to view the harbour. I love the ferries. Years ago I used to go to and from work by ferry. For speed try the new ferries, but stick to the old ones for viewing at a more leisurely pace.

Great views of the harbor and surrounding areas!. I took a ferry to Manly from the Circular Quay. It was a thirty minute ride. The views of the harbor are impressive! The ferries tend to be full. I used them several times as I also went to Taronga using the ferry. That was under 15 minutes. Would use them anytime as very economical as well!

Manly. Took the ferry to Manley beach . Prices eating in the hotels was fantastic . We had lunch in a hotel there can't remember the name, it was massive , and cheap and very good . A bottle of wine was $20 . Very nice .

Manly Ferry. Easy to use especially if you have already purchased an Opal card from nearby newsagency. The Ferry was comfortable and clean and arrived safely at Manly Beach. I love going on the Ferries.

Awesome visit but expensive. Ferries have a really nice view of sydney harbour. Highly recommended for people going to manly but the ferries going to manly sometimes experience rough conditions because it is nearly out of the harbour area. Great to take photos of sydney harbour. Highly recommended and with ur opal card on sun its only $2.50 or travel after 8 times its free so that will save u $15 cos one way ferry is like 7

So easy to get around. The Sydney Ferries make it so easy to get around Sydney and the Harbour. Good and big area at Circular Quay to depart/arrive from. Easy to navigate to and from. If you have any questions the staff are helpful. some of the ferries look old, but are still great to travel on. You can sit inside or outside. Highly recommend taking one or many ferry rides

Great views but can be crowded.. The ferries are used for commuters and tourists alike so they can be very crowded at certain times on certain routes. However, the views are amazing! We got the transit card that allowed for unlimited travel on all modes of transport so it was "free" to just take rides for fun. It was a great way to see the harbour. The trip from Watsons Bay to Circular Quay gave great views of downtown Sydney!
April 2013. You can buy a weekly pass which gives you unlimited travel for a week. If you like to travel around its ideal.

Must do!. We travelled via ferry several times. The Manly ferry was a great trip, we did it twice!! The scenery was fantastic. We travelled to Darling Harbour several times which is also a good trip. We found the ferrys very clean and the staff helpful. Great public transport. Worth getting a pass for the time that you are going to spend in Sydney, you can travel on the trains, busses and ferrys as much as you like.
take them all. It's a cheap way to get around the harbour and see the whole of the best points, it's a must do. Much better than HK Harbour and the air is clean

aaaand ... there's Syndey Opera House!. It's funny, though I was standing in front of Sydney Opera house, eating a Magnum and taking photos, it didn't really seem to sink in.It wasn't until we took the ferry accross to Manly Beach, and I took a moment to sit down and breathe, that I really realized how amazing the view was. I'm a little afraid of ferries. I get sea sick and freak out on the open water, but the trip was smooth, and even when the ship gently rocked, I knew I was in good hands.I wasn't on the ferry long enough to give a full review of the ship itself, but if you want some specatuclar views of the city, it's really worth a trip!
Best and Cheap. Sydeny Ferries are best and very cost effective.It was a kind of relief when we got to know about it as it is very economical and better mode of transport in Sydney.
Another take on Sydney.. Inexpensive way to see Sydney from the water -- and everyone should see Sydney from the water! It was so exciting I took way too many photos...

The Best Way to See Sydney. Great views of the city from the water. We took a number of ferry trip on our stay and the enjoyment never really got old. Highly recommend riding the ferries. We particularly liked our trips to Watson Bay and Manly Beach.

I Love the Sydney Ferries!. To me, what makes Sydney Harbour so awesome is that you can see the other side(s), so it's scenic wherever you are in the harbour. And the best way to see it is from the water. As a visitor, I found the Sydney Ferries are very easy to use. There's a series of reasonably priced travel passes that can be used throughout the Sydney transportation system - on the ferries, on the trains (even to the Blue Mountains), on the buses - we bought ours just before catching the train into Sydney CBD from the airport. It was very convenient and nice to not have to find the correct change in a foreign currency before each ride.
see the sights. great value, had ferries included with train and bus ticket, hopped on a few and visited a few of the locations, enjoyed Manley and it's beach the most

A transport with a view. A convenient and pleasurable way to transit various places of interest in CBD area. The transport is very comfortable and reasonably priced. It also provides a lovely view of Sydney. Check the website for timings and routes- they are very accurate.

Sydney Ferries to Everywhere. Sydney has ferries heading out from Circular Quay to all points of Sydney Harbour throughout the day. You can travel to places from one end of the harbour to the other, across to North Shore, to Darling Harbour, along the river to Paramatta and to so many other harbourside places. The ferries are so relaxing, very scenic and provide excellent photo opportunities of attractions which include the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. All trips on the same day can be done using the one inexpensive ticket which includes endless travel on ferries, trains and buses.
Manly trip. only 20 minutes to Manly on the fast cat and a very flexible timetable with boats leaving every hour.A good price at only $19 return.Not at all crowded I could have sat almost anywhere.
Trip to Manly. Its a beautiful way to get to Manly across one of the most delightful harbours in the world. Just do it you will not be dispointed.

BUSY WORK HORSES OF THE HARBOUR. Both as a tourist attraction, and public transport these ferries create a colourful scene as they travel across the Harbour to various destinations.
If in Sydney you have got to have a ride on at least one of the ferries.

Loved the ferries!. I took a ferry to Manley which was great. We also took a boat tour of the harbor which sounded like it would be touristy which it was but we enjoyed it. Good way to hear about Sydney and get a water view.
Simple, easy & enjoyable!. Over our 4 day stay in Sydney we used the ferries into the city often. They where always ontime, clean and its easy to understand the time tables.

Best way to get around. Use the ferry system to cross to manly Beach and again to Tauranga Zoo. Not only efficient and inexpensive, probably the best way to get views of the city and harbor. If you're in town for more than a day investigate the 'My Sydney' or 'My Ferry' multi-day tickets. Great value.
A lovely part of Sydney. A great place to spend several hours, relaxing, enjoying the gardens and looking out at the harbour. On the doorstep of the Sydney Opera House too!

Ferry to Manly.. Excellent place to visit with beautiful views of Sydney harbour and the bridge. No need to book expensive tours of the harbour just use the ferries. Get an Opal card for best value of ticket.
great transport. get a day ticket and travel all over on the ferries, so handy. Visit Bondi, Manly and Darling Harbour for a great day out.
Take the trip Manly Beach for a cruise across the harbour. For the price of a return trip to Manly you get 2 x harbour cruise with the bonus of some time at the beach.

A must do experience every time I'm in sydney. We caught a ferry from Circular Quay to Elizabeth Bay. A very scenic ferry ride and a great photographic opportunity. If you love beautiful homes and gardens then take a ferry ride de to Elizabeth Bay, catch the local bus from the Elizabeth Bay ferry stop and head up the hill to Miltary Road, Mosman . Cafes, pubs, clubs, shopping, and beautiful homes and stunning gardens. Wander along Mosman and enjoy this very pretty surburb.
Dont rely on the ferru to get you anywh et e on time. . Good for tourist but a hopeless service for commuters. The schedule is purely optional but the trip itself is pretty. ..

ferry to Manly.. No dislikes, the ferries are old but well maintained and the Manly ferry gives a great view of Sydney harbour and runs ever 30 minutes. easy booking system and seniors cards from other states are excepted ($2.50 for all day travel!)

Take any ferry! You won't be disappointed!. The Sydney Ferry system is inexpensive and efficient. It's a great way experience the harbour. All ferries leave from Circular Quay. We recommend buying a day pass if you're only in Sydney for a few days. We went to Watson's Bay and had a great lunch at Doyle's, and then ferried to Manly Beach for a great afternoon of shopping. The return from Manly Beach offered a beautiful view of Sydney!

We took the ferrie over to manley, it's a must to do.. Enjoyed the ride over seen plenty on the way over to manley , beautiful views.The ferrie stops at the zoo on the way to manley ,You must do. Very cheap prices.

excellent. these ferries are a great and inexpensive way to see Sydney sights.On a Sunday with an opal travel card you can go anywhere all day for $2.50. That includes rail, bus and ferry.It does however get quite packed leave early to take full advantage.

Sydney ferries. The Manly ferry provided an excellent service - price included on our 'opal' card. Seating inside and out. Due to high season the ferry was crowded but comfortable. We also used the Watson Bay ferry which was a fast service and also very good. We enjoyed seeing all the iconic landmarks from sea

Great Value. Its one of the easiest ways to travel around Sydney, the harbour is just incredible. We were there for a week and got a multi pass for $56 each, which we used daily and well in excess of its cost, hence great value and a really nice experience too.

Parramatta CAT. A trip along to Parramatta on the CAT gives an alternative view of Sydney Harbour to the Ferry to Manly.It goes pretty quickly and I would suggest a one hour stop at Parramatta for a coffee or a drink before returning on the next CAT back.The service is frequent and comfortable.
Awesome views. I love seeing Sydney from this point. You get to see the Opera House, the Bridge, and if you head to see Manly you'll see more.

Parramatta Ferry - different way to see Sydney. Most of the reviews of Sydney Ferries are to the already famous destinations such as Manly and Taronga Zoo. Well, there is another destination which worth to cruise, to Parramatta Wharf, Route F3.The ferry, River Cat, cruises to the upstream of Parramatta River, with end of destination at Parramatta Wharf. The trip is going under several bridges, such as Sydney Harbour Bridge, Gladesville Bridge, Ryde Bridge, Old Meadowbank Bridge, John Whitton Bridge, Silverwater Bridge, Thackeray Bridge, Carlington Railway Bridge, James Ruse Dr Bridge, This is the best way to see Sydney from different angle, from the River to the most upstream point, Parramatta Wharf.

Better than a taxi. We enjoyed the ride from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay for only $6 ow. The next day we took a ferry from Darling Harbour to Manly Beach return. It took about 3 hours but it was worth the view. Only cost $24. It's a great way to have a tour by water.

Great way to get around Sydney. From Circular Quay you can take a ferry to just about every Sydney waterfront on its 300km length - not forgetting the famous Manly Ferry!
Enjoy the ride!
Must Do!. If you come to Sydney you must get on a ferry and take a trip anywhere! Watson's bay, Manly, Rosebay, it doesn't matter just go for the ride. The sights are beautiful and not to be missed.

Watson's Bay. We took the ferry to Watson's Bay. The ferries were very clean and arrived at their destination in a very timely manner. I would highly recommend that you experience a ferry ride around the harbor.
a must do activity. we used the ferries 4 times to get to Watsons Bay and Manly and they run a very slick and professional operation- a great way to take in the sights.
FERRIES. Well worth using the ferries around Sydney. You get to see all the lovely bays and harbour side houses as well as getting up close to the cruise liners that are docking in Sydney

Sydney Ferries. Sydney Ferries are clean, punctual, relatively cheap - and cover a wide area. The staff are polite and helpful. On a bright summer's day, it's great to stand at the front of the boat, sailing across the harbour or on to the northern suburbs. My favourite trip is the ride from Circular Quay to Manly on the stately Freshwater. I've also used the ferries to Taronga (for the zoo) and the Jetcats to Cockatoo Island, Watson's Bay and Parramatta. Definitely recommended!.

Incomparable Beauty in a Marine Setting. Living on an island myself, I often exaggerate the inconveniences of ferry travel and take the surrounding beauty of nature in a marine setting for granted. The several spectacular ferry rides aboard the Sydney Ferry System reminded me of how lucky I truly am. If only in Sydney for a short period make sure try one out. My recommendation, if you have limited time, would be... the take the Manly ferry later in the day, have dinner in Manly and take the ferry back to the Quay in the dark.

Fantastic ferries. Sydney ferries are a great way to view one of the most beautiful harbours in the world.Not just a good means of transport,they offer a lovely travel experience.A trip to the zoo or Manly are two of the ultimate ferry experiences!
The only way to travel. Theses the best way to travel round Sydney harbour. Ferries always on time and great value. Also some wonderful sights to be seen whilst travelling

Ferry to everywhere. The ferry rides were brilliant.You could go to so many places on them for a reasonable cost.We took one to Manly . Then we took one to watsons bay and also round to Darling harbour

Easy to get around, spacious and fun. Take a ferry someplace! If you go to Olympic Park by ferry, it'll take about an hour and it's a cheap, free tour with sun and breeze on the top deck- a great way to spend some time on a beautiful day in Sydney.
Fantastic. I envy Sydneysiders going to work on the ferry across the every day. Riding a ferry in that beautiful surround,fresh air and wonderful harbour,what more could one want?
Very easy to use and fast. Utilize the Sydney transit system! Easy to use and ferries give you a great view of the harbours! Very timely and staff are friendly and helpful!
Get an OPAL card. The operators are super friendly and helpful. The ferries are right on schedule and offer many options for hopping on and off. The Opal card is a great buy for transit.

a fantastic way to see Sydney from the water.. For Me, this is the best thing about our holiday. We took almost one a day to get around.Get yourself a pass, which you can use on the train &bus.Cooling in the hot sun, and watching this great city at night is probably the most magical way to say good bye.Very romantic to get on a ship, with a picnic for the day.All the crews were always friendly & knowledgeable about the sailings.

Ferries a Good Way to the Beach. We took the ferry to Manly Beach. It was a very economical way to see the harbor area, and get to the beach. It also gave wonderful views of the Opera House and Harbor Bridge, especially on our return trip!

Nothing wrong with the ferry just the staff!. The booking staff couldn't be more unhelpful,if they tried, sadly a common theme with lack of customer service in Sydney and signs left up giving out of date information. But ferry rides were always punctual with friendly crew. Opal card is a cheaper option for travel, unless you going to an attraction, homework needed for that.
take the waterbus in sydney. best way to visit the harbour, the bridge and the opera houseno need to take the organised tour, prefereed one is the ferry to darling harbour
Brilliant. Avoid all the "excursion" boats that charge a fortune for a cruise around the harbour. Just take a couple of ferries. We loved them.
A worthwhile place to visit. Lovely way to get around. Take the Ferry to Manley which has a lovely beach and town. Not expensive and a nice way to travel.

Best way to see the city. A fantastic public ferry network that runs from Circular Quay to many parts of the city, which is a great way for visitors to get around. There are fast ferries out to the beaches at Manly, shallow draft "river-cats" which run to the Olympic Park and beyond plus less exotic vessels that are the mainstay of the fleet. A ferry is the easiest way to get to the zoo at Taronga, Watsons Bay (the original Doyles fish restaurant).Get a ferry somewhere
A day on the Harbour. this is always a joy to travel across the harbour on a ferry especially if its a day trip to Taronga Zoo and on a beautiful sunny day

Still a reliable swervice.. If you are in Sydney for several days and wish to explore then but a Multi 3 Ticket. It covers ferries, buses and trains and lasts 7 days. You can go as far as The Blue Mountains on the train and anywhere on the ferries. We easily got our monies worth before 7 days were up and it really does give you the freedom to explore Sydney and surrounds.

Excellent!. A wonderful way to get from one side of the harbour to another, whether it be Manly, The Zoo or Luna Park, I would always choose to go this way and we have taken many visitors on Sydney Ferries and they always enjoy it.
Figure it out or just ask.. Best trip in town. Any ferry to the end, eat/drink and catch one back. They don't overload so room is fine even if you are last one on.

Ferries, walks and many free attractions in Sydney.. I live in Sydney and almost every day direct visitors looking lost to where they are hoping to go. You can walk almost everywhere here. From Kings Cross, for instance, I walk down through Woolloomooloo, pass the Art Gallery (free), on down through the beautiful Botanic Gardens (free) to Circular Quay. There, you can visit the MCA (modern art), Customs House and the great Opera House...all free! Then, instead of the more expensive tourist ferries, catch the Manly ferry, great views of the harbour for half an hour (just the regular ferry fare), then in Manly, lots of restaurants and Manly beach. Also in Sydney, walk to Darling Harbour through the city, then on to Chinatown to Padd's Market, and a good food court upstairs. There are good budget hotels/hostels nearby, or up in Kings Cross (Victoria and Orwell Streets are best; the main drag gets too noisy. Over all, Sydney can be seen inexpensively...and it's beautiful. By the way, there is a free (green) bus #555 runs from the Quay to Central and back. Much to enjoy here.

Gets you from A-B, but could be so much better... I realise they have a captive audience, however that is no excuse for poor service, limited ticket booths, poor seating and long waiting times to get on the ferry with nowhere to sit while you wait. If it wasn't for the fact the Harbour can't be missed if visiting Sydney, I would suggest other methods of transport.Being local we take the ferry often and the kids love it but it could be a better experience.
A FERRY GOOD TIME FOR SENIORS. The ability to go anywhere for $2.50 each a day, especially up to Hawkesbury River to join the Postman's cruise, and to Watsons Bay and Rose Bay
Ferry Service is fantastic. Well we love the Ferries being Pensioners, as we can get a $2.50 ticket every day which allows us to use many transport options, it's great.The Ferry Service is wonderful.

Public transport at its best. Took the ferry from circle quay to manly beach. It's cheap, only fifteen dollars return and a really fantastic way to see sydney harbour. Lots of photo opportunities. If the wifi worked as promised it would be a full five stars. Manly beach is definitely worth a visit too!

Ferries excellent value, timely and good seating. How many places can you go and have a view of a great harbour and enjoy a comfortable seat for a few dollars? Well, here's one of them. Sit on the opposite side on the way back and see a whole new landscape.
]
Very efficient. We had an Opal card, so it made getting around very easy. Ferry to Manly only took 30mins and was lovely being out on the Harbour and viewing the sites.

River Cat - parts of it are excellent. We have spoken about doing the River Cat from Circular Quay to Parramatta for years but never got around to it until recently. The voyage from the quay through the harbour via Balmain, various islands,Hunters Hill, Cabarita & up to the Olmypic venue was excellent & gives a new perspective to those of us accustomed to driving to these locations. Good Sydney weather is a bonus.Here's my advice. Get off at Homebush Bay & catch another ferry back. The section up the muddy, mangrove lined Parramatta River is done at "no wash" speed, is dead boring & adds an hour onto the return trip.Take your own refreshments & nibbles to enjoy along the way. There are no food options on board. Refreshments can be had at various stops but will extend your trip time.

Sydney ferries. Sydney ferries are just the best. It is the only way to travel. I used the Manly ferriy, which I had used before, many years before. I travelled then on the old South and North Stein Ferries which had travelled from the UK under their own steam, the South Stein is now a Resturant in Darling Harbour. This trip I used the Ferry which takes you from Circular Key to Parramata, along the Parramata river. This was so enjoyable I just loved it. My best ferriy of all was the little ferry that travels between Circular Key to Milsons Point, Luna Park etc to Darling Harbour and back again. The men and women who work on these ferries were great, really great customer service, I highly recommend them.
Easy to use. Good time tables, easy to read schedule, fast and cool way to get around and look at the harbour. Good prices I think

circular quay to darling harbour. Why walk when you can take a scenic short trip on the ferry. This was much easier and cheaper than catching a taxi!Another must do when visiting sydney, and take a trip to manly. The staff in the ticket booths are very helpful.
Great experience. I took the ferry to go to Manly, It's such a great experience! It takes 45 minutes but the view from the ferry was unbelievable!

Great way to sight see. One of the best ways to get you bearings is to take a trip on the ferries to see the city. Each trip gives you a different view and something new to see. You could spend all day on these ferries and never get bored.
Good value. Great value tickets available, clean and on time. Links to all popular parts of Sydney. Good views from the ferry of all the harbour landmarks.
Fab ferries. These ferries are great, the best way to see Sydney. You can hop on hop off. They are on time, clean and tidy.
Great way to Sydney from the water. The Sydney Ferry's are an inexpensive way of getting from A to B and have a great view of Sydney form the water.

Quick frequent service. Easily accessible and reasonable- nothing to dislike. Food available on board. Good way to see Sydney Harbor at a budget price, especially if you take the ferry to Manly and return

The best way to travel to Sydney City!. Taking a ferry into the city from the suburbs is a great experience. We sat in the open air on the top deck. Had a great view of the opera house shining in the sunlight, passed close to a fantastic yacht, and a large cruise liner, watch small sailing boats raceing in the blue sea! What more could you want?
great service. We were in a hurry, and had to get the ferry on a Saturday, excellent service,friendly staff, easy to use Opal Card also, no problems wha tso ever.

Easy way to get about. The ferry system in Sydney is a great way to visit various locations in Sydney Harbor. It's well marked and easy to use. We visited various places over a few days in the area and enjoyed the clean and well operated ferries.

Great water trip. Don't miss the ferries from the Circular Quay in downtown Sydney. They are incredibly easy to access and use -- many of Sydney's citizens commute on them daily from around giant Sydney Harbour. Whether you're taking a water taxi to tiny Fort Denison for lunch in the middle of the harbour or a ferry to Manly Beach with its quaint Corso walk and a delicious lunch at famous Hugo's, the ride is glorious, the views of all of the hills and islands around the harbour absolutely spectacular.

New Year excursion. Sydney - one of the great harbours of the works - is ready for one of the most exciting nights of the year: people are bustling about, others are taking a leisurely stroll. The atmosphere is bouyed up by expectation. On the Harbour, on a Sydney Ferry, you can be in your own world, viewing whatever you'd like, taking in the scene as the ferry goes from one bay to the next, one wharf to the other.A wonderfully relaxing way to see the sights and take on the ambience of the occasion.Make sure you get back to your destination before the last scheduled ferry, as more and more people are coming to the city for the evening.A must! An annual event for us!!
Great Sites. Great way to view the harbor sites and cheap. Hop a ferry and ride to anywhere, you can get some great photos of the major sites.

We got on for Free on the Sydney ferries with our well-used Opal cards!!!. If you have plenty of time, riding the different ferries provide wonderful sightseeing without tiring your legs. The Manly Ferry is wonderful and SLOW. The Watsons Bay Ferry is wonderful and FAST---it stops at Darling Point, Double Bay, Rose Bay, and finally Watsons Bay. The ferry that goes to Parammatta takes 3 hours one-way.How we got to ride the ferries for free??? Since we were going to be in Australia for 3 weeks, we started out by loading AUD$50 on each of our Opal cards. All we did was use the Opal card 8 times anywhere in the city, with intervals of one hour between each ride. With so much to see, we had used the Opal card 8X in 2 days! So on the third day, anywhere we went on the Sydney train, ferry, bus, or light rail was FREE:))) Do know that the Opal card week is from Monday to Sunday. We also went to Blue Mountain for Free doing this. Enjoy!What else is free??? There's also Free Bus #555 that goes up and down George Street, both directions every 10-15 minutes, between Circular Quay and Central Station (Railway Square). Runs Monday to Friday 9AM -3:30PM, until 9PM on Thursdays only. Saturday and Sunday, 9:30AM to 6PM.

Captain Morgans Cruise was Excellent. We had a Buffet Lunch at the start of our Cruise the food was very good and plenty of choices . we had a good couple of hours on our cruise the crew were very good

Fabulous. Buy an opal card, we put 40.00 each and then topped it up as we needed to, you can order them online, register and then request a credit for the residue when you get home. We loved the ferries.

Ferries nothing special but scenery wow!. The title pretty much sums it up. The ferries themselves are pretty mediocre and, at least every time I rode along, over-crowded and not cheap. But oh my hte views.... worth it.

Travel the Harbour to manly. Taking the ferry to Manly is a must for any visitor to Sydney. Magnificent views of yacht racing, pleasure craft and the busy waterfront. Get off at manly and stroll down the corso. Take a walk along the beachfront to Queenscliffe or the other way to Fairy Bower and Shelly Beach. Great cafes and bars.

Cruisin' from Manly to the city or vice versa. If you're not in a rush, a ride on the Ferry from Manly to the City or back again, is a great way to travel. Feel the sea breeze in your hair on the outside deck as some of Sydney's pristine harbour-front bushland passes you by....and then some of Sydney's priciest real estate. Wednesday afternoon sees the harbour filled with the billowing sails of yacht-racing so make sure you bring your camera for some up-close action pics.

SYDNEY HARBOUR FERRIES. I suppose many people use the Sydney Harbour ferries to commute to the city either to get to the workplace or to shop, or to attend entertainment venues in the city - very pleasant and convenient! I am retired and hold a seniors's card and a pensioners' card, so I can use my $2.50 excursion card to travel to Circular Quay by rail, and then to travel by ferry to Manly (30 mins. each way) or to Parramatta (90 mins. each way) or to Watson's bay or Rose Bay. The trip to Manly has the advantage of a cafe on board (which closes at 7.00 pm) so you can buy coffee, pies, sandwiches and sweets. The ferry has to cross the open water (1 nautical mile) between the heads, and sometimes the conditions can be rough, so the boat rolls around and dips quite alarmingly at times (how exciting!) but I have never heard of the boat's actually capsizing. The ferry also has wi-fi access on the upper deck. I have made the round trip many times on these ferries (very pleasant and relaxing!) but a word of caution on Sundays in the late afternoon on the Manly ferry, because you will probably be ordered off the boat when it reaches Manly, and will have to join an enormously long queue to make the return journey, because it is just so popular on Sundays. I have spent up to an hour in the queue at this time. Graham Miller, Summer Hill.

Incredibly well organised. We took several ferries to various destinations and they were all so well organised and staff so helpful . Each ferry trip was also very informative about the areas we were passing and other areas we were advised to visit . Very impressed .

Great way to get around. They are comfortable, clean and timely. What more could you ask?! When leaving the harbor to venture to whichever destination you choose, the views to see are memories to last a lifetime.
it is OK. Automatic machine to buy tickets should work better way, beside that all is ok and the service on the ferry is fair.

Way to go!!!!!!!. What a fantastic service if your an Aussie senior $2:50 gets you an all day pass on the ferries train & buses around Sydney zones 1, 2, & 3 as for the ferries I'd say you would pay big bucks anywhere else Just love it while in Sydney. If your not a senior & you here for a week $65:00 gets you a weekly with the same option Plus Zone 3 gets you to Manly, Blue Mountain and more.
Great way to get about. Loved the ferries in Sydney - what a fab way to get to and from the various bits of this great city - and reasonably prices
Superb. For a public transportation system, the ferry is top class. Clean, neat, punctual and more so a calm and peaceful way to travel and see the magnificent city.

Save money!. If you love water travel, as I do then the ferries provide perfect,economical form of travel for day hoppers around the harbour or to adventure further afield. A lovely river cruise just over 3hrs return to Parramatta. Some provide coffee but buy your own at the Quay. Cafe/restaurant at Parramatta if you don't want to come back.As a place to visit and stay awhile, I prefer Manly with its many restaurants, shops and superb beach. . Beware weekends. It can be very busy especially when the markets on.

This is the way to travel!. Researched all the water tours, but for us this was perfect. We caught the ferry for about $15 to Manly at Circular Quay and sat on the right side of the ferry to give us a fantastic photo opportunity for the Opera House. We now have a great picture of us and the house behind us taken be a fellow ferry goer. It was an overcast day but we still had great views along the way. About 1/2 hour direct ride to Manly which he loved spending the afternoon in. Then sat on the other side coming back for different views (BTW - the ferry does not have to turn around - it had a wheelhouse on each end and just goes forward from both ends!) It was inexpensive, easy to buy tickets for right at the dock and was a great way to see the sights.

Good, Fast and Reliable Transportation from Circular Qauy. Took the ferry from Circ Quay to Milsons point just across the river. While the experience was not cheap $5 compared to the train. The sights were great and enjoyable. An easy way to get to or leave downtown. Just make sure you get on the right boat.

amazing views at night. i live in sydney, but still amazed by the views from the ferry from manly to sydney especially at night time as you approach the wharf. during the day the views also amazing as you leave sydney wharf to go to manly.

Sydney ferries. I have found that the ferries where clean effienct and fast a great way to get around the harbour and they were quite frequent you could get on and off depending what type of ticket you brought and better the being on the road with all the traffic

Great way to get around!. We're spending two weeks on a house/pet-sitting assignment in a suburb of Sydney, and have thoroughly enjoyed the Sydney Ferries. We purchased a couple of 7-day passes that can be used on the trains, buses and ferries. With this transportation combination, we can get anywhere we want to go in the area, safely and conveniently. The ferries have taken us to various beaches, harbors and bays, operating on schedule and with a high level of professionalism. It's a great value, and a great way to get around. Rather than renting a car, fighting traffic and facing frustration in finding a parking spot, we just walk from our house to the train station, then from the train to the wharf. Highly recommended!

Take the Ferry, Any Ferry. We went on a harbour cruise on the ferry (reviewed it here) and also took it out to the Manly beach for lunch. It's relatively cheap and very worthwhile as it will give you a terrific feel for just how big the bay(s) are around Sydney. After a half hour or so you travel past the inlet to the sea where many a hearty from seaman passed many years ago. A good time well worth the price.

Well organised. Great value way to see a bit of Sydney. Notice boards are clear and once you have worked out the best value tickets, easy to negotiate. We opted for opal card which for some reason you can only buy and top up at convenience stores not at harbour or station. They make life easy as you can hop off and on without having to queue for tickets and also use them on other public transport. Max charge per day 15 dollars 2.50 on Sunday's making them great value.
a great way to see sydney. The ferry network gives you a great way to see Sydney. Regular timetables take you all over Sydney harbour and great value for a day ticket.
Make sure you take the Ferry. Get a one day ticket on the ferrythat goes around the harbor out to Manley beach, Doyles for lunch and stop anywhere else you like. Get on, get off all day!
Friendly efficient service - fresh air travel in Sydney. One of the great attractions of Sydney for us, getting around by ferry - simply great fun, great views, friendly staff. Thanks

Cooks Ferries. Used Cooks ferries as they were hop on/hop off. Public service ferries go to one location.
Cooks not too expensive and went to Taranga Zoo early and avoided rush. Then onto Watson Bay and back via Darling Harbour

Great way to get around. we used the ferries every day, a great way to travel around to many of the beaches in Sydney area. Make sure you buy an Opal Card as this allows you to do unlimited travel for no more than $15 during week and just $2.50 on Sunday. This includes ferries, buses and trains!

Super service and sights . The best way to see the sights is via the ferry service.The Manly ferry is an institution and is one of the longest trips but worth taking. Get off at Manly - make sure you walk the 700m through The Corso to the other side to see the real Manly beach.Evening ferry from Circular Quay to the north shore and round under the bridge to Darling Harbour - great trip.Always on time and efficient.Easy to buy tickets and use.
Boatlover. The Sydney Harbour Ferries are extremely well organised,the crews are helpful and industrious at all times and the commentaries/information about the area are very good.

A must for every visitor to Sydney. It doesn't matter which ferry route you choose, a trip from Circular Quay on the harbour is always special. Manly is probably the most popular destination, but there are several other routes that explore Sydney's beautiful bays and inlets. If the sun is shining, it is a magical experience. The best way to see our beautiful harbour - and a thrill for young and old alike.
The way to get about. Amazing views of Sydney Harbour on every trip. Frequent services to the major areas, more at weekends to some of the more residential areas. Buy an Opal card for best value.
Wow. Easy travel bought 7 day pass and used it to travel to manly and back. The darling harbour and back to circular quay many times went on at night just to see all the lights.

Best views of Sydney. This is the best way to see Sydney from its watery heart. Both up or down the harbour the views are great and you can see all the famous sites and more on the ferry trips. Highly recommended.

not too special. Maybe we can take ferry often in my hometown, this ferry doesn't seem to be special or interesting for me.
however, it is not bad to spend some time inside with your friends or family.
Great for harbour views. Very efficient system which also uses opal (Sydney's equivalent of London's Oyster card). Do 8 trips (each separated by at least 1 hour) and the rest of the week is free.

Sydney Harbour Sight Seeing Cruise. I took the sight seeing cruise to Manily beach, Darling Harbour, Taronga Zoo, Watson's Bay, Luna Park, Circular Quay, Fort Denison, and Quarantine Station. It's about a 2 hour cruise or you can get off at many of the locations, explore and catch the next cruise that come around on a regular basis - Price $25 The seating inside is very comfortable or you can sit on the top deck, bench seating but a much better view.
Nice trip. Went to Mosman bay by Sydney Ferries, from Circular Quay. Punctual. And was a nice trip to this bay.

Waves of views. The views while taking the ferry from circular quay to manly and return are breathtaking. The bush, history, architecture and landforms are so varied. Coming back at dusk added another dimension. We sat on the outside on the side seats and marveled at the scenery.

You see more from the water. A very efficient, if often very crowded, way to see some of the main highlights of Sydney. Not only can you get close up views of the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge (from every angle!) but it is easy to travel further afield to such places as Manley and Watson's Bay.Make sure you have an Opal Card before you start your journeys and it is then remarkeably cheap as well.
It just works!. The ferries here in Sydney are among to best and most efficient in the world. They also offer amazing inexpensive videos over this stunning city!

Great way to see sydney harbour. As I live in Sydney I just love getting out on the harbour and boarding a Sydney ferry is the easiest way to do there are many different runs I find them cheap and easy to get around the harbour and would recommend them to see the sights of Sydney harbour

Best way to see Sydney. Sydney is at its most beautiful when seen from the harbour on a sunny day.Catch the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly, the Zoo, Double Bay or Watson's Bay to see beautiful pockets of Sydney in a relaxing an scenic way.

Way to Go.. The Sydney ferries are a very convenient way to get to many sites around the Sydney Harbor area. They are not expensive, by Sydney standards, run frequently, and are reliable. Start at Circular Quay.
A great way to see the harbour.. We took the Manly Ferry to Circular Quay. There are lots of photo opportunities with the Opera House and The iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge.

efficient ferries. I took a ferry to the Taronga Zoo. It left on time and delivered us to the zoo in the time expected. Had a beautiful view of the harbor and the city as we made our way to our destination. What a fun and inexpensive way to see the city!
Fastest Efficient Travel. We used the Sydney ferries every day to see the most of Sydney and the surrounding areas. The transportation was easy , inexpensive, scenic and always on time.

Great mode of transport. GREAT! The ease and convenience of these ferries can not be over stated. Cheap with a great view of the harbour and opera house. Make sure you grab one of these in your time in Sydney.

Water ways. The ferries are a great way to get around. They can drop you off here there and everywhere or you can spend a leisurely two hours as we did on a Captain Cook coffee cruise. Two hours of cruising the Harbour with coffee and afternoon tea included.There was also a commentary for those who like to know the history of Sydney.

Good value. The Sydney ferries link up the various harbours that make up Sydney. They are good value and cut down journey times considerably . It's also a great way to see how spectacular Sydney us from the water.

A great option for tourists. The Sydney ferries seem to be a main element of Sydney's public transport system, so are well used by the locals. But they are a really great option for both getting around as a tourist, and as a "tour" in their own right.They are very efficient and easy to use, and I highly recommend getting the opal cashless ticket ( like Oyster for London). One particular boon with this is that on a Sunday, the total cost of ferry travel (well - all public transport) is capped at just $2.50 all day.Ferries on all the routes run frequently, with long operatijg hours, and clear timetables.
Fast, clean, not an expensive. way to cross darling harbour. Great views of the Opera House and the bridge from beneath. Far cheaper than an organised trip and you can come & go at leisure.

What a way to travel. Brilliant way to get about, you can purchase a ticket or use your opal card. Great views from the ferries giving brilliant photo opportunities of Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House.
Sydney Ferries. The Sydney Ferries R so relaxing & enjoyable to... Sit back & enjoy the ride.....& Everyone can go on them too... Just lovely.
Cheap and relaxing tour of the harbour.. No need to book expensive tours just buy a ticket and do the round trip from Darling Harbour to Manly on public transport. Great views of the harbour

On time, great views. The only way to go in Sydney. Even if you have no destination, ride one for a brilliant view of the harbor and surrounds. We took it to Manly and to the zoo - both were wonderful and inexpensive. Sydney public transportation has it together.

good way to see Sydney and surroundings. Many small scenic ferry trips you can make, for an affordable price. We took the ferry to Watson's Bay and had a great fish and chip meal at Doyles, crowded with people, but just a short walk to the National Park and you will be able to enjoy a quieter beautiful area, with lovely views of the ocean, lighthouse, gorgeous trees, and maybe even a blue tongued lizard or two! Also took the small ferry from Cronulla to Jibbon Beach,(hope I spelled those correctly) walked around the bay and again into the National Park with good walking track, fantastic sandstone formations, beaches and aborigine art. You don't necessarily need a car in Sydney, great train and ferry service can get you to many places, even the Blue mountains, without any of the aggravations of travelling by car, just relax and let someone else get you there!
Trip to Zoo. Used ferries as return trip to Taronga Zoo. Great trip. Fun . Superb views and fast trip to Zoo. Loved view of Harbour - Bridge and iconic Opera House

Take the ferry and get free harbor views. We took both the Manly Island ferry and the Darling Harbor ferry in one day. Manly Island is a must! The views of the "coathanger" bridge and the Sydney opera house were super as we rode on the Darling Harbor ferry. Ask for the opal card and save money.

Buy a day ticket. Hope to Parramatta for breakfast or mid morn and then head to Manly for a day on the beach. In the evening go over to Luna Park and Darling Harbour(assuming you are not already there). A great vaue, stress less day

Perfect way to get around. I've recently moved to Manly and cannot imagine a better way to get to and from the city. Manly is an excellent place to visit for any tourist- with lots of surfer style shops, great beaches, bars and restaurants. Ferry staff are very polite and it always seems to run on time.

MA says " a great way to see iconic landmarks of Sydney ". We took the boat to Manly and there is no comparison by road. Easy to buy a ticket and well organised getting on and off each end. There's no better way to view the Opera House and Sydney bridge.
