The sights of all the other bays and inlets too is great.The boat we were on was built in 1974 so still going strong after all this time is wonderful. Everyone visiting Sydney has to take a trip!

Can't complain. We took a ferry to Toronga Zoo and back. There were several ferries buzzing around the harbor and ours was relatively quick and efficient. Ferry travel is a great way to avoid road traffic, and has a bit of charm to it, to boot!

Excellent form of transportation. Run on schedule, comfortable. You can get just about anywhere in Sydney. If you buy an all day pass, you can also use the buss system to get around. Most ferries have toilets.

Harbour to estuary. The Sydney ferry, you just must do especially the one from the Harbour to Paramatta. The view that changes from the Ocean to the harbour to the estuary of the Paramatta river to the city is spectacularly scenic with beautiful millionaires properties along the waterfront. The added bonus is some of the most beautiful birds . . . Pelicans, Wrens, Robins, vividly coloured Parakeets that you can see.Tip - On a Sunday a AUD 2.50 (only!!) per person ticket will take you on any Sydney public transport (Ferries, metros, buses etc. throughout the day. . . . .You can save a tidy sum when travelling with family.

Not to be missed. A trip on a Sydney Ferry is a "must do" when visiting Sydney, especially the trip to Manly and also the trip to Rose Bay and Watsons Bay. It is a great and fun way to see Sydney's beautiful harbour and foreshore areas at a very reasonable price. Not only are the ferries convenient for workers, they are also great for visitors to Sydney. Where you catch the ferry at Circular Quay, it is close to the trains and is a great spot for people watching. Also Circular Quay is close to the Rocks, the Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge. It is just a great place to visit. Whenever we are in Sydney, we always include a ride on one of the ferries.

Yet another MUST-DO. See Sydney Harbour with a different perspective view from the sea. Get an Opal Transport Card that will save you $$$$. It is available at any convenience shops and can be used on trains, light rails, ferries and buses.

Great transportation from Darling Harbour, great views.. Great service, and fast from one side of harbour to the other, terrific views of true bridge and the Sydney Opera House from the water, cameras ready!Can buy a day pass which covers subways and the ferry, and local buses.

Buy the OPAL Card!. We stayed in Sydney off and on for nearly two months while cruising, visiting other cites and New Zealand. When we first arrived we used taxi's and paid the Ferry Fare at the Circular Quay. On our second visit back we decided to buy the "OPAL Card" It is a wonderful way to easily pay for ALL Public Transportation. Train, Light rail, Bus, and Ferries The good news is there is a maximum daily charge agains your card of $15.00! You can purchase them at numerous convenience stores and Woolworths. If you run low on funds you just top it off with more value. Regarding the Ferries they are clean, spacious, and on time!

easy to use the Sydney ferries. We used the Sydney ferries a few times this holiday, easy to use, The ticket machines weren't to bad after a first time, ferries seem to go regularly and run very much to time. A great service and i lovely way to arrive in to Circular Quay
Cockatoo Island. Fantastic completely unexpected enjoyment. The ferry takes a nice view. Refreshments and toilets available. Really recommend it.

Good transportation. Sydney has really good public transportation, the ferries included. They're reliably (almost always) on time, get you out of the city proper. Good views of the Harbor (Opera House & Bridge) from the ferries too. Hint 1: Buy a full day pass and use all the public transport for a day for one flat rate. Hint 2: If you forget about the full day pass on your first trip, ask about just paying the difference for the balance of the full day pass.

Best View of Sydney Harbour. Take the opportunity to use the Sydney Harbour Ferries and do a circular route i.e. pick a venue e.g. Neutral Bay or Balmain or Double Bay and stay on the ferry to see all of the best views of the harbour in the shortest amount of time.Sit at the front for the best views and take sunscreen if it is hot or you will burn!!You will get to see to see some great sights, Opera House, Bridge, Darling Harbour, Taronga Zoo, City etc.... do it early as the sun comes up or over sunset ...... doesn't get much better!All of these ferries will complete the circular trip in about an hour!!
Ferry service. The service was very good and regular. All day ticket was very reasonably priced. There was also on board free wifi which worked reasonably well considering we were afloat.

Great transport. Circular Quey , This is a central point where you can take the ferry to where you wanna go in Sydney areas. From my understanding, the fee has been increased every year. Sydney ferries provide the most safe way to reach your destination and sightseeing. But a bit costly I would say.

Hooked onFerries. Relaxing way to cruise the harbour and surrounding areas. Go to the extremes of the network at Manly and Paramatta for a nice chill and if it's sunny, make sure you have sun screen, otherwise you will be frazzled!

Zoo Ferry... Took the Ferry for the zoo and then to cockatoo island, the ferry ride was a memorable experience overlooking the opera house, Passing under the harbor bridge. It is comfortable, relaxing and the best way for a tourist to take in the spectacular harbor.
Great way to travel.. Convenient and reasonably priced. Went from Circular Quay to Darling Harbor and back. Great views along the way.
Manly ferry trip. Had a great trip on the ferry to Manly. Easy to get of the ferry and go sight seeing. The timetable is very good .Clean and tidy

The only way to see the best of Sydney!. Taking the ferry to the Sydney 2000 Olympic site to Manly Beach it is comfortable, relaxing and the best way for a tourist to take in the spectacular harbour. With icons like the Opera House and The Harbour Bridge a perfect camers shot away.

Excellent service & great fun, just beautiful on a sunshiny day. Ferry tickets are great value got $$ , loved cruising the harbour , staff were very helpful too in regards too where to go & what tickets to buy
Easy and convenient. Great way to see a bit of Sydney and to get out and about on the harbour. Fab for getting to and from work but just as convenient at the weekend

Sunday Fun Day Ticket is great value!. We often use the Sunday Fun Day Ticket which costs $2.50 for each person if you are travelling with children. It's great value and you can ride on trains, buses and ferries with this ticket. It's not just for Metro Sydney but will take you as far as the Blue Mountains and many other places. We recently took some overseas visitors on a Ferry ride on Sydney Harbour and there's no better way to see our beautiful city.

A great way to enjoy the harbour. On a beautiful day, the perfect way to see the sights of the harbour and to enjoy the outdoors. Stopping off at the various wharfs allows time to walk and enjoy the foreshore.

Love being on the Harbour. Used my day trip pass to travel on the train, light rail , bus & ferry $24 for the day! Available at the railway station. Went from Circular Quay to Manly on the Ferry a great way to see the city. Enjoyed an icecream from the kiosk/cafe on board whilst sitting at the bow. Lots of photo opportunities. Travelling outside peak times is easy. Always love being on the water.

Sydney Ferries. Leaving from Circular Quay can be very busy and there's no queing system so always a big rush when the gates are open but it's a great way to get about Sydney and see Harbour bridge at it's closest and cheap

Opal Card. Sydney has an Opal Card which is valid on ferries as well as other forms of transport. It works just like an Oyster Card. If you buy one the ridiculously cheap fares are even cheaper. I haven't a huge amount to say other than the tip above. The trip affords one of the best photo opportunities in the world. If it rains there is plenty of cover.
Manly Ferry. From Manly to the city of Sydney or reverse - nothing like it! Peaceful, relaxed and an opening to see things from the water that you would not others wise see!
Best way to see Sydney. Always on time. Good value for money.There are plenty of routes to choose from - short and long trips. Easier than the buses. Pleasant and relaxing way to travel.

Excellent way to see the harbor. The Sydney Ferries are convenient and easy to use. Great way to see the the bridge and Opera house. There are many different destinations and it is probably one of the cheapest ways to get there. Love them.

Cheap and magnificent. The Sydney Ferries are an iconic part of the harbour city. It's a really cheap way to see all parts of the Harbour including a trip under the famous bridge. The best value is the Mymulti day pass for $24/adult. This allows you travel on all ferries, buses, light rail and trains all day. Take a ride to Watsons Bay for lunch or just tour around the Harbour. There's an iconic selfie waiting around every corner.

Frequent, wonderful view of the harbour and best way to Manly. You dont need to pay tour prices.Take a ferry out into the harbour. I took one to Manly and you not only see the bridge and Opera but you can get them both in the same photo... fantastic! and then you are just yards from the lovely Manly beach.. brilliant

Ferries Great. Sydney Ferries are a fantastic way to see the harbour. They run like clockwork so make sure you are in plenty of time to catch the one you want. Perfect way to see the Opera House and Bridge and on a sunny day what more could you ask for.I do live in Sydney and always think this is a great way for visitors to see our beautiful Sydney Harbour.
Best way to experience Sydney. Sydney is all about the harbour - so seeing it from a ferry is the cheapest and most enjoyable way to get a "feel", love it!

So relaxing. The ferry was very prompt and very frequent - peak hour every 1/4 hour and off peak, half hourly. We went on both an older one type and a catamaran - the latter was preferable. Very clean. For those who are seniors the price is $2.50 for all day! fantastic and for children it was $12.50 all day.But how lovely to avoid the traffic and have a relaxing trip into the city seeing all the sights of Sydney harbour. I would heartily recommend it even just for a ride.

Great Service. best way to see the sites of the Harbour before actually going to the, individually. Plenty of choice of trips and if you can spare a day you would do worse that purchase a day pass for the Ferries which includes the Trams and Buses and spend a day just taking the different ferry trips.
Easy to get around. The ferries are a great way to get around and also see the city from the water, they are very frequent.

Timely and Convenient. The ferries are a good way to get around Sydney Harbor. They are timely, easily accessible, and quick rides. Prices are around $6-8 for a one way price, so I recommend finding the best plan for you before going to a ferry terminal. They may have better options that can save you money.
Ferry good!. This is a great little ferry system which whizzes passengers around the gorgeous Sydney Harbour in all direction. Some of them even have a bow at each end for added convenience!

Sydney Harbour Ferries. The Sydney Harbour Ferries are excellent for enabling both tourists to visit a wide variety of the wider harbour sites and for some of the fortunate Central Business District employees who live near the harbour to transport them close to their area of employment. The ferries run very efficiently and on time. From Circular Quay ferries sail to Darling Harbour, Balmain, Luna Park, Taronga Zoo, Manly and many other sites around the greater harbour area. The ferries really are a wonderful way to get around the greater harbour area and see all the wonderful sights around the wonderful harbour area.

Great for getting about. You can get travel cards which cover the ferry , bus, and train its a great way to see the city from the water. They are replacing some of the older ferrys to sleek new craft. The ideal way to get the iconic photograph of both the opera house and the bridge is from the water. Its also great for the best selfie.
Ferries the way to go........... Always enjoy my trips on the ferry whether to Manly, Watsons Bay or Parramatta!!!!My favourite Sunday outing>>>>>.

Ferry Trips on Sydney Harbour. Sydney Ferries are a great way to see our beautiful harbour at a reasonable price. They run regularly , possibly every half hour to most destinations. There are short trips, also the longer trips to Manly taking you towards the Sydney Heads, the entrance to the our Harbour. This is a beautiful trip. They are usually very punctual so be on time!

the best cheap harbour cruise - don't miss it. Take a day tripper and discover the waters of Sydney from Manly to the Quay, From Darling Harbour to Parramatta, from Balmain to Luna Park. Such a luxury to travel to work this way if you can. It's exciting, vibrant, picturesque, simulating.

What a great way to see Sydney harbour !. The ferries are one of my favourite things to do when I visit Sydney - you can explore the harbour or travel to particular destinations. If you have an Australian Seniors card you can go anywhere for $2.50 for the day! Cockatoo Island and the zoo are great places to visit on the ferries.
Fun Rides. Very convenient, friendly staff, on time, and most important under My Multi Pass. One shall surely plan to use ferries while visiting Sydney.
Great ride, reasonable price.. Loved the regularity of the times as fitted in with our hectic schedule ! Great seats to see the opera house and harbour.

Best Sightseeing in Comfort.. Take a Ferry to Watsons Bay see most of Sydney's iconic buildings and monuments. Stop at Double Bay a small cove walk to the Village window shop the most exclusive labels have coffee with the successful émigrés. Get back on ferry to see the opulence to Watsons Bay. Walk along foreshore see the cottages of the old fishing village amongst the mansions of the nouveau riche. Stay for fish and chips at Doyles and back to the city

Great way to see Sydney Harbour. Sydney has several public ferry routes that are fun to take for tourists. No 1 must is the Manly ferry - gorgeous views of the Harbour - great photo ops of the Harbour bridge with Opera House. Manly has 2 beaches - Bay one good for toddlers and the Surf Beach with solid waves so worth the trip anyway. If you don't want to swum - have coffee or lunch at the Manly Peer and see penquins in the water or try your hand at sailboardingAnother nice ferry trip is to Darling Harbour - where you sail under the bridge.For an overview of Sydney suburbs you can take the ferry to Parramatta - free bus to the stationAnother lovely ferry trip is to the Zoo - take the gondala up to the top for magnificent harbour views and walk your way back down.Most cost effective and pleasant way to see the harbour at your own leisure.

Great way to get around Sydney harbour. Used the ferries a lot during our stay in Sydney. Very punctual and say to use especially with a myFerry ticket which can be used also on buses,trains a d light rail. Recommend trips to Manly and Watson's Bay.
Touring the Harbor. Many harbor tours and travels. Convenient and affordable way to go from town to town and a few beaches.
Very cheep.. One of the best ways to see the great harbour city and quite cheep too. The trip across to the zoo is one must thing to do and around to Manly beach for fish and chips.

Y Not. A Great view at a reasonable price. You get where you are going and take in the sights of Sydney Harbour. Could it be any better. Whenever you find yourself at the waters edge its a great idea to find your way on or in the water. Same answer if your in Nassau, Fort Lauderdale or Hong Kong always take the water taxi ( ferries ).
Sydney Ferries very easy to use. The Ferries are very easy to use and are great for exploring the harbour you get some great photos of the bridge and opera house from the ferry.
Ferry to Manly. Great. from what I see, you can choose fast or slow and they seem to run every hour. They leave EXACTLY when they say they do. I liked that.

Great Fun Great Value. Two of the ferries steamed to Australia in the1920, sadly these vessels the North Curl Curl and the Dee Why were decommissioned in the late 1960'. The remaining though smaller vessels continue to offer extremely good value and much fun. Board at Circular Quay and spend the best part of an hour on board on your way to Manly. Then go to its beach and have a walk, perhaps even a coffee or ice cream before returning. Great Fun.

The Wow Factor!. Anyone who enjoys being on the water will not be disappointed with these ferries. Efficient, clean and punctual. Buy a daily or weekly city travel city and appreciate this wonderful harbour.

A must and don't forget to get an OPAL card. The Ferries are amazing .. you must catch a ferry under the bridge …my tip is get an opal card.It is the local travel card for all public transport … you can't buy them from the train ticket offices for some strange reason...Available from newsagents near train stations - they are free… you charge them up… and your ticket prices are much cheaper for trains buses and ferries ... now here is the good thing … once you have had 8 rides in a week on your opal card … all your rides for the rest of that week are free … yes including Ferries … I think it excludes Manly but do some research … we spent a day cruising around on free ferries - great way to get to Darling Harbour from Circular Quay ..ferries are fun!

Sydney Harbour Ferry Travel. My very first ferry journey was from Circulay Quay to Manly back in December 1972 & I was enthralled. The weather was perfect & the views superb. Well none of that has changed. The ferry journeys to any part of the harbour are wonderful even in inclement weather - it is always an adventure especially with children. This is a mode of transport for many commuters so avoid peak hours.

Great way to get around. We took the ferry from Parramatta to Circular Quay, which is a really nice trip down the river. On the way back due to tidal restrictions we had to take the bus for the last section but everything was really well organised. A great way to enter Sydney Harbour!

Ferry to Manly is a MUST do. The slow ferry to Manly is a half hour ride around paradise...the wonderful Sydney Harbour. You can take this ferry ride to Manly and enjoy the Beach which is much better than Bondi

Best way to see the Harbour cheaply. We took the ferry from circular quay to Manley. It was summertime and we had no problem at all in finding a good view point on board. The views were just spectacular and even more so on the return at night. Seeing the bridge and opera house all lit up from the water was very special.A brilliant way to see one of the most famous harbours in the world.

DO NOT MISS THIS EXPERIENCE. Take a ferry up the Parramatta river, enjoy the wonderful homes on its waters edge, all the stops en route, maybe get off at one wharf, especially Cabarita Wharf. Take a stroll around whole of park and back to the ferry wharf. Continue your beautiful journey either up or back down our wonderful water way.You will love it for sure. Good Luck and enjoy!!

Ferry view of Sydney Harbour. Riding on Sydney ferries are always fun, I've enjoyed going on the ferries since I was a small child. I have never not enjoyed the ride from Circular quay to Manly, even in the rain & on choppy day's. On a beautiful Sydney day there is not many other activities to match a Sydney ferry ride to Manly.Generally the ferries are quite clean and the staff are usually friendly, the price is also not to bad either. I would recommend anyone visiting Sydney to think about riding a ferry, especially to manly on a nice day for lunch. Nothing beats it for a day out! Enjoy :)

These can give London Transport a run for their money..... A sheer delight using these ferries - always on time, reliable, clean and amazing views whichever way you decide to go, and cheap too. Get weekly pass if you are hanging around the area long enough - worth it - visit all the places you can using this transport - easy cheap and very worth while.
Cheap cruise of the harbour!. Haven't been on a ferry for years. What a very pleasant surprise. Clean, comfortable and beautiful views.
Wonderful way to see Sydney Harbour.. I love Sydney Ferries because they are an excellent way of seeing Sydney Harbour. They also run regularly and always on time.

Spectacular Sydney Harbour!. Despite being born & raised in Sydney I still get a thrill every single time I am out on the harbour.
You can catch a ferry to many places around the harbour and just sit back and enjoy the sights. Sydney harbour is even more spectacular at night.

a cruise down the Parramatta river. We caught the ferry home after a lovely visit for lunch in the city. It was a glorious day and cruising along gently down the river to Parramatta was the perfect way to get home. Nicer and more scenic than the train and much cheaper than a cab. I would recommend the trip to anyone. The staff on board were friendly and very helpful.

Great way to see the harbour. Sydney ferries are old and often crowded. But they are a great way to see the harbour, especially on a Sunday with the family fare day and $2.50 Opal fares. You can putter slowly around the harbour on the various routes, you dont even need to get off just ride back (unless you need to tap on and off) I recommend the Cat to Olympic Park, The Balmain run and the ferry to rose bay, and of course the Manly trip (though hugely crowded on weekends) ..riding the swell as you go past the heads can be fun. And keep your eyes open for whales at the right time of year. My wife and I spend the occasional Sunday just sitting on the chairs on the side of a ferry and watch the harbour roll past. Reminds us of why we love living in this beautiful city.

Nice way to see the sites.. One of my favourite things to do is jump on the ferries and spend a few hours cruising around our beautiful harbour. It doesn't cost alot and you can get off and on when and where you want. Great way to spend a peaceful day.

Nightmare ferry trip. We made a Sunday booking at Doyls, Watsons Bay for lunch. We arrive at the ferry terminal in plenty to catch the ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay. After being allowed through the gate to board the ferry we are then directed away from the board ramp as "the ferry is full". No apology only the comment "i cannot do anything". We and others who missed the ferry line up at the boarding gate waiting for the next ferry in 30 minuets. The ferry arrives and then there is a mumbled announcement that the ferry will be leaving from the other side of the jetty. All passengers who were waiting from the previous missed ferry again line up at the correct gate. They then open the far gate to the jetty and all the the passenger who had already missed one ferry were pushed to the back of the line. Again another missed ferry! We had only missed two ferries so far so I do not know how the other passenger were feeling who were now waiting to board their fourth ferry due to the incompetence of the Sydney Ferries staff. On our third attempt, now 1 hour late, we were able to board and begin our journey.It is no good ringing Sydney Ferries on a Sunday to complain as no-one is there to answer the phone.Lucky we maintained contact with the restaurant who keep our table for us even though they had a long cue of waiting customers at the time. On speaking to the restaurant staff they commented that it was not an unusual occurrence and as the "Sydney Ferries staff were public servants they could not be sacked unless they murdered someone".The meal and service we received from Doyls was outstanding. The service from Sydney Ferries is another matter and I guess they will not be happy until they have destroyed all tourism on Sydney harbour.
Best way to travel. Nothing beats the ride on a Sydney ferry, gazing at all the harbour life as you travel through it, salty air and wind.

Sydney Ferries. I live in Sydney and am a member of a walking club. We use the Ferries quite often to take us to good walking locations. A couple of walks start at Taronga. I would say we have used just about every ferry stop as either a starting or stopping point for one of our walks. This is a great way to see the harbour at a reasonable cost. Travel outside peak commuter times and you will get a seat for sure. Most of the ferries have toilets. Just hanging around Circular Quay waiting for a ferry is a buzz - both the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge are close by and in full view. Don't miss a trip on a Sydney Ferry.
Well Organised. I have found Sydney Ferries to very well organised and very helpful. There is nothing better to jump on the ferry and relax as it goes around Sydney Harbour
Sydent little green Ferries. The best value way to tour Sydney Harbour! Catch the little green ferries (the others are like a bus) or the Watsons Bay Ferry or Many Ferry (the big green one).

Old fashioned fun. Its been a few years since I travelled on the ferry to Manly. I was pleasantly surprised. It was on time, and very clean. It can't be beaten for some of the most spectacular sights of the Harbour.
Ferries. Best way to travel around sydney. What a view. Then buses and trains can be very busy. I frequently travel the parramatta river cat.

Sydney Harbour Wow!. The best way to see the world's best harbour. Take a trip to Manly passing the Heads and experience the slightly rougher waters near the ocean. See the wealthy harbourside suburbs on the way and the best views of the Opera House and amazing Harbour Bridge. Spend time on Manly beach and enjoy some of the many eateries there.

FABULOUS FERRY. The river cat from medaowbank to Sydney is a an easy and great mode of transport, particularly for someone in a wheelchair. Staff are accommodating and make it very easy. the only downside is the infrequency of the service and at peak times, the lack of room for all.

Fabulous Ferries. Sydney Ferries offer a great way to view the harbour. Most services are efficient and a fun way of travelling. Beware going to Manly on the weekend - be prepared for a queue and a wait.

Ferries. Generally one of the best ways to see the harbour - there are some facinating places along the harbour and River foreshores., Would highly recommend the trip to Parramatta. Reasonable cafe at the end. Also Cockatoo Island is a must

Best (and cheapest) way to see Sydney Harbour!. Is on a Manly Ferry! They sail backwards and forwards all the time, from Circular Quay in Sydney to Manly on the north shore, they are very regular, half an hour apart, so if you just miss one, hang about on the Quay for a coffee or watch some of the entertainers busking around the wharf, the ferry is a very inexpensive way of leisurely seeing the Harbour...the journey takes about 40 minutes and passes from one side of the harbour to the other, when you get to Manly you can walk up through the esplanade to the beautiful beach, passing many restaurants, cafe's and coffee shops on the way, the beach is one of the best and if you are feeling energetic you can do one of the walks that pass through there and follow the coastline to other beaches, stopping off along the way for a rest and a meal! There is also a café on the ferry for snacks and hot or cold drinks.....
Best view from any ferry ever!. The best ferry ride in terms of iconic views and the general harbour. Even if my ferry was late (it usually isn't) the view makes it all worthwhile.

Perfect day on the water. What a fabulous way to see the sights. Sitting in the sun with a harbour breeze. A myriad of photo ops of the bridge and opera house and fish and chips at Watsons Bay for lunch. It doesnt get any better. Remember the sunscreen.

Circular Quay to Manly return. An inexpensive ferry ride which passes some interesting places like the Zoo and Fort Dennison. Well worth the time and money. Take your swimmers and enjoy a coffee or fish lunch in charming Manly. A lovely day altogether ! You won't want to go home.

Why do a cruise?. We caught a couple of ferries. Everything to do with using a ferry in Sydney is easy and efficient. Ticket sellers do so with a smile and when a machine didn't give me my ticket, the ticket seller did:)

Love Love Love Sydney Ferries. Can really recommend this. Hop on one and just enjoy being out on the water and having a really good look at this beautiful harbour. A very inexpensive way to have a look around.
ferries are a great way to see Sydney Harbour.. Very relaxing and stimulating way of seeing the sights around the Harbour. Highly recommend this activity.

see the sites , Economically. No matter which ferry you take, ( I mean commuter ferry ) , a memorable trip on this world class water way, can be had for little money. Sunny days are best. Sydney to Manly, or Sydney to Rose Bay is recommended.

A-Hoy Manly. I went on the Manly ferry last weekend, something I have not done in many years. The Ferry left right on time, pleasant trip over there. I remember when I has a child, our parents used to take us often on the old Dee Why ferry where my sister and I would have a banana dangle on a string over the side and hang onto it all the way to Manly - the things parents made us do!Ferry was clean and comfortable, should do this more often now that I can get a $2.50 ticket return, train included also.
Reliable. a great adventure especially with Manly fast ferry, but the main the problem is the lack of the number of ferries which cause you and your family a crowded experience in the high season.

Sydney Ferries!. Sydney Ferries are not only a great way to get around in Sydney and some of the surrounding suburbs and areas, they are a fun little activity for your visit wether you on your own like I was, A young couple, A young family, An older family, or an elderly couple! They run fairly frequently to most destinations covered by the ferry for transport and exploring / Adventure purposes. Each time I visit Sydney for work or leisure I make sure to allow time in my schedule to take a brief ferrie trip from Cirqular Quay to Darling harbour these 2 destinations are fairly close together and you can easily stroll from one to the other or to each from many hotels in the CBD however this short ferry ride takes a scenic swoop trough Sydney harbour itself allowing FANTASTIC views and photo ops for the Sydney Opera House, Darling Harbour, The City Scape and The Sydney Harbour Bridge! I also treasure it as a brief moment of cool calm and collectedness when I am staying in the city. You get about 20 mins with Beautiful breezes off the ocean and some priceless views! Very affordable and fun treat!

Relax And Enjoy. There is nothing more relaxing and enjoyable than a trip on a Manly Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly starting with a up close view of the Opera House on your right to a close up view of the Sydney Harbour Bridge on the left two of the great icons of Australia.The Ferry passes Fort Denison a magnificient Stone Fortress passing Rose Bay where you still see Flying Boats arrive & depart crossing the Sydney Harbour Heads looking out to The Tasman Sea ( their can be a little rough swell) however the Manly Ferry goes through it with ease. Arriving at Manly Wharf make your way to a Paradise of Shopping,Restaurants,Hotels and swimming at the Faboulas Manly Beach.Then enjoy the Ferry trip back to Circular Quay.What a way to spend a day

Sydney Ferries. This is a sensational way to see Sydney Harbour. The views and the harbour is superb and a very inexpensive way to get around the Harbour. Whether it is across to the Zoo or over to Manly for the day. Sensational.

Watson's Bay ferry. On a really nice day take a trip on the Watsons bay ferry , Watsons bay has a great pub and has the best fish and chips in Sydney. After your fish and chips have a walk up to the lighthouse at Sydney heads, very easy and relaxed.
Best way to see the harbour for a few $. Being on the harbour is a wonderful feeling, no matter where your destination the view is fantastic.

Could be Sydneys Saviour. When I lived in Abbotsford I would use the ferry if I needed to go to Circular Quay or Darling Harbour. Friends from interstate or overseas would comment how great it was to be able to travel on public transport with such great views. The reality is, that as public transport it falls short on too many fronts. Firstly, the "all roads lead to Rome" theory that consecutive planners have forced on this city has created a hectic mess. Not just the ferries, but the roads and rail and to some extent the buses. If I wanted to go from Drummoyne to Birkenhead Point I would have to go to the Quay to get on another loop and pay twice. These wharves are less than a kilometre from each other. And for instance, the last time I had friends from OS in town I took them to Doyles at Watsons Bay for lunch. From East Balmain to Watsons Bay should be Inner Harbour to Inner Harbour. Instead, you pay returns via the Quay at $12 each. That's $24 x four people? When a cab is cheaper than public transport, there is something wrong. The government should be subsidising the ferry service in order to keep cars and buses off the road.

You too can be Captain of your own ship!. I recall a song from my youth - all about a person travelling to work every day on the Sydney Ferries. Each day he would daydream that he was an explorer, a pirate or a yachtsman, battling the elements to save his crew. Well you too can enjoy that feeling with Sydney Ferries. These cover the whole of Sydney Harbour - from Parramatta to Manly, from Luna Park to Darling Harbour, they are a great way to explore Sydney. It is very relaxing and with the right ticket you can get off and on for lunch or a walk around the Ferry wharf.
Great site seeing trip. Fantastic way to see what the harbour has to offer be sure to take your camera. When you get to manly you may want to go for a swim at the beach.

A different way to travel. We decided to go to Manly for the day and went by ferry. An enjoyable day and a unique way to travel. As seniors we only paid $2.50 per person to travel on the public transport system for that day. We had an enjoyable day and came back via the ferry and then caught the subway to near our hotel

You cannot visit Sydney without going on the ferry. Lots of different options, we went to Manly on a Sunday - they must do special rates as it was very cheap (sorry cannot remember, but I think about $8 for 2 adults and a teenager). On time, clean ferry.

Our fabulous ferries!. I enjoy being on the ferry more than any other mode of public transport; being on the harbour feels like living the life of a millionaire. The sights and sounds and smells of the harbour are all consuming. It is one of the best attractions we have in Sydney and the ferries offer a brilliant service to many points around the harbour. You can't visit Sydney without experience a trip on the ferry across to Taronga Zoo, then taking the chairlift up the entrance.
must do. the easiest & cheapest way to visit most places on the harbourdon't miss the trip to watsons bay & lunch at doylesgreat ferry ride to the zoo

Step back to a more leisurely time...... Sydney ferries with their quaint yellow and green exterior are a visual enhancement to the beauty of Sydney's amazing harbour and also offer the opportunity to cruise the harbour in comfort for a tiny price. A must do in Sydney!

Best value for seeing the Sydney harbour. Don't waste money in the fancy food cruises. Just pack yourself on to the ferry and sit on the outside for amazing views. Hands down the best value for money and they go to so many beautiful areas like Watsons Bay, manly etc. For those headed to Manly and the line is long for tickets, you can go to any terminal and buy tickets (you don't have to wait in such a long line!). My favourite is grabbing the ferry to manly in the early morning and watching the sunrise come out between the heads. The ferry is empty and it's just gorgeous.
Wonderful Sydney Harbour. So easy to get around and so much to see. Rain shouldn't put you off touring across the water but normally it is bright and sunny. A must do for any Sydney visitor.

ferry -- the thinking man's motor yacht!. Sydney ferries are among the clunkiest Union dominated rarely on time around -- but unless you're going to work or an appointment -- who cares ?Catch them to Manly , Darling Harbour, Watson's Bay , The Zoo , up and around the Parramatta River , to Olympic Park, many places -- just relax and enjoy the water views and great looking suburbs neighbour ing Sydney Harbour.The ticket system is a pain but generally the ferry based and shore based staff are nice and helpful! Cheap and great relaxation
Best way to travel. Sydney Ferries offer regular trips on the harbour and up river to lots of delightful destinations, whether a visit, work, or home. Let your mind wander with no hassles.

Cheap boat trips. This is a great way to explore Sydney, the trip up to Parramatta takes you up a very interesting river pass the Olympic Site and the ferry wharf at Parramatta has a great bus to the Parramatta Mall with lots of old buildings and great eating places, take the train to Circular Key and hop on the Parramatta Jet Cat, it makes a great cheap day out for young and old.

Always a beautiful view!. Forget climbing a building to peer over the harbour-catch the ferry from Circular Quay to anywhere! The best ride is from the Quay across to Milsons Point where you can take in Luna Park, the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and many other nearby sights. Grab yourself a day ticket and you can also head to Darling Harbour, Taronga Zoo and many other places. Don't forget to take your camera! You won't regret it!
Efficient and Relaxing. No fuss and clean. A great way to get around Sydney and enjoy the beautiful harbour and foreshore as you go ! Manly run is excellent

40 years traveling on Sydney Ferries. Don't spend a lot of money on Sydney Harbour Cruises take the regular ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and see everything on the harbour. Or for a good day out catch the ferry from Circular Quay to the Sydney Zoo ( the bird display is wonderful).

Great way to see Sydney at it's best. A trip on the many ferries is a great way to see the harbor and city, cost effective and they run when you want them to.Best rides; Circular Quay to Manly (fish and chips on Manly beach too good)Circular Quay or Darling Harbor to Parramatta up the Parramatta River, or a shorter trip to Abbortsford and have lunch at Sydney Rowing Club over looking the river.

Sydney Ferries. I travel to Sydney a few times a year. One of my favourite excursions is to take a ferry trip to Manly, have lunch on the Corso and come back to Circular Quay. You need to allow about 31/2 to 4 hours

Sydney by boat. Sydney Ferries are easy and safe to use with some of the best staff who answer tourist questions no problem. Take the Ferry up the Parramatta river to Parramatta well worth the effort and the food up there is just as good if not better than that in downtown Sydney.

Enjoy Sydney Harbour, one of the most beautiful harbour in the world. The best way to enjoy the sights of what Sydney Harbour have to offer is by ferry. Get a day pass so you can go on different routes to see various sights that can only be views from the sea/river. Take a ride to Woolwich and walk along the waterfront, pop in to the Dockyard for a drink or a nice view of the Sydney Bridge. There's a lot of options available,get yourself a ferry map and try it out it's well worth the time.

Sydney Ferries,great cheap attraction and photo opetunities!. See Sydney by boat and remember Sydney with your photos for years to come! Just don't forget to take your camera. Take the Manly Ferry and enjoy the coastal walks on offer Manly to Dee Why and beyond or the shorter harbor walk to Spit Bridge. Or From Manly to the city Walk to the Harbor Bridge or the Opera house and beyond to the Botanical garden and the Art Gallery. Enjoy the climate.

Sydney Ferries. Sydney Ferries are the only way to get around the harbour, you can spend a full day taking different trips, getting off and seeing the sights, you can also go up to Parramatta, this is a great trip and you see so much more of the Sydney waterways
Best way to travel across Sydney waters. An experience which is must for anybody visiting Sydney. Very safe and organised, gives you a good view of Opera House and Harbour Bridge.

Just Love a Ferry ride. If you want a nice relaxing time take the ferry over to Manly. I lived in this area for most of my life and just love that trip on a sunny day. Mind you don't go on the weekend as it is crazy with people and the ferry is packed. During the day and not at peak hour when people are travelling to and from work.You can also take a ferry to Taronga Park Zoo. Now that would be a lovely day trip

The Manly Ferry. Recently my wife and I with 2 friends decided to go to Manley for lunch and arriving at Circular Quay on the Parramatta to Circular Quay Rivercatt was perfect. We boarded the Manley Ferry (only a 30 minute journey) but made the simple Mistake of not sitting in seats facing towards Manley expecting the Ferry to turn around which it does not. That having been said travelling backwards was not an issue and the harbour sights were as usual marvelous. On the way back we ensured we faced the right way :-) What a great way to see the harbour as well as gwetting to Manley

A budget-friendly trip across the Harbour. A trip on a Sydney ferry is a must-do for a budget conscious traveller, or anyone looking for an affordable way to glide across Sydney Harbour and get uninterrupted views of Sydney landmarks such as the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and Luna Park.The ferries take you to places like Taronga Zoo and Manly, so you can really make a day of it.The negative side of it is that depending on the destination, these ferries are often jam-packed on weekends (and peak hour weekdays with commuters) so you'll want to be near the front of the line to get a seat on board!I recommend using the ferries on a Sunday if you're watching your $$ as an Opal Card will get you all day pubic transport in the city for a flat rate of $2.50.

Best way to see the harbour on a budget. I try to send all visitors out on Sydney ferries and fortunately live very close to a ferry wharf so get international guests to travel by ferry from Circular Quay or Darling Habour up river. The only down side is they are getting too popular so don't leave you trip until the last ferry back.

Best of harbour views and not expensive. If you are visiting Sydney, live like a local and catch a Ferry from Circular Quay. For best views of the harbour, take the Manly Ferry for a 30min ride to Manly Beach. Enjoy the beach and cafes before catching the ferry back. For something different, there is also the River Cat to take you west under the harbour Bridge, then the one hour trip to Paramatta passing Cockatoo Island and under several bridges. Parramatta is Sydney's next biggest business and shopping hub outside of downtown. Easy return trip by Rivercat or by Train to the city. For anyone on a budget, ferrys offer just as good if not better views of the harbour at a fraction of the price of harbour cruises.

Love the ferries . You would not go wrong with them on the Sydney harbour ... For travellers - you can pretty much cover the whole harbour on these ferries - do not buy individual tickets as these can be expensive - buy a weekly pass instead which gives u unlimited travel on all routes of all ferries buses and trains ... You will need that anyway if travelling to Sydney

Inexpensive way to see Sydney Harbour. Took the Manly Ferry from circular quay . The ferry goes right past the Sydney opera house and a great view of The bridge etc.This is excellent for those wonderful photo opportunities.A very comfortable ferry.
Busy but fun. A wonderful way to see the beautiful Sydney Harbour but prepared to fight for a seat on board in summer.

Sit back and relax. Sydney Ferries can take you to many different destinations from Circular Quay to Taronga Zoo, Cremourne, Neutral Bay, Milson's Point, Miller's Point, Blues Point, Greenwich, Hunters Hill, Drummoyne, Balmain, Darling Harbour, to name a few of the destinations. They also run up the Parramatta River to Parramatta and occassionally part of the Lane Cove River. It is something well worth experiencing.

Fast, fun and efficient...And take photos too.. It's like taking a bus except on water and way better views.Take pictures-- lotsa photos.Clearly this is local transport as well as tourists.Quick, easy and efficient. Took a ferry over to Manly. Liked Manly. Liked the beach. Liked the coastal walk. Took a ferry 5 hours later back. Easy, fun and efficient. and ya gotta see Sydney from the water. I probably should go back and taxi at night for the lights...

Great value for enjoying the harbour. As regular visits to Sydney since I was a young child, a ferry trip has always been top of the list of things to do. There is no more restful way to spend some time than sitting outside on a Sydney ferry, whether on the Manly ferry or one of the scenic ferries around the harbour. If you plan on taking more than 1 ferry ride in a day, get a day pass which is also good for the busses and trains.
Extremely efficient. We visited Sydney from Melbourne. Wow, the ferry system is not only iconic but extremely efficient, easy to use and runs like clock work.

Great way to see the city!. Excellent, reliable, comfortable service that was always on time. We did a trip to Balmain and another to Watson's Bay. Both were a delight, providing great views and a cool escape from the heat. Will do again with no hesitation.
Floaty.... Safe, reliable, clean and upright....all you need in a ferry! Have used various ferries around the Sydney area and they've all be good and very convinent.

The best way to see Sydney by far !. This has to be my favourite way to travel into Sydney by far . I just love the trip from Mosman Bay to Curcular Quay . That 1st view of the Harbour Bridge & the Opera House is just spectacular & a wonderful photo opportunity too . It is so relaxing and panoramic , I just love it . This is a must do for any visit to Sydney !
Take it to Manly. Lovely scenic ride across the bays and a nice town to walk around. The ferry's are very clean and offer very good veiws of the Opera House and the bridge
Unmissable Sydney experience.... great and inexpensive way to see Sydney Harbour....try the Manly Ferry, Ferry to the Zoo, Ferry to Cremorne/Mosman, Hunter's Hill/Balmain (inner Habour)

Excellent way to get around and get the pictures. Renting a car in a city like Sydney just doesn't make sense. These ferries are perfect, standing outside gives you a perfect view points of various attractions including the Sydney Opera House and the Bridge, great for getting pictures with both in the background.

Magic Manly Ferry. It was quite warm when we arrived in Sydney! The ferry to Manly beach was crowded but a great way to cool off and see the harbor and bridge. Watching the bridge climbers was amazing! There is a pass that makes the ferry fare cheap on weekends! You can buy it at the transit center at Circular Quay!

Experience a ride on a Sydney icon.. Enjoy a ride on one of Sydney's icons. An inexpensive and relaxing way to see Sydney from a different angle. View the opera house, the bridge, the foreshore,the famous Sydney Rocks area and much more. Try it. You wil find it well worth the effort.

Sydney's Ferries. I found Sydney's Ferries very easy to use. Their schedules and routes are easy to navigate and figure out. Besides the native Australians are also very friendly and eager to help a lost American by telling where to go. My husband and I purchased a week pass which allowed us to ride every form of public transportation that Sydney provided. It was the best deal Sydney had to offer. I remember the pass cost $55 - 58 dollars Australian. Some Ferries are older standard double enders while many are fast catamarans. The Sydney Harbor is a destination itself with constant maritime activity during the day and beautiful light shows during the night. Besides visiting with my extended family, enjoying the Sydney Ferry System is one of my seat joys in Sydney.

Superb part of the system. These form only part of the wonderful integrated transport system. They sail frequently and on time. Obtain for yourself an Opal card and load with an appropriate amount of credit. If you're doing a lot of travel around Sydney then a card is excellent value as there's a $15 fare cap per day ($2.50 on Sunday). The Manly ferry is $14 return any further trips after one more would be free for that day.We used the Watson Bay ferry and Manly ferry in our 4 day stay. You get superb views of the harbour features and surroundings.

A great way to see the harbour, bridge & Opera House. A hot day was cooled off by taking a round trip on the ferry. It was a great way to look at Sydney from a different angle. Not expensive, lots of photo opportunities

You don't need to learn to meditate. just hope on a ferry and the pace and places you pass will clear your mind and relax your body. Hang over the railing to really clear your head. Are the sea gull that follow fishing?

Great value, fun and wi-fi. One of my favorite things to do when I'm in Sydney is taking the ferry to Manly Beach and back. I stay in Manly for business every three month and use the ferry to come in to the city. Much much cheaper than a taxi, so much more enjoyable and it's a chance to catch up with emails by using the free ferry wi-fi. Great use of 30 minutes and awesome view of Sydney Opera House and Harbor Bridge.

Definitely a must whether you need to go someplace or not. If you aren't going over to Manly or the Zoo or something else, just jump on board and enjoy the ride. Just avoid the ferry to Parramatta or you could get stuck there (or spend forever trying to get out) due to possible tide problems (they stop ferries during low tides but don't warn you - fyi).

Taronga Zoo Ferry.. Took the ferry from Circular Quay No. 2 Wharf to Taronga Zoo. This is a short trip, only one stop. You can tap off/on at the Athol St Wharf, and make the return trip on the same ferry. A round trip of about 30 minutes that takes in some of the icons of Sydney - Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Fort Denison. Heaven.
Quick, easy to use.. I used the ferries a lot during my 8 week stay in Sydney, they are a fast efficient way of travel. Some are faster than others but it didn't matter you got there in the end.

Watch out for the splash!. We took a ferry to Manley and it is outside the harbor. As you make your way there you see the coastline of the city and its special. On the way back the wind picked up and the boat rocked and splashed but it was so much fun and such a tremendous view of the bridge and Opera House.

Going on the ferry. The BEST wasy to see Sydney is from the water. You MUST go on the ferry to Manly and enjoy the beach there. The views are tremendous. I found an excellent guide book which gave harbourside walks through natural forest using the ferries.

good value. The ferries offer an efficient way of getting around Sydney harbour and beyond. Frequent reliable service which visit a host of places like Darling harbour, Watson bay, Manly and Taronga Zoo .You also get a fantastic views as you pass by the Opera House and harbour bridge

Great to travel on ferries like a local. Sometimes it can be confusing getting to understand local transport systems and staff are often not helpful to strangers who don't know how things work and where places are, but the Sydney harbour ferries are a wonderful, simple service to get to great places. Pleasant boat ride, spectacular views, arrive exactly where you want: Manly beach, Taronga Zoo, Parramatta, Double Bay, with no hassles. The harbour ferries are really a classic example of getting there being half the fun.

Ferry system is cool!. The Sydney ferry system was so cool and easy to use I think that I was starting to become addicted to using them. Go to Watson's bay or manly beach or Taronga zoo it's all there for you.

Great way to get around to all the harbours.. Sydney harbours are just beautiful. You can spend all day just going around the harbours. We normally like to book-in with the cruises that are available around the harbour for evening cruise.

Exciting trip. Caught the ferry to Manley for a fantastic lunch at the German Bar then a quick snooze on the beach. Bit of a mistake as it was breezy and hot and we suffered a little bit of sunburn! The trip back was exciting as we had to wait halfway across for a very large cruiseliner to leave Sydney Harbour. Everyone was waving and cheering - it was great!

Manly Ferry a must... Very good service, regular crossings, good price for Sydney, much better way for getting in to the centre of the city with out too much hassle. Late night service to bring you back from the Opera or other night life.
The best way to get around to avoid traffic. Fast, easy, inexpensive in a high priced city. Good way to photograph much of the sights. Very easy to figure out and all the staff were very helpful.

What a way to commute to work!. Ferries are like buses or trains for Sydneysiders but they make a great way for tourists to see the city and suburbs from the waterside cheaply. With an Opal card you can travel all day for $15 or for $60 for a week and that includes buses and trains.

Reliable and great to get around . The ferry main terminal is a central Quay and you get tickets there. If you have an opel card (and if your in Sydney for a bit and using trains it's worth getting one) they take them on here too. Various destinations and great to just see the harbour too

Great sightseeing. A great way to travel and a great away to start your sightseeing. Its easy to forget that people commute to work on the ferries. For the tourist they are ideal for getting around efficiently. The trip to Watsons Bay and Manly are great but one of the highlights is the evening trip round to Darling Harbour when you go under the Harbour Bridge.
Off to Taronga Zoo we go. My little one went to Taronga Zoo on a guided tour. After taking the train we jumped on one of the Sydney Ferries. We got safely to the zoo and everyone had a great day.
Manly Ferry. A low cost way to see the harbour is the Manly Ferry.Service is frequent through the day (Every half hour) and great value.

Definitely a fun way to get around. We love to use the ferries to see the scenery and visit the scenery of Sydney. If you are going to be in Sydney a week or more, be sure to get an Opal card to use for travel. The cards are free, and you put money on them to use as tickets on most transportation, light rail, ferries, buses and trains. Fares are cheaper in general with Opal card and also during non commute times. You scan your card on an Opal reader before and after traveling. If it's a hot day, riding the ferry will actually cool you off. There are various ferry trips, which run regularly, get a brochure where you buy tickets to see the various lines.  While it's more expensive and takes longer to ride ferries then trains or buses, it's definitely a "must do" experience of Sydney. Our favorite trip is to Watsons Bay for seafood at Doyle's on the Wharf and a view of the Pacific on the other side of South Head!
watsons bay to the quay. Ferries are very fast and often,going to all the main points of interest,a very relaxing way to travel/No cars or stress

Lovely ferry rides. We took the Manly and Darling Harbour ferries, I absolutely loved the views on the way to Manly from Circular Quay. Get a seat at the deck for the best views and try to catch the ferry back for fantastic sunset.
Really great!. The Sydney Ferries are a great way to get around on the sea. The views are incredible and the seating is good quality. Each ferry is clean and the crew are all lovely people.
Excellent. The ferries are just a great inexpensive way to get around and sightsee as well as just spending some time just cruising the bay jumping on and off whenever you want.

Circular Quay is a shambles. No integrated signage system at Circular Quay means you get off the train and have no idea which pier your ferry leaves from. This means running up and down the whole quay checking at each pier. Then when you get to the right pier, the ticket windows are closed and you have to go to a different pier to purchase tickets. There is no way to compare the timing of the private ferries with Sydney Ferries without physically running up and down the entire quay. All of this information could be displayed on a sign and take a lot of stress out of the travel experience.

Iconic - great way to enjoy Sydney. Admittedly I am not a daily user, but several times a month. I travel between MacMahons Point and Circular Quay and also Darling Harbour. Nearly always it feels like being on holiday. Friendly staff, easy going, I love the ferries!

Still The Best. We Used them this time last year also and we never get tired of travelling on the ferries, we went to Manly a couple of times and daily to different stops and the harbour and they always seem to be on time.As last year we got a My Multi 3 weekly pass, this year they had gone up by $2 to $65 but the Sydney public transport system is excellent, the my Multi 3 is excellent value and covers you for most of NSW, My Multi 1 & 2 are slightly cheaper but you can only use them in certain zones, you need a MM 3 for Parramatta and Manly Ferry, I also downloaded the Opal App which is perfect to plan trips on public transport and timetable, lot of debate in Sydney on which is better, Opal Card or My Multi, I would say for tourists My Multi is the only way to go you can get 1,3,7 day passes and travel as much as you like, Opal Cards you have to top up or have credit available and you get charged per zone you travel through, charges are capped at $15 a day or $60 per week but Opal is not available through the whole Public Transport Network, if you still have credit left when you finish your holiday you can't get it refunded, Opal is Tap on and Tap off, if you forget to Tap off at a station next time you Tap on you are actually Tapping off from last trip so all gets a bit confusing unless you do it everday so tourists again I would say stick with a My Multi
Great system. It's a brilliant system and easy to use. I loved every trip i took on the Ferries and the staff was servicemindet.

Great Way to Travel - Sydney Ferries. Stayed in Manly / Freshwater - used the MyMulti3 pass to get to and from the city. On time and enjoyable - GREAT views of the city and surrounding areas. There is Wifi - although sometimes it doesn't work. Food and drink available but we didn't have any. There is plenty of room to bring luggage / etc. but it does get busy during the rush hours as this is a form of commuting for locals.

Quick, easy and on time.. You can use your opal card for the ferry. They come regularly, they are cheap and on time. Don't be late to catch it as they don't wait for you. We had a smooth, quick trip to Taronga Zoo. Buy your zoo tickets at the wharf as this is the cheapest place to buy them.
Excellent value on Sunday. Bought an opal card on Sunday and travelled on ferries and buses for $2.50 all day - absolute bargain. Try outlying bays such as Rose and Watson or Manley on the sea front.

Good value, cheap thrill. If you want to get a good view of Sydney Harbour, without paying the earth on a 'cruise', this is your chance. Pick any of them, pay a return fare or take a bus the other way back, you'll love it. My favourite is the Rose Bay to Circular Quay route on the hydroplane, but the Manly ferry boat is more classical and gives you a longer and more old fashioned ride. Either way, you will not be disappointed.
Great trip. Ferries take you to manly and other areas. It's a nice trip and the views are fantastic. Again it is quite expensive but so is everything else
So easy!. So easy to get around! and beautiful views of the city from the ferries. You'll be able to get great pictures from all angles of the city!

Our ferries. For a great way to see Sydney harbour, hop on a ferry & cruise around. Even if it's raining ,it's a great experience. Amazing !!!!! On a sunny day the water is magical & the feeling you get is awesome .We have lived in Sydney all our lives & we're both in our 60s, but still get a buzz doing touristy things. ENJOY

Excellent for seeing the harbour on a budget. Such a cheap way of seeing our lovely harbour.. Really comfortable and so many options to chose from .. Could spend a whole day just riding around .. So convenient !

Very impressed. We followed guidance from hotel staff to travel on Sydney Ferries to Manly rather than booking a cruise. System is impressive! Hard to believe that this service is public transport given the route and surroundings, we have subsequently used the ferries to go around the various harbour stops and islands, we haven't experienced any delays or problems and would recommend the services, crew have bee very helpful and know their stuff. If you are going to travel over more than one or two trips check out the multi-trip deals where you can travel unlimited.
A great way to travel around the Bay. Good choice but view all options for best value.Used hop on hop off bus plus ferry offer. Got our money's worth.

Circular Quay ferry to Manly. The Sydney to Manly ferry service runs every 30 minutes and takes approximately 30 minutes of travel. You past the Sydney opera house offering a great photo opportunity of the opera house to the east and Sydney Harbour Bridge to the west, you also travel past Fort Denison, Garden Island naval base and past the harbour heads showing great views of North and South heads. Being a local have travelled numerous times on the ferry and always enjoy the trip. Arrive at Manly offering a great selection of restaurants and pubs and walk down the Main Street called The Corso and you will arrive at the iconic Manly ocean beach. This is a very affordable day trip for visitors to Sydney. There is also fast ferry service offering the same trip at more cost but not as easy to get that perfect picture.
price. the manly ferry from circular key is a little $$ but okay, once in manly suggest hugos at the wharf, very nice, manly ok for lunch and beach walk only.

Gorgeous view of the opera house. We took a ferry from Darling Harbor to Circular Quay and it was the perfect way to see the opera house. We went right under the Sydney Harbor Bridge and got great pictures of everything! We couldn't have planned it better!

Awesome harbour! . I'm lucky I live in Sydney, but whether you're a local or a visitor to our beautiful city, a trip on a Sydney ferry is a must do! A couple of suggestions: locals... there's plenty of weekend parking at Mosman Bay and Kirribilli Point (end of Broughton St - nice walk around to Milsons Point (MP) wharf - right by Luna Park. Visitors: there are buses to most ferry wharves and Milsons Point is just down the road from MP train station. The MP ferry goes to Darling Harbour or under the bridge to Circular Quay. The Mosman ferry gives you a spectacular cruise past Fort Denison, Kirribilli House and the Opera House. Our recent trip was a Mosman Ferry to a Sunday movie at the Dendy and a visit to the amazing Chuck Close exhibition at the MCA. Of course there are lots of other options... the zoo... Manly... Parramatta... Balmain...

Wonderful way to see Sydney Harbour. Have been to Sydney a number of times and love travelling on the Sydney Ferries. Usually stay at Darling Harbour so it's very convenient to catch the ferry at Pyrmont around to Circular Quay, and from there to any number of destinations around the beautiful harbour. They run reasonably on time and are clean. The Manly ferry is a must ride also. And for seniors for the price of $2.50 you can ride the ferries all day, plus travel by bus and train as well. Well done, Sydney!

Amazing. What a really affordable way to see our great city. Jump on this ferry, get a million dollar view for pocket change. I think this should be a definite journey if you are a tourist and if you are lucky to be on it every day then you are among the lucky.

Very good. Purchase your tickets and have a wonderful day on the ferries - you can get to most places around the harbour, if you are lucky there will also be come commentary. See where all the ' other ' people live in the beautiful waterfront homes, go to Parammatta, the Zoo or whatever your choice is, I'm sure you will enjoy it

A little pricey!. The ferries are easy to use and clean, but I found the prices to be high. Once we realized we could walk to most areas around Sydney, we stopped buying ferry tickets! It's a very manageable city by foot, don't be afraid to explore!

Best Transportation. Sydney ferries are best transport facility for travellers. It's beautiful, cheap and you can explore most of the main attractions right from Opera house, Darling Harbour, Toranga zoo and many more. Overall a beautiful experiance.
A value at twice the price. The availability, coupled with the low price makes this a great find. They locations serviced is equally outstanding.

Manly Ferry. The cheapest cruise I've ever been on @ $2.50 return for Seniors!On time, iconic and really enjoyable sitting on the deck in the sunshine, as the ferry cut across the sparkling harbour.Recommend.

great views. Loved that you could get on a ferry in Darling Harbour and go round the corner to give international visitors an amazing sight of the bridge. Also caught a ferry to Watsons Bay to have lunch at Doyles. Probably helped that the weather was amazing but there is no better way to enjoy Sydney then on the Harbour.

Efficient and charming. For moving across Sydney harbour efficient,y and at reasonable cost you can't beat the Harbour ferries. Not only will they get you where you want to be but you will also get an excellent view of this beautiful area. Ferries are regular and you can either but a ticket before you start from newsagents or 7Eleven stores. Even better an Opal card will save you money and can also be used on the busses. Nice one Sydney!

Inexpensive travel. We travelled to Darling Harbour and back, enjoyed the views of the most beautiful harbour in the world,opera house,Harbour bridge, passenger ship docked at circular quay, for only a couple of dollarseach way, it ius even cheaper on a Sunday.You don,t have to do expensive harbour cruises

Great. Went on several ferries, easy to get on and off.
Got ticket from Machine, which worked ok.
Being on Sydney Harbour is fantastic
well worth it. On time, efficient and excellent views. A definite must. Great way to get around the city. Cost efficient too.

fabulous ferry ride. My last evening in Sydney and took the ride from darling Harbour as I was staying there.The ferry is a double decker and the view from top is good. The ferry stopped and picked passengers from some stops along the trip.The ferry stops at the Maritime Museum, Luna Park and some other stops before reaching Circular Quay. Shortly it continues its return trip to Darling Harbour and the trip takes about 50 to 60 mins.There is a free wifi on board. I took the the trip at sunset and I got to see the view in daylight and night. The scenery is magnificent and worth the trip. Don't miss it if you are in Sydney.

A great way to acquaint yourself with the harbour. As I have lived in Sydney my entire life I often forget what a beautiful city I live in. On the couple of occasions every year when I am required to take a ferry I realise that I am lucky to live in a city that is built around such a beautiful natural landmark.

Best Way to Get Around Sydney. Easy and convenient access, this is the best way to get around Sydney with a great view along the way. The best routes are Circular Quay to Darling Harbour and Manly Beach. Beautiful views while you make your way to your destination.

Best way to enjoy sydney and the harbour. There is so much to see on the harbour, whether it be the Opera House and Harbour Bridge and or some of the further suburbs - either way, the best way to enjoy the beauty of Sydney is to spend a few hours on the harbour just meandering around the myriad of sights. Great value and less stressful than driving a car.

Sydney Ferries. It is a thrilling experience. The ferry boats are very good. They give full entertainment, good dinner and what not. Their staff is also very courteous. Sea gulls accompany us throughout the ferry.
Brilliant. Absolutely loved taking the ferry across to Manly. Excellent view of the harbour and coastline in the way to Manly. We will be back :) Thank you

Great way to get to Manly. The best way to get to Manly is by Ferry from Circular Quay.Plenty of choices to choose from seating inside, outside, upstairs.If you have an Opal Card make use of the $2.50 all day travel on Sundays.You won't get cheaper than this.The ferries are pretty good and quite stable.Don't think you will get sea sick on board and if you do then there are toilet facilities on board too.There is also a small kiosk/café on some of them too but for such a short ride there's no need.

Nice adventure. Your stayed in sydney is not complete if you do not use the ferry system. Its a fast adn cheap way to access everywhere you want to go and at the same time it gives you a feel of what is like living by the most famous harbor in the world.

Perfectly priced for Seniors. Buy a $2.50 ticket and explore the harbour, from Manly, Taronga Zoo and other points.
Great service for visiting tourists

Government Run Harbour Tours. This is an excellent service which links to buses on shore and will get you to just about every worthwhile point on the harbour. Some minor signage difficulties: such as an indication as to which wharf F4 or F6 is leaving from at Circular Quay would help. If it was there it wasn't obvious. We just asked one of their many helpful employees.

Great way to see Sydney. A day travel ticket for a snip of the commercial harbour tours. Travel around the harbour area hop on and off. I would recommend Darling harbour to circular key for a fantastic view of the Bridge and Opera House.

Quick and efficient ferry service. Great way to get around Sydney and enabled you to see lots of wonderful sights on the way. Never too busy, because there were plenty to use if one was full, then there was another one not far behind.

Sydney ferry from circular quay to parramatta. Sydney ferry which takes approximately an hour and half from Circular Quay to Parramatta is a delightful trip taking which stops at 12 places along the way and provides a wonderful scenic tour . At the landing in Parramatta there are numerous reasonable places to have lunch right on the river.There are many historical places to visit in Parramatta and one walk from the ferry landing to the historical Elizabeth cottage is recommended.Elizabeth Cottage has free admission and the ferry ride is just over $7.00. A great way to see a large part of Sydney by water. The return can be made by the ferry of by train.

Get a Pass if you have a few days. WE just paid by the trip but I understand we could have saved had we had a pass. WE rode the ferries to three different towns each was so different. it was fun to see the skyline, and the homes along the different islands.
Manley ferry. Great way to see the harbour and surrounding area but very busy ...cheap round trip and Manley beach is lovely...well worth it

Great Way to Travel. You wont be disappointed catching a ferry from circular quay to either Darling Harbour or Manly. The ferries are clean and are such a relaxing and scenic way to travel around Sydney.

Great way to see the harbour. Captain Cook ferries stop at all the places of interest and you can hop on and hop off. just make sure you check how often they go and when they will be back to pick you up.

Ferry - Circle Quay (Sydney) to Manly Beach. Want a short break from the 'big city'. Take a 40 minute ferry ride to Mandy Beach. Very scenic trip and Manly Beach is great. See review of De Vito Pizza at Manly Beach. Once at Manly, walk straight ahead to beach (follow crowd), if want pizza, when road curves to right, down about 5 stores on right. Loved Manly, great break from the city.

The best ever!. Sydney ferries afford awesome views of the harbour and the local sites for a very small cost. We caught several and I think the ferries were one of the best things about this amazing city.

Best Harbour Tour - the Ferries!. We decided to take the ferry to Manly Beach and it totally surpassed and replaced taking a 1 or 2 hour tour of the Harbour. The ferry was clean, restroom serviceable, seating good! And a relatively bargain price compared to the tours.

Awesome.. Spent a month in Australia and catching the ferries around the harbour with the sun beating down is a memory that will stay with me forever. A terrific way of getting around and seeing one of the best cities in the world.

great way to get to manly beach. Unless you have a vehicle you will need to use these to get to Manly Beach. I prefer Manly to Bondi the beach is much nicer and not as crowded, more room for the people to spread out. Sometimes the trip can be very rough with the waves coming in from the ocean so if you get sea sickness maybe you should not take the boat!

Best value in the world. I often enjoy a ferry trip and have a few amazing stories about what I've seen from a ferry, This has got to be the best value for money, a ferry from the city to almost anywhere is well worthwile and I'd recommend standing outside and soaking in the sea air

New ferries are great. Took the ferry to Watson's Bay and back on one of the new ferries. Wow they're good. Comfortable and so fast. $31 ish return for 2 adults and 1 child but well worth it for the views and ride.

Best way to see Sydney. If you are looking for something to do in Sydney when you are feeling bored, then I recommend catching one of the ferries. It definitely is another great way to see Sydney by sailing past the opera house and going under the harbour bridge. I personally recommend catching the manly ferry as you get a little bit more time on the water both ways and also spend the day at Manly by getting something to eat and going for a swim at the beach.

bad service. Ferry ride was good, nice to have sea breeze but we wait over 1 hr for ferry to pelican bay. Ask staffs if we could make it there and back in time they say "maybe, not sure" not helpful. had to taxi to train back.
Ferry to Manly. Great views of the whole harbour - excellent on a summers day.Cheapest way to see the Harbour in all its glory. Nice way to get to Manly.

Top job under trying conditions. My wife and I utilised the Sydney Ferry service over the Australia Day weekend and found the experience very good. Many thousands of people all trying to get here and there and being shepherded by very experienced and helpful staff.Amenities were always found to be clean - how they do this I do not know.I do not think there one a bad thing to be said about a ferry ride around our beautiful Sydney harbour.

Wonderful location and many interesting botanical specimens. These gardens have probably the best location in the world -- right on Sydney Harbour. They are worth a visit to enjoy the views from the foreshore walk and also to venture more deeply into the gardens to experience a network of paths which lead to interesting and varied botanical vistas. The gardens are a peaceful oasis in the middle of a big city.

Spend the day on the harbour. There is a choice of six routes on the harbour service, but perhaps the best thing to do is get an "all day" pass and spend the day doing all six routes and see all of the harbour ...... perhaps the most beautiful in the world? At each destination there is a docking area and they all have a decent array of food outlets, so break your day with a few meals!

Great way to get around. We took a ferry to manly and enjoyed the ride very much. It's a great way to get around and amazing views to boot. You don't need to wait too long for a ferry and they get you there quickly. Nice way to see the harbour!
No visit in Sydney is full without a ferry. When in Sydney you must take a ferry.I suggest ferries to Manly, Watsons Bay, and Cockatoo Island at least.The more you take the better.

Excellent service and well worth the ride!. Do take a sydney ferry when you're in sydney. It's a low cost way to experience the harbour. The tickets can be quite cost effective if you do your math. But it's a must do to see and experience the harbour.
A great way to see the harbour. The ferries are so easy to get on and off and a good way to see the harbour as well as get to the many waterfront cafes and restaurants.

Great fun and easy to use. Staff helpful ferries on time and plentiful. Great way to get around sydney take the ferry to manly a great stop over point. Wonderful views of the harbour and very efficient mode of transport.

Great way to see Sydney Habour. This is a great way to just kick back, hop on and hop off at various sights - really enjoyed listening to the history/real estate information and general information of all the stops!!

Always worth the price of a ticket!. Sydney is blessed with a fantastic and efficient ferry system.Start at Circular Quay which is the hub for this wonderful mode of transport and go any where.The trip to Manly or Watsons Bay are my favorites.The view are great!
A good way to cross Sydney's bay. It 's another way to see the opera house and sydney' bay. When it's sunny take care to sunburns. We bought a city pass so the price of the cruise was very cheep.

Great Fun. My family and i got a ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour to go see Madame Tossauds. We also got one from Circular Quay to Manly. It was very fun for the kids and they had ferries leaving every 15 minutes. The boat has free Wifi so that is a plus.

On a nice day no better way to get around.. From Sydney originally but lived in Melbourne for the last 22 years. It was a beautiful day so I decided to take my son to Darling Harbour for some lunch. We actually went Circular Quay to Luna Park got off and had a look around and then got back on to go to Darling Harbour and in the afternoon came back to Circular Quay.Buying a ticket was easy, actually avoided the queue and used the automated machine & actually bought a day pass, bust train and ferry all day. The price for this was $24 ( I think) and we certainly got good value from it. The service departed on time and the staff were friendly and helpful getting people on and off.The views you get on such a short trip on such a nice day are just amazing. The Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Darling Harbour, the Maritime Museum, even a large cruise ship that was docked at Circular Quay that day.It is public transport with a view - really a great value experience.Almost forgot to mention, my son was very impressed that they had free WIFI on the boat!
It is fun!. Best way to see the Harbour inexpensively is to take a Ferry Ride. Easy to do, easy to find your way around. No complaints.
Quick and Efficient. Wow these ferries zip in and out a great way to look around and only a short journey giving quick access to so much.
