Fast, efficient and what a place to work!!. This has to be the best way in the world to see the city of Sydney.Just get on at Rose Bay and go to Circular Quay or Circular Quay to Manly. Anywhere is magic.A circuit from Circular Quay under the bridge to Darling Harbour and back to Circular Quay is 1 and a half hours of magic. clean and efficient it is a great way to see the city

travel in ferry from paramatta to darling harbour. this travel of about one and half hour is so pleasant and thrilling.the view from deck is eye catching and worth photography to preserve memories for life time.nothing during visit to australia is disliked
Great service. The Sydney ferry system is perfection. Fast, on time and convenient to reach all the sights in the city harbour.

East to get where you want to go. If you enjoy travelling by boat, this the best way. Good timetable and easy to get around. If you are in Sydney for a couple of days, think about choosing the weekly pass which you can use on rail, boat or bus. Usually it works out cheaper than daily tickets. If you are only there a day, think about buying the day pass. There is an Opal pass, which seems to be cheaper, but we did not check out that possibility as you cannot buy it at Sydney Ferries.

Good mode of transpo.... Seeing Sydney from the ferry is amazing. You get that unobstructed view of the tourist spots. It is also a good way to go around Sydney if you don't want to get stuck in traffic.

Hop on hop off in any number of places.. Excellent service , runs on time . If you are in Sydney for any length of time purchase a OPAL card . This can be used on buses / trains / ferries and the beauty of it is that after a total of 8 trips / week all other trips are FREE

Best attraction in Sydney!. This ferry is the best that Sydney can offer you! It works good (schedule is friendly, only the last ferry from Watson Bay goes to early - around 16:30 i guess). It is amazing view of Sydney, you can not have such view from anywhere else. It is not the cheapest, but if you use your public transport card often you are going for free after spending 15$ in one day, or 50$ in one week. I loved it!!

Best way to travel when in Sydney. When travelling to Circular Quay or Darling harbour, we take the ferry. We also take the ferry to visit all the stopover places just for the fun of it. Had quality time with the family. It is a nice and fast way to travel from one point to another as traffic can be heavy on the narrow roads. We had the weekly pass which was very economical as you can switch between ferry, bus and trains. We love the ferry best as the view was beautiful and the ferries are well maintained. The ferry service is prompt and staff friendly and professional. When in Sydney, make this a must to experience.

Best views in sydney. The ferry from circular quay to milsons point, which we got numerous times, gives super views of the opera house and Sydney Harbour Bridge. It cost $6 each way and we should have looked into the possibility of getting a card for discounts during our visit but in 3 days used this a dozen times as we stayed in North sydney.Head for the top deck, there is outdoor seating and get your camera ready.Tip: you have to queue to pay for you trip during busy precious once you arrive in circulat quay as there are no ticket selling facilities from milson point, so to get through barrier it is torturous to buy out of machine, do look into a tourist pass.Friendly staff, great views and a chance to travel in the beautiful harbour.
Thrifty traveller. A $65 Pass type three will allow you to travel trains, light rail, buses and ferries for a week. An economical way to travel to see the harbour in style

Easy. The ferries are a easy mode of transportation and all the wharfs are easily marked. The cost to ride all transportation all day is $14 and it's well worth the money. The ferries are clean and they go everywhere.

Great way to travel. We used the Sydney Ferries extensively during our stay in Sydney, found them to be regular, well priced and a good way to see the beautiful harbour area and surrounds. If you don't have a ticket at a stop you can hop on and pay when you exit - very handy when the kids are too tired to walk to a station.

Efficient, nice views, Buy an Opal card. We took a couple of different ferries, one to Manly, one to the Zoo. Each one was fine, on time, efficient and provided a nice, cool (temp wise) experience.The tip we have is to buy an Opal card. You put money on the card and then it is a simple tap to gt on and tap to get off. The best thing about them is they only charge a maximum of $15 AUD is any one day. I think there is a weekly max too.We took the ferry to Manly in the morning, and returned to Sydney about 4:30. This is about 14.50 AUD per person. That evening, we took the train to Newton for dinner. 64 cents round trip.. because we hit the daily maximum! This means you could ride the ferries all day for $15. Why get a harbor tour? No narratives of course.Any remaining money on the Opal card is not refunded.. we just gave ours to our family who lives there.

Easy way to know about this city. good view when you make your journey through ferry, which is easy and cost-effective for normal ones. I like ferry from circular quay to Manly or darling harbor. Good view and wind blowing your face with sunshine. Comfortable and relaxing. Remember to check departure time, or maybe wait a long time in Dock.

A chance to explore. The Sydney Harbour ferries offer a great public transport opportunity to explore. From a trip across to Manly on one of the grand old dames of the harbour to a trip up to Parramatta on one of the sleek ferries, there is lots to see from the water. Go to Watsons Bay and enjoy some take away fish and chips from Doyles on the wharf and then have a swim at one of the two beaches available. A trip in a ferry on the harbour is a must -do during your visit to Sydney.
Brill Service. Travelled on ferries to Taronga Zoo, Manley Beach, Watsons Point. Free Wi-Fi on all ferries. Spacious inside and they appear to run on time!
A must. I love the ferries and find the journeys relaxing and the scenery makes you realise we have one of the loveliest harbours right here in Australia.

Must Do Manly Ferry. If you are visiting Sydney you must catch the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly, walk the short distance through the Corso to Manly Beach, have lunch at one of the many cafes, coffee at one of the many great coffee establishments, and ferry back to the city. It's a different world and a magic day out :-)

Great way to explore islands..... I feel Sydney Ferries offers best way to explore few islands surrounding Harbour ( Manly, Taronga Zoo… ) and for some of the resident this works as mode to commute for work or shopping and many other reasons. You can enjoy the hop on hop off ferries or regular ferries depending where you want to travel. I feel Opal card gave us great discount on all the public transport.
a good way to see the harbour. the ferries are a relatively cheap way to see our beautiful Sydney harbour. Try the many ferry you are sure to love this trip and plenty of things to do in Many
Sydney Ferries.. Used them several times, a must to do for all travellers, views in the Harbour were beautiful. Service was prompt and not too expensive.

What a way to travel!. Least expensive way to see beautiful Sydney Harbour. Great at any time of year and in all weathers. Why pay fancy tourist prices? If you want help identifying bays, islands, landmarks etc, just ask a local. Sydney-siders love their harbour and are happy to talk about it.

Do the Harbour and get where you are going. Sydney Ferries are one of the best ways to exploit the beautiful Sydney Harbour. The traditional trip is from Circular Quay (Between the Sydney Opera house and the Sydney Harbour Bridge) to Manly where you have an icecream walk the beach the other side of the Manly spit and catch the ferry back. You can roll a little when you hit the swell coming in the Sydney Harbor Heads but nothing to be worried about. There is also a wonderful trip from Cirular Quay to the Torongo Park Zoo. It is one of the most beautiful Harbors in the world and this is a cheap and efficient way to do it.

Poor service and employees.. We purchased our tickets for Watson's Bay and were told to sit in the wheelchair spot, on the wharf, to be first on the ferry. The ferry arrived and we were completely ignored and ended up being last on. A no time were we told that we would encounter problems getting the wheelchair off at the Watson's Bay wharf. When we got there we encountered several steps which were not wide enough to manoeuvre my sons chair. We asked the ferry employee if we could use the boat ramp to get up the steps and he just gave ignored us. The ferry employees are rude and do not promote tourism in Sydney.We also tried to buy an Opal Card and every sales point had already sold out, this is not a good system for tourist.If you can find other ways to get around Sydney do so and avoid the ferries.

Must do on Sydney list. The ferries criss cross Sydney Harbour and are the best way to get out on the water and visit many of the harbourside suburbs which have stunning views to the city or the bridge or just of the glorious harbour waters and foreshore. Many of the ferry wharfs are close by to shopping areas and famous landmarks, such as the Zoo, and Manly, however many wharfs are much smaller and are a joy to discover as they are often in residential communities with lovely walks, parks and sights to visit. Greenwich and Balmain for example, or MacMahons Point. For the cost of a ferry ticket and a picnic a super day out from the hustle and bustle of the city can be had.
Loads of options.. The ferries from various harbours although mainly from Circular Quay go everywhere around the harbour, they are very well organised and the trip to the Zoo is worthwhile
Riding the Ferries.... I spent a wonderful day riding the ferries out of Circular Quay for a $24 rover ticket which includes buses and trains. What better way to see Sydney from the water.
Excellent service!. We used this as our transport between Manly and Sydney city and I must say it was excellent. Much better than the tube and bus.
Great way to see the harbour. Really enjoyable short trips, great views, comfortable and economical way to travel. Ferries are regular and easy to access.

sydney ferries. it is a chaep way of seeing Sydney habour plenty of places to visit taroga zoo, manly beach , darling habour .also there are night cruising resturants on private boats which are very popular.

Nice place to enjoy Sydney Harbor. I took the ferry to Manley Beach for the day. The day was clear, and lovely and the voyage was restful and pleasant. They navigate near Sydney Opera House and the Sydney Bridge, so you can get some great photographs if the visibility is clear.
Be sure to take your camera or phone!
Sydney Ferries. A very easy way to get around the harbour and visit all the different bays surrounding Sydney, you,are spoilt for choice with the beaches

Take the ferry to Manly Beach!. Only a 15-20min ferry ride, take the ferry to Manly beach. This will allow you to see the skyline from the water and it's just gorgeous on a nice sunny day. The beaches at Manly aren't as nice as Bondi. They're smaller and filled with families instead of tourists, but it's a great spot to checkout after you've done Bondi.
Remind me of Hong Kong. Like all ferries that locals use - good and cheap way to see the city. I went to other side of harbour and day ticket only $12

A Must For Tourists. Take any ferry and get beautiful views of harbor bridge, Opera House and other attractions. You can go to places like Cockatoo Island, Taronga Zoo, Olympic park, Paramatta, etc. The ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbor or vice-versa provides excellent views. The ferries are cheap, you can buy a day ticket, which can be used for unlimited rides in train, bus and ferries for almost 24 hours.Daily thousands of visitors take ferries to reach for their work.

Get the Sunday Family Ticket. For only $2.50 per person, families with children can travel Sydney trains, buses and ferries all day on Sundays. Absolutely brilliant value. Sydney Ferries alone can take you to so many different places on clean, punctual ferries. There is something about cruising the harbour on a nice sunny day - a must do when in Sydney.

Essential Sydney Experience. A must for any tourist.regardless of where you go it will be a great trip.
Get a different perspective on the Harbour Bridge and Opera House.
Manly Ferry is the most popular also Cockatoo Island or Taronga Zoo are recommended.
well done. Since there is new management who runs the show, things have really improved. On time, smiley staff, clean boats ..Nothing to complain

great way to see sydney.. Caught a rivercat from olympic park to darling harbour down the parramatta river,Great views of the cliff top mansions and there power boats. You can stand on the foredeck to see more of the sights and catch a breeze. many other historic sights can be seen or visited from a ferry.

Good Way to Get Around. The ferry hub is at Circular Quay and boats come / go to all parts of the harbour from there. The services are punctual.
These are probably the most scenic ferry rides you will ever take. They are not expensive and are a particularly good way of travelling between Circular Quay and Darling Harbour.
fab way to get around. Fab way to get around, lovely ride between darling harbour and circular quay, beautiful at night! Get a multi travel ticket and ride them as much as you want!
From Sydney to Manley. The ferries are great, and there are many to choose from. Very quick to get you round to the different harbours

What a relaxing way to get around Sydney. Yes you can take a car, train or bus around Sydney, but the best way to see all of the City and outlying suburbs and towns is by ferry. Reasonable seats, loos some have refreshments too, a brilliant way to get around, beats the daily commute in London by miles.

Ferry Tavel a must. If you buy a weekly travel ticket, cost me A$64 (£32) I could get on and off any buses, light rail, ferries as often as I wanted for no extra cost, really worth it. The ferries rain on time and I felt comfortable.
Staff very friendly and helpful too.
Old ladies of the sea or modern cats.. Ferries are cheaper than booking a tour. Consider the Sydney transport weekly or daily multiticket and travel as often as you like.
another view. you can use the ferrys with the card (like Oyster) and you get another view. ist Relaxing to travel by boat and once you have understood the timetable ist easy to find your way
great. I loved the ferry ,used it several times to darling harbour and manley. The scenery was great.Was there for five days should have got the weekly travel ticket.

The Only Way To Go. What can be more relaxing than seeing a city from a ferry. Sydney has a magnificent harbour & cruising gently around gives one time to absorb the scenery. From some magnificent waterfront homes to the many high rise apartments dotted along or near the water. Take the Parramatta ferry which is a relaxing hour or hitch a ride to Watson's Bay and stop off for lunch or dinner at the renowned Doyle's Restauranr or just a cool drink. Get off, get on & explore the various stops along the way. What could be more relaxing than travelling to work by Sydney Ferries

New Years Day 2015. The ferries are clean and well run.In our case we caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly on New Years Day.The only small issue was the tickets office on The Manly Pier was closed and the queue for tickets was quite long, but they managed it well and we didn't have to wait too long to get a ticket and be on our way.I would thoroughly recommend catching a ferry as a cheap and easy way to see the sites of the bay.
Very smooth ride. Took a ferry from Manly Harbour to Circular Quay on a Sunday. The queueing system was orderly and the ferry was very spacious with a cafe that provided ice creams and a hot drink.

Buy a Week Pass. We bought the weekly pass to include ferries, train and bus. We rode the ferries most every place they went. Totally worth the investment to be out on the water and even got fortunate to see the Hobart to Sydney Races begin while ON the ferry.
Hop On Hop Off - the choice is yours. Very comfy trip. Sit inside or out - get on or off at a stop of your choice. A must do if you visit Sydney.
only way to travel. A must is a trip to Manly. takes half an hour and travel through the harbour past the heads into a beautiful beachside area called Manly a must for a day trip

The only way to travel. I'd love to live in any city where this is the main wAy to get around, taking the ferry to Manly is one of the 1st things we always do in Sydney... Top tip, if your here for a few days, consider a weekly travel card, it's cheaper and easier

Easy way to travel. We used the ferry to return from Olympic Park after our Blue Diamond Tour to the Blue Mountains (highly recommended see separate review). Comfortable but cool in December so bring a jacket. Plenty of indoor seating.

Head to Manly and get some fantastic scenery on the way. You can't visit Sydney and not get on the ferry to Manly. It's really not an expensive day out at all, just get your return ticket at Circular Quay and head out on the harbour. No matter what side you sit on, you'll get a beautiful view—southside you'll get a frontal shot of the Opera House and the Botanic Gardens all the way to Rose Bay and Watson's Bay where you'll see tiny coastal beaches tucked away in little coves, scattered across the shoreline. On the Northerly side, you'll get a view of the Harbour Bridge, Cremorne and Mosman, the Sydney National Park and some spectacular cliff faces that reach out to the harbour.The ferries themselves get very busy and you might find yourself leaning against the side as opposed to getting an outside seat, but if the weather is nice, it's definitely better getting the wind in your hair than the view from a window. The ferries are old-world style and nothing like the high speed ferries with all their silver and shiny bits. But if you're looking for a beautiful, relaxing day I highly recommend this trip.

Best ferrys. All the ferrys leaving for different locations are a must ride and so inexpensive, you get some great photos of the harbour, bridge and opera house, even if you don't travel well on the sea this will make it a joy to ride on as they seem so stable,

glorious views great value. if your in Sydney for more than a few days pick up a multi travel card for about $40 this gives unlimited travel on ALL ferries and buses and trains throughout Sydney you can then jump on and off all ferries and explore the bays

Excellent Transportation. What a very efficient way to get about Sydney, there are numerous places visited by the various ferries operating out of Circular Quay with the famous Bridge on one side and the Opera House on the other.We bought an OPAL Card which allows you to travel on all forms of public transport throughout the city and even beyond on the trains. The maximum you pay is AU$15 per day and only AU$2.50 on Sundays so very good value for money.Some of the ferries take about 45 minutes between destinations so it gives you the chance to sight see from a different vantage point.

Great value on a Sunday. $2.50 all day on the ferries on Sunday is excellent value although it can get busy. we paid $30 for a family of four from circular quay to Darling harbour return which we thought was ok. They run frequently & are reliable. Great trip for the view of the opera house & bridge.

A great way to see the Harbour City. We caught ferries to the Zoo and also the RiverCat to Parramatta. What a beautiful, relaxed way to see this magnificent harbour, the islands and the waterfronts, both industrial and residential.The trip to Parramatta was curtailed at Rydalmere because of low tide but still woth every cent.Some of the old houses facing the waterfront remind us of the history of Sydney, many pre-dating the modern bridges and having originally been accessed exclusively by water. And now the more modern buildings using new technology to maximise the views with expanses of glass. Very different but interesting in other ways.Similarly the boats, old and new moored independently and in marinas along both sides of the river were fascinating.
Best ferries in the world . Great inexpensive way to see the city and a great way to spend a day seeing different suburbs, buy an opal card and see the sites
Love sydney ferries. got to go on the Sydney to Manley ferry when you're in Sydney. Great experience, the best view you'll have of the bridge and opera house all at once.

Great way to travel. I have become a ferry convert only recently, maybe 3 months ago. I certainly am not looking back though.No traffic jams, no sweaty over crowded carriages. Just beautiful views and comfort.Definitely worth the extra cost when compared to trains and buses.
Easy Way to See Lots of the Sydney Area. Efficiently run, reliable, friendly; the ferries are a great way to get around and see the Sydney area.

The only way to travel. Great value for money, always on time. We took advantage of sitting outside in the sunshine and taking in the spectacular views. The perfect way to see more of Sydney, including Manly and Paramatta.

What away to go!!!. This has got to be one of the highlights of Sydney.The ease, and enjoyment of getting around is unsurpassed on this fantastic system. We used not only as a means of getting to a destination, but also as an activity in itself.Can highly recommend a trip up to Paramatta and back as an excellent way of spending a few wonderful hours. So much to see and take in. This trip can be broken by a stop off at Cockatoo Island. Excellent presentation provided on the history of the place.The Ferry was not airconditioned so on a hot and humid day it can be a little warm and muggy, but alternate from inside to the front deck and it will make the trip much more enjoyable.Also highly suggest the Mosman Ferry. when you get to the Mosman wharfe, take the short walk around to the "Rowers" Club. Imbibe in a nice cold beverage or 2 while you wait to catch a return ferry. Aboslutely wonderfull

To Manly and back. Recently took the ferry to Manly as a way of seeing both the harbour and an outlying suburb of Sydney on a glorious sunny day.The ferry commenced its journey from Circular Quay, which is between the bridge and the Opera House, the trip takes roughly twenty minutes, we took the non stop, direct ferry.The ferry offered many outdoor viewing spots to take lots of photographs and the going was very smooth.Manly itself is quaint and very popular especially on a lovely sunny day and has a good variety of different beaches. The child friendly beach is close to the ferry terminal and has some lovely bars/cafes which also offer good views into the bay.Overall this is a most pleasant way of spending a day whilst in Sydney.

Great value harbour cruise. Enjoy this extensive network that can take you the length and breadth of Sydney Harbour and up the Parramatta River. Excellent value and a magic way to spend a sunny day in Sydney. Don't go to Manly on a big sea day though as the harbour gets rough over there.

Good value for money and an easy and fun way to get around. We used ferries every day whilst staying in Manly and we travelled to Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, even the Olympic site - all with ease! There's a great view as you round the bay coming from Manly and they seem to run to timetable. There are various options and a choice of company, one chap even suggested we use his competitor so we wouldn't have to wait so long!

Good value. These ferries are like city buses which will take you out of the pavement and on to the waves. We went to Manley Beach just to hang out for a few hours.Well run. On time. Great views of Sydney and outlying islands.
Wow. I could have spent all day on these , queues were a bit long but it was new year, great views coming into Sydney , stops at lovely harbours along the way

Fast, consistent, and easy transpo. The best way to get around SYD! I took the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbor, Taronga Zoo, and Manly Beach. They are on time, easy to figure out, and the best way to get from one point to another. The Manly Beach ferry even has a cafe available as well as free WiFi!The views of SYD from the ferry, by the way, are spectacular!Travelers' tip: If you plan to take more than one ferry, just get an OPAL card. It was much easier than having to buy a ticket every time. Just "tap" and go. They are easy to refill if necessary, but also easy to track the balance.

Use OPAL. Anyone going to Sydney needs an OPAL card. The OPAL card made travelling in Sydney stress free - especially when using the ferries. The ferries are the easiest way to get around - and you cant get lost.....not when you have the Bridge and Opera House as landmarks. Circular Quay runs smoothly, the staff were friendly...and most of all helpful.

See the sights from the Ferry. We used the ferries not only for transport but to enjoy the scenery. Not expensive and well kept and clean. go at night it is really most enjoyable even if you just do the Circular Quay. go to Manley we didn't ahve time unfortunately.

A great way to go.. The best way to get around and very cost efficient. Get an "Opal" card which makes hopping on and off services so much easier (can be used for busses and trains as well) but you will be unable to get a refund so don't put too much money on it to start with. Some great photo opportunities. Try to get upstairs at the back if weather permits for great views of the Opera House, Bridge etc.
Manly is sweet.. Best value thing to do in Sydney!!! Took the Manly ferry and went over for dinner...very enjoyable and very affordable.

Very convenient with stunning views!. During our stay in Sydney we have been using the wonderful ferry service. We bought an Opal card which makes using ferries and other public transport extremely easy to use. There are many shops where you can get a card and add a selected amount to your card. Tap on and tap off and enjoy the beautiful views of the harbour. The ferries seem to run quite regularly and have seating inside and outside and there are toilets too. Great way to travel.
Awesome experience. Awesome views and a serene experience of Sydney. We regret not buying tickets for 10 rides together (at the cost of 4!)

A breeze to see the city. I've always love taking the ferries in places that I had visited. I think it's relaxing yet giving you another perspective of the city from the water. If you like the ferry, buy a ferry pass as the public ferry pass is zoned according to distance. Sydney also has private ferries and express ferries. Check the site for ferries and buy to suit your need. If you plan to visit the Taronga Zoo, the ferry is the easiest option and I think most kids would live riding the ferry. You can also take the bus back to the City.
Great way to get around. These are easy to use, affordable and go to most of the attractions at regular times during the day.

Relax on the Harbour!. We spend many hours travelling on the ferries when we visit Sydney. A day ticket allows you travel on all forms of public transport, and if you have a Seniors Card, the ticket will cost you $2.50, which is fantastic value!

How cheap . $7.60 for 1.5 hour cruise accross Sydney Harbour and up the slow but impressive Parramatta river . Go back the same way or ,as I did , catch a train after a cheap mral among the locals in the Commercial Hotel .
Lovely ride!. We loved the Ferry Ride to Manly and Watson's Bay, most of the time, the Ferry was on time and very clean. The lines were long but everybody got on the ferry.
Circular Quay to Milson's Point. Take this route on the ferry and you'll crossing the water under the bridge. Magnificent sight. Must do!

what a great way to see Sydney harbour. It was Sunday and the Public transport in Sydney was set up with special prices for families, all transport, all places for very little $$. A trip to Manly and back was just the way to enjoy their largess. Our overseas guests were really impressed with a Sydney day at it's best.

Good views and efficient transport. We caught the ferry to Manly- it was an enjoyable trip with good views of the Harbour and plenty of seating. On the way back we were lucky enough to sit outside where the views were fantastic. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Sydney.
Sydney Ferries. Get on and off at Circular Quay. Free bus on George street. Use your hop on card on Ferries,Busses and Trains etc. Excellant service all round

Ferry trip Circular Quay to Manly. Cheap and cheerful way of seeing the harbour, better value than fancy cruises, with regular departures, and walking enthusiasts can walk Manly to Spit bridge and bus back home!

Very efficient. This is the best way to explore Sydney and to see its beautiful skyline. We took the ferry from Olympic park to Circular Quay (prononced as key) and the next day from Cirrcular Quay to the Taronga Zoo and the following day to Manly beach. We use the Opal card. Their ferries run on time! Bravo!
fast but crowded. If you wan't a nice trip don't travel on sundays or holiday periods as the ferries are packed to the brim with sunday fundayer's

What a fantastic way to see this great city. There is no better way to see this city, especially as you don't have the hassle of driving or dodging traffic, just sit back and let the world go by.
These guys are certainly professionals when it comes to moving large crowds of people, a very efficient and fun service.

Relaxing on Sydney Ferries. $2.50 for Seniors for an all day travel ticket on buses, trains or ferries has to be one of the best value options when visiting Sydney. You can sit back and soak up the atmosphere as the ferry goes on its usual route. It is possible to hop on and off if you wish to visit various suburbs. We parked at Meadowbank and boarded the ferry there. Plenty of all day parking there. We got off and had lunch at Circular Quay and then did the short trip to Mosman admiring all the houses that back onto to the water. Sitting on the deck in the sunshine and enjoying our return journey finished off a great day.
Great Way to See the City. Getting off shore is a great way to see the city.Bought a weekly travel pass which was great as used it for the bus, train and ferry:-)
Perfect way to travel. I know that I was on holiday but this has got to be the perfect way to travel around a city, particularly if you are not in a rush.Head over to the Garfish at Manly.
Best public transportation. No matter where you want to go there is a ferry. They are on time, reasonably priced, clean, safe, and a good ride.

The best way to see Sydney. We went for a number of ferry rides just for the experience. The harbour is just so beautiful from a ferry and the cost is very reasonable. The day transport ticket is the way to go because we rode the ferries all day in different directions on the same ticket. The harbor and harbor side residences are best seen from the water.

Great way of keeping cool and watching the world go by. Great way of keeping cool and watching the world go by, my favourite is the Manly Ferry, and each time it arrives either end, you just bob through the boat take a new seat and start again.It's like cruising but quicker and not surrounded by so many greedy porkers. If the munchies does get you, then you can also grab a pie.
Lunch cruise. This is one of the things we like most about Sydney - cruising around the harbour while enjoying a pleasant buffet lunch. Good value and great way to view the harbour.
A slow boat to heaven. Friendly and safe ..always on time , so make sure you catch the one you want ......can't really much more than that ...try it yourselves .....
Coffe & Cake ride. Morning Coffe & Cake Boat trip is well worth it. Takes you all the way out to the Ocean via the Millionaires Houses and little bays etc

A must for your trip to Sydney. We enjoyed multiple trips on the Sydney ferry system. Highly recommend purchase of multi-day transit passes--incredible convenience, economical with a well-integrated transit system of ferries, buses, and light rail. A fun trip is to Manley Beach and back, as well to Olympic park. Ferry boats range in size from larger boats transiting to Manley to smaller catamarans going inland to Olympic park.
Efficient Service. Used the ferries to return from Luna Park and to get to and from Manly beach. They are very efficiently run and easy to use with the Opal card.

Great way to get around. Bought a weekly pass - ferries, buses, light rail and rail - $63 for 7 days. Well worth it. Ferry hopped Darling Harbour to Circular Quay couple of times. Went to Taronga Zoo. Went to Manly. Also used on buses and trains. Ferries are frequent and easy to use. Great way to see Sydney from the water without going on a cruise. No commentary obviously. Workmanlike. Not luxurious.

Great all round Service from Sydney Ferries. Visit sydney a few times a year and Sydney Ferries alway provide a cracking service always on time and clean ferries Circular Quay to Darling Harbour good service and a great way to see Opera House and Bridge easy way and relaxing.

Historic and reliable. What a great way to see Sydney, ferries are wonderful the Sydney ferries are a icon of the Harbour and will deliver you to all points of interest on time and for a reasonable fee. Consider a weekly or travel pass if staying for a week or so. But well worth the effort and convenience, all aboard.
Good. May be as aussie standards need to improve standards . Its not up to the mark .Good to travel in ferry and its fine. Always busy and staff is okay and OPAL card system sounds fine.
Pleasant ride. We took the ferry from near the Olympic park to Opera house. The ride was very pleasant and smooth. Recommend visitor to take the upper deck for scenic view of the harbor.

Manly Ferry. We took the ferry across to Manly when we had a couple of hours to kill before seeing a show at the Opera House. Grabbed a bite to eat and then came back in plently of time to see our show. Relaxing way to see the harbour and grab a pre show bite to eat. got some great photos of the Opera house and Harbour Bridge!

sydney ferries. Ferry Transport serves dual purpose.... a tourist attraction as well as public utility transport service with nominal charge s..a ride in the ferry from Darling Harbour point to fixed points is worth experiencing. Age No bar... Everybody will enjoy. the ferry ride!!!

Love the ferries. What an enjoyable way to travel! The views from Neutral Bay to Circular Quay are so breathtaking. The service runs to schedule and sure beats the hell out of driving and trying to get a car park

A visit to Sydney. A traditional and very fun way of seeing Sydney Harbour. It is run very well with helpful staff. You can get on and purchase tickets when you get to Circular Quay, with tickets sold for you to exit i.e you will need a ticket to open the gate out.On a sunny day, the view of the harbour is absolutely gorgeous. Try getting a seat outdoor at the front, but beware of splashings from the wakes as the traffic is quite busy on the water.Prams and WC are well accommodated.
Very busy. Half hour to manly beach. Running every 20 mins as it was New Years day but ferries were very busy and people jumping queue when we had waited in it. Good value only 14.80 aud return

So Great to simply see Sydney. Unsless you need a commentary to go with the sights, this is the best way to see the Harbour. we took the Manly ferry (the Older Slow ones) to Manly and Back, sitting outside you get to see the Harbour and its many attractions. We also rode the Darling Harbour ferry from Circular Key to Darling Harbour and Back, it stops at about 4 points to drop and pick up passengers and again the views are amazing. Only use the Guided Ferry's if you need a commentary.

Great way see the city.. Get a opal card and getting on and off is fast.see the city from a different angle,manly is a must.i was lucky my cuz lived in Sydney so had no worries.so sad the seige happened as we were sat in a bar 100 metres away. If you have not taken a ferry you have missed out.
Great runway to see more of Sydney. The ferries are brilliantly easy to use and add to the whole trip as you are having a small ferry ride around a beautiful setting.

Iconic Manly Ferry. The harbour ferry system is first rate, but a trip to Sydney deserves a trip on the Manly Ferry to Manly of course. The views on route are special and although the trip can get a little bumpy on a windy day there was no need for seasickness tablets. Walk to the surf side of Manly and have lunch in the Manly pub. Don't rush this trip, make a day of it. There are plenty of shops to keep the ladies happy and I enjoyed watching the numerous fish under the wharf. The ferries run regularly and the costs is reasonable.

Lack of service. Our trip consisted of a ferry from Darling habour to Circular Quay, to connect with a ferry to Wastons Bay and return.The First ferry was 10 minutes late which resulted in us missing the second ferry. Due to the Watson bay ferry running about every hour, we were an hour late for lunch with friends.The watsons Bay service seemed very popular and the service is still lacking. On the way home we had to line up for 45 minutes on the Watsons Bay wharf to board the ferry to return, many people were not allowed on due to large numbers of passengers. This is very poor service, can't recommend ferries to Watsons Bay.

A great way to get an overview of the harbour.. Jump on a ferry to get you to Manly, Watson Bay, Balmain or where other place. Maybe do what I do in my lunch break do a loop and take and eat my lunch in one of the best harbours in the world.

Get an Opal Card!. Going on a ferry is a must for anyone visiting Sydney. Awesome views at a reasonable price, plus a fun mode of transport. Highly recommend getting an Opal Card if you're going to use public transport during your stay in Sydney as the max you pay per day is $15 (adult), $7.50 (child). Travel on Sundays max $5! I ordered our cards online from NSW Transport a few weeks before we went & cards were posted to us. We had to top up cards to min $40 (adult), $20 (child) but they say unused funds may be refunded upon request. We found this very convenient & excellent value rather than buying say mymulti passes or individual tickets each time. There were big queues for people buying ferry tickets, but we just walked through by tapping our opal card.

Convenient, scenic and fast. we took advantage of the one day pass that allows unlimited ferry / bus rides for the day....the ferry is fast and comfortable, allowing for amazing views of the Harbourwe took the ferry to / from Manly Beach - wow - don't miss it!

Why pay more?. The public ferries traversing the Sydney Harbour are a perfect way to view the city and its surrounds. There is always plenty of seating. They are clean and quiet...and economical, especially for Seniors! Hop on and hop off. You day is made!

Very nice view of the bridge and Sydney Opera House. Being on the ferries was an interesting experience. We could see nice sceneries of the Darling Harbour, Sydney Opera House and there were many photo opportunities...

Covenient. The ferry is really clean and great for easy travel to the other side of the river. However I think it is a bit too expansive to pay $6 for Circular Quay (Opera House) to Darling harbour.. It will be few cents cheaper if Opal card is used.

Great way to get around Sydney and the bays!. Buy an Opel card which makes travel on the ferries, buses and trains much easier in Sydney. If you have one of these cards and travel on a Sunday, the maximum you can pay is $2.50, which is such good value. The ferries go to just about everywhere and are really efficient. Just check the timetables and make sure you know which quay you are going from.

Travel on a Funday Sunday family pass. What a great way to see the harbour! No need to book a river cruise! We had a Funday Sunday family pass ($2:50 each) and with this we were able to hop on and off multiple ferries during the day. A lovely trip over to Neutral bay on a sunny sunday afternoon and a trip down to Darling harbour.

Great views. Big boats where they don't seem too concerned how many people get on. You are herded like cattle on and off the boats. The views are spectacular and this is probably the cheapest and fastest way to get around to Manly, Taronga, etc. The ride is nice and smooth and is novel. Expect to pay about $12 pp to go to Manly and more to get to Taronga.

Water way to get around!. A great way to see the harbour - good prices, regular services and great photo opportunities. Don't be put off by the hustle of Circular Quay, the staff are very efficient at loading and unloading people.

Sydney would not be Sydney without the ferries a must for getting about. An easy and enjoyable way to get around the city whether you choose the ferries that the locals use or the many options for visitors all are great. The hop on hop off is extremely good with great information given on route
Love It. What a great way to see the city - we travelled across to Double Bay, then over to the northern suburbs. Not the fastest way to travel, but a must do if you are from overseas.

Most convenient way to travel in the city. We have purchased a week pass for AUD 63 and traveled by ferry and bus which was very convenient. It is better then paying each time or getting taxis which are expensive in Sydney

Such a great way to get around. Circular quay ferries are so simple to catch, tickets are cheap and easy to purchase. The signage is clear - no chance of getting the wrong one as if you're really not sure the staff are very helpful. They are very unique to the harbour and an excellent asset.

Nice Ferries!. The Sydney Ferries were really nice. We took it from the main station to Manly. They had bathrooms on board. There were really good views. It got us there fast and it was on time each time we got on/off it. If you don't want to take a car or train this is a really good choice.

Fabulous transport. I always use the Sydney ferries were possible on my frequent Sydney trips. They are usualy a smooth and relaxing ride to your destination with the added bonus of seeing Sydney from the aspect of the water.

All day all ferries and buses for $17. Wonderful service on a busy day across and around the harbour areas to central quay .We spent a day in the botanical gardens and convict barracks by NSW parliament.Lots of bus time back to Dee Why and lovely tea in Manly.What more could you ask for - great efficient service from the ferry , and good use of the real time update screens to keep you informed .Well done Sydney Ferries.

Take the ferry from Syney Harbour. We tok the ferry to the botanical gardens. The ferry is just along the harbour side away from the ferry b there are a couple of options. Any of them are good. The hop on hop off bus kiosk is also next door to the ferry boat ticket kiosk. We took a smaller boat and we were very happy with the service. They give a little panoramic tour and informative talk as well.

First Class. Sydney Ferries are an important part of the City's transportation system.They are easy to use, reasonably priced, and well run. A trip to Sydney isnot complete with out experiencing this important part of every day lifeof travel.

Great Sydney public transport as always. Travelled by ferry from Manly to Circular Quay. Always surprised by how many people can fit on these ferries. Great trip and a small delay at circular quay while we waited for a cruise ship to depart. Worth the wait.

Terrible service on Sunday . Service on a Sunday is terrible. Not only are all the ferries full every single Sunday, everyone on the ferry pleads that it is not their fault! A lot of money has been spent on many of the wharves but very few have good public transport so once committed to a ferry there are not too many options. They then put on a special for families on the Sunday there is no room for anyone to get on even with supporting the service throughout the week. Travelling by ferry is fantastic! Unfortunately the service in Sydney is terrible.

Don't pay for a cruise... Take a ferry instead! . Sydney harbour is very beautiful and riding ferries is one of the best ways to go around the city. Don't pay $50 for a cruise, just ride unlimited ferries on a Sunday for $2.50 only.
The best way to take in the harbour and its sights!. Must do while in Sydney. My advise try something to eat or drink at the restaurants adjoining the wharf. Its such a nice experience

Fast, reliable and inexpensive!. Have always found the ferries to be on time, very clean, staff is helpful (wit my innumerable questions!). Always fun to be in front, for fantastic views (and photos) of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House, the Rocks....
great way to get around. Not that much and you get to get some great views. What's not to love? Give it a try as a way to get around and get some good photos!

Fantastic way to see sydney. Best way to see sydney. Ferries are reasonably clean and reliable. Great way to get to manly and using the river cat was fantastic. Be creative and get around easily. As a new senior card holder I travel any day for the entire day on any form of transport for $2,50. On Sunday anybody can do the same for $2,50. Fantastic seeing families using this to explore this beautiful city.

Don't use a car. Syndey is a beautiful and accessible city. When you have tired of the shopping, cafes and restaurants in the main town, my advice is to copy the locals and use the ferries. It is a relatively inexpensive and very pleasant way of getting around, without any traffic delays.

Close proximity to Hobart Race. The captain sailed very close to the competitor giving passengers exceptional views of the boats in the race. Safe and proline staff mingled with us making the event so very enjoyable.
Short ride with nice view. Take the ferry ride from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour & enjoy the nice view of the Opera House, Sydney Bridge.
Excellent. Cheapest harbour cruise you will find!!!! Circular Quay to Manly go past Opera House Harbour Bridge takes approx 30 minutes
Plenty of routes tp choose from. Just a wonderful way of getting round and seeing the city from many different perspectives. Went up to Parramatta for the first time by water. Good value

Smooth ride. We did pay $10/ person from Olympic park to Darling harbour, after visiting the Blue Mountains, and we love the ride along the river approaching Sidney by the north-west and avoiding lots of sailing boats in a regatta...

Great way to get around the Harbour. The perfect way to get around Sydney Harbour to all of the famous places such as Manly and Watsons Bay (both must visits if you are in Sydney for vacation). You will get some lovely views of the harbour front mansions of the rich and famous and a great way to get some sunshine and feel the salt air on your face. Best thing is that it is cheap and affordable!

Exhilarating!. The feeling of salt air hitting your face and the views of/under the bridge and the Opera House. Can't fault the ride considering the reasonable fare (compared to what one has to pay in NZ).A must for all travellers!
Excellent transport. The speed and price great . The views to and from Central quay to Manley were great. One return journey included a front seat thunder storm this was amazing Ito watch!

Sidney by Ferris. When in Sidney for a week, buy the MyMulti3 card. You can use it for ferries (including Manly Beach), busses and trains. Cheap and continent. The ferries are very convinent and provide a beautifull view if you stay in Sidney. They have good excess to all the tourist spots, and very much cheaper then taxi's. Avoid the taxis' if possible as they are EXPENSIVE.

View the Harbor, Spend the day at Manly, View Sydney after dark. The ferry to Manly (we took the high-speed) is a win-win-win proposition. The ride in each direction gives you a view of the coastline from the water. Once in Manly, there are opportunities to shop, graze and eat. We enjoyed a pair of meals along the Manly shoreline, sharing dishes and then moving on to the next eatery. Plan on returning to Sydney after dark to enjoy the view of the city as it lights up. We were extra lucky and caught one of the giant cruise ships pulling out. (See the picture.)

On time!. We took a ferry to the zoo and another to Manly. they leave about one minute ahead of schedule, there are plenty of them, they are clean and reasonably priced. They close boarding 2 minutes before scheduled departure, so don't dawdle. If you take one to the zoo, be sure to book the combined zoo entry fee, cable car to/from the dock and zoo entrance, and return ferry. It's a bargain.

A Good Service. The service is easy to use, runs on time and gets you there when required. You cannot complain about any aspect of the service which works. Use it when in Sydney for across harbour travel if you are old and if you are a Senior it is cheap travel

on sydney harbour. the best and only way to see Sydney Harbour is on the Sydney Ferries . they go all the way up to Parramatta on the Parramatta river stopping an all the stops.also around to Darling Harbour Balmain on the western side of the Harbour Bridge. on the eastern side u have Taronga zoo and the Spit, manly,and accross the heads nwhich can be exciteing if a swell is running.with a opal card good value

Mode of transport. Wit the geography of Sydney, Ferries are ding humane task of transport - easy, cheap and accessible. The way timely turnarounds are made by the ferry people, simply great. Office goers or tourists like me, rest assure you will be on time
Well connected. The Sydney Ferries is a great way to travel inside Sydney and connects the land very well in its bay. The view is amazing at night.

A scenic tour of waterside Sydney!. Well organized, it would be worhwhile taking one or more rides in the ferry and see how locals use ferry regularly for commuting. You will see a lot many houses, bungalows etc, small parks around the coast as your ferry glides by. I thoroughly enjoyed the ride. Well managed, with capable operators.
Trip to Manly. enjoyed trip across to manly.. ferries are frequent and punctual so easy to visit sights good view of Opera house and Bridge from the water
It's like Bus - stop all points. The Sydney Harbour Ferry runs like bus, it stop all the points, very good thought ! many route will give you great views. No toilets on board !

Excellent service. We travelled on Sydney's ferry service on a Sunday and it truly is hard to believe the Sunday $2.50 cap can include an efficient and trustworthy system like this ferry service. Comfortable and affordable, and manages the high foot traffic with ease
Great way to explore!. You cannot visit Sydney and not do the ferries... they are a great way to get around.... we truly enjoyed every trip on the ferries.

One of the easiest and pictueresque ways to travel. Although I was in Sydney for a short time I became a fan of the ferries. Its just feels wonderful to sit on top of one and feel the wind and the surf. One of the days the sea did become a bit choppy and was spraying surf so people had to sit inside. But overall a very easy way to get around while also enjoying views of the harbour.

Love The Sydney Ferries. How could anyone come to Sydney and not ride the ferries. This is our 7th year returning to Sydney and the highlight of our vacation is always riding the ferries. The Manly ferry is such a great experience. The trip from Circular Quay is 30 minutes of pure joy. Traveling past the Sydney Opera House and seeing the sky of Sydney is fabulous. The entire ferry ride to Manly offers such beautiful views. Also, make sure you ride the ferry to Darling Harbour. Anothert great ferry ride is on the River Cat ferries. All in all, can't wait to return next year and enjoy all of the Sydney ferries.

"mum and daughter travel the ferry". Manly ferry at wharf 3. $2.50 per person on family fun day. Sunday. Sit outside and take in our beautiful city...Amenities, refreshments on board. Get off at Manly or stay on board, change seating sides for the trip back to the city....
It was a nice ride. I went on do many ferries this year but I really like sitting out dude and resting and the breeze is amazing the prices are so fare I Wil be doing it again

Best harbor views while visiting parts of the city. You can get a beautiful view, and free wifi while travling to Manly or to other locations. You can also use your transit card that works for buses and trains on the ferries as well. Best value is on sunday when the total transit card charge is capped at $2,50.
Manly Ferry. Always a great day out and very reasonably priced. All of the locals travel this way so can be busy. Go and have brunch at one of the many cafes in Manly

The best way to see the City. Easy and easy-going. Good value, especially if you buy a 3-way ticket which allows trains and buses (but you pay extra at airport to get through the gate!). Must be crazy on a weekend going to Manly but on a Thursday morning it was fine, plus all the little jetties to the west under SHB are good.
Great way to view city!. Loved the ferry ride to Manly. Wifi on trip greatly appreciated! Boats run a tight schedule which is great (except when you miss the gate by one minute!).

Seriously excellent value (and what views!). Difficult to add much more to the reviews already posted by others - but have here a wonderfully reliable service, incredibly 'cheap' (I would say so by European rates) - and just stunning views on every trip.Rather than staying in Sydney centre, this time had decided to stay in Manly and bought a 7-day 'Multipass 3' ticket. For $63 you have access to all the ferries, buses and metro/tube in the Sydney area.Public transportation that is reasonably priced and pleasant to use! A rare experience.

Manly. Manly is a must,been over there now about 10 times or more its one of our favourite places lots to do and of course Surfers paradise,plenty of places to eat and relax,recommend manly bay,its better going by Ferry!

Great transport and good value.. I've always enjoyed Sydney. It's a great City. One of its endearing traits is its location. Take advantage of the ferries to specific places (what a way to commute) or to have a lazy cruise round the harbour. I visited many places in this way and was never let down. I also took a longer trip to Parramatta. 1 1/2 hours each way. Sat outside in the sun taking in the fabulous sights. Lucky Sydneyites!!!

Avoid peak time to travel to Manly from Sydney. Excellent service departed and arrived on time. Friendly staff helped with large luggage. Fantastic views of the Harbour on the way to Manly and Manly beach, much better than Bondi with a greater range of shops up through the Corso at Manly.

Highly recommended. Most relaxing and economical way to see the Sydney Harbour. We took the river cat to Parramatta River and the view of Sydney Opera House, harbour bridge was just fabulous, views along the river was also stunning. The ride takes about an hour one way, don't forget to check the time table and be at the ferry on time.

The best way to see the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. We just loved Circular Quay with its constant ferry activity. The $6 ferry ride to Darling Harbour is the best way to get dramatic photos of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. We even had an announcer on our ferry who did a comedy routine over the mike and then came round taking selfies for us on our own cameras. Magic!

Great way to travel. No need for an expensive harbour cruise just buy a day or week roamer ticket and cris cross the Harbour, all destinations give you a different aspect of the greater Sydney area. A must do on a visit to this fascinating City.
Sydney by sea. Sydney's Ferries are a unique way to see the city, and to see everyday life. Grab an opal card and take a ferry across the harbour, up the Parramatta river or across to Manly.
Best tourist transport. Go from Manly to Circular Quay on the ferry and see the Heads, Bridge and Opera House from the decks. Great and cheap way to see the famous landmarks!

A very efficient public service. A cheap way of seeing Sydney. Catch a ferry to Parramatta or the Zoo. Make sure you get an Opal card and if you are a senior make sure you get the discount! You can use the card on the ferries and trains and some buses.The ferries are clean and run on time and the staff are friendly and informative.We were very impressed.

Great way to see the city. Take the time to view Sydney from the water it is well worth the effort. Use the ferries or take a tall ship and cruise and enjoy a time of yesteryear complete with food and drink. Make it a day to remember..

Only way to travel on the harbour. Any where you want to travel around the harbour you have a ferry at your service. be it the Twin hull River Cats , Sight seeing cruisers, water taxis or the bigger Manly type ferries they will get you there. The use of the Hop on, Hop off ticketing makes travel so easy.It is a fantastic means of travel, no traffic jams just clear efficient sailing I must also mention it is a cost efficient way of travel.

Experience Sydney Harbour & Waterways. Use Sydney Ferries to see the beautiful harbour and sights. Travel to Taronga Zoo, Cockatoo Island, Fort Denison, Luna Park, Watson Bay, Mosman, Balmain, Woolwich & Manly. Catch the River Cat out to Parramatta.

best way to see the harbor. use your opal transportation card to hop on and off ferries just as a way to enjoy the wonderful views of the sydney harbor. think of them as a tour boat, that the locals happen to use a way to get to and from work.

The best way to get around. We used the ferries a lot during our stay in Sydney. They were punctual, clean and value for money. To see the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House from the water was a sight you never tire of.
Nice Experience. I visited multiple places from Sydney Ferries like Manly Beach,Watson Bay, Parammatta, Sydney Zoo etc and enjoyed the service very much.
Great. Loved the way these boats traverse the waters around Sydney. Fast, friendly and efficient, just great! Bring you to many places you will want to see in a few days.
Get the Multi Pass. Get the multi pass and take the ferry everywhere. Great way to get to the zoo, from neighborhood to neighborhood, etc. They run like clockwork so make sure you're on time.

Awsome. Have been on the sydney ferries in 2014. Went to luna park by ferry. It was an awsome trip. The view is amazing. You can see the opera house and harbour bridge plus much more. Sydney ferries will always be a favourite of mine

Great way to get around Sydney. The ferries, regardless of which company you choose, offer punctual, quick and fun transportations around Sydney! Prices are reasonable ranging from $7.80 to $9 per one way trip. Prices are from Sydney to Manly.
Quick and Comfortable!. My friends and I took the ferry to get to the Taronga Zoo, and really enjoyed the ride! The ferries are quick and comfortable, and are a great way to enjoy the harbor!
Sydney Harbour Ferries. Excellent value and service. Providing great views of the Bridge and the Opera House as well as stopping at various locations around the harbour and beyond.

A wonderful form of transport around beautiful Sydney Harbour. To be able to take a Sydney Harbour Ferry is a real treat - some of the boats are old & I love them even more - they have so much character. Their organisation & timetable is excellent & so easy with an Opal Card - highly recommended!!

Easy way to get around with a fantastic view. There are several options for the Ferry system depending of what you want to see and do. There is a "hop-on Hop-off" ticket that takes you to may of the sights located on the water or in the area. The run on time and all you have to do is describe where you're headed and they will sell you the correct ticket, no worries.

Best way to travel around Sydney. I was fortunate enough to move near a spot where the ferries run, and then to secure a job on the other side of the harbour. I have to say the commute to work has never been better, or more calming. What a great way to begin and start the day! And they are always nearly on time.
mistaken ferry trip. My daughter and I got on the wrong ferry , we were trying to get to Darling Harbour. It was a good mistake as we ended up having a tour of the surrounding suburbs

What a nice ride. Start at the Circular Quay and take a reverse commute. Sit upstairs and outside and look for dolphins. And if you stay on, you don't have to buy a return ticket. A great way to beat the heat!

Excellent value great sights. Our hotel concierge recommended the Manly ferry as a good way of seeing the main sights of Sydney harbour and of getting to see another part of the area on our short trip to the city. We went over to Manly for lunch and like most people on the day we made the short walk from the ferry to the ocean beach where there were plenty of lunch options and a beautiful coastal walk. Spectacular views of the city, the bridge and the Opera house and the bays between circular quay and Manly make the return ticket price a real bargain.
Easy to take. When you are in Sydney, just take a ferry. It is very easy and cheap too. F.e. take the ferry to Manly beach and enjoy the views and the beach.

Best harbour sightseeing tour. Take a ferry to Manly to see Sydney Harbour and Manly beach. Nice 40 minute trip with excellent views. If you travel on budget, don't pay premium for lunch or dinner cruises - views from Sydney Ferries just as good. Also you may go from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour.

Endless sightseeing, perfect way to travel to Manly. We took the Ferry from the City to Manly three times this week loaded with suitcases & found it a cost effective & easy way to travel. The ride is a real treat for the eyes with endless sightseeing both ways. The Ferry while old is clean & tidy and we travelled at times where there was ample seating. Highly recommend for visitors.
A Great way to Travel the Harbour!. Yes when in Sydney, get on a ferry & have a look @ the most beautiful harbour in the world. The houses, people & views are truly breathtaking! Enjoy!

Catch the famous Manly ferry. We caught the ferry to manly from the city, it is famous and yes I can defintely recommend it! Great views from the harbour (make sure you take a camera) and cheap tickets! Only down side is you are open to the weather and when we went it was raining, really windy and also the ocean choppy so the ride wasn't very comfortable! But I'm sure on a good day it is amazing.
Manly. Take a trip to Manly on the Ferry and get great photos of the harbour, the Bridge, and the Opera House. Well worth it.

Fantastic way to see the City. Whenever we have family over from the UK or other, I always make sure they are introduced to Sydney for the first time by taking the ferry from Rydalmere to Circular Quay. There really is no better way to be greeted by this amazing City!
Got to get to Watsons Bay!. Now $2.50 from Balmain to Watsons Bay for fish and chips how good is that and despite the crowds the ferry was organised and on time. Love those waves too!

Quick and Efficient. For most of us, the thought of taking a ferry back/forth to work/home is a bit odd. But here it's just the normal way to get around, and the thing to do. And you don't have to really have anywhere to go - just hop on and enjoy seeing the harbor! Just seeing the Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge from the water are worth the ride.

Love Those Ferries. A must do when visiting Sydney. A cheap way to tour the harbour and soak in the beautiful city skyline and surrounding bays. The service runs regularly so not always a long wait and often you can step straight on. I have never had a problem and always look forward to using the ferry service when I fly down to Sydney. Hope you enjoy your trip too!
A good harbour tour. Well maintained, and frequent service. A great way to get a harbour or river tour without the commentary. Very affordable.

Enjoy Sydney Harbour with a ferry ride. Fantastic way to enjoy the harbour views. Love hopping onto a ferry and going to Manly for the day. A wonderful way to experience Sydney waterways. A ferry ride from Palm beach to Ettalong (central coast) Excellent

Best view of Sydney Harbour. Cheap and clean. Two floors with bathrooms and cafeteria. You can go outside on the 2nd floor at either the front or back of the ferry. At Manly, you can board on the 2nd floor from the dock itself.
Day ticket to ride. Bought a day ticket and just went on the ferries and got on and off where ever took our fancy. Spent the day just enjoying the view and deciding where to hop on and off and walk
Great ferry service. Efficient, helpful, friendly staff at Circular Quay ticket office gave us advice which was really useful.

Easy access, great views. The ferries are quite easy to access and can take you to many places, including Manly Beach, a popular spot. This is a great way to see Sydney Harbor and the many boats on the harbor.

ferry in sydney. It was an efficient and economical way to get to the aquarium and to see the city. We did the Manly ferry ride on one day and went to the aquarium via darling harbor ferry ride the next day. Unfortunately, it was gray and gloomy when we did the Manly ferry ride so the vivid colors of the bay or area did not stand out. The darling harbor ferry ride got us to the Sydney aquarium. It was a nice ride and the weather was better.I would recommend taking the Sydney Ferries to get around.

Public Transport with a view. Use your Opalcard, by a single fare no matter you will get great views as you commute between downtown Circular Quay and Sydneys beaches and suburbs. Great value for your money!
Relaxing ride and cost effective. Best views of both harbour bridge and opera house. Cheaper way to get to the lovely Manly beach and added advantage- no traffic issue you have to deal with!!
Ferry ride to Zoo. Excellent way to go across the harbour from Circular Quay to the Zoo. Good views of the Opera House and Bridge.

Wild ride. If you want a wild ride take the fast ferry to Manly when the sea is rough - not for the faint hearted and maybe best to sit inside as it is fast and bouncy and a little scary if you sit outside at the back.I liked the humour from the crew who aren't fazed at all!
Site seenig. We had a evening Cruise @ Sydney. We also had a dinner on the Cruise. Whole Harbour area is lighted gives excellent view of the Sydney.

Up the lazy river on a Sunday afternoon. Using the Opal card for a day trip to Sydney we travelled in by train abd made a on the spot decision to travel by Rivercat to Parramatta. The quay was packed will famlies eagrr to catch the non stop service from Sydney to Parramatta and we deciddd to give it a miss as a all stops ferry wss scheduled to depart ten minutes later. Good choice. Comfortable seats with ample leg room made for an enjoyable experience despite the wet and miserable day.Lack of information at the Rivercat wharf at Parramatta regarding times of buses made it difficult to decide whether to waif for a bus or not.Decided the ten minute walk to railway station wss worth despite the light drizzle. Lovely way to travel to or from the city.A must do for visitors.
A must for anyone!. Anyone visiting Sydney MUST take the ferry to Manly... for a few $$$ you get to see Sydney Harbour and the Heads in all its splendor!

Efficient and cost effective. I have used Sydney ferries between Manly beach and circular quayAlongwith the incredible views that you can see between manly beach and circular quay, Sydney ferries offer a quick and cost effective means of travel between the 2 points. A round trip (valid for 1 day) costs 14$ and takes you point-to-point in 30mins!Definitely the best way to travel while getting a glorious view of the sea and the Sydney shoreline!

Very useful. Ferries are awesome If you want to get glimpses of most of the Sydney attractions without spending much time and money. Just take a ferry from the Circular Quay to Manly beach and you will get to see the Opera house, Harbour bridge, Luna park, Taroonga Zoo and take a few perfect shots too. Its a great way to explore the city center areas. Highly recommended.

Different angle viewing Opera House & Harbor Bridge. There are few destination you can go by taking Sydney ferries, such as Parramatta , Manly Beach. During the trip you can view the harbor Bridge & Opera-house from difference angle.If you have time you can please go on Sunday. With Family package you can try as many trip as you like for just AUS$ 2.5 person. This rate also able for you take buses and train by this ticket. ( applicable to Sydney Council transportation only). Remember only on Sunday.

Efficient and fun way to travel. The ferries are a great way to see the harbour as well as get about. Worth getting an opal card to use in combination with the trains and buses as makes getting about the city much easier. Well worth travelling a bit further afield to others points on the network.
What a way to travel. A top attraction and a perfect way to discover Sydney and its harbour. Wish we would have this kind of (efficient) public transport.
Ferries. Opal Cards are now being accepted on Sydney Ferries. Some stops it is hard to now purchase a ticket. Great way to view the harbour and get to those places the trains cannot.

Sailers in heart. If you ever dreamed of becoming a sailer and working the accountant job now, this is the closest you can get to wide spread sailing. By the way, very safe and well organised at the same time. Lots of connections and gerat places to see on the way.

Relaxing ride. Took a ferry from circular quey to darling harbour. Boarding at wharf 5. Caught the ferry at around 4.40pm, before office hours end so the ferry wasn't packed. It was a nice cloudy afternoon with cool winds. Sitting at the back (open-air) was a relaxing and enjoyable experience. Saw the opera house and the harbour bridge. P.S. check the display above the entrance before you board the ferry to make sure u are heading to the correct destination.

could be so much better. Living 50 metres from a ferry stop gives me some qualification to write about this experience.Indeed, Sydney Ferries offer a wonderful and reasonably priced way to exp[lore our magnificent harbour. You don't need to get on a harbour cruise- just take a few ferry rides and you can easily spend a half day seeing so much. There have been some welcome improvements like offering free wifi- excellent, but the overall experience is still not up to the surroundings.E.G. wouldn't it be great if you could have a cup of coffee or something to snack on like those wonderful ferries in say Stockholm, where you really feel that it's an experience as well as a commute. We have some old fashioned idea that the ferry needs to be sterile..what a shame.

Spectacular SYDNEY Harbour. Visitors to Sydney seek out the Harbour .... As they should. Such a spectacular location which encompasses so many of Sydney's iconic attractions. A suggestion from a long standing resident of this beautiful city. The best way to see the harbour and sample typical Australian culture, is to ride on a suburban ferry route. Many of these depart from the Circular Quay wharves and are a very cheap way of viewing the harbour fore shores. I would suggest the Watsons Bay trip. This leaves the Circular Quay terminal and in a circular manner visits many of the Eastern Suburbs and returns to Circular Quay about 60 minutes later. No need to hop on the tourist cruises run mainly by Captain Cook Cruises. The other trip recommended is the Manly ferry. The trip across takes 35 minutes and you get to view all of the eastern section of the harbour ... In clouding the coat hanger (the harbour Bridge and the Opera House etc). Both trips are cheap and highly recommended.
Great Ride Down River. Returning from Blue Mountain tour, the ferry ride back to Sydney was a feast for the eyes - and the ferry had a bar! A must do to get a good look at Sydney!

Great service. Just to sit at a bench and watch the bustle of the Sydney ferriers is amazing!There is one either coming in or going out all thye time.They service all the coves.İf you take a barbor cruise with them,you get to see how beautiful Sydney is and what a great integration it is with the sea

Way to see the Harbour. The Sydney Ferries go back a long way in history. There are many ferries going in many directions from Circular Key the main service travelling to Manly and back. If you want to get a birds eye view of the Harbour I recommend you take a ride on the Sydney ferries.
tim. The sydney ferries are famous with great service , we caught one to bondi beach , was excellent , some great sea food restaurants there .
Great way to travel. Wish we had these ferries in Scotland! What a relaxing way to travel around the city. Friendly staff and beautiful views of the city. Why would you not travel this way?!

Easy ticketing; helpful staff. This was my first-ever visit to Sydney and so I'd never used the ferries before. My children and I found the ticketing staff helpful. The ferries are a wonderful way to travel around Sydney harbour. Special thanks to a staff member who phoned me and took my daughter's camera to lost property after she left it on a ferry at Circular Quay.

Ferries - Great water transport. The Circle Quay (pronounced Key) is the place to be to take a ferry ride to many of Sydney's outskirts. You really don't have to take those expensive tours if you don't want to. The ferry rides go just about everywhere and they are inexpensive. I took a ferry to Manly Beach and it was great! The ferry's leave on time, most days they are very full with both locals and visitors, so try and arrive early so that you can get a seat on board. There are seats inside and a few bench like seats along the outside of the ferry. The ride to Manly was about 20 minutes, but I wish it was longer, as the views of all the sailboats and kite surfers was wonderful. There are limited restrooms on board the ferries. The ferries are a wonderful way to see Sydney and its surrounding areas.

A cheap cruise. We took the ferry to Manly Beach one evening just to see the sunset and to experience Port Jackson from the water. It was a nice way to spend a Sunday evening. (BTW, you can get a full day ticket on all public transit for $2.50. This "cruise" was practically free!)

Great service of Seniors. My husband and I paid $2.50 for a daily transport ticket which covered ferries, buses, light rail and trains. We both have Seniors cards from Victoria. We were able to travel everywhere by connecting between ferries, light rail and train. The ferries were great - we were staying near Darling Harbour and travelled between Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, Watson's Bay and Manly by ferry. The ferries were on time and comfortable. It is a great way of seeing Sydney which has so much to see on the waterfront. We found it remarkably straight forward finding the right platform for each ferry and really enjoyed our trips.

Great views & friendly staff!. Great views of all the local landmarks, much cheaper than a chartered boat. We literally ran to catch a departing ferry & they waited for us, when they easily could have left.

such fun. this was a great trip across to manly sunny day filled with adventure for the kids to see the sights of Sydney. Nothing has changed in the 40 years since I last went on a ferry on Sydney harbour except the service is less hands on. Fun trip
Very good :D. Good and fast service, however quite expensive as one trip cost me like $5 for one stop. Very smooth journey and efficient staff

Harbour Ferries. Really enjoyed Watsons Bay. Lovely seafood restaurants by Doyles, choices of kiosk plus more upmarket. Well worth a day trip on the Ferry. Another place is Manly. Walk to waterfront, lots of eateries, boutiques and wine bars.

River Run to Abbotsford. Every been stuck at Milsons Point and looking for something interesting. Take the rivercat trip from Milsons Point to Abbotsford and walk up the hill to the Abbotsford Rowers Club. That's a sepereate review. The very are clean, fast and smooth. Giving you plenty of time to read, caht with friends of take in the marvelous scenery of middle harbour.

great way to travel around the harbour. getting a round all day ticket is a brilliant way of seeing the suburbs of Sydney as well as getting from The Opera House to Darling Point where the Aquarium is

Best way to see the harbor and skyline.. With a camera or smart phone, you will be compelled to take many photos, perhaps considerably draining your battery. Other than that, I think you might spend a lot of time on the ferries.

Great Way to Experience Sydney Harbor. Yes, you can pay a lot of money for tours of the harbor but you can also join the locals on the ferries and get a great tour of the harbor and beyond for much less money plus you feel kind of part of the Sydney "scene" rather than a tourist. Most of the ferries leave from Circular Quay which in and of itself is fascinating, I have never seen a busier ferry terminal anywhere (nor one in such an amazing setting). Boats are arriving and leaving constantly from very early to very late and it's easy to spend 30 minutes or more just watching them come and go. There are many routes stopping at many different places. The boats are all clean, pretty comfortable and run impressively close to schedule. Some are older and have a sort charm because of that (I love the "double-ended" Manley Ferries) and others are quite modern catamarans. Most have a small buffet if you want a coffee and a sausage roll. Sure, there isn't a commentary but that's really not necessary in my view and in honesty, if want to get around Sydney the ferries are a great way to commute even if you don't care about the sightseeing. When in Sydney riding the ferries is a "must do" so don't miss it!

Best way to travel within Sydney Harbour. I always stay in Milson Point when in Sydney . This is North Sydney , on the other end of the Bridge . If I'm travelling to the city , CIrcular quay , Darling Harbour , Manley or Watsons Bay the ferry is essential . Every 30 minutes to any of theses destinations . Buy a week ticket ,much better value . Taxis a readily available but cost a fortune . Ferries are clean , reliable and just great to see Sydney Harbour .

The ferry is a great way to explore Sydney from its stunning harbour. Sydney Ferries can be caught from many locations around Sydney Harbour & the Western harbour. The best starting point is to catch a ferry at Circular Quay on the harbour at the northern end of the city. From here you can take the Taronga Zoo ferry or the Manly ferry to some of the city's best tourist spots, which are also favourites of Sydneysiders. The fare is relatively cheap for travel in Australia & you can't get lost as you can catch a ferry to the city from any wharf. Circular Quay has destination boards & you can pick up a route card & an Opal transport pass there too, or from many newsagents & other outlets listed at u & you can also plan your route using public transport around Sydney at http://tp.transportnsw.info/nsw/XSLT_TRIP_REQUEST2?language=en or choose your own language for the site.
