At Circular Quay an Opal card is available at Transport Customer Service Centre - Circular QuayOpposite Wharf 5 on Alfred St, CIRCULAR QUAY NSW 2000I am a Sydneysider & I love Sydney... Enjoy!

Efficient. Clean and comfortable. Schedule times often and adequate..Nice to be out on the harbor when the weather is warm. Why pay for a harbor cruise with the commercial ships? Take a trip to Manly Beach instead.

Take the ferry to Manly Beach. This is an inexpensive tour of the harbor as well as a nice way to get to Manly. While there we enjoyed some drinks at a harbor side bar while watching the beach and the people.
Different view of the harbour. Took the ferry back to Darling Harbour after our Anderson's Blue Mountain Tour. Friendly service. Efficient
Sydney to Manly. Lovely boat ride to Manly which was a lovely place. Lots of tourist things to buy,but not trashy! Beautiful beach and lots of nice cafes and restaurants to choose from.

Best harbour views. There really is no better way to see the harbour and no point wasting your money in the expensive tourist boats. My only criticism is they finish quite early on, I guess for safety reasons. Buying a travel pass, rather than singles works out great value.

Must do activity.. Any visitor to Sydney just has to take one(hopefully more) Sydney harbour ferry rides.Simply amazing.Chance to get some great photos.The ferry ride to Manly is probably the best but ideally get a ferry that makes multiple stops.Watsons Bay ferry ride gives you the chance to have a fish & chips meal.McMahons Point is another must see and would be an ideal place to watch the New Years Evefireworks show from.Brian

Always clean and on time. Public transport do not always tick the boxes, but the Sydney Ferries have my total support. They are always clean and on time. They work on one of the most beautiful harbours in the world and take me wherever I need to be.

Great service and stops and beautiful ride through the harbour. Views were amazing around the harbour, shame about the smog though as that distorted some of the great sights - a beautiful place to visit.

Very convenient ferries from the downtown harbour. We took the Manly Ferry over to visit the Manly beach area. Ferries were comfortable, left frequently and a reasonable trip $12. return. Ride is just 30 minutes and you arrive at this great beach area.
So clean!!!. These ferries are like no other ones I've seen in the world. They are clean, and the restrooms are as well. I was not afraid to use it.

Family pass vs Opal card. On Sundays across all Sydney public transit, families can ride for ver cheap, but you can't use your Opal card for this deal. You will need to talk to a ferry ticket person (if a ferry is your first mode of transport on the day) otherwise if you tap in on your Opal, you will have to pay regular rates 'cause you'll need to tap off at your destination. Plus, you can't multi-tap for the whole family, so.... If you are a family travelling in Sundays DON'T use your Opal Card.

Iconic way to view harbour. Fantastic and affordable way to view harbour and get around Sydney to various places without the traffic and in a peaceful scenic relaxing atmosphere, amazing views around harbour with frequent services running through the day to allow you access by water to and from various spots around the harbour, a must do in Sydney.

its a great way to get around good seats etc mag views of the Bridge,fort Denison the Opera house. Its a great way to see the city from the ferries.
On a calm day its good but beware of bad weather for is can be very ruff which will take away a lot of pleasure.
We have done all the trips on this harbour including the rivercat to Parramatta.
This a must so do it .
Perfect way to travel. Sydney ferries are the perfect way to travel around Sydney. The hop on hop off ferry is excellent, it helped us to get the most from our stay.
Great. Travelled on ferry to Manly with grandchildren, had a wonderful experience, enjoyed by all young & old.

The best way to experience Sydney Harbour. Visitors to Sydney must take a ferry ride, sitting out in the open air section of the ferry. A Sydney Harbour ferry ride is one of the best experiences, with lots of photo opportunities. The ride to Manly is great, there is a small canteen on board, they sell snacks and hot and cold beverages. Another super attraction in Sydney is Tooronga Park Zoo, and guess what you get to go on another ferry ride across the harbor, and the zoo is another great experience. Sitting out on deck during one of the many ferry rides available is a very relaxing experience, so don't miss out on adding to your memories of Sydney and your photo collection. Take the time to catch your breath, and just sit back and enjoy the experience.

fun with a 3 and a 5 year old. Off the train at Circular Quay, down the escalators and onto the forecourt of the harbor. Enjoying the various entertainers performing and then onto the ferry to Darling Harbour. Have to sit outside and, at the front to pick up, the breeze and watch the water lapping at the ferry. How amazing to look up from under the bridge and also see the laughing man's face of Luna Park. Great excitement at the pulling in and out of the wharf stops along our way and then joy oh joy...a pirate ship in Darling Harbour. Great fun, entertainment, educating and the ability to sit and savor these precious times.

Beautiful View. The best way to experience it in my opinion is to go early in the morning, take the ferry, spend the day at Manly Beach and surrounding and comes back to Sydney on the ferry at night. Experience the view with the sunset and the Bridge and the Opera House all light up straight from the water. It is BEAUTIFUL!(Visit in 2010)

Extraordinary shuttle service. Certainly the best and cheap way to have a great look and enjoy Sydney Bay.You will travel with many locals commuting from a suburb to the city center, and what a ride! Beautiful scenery, nice colours, for the tourists, an unforgettable experience indeed, to share with the Sydneysiders!
Trip to Watsons Bay. Nice way to get there instead using a car. Last ferry is a bit early other than that a great and cheap way to see the harbour.
Sydney Ferries. Great way to see the harbour and foreshore land marks. I particularly like the old chuggers, heaps of character.

Not very frequent and expensive. Seeing that Sydney loves their harbour and its a must to catch the ferries are quite expensive and don't run frequent (most are every hour!). It was cheaper for us to get a taxi to Luna Park instead of catching a ferry. Dissapointing
Always on time. We enjoyed going around with busses and ferries in Sydney, Manly and Narrabeen North. Everything is well organised, on time and the staff is always very friendly.

Fantastic trip to the beaches and bays in Sydney. The service of Sydney ferry is punctual and fantastic.Take the advantage of Day Trip tickets or Sunday Family tickets, you can visit all the beautiful beaches and bays in just one day at small cost. Make sure you check your timetable first before you plan your day trip on Sydney ferry.
Great weather & great sight seeing. We went from Circular Quay to Manly & had a fabulous day out, had lunch there & caught another ferry back to Darling Harbour.

great value great way to see the harbour. there are so many ferry trips that you can take from circular quay.if you want just a lazy enjoyable ferry ride why not try balmain.you will need an hour or so for a round trip.the ride will take you out under the harbour bridge and around the darling harbour pyrmont balmain area you will see the city from a different view you will see homes retired ferries in the harbour and a few places that you may like to get off and explore.unlike the manly ferry this is not a point to point service.it is used by locals to travel from home to the city.remember if you are a senior you can do this trip for $2,50 THEN CONTINUE ON YET ANOTHER FERRY.

Ferry to Watsons bay. Fabulous ferry ride to beautiful Watsons Bay- a special place, parkland, swimming, great seafood restaurants, great cafe and that's just the bay side. Walk across the park to view the ocean and the spectacular cliffs and wander around to hidden beaches then take a bus back to the City

Great way to see suburbs of Sydney. Usually I travel by ferry into Circular Quay as a local. My family also use the ferries to go to Balmain and many other suburbs of the city. It is a great way for visitors to see another part of Sydney without the hassle of the roads - so easy and no traffic jams It is all done for you. It is so beautiful of a sunny day. enquiries can be made to Sydney Ferries. AND the staff on these ferries are delightful and very helpful too.

Great way to see Sydney Harbour!. The classic trip on Sydney Harbour is the crossing from Circular Quay to Manly Beach. Fabulous views of all the harbour side properties as you slowly make your way up the harbour. It can get quite rough for a short time as you pass the Heads, but that just adds to the excitement! Good value for money, and very frequent crossings all day. A relatively inexpensive way to see the best of Sydney! On a sunny day, there is no better way to spend an hour.
Uniquely Sydney. The staff are really friendly and helpful. The charming ferries are on time to take to your destination on the worlds most beautiful harbours.

Sydney Ferries. I travelled on the Sydney Ferry to Manly with my family.The kids loved the ride . We went to the aquarium and it was just a few minutes walk from the wharf.We went on a Sunday which is family fun day and we only paid $2.50 each and you get to ride on the train,bus,ferries and tram which is very cheap.

OH MY GOD every ride on a Sydney Ferry takes me back to my childhood. Sydney ferries the quintessential iconic journey any tourist or traveller needs to take when you are in Sydney. Numerous styles of ferries exist all with their own personality, from the big manly ferries to the little tootle ferries that trip across the harbour. Sydney ferries what a wonderful experience for anyone of all ages, take a trip and gain a view back into childhood memories.

Circular Quay to Manly. Courteous staff organize passengers onto the vessel with a minimum of fuss. Smooth ride across the harbor and across the heads. The vessel is comfortable and clean. The scenery is second to no other harbor in the world! Disembarkation simple and quick. A thoroughly enjoyable way to see Sydney harbor.

Romantic Sydney Harbour cruise on an iconic Sydney ferry.. See spectacular Sydney Harbour on a 45-minute ferry ride without costing an arm and leg. Sydney Ferries is the ideal way to see it and it is great value at the cost of a ferry ride.

So, you want to see Sydney.. Like any big city, Sydney has many attractions to see which are in the vicinity of the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House, Star Casino, and two museums and a multitude of very good restaurants in the surrounding streets , BUT, have a good look at the Sydney Ferries. You can take one to many excellent places in the harbour, out to the Heads and west to Parramatta where the tourists will not get ripped off. Also here are some very excellent restaurants and on selected days, there are fairs with street stalls. The best trips on the ferries are to the Taronga Zoo,(a tip.... take your own food/drink, lockers available) Manly beach and Doyles on the Beach at Watsons Bay..... but, be careful here as the prices are well over the top. Have a feed at the wharf instead as it's the same fresh fish and chips as the restaurant but at least half the cost. If you want to see these places cheaply, go for the 'ticket options' which are really good value for the visitor. After you have done the city limits and filled your mind with information, take a leisurely train ride up to the Central Coast, go to Gosford and hop a bus to The Entrance for the day. Chat to the locals, they love it and will be happy to meet someone from far away. I know I do!!

Best value travel experience in Sydney. Hop on a ferry, at Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, or even Parramatta (River Cat). Spend a day exploring what I believe is the best harbour in the world. Head to Manly for lunch , or perhaps Watsons Bay for fish and chips. On a good day, it's an excellent way to see Sydney from the water, at a budget price. Get a day ticket, enabling a full day on the ferries !. Great for the whole family too.

travelling by Sydney ferries. What a way to see the greatest harbour in the world.Not expensive,especially as a Senior combining trains and buses. The ferry staff are helpful and the ferries depart and return on a very frequent times. Clean and tidy and easy to get on and off and wheelchair friendly. Any part of the harbour can be accessed by the ferriies.
Cruise Sydney Harbour. Great day to be had exploring spectacular Sydney Harbour, just take a ferry anywhere and back. Cheap way to see the city from the water. Kids love it.
Cheap way to cruise the harbour. There are a number of great ferry trips you can take on the harbour. The Circular Quay to Manly is a must do as is the Quay to Parramatta.

We are very lucky. We are so lucky to have options but to be able to take the ferry along the Parramatta river to the City for a small fee is such a great way to get to and from the city road rage free. The operators are fantastic too and always very friendly and helpful.

Spectacular. What a fantastic way to see the beautiful sites of Sydney.If you do it on a Sunday it will only cost you $2.50 on an opal card which gives you unlimited travel on public transport.See the opera house, Luna Park, Toronga zoo,Darling Harbour or just ride the rivercat all the way to Parramatta and enjoy the atmosphere.

Best value. This is the way to travel around our harbour. The prices are reasonable, especially for seniors and a bus meets most ferry stops. A trip to Manly, or Mosman or up the Parramatta River on a lovely day, is so relaxing. Pick up a timetable at Circular Quay or look online.
sydney ferries. totally professional in what they do.Staff are polite and helpfull,which is paramount for our overseas visitors

Best way to see Sydney. Public transport is the best way to see Sydney. It runs on time, is fast and good value.
The ferry staff are well trained, professional and friendly. Time it right and you can see fireworks, lights, races and fleet reviews from a ferry.
You can hop on and off all day.

Great experience..... There are so many places especially to get to by a ferry in Sydney....great trips to Manly & Parramatta to name a couple. Also if you head out to Cronulla there is a wonderful little ferry you cancatch over to Bundeena for a swim or the markets on Sunday is very popular. You can also do a river cruise good value for money....There are many more places around Sydney that you can see by ferry....On a whole staff are always pleasant & very helpful.... just pack a drink & some food & spend the day exploring great for the kids....

Sydney Ferries. Want a way to see beautiful Sydney Harbour ,go by ferry ,it stops all sorts of terminals dotted around the harbour.You can sit out side with the sea air in your face,or inside and watch the heads go by.It is a great way to see Sydney Harbour, you can go under the Harbour bridge and by pass the wonderful Opera house standing on the shore,, just magic

Great way to spend a day. We caught a ferry from Watsons Bay to Circular Quay waited 5 minutes then took the wonderful old Manly Ferry. A much slower trip than the modern ferries but gave us a chance to enjoy the beautiful harbour and enjoy a coffee from the cafeteria on board. Had lunch at Manly a walk along the beach caught the ferry back to Circular Quay Had a delicious ice-cream people watched then caught a ferry back to Watsons Bay. A great relaxing way to spend a day
Million dollar view for a few dollars!. I recommend any visitor to sydney to go on at least one ferry ride, as the best way to take in Sydney's spectacular scenery is from the harbour itself

Great Harbour Great Ferry rides. While staying in Sydney before and after flying overseas we went on two ferry trips for the huge sum of $2.50 each for the day. We purchased a pensioner all day travel ticket each which allowed us travel on Sydney Buses, Trains and Ferries for the day. Our first trip was to Manly from Circular Quay. The Ferry is easy to board. has good vision and is a wonderful way to go to Manly and back. Our next trip was up the Parramatta River as far as the Olympic Village Wharf and return. We found the wharves to be well sign posted, the Staff both on the wharf and ferry to be pleasant, friendly and helpful. I recommend a day on the Sydney Harbour Ferries to the young, elderly or families wanting a good view of our beautiful Harbour at a leisurely pace.

Ferry to Watson's Bay. Our best morning outing in years was a couple of weeks ago, when we caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay. It was a beautiful warm, clear day and we sat in the park looking back at the Sydney skyline, while eating a lovely takeaway lunch of fish, chips and salad from Doyles, at the end of the jetty. The trip back to the city was also very enjoyable, admiring the beautiful homes along the coastline of the eastern suburbs. Just a magic day!

A very exciting way to get to Taronga zoo. We solely use the ferry to get to Taronga zoo and kids love it.Can't beat the views! But price is quite stiff on normal days, so travel on Sunday to make the most out of your bucks!

Sydney ferries a great way to travel!. Worth the $$ to see the city from the water. Boat a little old and run down but you are there to see the sights not look at the boat. Open air setting the best for viewing.

Paramatta River to Circular Quay. What a refreshing and relaxing way to get right into the city centre, only one and a half hours trip from Paramatta Ferry Wharf to Circular Quay. No traffic jams. Going again next week!!!

Sydney Harbour. Ferries are the best way to see the sights of Sydney and the harbour. Buy a day ticket and you can travel on all services for the day. Even better on Sunday's travel all day for $2.50, includes train and bus as well.

Ferry ride down under!. Experience a nice ferry ride that will add more fun on your trip to Sydney. Riding on a ferry will give you a nice view of the Sydney Opera House and The Harbour Bridge and opportunity to see different angle of the tourist spot.

Cheap way to see the harbour. The ferries are your best bet for an unguided tour of the harbour. If you get on the loop from Circular Quay that heads to Darling Harbour, you can see the Opera House on the right then the ferry goes under the Sydney Harbour Bridge as it moves toward Luna Park, then a few extra stops around the harbour before arriving at Darling Harbour. It is especially cheap if you go on a Sunday because you can get a $2.50 pass to travel all day on all public transport.

best way to see Sydney harbour. The ferry trip from Circular Quay to Manly is a must for any visitor to Sydney. You will enjoy spectacular views of the harbour bridge and the Opera House. It takes nearly an hour but at the end you can walk down the Corso at Manly and have some lunch. The return trip back to Sydney is just as good.

sunday cheap day. sunday ferries are $2.50 to manly . great value and a well run service. people complaining about speed or ocean conditions are clearly morons. its a ferry, not a jet boat, and the ocean comes through the heads, so it can get fun!

Budget Mini Harbour Cruise. We have very often used ferries between Circular Quay and Darling Harbour and in both directions. Yes sometimes it is a bit overcrowded but still anytime I'm impressed from the different options you get to take very unique photos from Opera, Harbour Bridge and Luna Park. I recommend to use the ferries on Sundays with the Family ticket.

You have to catch a ferry while in Sydney. Sydney ferries are an iconic part of Sydney and allow you to see parts of the harbour that you would never otherwise see. A ferry from Sydney to Balmain is only a 10 minute trip and takes you to the west of the harbour. In Balmain you can explore one of 25 pubs and if you stay late it is just a short ride by bus back to the city. A round trip from Circular Quay on the Greenwich/Woolwich ferry is a beautiful ride and takes a bit longer but allows you to see some of the more prestige inner west suburbs of the city. A must is the Manly ferry which takes you on a trip to another iconic attraction in Sydney - Manly beach, where you can go for a swim and check out the trendy shops and bars. On the way you pass many attractions including Fort Denison, Mosman, Neilson Park Beach. The ferries are cheap and always run on time.

Sydney Ferries a cheaper option than a Private Harbour Cruise. It is so wonderful to buy a Sydney Ferry ticket to Taronga zoo, or even further to the beachside suburb of Manly. The views from the ferry whether from the older type (more fun) or the modern hydrofoils. You see nearly all the worth while sites of Sydney Harbour, Pinchgut, The Opera House, The naval base and more. Alternatively take a Sydney ferry ride up the harbour, under the magnificent bridge up the Parramatta river and see the wonderful riverside homes and parks along the shore and enjoy a picnic at Cabarita park.Go on a Sunday and get cheap excursion tickets great value.I enjoy taking all my overseas visitors on such trips and they love it, so try it.

Cheap and easy. Sydney Ferries are the most cost effective ways to see Sydney Harbour from the water. Pick a lovely calm sunny day and you will enjoy a fantastic outing. Lots of things to see and explore. Recommended for tourists and locals.

Thank you NSW Transport Minister Berejiklian!. Not meaning to be politically partisan, but kudos have to go to NSW Transport Minister Gladys Berejiklian MP for fixing our ferries and then some! My wife and I took a ferry ride for the first time from Abbotsford to Watsons Bay via Circular Quay using our Opal cards.Not only was it $2.50 per person on Sunday for the ENTIRE trip, and we avoided the dreaded Sydney traffic as well as not having to find parking, absolutely nothing could beat the enjoyment of cruising on Sydney Harbour on a mixture of public and privatised ferry services. They were on-time, clean, efficient, safe, comfortable, and the staff were absolutely professional, friendly and very customer-focused. My wife and I can't wait to try the ferry again, with our friends this time, on New Year's Day!

Forget the expensive private Harbour cruises - take a ferry. Up until recently, my wife and Iived on Sydney's Upper North Shore. Now we are able to enjoy the thrill of commuting to the city by ferry. Our nearest service is from Rose Bay. Travelling time to Circular Quay is just 20 minutes with a regular stop at Double Bay and a request only stop at Garden Island. On a glorious summer day, the views you will experience are just breathtaking. Imbue yourself with history as you walk through the Rocks. Better still, hop on another ferry to Darling Harbour and ultimately, Pyrmont Bay for a leisurely lunch at Balla, situated within The Star Casino. It's not cheap but the food and table service are excellent.

Ferries great experience. Recently my husband and I took a ferry from Circular Quay to Cockatoo Island and from there back to Darling Harbour. We travelled on a Sunday early afternoon and were pleasantly surprised as to how enjoyable and easy the travel was. Sydney ferries were using private company ferries to match the demand and because of this ferries were on time. They were also clean, not overcrowded and staff were very friendly. We used the new Opal card system and this worked perfectly . I would also recommend a visit to Cockatoo Island. It was interesting and had bars, cafes to cater for all. Darling Harbour ,as always was a great experience offering many choices for activities and eating venues.

Part of your best Sydney experience. I travel a lot on Sydney Ferries, and I love the experience. Those old iron vessels exude character and charm, the staff are friendly and helpful, and the harbour, well, the harbour just sparkles.

Excellent value. Go Sidney government ferries ,run on time lot and lots of people use it . Do not be late might miss ferry, good time tables, so many people wanted to use it over the weekend we went on it you had to wait to board, but they are very good on safety.. Can get various ticket options depending on when you are going / how often / how many time in one day / on consecutive days. Etc etc. , can pay by card or cash , lot of locations all over the area. More sailing Monday to Friday , over weekend/s fewer.
you pay too much for too little. overfult boat with too many people, the boat is slow and it cost 23,5 dollar from sydney central to manly beach

Functional plus beautiful and sometimes exciting. The ferry ride between Circular Quay (at the edge of the city centre) and Manly (a suburb on the north side of the harbour) is the classic choice for visitors to Sydney. The ride can be excitingly rough as your vessel passes close to the Heads, and the older and less stable the vessel the more exciting the journey. Mostly it's a smooth ride serving both locals commuting to and from work and visitors. Wharf 4 at Circular Quay is your departure point.

love the harbour. You just have to love the Sydney ferries on the harbour, the best most inexpensive way to enjoy Sydney harbour dont use expensive sightseeing trips you can see it all by using the Sydney ferries, and maybe even a river-cat down into Parramatta,

Sydney Ferries. We usually take a trip to Manly, when in Sydney, The Ferries are clean and well maintained. Ticket and boarding system is excellent.Cheers Niels & Mary, Humpty Doo, NT, Australia, Down Under

A thousand miles from care.. The Manly Ferries have been an enormous part of the growth and spread of Sydney for over a hundred years. There are many other ferries going in other directions but the Manly Ferries opened up an access to the 'Northern Beaches' and a whole new population emerged from that 'small step'. The first visitors had "weekenders" in the area to escape the hustle and bustle of Sydney Town. This transformed into permanent residential living thanks to the ferries. Years later, the ferries take commuters and tourists on a 30 minute cruise between the city and the beach suburb of Manly, my birthplace. Slow enough to afford a panoramic view of headlands and bush covered landscape that looks, for all the world, like an Australian painting. Commuters sit with their newspaper in hand to read on their daily journey and rarely get past page 5 while looking dreamily at the passing scenery. On rough days, there is a frisson of excitement as the ferry sails past the heads and a natural roll takes place with the slow heartbeat of the swell coming into harbour. Add sunshine and smiles and you are transported in more ways than one.

One of the best ways to see Sydney. At a very affordable $7 (one way), this is one of the best ways to see Sydney Harbour. I recommend trying to time your trip in to Circular Quay from Manly Wharf around sunset, as this is the time Sydney Harbour looks most spectacular. Park at Manly Council Carpark, take the ferry to Circular Quay, have a delicious dinner at the Rocks, and have a nice little cruise back to Manly on the ferry. Alternatively, Manly Grill (great ribs and steaks) is open till around 10:30pm if you can make it back to Manly in time.
Easy to use. Used the ferries quite a bit in our 5 days in Sydney, they were easy to get around to the various spots. Get a pass if you are using them for more than one day.

Manley Ferry never fails!. We had the most wonderful trip to Manley via the Ferry and the views of both the Harbour Bridge and Opera House were magnificent! How wonderful too, to get these views from a Sydney Icon! The manley ferry is up there with the Staten Island ferry as one of the worlds great ferry rides!

Tip top Service. Talk about punctuality and reasonable fare. This is indeed one of the best transport service in the world. Do buy the complete ticket of bus-ferry-train.Enjoy the romantic and majestic sunset especially when you take a ride from Sydney terminal to manly beach with the view of Sydney Opera House and occasionally a school of dolphin swimming around you!
Easy way to get around. Great way to see lots of Sydney. We brought a day ticket cost $24.00 approx spent most of the day on the ferries. Loved it.

Best-ever bargain boat rides. Ferries are an essential part of Sydney's transport system, used routinely by Sydney residents. But they also afford a wonderful way to see the city's waterside delights - and at remarkably low cost. They are even included in the $2.50 pensioner one-day ticket that covers all the city's bus and rail systems. But even at regular fares they are terrific value. From Circular Quay, go across to Mosman, up river to Cockatoo Island and beyond, or out round the bays beyond Bondi. Look at routes map and take your pick. Fantastic views of amazing waterside houses and gardens (modern and older), some climbing precariously up steep, wooded cliffs - much to envy!  The only challenge is finding where the boat you want actually goes from, and even when you have found the right Quay (numbered 1-6, but 5 and 6 are for cruises), need to keep alert to ensure you get on the right vessel . . . Wear a well-secured sunhat, and may need jacket (can be quite breezy); remember sunscreen. Once on board, just sit back and gaze around you!

Great way to see Sydney Harbor and to Get Around. The ferries run quite often and are on time. They go everywhere, including up the Parramatta River. On Sundays they have a really good deal for day passes...especially if you are a concessionaire (retiree). You never get bored on one of these rides.

Cover a lot of ground!. Try to avoid the really busy times, crowds really get pushyInexpensive way to get around the harbors; Sydney and Darling.Not enough outside seating.If you want to get pictures, get an outside seat.
Getting around. Great service they might not always be running on time. Friendly and helpful staff great to have a look around all the suburbs of Sydney and not over prices like some others.

Great and cheap way to see Sydney and the harbour. How can one go wrong with the ferry system in Sydney? The ferries are efficient, quite cheap (especially if you are a senior and buy the $2.50 day pass that gets you unlimited access to all buses, trains and government-owned ferries) and the views are spectacular. We took the ferry to Manly and back and enjoyed several hours walking along the Corso to the ocean beaches and back. The ferries can be very crowded but there is always room to sit down if you want to- both inside and also on the outside seating areas. On other trips to Sydney we've often spent an entire day taking different ferries to explore the many bayside communities overlooking the harbour.

Fantastic way to get around. I just love the old Sydney ferries, they are just classic!We took a ferry over to the Taronga Zoo and were lucky to have a beautiful day to be out on the harbour. Anywhere you take a ferry gives to a great view of the opera house and the harbour bridge.Make sure you head out on deck if the weather is fine.They are quick and leave on time, certainly a fun way of getting around.
Best way to go to Manly. If you want a good overlook at the Opera house here is the way. It is actually a beautiful cruise through the bay.
Best way to see the harbour. I took the ferry to visit a friend's house in Manly. It was a great way to see the harbour for about $7 or so.

More convenient than bus in some area. We used the ferry a lot during a 1 week stay in Sydney. From Circular Quay, we went to Balmain, Luna Park, Darling Harbour, Manly etc. It's easier to take ferry than to take bus to these area. Some ferry is equipped with washroom (I am not sure if every ferry is). For longer trip (e.g. to Manly), you can sit outside on the upper deck and get the unobstructed view of the harbour. It is very relaxing.We used the Mymulit 3 pass and all ferry rides were free.

Love the ferries!. We loved taking the ferries everywhere, fast, efficient and time tabling easy to understand. We purchased multi passes too for access to buses and trains also. Special mention to one of the staff, Grant, on the darling harbour to circular quay service, who helped us, and others, taking our photo when coming into Sydney Harbour. Did everything with a smile on his face and was very welcoming.
The only way to travel. From Circular Quay the ferries will take you just about anywhere, inexpensively and with frequent departures. The only way to travel.

We traveled to Manly. We enjoyed the return trip to Manly. Nice coast and good views from the ferry and it was definitively not overpriced. Great situation happen when we were returning to the Circular Quay. Some really huge ship was leaving the harbor so we way making a way for it. Our ferry went under the bridge and we got some very nice views there.

Fantastic Ferries!. The ferries from Circular Quay are an absolute must if you are visiting Sydney. We went on several of them including Watsons Bay and Darling Harbour, they run very frequently and offer a great view of all the waterside attractions. Best of all they were included in the cost of our $2.50 'Pensioner Excursion' train tickets!

cicular Quay. a good trip to the Circular Quay known locally as the Rock. Will a good German beer keller with live music and the staff dressed in the costumes of germany and the food plenty of it and good.So much going on there is something for everyone.. Music all around lots to see and do with many attractions like and Aboriginal music and you could have your picture taken with them but you can or not give a donation up to you.

Very prompt Service. I went to Manly Beach on the Ferry and it was indeed a memorable one. Me and my family loved it. The Ride from the Sydney harbor to the manly beach took about 25 minutes and every minute was a exciting one.

The Best. One of the great things about Sydney must be the ferries. Whether day tripping, shopping, sight-seeing or commuting it is a joy.Any day that starts on the water in sunshine is a plus, that the ferries are regular, punctual and convenient is even better.We're stopping in Balmain so a five minute stroll to one wharf or fifteen minutes of exercise to the other Balmain stop is no trouble (there's even a connecting bus on the longer route to a wharf).It is a simple thing but one I find lifts the spirits, especially compared to taxis and congestion back home.

Great service to get you around. on-time, efficient, not overly expensive and a really great way to see Manly and Watson's Bay. Watson's bay is the 'in place' to be apparently, there's some great bars and places to eat there

Cheap fun way to travel on Sydney Habour. We went to Manly Beach via the ferry. Cost for return ticket was =$14 each.Manly is lovely. We had lunch at the Bavarian and it was very good food, right next to the wharf. Drank some beers at the Four Pines brewery = Koelch beer and as I come from a town 30km east of Cologne ( Koeln) I loved that experience. That is also available at Circular Quay at the tiny Liquor store open long hours. Coffee was nice on way to Manly and average on way back. So depends on who makes you Cuppachino ;-) Takes 30 minutes, Ferries are very frequent and you get excellent harbour views on top. Manly was one of our really nice days in Sydney, staying at the Intercontinental.
Such an easy way to get around Sydney. Buy a day pass and spend the day cruising around the harbour! There were plenty of seats, great views and was an inexpensive way to see the sights.

Sidney's Underground. The ferry system in and around Sidney is akin to Londons Underground system in that the city could not survive without it. It links the numerous bays and inlets in and around Sidney and always appears to run to time. A must do thing whilst in Sidney.

Beautiful and fun way to see the city. We took a quick ferry ride across the harbor and back and had a wonderful time. For something around $10 USD each, we got to see the CBD from the water, the Opera House, the Sydney bridge, and also really enjoyed seeing some of the waterfront homes on the cute harbors to the north of downtown. Definitely recommend taking a ride when you're looking to sit down and rest but don't want to miss out on everything Sydney has to offer.
Manly bay/Zoo. ferries are a great way to see Sydney city and surrounding areas. they were reliable, easy to get on and off and very quick.

Quick scenic trip to McMahon's Point Wharf........ As we were pinched for time to see everything, and we just had to experience a ferry ride, we decided to do a quickie ride with Sydney Ferries from CQ to McMahon's Pt. Ferry Wharf and back. Fantastic use of 45 minutes and we are glad we crammed it in. We had a MyMulti DayPass so no drama getting through the turnstiles and onto the Ferry. We sat at the back of the boat, a great vantage point to view the wash and see where we've been. Those Sydney Ferries may be looking their age, but they still have plenty of 'go' in them! It would have only taken about 15 minutes max. to arrive at McMahon's Point, after one other stop being Milson's Point Wharf where Luna Park is. We no sooner got off the ferry, walked through the ferry shelter to the grass park along the shore and sat down to take in the views..when another ferry came from Darling Harbour direction to pick us up. By then it was starting to spit rain, so good timing all round. Sydney Ferry staff were courteous and very efficient. Next time I'm in the big city, I will endeavour to take the bigger ferry to Manly.

Sydney ferries. No trip to Sydney is complete without a trip on the Manly Ferry. Relax whilst taking in the views of the harbour. Great for photos especially around sunset. Try some fish n chips when at Manly. Be sure to protect your belongings ' especially your purse as with all tourist spots.
Enjoy the Ride. Worthwhile experience. Value for money and save a lot of time, if you are planning Sydney Sightseeing

Fun for all ages.. Not long living in Sydney, my husband and I are keen to explore and not always use the car. The ferries are a fantastic way to see the Harbour and bays, even if you just want to enjoy the ride and stay onboard for the return trip to Circular Quay. Obviously weekends are very busy with Sunday even more so with the $2.50 cap on the Opal card....prepare to wait. The popular spots such as Manly, Watsons Bay and even Parramatta, I have seen people not allowed on board due to numbers and even full to capacity boats just whizzing past. Pick your days. All in all an absolutely great way to get around to view beautiful Sydney.

Great way to get extra photo angles. In addition to being a means of transportation, the ferries offer the opportunity to capture photos of the bridge, Opera House, and other landmarks from additional angles.

Great transport option. A wonderful way to start the day. I attended a conference in Sydney city so stayed with family on northern beaches night before. I was dropped off at Manly ferry terminal. I purchased a ticket at the ticket window and waited for a short time before boarding. It was a lovely morning and was a hassle free way to commute to the city.

A must when visiting Sydney. On this visit to Sydney we took 2 ferry rides - 1 to Manly for lunch and the other around Darling Harbour. This is such a special way to view all the sights from a vantage point unique. Easy to buy tickets, easy to read signage, smooth and safe excursion.
Get your bearings by taking the ferries. We took this several times in the week we visited. Use it to explore beaches, shop, and sight see. Found them always clean and on time.

Great fun. The ferries are the best way to get the spectacular views around the circular quay, darling harbour, the opera house and going to Manly. We are so lucky here in Sydney to have this kind of transport, they run on a timetable and you will have all the convenience and the comfort of your sightseeing. Catch them from Circular Quay , and also will give you other information to go other destination with the Sydney ferries.

Ferry to the zoo. Took this journey over to the zoo. It's the most interesting way to travel to a zoo. Good value for money and was a good smooth journey. Amazing picture to be taken on the way. Fully enjoyable and made the day at the zoo more enjoyable.
great trips. Used the ferries a few times during our visit. We went to Manly one day. another day down to darling harbour where you pass balmain under the sydney bridge. Wonderful and cheap

Great way to travel. Sydney is so scenic that this is a great way to get around. It is great to travel in the daytime with a brilliant blue sky and the downtown towers gleaming in the sunlight. At night it is spectacular leaving Circular Quai with all the building lights reflecting in the water. A great memory of being in Sydney.

Great views of sydney. We have used the ferries daily to get about the harbour area which if you don't know covers a massive area. There are fast and slow ferries to suit your needs, they are cheap and easy to use taking you to the many many places available in the harbour area.
Great service.

Great system. We had a 7 day bus, train and ferry pass, it was easy to find a ferry, we went to Manly which is well worth it.We also went to Paramatta which gave us a good look around the harbor, although this trip took 1.5 hours one way. It was very hot and no air-conditioning so we trained back to town

sydney ferry. when one takes a ferry, one can see the most iconic attractions of Sydney, Sydney opera house and Sydney harobour bridge from the sea and that view is amazing compared the one that one gets from the land.
anything which shows off harbour is great. went on several ferries to Manley and darling and zoo all views great and service very efficient a must to do

"Ferry Good Indeed!". Travelling on Sydney Ferries is very special for my wife and I whenever we go to Sydney. There is no fuss or bother even if travel is taken at peak periods. The signage is excellent and departure/arrival times are very prompt.
All day fun. Many destinations. Cheap to travel especially if you are a senior. Plenty of room on ferries. We spent a whole day just travelling on the ferries sightseeing.

Fantastic!. As Sydney is a city clustered around a beautiful harbor the ferries are and integral part of its soul and very being.Go to Circular Quay, purchase a day pass and then ride the ferries to wherever they take you. It's all very beautiful.Otherwise if you are one of those souls who need a plan travel to Watson's Bay and have a seafood delight at Doyles, perhaps look at the kangaroos at the Sydney Zoo or eat lunch and people watch at Darling Harbor.A great way to spend a day in Sydney.

Can't visit Sydney without having a ferry trip. There is something special about a ferry trip on Sydney Harbour. To see the city from the water is spectacular. If you don't have anywhere in particular to go just do a trip for the hell of it you won't regret it there is a certain romance attached to it.

Nice way to see the harbour. The ferry we caught to Sydney Olympic Park was nothing flash. Functional and well worn. Staff were perfunctory and yelled out that no food was to be eaten inside - only outside where at the time it was windy and lots of spray. This no eating inside policy should be clearly displayed and advice posted before getting on the ferry. It would limit a lot of the hostile reaction. Otherwise the journey was safe, embarking and disembarking easy. The crew know their maritime expertise even if customer service training is lacking. And why are ferry toilets frequently disgusting?
Great way to travel. Good value, relatively cheap way to get from A to B .Circular Quay to Luna Park takes 4 minutes.Or go to Manley, my favourite beach.

Best way to see Sydney Harbour. Without doubt the best was to see Sydney Harbour Skyline, The Bridge, Circular Quay and the Opera House. Around £2.50 single for the thirty minutes trip between Darling Harbour and Circular Quay. Very frequent during the day and hourly after about ten at night.

So good I rode them on two separate occasions. I was really taken by the green & brown ferries plying the waters between the Sydney Circular Quay and Manly. One evening we took a VIP taxi ferry over to Manly for evening dinner and caught the last ferry back at 21:30. The sights of Sydney by night were out of this world. This is bucket list stuff... On a second afternoon I took the same connection up to Manly and back just to repeat the feeling. There is so much to see on the water and that view as you approach the Sydney Opera House and the Sydney Harbour bridge is just out of this world!

Great possibility to reach nearly every point in Sydney at a good price. Use the Ferries as often as possible - they allow you to reach a lot points of Sydney for a good price! Another point is that you get amazing views e.g. of the Opera, which you wouldn't be able to have without the ferry.

Typical ferry but good way to see the coastline. A pretty good ferry trip other than the fact there are some Japanese who try to block the stairway to the upper deck so they have it by themselves. A good way to spend a hour and see the attractions.

Best way to see the area. If you plan to travel on more than one day, enquire about a weekly pass...but if you even have just one day to spare, don't miss this! What better way to spend a day...go to Manley...have a walk, go back to Circular Quay and see where the next ferry is going....jump on....enjoy yourself!
these are a must. Very helpful staff large well maintained boats with on board food and drink great way to see the harbour and travel to other beach resorts

Fantastic way to explore the Harbour. We stayed near Circular Quay and used the ferries almost everyday . Watsons Bay , Balmorral and Manly were top destinations for us . The views around go harbour are breathtaking and it's such a cheap and fun way to get around .
Great Service. The ferries from all of the various places are all very reliable and a fun and unique way to travel to different parts of Sydney.
great way to get around. This is a great way to get around. We took the ferry from Darling Harbour to Olympic Park for an event at ANZ Stadium. It was by far the most pleasurable way to get there.
stunning views of opera house and bridge. I never tire of the views from the ferries going over to Manley, Watson's Bay or Darling Harbour. Excellent service generally on time.
Great way to experience Sydney Harbour. Catch a ferry any where on the harbour for a great way to see the sights of Sydney. Affordable travel options and sight seeing all in one.

Great way to see the harbour!. Reliable, quick, and the perfect way to see the iconic images of Sydney. A trip into Circular Quay lets you see the Opera House and the Bridge from a completely new viewpoint.

Manly Explorer. On a recent trip to Sydney we found we had some extra time on our hands, so we opted to take the ferry to Manly. The day was perfect the harbour waters were deep blue against the white sails of the Opera House on the way across the harbour.Just to relax and watch all the crafts sail and motor by with the sea breeze in you face was the perfect way to relax, when we arrived at Manly we strolled down to the beach and watched the surfers before returning to a cafe opposite the wharf. You can view the staff making the cakes muffins and danish on the premises before you make your selection (yum) their coffee is excellent as their service,a must to visit at Manly.

Pleasant way to traverse the beautiful harbour. We stayed in Sydney recently and caught ferries on several occasions. Its a great way to get around, relax and take in the beauty of the harbour. Staff were friendly and helpful and we thoroughly enjoyed our outings.

What a view. Great way to see the harbour and Sydney's attractions. If weather isn't so good, enjoy a trip up Parramatta River (although the ferry did break down the day we went). Got off at Sydney Rowers Club for a yummy lunch and coffee, a great way to relax and spend a couple of hours if you have time.
Fantastic and cheap!. Take the Manly Ferry - An incredible experience at public transport prices! The views are outstanding and the workers are friendly
Easy to understand and get around. Brought a opal card $10 it lasted two days used ferries to go to manly and darling harbour and a bus to bondi beach. Very good transport system

Pricey on the wrong days. If you need to get from one place to another in Sydney Harbour the ferry is the way to travel. It also gives you a terrific view of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and The Opera House. If you can travel on the ferry on Sunday. It is less than 1/3 the price of the rest of the week.

Great savers. A must use tranport travelling around Sydney. Buy a weekly ticket that enable you to save more on journey by trains, subway, bus and ferry. It is available at most mart kiosk. This ticket got us all The way to and for Blue Mountains too.
Excellent Ferries. One of the best experience is travelling in ferry to different places like manly,toranga zoo, parammatta. A day rider ticket helps to travel in all the ferries.

Fantastic Sights and Schedule. We purchased a 7-day multi pass on arrival in Sydney and have well and truly had our moneys worth. Travelled Darling Harbour to Circular Quay, Circular Quay to Taronga Zoo and Circular Quay to Manly. Ferries are on schedule, easy to access and clean and tidy.
Sydney ferries. Mostly on time, very easy to figure out where they were going and timetables. Nice to have indoor and sheltered areas.
Great way to see the Harbour. Do yourself a favour jump on it go to manly to the Hotdog Man and have yourself the best hotdog ever.
Service. The service was excellent,on time and very friendly staff,Free WiFi on board helped to arrange outings

Perfect Harbour experience. What a great way to see the Harbour up close (can't get any closer). Took the ferry to Manly. It's a delightful ride with unbeatable views of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, the Sydney skyline and all sites along the way. This is a definite must.

One of the highlights of our visit. We used the Manly ferry on several occasions both to visit family in Brookvale and simply to enjoy the unbeatable views. Sailing out in the late afternoon and returning after dark gives two very different views of the harbour area.
Great way to travel in Sydney. Really enjoyed using the Ferries, they run really frequently and you can get to almost anywhere you want to visit, except Bondi!
Good value. Brilliant way to see Sydney and so relaxing. Great way to get around to all the sights, can be very choppy in the harbour on windy days though not good if you get seasick!

Cheap thrills. Jumps on a ferry from Circular Quay take a ferry to Manly return and get a cheap look at Garden Island Kirribilli and Admiralty House, Tooronga Park Zoo the Botanic Gardens, Watsons Bay the flash houses of Vaucluse and Point Piper and of course the north and South Head that provide the opening to the Pacific Ocean.
rohan. We caught a small ferry to rose bay , it was fantastic , a great service , the restaurants there wer fantastic ,

Best kept secret Down Under. Ok- I admit I like a fair bargain when I can find it. While I live in Chicago, I am frequently entertaining tourists in Sydney - my favorite bargain?? Take the ferry from the Sydney Quay to Manly. Great views, great beach once you get to Manly and a few pies on the pier make this an EXCELLENT afternoon trip. The Manly aquarium is a retro-blast... especially off season during the week when the staff are bored and bring out the critters to play.....

Good way to sight see. We travelled on the ferry up to Parramatta on Parramatta's foundation day, and was fortunate to have a national trust group on board, they highlighted several places on our journey and was filled with lots of history. I have to say this is not the norm.We have done this journey several times and it's a good way to see the countryside from the water. Crew pleasant and efficient, weather was warm and a pleasant trip.
Best way to see the harbour. Did the trip to Manly and also one to Mosman. This is the best way to see the harbour by local ferry as you can take your own time. Plus cheaper than an organised tour

Very Good Experience.. A good way to get cool views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, The Opera House and the Sydney Skyline. The time just flies and your camera battery may die sooner than you can imagine. Good Deals on Sundays if you are travelling with a kid.

Leisurely ferry ride back to Circular Quay. We took the ferry from Manly back to Circular Quay. The weather was perfect and we sat outside up the front of the ferry. There were numerous yachts sailing Sydney harbour at this time, which made the ride even more interesting.

The best way to see the Harbour and the Bridge.. Excellent service to a number of locations which give you the chance to view the harbour bridge and the Opera House from the best angles.If you purchase a 1 day Sydney Trains visitor ticket you can use it on both "metro" - standard buses and standard (not fast) ferries.
Great service. The ferries are an excellent service. Such a great way of getting around Sydney harbour. No need for cars.
Great way to see and feel Sydney. Not crowded, comfortable and have WIFI. And, you can as many loops (not officially) as you want. Anyway, for $ 6.00, great value
Awesome Ride. Brillant way to get to the City, about 1 hr ride Fun if theres a swell at the Heads,cheap enough relaxing sitting outside too
The cheapest tour in Sydney. A great way to spend a day seeing the city without spending a fortune - not to mention more relaxed than trying to get across the harbour through the tunnel or bridge

A Sydney must do.. Sydney Ferries great for commuting but even better for sitting back and appreciating the magnificent harbour, its shoreline and all the action on the water. Especially good on weekends and other times when the yachts are racing. Jumping on and doing the various trip circuits both inner and outer harbour is a great way to spend an hour or more. Good value for money and fantastic value if you are a senior.
Ferries. Parramatta cancelled because tide went out. No prior warning. Neutral Bay cancelled no reason given.Left stranded to find own way home.

Manly Ferry. I was very lucky to have had spectacular weather for the 30min trip across to Manly. There were plenty of other boats on the water and the ride was nice and smooth. All ran on time and there was plenty of room. I would get on early if you want a seat outside up front as this space for seating is limited.
Harbour trip. Take the inner harbour ferry $12 return. Interesting trip. Great for taking pictures you go under Sydney bridge goes to Luna park the Maritine museum and Darling harbour
Iconic older ferry,great helpful staff.. A pleasent trip on the old ferry on a beautiful day in one of the most beautiful harbours in the world.

Never boring. Love the ferries! I've lived in Sydney all my life and my breath is still taken away when I get on a ferry. Maybe going to the beautiful inner west wharves of Balmain or Birchgrove, or doing the 'drop-ins' at Garden Island and Double Bay. We can all share the famous harbor that is Sydney - no need to own a waterfront home, but watch out if you do because we'll be checking you out on the way to Manly :))Dulcima

Great Water Rides. Sydney ferries provides , beautiful views of the Sydney bridge , opera house and other sky raisers around. The breeze as well as the scenery around is very nice . One can have a cruise for 2 - 3 hours in the ferries and enjoy the backwater , breeze and the scenery along with some drinks and food. It makes a memorable ride and one will enjoy the neat waters and clean & well operated ferries. Recommended
Experience. What a great way to see Sydney & it's area from a different perspective. The ferries are quite cheap & we went to Manley for a trip out, wonderful!
Great way to travel around Sydney. The ferries are clean, efficient, cheaper than taxis and you get great views. Worth going on just to get a different perspective on the city.

Smooth rides all the time!. I have used the Circular Quay to Manly ferry and the Circular Quay to Parramatta ferry many times. Both were excellent rides, smooth, never crowded, and they were always on time. Sitting outside in good weather gives you some amazing photo opportunities of Sydney city and the harbour bridge.

Great service - especially on Sundays. When visiting Sydney last weekend we hoped on the ferry to be surprised by the Sunday Family fun day pass. Just 2.50 and maximum do $10 per family to travel on the buses, ferries and trains all around Sydney. What a great way to get out and about and enjoy the city. Can I also say that the staff of the ferries dealt with crowded wharves and rude patrons extremely professionally. A first class service.

Public transport in Sydney is fantastic. It was so easy just to jump on trains, buses and ferries in Sydney. We stayed for 5 days and bought a weekly pass when we arrived and found it so easy and convenient, there was minimal waiting as the public transport was so frequent. The best way to get around Sydney, we caught a few ferry rides to Darling Harbour and Manly to see the harbour sites, didn't need to pay for an expensive harbour cruise, just jump on and off the ferries to different locations.

Great way to get around. Save yourself from spending $80/person on a tour boat, just hop on a Ferry and experience awesome views of the Harbour (minus the guided tour which can be nice if you are a history buff). The extra bonus, you end up somewhere cool like Manly, Taronga Zoo or so many more options.

All aboard!. The Sydney ferries are just fantastic - a beautifully relaxing way to get around Sydney. We bought a My Train 3 which enabled us to hop on and off buses, trains and ferries all week with no fuss - extremely good value.
great way to travel. Sydney ferries were a great way to see Sydney really didnt need to book any personal ferry tours as you get to see it all by ferry . So easy to use and well organized

Very efficient. The Sydney Ferries are a very efficient system to get around the harbor. They are centrally located between the Opera House and the Sydney Harbor Bridge. The cost is minimal and the time schedules are well posted.

Great way to see Sydney Harbour. Used the Ferry to visit Manly. Great service, Wonderful views, Easy to use. They run on time and tickets are easy to purchase. Perfect way to visit Manly from Circular Quay.
A must do. You have got to take a ferry from Circular Quay if you are in Sydney.You need to see the harbour bridge and the opera house from the water.

Jump on a Ferry. As a Sydneysider I love to give myself the occasional treat of taking a ferry. My favourite is to drive to Manly then to catch a ferry into the city to the cinema at Opera Quays or to go to the Museum of Modern Art (MCA - free entry, fee to special exhibitions). Sometimes, especially when the jacaranda trees are in bloom it is lovely to catch a Rivercat up the Parramatta River. A short walk away is the Parramatta Arts Centre which often has an interesting exhibition. There is a permanent exhibition featuring the history of Parramatta which was central in the establishment of the early colony of Sydney. A ferry to Kirribilli only takes approximately 10 minutes but once there you can go to Luna Park (free entry, fees for rides) or walk around Kirribilli which has some very pretty streets. The little village has several cafes and other places to buy food.

Fabulous Ferries. A fabulous & economical way to get around Sydney & the local area quickly. Check out the Opal pass which allows unlimited travel for only $15 a day & $2.50 on Sundays. Ferries run on time & frequently.

An enjoyable rough ride. We had been to the Opera House so Manly was our next tour destination. On a good day we would probably have taken a couple of ferry rides but the rain did restrict visibility so we settled on the Manly one as it crosses the harbourAn overcast windy, wet day but an enjoyable trip over even in the wet the harbour and views were good. There was a warning to come inside the ferry as the seas were very heavy at The Heads and there would be severe roll and yes there was lots of rolling but remained enjoyable. The rain was very heavy so we did not get off the ferry simply completed a round trip.It is worth the climb upstairs as the view is much better. Our trip was early afternoon 2.45pm but it was already getting busy I would definitely avoid the peak hour travel.An All Day Excursion ticket allows travel between 9am and 4pm. Well worth it as it gives you access to all buses, trains and ferries. We used it to travel around the city loop getting off where we wanted a good means of transport.

the best way to travel. the Sydney ferries are just great. they open up the harbour and make it easy to explore. It is such a pleasant way to travel and the harbour views are such one can never tire of them. I could spend days just sailing back and forth on the ferry. If you have kiuds watch out for the sunday special when you have very cheap travel provide every adult has a child with them!! A great way to take small relatives around central Sydney, as even the travel is exciting.
excellent to get around quickly. get anywhere on the harbor without hassle. get a multi trip ticket as it is much cheaper if ferrying to a couple of place a day.

Circular Quay to Manly via Sydney Ferries. This is by far the best option to get the most of Sydney Harbour for minimal cost.Jump on the ferry at Circular Quay and take the ferry to Manly Beach.Have an ice cream or fish and chips and then ferry back to the Quay.On your return journey make sure you get up the front of the ferry with a camera for a special view of the Opera House and the bridge.Unforgettable.

Great views and good way to get around. We used this on a one day pass to go to Manly beach. It's an excellent way to see the harbour bridge and the opera house. It's easy way to travel across the bay without taking an expensive dinner cruise.
Great way to see the City. Sydney Ferries are great, central location in the Harbour, travel to all the surrounding suburbs and islands, best way to see the city from the water.

Great way to get around. The ferries were a great way to get around from one side to the other. They are a bit pricey so make sure that you plan your trip well to make the most out of the fee you pay.

Memories of Venice. Catching the Ferries from the City over to Manly Beach brought back wonderful memories of us Ferrying around Venice. But the views were even better, the harbour is great with a great Ferry System so easy to use.
A good way to take photos. Save your money on a harbour cruise and just jump on a ferry to get round Sydney. Darling Harbour to Circular Quay gives you great views
Great experience all round. I live in Sydney, and love catching a ferry to places such as Manly, Balmain, Cockatoo Island, Watsons Bay and Luna Park.
Go anywhere. We used the ferries twice, too the zoo and to Manley. Always on time. Great way to get about. Catch them from the wharfs down town. Use the free 555 bus to get there.

Seeing Sydney from the Water. I got on a ferry and just looked at the city. Seeing Sydney from a ferry is as good as seeing European capital cities from an open top bus. The ferries run regularly and you can go to Manly, see Balmain and the fabulous waterfront properties of the Eastern suburbs.

Great way to get about. We used the ferries a number of times in our 3-week visit to Sydney - mainly between Drummoyne and Darling Harbour/Circular Quay plus a trip to Taronga. It's a working transit service (our daughter uses it to commute to work) rather than tourist pleasure craft but the service is quick and efficient, most of the boats are clean and modern and the crews always seemed friendly. Easier and more pleasant way to get about than the buses (although of course limited in terms of where they'll take you). A cheap alterntive to a bay cruise and you'll get to see most of the harbour sights.

Nice relaxing way to travel around. We took the 30 minute ferry ride to beautiful Manly. Great views of Sydney Harbour Bridge + Opera House. Many great photo opportunities along the way. Get on the ferry early and go up one level to the front outside area. Limited seats out there but is a great place to take photos from.
Easy and fun. The only other ferry I have every been on is when I go to Hong Kong.The Sydney ferries are clean, easy to find, punctual and cheap

The best way to look at Sydney. A must do activity for anyone visiting Sydney. Sydney ferries offer a host of fun activities all day round to take a ride around the opera house and the harbour bridge.

Easy to use travel. This is a great way to get about, not just to cruise around the harbour but to get to the out of the way islands and bays. There is a regular service to just about every where you want to go with a hop on and off service and better still they run on time, every time at very reasonable fares.

Best Value!!!. Buy a package of tickets and each trip will cost about $5...sail up the Parramatta river all the way to Olympic Park. Lots of great stops on the way...Hunters Hill, Sydney Rowing Club, Cabarrita. Best value in Sydney and stunning Harbour views...just don't forget your camera.
Outstanding. Me and my family like to travel by Sydney Ferries. We had already visited Manly cupel of times. We love movies in the Ferry. My kids love raining on the Sydney Ferries
Great Fun, Beautiful Views. We took the ferry to Manley Beach and to the Zoo. The views of the harbor from the boat are stunning. The ferries have plenty of seats and clean bathrooms!

Travelling the Harbour. I use the ferries to go to work each day and it is the very best way to see Sydney. The best thing is the friendly staff. Where else would you get public transport staff greeting you with a smile, a "good morning" and "have a good day".There have been times when the ferry, having left the wharf found itself with foreign tourists on board the wrong ferry. The ferry then re-docked, tied up and let the passengers off! Other times when at a wharf the ferry master has seen people running to catch it and have waited specifically.All in all the service is great.The only downside is that more people don't use the river and harbour as a means of transport so the frequency is not as great as everyone would like.But as a way to get to work, second to none!As a way to see Sydney Harbour, absolutely brilliant.
Love it. Going on our Sydney harbour ferries is really good, relaxing and fun. I get them from Drummoyne to darling harbour or the quay and quay to manly.

A must for every visitor to Sydney, a cruise around Sydney Harbour. A great way to relax. As an expat, I have always loved taking a ride on a ferry & a wondeful way to ride to work. There is always something to see

best & cheapest way to see Sydney. Sydney ferries offer a reliable, low cost & effective way to see alot of the Harbour city, from Manly to city & Parramatta.Other attractions the Zoo, Darling Harbour, Manly, fish & chips at Watsons Bay. The ferries are fast, reliable & clean with good all round viewing!!
Ferry ride.. Clean,frequent services to and from my destination.Great way to get around and see a lot more than other forms of transport.
Trip. Wonderful. Felt safe. Kids enjoyed and felt great being on water. Beautiful seeing the opera house lit up at night time
Ferry travelling. Its the best way to see the real aura of Sydney.Try the Parramatta ferry to Parramatta and have some lunch at the fine restaurants in North Parra.
Great transport mode. Clean, friendly, on time and good value.The best alternative for visiting tourists, and retirees.That is my review.

Family Funday on Sunday's. $2.50 each. Did you k ow you can travel on any ferry bus or train as far as blue mountains and any ferry route for only $2.50 for each family member. Applicable to Sunday's only and you can hop and off as many times as you like. Just ask for family fun day.
A must see if you're visiting Sydney. Beautiful sunny day to travel from Circular Quay to Manly. Interesting to see the eastern suburbs from the water after passing Opera House and Harbour Bridge.

Commute or sightsee, both are very comfortable. I have been riding the Sydney Harbour Ferries since I was 9 years old when we moved to Sirius Cove. I watched the Opera House being built as I passed by on my way to university, and now I use the ferries to travel from Rose Bay to the CBD and back. What a pleasant journey! That is only a ten minute ride, but if you would like to travel further, I would suggest a ride up the Parramatta River and back, especially now as all the jacaranda trees are in bloom. Don't get off, just go up and back when it is a sunny day.

Sydney Ferries provide most aesthetic, relaxed & cost effective option to optimise the beauty of Sydney harbourside ... Located in the heart of the city's Harbour arena, and a few meters from historic landmark The Customs House, Circular Quay provides a world class multiple ferry line service which encompasses the full scope of Sydney Harbour & beyond. It's a popular choice for city office workers requiring a quick daily commute, anyone wanting most accessible transport to Sydney's Opera House/Botanic Gardens/theatres/Art Galleries etc & a quick connect to buses & trains traveling to extended suburbs. The Manly ferry is especially popular with visitors/tourists keen to have an uninterrupted view of iconic sites - notably Admiralty House & Kirribilli House (official Sydney residences to the Governor-General & Prime Minister respectively), the Lighthouse & Mrs Macquarie's Chair before passing through the famous Sydney Heads which form the two km wide entrance into the Sydney Harbour. I especially recommend taking the Ferry from CQ to Luna Park, having lunch or dinner @ wonderfully quaint Ripples restaurant (BYO) a few steps from alighting & afterwards taking a memorable stroll under the Harbour Bridge - if you're feeling energetic it's a picturesque walk back into the city; alternatively the ferry timetable works well.

Scenic views on the Sydney ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. Recommend to take the Sydney ferry from Circular Quay to Manly especially on Sundays as it costs only $2.50 person!! In fact for $2.50 you can go anywhere in Sydney via public transport. Check out http://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/content/sydney-ferries

Great way to see the city. The ferrys are not that regular, but they do take in some beautiful sights along the way. Try catching one to Watsons bay on a weekend, have a few drinks there and then head back to the city - as you head into the circular quay area you see why it is such a magic place. Take the camera...
Sunshine & Sea-nery. On a warm spring day you can't beat the ferry trip to Manly. The Ferries are quaint but comfortable and they even have a small cafeteria were you can get a snack and a drink.

A must do when visiting Sydney. ThecSydney ferry is the only way to travel on the harbourTo Manly it is a superb way to leave the hustle of the city to the besutiful northern beaches starting at ManlyThey run on time and while it is lovely when the sea is calm don't be put off because a swell just enhances the experienceOhThe coffee on board isn't too bad either !

Jump on and see the city from a different perspective. Yes, they are a form of public transport. Yes, many Sydneysiders rely on them for their daily commute. But, the Sydney Ferries are also a good value way to experience Sydney Harbour

Stunning harbour views. In the late afternoon in summer cool off on the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay. On arrival at Manly walk to the beach and watch the sunset, mabe have a meal at one of the many eateries. When the sun has set return to Circular Quay and enjoy the lights of the harbour, city, and the Sydney icons.Not very expensive at all!

Sydney Ferries. The ferries in Sydney are iconic. They have been a part of Sydney for the longest time. So much more interesting than catching the bus.Good cheap way for tourists to travel from Circular Quay to Manly. It's a novel way to see the Sydney harbour waterfront also and check out the houses that have the expensive water views.

"Travel like the locals". This is probably the cheapest way for visitors to Sydney to see the harbour ,a trip to Manly or the zoo on the ferry is a must for any overseas visitor, lots of photo opportunities as you sail along past the famous opera house.
Ferry trips. Great to have a ride on one of the old ferries get there early and grab a seat on the outside for the best views, ferries seem to go verywhere

what a wondrful way to see the harbour. Don't bother with an exensive harbor cruise. Just buy a ticket to Manly take the 25 minute cruise over passing most of the major landmarks. Get off stroll to the beach for lunch/coffee/ fish and chips and then do the return. On our last trip we were joined by a pod of dolphins and you at the right time can spot a whale.

A Great way to spend a day. Take the ferry from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay. It goes to Balmain, and Luna Park before going to Circular Quay. From Circular Quay you can take a ferry to Manly, Parramatta, in fact anywhere that takes your fancy. Perhaps the zoo, or maybe Blues Point, where you are able to stroll up through the dozens of cafes and small bars.Watsons Bay is a great place to visit on a ferry, you can sit on the beach and eat delicious fish and chips, whilst enjoying a cold beer from the Watsons Bay Hotel. The magnificent city silhouetted in the foreground, yet a whole world away..Sydney Harbour must surely be the finest harbour in the world and it is so affordable to see.The views are spectacular, after a few hours on the water you do feel as though you have had a holiday. Saturdays and Sundays are the race days for the 18 footers. They fly through the water at breakneck speeds with the sailors hanging on for grim death, guiding these wonderful craft over the course. They are a magnificent sight with spinnakers in full flight. Have at least one day on beautiful Sydney Harbour.

Sydney by Water. Sydney is well known for it's Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Opera House, Taronga Zoo, Darling Harbour, Historical Parramatta, Vaucluse and many other places.But did you know that you can access all the above places by water? All ferries depart from Circular Quay.Now I don't recommend you do all this in one day, you'll be pretty exhausted if you do.For instance a trip up the Parramatta River and back will take you almost half a day on it's own.Taronga Zoo will take a day or more if you really want to get into it.A 'day trip' to Manly will take you how long? You guess! That is if you get off the boat and stroll around. Walk up the hill to North Head, Back down to Manly Beach, lunch on 'Fish n Chips' on the Corso', relax in the shade of the great Norfolk Pines; all this makes for a great outing.Then there is the trip to Watson's Bay, where you can get off and lunch at the famous 'Doyle's Fish Cafe', enjoy the Harbour beach, walk up the hill for spectacular views of the ocean at the 'Gap'.Make sure you get back in time to catch the ferry back to Circular Quay, or alternatively catch a long bus ride back to the City.Exploring Sydney by Ferry is inexpensive. It is public transport after all and people use it for all reasons, including commuting to work. Ask about special tour tickets, or pay individual fares, whichever suits you best.Welcome to Sydney waterways!

What! You Don't Own a Superyacht?. Well, most of us don't but with Sydney Ferries you don't need to! If you are a visitor to Sydney and you want to, say, visit Manly or Watson's Bay for lunch (and a swim!) then avoid the roads and take a ferry. You will enjoy the trip 100 times more and get a taste of why Sydney really is one of the most beautiful harbours in the world. You can bag the 'Big Five' and more...Circular Quay, the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Fort Denison, Taronga Zoo (the list goes on) in full 'surround sound'. And did I mention it's cheap? Sydney is the harbour so you best get on it and enjoy it. Timetables available at: http://www.transportnsw.info/en/maps-and-timetables/ferry-timetables.page

Manly ferry awesome. Hi, for those wishing to experience the wonders of Sydney harbour but at 5% of the price of a tour - this is for you. Join the locals who commute to and from Manly this ferry trip can't be beat. Suggest you avoid public holidays and summer weekends as it can get terribly busy!

Lots of ferries all day and often. Sometimes I pick a ferry at random and buy a return ticket. Then I do not necessarily get off a the destination simply enjoy the ride back to Circular Quay in central Sydney. The movement on the water is calming, the views change and are always interesting. And I find it interesting to consider that most people on these ferries live in Sydney and this is their normal way to commute. For me it is always a holiday option and gives me a change from the hustle and bustle of the streets.

Sydney Harbour Ferries. Sydney ferries are a great way to see the beautiful harbour. I have 2 favourites. The Mosman ferry is a 45 minute round trip from Circular Quay, taking in waterfront mansions and maxi yachts. You can eat some lunch and take in one of the best harbours in the world. The other favourite is the Manly ferry, taking in a "ground" level view of the Sydney heads looking east. Both ferries give a close up view of the Sydney Opera House too. They are a cheaper alternative to a tourist charter, the only downside being a lack of commentary.
The right way. Make sure you take the public ferries. Circular quay mosman is nice. The bus and the art gallery. At night the bridge is good as is opera house

Best view in the world. Sydney ferries criss-cross all parts of Sydney Harbour, giving you a spectacular view of this beautiful waterway. Seeing the harbour from the water is magic, especially if you choose a trip at dusk. Watching the twinkling lights come on is beautiful. A ferry ride is a relaxing way to traverse the waterways. You can choose to stay inside or ride outside with the breeze in your hair. It's also a great way to see the houses and buildings along the water's edge and you share the ride with tourists and locals, with business suits and strollers.

Take a ferry to Manly and see the best of Sydney. Nothing beats taking the iconic ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly beach. You get to see up close the Sydney Opera house but as well as see how locals live by looking at those living in the many suburbs next to the shoreline. The bonus is getting to Manly and walk over the other side to see the beauty of Manly beach. Eat like the local and eat fish and chips at the local fish and chip shop. We always bring all our overseas visitors to take this ride. And its the cheapest ride which can take the afternoon full of priceless views of Sydney.

THE way to enjoy Sydney Harbour. You just can't beat the enjoyment and contentment of ferrying around Sydney Harbour on a sunny day. There are so many options -- short jaunts around the inner harbour, a special watery vantage point of Darling Harbour, a lingering sojourn across the harbour to Manly or Watson's Bay.
