There is so much to see, from the variety of boats in the harbour, to the waterfront homes from Victorian to modern, and then there are many special walks along the foreshore between ferry stops. There is just something special about the Sydney Ferries. If you are a senior (AU), you can go all day for $2.50, and there are day passes available. So when you visit Sydney, please take the time to explore the ferry system.

Best team. Have to hand it to the sydney ferry team, they are so friendly and helpful, have left a couple of things on board once and everyone I spoke to couldn't have been more helpful. And they had rescued my belongings too! Thanks guys keep up the good work

Sydney Harbour Viewing by a local. There is no better way to enjoy Sydney Harbour than getting on one of the many ferries that grace the waters.Whether it is one of the 9 Small Sydney Ferries (each one named after a ship from the first fleet), the larger ferries that majestically cruise across the heads to Manly and back to Circular Quay or the River Cats that go upriver towards Partamatta, they all have something to offer both visitors to Sydney and the localsAllow plenty of time, don't worry about the time and just sit back and take it all in, on a beautiful sunny day, there is not much better !

A car would be a hassle!. You can purchase what they call a "transportation pass" down on the Circular Quay. Good for buses, trains, and ferries. It's a $60 bargain. There is unlimited use with this pass. Can be purchased at a kiosk with your credit car.

Slow and scenic. Often take the Circular Quay to Darling Harbour or the Manly Ferry. The Darling Harbour service takes about 25 mins, and you can really walk there in the same time. But you don't get the view of Sydney Harbour in the same way. The Manly Ferry can be VERY busy on the weekends, so time your trip carefully.
Better than a tour. We saw moore on the Ferries than the people we talked to that up to $100.00 for a harbor tour. The price is very cheap and you can see a lot and experience other parts of Sydney

The only way to travel !. The ferry system in Sydney is reliable, clean, efficient and great value. It's the only way to see the harbour and the ferry crew are all so helpful. It made my stay in Sydney much more enjoyable.

trip to manly. lovely cheap ferry from circular quay to manly ,great way to get about best to buy an opal card it lets you on the ferry trains buses etc just top it up and scan fantastic saves you time and money

Play on the boats. The ferries are excellent value for money and really get you around quickly. Luna Park and Toronga Zoo are only minutes away. You can do a round trip on the ferry and see all the harbour sites easily.

Loved it !. You can just get on the ferry and just go around the harbour it was wonderful to see the whole harbour and enjoy the sunset over the bridge ! It only cost $7 and it was the best part of my weekend away in the city got some gorgeous photos of the harbour and really loved it !

Catch as many rides as you can.... Without doubt , the best way to see Sydney Harbour. Take as many ferry trips as you can in as many directions as you can ; go around in circles if you have time. I prefer to sit outside to take full advantage of the views.

Good ferries. The return trip to & from Manly can be quite expensive in the long run. They probably offer passes for frequent customers. Otherwise, very comfortable and punctual ferry. They sell different ranges of refreshments on board, i didn't buy any so can't comment on prices.

Sydney Habor tour. This is really the best way to see the Opera House and the Sydney Bridge (a.k.a. The Coathanger). Food/snacks are frequently offered on the tour or you can take a fast spin on a Sydney Cat.
Commuting with a view. Lovely way to relax, unwind and sightsee and enjoy the trip before the destination. Punctual and run to time, great service. Hectic at rush-hour but can be avoided if you want.

Best Cruise in the Southern Hemisphere. Get a day pass and enjoy a series of relaxing rides around the world's largest natural harbor. The ferries are the best way to get around and make the visit to Sydney complete.
Sail the seven seas. Ok not quite, but everyone should at least experience a ferry trip particularly out to Manly and back what a great day

Good for tourists but maybe expensive for everyday commuting. The public transport in Australia is quite expensive in general (it makes me miss the UK, just a replication) and the ferries are obviously not an exception. Anyway, no doubt about its good quality, excellent timing and security management, yet to say that there are quite a number of good shops (coffee, ice-cream, and even shoes) around its stations. Love it in general!
Manly. Very relaxing and on time. Is worth taking the time travelling on the ferries there are so many places you can go to and much more relaxing than sitting through traffic
Relaxing travel. As a Senior,$2.50 for a daily ticket unlimited travel, excellent value.Darling Harbour to Circular Quay then to Manly,great day out.

Great experience. I took the Sydney Ferries when I was in Australia and it was really a great experience. You get to see the whole view of the Parramatta River which is amazing. When I get back, I will ride again.

Busy but reliable. From my experience, the ferries generally run on time.I like that the ferry to Manly has a cafe on it so you can catch it and have a coffee on the trip.The down-side is there is always a massive line for the Manly ferry, although I have always managed to get a seat. Try and get there early to avoid disapointment.
Spectacular views. Took the ferry at Darling Harbour to the opera house and Sydney bridge, very reasonable $12 return, great photo opportunities and a great view of the skyscape.
Fast & Effiecient. Buy a week pass (which also covers bus & subways). Great service!!! AND... Great Views!!! Nothing really to dislike
Getting there is half the fun. Fun, great views. We took it to the zoo and enjoyed the ride both ways as we got views of the opera house different than you can get on land

Special without being pricey. If you are in Sydney area this is a must do. Even if you aren't going anywhere in particular, it is a fun, easy and cheap thrill. We were staying in an area called Mosman across the bay and it was easy to get from there to any attractions in the city. Make sure you take a few ferries while you are in the city.
Great!. We had a fabulous return ferry ride to Taronga Zoo and what a great way to start and end the day. Thoroughly recommended way to travel about in Sydney.

Sydney Ferries. Good experience to enjoy the ferry rides. A good way to commute to another place by ferries. Loved to experience the ride with my family. Different types of ferries were there as per the place you want to travel. timings were good and very convenient.

Fantastic Sightseeing - Relaxing. Awesome way to relax on the water on a beautiful sunny day. Great way to make your sight seeing experience of the harbour and surrounding suburbs magical and uplifting. Just fabulous.
jo. Tokk a ferry to the beach , a fantastic ride and view , the tickets were cheap a great experience , they are big ferrys and very efficient .

Cheapest way to see Sydney!. The ferries are used by locals and are a great and cheap way to view the city skyline and go to Manly and the Northern part of the city. You can buy a day pass and the conductors are very friendly and try and assist with sights.

A great way to travel. The most enjoyable to travel in Sydney; whether it is to work, coming home or taking a day trip there is always something new to see. A must for all visitors to travel from the city to the beaches
Manly Ferry. Great value, lovely views and Manly is a must visit place. A work colleague suggested this and I'm glad we took his advise as it was lovely.

Great way to experience the harbor as a local. Take the Ferry to Manley and also Darling Harbour from Circular Quay. This is probably the cheapest way to get equally the same view as the expensive pleasure cruises. The view is outstanding, especially on the Manly Route. Manly is worth the visit too.
Get anywhere on the water. Plenty of choice, easy to get to Parramatta or Manly Beach and anywhere in between. Great value for money and run all day.

Is keen to satisfy. Being on Sydney harbour is always an experience. The ferries are the cheapest and most direct form of travel on water. There are other cruise boats but you can see everything from the ferries. They were doing a survey about how to improve and get value for money for the user.
Ferries are great. Very convenient. Travel early to miss the crowds, especially on the weekends. Watson's Bay is a beautiful spot to visit from Sydney Harbour.
Great way to travel. Ferry's were very frequent, a great way to travel to see the sights, lots of commuters, what a way to travel to & from work.

Great scenic ride. We took a ferry ride to Manly to see the sights. On Sundays, they have family day with tickets for $2.50 to ride all the trains, buses, and ferries per person for the whole day. The ferry gives you some of the best photo shots of the city and harbor.

We travelled across to both Manly and to Taronga Zoo on the ferry. Both crossings were picturesque with good opportuniti. We travelled across to both Manly & Taronga Zoo and it was very comfortable and picturesque.. We had many photo opportunities. It is a must do to get out on the harbour especially on a really hot day.

Get great view of Sydney harbour. A great way to see Sydney from the water. Take Taronga route for a short trip to the zoo and you get complimentary view of the great Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge.

Go for an Adventure. Taking a ferry is the best thing you can do. It allows you to go and experience a whole different dimension, and its all at your finger tips! Whether it's just for the day, or for the entire weekend, it is well worth every second of it! Enjoy the ride, it's part of the journey!

Great views. Best way to get around sydney get a weeks pass and take advantage of the views we used every day went to most of the beachs we never noticed overcrowding and the ferris were always spotless the journey from sydney to manly the best then on to Watsons bay
Y

It's worth being on the harbour. Take the ferries. The government ones will take you to places such as manly( which has a really good market on one of the weekend days). You can catch a ferry to taronga zoo. It's a cheap way to be cruising on the harbour. A must for the tourist.There is also private charters that do tours around harbour. I like those too. You get historical facts.

Best Transportation secret. The ferries are the way to go (especially if you are staying close to Circular Quay) - we were and took advantage of the ferries to go to the Zoo and Manly Beach - fairly priced, clean and a fun experience.

Choppy waters didn't stop us going!. The weather was a bit poor when we left Sydney and the bay was choppy but the big old ferry made it safety despite a bit of "ups and downs" at sea! We went to Manly and it is certainly wortht the trip. You can get a day ticket for all the Sydney ferries which is a good way of seeing the city. Try also the Whale Watching trip.
Great rides and many directions to go. The ferries were very well run and easy to access. Ride was smooth and gave many great picture opportunities.

Best way, on the harbour. I live in Sydney, and love our Ferries. It gets you around so many parts of the beautiful harbour, for little cost. Check out the official Sydney websites to see the best cost/tickets. Circular Quay is the starting point of the ferries. The most popular ferry is the Sydney to Manly Ferry. Great trip of about 25 minutes. Relaxed trip. Toilets on board. No smoking. Take water to drink and apply sunscreen in summer. Another lovely trip is along the Parramatta River. Ferries run to different timetables according to destination. Check website for more information. Enjoy yourself!http://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/content/sydney-ferries

Cheap tour! :-). These ferries are very regular and are a great way to see the Sydney Harbour and cross to many of the bays and to Manly. It was a very pleasant ride across the harbour to Manly on the day I went.

Ferry to the zoo. I took the Ferry to Taronga zoo enjoyable trip but I really do think a bit of commentary will be great.You can get a good deal which incluides the ferry and zoo ticket which I though was good.
Wait time non existant.. The longest we had to wait for a ferry was 6 minutes and we caught heaps of them. So easy and such nice views while you get to where you are going.

Great way to get around. We always go on at least one ferry trip when we visit Sydney. Ferries cover many areas and there are plenty of times to choose from. The trip to Manly from Circular Quay is always a favourite. Fares for public transport are cheaper on a Sunday with the family saver fares.
Efficient transportation. Took several ferry trips to Manly beach and Taronga zoo. Sit outside when you can. We were told whales were seen in the harbor that morning.
Cheap, fast, fine. Don't hesitate to use these ferries. Ticketing is easy, they run a lot, and they are much cheaper and faster than cabs to get to outlying areas.

harbour ferries. brilliant inexpensive way to get the best views of Sydney Harbour $12 return lasts approx. an hour sailing under the harbour birdge and onto darling harbour with some great photo opportunities of the Sydney Opera house well worth the trip.

very efficient and timely. Took the ferry to/from Manly beach, easy on/easy off, convenient. Easy to buy tickets and decent seating on board. Trip was 30 minutes and the only convenient way to get there.

Great way to see the harbour. The ferry system in Sydney provides a magnificent way to travel to various points along the harbour or just to enjoy the natural beauty. Costs seem to have increased significantly in recent eyes with a single ticket now costing $6 AUD. But again, one if those things you really have to do when in Sydney.

so nice to be on a ferry with the wind in your face. its almost like being on the titanic, but we didn't sink, standing at the front of the ferry with my husband , in his arms with our hands in the wind, was such a great romantic experience

Circular Quay to Parramatta - world-class experience at a tiny price. Last Sunday we used our Opal cards to play tourist in Sydney; all travel on public transport is capped at $2.50 on Sundays, so by the time we reached Circular Quay by train, all subsequent travel was "free".We boarded the River Cat at Circular Quay in perfect Spring weather and took an outdoor seat at the front of the ferry. What a journey...under the Sydney Harbour bridge, Darling Harbour, the waterfront suburbs, the myriad yachts, boats and commercial watercraft and finally the narrow, winding mangrove area of the river where the ferry must navigate between port and starboard markers. Although I live in Sydney, I'd never taken this 90+ minute trip before; it was fantastic.I would wholeheartedly recommend this trip to tourists and locals alike.And I'll tell you again, it is essentially FREE on a Sunday for users of the Opal card.

A trip to Manley. We took the ferry to Manley and back without getting off. It was a very inexpensive way to see Sydney Harbor and the Opera House from the water sides. The trip was very pleasant and I would highly recommend it.
Fave. The Sydney Harbour ferries were by far my favorite thing in Sydney. They are convenient and cheap and easy to understand, and they turned every trip into a sea adventure.

Relaxing transportation. The ferries and ferry terminal at Circular Quay is worth the visit whether you take a ferry or not. Everything is well marked as to where each ferry goes and the fare is fair and a good way to travel to the different areas of this beautiful harbour.
Quick and easy travel!. Took the ferry to Luna Park with the family. Clean and large inside compartments with lots of viewing opportunities. Smooth journey with safe ramps for easy disembarkment.

very efficient. Whilst on holiday in Sydney we used these quite a lot too see various things around the harbour and found them to be reasonably priced and always on time and a very quick form of transport.

Take a trip to Watson's Bay. We had a beautiful sunny day on a ferry to Watson's bay, a walk up to the heads to Sydney harbour and then a walk to the gap. We got lost and ended up on the way to the heads and kept walking. It was well worth the walk. We enjoyed stopping and admiring the beautiful beaches and boats along the way. A beautiful part of the world.

So easy to use. We used the ferry several times during our trip to Sydney. Easy to purchase tickets and frequent service all adding to the rating given to this service. We went to several destinations using the ferry, taronga zoo, manly beach and sea life sanctury, darling harbour, Luna park, Olympic village etc. These trips were all completed with ease. The use of the ferry also gives great opertunities to take endless photos of the lovely places around the harbour.
Efficient. We used the ferries for transportation and for sight seeing. It is always on time, clean and friendly staff.

The perfect way to get around Sydney. Having been to Sydney once before, we felt that the ferry boats are as much of an icon as any of the conventional tourist sights.What do they do - well ferry you to the outer reaches of Sydney, and do it well. Fairly cheap, and with a reliable service. All you need.

Cruising in a different way. Buy a two day pass and explore. Get off and on all over the place. Try every single stop on the way the Watsons Bay. Do all stops to Darling Harbour. Enjoy crossing the Heads especially on a windy day... better than a roller coaster. Ferries and catamarans on the harbour are the best thing to do during any Sydney visit. Dont miss the experience. On really hot days sometimes the wharf workers hand out free water bottles.

Water trip. We went on two Sydney ferries.The 1st out to Manly beach. It's a nice trip for the price of a coffee & cake.Good photo opportunities on the ferry ride.The 2nd trip we did was from the Olympic village to Darling harbour.I would recommend taking a ferry to one of these locations.

Best way to see the city. Apart from being the most convenient way of transport in Sydney you also get free wi-fi which was a plus. You can go almost anywhere - the only place I took a bus to was Bondi beach, otherwise when travelling on public transport I took a ferry. When going to/coming back from the Circular Quay the views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge are one of the best you can get
The way to see the sites. Efficient & really economical way to get around & see the sites. Go to Manly from Circular quay & take in the Opera house. What could be better on a sunny afternoon?
Ferry nuff. Efficient, punctual and with some pretty awesome views. Best value tour of the harbour sights, try to take during the day and night, it is well worth it.

This is the way to see the city landmarks. Various companies vie for your business by offering harbour cruises, but in my opinion the best way is to use the plentiful (and cheaper) public transport services. Get the ferry from Darling Harbour and sail under the Harbour Bridge to Circular Quay. Catch another ferry to Manly, pass the Opera House, various islands and inlets and suburbs. OK, you don't get the commentaries but you get the same views and the same iconic scenery. Definitely a fan and will do it again before I leave.

Fantastic service. Take as many ferry trips as you can on one of the many variations of transport passes, it's the best way to see the harbour and the communities on the harbourside, lots of multi million $ houses to see.
Plenty of choice. Lots of destinations. Manly, Darling Harbour etc. Just turn up and there will be a destination to suit. The Ferries are clean and efficiently run.
Hop on and go explore. Fun. Smooth sailing. Great cheap way to view the coastline. Can get nice and close to the opera house. The Sydney Harbor bridge. Get a over 60 seniors ticket for $2.50
Great way to see the city.. The ferries were on strike when I arrived but I can recommend the $23 day ticket which covers trains, buses and ferries.
Great way to travel. Very reliable way to trouble about the Harbour. The staff are very helpful and the prices excellent.
Great. Went from Circular Quay to Manley great service and very comfortable even free wi fi!!!! Stunning sights from the ferry too.
Great way to travel. Used the ferry system to travel to a few places. Much more special and relaxing than taking a bus or train.

Take Your Camera. The Sydney Ferries are an iconic and easy to navigate way to see sydney harbour, and the best way to get to the Zoo, Botany Bay, Luna Park and Manly from the city. Staff are courteous and you never feel unsafe. Brilliant place to get pictures of the bridge and the opera house from a different angle, and (when coming from Manly) you can get them both in the same picture. Also have the camera out for when you go through the heads, as the cliffs are pretty spectacular. there is plenty on indoor seating for when the weather is foul or the sea rough, although I recommend that thrill seekers stand on the bow (titanic style) in heavy seas, there's nothing like it!
Sydney ferry. If you use Sydney ferry you will enjoy the best view of Sydney harbour.I recommend to visit Manly because the trip with the ferry is amazing!

Sydney Ferries What A View. There can be no more pleasurable way of seeing Sydneys iconic harbour than on the water with Sydeny Ferries. Board at Circular Quay for the trip to Manly, Mosman and you will have one of the most memorable experiences. This includes when its raining and there a bit of a swell. Rest assured if the water is to choppy, they may cancel the service. There are tour boat operators who do the harbour run, if you are a tourist, in no hurry you, you can hop on the ferries over a couple of days for a fraction of the cost of going on tour operated boats,view Sydney skyline from a differnet perspective, do try to do a twighlight ferry ride as the sun sets, it is truly magical on the harbour. Sydney harbour is one of the great harbours of the world so enjoy the ride or two.Oh yes while in Sydeny take a walk across the harbour bridge to the north side, there are cafes and you can photograph Sydney from a different perspective.
What Fun. Easy to buy tickets...went to Manly decided to sit outside had an elderly guy named Allen sitting next to us give us a great history lesson...he was an ex school teacher
FUN TIME. Nothing more enjoyable than the trip from Circular Quay to Manly and back. Great sea breeze with enjoyable rocking as you pass the heads. Definitely a must.

Just delightful. Travelling on the Sydney ferries is great fun - especially if you are on a holiday. The views of the harbour are fantastic and it is also a great way to meet up with other travellers. For minimal cost, it is one of the best rides in town.
Brilliant!. Great for getting around the CBD and very frequent too! Just hop on & hop off when you get to your destination!
Perfect way to get around. The ferries are great in Sydney. In our time there they were always on time, always clean and the staff were always friendly.
Good. we took the ferry from darling harbour to taronga zoo wharf. Ferry service was good but they did goof up with our zoo child passes and we ended up paying more at the zoo.

A great deal in pricey Sydney. Thanks to government subsidies, the Sydney ferries are not just a means of transportation, but a top and affordable attraction as well. A half-hour trip to Manley affords fabulous views of the Opera House and busy harbor traffic for only $7.50 AUD -- less than a cup of coffee at some harbor cafés. Have a drink or lunch at your destination and hop back on for a wonderful outing.

Enjoy the Views.. The ferries are cheap and an excellent way to see Sydney Harbour - We took ferries up the Parramatta and across to manly.Photos - well which direction doesn't have a view - The ferries are cheaper than the cruises and you can stop off at any of the stops on route and then return to the next ferry to continue your adventure at your pace.

A great way to travel. Took the ferry from Sydney to Manly and loved it! Quick and easy as ferries seem to be going very frequently every day of the week and so cheap to use. Beautiful views of the Opera house, harbour and harbour bridge - some great photos taken onboard. Also a cafe onboard for coffee, icecreams and snacks. Lovely to sit outside in the sunshine and enjoy a ride across the harbour!
A great cheap way to see the harbour.. I love the ferries it's a great way to see Sydney harbour for a cheap price.the are reliable and mostly run on time.

Great at night. I stead of spending a ton of money on a boat tour we opted for dinner of fish and chips at Circular Quay and then ferry tickets from there to Darling Harbor for 8 AUS a piece to see the fireworks on saturday night. What a great way to see the city and the opera house and bridge along with Luna Park. The ferry stops right at Luna Park so you can snap some photos of the great park. Short enough to not make you sick but just enough to get all the photos you need. Loved it!

Great way to get around. On a recent trip to Sydney we caught the ferry to Manly Beach for a day out. Was a great experience got to see some of Sydney's Icons close up as we travelled close by. The Ferry was comfortable an clean was well organised getting passengers on an off.

Sailing the Sydney Harbour what more can i Say. They offer very good journeys around Sydney harbour to all points. It is quite a god fare and the trips are smooth. So many differing destinations you can have a whole day of riding.

Sunday family fares make a great day out. The new OPAL card caps the price of travel on a Sunday at $2.50 per person. This alone makes getting the OPAL card worthwhile. The day was perfect however the services from Circular Quay were leaving at capacity and we were bumped from our ferry. Saying that the service frequency was acceptable and therefore the wait was not too long. Also the staff attitude and service level has improved considerably in recent months. Overall, very recommended.

Great value free sightseeing. This system of transportation is an invaluable part of a Sydney visit. Get the new opal card at the ferry station which can be used on all transportation. Trains buses and wonderful ferries. Get to see all the harbor sighs while going from place to place. Sit on the outside benches to take great shots of the city
Good fun.. This was a perfect way to entertain my kids for a day. We hopped on and off a few ferry rides going to different stops. Good to see Sydney from the water.

What a way to float.. We had a great trip over to Manly for dinner on the fast ferry. It was nice to be able to drink a cold beer on a warm night.
Next time will go during the day.
Sydney does Ferries RIGHT. These are easy to use, CHEEP, quick and the view is amazing. don't give your money to the tourist boats!

The best value ride in Sydney!. Where else in the world do a city's highest paid workers travel to and from work on a spectacular harbour on vessels that have a fare that is 75% subsidised by the taxpayer? Sydney - thanks to the Sydney ferries. And the crews share in the good times. Because the Ferries to and from Manly cross the Heads, they are classified as ocean going and the masters are employed on ocean going terms - six months on and six months off.Take advantage go of this boundless generosity to see Sydney at the expense of the NSW taxpayers for less than the cost of a cup of coffee.And the ferries are iconic!I would rate them 6 stars if possible.
Tourist. Just a great way to travel, and with a 'day ticket' it is very reasonable, and it has unlimited travel on ferries, trains & busses. ($23 per adult)

A great way to see all of sydney. Ok so this is a great way to get around. If you get a hop on and off it's cheaper and you can use it all day. They are on time and the ride is enjoyable. If your short on time I recommend this
good service. a very friendly and nice service,smooth and safe.Very professional and personal approach by staff.the cost is average and service is on-time
Good to get around. If you get motion sickness easily I recommend sitting out the front or the sides of the ferry. Enjoyable ride :)
Great way to see the city!. Easy and convenient, these ferries are a great way to get around the city and explore everything Sydney has to offer.

Take atleast one ride whilst in Sydney!. The ferries aren't just for show, there a genuine efficient and reliable mode of transport in Sydney. You have to get out on the harbour at least once whilst in Sydney, recommend either heading over to Taronga Zoo or all the way out to Manly if you have more time. Great views all the time, don't sit inside, admire the views on the upperdecks.

Perfect services.. They offer very good journeys around Sydney harbour to all points. It is quite a god fare and the trips are smooth. So many differing destinations you can have a whole day of riding.

Ferries are awesome!. We travelled somewhere every day by ferry - it was relaxing and fun for the whole family.
We bought the multi pass and went to Manly every afternoon....so beautiful!

perfect on a bright sunny day. I love travelling on Sydney ferries, Sydney is arguably the best harbour in the world and catching a ferry is the easiest way to explore the harbour. By world standards, its reasonably cheap to do so and its the perfect thing to do when in Sydney on a lovely sunny day.

Cheap and handy.. Really handy transport if you're wanting to go anywhere over the water, a whole lot cheaper than the touristy Ferries.
We were on the darling harbour to circular quay ferry and you go under the harboir bridge and get some spectacular views of the opera house. Easy to use and understand which one goes where do we didn't get lost.

Sydney Ferries. They are a great way to travel. Not to expensive either. We really enjoyed that way to travel. We had no trouble getting where we wanted to go.
the sights you can see from the ferries are great. Just sit back and enjoy it all

A great way to get aournd. We took the ferry to Manly as a day trip.... great views and inexpensive.
Always on time and great value but watch out for the school kids... mid morning ferries have loads of school outings on board.

Love Sydney ferries. Was here for a family weekend. Sydney ferries are a great way to see the harbour. Our kids loved the ride on them. One important piece of advice - get there 5-10 mins early before your ferry is scheduled to arrive, as they mercilessly shut the gates early so that they ferry can leave on time. It's easy to miss the ferry because of this.

Up the Parramatta River to Olympic Park. Why catch the train when you can cruise parts of Sydney Harbour then up the Parramatta River to get to the Olympic Park precinct? This was a fantastic option for us as tourists in Sydney to catch a show at Olympic Park. Great views of the harbour and up along the river. Highly recommend this option if you have the time! A shuttle bus took us from the ferry stop off to AAMI stadium.
Easy to use!. Easy to use, easy way to view the city! take time to visit Manly, just outside the city centrum. Fair price and comfort.
Excellent way to get around. The lady at the kiosk hipped us up to an all day pass. Great money saver and you can travel to all of the stops in one day if you wish.

Manly Ferry. Took slow ferry to Manly great little beach suburb fairly quiet on the day. Trip back waters were stormy and choppy nothing like the North Sea..the whole trip was a reasonable cost, efficient and pleasurable - will do them again next time to some other area, on trip back be sure to be on the left side as you turn into Sydney Harbour the Opera House and Bridge were spectacular in the storm.

quaint ride. A bit of a rush to just catch the ferry after a greuling trip on the 555 free shuttle, which was packed each trip. A quick assist by a portable eftpos gave us just the time we needed to meet the dead line for the service we wanted to catch. A nice ride to and from Manly was enjoyed by us all. School holidays meant the ferry was pretty full too. A great asset to the city. Drops you close to town on return..so a great time.

Cheap,fast and iconic . Got the ferry over to manly on a Sunday arvo. It was busy , lots of people but we wearnt in a rush and didn't let things get to us. The ferries are maned by experienced professionals, it was a good ride and the price I think is fair, a much better way to get to manly than driving

Union Run Ferries. Very long queues met us on Sunday afternoon 28 September as we tried to take our granddaughters from Circular Quay to Manly on the Manly Ferry. When it became obvious that we would not get on board because of the numbers in front of us we decided to go to Watsons Bay instead. Again a large crowd was waiting on the wharf. The ferry that took us to Watsons Bay did not move into position or allow passengers to board until exactly the time it was due to depart.It had remained idle at the adjacent wharf for 25mins and had clear access to our wharf for the last 15mins of that time.Allowing for the time for passengers to board ( not all were able to because it reached capacity) the ferry departed 15 mins late. We and lots of others had waited over an hour at Circular Quay for a ferry we could board.Apart from the need for more ferry services, it is obvious that the ferry timetable is determined by the union-run Ferry Master and staff. There is never any sign of management staff controlling scheduling at Circular Quay.

Just like I remember. The old ferries are just like I remember from a kid, it was lovely to be able to take my children on one of the old style ferries. They were really nice and clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and polite... Thank You
Good service, but could be more frequent at weekends. Really enjoy using the ferries which are clean and convenient. Just wish the ferries ran more frequently at weekends
Good fun. A great transport system for this neck of the woods. Ferry to Manly and enjoy the views. Ferry around to the different locations rather than taxi or bus and experience the lovely harbour !

Best way to see the harbour and on the Cheap!. For any visitor to Sydney... a trip to Manly on the ferry is a must! Best way to see the amazing views. It isn't too expensive... aprox. $14 return. If you have clocked up 8 trips on your Opal Card then it would be free! Punctual, safe and clean service. Wifi available on most ships.

Commuter Heaven. What a great way to get to and from work on a lovely day. Of course some days the weather is pretty wild but that is not too often and it certainly beats sitting in traffic. There are many lovely places for visitors to enjoy too, like Taronga Zoo, Milsons Point, Manly Beach, Watsons Bay, just to name a few!
Cool way to travel. These ferries are fast, on time and reasonably priced. A great way to get around Sydney and fun for the kids.
A great way to get around.. This service is fantastic. A great way to enjoy the Harbour, be it commuting or travelling a tourist. I love them each time I come to Sydney.
Ride the ferries for a day. Purchase and all day travel card and ride the ferries. This is a cheap way to see the sites of this magnificent picturesque harbour at a very affordable price.

Whether to work or social they're great. The Sydney ferry system is simply sensational. Whether making the 30min trip in from Manly for work (always on time), or socially to get to Toronga Zoo or Luna Park, simple easy & friendly staff. Helped & recovered kids lost property...all with a smile & actual intent (rare in some service businesses today).

Great way to see Sydney Harbour and much more. If you want to see Sydney Harbour including the Opera House and harbour bridge then hop on the Circular Quay to Manly ferry. The views of both are great. There are so many destinations to choose from and it's a fab way to travel around Sydney. Life is much easier if you get an Opal Card (works just like an Oyster Card if you are a traveller around London), just touch on and touch off. You can top up at lots of places and travel on trains, ferries and buses. Sundays are particularly good value with a $2.50 Aus Dollar price cap for unlimited travel. Monday to Saturday there is a $15 Aus Dollar cap, great value.
You have to give it a go. We took a short 13minute hop from Circular Quay over to Taronga Zoo. The ferry was quick and efficient and the staff on the wharf were lovely.A must do when in Sydney town.

Go everywhere and anywhere. Get a pass and travel to your hearts content. These are a great way to see Sydney. Head to manly for the day, Balmain for brunch or the paramata one that heads up river.The terminal in sydney is a hive of activity to watch whilst having a break
Enjoyable. Great way to travel and sightsee together. The ferries run frequently and are easy to negotiate. And they are very affordable.

A unique experience. For a land lover like myself the initial experience of the ferry service was confusing but the wonderful people of sydney made it so easy to get around and navigate the system. I wish I had more time to explore the harbor using the ferry system.
Efficient and on time. The ferry was on time. Safe to board. They say theres wifi on the ferry but i couldn't pick up wifi. I was there for the view anyway so it didn't matter much.

Great value, great sights, great way to travel. Plan ahead and don't travel at rush hour!The travel boards are asy to work out where you want to go and the staff are friendly if you have a question. Ther boats are mainly for getting people from A to B but feel free to tak ea leisure cruise and a fraction of the cost fo actually taking a leisure cruise! Located near the bridge and the Sydney opera house its a nice way to get to work!Rush hour is busy so stay away if you can but dont let it put you off - its much less busy and stressful than the tube.

The perfect way to see Sydney. Anywhere you go on the Sydney ferries is a memorable experience at a fraction of the cost of a tourist trip. Experience the buzz at Circular Quay watch the Opera House and Harbour Bridge glide past and then enjoy the scenery and people watching
Great way to see Sydney's Skyline. Especially when it's good weather, the Ferry's are a great way to watch Sydney's skyline and take some good pictures.
talk the night ride. we took the night ride with captain cook cruise. awesome view to look at the harbor bridge and opera house.

The BEST way to experience Sydney.. Do your self a favour buy an all day ticket for $23 per person & use it all day! I find this a very relaxing way to take in this iconic city, the ferry terminals are self explanitory with digital read outs of how long you have to wait for the next boats to depart, ticket offices are are maned & they are more than happy to help with info. Added bonus is the all day ticket includes buses, trains & the light rail; excellent value for money in this world class city!
Best, cheap way to see Sydney Harbor. Get an all day pass, and take all the Ferries. It is a cheap way to see all the Harbor sights. Make sure you the the Quay to Luna Park Ferry.
Fantastic. Liked---Great service and cheap--We are seniors so it was $2.50 all day on and of all public transport.Dislike--None

A great way to see Sydney Harbour!. This is one of those must-do things in Sydney. I always enjoy taking the ferry over to Manly. You get a nice cruise around a beautiful harbour, then go and walk around the beaches of the Northern suburbs, grab some lunch, a few drinks, then head back into town.

PLEASANT AFTERNOON JAUNT. We took an afternoon tour of Sydney harbour, which included afternoon tea/coffee. The scenery is of course absolutely stunning, and the commentary answered any questions we might have had and informed us of lots of facts we'd not known. The staff were friendly and helpful, the boxed tea was adequate, and it was a good way of resting your weary feet whilst enjoying and learning more about this wonderful city

Best way to see the harbour. Jump on a ferry, any ferry and see what Sydney's really all about, being on the water. My favorite is the trip to Manly where one passes million dollar mansions, barren headlands, beaches and open sea, all in a 20 minute journey!

Such fun!. I have caught the ferry from manly into circular quay and return a few times now and it is such a quick and pleasant ferry trip! Cheap and affordable way to show family and friends around Sydney and also being able to appreciate beautiful views from the city harbour all the way out to manly harbour!
Aaa another Sydney Transport Fail. Old......slow...rocky boatsWhat can i say but ask why is this under attraction?Did i mention way over priced trip....

Circular to Manly Ferry. I took the ferry from Circular to Manly. Trip is about 35 minutes. You can check out the departure times at the nearby information center next to Circular Quay and the train station. It will allow you to take upclose pictures of the Opera house from the river as the ferry departs the quay.
Took ferry to Watson's Bay. We love the Sydney Ferry! It offers the best view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Make sure you plan to take one when you visit!!

A budget ferry with awesome views of Harbour Bridge and uptil Manly beach. A very budget ferry with scenice views of Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Its a good 1hour long ferry and hence you get ample time to enjoy the scenic views. The ferry does have coffee/drinks and snacks on board( paid ofcourse). It costed almost 16AUD for a return trip from Manly Beach. The ferry leaves from Circular Quay and the nearest train station is Central and from there it is 15mins walk.

Ferry travel a must.. A ferry travel is a must, even if you just go from Sydney Harbour to Darling Harbour. Sydney is seen from a different perspective. We did a Harbour cruise which too us to Toronga Zoo, and Watson's Bay. We got off at Watson's Bay, walked up to The Gap to admire the magnificent views, then we had a wonderful Fish & Chips lunch at Doyles. A perfect day.
Sydney Harbour by Ferry. Great views and no traffic - commute or sightsee all around the harbour, the longest journey under an hour and maybe $5-10 depending on distance.

The Way to See the Harbour!. Why pay for an expensive harbour cruise when you can hop on a municipal ferry for a few bucks and get a close up view of the Opera House and harbour Bridge included in your fare? They're magic. We were staying in Pyrmont and often needed to get to Circular Quay for transport links to other areas. We hopped on the ferry at Pyrmont Bay and hopped off at Circular Quay about 20 minutes later. It's a really convenient service, though we did suffer on our first morning as the little darlings were on strike!

Must do in Sydney. Better to do this in the morning when there is not many people. Not during the rush hour, make it before that.great view to see the opera house and harbor bridge as we'll,better to do this in the morning when there is not many people. Not during the rush hour, make it before that.great view to see the opera house and harbor bridge as we'lletter to do this in the morning when there is not many people. Not during the rush hour, make it before that.great view to see the opera house and harbor bridge as we'll

A worthy and joyful experience . I took the ferry to Manly. We have been snapping the Sydney bridge and opera house in various places. I think I got the best view of the bridge and and opera house from the ferry ( we were in the open air compartment). The ferries are punctual, comfortable and provide wifi facilities. I enjoyed the ride.

Hess Family visit to Australia. The ferries operated on time. They were comfortable and fast. Deciding which ferry to take was fast and easy. Some tickets were purchased at a staffed window and others were purchased from a kiosk.

Pass on harbor tours and take the Ferry. Why spend the time and money on a tourist cruise, when you can take any of these excellent ferries? The classic is the ferry to Manly at sunset (and immediate return).
Relax. The ferry was a total chill out with spectacular harbour views. The ferries ran on time and were clean and tidy.

Great way to see Sydney.. The ferries are a great treasure of Sydney. They should never be put out of service. You get to travel a large part of Sydney and it is a fabulous option if you want to see the bridge. In my opinion, this is the way see the Harbour Bridge.. Coming from Pyrmont wharf and then eventually being able to see it in all it's glory as you come around the point with the opera house in the background is quite special.

Well done by the staff. It was not the calmest day on the harbour and as vistors we were also concerned about the ticketing issue, having caught the ferry at Balmain with no ticket office. We were told that tickets as such did not exist anymore, cards had recently been brought in.The dech hand was friendly and helpfull pointing out there was a machine at Circular Quay where tickets are issued. The Captain joked with paddengers as the seas rose and broke over the boat, telling us hat there was plenty of seating available outside.

Quick trip. In Sydney on rainy day , not much time, wanted to see some of Harbour, this was the perfect way to see some of it. Didn't have to spend a lot of money or time . Easy to read schedules and routes at terminal.
Take a ride. Very good, went to Manly to watch Manly v Penrith...great game.Ferry ride was great and when you get off the busses are just outside the ferry terminal.

Nice view. It was a very great experience. You can feel the wind.. You can smell the good weather. You can see Sydney Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House so clear. Must try.Aud 6 for single trip from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour

Icons of Sydney. I think that my favourite part of Sydney is the Ferry ride to anywhere. The Manly Ferry in particular is fantastic, going past the heads and to the beautiful destination of Manly. Must be preserved forever.
Inexpensivce Harbour Tour. We took the ferry to the Taronga Zoo. It allowed us to see the harbour, bridge and Opera House and not pay for a "dinner cruise"

Great trips on the harbour. The harbour ferries are not to be missed the various trips that are available such as Manly are great and the option of the fast ferry is also exciting across the harbour. We did a few trips to different points and included a visit to the zoo great fund day out even if you are in your 70's

Excellent Way to Experience Sydney Harbour. Finally took the Sydney to Manly ferry, it was a lovely 30mins journey although a bit chilly to sit on the outer door deck. On our way back, we manage to capture a building picture of the harbour as the sun was setting.
Better than road.. Well worth the trip to Manly Wharf hotel on the harbour for a relaxing lunch in a pleasant atmosphere.

Ferry rides. I recommend Taking the Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly n Taronga Zoo.. It is cheap, comfortable and a very relaxing trip.. All ages will love it. Sit up front and enjoy the occasional,sea spray. Great views from aboard..
What better way to see Sydney. The Sydney ferries are the best way to see the harbour. The Manly Ferry is a MUST for any visitor. Cheaper and better than many of the harbour cruises
See the sights. The harbour bridge, Sydney Opera House, Manly beach and other sites to see while out on the water. Try to pick a calm day though.

Best way to get from Sydney CBD to Manly quickly. I always love the jet cat, with the sea breeze through ones hair and the scenic ride off to either the Zoo or Manly Beach. Views are better than you can get in a car, coach or train. Everyone should take the CBD ferries at least once .
Sydney Ferries. The way to get around to all the beautiful place around the Harbour. Everything about Ferries was good as they come regularly

The best way to go around. The public means of transportation of Sydney are the best way to go around the city and the suburbs. But the ferries are my favorite. They are very comfortable and punctual. And the views of Sydney from the water are amazing.
Great value amazing views. Had some time to kill on work trip. Jumped on the ferry to manly.... what fantastic views of Sydney for 16$.....
Great views and staff. The employees were courteous and helpful, and our ride was awesome. Highly recommend this mode of travel while in Sydney.

Outstanding way to see Sydney Harbour...... Sydney Ferries is the best way to see this unique harbour, the Parramatta River, Manly and an easy way to get to Darling Harbour. Ferry services also provide residents and visitors an enjoyable way to reach Balmain, Double Bay, Taronga Zoo and Cockatoo Island.It gets crowded, the swell can sometimes make it a bit rocky but there's just something about riding this public transport option - of course the Bridge, Opera House and city skyline just may have something to add to it!Whether watching them come or go or hopping on a short trip is one of the highlights of a visit to Sydney - It kind of makes you feel like a kid again!Enjoy the ride!

What away to get around the city. This was an excellent way to get around the different attractions of the city, they are extremely reliable and the views you can get from the ferry is exceptional I would recommend them to anyone visiting the city
Free harbour cruise with a destination. You haven't been to Sydney unless you've taken a ferry. The first one to do would be Manly though the list is long and my praise is high.

Great option!. How fabulous to be able to travel around this amazing city on a water ferry. Been out to Olympic Park a few times and from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour and Balmain many times and it's always efficient and reasonably priced.
Great coverage on the harbour.. Is great way to see all the landmarks in Sydney and get out to the surf beaches. Don't know anywhere else in the world where you can do all that.
Pacific Island Cruise 2014. We caught a ferry from Circular Quay over to Manly and back . Boat was clean and tidy . Weather was great so was able to see lots of things .

Nice touch. Was on a Parramatta river cat on Sunday 4th with friends and for a public service I couldn't help thinking this could have been a charter trip. The staff were just great and very helpful, but this one female staff member went out of her way to help and give advice to other passengers and when this small child had a melt down she was straight there to comfort them. When the ferry reached Parramatta she was the gang way wishing passengers a good day and thanking them for traveling with them. Well done that lady. She was a tall blond lady in her 30's.
A relatively inexpensive way to see Sydney. Hop onto the Manly ferry. For only a few dollars, you can really see this great city of Sydney. (Pick good weather though!)

Still a great way to travel, though the magic has gone.. 30 years ago the ferries were new and exciting when I lived in Sydney - the old gangplanks and happy, chatty workers made for many a pleasant trip.The routes are still there, though the red and yellow ferry to Birkenhead Point market has disappeared. The market still exists, but the distinctive ferry is no more.We went to Manly - Cheap, on time and all the expected things a ferry provides.Sad to see the cleaning and maintenance was sadly lacking - a lot of rust and dirt ruined the tourist view I thought. The gangplanks are gone - replaced with drop down walkways powered by hydraulics instead of brawny sailors. Somewhere the magic experience has gone, replaced with impersonal 'functionality'.Still a great way to travel, with views aplenty.

A must-do for every Sydney Tourist. I lived in Sydney for years, and every time I'm asked to recommend a "top pick" or "must-do" for every tourist, the first thing I say is "the Manly to Circular Quay Ferry". This harbour city is best seen from the water, so do yourself a favour and jump on a ferry.

A MUST if you are visiting Sydney. The efficiency, cost and splendor of this form of transport makes it a 'must do' when visiting Sydney. Whether you are going to Manly, the Zoo or just to Darling Harbour the journey will give you wonderful photo opportunities of the shores of North Sydney and the wonder of the Harbour. Prices are good value - much better than the overpriced 'packaged deals' - and frequency of departures/arrivals sufficiently good to ensure that if you miss one you will not have long to wait for the next. It is not just a transport system. It is an experience that one should not miss

Good Sight Seeing Choice. Cheap -- fun and great way to see the harbor. Buy a day pass including the bus, train and ferries....take Darling Harbor at night to see the sights and get some great pictures.
What a great service. I hadnt been on the ferriers for a number of years. They are well organised, reasonably priced and clean! Very nice ride over to Manly!
An experience in itself. Had the Multi Pass day ticket, so used it for 2 ferry rides, including the iconic Manly Ferry. Also did the Kirribilli loop which takes half an hour.

Great way to see the Harbour etc. This is our second Visit to Sydney and both times we have had a ticket that allows unlimited use of trains, buses and ferrys.
The ferry is a great way to see the harbour and visit locations such as Manly. Why pay for expensive tourist boat trips?
Cheap and functional. Very good way to get around. We took a ferry over to Manly and one to Luna park. The ferry is comfortable and functional.

Enjoy the view. The Sydney Ferry service is awesome. The boats are very stable and roomy. The schedule is always bang on for timing. The ferry service is a great way to see the sights as well. Take it to Manley beach for sure and while there, enjoy some fish and chips!

Fantastic Ferries. I liked that you could get to so many destinations on the Ferry. Manly is a favourite of mine. They are quick, efficient with so many companies to choose from. Ferry staff are polite and courteous.
The only dislike I may have is that they weren't running very late when I was there.

Up the river. Delightful view of Sydney from a different perspective. The ferries have free wifi internet (although it can be a little flaky). We travelled from Circular Quay to Homebush Bay and return, enjoying the view of the waterfront, and various examples of architecture up the river. Sydney public transport is gradually changing over to the electronic Opal card, which is a much cheaper option than individual paper tickets. (for a return trip using paper tickets, I paid a total of $14.80- $7.40 each way. My friend's Opal card was charged $7.00 for the whole return trip)
Wonderful way to get around. Easy way to see the area! Clean and reasonably priced.Highly recommended. There are some good restaurants and shops near the Sydney Harbor stop.
EXCELLENT facilities. Cross the water, enjoy the scenics, mingle with the tourists and locals, a fantastic experience and all very organized
Magic. Any experience on the busy waters of spectacular Sydney Harbour is magic.The beauty of Sydney unfolds from the Harbour. All visitors should experience a ferry trip.
Good service.. They are efficient and you can go anywhere at a very low price. The harbour is most lovely to just ride around no matter where you were to go.

Best way to enjoy Sydney harbour good or bad weather it is breath taking. The sights sounds and boats and yachts travelling around the harbour as we'll as the different angles of the opera house and harbour bridge and the many places you can travel including to parramatta on the rivercat

Great views. The ferry was so easy to use. I travelled alone to visit an old friend and from booking the ticket to arriving in Manly the trip was simple and easy to use. The ferries run every 30 minutes and the fares are very reasonable.
Mosman to get Quay . Great way to get around to coast close suburbs to and from the city. Get a great view of the city and surrounding suburbs for a decent price.

SYDNEY HARBOUR (Government) FERRIES. A very inexpensive way to see the Harbour North South East and West and the Landmarks on the Shore. Opportunity to Visit Manly, Watson Bay, Parramatta and of course Darling Harbour. Best thing besides going on a Harbor Cruise on Commercial Vessels.which could prove costly to a tight budget traveller.

Tourist must have experience!. Most economical way is by getting the multi pass, you can get in to any ferry, bus or train. excellent service, on time and spectacular views. We took one day pass n we did 4 round trips to different direction until we got seasickness :).

Best way to see Sydney. The ferries generally provide a very prompt and efficient service. Comfortable and generous seating and loads of space to sit outdoors and enjoy the sights. If you have a choice of bus, train or ferry, take the ferry - especially the Manly and Parramatta routes.
The only way to see the Harbour. The Taronga Zoo Ferry is a short comfortable ride and provides great views of the city and surrounds. Ticketing was a breeze.

Ferries to everywhere. Most ferries start at Circular Quay, great way to see a lot of the landmarks for tourists, always enjoy the ferry ride even when the water is choppy, A spectacular sight is Sydney Harbour !!!!!

An absolute joy. We have had a number of occasions recently of taking a ferry to such places as Manly, Fort Denison, Taronga Zoo, Balmain and each time have really enjoyed the opportunity to relax and take in the beautiful Sydney Harbour. With the new Opal Card it is really easy to simply turn up and board the ferry. Of course, I don't think there is a finer harbour than Sydney Harbour so that of course adds to my travelling pleasure.
Too old too slow. I've been travelling on sydney ferries for for 33 years and they go the same speed and are soooo sllooooowwww for the cost if $7 approx. WE NEED AN UPGRADE

Manly ferry was interesting. Good trip to do I have done this trip for over 55 years It's as interesting now as it was then on around the harbour.. Has improved the quality of ferries over the years . Unfortunately their is not the staff on board to tell you what's what on the harbour .. I'am sure if you ask people on board they will assist you on location
Manly & Darling Harbour. Ticketing staff very helpful - ferry trips efficient and comfortable and cheaper than taxis especially from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay.
Good. Good view of the city ,opera house and harbor bridge ,nice and clean always on time ,always a worth to travel in ferries specially ji nice summer days

Manly and back. I really enjoyed this. The boat is nothing special by any means but it gets you where you want to go. We found it expensive as all things in Australia and don't expect much in the way of service of friendlessness from the Australians working on board. The day we went their was approx 10 people on the whole boat. it was great. Their is also a few photo opportunities along the way.

If you are a tourist don't miss the boat!. By far the most economical way to enjoy anywhere on the harbour and up the river to Parramatta.The ferries are reliable (only really bad weather will stop them), clean and comfortable. If you are short of time in Sydney and want to experience the best of Sydney Harbour - take the Manly ferry (to Manly), get off and stroll to one of (if not) the best beaches in Sydney. When you are done return by ferry to Circular Quay. There are plenty of other ferries to catch to explore the harbour and zoo.

Great Transport to Manly. Wife and I love going from the Quay to Manly especially on a day of high swells. More fun than Luna Park. The ferries are safe, quick, and quite comfortable. If you enjoy a bumpy ride, ride up the bow outside.
v. Clean and always on time. As are the buses and trains. We rode the ferry as way to sight see and become familiar with the area. Buy a long term ticket for great savings on vacation travel.

sydney ferries. fast efficient and reliable, when visiting Sydney i recommend a mult pass. You can virtually motor anywhere and then catch a bus,or even a tram if you need too. With Sydney's amazing waterways you cant go wrong.

Enjoyable and cheap. A great way to get around and enjoy the harbour views, easy to get to anywhere around the harbour area, plus it is a lovely way to travel when it's hot. We used them a lot, including for travelling to Taronga Zoo. They are cheap, reliable and frequent. It's best to avoid peak hours on work days though as they do get crowded then.

Ferry ride. Brilliant old ship. Great service. Comfortable clean safe ferries run every half hour there and back from circular keys Price is very resonable. When you get to Manley there are plenty of places to set and drink and so many great walks.

Can't beat Family Fun Day. Got to tip your hat to a system that allows you and your kids to travel anywhere on it for only $2.50. This time around the ferries were clean and the toilets well maintained. How can you live or travel to Sydney without getting out on the harbour!
Fantastic service. We are over 60 & travelled ferries, trains & buses all day for $2.50!!! We travelled off peak when the transport was quieter.
Well Organised. We did a trip to Taronga and also to Rose Bay. Loved it. Different world out there. Nice change from the bus and train.
Can get anywhere. Easy to use. Not bad for price $5 for circular quay to Darling harbour. Tours and general ferries go from circular quay.
No problem going anywhere.. Was able to visit all the surrounds areas with no issues. Recommended the pass as the cost add up quickly paying per km.

Manley Ferry. We caught the ferry @ 5pm. as a senior a return ticket cost me $2.50. We had a look around Manley then had a meal and caught the ferry back to the city. We saw the lights of the city including the opera house & bridge as we made our way to circular quay. The trip took 30mins one way. Very enjoyable and inexpensive thing to do in Sydney,

A must do trip. We took the ferry to Manley Wharf for a great day out. The ferry is inexpensive and runs regularly to and from Manley. This was a really good way to see the bridge and the opera house and the islands of Sydney Harbour, Manley was beautiful with fantastic beaches, walks, restaurants and shops.
Manly ferry. Brilliant & low coast way to see the harbour & work out the geography of the area. Plus you get go to one of the many lovely seafront places to eat in Manly.
City to Manly. Every time we are in Sydney we always enjoy a trip over to Manly on the ferry, so special to see all the sights and feel the sea air once under way, even in winter time.
bai. The famous sydney ferries are a must , they lhave a great service and are iconoic on the city , we took ferry to manly , just awseome .

Excellant way to move around. We used our Sunday fun day travel passes and used all public transport, all day for $2.50 per person. This made for a relaxing and inexpensive day visiting the Darling Harbour attractions with our visitors. Good one Sydney transport, I hope this continues when everything moves to the new Opal cards.
sydney ferries. The sydney ferry trip from sydney to manly was fun and enjoyable. The breeze was strong and we took many photos

Efficient. The ferry system is fast, efficient and a great way to see Sydney and all of its Bays and harbours.
Very reasonable price wise. We took some of our best photographs of Sydney from the ferry.

Good services. Public transport is very good in Sydney also the ferries. You have good views from them and very convenient.they brougt us every were we wnated to go . never had to wait for long.good schedule.

Had fun with the kids. We caught a ferry to Manly and our kids really enjoyed it. It was a bit windy, but there's an inside area where you can sit if the weather isn't too good, there are windows, so you can still look at the view. We took a fast ferry on the way to Manly and a slow one on the way back. I think the slow one was nicer, because it gives you more time to enjoy the views and take photographs. The staff was also very friendly and lovely.

Perfect transport for nearby islands and bays. Ferries are the perfect and fastest transport for nearby islands and bays. Though some of the certain route ferrires will stop for the day as early as 4:00 PM ( in august) and we could nt able to make it to Watson Bay in the evening. The ticket is little costly though, but the ride and experience is one in the best
Great Value. No visit to Sydney would be complete without a ride on the ferry. Very roomy and has an old school feel. You can catch a train to Circular Quay and you are at the ferry terminal.

Daily commute in style. We catch the ferry to work every day , and I must say we feel very privileged to live in such a beautiful city. Although they sometimes run late, this is the perfect way to get from A to B.

Fantastic way to get around. A fantastic way to get around, we caught it at Darling Harbour and ended up at Taronga Zoo, we passed the Sydney Opera House, Circular Quay and the Sydney Harbour Bridge, so scenic all in one no fuss trip.

Beautiful scenery. We travelled from Darling harbour back to Circular Quay. Such picturesque scenery on board the ferry, especially when on the top deck. A great experience especially at dusk as the sun comes down over the bridge.

So lovely. The boat is calm, with both indoor and outdoor seating. Snacks are available. As with most Australia tours, you will take too many pictures and have trouble editing, but it's worth that task. Very nice

What a Way to see Sydney. I travelled to and from work for 5 years on the Sydney ferries and what a way to get to work
For a tourist there is no better way to see Manly the Eastern suburbs or the West than to take a ride on a normal Sydney ferry
The ferry to Cockatoo Island is a must!!!

Manly ferry expert. We caught the Manly Ferry 8 times all up. They were kind enough to hold it for us once so we could quickly get tickets to catch it. Glad it is still person operated not all machines. Can be a little rocky in choppy waters but all good, a great experience!

Sydney ferries. Ferries usually leave every
half hour to manly and is a very enjoyable half hour ride however many other destinations to choose from including Taronga Zoo which is a must see.
nice view. had a nice ride on the ferry around the harbour. Ferry was on time and comfortable enough. Take warm clothes!
Relaxing. Took a ferry to and from Manly Beach. It was nice, clean, and quiet... I would take any of the ferry's based upon this experience. Free Wi-Fi was a bonus!

day tripper. love the ferries, i think for the first 18 months of living in sydney i went on them most days, if you get the day tripper ticket you can get on and off them as many times a you like, best value thing in sydney. either a quick trip to darling harbour or a long ride to parramatta, you dont even have to get off, just stay on for the ride and watch the world go by, in the summer the ferries are packed, but very frequent and always on time, a trip over to manly is always worth a visit or to watsons bay, there are heaps of choices

Harbour views. The ferries are a super way to explore the harbour. There seemed to be discount prices on Sunday! We also returned from a trip to the blue mountains getting on the ferry along the Paramatta river and returning to the harbour, it was at sunset and the views of the bridge as we went under at sunset were amazing.

Safe. Clean. Timely and reliable service.. We took the ferry from Circular Quays to Manly beach and enjoyed the 30 min ride up to the Ocean on a slow ferry offering fantastic views. Well-run service that was on time, very safe with good signage, announcements, attentive crews and very clean ferries. We took our concierge's suggestion to do this trip rather than several pricey tours designed to fleece tourists - the one trip that stops at all 8 wharfs is a bit too much for one day. Trip to Darling Harbour from Circular Quays also highly recommended passing under the Harbour Bridge and past the main harbour berthing big cruise ships.
Trip to Rosebay. This is a cheap way of seeing Sydney Harbour and for me the easiest method of transportation to Rose Bay to catch a seaplane to Palm Beach for lunch. Beats a taxi!!!

Another visual perspective. Due to time constraints I only managed a quick return trip to Taronga Zoo and I'm always glad I did.The short trip was enjoyable and an excellent way to see the skyline of Sydney from the harbour especially on a beautiful late winter's afternoon. You'll get a different visual perspective of the Opera House, the bridge, Luna Park and houses clinging on to the water's edge. If you have time, I suggest exploring the neighbourhood then take the later ferry back to Circular Quay.I thoroughly recommend taking the ferries that ply to places including Manly, Mosman, Rosebay or even up the Parramata River.

Easily the cheapest way to see the World's most beautiful city.. There are plenty of up-market cruises around Sydney Harbour, but easily the least expensive way to see the World's most stunningly beautiful city from its centrepiece, Sydney Harbour, is to take public transport - Sydney ferries. Most leave from Circular Quay, undoubtedly so-called because it's rectangular:) 'The Quay', as locals call it, has a station on Sydney's underground rail system and most buses that travel north on George or Elizabeth Streets also terminate there. Large ferries and higher-speed hydrofoils travel from The Quay to the beach-side suburb of Manly. Forget the Hydrofoils if you're sight-seeing. You won't see much. Take the stately old ferries, grab a seat on the outside and sit back to enjoy the views. The trip takes about 30 mins each way, though do spend some time wandering from the ferry wharf in Manly through the shopping area to the surf beach. Just a word of warning - there can be a fair bit of wind chill on the outside of the ferries if the weather is coolish, so be prepared to rug up a bit.A word of warning though, if you get sea-sick. Check the weather, especially the surf conditions. If there is a large swell forecast - especially if it's coming from the SE - the ferries will pitch and roll quite a bit for about 5 minutes as they cross inside the Heads (the entrance to the harbour). There's little danger. The Manly ferries have stabilisers. In fact, they were built in Scotland and sailed to Australia, so they can handle the open ocean. The ferry to Manly is the only one that is affected by ocean swell.Smaller ferries service numerous wharves up and down the harbour. Perhaps the best trip is across to Taronga Park Zoo, well worth a visit in its own right. It has to be one of the most visually stunning locations for a zoo anywhere in the world. When you get off the ferry there, it's a good idea to get a connecting bus up to the Zoo's main entrance, so you can then walk through the Zoo DOWN to the ferry. The walk in the other direction is quite a climb.To really get some idea of the way Sydney clusters round the harbour, take a River Cat ride up the harbour all the way to Parramatta, Australia's second oldest city. River Cats are modern, quick catamarans with shallow draughts so they can get well up river. (Sydney Harbour is really a river flowing into a geological feature known as a 'drowned valley'.) Although you'll be in an enclosed craft, the large picture windows provide excellent viewing.The River Cats will take you where no other cruises go.The fares on Sydney ferries are a small fraction of what you'd pay for more 'touristy' cruises. So take your own food and drinks, and save lots all round. You can get multi-trip tickets, which reduce overall costs even more. Tickets can be purchased at any newsagency, or at Circular Quay.Sydney Harbour is simply stunning and the best way to get great, up close views of the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge, Pinchgut and all the many harbour-side site is from the water. Sydney Ferries are easily the least expensive way to see those views.

Bobbing about in the harbour. My daughter and I spent the weekend in Sydney, We bought multi-tickets so that we could hop on and off trains, buses and ferries whenever we needed to.We went on ferries on several occasions, including to Luna Park and to Darling Harbour. All of them were in time, there was always plenty of seating, they were clean, and the crew members dealing with the embarkation and disembarkation were always courteous.Coming from England, where I am mostly used to public transport in London, I have to say that I think Sydney has got it right. And of course having ferries in the mix makes it much more interesting. Even when (as it was on this occasion) raining a lot, you can travel all over under cover.We both enjoyed our ferry trips a lot, and will be using them again extensively next time.
Excellent time keeping. Brilliant service, excellent timekeeping. Value for money and a very nice way to get around the city

The only way to see Sydney. We used the ferries every day and found them punctual and faultless. The cost was reasonable, and we bought a weeks pass which covered the trip to the Zoo and Manly.As far as I'm concerned, there is no better way to see the city. Oh and the kids said the free on board Wi-Fi was great.
what a view and so cheap. Get a My Multi ticket including ferries and for a few quid a day you can have unlimited rides on 7 different routes in the best harbour in the world

Sydney ferries.. We bought a multiple ticket and went to Cockatoo Island,very interesting and then we got a ferry to Manly.Easy access and very frequent. Lovely day and plenty of room on the ferry.Price was very reasonable.

very organized and on time!. Nice to see a system that works so well and is not expensive!! We took the ferry to Manly, the zoo, a tour around the opera house and they are very comfortable and easy to get to!
Great Ride. Brillant way to travel around Sydney Harbour, had a ride to Manly and Back! Staff professional, not over friendly! The ferry could be a little cleaner
Efficient and value for money. Has to be seen to be believed how efficient and what a great scenic ride this ferry is. Would not mind commuting on this everyday if I lived here.

Great way to travel and see the harbour. Friendly service, always on time and a great way to travel and see fantastic views of the harbour!
The ferry can be more expensive and longer at times but at least once while you are in Sydney, choose the ferry. You won't regret it!
Great way to use the harbour. The ferries utilize the water system they were given. Sydney and outlying areas get by using the ferries rather then spoiling the countryside by roads.
Great.. Great ferry for a reasonable price. Incredible way to get around and see the city. Wi-Fi was inconsistent.
Friendly service under pressure. I used Sydney Ferries when attending the Vivid festival. The ferries were packed and we had a long wait, however staff were friendly and efficient.

Nice Place to take Pic of the Opera House and the Bridge. An excellent way to take in the sights and explore the Sydney harbour. There are many excellent points along the route to take pictures with the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge in the background.
Ferries. Really good value lords of them on time different routes never over crowded and nice helpful crews. Nothing to dislike unless the water is choppy!
VERY ENJOYABLE. Used to travel to Manly. Highly recommend Iconic part of history very economical and a must do..... Enriched in history

take pictures from the ferry .... we use the ferry to get to some "islands" or spots. very easy and you get beautiful and lovely pictures of harbor bridge, opera house without people's heads and faces in your pictures :-)
Convenient transportation. Enjoyed being able to use the same travel pass on buses, ferries, and trains. Made getting around town that much more of an adventure!
love being on the harbour. It is great to catch a ferry to somewhere even if it is only to be on the ferry and harbour. Easy transport to a number of destinations.

Great way to get around. We were staying in darling harbour and friends live in balmain so it was great to be able to see them and get around not having a car. Some great restaurants in balmain so makes it more reason to go over. Cheap and easy with great views.

Love Sydney Harbour and the Sydney Ferries. The regular ferry service to Manly is a must do in Sydney. The best way to see Sydney Harbour. If you get a day pass you can ferry hop all around Sydney harbour. Another good trip is the ferry to Watson's Bay and enjoy takeaway fish and chips in the park overlooking the Harbour and views to the City. I just recently took a ferry from Circular Quay via Darling Harbour along the Parramatta River to Parramatta which was an interesting trip but took most of the day (3 Hour round trip). The trip to from Circular Quay to Manly is about 30 minutes each way and you can purchase food and drink on board.
The Ferry. The cheapest way and of the best ways to see Sydney from the water. The trip from the city to Manly is a must do.

"must ride if you are in Sydney". The views of the world famous Sydney Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge are great on the Sydney green and yellow ferries. Catch one that is heading toward the Darling Harbour area, you will be in for a treat to go under the Sydney Harbour bridge a well as see both icons. The schedule of departures is very much on time; therefore, it is a good idea to double-check the timeframe before heading out. Again, if you purchase a Sydney Multipass 3, the Sydney ferries fare is covered with it. There are quite a few different ferry rides to take, depending where you are interested to go as well as how much time you have but one must definitely take a ride on the Sydney ferries- probably nice to go once during the day and another time either at sunset or evening for the different colors and lighting. Well worth the ride and bring your cameras!
Great way to see the harbour. What a fantastic way to see the harbour. Highly recommended. Bring your camera bc it is quite scenic. I tried most of the Ferries over the course of a few days.
Touring the water. Easy to access and a great way to take in the sights form one point to another, very comfortable, nice views, and easy going people, very comfortable, and most affordable

great way to travel. Took the manly ferry, and had a ball sightseeing around Manly. Then on the return, had a front see view of the harbour, and it was just breathtaking, seeing the whole harbour precinct in its full glory. Absolutely loved it

A must for tourists. I might be a bit biased but I think that the Sydney ferries are an iconic part of Sydney. Biased because when I was going to school and University I caught the ferry every day from Taronga...so I watched the Opera House being built and before me my dad watched the Sydney Harbour Bridge being built, he took many pictures which are now in the state museum.The most beautiful trip for a tourist is the service into Mosman Bay, I thoroughly recommend a trip on the ferry for first timers to Sydney...there is nothing better.
Real Sydney. Only way to see the real Sydney is on the ferries. They are cheap, efficient and reliable and a great way to get around Sydney and environs.
