Sydney Ferries Go Everywhere.... The Sydney Ferries are a great way to travel around when visiting the wonderful city of Sydney. They go everywhere! Whether you want to go for a day to Manly near the mouth of the harbour, or to the suburbs up river and the old Olympic stadium area. Yes they will take you there. Or if you just want a cruise on the harbour. No problem. And they are so frequent, that on the main routes you don't have to wait long before the next one is docking for you to jump on... Very enjoyable...

Middle Harbour Cruise. Great value for money - you get a guided tour around Middle Harbour for a lot less than taking a cruise with a tourist company. Food and drinks available to buy on board as well.

part of the experience !!!. No trip is complete without taking a ride on one of the ferries moving into and out of Sydney Harbor. Although we arrived and departed by cruise ship we still enjoyed our time on the harbor traveling back and forth to Manly Beach and to the Taronga Zoo. It is a unique and inexpensive means of transportation around the area and one that should be enjoyed both during the day and in the evening.

Very Quick and Easy!. Took to the Ferry to the zoo and it was so quick and easy! I usually get seasick and didn't have any problems, plus the view from the Ferry is the best part. Take your camera and sit outside if you can and you'll get some stunning images!

breathtaking experience. this is the easiest way to see the most beautiful attractions in Sydney. Highly desirable, you can see all the attractions from a very exclusive angle. Certainly not to be missed.

Can't leave Sydney without a trip on one of the many ferries. If you are a visitor to Sydney or a local it is a must do to take a ride of one of the many Sydney ferry rides.Whether it be a 30 minute trip to Manly or the 90 or so minute trip down the Parramatta River you won't be disappointed.The ferries are clean and run regularly and you can sit inside or outside depending on the weather.Note the trip to Parramatta is by the river cat and if the tide is low the cat can't get into Parra so buses meet the boat and shuttle passengers to the wharf.Last river cat ends early so make enquiries first.Very scenic trips on all ferry trips... Can't go wrong and very inexpensive too.

We went to Manly. We took a ferry to Manly beach from Sydney harbour and it was a great experience. We were lucky because it was a very sunny day, so we spent the whole day at manly. Great location, definitely a friendly family place. If you take a ferry to go there, make sure you take the slow one because you'd want to see the harbour, it's so beautiful!

Glad that Sydneysiders have such a cool way to commute!. My family and I caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly on a Sunday, and were pleasantly surprised that the all-day pass cost $2.50 each. We loved the commuter ferry and are very jealous of all those who get to do their morning commute in such a fashion. At Manly, everything was clean and sparkling, with the most amazing array of foods in the ferry terminal. The food closer to the beach wasn't nearly as amazing or well-priced, though. Anyway, the Sydney ferries are great. Tourists: be aware that there are other ferries that market themselves more obviously to Manly but that are far more expensive!

Sydney-Manly Ferry: the best way to see Sydney Harbor. This is THE way to see Sydney Harbor, nothing beats the scenary when the ferry sails right in between the bridge and the opera house. Wharf #3, Sydney to Manly. Free WiFi, good view, they also sell snacks on the ferry. My favorite. Been to Sydney several times, it is a MUST-DO everytime, just can not get enough of it!

Wonderful transport in Sydney. Took the ferries to two locations--Taronga Zoo and Manly--from Circular Quay. I was really impressed with the standard they have. Ferries departed on time and you have a choice of either sitting outside (to get better photo opportunity of major landmarks as well as to feel the cool breeze), or inside (warm and cozy with a cafe). I came during the winter season, which to me, it is still fine to have a seat outside. The crews were so friendly and responsible. They came and suggested politely for me to sit inside, in order to prevent myself from getting wet due to the weather conditions. Luckily we heeded his advise as minutes later, the waves were so strong that my previous seat was swept by the waves. Once, due to the choppy seas, the barista was unable to make us a cup of hot chocolate. Highly recommended form of transportation, to at least try once.
Brilliant. Regular boats all day long to many locations. Its the perfect way to get a feel for Sydney and see some great sights
Ferry to Manly. We too the ferries to Manly and also to Watson Bay. They are very frequent and on the ride to Manly to look back at the Bridge and the Opera House is quite spectacular.

Great value and sightseeing included. Manly to Circular Quay and back - lovely views, efficient ferry service, good value for money. Ideal way to travel in from the northern beaches, although you might need a strong stomach if the sea is particularly choppy.
frequent and convenient. These are the most well used and efficient ferries I've taken and I'm from the San Francisco bay area where we used ferries frequently.
Thumbs Up!. Sydney Ferries are some of the best in the worldwide! They come regularly and on time and are the best way to see the Sydney. Harbour. A trip from Circular Quay to Manly is a must.
Day Trip. Having visited Taronga Zoo, you cant get past this service. You will have a choice providers, but this is the best value.
hahahaha. i would not go on one of this again the service was poor and the people working on the ferries were rude. not bar to get a drink. and went to fast so i felt really sick.

Trip to Manly. Catch the ferry from Circular Quay across to Manly through the heads, spectacular, breath in the sea air and relax. When you get there have fish n chips on the walk way, feed the seagulls as well.

Great way to get from place to place!. We caught the ferry from Sydney Harbour to Manly. It was about a 30 minute ride and the views are just spectacular! It gives you a different perspective of the harbour and its surrounds. The ferry itself was relatively clean and staff friendly, just a bit over-crowded though.

Very enjoyable and - the way to travel. We were staying in Mosman near the Taronga Zoo and used the ferry many times to get to the heart of Sydney. Enjoyed ever trip. Be aware on the Sydney side they do not always post the trip information until after the ferry has left the dock. THis did happen to us and we missed the last ferry of the day to the place we needed to go in Mosman. So we had to take another ferry to Moasman, and you would not think Moaman was that big but it is! Then on the Mosman side we had to taked a bush and the drive was very helpful inthat we, silly us, did not know the exact name of the road we needed. But he got us to the center of Moasman and with his help we were able to get back to where we needed to be. The ferries are a good value and really quite easy to navigate, just ask some one if you are not sure. But you really do need to be aware and look at the posting often. And as I said earlier some times the ferry posting is not posted until after the ferry has left....And our situation still left us with good feelings and attitude about the 'counrty down under'!

My daily commute . Simply put one of the best ways to travel in Sydney and you will see so much. The ferry from Balmain to circular quay is fantastic, then head to Manly to see the whole harbour. Tip. Go on Sunday for cheap all day tickets

History in the making. These boats, be it the old ferries or the newer ones are maintained as best as they can be. Thousands of passengers ride these each day, so they get a hard life, are part of Sydney them self.

The best kind of public transport in Sydney. I live in Manly so I use the ferry regularly to travel to the CBD. This 30 minutes of travel a like a short break. You can enjoy the good sea air and no stress with permanent stops like by train or bus. And short before arriving the CBD you have the best view on the Sydney Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. A visit in Sydney without take a ride on the ferry is no proper visit.
Easy. We took the ferry to Manly beach. It was so easy to buy the tickets and catch the boat. Good schedule too.

Transport to the city. A great way to travel into the city. We board at Sydney Olympic Park and enjoy a great trip down Paramatta river to Darling Harbour.....no traffic,no hassle just a lovely cruise on the water right bang into the city. The only way to travel.

Sydney Harbour ferries. They are for everyone but particularly good for a tourist to see the beautiful harbour. The ferry staff are always friendly and helpful and ambassadors for Sydney. Free WiFi is good too.

Take the ferry to Manly. Our daughter lives in Manly, the ferry (slow ferry 30 minutes and fast ferry 20 minutes) goes directly past the Opera House with great views of the Harbour bridge. In Manly, a number of very good restaurants but make certain that you walk to the ocean side of Manly.
Funday Sunday. Great way to spend a Sunday morning with a young family checking out the sights around Sydney Harbour

Fantastic way to see Sydney Harbour and the Parramatta River. I found this a fantastic way to see the harbour and river. A little expensive but found using the Opal card easy. Ferry crews were extremely helpful, giving ideas on places for lunch or places to see. Highly recommend a trip on Sydney's famous ferries

A great way to experience the harbour. Even if you don't need to take a ferry to get to your destination a ride on a harbour ferry is a must do when visiting Sydney. The larger ferries go all the way to Manly but a short hop to Milsons Point is fun - or to Double Bay - for the best view of the multi million dollar home that can be best viewed from the water. On a sunny day head to Watsons Bay and sit in the park with Fish & Chips from Doyles. So many options with Sydney Ferries! I justt love them.

The best way to see Sydney Harbour. This is the best way to see the Harbour at low cost. The ferries are frequent and cover many destinations. Don't forget to take the Rivercat to Parramatta giving excellent views of the inner harbour and the river. There are lovely restaurants along the way too.
A great way to explore around Sydney. From the hub of Circular Quay you can take easy trips to Manley and all the many Harbour-side areas of Sydney
Cheap way to see Sydney waterways. Jump on at Circular Quay and go......Up all the way to Paramatta, or just across to Milsons Point.Its much more fun than a bus or the train.

The dreaming commuter. I am able to use the ferry many times during the week and I find it as an extremely convenient and beautiful way to go around Sydney whatever could be the reason.Clean fast efficientThey should more around Sydney.The crew always helpful and courteous What else do you need?An icon of Sydney every day life!
convenient transport. enjoy the sea breezes and take the ferry to manly, the zoo, etc. Ticketing was also conveniently available.

A Sydney MUST. Much has been written by other reviewers on the ferries. I can only add that my experience with my family including a young child was excellent. The ferries are excellent platforms for viewing Sydney, and hence Australian, icons, and standing on the outside deck gives a great sense of involvement. Thoroughly recommended!
Enjoying Ferry ride.. Sydney Ferry ride is also essential and enjoying part of Sydney visit. All landmarks are watched during ride like Sydney Harbour Bridge and Oprah house.
Great schedule and friendly employees. We took ferries to the zoo and to Manly. The service was great and on time and the employees were really friendly.

Fantastic Harbour. Whenever we go to Sydney we love getting out on the Harbour. So many options and not expensive. Highly recommend the Captain Cook afternoon Tea cruise with a great commentary and its hard to beat the trip to Manly on the great old Manly Ferries.

Best way to get around Sydney. We used the ferries more than any other transport. Easy to get around Sydney and you wasn't waiting long for the next ferry.
Would recommend using this way of transport

A great way to get around!. We used the ferries many times to get around Sydney. Some of the ferries went to Manly Beach, Taronga Zoo and Darling Harbor. All of them were nice,and roomy with free wifi. It was a great way to take pictures of Sydney from vantage points you could not get on land. The ferries were very reasonably priced.It was by far the best way to travel.

MyMulti2 is best value. I purchased a MyMuilti2 weekly ticket in conjunction with a Sydney Airport train gate pass (station access fee).This gave excellent value although unlike Melbourne, the MyMulti2 does not allow one to travel on the Manly ferry or the full distance of the Parramatta River ferry (but it does all other ferries.)We used the ferries to Old Cremorne and to Watsons Bay, as well as from Darling Harbour. The second and third were well patronised, the first (offpeak) only had about 30 passengers on it.The older vessels are terrific. The newer (20 year old) hydrofoils used to Watson's Bay are not so interesting, but all ran on time.
Best way to get around. A really good way to get around the harbour, quick and cheap way to get to Circular Quay or Manly, see the Bridge, Opera House, and sunset across the harbour.

Always on time!. I stayed at Darling Harbour and used the ferries regularly to get to Circular Quay and from there to Manly, Olympic Park and Taronga Zoo but basically Circular Quay has ferries to all areas of Sydney. This is a very easy way to travel around Sydney waterways and see fantastic scenery. We were always wowed by the sight of the Harbour Bridge and travelling underneath with the Opera House in front of us. The view of the skyline at night is equally if not more appealing! The fares were 6 aus dollars for zone 1 which is under 9 km travel and 7.40 aus dollars for zone 2 for more than 9km for each single trip per adult. I would recommend day tickets, weekly tickets and combined bus and ferry tickets if you are planning using a lot of public transport.Overall the ferries were very clean, comfortable, with friendly helpful staff and importantly always on time!

Quaints and cheap. I went to Manly on the ferry and ride on the ferry was the best part both there and back. You get this AMAZING view of the Harbor bridge and the Opera House and get to see all these super ritzy houses on the harbour.

Best bangs for bucks. There are many different trips to be taken on the Sydney Ferries, all interesting and all.very different. Buy a pass and do the lot, but take.A look around at each terminus. Don't be in a hurry though, sit back and relax and.take it all in.Go to Manly.first, then work your way through the rest. You won't be disappointed, particularly if the weather is good, which it generally is

Best tourist experience for under $10 in the world. Sitting on the Manly ferry travelling down the magnificent Sydney Harbour to Manly on a sunny winter's day.... where else in the world could you have such an experience. As a local I take our magnificent harbour for granted. We all should appreicate it as one of the outstanding urban waterways in the world and to experience this for the price of a ferry ticket - wonderful !!!!

A must do. An experience for all ages. Good service run on time, helpful staff. Ample seating inside and out, with plenty of room for strollers and bikes. Busy all year round. Great views of Sydney harbour and surrounds with great scenery. Relaxing way to travel. Reasonably priced even better get an Opal card max fare on a Sunday $2.50 plus you can use your card on buses and trains!

The best way to see Sydney. The ferries are an essential component of the public transportation system of Sydney. So, the right time to use the ferries as a tourist is after the morning rush hour has ended and before the afternoon rush hour begins. The harbor unfolds in front of you—and behind you, and on both sides. The best views of the Opera House and the Harbor Bridge are from a ferry.In my opinion, if you want to experience Sydney, taking ferry trips is a must.
smooth sailing. The staff were very helpful with our small grandchildren & strollers. Information was given freely & the ferries were clean.

A scenic journey. As many have already said, a trip on the Sydney Harbour Ferries is a must! I took the ferry across to Manly - great weather, though a bit too windy to be outside for long (but hey it is winter!)It only takes half an hour to get to Manly this way and the scenery is quite beautiful. Once in Manly there is a great shopping strip and eateries everywhere. The trip itself was very smooth and comfortable.
Fast and effective. Great views of Sydney harbor. The tickets were affordable and well worth it! The services were fast and effective.

The Ultimate Public Transport. If you're visiting Sydney a ferry trip to explore and really experience the Sydney Harbour is a must. The routes offered are extensive and my favourite journey because of its sheer beauty is from Circular Quay to Manly. On a great weather day it's fantastic to experience the journey outdoors because you can't beat being on the water with the wind in the hair and the sun on the skin. The ferries are super efficient and reliable.
Awesome!. You gotta take the ferry from Downtown to the local beaches. Best way to get around! Oh yah, wear sunscreen.

Fast, efficient, and great views. All ferries go to or from Circular Quay. Even a short ferry ride from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour offers good views. The best one for scenic experiences is the one to Manly. However, if you have a transport pass, the only one that will cover that ferry is the three zone pass. Most tourists won't need a pass that will cover that kind of distance. If you're in Sydney for more than a couple of days, but the pass for the distance you need and then buy the Manly ferry ticket separately. No matter how you do it, but sure to take your camera. There are great views any time of day, although morning views might have better light.

The best way to see Sydney. The ultimate way to experience Sydney. These ferries are the essence of Sydney. More than just public transport, you can experience post card views on every journey. A must try before you die!

Must travel by ferry when in sydney Memorable. l have always made sure that l catch a ferry from circular quay to Manley when l travel to Sydney, the sights, the deck and the sun beaming on you as you travel is the most memorable, highly recommend.
Sunday family ticket. Take a child on a Sunday and the family ticket is only 7.50$ bargain and a cool way to travel around this wonderful city.
Best way to see Sydney Harbour. Jump on the Ferries to head to many of the main attractions on and near Sydney Harbour, including Taronga Zoo. Staff are lovely.
Great. Although can be more expensive than a train, the Sydney ferries are a great fun way to go for a cruise to many Sydney tourist attractions.

Have an afternoon out in Manly. An absolute must do. We took the ferry to Manly which took about half an hour. The ferries run regularly and are good value for money. Nice and romantic way to get off your feet and see the sights.

Does what it says on the tin. What can you say about a ferry service? It gets you from A to B quickly & efficiently - which was just what we wanted. Excellent [this year - but last year when I was in Sydney they were on strike so they cannot have full marks]
Great way to get around. Run on schedule. Very cost-effective. Transportation and sight-seeing in one. Free wi-fi on board the ferries.

Favourite form of transport in Sydney. I would highly recommend the Parramatta River ferry service, and the Manly ferry service - both my favourites. I'd also recommend a day trip to Cockatoo Island by ferry - especially during warmer months.

Fantastic public transport!. Sydney's public transport system is brilliant and the ferry's are a real highlight. Being 60 and over we were able to purchase a $2.50 pensioner excursion ticket to travel on all public transport all day, including ferrys. We travelled to Manly, Watson's Bay and even took the long river ferry up as far as Parramatta. The ferry service is great, they were always on time, clean, comfortable and for us a very cheap way of seeing the wonderful Sydney Harbour. We had intended to do a cruise but really didn't need to after enjoying so many ferry rides.

Easy Travel. We caught the ferry at about 6:15pm. We sat at the back of the boat and got to see great views of the harbour bridge, opera house and the city at night. Really showed off how beautiful the city is. Got the ferry to Manly, which had great bars and restaurants to eat and drink at.

Such fun and lovely views. Went on all the ferries Manley was beautiful shopped in mall and went sat on beachHad a beer in restaurant waiting for ferry Was a cow heard going home though ferry was full but funWent to Watson bayLived the peacefulness if the town walked up hill to Ocean and had fishn chip lunch in bayWent to parramatta didn't get off Got off on cockatoo islandSo many places to goLuna park looks lovely from ferry and the bridge and opera house too just loved it all
no stress travel. this is a great way to get around its so relaxing as you don't hae to watch the cars or pedestrians just sit back and let some one else to the negating.
Great service. Good regular clean transport around Sydney. A bit difficult to figure out where you are going and what ticket you need when you first get there.

Great way to travel. It was my first trip to Sydney, so we bought a seven day MyMulti ticket which covered trains, buses and ferries. The trains were convenient, the buses scary (the drivers went so fast) but the ferries were fantastic.We tried to go on one every day, as they were so easy and frequent. There was so much to see once out in the harbour. We went to Manly one day, which took a while, and it was a bit rough going across the heads. But we were fine, even though we don't have sea legs.The ferries are nothing flash and don't have a lot of facilities, but are a qreat way of getting around and seeing more of Sydney.

Family weekend adventure in Darling Harbour. It was great to hop on at Circular Quay and do the 'round trip' before we got off.Make sure you know what ferry pass you need before you purchase and ask all the questions.

Rivercat Ferry to Parramatta. My friend and I had a return trip to Parramatta on Rivercat ferry. It was very pleasant to sit and enjoy the sceneries around the Harbour and along Parramatta River. It would have been much nicer, if the windows were clean.

5* service. We bought the My Multi3 ticket and we were not let down.Theses ferries run to military precision and are never late. We travelled the whole of the ferry network during the day an in the evening.The customer service was brilliant, along with comfort and some free WIFI
Efficient. Comfortable.. You can go up river or down and to Manly. Sydney ferries are the best way to see the harbour. You can go right up to Parramatta by ferry or out to Watsons bay.

Superb value. Just take a ferry anywhere - views superb - cheap service and can recommend water taxi - only cost us $30 for three from Darling Harbour to Luna Park and took ten minutes - cheaper than ordinary taxi.
Ferries. Great value, frequent and local. Great way to see the Bay and enjoy the views. Take your own drinks and food spend your money on a great Hotel room ShangriLa La

Lots of options!. I used the ferry a lot during my stay. That's the wonderful thing about Sydney; where we tend to take a taxis in Melbourne Sydney takes a ferry! Its so easy to just dart across to Manly for lunch or Watson Bay for dinner. It's an easy and inexpensive way to travel, and there's lots of destinations around Sydney that you can visit simply by buying a ticket and jumping on board.
Captain cook tours. Go for the coffee cruise, early and it won't be too crowded. Lovely atmosphere, great tour guide and nice cake with coffee.

The best way to really see Sydney Harbour for little expense. There are 2 ferry routes that are really worthwhile for visitors to Sydney, They are the Manly Ferry and the Watsons Bay Ferry. If you have limited time in Sydney try to make time for both, they reveal much of the beauty of Sydney Harbour.

For me a must on every Sydney visit. It's been decades since I lived in Sydney. I never return there without a trip to manly, at least. Even when I go for one day business meetings I always take time to do this trip.

Beautiful Ferry ride to manly!. The ferry is about 30 minutes, but you can't beat the views. I would definitely recommend taking the scenic trip and observe unbeatable views of the opera house and sydney bridge while aboard!

Nice views. Everything seems to run very smoothly and efficiently. Lots of ferry times, easy to buy tickets, clean and comfortable inside. Nice way to get around with the bonus of different city views.

Excellent Transport option. My mother and I recently visited Sydney and we used Sydneys Ferries nearly everyday. We found them easy to use and on time. As a bonus for us travellers most of the ferries have free wifi on board :)

Enjoy the Beauty of Sydney Harbour. There is so much to see and enjoy by taking a ferry ride from "Circular Quay" on Sydney Harbour. Go to Manly on the 'North Shore', walk the Corso along Manly beach, have a 'surf', or lunch. There's nothing like a ferry to Manly when the waves are 3 metres high! You can also go to Sydney's famous "Taronga Zoo" in 20 minutes. If you would like to see the Sydney Harbour Bridge 'close-up', take a ferry to 'Luna Park (Just for Fun), or to Darling Harbour (shopping, restaurants and bars), or to Parramatta (one of the oldest cities in Australia) and go past the site of the 2000 Olympics (Homebush). There are many more views, and attractions on Sydney Harbour ferry rides!

The work horses of the city. I live in a land locked city 300 kms from the closest body of water so I may gush too much about this experience but I could seriously just spend a couple of days travelling to and fro the City on these. Safe, clean and cheap - work out your itinerary and get the Travel card - remember to ask if you are eligible for concessions - Age, Student, etc.
The way to travel. This is the way to travel. Love just sitting and relaxing enjoying the views of the most stunning harbour in the world. So cheap too with the weekly pass.

Best Way to See Sydney Fast. Easy way to see Sydney Harbor - you'll want to sit on the upper deck - but under the overhead shade (you'll broil in the open area. You'll see everything from Luna Park to the entrance to Sydney Harbor and it's terrific. Great value. Great tour guides - only problem we encountered was local tour groups talking over them (which should NOT be allowed). We take this trip EVERY time we visit Sydney.....
Sunday funday. Amazing offer we went blue maintain and mainly very cheap plus many people visited and used ferry is fabulous.

I love Sydney Harbour and Sydney's public transport. We stayed at Kirribilli and used the ferries each day. I purchased a 7 day multi pass for ferry, train and bus. The cost was $135 for family two adults and two children. You buy one $27 ticket for a child and all children in the family travel on the one ticket. The tickets aren't valid for Manly or the airport. It was a great way to travel. Quick, friendly and clean. We travelled to CBD, Darling Harbour, Watson's Bay, Manly, Taronga Zoo, Luna Park by ferry, Bondi by bus and train to Olympic Park and various stops around the city. We got good value for money and there is no better view of the CBD with the bridge, Opera House and Luna Park than the ferry to Kirribilli at night.

Cheap tour boat. This is a great way to get around and to see the harbor. Loved taking it to Manly Beach. You can buy a week long pass that covers the trains and ferries (and buses too I think). Great value.
WIFI!. It has such a good view when you take the ferries to the manly beach, you can see the whole view of bridge and the Opera house. Many people take pics on the boat. And it has wifi on the ferry!

Different way to travel. Much quicker than using the roads but slightly more expensive than the bus. But you see different things from the water so well worth the effort. Darling Harbour to Circular Quay in 15 minutes for $6.50 each with Captain Cook Cruises, includes a commentary of the sights you are passing!!

What a great public transportation mode.. Everyday we would ride the ferry from our daughter's home to downtown Sydney. Fun way to see some of the city, relax, and use their free wifi. Takes you right into Circular Quey or downtown. Reasonable price and pretty good schedule between runs. You could see most of the harbor this way.
A great way to see the city. Ferry rides allow you to see the city from a different angle. The ferry to Manly and back was lovely and the ride from Watson's Bay to Circular Quay was also nice.
best harour cruise in the world. Sydney harbour has so many attractions and small intimate bays and coves. It has so much to offer and what better way to see it but by ferry
Tourist friendly. Easy to use and the staff working there were so helpful and friendly .Definately catering for tourists.

Best view of the Opera House. Taking the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly beach was the best choice I made that day. It was slightly more expensive than the bus, but the view of the harbour and the Opera House were magnificent. It was very crowded on board, but we managed to find a seat outside, which was fortunate. I highly recommend the ferry.
Beautiful experience!. The trip across to Manly was sensational and the ferries are such a fabulous way of seeing Sydney Harbour.

Cool way to see the harbour. Staying in manly, took the ferry in to circular quay every time I went to the city. Its easier than driving and finding a parking spot, and its just a cool way to see the waterway. There is lots of impressive houses on the cliffs and lots of boats. A great view of the harbour bridge and the sydney opera house from the ferries. Its also cool to see other boats and ships passing through nearby.Loads of room on the ferries, so it is just a nice relaxing trip home after a day in the city for us.

Very nice on a nice day. On a nice sunny day catch Manly ferry from Circular Key, have a relaxing trip, have a walk around Manly and take a ferry back. For few dollars you would have a wonderful experience on Sydney Harbour. (Compare to expensive "harbour cruises" with cheap sparkling wine and a stop to peep at a nude beach… who needs it, who wants it.) Manly ferry is highly recommended.

Wonderful Experience with Views to Match. We used the ferry system many times during our stay in this fantastic city.The views of Sydney and surrounding area are amazing, must be one of the best ferry systems in the world. We travelled several times to Manly Bay and enjoyed every minute. The cost of the ferries is remarkably cheap for what you get, such a great way to travelWe very lucky with the weather during our weeks stay which helped massively.

Cannot fault them. I have used Sydney Ferries at different times of the day and night and have always found the staff pleasant and helpful. The ferries are always clean and you always feel safe. With the new Opal card, getting on and off is a breeze
Excellent. Ferries are great to get to other places; Manly, Watsons Bay etc and very reasonably priced. We used this mode of transport on a regular basis

Love getting the ferry. Here on family holiday all of us were using the ferry each day to get in and about the harbour. It's fast, prompt and a lot of fun. The views at sunset under the bridge are amazing too. Definitely the best way to get around and we loved it.

Great way to see the Harbour. Get a ferry from the city to Manly and enjoy the beautiful scenery and relaxed pace while you sip on a coffee.Make sure you walk through the Corso to Manly Beach, but also explore some of the little alleys off the Corso along the way - you'll find some less touristy shops and restaurants.

Sunday is cheap!. Our family of 4 took advantage of the family freeday on Sunday. It's a discounted unlimited ride for family. We went o Manly on the ferry, and later took the ferry from Luna Park back to Circular Quay. The ferries are clean efficient and on-time. We really enjoy the Sydney Harbor on the public ferries.

Take a trip up the Parramatta River from Circular Quay for an alternative view of Sydney. Everyone raves about the Manly ferry and yes, I agree, its a lovely trip. But if you want a real surprise take a trip up the Parramatta River. Its a real eye opener for anyone that hasn't done the trip. Once you get past Rhodes, the ferry slows, the river narrows and the mangroves take precedence. You wont believe that you are in the heart of Sydney. At the end of your trip is the Parramatta wharf and weir. Great place for a coffee or lunch. Alternatively walk back down along the river to the updated Albion Hotel which has a lovely courtyard or catch the free shuttle bus over to Parramatta Park and have lunch at the Parramatta RSL Club. Wonderful way to spend a lazy Sunday with your friends and family. Leave the car at home, avoid the traffic and enjoy!

Loved the ferries. We stayed at Milsons Point so we used the ferries to get to Circular Quay and also to The Rocks. The ferries are regular and comfortable, a great way to see the city from a different perspective. The Circular Quay one goes so close to the aquarium and the Maritime Museum. A bit expensive to use all the time.
sydney harbour by ferry. they cheapest way to see Sydney Harbour and the foreshores - the ferry boats are clean the crew are professional and the places to visit are vast and different
Manly ferry a must. We loved catching the ferry to Manly - a pod of dolphins swam by and great views. A great way to see more of Sydney Harbour
simply wow. I took ferries to Manly and Watson Bay, it is a wholesome experience, can't say if it is more beautiful at daylight or night, really it is a must

Must Do in Sydney, get a MyMulti Day Pass.. You can get a MyMulti Day Pass and ride the ferries, rains, buses all day. The ferries are my favourite thing to do in Sydney. I could ride on them all day. Everyone usually gets the ferry to Manly, Taronga Zoo, Luna Park or Darling Harbour. All good. You could try other places for an adventure if you have heaps of time. At this time of year, make sure you have a really warm coat because it gets cold in the afternoon on the ferries.

On Time. The Sydney ferry service visits several locations and we took this to Manly and also Darling Harbour.The ferry is very comfortable and also has free wifi on it. It is always on time arrival and departure.

Best value in Sydney !. If you are a pensioner, you can travel public transport in Sydney all day for $2.50. This includes, trains, buses ferries. The Manly ferry is one of the best and cheapest trips in the world. Past the Harbour bridge, the Sydney Opera House, Fort Dennison, The Heads, to Manly and return !I do this trip any time I am in Sydney and I never tire of it.
Great transportation. Easy to use, avoid commuter traffic, and enjoy the beautiful water views. It's a great way to get around the city!

A ferry ride with great views. I took the ferry ride on Sunday the Family Funday Sunday fare is applied, only AUD2.5/person/day which was a bargained price. I took a return trip fom Sydney Harbour to Darling Harbour which stopped in several terminals. The view of the Opera house and the bridge as well as the river from the ferry was great. The ferry itself was old but it was clean. The seats were not so comfortable. Nevertheless, I think you have to experience this while you're in Sydney.
City Lights by Ferry. We rugged up and sat up the top of the Rose Bay and Darling Harbour Ferries after dark. The view of the Harbour was amazing.
it was a ferry. Great trip across to Manly clean ferry plenty of room to be outside or in. Cafe also available on board, although we did not use it.

GREAT WAY TO SEE THE HARBOUR. Great way to see the harbour. Took three ferries, one to Manly, one to Taronga Park Zoo and one to Darling Harbour. Each ferry ride gives you a different aspect of this beautiful and each destination has a different thing to do. Ferries were clean and staff friendly and informative.

Would definitely do it again. On our recent visit we took the ferry out to Bondi Beach and enjoyed the ride. Great view of the harbor and good way to get around in Sydney. The ferries run pretty regular and we had no problems.
good trip to Manly. Very friendly staff on the fast ferry, even recommended place to eat (three beans café) at Manly, which we enjoyed
Relax and admire the scene. What a terrific way to admire the Eastern and Western suburbs of Sydney from the many ferry routes in the inner harbour and all the way to Manly. Not to be missed
A must for every traveller to Sydney. If you are heading to Sydney you must take a ride on a ferry. You get a great view of the bridge and opera house

Experience Sydney from the water. Sydney has an extraordinary transportation system -- taxi, bus, rail, light rail -- but our all-time favorite is the Sydney Ferry system. It is convenience, cost-effective, and a great way to get harbour views.
Great views. We thought the ferry trip was really enjoyable , seeing the sites of the harbour and best of all the sites of the opera house which is amazing .

Captain Crook Cruises. Outstanding! I took the Hop on Hop off cruise around Sydney and Darling Harbour. I took some great photos and learned a lot about the history of Sydney. It's well worth it mates! :)

A very enjoyable experience. We caught the ferry from Kissing Point into Circular Quay. The scenery was very enjoyable, however one of the crew was just amasing - her passion for her job was outstanding - so welcoming, friendly, entertaining and an absolute asset to NSW Ferries - I just wish I had got her name to acknowledge her properly!

Insider tip -- best Opera House views. Before visiting Sydney, some Aussie friends gave us a tip -- the best and cheapest way to see the harbour and the Opera House was not on a tourist boat but by a standard commuter ferry. So we bought return tickets on the Manly ferry. Our friends were right -- for a fraction of the price of the tourist boat, we were on an uncrowded boat that afforded us some amazing views of the bridge and Opera House. On Manly Island, we had a lovely wander and lunch before heading back on the ferry to take a few more shots and enjoy the trip back to Circular Quay.
Very Interesting. It really is well worth going on a ferry ride as it goes quite a way down and of course back. There are some beautiful sights along the way. It can be a bit breezy but worth it.

Tea time cruise. On my trip to Sydney, I went on a tea time cruise around Sydney Harbour on Captain Cook cruise line! The cruise was very entertaining! We learned a lot about the history of the city and the commentator was very pleasant and a bit funny in delivering the message! A very nice inexpensive way to spend an afternoon in Sydney! Oh the coffee and pastries served was very delicious!
Great! 😍. First, it's cheap.Second, it has wifi!Third, it's perfect! You can see the clear view of Sydney seashore with this ferry!

Best way to see the harbour foreshore - from a Ferry. Regular ferry and connecting bus services make it very easy to see most of the harbourside.I caught a ferry from Circular Quay to Neutral Bay, then I walked up the hill to Military Road and then caught a bus down to Mossman Wharf where I had a look around, then caught the bus back up to Military Road again where this time I changed to a bus to Balmoral Beach. At balmoral I walked up the old tramway rock cutting where the trams wound there way up and down from George"s Heights to Balmoral. It was then getting dark, so I caught a bus from Balmoral to Athol Wharf (Taronga Zoo). The bus connected nicely with a ferry back to Circular Quay. It was then a train to Central and my Hotel. During the morning I travelled round the Western suburbs by train and the extenstion of the Light Rail. Being a Senior Card holder, all this travel was done for the amazing cost of a day ticket at $2.50. A great way to see Sydney.

Great way to get around. We loved travelling on the ferries. They were always clean and reliable and staff welcoming and friendly. We had purchased a Mymulti travel card and the ferries were included on this card which made them very accessible for us to use.

Wonderful way to see Sydney.. Great service from Sydney ferries.Regular departures,several destinations,well organised and a treat to travel on.Everyone should explore the harbour this way,truly delightful.

Efficient Public transport. We spent hours travelling all around on these great ferries, and because we are pensioners we were able to use our daily travel ticket that we had purchased for the train, a bargain and a great way to see so many wonderful places all around Sydney.
Holiday fun. Went on the ferry up the Parramatta river to parramatta . The trip was great as you got to see other parts of the Harbour you dont normally see
Must do. I loved everything about the convenience of the ferry.We took the ferry to the zoo and found it very easy and quick. They were not crowded and offer a great ride and view of the harbor

the harbour ferries are a must. so cheap to ride on the ferries on the harbour.it was a public holiday so it was only $2.50 for a daily ticket..pensioner excursion ticket ..buses..trains ferries all day.spent 4hrs on the harbour going on 3 different ferries.fabulous views of luna park the bridge opera house ..and all the cliff hugging ap apartment blocks on the edges of that harbour.
Great way to see Sydney. The ferries are frequent, relatively cheap, and since the whole city revolves around the harbour, this is a fantastic way to get an overview of Sydney.

Sydney Ferries. What a excellant way to see the harbour from a ferry, alot of different ferries to different parts of the harbour, just remember the ferry takes the locals home, any trip is great and worth the trip, price of ticket is worth it to see this great harbour and worth the trip.
Marvellous. What a brilliant way to get around and see the city from the water. Trips to Manly and Watsons Bay a highlight as well as the circular tour

Fun trip to Manly. For what is basically a commuter ride the return trip to Manly from Circular Quay is not exactly cheap, but on a good day (we had one) it's a good trip. We travelled late afternoon in winter - smooth sailing all the way and lovely views of the Bridge, Opera House and city lights on the trip back. An iconic tourist trip and a bit of fun.

Excellent. Not only are the Sydney Ferries commuter transport but very good for sightseeing. They are well organised, clean and run on time. We did several trips around the Harbour and it was a lot cheaper than taking a tour. You can get a day ticket which is well worth it.

Great way to see the area. We bought a 7 day Sydney metro pass that gave unlimited rides on the ferries and busses and trains. It was so easy to put the pass into the gates and then just step on the ferry. We used it to go to Manly for dinner or to go for a quick ride to Watson's Bay. The whole bay is beautiful. Some people said they saw whales in the bay and the locals say there are 2 kinds of sharks in the bay. I love looking at the houses that are along the water.

whats a visit to sydney without a trip on a ferry!. all visitors to sydney must take a trip on a ferry, get one of those day trip cards which allows you to come and go as many times as you please in certain areas. great way to entertain kids, particularly like the Circular Quay to Manly trip and CQ to Cockatoo Island. Both well worth it. Sydney Ferries are awesome!

The most relaxing form of travel in Sydney. There are so many destinations around Sydney that can be reached by the Sydney ferry fleet. Most journeys originate from Circular Quay and you can travel to and from multiple destinations all around what I consider one of the most beautiful harbours in the world. There are many round (return) trips that take only about 30 minutes to complete. Try Mosman and Neutral Bay if your time is limited. Watson's Bay is another good choice for lovely scenery and it is a very interesting destination to spend time above the cliffs that face the sea. It is a lot cheaper than taking a Tour type trip on Private ferries also operating from Circular Quay. You may also like to try Darling Harbour, Taronga Park Zoo or Manly which are also interesting Sydney ferry destinations. Nearly all routes have regular services, and you may also consider alighting at one of the smaller stops along the way and walking parts of the harbour, and picking up a ferry again at an entirely different point. Cremorne/Mosman ferry is very good for this option but there are many choices too.

Wonderful way to see the Harbour. Make sure you get an all day pass or 7 day pass if you are staying that long - pass covers ferries, trains and buses. Get from an operator and if you have a Seniors Card use it. Use the ferry to get to places but also a great time filler if you have a couple of spare hours - hop on and stay on for the return journey.Get on quickly to get the best seats outside.

Inexpensive way to see the sights. Nothing better than hopping on a ferry to see the sights and there are several to choose from. They're comfortable and clean and you can either sit inside to enjoy the views or go outside. I know they're probably packed during business peak times but travel on them at the weekends and you really get to see so much.
full ticket in the first day. you should get a full ticket at the beginning of your trip, then you will really enjoy your travel to Sydney, while you are saving your money.
Stunning sights. We travelled on the ferries during Vivid festival, and the sight were absolutely fabulous, so well managed, could not fault the service.

Circular Quay to Manly. So cheap for half an hour on the ferry to see the beautiful harbour, highly recommend. Great photos of the opera house and the bridge, great way to see it.
Wifi on the ferry (free) very good

Best way to see Sydney harbour. Whilst the ferries area great way to get around, for sight seeing they are the very best way to see the harbour at a bargain price. No annoying commentary, no overpriced food; just bring your picnic and enjoy the magnificent scenery - Manly, Mosman Bay, Balmain or Watsons Bay or Hunter Hill are great destinations for a ferry ride
Wondering how to best enjoy Sydney Harbour. Catch a ferry to Manly and back and enjoy the best views the most beautiful harbour in the world has to offer.
Does the job!. We used Sydney Ferries to get us from Circular Quay to Manly beach. Although they were hardly hi-tech or full of things to do, the journey to Manly was beautifu and not too expensive.

Better than an organize tour.. I decided I wanted to do some kind of cruise in Sydney (mainly to take nice pictures of the opera house and the harbour bridge), and for me the best option was to take the normal ferries. There are different routes and options, and the prices are ok.

Great way to see Sydney, Darling Harbour and Manly. Using the ferries is a great alternative to the trains, taxis or walking. Would definitely recommend taking the ferry to Manly, both to and from Manly you get great views of the Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge, Sydney North. Also if you go towards Parramatta you see Darling Harbour and other parts of Sydney. It is not too expensive either, will definitely be using them again.

Great. The ferries were a great way to see the harbour and get around. The week mymulti pass was a really good deal and also took care of our airport transfers (by train and ferry, you pay a bit extra for airport gate passes). Watch out for the timetable, though, the ferries drop off in frequency in the evening and don't start running early weekend mornings.

Circular Quay to Taronga Zoo. Tickets were $AA12 return and we purchased them when we got there. This does NOT however cover the bus to the entrance of the zoo from the ferry. Because the zoo is at the top of quite a steep incline, try and get the gondola up from the south entrance as you get amazing views going up. (Take comfortable shoes as a lot of the zoo is on hilly and steep walkways) There are several cafe's and shops at the top.
Ferry and cruises. We used the ferry and cruses and found them very cost effective and a great way to see a large area of Sydney from the water. Commentaries on the boat cruises were good.

The Ferry Masters in Sydney are the best. Not being biassed but my brother is a Ferry Master on the Sydney Harbour and he makes every trip he does around the harbour a special experience for all his passengers. Take a ride on the "Charlotte"!!!!

Very efficient and easy to use. We purchased the multi pass 3 ticket for the week which meant all train, light rail, ferry and buses with unlimited use. We used the train and light rail plus enjoyed the benefit of the ferries. A trip to Manly with the picnic fish and chips at the beach. Day after walking the Jenolan caves we wanted a rest but still see something so we got on the ferry at Circular Quay to Parramatta. This takes you all the way up the river, stopping at many wharfs along the route. A great way to see the harbour and river. All in the price if your pass so well worth it.
Best way to travel in Sydney. If you vist Sydney, forget taxi and any other way to travel, cheap, conwinient and you can everything

Punctuable. Service was very punctuable. I was expecting more services would be running after peak hours, so I found every half an hour wasn´t as frecuent as I would of liked as I had to wait a bit. But the service is clean, quiet, and reliable.
Take the time to use the ferries. Well worth using the ferries to get around its cheap and speedy take the trip to Manly. It's about 30 mins but well worth it.

good for commuting and tourism. On a nice sunshine day it is really worth going for a "harbour cruise"Sitting on a top deck can be a great way to explore Circular Quay and Darling Harbour, and even to Manly

Fantastic way to travel.. We bought a 3 in 1 ticket that enabled us to travel on the buses, trains and ferries during our stay. Travelling by ferry was a brilliant way to get to all the different water fronts and especially during the Vivid Light shows we were able to see the lights at all the different locations. Such a relaxing way to get from A to B. Timetables easy to read and the ferries very regular. Highly recommended.
Great way to get around. The ferries were a great way to enjoy a beautiful boat ride and see the Harbor Bridge & Opera House. We went on it a few different time. Great ride to Manly Beach.

Grab a ferry, and have a tourist ride to wherever and back for a few dollars.. Better than an expensive tourist boat. We travelled from Pyrmont to Balmain, across the Harbour to Milsons Point, and back under the Bridge to Circular Quay. Took just over 30 mins, and cost $6.

A very good way to travel around Sydney. The ferries services is one of the best transportation Sydney had to offer. By taking the ferry, you can have a different perspective of the Sydney. Views you would not be able to see from buses or train. The ferries although some are old, but its still an experience to be transported in a retro ferry. Most importantly, the ferries are clean and the have open deck where you can enjoy the breeze while enjoying the scenery. A definite must try even though the departure time might take quite sometime to wait.

Great views and so cheap. The cheapest most relaxing way to see Sydney harbour. Day or night this is the best way to see the city from the water and all those little nooks and crannies that you miss when driving or even walking.

Getting around. Great value for getting around the harbour, 23.00 for all day pass.
Stopped at some of the main attractions.

On the way to manly, ferry is a must do. The traditional ferry that almost everyone in manly takes to go to work on the morning is a great attraction in summer to discover the bay of sydney. Wifi on board if you need, but you would rather stay outside to enjoy the view on the opera, harbour bridge or try to sight dolphins or whales.

Best way to see Sydney Harbour. The green and yellow ferries are an iconic part of Sydney harbour. They're slower than the fast tourist ferries but that in itself makes the journey enjoyable. Over a couple of days we took the ferries to Manly, Watson's Bay (walked up to the Gap while we were there plus enjoyed fish and chips in the part), and Milson's Point spending time in each location before getting the ferry back. With an all day ticket you could have a great day exploring many areas around the Harbour. There's no commentary as you would get on the tourist ferries but the harbour speaks for itself, besides you can read up on where you're going beforehand. They're inexpensive and they always run on time which is great.

Parramatta River Night Lights. Took the journey from Olympic Park to Circular Quay after dark. The new high speed ferry was a great ride - lights along the shore and the view of the city was spectacular.
Ease and convenience in one.. Moved quickly, easy to maneuver . The ferries are spacious but the lines can get long. It's a great service to travelers and make it easy to check out outlying areas.

Sailing the Seas. The easiest and cheapest (it would probably be best to buy a day ticket) way to see the harbour and surrounds is by ferry of which there is quite a choice depending on your destination. This would be similar to a "hop on hop off" bus trip. The ferries are clean with good facilities, usually run on time and efficient.

Da Manly e un vero spasso traghettare/Manly ferry and a real hoot. Circular Quay Manly - Manly Circular Quay = 14 dollars and 60. Incredible that offer this service and the view of the Sydney Opera House. The places you can visit with Sydney Ferries are many and I must say everything is well organized and punctual. Extreme cleanliness and respect of the staff to ourselves that we travel every day. This service brings all the manifestations of Sydney in the arch of the year. A note and International Fleet Review in which this year I was able to really enjoy the fireworks. Service small bar during transport alway to produce really cool. I wanted to serve me more about this service and stay in Sydney but unfortunately I have to make other plans for my life. A beautiful Ferries

Good Transport Around Sydney at Cheap Prices. Ferries in Sydney and around Sydney have been going since 1789 this is just one year after the first fleet landed in Sydney Cove (Port Jackson) in 1788 and this first service was set up to go to the new farming settlement of Parramatta.The ferry (or Rivercats now) ride up the Parramatta river is spectacular and takes you by some of our most historic areas. It will also take you past some of our modern and very busy areas as well.A good day is jumping on a rivercat at Parramatta wharf, traveling along the Parramatta River into Circular Quay then changing and jumping on a Manly Ferry.What a great way to see Sydney, its surrounding areas and of course the most beautiful harbour in the the world Sydney Harbour.Parking is plentiful at Parramatta, but be mindful of the return rivercat times to Parramatta in the evening or night, it's a LONG way out there if you miss the last ferry.Prices are reasonable, food and drinks are available on all rivercats and most of the Sydney harbour & Manly ferries. All day tickets are also available.Also if you have time, be sure to take a ferry ride to Darling Harbour, Balmain and around the inner harbour areas. Of course a full day will be needed if you plan on taking a ferry to Taronga Zoo, and this is a magnificent ferry ride as well to visit one of the worlds best located zoo's with magnificent views of they city of Sydney, the Sydney Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge.Be sure to bring a camera with a decent (at least 10X) zoom, as from this vantage point, and anywhere on any ferry some amazing photography is available.
GReat way to travel. Great way to see and experience the harbor. Great schedules and easy to use. Some ferries are newer than others, but clean andvery efficient. Staff very helpful.

Ferries make traveling fun. We loved taking the ferries -- it makes the trips across the harbor easy, fast and fun. There are plenty of inside seats in case of bad weather, too. Sydney has great transportation -- trains, bus and ferries are all easy to use, clean and safe.

Take the ferry!. The Sydney ferry is the least cumbersome way to commute between some of the popular tourist attractions in the city. More importantly, the ferry was a wonderful experience for me because my ferry um... drivers? were excellent company. Okay, before I just start to rave about them, the ferry allows you a fleeting glimpse of everything. If you want to get off at a certain point, say for instance, the Sydney Opera House, the ferry can also drop you off there and then pick you up whenever you want. If you manage to convince the ferry guy to slow down, you can get some great shots of the Sydney Harbour Bridge as well. You can also go up to Manly or Circular Quay. The view from the ferry right is absolutely amazing.
Good way to see around. We went on the Ferry to Manly and Darling Harbour. We should have bought the day pass which would have been more economical. The ferries are a great way to have a look around.

Love travelling the harbour on the ferries. By a all day bus ferry ticket and travel all over the harbour as a local we would do this with friends and family all the time best way to see Sydney and you can gat off and on

I so love Family Fun Day Sunday!. With fare of only AUD2.50 per adult (only applicable to family travelling with children), the pass can be used to travel to the many islands around Sydney. We used it to travel to Rose Bay and Manly.

Great way to commute to the conference. Sydney Australia provided complimentary transportation to all Rotary International 2014 Convention Attendees (all 17500 of us). We could choose between a bus from our hotel, train connections that seemed seamless via Central Station, and the Ferries. I chose the Ferry whenever possible as it afforded some quiet time to mingle with other Rotarians from around the world and at the same time ... enjoy beautiful Sydney from the water. The Ferry System is so easy and the boats are clean and well maintained.
Always a pleasant trip. Going on Sydney Harbour is always going to be a pleasant experience. Most ferries have good facilities so never an issue during the trip

Fantastic Ferries. For a wonderful trip on sunny day, take trip on the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. The beautiful and expensive harbour side homes are easily visible as you sit back and enjoy the scenery.
Had to do it. Took the ferry to Manly from the Wharf. Ferry was nice but would have liked more outside seating. Next time need to board earlier for better views

good ay to get around harbour. Ferries are a good way to get around the harbour with great views that are always enticing. The ferries are cleaner and more efficient, but no parking at Ferry stops is a big drawback.

like a step back in time but it is worth it.. this is what makes it the best harbour in Australia, you can see it from the land but from the water it is even better. The ferries are great, the trip to Manly on a stormy day is quite exciting!

Take a ride and see the harour. The manly ferry is out of Circular Quay and costs $15.00 return, which is a bargain for the views you get of the harbour and the best views of the bridge and Opera house.
They run ever half an hour, well worth going for a ride.
Manly trip.. Took no time at all to get to Manly. Loved enjoying Sydney from the water. Very convenient, was a great day just popping across the harbour to enjoy lunch at Manly from Circular Quay.

what a harbour!. Service was good, clean and on time. Staff were friendly you have a great opportunity to view the best harbour in the world and all the great attractions around our beautiful harbour.

Happiness is the Manly ferry captain who doubles as whale watcher. The Manly ferry is a delight on any trip to Sydney but it was especially so for us when the captain came on the PA to tell passengers to look out for a couple of whales near South Head. Worth every penny, and so good in a rushed and crowded city that sometimes forgets it's full of humans.

Vivid in Sydney. Sunday is the day to take the family on public transport in Sydney!
Purchase a FAMILY FUNDAY ticket at $2.50 each person for all access train/ferry for twenty-four hours. Buy these from the ticket machines at the stations.

Easy and accessible!!. The employees are great at helping you to get where you have to go. You can actually buy your Taronga Zoo tickets from them when purchasing ferry tickets and save!!! Right at Circular Quay. Enjoy:)
Easy. Very easy to purchase tickets - visited Manly Beach for a nice lunch and stroll then back to Circular Quay.

Great service and top views of the harbour. Always find the staff friendly and helpful whenever we've caught the ferries. The views offered are sensational too - Manly to Circular Quay has to be the pick for visitors, arriving between the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. We like the River Cat service to Olympic Park/Parramatta too which gives a different perspective and takes you under the bridge
Ferry trip. Sydney ferries are great easy to buy tickets and virtually can get you anywhere within a reasonable time.

Great way to travel!. I absolutely love these little ferries. You can go all over the place in them, and have a relaxed and very scenic journey. It can be very busy at peak travel times, but well worth doing for the pleasure of the trip.
slow ferry. took one of the ferry because of a tour i booked and it was horrible. i would choose to walk. maybe i'll walk faster than the ferry

All Aboard Sydney Harbour. The Sydney Ferries are the best way to get around on one of the best harbours in the world.
Don't let the traffic get you down.... jump on a ferry and relax on your way to the city... I could not be any easier.

So easy, you don't need 'premium' cruises. Sydney ferries even have 'greeters' at some times, although you don't usually need them. Buying ticket in machine can be slow, but you'll get it right. Then hop on and enjoy great harbour cheaply!

Purchase a MyMulti Day Pass. If you want to travel Sydney Harbour by ferry then purchase a MyMulti Day pass. For just over $20 for an adult and $11 for kids you get all your travel on Sydney Ferries but also buses, trains and light rail. Excellent value.
So eay to get around. We caught a ferry everyday, to somewhere. They are a greta way to get around. Beautiful Harbor to admire hwile gettign to oyur destination. Very regular, very easy to catch.
Value For Money. This was just perfect for us. We were able to see Manly and Bondi Beach in one day. It was value for money and the staff were friendly and always happy to help.

See Sydney Harbour from the harbour!. A trip on the Manly ferry - about half an hour - is a wonderful way to see Sydney from its harbour. Boats everywhere, as well as the chance to see the Pacific through Sydney Heads, plus the opportunity to visit Manly and see its beach and the surfers. A grerat afternoon if you have nothing better to do.

Great way to travel around the harbour. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour and it stopped at a few places along the way so we had some sightseeing which was great too. Good staff, quick loading and disembarkment, very impressed. Easy ticket machines to use, although they are now moving onto an Oyster Card system so not sure what tourists will do for short term fare ticketing.

Water travelling. The ferries go to a myriad of places along the Sydney area coastline, from Darling harbour we went to Bondi beach (didn't see the VET alas), Manly beach, Circular Quay (worth it if you don't want to walk).
Great quick service. Really like using Sydney ferries it becomes part of the Sydney experience every time we come to Sydney such a lovely harbour and a great wa to see it.

A very nice experience.. A sydney harbour tour is never been complete without you riding a sydney ferries. We ride a few times in the ferries but i enjoyed it the most during our last night in sydney. We took a night date riding a ferry and it was pefect because there were only few peoplw riding sydney ferries at night. But we saw the beauty of sydney harbour in the night. The lights of the buildings from one harbour to the other one was very nice and the cool breeze was great. It was one of the nicest experience i had with my hubby in our sydney tour.
Great mode of transport. Opportunity to get from A to B without traffic and see some sights on the way. If you happen to be pensioners extremely cost effective.

Top of your to-do list. If you have travelled all the way to Sydney,Australia,managed to find yourself in Sydney Harbour then you must,must take the ferry to travel around the harbour.They are safe,reliable,inexpensive and a wicked way to see the Opera House and the bridge from a different perspective....please do this...it was amazing.
Manly Ferry - Quintessential Sydney experience. Rain or shine, hop on the ferry to Manly and travel the 7 miles from Sydney and a thousand miles from care. This is a must for the visitor to Sydney.
Practical and fun. Love Sydney Ferries, especially the Rivercat that runs between Sydney and Parramatta. Offering a pleasant and reasonably priced trip.

A great way to get around!. Though the ferries see a lot of use, they combine with the train system to be an amazing way to get around town. After a week of driving the two lane roads of New Zealand, it was very relaxing to watch the city drift by.

See vivid by ferry. We took saw the vivid festival around the sydney harbor; then took a ferry from the circular quay to the darling harbor. Much cheaper way of seeing the lights. We also took a ferry to Manley. Both provided great views

Fantastic Views. This is the cheap way to appreciate the wonderful Sydney Harbour with a ferry crossing, there are numerous with lots of areas to travel to or just to go and return on the one trip. Best view for photos of Harbour Bridge, Opera House and Fort Denison. Added advantage of a wonderful boat trip on a superb harbour.
Over to Manly for lunch. Friendly staff at window (wasn't last time we were in the city) running to time and a great way to travel and see the sights

Great way to travel. What a great way to travel. I used Sydney Ferries to get to the Zoo and Manley. Both trips were good value for money, enjoyable and on time. You have the choice of sitting outside or inside and toilets and a cafe (for the Manley trip) are onboard. They run regularly. Great views from the ferries too. Well worth using.

Best way to see Sydney. An incredible way to see beautiful Sydney. A very cost effective and exhilarating way to enjoy the Sydney Harbour and get to the various attractions. Our family loved the view and mingling with the other tourists and locals. A must do when in Sydney.

" Ferry Good Indeed!". Travel on Sydney Ferries is one of life's great pleasures! To be able to sit back and relax and watch the panoramic splendour of the Harbour sights unfold, instead of intently driving one's car fearful of avoiding yet another crazy driver, is heaven indeed!
sydney Ferries. The best mode of public transport in Sydney. So relaxing, and what a view! Fast and efficient. On time service

Fantastic Sydney Ferries. We used the Sydney Ferries many, many times per day. It is a brilliant way to see all the attractions and sights around Sydney from Darling Harbour to Manly. Being pensioners it only cost $2.50 per person for the entire day. You can use the same ticket over and over again, on ferries, buses and trains. Have breakfast at Manly, lunch at the zoo and dinner at Darling Harbour, then cruise back to Circular Quay for drinks at the Opera Bar. Brilliant and reliable transport and amazing views everywhere.

what a view...... Loved leaving and arriving at Circular Quay on the ferry, each time your breath is taken away by the view of the beautiful harbour bridge and opera house (hence having around 100 photos just from the ferry).

Inexpensive way to see other areas. We took the ferry to Manley Beach, wow great shopping, walking, scenery and beach. the Ferry is relatively inexpensive way of public transportation. The boarding process was quick and organized. My only recommendation is that if you enjoy looking out at the water try to be towards front of line. Our outgoing Ferry had plenty of outdoor seating and viewing areas, the return Ferry did not. I will show the hours in my recommendations but it does depend on the choice of destinations you take.
Night Lights. What a fantastic way to see the city. Be sure to take the trip to Darling Harbour because the view of the Opera House beneath the Harbour Bridge will take your breath away
Great way to see Sydney Harbour. Convenient and cheap way to see Sydney Harbour.Ferries run frequently and you can visit attractions at a fraction of the cost of organised tours.
memories galore. Our grandaughter loved every minute on the ferries especially going under the harbour bridge, and over to Talronga zoo

A must. Taking the ferries around Sydney is more fun than a barrel of monkeys. It's a bustling transportation system and probably the best way to get around to key sights/areas as you don't have to deal with traffic. It's also a great way to meet both locals and visitors and probably the best way to really see the city. And the view of the Opera House from the water is magnificent.

Great way to see the harbour and surrounds. We used the ferry a lot when staying for a week in the city. The best journey was to Manly. 30 minutes and you are there. Boarding and offloading simple and straight forward. Just follow the crowds. Plenty of seats. Fares reasonable. You can get all day tickets too.
Out and about. Taking the ferry adds another aspect to travel in Sydney. It's public transport but you feel freer (and more relaxed) than catching a crowded bus

Come sailors one and all. The ferries are a wonderful piece of local culture: whether you take the river cat up the Parramatta River or the ferry to Manly (or one of the many other smaller ferries to the myriad of harbour wharves)...they all share one thing in common. You'll pull out of Sydney's first white settlement location, see the Opera House and Harbour Bridge from a completely different angle and most importantly, arrive somewhere that offers an alternative to the hubbub of the CBD. My personal favourite is Manly. Its pre-metric motto of "7 miles from Sydney, 1000 miles from care"...really sums up its charm. Stand on that deck, feel the wind in your hair, smell the salt in your nostrils....and keep your eyes open...little fairy penguins play on the rocky outcrops all around the foreshores.
It's easy to get about Sydney Harbour. You can pretty much go anywhere you like as there are wharfs in Darling Harbour, Milsons Point, Shark Island, Circular Quay and the list goes on.

A Good Way to See Sydney. Instead of paying for the tour Ferries just take one to Manly and have a walk down the Corso and have Fish & Chips on the beach. Or take the Parramatta River Cat to Parramatta and walk to the main street for a bite to eat. Also you can take one of the Ferries that either go west or east the the Harbor Bridge on a Round Trip and enjoy the sites.

A Must do in Sydney is a Ferry Ride!. The ferries on Sydney Harbour are a great way to explore the city from the Harbour! You can check out all of the real estate as well as most attractions along the way. Manly beach is a must to visit on the big ferry when visiting Sydney. Enjoy this glorious city!
Ferry. Quick and surprisingly easy just like catching a bus. A nice way to see some of the landmarks from a different perspective
Fantastic service. They always run on time, there is actually space for the passengers to be comfortable, with spectacular views

What's not to like. People we met recommended the ferry as a trip all by itself, even to just go out on the water. So we did! It was a beautiful sun shiny day and the trip on the water added a special touch to the day. We enjoyed seeing the bridge and the opera house from the water, too!

Take the Ferry. There are any number of ways to explore Sydney and one of the cheapest is to take anyone of the Harbour ferries. They all leave from Harbour Quay and figuring out where they go and getting a ticket is simple. Take the ferry to Manley Beach. A great ride where you can see most of the harbor and take a hundred photos - walk around Manley and enjoy for as long as you like and grab the ferry back. Best value in town.

Mosman Ferry service not available at present , disgraceful.. The Sydney ferry system is excellent , however the one hour delays after 8pm is not at all good..If one misses it is a long wait in the cold ,on a dark & blowy evening.Also it's most unsatisfactory that a city as large as Sydney can just ignore the fact that Mosman exists & not make some effort to have the ferry endeavour to pull in at such a busy terminal & 6 months 'out of service ' is a disgrace.

Great Value. With all the commercial options available to cruise Sydney Harbour its still hard to find better value then the government run ferries. Just catch the first one leaving. The destination doesn't matter. Sit outside and enjoy the atmosphere and view.

Great service. Ferries came and went regularly. The timetable was displayed at the entrance to each ferry terminal so you knew where to go to catch a particular ferry and what time the next one was. We had purchased a 7 day multi ticket for $63 that allowed us to travel on trains ferries and buses so fares were excellent, we tripped all,over the place. Some ferries even have free wifi on top level. Wonderful experience.

Journey by Boat. Sydney harbour is a beautiful sight especially by water - what a unique way to get around and scenic. An opportunity you can't miss even though I live here in Sydney, I dont get to do it that much. Enjoy.

See Sydney harbour from the water. Sydney Ferries run an excellent covering virtually the whole of Sydney Harbour - even up to Parramatta - not expensive - great for children. Check the timetables on Sydney Ferries website. Sydney harbour is one of the best in the world if not the best - enjoy it on a ferry ride.

Bargain. If you want a cheap harbour cruise, the ferries are the way to go. Sit outside and watch the view. The best options are circular Quay to Manly or Watsons Bay and you can have lunch in either place before returning. A quick option is just over to Milsons Point then walk back over the Harbour Bridge.

What an idyllic way to travel!. As a Melburnian, I am so envious of Sydneysiders who can hop in a ferry to go to work - or just discover other parts of this beautiful city. And it is so sensible (unlike Melbourne!) because if you don't have a travel pass, you can pay before you exit the turnstile after you have finished your trip.Some of the ferries are a little older, but that just adds to the charm.The best view is from the deck - but take a shawl in warmer months as it can get a little chilly.If you are visiting Sydney for the first time, put aside a day to explore via ferries. Better still, have fish and chips at the legendary Doyle's restaurant in Watson's Bay. Or even better - but much more upmarket - Catalina's at Rose Bay and watch the seaplanes arrive and depart. And that is just a taste of where you can go via this stunning harbour.
very unique mode of transport. this is the best way to get from bay to bay and see our most famous land marks. the ferries are so "sydney" and are great fun for kids and big kids..much recommended

TRIP TO COCKATOO ISLAND. We recently caught a Sydney ferry to Cockatoo Island. We found the trip across Sydney Harbour to be fantastic, and the Sydney Ferry staff were extremely helpful, both on the ferry and at the Quay. It was a cheap and enjoyable way to view the harbour.
Beautiful Day on this Amazing Harbour. If you are a Senior there is no better way to enjoy a lovely sunny day for $2.50 (ferries, bus, rail and light rail) than by getting out a Sydney Harbour.

cheap travel. A cheap way to see Sydney Harbour , sydney Ferries, they go all aroung the Harbour , under the bridge ,opera house , Taronga Zoo , wharf , Manly , Luna Park , And Sydney Skyline by night is just beautifull , Take a lunch with you , Best time to see the Harbour Dec,Jan, Feb, Sydney by night any time .

See Sydney Harbour. By using the Sydney Ferries you can get an inexpensive view of all the myriad bays and coves of this great harbour. We live in Sydney and regulary use the ferries to get around. They are comfortable and on a sunny day it is delightful to sit outside with the wind blowing through ones hair. Circular Quay is the hub. From there one can get a big ferry across to Manly and walk the Corso to Manly Beach. There are numerous eating spots along the way. Taronga Zoo and Darling Harbour can be destinations. Maybe you'd like to travel up to Parramatta and delight in seeing the old sandstone buildings from the early days. Maybe you'd like to go to Cockatoo Island where families camp and art expos are often mounted. Then in November, when the Jacarandas are in bloom, travel to Woolwich and Greenwich. Go to Watson's Bay via Rose Bay to get a wonderful distant view of the Opera House and the Bridge. There is a fine fish restaurant there. All this at minimal cost. I never stop marvelling at our beautiful harbour which is there for everyone to enjoy.

Cheap and fun way to see Sydney.. Sydney ferries are a wonderful cost effective way to travel travel around the city. There are a large variety of trips to chose from. You can travel all the way up the Parramatta river to Parramatta, visis Manly, Watsonson Bay or the Taronga Park Zoo. The deckhands are all cheerful, helpful and friendly. The farriers are largely used by commuters but are equally a wonderful resource for sightseeing.

Public transport on the water. What better way to see our city than by taking a ferry ride., A friend and I were 'pretend tourists' last week and took a ferry to the Eastern suburbs. The weather was ideal. The water glistened as we saw our city from a different perspective; wonderful photo opportunities too for the camera buff. You can stay on board or stop off to explore or have lunch. The crew were friendly and helpful and they looked as though they were really enjoying their work.

Cheap way of seeing Sydney Harbour. Buy a Ferry 10 tripper ticket and for less than $50 you can explore all of Sydney Harbour (Manly is a separate ticket) from Parramatta to Watson Bay.
