Take a ferry outside peak hours as these ferry's are used as commuter ferry's for most of Sydney workers living near or around the harbour and working in the city.Watson Bay round trip is my favourite, with the bonus of a fantastic Fish & Chips at Doyles when you get there or after your walk around the beaches and head land.Take at least two days out to explore this fantastic harbour and its many interesting sight seeing locations.
Beautiful View. i like the sightseeing. lots of food and beautiful stopovers. able to see the other side of Sydney from the water on a very affordable rate.

Just everyday transport to us, but.... My kids catch a ferry to school every day, so we don't see it as a big deal, but it seems to interest visitors. Don't get me wrong,nthese are no glamorous cruise boats - they really are just everyday transport boats, but you do get to see a different view of the city, and they're cheap & convenient. They're a much more fun way to travel from the city to Parramatta, too.

Fantastic inexpensive way to see Sydney Harbour. The government ferries that depart from circular key are a Fantastic inexpensive way to see Sydney Harbour The manly ferry is best and I'd advise to get off and spend a few hours there before your return to Sydney. The ferry service once advertised Manly as "seven miles from Sydney, and a thousand miles from care".

Best way to get around Sydney. Easiest way to get around the harbour, get a daily/weekly pass if they for awhile worth the money and you can use for all ferries (except fast ferries eg.manly) buses and trains

Charming way to explore the harbour.. I love these old world ferries that look like something out of a fairytale storybook. Standing at the railing on the bottom level you are so close to the water and with the wind in your hair it's the best way to enjoy the harbour views. Love the trip between circular quay and darling harbour.

What a deal!. We bought a senior travel pass for $2.50 a day each giving us access to the government run ferries which was a deal! One day we took a trip to Manly and spent some time there. Another day we took the Parramatta ferry which takes about an hour and a half but we got off at Abbotsford. We walked up the hill for a few minutes and enjoyed a drink and a view in the Sydney Harbour Rowing Club, very nice. It was lovely being out on the harbour with the differing views. The ticket also works on buses and the light rail and can be purchased in most newsagents.

Smooth way to go. We took a ferry from Meadowbank wharf to circular Quay recently. We were surprised what a lovely way to go into the city this was. We saw our weel kinown city from a whole new perspective. The service was fast (about 35 minutes) not expensive, and we were able to park right at the wharf.

good way to see Sydney Harbor. Taking the Sydney ferry (Circular Quay) or a Sydney cruise (Darling Harbor) can give you a comprehensive tour around Sydney harbor and all the beauty of Sydney environment. Travelling on the water, you will enjoy the cool fresh air of Sydney harbor. The calm water within Sydney harbor will suit any sea sick person that may not endure. Take the Sydney ferry to Manly would give you the full length of East to the Northern side of Sydney. With Luck you can see sea visitors, the whale and other sea creatures entering the Sydney Harbor and will provide instant nature water display. Taking the Sydney ferry up the West side will take you to inner Sydney harbor residency area of the West.You can enjoy taking a Lunch or Dinner Sydney Harbor cruise organise by cruise operators departing from Darling Harbor. Organiised pick up at Circular Quay can be arranged. The 2,3 and 4 hours cruise would give you enjoyment sightseeing Sydney harbor. Take the romantic night dinner cruise with your special on and have a memory to remember visiting Sydney. I would recommend taking the day and night cruise to absorb the Sydney Harbor beauty.
Fabulous. While we were walking along this coastal walk a whale breeched not far a or quite a timeway It kept breeching

Great way to get around as long as its not foggy. Sydney ferries are a great way to get around Sydney, especially to get to the zoo, city, manly and darling habour. No traffic can stop them lime a bus, but be careful, fog can disrupt their running in winter, so have a back up plan if fog is forecast and toy want to travel early morning.
What a way to travel to work. A most enjoyable way to travel. Morning is the best time, but evening lights are nice as well. get an outside seat

Magnificent Sydney Harbour‼️‼️. Beautiful Clear Day and a wonderful Ferry ride from Circular Quay to Abbotsford. Easy ticket purchase system. Very helpful staff. Magnificent Harbour What can I say. Do It!!! Amazing way to see the foreshores of Sydney.

Ferry Good. An excellent way of getting around the harbour. This very evening a departing ferry returned (having barely moved) to the wharf to collect late arrivals; a fantastic gesture and rare in our calcified times. Shame not all the ferry passengers saw the good side: what a pity your journey home was delayed by a max 5 minutes when the beauty of the gesture saw a family smiling, elated and relieved to be getting their kids home on time after seeing Vivid in the flesh. Those kids are our future and they need their sleep! Thank you Sydney Ferries for a fantastic attitude.
GREAT VIEW OF SYDNEY AND VERY COMFORTABLE. We took the ferry to Manly. They are on time comfortable and the best view of the Opera House. There is a tv and it is secure even late at night

Great way to cruise the famous harbour. Definitely a great and affordable way to cruise the harbour! Took it to and fro Manly from Circular Quay. Grab a seat at the upper outdoor at the head of the ferry.

Transport Gem. Loved the variety of the short trips available via Ferry on Sydney Harbour
Cheap and efficient. We travelled after the morning and before the afternoon rush hour and it was the best way to get to Manly, to the Zoo etc

How do they do it?. We travelled exclusively on Sydney transport and in particular the ferries. We never had a ferry that was delayed or late and at every stop they managed to line up with buses and trains to continue your journey. I really wish our state could get it so right like Sydney has.Every deckhand was polite with a welcome aboard and on departure.......great work guys and girls.

There are more ferries than most people know!. The 'normal' Sydney Harbour ferries provide an exceptional service throughout many areas of the harbour, but there's also the Matilda ferry services that cater to some of the smaller ports with their super-quick catamarans operating out of pier 6 of Circular Quay.

Sydney Ferries. The Sydney ferries are a very convenient and enjoyable way to get around Sydney. Not only do you eliminate the road traffic and stress, you also get to see things you would not have normally seen as well as enjoy the fresh air!

Sunday family rate. We caught the ferry on the spur of the moment from Taronga Zoo Wharf to Circular Quay. It was $12 for 2 adults or $7.50 for 2 adults and a child. So for the three of us to travel cost $2.50 each. And I've attached a picture of the view. Love it!

Great service and fantastic views!. On time, relatively cheap for a capital city and what you get and the views as you travel are stunning! I bought a week's multi pass including ferry, bus and train travel for a family of 4 for about £85. Unlimited travel in Sydney and suburbs for a week for £21ish each. Used it every day to go and explore and had loads of fun catching ferries and watching the world go by!

Great transport. A perfect easy way to get around and see Sydney. We boarded mainly from DArling harbour and went as par as Olympic park in one direction to Manly in the other. Fast , easy and efficient as well as reasonably priced
very good service. This is a good way to get about relaxing too with good views a multi ticket is well worth getting always on time excellent

Nice ferry ride to Watsons Bay. Talk about great value. Catching the ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bays for fish and chips at Doyles was a lovely experience. The views across the harbour were breathtaking. Oh to be rich and live with that view.

So Sydney. This is must do. A common public transport with Circular Quay the hub as are the buses and trains. They are efficient and so traditional. No trip is of great length and the frequency, easy of use and timetable would suit all. The $2.50 per person family Sunday ticket is the best value in Sydney.
Ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour. Nice trip under the bridge, over to Luna Park then down to Darling Harbour, nice day too. Cost for trip was very reasonable $12 return.
Great way to get around!. So much fun to get around . Comfortable wait times. Very scenic! Gives you a great overall viewing of the Harbor.

Great way to get about. Don't book tours on Sydney waterways. Get on the local ferries and go anywhere. The staff at ticket counters in the Quay are fantastic and will give you all the information you need.

Water ways are awesome. You can spend the whole day riding the ferries and see new and exciting things. I took it to Darling Harbour and then I went to the complete opposite side of waterway. You can hop off and explore other sites or you can just enjoy of cruise on the water. If thirsty they sell beers and water on board. And its an awesome way to see other angles of the Opera House and the Bridge that you cant get to see when you are on land.

Efficient waterways of Sydney. Just buy mymulti 3 pass and enjoy unlimited travel on sydney public transport including long distance ferries. Best way to reach Taronga Zoo, Manly, Mosman and many other famous places.

Darling Harbour to Circular Quay. A quick ferry ride from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay, or in the other direction is an excellent way for tourists to enjoy a water view of Sydney without the expensive costs of a day cruise. It travels under the harbour bridge too :)
Harbour delights. Best way to see Sydney via all the ferries-for tourists buy a weekly ticket as it's not cheap unless you have family then you can travel on Sunday for $2.50 or Opal card.
Very Efficient Service. Travelled to Taronga Zoo by the Sydney Ferry. Left on time,return was on time,views were amazing as we travelled.

Great way to get about. Grab a weekly multipass and use teh ferries to see Sydney in the best possible way. The ride to Manly is fantastic and the colourful ferries are seemingly everywhere, but all departing from Circular Quay. Great experience.

Cheap day out for Seniors. The public transport system seniors card for $2.50 lets you ride the trains, buses and the ferries. Ride them all day at your leisure, it is a great way to spend a sunny day in Sydney.
Excellent value. Very reasonably priced, a great trip round to Manly Bay for lunch. Plenty of seating for everyone too.

Sydney from the water. For those with some time to spend, doing some trips on the ferries is relaxing and a greatand economical way to see a range of perspectives of Sydney from the water. It is an ever-changing pleasure. While there are specific destinations such as Manly and Taronga Zoo, simply taking a leisurely cruise around is a great plan for a fine day.Another fun thing to do is to take the Rivercat up to Parramatta with a stop at Cockatoo Island, a cultural place and precinct set in the harbour. Again, make sure to do this on a fine day. Take a picnic lunch and find a spot to enjoy it!

Great ride. Sydney ferries are safe, efficient and a great way to see a lot of areas of Sydney Harbour. The fares are not terribly expensive. Night time is also quite a lovely way to view the Harbour and its city lights.
Great way to get around. A nice difference from buses and subways. Very accessible, good schedules and what a view!!! We skipped a harbour tour and took the ferries!
Quite enjoyable. This was one of the best deals in Sydney. The ferry covered the entire harbor and allowed you to get some excellent photographs up close.

Friendly staff. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The ferry boats are keep clean and the seating is comfortable. A visitor can easily get where they want to in and around the greater Sydney area

Get a ferry to Manly and spend the day there. Took a ferry to Manly. The Manly ferry is a larger boat so it can be busy but the view! WOW. Arrive early to get a good seat at the front of the boat and take heaps of photos

Great way to see the harbour. What a tremendous service. Reasonable cost, punctual, efficient boarding... Travelled to Manly for the day and had a great time.If you want to see Sydney Harbour and travel to a great destination, then would certainly recommend travelling by ferry.

Very convienent. Took the ferry to Manly and it is very straightforward. Just buy your tickets at the wharf and go to the correct ferry number. Every 30 min there is a departure. Nice views of the harbour area, clean ferry and enough space.

A great way to explore Sydney Harbour. Although most of the ferries plying the harbour are rather old and tired, they are still a convenient way to see places like Government House, Manly Beach, and also to visit Taronga Zoo Park.
Nice view but a bit costly. Offers amazing view of the harbour and Sydney CBD. The ferry rid was a bit too costly and the line was too long.
You have to try at least one trip. We think the best trip is over to Manly even if the weather is not good. We did it twice in two days and got wet both times but it was worth it.
Easy and lots of fun. Just love the ferry transport in and around sydney. Makes it really easy and fun to get to all the really cool places.

Friendly and flexible. If you want to get out on the harbour for a brief trip you don't have to hire a water taxi or tour. I loved our couple of trips to Manly etc. Staff on hand at Darling Harbour to help us with our tickets, pricing and route. Very efficient. Great for kids.
Cheap tour. This is a great way to see Sydney for a very cheap cost. You can kill a few hours with very little cost and you get to see some of the best views Sydney has to offer :)

ferry transport. busy place, circular quay but at least 2 boards showing ferry schedules by the gates to the boats. buy your tickets there. I was staying in Parramatta and used the Parramatta ferry to get in and out of the centre, much more fun than the train. Got caught once at low water and had to wait half and hour on a quay a short distance from Parramatta but another ferry turned up so not a problem though information was non existent at that quay. did a couple of other trips from circular quay, again, queues aside, all very simple and a great way to see other parts of the city.

As advertised.... Never used Sydney Sydney Ferries before. In town for the weekend... Travelled from Circular quay to Taronga Park Zoo and the Mairime Museum. In short, very easy... Helpful staff (we watched as ticket booth staff patiently explained 'bits and pieces' to international tourists), good frequency, amiable ferry crew..Made using an unfamiliar mode of public transport very easy.
Great way to see Sydney. The ferries are used as a means of transport by locals, and so it is a great way to feel part of the city. Also it is the best way to see beautiful Sydney Harbour.

Efficient Sydney icon. Each time we visit Sydney we use the ferries. We have always found them to be reliable and easy to use. It's lovely to be out on the harbour and look back at the city, especially in the evening when the lights are on.
easy Way To Get Places. We used the ferries for our time in Sydney and found them to be so convenient and pleasant to use. No apprehension about recommending them.
A must.. Doesn't matter where you are headed. if you can take a ferry, then do so. The view from anywhere on the harbour is worth the trip. Not expensive.

At sunset it is just magnificent. This is definitely a must do when in Sydney. I have lived here all my life but sometimes I forget how beautiful the harbour is, and this is definitely the cheapest way to enjoy it and get around. I caught the ferry to Manly from Circular Quay at 11am, walked all around Shelly Beach in Manly, had lunch and walked around the markets, and then caught the ferry back at sunset. This was truly the spectacular part of the trip. Colours galore and I got some amazing photos. Suits people of all ages. The walk around to Shelly Beach is lovely - especially in summer when you can take your swimming costume, snorkel and mask and enjoy some snorkelling off Shelly Beach.
What a way to travel. Really good experiences and views. Nothing better than using the ferry to see the views. Really reasonably priced as well.

Such a Sydney Thing to do. Not all sydney siders catch ferries, but normally everyone in their lifetime at least once grabs one to get across to Manly or the Zoo at some stage of their lives. Its a great iconic Sydney thing, hard to describe why but it simply is. On a blue sky day, the views going out from Circular Quay and besides the Harbour Bridge are breathtaking. For tourists it also allows panoramic shots of the bridge and opera house from a sea based angle - which is superior to those available on land. Treat yourself and enjoy
Easy!. Great views and easy to use. The free WIFI is fantastic! Everyone is very friendly. You can buy a weekly pass that gives you unlimited access to all of Sydney's transit.

A Sydney highlight. What better way to view the Sydney skyline and suburbs. With much of Sydney life centred around the harbour, catching the ferries to and fro across the water gives an excellent view if the surrounds. Stopping off at various places for a coffee or glass of wine, this is a relaxing way to take in the sites

great service. We travelled from Circular Quey to Manly - I couldn't believe how cheap a return ticket was, how good the service was and how efficient it was. Pity we don't have that sort of efficiency in Melbourne.
Cheap and reliable sight seeing from the Darling Harbour service. Take the 30 min ride for $6 to Darling harbour...under the bridge and get off at the Maritime Museum!

Great way to see the Harbour. Riding one of the Ferries is a great way to see the harbour and spend a little time relaxing for a very cheap price! Do yourself a favor if in Sydney and enjoy a boat ride and see some of sydney from a different point of view:)

The best way to get around Sydney. Buy a multiticket and use the ferries as a hop on hop off way of gettinga round the city and surrounds. Great views as you travel around the harbour. With the top ticket you can travel everywhere including up river to Paramater, over to Manly for a beer or even on the Train to Katoomba in the blue mountains. Best public transport system I have every used.

Frendly... BUT precise, punctual and careful towards All customers. The view on Sydney's bay is breathtaking, Manly offers various attractions aside the beaches, navigation is normally smooth and pleasant, waves fron the Ocean permitting.
Manly ferry. Reasonable value and easy to buy ticketsRegular serviceComfortable ferryGreat way to see the city and Manly is a great location to visit for shops and restaurants
Busy!. We took the ferry from Sydney Harbour to Manly Beach...it was a beautiful trip with views of Sydney and all the sailboats. Loved it!

Wonderful experience. We are from Canberra and we die to travel in ferries. We planned the trip on Sunday, and was pleasantly surprised to know the ticket is just $2.50 on Sundays, yes just 2.50 for train, buses, light train and of course ferries. It was very crowded on ferries as it was Easter Sunday, but the whole family enjoyed the experience. I recommend having a trip during day and another one in the late evening after sun down.
Ferry to Manly. Go for the MyMulti3 pass if you are planning to go to Manly. It's a pretty trip, and Manly is quite charming for an afternoon!

Easy way to get around. Very easy to use, got a week long pass for all zones including airport pass for the family, went everywhere very easily. Attendants were friendly and informative if we needed to know anything

Travelled on ferry to Manly. Scenery was fantastic. Ferries clean and on time. Smooth journey,staff pleasant. Value for money on return ticket. Hadnt been on Ferry or to Manly since 70s and was impressed.
A great way to see Sydney and what it has to offer.. Fantastic views of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and Luna Park. Ferries are punctual and comfortable.
Easy to use. REally good to go for a tour from Sydney to Manly ex. Great way to see the city but something too wind. Be prepared

Best harbour cruise. With seniors discounts the ferries are the best way to see the harbour. Did 2 trips, under the bridge to Valencia St and across to Manly. Information staff very helpful with timetables and linked bus transports. Highly recommended.

Very well organised. Great fun and well organised. You can get on and off at several points around Sydney harbour with a commentator who provides useful interesting information surrounding the history of the harbour and Sydney.

Fantastic travel. We bought senior citizen day ticket, bought in any newsagents, costing $2.50 each.
We went on buses, trains, trams and ferries.
The buses and ferries coordinate arrival times. We were very impressed.

Sydney harbour skyline. At the Circular Quay, many ferries transport you to many places, I caught the ferry to Darling Harbour with good views of Opera House, the bridge and the harbour skyline and also the ferry to Manly Island and it was really nice there. Buy a weekly Travel pass if you are there longer and it will be great value as you can use buses trains and ferries with this pass,

Ferry service. Very efficient and reasonable way to see the various locations around Sydney Harbor. Went to Manly Beach, and Cockatoo Island with ease. The journey is as much fun as arrival at the location

Beaut way to see Sydney. The ferries were great. We used them a lot. $2.50 Family Fundays on Sunday is excellent value and includes all ferry bus and train transport for $2.50 when travelling with family. They didn't always run on time but didn't bother us as we had the time. Great way to see the city. It's pricey for individual tickets but the weekly pass is fantastic value.

Way to go. Sydney Ferries all pass through Circular Quay, a hive of activity. All ferries run to a reliable timetable. First ferry I took was over to Mosman, then walked across to the Zoo ferry terminal to catch the ferry back into Circular Quay with the full glory of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge laid out in front of you for great photos. Second ferry trip I took was on the iconic Manly Ferry to see the full extent of Sydney Harbour. All good.

See the REAL Sydney Harbour. Travel like a local and see all the sites into the bargain for a fraction of the cost of a 'Tour Boat'. Services are frequent and are scheduled throughout the day. Sunday is the busiest for families as adults with kids get discounted tickets.
Manly on a sunny day. As UK residents its always fun to visit Manly by ferry to get a fab view of the Sydney skyline from the water, particularly the Opera House and Harbour Bridge.
Geat fun. The ferries are a tourist attraction in themselves. Great view of the harbour. They are cheap and run on time.

A great way to see the city. We had visitors so we thought this would be a great way to explore Sydneu and it was. Hop on at Parramatta (or closer in at Abbotsford as we did) and while away a day on the ferry exploring Sydney a Harbour. Don't get caught out when the attendant doesn't have a multi pass on her - hold off buying your ticket until you get off.. We were stung buying a single leg $6 each and then had to keep buying single tickets.. An expensive way to do it!

The best way to travel in Sydney. Sydney Ferries offer a fantastic, cheap, service to many locations. You get great views all the way to your chosen destination and it's such a relaxing way to get there.

Runs much better than the airlines. Sydney Ferries are a great way to get around the area and enjoy nice view of Sydney's Bridge, Opera House, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and other areas.Buy a Day or Week pass and save the money on a harbor tour and use the ferries to get you from point A to point B and sill see the sights.We were in Sydney for a week and used the ferries and trains a bunch and the Ferries were on time every time.So if you are in the Sydney area for a while, use the ferry to take you to places like Manly, Cockatoo Island, Luna Park and even to the Sydney Olympic Park.
Convenient. All of the ferries left from a central location in Sydney's harbor. We took the Manly ferry. It was very clean and efficient.

Expensive. Recently stayed in Sydney over the Easter break. Obviously a very busy time. Easter Sunday was chaotic with no real system to board the ferries. Everyone pushing to get on a small gangway, prams and all.A short trip from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour was expensive at $48 return for a family, in fact public transport in general in Sydney was expensive.

Fast, efficient, fun!. Using the multi transport tickets bought at Central Station [one cost for a day for all trains, buses, ferries, light rail], I took my UK visitors by ferry to Watsons Bay. The ferry ride was fun, being able to point out various sites around the harbour to them, the weather was sunny, and the ferry staff were helpful and friendly. A great way to travel.

Sydney Ferries. Sydney Ferries, juga dikenal dgn Circle Q, pelabuhan Ferries yg menghubungkan Sydney City Circle ke Manly, Sydney Zoo dsbnya !Sydney ferries juga selokasi dgn Sydney Opera House & The Rock
Excellent for views of the bridge and Opera House. A great way to see the Opera House and Harbour Bridge, we took the ferry to Manly which has a lovely beach and great ice-cream!

Manly ferry cruise. Take the 4.30 pm ferry to manly. Spend some time in manly wharf and return with 5.30 ferry. City lights up around 6.00 so when you're reaching Sydney harbour, you'll be welcomed back by the glowing skyline.
Efficient on time service. The $63 pass, good on all public transport, made getting around Sydney a breeze. The ferries were easy to understand and provided entertainment as well as transport.

Public Transport. Travellers and tourists should be aware that they can purchase a DayTripper tickect for approx. $23 and use the ferries, trains and light rail all day. Ferries are excellent and so to the staff

Sydney Harbour by Ferry. See Sydney Harbour by Ferry. Ferries leave Circular Quay for several well known areas around the Harbour. Parramatta can be reached using a Rivercat which navigates the Harbour and Parramatta River. A free bus will then pick up and navigate around Parramatta and with any luck you can ask the driver to point out historic places. Parramatta is one of the oldest settlements of Sydney. Perfect for a perfect day.
Sydney Ferries. Its a good way to get to see the Harbour. Ferries go to Manly and up the river to Parramatta. Its an easy way to get around Sydney and the Manly Ferry sells food and drinks.
Great views. Either take the ferry from Darling Harbour or back from the Rocks.Fare about $6 single,this is the cheapest way to get the best view of the bridge and the opera house.

A GOOD WAY TO SEE SYDNEY HARBOUR. A good way to view Sydney Harbour from the water. Inexpensive and very well used by locals and tourists alike. Regular services and timely operation.We took the Ferry to Manly with its interesting Art Deco buildings and cosmopolitan vibe - strongly recommended.
Iconic ferries. We travelled to Manley on the ferry and was a great experience both ways, lots of space and great scenic views

Great way to enjoy Sydney in the rain. We visited during a during a few rainy days and found riding the ferries was a great way to stay dry and see the city. Took it to the parramatta from the quay and had a lovely train ride back. Great for kids too. Get the week long Sydney transit pass and enjoy trains, ferries, and light rail. It will save you money and so much time!

A Must do. We took the Sydney to Mosman Ferry, and never got off. Just went for the ride and the views. The views are spectacular. The ferry was smooth and timely. We also took the ferry to Manly, Smae kind of service. This is a tourist must do, get out on the water of the harbor.

it is definitely worth doing. Is there any better route to work in the world? No, seriously - I challengeyou to find a more pleasant, relaxing and refreshing way to start and endyour day. Jump on The Collaroy or The Queenscliff, and start to enjoy better living.
Sydney Ferries. A great way to great around Sydney, Book in for a lunch at Doyles and then perhaps a trip on the ferry to Manly to walk it off! Travel to many different areas at a reasonable price.

A must if your visiting sydney. I've lived in sydney my whole life and catching the ferry is one of my favourite things to do when I'm in the city. The tickets are cheap and they can take you all over the harbour. Sitting on the outside of the ferry is a lot of fun, although you may get a little bit wet if a wave hits the boat. You can see all the sights like the harbour bridge, opera house and Luna park. In my opinion it's the best way to travel in sydney.

See Sydney from the water. This is a great way to see Sydney from the water without a high price. Choose a trip that pops in and out of the ports around Sydney like the trip from Parramatta or Watson's Bay.

Delightful Excursion to Watson's Bay. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay and walk around the cliffs to the lighthouse overlooking The Gap. Views of both Sydney and the open sea are spectacular from different vantage points along the pathway.

THE way to get around. Buy a pass that lasts for days. My husband and I each had one and that way it worked for busses, ferries, etc. It was handy and affordable. I would do it again without hesitation.

The best way to travel.. The ferry services in Sydney are just fantastic, easy to use for any visitor. If you are staying for any length of time then I highly recommend the combined bus, train and ferry pass.

Ferry issues. The commercial ferry operators are very territorial. Be sure you have a ticket for the right one, or they may kick you off. We purchased ours on a Hop-on bus, but it turned out it was not for the Hop-on ferry. They nearly left half of us behind, trying to sort this out.

Bargain prices, great views. You can't beat the public ferries for convenience and price. You can travel all over the harbor for about $24, and the boats are fast, clean, comfortable and always on time

A great way to see this magnificent harbour. As a local I love taking the local ferry from Circular Quay over to Neutral Bay and Kurraba Point. It offers a quick trip and a great way to see the Harbour Bridge, Sydney Opera House, Kirribilli and Neutral Bay.
do it because you can. Any age can do this walk and a real highlight of our trip, we were with a good group and went to the pub afterwards a real hoot the whole experience.
Sydney Ferries are great!. you cannot miss a trip across our beautiful harbour on any of the ferries! pick a good weather day and enjoy the beautiful views

Great value for money. A wonderful way to see our magnificent harbour. Why not go to Watsons Bay and enjoy fish and chips. Manly is only a half hour trip and you can visit the magnificent beach voted better than Bondi. If you want to catch up on a little history, take a ferry to Cockatoo Island, great set up and guides to show you around and if your game you can stay overnight. So many picturesque places to see by riding Sydney Ferries.
this is a must do activity. nothing like hopping aboard a ferry at circular quay and taking a ride around the harbour,you can go to manly ,lunar park the zoo or just cruise...you wont be disappointed

Great way to see the Harbour. Caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Paramatta. Did the return trip in one hop - beautiful day, and enjoyed seeing parts of Sydney harbour you would never see from the road. Some fabulous real estate, interesting bird life and boats of every shape and size. Great way to fill in a couple of hours - recommend.

Sydney by Ferry. A great ferry ride is from Circular Quay to Parramatta. These ferry's are very comfortable and tickets are cheap. Upon arriving at Parramatta get of the ferry as there are many shops to visit On your return to Circular Quay take the train as you will see many different sites along the way. A great way to spend seeing Sydney and its cheap.

Great day out. This is the way to see Sydney at its best. If you are a senior or pensioner remember your $2.50 ticket for ferries trains and buses.A couple of suggestions, the trip to Manly is a must, the River Cat up to Parramatta lets you see more of Sydney out of the City, or catch the ferry one way and return by bus to Watsons Bay. Doyles have a take away fish and chip cafe on the wharf and it is very reasonable and delicious. You can also do a harbour cruise. If you want a wonderful meal and harbour cruise, there are some that depart Circular Quay, and also many depart from King St Wharf opposite Darling Harbour. Even on a wet day it is a great way to see our beautiful city!

I love Sydney Ferries. I love Sydney Ferries but especially the older, green and yellow ones. They are slower than the sleek, river cats but when you are on Sydney Harbour, what's the hurry. The longer the trip takes the better. For around $5 a Sydney Ferry will take you just about anywhere on the best harbour in the world and that is a bargain in my book. For a little more, a ferry ride to Manly from Circular Quay is a must do in Sydney any time of year.We live near to a ferry wharf and if ever we want to travel by air we jump a ferry to Circular Quay and then catch a train to the airport. Brilliant.
Affordable, fast and comfortable. A great ferry service serving a great city. The ferries are frequent and comfortable and offer a great view of Sydney and surrounds
Fantastic views. We used the ferries every day. It was a lovely way to ride. Hoping there might be a wharf at Wynard Walk once completed.

Sydney Harbour Ferries. Whilst many visitors to Sydney take in a ferry ride to Manly, there are many other options to enjoy the magic and scenic beauty of Sydney from the water. If time is short take a quick round trip to the Zoo or Neutral Bay. If you have a little longer take the ferry to Watson's Bay, visiting Rose Bay, & Garden Island along the way. At Watson's Bay, enjoy Doyle's fabled fish and chips and a leisurely stroll around this quaint seaside village, before the breath-taking return ferry ride when the true beauty of Sydney Harbour, the Opera House and Harbour Bridge come into full view. From Circular Quay you can also visit Darling Harbour and historic Balmain, buzzing with quirky pubs and restaurants..
Great to see sydney harbour. This is a great way to see Sydney harbour. The trip to Manly and back is fantastic. Also the trip to Darling Harbour is a good trip.

See Sydney. You can sit on a ferry all day, be driven around Sydney Harbour and see the city from another perspective - the water. You don't have to worry about traffic and parking. You can travel extensively around the harbour and it provides a picture of the ever-changing architecture ranging from the homes of the rich in the eastern suburbs to the industry of the Parrammatta River.

Great way to see the harbour. A trip to Manly from Circular Quay or vice versa is an ideal way to see Sydney Harbour at its best. It takes about 40 minutes by traditional ferry - my choice -through there are faster ferry for the time poor. Have a stroll around Manly and check out the beach. have some lunch and catch the ferry back - or there's a bus if you want to see some of the suburbs??!! Some say Sydney is upstaged by its harbour but for those of us who live here, the harbour is Sydney. I always take visitors from overseas on a ferry trip. The ferry fare is not exactly cheap but you can feel pretty special nonetheless.

Sunday Bargain. $2.50 on Sunday funday per person for unlimited travel. What a bargain! We went Darling Harbour to Circular Quay and back - just brilliant. Then the ticket worked on the trains and buses too.

Great staff. We have used the ferries a number of times during our stay here and found the staff friendly and helpful every time we needed to ask stupid questions or for directions. The ferries are a cost effective, easy means of transport.

Circular Quay to Manly, slow ferry for photos. Old ferry or new fast ferry? Want to take photos take the older ferry, it only takes 30 mins anyway to Manly. Sydney is a beautiful city, a great way to see a bit more is by ferry. Highly recommend.

Good for travel. If you are on a visiting tour, then ferries are one good way to transport. You can come over to harbour bridge trhough train and from there take ferry to nearby places. This will save time and they are cheap as well compared to trains

Great way to get around Sydney. We used the Sydney ferries a lot during our visit. The scenery on the trips around the harbour is postcard perfect and on a sunny day when we'd got all the photos we wanted, it was just lovely to sit on the sun and enjoy the trip. We did a trip out from Circular Quay as far as the Olympic Park with the intention of getting off for a coffee but there wasn't much to be seen at the outer ferry stops so we just enjoyed the sun and came back into the city - a great way to while away a few hours!

Only way to travel. As a visitor from Perth I found the ferries a wonderful way to get around. Once you get to circular quay you can just about catch a ferry to anywhere. We caught the ferry to Toronga Park Zoo and Manly. A really good tip is if you are a pensioner you can get a $2.50 all day ticket and you can travel all day on any bus,train or ferry.

Got to be done, at least once!. I took a ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour, and also to Manly. The Ferry to Manly was jam packed solid, so I would be advising you all to make sure you are not one of the last people on the ferry if you want a good view. I stood outside and was filming with my camera all the way. As you leave the Circular Quay port, you have Sydney Harbour Bridge to your left and the Opera House to your right. Must be one of the best ferry rides in the world. I really think it was worth the price. Do not worry about sea sickness, as Sydney waters rarely get choppy, and the ferries themselves are extremely safe. Staff were pleasant and helpful, and the presentation of the ferry was clean. You have to take a ride on a Sydney Ferry once in your lifetime, it just has to be done.

Get to know Sydney Harbour. We bought ferry tickets for $55 each to hop on hop off at any of the stops on the harbour, including Taronga Park Zoo & the chair lift from the harbour up the cliff to the zoo. An amazing day.

The best way to see Sydney Harbour. They say Sydney Harbour is arguably the best in the world and seen from any of the landbased viewpoints it's hard to disagree. But the best way to see the Harbour and the icons is from the water and Sydney Ferries will allow you to do that.
Rivercat. Relaxed trip from Circular Quay to Parramatta on Rivercat. It was a lovely day and looking at all the sight along the river was good.

Great service and location. Definitely recommend using the service. It's a great way to experience a different view of the city, and getting around. Whats also nice is the locations where it drops you off. You're not in some far off area, but immediately near the the towns center.

Easy way to get around Sydney. Easy to access, easy to board and easy riding. We went to both Manly and Darling harbor
The ferries run timely and are an excellent way to move around Sydney.

travel options. Best to get the all round pass bus ferry and train and your done - all day long for 1 fee!
best value around leaves the Sydney Explorer for dead!
Go anywhere.. A brilliant way to see Sydney and it's surroundings. You can hop on any ferry and go anywhere and you will see sites. It's a great harbour and the people are most friendly.

Heaps of places to go to by ferry. There are all types of ferries in Sydney = private ones for the organised tours which are great but there is also the public transport type. They include hydrofoil, fast and time saving, but also the nice and slow ferries, not as expensive but can take you to different places around the harbour as well as down to Parramatta for a trip.. There is even some commentary on some of the harbour ones to tell you the historical incidents and also where the celebebs live....well worth the ticket

Ferry in sydney. The cheapest way to experience Sydney Harbor - not posh or glamorous but fun. Taking the ferry to Manly is a beautiful ride, and taking it to the Zoo is the best and quickest way to get to the Zoo. Passes are available for the Zoo and ferry, which will save about $6.00 pp

A great way to see Sydney from the water. During a weekend visit to Sydney, we had a Sunday afternoon trip on the Manly ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and return and then later in the evening we travelled by a smaller ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour.We caught the 2.00pm ferry to Manly after standing in a short queue at the Circular Quay ticket box to purchase our tickets. When we boarded the Manly ferry we found it to be very crowded with no seating left unoccupied on the outside decks. We therefore had to find seats in the enclosed upper deck. It was a very warm, humid autumn day and it was quite hot and stuffy in the enclosed upper deck. The voyage across the harbour took 30 minutes and we enjoyed what we could see of the views. Disembarkation at the Manly Wharf was orderly and quick, considering the large number of people onboard.We caught a return ferry to Circular Quay at approximately 6.00pm. This time the ferry was much less crowded and we were able to sit outside on the lower deck. From this vantage point we were much better able to take in the views of the Sydney skyline. This was a good time to travel in this direction on the ferry as the lights of the city were just starting to come on as evening approached. As the ferry approaches Circular Quay you get a spectacular close-up view of the Sydney Opera House. At Circular Quay, disembarkation was again well-managed and achieved quickly and efficiently.Later in the evening we caught a smaller ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour where we were staying. We experienced some difficulty with the ticket machine rejecting our $5 notes and we again had to go to the ticket box to purchase our tickets. We also found some of the signage at Circular Quay a little confusing and we almost missed our ferry because when we went to the wrong wharf. Tip here:- look at the illuminated timetables near the ticket boxes, not the painted signs at the entrance to the wharfs, to find out which wharf your ferry departs from.The ferry trip to Darling Harbour took about 20 minutes with three stops en-route. The first stop was the most interesting when, after passing under the Harbour Bridge we arrived at the Luna Park wharf. It was spectacular sight at night, with the large laughing face entrance to Luna Park being brightly and colourfully illuminated. The journey into Darling Harbour was also quite impressive at night-time with a number of interesting illuminations to be observed.Sydney ferries are a great way to get to see various points of interest around Sydney Harbour. Buying single trip tickets for trips is not particularly cheap but there are other more cost cost-effective ways of purchasing tickets available for those who have time to investigate them.

Pleasant trip. Used the ferry as a family to attend the Zoo. Love that I was acknowledged as a Senior. Kids loved the free Wifi. Wonderful photo opportunity from the ferry of the harbour bridge and Opera House.Most enjoyable.

A must do.. We had a My multi 3 ticket which was great.We frequently hopped on the ferry as we like a boat trip, especially loved the night trips watching the city lights.
Great for views of the Opera House and Bridge, and to give you feet a nice rest. Always take a jacket ,it can get chilly even in summer.

Hop on Hop off Ferry. The best way I believe to get around Sydney and see the sights is to use a Ferry.Just do a circular tour or hop on hop off at all the point around the Harbour. Get great photos of the famous sights and the properties around the harbour.A must is a ride to Circular Quay and onto Tarronga Zoo.Search out some great deals with Captain Cook Cruises, you can buy a multi day ticket and get free entrance to the zoo and free fast ferry tickets to Manly. Good value for money and a very pleasant and relaxing way to get about.
Great value tickets. Buy a weekly ticket for about $au 58.This gives unlimited access to all buses, trains and ferries. Tremendous value.

Great way to see the harbour. The Sydney ferries are a great way to see the harbour at very little cost. If you get on at one of the more remote ferry terminals, dont worry about paying until you arrive at Circular Quay you can buy a ticket then. You can't get out of the terminal without a ticket anyway.

So Much Fun. Loved it, so much fun.Ferries have so much character,on time,quick and efficient way to travel around the harbour. $6 return for a pensioner to circular quay and $12 return for adult. Stops at luna park.

Very comfortable way to see the harbour and visit locations. The large network of ferries takes visitors as well as local residents to a wide range of places on the harbour. The ferry trips are an excellent and comfortable way to see the harbour and visit a lot of locations. The timetables are frequent and reliable, the seats comfortable with a choice of inside or outside seats.

Cheap, clean and million dollar views. Wy travel any other way, cost so little and see so much, just get the ferry from circular quay to Manley beach and back - million dollar harbour and bridge opera house views for a few dollars ! Can't beat it.

A must in Sydney.. The Sydney ferries provide an amazing alternative means of transport, that provide breathtaking views of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Circular Quay and the CBD. Taking the Manly ferry for the first time was quite an experience. The trip is about 40 minutes across the harbour, very smooth and comfortable. Plenty of seating, even a café on board for snacks and drinks. You have the choice of being out the front or inside and two levels, gives you plenty of access for great photos when passing the Opera House. Easy to get tickets and go aboard, and sit back and enjoy the ride with spectacular views.Arrival at Manly is a breeze, a few minutes to wait before heading onshore and enjoy the Manly area. The ferries are daily commuters for workers as well, and during peak times can be full with students and workers. Pick your time to go on a ferry to avoid the rush and crowds. Our perfect Manly trip was between 11am and 3pm, and did not encounter any large crowds or queues. Would certainly do this trip when again in Sydney.The weather turned nasty on the return trip with heavy rain and high seas, but the trip was still good, except very difficult to get any photos or videos outside! On the way into Sydney ferry terminal the heavy rain was in the direction the ferry was travelling meaning it was not possible to sit on the outside front deck to enjoy the views back into the city.Another ferry trip was straight across from Circular Quay to Milson Point (home of Luna Park), takes eight minutes, and for a shorter trip this is an ideal stop. To go on to darling Harbour is another few minutes. The views again are amazing and you are right under the harbour bridge @ Milsons Point, well worth the effort to do the trip. Note a school at Milsons Point is out at 3pm and a lot of students are at the Milsons Point ferry terminal.Once @ Milsons Point outside Luna Park, there are no shops, and if Luna Park is closed, as it doe's weekdays @ 3pm, there's nothing much there, except the Sydney Olympic Pool. The ferries that serve this short route do not have cafe on board. But all have toilets and washrooms.They run very strict to time and while the harbour has a lot of water craft, the ferries travel well and safely and you can be assured staff are friendly and helpful.The ferry terminal @ Circular Quay is well signposted so you know exactly where to go for your destination.Ferries go to Taronga Zoo and Watsons Bay and other destinations and are a great way to get around. Highly recommended and for Australian Seniors only $2.50 ticket all day for Sydney trains, buses and ferries to go anywhere.
Scenic trip. The Manly ferry was great, plenty of seats and spectacular views of the harbour, great value for seniors.

Ferries do a great job. I had never experienced a ferry system like the one in Sydney. What a great way to travel around! Our first experience was with the Hop-On Hop-Off ferry which offered a nice introduction to the area. There are so many ferries available all going to different places. The choice is yours. Signage is good and prices are reasonable. Ferries seem to stay right on schedule.You really miss something if you don't go somewhere on a ferry. The trip to Manly was one of our favorites and was on a huge ferry. Other ferries are quite small. Something for everyone. A must do while in Sydney.

Economical and a great way to travel. On a nice day, this is the way to see Greater Sydney. From Circular Quay, the most famous sites Sydney has to offer are a ferry ride away, and not expensive. For all day trips with ferry, consider a day pass

could not fault. could not fault the ferries or the ferry service i.e.timings of departures etc. I have mentioned in a previous review that if you use the local buses,trams,trains and ferries it is a MUST to buy a multi-ticket. In Feb 2014 the price was $63.00 AD - which believe me is not a lot when you consider you can even got to the blue mountains, Manly, the zoo etc. The travel to mall these places is included in the 1 ticket.

Most likely one of the least expensive tours. We took the Sydney Ferry from Circle Quay to Parramatta, a trip that takes you all the way through Sydney harbour, under the Bridge and then up the Parramatta river. Total time about one hour. Check the departure times ahead because there is only one departure per hour. It is a beautiful ride with great sightings. Parramatta itself offers some nice walks and the buildings in Church street give you a feel that you go back to the 30's. And if you want you can take the ferry back to Sydney or take the train. Overall a wonderful package that only sets you back about AUS$ 14 per person. A price that cannot be beat by any other tour operator.

Water Views. To get a good view of Sydney from the water, I would recommend taking a RiverCat ferry up the Parramatta River. I got on the ferry at the Sydney Olympic Village at 5pm, so I got to bet the crazy traffic back into Sydney plus got excellent views from the water.

Good service. The Sydney Ferries are a great way to get around the Harbour. There are many different ferries available from cats to the older style, all good. There are hop on and hop off ferry rides available and the ferry to Manly is a really enjoyable ride.
Easy to figure out way to travel.. Locals very helpful in letting us know docks of certain ferries. We primarily traveled between Darling Harbour and the Circular Quay, bough the walk is easy.
great!. Very punctual and good services. The map and people are very helpful as well. With this, safe up a lot of walking and at the same time can see all the attractions bin Sydney!

Easy to take for a weak tummy. Since I am not good in motion I was quite worried I would be sick, however, sitting and standing outside on the deck I enjoyed the trip and the scenic views without any discomfort. It is quick and unless there is really bad weather, quite a smooth ride.

Best way to tour the harbour. We took several of these during our 10 days in Sydney -- mostly as part of our 1 week travel pass (a good bargain). Lot's of camera opportunities. With the pass, since we were staying in Surrey Hills, it was a quick walk to Central Station, a quick train to Circular Quay, and then right on to the various ferries.

Took a Ferry to Manly Beach. Very clean, organized and comfortable. Room for luggage and bicycles. The ferry had free wi-fi and also had restrooms. The ferry terminal was very organized and the ferries were always on time. No complaints!
Manley ferry. Brilliant value for money - especially the ferry to Manley so cheap compared to what you would have to pay in England for something similar.
A great way to travel. Sydney Ferries go all over Sydney Harbour so they are a great way for people to commute as well as taking overseas visitors for a Ferry Ride to see the wonderful place we live!

All types of sizes and services. From a modern catamaran to an old rusty monohull, there is a ferry for every taste and budget. Get on the water and view Sydney from a different perspective. There are so many choices that you can't go wrong.

A stress free way to enjoy Sydney. The traffic is getting worse and you need to give more time for a trip to the city but the ferries givea more enjoyable option in far less time - a trip from one of the harbour terminals only takes minutes but it gives you all the side benefits of stress-free, being a tourist on a business trip to the cbd and no need to worry about car parking when you get there.

Nice Ride and View of the Horbour. On our recent visit we took the ferry out to Bondi Beach and enjoyed the ride. Great view of the harbor and good way to get around in Sydney. The ferries run pretty regular and we had no problems. Would definitely do it again.

Great way to see the harbour and rest after walking all around downtown.. Easy to find. Great way to get your bearings if you don't know the city. Pleasant and relaxing to watch the city float by you and to get a feel for the different neighbourhoods.

Cheapest Harbour Tour ever!!. Take the Manly Ferry goes right past the Opera House out towards the Heads. It is one of the longest rides but worth it. If you are a Senior its $2.50 return!! Great views of the Bridge on the way back.
great transport. Great service and good way to see the harbourFerries were frequent and on time.Seniors day ticket great value at $2.50

Offer visitors discounts for using multiple transport systems. Used the ferry service from Circular quay to Darling harbour a few times but found $6 one way each person a bit steep, we walked it a few times, but due to bad weather opted not to do it again, Ferries were always on time though and very professional. We did a sydney sight - seeing bus tour out to Bondi as well so for 40 dollars each its a pity you did not get any discounts for using the other public services like the ferries....
Great way to See Sydney. Great value and a great time on the ferries. Nothing like a ferry ride to see a town. We rode all over on the ferries

had to wait 4 hours for a ferry. Arrived at the ferry wharf on time with a ticket. Wasn't allowed on the Rivercat because I didn't have a "boarding pass". I was the first passenger to arrive at the wharf and yet they didn't give me a boarding pass upon entering the wharf or when they walked around giving boarding passes. Since when did you need a boarding pass to get on a ferry when you have a ticket?Next ferry was 1 hr later. I didn't get a seat on that one because the boarding pass they gave me was the wrong colour. Next ferry 1 hr later, I had the right boarding pass, the right colour but the ferry was full. Finally got a seat on the next ferry 4 hrs after I should have got a seat. Hence I had to wait 4 hrs for a ferry. The people on the wharf saw me with these issues, just laughed and didn't care. Typical public servants alright. Never again.

27 ferry systems!. Must be one of the best ferry services anywhere. Very efficient, take you almost anywhere in the harbour, for reasonable fee. There are also "water taxis", small 16-person ferries that will pick you up at any time and drop you off at designated spots.

Great service. Whilst in Sydney, it is a must to travel somewhere on the ferries! We went on them 3 or 4 times--to Manly Beach & to the Zoo. Very nice trips, of course great scenery & if you are a Pensioner it only costs $2:50 for a day trip ticket, with which you can travel on bus, train, tram & ferry as far as the Blue Mountains or Newcastle! We found the ferries to be clean, punctual, & a very comfortable way of getting around the Harbor!

best way to see harbor. as i said on other review of the harbor, this is the best way to see the harbor. Relatively inexpensive. was also fun to see all of the local commuters using the ferry instead of their cars.
relatively cheap and easy to use. Just walk up to the pier, buy a ticket to where you want to go and jump on. Simple. Then sit back and enjoy the view from inside or out

Manly. OK so the parking in Manly is diabolical, but the atmosphere is still that of the Tweed and other iconic beaches. The fast ferries will carry you to the city in comfort and with speed... but the Manly ferry is a must....she rolls and rumbles to the big swells coming through the Heads, or sails sweetly in calm weather....catch her over to the city for a night at the House, then sit out the back (take a shawl or coat) and watch the lights as they recede - special occasion, or just an addiction, the Manly is one of the world's must do ferry trips.Other ferries take you around the Harbour seeing it from all angles, you can spend the day on the Ferries and just drink in one of the world's Great Wonders.

Best way to see the harbour...... Sydney Harbour is what mkes Sydney so special. The ferries provide a wonderful and unique way of seeing all its glory and its nooks and crannies. Should definitely be included on anyones itinerary. If you are visiting during cruise ship season you will likely get to see some of these gigantic ships up close at Circular Quay.

Great value for money. I purchased 2 x 24hour ferry tickets for $23 each and my wife and I spent a great day sightseeing from the river. Three hours in Manly then off to Paramatta for a couple of hours. We finished off with a visit to Darling harbour and were really impressed with the enjoyment we obtained for such a small outlay. If we had been Australian citizens we could have done the complete trip for $2.50 each. That must be the best value for money tourist ticket in Sydney. The ferries are reasonably comfortable, for a boat, and very efficient offering inside and outside seating. A fantastic advert for Sydney tourism. I would definitely do the same again.

Cheap and quick way to take in the views. With just one day in Sydney, we did a lot of walking and it wasn't until late afternoon that we wondered about a boat trip in the harbour. We were too late for any of the pricey tours, so we decided to just jump on a ferry at Circular Quay.For the princely sum of $6pp we were treated to those classic views of the Opera House and bridge from several different angles. We also got a close-up look at Luna Park and several different views of the Sydney skyline before arriving at Darling Harbour. We'd made two or three stops along the way, which made the short trip (20 mins?) more interesting.If you don't have the time or don't want to splash out on a full harbour tour, the ferry is a great way to see the iconic views of Sydney and take in that different perspective that you always get from the water.
efficient.. busy area on Circular quay - easy to get confused what ferry, and how much. Having said that - the experience was good, on our ferry to the zoo, and also to Manly.
Lovely way to see Sydney!!!. So relaxing on the water to see Sydney sights and a cheap comfortable way to travel Most people very orderly and considerate!!

The best sightseeing value!. The Sydney Harbour ferries are a utilitarian operation designed to move people efficiently around the city, but they are an inexpensive way to see a huge amount of the city from a truly unique perspective. We enjoyed just "riding the ferries" using our travel pass to just select a destination and hop on a ferry and go. Sometimes we would go for lunch -- hop on the ferry to Parramatta and have lunch at the riverside restaurant and marvel at how we had gone from the wide expanses of the Harbour to the tidal weir on a narrow river in the space of 45 minutes.Hardy high class, luxury travel, but a lot of fun and a great way to visit both the hot spots, and some neat out of the way locations. And yes, as some other travelers have noted, the Aussies tend to be a pretty courteous and friendly lot which makes the trips even more fun.

Good way to see the City. You get to see the key visitor attractions for a fraction of the cost of the tourist boats and they are much more frequent. Although you do not get any commentary, most of the information is available in a cheaper guide book so having paid for a 24 hour pass (actually less than 8 hours) on a tourist boat and taken a few trips on the ferries, I would definitely recommend the Sydney Ferries instead and spend the extra money on a nice lunch somewhere!

water travel. best way to see Sydney and the harbour and so cheap being a pensioner only $2.50 for an all day ticket? I just can't believe that one could travel on the ferries all day for that price and see so much,ten out of ten

A family getaway. We travelled with our adult children and parents in their 70's. It was easy to get tickets (the que was long but what can you do) and boarding and disembarking was not a problem. People were respectful of our aging parents who both walked with sticks. The ferry was clean and we were able to sit inside or stand outside. The scenery is spectacular.

Public Ferry Journeys. We used two ferries out of Circular Quay.The Manly Ferry and the Darling Harbour Ferry. Both provide great views of Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera house at very modest cost whilst also providing transport to Manley Beach and Darling Harbour with its Museums and many cafes and bars etc Each journey around 30mins.

Great but don't come often enough.. The Sydney ferries are superb but they don't actually come often enough and they don't for some reason, travel between the north shore of the harbour and the south shore until you get to the area around Circular. Two great little extras are that you get free wifi on the larger ferries and that on the smaller ones, as long as you avoid Circular and Darling, you don't actually have to pay. Ding, dong!

A visit to Sydney is not complete without a Ferry experience. Buying your ticket on line will help you avoid of the ridiculously long queue that is made sometimes. It dos walk quickly though.Regardless your destiny, any ferry journey will give you a completely different perspective of the city that you must try!

JUST DO IT. The old ferries of Sydney are iconic , a symbol of this great city and used daily by hundreds of thousands of commuters. They leave from circular quay and can go to all parts of Sydneys Northern shores. On a clear day you can lose your head in the beauty of the harbour sitting outside on a ferry deck soaking up the sun and sights. I recommend this trip whether it be to Manly where you can take a stroll down the esplanade and end up by the beach where an abundance of good restaurants awaits you or just over to the North shore where a great view of the bridge and opera house can be viewed.

Used the ferries for day trips to Manly and Parramata. great service on the ferries. Only hitch was the we didn't know until the stop before Parramata if we were going to land there, due to tidal flow of river

Love the ferries a chance to chill out and enjoy our beautiful views of the harbour. It was an awesome experience very relaxing - only thing that is a bit of putting is the homeless people very disturbing sight.

Unforgettable journey. Spectacular views of the whole Sidney harbour from these ferries. They are the perfect option to know better all the city. Also you can get to other location near to Sidney, without be in the middle of traffic jams.

The absolute best. My experience is that they arrive and depart on time. Excellent indoor and outdoor seats. Clean, high back seats and there is also fast cat service if you need to get in or out of town quicker. Super safe and efficiently operated. Commuter times are super busy. No better way to commute anywhere else in the world if you ask me than on a Sydney Ferry Boat!
Cruise the harbor. We went on the harbor cruise, but didn't do the hop on - hop off. Took about two hours and it was fun to see the little towns/ beaches. Would highly recommend it.
sydney ferries are wonderful. go on as many ferries as you can it is a wonderful way to see Sydney get a day pass.....and you must go to Watson Bay
You have got to give them a go. Very well organised, planned and very impressive. Once you have found the layout of the terminals, staff very helpful and pleasant.
Brilliant ride across the locations. Brilliant ride across the locations , mainly the Ferry to Manly. the views in the ocean are brilliant against the backdrop of the harbor Bridge

Ferry to ride. An easy to use system ,allowing tourists an easy option to visit great sights of the city. Value for money using the all-day ticket. Giving you access on ferry, train and buses.Staff are also there to assist for best options for your travels. We opted to travel by ferry from darling harbour to circular quay disembarking at Watson Bay. We had a few bay stops in between allowing us to see different sights of the Sydney Bay.

Ferries. What a wonderful way to travel for a tourist….By water.There is an abundance of forms of water transport,from private water taxis to municipal ferries.Try the Coffee trip round the harbour,good value and a good way to see Sydney and surrounding area.
Comprehensive. I'm simply in awe of the scope of this operation. Cheap and acceptably fast transportation on a reasonable schedule. And on clean, safe vessels. Nice
Manly Beach. For a few dollars you has a nice trip by boat for half an hour. The ferry drive through the whole Port Jackson so that you can see some of the different bays.Very nice!

people movers extraordinary. these ferries are so efficient and reliable that I think that all travel companies could learn from them-however the actual rolling stock leaves a lot to be desired-scruffy seats and smelly toilets anyone?

Best way to Travel in Sydney!. We were staying in West Ryde and I did drive in to the city centre a few times, but I have to say the Ferry was much more pleasant and relaxing. You can buy an all day ticket which lets you use the ferries / busses and trains for 24 hours and we found this to be excellent value for money and the views along the way from the ferries....well what can I say BREATHTAKING. we parked at Kissing point and went to Darling Harbour / Circular Quey and from there to Manly. Used this service on a few days to go to different places, The Rocks on Market day was great and even after all my shopping I had a lovely ferry trip back to kissing point and then drove 5 mins to home. Oh and some of the Pics we took from the ferry were amazing......couldn't have got them any other way. xxxx
Best way to get around!. Great service, opportunity to see all sights. Much cheaper that any land transportation. Amazing view.
Nice and Reliable. Very reliable way of transportation ,also it is the best to see a lot of Sydney attractions.it is cheap and lot of fun.
buy an all day ticket $23. buy an all day ticket, allows you on the trains and ferries all day. we done the zoo and then up to manly. a cheap way to see more of sydney
Fabulous ferries. Good, efficient, cheap way of doing a cruise and still able to see all the sights. Went from Sydney Harbour to Darling,although it's not far, but also went to Manley as well.

A great ferry ride. i had little time and hopped on to a ferry at darling Harbor . Changed at Sydney Harbour to a Manly ISland ferry at 8pm and had a wonderful trip enjoying the breeze on the open front deck and the fabulous view of the Harbor bridge and Opera House all lit up at night
Excellent.. What a great service, would recommend to anyone. Very reliable and great helpful staff. Excellent way to get around.

Great views.. These busy green and cream ferries can take you to various places cheaply around one of the most beautiful cities in the world. Views on a sunny day, are gorgeous. Especially recommended, is the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly.

Fast Efficient and a great way to see new Neighborhoods. WE used the ferry to Many and then from the Olympic Stadiums back to Circular Quay... If we had more days I would have taken more ferries to more places. They are incredibly efficient, fast, clean and offer views you cant get any where else. Carry a warm jacket and your camera!

Gorgeous!. Must do while you're in Sydney - such an affordable way to see the sights. I suggest taking the ferry at night when the city is lit up so beautifully. It can get a little chilly with some mist from the harbour so you may want to bring a light jacket or hoodie (I didn't plan ahead so was freezing - but it was still very enjoyable).
Wonderful. A fantastic system - so easy to use and the staff were so helpful. Cost efficient a wonderful system.

Economical to view Sydney skyline and Opera panoramic views.. The Sydney ferry is cheaper than tourist ferries, offers the same view of skyline and opera house. Plus it saves time as the ferry is frequent.
Cheap way to cruise the harbour. What better way to see Sydney than to hop on a ferry and cruise the harbour. Stunning views and great atmosphere. Hop on and off where you want to.

Excellent. The green and cream government Ferries at Circular Quay are a sight to behold very majestic..They run to most of the beautiful bays around the harbour and are cheap to use...very efficient and run on time....the best are the Parramatta run up the scenic Hawkesbury River which takes an hour and the other trip we enjoyed was the half hour trip to Manly,lovely place with safe sandy beaches and coves...take the coastal walk from the Wharf past the Sealife Aquarium..it's stunning.

Forget the advertised cruises. We bought a day ticket for the transport system, which cost $23, such good value. We took four of the ferries and saw most of Sydney Harbour. Particularly lovely are the trips to Manly and Watson's Bay. We also went to Parramatta which is a longish trip, three hours return but worth it so that you can see the extent of the harbour. The ferries are clean and punctual. Staff are helpful and polite. Add to this the fact that you can use the ticket to travel on buses, trains and the light railway which will take you to the Blue Mountains, Newcastle and beyond. Excellent value. Weekly passes work out even cheaper so if you plan to travel Sydney use them! Take the ferry to Watson's Bay, have a wander then take the bus to Bondi Beach, follow the cliff top path to Bronte, Clovelly and Coogee...yes Bondi is a large sweeping bay but the others are so much better.

Very reasonable. We travelled on a couple of the ferries, the last one, was to Manly, 25 minutes across the harbour. All were reasonably priced, the ferries themselves, were clean and ran on time.I great way to get around.
Great way to see the Habour. We hopped on the Manly Ferry and got great views of the Harbour; return journey approximately 90 minutes; it's a great way of escaping the City

By far the best way to travel in Sydney. By far the best way to travel in Sydney - which otherwise has a pretty shocking transport system - the ferry was always a pleasure to get to places... It's relatively cheap, and there are bulk/week pass options to make it cheaper still. Seeing the city from the sea as a tourist was actually a great way to get an appreciation for it, and I imagine that as a commute it would have to be amongst the best! We used the ferry regularly to get to and from Circular Quay from Cremorne and Mosman, and chose to go other places simply for the ride...

Easy Peasy. We love how walkable Sydney is! The trains, the buses and the ferry are all easy to figure out and come often, I don't think we've waited more then a few minutes for any. There are a lot of friendly staffers you can simply ask for direction - just head to the ferry, bus or train and ask -I recommend the week pass - you can use on all transportation for 60.00 AUD. Worth every penny.
multipass. the one week multipass is a must have,we used it all the time .Mistakes or wrong directions are with no matters
A cheap way to see the sights and visit the suburbs. Quick efficient and relatively cheap ferry services that take you across the harbour. You get to see all the sights and a lot more.
Sunset trip. Do the trip to Manly, enjoy a drink at Hugo's next to the pier, and then board the ferry back to Sydney around or better shortly before sunset, it's beautiful!

Great value. Instead of joining the cruise, get on to Sydney ferries. It is a economical view the view the harbor and the Opera house. I took the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbor. It was a scenic trip on budget. But, the view is priceless.

An excellent and unique service!. I was travelling from Melbourne to Sydney only for two days and found this a very fun and unique experience. When travelling towards to the Opera House its very scenic indeed.
Easy Stress Free Travel. So easy to get around, look up on the boards to see where you want to go, which dock to go to and what time ferries leave. Staff there to assist you if required.
Great way to move around Circular quay and Darling Harbor.. Great service, perfect to experience the Sydney Harbor, on-time and with free-wifi on-board, very good pricing.

Be careful with return times. The main Manly ferry is a great sightseeing trip with free wifi on boad (take not all the big Sydney Hotels) but the last ferry return from Watsons bay is 4pm (so dont get a return ticket as you will need to get the bus back)

Best value in town!. For everyone who plans their first visit to Sydney, I give them one piece of advice: buy a one-day My Multi ticket. This ticket not only gives you access to the subway trains, but it also gives you first-class rides around Sydney Harbour (Cockle Bay Wharf, Darling Harbour, out to Manly, etc.). Save the hundreds on paying for a cruise, and simply ride the ferries all day and into the night!
Ferries. Great for a ride and getting around. Not too expensive, all seem frequent say every half hour and operate from Circular Quay

High class public transport. I use the ferries for transport whenever I get the opportunity. The journey is so much more pleasant than the train or bus, with the backdrop of Sydney Harbour and the opportunity to get fresh air if seated / standing outside. My kids absolutely love going on the ferry.The timetable is reasonably reliable, and there multiple routes offering access to many harbour side suburbs. Whilst more expensive than other transport, the opportunity to sightsee should be fairly motivating if your journey is served by one of the ferry services.
Taronga Zoo. It was a nice day.Opens about 9am, closes at 5pm.To look at everything you need a full day there,Morning Ferry takes about 1/2 hour to get to Taronga.Afternoon Ferry takes about an hour.

Run like clockwork. We loved to ferries. We zipped up on deck to see the view as we travelled from Darling Harbour up to Manly. Going across the harbour mouth was spectacular. We couldn't understand, however, why the wedding party had chosen the Q Station as a venue!
Great trip. I had never been on a ferry before and the trip to Manly was great we got to sit up stairs and the seats were very comfy and the view was great.

Great and Cheap way to Get Around Sydney. Loved the Ferries.Easy to access to all the attractions in Sydney and at a reasonable price.They have regular departure times and easy to hop on and off at any spots.

cheap way to travel. They may be old fashioned but it gives them character. What a great way to travel around Sydney. Good access to Homebush for concerts, the zoo, Manly beach and Luna Park. Cruising has never been cheaper.

faster means to reach some places. Definitely a faster means of transport to reach some of the places when compared to taking the road from circular quay, you can also find some WATER TAXI's. You will get a Great view of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and all high rise around. time to take Ferries is during peek hours to escape from the traffic on roads....

Ferries from Sydney. The Manly ferry is a must. Similar to the Staten Island ferry in NY. Good to get to Manly beach and eateries and great on the return for the best views of Sydney harbour bridge and Opera House - breathtaking! Sunday with kids is really cheap fare. Ferries to many other locations around Sydney including Tarronga zoo.
Captain Cook. We had dinner on the Captain Cook while it cruised around Sydney Harbour the food was very good and the photo opportunities were plentiful.
Nice trip to Manly. Well run and timely. A nice way to travel to Manly with some great views along the way. The cafe was closed when I went so I cannot comment on that.
Good views. Took the ferry to Manly - a real inexpensive highlight of our trip to Sydney for the great views of the harbour, bridge and opera house. And Manly isn't bad either!

Great service, great views.. Sydney ferries operate several routes in and around the harbour. Not just a way to get around, but a great way to see Sydney and take some photos.There are a variety of pass options, including a 'MyMulti Day Pass' for $23 which allows you to ride ferries, trains, busses from the time you purchase it until 4pm the next day - a great deal, and a great way to relax after a long day of walking around.
Great way to see Sidney Harbor. We had Sidney transit passes . Boarding and travelling was easy and Quick. We even had one of the ferries wait and re-extend the boarding ramp as we ran down the dock.

Cheap way to get the best view of sydney. Cheap compared to tour boats. Took ferry to toronga zoo and Manley. Both trips got seats facing the view. At the weekend it was fun watching the sailing boats dodge the ferry.
prompt timing. used to live in sydney and went to work on ferries - reliable and clean- gets busy but is a very cheep way to see the harbour - especially if you go to manley for the day

Enjoyable,scenic river trip. We took the ferry at the conclusion of our Blue mountain tour. We were able to see close up many of the iconic structures in the harbor including the Opera, Harbor Bridge,and Cruise Ships.

Great way to travel and see the harbour. On our recent visit to Sydney we got the one week MyMulti 2 passes which allowed us to use most of the ferries, buses, and trains throughout Sydney. We especially enjoyed riding on the Sydney ferries. We were on them every chance we had. They give a great view of the harbour, especially the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. We even made a special trip at night so that we could see the city lights. In all the trips we took on the ferries we never felt crowded. We enjoyed sitting outside, but when it's too hot or when it's raining there were plenty of seats inside.
