Good deal for pensioners. We liked the regular service from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay I.e. every half hour.Also the cost for a Pensioner of AUS$2.5 each for a days travel all the way round the harbour and out to Manly Beach and return.
First Class Service, though a bit expensive.. Have made good use of the ferries once again but expensive - you need to carefully balance out 3/5 tickets v paying as you go.
Fun time. Sydney ferries are good to travel on, some may be a bit old but it's a great way to travel & see the different waterways.

getting around sydney. The ferries are probably the best way to see sydney harbour from the east, manly and watsons bay out to parramatta, passing by olympic park. Oldies can get a daily excursion pass for $2.50 which covers all modes of transport - bus, train and ferries for the one price. Great value. You can get off at any of the ferry stops have a look around and then wait for a ferry to pick you up and continue. A great way to spend a day or so.

Easy to use. We took the ferry to Manly (and back) for dinner one night during our stay and it was very easy to use. It was also inexpensive. The journey from Circular quay takes approx. half an hour.
great. These ferries are excellent value, we are Western Australian seniors and we were allowed the seniors discount. We went to Manley, a lovely trip on a very clean ferry
City taxi. It is always very interesting to see how people get around in cities. These huge water taxis are a great form of transportation.
Nice Boat. We took the ferry to Manly beach and it was very nice. Left on time both coming and going. Beautiful scenery enjoyable cruise to Manly.
Ferry to The Zoo. Ferry On Time every time. The ride from Darling Harbor to the Tonga Zoo was smooth and gave great views of the Opera House and the Bridge.
What a ride. Brilliance day out see the Rich and Famous homes as you past over the Harbour, it was a large ferry a little rough over the heads but what a lovely way to see the Harour

Great way to get around Sydney. Just loved the easy access to the ferries from the Circular Quay. Reasonably priced for rides from Sydney over to any of the bays and towns further away. Sailing regularly and very reliable. Took the ferry over to Manly one night and to Toranga Zoo on another.

A Pleasant Surprise!. To our pleasant surprise, and for one price for a 7 day period of 'on-off' privileges, 'The Sydney Ferry System' connected the outlying regions of the city to its core and environs for us. We got on at one end of the city and met our friends at the other (they walked!).There are a myriad of styles of ferry craft, of every shape and size, from classic to modern. There are a number of these vessels plying the waters of Sydney Harbour concurrently and daily, with an ambling speed that the rider can enjoy either inside on chairs, or outside on benches or chairs. The views they offer of the city are spectacular, and well worth a trip just to enjoy that aspect. On our particular trip we used the ferries as a respite for our walks along the Harbour Front promenade; to visit friends in the suburbs; and just to sightsee itself!

Iconic Sydney. If you're not from Sydney, a ride on one of our ferries is a must. Even if you ARE from Sydney, ferry rides are a must. Whether it is to Manly or Taronga Zoo, the journey is always better than the destination. I caught the ferry as part of my study commute throughout 2013 and Sydney Ferries have impeccable reliability for a branch of public transport. I recommend sitting outside, its quiet, breezy and relaxing and you can really take in the views. There is indoor seating available in case the weather isn't perfect. There is plenty of room for prams and wheelchairs and the staff are always willing to help. There is just something majestic about the ferries that I can't describe until you try them. So try them!
Best way to see Sydney. We stayed in Manly for 5 days so used the ferry quite a bit. Definitely a must do, whether the ferry to Manly or the other way to Darling Harbour and further down!

Must do while here. Whatever your plan whilst in Sydney you must at least use these ferries. Its a great way to see the sights for a reasonable price. You can hop on and off at various places along the way or just stay on for a return trip whilst taking some photos.

Great way to see Sydney panorama. There are lots of ferries leaving from Circular Quai. Do not waste your money on one of the sightseeing tours, but hop on a regular ferry. Go to Manley, or ride to any other destination just for the fun of it. Great views from the water.

my favourite way to see Sydney. Sydney Ferries are used by locals and tourists alike. They are a relaxing and an efficient way to get from one part of Sydney to another. The Circular Quay area is home to most of the Ferries. Timetables can be found there. Large boards show the times of Ferries and what wharf to go to as well. On the Ferry, you can sit outside on a beautiful day, or inside if you prefer. Toilets on board. No food for sale on most ferries, but you can purchase beforehand at the many kiosks. The Manly Ferry is the largest and probably the most popular. Go with time to spare as there is often a queue to get on to one. Go to Watsons Bay for a meal and stunning view, Taronga Zoo, or head inland to Parramatta with the Parramatta RiverCat. Take some water in summer, a hat and sunscreen as our sun can burn you very quickly. Ferry trips are my favourite thing to do on our beautiful harbour, and I was born here! It is easy, cost effective, and most of all- Fun.

Wheelchair access excellent + friendly staff. We travelled to Taronga Zoo via train , ferry and bus. we found all three to be very easily accessible and the staff all were friendly and helpful.You do need to be aware that as the tide goes out the ramp to the floating wharf gets STEEPER !!

Here's a tip for senior tourists. There is no question that Sydney harbour is magic and a major attraction for visitors.You can take an expensive harbour/meal cruise or you can use the Sydney Ferry network.If you have a senior/pensioner card use the auto ticket machine and select the pensioner/Excursion button. You can travel the whole network for $2.50 for the day.If you are not a senior buy the Opal Pass-,$52 for unlimited travel for a week, still great value.Take the Manly ferry and walk around Manly, or take the Watsons Bay Ferry to visit that beautiful village. The Neutral Bay ferry takes 11 minutes and you can lunch or have coffee at Thelma and Louises cute Cafe ,right on the water with no walking effort. Or take the Darling Harbour ferry ,you can spend at least a day here.After a week here we have found the ferry staff friendly and helpful and the service most efficient.
HARBOR CRUISES. The ticket seller was very helpful and the staff were lovely on the Captain Cook tours. I haven't been on the regular ferries for awhile

Best Harbour, The worst Ferry service. As an Aussie taking international visitors to visit beautiful Sydney Harbour, I wonder how any international guests to our country could find there way around Sydney at all if they are utilisiing Sydney Ferries. Clarity of information - PoorFriendliness and Service - PoorEase of use of ticketing - a disgraceInformation provided by staff - wrong.If its tough for an Aussie visiting Sydney, how can we possibly make visitiors feel comfortable and welcome.

Take a Ferry to Manly for a great Harbor view. Take a ferry from circular quay to Manly for a great harbor view. If you are visiting Sydney for the first time or on a brief stay this is an absolute must do!
well run and good value. We used the ferries to visit Darling Harbour and also to go to Manley. The ferries are well run and give good value and stunning views on the way.

A must-do for visitors. Take a ferry to Manly from Circular Quay and then walk through the plaza to Manly Beach. You can just get a gelato or fish and chips, or walk all along the ocean's edge around to Fair Bower on a beautiful day. There are great eateries everywhere - you can't go wrong, then catch a ferry back to the city

Great public transport. We used the ferry to get to Doyles fish restaurant in Watsons Bay - the staff were really helpful. Try to get your ticket ahead of time if possible as the ticket office queue was long and slow.

Manly. we took the ferry to Manly, its cheap and takes about 35 mins or so. It is always busy and was crowded on both journeys.Stand outside if you can for the best views, on the sides so you can see the Zoo and Custom houses on the shoresDon't use the toilets! The ones at the destination in Manly are downstairs and pretty awful, wait until you find a restaurant where they actually care
Great way to get around. We used the ferries extensively on our recent trip and found them to be punctual and good value for money. All the staff were very helpful and courteous
I love this ferry. Go to Manly, the view is great, the ferry is confirtable and you get yhe best photos of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge from there.

Manly Via The Ferry. Great way to get around . We went to Manly by the ferry , can get busy so try to avoid peak times as you can feel a bit herded .Great way to top up your tan if you sit out on the deck and of course great photo shots of the bridge and Opera house and cruise liners moored up along side of the ferry terminal .
Manly ferry. Free Wi-fi. Manly to the Quay return is very expensive at $14.80. Don't eat at the seafood place near the beach (the one with tables on the mall) as it's expensive and the food is crap.

Take the ferry to Manly!. We'd been told to take the ferry to Manly, and really pleased we did. There's a fantastic view of the bridge and the Opera House from the water, and Manly was such a lovely area to visit.
Visit Manly by ferry. 25 minutes North of Sydney by ferry for $14.50 return, manly is a relaxing contrast to the hustle and bustle of Sydney.
Very good service. We travelled out to Watsons Bay and the service was very good, fast and efficient, for a very reasonable $12 return

Great Value for Great Views. We bought an all day ferry pass and did the trip to Manley, visiting Manley Beach and walking the town which was quite enjoyable. We also did Darling Harbour. The best thing about the ferries to us was getting all the views of the Opera House and the various cities from the ferry, not to mention how wonderful it was just to be on the water. I think this is one of the best values in Sydney. We could have added bus and local train transport to the daily pass, but we opted for just the ferry as our hotel was very close to the Harbour..
such a great way to travel. There is a large selections of places to visit on the ferries. At busy times there are queues to buy the tickets. But a great way of seeing around the harbour too.

Holiday of a Lifetime. Whilst on our holiday of a lifetime we stayed in Sydney we bought a 3 in 1 ticket for the Ferrys, Buses and Trains for 61 dollars per person for one week. Great value for money. You can buy these in the Visitor Information Centres or newsagents. The ferrys from Circular Key were so efficient and you can go to Manly and Bondi and other places. A truly great way to travel and to these places whilst passing the Sydney Bridge on one side and the Sydney Opera House on the other side each time you leave for these destinations and you can take some memorable photos of these landmarks. Fantastic.
Fast and easy way to travel. A great cheap way to see the harbour from the front of the ferries. Shelter inside if the rain or wind is too much.
Efficient. Very efficient service. I wonder why they can keep it so well priced. Perth could do with a service like this.

A great way to get around - but take a day-tripper to get the best value. This is a great way to get around the harbour. The fares are reasonable. There are crew people to help with the complexities of ticket buying. The ferries seem to arrive and leave right on schedule. AND it's all completely accessible.

Great service with ontime services. Took the ferry to Manly and Watsons Bay. Great service, ontime and fast. Thoroughly enjoyed our trips and the best thing was we didn't have to hassle with Sydneys traffic.
Well run and clean. Very helpful staff and overall well run. The Manly ferry is particularly nice with many great views and photo opportunities. Then you get to Manly, what a cool place.

Manly Ferry. We took the Manly Ferry on the advice of reviews from Trip Advisor, and we were not disappointed. The ferry was well maintained with adequate seating on the outside. The ride from Sydney Harbour and back afforded multiple photo opportunities, and Manly was quite picturesque as well. This was a great way to spend an afternoon.

Ferry to Manly. Great trip across to Manly. The ferry we got went directly across to Manly no stops, but there are a lot of ferries that make multiple stops and also go under the bridge. To see the Bridge from close up is awesome

The best way to travel. Easy, affordable way to get around Sydney and you get the bonus of the view, which is stunning.
It's a great way to get to Iconic areas like Darling Harbour and Watsons Bay etc.

Take the ferry to Manley. Sydney is an amazing city and this was our second time there. One thing we really wanted to do again was take the ferry to Manley, walk along the boardwalk to Shelly Beach, stop partway for a cappuccino at the little cafe, and have a swim in the rock pool. We did it all and it was as good as the first time.

The best way to enjoy the harbour. The ferries are the best way to experience the harbour and a day trip to Manly on the ferry is a must do when in Sydney. It's about 40 mins each way and the most wonderful 'ride' in the harbour, especially when you go past the heads. Be warned that on a rough day, you may get a little wet if you sit outside but that's all part of the fun. If you don't have enough time for Manly, then the Darling Harbour ferry is the next best option, and if you still don't have enough time, then at least hop on the Neutral Bay ferry. The Darling Harbour route goes across the harbour to Milsons Point and directly under the Sydney Harbour Bridge, so you get a chance to really experience the majestic size of its construction. The Neutral Bay ferry goes by Kirribilli House, and there's a great cafe at the Neutral Bay Ferry Wharf, with good coffee, delicious treats and fabulous views. You can also get some great photos of the bridge from almost any of the ferries.

Toot Toot!. I have never seen anything like these huge boats, from the old style to the modern catamarans, nonstop all the time going in all directions. A must is to take the Manly ferry where you pass the Heads arriving at the beautiful seaside town. Very exciting!

Only way to go!. Wherever you're coming from, get the train to Circular Quay, and hop aboard one of the gaily painted ferries so conveniently close on exiting the station; if there's a wait, it won't be a long one and there's plenty of excellent coffee houses from which to people-watch. If you have a specific destination in mind sometimes the cost of the ferry is included. Or if you're open to suggestions, get a day pass and wander at will. I travelled in from South Sydney, about 45 mins on the train but for $23 my ticket would take me on any bus, train or ferry until 3am the next morning! Most of the top attractions in Sydney are accessible from the sea, including Olympic Stadium half way down the river to Parramatta on a river cat. Kirribilli, a leafy suburb right under the bridge is 5 mins away - the whole round trip back to Neutral Bay and back to the Quay would be barely 20 mins. Go to Manley for lunch and walk the historic Corso and Steyne. Or Watson's Bay to sit on a glorious beach and eat fish and chips. Or get a take-out and enjoy lunch or dinner on board with an open sky overhead, dozens of water craft in every direction and the wind in your hair. Doesn't have to be junk food either. Plenty of healthy options close to the station. if you want something more active, ferry to Darling Harbour, visit one of the attractions there or have a look around - perhaps see the Chinese Gardens - and walk back to Circular Quay via The Rocks and finish with a wine or a meal in one of the myriad of restaurants, some with historic value. The Glenmore pub has a rooftop bar with great views - but don't go on a Friday night if you'd like peace and quiet! The logistics of keeping these craft criss-crossing this glorious harbour defies belief. Well done, Sydney.
Sydney Ferries. Great way to see the city from the Harbour. Look at getting a weeks passage that will allow you to travel on the rail system as well as the ferries.

Cute little ferries. A wonderful way to see the harbour, as well as useful transportation. The little green & gold ferries scurry about everywhere, with Central Quay very much the centre of operations. The small ferries are named after the ships of the First Fleet, the original transportation of convicts to Botany Bay.Much larger ferries take large numbers to Manly.Services are comfortable, frequent and efficient, and not too expensive. An all-day ticket will cost you $23, which includes trains and buses as well as the ferries.

The pulse of Sydney!. Whether is commuters or sightseers, the ferries are integral to travel getting to and around Sydney. The ferries are the preferred way to travel to the Zoo and Watson's Bay. Can't imagine going to Sydney and not travelling on the ferries.

A tremendous way to travel Sydney. With one of the truly beautiful harbours of the world, this is certainly the best way to see Sydney.It is quite economical and travel a pleasurevery efficient and reliable.It provides access to all focal points of Sydney, including some of the outer suburbs.Ideal for those wishing to avoid busy road travel or very high parking fees.The extensive and picturesque waterways make

Great way to see the sites!. It's easy - just buy a ticket and hop on board! You can get on and off at every stop (depending on the ticket you purchase) walk a bit, shop, eat and then get back on for a nice, enjoyable ride! Had a grand time seeing the harbor!
Excellent choice of transportation. Take the ferries instead of taxis. You enjoy the beautiful harbor view. They run on a very timely basis. No traffic. Just beautiful skies and fresh air.

great way to see and get aroundSydney harbor. This is a great way to see the harbor, and to get to another part of Sydney. The ferries run frequently, and the cost is very reasonable. It doesn't take long to get to any of the stops, even the far beaches. We were staying near the Central Quey, and could easily walk there and get around to other parts of the city on the ferry.
to manly. very simply, turn up buy a ticket and wait for your ferry, comfy and clean. whith some lovely views of the opera house as you return

amazing trip to Manley beach. catch the ferry from circular quay to manly for amazing views of the city and to see parts of the harbour you don't get to see from the city. try to get a seat on the outside of the ferry to enjoy the sun, you wont be disappointed. when you get to manly, take the short walk to manly beach for some fish and chips on the beach :)
lovely way to see the area, and get about. the main Sydney ferries are well run and frequent. we found that the competing faster ferry Circular Quay - Manly was a better choice when it was running.

Nostalgic. The ferries are great hop and and off anyplace u like a great way to travel round Sydney area far better than taxis . Very well signed as is everything in oz . Also super inexpensive which is also a bonus .

choose the fast ferry. The fast Ferry, that is the Sydney ferry company one. is brighter and cleaner than the larger ones. offers a free tea or coffee. drinks from the pay bar would have to be downed very quickly! The sydney ferry was cheaper than the others. Maybe it varies to the time of travel but certainly good value.

Fab way to get around and see Sydney - and free wifi!. Loved the ferries while we were in Sydney. The day travel cards you can buy are worthwhile if you are stopping at different places, we did Darling Harbour to Circular Quay to Manly one day. Also free wifi for 2 x 45min sessions which is handy when you're staying somewhere where the wifi is really expensive!
Ferries are easy and on time!. The ferry operation out of Sydney Harbour are easy and a great way to travel. Signs are easy to read and the ticket agents are right there to direct you if need be.

Such a good way to get about. We travelled on the Captain Cook ferry from the Sea Life centre back to the Wharf very reasonable. We took another from the Wharf to Manley also reasonable. These ferries run regularly and are such a good way to travel.

Excellent service. Wow. Sydney ferries operate an amazing service. Ferries are frequent, on time and really easy to use. All ferry staff - from kiosk to on ramp staff - were very pleasant. They will even put the ramp back on for you to get on if you are a tiny bit late! We used Sydney ferries a lot as part of our Multi Pass 3 weekly ticket - used the ferry to Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, Milsons Point, The Zoo, Manly, Watsons Bay, Sydney Olympic Park. A really nice, very economical way of getting around. Wharf electronic display boards easy to use, website easy to use to find out times and routes. An international first class service.

Fantasic!. What better way to see Sydney harbour than to do it by ferry. Tickets were quick and easy to get, not too much of a wait but do be quick if you want a nice seat up top on a sunny day. Seats go quickly.
Great way to get around.. The ferries were on time, clean and operated by friendly staff. A great way to get around and see Sydney by water.

Cruise To Your Destination. Public transport but a nice alternative if it is available. We were headed to Cockatoo Island so the ferry from Circular Quay takes you under the bridge and past Luna Park. I nice little adventure if you are new town.Don't expect the big yellow and green ferries on this run at the moment. You will get a variety of the more modern kind. One day we had a craft with the seats up top. If you are not worried about being blown about it is a nice way to look about.The staff are nice and helpful and available for all manner of silly questions.
Simple and easy to use. Sitting on the front deck was terrific. The views were terrific. Booking the tickets at Circular key was simple and straight forward

Beautiful. This is a beautiful and cheap way to see the coastline around Sydney. I met a lady on the plane over from San Francisco who said this was one of her favorite attractions. You can buy an all day pass and ride around and take photos as much as you want to.
Great way to see the harbor. We took a couple of the harbor tours and cruises. What a great way to experience the ambience of the entire place.
Awesome trip to Manly. Easy, reasonably priced! and free WIFI! what more do you need! :) oh and the site of the city is great!
Ferry Ride. We went to the Taronga Zoo and took a ferry from the Darling Harbor to the Zoo. It was amazing. You could see everything. Veeeryyy niiicee!
great. what a wonderful travel system. the ferry to darling harbour takes you under the bridge it took me days to stop smiling

Sydney Ferries. You can pay one rate for 24 hours and use the ferry system as often as you like. You can go to the zoo, aquarium, Sydney Harbour, museum, and many more. Well worth it. Or just sit on for 90 minutes and do the circuit.

Sydney ferry service. Absolutely brilliant! I loved it! Almost wherever you want to go you could take the ferry. As a pensioner, it only cost me $2.50 for a whole day and I could go all the way up to Paramatta if I wanted. The best thing you can do is to get yourself a ferry time table and then hop on and hop off to places like Manly, Taronga Zoo, Darling Harbour, Cockatoo Island and so on. Very convenient and so much fun to be on the water on a hot day!
Easy and realible. Times are easy to follow and precise. Even been December they were never to crowded. if you buy the weekly pass they are included (all but Manly Ferries)

Ferry to Manly great views of harbour. we came back at night and sat on the outside of the boat. quite cold but amazing view of the harbour, the bridge and sydney opera house!! i would imagine if you went on a scenic ferry ride that's what you would see!

Value and THE way to see Sydney.. These are working ferries & folk commute using them and by getting a few different ones (my fav is to Manly and back) you will have a real feel for the harbour that makes Sydney great.
Fast and efficient. Don't use an agent buy your tickets at the pier directly. There is wifi whilst in the harbour on the ferries. They are fast and efficient with no fuss.

A budget tip. If you would like to take a tour around the Sydney harbour and surrounding area, see the Harbour bridge and Opera house fromt he seaside without having to spend a lot of money for going on a cruise, simply buy a day ticket for yourself and the family to the regular Sydney ferries. The take you more or less the same places, without the guides and a small refreshment, but you get a great view of all the interesting sights from the seaside at a much lower price.We bought the family pass, which I believe was AUD 55,- for the family and spend 3-4 hours touring around Sydney and got the see all we wanted.So thumbs up to this way of seeing Sydney fromt he waterside.

A must do when visiting sydney. Hope on a ferry and go for a ride with the little ones. Sydney Harbour is beautiful and your kids will enjoy this as much as you. Its a cheap yet scenic way to get around.

Sydney Ferries. What a great way to get around. I wish other cities used their waterways as efficiently as Sydney does. Inexpensive and fun. The ferries are frequent and go to all the places a tourist would want to see.

Great way to see the harbour. On a Sunday we got the pass that was $2.50 per person for all day travel (family fun day). We spent most of the day just ferry hopping - a trip to Taronga Zoo ( did not stop there), to Cremorne (did the walk to Mosman), back to Circular Quay and then to Double Bay ( for afternoon tea and found an antique fair in a park). Would have done more but we were going to Lion King that night.

Ferries are fun way to get around, not always fast. Today we used the river cat to parramatta and whilst it took 1 hour 20 mins we got to see western sydney from a different angle and we loved it. Very gentle pace and plenty to see. The manly ferry is world famous but don't miss some of the others like a ferry to mosman bay or to cockatoo island (which is also marvellous). Not super cheap so look at multi tickets for a week if you are planning a lot of getting around Sydney and are staying more than 3 days.

Great way to see the harbour. If you buy a multi pass you can use it to get around to many of the harbour islands and areas. Manly is NOT included. Good to get on the water when the heat is getting to you!

Fantastic Ferries. Best way to get around and have a fantastic view of the city and landmarks while you are doing it ..... efficient, clean, friendly (funny at times) staff, economic, .... it is the only way to get around.

All aboard!. Only had a 4 day stay but the availability of the ferries and cruises makes it very easy to see a lot in a short time.We were particularly impressed by the Manly trip (very regular) and great views of Sydney on the return.Also did a Coffee Cruise, Evening Meal and to the Zoo with James Cook Cruises all worthwhile.

Convenient and inexpensive. Watching them from the 31st floor of our hotel as they buzzed around in Circular Quay I was amazed that there were no collisions!We managed to use the ticket machines on the quayside and took a couple of trips during our visit - one to Manly and another along to Darling Harbour which cost AUD$14 and AUD$12 respectively for an adult return.With decent weather we were able to sit outside most of the time and take in the views from the Harbour (and under the Harbour Bridge on the Darling Harbour boat). The breeze had got up on our way back from Darling Harbour and many people headed inside for shelter.Easy to use and good for a bit of sightseeing.

Not being a tourist!. This is one thing which I liked the most in Sydney. I didn't want to travel like tourist and wanted to enjoy as a local. Ferry is very inexpensive and one can access almost all the places using Ferry. I will highly recommend taking a ferry from Circular Quay to Manly.

Efficiency at its best - great way to see the harbour. we took the manly ferry on Australia Day. The harbour was totally congested and the ferries were having touble getting through but they still ran like clockwork. The sher number of people they can get on and off those ferries in such a short period of time is amazing, very efficient. It was a sunday and its family fun day on public transport which means for $2.50 a person you can catch any train, bus or ferry in the city. Fabulous value. The old ferries are fabulous and the views of the harbour amazing. I think it woudl get old wquickly every day but as a tourist its the best way to get around the harbour.

Great way to get around. I loved the ferry for transportation as well as to see the Harbor..actually thought the ferry ride was better than the guided Harbor cruise. If you are there a week or more see about the 7 day transport ticket that provides access to trains, buses and ferries..good deal. People are so friendly..it was a perfect stranger who told me about the tickets.

Great way to get around!. We stayed in Manly Beach and took the ferry in each day we visited Sydney. Much cheaper than a taxi and it offers a wonderful view of the Opera House and Bridge as it comes into Circular Quay. For visitors from the USA, the tix machines require a PIN code for credit card transactions.

Fabulous Ferries. Lots of ferries leaving so no waiting around.
On time.
Quick.
Very clean.
Great value.
Even better value if you have a Seniors Card.
Good way to see the harbour.
Great way to see it all. The ferry will take you all around the harbor for a resonable amount. We did the trip to Darling Harbor and also the one to Manly.

Sydney Daily Transport Ticket. Cost is $23 for a daily ticket which allows you to travel on ferries, trains and buses. The Sydney Ferries staff are most helpful about ferries and their timetables but cannot help you about trains and buses. You have to ask at the train ticket booth in the area opposite the Circular Quays ferries. Just past this area are the bus ticket sellers who can advise you about bus travelling around Sydney. Great way to explore Sydney if you don't have a car is to buy the $23 daily ticket. Bonus if you are travelling with a child on Sunday - your ticket will only cost $2.50.

Great Views, excellent for kids. My kids loved the idea of the ferries. We went on a day we had an all day pass on the trains (works for the ferries also). On Sundays this is a great deal for families! The views were remarkable and we loved taking photos from here. It is a bit windy on certain parts so take a light coat along (or stay inside, but with the views makes it hard to resist being outside). There was free Wifi on board and made the time pass even quicker.
Ferry good indeed. An ideal way to travel around this lovely city. I paid about 65 Aus dollars for weekly pass getting me on all trains, buses and ferries, which I thought was tremendous value

Ferry to Manly from circular quay. I took the ferry to Manly on Australia Day. Ferry can hold a lot of people and departs every 20-30 minutes. The Ferry I took, was about 30 mins, however there is also a fast ferry that takes 20 mins - not sure on cost of that one but mine was about $14 return.
Everywhere is Better by Ferry!. The ferries are a fun, efficient and scenic way to go everywhere! My favourite routes are to Manly, and from Watson's Bay to Circular Quay.

Sydney Essential. You cannot possibly visit Sydney without a ride on a ferry. For a day pass you can travel as much as you like on them. There are some gorgeous coves with restaurants or pubs to visit or lunch,.

Reliable, good value on a 7 day pass. We used these as a kind of water bus to get around Sydney, mainly from our hotel at Darling Harbour, to Central Quay. We also used them to Manly beach, the Olympic Park, and every where in between.A 7 day pass provides excellent value if you use them a lot. And it also includes use of the local buses too.Every ferry stop has an electronic board showing when the next one will arrive to put you at ease. They always ran on time, we're never full, and you get to see so much of Sydney.Free Wi-fi upstairs on most ferries was a bonus.Forget the taxis, use the ferries

Relaxing way to travel. Coming from Melbourne the ferries are a real novelty. Could there be a better way to get from A to B on a beautiful sunny Sydney day? Maybe not so much fun in the cold and rain, but what is?

The only way to travel in Sydney. For someone like me travelling on boats is something of a novelty, but in any event I really lie going on these ferries. They are a good way to see the sights round the Harbour and they are a quick way to get from A to B, especially when you take account of the traffic congestion.

Expensive but beautiful scenery to Manly. We thought going to Manly was a waste of time although the beach is lovely and the pine trees lining it unique. The Ferry ride was more enjoyable then the touristy town.

The only way to travel to work and to see Sydney Harbour!!. Take the big Sydney ferry for a slow ride to enjoy the harbour and take your photographs or jump on a fast ferry to enjoy a calm ride to work. Early morning ferry rides to work - almost don't feel like you are going to the office. A great way to destress and disconnect on the way home.

Best transport in Sydney. Easy and affordable way to see the sights even made the return trip all the way to Parramatta just to get a flavour of the area. Well oiled links to main attractions, beats the queues elsewhere. Don't go home without making at least one of the journeys, seeing the bridge and Opera House from the water is a must.

The best way to get around Sydney. They bring you everywhere for a few dollars. You got great views! Best way to get around the Harbour. I really don't know why you want a harbour cruise at one of the company's, when public transport is this great and affordable!

Don't take a taxi...take the Ferry.. On our 6 day trip to Sydney we took the Ferry multiple times to multiple locations.
Quick & scenic.
Skip the taxi ride (like we took before we knew better).
Not only is it pretty inexpensive, but you get a nice view & don't sit in traffic.
*Make sure you're on time...they leave on time.

Great. The river cruises are fantastic to get to different locations including Manly and Taronga zoo and see the sites of the harbour, well organised, well located and well run. Some evening cruises provide excellent facilities and dinner packages and are fun for all ages. Recommended if in Sydney.

Great way to see the harbour. We bought a week pass for all public transportation. It was well worth it since it includes the ferries. We went to Watsons Bay, Manly, the zoo and the maritime museum all by ferry. They are clean and convenient. Great way to see Sydney from the water.
Great way of Seeing Sydney. Get the Manly Ferry - its a great 30 minute journey with great views of the harbour and Manly beach is worth a visit!
Efficient service. Brilliant way to get around, good efficient services and on time too. Easy to book and reasonable price. Good way to spend some time sightseeing.

Sure and On Time. If you want to do a short and sometimes longer water tours of the Sydney area, take the ferries. They are reasonable in price and you can get several days worth of passes. They also run at night for some beautiful views of the lights.
Perfect services. Perfect services! Always on time! Good services by offering free wifi. Even the possibility to watch tv!! :-)

Do What the Sydneysiders Do, Ride the Ferry. So okay it was explained to me, like, a hundred times but I really didn't get it until I tried it out first hand. You just cannot beat the Sydney Ferries for both moving about downtown Sydney and for excellent waterfront sightseeing.As an American I am not overly given to riding public transportation but you just can't beat this system. For the price of about three trips you can get an unlimited all-day use pass which gives you as many rides as you like on the Sydney Ferries. Our first day in Sydney we took our rental car downtown, parked it in a car park (garage) for the day, and set out to explore. Soon, we were riding the ferry everywhere. Even better, our second day, we left the car at the hotel (in the suburbs) and just rode the ferry into town, then all over town, and out to Manly.The ferries are all clean and comfortable. At some peak riding times they can be quite full but mostly all day long there is plenty of room. And, they all DO run on time.Wherever you choose to board, you can purchase your tickets at the landing. Americans should probably understand that credit cards in Australia all come with PIN numbers (just like debit cards) so even after you swipe your credit card you are asked for a PIN number. You just say "It's a signature card" and they print a paper receipt for you to sign. At some of the ferry landings, you will find the only tickets are sold by automated machines that cannot handle "signature credit cards" but this is not a problem. It is OKAY to BOARD the ferry without a ticket, since you can buy a ticket once you are aboard from the ferry crew. And, they can handle "signature credit cards."The ferry timetables are a little complicated to read. Even though they are posted everywhere, at all the landings, on the ferries themselves, and in numerous brochures, it takes a few minutes of study to figure out when the next ferry will come by. This is not really a problem. You just wait at the landing and a ferry shows up, usually in the next few minutes. It is important, however, to understand that some routes are run on Saturdays only or not run on Sundays, so maybe a little time studying the timetables is worthwhile.We goofed up and, not realizing the ferry we needed back to our hotel ceased to operate early on Sunday evenings found ourselves stranded downtown far from our hotel. Still not a problem! The all-day pass is called a "my multi" and it works not only for the ferries but the trains and busses, too. After a bit of helpful advice we located the correct bus and simply rode back to our hotel that way. (What took us 12-14 minutes in our car took only 20 minutes on the bus. Not bad.)The only other thing you really need to understand is that downtown at the main station, Circular Quays, the ferries operate from several distinct wharves. Certain ferry routes sail only from specific wharves. We found our selves on the wrong wharf once looking for our route, but it was quickly figured out and the wharves are only a couple of yards apart.So take a clue: leave your reticence over public transit behind, skip the expensive tour tickets, and just buy a very reasonably priced all-day ferry pass. Go aboard, pull out your (free) tourist guide you pick up at the many information kiosks, and read about the famous landmarks you see as you pass them by. Or just soak in the view of this fabulous waterfront city from the harbor side view.
A great way to see the Harbour.. World class views of an outstanding city. There would be no better views than of Sydney from the deck of the Manly Ferry.

Get around town. The Sydney Ferries offer a great way to get around the Harbour and see other parts around Sydney. The best option is to get a My Multi pass which offers ferries, trains, and busses around the city. Taking the ferry out to the zoo or to Manly for lunch you will always have a spectacular view of the Opera House and the Bridge coming back to the Harbour so have your camera ready!

Brilliant Service. We used the Manly to Sydney ferry most days, what a brilliant service, reasonably priced and a ferry roughly every half hour. I would recommend everyone use the ferries, so much cheaper than taxis and very relaxing

My favorite way to get around Sydney. I purchased might we passed her $61 on all Sydney public transportation. This included the ferry system. There is no better way of seeing Sydney on the water for such a low price then the public ferries.You can get to almost any destination outside of the main city by using the ferries. I took a couple day trips to the zoo Manly Beach and other areas.Even if you do not go to any particular destination you should hop on a ferry to get a whole different you of the city and harbor.
Wonderful. The easiest way to get from Manly to Circular Quay is by ferry. How fortuitous that it is also a marvellous short cruise taking in the opera house and Sydney bridge.

Buy yourself a pass. ....and ride all of the ferries. I find myself choosing the ferry when a train or bus would get me there quicker because it is so relaxing to be on the Harbour taking in the sunshine and the salt spray.It is a great way to see the gorgeous coastline and visit many of the communities without contending with the traffic.

Ferries. The wolrd Ferries and Sydney are synonymous - you can hop on these to take you to all sorts of places in the locality. We used the Ferry a couple of times to go over to Manly Beach which is well worth a visit for shoppers and those who wish to frolic in the waves.
The only way to really see Sydney. Cheapest way to see sydney ....best views and value for money could do with better seating though :)
good schedule. With those ferries your can visit the whole terrain, easy to jump in a ferry and going downtown (other side) or to some special places.

Sydneys best attraction is the water. I love Sydney and love the waterways around Sydney, I love nothing more than travelling on the ferries, there is nothing better than a trip over to Manly for a nice lunch and then another ferry ride back again. A trip to Sydney is not complete without at least one ferry ride.

$61 for the week. Used the ferries instead of paying for a harbor tour. Thats the way to do it. met some awesome people. saw everything in the harbor we wanted to, and hopped off anytime we got hungry then right back on

Fantastic ferries. I loved that it's so easy to travel by ferry around Sydney. The ticketing process is quick and easy. On weekends if you buy a ticket on the ferry you can also use it on buses and trains. Since my ticket was a seniors, I am not sure if it applies to all tickets or not, but I was a happy person! It was a cheap day out, travel wise. The ferries are large, spacious, clean, comfortable and easy to get around. I also liked that you could get a snack and drinks on board.

Err! Water!. Sydney has one beauty: it's water. I really love taking the ferry from Circular Quay to anywhere in the city. It is easy and it is very nice. The last time I went all the way to Paramatta from Circular Quay. Almost a two hour trip all the way in the Paramatta river. Pretty nice way to see the city.
Great Value. Make sure you take the Ferry to see the harbour. Its' the best way to start your stay in Sydney. You won't realize how big the harbour is.

Relaxing journeys. This is a fine way to travel if your destination fits in with their itineraries and timetables.The Manly ferry was particularly enjoyable as it travelled from Circular Quay past numerous bays and headlands towards the harbour mouth.The only drawback is the fare structure. One way fare of 7.80 dollars for the 30 minute journey to Manly represent value for money but 6 dollars for the 10 minute journey to Cremorne Point is excessive.
Manley Ferry. What an excellent way to see Sydney. Get the slow ferry to Manley, see all the sights of Sydney and experience on of Sydney's fabulous beaches

Very convenient. Took ferries to Taronga Zoo and Manly. Easy to catch the appropriate ferry. (wonderful transit overall in Sydney)The one to Manly was a bit rocky for a portion of the route, but nothing major.

Public transport with a smile. If this is your first visit to Sydney do take a ferry even if you only have time for one ride across the harbour. The Manly ferry is a particularly good way to view the beautiful harbour and much cheaper than an expensive tour but you don't get any commentary. If your visit gives you plenty of time try the catamaran to Paramatta. I'm sure you will enjoy which ever ferry you choose and the staff are most often friendly and helpful.

The best way to see Sydney. Brilliant. This is the best way to see the harbour. Ferry tickets are not very expensive and allow you to see beautiful parts of Sydney from the water, that you otherwise may not see. I recommend the journey from Circular Quay to Manly.The only downside is navigating the timetables and ferry docks at Circular Quay, is quite confusing.
Easy travelling. Taking the ferries was one of the highlights of our Sydney stay. So inexpensive, easy to use and always on time. Made travelling between bays exceptionally easy, quick and fun.
excellent vfm. the ferries are an excellent value for money way of seeing the sights from the water - by day and in the evening
Great. This might be one of the most great ways traveling to visit Sydney. The trip indeed so pleasant. This is a great tourist spot and worth a visit.

Excellent Service. We used the ferries on 3 occasions and received excellent service on 2 occasions we went to the wrong terminal and our card was swallowed by the machine and on both the occasions the staff were very helpful and assisted us without us having to pay for new tickets. thank you

Ferry service is excellent. We went to Manly on the ferry and was excellent, Manly is fantastic and worth the day out, we also went to Parramatta on the ferry...... he ferry ride was again excellent with some great views but Parramatta was lacking in anything to do, excellent lunch at Westfield then decided to get the free shuttle to check out the RSL club, asked the driver where to get off and he said in a foreign accent "I don't know, press the bell when we want to get off" Well hello we are tourists (you could see that quite easily), we ended up seeing the RSL as we drove passed it and walked back, for us the Ferry Trip Brilliant and Parramatta not so, ferry may stop one stop before Parramatta due to tides and you buss from there.We stayed in Sydney 8 days and got a My Multi 3 transport ticket, this gave us unlimited access to all Rail, Ferries and Buses, cost was $63 each for the week and excellent value, you need a Multi 3 to get to Manly or Parramatta or pay the difference, visit the NSW transport web site for info and we used 2 phone apps, Moovit and Trip Go both work with GPS and give all the info and timetables you need
ferries. The Manly ferry was great. Except to many people that is my dislike.The price is good but for a person from interstate it can be confusing.

Enjoyable. I have done a ferry trip from Circular Quay to Paramatta which was pleasant. Manly ferry is the best way to have a good view of the harbour. Enjoy Manly attractions and come back. If you are visiting Sydney a ferry rid is a must to complete the tour.
Great way to travel. We travelled everyday to a different place during the seven days when we visited Sydney Manley is a great tourist spot and worth a visit.

Choose Captain Cook ferries. We had an amazing river cruise down the Parramatta river. Sydney is blessed to have both an amazing shoreline and an amazing riverbank line. The blue waters underneath and the refreshing wind was quite an experience.
excellant ferries. absolutely first class service. Very efficient and the ran like clockwork with friendly and efficient staff. If only London transport was like this!!!!

Great value and provides flexibility. Get a ferry, train and bus combination ticket and then you. An hop on and off all and very easily get around all of the city and beaches. The ferries are a great way of having a harbour tour at the same time
Easy travelling. This is a great way to see the harbour the way the locals do. The ferries are frequent, cheap and efficient and go to many places in the harbour.

Don't fret - ferry across to .... ... Tarnoga Zoo, or Manly, or Watson Bay, or travel up the Paramatta river. Boarding a ferry at least once during your stay in Sydney will make the city experience so much more complete. The docks may seem a bit crowded and chaotic at times, but it is all very well organized and easy to navigate, once you get the hang of it.
Very enjoyable. We went on a ferry trip to Watsons Bay, very good smooth journey and a lovely view of the bridge and the opera house. Would thoroughly recommend
Great Transport links. The ferry service is excellent. You can go to so many places from Circular Quay and what better way than across the water. They were always on time as well!

Manly Ferry trip. Sydney Ferries has a wide range of destinations but the one we went on was the ferry to Manly and back. The day we chose to go there happened to be an international cruise ship in harbour and it was utter chaos at the wharf. Ticket machines were blocked off, there was a massive queue just to get your ticket, then there was an even bigger queue to actually get on a ferry. Although not entirely their fault it did impact on our experience. However you could see on the other wharves things were running a lot more smoothly. If you get a decent seat you can get some fantastic views of the harbour, and they also provide free wi-fi onboard which we found very helpful :)

Fun to jump around and take. the ferries from place to place. On Sundays, I bought a family pass which allowed me to take the ferries everywhere. So take advantage on Sundays and use the ferries as much as possible. They seem extremely safe and organized with lots of ferries scheduled.
Ferry trips. We went to Watsons Bay to have lunch at Doyles Fish Restaurant.. Great timetable, clean ferries. Fast.

One for every occasion. I love the ferries....... We bought a My Multi for the week which covers all the transport in the city and boy have we used it...... C the ferries are great depending which one you take you have fantastic views of waterside Sydney and suburbs....... Definitely should be on a Sydney to do list...... At the top!

The best way to get around!. We stayed in Darling Harbour and found the ferries to be the best way to get around. We bought a 7-day MultiTicket and jumped on and off all the time. From the ferries you get some beautiful views of Sydney Harbour Bridge, The Opera house and the skyline.
Wonderful way to travel. Fast, on time and great service. Did a tour around the harbour and also visited the zoo. Take your camera

Ferry Service on time and very helpful. As a first timer to Syndey we were a bit intimidated by striking out on our own without an organized tour. The ferry service people were very helpful and we had no problem heading over to enjoy the day at Manly.

Sydney Ferries. While in Sydney, it will be a great dissapointment if you do not hop a Ferry for all over the Harbour sites. Visiting Manly is a must with its beaches and shopping precint. Daily tickets available and cheap.

Great...but not in summer holidays. The Sydney ferry service is fabulous - except in January! We have used the Parramatta River service many times when visiting Sydney to travel the Parramatta River. However, every time we have visited in early January, river cats from Parramatta are unable to cope with crowds and cannot pick up waiting passengers along the river. Don't miss out on the wonderful trip along the river ... just don't do it early January!
Great experience. We really enjoyed our trip, it was good value for money and worked like a well oiled machine. The views were, of course, wonderful !

Ideal transport. We were staying up in the Northern Beaches area, drove to Manly and picked up the Ferry to Circular Quays. Great service, very efficient, great value. Slight downside was the high cost of parking in Manly, A$28 for the day.

Convenient and Inexpensive. We loved the ferries. We rode them two days. The first under the bridge and to Darling Harbor area. The second day we went to Manly. Both rides are a great, inexpensive way to see the Harbor. We chose this over a dinner cruise.

TAKE THE MANLY FERRY. You will get to see it all. Manly is an interest place also but if you are staying there you must take the ferry over to Sydney. We were lucky the day we took it there were lots of sail boats out in the harbor. You pull into the Quey (ROCKS) right in the middle of all the great sites of Sydney. There is a free bus you can take that take you to the top of the gardens (nearby about 2 blocks) then walk through the Gardens back to the Ferry
Very very impressed. Used the ferries a fair amount during our short stay in Sydney. Easy to use, run very frequently to a lot of different places, definitely value for money.
Great way to get around the harbour. The ferries run quite often and are reasonably priced. It is easier to take the ferries to get to Circular Quay, Luna Park, etc, than to walk or take a cab.

value for money. Take a ferry trip from Circular Quay to Manly and have the best ferry trip in the World check out the Zoo on the way or take the best photos of the Sydney Harbor Bridge or the Opera House

Easy to see the sights. The ferries from Circular Quay are frequent, clean and user friendly.They are a great way to get the best views of Sydney Harbour and areas away from Sydney and very reliable. Fairly cheap and the best way to get to Taronga Zoo, Manly etc.

I love Sydney Ferries. Whenever I am in Sydney I do as much by Ferry as possible. All the routes are beautiful but my favourites are from Manly to Circular Quay or Parramatta to Circular Quay. You can see so much of the beautiful city and its so reasonably priced as well. A must do for anyone visiting Sydney.

Ferry. Great way to get around. Check out Captain Cook Cruises for a great deal to the zoo.
Be aware though that if you are NOT a NSW student concession card holder you will not get a concession!

Best intro to the City/Harbor. Dirt cheap, clean, and fun. We took our first trip to Manly then spent a couple trips just enjoying the ride before getting a cab or bus. All our trips were sunny and warm, which frankly also describes EVERYONE we met! I can't wait to go back to OZ.

Weekly Multitrip Ticket. If you are staying in Sydney for a week, then this ticket is a must. For $61 it gives access to all the ferries, all the buses in the Sydney area, AND the trains as well. Amazing value and allows you to get around the whole of the Sydney metropolitan area.

best day out ever!. I have loved these ferries for decades and the experience never gets old.
Do not be sucked into taking a harbour cruise- get yourself on the Manly ferry.
If the waves are choppy go and stand at the front so you get splashed when passing the Heads!

The best way to see the harbor. The ferries are the best way to get out there and see the tucked away beaches and the vast harbor that is a Sydney icon. Rather than pay big bucks for a Capt. Cook cruise or a Tall Ships cruise, that the Manly ferry for only $14.40 return and see the whole harbor as well as experience Manly (originally designed to emulate Brighton, England) with its beaches (Shelly Beach is very nice) and art gallery.

Super efficient and the best way to travel to many places. You cannot visit Sydney and not try the ferry ride, its very efficient and lets you get great views of the harbours and various bays from the sea. I noticed a lot of tourists were getting confused with the timetables and kept running around trying to find someone to ask. Best advice is to look out for the TV screens at each of the wharfs, see the destination you wish to go to, the timing and the wharf number :)

Parramatta Ferry - Fantastic experience and as cheap as chips. The Parramatta Ferry runs from Circular Quay to Parramatta and is serviced by a Rivercat which has loads of seats inside and maybe 30 outdoors in the bow in a reasonably large viewing area.Pick a sunny day when the breeze will cool you down and watch the skyline, millionaires' houses, Olympic Park sail by. Then, as the river narrows, there is plenty of birdlife to take in.If you are only going one way by ferry (and the other by train) would highly recommend doing Parramatta into the City as the queuing (lack of) system may be rather less chaotic.
A bit of a refurb wouldn't go amiss!. Reliable and cheap but hey it is time for some paint and outside and in and a little upgrade without losing the historical heritage eh?

Cheapest entertainment in Sydney. If you are in Sydney as a tourist, then the best, cheapest thing I can recommend is to take a ferry to Manly or Taronga Park Zoo. Its the cheapest thing that you can do and you don't even have to do "anything" else except enjoy the stunning views from the harbour and soak up the sun.
quick and official. We used ferries nearly every day we've been in Sydney. It is great way to travel and saves lots of time. It was quick and official.

The cheapest view. We enjoyed the trip from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay as we passed right under the Bridge and stopped at one or two places on the way. This good service runs about every 20 minutes.
went Manly. Ferry was very full, sat inside so not the best experience as it is always more fun out side, but was just to crowded being 1st Jan.

SUPER RELAXING AND VERY SCENIC.. Nothing better than a great summer day relaxing on a ferry ride to Manly beach.Spend a couple of hours walking around Manly and then hop back on the ferry for a trip back to the city centre.If you have kids you can also take a ferry to Taronga Park Zoo its well worth it.
Great way to see the Harbour. Efficient service and comfortable way to get to Manly. Also nice to get on the water to see the Harbour.

A great way to spend an afternoon. We loved the trip on the Manly Ferry and we spent the day there. Then we took the ferry ride to Parramatta but not so lucky as the tide was too low for the ferry to go the last 20 mins and we were transferred to buses. Check before you take that trip.

Great services which offer ecenomical trips. This is just such an economical way to tour all the areas around the harbour, regular services all over at a very economical price.
Great value.

Good views on the main buildings. If you have a ticket for the Sydney bus and train systems you can also use the ferries. It's a good way to see more of the town and most important buildings. It's relaxing for families, no walking all the time and you can hop off or on as you like it. Very enjoyable on warm days.
Scenic Transportation. The Sydney Ferries are very efficient and convenient to hit some of the Sydney highlights, such as Manly Beach, the Zoo (a must-see), sight-seeing, and many other places.

Ferries the way to travel. Yet again we had a great time travelling around Sydney on the ferries. They are on time, safe, easy to negotiate and great fun. The staff are amazing. This trip we went to Darling Harbour and walked the length of it, taking in the Christmas spirit. Brilliant.

Sydney Ferries has the best service. My recent trip to Sydney I was using Captain Cook ferries to go to Taronga zoo. The zoo was awesome but I went on a very hot day so I decided to cut the trip short and headed back to the ferry station. Finding out the next Captain cook ferry will come in roughly two hours later. Meanwhile I was waiting for the ferry at least four Sydney ferries left for circular quay. The next day went to Manly and took Sydney ferries, it was as quick and a lot cheaper too.

Fast Ferrie to Manly. Loved the the ferrie trip to Manly. Walked thru to ocean beach and spent a very pleasant couple of hours having lunch overlooking beach. A couple of hours exploring and then back to Sydney.

VERY WELL RUN!!!!!. While recently in Sydney for three nights, I was told I should visit Manly beach, so I caught the ferry from the terminal next to the Sydney Opera House.It was very quick and easy to purchase my ticket and find the correct ferry. Both ways ran exactly to time, and the trip gave perfect views of the city, Sydney Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge and the many beautiful homes along the shoreline.The price for the return trip ticket was very cheap as well!

Great View. Being in Sydney, we rode the ferry to Manly Beach and toTauranga Zoo. The main wharf is nice, giving easy access to all five terminal points in Sydney. The ferries were on schedule and for late transfers, they waited for us as we hop off one ferry onto another ferry. It's worth buying an all day pass to ride the buses and ferries.The ferries are two level with adequate seating on the insideand outside. The restroom are acceptable. The scene isbreathe taking so I would recommend definitely making itpart of your trip. We took our wheelchair and the ferryaccommodates it.
Great way to travel!. We used the ferries a lot during our stay in Sydney and loved them. The views were fantastic and the trip itself was really good. Not too bumpy even in choppy waters.

Good way to get about. Great ferries that take you to some interesting places including Manley and the zoo. Regular and efficient. Clean and great value especially if you get a season ticket. Preferred to walk to Darling Harbour but as I said a great experience and spectacular views of opera house and skyline.

Fun on Ferries. The Sydney ferries are excellent and such a good way to get around. The views every way that you look are stunning. This time in Sydney we got a bus to Watsons Bay and then later on got the ferry back.
Great - cheap way to see Sydney. Recommendable - cheap option to see Sydney from the waterside. On Sundays it's cheaper, but lots of people. Great way to see Sydney and its suburbs.

Sydney ferry. These are great ways to see the harbor and not spend much money. The trips are short or at least fast and the boats are comfortable enough. There are many going in all directions so everyone can find a trip they will want to do.

Convenient and easy to use...worth considering plus great views of the harbour. Loved the casualness of the ferries - the convenience, price and accessibility as well as the staff were surprisingly helpful given a public operated transport service
Great For Getting Around. Ferries were a great way of getting around. Always on time. Getting a 7 day Multi 3 Pass proved to be a good buy.

Sydney by boat. Take any ferry (easy and affordable public transport) for a wonderful sightseeing of Sydney This is the best way to get around while benefiting from a wonderful view of the city and its amazing bay.

Simple, Efficent and Value for Money. We took a ferry to Manley Beach from Circular Quay. Although busy, there was plenty of room, and the boarding and disembarkation were executed quickly and safely.
The ferry offers a good value harbour cruise, with excellent opportunities for photos of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House, along with the many inlets and beaches along the way.

Great way to see the harbour & sights. Took the ferry to Manly which has one of the best beaches in Sydney, for just under 15 AUD$ return!
The 30 min journey is also a great value way in which to take in beautiful natural Sydney Harbour and its iconic architecture.

Very efficient. Although technically Sydney ferries is not an attraction - it is a public transport system - they are a fantastic way to get around the harbour and see the sights. You can get a great view of the bridge, the harbour and the Opera House from the ferry and they are fairly lost cost to use.It is worth travelling on at least one during your visit to Sydney.

River cat to Parramatta. I never tire of this trip, and usually each Sydney trip has the Parramatta trip include when time permits, it is delightful. I don't even get off the boat but instead just do the round trip. What a wonderful way to see the greatest Harbour in the World and the fascinating Parramatta river.
Great way to see Sydney. Don't waste your money on a fancy cruise. Grab a all day multi pass and you'll see the best the harbour has to offer

Great way to get around!. We made good use of the ferries to go to the zoo and to Darling Harbor for various activities. We took lots of great pictures from the ferries.
I wish the different ferries were better marked for tourists who aren't familiar with them. We found the ferries at Circular Quay especially confusing. Besides that, wonderful service!

great way to see the city and opera house from the water side. we tool the ferry to watsons bay had fish and chips and continued from there to bondai beach by bus and from there did the coastal walk was a great day!
Handy and efficient. These ferries are a great way to get around the harbor area. Efficient and comfortable, they run as frequently as most bus lines in a city would run.
Economical harbour cruises. Take the kids to Manly on the ferry, get the bus to Q-Station and take the historical walk, or do the sydney walks and catch the ferry back to Circular Quay. Great fun

A must try if in Sydney.. The cheapest way to see and experience Sydney harbour and the numerous bays around the harbour. The best trip is to Manly that takes about 45 minutes and is the best way to see the sunset over Sydney harbour bridge in the afternoon

Ferries. I think that's one of the very few things in Sydney that's not as good or better than in Brisbane (where I live), hehe. But that's only because Brisbane's ferries are very good and doesn't meant that Sydney's aren't. In fact they're a great way to travel within the harbour and they provide great views of the Opera House as well.

Great view of the city. Take the ferry from circular key towatsons bay. That way you get to see the opera house,the whole CBD and the rose bay from a different perspective. The prices are not so high and the ferries go every half an hour, both ways.

Brilliant way to see Sydney harbour. Ferry travel is an inexpensive and relaxed way to visit different parts of Sydney. An all day MyMulti Pass gets you on all forms of public transport for $A22, and you can also get a combination all day pass with entry to Taronga Zoo, another must see in a brilliant harbourside location.
very enjoyable. for the multi-ticket you can do unlimited rides for a day..a must do and also great for families with kids

reliable. at circular quay (or over internet) you get the complete information about where when and how much your planned trip will be.
lovely service for everybody!

See Sydney by ferry. Best and cheapest way to see Sydney. If you have trouble navigating signs, just ask an attendant. We did and they were very friendly. Ferries were clean and large enough that you feel safe. We bought an all day pass at the airport for train/rail/ferry. Great photo opportunities from the Harbor looking back at Sydney, the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House.

great ride and fantastic vies. i took a ferry to see the Sydney skyline and was rewarded with a fantastic view of teh Opera house and the Sydney bridge as we left the harbour. we went to a bay in the suburbs . The residential places surrounded the bay , with yacths moored in the little marinas and family piers. all very lovely.please make sure you buy the tickets in good time and also make sure you know which quay its leaving from. the Ferries leave on time and wait for no man .
Gives Sydney Charm. Really enjoyed the the ferry service in Sydney, it gives Syney charm like the trams in Melbourne. Go Aussie.

travel around sydney. great way to see Sydney from the water, gives you a different perspective to the city. the view of the opera house and the harbour bridge is fantastic! as the sun goes down on the ferry as you pass by the opera house is fantastic. we used them plenty of times whilst on our visit, and found them plentiful, reasonably priced, and efficient

Incredible views at great value.. If we had more time in Sydney, we would have spent more time going back and forth between the various beaches and Circular Quey. The river ride is also wonderful and beautiful. Each time of day gave a different perspective of the harbour, the bridge, the opera house and the water activity. Enjoy a day pass on the harbour.

Efficient and clean. Impressed by how old the ferries are but how beautifully maintained and pleasant to travel in. As with all things Australian, very punctual and reliable. Pleasant staff who are happy to assist. Sundays there is a "Funday Sunday" ticket for families with at least one child, ultra cheap and great value for money.
Easy transportation. The ferries are an inexpensive and easy method of transportation to visit other areas around the harbor.

Ferries.. I found the commentating on the organised ferries very good.The local ferries very cheap and able to get on and off whenever you wished.The sights around the harbour was well explained in the commentaries.would definitely do them again.
trip to manly. Liked how efficient it is run, disliked a bit expensiveespecially if you have family, but you can get a all day tripper

Must do. I am normally not a fan of public transport in the UK but here the Sydney ferry system was fantastic! With ferries constantly coming and going, you never have to wait long. Don't bother with the expensive Sydney tour cruises or the hop on hop off cruises. The ferry system operates all day and very late into the night and if you buy a daily or weekly pass for unlimited travel, it represents such good value for money.We used the ferries for Manly, Taronga, Luna Park, Watson's Bay, Darling harbour etc. It really is the way to get around the city. The views are amazing and it is a lot of fun. A must do when visiting here.

Great way to see the sights. Did 2 trips - first was Circualr Quays to Manly and back with the iconic views of Opera House and Bridge. The ticket machine was cumbersome and caused several people to miss the ferry. Altho busy, plenty of space to sit and the ventilation inside was good. Second was Circular uays to Darling Harbour - for me this was the better trip involving 4 stops, sailing beneath the Bridge on the good ferry Scarborough, able to look back through the Bridge at the Opera House, before rounding to Darling Harbour which is a tremendous place to be - well worth the relatively low cost. Must be a great way to travel to work!
So easy. So easy and cost effective way to travel around one of the worlds best cities.Ensure you get an all day pass for a very cost effective way to travel

Great way to see the harbour and Sydney. We took our trip on Sunday which was a "funday" were you get unlimited use of ferries and busses for $2,50 a ticket. The ferries are getting old and could do with a shine up. But hope they keep the same style of ferries. The best way to see Sydney Harbour for next to nothing.
Very well connecting. Very comfortable and cleanVery well connectedStaff was goodVery informingTickets were easily available.

Must do whilst in Sydney. Right up there with Staten Island in New York and the Star Ferry in Hong Kong - the Sydney ferry provide fun and unique access to many ports of call on the harbour as well as unsurpassed views of the city and quaint harbours in the bay. You will not be able to cease taking photos and wishing you actually lived in Sydney on the bay.

Beautiful Harbor. We took the Ferry to Manly Beach and also Darlington Harbor as well as a ride in from Olympic Park. It would be hard to choose anyone as the best because they are all so beautiful and different. So easy to use.
Sydney Harbour on the cheap. Excellent way to see the harbour and meet the locals without the cost, Extensive route programme, cheap, cheerful and efficient.

Best way to travel. you have to travel at least once to experience all that sydney has to offer, some great all day passes and would recommend you get off across the harbour to get a different view of sydney.

Simply Sydney. You can't see Sydney properly without the Sydney Ferry experience. We travelled on the Darling Harbour and Parramatta River routes over 4 days on a MyMulti ticket and were thrilled with the value for money spent. Love the free WiFi too!

Great value. Can't beat travelling on the ferries. So many different destinations and all very quick. Passing the Opera House daily is awesome especially when the window cleaners are working. Photos all taken from the ferry to Taronga Zoo

Great deal for siteseeing and moving around the city. I bought the multi pass for trains, bus, and ferry. These ferries were so easy to use. They cut travel time and provided a fun way to get where we were going. Better deal than a site seeing boat ride, ride them all and enjoy the sites.

Relaxed and enjoyable. What a great day on the water. Took the Ferry from Watsons Bay to the city and back. So great to get into the city away from traffic. THe views of the harbour coming in are also fairly spectacular.
NO BETTER WAY TO SEE SYDNEY. Try the Quay to Zoo crossing, or to Manly to really experience that lovely harbour, and the sights everywhere you look. You won't regret it.
Using a Travel Pass. Went on a couple of Harbour Ferry rides - scheduled services and did the return trip - at night there was a Fire work display in Darling Harbour

You can ride all over the harbour. This is just a great way to see Sydney, even when its raining.
Get a ferry to Manly and a rivercat to Parramatta
best thing to get around in Sydney. the best way to explore Sydney, get the best views of the skyline, Harbour Bridge, Opera House,.. is by ferry. Good service and they run all day long

Impressive set up. We were impressed by the set up of the Ferry services, everythign is very organised and not overally complicated to understand. Ticket sales are easy although it woudl be nice to have the prices hanging up somewhere

Well worth the trip. The ferries are a great way to get around, and even if you have no place specific to go - if you take the Darling Harbour Ferry on one trip from Circular Quay, and then another time take the Manly Ferry -- you can have two great Harbour tours for a pretty cheap price (un-narrated of course as these are commuter ferries!)

Such a pleasant and budget way to enjoy the magnificent harbour. We have taken ferries in Sydney many times but this week enjoyed the trip from Circular Quay to Manley as we had time to 'waste' before a meeting. The ferry as usual was punctual and businesslike in its embarkation of passengers. We enjoyed the outside deck in both directions and it enabled us to see many of the vistas of the Sydney Harbour itself.

Excellent Transportation. Excellent transportation. They have WIFI on the ferries. They are on time as per schedule. Clean and spacious seating. Beautiful view of the water. Took them to Manly and Toronga Zoo. They are a little slow, but im not sure if they can physically go any faster

Very efficient ferry system. We thought we were used to ferries, but we were impressed with the easy on & off features of the Sydney ferries. We thought the ferries were easier to navigate than the buses. Locals suggested the ferry to Manly Beach, which was a perfect Sunday afternoon pastime.

Great way to get around!. The ferry service is wonderful, with ferries going to various destinations around the harbour. You can get an inclusive ticket for the Zoo around $45. If you have a concession you can use the ticket on the ferry as well, making it a cheap way to travel. I have been to Manly which is a good place to visit, this time I went to Watsons Bay, it was a beautiful, bright, sunny day. There are walks at the Bay and you can get a bus to Bondi. Lovely tea rooms just 5 minutes walk from the Ferry station.

Great way to experience the harbour. Sydney ferries, leaving from Circular Quay below the train station there, are the ideal way to combine getting to places, such as the zoo, Darling Harbour, and Manly, with marvellous views of the harbour itself. No need for cruises when the ferries themselves can take you to most of the harbour and harbourside places you want to go. Given the beauties of Sydney's harbour location, and the convenience also of the ferries, trips by ferry should be at the top of everyone's list of "what to do in Sydney".

I envy this system!. I live on the island of Vieques, Puerto Rico and we have a dreadfull ferry system...but let me tell you...if you do not know what to do just get on any of these ferries and go somewhere...there are many interesting stops and places to visit and spend the day...it is cheap and very enjoyable...the ferries are on time, clean and comfortable...enjoy the day

Great Day visiting different areas. We bought a one day pass for $22 which proved to be great as we went from Darling Harbour to Circular quay then on to Manley. The only thing is the day isn't long enough to do all you want to do, after we got back from Manly we went to Cockatoo Island - worth a visit but it is not what you expect. It is an Island where prisoners were kept, then turned into a naval shipyard.
Excellent public transport system..... $2.50 per day for seniors to travel on bus/ferry/train - what a great deal! I recommend all major cities have the same thing!
great fun. Is there a form of public transport anywhere in the world that comes with better views? Oh, and they're also very convenient...

Sydney Ferries. Ther are three types of ferries - the Inner Harbour, the smallest which ply between the inner harbour suburbs to the Gladesville Bridge, the Manly Ferries which go between the Quay, Zoo and Manly, and the Rivercats which go to Parramatta and a number of destinations beyond Gladesville Bridge.Your destination will decide which ferry you will catch. If the weather is fine, its best to sit outside and enjoy the harbour views as the ferry moves between its destinations. All are wheelchair accessable. The Harbour is full of history, so a harbour cruise with commentary is a good idea for visitors. Ferries can be used to acccess harbour walks....some brochures are available at Manly Info Centre near the wharf.

I love Sydney Ferries - an amazing way to commute!. You just have to love Sydney Ferries - what a great way to get around and commute. Sydney is one of the most beautiful cities that I know and there are few things that beat pulling out of Circular Quay in twilight and sailing round the Opera House.You'll have the city, Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House all in your view, and all for a ew dollars. One of my favourite things to do on a sunny day in Sydney is just to get on a random ferry and sit there watching the view on a full round trip.

Great way to get around. We stay at Mantra within easy walk to Circular Quay so our preferred way of transport were the ferries. The service is really good and you get amazing views of the Harbour and all that it has to offer. A must do is ths trip to Manly but the one to Darling Harbour also offers spectacular views. Highly recommended.

Circular Quay to Paramatta - A tour in itself. The ride to Paramatta takes about 1.5 hours and goes as far as you can go on the Paramatta River. You see island, birds, the Olympic Stadium and many sections of the city. Have lunch in Paramatta wander around and then take the train back to town in about 30 minutes. Great excursion for cheap price.

Sydney Harbour Ferries. These ferries are the best way of seeing the Sydney Harbour if you are on limited time or budget.
