Maps and information to various locations is easy and hassle free.
We travelled after the morning and before the evening rush so always found a seat with a view.

Sydney by water. The Sydney Ferries are a great way to see the Harbour & all it has to offer a tourist. They take you across to the Taronga Zoo & out to Manly Beach, just to name a few places. Great fun !
Different. A different way to travel through Sydney. The ferries don't arrive to regularly so you need to time it. However, worth doing as it offers a different pov of Sydney.

Best harbour tour you could find anywhere. Forget your harbour cruises....get the ferry to Manly like a Sydneysider and be treated to the best views of the most beautiful harbour on the 90-minute round trip. Stop in slightly seedy beachside Manly for lunch for good measure. Great way to spend a morning or afternoon.

Best Part of Our Entire Trip. We loved the Ferries we used the Ferry to travel to Taronga Zoo. The fleet review was on at the time. My daughter loved every second of it, she didnt want to get off when it was all over.

Good services.. The ferry is cheap to use and you could see all of the harbour in one day hopping on and off. The best one was to Manly which is at the other end of Sydney and a good 45 minurtes journey.

Best Way to Travel and See Sydney. I always take a ride on a ferry, whether to Manley or just a ride on a River Cat to see more of the beautiful area. If you go to Manley, take the fast boat. It's fun and gets you there faster so you can enjoy even more of the beautiful beach community!
Convenient and easy. We used Sydney Ferries alot during our recent trip to Sydney. The system could not be more easy and convenient.

Good mode of transportation. Took the ferry from Circular Quay to the Taronga Zoo and back. You can purchase a ferry ticket which also includes the zoo admission. Also took ferry from the Quay to Darling Harbour. It is a good way to get around the city.

awesome way to travel. we used the ferries a few times on our trip to sydney ... you arrive early and then get pushed out of the way by those arriving late, you learn to stand your ground and push back :) ... there are plenty of seats and the trip is very relaxing ... we took the ferry to the taronga zoo and also to manly

Manly ferry. One of the must-do places when visiting Sydney. Fun ferry ride to the cute little town of Manly. We walked around the harbor, looked at items made by various vendors displaying their talents, and had a lovely harborside lunch.
Perfect way to travel - free wifi. Enjoyed commuting in the ferry, very comfortable seating on the deck and inside. Free wifi is a big plus.

Great way to see the city!. We bought a day pass for the ferries and took the ferry to Manly first. This was a beautiful ride that let us get a good view of the opera house, bridge, fun park, gallows island, and the gorgeous headlands and cute lighthouse. We got off in Manly and walked around for a bit and had lunch. Then back to the ferry terminal, where we switched to the Darling Harbor ferry. This takes you up to the Maritime Museum where they have a full replica of Captain Cook's ship. This is a great way to see the city and gives you a wonderful aspect for photos!

Getting a little more expensive. The ferries are nice but the prices of the tickets have gone up. It simply doesn't make sense when the train goes to Parramatta as mymulti zone 2 but for ferries you will need mymulti zone 3. That aside, the view of the two sides of the river is really nice. Try route F3, from Circular Quay to Parramatta wharf as it gives you the best view of the Parramatta river. Note that the trip takes 1.5hrs one way.

Great if you have a week pass. If you buy the week transport pass ($57 or so), this is free and unlimited travel on the ferries (except Manly which needs a $60 pass). Great way to travel - and allows you to stay out of the city, eg at Admiral Collingwood Lodge in Drummoyne, which is great. I wonder how long it takes before you get tired of gliding under the bridge or past the opera house?

Efficient and Cost Effective Service. Great value for money - buy a weekly ticket that also covers the trainsThe timetables are readily available. The announcements clear and easyThe info boards are on every wharf so easy to find your way aroundFree wifi on every ferryFast and efficient service all roundGreat staff on board tooThe Manly ferry also has cafe facilities
Great!. Have done a Sydney Ferry trip a few times now and we love it. Always on time and always makes safe passage to our destination :)

Cheap way for enjoying the view. We bought a day pass valid for all public transport including ferries. So we boarded one to a suburb. Really enjoyed the view, with Opera House and Harbour Bridge along the way. Nice weather too! A cheap and enjoyable way to admire the view

Hop on/off. We took a Captain Cook cruiser that allowed you to hop on/off at various locations. However we stayed on for the 1.5 hrs and just enjoyed the trip and commentary. Lovely to see the bay from the water and go a little further down to experiecne the majesty that is Sydney Harbour area including Darling Harbour.

Efficient and scenic but note that they close at 7pm!. A really efficient system to take you around the harbour ...however it is a shame they stop so early in the evening so you can't use them to come back from dinner across the bay!
A new adventure. Took my kids on the ferry today for the first time. Clean reliable and up their good standard. The extra waves and rolling added to the adventure.

May break down, not comfortable and slow. these ferries are iconic but just like their train counterparts the old rattlers they cannot go on for ever and will need to be replaced. The ferry seats are not comfortable and remind me of a Hospital seating with plastic seats from 1980's. Most often than not the Ferry would break down on a key day and get replaced by a modern private ferry, as had happen to me. I would say allot of these ferries are long in the tooth old they need to be retired. maybe the Manly ferry would be a better alternative than a Sydney ferry.

best way to see the city. They may seem old and rickety but they have character and efficiency. They let you see all the best tourist sites of Sydney - Opera House, Harbour Bridge , Luna Park, Naval dockyards, CBD etc.etc. They are also faster than driving across the bridge and looking for non-existent parking spots. Had been to a function when a storm hit and automatically assumed a taxi was the fastest option - unfortunately the venue hadn't seen a taxi for 1 1/2 hours so we headed to the ferries.Caught one just in time and was home and dry within 15 minutes - a much better option.

A relaxing & inexpensive way to get around. We always ensure we take at least 1 ferry trip when we visit Sydney.They are always clean & tidy, staff are helpful, & a very cost effective way to get around the harbour.We took the ferry to Watsons Bay on a Sunday. The ferry was quite full but you can still get a great view from most seats. The ferry arrived & left exactly to schedule.Just all round good value.

Stress free journeys. Hop on and off anywhere , buy a multi ticket 3 for a week $62 pp , unlimited travel on ferries , trains , and buses a great way to get around . And if it says it's due to leave or arrive at certain times it moser definitely will . We both thoroughly enjoyed our ferry trips a great way to get around and would highly recommend it

Manly ferry dreams. The Manly Ferry is an iconic part of Sydney life. It takes in views of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Fort Dennison and much more.Sit up top in the open and catch the ocaasional wave splashing over the bow as you pass across Sydney Heads

Excellent layout for ease of use. The Park Hyatt hotel is very close to the Ferry teminal and you can use it to get just about anywhere in Sydney easily. The staff was friendly and helpful. The Ferries were clean well kept and seating was nice and you didnt feel crowded getting on or off the boat and schedules were easy to read and understand.

Wonderful way to get around and see the sights. We bought a day ticket, and then went on every ferry ride we could fit in, just to get an overview of the city and the bays. We went under the harbour bridge and past the Opera House, visited Manly and had fish and chips on the beach, walked the coast line between Mosman Bay and Cremone Point, and felt we had had a thoroughly enjoyable day, and on a budget too.

An excellent way to commute. When visiting Sydney the transport system allows you to purchase a multi-trip ticket for 3 or 7 days. This gives unlimited travel on the ferries and also includes buses and trains - absolutely superb value.

Just like clockwork... These ferries operate efficiently, effectively and on time. When the big hand hits the departure moment, these ships are pulling away, or coming in. A wonderful way to move around and see most of Sydneys most amazing attractions.
Take a Ride. Don't miss a ride on some of the "cutest" ferries ever! You get an entirely different view of Sydney from the water. Try to catch an evening ride, too -- the city lit up is amazing!

Best way to sample Sydney lifestyle. The city ferries are a convenient and fairly inexpensive way to cover a lot of territory in very little time. We were able to visit Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, Manley Beach, Bondi Beach, and Luna Park in a period of about 5 hours and really enjoy it without feeling rushed. Be careful to get the right ferry pass! There is a private ferry service that offers faster smaller boats to the various beaches - but it doesn't go to Double Bay (where we were staying), and it doesn't run the same route or schedule to the principal ports (Darling Harbour and Circular Quay).

Efficient, clean, punctual and great service. I am from Vancouver and have been to Sydney several times. One the best things I enjoy doing every time I come here is getting on the ferry to Circular Quay via the Parramatta route. The scenery is breathtaking as you see luxurious water front properties on either side of the ferry. It is even better sitting outside and getting some breeze in. The best is saved for last as you come closer and closer to Circular Quay. You get to see the skyline of the city from a distance, then the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House; outstanding. As far as my knowledge goes the Sydney ferries are the second biggest in the world (in terms of routes), first being British Columbia, Canada. Today I literally had to run to get on the ferry at Olympic Park. The crew were just putting the foot bridge back on to the ferry and then saw me running towards it. They stopped what they were doing and put the foot bridge back and then they thanked me for making an effort to get on board! The way they said it was so jovial, kind and friendly. The fee was $7.20 cash to get in to the city. I have done the Circular Quay to Manly route a few times and the ride is also very beautiful. Thank you Sydney Ferries; keep up the good work!!

effiecency of travel. like very busy ants - these ferries were plying to and fro all day and night - a very reasonable way of seeing the harbour area - which is vast. by a return ticket to the first stop on a route and either get off and then catch the next one in the same direction or stay on and you get a round trip at a good price!!

See the harbour from a different point of view.. Catch a ferry for a bird's eye view of beautiful Sydney harbour. Departing from Circular Quay in the City jump on a ferry to Manly and take advantage of some fantastic photo opportunities of the Opera House and harbour bridge. Other spots to journey too include Taronga Park Zoo or Watsons Bay.

Excellent!. Amazing transport to navigate to and from Manly, Darling Harbour, and Bondi. Excellent experience to also see the bridge and the Opera House from the ferry. You can also see Luna Theme Park nearby.

Best transport , great views. envy the commuters...they get this every day.We just hopped on various ferries just to enjoy the Harbour views and get the possibility to stop at so many beautiful coastal suburbs. Double Bay and Vaucluse a favourites.The view of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House from the water is breathtaking!

First time Sydney ferry user. We used the ferry to get to Manly, loved it. On time, clean, crew courteous, no negative comments at all. We were put on a ferry at Rydalmere after a bus tour, the route to Circular Quay took about an hour and was well worth it. The ferries are definitely a good way to see Sydney.

ferries are inexpensive way to move around.. clean, spacious & inexpensive. One may choose to be inside or as we did--sit on open benches. We took multiple rides--to darling harbour, to Tarong Zoo aswell.
Take the ferry. Awesome way to see the city, go to manly, the zoo, darling harbour etc. don't waste your money doing a harbour cruise just jump on the ferries for a more authentic experience.

Very comfortable and convenient.. One thing a tourist should experience in Sydney is a ferry ride. You can to see the city in a new light, not to mention enjoy great views of the main attractions like Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge, etc... Also, if you take it during sunset time, you get to enjoy spectacular sunset views. The ferries are also very clean and comfortable.

Love going around on the ferries. Cheap and easy way to get around the harbour really easily. Don't pay for the cruises no need to - all you need to do is get on the manly ferry or go on the one to neutral bay. Those are the prettiest. Get an all day pass and enjoy the harbour

best way to see Sydney overall. Sydney is so much about its harbor, that getting on the ferries and checking out the headlands or little coves is the way to go. The ones I took were on time, efficient and easy to access.

The best transportation in Sydney. Wow is the word. Get an unlimited weekly pass and ride to your hearts content. There is so much to see from the many ferries. We took the ferry to and from Darling Harbor and Circular Quay almost every day. We also took the ferry to Manly to see the beach and walk alone the shore where apparently penguins nest but we dint't see any. Take you swimming trunks for the beach near the wharf and also the salt water pool near the end of the coast walking path.
What a way to travel. We loved the ferries and a great way to travel. We were lucky with the weather so it was lovely to sit outside.

take me to the water. This ferry system is excellent. They have multiple piers taking passengers to all points around the area. there really is no need to take a harbor tour; just get on a ferry and see it all. You can quite easily get to many interesting spots in a short period. alot of spots u can take the ferry over and then get the bus back. Manly beach is 1 of our favorite spots for a ferry run.

The best way to get around.. We paid $22 each for our all day passes, which allowed us to use the ferries as much as we wanted. A fantastic way to see the harbour, we took some great photos while on board! There is a ferry that takes you directly to Taronga Zoo, as well as Luna Park, Darling Harbour, and Manly. If you're after a long ferry ride, take a trip up Paramatta River, which takes around 2 hours. Easy to read timetables, so you'll be able to find your way around easily.
great way to see the harbour.. we used the ferries to go to manly and the zoo great way to get there, also a harbour cruise which was fun,
Great way to view from water!. This inexpensive ferry is a good way to see the harbor landmarks and get to manly Beach. Cruiser ride and pretty good speeb
A novel trip to Darling Harbour. I took the ferry to darling harbour and it was a great way to see more of the harbour. Easy, fun and lots to see. Don't miss it.
See the City from the Harbour. We used and all day pass to see Manly and take a two hour trip up the Parramatta River. Great value for money
What a great service. We bought a day pass and took the ferries all over. What a wonderful and very organized service. This is a great way to see Sydney and see why the harbour is so famous.

Runs like clockwork, but ticket system is crazy. The service is incredibly prompt and has many convenient routes. However, there are three serious flaws that negatively impacted our week in Sydney and left us feeling 'robbed'. Watch out for the following: 1) We were told on the last day by a helpful crew member that you only have to pay for one child. After a week of paying for both (NOTE THIS ALSO HAPPENED ON THE BUS)2) The ticket machines will only sell one ticket at a time. When traveling in a group / family this is extremely inefficient. 3) Maximum change from the ticket machine is $19, meaning that tourists with $50 will always lose money -- especially given point 2 above.
Best way to get great photos!. Efficient, priced right travel and a better valued way to see the harbor, views of the city, and other venues around Sydney than the paid harbor tours.
Best views for cheap. Bought the week pass for the bus, train and ferries, so got the trips from Darling harbour to Circular Key, then the Zoo. Must do.
Good way to see Sydney. The ferries are a good value, easy to use way to explore Sydney. I recommend taking one over to manly beach or to the zoo

DIY Harbour Cruise. It is very easy to design your own harbour cruise using the public ferries.Just pick your port/s of call, buy your ticket and your off on a fabulous day at a bargin price.Not to be missed.

Indispensable.. Sydney Ferries are my favourite way to get around. Coming from Auckland, having such excellent public transportation as the Sydney ferry and train systems is a wonderful surprise. When we first moved here, we would ride the ferries with our laptops to take advantage of the free WiFi. I highly recommend the Zone 3 Weekly MultiPass, good for unlimited travel on all ferries, trains and buses. It's currently $61.

Smooth Operators. Gets you where you want to. When you want to. Quickly, cleanly and accurately.
Shows you another perspective of the Harbour giving you the millionth photo oportunity for this VERY photogenic city. Staff were always very helpful. If you dont know. Ask. Someonewill ALWAYS help

A must!. We caught the ferry from Sydney Harbour to Manley. No queues and great value for this trip that takes about half an hour each way. Provides good views of the bridge and opera house. A regular service that leaves each way every half hour. Manly itself is a surfing area with numerous shops, bars and restaurants. There are 2 sides to Manley, the beach area where the ferry comes in and a surfing beach on the other side. Just walk through the shopping street to get there. really recommend a ferry trip.

Convenient mode for sightseeing. We took the ferry to Manly and this is the cheaper option than the Manly Fast Ferry that we almost purchased. Journey is 30mins and ferry departed every 30mins which was very convenient for returning to the city. Cruise left on time and this is a great way for sightseeing.

Great way to see the city. The ferries operate timely and efficient service throughout the harbour areas of Sydney. We used the ferries for both transportation and sightseeing. Get out on the ferries to see incredible views of the harbour areas and greater Sydney!

A MUST DO in Sydney. The Habour Tour was awesome, we did the trip as the sun was going down so saw the harbour and surroundings in all its glory in both daylight and dusk, fantastic experience and well worth doing. We did it as part of a package through Viator which worked out to be £10 each - bargain.
nice for transport. descent, nice views of the harbour - quite pricey but worth it. took buses one way and the ferries on the way back...

Steady Service. A very smart and convenient way to get around the city and some of the outer areas. Especially as a tourist, we have found the ferries get us close to where we want to go and not in the rush of the city itself. A good option to get about.

Sydney Transport Tip. The Sydney ferries are a beautiful way to see the city. Little tip for travel - instead of any of the expensive tourist passes, buy a standard pass from any of the stockists. I bought a My Weekly 3 trip that meant I could use ANY train, ferry or bus in Sydney, from Manly to the Blue Mountains. It cost $66. Easy to use and well worth it :)

See Sydney Harbour. A return trip to Manly on a Sydney ferry is a great way to see the Harbour. Approx. 30 minutes each way with views of the Bridge, the Opera House and city skyline. Clean, punctual and at about $14.00 each it is quite economical. The outgoing trip we sat at the rear of the ferry to get some snaps but soon found out others like to stand in front of the seats making it difficult to get a good photo. On the return trip we sat on the starboard side external seating which allowed for us to take as many unimpeded shots as we liked. The weather was lovely and we were glad we had taken the sunscreen. For those who want sit inside / undercover, take your time and avoid the "cattle crush" to get onboard.
Pleasant. Enjoyable visit to Manly! This is an actual commuter line travelliing through the harbour by the Opera House, Bridge and sailing ships.
Good time on the Ferries. Brilliant service . Loved the travelling on the water!Usually on time . Scenic way to see tourist attractions around the harbour.

cheapest tour in town.. we decided to for go the standard tours for a ferry ride around the harbor both during the day and early evening. We totally enjoyed the views and the peaceful pace of the surrounds. give it a go.

Harbour Views. We were in Sydney for a few days and decided to go to Manly for lunch with a friend, we hopped on the Sydney Fast Ferry and this was great. It only took around 15 minutes to get there, which left us plenty of time for lunch and get back to the city in time for our dinner reservation that night. I highly recommend the fast ferry if you are short on time, but the older ferries are also great, they just take a bit longer to get there.

Great way to see the sights of Sydney. We enjoyed all of our experiences on the ferries. They were always on time, the staff were friendly and always safe in their practices. You get a great view on the city, which you can't see on land.

Good service. Road the ferries 3 times. On time and well run. Not too crowded and have great views of Sydney harbor. Not super cheap. But nothing is in Australia. Got wet standing on bow so don't recommend if your on your way to dinner.

Soak up the Harbour views. This is an inexpensive way to soak up all the views of the Harbour. Grab a day ticket and just jump on and off ferries all day. You will get many photo opportunities for little hustle and bustle. They stop off at all the tourist areas and offer an on time service. For us anyway on the day.

Bargain Harbour cruise. There is no better way to enjoy Sydney Harbour than to actually get onto the water. Grab a Sydney Ferry ride to Darling Harbour and you get to cruise past the Opera House and under the Sydney Harbour Bridge. If thats not enough, you even stop over at Luna Park. All this for less than $10! Love it!
ferries. Great way to get around Sydney, lots to see, well organised, good network , convenient stops, friendly atmosphere

Better than a $100 Harbor Cruise. Why pay $100 or more for a Sydney Harbor Cruise? Enjoy the same views from the deck of a Sydney ferry, and have the freedome to explore what's at the other end. Manly, the Taronga Zoo, etc, etc. And if you catch the ferry to Manly on a choppy day as we did, you may even be entertained by the sight of other tourists getting doused on the foredeck if they don't have the sense to come inside as the boat crosses the open water between the Heads!

The best way to see the harbor. I recommend taking the ferry between Circular Quay and Darling Harbor for the views of Luna Park and the Bridge, and the ferry to the zoo and to Manly Beach for wonderful views of the harbor. This is the way to see Sydney!!
enjoy the sights. what a great cheap way to see the opera house and harbour bridge from the water, an all day ticket allows you to see all sydney harbour has to offer , for very little outlay

Good value transport.. These great little ferries operate all over the shop and don't cost the earth. don't miss the Manley Beach ferry (pun kind of intended) as you get to see all the sights (Opera House, Bridge etc.) close up for a fraction of the cost of the "Tour" boats. Also Manley beach is great.
great way to get around. easy and efficient way to get form place to place, always on time and lots of them. Very helpful staff

Great. A friend told us that it was not necessary to book an expensive cruise and the ferry was good enough. We were here during the fleet review - we took the ferry from Darling harbour to Circular Quay. The ride was to Circular Quay was slow due to the number of boats/ships for the fleet review... but it was worth it as the scene was beautiful.

Ferries are the best way to see the Harbour. Fares are economical (especially for Seniors [$2.50 for an all day ticket] ) and the service is reliable. There are about six or so services ranging from Many Beach and the Paramatta river.

The BEST river transport in Sydney.. Taking the trip to Manly is a choice between routes that include, car, bus, train, ferries and walking. Right forget the walking it's too far. The ferries operated by Sydney Ferries are wonderful. Clean, quick, smoke and chewing gum free and WiFi. An excellent service. Bonza.

Take You Almost Everywhere. You can get a ticket to ride all of the ferries for one reasonable price. If you want to go to The Olympic Park, The Zoo, Manly Beach or The Rocks. The ferries are for you.

To Manly on a slow ferry. Probably the best tourist outing if time is short in Sydney. Leaves from Circular Quay and options of seating inside or outside. Regular times of travel - take a stroll along the Manly Corso and Shelly Beach.

For the best harbor views of Sydney. We took the ferry from Pyrmont to Circular Quay, as this was a nearer option to get to the Opera House, rather than drive or walk there.The view from there has got to be the best, to see Sydney and its impressive scenery. Both the CBD as well as its North Sydney counterpart were shown in full glory, although what was unbeatable was the view of the Harbor Bridge from the water (totally different from what you see from above or when driving on it)!At the same time, as we were in Sydney during the Fleet Review event, we could also see the various naval ships (and even several tall ships) berthed in the harbor, something that does not happen often, in fact!

Go public transport on a Sunday. If you happen to be in Sydney on a Sunday, take advantage of the family tickets for public transport. For a total $7.50 my two teenaged grandchildren and I went on trains buses and ferries all day Sunday. The best trip was the ferry to Watsons Bay, which was a beautiful trip and terminated at a lovely park in Watsons Bay, where we ate superb fish and chips at Doyle's Seafood. Then we caught a bus back to the city. A great day and cost next to nothing.

The Quay to Manly. Any visitor to Sydney simply must catch the ferry from Circular Quay (just near the Opera House) to Manly. Grab a bite to eat at Manly, walk along the Corso to the Ocean and return back up the finest harbour in the world to the Quay. Brilliant!

Great way to travel. We knew what we wanted to do in Sydney but weren't sure how to do it. We therefore decided to do a reccie and do most things in one day and then return on another day to places where we wanted to spend more time. We were staying near Darling Harbour and so walked to Kings Wharf. We travelled by ferry on a 22 AUD day ticket for ferries, trains and buses from Darling Harbour to Sydney Harbour, Circular Quay. We bought this ticket from a machine by the ferry terminal. Had a coffee in the cafe in the Sydney Opera House with free wifi and excellent gift shop and then caught the 30 minute ferry to Manly. Walked through the pedestrian subway and spent some time on Manly Beach and then caught the ferry back to Circular Quay. We then caught a 25 minute ferry to Watson Bay and had fish and chips at Doyles and a general lookaround. The last ferry to Watson Bay is 3.10pm Monday to Friday and this one is the last one back too so if you want a return ferry ride, you will need to go earlier. Also if you want to eat at Doyles on the Beach rather than Doyles on the Wharf/takeaway, please note they are closed for food from 3pm to 5.30pm. We then caught bus 380 to Bondi Beach where we watched the surfers. We then caught bus 333 to Circular Quay and then a ferry back to Darling Harbour. This was really good value for 22 AUD. The ferries are an excellent way of seeing the areas around the city and you get up close to the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House from these ferries. I was pleased we had the day ticket because you have to have the correct money on the buses.

Sydney ferries. Great, a very enjoyable experience, well run and very clean. Everyone should do itPrices were reasonable, we met many people on the ferries. And it was great talking to them, specially the Australians.
Very convinient to use. Great mean to explore the Sydney Harbour and city's surroundings. Much cheaper than tourist boats and much more flexible to use

Despite the weather, the ferry ride was amazing. We caught the fast ferry from Sydney Harbor to Manly Beach and the regular ferry back. Both were clean, well staffed, on time and fast. Even though it was pouring and windy, the ride was fairly smooth and the views were outstanding.

Sydney's finest. What a great way to travel and see the best Sydney has to offer. Very reasonably priced and the crew really enjoy their work. NOt a better way to finish the working week when traveling to Sydney than catching the evening ferry away from circular quay.

"Transit Pass" is the way to go. The only way to see this city with plenty of places to see is with a "transit Pass". For $20 it allows you to travel on buses, trains, ferry's, with unlimited hop on hop off. You can get to Manly, Bondi Beach, Toronga Park and even go and see Olympic Park. The ferry's have free wifi. Don't forget to take your camera with you as many photo opportunities do arise. We found this to be the best value for money for sightseeing this beautiful city and surroundings.

great way to see Sydney and the outskirts. Wish London had this service. Frequent reliable service and you can use your travel cards too. It is nice just to take the different ferries just to do sightseeing as you get up close to the bridge and the opera house. Take a night one and a day one as it is so different. They are clean and the staff are helpful.
fantastic views. Reasonable price even for a long ride. We stood outside in perfect weather to get the best views of Sidney and suburbs and tons of boats.

Fabulous ferry ride. We did a day trip to Sydney and the ferry ride to and from Manly was a real highlight for me. We even saw dolphins (2) swimming not far from our ferry. Imagine how clean is the water!! Try to get a seat on the side of the ferry ( outdoors) it is such a different experience from riding inside the ferry. We did both. Great opportunity to take lots of photos of yachts sailing around, opera house and harbour bridge. The ferry ride is a must do!!

Service edging on terrible. 1st off, get a ticket. Directed by burly security that you have to line up this way!! Then fronted ticket operator. Grunt, grunt...no responses. Board ferry, get our of way, dont stand here, dont do that. God, what poor communication skills this operator has

Very efficient with great schedules. This has to be the best way to see Sydney Harbor and easily get to locations around Sydney. We took the ferry to Manly. Don't miss that one. It's a cute town with an amazing beach. You get to see the Headlands from the ferry. It's a great ride. We sat upper level, outside for the best views. Have your camera ready!
Why pay for a harbour cruise.... .......... when you can see all the views for a few dollars on a harbour ferry? Great service from Circular Quay and Darling Harbour.

Fantastic service. The ferry network is excellent. If you happen to be in Sydney on a Sunday with children, there is a great deal called Family Fun Day Sunday which costs $2.50 per person which gets you unlimited rides on any train, bus, ferry or tram at any time during Sunday. This is aimed at families as you must have a child with you. Awesome deal. There is wireless internet available on at least the Manly ferry but not sure about the others. The river cat up to Parramatta is worth it just to see the sights.

Great way to see Sydney Harbour.. It's a great way to see the harbour city. Get a different perspective of Sydney, especially at night with the city and Opera House lit up. You can also take a trip up the Parramatta River on a Rivercat to explore Parramatta which is an integral part of Sydney's early settlement history.
Budget view of the harbour.. Good cheap way to see part of the harbour and get across to the lovely friendly Manly.Frequent efficient service which is better on deck on a nice day..
can get your ferry ticket early. lines tended to be long but you can get your ticket way before you actually use it. great way to see the city.

For amazing views. The ferries operate like clock work and reach several destinations throughout the day. We used it to visit the Manly beach. Once the ferry leaves the harbour, travellers are presented with fantastic photo opportunities of the surroundings. We sighted an Australian war ship that had berthed and it was quite impressive. The trip itself is quite uneventful but the experience is well worth during a visit to the Sydney City centre.

Best value to tour the Sydney waterfront. We got the multi day pass the first day we arrived. Had a wonderful time taking ferries on most of the routes in every direction. Visited the Tarango Zoo one day and a trip out to Manly Beach and Watson's Bay was spectacular and very enjoyable. We always rode them just after the morning rush hour and one night we chose to return 2 runs before the last ferry scheduled. Returning to the Opera House area as the sun set. A truly magical sight. This way we felt there was no need to rent a car. The one tour bus ride we took out to the Blue Mountains ended at a ferry terminal. Since we had the multi day pass we told the tour guide that we could go on our way and not have to wait for him to figure out everyone's tickets that was included in the tour.

Great day out. The Ferry a great day out, always seem to run on time and get to see all the lovely sights of Sydneys fanastic habour. The trip to Many take you to a lovely beach side town with good shopping and lovely ocean beach all for the price of a ferry ticket. There is also a fun market on saturday and great old pub on the corner by the beach. The resturants are all reasonably price with very good food.

Use the ferries to see Sydney from the water. These are not tourist ferries but public transport which go back and forth at regular times to all parts of of the harbour. try manly, or a trip to the zoo.

Sydney Harbour at its Best. Best way to travel on Sydney harbour to take in and enjoy all the harbour has to offer. Fantastic views of the harbour, bridge, opera house and Sydney coastline. Well worth the extra time to Manly rather than the hydrofoil and cheaper as well. Great way to visit the zoo as well. Gives you a real experience of Sydney.

Best transport to view the city from a different perspective. The ferry is an affordable transport for any visitors to view the city from a different perspective. If you get a MyMulti pass, it will include ferry transportation in it. Just get on one to Taronga Zoo or Manly. You will certainly enjoy the trip to see the Harbour Bridge and also the Opera House from a different angle that will not be available unless you can walk on water. Catch one during dusk and you will be mesmerise with the beauty of Sydney. It is also a great escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. Get on one of the ferries early if you want to sit on the deck. The seats get snapped quickly.

Great for pensioners. $2.50 for the entire day to go anywhere any time on any transport, how good is that. Ferries were great and staff manning the ticket boxes very helpfull for an interstater visiting.

great value. use this as a way to get around ,get a day or 3 day etc , you can get off and on as often as you like ,we got to see lots of places very cheaply this way. dont bother with captain cook tour ,you can see it all from the ferry we even went to manly on it .and went to olimpic park sight ,as well .and used between darling harbour and sydney harbour darling is cheaper to eat there fab .

Great. My wife and I used the ferries to get around during our stay in Sydney. They are a quick and efficient means of transport. Not only do they get you where you want to go but you get great views of the city en-route. Great value.

great way to get around and see the sights. very easy to figure out and get where you want to go. The views are beautiful. There is lots of shopping and places to eat at the Circular Quay, even a liquor store. (not so easy to find) I recommend this as a great alternative to trying to drive on the wrong side of the road!

Great transport links. We where in Sydney last year and we used the ferrys all the time to get round with . Great way off seeing all the sites like sydney bridge manly is a great place to go to . Could not fault the ferries at all.

Great way to travel. Sydney ferries are frequent and reasonably priced. By far the best way to get around the Sydney harbour area to Manly, Tarronga Zoo, Cockatoo Island to name but a few. Be aware that the ferries do not run in rough or windy weather.

Great Boat Ride. If you intend to visit Manly Beach you need to catch the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay. It is a beautiful way to see the Harbour and takes about 30mins to get to Manly. I was amazed at how busy the harbour is especially if it is a beautiful sunny day. It is definitely worth the money and when you get off at Manly it is a easy walk to the main beach walking down a mall with loads of shops.

Great way to see Sydney from the water. I love the Sydney ferry service because it's a relaxing and very enjoyable way to see Sydney if you like travelling by water (which I do). I went when I still could use my student pass (for concession), so the cost was very reasonable (I think around $20 for a 10-trip ticket). I got to see lots of places that would have taken a long time to travel to by car (so wouldn't have gone to as I was taking public transport during my stay) and the place where I was staying was only a 5 min walk to one of the docks and then a 5-10 min ride to Circular Quay on a ferry, so it was really convenient too! I highly recommend the Sydney ferries. Don't forget your sunscreen and sunnies though.
Fine. Took the very to Manly. greta to be on the water going past those well recognised landmarks. Smooth ride and comfortable.
Try this for a relaxing day without the car. You can sit out on deck on a good day and the ferry makes many stops. Best of all you go under the Harbour bridge with photp opps galore.

great service. the ferrys go so often you don't have to rush and so easy to get on and off if you want to purchase the off on ticket and so fast to get from on side to the other and easy to get to from our hotel the four seasons

Cheap, efficient and clean scenic harbour tour.... The ferries were on time and we used our 'Pensioner' passes and travelled all day for $2.50. A great way of getting around Sydney, where we travelled from Cockle Bay to Balmain, then Circular Quay and then on to Manly and return.Very clean, very enjoyable.Thanks to Sydney Ferries....!

Much nicer than taking the bus. I spent 5 days in Manly and took the ferrys across to the city. This ferry is slower than the others but is still ok. This is the better one if you just want to relax and chill out, the other ones tend to have more business people onboard. Great way of having a good look around the harbour.

Excellent way to see more. We were in Sydney for the very first time and took 3 Ferries to different places. Do this, you will find some fun places. We went to Watson Bay and Manley. We also did a Harbour Crusie. The cost is low and you see so much!
Nice little cruise. It's a good way to enjoy the view of the bay . You can go,to beaches , to the zoo and takes photo from the opera house .
Great way to travel. Efficient and well maintained. Easy to buy tickets and did not have to wait for long as they have plenty of boats on the go!
Cheap harbor touring. bought a day pass and spent the day touring the harbors. easy system to use and great close ups of the city from the water

Great way to travel and see the sights. As part of the one-day MyMulti pass, we decided to take the different ferries out for the heck of it. It was a nice way of seeing the sights without exhausting ourselves more than it was necessary.
Mosman ferry - nice way to see how the other half lived.

Great way to see harbour from another angle. We took the ferry from the Circular quay around to Darling harbor. It was a relaxing trip and very enjoyable with a different angle of view of the harbor and the city. And a cheap ride also! Really worthwhile!

Great value and great way to see lots of sights. My friend and I hopped on the ferry at Luna Park and spent on hour enjoying the views. It was so cheap and relaxing. $5.80 for each of us. Wish we had more time to travel in the other direction and see more towards the heads area.

Great way to get around Sydney. We haven't travelled on the ferries for a few years but had the opportunity when we visited Sydney for a few days in September. The ferries are great for getting, although I found them a bit expensive compared with similar in other parts of the world. But if you want to see the harbour, take a ferry trip from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour, or Manly.

Inexpensive way to get a fabulous view. Taking a ferry is a wonderful way to see the Harbor Bridge, Opera House, and Circular Quay for next to nothing. I took a ferry from Darling Harbor as an easy way to get to Circular Quay. I was prepared for how great the view was as you cross under the bridge, see the Opera House, and pull into the harbor with the skyscrapers in the background.
Clean, fast, and efficient. I grew up in Seattle - I am used to water transportation. I LOVE the ferry system in Sydney. They operate like water....buses. Timely, fast and dependable. Dig it!

Easy and Cheap Way to Get Around. The ferries were my favorite way to get between areas in Sydney. Well-developed routes, run on time, and not too expensive. Lots of great photo opportunities as well.
Everywhere for $2.50. What great value for seniors, all day train, bus and ferry. We went from Parramatta to Watson's Bay and loved every trip.

Best Travel Tip. The ferry we cruised on was excellent value for money. It was clean, we had great views of the harbour, the bridge, the opera house and the trip to Manly took us through the heads and gave us a better idea of the city as a whole. Money well spent!
Cheap and quick. This is an excellent way to see Sydney, Staff are always willing to help you. Get outside and enjoy the sea air and see the sites
A great way to enjoy Sydney & more!. Very frequent & cosy way to travel around Sydney! We used to visit the Taronga zoo, Manly and Watson Bay. Sydney at its best leaving and approaching it again....
Sydney Ferries. Quick, and functional. We had no problems with the service. Gangway control, gate security and seating comfort were good.

Who needs a car!. The ferry service is fantastic, get on and off,
Easy ticket system,
Friendly staff,
Very efficient.
Loved the iconic side of each and every one.
Had a car but didn't use it as the ferry was so easy and convenient and went everywhere we wanted and need to go.

Sydney Ferries. This a great way to see the harbour and get fabulous views of the bridge for very little money. We took a ferry from Pyrmont to Milsons Point Round 6pm on a Saturday night. The lights were starting to come on as we reached our destination so I got some great photos of the harbour bridge. Luna Park is at Milsons Point. So we got some great photos of the entrance (that famous smiling face) before meeting friends for dinner. We took a taxi back as the ferries stopped for the night quite early. We also took the ferry from Circular Quay to Pyrmont. Circular Quay is a very busy place but quite easy to navigate. There are ticket booths on the wharf. We had some difficulty with paying for our first trip as there is nowhere to pay at Pyrmont or on the ferry. We had asked at the hotel and been told that Sydney Ferries were installing a new ticketing system and not to worry if we couldn't pay. So we got a free ride. It's not in my nature to do that and I wouldn't recommend it. As Sydney Harbour is such a major tourist destination I felt this aspect was not being handled well.
Great Days out!. Sydney Ferries are the best way to start a day trip. Just jump on a ferry and end up some where completely different. The views of teh harbour and the opera house are just amazing!!

Take a ride to Bondi Beach!. Beautiful ferry ride to both Bondi and Manley Beaches. Even if you aren't a surfer, you have to experience Bondi. Many is much more laid back but both are beaitifull areas with typical seaside amenities.

A must!. If you are going to manly, just for less than 15$ you can get a return ticket and enjoy the gorgeous view of the opera house and harbour bridge! Dont miss it! Get in line quickly cause the seat outside fill up quite fast!

Terrific. Make sure you get the one you want as some go to Manly some do not. We went to Watsons Bay which i recommend for lunch but they do not tell you much about what to look for ...we stumbled upon the cliffs at the top of the park which provide a magnificent view you do not want to miss.

Ferries of Sydney Harbor. We loved the ease of getting to and from places near the Harbor. The ferries were easy to board, a relaxing way to see the Harbor. There were many great views to capture and share with our friends on the web.
Great form of transport in Sydney. Jus hop on the ferries to get great views of the Darling Harbour, Sydney Harbour and Opera House. It's cheap and convenient.
Great way to get to the zoo :-). Have been on thus ferry to the zoo every visit & it is a great way to see the bridge & opera house, the kids loved it.
A great way to get from manly to the city. Only 18 minutes journey . Great way of going . Lots to see on the way . It feels like Sydney as it should be. Take this journey.
Beautiful views!!. Our plan was to catch the ferry to Manly and we were not disappointed! If you sit at the back of the ferry you will get a perfect view of the bridge and opera house!

Sydney to Manly and back!. I recently went on a ferry from Sydney to Manly and back! The journey took approximately 20 minutes and once at Manly I enjoyed some lunch in the sun by the water! There are many great restaurants just as you step of the ferry so you do not have too look far! The ferry ride overall was smooth and relaxing!! It is however very busy, a lot busier then I had originally thought so if you want any specific seating area do not be the last one in the ferry!

Try the River Cat. Try this trip if you have a day to spare. We hopped on at Circular Quay went to Rydalmere, hopped off and got another ferry right through to Parramatta. Word of warning, if it's low tide at Parramatta you will need to get the ferry bus to Rydalmere and catch the ferry back to Circular Quay from there (too shallow for the ferries at Parramatta). It was a great day out, plenty of restaurants from which to choose in Parramatta. Can't go wrong.

Good way to see the harbour. Get a multi pass and you can ride all the ferries.Took a trip to Manly. Worth the long journey. The waves are high as you approach Manly wharf. Make sure you are not prone to seasickness.
Very reliable. These ferries are very reliable, easy to use, relatively cheap and a good way of seeing iconic sites such as the opera house and the bridge.
Great way to visit the suburbs. This is a very nice way to visit Manly and Watsons Bay (amongst others). It hardly costs anything and the views of the Sydney CBD + Harbour Bridge are great. Must do.
Great way to see everything. Fabulous way to see the bridge and the opera house. Comfortable, excellent way of getting from one side to the other without too much fuss. Loved it

great way to get around. the ferries are a great way to get around Sydney and get to the zoo and Luna park great for just a ride down river to Parramatta and if your a senior for $2.50 a day you can go anywhere use the same ticket for trains and buses cheap day ouy
EASY MODE OF TRANSPORT. Inexpensive way to get to the zoo and back. Comfortable ride and quick with easy access on and off the ferry.

A great way to see the harbour!. We took a couple of return trips around the harbour to see how the other half live. Mosman ferry trip spectacular just to travel on and return straight away. It is worth spending a day in Manly or a half day at Watsons Bay... What a gorgeous little spot to lie in the sun!

Fun and convenient, saves walking. The ferry maps show how varied the places to go are, it is a great way to see Sydney and the Harbour, great for photographers and tourist and also very convenient for the locals not having the drive.

You can go anywhere on the ferries. The ferry schedules are very flexible and the ferries can take you to so many different locations. You get some very spectacular views of Sydney from the water depending on the route you take. Many ferries have wifi access as well.

Easy Peasy and lots of fun. Very simple to use, great fun wether you are alone or in a group. Take one to Manly or the Zoo and it's great to see things from a different angle along the way to your destination! Highly recommend using them over any other transport.

a great way to spend a couple of hours. A ride on any of the Sydney Ferry services is well worthwhile. The ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly in my opinion, is, along with a trip on the Star Ferry in Hong Kong and the Moscow underground trains, one of the great urban transport rides in the world.

Unsuspecting fun. The workers at the Sydney Ferries were extremely helpful when I stopped by to inquire about the options. The gentlemen gave me a map with options, gave me his opinion on which ones were worthwhile and pointed out that if I got the pass it would be more economical then buying each ticket individually. I took a number of the recommended routes and thoroughly enjoyed them. It was nice to get out and about on the Ferry. The only small annoyance was that the free wifi didn't always work on the ferries.

Parramatta Ferry. Excellent I would say a hidden gem. It takes 1hr 50 to get to Parramatta, we then got off and walked along the river to the town centre which had some great places to eat, with every cuisine and budget catered for.A great day trip and excellent value as it was about $7.20 each way, which is the same as Manly ferry but twice the length.
Good way to see Sydney harbor. Enjoy our ferry ride and visit to Manley and what a great nice and sunny day we had .great to be had on the water and beach
Like it.. If there any options to go by ferries I never took anything else. I just loved it. All the views are so good. So much enjoyable. All thrips are so memorable. Just awesome.

Sydney Ferries on a Pensioner Discount. For $2.50 each day a pensioner can hop on all the ferries, trains, light trains and buses and see Sydney on the cheap. This is what I did. Ferry staff were very helpful too. Great way to see Sydney.
Trip to Parramatta. Beautiful day, stunning views of Sydney harbour and river all the way up to Parramatta and back by the same ferry.

travelling made easy. The best way to enjoy the Sydney skyline. the regularity of the ferries makes for a real fun day visiting all the little communities around the harbour. what a saving on older legs (mine included). if you are a senior u will be able to ride all tyhe ferries all day for $2.50 --- best trip in town.make sur you go round to Darling Harbour if you use the ferries. The skyline here now matches that of Circular Quay and i beleive it will outdo it in the next 5 to 10 years.

A wonderful way to see Sydney from the water. There is a great selection of ferries going to all sorts of interesting places around the harbour, old settlements, new settlements, and accessing them via the ferries is quite different than by road; even the ferry to Parrammata provides a whole new view of the city, and you can choose to return either on the ferry or by bus or train as the ferry stops at the main transport hub in Parrammata. It is a wonderful way to spend a relaxing say.

A great mode of transportation!. My daughter and I were able to visit every attraction we wanted to see in Sydney using the ferries. We never had to wait long and the view can't be beat. It was a great way to get around the city.

Fantastic service. I took the ferry from circular quay to manly beach and to the darling harbor in Australian day. The ferry past through the Sydney opera house and sydney bridge. On that day, lots of passengers on the boats celebrate the Australian day. It was a really fun to see the views on the ferry.
Nice and quick!. gets you from point A to point B nice and quickly, but also giving you a smooth and beautiful ride. Much prefer the ferries to taking a train or bus, and they are definitely cleaner!
way to go. What a great way to see the harbour.A must have is a mulitcard.We had fantastic weather.Even a short express 15min trip from circular quay to darling harbour is an experience
Harbor Vistas. The ferry between Sydney and Manly Beach Sydney offer wonderful views of the harbor at a reasonable rate and takes you to a popular local beach that isn't visited by many tourists

Easy for transport and good way to see the place!. The ferries offer an easy and convenient way of transport around the harbour and the city centre as well as a practical way to see the harbour bridge and opera house. Take one, you'll love it!

Worth the trip. Taking the time to visit Manly is worth it. There is a good beach vibe great places to eat and drink and its easy to get to via the ferry which also offers great views of Sydney on both the way out and back

nicely surprise. I took the ferry for the first time in long time and was very surprise with the customer service of the crew was very helpful, polite and smiling not what I had remember. Thank you for improving.

Nice Ride. An absolute must, getting a nice overview of the city and some historic background of the city. The ferry driver talked about points of interest and we ended up going full circle just to jenjoy the ride.

great day on the harbour. The Manly ferry is good for a day trip, Manly is a fantastic beach with a promenade and there are nice takeaway food shops too. the ferry takes about 1/2hr and you get to see the Opera House and foreshore suburbs from the water. A must do for any visit to Sydney. Another great trip is the ferry to Watson's Bay from there you can walk around to Camp Cove which is a lovely small quite beach and go up to the historic landing spot. The trip to here lets you glimpse some of the best Sydney residences too.

Seniors can travel all day for $2.50!. If you are a senior with an Australian Federal Government Seniors card, purchase a daily Seniors Excursion ticket for only $2.50 for each day you travel. Using this ticket you can travel on any of the public transportation ferries as many times per day (back and forth) as you like. Manly, Watson's Bay, Darling Harbour and Paramatta are all worth a visit. The same ticket also allows you to travel the entire train and bus network. You can buy single tickets at a ticket counter at a train station. These are valid however only on that particular day. You can purchase multiple tickets in advance at newsagents, 711 convenience stores, as well as Tourist Information at Darling Harbour. It really is an amazing deal!

such a pleasant way to get around. We were staying near Darling Harbour, so used the ferries to get to Circular Quay and Taronga Zoo. There are frequent ferries to every location, and as the weather was quite warm and sunny, this was a most pleasant way to get around. We never had to wait very long for the next ferry, the times posted on the schedule are pretty accurate, and the staff all very helpful and welcoming. One word of warning, if you plan to stand/sit at the very front, do be prepared to get wet if a large wake is created crossing infront of the ferry! Definately a delightful, not particularly expensive way to get around Sydney!

You must take a ride on a Manly Ferry. The old cumbersome Manly Ferries are a Sydney icon. Reliable, large and plenty of seating on several decks. They offer the most interesting way of travelling from Manly Beach to Circular Quay Wharf near the city. As you come around the last bend in the harbour you see the harbour bridge straight ahead with the Opera House on the left. Quite a photo.

Clean and tidy and better still on time!. Was on time every time we used them, quick and easy to use, free wifi and clean. Staff were nice and friendly too and helped us out when we asked them anything.

A fresh look outside the harbor. We were told this is a "must do" and I see why. You get to see beyond the harbor, which in itself is fabulous, but allows you to get a glimpse of townships that comprise Sydney. There are so many ferries to choose from and I'm sure the evening ferry provides a whole new experience than during the day.Being on a budget, we chose the simple route which gives a straight shot ride across the harbor to Manly Beach and return, so the fee is roundtrip. The ferry doesn't even turn around; it goes backward. I looked at my pictures for the name, didn't find it, but they're popular. It's the big green one with the two tiered yellow top. It's amazing how many people they pack on there and with speed and efficiency. There is a restroom and a bar on the ferry and it is wheelchair accessible.It moves at quite a clip and along the way, the scenery is beautiful. Again, I took way too many pictures. Once at Manly Wharf, we took the time to explore the main road of Manly Beach and wished we had another day or so to spend there, as well as other little towns we saw. It was dusk on our return and what a sight. The harbor skyline is amazing as the sun sets. I would definitely consider a ferry ride late afternoon, early evening. Regardless, it was money well spent, fun, relaxing and a great opportunity for photo ops, not to mention, seeing another side of Sydney that we would not have seen.
Riding the Ferry. Even just a one-way ferry ride to Darling Harbor, you get an amazing view of the Sydney Opera House as well as the Harbor Bridge.
watsons bay. Took a relaxing ferry up to watsons bay just to sight see. Next time would love to get off and perhaps a walk around the gap.

Great way to travel. The Sydney ferries are a great way to travel around. They go just about everywhere. We found they ran on time, and are quite fast and efficient. Even just to go and have a look at places like Cremorne Point, Cockatoo Island, Manly, etc. A Ferry10 ticket is the most economical.

quick and easy. really easy way to get around Sydney definitely worth getting a weekly ticket for hop on/off travel including trains and buses easily got our monies worth several times over, clean and efficient with easy to follow timetables. also offer unbelievable views of many coves and beaches.

an interesting way to get to center sydney. Love this transportation option, very easy to get ticket and beautiful view along the trip. The ferries goes to important destination points. From the outskirt Sydney area, you can drive to the closest harbor and take the ferry to your destination and back to avoid traffic and expensive parking in the center Sydney area....we found that this is the best way to get to the city central....
Good view over the harbour. Took the ferry to the Taronga Zoo. Breeze and ease. Good view overlooking the harbour and a balcony to take photos on the way and efficient service.

Easy way to get around. We caught a ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour - very easy and great views of the harbour. We caught the bus/train back and would much rather have caught the ferry again.

Love being a senior!. Getting around Sydney and Sydney Harbour could not be easier and cheaper.Show your Seniors Card at any ticket outlet and ask for at PET a Pensioner Excursion Ticket & travel the city and the Harbour all day for only $2.50 - at Maccas, but a cheap burger and get your free tea/coffee with your seniors card.

what a fantastic service. i actually run a passenger daily boat tour in cyprus, and can't be but very impressed with sydney ferries. we purchased a weekly ticket... walked down to circular key every day bar one and jumped onto a boat and off we went... always on time...every time, well done guys...very impressive

Best vaule. A friend recommended that we do the Sydney Ferries saying it's the highlight of their one month trip travelling around Australia. We weren't too keen in the beginning but we have a couple of hours to spare before going to dinner so we thought we would give it a try. And how glad that we did. it's such good value and there's so much to see. This is a must do when you visit Syndey.

Great value. The best value in town BUY a MULTI PASS. We got a multi pass for 1 week & can get on & off all the buses, trains, ferries & trams as many times as we like for 1 week. Fantastic value. we got our money worth on the first day. The ferries are a great way to get around & see everything. The Zoo. Manly. Watsons Bay, Darling Harbour,Parramatta & the list just goes on. Try to go on every different route, worth the effort.

Great way to spend time. We rode every ferry they had at Circular Quay. Highly recommend any of them. They all have restrooms and the views from the boats is great no matter where you are going. A must do while in Sydney and a great way to get around when you don't have a car

Great value way to see the harbour. We took ferries to both Manly and Parramatta (via the Sydney Olympic Park) which gave us a great opportunity to see the harbour highlights for a very reasonable price.
rivercats. What a great way to venture into city on a Rivercat. Pick a sunny day & relax in the sun & enjoy the view along the river & towards the bridge

Nice Ferry System. The Sydney Ferries are very nice. If you go on Sunday's the fare for the ferries, trains, and buses is only $2.50 per person for all three. The boats are very nice and they have bathroom facilities on board.
Ferry Ride in the Sun. Taroonga Zoo by ferry is the best way to go. Sit in the sun and watch the world and the boats go by. Sometimes you get to see a US navy ship in port.

Family Funday Sunday,. $2.50 per person in your family makes this the best Sydney deal! Enjoyed the conversations with passengers as well as taking scenic photos of Sydney harbor. Make sure to go up on deck and be prepared for the crowds. Upon landing at Manly, the ferry landing offered a variety of food choices from seafood, Spanish, Japanese, gelatos and coffee.

Seniors - Get on Board. Getting around Sydney and Sydney Harbour could not be easier and cheaper.Seniors ( from any state in australia ) Show your Seniors Card at any ticket outlet and ask forat PET a Pensioner Excursion Ticket. It is valid for all•CityRail services •Government and private bus services •Government ferry services Travel the city and the Harbour all day for only $2.50You dont have to be a pensioner, just a Senior ( over 55 and working part-time )Get your Seniors Card first.When you are at McDonalds, but a cheap burger and get your free tea/coffee with your seniors card. Holidays in Sydney could not come cheaper than this.
Extremely good value for money. Don't waste your money on a fancy harbour cruise, take the ferry instead! It does exactly the same route.

Friendly, great views. The staff are friendly and helpful, which counts for a lot to me! The views from any ferry ride you take are absolutely gorgeous. Take a jacket and go outside for a bit to take pictures!

A great way to see the city. Going by ferry gives you a much better perspective of the city than you can get from the streets. It is especially good at night when all the city lights are reflected off the water. The trip to Manly is worth doing as is the trip from Darling Harbour to Circular Harbour.
Neutral Bay ferry. Take the ferry from Neutral bay for great sweeping views of the Opera House and Bridge, while visiting one of the prettiest suburbs in Sydney.
A great way to see the city.. When in Sydney a ferry trip is a must - they run like clockwork and give you a different view of the things to see in Sydney. Great for the kids too.

Well kept and on time. Bought the weekly pass for public transport. The ferries run well - people commute on them and for a week so did I. They leave frequently and schedules are easy to read. Staff is very helpful and patient with newbies. Great form of transport.

just ok. they seem to be using the wrong size ferries for certain trips, had to line up for 20 minutes waiting to get on a ferry after being not let on the the first ferry as it was too full. not sure if this is always like this (it was a beautiful sunday arv). would not use again for the price you could just about get a taxi or even walk, we just went from circular key to darling harbour
On time. We travelled as a family to Taronga zoo on the ferry. Ferries left and arrived ontime, it was a great way to see Sydney Harbour.
Sunday Funday. What a bargain that was 2.50 AUD each for all day travel (which we used to go to Manly Beach via Circular Quay)
Ferry ride. Took ferry to Watsons Bay. Beautiful views, and lovely walk to The Gap. Ferry was clean and very little swell in the harbour.

Sydney harbour ferries.. Great atmosphere with all the ferries buzzing in and out... we took one to Darling Harbour...can be a bit expensive if there's a family of four... on the return trip we fancied a walk back to see a few sights and was amazed that it only took us about the same time as the ferry did which was about 15 mins...

THE BEST OF SYDNEY HARBOR!. Sydney Ferries have been around since the 50's and earlier. One of the most popular is the ride to Manly - which is where my mother lives. If you are a visitor to Sydney that this is a must do. You get great pictures of the Sydney Harbor Bridge, the famous Opera House and all the activity of one of the best harbors in the world! You can take a ferry to Taronga Park Zoo and any other stop around this beautiful harbor. Of course I am most passionate about Manly - even though most visitors want to see the famous Bondi Beach. Manly beach is amazing. You can walk along the promenade and around to Shelley Beach and enjoy the sparkling waters and fresh air. Lots of cafes along the waterfront and many to choose from - plus many hotels to choose from. A walk up the Corso from the ferry to the beach is charming. Bring your bathing suit and sun block and a towel. Great surfing and lots to see. Everyone walking their dogs each morning, mothers with strollers on their morning power walks, early morning surfers braving the winter which is really not that cold. You will also see the gorgeous Sulphur Crested Cockatoos grazing on the grass down at the harbor front - a great photo opportunity as they are quite oblivious to your 2ft distance! Then it is back to the City and maybe another ride on these efficient and charming ferries!

A Sydney delight. Catching ferries around Sydney is the only way to go, buy a 10 ticket book, go pretty much anywhere you want. A highlight for us was a night trip around to Darling Point...beautiful city views.

Great way to get around in Sydney. Travel on the Ferry to beach at Manly, or to the zoo, or maybe Watsons Bay for some seafood, or use the Rivercat and travel up the river to Parramatta ,many other routes to choose from , a very scenic way to travel, they are clean and well kept

Great way to travel. If you get off one of these ferries miserable, you have serious issues in your life, because this is just a wonderful way to travel, offering an experience, views and the feel good factor. We love travelling on the ferries.
The way to see Sydney. Very efficient, turned up on time and for us are absolutely Sydney. Only drawback was the limited service from Double Day on a Sunday.

My Multi. We bought a my multi ticket for 7 days and could enjoy as many ferry, train and bus rides as we wanted. Taking the ferry gives you a different view of the city and Sydney is too big to walk everywhere. The ferry is expensive ($5,80 for 1 way) if you have to buy a ticket every time. The my multi was $44 for a whole week, so definitely worth it.

Great and scenic mode of transportation!. We used the ferry from Darling Harbor to Circular Quay. You can hop on and pay when you get off. You get a great view of the bridge and Harbour as you go across. You can pay when you get off ($5-6) as you need a ticket to exit. It ends up being faster and cheaper than a taxi during the morning rush hour. You can sit inside or outside. I like sitting outside in the front as there is a little bench up there.
Great way to cross harbour. Used by locals and tourist, very safe very reliable, great way to see the harbour bridge and opera house?
Great Sunday outing. Family tickets are available each Sunday, so we took the ferry to Paramatta. Relaxing journey and great to see another area of Sydney

Absolute Must do from Darling Harbour to Central. This is an opportunity to get some great photos of the harbour bridge and Opera House, especially at dusk. You can pay either as you get on or off so don't worry about boarding without a ticket. it will cost you between $5-6 a person

A great way to get around!. We travelled to Darling Harbour on the Ferry. It was a great ride (much cheaper than taking a tourist ferry around Sydney) at a great price and the weather was absolutely perfect!

The best thing about Sydney. Going on a ferry is about the best thing you can do in Sydney! The views you get from the water are far superior to that from the shore.One afternoon I had a bit of free time so jumped on the ferry to Manly and had an ice-cream in the wharf before getting the next one back... although coming back in a thunder & lightning storm wasn't quite what I'd intended!Unless its a very bad day, sit outside and feel the fresh air in your face!

The only way to see Sydney is from the water!. Sydney ferries and just the best way to see Sydney and its stunning harbour. Any time of the day or night, rain, hail or shine - it's a must! Well-appointed, clean, comfortable and moving at a perfect sight-seeing pace they are THE best way to see Sydney. Just hop onto a ferry and do the round trip if you don't have anywhere particular to go - you won't be sorry!

The force of the wind. While in a ferry the force of the wind on your face is priceless. That is the high point. I did not sit down for a second.Standing up front feeling the wind with with the amazing sea in front of you.

Best harbour cruise available!. Buy a weekly MyMulti pass for unlimited ferry, bus and train usage around Sydney (cost is going up from Sep 1 but still a bargain). You don't have to worry about getting tickets organised each time, you aren't constantly shelling out cash again and again just to get places, and if you go to say, Manly Beach, Watson's Bay for fish and chips, Circular Quay to Darling Harbour and then a few train and bus rides around the place - you easily get your money's worth.

Slow boat to wherever on the harbour. So many different ferries to take you to all sorts of destinations ie to the sydney zoo, darling harbour, to manly and other destinations. Great on a windy day if you dont get sea sick

Great transport. Sydney ferries connects so well from Circular Quay to other places (Paramatta River, North Sydney, Greenwich..etc.) You will see a lot of different types of ferry stopping there. It is great place to go and connect to other places by taking the ferry.

Great Public Transport with a View. Taking the Sydney public ferries from Circular Quay is a great cheap way to travel around to various spots of Sydney Harbour and Darling Harbour and you get the beautiful views as a bonus. The ferries have easy access on board and off, all offer conveniences, and many also offer snack food and drinks. You don't need a car, the ferry are convenient and will take you all around the harbour and down its rivers. A must journey to take whilst in Sydney to get the best views of Sydney Harbour and its famous icons.

Travel off peak. An interesting way to enjoy the Harbour. Catch a ferry and enjoy a coffee near a wharf then enjoy the trip back. Avoid peak time for a relaxing trip and choose a day you can sit outside.

Great way to see Sydney. If you buy a multi-day pass you can go all over Sydney incredibly cheaply because it covers ferries, buses and trains. Most tourists probably only need a zone 1 pass. A lot of fun to take a ferry, get off and walk through a neighbourhood or through a park, and then back on again to another destination. Watch out on Sundays, as the service slows down a bit, so you have to plan more carefully.

The only way to explore Sydney Harbour. Buy a travel 10 ticket or some such other multi journey package and explore the harbour and the older suburbs that cling to the harbour's foreshore. This is the most cost effective way to see Neutral Bay, Kirribilli, Balmain, Greenwich, Drummonyne etc. which offer visitors an introduction as to how Sydneysiders live, work and play. Each has its own charm and character and most offer good quality eating/drinking with easy walk of the ferry wharf (Greenwich is an exception to this). The Ferries also give you the chance to meet the locals who use the ferry service to commute to and from work, though you might want to avoid the morning and evening rush hours!

Great way to see the harbor and it's many sites. Sydney's ferries are clean and efficiently run. You can do a short journey - to Luna Park for example, or a much longer trip along the Parramatta River. We went under the bridge to Balmain to visit a popular bakery. These journeys are a fun way to fill in an hour and see one of the nicest looking harbors in the world.
Only way to see Sydneyv. Reasonable prices ,efficient and the best way to see Sydney and the harbour . What a way to travel to work every day !

Public transport at its best. What I liked about this was on major event days its free to travel! Saw the third test between the lions and Aus and it was free to get to the Olympic Stadium. Great idea.
Best Value. The city Multi pass covers the ferries. There are commercial jump on and off boats, but its basically the same service and its included in your pass.

Ferry of a Lifetime. Come on, you can't do Sydney without hitting the ferries. The day is twice as gorgeous while out on sea, going to beautiful port to beautiful port. But let me give you some advice you likely haven't heard before -- hit the ferries and get off Cremorne Point on New Year's Eve and see the world's best fireworks show from dusk to midnight. Be prepared to pack your picnic, wear a windbreaker, and be ready to stay out past 3 a.m. due to all the crowds that will slow you getting home. But what a show.

The best way to see Sydney. The ferries are a wonderful way to see the harbour city, a morning trip to Watson's bay and lunch at either Doyle's or The Watto Hotel then a stroll to the bluff or just catch the ferry and return stunning views

You Haven't Been To Sydney Until You've Caught A Ferry!. Ferries are how the locals still get across Sydney Harbour for work and leisure and if you don't want to waste your hard earned travel bucks on an expensive tourist harbour cruise, just jump on a ferry at Circular Quay and head out anywhere towards Ultimo, Darling Harbour, Balmain and you'll go under the bridge, with fabulous views back to the Opera House and Bridge. Get up close and personal with the face of Luna Park. It's a photographers paradise and you'll get fabulous shots to take home by night, or day and in any weather.The round trip back to Circular Quay will cost well under A $10!Simply enjoy, pack your camera, avoid peak business commute hours and you'll probably find a Sydney Ferry ride will call you back again and again. Also recommend the trip out to Paramatta, along the Parramatta river, in the flat bottomed Rivercat ferry, past the Homebush 2000 Olympic Games site to Paramatta itself. Home of Elizabeth and Experimental Farm and Old Government House. Another lovely day trip of historic interest.Then there is the ferry-Zoo ticket deal, available at the Circular Quay Terminal, an iconic Sydney must, or if you simply want to chill awhile. try the longer trip, across to Manly.Sydney Ferry Crew are always cheery and obliging, from my experience. One of the reasons I keep going back!

Gorgeous harbour. Always a gorgeous way to see one of the most beautiful harbours in the world! We always try to get on the harbour when in Sydney and the ferry service provides many great trips including to Taronga Zoo and Manly

Great way to see the harbour. Cheap, efficient and an excellent way to see the harbour. Don't get ripped off on a harbour cruise, buy an all day pass and travel all over the harbour at a fraction of the price. The trip to Manly is well worth it, Also take the ferry to Darling Harbour from Circular Quay instead on the train or bus, it takes about 10 minutes and you get to view one of the world's top harbours.

consider this instead of the tour boats. well-signed, these ferries are a delightful way to visit both the harbor itself as well as reaching Manly, the zoo, or Watson's Bay. The Watson's Bay ferry hugs the southern shore and provides easy access form which to take the bus to Bondi Beach. With a modicum of planning this can be a great way to get out on the water.
what a great way to travel. not sure how they are paid for as none seemed to be that busy - but what a GREAT way to get around and enjoy one of the worlds scenic harbours
Very Good. This is a great way to travel, inexpensive, no traffic jams and great views as well. Coming back from Manly to Circular Quay at sunset is a must!

Download the Trip View App to get the timetables. The Sydney ferry service is very extensive and includes most ferries on the harbour with the exception of the Manly Fast Loop, so a public transport daily or weekly ticket can cover wherever you need to go on the harbour.
Sydney ferries. An excellent and unexpensive way to tour the beautiful harbour and to get to destinations across the harbour.
Ferries are Fun!!!. Great way to get around Sydney! Very clean and comfortable! They were not crowded at all, as many ferries go back and forth all day.

Sydney Ferries great way to see Sydney. I was blown away by the extensive service the Sydney ferries provided. I talk a ferry to Taronga Park Zoo, went under the Sydney harbour bridge, experienced scenic views past Sydney Opera House. Definitely the way to go. Staff are very helpful.
