Efficient transport system. Great way to explore Sydney Harbour - even if you just take a ferry to see whats at the end of the line! Quite cheap to use and they certainly run on time. The staff at the office on Circular Quay were really helpful. I recommend the trip to Watson's Bay.

Simply the best and only way to get around. No stress, cheap and frequent and all such scenic , short trips; simply the only way to get around, day or night and just gorgeous views and the harbour, opera house, bridge etc. What a civilised way to get around and just imagine if one could commute to work on these!? Am so jealous!!

Loving them more and more. We are starting to use ferries more often as a way of enjoying Sydney.In the past we would have driven to activities in the city assuming that gave us more flexibility but now we have adjusted our lives around the ferry timetables and are enjoying a variety of activities from restaurants to theatre, joined the MCA and enjoying all the benefits the city has without the stress of driving and parking.The ferries may be old but that adds to their character and you never get tired of the sights of the Harbour - every trip seems like a special occasion now.

A cheap tour!. A journey on the old Sydney ferries is like going on a cheap tour of the harbour. Go from circular key to Manly, or even a short trip across the Harbour, and you'll have great views, fresh air and hopefully - sunshine!

Normal. Just a normal mode of transporting within the tour spots. But a good opportunity to just view past the surroundings on the ferry if you do not intend to vist each tour spot. I got to see a few cruise boats on my ride.
They run like clockwork. We used almost all the ferries to all the destinations over our long visit and found them very efficient,clean,comfortable,and "On Time" every time. Well done you guys.

Good Value Cruises. The Sydney ferries from Circular Quays are a great way to enjoy the world famous views of Sydney Harbour. They are good value and if you buy a return ticket, it allows you to stop at the various jetties, explore the area, then hop on the next ferry to proceed to the next jetty. A perfectly enjoyable way to explore the harbourside suburbs of Sydney while enjoying possibly the best views in the world.
Best way to get around.. If you are used to travelling on buses then these are the Sydney equivalent. Ferries take all around the harbour in a speedy efficient manner-& they are economical.

Great Way To get Around. The only way to see Sydney Harbour in all its glory. Day and Weekly passes are available which include buses and trains also. We spent a fantastic week using the ferries to sightsee. Frequency and punctuality are first rate. A must if you visit Sydney.

Get an all day ticket and go nuts on the ferries/trains and buses!. For the best value tour of the harbour get an all day ticket to the rail, ferry and buss for $22 for an adult. That will get you unlimited rides on everything all day and night. The best value!!!!

Great way to see the harbour. Took the Hop on Hop Off Captain Cook Cruises boats. We went out to Watson's Bay. Great views looking back to Sydney from here. The ferry makes stops throughout the harbour. Also goes over to Darling Harbour. With the HOHO pass, you can ride all day.
Great Value. The ferries are a great way to see the vast Sydney Harbour at a very reasonable price. We spent 1 1/2 hours on the ferry and enjoyed all of it.
good service!. used this service several times during our 3 week stay.found them punctual and relaxed very strict on safety which is a comfort.
a great way to get a feel of Sydney. to get around rather then sitting on a bus. Better views and more fresh air!Very clean boats, plenty of departures and easy to navigate the timetable.
over to the zoo. travelled over to Taronga zoo, the ferry was clean, and the trip was pleasant, excellent public transport
Best Way to see Sydney. buy a day ticket and spend the day in the harbour, visting all the different bays, beaches and landspots. Friendly crew, great day out
Great service. Liked the ease of riding the ferries. Price also good.Very clean and comfortable. Sraff were wonderfull and helpfull when answering our questions.
Efficient and relatively cheap. Run to a good schedule but don't run late enough. latest ones are all just after 10 from the centre of the city

Only way to appreciate Sydney Harbour. Recently travelled from Darling Harbour around to Circular Quay. A very pleasant and leisurely 20 minute trip. Have previously travelled on all Sydney Ferry routes and really enjoy the Manly Ferry Run which we did not too long ago. Best times to travel are outside School and Public Holidays between 10am and 4 pm.
Ah the Views. By touring on the ferries, you get to where you should go in any event, but also have the joy of a water-to-land view that is largely unobstructed. Very nice.
Best way to explore Sydney!. It's a great way to get about & great value. Perfect way to see the famous sights & creates a lot of brilliant photo opportunities!

great way to get to manly. quicker and prettier to get to manly from the city
avoid the traffic nightmare and go via ferry
Ferry is clean and has snacks and drinks if you need
Great way to check out some of sydney

Family Funday Sunday!. On Sunday's an adult travelling with a child under 16 can catch a Sydney Ferry for only $2.50! We hopped on at Circular Quay and did the loop around to Darling Harbour and back (I think it took about half an hour). Try and get a seat outside, but it does get windy so hold on to your hat, my daughter lost hers overboard & it was strapped under her chin! Taking the ferry is a fantastic way to get some amazing photos of Sydney Harbour, the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge and other attractions & landmarks.

Nice!. If you're in Sydney and want to see the city from the harbour (it's absolute best view) then you have to go on one of the ferries. This particular time I went form Darling Harbour to Circular Quay. It was a pleasant 25 minute journey. The ferrie was very clean and efficient. The views were stunning and to go under the bridge is still exciting despite having done it many, many times. Highly recommended.

See what makes Sydney sizzles!!. If you love the sea breeze and want to see Sydney's skyline at the same time, look no further. Head down to Circular Quay (the Harbour) and take the many ferries available at the 6 quays. You can dine and cruise, cruise only or just take a single or multiple ferry trips to see the beautiful coastal attraction off Sydney.With the Cruise at Quay No.6, you pay AUD28 for "hop-on, hop-off" cruise to Taronga Zoo, Watson Bay, Manly Beach, Luna Park and many other places. You can hop-off to explore these places or stay in the yatch for a 2 hour cruise. Buy your lunch before you board, though as there is no food or drink sold on board. Get ready for a wonderful trip and see both the Sydney harbour and The Sydney Opera House. And while you are at the Harbour, make that tour to the Opera House. The tour will set you back for AUD35 while it's free to roam outside it.And... don't forget the fish and chips....there's nothing like eating takeaway fish and chips with the scent of the ocean around you...and the flocks of seagulls...and Ibis....enjoy !!!

relax. The ferry rides were very relaxing way to spend time while getting beautiful photographs of the Harbor Bridge, Opera House, bays, and ships. Buy a MyMulti pass and ride the ferries, trains, buses, and light rail all for one price!
Don't Miss This. A wide range of ferries from the large ones going to Manly to the little harbour taxis enjoy them all.
A must d.. You must have a ride on Sydney's famous harbour ferries. Very regular and right on time and not too expensive.

Sydney to Manly. This is a wonderful way to see the HArbour, plus your destination at Manly is a great location in itself. If you are only in Sydney for a short time, treat yourself to a day return to Manly. Enjoy the crossing over and back, enjoy the view. Manly is a very pleasant destination with lovely shops, cafes, restaurants and beaches, and then if you go back to the city in the evening on the return ferry trip, Sydney Harbour offers a whole new experience at night time, the lights, the view, the skyline, is breath taking.
Just the best way to see Sydney from he water. Take a ride on any ferry but the best is a trip to Manly and back. Great views and take a stroll down to Manly beach and the stores and eateries too.

great, once to get the hang of it. seems like this is used more by tourists. clean, punctual, and i enjoyed it. at times the signs were confusing, and even blatantly wrong (only happened once). some ferries are run infrequently and some stop way too early (Watson Bay's last ferry is around 3p) buy a 1 week unlimited public transport (not monorail) pass for $44 (day is $22)

great value for the ride. after all the taxis and bus tours we found the ride on the Ferries a great way to see the sights around the harbors. for a small fee you can ride the Ferries around the harbors and to several other places . there is no guide to what you are seeing however you will get to see everything harbor side and easy access to several other places .

Nice way to get around Sydney. it's another way of transport, twice the price of a train ticket but gets you to your destination quicker. specially if you need to go to Manly, I think it is the quickest way to get there. the services are very reliable and there is WI-FI on board

Unforgivable. I do not have the words to describe my disgust at how poor this company operates. For the last month I have used these guys to get from Manly to Circular Quay and Darling Harbour, they don't give a 'jot' for you as a customer. An examples, Australia Day 2013, extra ferries took people to Darling Harbour, but after the fireworks when everyone was waiting patiently for the return ferry from Pyrmont to Circular Quay, the 9.30pm ferry came, allowed 3 people to board, and abandoned the rest of us (some 50, 60 people) who would then miss our last ferry home to Manly. The Captain just put his head out the window shouting at us to 'check the timetable for the next scheduled ferry service'!! No extra ferries had been put on to return us to Circular Quay, how irresponsible considering Darling Harbour was packed to capacity, and everyone was going to miss their last ferry home. what where we supposed to do 'walk on water' home to Manly??Where is their social responsibility or 'matesmanship' to fellow Aussies on Australia Day???...how ironic...

Check your tickets. I recently travelled from Darling Harbour to Cockatoo Island (there is no other option to get there) on the Sydney Ferries. When about to use a machine to buy a ticket I was offered the services of a Sydeny Ferry ticket man to amke things easier. I just got home and found that I was charged $44 for 2 adult return tickets that shoudl ahve been $28.80. Currently waiting thier reply to refund the difference. If that what happens to Aussies in our own country, what are they doing to tourists?

Unique opportunity for relaxing and sight seeing. You have a choice of routes to various parts of Sydney Harbour, and the tickets are very reasonable. You can just sit on the deck and enjoy sun and wind and the view, then go home. Or you can go to any of the destination, have a meal out, and return by the same route or bus or train on a day ticket. Enjoy it, not many cities offer anything like this.
hop on / off. great way to cruise around the harbour & get your bearings as to where you want to hop off....we hopped off at the Zoo - great & Darling Harbour..awesome.

Budget river cruise!. On a nice day, the trip down to Paramatta and back is a great way to spend a dew hours. We went on a Monday so paid $14 each return......if you get the chance to sit up the front and soak up the sunshine I would highly recommend a relaxing trip down the river

Don't pay for a harbour boat trip. Just take the ferry to Manly for a great trip - you see so much on your way. Ferry takes around 1/2 an hour - you do get free WiFi on the ferry too which is very helpful.

Efficient but expensive. Like most things I am discovering in Sydney, very expensive. The ride to Taronga Zoo was fast and efficient at only 12 minutes, free wifi on the upper deck was a bonus, though they have disabled Viber on their network, so i couldn't call home, which might have lost them a point.

Ferries. Brilliant way to see the sights,did manley ferry followed bt watsons bay. Also went to mosman bay we were based at darling harbour just kept jumping off one to another. Good views of bridge,opera house and all the boats.

Just do it, even it going nowhere!!!. Why not? May as well!!, it's the most convenient and scenic way of getting round the urban archipelago that is modern Sydney. If you get lost, it's a boat ride. If not, you've got so many sights seen during and at the end if ach journey. The only shame, us that boats don't eat you to Bondi

A fun way to travel around Sydney Harbour!. The ferries are great! It doesn't matter what time of day you travel -- there is always a ferry to take to somewhere around the harbour. Get an all-day pass and explore for a very reasonable price. You can go to Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, Cremorne, Manly, or anywhere in between. Wonderful views of Sydney!

Take the ferry to Parramata or Manly. If visiting Sydney, you don't necessarily have to go on a tour.
All the regular ferry lines will give you a trip to remember:
Take the trip to Parramata and you will see Inner West and Sydney Olympic Park.
Or take Manly line to the beautiful beach!
Or take a trip to Watson Bay for a ride around the Harbour

Ferry from Sydney Harbour to Manly.. The ferry ran on time was clean and comfortable. Our trip to Manly was a highlight of our time in Sydney and returning on the ferry at sunset was unforgettable. The sun setting behind the bridge and glistening off the opera house was quite stunning as was the skyline of Sydney with all the lights coming on.

A must for all visitors. From one of the many ferries you get such excellent vierws of Sydney and once you've reached landing stage further along the bay the coastal walks are most enjoyable. At Circular Quay there are clear plans and electronic boards informing you of the ferries which run very punctually. However, even for a short hop across the bay you still have to pay for a full journey or a full day ticket which is then very expensive.

Cheep way to see the harbour.. You don't have to buy the harbour cruises to see the Sydney harbour sites, just take a ferry. We took the ferry to Manley, git great views of the bridge and the opera house, and also got to see Manley and the beach.

A great way to get around. From my hotel being just two minutes from Circular Quay and staying in Sydney for a week the ferry provided a very efficient way to get around and for the time I had when not working my weekly ticket gave me the opportunity to get to some great locations. A must for the visitor to Sydney.

best way to visit sydney from the water. couldnt wait to go on one of those ferries to browse around sydney from the waterside. its absolute worth it, its comfortable to been carried around for a change and let islands pass - you can buy return-tickets or combo tickets, so you need information about their offers to match with your plans

Good Value. The Sydney ferries are a good way to get around the area. For example, we used the ferry to get to the Taranga Zoo. The combo ticket covered our ferry ride and the zoo entry. The best part is that we didn't have to stand in line again when we reached the zoo.

Great way to tour Sydney Harbour and surrounding islands. The ferries are a great way to rest your tired feet and see the sites of Sydney. We bought a daily pass and took the ferries everywhere in a day. I suggest passing on Cockatoo Island though.
Scenic ride. The ferries are great way to get around and enjoy the beauty that Sydney has to offer. They are a little more expensive than getting on a train or bus but well worth it!

Awesome Cruise. Highly recommended. This is an excellent was to see the habour without walking. Recommended for just about anyone, but especially for seniors or those who tire easily from walking. A nice way to end a long day.

Best cruise value. There are one-day and weekly tickets of various sorts for public transport. All the ferries go to and from Circular Quay, and you can see a lot of the harbour by riding a few of the ferries, while paying far less than for one cruise.

Orientate yourself at a low low cost. The best way to get around Sydney and discover the beautiful Sydney Harbour. They're not always the newest ferries but that's half of the charm of seeing Sydney from the water. So what does it matter if you get salt water on the face and in the hair.

Weekend rates are superb. Travelled with 2 kids from Rydalmere to Darlling Habour and cost each person $2.50 for the day, yes that's right it includes the return journey and any other public transport travel in and around Sydney for the day.What a fantastic deal especially for families.So much fun for the kids and a great way to travel without all the hustle and bustle of trains or busses.

Great way to get around and see the city. There is no reason to book a $100+ harbour cruise, as these ferries go everywhere you would want to go, and offer up the same views. We purchased a 7 day transit pass, which included all ferries, buses, light rail, and commuter trains, for only $51. They offer a number of different passes, included ferry only passes. The ferries run on a very regular schedule during the day, usually ever 20 minutes, and offer ample seating, both inside and out. We spent a whole day just riding the different ferry lines and exploring the neighborhoods at the other end. At the very minimum, one should take the ferry to Manly Beach, as well as Watson's Bay (which offers some amazing views of where the harbour meets the sea via the two walkways from the ferry terminal). The river ferry is also a good choice to see a different side of Sydney.It is very easy to find the right ferry from the main ferry terminal, as the piers are clearly marked and there are plenty of electronic signs. Unfortunately, the other ferry piers are much less user friendly, often lacking any electronic signs, as well as very limited schedule info. Since some piers are served by multiple ferries, you have to make sure you are getting on the right boat. Also, if you plan on traveling after 7pm, make sure you know the schedule in advance, as ferry service becomes much less frequent, and many stops are taken out of service. We made the mistake of taking the river ferry at 7pm, waiting until the sun started to set on a 40+ degree C day. As it turned out, rather than going to the normal final stop, Parramatta Pier (which is a large suburb which is well served by buses and rail), the ferry only went to the Olympic pier. The ferry schedule indicated that a bus serviced this station, but we found out that the bus only runs during very limited hours. We hoped that we would at least be able to walk around and see some of the olympic stadiums/structures, while waiting for the next ferry, in an hour. Unfortunately, this pier is miles away from anything whatsoever, in the absolute middle of nowhere. The only people who use it are people who park their cars and ride the ferry, so I would not advise anyone else to get off here, and I cannot imagine why anyone would be so ignorant as to make such an isolated stop the terminus pier on a ferry line (as just about every other stop before and after it is well served by bus and rail service).
excellent. Great service, fast and cheap. Highly advise this to anyone! Make sure you wear sunscreen! It is a very fast trip.

A relaxing way to travel. We recently spent three weeks in Mosman and regularly caught the ferry into town and back. They run reasonably often, there was always room, even on New Years eve when many people were scrambling to the best views in Sydney Harbour. The staff were friendly, often saying "good morning" to us when we boarded. There were plenty of machines at Circular Quay to buy a ticket and the staff at the gates were also very friendly and helpful. It was always restful and peaceful on the ferries looking at the lovely waterfront properties and for only a few dollars worthwhile taking the trip and avoiding the roads. Thoroughly recommended!

A great way to get around.. The ferries are a great and scenic way to get around. If you want a narrated tour, then go with one of the travel/cruise operators, but if you aren't too worried about that, the Sydney Ferries (public transport) are a much cheaper option. $22 for adults, $11 for kids, $2.50 pensioner for all day. Darling Harbour has three stops, but the King St one if the most frequent. Don't be confused by the stop near the Aquarium. Continue a bit further down the warf to find the main terminal. Also, as others have pointed out, there is free wifi on a lot of them. Often just up on the top deck though.The "recommended length of visit" is a bit deceptive. Can be anywhere from a few mins for a short trip to the whole day.

Go places - easy!. The ferries from Circular Quay were a great way to take in more than just harbour front Sydney... We took one to Taronga Zoo and another to Manly which gave us great photo ops as well as getting us there!

Best way to get around Sydney. Best way to get around Sydney. Don't spend your money on special cruises, yellow and green ferry will do the job. Use it to get to Manly, ZOO, Darling Harbour, lunapark or go anywhere really. Jump off where you like it, take some pics and go back. It's great fun, staff is very polite and bigger boats have bars and free wifi, what more do you want?

secrets. the little ferries that service the harbor are a great way to discover the secrets of Sydney ........ the trips to Taronga Park Zoo, Watson's bay or the head of the Parramatta river al make a cheap days entertainment and excitement ...... showing the majestic views of the Bridge and Opera house from so many different angles.

Great views and great way around :D. I found that the ferries were a bit expensive. But the view was beautiful. I caught the ferry to Manly beach, and it was wonderful. We got to see dolphins in the harbour and great scenery. It was a comfortable ride and a good way to get around Sydney.

Free wifi - great way to get around. Really enjoyed Sydney's public transportation, and most of all the ferries - took the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour - a fun afternoon. Loved the free wifi on the ferry!

A must do in Sydney. Doesn't matter which ferry you take but you must take at least one ferry ride on the beautiful Harbour in Sydney. The many one is a favourite as it is 1/2 hour and you see most of the harbour east of the bridge and quite inexpensive compared to tourist operating boats.
Rivercat to Abbotsford. Great way to see parts of Sydney Harbour that are west of the Bridge. If the weather is fine, a seat outside at the front is a great spot.
Comfortable and Easy Way to Travel.. Buy a Transportation Pass and take the ferry or buses to get around. The ferry is an easy ride to explore othr areas around Sydney.

Great Way to See Sydney. We paid AU$61 for a week's worth of unlimited travel by train, bus and ferry, and it was worth every penny. The one-hour ride to Parramatta is a lovley, calm, quiet trip on a very stable and near-silent catamaran ferry.
Take to the Water to See All the Sights. Rapid, reasonable transport - from the hub of a great city. Best way to travel if you want to get anywhere. Check out the trip to Manly!

Sydney Sailing!. Loved travelling on the Balmain to Circular Quay ferry whilst visitingSydney. What a fantastice way to travel. It's like being on a mini pleasure cruise round Sydney Harbour.
Each time I travelled the ferry arrived on time, the staff are courteous and helpful, it's a great transport system.
Sydney Ferries. Fantastic way to see Sydney, Although it was very crowded when I was there but I imagine that I experienced it at its busiest travel period. Highly recommend to anybody.

Excellent value for money. You can buy an all day ticket for 23 dollars, and hop on any of the Ferries to go to any of the destinations available. Well worth the money and sightseeing if your feet are tired of walking!

Good way to get around. While in Sydney we took 3 ferry rides to different locations. It was very easy to find out which one to take but we never knew whether we were supposed to buy tickets on the ferry or purchase beforehand or when we got off, got very confusing, but a great service.
Fantastic. The best, fastest and cheapest way yo get around. Jump on the ferry to go almost anywhere. Bondi, Manly, The Zoo, and just to see the sites.

Leisurely day on the harbour. Start at Circular Quay where you can see the range of ferry routes available, then pick one and get on with it. You could spend a week cruising the harbour if it takes your fancy!

Ride around all day!. Simply the best way to enjoy beautiful Sydney Harbour. Staff are always very friendly and helpful. You can get chilled water onboard. Sit outside but wear a hat that wont get blown off.

Efficient and tidy. The ferries run regularly, boarding and disembarking were handled efficiently, and the passenger areas were amazingly neat for the volume of traffic. I did find the prices to be a little high for public transport, but since most public transport doesn't also come with a view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge, I could overlook the cost.
A bargain. The ferries are prompt, and they have free wi-fi. The views are spectacular. Fares are very reasonable.

What a wonderful sunset from the Manley Ferry. We would recommend taking the original Manley Ferry (not the fast ferry) back into Sydney just before sunset. We managed to time our ferry ride just right and had wonderful views of the Bridge and Opera House to remember our trip. The trip was recommended by our tour guide and was a perfect end to the day.

as good as ever. I haven't been on the ferries for years and had to get on one to go to Manly it was great, there was 1000 people on our ferry, the same on the one before and also the one after, but it was still a great trip, lots of seating and a very smooth ride.

Charming. Equipped with Wi-Fi so that as you went on a cruise, you could check against your device what you were seeing, or if you had doubts about something. And what order while getting on and off the ferry! A lovely experience...

FERRY TALES COME TRUE. For the traveller the most fun way to get around. For those working ....could there be a better way to commute? Single or return tickets but the best value is a day ticket or a weekly MULTI ticket which can be used on ferries, bus and some trains. For instance, ferry trip to Manley takes half an hour, and passes the Opera House, Bridge, Government House, the fabulous houses on the harbours edge, Chowder Bay and Balmoral Beach before arriving at Manley Wharf. And the return is another half an hour of pure pleasure. A ride on several of the ferries shows the beauty and the diversity of this wonderful harbour. We too have found the staff on the ferries to exceed expectation in customer service. We find it a more interesting alternative, and more cost effective than a Harbour Tour. What more can you want from a ferry ... except free WiFi ...and we see some of them provide that too!
see Sydney. these wonderful ferries go to all parts of Sydney which the traveller would require. They are efficient and reliable and easy to use
Beautiful views. Really nice and easy way to see the harbour! Quickest way to get to Manly or visit other areas around the bay.

Great way to get around. and have a view of Sydney at the same time. I think it is actually the quickest way to get around Sydney as you are avoiding the traffic and these ferries go so regularly that you can get anywhere in Sydney very fast

Never thought that I would write this review.. OK we are retired and both travelled on NSW public transport for 40 years and we are both accustomed to no service at all from State rail, Sydney Ferries whatever. To our surprise we utilized the ferries during a recent stay to get around and the service was spectacular. Friendly smiling faces and young people willing to offer assistance and help to a couple of oldies unused to the current Sydney system. This did not happen once but consistently over a few days. We were made to feel special and important. We were welcomed aboard and wished a happy day by young smiling people.Congratulations to whomever runs this show you are finally getting it right and a special thanks to all those young people who helped us you did very well indeed. The ferries are a great way to get around and we will used them in future.Also a very helpfull bus driver went out of his way to assist us. How things have changed.
Good fun. Great way to get around Sydney harbour and it is so cheap.The ferries run all day long.Just do it !

buy a weekly ticket. We collected all the timetable leaflets for each route at the start. (They really work).We strongly recommend buying a weekly travel ticket which also includes all buses, trams, railway in the centre. Its huge value at Aus$44. From then on the rides are free.Everybody in the world says these old ferry boats are the best way to see the Harbour, getting on and off to see high-end residential districts to tourist tat (Darling Harbour). Less obvious isyou can use the ferries at all times of day. Like a lote of jet-lagged Europeans we were early risers so go on a ferry to Manly to have breakfast on the Ocean Surf Beach. After dark and after dinner we wandered onto ferries to anywhere to see the harbour lights by night - absolute magic. All the ferries leave and come back to Circular Quay and round trips are easy.
efficient. Its great to see a city so organised on their waterfront transportation needs. The ferries run smoothly and on time. The cost is reasonable and allows multiple trips to various locations.
wow - great views. We caught a ferry to Taronga Zoo and the 12 minute ride was very easy. The views of the harbour are superb and there was also free wi-fi on the boat.
Slow and traditional. great way to hop from place to place and get a good view of the bridge. Its getting a bit old but otherwise good and staff are helpful and informative.
Great value!. We were in Sydney for 6 days so we bought a my multi 1pass which was excellent value so we went on all the ferries.Fab views and always on time.

Great way to see the beautiful Sydney Harbour. Taking a Harbour Ferry ride is a great and cheap way to see the Harbour. We have been on the Manly Ferry quite a few times, and also across to Luna Park. Beautiful views of the Harbour, the Bridge, Opera House etc. The kids love it. Take a stroll around Cirqular Quay and the Rocks as well. Beautiful part of the city.

Fun rides as events, more than transportation. The ferries are well-organized, signs are clealry marked, ferries are on time. Ferrying aro9und the harbours is an event in and of itself, more than just a means to get somewhere
Sydney ferries. What better way to see the Harbour at economical price...go to Manly stay for a stroll thenc ome back....excellent.

Cheap Entertainment. Travelling on the ferries is a cheap way to get a fantastic view of Sydney. We always buy a Multi Pass which provides travel on trains, buses & ferries. Today we went to Watson's Bay which was great.

A cheap and great way to see Sydney Harbour. This is an excellent way to see your way around Sydney Harbour, using the public ferry system. Manly is a wonderful ferry ride that covers a lot of the harbour. If you have a few hours to kill, then this is one way to do it, take your camera and enjoy the views you will see.

included in the day pass. great for tourists. if you'll be traveling throughout the city, opt for the day pass and you'll get to enjoy the train, buses, AND ferries. all inclusive. leaving from circular quay, you can catch the ferries to various areas of sydney including the fish market and manly.

Quick alternative to buses and trains. We found the ferries reliable and fast to get to destinations around the harbor. At busy times make sure you are early so you can board first to get prime location for a seat with a view. Look into buying a concession pass - worth buying if you are taking several routes.
Sydney Ferries. The best view of Sydney Harbour you can get and they take you all over!. Well priced and good service.
Cheapest best option of seeing Sydney!. Nothing like it anywhere else anda bargain for the journies. I would recommend a round-trip fare from Circular Quay to Manly or Paramatta.
Great. Really easy access from Circular Quay, plenty destination on the harbour. We went to Manly, 30 mn journey and this very pleasant
Perfect way to get around Sydney. Perfect way to get around Sydney that also provides some stunning views back over the city. Darling Harbour, Circular Quay and the Taronga Zoo just a short hop away.

Took the fery to manley beach. It was a lovely afternnoon trip. We went to manley beach. The fery was an efficient means of getting there. It provided great vistas of sydney and the harbour entrance. The ferry runs very frequently so no worries about getting there and back.
Great value travel. Perfect way to get around in Sydney, just make sure you have a timetable to hand else you might get stranded!

Convenient. Love the ferries, easy to use.
Getting a day travel pass was difficult. Often easier to just buy one way or return tickets
Fascinating. Like water ants they scurry about carrying tourists and commuters alike.Watching them at circular quay is fascinating and riding them made me feel like a real Aussie.

Best way to see Sydney harbor and up the river. It is an economical and convenient transport to go around the many attractions in the Sydney area. Beautiful homes along the water, a must do trip to the Sydney Zoo, a half day trip to Manly Beach, the pictures come out great by the Opera House and the Sydney Harbor Bridge

Take a dinner cruise too. It's hard to see Sydney and it's harbors without getting on a ferry. We went on several and were happy with our decision. From the beautiful homes along the water to catching a glimpse of a whale, and then of course the Opera house and bridge. Wow! I could live there!

Fun to do. Ferries were so busy two by-passed us but the service did keep us informed and put on extra boats. Gave only 3 stars because the ticketing system was abysmal ... Advise you leave plenty of time to buy a ticket!!

When the ticketing machines break in peak season. When they broke we had to miss 3 ferries queuing for manual tickets. Then the ticketing lady insisted on seeing my pensioner ID. I had left my wallet at the hotel and she simply didn't buy my grey hair as evidence I qualified for a concession. Thus holding up the queue. Frustration from all travelers at a "giving" time of year?
Lots of fun. We travled on the sydney ferry in late august. Great fun, would do it again! If you catch the manley ferry you go right out betewen the headlands!
cheap way to see harbour. I had a couple of hours to fill in and did a return trip to Manly. Great way to fill in time and to see the harbour. Very relaxing.

A day of sheer joy. Just wander all over the system, get on and off at will, wander ashore then move on, stop for coffee, lunch, a stroll, whatever takes your fancy, a glorious way to spend the day afloat on a waterway of impressive grandure
Amazing. By the day pass and hop around to different sites for a day. This was one of my favorite things. You see the entire harbor for cheap. Go to Watsons Bay and Manly Beach.

Great adventures. Made several trips on the sydney ferries... even out to Parramatta in torrential rain and had a great time. the ferries are regular and a great way to see the sights of sydney even if you cross the harbour or go to Darling Harbour and back.

sydney ferries. What a great trip from central key over to manly.Looked around manly than caught ferry back.
Plenty to look at on way over very relaxing

Great experience. Great experience - kids loved the ride, and the staff on the boats were very friendly and accommodating. Buying tickets was a bit frustrating - eventually found someone to explain the machines and then it was fine.

Sydney Family Funday Sunday. The Sydney Ferries charge $2.50 per person for all day use on ferries, buses and trains on Sunday! We hopped on a ferry and spent the afternoon at Manly Beach. It is a very efficient way to travel.
A fantastic way to see the city at almost zero cost. These little ferries run frequently, give a great view of the city, and run frequently. No brainer! :)

What an interesting ride!. The ferries were excellent mode of transport to the Tarangoo Zoo and Manly. Ferries to Manly are of a bigger size, with bigger sitting capacity, and thus more stable. The rides were smooth and enjoy the beautiful and priceless sceneries along the journey!

Sydneys bargain harbour cruises. Buy yourself a day ticket, and enjoy the many destinations on offer in one of the world's great harbours, it is a bargain, in particular for those on a Seniors discount.

You have to love the ferries!. On a lovely sunny day, what could be lovelier than a trip on one of Sydney's ferries? As well as transporting you in a timely manner to several destinations, it is a scenic tour, as well - and reasonably priced.
Quay to Darling Harbour. Great ride to Darling Harbour as you can see the Harbour Bridge and Opera House at the same time. Ferry was completely open at the time so great viewing of the harbour.
Take a ferry!. Over to Manly or the zoo or garden island you get to see alot of the harbour and good views of the Opera House and bridge. They go frequently.
Trip Worthy. Views are always scenic if you're sitting outside. Comfortable facilities for a public ferry and friendly staff.

Scenic ride on Captain Cook Cruise. Very punctual trips both ways. Great view from Darling Harbour to Toranga Zoo. Very informative review being given by the operator throughout the trip both ways. Learnt a lot about Sydney history from him.

Only way to see the harbour. Sydney ferries are very frequent and quick to all areas of the Harbour. Short trips and longer ones like Manly. Locals use these ferries like some people use the trains or bus to their destinations.

Great Way to See the City. Taking one of the many ferries from Sydney Harbour is a great way to see the scenic views of the city. Buy a MyMulti Weekly transit pass and you have unlimited acess to these ferries that take you to Manly Beach, Darling Harbour, Luna Park and many other pages.

See Sydney from the Water. As a harbour city one of the best ways to see the city is from that harbour, but no need for an expensive cruise. Get on a ferry and visit the "back streets" of the harbour. Balmain or Mosman ferries particularly recommended.

Old and tired but the best and cheapest way to see the Harbour. Sydney Ferries struggle with cleanliness and speed. Having said this there is no better way to see the Harbour and generally the staff are very pleasant. The fares are very reasonable and its far superior to Sydney's ever increasing traffic. The ferries to Mosman and Manly are the most picturesque. A must do when you are in Sydney.

Hustle & Bustle. Great way to get around if you have limited time. Ticket booths were a little confusing as was some of the signage telling you which ferry went where. Being school holidays is was busy but still recommended mode of transport
Transportation. Best form of transportation may it to Manly, the zoo, Watson's Bay etc. Clean, efficient and a good way to be in the bay.

Excellent value.. Whichever ferry you decide to travel around Sydney will provide you with quite an exillerating and most memorable experience. The cost of a trip on the ferry is minimal when you consider just how dear food and other essentials are in Australia, but travel be it by train or ferry is very good value. Recently I took the ferry to Watson'sBay from circular key's, it was the high speed ferry and we decided to sit /stand at the back which is in the open, however you do have comfortable covered areas if you prefer, as for myself I prefer to be out in the open and to feel the wind as it either run's through your hair or sends spray up over your face, depending on the weather. The ferry services are regular, the ferries are in good working order, I personally have not travelled on a ferry that has suffered any mechanical failures. I have always found the staff to be very courteous and friendly. I feel that Sydney without the ferries just would be not well Sydney! a bit like morecambe without wise, if you know what I mean. Great value and a great service, it is one of the thing's that I look forward to whenever I visit sydney, a trip out on a ferry. Where it goe's does not matter to me it is just the magical experience and feeling that goes along with the pleasure. And great value for money.

Easy travel in Sydney harbour. Sydney ferries are good value, efficient and clean. Get a weekly pass (it's only twice as much as the day pass, so good value even if you don't use it every day ) in Dec 2012 they cost 43aus$ per adult. It's great to jump on and off ferries. Try the river cat to Paramatta - lasts an hour - great views.The pass also covers all buses and train (trains in zone 1 for the price above).
Must see Sydney from the water. This is a must see/do. I took the grandkids out on a day-trip and they loved it. Even hardened Sydneysiders enjoy this.

Cheap,clean efficient. A great way to see the sights without breaking your wallet. Take a ferry to Manly beach,nice day out.you can buy an 24hr ticket for 21 bucks which allows you to ride the ferries and trains as much as you want....anywhere....anytime. A very inexpensive way to see the sights.
Relaxing Travel. To sit and watch the sea, the boats, the things to look at as the scenery goes by is delightful. Very relaxing and inexpensive in comparison of driving.

Cheapest tour you'll ever have. Hop on the ferry from circular quay to manly wharf for some impressive city views! Make sure once you get to manly you have a beer at the Manly Wharf. Sunsets, People watching - what more could you ever want.
Made everything accesable. Made it easy to get everywhere. Make sure you buy a week pass if you are there for a while, we didnt and it would have been cheaper
Reliable. We used many ferries to commute to Taronga Zoo, Lunar Park, etc. Each ferry service was quick, on time, the staff were pleasant and the ferry in excellent condition.
Sydney Ferries. On time and frequent good value for money. A good way to see Sydney from the water, and cheap fare included in your train ticket
Best value Harbour cruise. Buy a Ferry Ten ticket and jump on a ferry to anywhere. All the trips are good. You can sit inside or outside depending on the weather. Most routes run at a good frequency.
See the Harbour. A great relaxing way to see the Harbour, Historical areas & buildings, Government House, go to Manly, Taronga Park Zoo & more. Reasonable cost.

Great sea wind. I was gazing into the view feeling sea wind and was just chilling out looking over at the city.
Opera house shows a different look on the ship.
I had a fun talking with other tourists on this Ferry.

Why pay through the nose for a harbour cruise?. There is absolutely no point paying for a harbour cruise.Take an economic ferry from Circular key to Manly or (my favourite) go up river to Parramatta.Ferries are safe and regular but make sure that you note the last times for return journeys as it can be a long way back by other routes.Using a MyMulti Zone 3 ticket at a cost of $21 you get "all you can eat" all day on ALL sydney buses, trains, and ferries with the exception that you can't get off at the Airport stations without an extra charge.I make this a "must do" when friends are visiting Sydney for the first time. See the Opera House and Harbour Bridge and enjoy the finest harbour city of the World.

Who needs a harbour tour boat?. The harbour awaits you at Circular Quay from where you can get a ferry to many points around Sydney harbour. OK, you do not get a commrntary and food and drink service, but the views are just as good and with one of the flexi tickets you can reach most of the areas of interest.A simple run round to Darling Harbour offers great views of the Opera House, thr bridge and the Sydney sky line.Choose an evening ferry back from Manly for sunset or the city at night.Make sure you have your camera!
Manley Ferry. Manley Ferry is inexpensive, efficient and clean. 30 minutes to the Island via a roof top seat -- fantastic.
Brilliant Service. This is an excellent way to get around. The Ferries are quick, efficient, on time and lots of them.Didn't dislike any of it.

Good way of getting from one side of Sydney to the other. Whether you catch a slow ferry or hydrofoil-the views are spectacular. One needs to allow enough time to get to the chosen destination, as they could be long queues- especially in the summertime.

Good fun. The weather wasn't great when we visited Sydney so we purchased a day ticket for the ferries. What a great way of seeing more of the surrounding districts, you can hop on and off as many times as you like. We sailed as far as we could one way and again in the opposite direction. As a bonus they have free wifi on the ferries, what a great idea! Certainly good value for money.

On time / Gets you where you need to be. Manly ferry service has phone chargers, tv with the news on etc. Wifi, on board cafe, what more can you ask for. Always on time. Staff are good. If your visiting for a week or going to be going more than a few places get a MyMulti ticket. This allows you to get any bus / ferry & trains to a certain radius for a whole week.

Buy an all day ticket and use it to the full. The best value buy for a tourist new to Sydney is an all day Zone 2 pass at $21. Take the ferry to Parramatta and get some idea of how incredibly extensive the harbour is. See the wonderful waterside houses and the huge amount of activity on the water. Don't bother stopping in Parramatta, just stay on and come back to Circular Quay where all the ferries start. Then go over to Manly on the regular ferry and in half an hour you can walk down the Corso from the harbour to the beach on the Pacific. Back again and you could do worse than visit Darling Harbour, again by ferry where there are numerous attractions. Unbeatable value and as authentic as any part of Sydney.

Cheap and cheerful. Grab a $14 dollar return ticket from Circular Quay and head of to Manly, see Sydney from the water and just absorb it all. There and back will give you a feel of how Sydney is laid out and where Cook skimmed through the heads and into the beautiful natural harbour.The best bit for me is to come, when I watch the New Year fireworks on the TV here in cold dark UK I will know, I have been there, touched it and loved it.

hop on hop off. Take the Capt. Cook hop on hop off ferry. Ticket good for 24 hours. Get off at the zoo - access via gondola included with ticket price. Stay on ferry to see the harbor, hop on hop off at will.

Great way to get around. In our 5 days in Sydney we were on the ferries every day - to Manly Beach, the Zoo, another suburb. So easy, great views of the city and just a wonderful way to get around. All ferries leave from Circular Quay, which therefore makes it a very happening place as well. Get there early - shops, buskers, aboriginal art for sale - a real scene. Ferry schedule is on line
Excellent value. Buy a day ticket for $28 and ride the reffies ( and trains in Zone 1). It's the best way of seeing the city from the water and understanding how the city is built on the water.

Easy way to travel. Easy to buy a tickets and walk to the ferry. At the electronic boards you can see the times and there are also leaflets. Enough space inside and outside for the beautiful views of the harbour.

Trip To Manly or Darling Harbour. Whether you prefer a long ride to Manly, or simply a short ride to Darling Harbour, a visit to Sydney is simply incomplete without a trip on the Sydney ferry. Enjoy the amazing view as you stroll through the open sea!!!

Great ferry system. The ferry system was almost as easy to use as the train system. The local ferry's had a lot of stops which was good, but the bad was that it had a lot of stops...lol. If you are in a hurry, the ferry is not the way to go. With the right amount of time, the ferries are a nice way to get around

Awesome service. For just over $100 for 2 adults and 1 child we tripped around on the ferries. They took us where we wanted to go, were mostly on time reasonably clean and for the most part we had very little waiting time. The staff were always helpful and efficient. All we need is for them to come over and run our bus services in Adelaide.....

Cheap way to see Harbour. The ferries are a fantastic cheap way to get around, you can spend the whole day cruising around for less than $30. I just wished i knew how easy they are to use before i spent $50 on a 1.5hr cruise with a guide. You really cant get lost and the staff are very tourist friendly and more than happy to guide you in any direction you want to go. You get fantastic views of the bridge and Opera house and the harbour in general.

Romantic Sydney oceanfront at cheap fare. Spent at least one hour a day on the Sydney ferry during a 1 week visit. Best to go in the evening for best scenery. Just made me fell in love with Sydney harbour. Buy weekly pass for best deal.

Mode of travel. Sydney ferries beat most other modes of transport.Comfy seating, easy laid back feel, great views, nice pace, friendly staff. Reasonably priced etc... Well connected.We enjoyed the parramatta - circular quay route in addition to the other routes such as circular quay to taronga,darling harbour etc
A well spent $28 on the harbour. We took the ferry from circular quay to manly which took approx 30 minutes each way. Great value for money.
Fast and reliable. On time and organised.Efficient and lots of them to different destinations. I like a bit of wind in my hair!

Great views. I took the ferry from Homebush to Circular Quay off peak hour. Large and modern boat with free wifi. There is so much to see along the way and so much better than travelling through traffic. Lots of great photo opportunities and travelling beneath Gladesville and the Harbour Bridge is an added bonus. Of course the views into Circular Quay are spectacular. Highly recommended.

Spend a day on the water for a couple of bucks. Love riding the Sydney Ferry service - and now they have a seniors all day ticket for $2.50 you can ride the harbour all day for the price of a coffee. Its a good service, with iconic views and lots to see and it is the absolute best way to see this great city.

Sydney Ferries. It's has to be the best way to explore Sydney. If you want something different and want a fantastic view of the bridge, jump on the ferry to Parramatta ( return ). You won't be disappointed but you do need a spare two hours.

Plan a day riding the ferries!. We got the best advice from the ferry ticket window - bought an all-day pass and just rode ferries - five of them. Sometimes got off and did more. Sometimes just stayed on and rode back. Spent time at Manly Beach, which was great (although touristy). We LOVE boats, and these ferries do not disappoint.

Relaxing way to see most of Sydney!. Take the weekly ticket at $ 43 and then hop on and off all week - good value. eat at Watson's bay, Double Bay Sailing Club, Manly Skiff Club etc.. (will need ID to get into these clubs)

great way to get around. we travelled frequently on the ferry to cicular quay and darling harbour and found them to be the quickest way to get around sydney .they run about every 20 minuate during the day and lessfrequent in the evening last one is around 10pm.

Great way to see the sights. We used the ferries as a source of entertainment...often riding around just to be on the water, and to get a new perspective of familiar sights (the Harbour Bridge from underneath!)

just like catching a bus.... we hopped on and off ferries several times during our visit. we were going to book a harbour cruise to take pictures of the city from the water but didn't need to as we took them from the ferry. One day we found ourselves at Darling harbour and couldn't face the hike back to Circular quay so hopped on a ferry instead, free wifi too!

nice one. used ferries to travel to and from Manly beach. nice journey. every half an hour there's a ferry to go to Manly beach. same day evening cruised through Paramatta River. it took an hour each way, but it was worth going there.

Anywhere and Everywhere!. I have been on every Sydney ferry. From Milson's Point to Lavender Bay to Taroonga Zoo. All of them show spectacular views of not only the Harbour but arrive at destinations which deserve to be explored and enjoyed. Hunter's Hill, is where one of the most interesting and beautiful 'walks' of Sydney commences. Each destination builds upon the other offering not only Harbour views, but icons of Australia, such as, May Gibbs house. Sydney our first and most remarkable city!

Excellent Service and Great Value for Money. Buy the multi trip ticket for $60/week which covers all zones and the trains as well.Timetables are easy to follow. Good announcements on all of the boats too and very helpful staff

Careful you do not get wet ... !. I am always amazed at how cheap ferry transport is in Sydney. And on our way back from Manley, the captain told everyone to "watch out if you are outside - lot's of swell today and you will get wet".He wasn't wrong!And didn't the kids love it - the ferry was like a roller coaster that day and very exciting!

Great Bargain and Stellar Way to Enjoy the Sydney Harbor!. We took the Sydney ferries multiple times enjoying them greatly. They are inexpensive, well cared for, and run on schedule like Swiss watches. They are one of the best bargains in Sydney!
great. WE took the ferry to the Zoo and these ferries are in and out and so well orgainzied and it was fast and effecient.
Watson Bay. Take a water taxi to Watson Bay. Very affordable and nice area to visit. When you get off the ferry, there is a bar that serves great fish and chips.

Fun way to get around the city. We had a weeks public travel pass, which was great. You could travel to where ever by ferry, bus or train. The ferry rides are a good way to see some lovely spots around Sydney

BRILLIANT. The best way to get around the harbour is definately with sydney ferries. friendly staff great views of the bridge and opera house. Great way to see other places along the harbour and to get manly or taronga zoo

Great Staff. Twice we purchased tickets from the ticket area at darling harbour - each time a really lovely lady came out to offer assistance - I am sorry I did not get her name as she is a credit to her company, a true professional. The trip we took were short - from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay but they were also cheap and well run.

Getting you anywhere. Some people don't like ferries. I am not one of them. I love being out on the water and sometimes just ride them back and forth, checking out each harbour, each headland just for kicks.

Ferry to Darling Harbour. Really easy, just buy a ticket at terminal 5, sailed round to Darling Harbour, good filming oportunities. Gave us a chance to have a good look at the new Carnival cruise ship moored on the Rocks, which had just arrived to take up its new home. Darling harbour has a more cafe culture feel to it. Tall ships moored there and some lovely buildings including the government building at the waters edge.

WHAT A BARGAIN AND GREAT VIEWS. purchased the all day pass for $21. made 3 round trips, $3.50 each way, 1 to manly, 1 to watson's bay and 1 to darling harbor. good way to spend a day and see lots of the area. make sure you check the time tables of the ferries.

A great way to get around. I had been told the zoo was worth a visit (which it was!), so took a ferry from the iconic harbour, and enjoyed wonderful views of the harbour, the Bridge and, of course, the amazing Sydney Opera House. The ticket clerk was really helpful and friendly (a common experience in Australia), and advised a combined return ferry and zoo ticket at a discounted price.

Cheap transport. We loved the ferries especially as we have a seniors card and it cost us $2.50 to travel on train, ferries and the buses all day. It was fun. We caught the ferry to the zoo, darling harbour and manly.
Ferries. All the ferries are nice to ride on. The employees are helpful and friendly to answer questions. It is a cheap way to get around Sydney.
Great way to travel.. Easy to use - especially with a day pass. Even on busy days plenty of room. Old ferries and new ferries - all good.
Sydney Ferries. Great for viewing and peaceful travelling. I liked that you could move around to where you want to be looking. Easy to get tickets and board.

Great but busy. The ferries are a good way to get around Sydney but tend to be busy- esp the Manly, Taronga, and Watsons Bay ferries during the Summer. Queues for tickets, queues for ferries- queues to come back..... but they are a novel way to get around and are very safely run.

Best way to see the city!. Although most ferries leave from Circular Quay there is a great ferry service from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay. Great views of the Bridge and City and gorgeous Lavender Bay and stops at Luna Park too. Sit outside for the best views.

Great way to travel. What fab views, pity the ticket sellers were not a little friendlier. The maps are good but some info was lacking regarding fares but the ticket seller we approached was very curt. Ferries were clean, seating good.
Excellent. The ferries run so frequently they are a great way to get around Sydney. If you are staying in one of the suburbs just use the ferry to get to Circular Quays, what a way to travel.
A good way to see the sights. A trip to Manly is a must and the ferries also go to Darling Harbour. Clean and tidy. Easy to use. Good services including onboard wifi.

Parramatta River Cat is brilliant!. I have used River Cat from Rydalmenr to the city a few times now & the trip is just glorious, even on a bad day. The staff are helpful & polite, the seating inside is comfortable & the outside areas clean & tidy. Thaks for the great trips!

Easy way to get around. Ferries are numerous and not that expensive. Can get wet if outside, especially on the Manly ferry. The stops around Darling Harbor aren't necessarily easy to find or use and the multiple stops can be confusing.

Variety of routes, views and boats. Economical, with a chance to see the hidden faces of Sydney from the water. There are a variety of boat-types from conventional ferries to catamarans, but all affording great views. Passing under the Harbour Bridge is just awe inspiring

affordable sightseeing. We stayed in Darling Harbour and used the ferry sevice to get to Circular Quay and across to Manly. The views were amazing as we passed under the Harbour bridge towards the Opera House, and then docked next to an ocean liner. Our trip over to Manly was on a weekend so there were sailboats everywhere which added to the wonderful experience. The ferries are frequent and always left right on time. It was a cheap way to see Sydney Harbour and would recommend it to anyone visiting Sydney as long as you do not want a commentary.

Nice. Fast way to travel between beaches. I went to Manly by taking a ferry from Sydney. I would suggest getting a week pass so that you can travel between trains, ferries and buses. $60 but worth every penny if you are intent on travelling a lot!!

Make sure you have your Camera!. Stand outside and be bundled up. Grab your camera and start taking the photos as the ferry captain tries to steer clear of the hundreds of sailboats getting in the way.

Reliable and Comfortable. Sydney Ferries is one of the most reliable public transport systems in Sydney. Unlike trains that frequently undergo track work or buses that are unpredictable, Sydney Ferries is a much more comfortable alternative. Even during peak hours most of the time you'd be able to get a seat. The best ferry rides are probably along the Parramatta service because you get great views of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House, and then you get a great view of Suburban Sydney. The prices are little more expensive than trains and buses, but the views are incredible.

SO FUN!. This is a great, relatively inexpensive way to see Sydney Harbour. We had a fantastic time on the ferry and would very much recommend it for transportation as well as sight seeing! It's relatively inexpensive and you get to see all of Sydney Harbor! Don't miss this!

First Class. Transitting one of the most spectacular Harbours in the World, the Ferry Service runs like Clockwok, shifting Tourists and Commuters daily.There must be figures somewhere to indicate the numbers of passengers moved but it is surely in thousands. I always enjoy travelling this Great Harbour and find the Sydney Ferries to be the least expensive way and entertaining.Do it, it's great

Staff could do with remembering who pays their wage.. The staff are ignorant, unless you are a young woman in a short skirt then they are over you like a rash. Help is difficult, or in my case, impossible to come by.The iconic yellow and green ships ride out of circular quay and are a great way to explore this great city, but don't expect any interaction

The Ferries. This is such a good, cheap way to get around Sydney on the water and the ferries always ran to time and the harbour was very interesting and it has a lot of history going back to the Convict days.
Ferries are good value. Apart from the travelling on the Manly Ferry, we took the River Cat up to Paramatta. A smooth, fast ride with great scenery on each side, it was well worth the trip.
excellent. they were always on time, very friendly staff, it's a cheap way to get around & very scenic. loved every minute on them, very relaxing

A great way to travel.. On a nice day this is the best way to travel. On Sundays it's family day and you can ride as much as you like for the one cheap ticket. We went from Circular Key across to Taronga zoo, back, and then to Darling Harbour and back, had an icecream and then back to Darling Harbour for dinner. All the while enjoying being out on the beautiful harbour so that the trip was as wonderful as the destination. Even when it's not Sunday the ferrys are cheap and very well organised with very helpful staff.

Captian Cook Cruises. Was so looking for the a cruise on Sydney Harbor. Such a disappointment. The cruise we booked was cancelled at the late minute and we were put on a ferry that raced around the harbor. Nothing relaxing, just hurry up to the next stop. Had to rush to take any pictures and because of the speed of the ferry most were blurry. Would have preferred a refund but was not given that choice.
Great value, great fun. They are a good way to get around, and they are fun, too. Warning: sometimes they take a long time, stopping at every ferry stop...

Great value. Great value and the best way to travel around. A week ticket got us to Manley, the Olympic village, the Opera House and Bridge also free wi=fi while on board. the best bargain of the visit
nice. take ferries for transport. well recomment ferry tours with show @ dinner going around sydney harbor.perfect view

Best Way to see Sydney Harbour. I'm not a big fan of tours - why pay to hear lots of inane commentary when you can take your own tour on Sydney ferries - and get your own commentary from your phone / tablet - or your guide book?
Great value and they go all over the harbour.

Milsons Point to Circular Quay WAY too expensive. Four of us decided to catch the ferry from Luna Park back to Circular Quay -- a trip that took maybe 5 minutes. It cost us $5.60 EACH and we had no idea of the cost until we got off the ferry at Circular Quay (we were all from interstate or overseas). It had only cost us $23 for the taxi from Haymarket to Luna Park, so the extra hit of $23 for the ferry then another $18 for the taxi from Circular Quay back to Haymarket was unexpected. A nice ride spoiled by a WAY overpriced fare for the distance travelled!

Excellent value. Costs just a few dollars to take a trip around the harbour and when weather is hot and sunny its breath taking but also very busy with other tourists who choose to take the cheaper option instead of the $35 dollar trips so many charge you and you get just as agood a trip on the local ferries would highly recommend them
Ride Ride Ride. What a value. Bought the 10 coupon book and rode all over. Loved the quay to Darling Harbor route at sunset. Under the bridge and over to Luna Park. Sweet.

Great way to get around Sydney Harbour. This is the only way to get around the harbour. Whether its over to Manly, or back from Milsons point they are a great way to see the harbour day and night. Regular, on time and reasonably priced definately worth a trip wherever you are going.
Sydney Harbour Ferries. The staff on board very efficient. Great views and always punctual. Ideal for taking a look of where to visit on arrival.
Best view of Sydney Harbour. Take the Manly ferry to get the best view of Sydney Harbour, and there is a great beach, shops and markets when you get there.
Easy travelling. Convenient and easy way to get to Manly. Relaxing, cheap and you can enjoy the view of the way and really take in the scenary

best way to see the harbour. Cheap way to get the best views of Sydney Harbour apart from a helicopter trip which costs lots. The ferries run at regular intervals all day till quite late from Circular Quay and off various trips or routes. I suggest the Darling Harbour trip is a must as is the full harbour cruise Excellent value all round.

Cheap afternoon on the harbour and waterways. We thoroughly enjoyed a ferry ride from Circular Quay up the Parramatta River to Parramatta. Great views of heritage sites and magnificent homes and parkland as well as the mangroves further up the river to just below the weir at Parramatta. Would recommend for general sightseeing and for families. Watch the timetable at Circular Quay to make sure you are going at high tide as only then will you make it all the way to Parramatta.

Cheap afternoon on the harbour and waterways. We thoroughly enjoyed a ferry ride from Circular Quay up the Parramatta River to Parramatta. Great views of heritage sites and magnificent homes and parkland as well as the mangroves further up the river to just below the weir at Parramatta. Would recommend for general sightseeing and for families. Watch the timetable at Circular Quay to make sure you are going at high tide as only then will you make it all the way to Parramatta.

See the City of Sidney by water.. We travelled by public ferry to several islands, and between several quays around the city proper. This is the way to see the city!We did enjoy a harbour tour also. They provided a better history of the city sights.You can't beat a taxi by water!

What a pain. Arrived to catch the ferry in time for Taronga Park only to be told it was cancelled because they could not get the ferry in because of the cruise liner that had docked close by. Had to wait another 3/4hr till by then double the amount of people waitng BEDLEM!!!!. BAD PLANNING BY FERRY OPERATORS and there OCULDNOT GIVE A DAMN ATTITUDE was a bad look to overseas people.

Tourists - buy a multi pass. If you are in Sydney for a few days buy a multi pass. $43 for a week's travel on all the public ferries, buses and trains. Fantastic value and so stress free - just hop on and off wherever you like . The ferries are the best way to get around and so reliable. The harbour views are breathtaking.
Ferry to Watson's Bay. nice trip from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay. Stupid Sydney ticketing system always annoying ( ie different tickets for train/ferry etc )
Go where you want when you want. Affordable way to see Sydney Harbour if you don't want to pay the big bucks for lunch/dinner cruises

Efficient, Busy and bouncy. These ferries are reasonably priced and a delight to ride on. They are on time and comfortable. Take the hour's direct trip to Parramatta along the river set about with mangroves and see the homesteads of the early settlers. This costs a tenner return and is a big bargain.

Great way to get around AND see the city. Public Transport, which doubles as a beautiful way to see an amazing city! You can take the ferry rides for the ride and the view, rather than to get from point A to B! Great!

Relaxing Way To See The Icons, Minus The Traffic!. I love travelling around Sydney water, and the ferries are so cheap, especially on Sunday, Family Funday, $2.50 per person in a family group. Why would you drive?????

Just waste a few Hours. these ferries are great to get a view of Sydney, I found myself just heading down to the pier and booking the next one out. Did this about 5 or 6 times and always ended up somewhere interesting

Fast and Friendly. I had a mymulti pass which let me use the trains,buses and ferries as much as I liked for 7 days. So I would go from Circular Quay to various locations all over Sydney harbour like Darling Harbour and Taraoga Zoo.

Just go!. Used the ferries every time we've been in Sydney. The views are just fantastic. Past the opera house, under the bridge, into darling harbour. Up to Luna park. Take the trip to manly too. Ferries busy but we always got good seats outside. Take food on board from the vendors at the harbour and have your own on board picnic. Great memories. Family tickets very cheap, especially travel on a Sunday.

Sydney isn't Sydney without its ferries. They come in all sizes, go to a multiplicity of interesting destinations not only in the main harbour but the backwaters and creeks and bays beyond and behind the Harbour Bridge. It's one of the most pleasurable means of public transportation Sydney has to offer.

Great value for money. Purchased a multi day ticket for $21 and this enabled me to travel on all Sydney Ferries for the day, also included bus, train and light rail. Took bus to Bondi Beach and ferry to Manly. Pensioner all day ticket $2.50 - great value

Transportation and wifi. Ferries are the way to travel to northside locations like Kirribilli. they run every half hour and have free wifi. Buy a ten-ticket which can be used by two or more people for less than $5 per ride. Great views of the Opera House from the ferry.
nice and safe journey. Good service with well managed time schedule for the ferries from the quay to all around the city! I took one to the Taronga Zoo and realy enjoyed the way
Take ferrie to zoo. Great deal for ferrie to zoo which includes ferrie return trip and entry to zo even included the scenic trolley ride up and down hill to zoo entryA must see if in sydney
Scenic ride. The ferry is well maintained, the ride is smooth and my children like to sit on the upper deck on our way to Taronga Zoo from Circular Quay
great. We loved the views of the city, well presented and the staff were very helpful & friendly. Loved the atmostphere

Hop On Hop Off ferry ( Pier 6) the best!. This is the best way to see Sydney. Takes you all around the harbor- from Watson's Bay to the Zoo to Manley to Darling Harbor etc. You can get off, enjoy each site and get back on - which we did! Great commentary. Big tip- you can take it again- for no charge- within 24 hours so we did the full tour the first time and did the hop off/on the next day.

Great way to see the harbour. I really like travelling on the ferries around the harbour. It really is the best way for an average tourist to get a feel for it. What I hate is the price of tickets. You will not easily escape from the experience with a family of four (2+2) for less than $40 for a return trip in the inner zone.
ferry to Darling Harbour. Pleasurable trip.it took about 20 mins from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour.But coming Back was 7 mins by taxi and cost the same.

An Absolute "Must-Do!". We took advantage of the Sydney Ferries twice during our week visit: the Parametta River ferry (our return after visiting the Blue Mountains) and the Manley Ferry. Both were great ways to see the city from a "harbor" perspective and you can't beat the price. If you are in Sydney for more than a couple of days, get the weekly pass for $43. It includes the ferries, trains and buses!

Utterly charming!. We went to Darling Harbour by the ferry service run by Sydney Ferries. Like everything else in Sydney, this was a very charming and civilized experience. It was even wi-fi enabled! Lucky Sydneysiders!
Reasonable price for fantastic views.. Several choices to take, I really like the ferry to Manly. HOHO ferries available but much more expensive than regular ferries.

Who needs to book a harbour tour. While we were in Sydney, we had a week long transit pass that included travel on the Sydney Ferries. We spent a lot of time traveling between Darling Harbour and Circular Quay and the various attractions in between. Rain or shine, the sight of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House were always awe inspiring. Good value, great transport and a good way to experience the harbour and see world class views.

No problems. we used the Sydney ferries to get across to Taronga Zoo ... we got the combo ticket so we had the ferry to and from, entry to the zoo and the sky cable car. The ferries ran on time, seating was adequate and was run efficiently. Runs more often the other companies and we had no problems whatsoever

Always on time!. We have found the Sydney Ferry system to always depart on time and provide a reliable and cost effective solution to getting around Sydney Harbour. Even if it is only a short distance you are looking to travel, it is worth considering.

Nice way to see the harbor and view, infrequent runs at night. Take the ferry to Luna Park and McMahon's point to get a great view of the bridge and opera house from one side, or ferry to Manly for the other. Ferries are punctual and nice ride, but limited frequency at night.

What a view!. A fantastic method of Sydney transport; peaceful, beautiful and a great way to start your day. The Sydney to Manly is a MUST! Take friends from overseas on this ferry and theyll love it.
Why take a tour boat?. Much cheaper and well worth the few dollars to take the ferry to explore the near by beaches. Ferries run often so the wait is never too long.

Take one to Watson's Bay at sunset. This ferry takes you close to the shores At sunset it is amazing. Then return on the same ferry as it is getting dark and see the Opera house and Harbor Bridge lit up.
Great way to See Sydney. What a great way to see Sydney from the water. We also went to Manly had a beer there and went back to Darling Harbour. A great way to spend a afternoon

Very Easy to Use. The ferry system is a great way to get around Sydney and a scenic way as well. They are very easy to use in regards to finding the right one for your destination. I would not use the ferry if you are in a hurry. They are not the quickest method of transportation. Fun way to travel for children.

Great transport. WHAT BETTER WAY TO SEE SYDNEY!
Great way to get to different points in Sydney.
Easy, Frequent and reasonable priced.
Locals use it and tourists.

Great travel. easy and scenic way to travel I enjoy the calmness of the journey and the views, the Opera House and bridge
this is truly a great way to travel to the city

Efficient way to travel. The ferries departs frequently to many locations and they operate on time. Very efficient and due to its lower cost (compared to private ferry operators), the ferries are often packed, but I will recommend this over the private operators who did not seem to be as efficient as Sydney Ferries. Great way to enjoy the sea breeze and tour the harbor!

One of the best ways to see the harbour and Sydney.. The Sydney Ferries must be the best way to enjoy the Harbour without owning a boat! You can be amongst the yachts, the speedboats, and other water craft from (usually) under a $10 ticket! Great views from every seat. Lots of locations to visit around the harbour too. Take a ferry to the Zoo, or Manly Beach, Darling Harbour, Watson's Bay for fish and chips, or out to Parramatta. Be sure to use sunscreen and take a hat if you sit outside. The Aussie Sun is known to burn your skin after only 10 minutes enjoying its rays. Take water too. Some ferries offer food. All have toilets. It is one of the BEST things to do while in Sydney. My favourite activity, and I LIVE here!

Sydney Ferries: Pros and cons.. The ferries operate on time and provide a relaxing trip to several locations. They are expensive for visitors, if bargains exist for visitors, they are well hidden. In spite of the cost angle, they are comfortable and give the visitor wonderful panoramas not otherwise available. Particularly enjoyed Taronga Zoo and the ride to Darling Harbour. The latter provides numerous shops, excellent restaurants, a nice Aquarium. Nearby Chinatown is worth a visit.

Good way to tour the harbor. We toured the harbor area on the ferry boat. We purchased round trip tickets and enjoyed the views. The ferry goes by the Opera House and you get to see the skyline of the city. There are serveral different destinations the boats go to.

Great alternative to driving. We took the ferry to both the Taronga Zoo and over to Manly as well as back from Harman, and found them to be fast, safe and quite efficient! While we did not partake of the onboard food/drink, it was offered, as well as outdoor or indoor seating. It was a pleasant, reliable, affordable way to see the sights of Sydney!

Best way to get around. The place we stayed in Kirribilli had a ferry stop at the end of the road. If you can arrange it that is the best way to stay in Sydney. Clean, punctual, makes an ordinary journey scenic and fun.

well worth a visit. Busy area but great choice of locations to visit at reasonable cost. Even if you've never been there before, its easy to find out which quay you need to go to. The boats are frequent and its a great way to see a different perspective of the skyline of Sydney harbour and surrounding areas
On time and fair value. We took a couple of ferry rides (Darling Harbour, Manly, etc.) and enjoyed each one. This is a great way to commute and the prices are reasonable.

Get about. We stayed at Parramatta Meriton Apartments and we really appreciated the Cat service to the city. So easy to jump on and off to where we needed to go. Also used the ferry to the zoo. Sydney is very easy to get about in.l

Great fun but avoid on School holidays. Took a trip to Manly with a horde of feral NSW children some half dressed and was gobsmacked by their rudeness and swearing not to mention there dress sense..they would all be laughed at in QLD !!
Easy way to travel. Only way to get around... what a way to enjoy the scenery. Very comfortable and you get to see things that you wouldn't just catching taxis

You can cover a lot of territory on these ferries.. Sydney Harbour rates as one of the most spectacular harbours in the world, perhaps even the most spectacular. The Sydney Ferries operate from Parramatta to Circular Quay to Watson's Bay, Manly and Taronga Park Zoo.
