As a pensioner you can ride the ferries all day long for $2.50 but normal fares are OK as well. Avoid peak times and take your camera.

Great Ferry Rides. This service can get you most places in Sydney. From Olympic Park all the way to Manly and Beyond. They even come with free wifi. If you want absolutely spectacular views of the Opera House. Just catch the Manly Ferry for a small price compared to large sightseeing boats. If you are in Sydney give this a go.

Hard to argue with a cheap ferry ride on best harbour in the world. With Ferries servicing points as far east as Manly and Watson's bay through North Sydney, Cicular Quay (the main hub), Darling Harbour, Balmain, and points further up Parramatta river as far as Meadowban and Parramatta itself. If it's a sunny day and you have an hour or two to spare, or want the best way to get from city to manly, then a ferry is your best bet...

Manly or just Sydney. We took the ferry to Manly, which takes about 45 minutes. The views are amazing, especially when going back to Sydney around dusk. Also the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour is a good way to see Sydney and especially the Opera House and Harbour bridge from a view.

Parramatta Ferry doesn't go to Parramatta. Ferry stopped before desination, and we eventually caught a bus. Not a good tourist trip as the inside ferry was view restricted by dirty windows, and capacity crowds. Return trip on a Sunday was a nightmare. Full of prams and eskies, and screaming uncontrolled KIDS!
Would avoid unless a commuter.
The Ports. Great Service, very Friendly.. Visited Taronga Park Zoo. Had all in one ticket, return, purchased from Circular Quay for Ferry, Skyrail or bus to Zoo Entrance and Entrance into Zoo.

I dropped my wallet and a month later someone called me and made arrangements to return it!. We have been visiting Australia for 15 years. We get back most every summer. This year, I must have dropped my wallet and didn't notice. Had no idea where it had got to. A full month later, I got a call here in the US from someone who works for the Ferry company. He told me he would ship my wallet, he counted the money and assured me it was all still there (it was over $500!) and he was not at all sure he would take the gratuity I told him to take before mailing it back to me. The wallet has not yet arrived, but I am amazed and delighted that he called and made the offer to return it. Australia and Sydney Ferries are awesome!
Fantastic value. Buy the MyMulti Day Pass for $21 which will allow you to take any of the ferries, trains and buses all day. The cheapest harbour cruises by far and a fantastic service.

Night Lights. We took a ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour at night, and saw fabulous lights of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Luna Park, Darling Harbour, the casino and all the city skyscrapers. Just stayed on the ferry for return trip which took about an hour, very relaxing and easy way to see the sights at night. Day trip to Watson's Bay fast and smooth and great way to see the little bays, boats and spectacular waterfront homes around the bay. Take a coat and enjoy the breeze!

Manly Ferry. everyone has to go on the manly ferry once. Not only to get to manly which is a great place to go to but the ferry ride itself i love it...I have done it a million times and I dont need to travel by ferry just because it is fun to do.

Ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour. Caught this ferry on a Friday. $5.60 one way. Bought my ticket from an actual person rather than a machine - at least you know you won't lose your money that way.Took about 30 minutes and stopped at a few places along the way (such as Balmain).The staff member seemed to be very safety conscious when pulling up along the wharf and loading and unloading passengers.Different option and allows one to see everything from a different aspect.

Easy way to get around. The ferrys at the harbor are a great form of transportation. It makes getting there fun. They run often and on time and it is easy to figure out which pier is the one for your destination as they are right next to each other.

Great value way to see Sydney. We spent 10 days in Sydney so we invested in a 7 day MyMulti 1 ticket@$41 - great value.We rode every ferry we could,they all leave from Circular Quay - the Cat to Parramatta,the ferry to Darling Harbour (especially at night) the Manly ferry - do the Manly Walk. Visit Doyles at Watson Bay.Ride all the ferries you can manage and take your camera.Staying near Central and Museum stations, we could hop onto double decker trains to destinations all over the city,including Bondi Junction.We also used the light railway(tram) to the fish market,and It's just as easy to use the numerous buses,as many times as you want to.

Excellent way to see Sydney.. Use the ferries as much as you can. They keep you out of traffic, and there are fabulous views of the coastal bush and buildings. Some don't run late enough though. If you want to go to the city from the east (Rose Bay ferry), which you will if staying around Bondi or Rose Bay, the last ferry was around 7pm. We want to be able to return after our evening out by ferry.

very handy. this is the easiest way of getting around Sydney and you are able to get from Manly to Paramatta on the ferries. Don't be talked into a day pass unless you are doing a lot of ferry rides it is far better to pay as you go. Concession card holders can buy a pensioner excursion ticket for $2.30 and can use it on the ferries, buses and trains all day for this one fare.
Excellent transport in Sydney. no better way to get around in sydney, they run regularly and on time, but its the views you get of sydney from the sea that make these trips so special.
can be windy. we did 2 boat rides ,they are nice but take a jacket,even if the sun is shining.It is worth doing it as you can see many of the Sydney sights
A great way to see the harbour. We always have at least one ferry trip when we visit Sydney, this time we had two - to Parramatta on the cat, and from Watsons Bay back to Circular Quay.

Best way to see Sydney shoreline. You can travel from Manly to Parramatta and other shoreline up market suburbs for the best views. get a daily ticket and you can use all means of transport. Sydney is the Jewel in the Crown of Australian cities
Great System. Based conveniently at Circular Quay much of the area is accessible along with a lovely ride. Know the exchange rate and don't go into sticker shock.

Excellent mode of transport. We took ferries twice, one was from Olympic Park to Darling Harbour, another from the Circular Quay to Watsons Bay.The ferries are punctual, clean and gave you views that you will never see it on land or on foot.Travelling by ferries are also faster than the public buses. The embarkation was also very quick, unlike some ferries in other countries that took very very long to park properly at the pier.

Ferries - Fantastic!. The Sydney Ferries are fabulous. With so much choice and such a comprehensive timetable we were able to go to much more than we expected without any hassles. The signage is great, the ferries run on time and the staff we had dealings with were pleasant and helpful. Full marks for good service at a terrific price.

cheap, discounts avalaible, and its a must for tourists!. we wernt waiting longer than 10 mins for a ferry, reasonably priced & fast with lots of space inside and outside. so you can take loads of photos from outside, or if its cold then go inside! very safe, and barely even felt a wave! beautiful views of the harbour! and took us to a private beach!we went to taronga zoo on the ferry, and getting our zoo ticket with the ferry ticket together at the office gave us a discount and it was around 50 dollars altogether!awesome

do go by ferry!. i love hopping around the harbour by ferry - a total delight and what a view! i prefer the old style ferries rather than the slick fast newer ones. wonderful views, the excitement of crossing the Heads - or just to get home!

View the harbour from a different angle. We used several ferries and had a good look around Sydney Harbour, after climbing the Bridge it was only fair to travel under it. The ferries were a much more enjoyable was to get around Sydney and more relaxing.

Sydney Ferry Trip. Unless you suffer severe sea sickness, a Sydney Ferry ride is a must for everyone (locals or tourists) at least once (if not more often). There are so many trips you can take to various spots & you simply cannot get a better view of the major icons such as the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House, & surrounds. The wind in your hair, the smell of the sea, the sun on your face - oh yep, you're alive alright!

Cheapest touring for Seniors. We went to the train station to pick up an all-day travel pass for $21, thinking this would be a good deal as we planned to spend the day riding the ferries round Sydney harbour. The friendly ticket seller asked if we were seniors, and would we like the $2.50 special ticket? Would we! We had a ball, ferry to Watsons Bay, back to Circular Quay, then to Manly for lunch and back to the Quay again to connect with the afternoon ferry up the river to Paramatta. A brilliant day all for $2.50. Thank you Aussies!

Great way to take in the harbour and get to where you want to be. The Ferries are the best way to get around the harbour and visit the zoo, manly beach and a host of other attractions. We stayed near circular quay and used them as an alternative to walking to Darling Harbour.

magistic cruise. We went on the lunch time cruise. The food was tasty with a great selection to suit everyone and the staff very helpful. The cruise takes you past all the must see in sydney. Definately reccommmend this

Great Way of Seeing the Harbour. Solicitous, helpful staff, on a breathtakingly scenic journey even for the shoppers and commuters around us. We only travelled from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay but saw the harbour bridge, the Opera House, a glimpse of various smart-looking suburbs and the funfair park, with its huge, grotesquely smiling entrance. This must be the best value harbour tour of them all.

A good operation. They run a good fleet of ferries all over Sydney harbor and you can go to so many places.We just hopped on one and off we went - a good way to see around the harbor which is so nice.Also the ferries are not expensive.

Sydney Ferries. Enjoyed the Manly ferry which also sold food and drinks and the Rivercat which doesnt sell food althought it is a great trip along the river sightseeing and travelling under sydney harbour bridge and sailing along side the Sydney Opera House fantastic landmarks along the way

Great service. What I love about visiting Sydney is buying an all day ticket and using the ferries to get out and about to various walks and places on Sydney Harbour. I have found the service to be efficient and courteous. The annoucements are clear and easy to understand (unlike the train service).
very convenient. I took the ferry I believe 5 times to different locations and it worked well, many offerings and not expensive.

Good way to get around. It's relaxing to get around by ferry. You get a feel for the harbours and the places built up on the different parts of the bay. Not cheap though, as the fares can add up over a few days.
Best transport. The ferries are a better choice compared to trains and buses if you stay near any ferry stops. Better views, easy access to anywhere

Try it once, for the experience.. Compared to cruises, the ferries are extremely cheap (5 AUD one way). So if you would like to experience a cruise on the harbour, try ferries once. But if you plan to use them as a mean of transportation, they are extremely expensive compared to alternatives. As an example, a trip by ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour will cost you 10 AUD (return per person).And because the ferry has so many stops, we found out that walking between the two locations is faster (and you get to save a few dollars).

Toronga Zoo Ferry. The best way to travel to Toronga Zoo and you get an Excellent View of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Sydney Opera House. Ample Opportunity to take Video or Photos to keep forever.
Ferries are great. We caught the ferry to Cockatoo Island. It was on time, actually it was free because of the bienale. Great atmosphere.
nice. the Sydney ferries is very busy places, at almost all time of the days. There is a lot of stores, restaurants and attractions near it, so it makes it a very busy area.

Fantastic Public Transportation. For 43AuD for a week pass of unlimited subway, bus, & ferries... fantastic value. Everything runs right on time. The pass does not cover the airport link or the monorail.
What a way to travel. There is no better way to see Sydney than to take a ferry anywhere, or preferably everywhere, on the harbour. It is so relaxing.

Cheaper than a Ferry Tour. If you don't care about a running commentary about the sights than this is the best way to go. Purchase and all day pass that lets you ride the trains, busses and ferries as much as you want in one day (Still less than a harbor tour!)
Sydney ferries. I have not travelled on the ferries for many years, though they seem to be the same ferries that I travelled on 60 years ago as a child

Cannot be beat for timely service, and BONUS(!) excellent sight seeing!. I try and take the ferry everytime I go somewhere here. It's amazingly efficient, but also a gorgeous place to sit back and enjoy the ride. Clean and safe with seating in or out. Also has free wi-fi. With stations so easy to get to, this one's a no brainer.
Love the ferries!. I loved the ferries. My favourite are the old green and yellow ones - sit outside on the shiny red bench seat and watch the waves rock 'n roll. Fantastic :)

Cheap and enjoyable. These have just been privatised so it may be the last time I can say how much I love this mode of transport. You can get out on the harbour with great friendly staff and drink in the atmosphere as you wend your way to your destination.
Fantastic way to travel. Love traveling by ferry around Sydney Harbour, but it is SO expensive!! Such a shame because it really is the most reliable and pleasurable transport option around Sydney.

Best way to see the great landmarks. Take the ferries to manly or just to get from one part of the city to another.... you get the chance to see angles of the Opera House and the Harbour bridge you just wouldnt get the chance otherwise. I do not have great sea legs and try to keep myself on terra firma, but this is worth it!!

The only way to sail. Just so easy - just buy a "Hop on Hop off" ticket and just enjoy the stunning views from boat - very informative and friendly staff - as the weather was so good good we never did try the covered area but would suggest it was as good as the outer decks.
Convenient. If you have ridden the Star Ferry in Hong Kong, these are very similar. Great views of the harbour and you can venture out to various areas of the city.
Excellent. Get the MyMulti!. I'd recommend getting the MyMulti pass which includes the ferries. Went to Manly, Cockatoo Island, Watson's Bay etc. Clean, free wifi on most boats. Great service.

Inexpensive and always on time. We bought tickets for a week, they were very cheap and we could also use the buses. We visited Manly, Watsons Bay, Darling Harbour, Luna Park at Milsons Point, the Olympic Park and Bondi Beach by bus. The ferries and buses were clean and punctual. I dread to think how much the equivalent trips would have cost us on public transport in the UK!

Best ferry ride ever!. The ferry system as a whole in Sydney is great, and relatively inexpensive. The ferry to Manly gives you a tour of the whole harbour for very little, and delivers you at the gorgeous beach resort of Manly. The ferry rise to the zoo is also lovely. But the best ferry ride is to Watson's Bay--standing at the front of the fast, catamaran style ferry in the middle of a sunny Sydney harbour, and letting the wind whistle past one's ears while looking out on the gorgeous parks and houses along the coast was just great.
Tour the Harbor. The Sydney Ferries are working transport for the hard working people of the city, and offer a very affordable and enjoyable view of the 'real Sydney'.

Captains Cook from Olympic Villa to Darling Harbor at dusk. The travel started around 5:15pm, it was starting to get dark.We arrived to the harbor 45 minutes later, it was dark and the skyline is not well lit.I think it's better to take this tour during the day.The ship was ok, not many amenities on board.
We went on the one from Circular quay to darling Harbour. Brilliant as we had two pushchairs the staff were great, views around the bays, and coming into darling harbour were spectacular

Good way to get around. We took the ferry to the Toranga Zoo. The pricing included round trip transportation, enterance to the zoo and cable car ride to the top zoo enterance. It was a bargain since the ferry went past the opera house and bridge and we were able to get beautiful pictures.

A super way to see Sydney and get around. The public transport IMHO was excellent in Sydney and a great way to see the sights, sounds of Sydney as a city. The ferries were probably the best among all of this. It gave you an insight and connected you to some of the best sightseeing around the city from the famous Sydney Harbour bridge to the Opera House to the zoo and many more. If you get the chance take the hop-on, hop off ferry that gives you even better insight. I think that's managed my Captain Cook tours. Very good service.

Rocky, but fun. I enjoyed going on a Sydney Ferry and would love to do it again. I love being outside feeling the breeze being swept off and on your face, it is the best feeling. Sydney Ferries are a great relaxing thing to do especially for tourists and are a different way to get around as well as an exciting way.

I live in Sydney. Sydney Harbour is the best and seeing it via ferry is magic..plus it costs very little. A fast and easy way to get around, you can take a ferry to the Zoo and to many different suburbs which are on the harbour.
Like a bus. A great way to travel around the harbour and surrounding areas, and at a reasonable price, they enable you to jump on and of as you wish, or you can just stay on and enjoy the view

Had trip up harbour to Parramatta. Great fine day..went somewhere I had not been before. Sat outside in the sun At the start went by the Opera House and under the Sydney Harbour Bridge...Could not go all the way as tide was out so they took us by Bus into Parramatta..Bus to station and cought Rail back to Central station.Purchased a all day pass for $2.50 Great value.

Fantastic service and very reliable.. Sydney ferries are one of those elements of Sydney that people always talk about, imagine telling your friends around the world that you walk along the beach and get a ferry across Sydney Harbour to get to work in the morning? I know i loved it, and it was made all the better for the fact that they are regular, reliable, cheap and safe, aswell as offering fantastic views of all the harbours and coves around Sydney.
Fun little ride. Worth the ride over to Manly. Even though it was a rough ride due to the rainy cold weather we enjoyed seeing the sights as we sailed by.
Sydney Ferries. Nice view but timetable not. Recently privatised so may improveThey need to cater more for special days. Mothers Day, School Holidays more ferries should be available for the crowd.

Efficient way of getting around. I stayed near Circular Quay and took advantage of the ferries to bring me to Manly Beach one day and Taronga Zoo the next. The ferries are super efficient, very affordable and are well equipped on board. The ferries even had Wifi on board which was great!!

Expensive ... but the best way to see the harbour up close. The ferries, like the other forms of public transport around Sydney, is convenient but unfortunately overpriced. But it is still the best (and relatively cheap) way to see the harbour as you don't get a view of the city skyline or the harbour bridge otherwise.

A Trip to Manly. If you go on a Sunday as a family or even an adult with a related child, you can purchase an all day ticket for $2.50 per person, which allows you to go on bus, train & ferry all day unlimited. The trip to Manly costs $7.00 usually. The NSW Transportinfo site has all routes, timetables & fares. The view of the harbour is spectacular, you don't need to take a cruise, which is a lot more expensive. The fare to Manly on other days is $7.00. There is a beautiful beach at Manly, lots of restaurants, shops etc.

Always a treat in every respect. If visiting, touring on business or just going from A to B Sydney Ferries are always such fun.Clean safe and the land based scenery on the way always breathtaking.Take a morning to go the further most further points that your time schedule allows to go to Manly or Paramatta and back. Sop and get off in Manly go there and back to Parramatta....don't get off at Parramatta.Make a point of going on the ferries it is well worth the cost.
Great way to get around Sydney. Lots of fun, very clear schedules. Can get a pass for $21 for the entire day/night and ride all over the Harbor.

Forget about Harbour Cruises. Don't waste your money on taking a harbour cruise. For a fraction of the cost, get yourself either a day or week pass, and use the ferries to get to different points in Sydney and it also is a great way to see so much of the city! It was affordable and there are frequent ferries so the waits aren't bad.

A must do when in Sydney. THE, way to get around Sydney. From the must do Manly ferry to the little local ferries around Circular Quay. You also get a trip under the bridge rather than pay for a cruise.... The view when you come back from Manly the the opera house and the bridge lives with you forever. Watch the return times on some of the outlying ferries and we missed one and got the bus back. Buy the multi day ticket when you arrive at the airport then thats all you need job done....

Cheapest way for ferry ride -- awesome views. Bought a A$2.50 per tIcket from the train station - called family funpack. It covers trains to city, busses and even ferries. However only for sundays.
Cheap way to get really awesome view. Took the ferry from circular quay to darling harbour from dock #5. I think evening sunsets are really beautiful
Manly Fast Ferry. You can buy alcohol and enjoy while viewing the stunning coast line, 15-20 min Ferry from Rocks to the heart of Mnaly well worth the venture.

Good transpost option in Sydney. We spent a week in Sydney and got a Myweekly pass for the ferry, trains and bus which was a good option for us and we made use of it every day. If you are staying in the Circular Quay area, the Rocks or Darling Harbour id recommend the ferries as a good way to get around. Its the best and most scenic way from the City to the Zoo, Luna Park and Manly. Also good way to get around to Darling Harbour and the Naval Museum or vice versa to Circular Quay. The ferries themselves are comfortable, have lots of seating, and are modern inside but painted like an old Melbourne tram outside with the cream and colonial green colour sceme.
Great Service. Loved the hospitality of the people that operate the ferry services! It makes the rides on the ferries more enjoyable!

Great for photo opportunities. Would recommend the ferries for the scenic travel they provide. Some great views can be had from them. Generally they run on time too. A little expensive although for the over 60's the fares are included on a day transport ticket.

Not so well kept secret. Give the overpriced cruises a miss and buy an all day ferry ticket instead. You can get to a multitude of harbour vantage points very easily and end up back where you started.
They are the best. Be it the Manly Ferry or the Darling Harbour Ferry or a trip to Watsons Bay, if the Ferries are an option to get to your destination Id say use them each time.
Trip. Its always great to take a trip to where ever on the harbour in the ferries, great views good fun lots to see.

Reliable and civilized. Ferries are the ultimate civilzed public mode of transportation! In Sydney, they are particularly great. They take you to so many places, so fast! My public tranportation pass was by far the best buy...
Nice views and more!. We used the Sydney Ferries daily to get around. The view is beautiful and the ride is cheap. It is the easiest and most fun way to get around Sydney Harbour.
Nice. It is a bit expensive but if, like me you buy a my multi ticket for buses, trains and ferries, you must take the ferries ! At least the one for Manly.

Efficient and comfortable. There is no better way of getting around Sydney harbour than using their ferries, whether it is to get to Mossman for the zoo or going across to Manly. Even the trip to Double Bay is quick and efficient and preferable to a car.

Best Travel Deal in Australia. My wife still won't talk to me after spending two weeks in Sydney. Was she mad at the way I treated her? Nope. She is envious as can be that I had a seniors card and was able to travel the length and breadth of the Sydney public transport system for $2.50 PER DAY. Unbelievable. First thing we did was get the train from Bondi Junction to Circular Quay to catch a ferry to Manly Beach. Excellent!Next day we went back (another $2.50 out of my pocket while she shelled out) and hopped on a ferry that went all the way to Watson's Bay then back via Double Bay and Rose Bay on its return to Circular Quay. This time my wife purchased an all day all-inclusive ticket that covered rail, bus and all ferries for $21.00 and you guessed it: I still only paid $2.50! No sooner did we finish the one ferry but we hopped on another to Mosman Bay via Cremorne, South Cremorne and Old Cremorne. These would be the singularly most scenic bays we had seen after two weeks of traipsing about Sydney and its many beaches.If you really want to see the best of Sydney, take the ferries.

Fun and inexpensive.. Took the ferrie to Manly and loved it. Inexpensive, relaxing and not too long. You get to travel on the harbour and take in all the sights and see some of the lovely homes along the harbour. Very easy to do, great for all ages.
First Class. Works like clockwork. Wonderful, organised and reliable. Staff friendly and obviously hardworking - first class transport
Great Value. Easily accessible, reasonably priced, reliably regular. Handy to use as a viewing platform for many aspects of the harbour.

Cheapest scenic river cruise. If you are traveling with children, take advantage of the Sunday family saver - $2.50 all day on bus, train and ferry! We decided to take the ferry down the parramatta river and back. Such a relaxing way to see Sydney and a good chance to rest your feet! Ferries are clean and safe, very pleasant.

Not so good for tourists. These commuter ferries can be overcrowded at certain times of the day as these are primarily public transport and therefore are packed with day-to-day workers. Also the trips can be rather short and the ferries may stop at several places. Better to take the Manly ferry in the off-peak period

Don't miss it. They aren't the prettiest ferries but they are stable and cheap. I really enjoyed being out on the bay and enjoying the fresh air and getting some amazing pictures of the opera house and harbour bridge.
Day out to Garden Island. We took the ferries to visit Garden Island. They were on time, reliable, and fairly well priced. You get a fantastic view of Sydney Harbour and the surrounds.

Manly Ferry - Still a joy. We caught the Ferry across to Manly. Still a great ride past the Opera House and with magnificent view of the Harbour Bridge.
Ferry is a clean and enjoyable ride across the Harbour.

A fabulous travel option. Where can you get views to die for while travelling to a see some of the highlights of your holidays?We used the ferry to access Watsons Bay (home of fab fish and chips at Doyles and a lovely coastal walk back to Rose Bay), plus taking another trip to Taronga to the Zoo.If we had had the time we would have used the services to Manly and Paramatta; maybe next time!This is an efficient and reasonably priced service, with frequent and (from our experience) very reliable sailings, with of course great views of a certain Bridge and Opera House, plus the fabulous harbour and Sydney skyline!!!
Helpful. This is the way to easily get to the fabulous Taronga Zoo, for your first look at koalas! 'roos! Splendid views en route.

A great way to enjoy the Harbour. The Sydney ferry system is a great way to enjoy the views of this wonderful Harbour. Take a trip from Circular Quay to Manly Wharf and take in some great sights. And it's pretty cheap for the experience too. Even a Catamaran trip out to Parramatta will give you another view of our City. A must for any visitor.

Great travel option. We took advantage of the ferries traveling to Watsons Bay and Darling Harbour. Ferry frequency was good and we never had to wait very long for a ride. Buy the day pass and you have unlimited travel that day.
Way to go. Went to cockatoo island island, manly and some shorter trips. The ferries were great and the kids really enjoyed them
Best way to see the harbour. Take any of the ferries for a fantastic view of the harbour whilst mixing with the Sydneyites going about their daily business. A great good value trip.
So efficient. I used the ferries a few times to get from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour and they were great

Ferry. A great way to see Sydney Harbour, some fantastic picture oppourtunities and very relaxing. Once in Manly check out the skate shops, walk along the beach prommenade and grab some lunch or a capuccino.
i love a ferry. this is one of the cheapest ways to see the harbour. its public transportation at its best
Sydney Ferries. a great way to get around. I love the idea of scenic tourist activity and commuter transport mixed. I took two ferries and loved them.
FUN!. The cheapest cruise on the harbour, and the best. Forget Melbourne's trams, the ferries are just a wonderful way to see Sydney

Very quick and nice ferry to Taronga Zoo. We caught the Taronga ferry to the zoo and it was a lovely ride. We got to take lots of pictures of the views and it stopped us just over the road from the zoo :) Will catch it again when we visit Sydney again when our son is older :)

A bit pricey but..... Took the ferry from Circular Quay to/from Manly and to/from Luna Park and Darling Harbour. Not as cheap as one might expect but still good value for money. Plus the views of Sydney are priceless.
Great way to see the Harbour on a budget. Frequent services up and down the harbour at a cheap price. Many ferries have a coffee bar for snacks.

Sydney is about the harbour. Sydney, Australia clusters around the shoreline and beyond of the finest and most beautiful harbour in the world. Sydneysiders use harbour craft for celebrating, partying, dining, recreating, commuting and sightseeing. No trip to Sydney is complete without at least one ferry ride. Sydney ferries range from the nostalgic and old fashioned queens of the harbour to the hydrofoils for fast movement between destinations. The ferries range as far as the upper reaches of the Parramatta River to Parramatta itself and to every other nook and cranny and water suburb. A night sightseeing ride would show you a side of the harbour that will stay with you for ever. If you are here at New Years and are lucky enough to see the fireworks from the water, you will never leave this city. Take your camera, a tripod if it is after sunset.

best public transport - a gem!. took the City to Manly ferry, beautiful views on time and safe. had late lunch in Manly. manly can be a little better - main strip/mall sems a little run-down or less appealing (old? fast food...junk food? ) found a restaurant accross the beach( Whitewater Restaurant). asked if we could have coffee and proprietor had no hesitation in welcoming and accommodating us , then we decided to have a big lunch there. early evening we took the ferry back to a fantastic night view of Sydney city skyline. worth the $14 fare!
Great way to see the harbour. Lovely way to see the harbour from the water, and to get from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour
Trip to Darling Harbour. Caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour for dinner one evening. Nice way to travel for dinner.

Great Value trip and lunch. All you can eat buffet while you travel around this world famous habour. I think my son (he of the hollow legs) had 3 helpings of butter chicken and then moved on to puddings. Really good value for money
FAST & EFFICIENT. Best public transport I have used in years fast and on time.
relaxing. The service we took doubled as a scenic cruise and 'getting from a to b'. Very efficient on time and if you are a bit time poor, a great way to get in views of Sydney from the water.
My son and I took ferry from manly. Its the first time for me,excellent experience from Manly and worth the cost of $7.00 ea way.It took about an Half hour each way.The boat was good and run well
For Sydney by water, scenic views. Absolutely fabulous for trips to Cockatoo Island and Manly or Taronga Zoo!
Sydney Ferries. great service with staff out to help u at ticket areas.

Very helpful staff and great way to see Sydney.. After patting ourselves on the back for managing to buy tickets from the machines we promptly entered the wrong terminal. Luckily the obliging staff members were very helpful and we were directed to the correct place and able to go through without it affecting our tickets. The service seemed very efficient and the view of the harbour as we crossed past the bridge and around the Opera House was priceless.

Cheap and Fun Travel. This is one of the Sydney attraction that you should do.Go with your partner or friends and enjoy the short trip by ferry. You can enjoy the view surround the city and stop in some wharf, you don't need to get out if you just want to go around with the ferry. Just make sure you buy the return ticket for this.The ticket price is reasonable even not cheap but it's quiet fun as Sydney is a famous city with the harbour.
Easy way to travel. Trips every 30 mins to manly return makes traveling to manly beach a dream

Great way to get from one part of Sydney to the other. The ferries run a regular schedule just like buses. The cost is reasonable plus you get to the Opera House and other sights depending on which ferry and which direction you are going.
Ferries. Not the best food but views are great takes about one hour and you see some beautiful homes
Get Around With Ease. The Sydney Ferries system is absolutely excellent and so easy to use to get to various places of interest or just to take in the views going to and from the many locations.
Fun Rides. Beautiful Sydney Harbour and beyond. Get was to get to Manley Beach
mymultipass. the ideal way to get around Sydney. Get a pass and hop on and off at any time. well worth it and the ferries are on time, clean, comfortable and well run.

What a way to travel. Over 4 days we travelled the harbour with ease - always on time and the staff always willing to assist with directions.
Great way to see Sydney
Very fun. Great how you can travel around on your daily trip pass.

Ferry Ride - Cheap and Best. If there is anything that i found inexpensive in Sydney, it was Ferry Ride. Most of the NSW cities are well connected and it was almost one-fifth the rate of a taxi-ride. and the journey was cool, pleasant and timely.

Inexpensive ride, amazing sightseeing vistas!. Without much planning, we bought multi-pass tickets and rode the Sydney Ferries out to Manly and then up to Paramatta. It was a great way to see a lot of the city -- the view from the harbor is a lot different than seeing it from within! It tends to be a little chillier on the water, so keep that in mind, and also consider when the sun sets -- a good bit of a trip back from Paramatta was in the dark, but seeing things lit up was also nice.

Wet or fine the Harbour is tops.. The weather was awful but the Ferry trip to Manly was great, I enjoyed seeing Sydney Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge, Fort Denison along with the great views around the Harbour, I didn't even get off at Manly but stayed on for the round trip, certainly well worth doing.
Heart of the Harbour. What a cheap and easy way to see Sydney on the water. Authentic ferries friendly and helpful staff, a good experience.
Sydney Ferries. A good way for visitors to see the harbour and surrounds.
Great way to get around. Get a combined travel card and you can travel all day on the ferries and then get the train, bus home.
One of the joys of Sydney. Convenient, safe, well-run and super views along the way. A wonderful way to travel and sightsee.

Great for a low priced tour but over priced for commuting. I've been on the ferries a lot in my life and they are great and I can imagine tourists having a great time on them. If you are a local wanting to travel somewhere though it is not such a good idea as they are a bit pricey for just zipping around.

Best Value Trips in Sydney. If the very poor £sterling/dollar exchange rate is sqeezing your Budget, the ferry trips from Circular Quay offer a splendid variety of short river trips at a relatively cheap price. If you are visiting with children the Transport System provides a special deal on Sundays; for $2.50 per person you can purchase a family ticket which provides train and ferry transport to all areas covered for the day. If the weather is good, go to Manly, it is a lovely area with "Little Manly Beach" for Small Children, or the Main Surfing Beach for adults and older children. Manly has a very nice promenade.Ferries also go to Darling Harbour, which has an excellent (free) water park for Kids, and there are several restaurants offering good Lunch Deals. Well Work a trip.Also close to Darling Harbour is Paddy's Market. This is a massive market selling all sorts of products. Many of them are cheap trinkets, clothes etc. from China, but with clever selection it is possible to make a good buy.
Iconic trips. Best thing to do in Sydney - train form airport to Circular Quay. catch a ferry anywhere - Manly is my preference.low cost enjoyment with iconic views.
I wouldn't call it amazing. Certainly not the prettiest sight, however the ferry adequately serves it purpose. Good for accessing Luna Park, islands and alot cheaper than a cab
Fantastic Service. Freedom of the travel pass, travelling at willAbility to take so many pictures TY
Fun Way to get around. Great way to get around Sydney. Wished we had the same set up in Melbourne.
Always a must when in Sydney. I have always loved catching the ferry from Darling Harbour to the Opera House..The trip to Manly is fantastic as well

Ferry to Darling Harbour from Sydney Harbour. All the ferries are not wheelchair accessible but those leaving the platform 5 are usually accessible. The "ride" is not too long, is safe and this is an easy way to go from the main harbour to Darling Harbour. Cost of a ticket is around 10AUS$ one way. Using this ferry you can take marvelous pictures of both Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House.
Simply perfect. Good, clean and what is the most important... Always on the time...
Best way to get around. Very reliable and relatively cheap compared to other forms of travel across the bay, particularly to Manly. If only there was one to Bondi!

Harbour Cruise. I liked the houses overlooking the harbour, It was enjoyable learning the history of the area, and stories of the early settlers.
Sydney harbour is very interesting with the Opera House, Harbour Bridge. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.
beats swimming. bit windy the day we travelled but good seating and efficient service really good for sight seeing
Great. The Sydney ferries are clean, convenient, and efficient, as is all of the Sydney public transportation.

Family Funday Sunday here we come.... We really love using the ferries on Sundays, as we can travel as much as we want only for 2,5 dollars / person, thanks to our son. :)
Sydney Harbour is just wonderful on a sunny day and no trip to Sydney is complete without experiencing what the city is like from a different perspective.

Strongly recommended. The ferry takes you around Sydney Darling Harbour, Tooronga Zoo, Sydney Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House. The whole trip is not too costly and is worth do.ing on a nice sunny day
a great experience. great price & quick trip. Great photo opportunties
Sea legs. Great humour for all of our mates aboard, but I can throw up looking at the sea. Well appointed ferries and no upsies, very happy

Use them as much as you can. This is a city based round its harbour and the ferries are a lovely relaxing way to travel and see it. We just loved being able to choose so many destinations in different directions from Circular Quay. Whilst the ferry to Manly for example is direct, others like those to Watsons' Bay make stops along the way. If you get a day ticket you can get on and off as the fancy takes you, explore, have a bit of lunch and a drink, and then get on again a bit later on to either carry on or return to the centre. You also get different views of the harbour bridge, the opera house and the skyline from the water too.
An icon. the transport system as a whole in Sydney is fantastic,but a trip on the ferries around Sydney harbour is a must do
Great service. The Sydney ferries are so easy to catch, they are clear about where the next stop is, the service is regular and the staff were helpful when required.
Smooth ride. very good smooth ferries rides , very good service . awesome view
See the beauty of the Opera House from the water. The views are stunning and the experience is breathtaking.

Good way to get around. We used the ferry to see the sites and get from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay. Seems like a much cheaper way to see the harbour then the official 'tours'. Not crowded either which was nice.

Fantastic harbour views all the way. The ferries from Sydney (Circular Quay) to Manly regularly every day of the week. The journey takes 28 minutes. Close views of the Opera House and Harbour bridge on the early part of the journey, then the scenery changes as you pass many little beaches and inlets. Close to Many you will pass the "heads" which is the outlet where vessels leave the harbour to proceed out to sea. At this point, there may be some "rocking" of the ferry, depending on the weather conditions of the day. So much to see at Manly. Lovely seaside shops, eateries,the aquarium, many walk paths and beaches. Also this is a pleasant journey by night as the ferry approaches the lights of the city and Manly.
Lots of Choice. What can you say, they were very much to time, very easy to access. The ferry's are basic but they do a job. The timetable is very informative. But remember there is a lot of choice.
excellent every time. ferries were reasonably priced and clean and on time...and you can't beat the view!

Well-equipped. This experience is literally a breath of fresh air and not to be missed. We took the ferry from the Darling Harbour terminal to Rydalmere, then bus-titution (ie bus substitute for ferry) to Parramatta due to low river tide. My son is not into boating (I am) but he loved it. In winter, secure head and eye protection is a good idea if you want to travel on the exposed deck for a better view - the wind chill factor can be awesome once you travel beyond the harbour bridge. As previous reviewers have mentioned, there is free on-board wireless internet - for details, see http://www.sydneyferries.info/experience-sydney/wifi-on-manly-ferry.htm. But did you notice the power sockets near the indoors seats? Worth finding out if you can plug in your laptop/smartphone etc for recharging while you get a recharge up on deck. I wish all public transport had these features.
I love to ride around the harbour in these lovely old ferries!. Buy a pass for the duration of your stay then you can go on a ferry ride whenever you just want to relax and enjoy the harbour views
Great views!. We took the ferry from Manly beach to the Sydney area and I loved the views! So many things to take pictures of.

A different perspective . The ferries are reasonably prices and once under way give you a different perspective and great photo opportunities. Free wifi and regular schedules make this an enjoyable alternative to navigate around Sydney.

Family Ferry, Train, Bus pass was PERFECT!!. We didn't have to worry about how we were going to commute around sydney, Bondi or Blue Mountains, the transportation system is one that should be copied around the globe!
Great way to see Sydney Harbour. Much cheaper then Harbour Cruises and just as good. Great way to get around the Harbour.
beautiful waterways. easily the highlight of our visit - absolutelly breathtaking views and a mst do experience - take the manly ferry
A nice way to spend the afternoon. We enjoyed traveling on a number of ferries around the harbor, seeing different parts of the harbor. WW bought a daily my Ferry ticket, which we got value from.

Sunday Family Price $2.50 each!!!!!. Wow, if you have a child in your party everyone travels for $2.50 each on a Sunday, we took a ferry to Watsons Bay, had lunch on the water, took great photos of The Entrance and it was raining hard that day! Staff were super helpful, happy to give advice on where to go and the whole day was just so much fun being out on the water sight seeing.Who would have thought Sydney could be cheap!!!!!Get out and do this family experience, the kids will love it - everything excluding the Monorail is accessible, you could do a day trip to the Blue Mountains for $2.50 - awesome!
Best way to get about Sydney. The ferries from Circular Quay are frequent, cheap and offer the best way to get about the coty and to its main attractions. I use them all the time while in town.
A great way to travel. The ferries are a great way to travel, you feel like your exploring as you travel to your next destination. Well worth taking the time to enjoy.
great way to sight see. buy a weekly multi transport ticket and do all the ferry journeys,they are great

A real treat!. I love travelling on the Sydney ferries and take a trip every time we visit the city. A lovely way to see the harbour, and just perfect on a summers day. The trip to Manly is not to be missed.

May 2012. We bought a Sydney Travel pass for the week when we arrived at the Sydney airport and it included the ferries. My husband and I were in Sydney from Monday-Friday and we randomly jumped on the ferries to just explore.This is where we took awesome pics of the Sydney Opera House and the Sydney Bridge!I think I was most impressed with how the ferries are on time, clean and everyone is SO POLITE. I wish we had such amazing transportation like this in the United States!

Great ferries. You can save yourself some money by travelling on the normal ferries and still get a good tour around the harbour with commentry, so don't miss them. There is a great ferry ride which goes up the Parramatta River and its quite an enjoyable ride for a couple of hours, you could get out and have a look around Parramatta before travelling back on the ferry
Worth a Ride!!. We purchased a weekly pass for ferries, train, busses. Rode ferries to several destinations. Very easy way to get around and see the area. Plus it's fun!!
The best way to see Sydney Harbor. We did the full circuit and enjoyed the commentary
Great transport. Jumping on a Sydney Ferry is the most ideal way to get around Sydney Harbour. Great services.

Excellent show, great staff and good food.. Everytime I go to Sydney, I usually go to this show. I have been there at least 3 times and always bring my friends. The show is very good in the most part and they are happy to accomodate all food requests. The views from this boat at night are incredible and completely unparalled when the food and entertainment is also thrown into the mix. I am a domestic travel agent and I definitely recommend it to all my clients when they are looking for an escape in Sydney. Well worth the money!

A relaxed way to travel. What better way to see Beautiful Sydney than to travel on the wonderful ferries. I was born in Sydney but have lived abroad for the past 27 years. My husband and I bought a weekly travel pass and what great value we had. We had a wonderful time travelling on all the ferries visiting the lovely destinations. The weather was perfect and our trips on the Sydney ferries and the river cat were utterly delightful and very memmorable. Highly recommended!
Like the Free Wi-Fi. pity it took the entire trip to connect to the Wi-Fi, must be the world's slowest.
Fun Day Out. You can't go wrong no matter which Ferry you jump on - Watson's Bay, Taronga Zoo or pop over to Manly. They are comfortable and fun to do.
Good value. I took the ferry ride to Manly beach. The ferry was nice and clean and the ride was scenic. It was $14 round trip - a good value for a 60 minute (round trip) boat ride.
Excellent. Excellent , clean , frequent convenient schedule. they even have wifi

Fantastic service. Easily the best way to sight see around the harbour. Buy a multi-trip ticket for not much more than a two hour "cruise" and you have a week of unencumbered travel on the ferries from Manly at one end to Parramatta at the other. You will see bush, beaches, cities, Olympic Park, fantastic houses, public gardens, islands, museums what what is almost a mangrove swamp for the last stretch to Parramatta. They all seem to run to time, are all well signposted and positively luxurious compared to the trains and buses. Your multitrip ticket also covers trains and buses.

transport. great way to see Sydney. Went to Watsons Point to get to Bondi. Another trip took us to Manly, great fish and chips and lovely walks even though it was raining. We took a ferry up to Parramatta but tide wasn't right so tranferred by bus to travel from the stop just before. Now if you have a SENOIRS CARD all this public transport travel cost you just $2.50 per day. Fantastic!

Fabulous way to see Sydney harbour. Bought a A$41 pass giving 7 days unlimited travel on Sydney's buses, trains and most ferries (excludes the fast ferries and Manly ferry). That is exceptional value. Easily accessible from circular quay, and plenty of regular timetables to chose from - ferries run on time, and are a fabulous way to see Sydney
Fast and good. They depart on time, they arrive early. They are also thrifty when it comes to tickets. We were 4 and we had only 1 so we had to insert the ticket 4 times. Wise saving. :)

Offers best view of harbor, bridge, and opera house. With the purchase of the multi-pass the ferry rides were included with the train and buses. We were able to get plenty of photo ops while riding ferry to manly beach and the star casino.

Great way to see the Harbor. We went to Manly and back and that was a lovely ride. We also went from the Quay to Darling Harbor and this offered a great photo op of both the Opera House and the Sydney Harbor bridge.
The way to go. Excellent, relatively inexpensive way to see the water ways of Sydney. They run in all directions offering many options of times and locations
Pollution Free & Safe. I found Sydney Ferries to be very safe and pollution free compared to ferries I have used in other Asian countries.
Great way to get around!. The best way to get around Sydney harbor! We bought a three day pass and jumped on and off whenever we wanted!

Sydney Ferries are the best deal for tourists!. Very affordable and easy way to sightsee the wonderful places in and around the largest harbour we have visited. Weekly pass is
a great deal and we dined in numerous lovely places, visited lovely beaches and did a great deal of sightseeing including the
zoo and the Parametta River thanks to the ferries.
Ferry travel is fantastic. What an enjoyable way to spend a day - riding the fabulous Sydney Ferries anywhere you want to go.

Service fine, staff a bit rude. Its just a ferry, but a ferry in Sydney harbour, so it's really the cheapest way to get a great view of the harbour bridge and opera house. Got on the ferry at Pyrmont bay where the casino is and went to circular quay. There was nowhere to buy a ticket at the wharf in Pyrmont and when we asked a ferry staff member we got some rude grunt of an answer we couldn't understand. You can buy the tickets at circular quay on your way out. The view on the ferry was great and the ferries were very clean and well maintained. I suggest walking from circular quay to the casino and checking out Darling Harbour and relaxing on the ferry on the way back.
Nice way to view Sydney. Take a trip from Circular Quay to anywhere on the harbour, its a great way to see the city.
The way to get around. The ferry got us to Manly, Darling Harbor and the Zoo. A trip and harbor tour all in one! No need to take the harbor tour.
Ferry to zoo.. We took a ferry to the zoo and back . Get a late one back so as to see the harbour bridge all lit.

Unmissable Way To View Sydney Harbour. on the cheap! Australia is so unbelievably expensive to visit, eat and drink in (though I understand breathing remains free, for the moment), that you need to use every trick and opportunity, and this is a great one. Just do not forget your camera.And given the shameless rates hotels charge for WiFi in Sydney and beyond, the fact that you can enjoy free WiFi for much of the trip is an added bonus (given Aussie prices, I use the term 'bonus' loosely. No wonder everyone is smiling over here!)It is also worth spending a while looking around Manly and particularly the great beach. It all just feels 'right'.
Sydney = Ferries. The ferries aren't super fantastic, but the harbour they traverse is. Feeling board? Just get on any old ferry and go there and back.
average. its a ferry, what else you expect, you can take picture of opera house by taking ferries and go to bondy beach. have fun at the beach and enjoy

Great way to see harbour and get to some Sydney Landmarks. We somtimes get a Family FunDay ticket from Railway Station which is available for any Sunday from Midnight to midnite. It covers includes 2 Adults and 2 Children fro $10. You get to use Ferries Trains or buses. Ferries are great way to get to many Landmarks (Zoo, Luna Park, Darling Harbours, Watson Bay etc etc) Great Value and free wifi.
Great way to get around Sydney. Ferries are a fun and inexpensive way to get around the city. Highly recommend it instead of a cab, when it is convenient. During rush hour, the ferries are faster.
Easy. They really make taking the ferry very easy. There are tons of guide visible in few languages, and staff are always happy to help.
Great. Do not have to wait long for ferries, great way to travel
Ferries to everywhere. So cheap to travel on the ferries, they give you many different views of the harbour.
Excellent Service. Great service - cheap fares & regular services to a variety of locations

Wonderful value for Aussie pensioners, on a stunnibg harbour.. For a $2.50 pensioners ticket you can spend the day traveling all over the harbour, and up to Parramatta as well, then use your ticket to get to any other part of Sydney, Newcastle, the Blue Mountains or down to Woollonggong. All for the price of $2.50, bargain of the century.
Loved it. Very easy, convenient and the best to feel sydney living surrounded with the sea

There and back. We took my elderly Mum on a trip to Sydney and took her on around trip to Rose Bay and Double Bay etc. It was a lovely day and she really enjoyed the trip and the site seeing on the way. We have done it other times and got off and visited the area but did the round trip this time. Great for a person who needs assistance to walk with a stick or walking frame.

Ferries are golden. Caught the ferry from Rose Bay to the city for 7 years. Now just from time to time. Magic experience. Love the crews and their low key ozzie humor. And some great skippers that I got to know: Richard Clark amongst others.Hopefully the privatisation push won't destroy their unique culture.
best travel option. these little boats offer fast and frequent travel options around the harbour.
Efficient with plenty of sailings!. Great views to be had! Fast and varied options for getting across the harbor.

On time and take you right where you need to go.. Once we figured out how to buy a day pass we used the ferry to go all around. It was nice and cool and was so pleasant being on the water and seeing the view of the bridge and Opera House from that vantage point.
Must do. Cheap and easy way to get best views of Sydney. A must do when you next visit Sydney.
Good option to get around. but not very clean and quite pricey. Nice to ride on the original ferries but felt they could have kept them in better condition.
Good Transport. There are many ferries that leave from Circular Quay going to many other parts of Sydney and they are very punctual
Value for money. I wish I had had the time to lounge in them, without getting off to see the sights.

Best views of Sydney are from the Sydney ferries!. The Sydney ferries are a great way to get around Sydney - Sydney Harbour, Darling Harbour, Luna Park, Opera House, The Rocks etc. The ferry rides also give a great view of the Sydney skylines from various points. It is cost effective and time saving.
The best way to experience Sydney !. It really is a wonderful and cheap way to not only get around Sydney but a wonderful sightseeing opportunity in it's own right!

go more places for less. We took the ferry to Paramatta from Circular Quay on the advice of a friend. it proved to be a great suggestion. you see a lot more of the harbour, including the Olympic site stop, can hop on and off at any stop and tour around. We loved the trip up and after touring round Paramatta, decided to return via the bus.The staff are friendly and helpful. Give this a try and use your transit pass to save a was of dough as well.

The Cheapest Harbour Cruise in Town.. Often when in Sydney I choose to do the ferry trip to Manly and back. Manly offers ocean and harbour beaches a short walk apart, shops, cafes, pubs,walks and an aquarium. And you get the trip up the harbour from the Quay to the Heads for a low public transport cost.

Charming, fun and inexpensive way to cross the harbour. Want the cheapest cruise ever? Just jump on a Sydney ferry and you can go to various locations around the l;o vely harbour.
We have visited Taronga Zoo, Luna Park and prob best f all Cockatoo Island on a ferry. The beach style bar at Cockatoo island + ferry experience is one the great gems of Sydney
Great form of transportation. The ferries are a great form of transporation and save lots of time in comparison to driving to the places they service. They are clean, safe and always on time.

always on Time. You can always count on taxes and death as they say but i guarentee you that the ferry can always be counted on . Thank you ferry for teaching me to be on time as more than once have i been stuck at the gate saying your closed with the ferry just within my reach... ah but thanks for getting me on time when I am organised

Great views of the harbour with destination included for free. We took the ferry to Manly Beach and the ferry ride itself was half the fun. The ferry moves slowly through the harbour, giving you ample opportunity to take pics along the way of the buildings and other boats/ships.One important hint--if you want to take pics while on the ferry, try to queue up at or near the front, then take one of the seats on the outside of the ferry. They will tend to fill up quickly, but if you get a seat there, you will have lots of opportunities to take pics. For the best views of the Opera House, sit on the starboard (right) side leaving Sydney dock and port on the way back. For best views of Harbour Bridge, do the opposite.

Ok, but can be improved. Recently decided to spend the day getting on/off various ferries for my young son to experience something different.It was a nice day but some staff need to be taught manners, especially when talking to children. Not all children are naughty!!!! I did not appreciate a belligerent staff member telling me to keep an eye on my son when he was standing very quietly & holding my hand while looking out of the window!!!!! The rude reply I got when I questioned his reasons for saying it was beyond belief - he needs to find a new job.The facilities leave a lot to be desired.
Ferry. Very good service, frequent and on time, good value
Great service. What a lovely and relaxing way to travel. Efficient service. The weekly tickets are very good value $AUD43. They offer unlimited travel on ferries, buses, trams and certain rail zones.

The best way to spend a 'Sunday Funday'. $2.50 for a day on the harbour using the CityRail Sunday promotion for families/anybody, jumping on & off at any number of wharves around the harbour, accessing a range of attractions, picnic sites, fish'n'chip opportunities (such as Dolyes at Watsons Bay or Manly). Makes me wish I lived where I could commute to the CBD this way.
Fantastic. Makes getting around Sydney so easy and such wonderful views of the city and sites. Really enjoyed the trip to the zoo. Got my best photos of the Opera House from a ferry.
awesome. love travelling on the ferries.the totally awesome sceneries of the sydney harbour,cant top the views.could go on the ferries all day long
Loved the ferries.. Great for our kid and the zoo destination makes for a great days outing for a family.
why do a tour whne the ferries give you a great experience. take a ferry anywhere in Sydney from circular quay on a great day and you will never forget the Sydny experience
Sydney Ferry Harbor tour. The Ferry that we rode was very accomodating and helpful when we got on and off at the various stops. Beautiful ride!

Another Sydney must. If you're in Sydney for more than a few days, get yourself a multi ticket (AUS $43 for 7 days - good on the buses, the tram, the train and the ferries) and the city and the harbour are yours. When in doubt jump on one of the ferries.
Grreat for seeing the harbour. Each table has a map and explanation of the buildings, much cheaper thean doing a harbour tour.

Sydne Ferries. We went to Parramatta on the catamaran, and Manly on an old fashioned ferry, using a Pensioner Excursion Ticket. ($2.50 each). That gave us two different, but equally enjoyable experiences. Living in a river town, I was interested in the narrowness of the channel to Parramatta, and the way it changed from one side of the river to the other, as well as the mangroves growing along the edge, which gave a feeling of how the river would have looked before white settlement. We had good views of harbour side houses and bays, as well as a number of bridges, all different in style. The trip to Manly took us close to Sydney heads, across a much wider and more open section of the harbour, where there was more harbour traffic such as yachts and a cruise ship. We got off and spent some time on the wharf at the lolly shop and Aldi, and walked through to the beach which was pretty. It was a very enjoyable day out.

Great, for a public transport system. We originally considered a private water taxi but ended up taking the ferry option and in the end this was a great option. It was clean, interesting and very efficient. We stopped off at a few more places than we had expected en route from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay but in the end had no regrets.

The BEST way to get around this fabulous city and outlying areas!. Whether you're visiting Manly Beach, Taronga Zoo, Darling Harbour or the many other fabulous sites, the ferries are the way to go. The waterways are the most picturesque in the world!

Parramatta Ferry. All the ferry trips around Sydney have something to offer but for a longer trip Manly is maybe No1 and the trip out to Parramatta by fast cat gives a longer trip outside the harbour. Expect to pay $5.60 one way and you have to disembark and re board. You'll see riverside suburbs that then meld into mangroves on the way up to Parramatta. I think you go for the trip...not Parramatta, although the city and Old Government house is there. Restaurants abound including one at the wharf which is fairly good. You can go all stops which might include Darling Harbour but another spot is the rowing club at the Abbotsford stop which is a great spot on the river for a drink or lunch. Alternatively, the express no stops except Rydalmere and Parramatta. If it has been raining heavily, you have to change to the bus for a ten minute ride. Best to turn around or not go after heavy rain. Friendly staff. Nice trip on a sunny day.

Not to be missed!. Whenever we are on holiday in Oz we have to spend our last week in Sydney, get a My Travel weekly pass and travel about on all the ferries (and trains and buses). What a brilliant way to travel..... take the ferry to Manly and have a walk up the Corso and then go up to Parramatta to get the return at sunset and that's an excellent day out.

Great Ferries, Free Wifi!. The Sydney Ferries are the perfect way to see the city. Get the week long transit pass which includes buses, trains, and ferries and you can spend as much time as you like on the water. Plus, the ferries even offer free wifi if you are worried about staying connected.
Ferry under Sydney Harbour Bridge. About $11 return from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour, you are able to get some great photos of the bridge & opera house.
best way to get around. purchase a pass for unlimited rides....i spend alot of time during my trips to OZ riding the ferries.....skip the tourist boats and dinner cruises....save tons of $$$$$
Take the Ferries. Get an all transport pass for as long as you are in Sydney and USE it...Ferries go to amazing places...get off walk around and catch the next one..

You have to do it!. If ever you visit Sydney, you have to take a trip on one of the ferries from Circular Quay across the harbour waters. The best place to appreciate the beauty of the harbour, the bridge and the Opera House is from the decks of one of the green-hulled ferries. If weather permits, stay outside. For obvious reasons - the ferries are mainly a means for commuters to get to and from the centre of Sydney - most of the accommodation is inside.If you are only going to take one trip, maybe the ferry to Many is the best option. It is about twenty minutes or so and Manly is an interesting place to visit with good beaches and seaside attractions.
Great Harbour Experience. Rode the ferry from Pyrmont Bay (end of Darling Harbour) via Luna Park to Circular Quay. Great views, efficient transport, exciting for the kids.

Great way to relax and see some of the city. Get a long trip by ferry if you are in Sydney. It is rather cheap and the view is quite amazing. It was very relaxing and rewarding with all the views, especially since weather was great.
Excellent to get around while enjoying spectacular views of the harbour. Best way to see the Sydney Harbour, and travel between the sights!

Great value. Was able to use the same train ticket from North Sydney on to the ferry and back by bus - all for $2.50 senior rate. Best value in Sydney. Very efficient, clean, on time and beautiful views.
Good value and timekeeping. We went from Circluar Quay to Watson's Bay taking about 25 minutes a great way to see the city and its outlying suburbs.

Manly and Circular Quay. Prices were good. If senior you can travel all the ferries for one price. Get tickets at Woolworths. Views are excellent on the outside front. Manly Ferry is a must to visit the beach there. Very nice, but dangerous beach due to tides.
Easy. The Ferries were easy to get around and were always on time.
Relaxed Water. Love to relax while gliding on the water to and from Circular Quay.

One of my Favorite Things About Sydney. The Sydney Ferries are SO cool. What better way to get around they by water? We purchased the MyMulti which included ferries, buses, and the subway. Definately the way to go!
GREAT SERVICE. All the ferries get you to where you need to go around and beyond the harbour. Good fun and great views.

Fast and easy. These little ferries is goingto and thour all the time. Its not à long time to wait and the amning is very resonable.. Mind you, that there is different taxes, depending on age and wich person WHO serves you! Some ticketsellers says that this is what counts, other say someting else.
Great cheap way to see the sights. We took the Darling Harbour ferry just on sunset. It's a great way to see some of the main sights eg the Bridge, Opera House & Luna Park.
Excellent service. Get a day pass and enjoy the ride to all the popular attractions in around Sydney Harbour

Ferry from Blue Mountains. We went to Wildfeather park, which words couldn't explain the beauty of the park. We got to pet the koals, wallabees, and kangaroos. It was awesome.
The blue mountains were wonderful and magnicifient

A little sight seeing on the ferry. The time we went it was raining hard. We bought a one day pass for the public transportation. We decided to get on the ferry because it was raining so bad. But at least we could see the area without getting wet on the ferry. Also there is complimentary internet wi-fi service...not bad.
Holiday Down Under. Great way to get around Sydney and fun to explore the different ports.
Great mode of transport. on time, and lots fo see. also took the captain cook harbour cruise, terrrific, morning cruise, served coffee, tea and snacks. tim tams best cookie ever!!! we got hooked

Plenty of choices. Lots of cheap and easily accessed ferries at Circular Quay. Billboards display the times and the berths - take your pick. lots of options to spend a day at leisure. Its up to you what you choose.
Ferries are Awesome. The ferries run on time and are a really fun way to get about in the area
the best way around Sydney harbour. great value way to see around Sydney Harbour - check out time-tables beforehand to plan your day - Many & Watson's Bay highly recommended
super fast. wow, we set off from Watsons Bay on what must have been a hydrofoil and were back at Circular key in no time. Great value seeing the City from the harbour
Nice ride. Take the ferry to go from Circular Quay to many touristic places : Manly Beach, Watson Bay, Luna Park, Taronga Zoo...
The best way to see the Bridge and Opera House. Any of the standard ferries are worth a trip. Our favourite was the Taronga Ferry and the Manly Ferry

You have to take a ride!. We took quite a few ferry rides and I think it was one of the best things about our stay in Sydney. Just taking a short ride from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour is awesome. Take a little break from walking or taking the bus. Enjoy the wind in your hair, the sun in your face and the free wifi on board (for those who cannot do without!). We purchased a transport pass which included ferry rides so it's a good option if you're staying in Sydney for more than a few days. The photo ops are also really nice.

Good transport sytem. Sydney ferries are back bone of Sydney transport systems. The are handling huge number of people daily. Mostly weekdays office hours are busy. I traveled so many times in different ferries. I like to travel again and again. Visitors can take ride to Tarronga zoo, Manly, Paramatta, Darling harbour, Watson bay etc...
Worth it even for the ride. The ferries from circular quay go to several places any of them is worth a trip just to enjoy the ride.There are great views to be had from outside the harbour too!

terrific transport.. What a fantastic way to get around. The service and friendliness from the staff was terrific.The scenes of the Harbour and sydney lifestyle was also great. love it love it. Can,t wait for my next trip. Who needs a car!
Convenient. A great way to get around and great value for money.

Travel. We used this to go to Tarronga Zoo, staff very helpful as to use of tickets etc. Frequent ferries and we quite often came in on one ferry and then jumped on another one to get to another destination.
The First Fleet. Particularly enjoyed the older ferries rather than the river cats - very fast and very organised. Being able to sit outside and feel the wind in my hair! Like the First Fleet names.
Ferry to Manly. Great way to see the Harbour - ran on time and efficiently.

Best way to experience the harbour.. Take the ferry after dark from Darling harbour back round to Circular Quay. Nothing more romantic with all the lights and sounds from Luna park etc. Any of the ferries that go across to the north shore are also great value and a real experience.
CHEAPEST WAY TO SEE THE HARBOUR. Take the famous Manly Ferry from Circular Quay to have lunch in Manly - great day out.
Excellent travel to see the Bay. Used ferry to get to Darling Harbour, Double Bay and the Zoo great fun
Cheapest way to see Sydney Harbour. Take the ferry out to the heads which is the longest trip and shows you the best of the harbour
Cheapest way to see the harbour. Good way to see the harbour on the cheap. Not always the cleanest like any public transport but million dollar views for $2.80

DailyPass. Carefully read the opportunities and get a daily pass where you can use it on the buses, rail and ferries.
You can even sail to Kings - Darling Harbour. It takes you to the Zoo.

Fantastic transport. The Sydney ferries are just the best way to get around the harbour areas. All run on time and often there are connecting buses waiting at the ferry stops. Buy a weekly combined, ferry, bus, rail ticket and for around A$45 for the week you can get to everything in and around Sydney with no hassle. Far better to use the ferries than the expensive Harbour Cruise boats - you just don't get the onboard commentary. We also notice that now the ferries offer free wifi for 45 mins in the morning and 45 mins in the evening!
Great way to enjoy Sydney. Views are great. If you are tired of walking but still want to sight see, hop on a ferry. Great deal esp if you have a multi pass. It also has free wi-fi!

Best public transport in the world. As a long time local I've always thought Sydney ferries are the best value harbour cruises in the world. Don't go for the overpriced lunch buffet cruises- jump on a local ferry and do a loop. You can even hide some champagne in a Plastic bottle if you want a bit of hidden romance...
Reliably frequent. If spending more than an a few days, worth getting a My-multi ticket to get best value out of combined train & ferry use.
fast and clean. I found the ferrys a wonderful relaxing way to see the city and surrounding areas and the best way the get the zoo.

Quite worthwhile.. Start off with a caveat: The Sydney Ferries are not tourist cruises. They are part of the public transportation system that just happens to be conducive to tourist activities. If, as a tourist, you hop aboard one expecting to be catered to, then your expectations will not be met.That being said, the ferries offer an inexpensive way to see the harbor, as well as get out to suburbs of Sydney that really aren't easy to get to, such as Parramatta or Manly. For around $A50, you can get a weekly pass that covers the ferries, as well as trains and buses. Hard to beat, when a tailored-for-tourists harbor cruise would run nearly that much, if not more.The ferries are relatively clean, not eat-off-the-floor quality, but that's not a big deal. They're safe, the crews are attentive to passengers, there is food available once in a while, nothing special. You can get some great views if you're able to get to the front or back and get by the railing - beaches, forests, the open ocean, random watersport enthusiasts buzzing the ferries on their windsurfing boards. If you take the ferry to Manly, you can see the backside of the Opera House, which is a view not everyone gets.The ferries run on a fairly tight schedule, seem to only vary by around 5 minutes. I'm sure in really poor weather there are problems, but that's just how it goes. The schedules could be difficult for a non-English speaker, but should be easy to figure out in a few minutes for any English speaker.Essentially, this isn't necessarily an attraction to visit, but an attraction that also happens to be a great way to get around the city if you have an adventurous inclination and free time.
fantastic. effiecient - lots of them ! - clean and comfortable :)

Great way to travel. Got the ferry as a return trip from Manly, refreshing, relaxing, chilled and so enjoyable. Complete with wfi if you need to work but trust me don't miss the opportunity to enjoy the moment

Great fun and a great way to see the city. We took our 14 month old son on the ferry and sailed from Cockle Bay Wharf to Circular Quay. It was a great way to see the city, the harbour bridge and the opera house. My only quibble is that the ferry ticket is quite expensive which is why we only made the one trip.
Best views. There is no better way to appreciate what Sydney Harbour is all about.

A wonderful way to see Sydney. I was visiting Sydney on my own and found the ferrys a wonderful relaxing way to see the city and surrounding areas. Very reasonably priced and easy to work out from the timetables which one went where. You also get great views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera house when coming back to Circular Quay. Definitely a must do whilst in Sydney.

Sydney Experience. You cant go to Sydney and not get to use the Ferries. It is a great way to travel. The fares are reasonable and the puncuality is fantastic. It can get a little crowed especially if you like to seat on the outside. Can get a little stuffy inside. Personally l like to seat on the outside.

Convenient & Scenic. Catching ferries from Circular Quay to cruise around the Sydney Harbour is a great way to view some of the sites. It's also a handy way to travel for business to & from meetings. Convenient way to travel in & around the CBD, in particular.

Best ferry system in the world.. Yeah, you have trains, taxis, buses... But none of them have the magic of a ferry. And Sydney ferries rank very high in terms of efficiency and service. They are punctual, clean, unexpensive and offer a fantastic view of the city. A view like no other. Few cities in the world may get closer to the fun of the ferry experience in Sydney: Hong Kong or Istambul.

Sydney Fairies. A very cost effective way to see the harbour and visit sections of the city. Only $21 per day per person, but you need to know where you are going, so best to take Captain Cook for a guided tour the 1st day.
Great mode of Transportation. Very reasonable and wonderful views!!!! Definitely a must!

Lovely day out on the Ferry. A great way to spend time on a beautiful sunny Autumn Day. Went from Manly to Circular Quay, then Circular Quay to Parramatta. Worth getting off at Parramatta to walk through the riverside park.Tip: if you are a family (parent and children) and are traveling on a Sunday then you can get "Sunday Funday" tickets for AU$2.50 each, valid all day on all forms of public transport, see http://www.131500.com.au/tickets/explore) for details
I love ferries. All ferries come or go from Circular Quay. My favourite is the Mosman Bay ferry or Manly. A cheap way to view the harbour.
Quick and pleasant. Highly recommend these if you want to get to Watson Bay and Manly and other spots quickly, while enjoying the view of the harbour, bridge and opera house.
