A great way to tour the waterfront. For just $5.50 each we went aboard and enjoyed a wonderful, leisurely cruise from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour. The ferries are an inexpensive way to see Sydney and surrounds from a different vantage point, and get to your destination in a relaxed, easy fashion with great photo ops all along the way.

Do ride the ferries. We bought the transit pass that allowed us to ride all the buses, ferries and Metro - and we took advantage of that by riding as many forms of transport as we could. Ferries are large and comfortable and you get wonderful views of Sydney from tham.
Fun way to see everything.. But, don't expect any food or beverages of interest. Hey, Sydney! Wake up to this!
Do it.. Hop on and off wherever you want to visit. I've been to Sydney many times. You can't see the city and harbor in a better way than from the ferries.

Very good service. The ferries were one of the many highlights of our stay in Sydney.
We took ferries frequently and thoroughly enjoyed the experience
sydney ferries from manly to sydney. Fab just watching the world go by spent several trips going on the ferry
The Best Transport. Fantastic views on all ferry rides in this city! Cheap transport, especially if you buy a multi transport pass, that includes, ferries, buses & trains
Great economic way to travel sydney waters. I love the trips you can do around the harbour and rivers

excellent way to see Harbour. The Sydney Ferries are an excellent and economical way to see Sydney Harbour. You can get to all the best spots eg, Toronga Zoo, Darling Harbour, Manly. They run at good time intervals and are clean and tidy.
Don't miss them. The ferries are the way to go, whether as a sightseer or a visitor to Taronga, Manly, or just the North Shore for a quick look-around etc. Take the ferries!
So easy to use. It appears we were never off the ferries, get a multi ticket and you can use the ferries, and busess to your hearts content, ferries offer free Wi-fi
Great way to discover the harbour. A great and inexpensive way to discover the harbour and the surrounding areas around Sydney. Well worth a trip on these ferries.
A nice way to make a harbour trip!. An easy, cheap and comfortable way to reach different destinations.

pleasant way to travel. We caught the ferry to a friends place for dinner at Balmain East- we were on holiday and never been there before. It was easy to get to Circular Quay and everything was easy to find and organise a ticket. The trip was pleasant and a great way to see the harbour. the ferry left on time
Sydney knows how to use the waterways. Great ferry system, efficient and fast. pretty clean inside (signs everywhere that placing your feet on seats and chewing gum is prohibited inside..hehe)

Innovating Sydney ferry. Sydney Ferries ferry service has operated in Sydney harbor area for over 135 years. Ferries provide regular services to over 37 wharves, including the suburb of Manly and the city of Parramatta River. Since 2004, Sydney Ferries Corporation Corporation staff and management of current operations of Sydney Ferries. The Sydney Ferries are part of State Transit, a state enterprise service bus and ferry transport in Sydney and Newcastle. The decision was made to reform in an effort to address the growing debt and low passenger numbers in recent years.
Busy during Christmas Holidays. Took ferry to go to the zoo during the christmas vacation and it was insane. Line-ups of people. Overall good service.

The best scenic views of Sydney plus a touch of history. There can be no better way of enjoying Sydney's best than taking a ferry around the highlights of Sydney.With Sydney's choked up roads and a rail service? that you would avoid at all cost, this has to be the best way of either transport to work or as a sight-seeer.The ferries though are old - you almost feel that you have stepped back into a time machine.

nice way to see the harbour. Very dissapointed in the transport charges in Sydney. Almost $8 return from CircularQuay to go across to the other side. Most cities have a 2 hr ticket, but not Sydney. Apart form tat gripe they operate the ferry well and it was very pleasant seeing the harbour from all angles

A must do!. Ferries are not only a convenient way to get around Sydney, but they also offer a spectacular view of our city.
You might like to take a ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Beach or Taronga Zoo. I highly recommend adding both to your itinerary.
Shannon
www.urbanchicguides.com

ENJOYABLE for TOURISTS! Is it enjoyable for locals, too?. Thank goodness I am not a worker who has to use this mode of transport every day because I am sure it would lose its 'specialness' and become mundane and boring.This is an event that is enjoyed by all tourists for what it is ... an amazing way to see a fantastic city. Getting a full week 'travel pass' enabled us to explore many parts of Sydney by using ferries / buses / trains to the 'full max' and enjoy it we did.The ferry service is unique and also practical, but most of all ..... EXCITING to those who use it while they are relaxing on holiday... I live in an area that used to have many ferry services 100 years ago, but sadly due to lack of the population, and no doubt the costs, that service has completely gone... what a shame
Cheap and excellent travel. After the Hong Kong ferries, these must provide the cheapest and most fantastic sightseeing opportunities to see the area.
Sydney ferries have one flaw. They should operate much later than they do. Last stop around 5pm for some locations is just ludicrous.
A Definite must. Got the ferry from circular quay to Manly beach, $21 return for adult and child was well worth the money for the great day we had.
Easy to get around. Easy to get around. Easy to get around. Easy to get around
Very Comfy. Comfy,clean seats inside and out,and free wifi! I was pleasantly surprised:)

Excellent way to see the Sydney Harbour, Opera House, Sydney Bridge and much more. If you are staying for a few days, buy a ticket that gives you unlimited travel on the ferries, trains and buses for a week and you can hop on and hop off the Sydney Ferries without the hassle of buying tickets for each journey. Money well spent. This includes the Manly Ferry, which is a 1/2 day trip.The ferries take you all around the harbour and this is the best way to see Sydney, day or night
Great service.. Great service always on time, take you to all the place in and around Sydney.

Sydney Ferry ride to Manly, Zoo, Darling Harbour. For Travellers to Sydney, if you have enough time, be sure to plan a Ferry Trip. You'll see amazing views from Sydney Harbour. Firstly you'll cruise out fo Circular Quay, which is the main Ferry Station. Immediately you'll have spectacular views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, and all the surrounding harbour . Cruising to Manly is an iconic trip, and a great and cheap way to see surrounding bays and harbour beaches of Sydney. You can also marvel at some of the beautiful harbour frontage houses.If you go to Manly it will cruise east towards The Heads, which are the cliff edges at each side of the entrance to Sydney Harbour from the Ocean. North Heads are the Manly side , and the South Head is Watsons Bay.At Manly you can walk up the mall to Manly Beach, shop, and visit nice restaurants.You'll also get so see plenty of other harbour craft, often sail boats and other ferries cruising around. Its a very relaxing way to take in the grandeur of Sydney Harbour, which is one of the most beautiful harbours in the world.A Ferry ride to the Zoo is quicker than the Ferry ride to Manly, but also a nice way to see the Harbour is you have only a little time, however the Zoo is another amazing day trip, and you'd could really spend an entire day there.There are lots of other Ferry Trip, like to Darling Harbour, and you '' cruise past theh Opera House and directly under the Sydney Harbour Bridge. This is a quick trip also, and it keeps you on the city side of the Harbour, At Darling Harbour, theres many restaurants surronding a lovely bay, shopping, gardens and water features.

Great way to get around.. On a clear day this is the best way to travel. Did an early morning trip into the city from Homebush Bay and the obligatory trip to Manly. Cruising down the Parramatta River is far more pleasant than contending with peak hour traffic either on the roads or the train and of course, the views here and when crossing the harbour to Manly are fantastic!
Great way to see Sydney. A lovely way to see Sydney's sights by water - Bridge, Opera House, Manly and it's gets you from A to B too!

Buy a pass and save money. We were in Sydney for six days and bought a 7-day transit ticket for $51.00. That gave us unlimited access to all of the ferries and the buses. Cheap and efficient way to get around Sydney, and riding the various ferries gives a full harbour tour -- no need to book special harbour tours!

Grab a ferry and get out on the Harbour. Whether it's a trip along the river to Parramatta or Homebush and Sydney Olympic Park, or under the Bridge to Birchgrove and Balmain or across the Harbour to Manly or the Zoo. A trip to Sydney is not complete until you get out on the water and relish in the views of stunning Sydney waterside.
Do them allll !!!!!!!!!!!. If you can don't go at peak times as this is a Very busy travel network !!!!!!!! but is a great way to get about !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Awesome public transport!. We had bought a week long metro pass (subway/trains) and were amazed and excited to find out that the same pass allowed us to use the ferries! What a deal! The ferries are a great way to get around the city, they are clean and quick.

cheap way to see the waterfront and attractions.. you can buy an all day ferry pass for $21 and see all the waterfront attractions. Very easy to use the ferry system. The boats are clean and reasonably comfortable
Nice n Budget way to see the Sydney Harbour Bridge. It cost $2 for one way, but you can see the bridge in the closer and nicer view.
Relax the day away!. There are sooo many choices of where to get on and off.A weekly ticket will give you several options.Be sure to go to Manley Island!

Sydney from the water. Sydney is even more beautiful from the water. Take your choice of all the commuter ferries and their different destinations and get to know Sydney from the water. Also, take an evening one and check out the city at night...awesome
Great way to see the harbor. Much cheaper than a harbor cruise...get the ferry to Manly and Watsons Bay and you get a great view of Sydney from the harbor

Great transport. Went to Sydney for the weekend and had to catch the Manly Ferry. I was very impressed very clean and comfortable. The service is very reliable and cheap compared to a taxi from Manly to the airport. The facilities around the Manly Ferry Terminal and Circular Quay are very good, clean and well thought out.
Very expensive. To go to darling harbour from Kirribilli cost $22 It would be very difficult if you were a overseas visitor on a budget and with not much English!

A Relaxing timeout. To get a good idea of the layout of Sydney travelling by ferry is a good way to go. Get a ten trip ticket and you can get to all different parts. There are some nice pubs/clubs to hop off the ferry and have lunch at.

Get and Inexpensive way to get Around Sydney. The Aussies really have their Ferry system down. They are a safe, fun and inexpensive way to get around Sydney. They depart regularly and are much less than a taxi ride. The added benefits are that you will have a great vantage point to look back on Sydney....so bring your camera!

Very relaxing. We purchased a pass which gave us unlimited travel on buses, trains and ferries so did a fair bit of getting around on these. Great value and easy to jump on and off whenever you like, we went and saw all of the attractions along the harbour. We also purchase a monorail and light rail pass which made all of our travel super cheap. Do your homework before you go and you will save heaps this way

good way to get around. The Sydney ferries are a good way to see Sydney,if you want to go under the Harbour bridge,venture to Manly, Go to the zoo, or just see Sydney from the water.Get to see the three nuns from a different angle.Catch a ferry to North shore and walk back over the bridge.
good value. buy a "Myticket" for a week and get unlimited travel on ferries, buses and trains, well worth it.
Easy Transport Options. Easy and relaxing way to travel around Sydney's Harbour.

Sydney Harbour Ferries. This is the cheapest and most hassle free way to see Sydney Harbour. Ferries run frequently to numerous points around the harbour. Best is the Manly ferry-it goes right up to the Heads and is about the longest ride. Manly boasts a variety of cafes and restaurants.

Sydney Ferries are an importrant part of our transport system. As well as being an intergral part of our transport systme Sdyney ferries provide hours of fun for tourist and visitors to Sydney. On some of the ferryies food is available and most have restrooms. The ferries are very crowded during peak hours during the week. This a relaxing way to travel in a very busy city.

Best way to see sydney. We always use the Sydney ferries to get around to the diffrent parts of the city. They are a lot cheaper than using the captain cook tourist ferries. The ferries are clean and always on time! As a sailor of 23 years it amazes me on how fast they entrer the quays and embark and disembark the passengers. My only fault is why do the ferrys stop running from watson bay so early in the afternoon? The fact that this ferry is always packed show that there is a demand for a later service.

Stress free & on time travel. Recent business trip required travel from Darling harbour to Circular Quay each day. Day 1 we took the train and coming from a city that has no hustle and bustle, found the train overcrowded.That afternoon and for the next 3 days we took the 30 minute Ferry journey each day. Was a splendid way to wind down after a hectic day, with the added bonus of getting to see some of the sights of sydney from a totally different perspective.Ferries ran as scheduled.

A fantastic way to get about in Sydney.. Sydney Ferries is an attraction in itself, as well as a regular efficient service that calls at many of the bays and harbours around Sydney. Tickets can be bought at many outlets (including little supermarkets) or failing that, just board the Ferry into Circular Quay or Darling Harbour and pay as you leave. The Ferry maps and timetables are clear and well placed, the ships are clean well fitted and comfortable. The larger Ferries, ie to Manley - which involve a longer spell on the water sell refreshments and meals.Some of the views around Sydney, can only be seen from the water, and this is the most relaxing and enjoyable way to do it.
Must do for all visitors. You can get to many of Sydneys attractions using the ferries that are freuent and very convenient

Great Rides. We stayed 1 week in Sydney and decided to buy the MyMulti1 bus/train/tram/ferry ticket so we are able to use the Sydney Ferries several times. We took the Ferry to go to Manly, Olympic Park, Luna Park, and Parramata. Ferry are always on time.

Nothing like it for travel if you like the water!. Easy to get on and off (must pay each way) Tickets at Circular Quay outside each destination. All wharfs are numbered and show you indicators of where you go to and stops along the way. Can do short ones under the bridge, do a walk and return by train over the bridge or by ferry again. Go to Watson's bay,eat a great meal at the waterfront and go for a scenic walk to The South Head and back and then come back to Circular Quay and there are buses and trains to take you home/hotel. The free bus shuttle runs there if you have a mile to go to your hotel.It follows a square route, but you can hop off and go the few streets to your hotel, or stop and eat at restaurants,etc. Ferries run frequently and timetables are posted outside or there for you to pick up to know when you can plan to return without a long wait.

Best Value. We were lucky we had a very lively knowledgeable experienced lady guide in this ferry tour. Also it was Australia Day ( like July 4) and the Sydney water was full of different old and new boats, different sail boats and a big Cruise ship.The guide happily described all the structures as we pass thru them, describing and naming each nook and cranny in the harbor including WW II structures, company buildings, celebrity houses and apartments, male nudist beach camp,and almost all the icons of Sydney.Ferry was clean, well maintained with comfortable chairs and tables. Lower deck is of course covered (if it rains), and the upper deck has the middle part also covered and the rest open for better viewing.Tea with a box of cookies is served. A very enjoyable experience with good value.
Great transport. Excellent selection of ferrys to explore this city!

A Wonderful Way To Relax and Be Inspired By the Magnificent Scenery. There are so many ferry trips to take. Not one will disappoint you. The old wooden, green and yellow ferries are truly charming and provide a wonderful sense of nostalgia. Sydney ferries terminate at Circular Quay and, for a reasonable price, can provide the visitor amazing views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, The Opera House, the high-rise buildings of the Central Business District and North Sydney, the Botanical Gardens, Luna Park and waterfront homes that are unquestionably stunning. In addition to the older fleet of wooden ferries, there are the newer 'rivercats' - sleeker boats with more shallow hulls- that travel up the Parramatta River. They are great if you don't intend to disembark. If a ferry plus beach experience is for you, taking the Many Ferry is an absolute must. Stunning harbour views, soft sand, waves, a walk along the beach and great seafood awaits you!

The only way to travel. I have lived in Sydney for 30 years, and still love ferry travel. We often just catch any ferry and get off at any stop and walk to the next stop and then catch the next ferry to someone else and .......

The best (and cheapest) ferry ride in the world. We had a seniors day pass costing a couple of dollars which works on all the public transport and took the ferry from Circular Quay to Pyrmont. We didn't know what to expect, just wanted to get back to the place we were staying.The trip is unbelievable and worth ten times the price. You have wonderful photo opportunties as you zig zag across the harbour, past the opera house and under the bridge.Fantastic
Easy travelling. Quick, on time & comfortable, a great way to see Sydney!
DId exactly that they were supposed to do. On time , Clean , efficient., good vaklue for Australia . A pleasure to use .
Great. Wonderful way to see the harbour - hop on hop off tickets are best value.
Women ferry attendents. We caught the Ferry From Circular Quey to Watsons Bay, what a great way to see the Harbour, the women ferry attendents were amazingly good at their jobs.
Cheap Alternative to a tour. Why pay $20 to do a Harbour cruise when for about $7 you can take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manyle and see even more!You can even take the Cat to Parramatta.

Excelent value. As we were in Sydney for a week, we bought a 'week' ticket which covered us for ferries, local buses and trains. This was good value as we used the ferries and buses quite a bit. Watson's Bay was beautiful, Paramatta River also, and many other bays. Well worth it if you're there long.
Good Fun and Reasonable Prices. Great way to see the sites around Sydney harbour. Very economical. Ticket machine could be simplified though, it is designed for frequent users, not visitors
best transport. great way to get to know the harbour - cheap and regular

Best way to view Sydney. A ferry trip to Manly, Watson Bay, Mosman or any of the locations on the ferry routes is a good way to explore Sydney and get close-up photo opportunities at the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Check the timetable in advance so you don't need to wait.
Efficient ferry rides. Took ferry from Darling Harbor to Sydney Cove and return. Ferry was on time - and a great scenic ride.

A wonderful way to see the area. We paid for a day ticket for the ferries and spent the day enjoying the sights and sounds of the riverways. Manly is a great place to visit, as is Darling Harbour. We really enjoyed the rides and the day ticket was good value for money.
Very good.. On time, courteous staff, well kept boats. No problems at all here.

Very efficient and delightful way to get around. Fun way to get around the Sydney harbor bypassing cars/traffic. Prices not bad - cheap compared to taxi or parking fees, and buying a pass helps. Always ran on time in our experience.

Classic Sydney at its best. I love Sydney's ferries. For all the politics and problems (privatisation, cuts to services, etc), I still rate the ferries as one of the best things in Sydney. I especially love the 'First Fleet' ferries (named after the boat of the First Fleet), but the Manly ferries and those that go to Mosman Bay are also charming. My favourite routes are: Darling Harbour in the early evening as the lights of the city sparkle over the water; Manly -- a great trip at any time; Mosman Bay/Cremorne, which is probably the prettiest trip on the Harbour; and Neutral Bay for a quick pretty trip. Highly recommended to anyone visiting Sydney, and locals too!!!
Luna Park & Milson's Point. Great to see kids enjoying the same rides I did 50 years ago! So spewcial to see the Opera House and the Harbour from different angles - and the Tall ships!

Great way to get around the city/environs quickly. Beats taking a taxi or walking if you are going from place to place around the city. They will take you to Manly Beach, Darling Harbour and The Rocks. Will also take you to theOlympic Park
Fast and efficient. We took the ferry to Watsons Bay..very economical,fast and efficient for traveling around Sydney..we got to seee the sights as well
Hassle Free.. The two rides we took were both hassle free and on time.
Sydney Ferries - the best way to see Sydney. Ticketing is easy and relatively inexpensive - less than $6 for a single ticket.
Great way to explore Sydney. The Sydney Ferries are the best way to see Sydney from the water and to explore the nearby attractions. The ferries are cheap to use and very frequent.
Great wet weather trip. Great in wet weather day ticket will allow to travel numerous stops on the harbour as well as a river trip to Parramatta
Time filler. Needing something to do that's cheap.? Take a ferry ride. Just being on the water on Sydney Harbour discovering another little inlet.
The way to see the harbor. Best of these to see harbor is one to Manly. This goes out to mouth of harbor and back. Spend a few hours in Manly, a cool beach town which is easily walkable.
Travel with the locals. Travel easily and comfortably around Sydney Harbour with these ferries. They are simply easy, comfortable, and convenient.

Best way to see Sydney. Even if you are not intending to take a ferry to a particular destination for a purpose, simply getting on one on a fine day and enjoying the ride and scenery is well worth it. Local seniors with appropriate ID can generally get a $2.50 pass which allows all day travel on buses, trains and ferries so this is a very good bargain. But, given its spectacular setting, Sydney can be well appreciated from the water. A trip to the zoo or Manly or up the river on the river cat, is a great way to spend a day and also, keep clear of Sydney's traffic!

Best ferries in the world, Great, sensational, affordable way to travel in Sydney. a great way to travel in Sydney. A very well organized system of ferries to take the commuters and the tourists to the suburbs around the Sydney Harbor. a great way to travel, it makes me feel like I am part of the Harbor

best rides in the world. Well organized, great fun, and useful too when you need to get to a Sydney suburb that has a ferry stop. Whenever possible I catch a ferry, it makes me feel part of the Harbor
reliable, clean and pleasant. Buy a 3 or 7 day pass at the airport to cover airport link train and all public transport on buses, trains and ferries for your stay.
Inexpensive and a delight to use.. Upon returning from an outing to the Blue Mountains, we returned to Sydney using the Captain Cook Ferry. The crew and the ship are very satisfactory.
a true Sydney experience. loved the experience of a Sydney Ferry, went to Paramatta and to Manly!
Fantastic cheap way to see Sydney. Cheap yet fun and relaxing touring around the harbour without the cost of a commercial vessel.

So easy to get around. We purchased a 7 day pass to travel on all the ferries, trains, and buses in Sydney. It was the best thing we purchased all week.
Best bargain. Traveling around on the ferries was so easy and enjoyable. Loved it.
Best Value Harbour Cruise. I take the ferry with the kids - cheap and easy cruise. I'd take it to Manly and have a look.

Cheap way to travel and great views.. We bought the $21 travel day pass. This pass allowed us to travel on train, bus and ferries for the whole day. Good value and we took full advantage. These passes can be purchased at any railway station.

What a lovely way to relax and enjoy the view.. We caught one of the lovely ferrys from Circular Quay, to Darling Harbour, after wandering through the Rocks Market. It was a warm day, and we enjoyed the breeze, the view, and the fact that we all travelled (4 of us) for under $15.We were planning to head to the Hard Rock Cafe, and asked the gentleman who was casting on and off, where we should be hopping off. He was very, very helpful, and came back to us during our trip with a map and more information. All the staff were very friendly and it really was a lovely afternoon.I would say that a trip is a "must do" on your trip to Sydney. Hubby would have been happy to just sit on the ferry and do laps of the harbour.

Best (and cheapest!) way to enjoy the harbour. Sydney Ferries may look old and not very impressive but these are the best way to visit some of the best sites Sydney has to offer and take in the beautiful harbour. If you want a short ride take the ferry from Circular Quay to Luna Park (Milsons Point) - a small theme park with some of the best views and Kirribilli village with its multicuisine restaurants. Another good trip is from Circular Quay to Manly- a lovely seaside suburb with great surfing and cool restaurants and pubs.
don't pay for an expensive harbour cruise - just take a ferry!. clean, friendly service (how can they be cranky when they have the best job in sydney), amazing views and always on time.

Fantastic trip to Circular Quay from Watsons Bay. Great trip on the harbour via Rose Bay. Ferries run regularly and seniors can get a pass for all day on all public transport including the iconic ferries for only $2.50
Need New Ones. Great service but could be better. Needs more seats outside.

A Sydney Harbour cruise bargain!. For the visitor to Sydney, the ferries are an absolute gem. If you buy a multizone pass you can ride on any Sydney Ferry you choose and what a wonderful experience it is. Of course there are loads of cruise options (including dining and shows etc) but if you have the time, sit back and take in the views of this wonderful harbour plus you can hop on/hop off as you fancy!

Loved the ferries. A great, inexpensive and efficient way to travel. We particularly liked the journey from Sydney Harbour to Darling Harbour. The Ferry travels under the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Gaze back and get stunning views of the Bridge and Opera House. A busy, exciting river.

Great way to travel and also see this Harbour city from the water.. A must for all locals and visitors alike, but remember to carry a jacket or cardigan as it can get a bit cool at times on the harbour. We decided to sightsee on a beautiful summer Sunday so we took the trip up the Parramatta River on the Rivercat. After shopping and lunch we took another Rivercat in to Circular Quay and walked around the Quay, Bennelong Point and the Opera House and the Rocks before returning to the Quay for afternoon tea at City Extra and then taking the Rivercat home. We arrived home sated and not stressed with having to fight traffic or other travellers at the bus stops. Recommend such an excursion and savouring the many delights of travelling on the Sydney Ferries. We have also enjoyed on other excursions various trips and commute on the Taronga Zoo, Manly ferries and Cats.
Just SO much to see on the lovely Harbour. Loved nearly everything. Only complaint would be the long walk from where the Ferry dropped us off ,to Harbourside Darling Harbour[ & it was raining]
A great form of transport. We took the Sydney Ferries to Taronga Zoo and Luna Park. They were punctual, clean and comfortable. There was also free wi-fi on the ferries we were on!
Best way to travel in Sydney. Every minute spent on a ferry is just turning from side to side to see more amazing sights I would rather take the ferry in Sydney than any other form of transportation.
Various ferries. Great way to hop on and off to see many parts of Sydney and suburbs.

Great way to get about. Use the ferries to get around or simply to enjoy the whole harbour experience. A cheap way to spend a few ours is simply to ride the ferries. Avoid rush hours however as they are packed with commuters.

A local legend. You cannot visit Sydney and not take a trip on the ferries.These little workhorses are brilliant... what a way to travel, much better than the bus or train.Every journey is an adventure. The staff are mostly good humoured and the whole operation is very slick.Who wouldn't be amazed and enchanted on a Au$5 trip when you get to see the harbour with the Bridge, docks and Opera House up close and personal?
Great value and the easiest way to see Sydney from the water.. We always but an 8 day pass which gives unlimited travel on ferries, buses & trains in and around Sydney. Superb value.

Great way to get around. We found this a great way to get around and see Sydney. We went on 6 ferry rides all up in 3 days. We had the multi tickets so we could use any of the public transport all day. It makes it very ecomonical. The ferries are great to ride on and relax while taking in the views.
Superb. Took a trip out to Watson's Bay and the ferry was very fast and economical

Sydney Harbour. a great way to take in the scenes of this great harbour proving lots of opportunity to capture some fantasic photos...AND suggest a ferry from Circulay Quay across to Manly then stroll down the esplanade to Manly Beach and then take the ferry back to Circular Quay after having some fish and chips while sitting on the beach ..the trip will take about an hour each way
Ride the Harbour. What's not to like? Far better to relax and unwind on the harbour than to join the madness on the roads into the city.

a truly special way to see sydney. not only can you get around places, you can thoroughly enjoy the time on the ferries. My kids loved it, whether popping over to see mosman and the zoo, or heading to Balmain to find a bar. The ferries get you to plenty of desirable places and are good fun.
Sydney Ferries. The ferry service provides an excellent way to see most all aspects of the harbour and surrounding areas (Manly) without paying for a tour. Buy an all day pass and cruise everywhere!
A great way to see the city. A cheap and scenic way to see the city. Take a ferry over to Taronga Zoo, or to Manly, for some stunning views.
ferries. they did the job i thought, they werent to bad. they are a fast way to the zoo and im sure other places, i only went on them a few times.
A must when visiting Sydney.. A journey from Sydney city to Manly or any of the other harbour suburbs is a must when visiting Sydney. A very inexpensive outing which showcases our beauiful harbour.

Highlight of Sydney. Getting around by the Sydny Ferries is a most enjoyable way to explore the various harbourside suburbs. For Seniors it is the best value. $2.50 all day and you can use any sydney Ferry, bus and/or train. Can't beat it for value.

Ferry Good Way To See Sydney. Really this is the 'only' way to see Sydney and it's harbour scenery, hop aboard the inexpensive familiar green and yellow ferries that ply the harbour all day every few minutes. You will get some marvellous photo opportunities along the way starting with the Opera House The Harbour Bridge, Manly, etc. You can hop off and back on when you wish to linger at one of the stops along the way. Quite an experience and one you won't forget in a while, an absolute must-do when in Sydney. The same as the Star Ferry in Hong Kong but with arguably better views.

The best way to tour the harbour!. If you`re visiting Sydney, get yourself a transit pass and make use of the Sydney Ferries. This is an ideal way to get around and see the harbour while you`re at it.

Great transport. Great way to see the city and harbour. Lots of chances to take pics of Bridge and Opera House. Didnt need to pay for expensive harbour cruise. Bought week pass good for ferries, train and bus.
a must visit. take a ferry and have fun around Sidney! thay are clean,fast and offer the best way to arrive at Zoo or beaches around!
Captian Cook ferries a must. Great price and excellent view of both Harbours - went to Taronga Zoo which was awesome.
Fun, cheap, picturesque. I love to just find a ferry and take it wherever it goes. Sydney Harbour is beautiful!

Manly to Sydney Harbour. The ferry ride from Manly takes you right to the Opera House. Great photo ops of it as well as the Harbour Bridge. The coastline was also a beautiful sight to see during this 30 minute ride!

The way to see everything.. Very busy and bustling but wonderful way to get about. Take one to Watson's Bay and eat at Doyles on the beach. Tickets can be used on buses too if you request them. Ideal for getting back after last ferry from Watson's Bay.

All aboard. Perfect way to get around to see the different parts around Sydney. I took the train the first day and the helpful ticket agent sold me a $44 or so 7 day unlimited pass I could use on all trains within the first or second zones (which was fine for getting around the CBD and Bondi areas) and also all ferries. It was so worth it.The signs in Circular Quay are very clear and they have different ports depending on where you're taking your ferry to. Great way to get onto the water while someone else is driving.
Ferry to Manly worth doing. Great to see the Harbour, bridge and Opera house from. The ferry to Manly well worth it rain or shine.
Cute ferries. I love the ferries in the harbour - they are so cute and ferry everyone efficiently around the harbour - they always seem so 'right' especially in the sunshine!

Great form of public transport.. Comfy and reliable service and not very expensive. I took the River Cat on this visit but have previously used the ordinary ferries to do sight seeing and it's a great way to explore the city and see things you won't any other way.
Nice way to get around. Nice way to get around. We did the trip up the river to Parramatta. There is nothing in Parramatta when you get there but the trip is nice. A nice way to see the foreshore.

Green and Gold. A great way to see the city of Sydney and it's cheaper than a harbour cruise. Hop on and off or travel to specific locations with the wind and the sea spray in your face you'll know you're alive. Motor past the Opera House and Under the Coat-hanger (Harbour Bridge). It's the way to go.
So many nice excursions.. Sydney harbour is so nice to ride the ferry on. They are not expensive and it's good sitting outside on the ferry. Lots of interesting stops around.

What a way to get to work. I just love the ferries. Even if you are only in Sydney for a few days it's worth getting a weekly travel card so that you can get on and off ferries, buses and trains. It's fun just to go to Circular Quay and get on the next ferry out to see where it takes you
Best travel value in Sydney. We enjoyed on the ferries on Sunday, when all tickets are $2.50 for unlimited use. Best views, best air, great photos.

Good way to get around. Sydney ferries are not all equal. Some are small and not that comfortable on the less well patronised routes. The bigger ferries e.g.on the Manly-Circular Quay route
and the catamaran on the Parramatta river are the best of them. Not a bad way to get around the harbour foreshores
Ferry Me About. The Sydney ferries are one of the most wonderful activities you can do, in the world! Just buy a ticket and hop on and off. I like the McMahons Point one.

Prompt, safe ride with nice views. The ferries were on time and felt very safe. If you have done a lot of cruising, it may not be worth it to take one just to see the views, as there are many vantage points from Sydney. Nevertheless, gets you where you need to go in a timely fashion.
Good Value. Good value for money and the sights are spectacular going under the bridge was the high light for me

Catching The ferry or cat. It would have to be the most scenic part of sight seeing in Sydney, you can catch a ferrry to almost anywhere. l mainly catch the ferry if l am going to the Zoo, or too Manly. Manly is the most restful, place beaches are clean, the mall to the beach is great there are cheaper meals to the more expensive meals. All l can say when in Sydney dont miss Manly.

A good way to see the harbour. There are many expensive cruises to be had on Sydney Harbour but when we have guests from overseas we just hop on a ferry. We have taken a bus before now to Watsons Bay, had fish and chips there and then caught the ferry back to Circular Quay but of course you could catch the ferry both ways. Sometimes on the weekends they are very busy with families and in the early mornings and early evening with commuters but if you have the time catch one and admire the view.
Wifi onboard. We took the ferry to Manly. It's a great way to experience the harbor and I could send pics on Facebook as I took them. The free Wifi was much appreciated.

See the harbour on a ferry and meet the locals. I dislike organised tours for tourists.I prefer taking the means of transport locals use and share info with them.We took a ferry headed for one of the islands and did a two-hour round trip just before sunset.It perfectly met our expectations.

Best thing in Sydney. Just the best thing to do in Sydney is to get on any of the ferries at Circular Quay, you will never get tired of travelling this way.Much cheaper option of viewing the harbour than other commercial boats and just as much fun.
My travels on Sydney Ferries.. Well run, clean vessels and caring staff, good scenery. Ran on time. A bit expensive though.
A great way for visitors to view the Sydney Harbour and for regular commuters to travel to and from work each day.. The many varied ferries service Sydney Harbour right up the River to Parramatta.
Great. Neutral Bay ferry from Quay 4 was great way to see harbour in a short amount of time. We stayed on and did a round trip. Was able to see local houses, people etc.
always punctual. bought a day pass as we were planning a lot of travel for the day, ferries always punctual and a comfortable ride across the lovely sydney harbour!
Excellent views. This is great, going under the Bridge, fanstatic and arriving at Circular Quay. Everything well signposted to where to go
Sydney ferries. They offer a good reliable service at reasonable fares. Some of the fleet is ageing but they are comfortable and safe.
Dirty & foul smelling. Dirty, dusty, foul smelling, litter every where, shoe marks on seats, Felt totally unhygienic.
Excellent service. We had a great day with one of their special tickets visiting nearby places on the ferries, very efficient.
Such a right way to visit Sydney. What a good idea to visit Sydney from the sea, travelling to Manly, to WATSON'S BAY and his favourite seafood restaurants, to PARRAMATA on the river.
Ferries are the way to go. If you want to get around Sydney I would recommend the ferry system. The ferries are always on time and the prices were reasonable.
The best way to see our beautiful harbour. One of the best things you can do is take a ferry to Manly beach and back. (Make sure you get some fish and chips whilst you are there!)

Scenic way to travel around Sydney. Cheap, usually on time, with excellent views of Sydney Harbour. Slightly more expensive than travelling by train, but you do get much better views. I wouldn't recommend eating onboard (it is pretty expensive given it has a monopoly onboard) nor going to the bathroom if you can help it. Most of the ferries (if not all) go to Circular Quay which is in the middle of Sydney CBD, next to the train station and a major bus hub, so it is super easy to get do. At least one ferry ride is a must for each tourist visiting Sydney.

Hang out on the boats. Take some time for Sydney's ferries. We took the boat at different times so that we could see Sydney if different light (morning and sunset). It was a relaxing way to see the city. Also it's worth taking a trip to Manly Beach - fun fun fun.

Excellent way to see most of Sydney attractions. The ferry routes include the scenic beaches. Schedules are frequent and prompt. And for AUD20, the Mult-Bus tickets that may be bought from Newsstands in most malls allows unlimited access of most buses, trains and ferries around Sydney. And oh, there is free wi-fi on the ferries-- wonderful bonus!

Love my ferry rides in Sydney. As long as you are not riding it at the rush hours on a weekday, the ferry rides in Sydney is always enjoyable. It's one of the most beautiful harbours and the breeze really calms the mind and lifts one's spirit.
the best way to get around. travelling on the water on one of the nicest harbours in the world - what's not to like (provided it goes to a destination you want to go to!)
What a fun way to travel to work. We bought a weekly multi-trip and happily just cruised round the harbour for fun - as tourists do! Cheap and a very good experience

TAKE A QUICK TRIP. I got out to the Olympic village by ferry and then back by train .. lots to see on the water .. find a map and get to some neat areas that most tourists don't even think of getting to .. just ask the agents and they'll help get you where you want to go ,, economical way to travel around the city and burbs too!!
Average. Not always on time, not always realiable but a good way for tourists to see the harbour. Less attractive (and getting expensive) for the daily commuter.

Captain Cook's Tours. We went on a 'Coffee Cruise' around the harbour area and enjoyed the event. The cruise lasts about 2 hours and afternoon tea/coffee is served, together with a small refreshment cake package. The commentary was informative and the vessel was comfortable. A good way to see Sydney harbour from the opposite direction!
Great way to cruise the harbour and get around for little money.. The sydney ferries offer a good value harbour cruise but with out the commentary and overpriced lunch!
Best value in the world. For around $12 you can have a return trip from Sydney Harbour to Manly - about 45 minutes each way. The most spectacular trip in the world. No better value anywhere.

Take a trip. I love the ferries and at every chance I get I take a trip around the harbour to unwind and forget the daily drudgery.I get completly relaxed by the time I finish.Take your camera with you

Sight-seers Must. Very convenient ferry service to all surrounding areas. We took ferries to Manly Beach and Taronga Zoo. Ferries are reasonably priced and give you a great sense of the surrounding area. This was the first thing we did when we got into Sydney.
The Way to see Sydney. Take time to understand the routes and timetable and you will be rewarded with an unrivaled way toi see and get around Sydney.
Transport with fantastic views of Sydney Harbour. A cheap way to explore Sydney Harbour and its many attractions. A single day ticket can be used on all the ferries

Cheap way to see the city. We got the ferry from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay, needed to get to Opera House in time for dinner. A cheap, convenient and well worth the views trip. Compared to the touristy water taxi it was half the price!

sydney ferries. just hope on and off different ferries, sit down and enjoy the views of Sydney harbour and surrounds from the water. A cheaper alternative to an organised harbour cruise, especially if you buy a day transport ticket for 20 A$ per adult which lets you also travel on buses and most trains.
Cant beat the Ferry!. Travelled on the Ferries a few times now and always feel nostalgic and proud to be Aussie!
Great views. Cheap way to see the Sydney skyline. Just take a ferry or water taxi and skip the more expensive ones.

Excellent value. This mode of transport is very good for around the harbors in Sydney, Go to Watsons Bay their is a wonderful fish restaurant their on the beach. Book so you get a good table in the front close to the beach.

The best show in town.. Fight your way on to the ferry---it's such a thrill to round the corner from Darling Harbour and see the Bridge and the Opera House.
Weekdays are better, and the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay is a great trip.
Unmissable. Grab a ferry - any ferry. A great way to chill-out if in sydney for a short stay

Inexpensive and reliable. Sydney Ferries are great! They are most likely going to be privatised soon so whether that impacts on service or pricing is unknown. The ferry from Parramatta toi the city is a great way to get to the city from the capital of the Western suburbs. The Manly ferry is a quick and pleasant way to get to the beaches of Manly and the trips are more than just a means to an end, they are part of the holiday experience.

Sydney Ferries best way to see Sydney Harbour & 18'Skiff spectator ferry best of all. Sydney ferries are the best way to see Sydney's incomparably beautiful harbour. You can get on any ferry wharf and go to Circular Quay and then just keep getting on ferries and coming back to the Quay. The ones not to be missed are the Manly Ferry, the Rose and Double Bay ferries, the Taronga ferry, the Mosman ferry. Taronga Park zoo must be the most stunning in the world. You find yourself gazing at a giraffe with a big blue harbour backdrop. The best value of all is on Sundays during the 18foot skiff racing season between October and the end of February. 18 foot skiffs are known as the Formula One of sailing. The fastest thing on the water under sail and the hardest thing in the world to sail. If there's a bit of wind, the fleet flies. Really flies. There are about 20 sponsored boats, each sailed by 3 impossibly fit, way too good-looking young men, out on harnesses, risking their lives. The spectator ferry leaves Double Bay wharf at 2.15 (tickets are $15 from the Club which is on the wharf). There is a bookmaker on board (a century old tradition) so you can have a light-hearted bet on the boat you like the look of. For your fifteen bucks you get a stunning view of Sydney's amazing harbour for about 2 hours and a ringside seat at the most exciting sailing in the world. Even a commentator to tell you what's going on.
Great way to travel. These ferries are well run and frequent. Lots of info at Circular Quay to show you which ferry to take. Take a minute to study the map and you will be using them like buses. !
Fine public transport. A great way to get around and see the harbour without paying for expensive tours. Frequent services from Circular Quay, reasonably priced, and even cheaper on a Sunday

Where else can you see this much beauty for so little?. The Sydney Ferries are perhaps the best value boat ride you'll ever take. For the price of a cafe meal you can board an historic boat and enjoy the glorious Sydney harbour. These ferries are not a 'tourist attraction' (although they are deservedly popular with tourists) but a necessary part of the public transport system in a city built around a harbour. Residents and regular visitors divide clearly into those with a long term love affair with these glorious vessels and those that just don't get it. We still have friends sneer at us when we announce that we plan to spend the day on the ferries, but on a clear day, no matter what the season, there a few things more enjoyable that a few hours chugging around the harbour. Highly recommended as a low cost tourist activity with particular appeal for kids. If you live in Sydney and you've never been out on a ferry then give it a go. You might just be surprised.

A great way to explore Sydney Harbour. We caught pretty much all the ferries except for one. They are all great, with something exciting to see on all the routes. In particular I would recommend the Mossman Bay, Manly, and Watsons Bay ferries. Also make sure to take at least one ferry that goes under the bridge such as the Paramatta Rivercat or Darling Harbour to Circular Quay ferry. It can get pretty breezy and cold on the outside decks, so keep that in mind when looking for a seat.

Taranga Zoo. We went across on the ferry for the opening of the Zoo at 10am.It was a great short journey.The frequency of the ferries was great.Taranga Zoo has the most wonderful view of Sydney Harbour.
Just do it.. Loved the ferry terminal and the fact that you can just get on and go anywhere.

If you are short of time... If you have a short stay in Sydney, just catch one to Neutral Bay and back or Mosman and back. It is a great way to have a sandwich and enjoy the views with the harbour cruise prices... Depart wharf 4.

Fantastic views while you travel to your destination. Loved the entire experience of the very efficient ferries, reasonable costs and the fantastic views. Got to travel to Manly if only for the 360 degree views of bits of the harbour you cant see from Circular Quay.
Darling Harbour. Must see and do. Ferries take you right under the bridge and past Luna Park, great way to get around.
Best View from the Ferry. It would be the best seat of the house to see Sydney Harbour. Opera House and the Bridge.

Great way to see the waterways of Sydney!. We bought a daypass that entitled us to unlimited travel on the train, bus & ferry! Went up to Parramatta on the Rivercat, & checked out the Balmain & Neutral Bay ferries.
Totally enjoyed the day!
Go exploring. The ferries are fun to take, reasonable in price and allow you to see areas of Sydney easily.
Waterborne Millionaire for a Day.. The best and most satisfying way to visit places like Balmain, Parramatta, Mosman, Watsons Bay, the Taronga Park Zoo and Manly.
Great, relaxing ride with a view. We took the ferry from Olympic Park to Darling Harbour. Wow what a beautiful ride. Very affordable, relaxing, with incredible views of Sydney waterways and harbours.
The Best!. Loved the fact that you could go anywhere in them for a nominal price. They leave every half hour which was great.

Relaxing way to take in unique views of Sydney Harbour and surrounds. That's exactly it in a nutshell. A trip on a Sydney Ferry is just so lovely and relaxing and you will get to see parts of Sydney from the ferry that you will never see by road or air. The atmosphere on a Sydney Ferry is just so relaxing. There are many trips available; the visit to Manly and to Taronga Zoo are probably the most popular but going up river to Parramatta (about 1 hour from Circular Quay) is a delightful way to spend a couple of hours (there and back) before heading back into Circular Quay area for ice-cream, wine, food, other attractions or all things put together and more! There are also trips to Watson's Bay (via Rose Bay) amongst many, many others. On the trip up river to Parramatta you may get lucky and see some amazing kingfishers (brightly coloured bluey/green Australian native bird) in the mangroves amongst other natural delights; and the incredible apartments/micro cities being built and developed along the river at various intervals. The old ferries take you through a time machine back to the years when Sydney was a booming industrial metropolis with the harbour being the focus for Sydney's shipping industry; in the days when the now modernised and developed finger wharves serviced the industrial needs of the city. When men wore dress hats with their cuffed-pant, wide lapelled suits and women wore gloves; matching handbags and shoes ... and hats. Enjoy the nostalgia, a totally different view of Sydney and a relaxing trip on the water.

Easy and Inexpensive. From Circular Quay, almost everything is accessible to you by foot, train, bus or ferry. The ferries are very convenient (multiple leave/arrive each hour), fun to ride and relatively inexpensive. The view of Sydney from the harbor is also a must see and probably worth a ferry trip on its own.
Good Veiws from the water. A really cheap way of getting great veiws of the harbour from the water

Great way to explore. Get the day pass and ride as many ferries as you like. Take the north shore route to visit little coves and points such as Cremorne, the bigger catamarans to explore the southern shore bays such as Watson's Bay, the River Cat to go up to Parramatta, or best of all, the Manly Ferry.

Spend a day on the water.. The ferries go all over the harbour----if it's a sunny day you can cruise to different points, have breakfast, lunch or dinner and cruise a different way home. The evening trips show a brightly lit harbour foreshore.

Better Option Than Tourist "Tours". If you are visiting Sydney I would highly recommend taking a harbour cruise....but it is much cheaper to take one of the commuter ferries than to take a tourist "tour" type of cruise. They go basically the same place and offer the same views. Be sure to save the $$$ and just take a local water taxi/ferry.Overall, be sure to at least get on a cruise!
The nicest way to travel.. I always use the ferries when I'm in Sydney. When you travel at night and see the quay and Opera House all lit up it takes your breath away.
Sydney. Excellent service, but it is part of the publice transport system and that always could improve. Considering the vast number of people it transports, does very well.
Your own personal cruise. Perfect way to get around the Harbour. Cheap and fun.

Don't forget your ITouch--they have WIFI!!!. The ferries are a great way to get around the entire area. You can go to the beach at Manly or to dinner at Watson's Bay or two dozens of other locations. They are clean, fast, run good understandable schedules, and have convenient boarding locations.

Great way to see Sydney Harbour. If you can, buy a weekly ticket that permits access to ferries/buses and limited underground in Sydney. It is a very economical way to get around the city and to the beaches

See Sydney from on the harbour. Ferries leave from circular quay all day and some into the night you will find many brochures around the Quay showing times and all the trips they do the ferries will take you to the Sydney Zoo in fact there are ferries to anywhere around the harbourLooking from the ferry deck is magical and it is a great day out to stop somewhere for lunch along the way then back again on the ferries for home

A great way to travel & enjoy the sights. We spent most of out time hopping on & off the ferries. It was certainly a much cheaper way to see the sights than the organised Harbour cruises. We bought a 4 day pass giving us unlimited travel on trains & ferries so you didn't have to worry about cost all the time. A great way to see Sydney & the beaches.
cheap travel. use the public ferrys as a lot cheaper than the ones laid on for the tourists
A great way to travel and quite frequent too.. You could buy your attractions tickets for Lunar park, Taronga zoo etc from the ferry ticket booth. That way you get a discount tto.
Great way to see the harbour. Genuine public transport ferries, so avoid peak hour if you are a tourist. Gets you to some great locations around the harbour with spectacular views.
Do it!. Catching a ferry on Sydney's beautiful harbour is a must. It doesn't really matter where you go, just go!

They are efficient. The ferries are a great way to get around and go as far up as Parramatta, the trip is a nice one and takes you from harbour to river and some lovely houses are to be seen on the way. Other ferries go to the north shore and Taronga zoo and are a great way to get about especially if the weather is good.

Love Sydney Harbour and the Sydney Ferries. An inexpensive way to see Sydney Harbour is by Ferry. You can get an all day pass for about $22 which allows you unlimited travel on Sydney ferries, trains and buses. The best boat trip in the world is the 30 minute trip on the ferry from Circular Quay Sydney to Manly. I also suggest if you have the time to do the 20 minute trip to Watson's Bay or a round trip to Mosman and Cremorne and back(stay on the ferry and enjoy the views). Sit outside on fine days and enjoy the weather and views.

From city to beach. How can you beat a trip on the world's greatest harbour? The ferry from Circular Quay - right next to the Bridge- takes just over half an hour to go up the harbour, across the Heads (the opening to the sea) and into Many Cove. Disembark and walk along the Corso from the harbour to the ocean beach. Manly is one of Sydney's great surfing beaches. Continue around the walkway to the right and you will follow the coastline to Cabbage Tree Bay (Shelly Beach) where the best snorkling in Sydney can be found. Where else can you snorkle, swim, sunbake and have lunch with a glass of wine right on the beach? The walk to Shelly takes about 20 minutes and is well worth it. So, grab your swimmers, towel and snorkling gear and catch the ferry to Manly.

Harbour ferries.. These are the best experience of a lifetime. Children must have a ride and see our spectacular city highlights and foreshores if visiting. You never know when a dolphin or whale many just swim past. You'll be in awe.

NYE Gala is fantastic!. We just did the show which was great, had dinner elsewhere, and hung out till the fireworks without being at the after party. The gala was so much fun, a great host even though I am sure I missed most of his humor, the Tenors, Bass, and Soprano's sang with passion, and the interior of the Opera house in the auditorium did not feel like a huge place like say the Met, but from my humble opinion felt more like a small club like Birdland or the Blue Note.
A masterpiece. Watching the ferries coming in and out of Circular Quay is a mesmerising display of timing and skill.
Great way to travel. The ferries go all over the harbour and river, so it's a great way to travel. Really enjoyed the ride to Parramatta, just check that the tides are with you!
great way to get around. I took the Manly ferry and it was a great trip and not expensive. Its quiet comfortable and the ourside viewing areas and seats are great when the sun is shining.

the best, cheap tour!. The ferries provide the best and inexpensive tour of the Harbour. Visitors can catch the manly ferry and go all the way up the harbour and back. Or return to the CBD on the bus via the Spit Bridge and cross the Harbour Bridge as well!
Iconic AND Functional. Classic green and gold passenger ferries run timely to almost every destination you'll want to visit in Sydney.

Why take a private company?. Actually, everything is said about the ferrys already. It is an awesome way to see Sydney and especially if you need to get around by bus/train too, it gets incredibly cheap when you take the MyMulti tickets. I don't see the point of taking any of those fast boats, etc. as it is a punctual service with the possibility to take plenty of pictures while enjoying the sun.So far, we used it to get to Manly and to Darling Harbour. The trip to Darling Harbour is excellent as you can get pictures of the harbour bridge with the Opera house in the background and also you can get out at Milsons Point(Luna Park), Balmain and McMahons point. Totally worth it! The free wifi doesn't work very good for me, after all, but whatever, why bother using your phone when you have these astonishing views!
The only way to go !. Just the best way to see the harbour and surrounds & such good value
attractive and convenient. The ferries are a great and convenient way to get around - it is like a mini cruise wherever you go. Always great views.
Always worth the money. The trip out to Watson's Bay for Doyle's fish and chips or the Manly Ferry to the beach are a must do

To have a different view. Moving by ferries is an efficient and absolutely cheap way to visit Sydney.It's really nice especially if you travel with children and to have the best views of Sydney Opera House. You can board the ferry in Darling Harbour and then arrive to the Opera House. During the journey you can have a stop at he famous Luna Park. It is really nice. Your trip will be nice even in winter time. Don't worry, you can sit inside and have the same views.

Excellent Harbour Views. Buy a day or multi day ferry ticket.Take a ferry ride west of the harbour bridge to Darling Harbour and Balmain etcMany ferry routes east of the bridge ~ Manly Mosman Taronga Zoo and Watsons Bay. All provide excellent views.Remember your camera
Great way to travel. You get to see the beautiful parts of Sydney harbour to different locations including Taronga Zoo.
Clean and efficient. Good, economical way to travel around Sydney Harbor and surrounding area
Relaxing. What a way to get around Sydney Harbour to many points. A River Cat ferry also goes down the Parramatta River to Parramatta from Circular Quay

Convenient way to get around the harbour and great scenic views. The ferries have a very convenient schedule especially during rush hour and seem quite efficient. I took the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour and the trip took about 20 minutes. I was able to take great photos of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. Also there's is free wifi - you get 2 free 45 minute sessions a day. I highly recommend taking at least one ferry trip. If you want to take different ferry trips during the day, you should purchase the all-day ticket for $20 (also available for use on the train, trams and buses).

Cheap, cheerful and usually on time. The harbour is the heart of Sydney and the ferries the lifeblood, pumping their way sluggishly around the harbour. Make sure you take advantage of the family excursion tickets on Sundays when $2.50 will get you a day on the harbour stopping at every village and wharf that takes your fancy - and a train ride home again.

The cheapest way to see the harbour, Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Take a trp on the Sydney Ferries to see the spectacular view that is Sydney Harbour. For just over five dollars you can take a trip to Darling Harbour or other places and see the Opera House in all its spectacular glory. A must do and cheap! The best way to get to Taronga Zoo.

Cheap Harbour Tour a must do for tourists. The cheapest and one of the best ways to see the beautiful harbour. This way you can also see the bridge, opera house and the city from the water.I recommend you take the Ferry to and from Manly, but also try one to or from Balmain .. or at least Milsons Point.
Free Wifi On Board. i luv their punctual time, and also free Wifi during the trip. using the mymulti1 ticket that i bought for weekly purpose , very easy and economist.
Slow boat with greatviews. Just the maritime experience, and the wonderful views of the harbor, bridge and opera house

Efficient and nice view. Lots of ferries going everywhere in Sydney Bay, quite fast, allowing nice views, for a cheap price (no need to take a cruise !)
Aspecially go to the zoo, to Manly, around the bridge
Wow what fun. i love the ferries and you cant beat travelling around sydney by Ferry for the views, charm and experience. I do it everytime we go and love it just as much.

Good way to get around. Since the best parts of Sydney are on or near the harbour, the ferries are a good way to get around and see the sites. There is a hop on hop off option (like the hop on hop off bus). Tickets are available at Circular Quay. The staff are very helpful and provide advice on the lowest cost options.

Great way to get out on the Harbour. Less money than going out on a tourist boat trip around the harbour, but less glamourous. During the week, local Sydney-siders use the ferries to commute to work, so they're not the most sophisticated way to travel but they will afford you a less expensive look at the harbour. Take a ferry to the Zoo, Manly or Watson's Bay and check out all the pleasure crafts, big houses, places you'd like to explore further, etc. Be warned - when the sea gets a bit choppy, the Manly ferry can be a bit like taking a scary ride at an amusement park, complete with sprays of water.

My daily commute. I ride the ferry every day. It makes my daily commute a pleasure. They are on time 99% of the time, comfortable, and the crew is always friendly. I've been on pretty much all the ferries at one time or the other and they are the best value in Sydney.
sydney. What a great way to get around to other parts of Sydney. $16.00 to travel return to Manly. $11.20 to travel to Watson's Bay. Easy to find with the display signs and staff very helpful.

A fantastic way to see one of the best harbours in the world!. Sydney Harbour is one of the main things that draws me into to this wonderful city. I never ever tire of being on the harbour and I never tire of viewing it from any angle that reflects the water .... make sure you ride on any of the numerous ferries whether it be to Manly or up the Parramatta river. Do a ferry and explore it for yourself.
Relaxing and unique. A great way to travel and be a part of the harbour. This is a winner for seeing the harbour and accessing the major attractions. Do it!

Forget those expensive tours. Just head to Circular Quay and jump on a ferry. Even a trip to Mosman Bay will delight but with more time, do Watsons Bay or head in the other direction and do Homebush or Balmain.

Ferry to Manly was fun and easy. The schedule ran very often and was easy to catch when convenient.. We took the Manly Ferry and really enjoyed it. It was about a half hour, very comfortable and affordable, and we say great views of Sydney and the Harbor Bridge and Opera House.

what better way to see the habour, apart from your private sail boat of course.. Love the ferries, go on as many as you can! Drinks server on the manly ferrie on Friday nights, great photo opportuniites on the Opera House, bridge and harbour.
Manly ferry - easy and reliable. Every time I travel to Sydney I take a ferry across to Manly - great food places and a relaxing way to see the world famous harbour without paying exorbitant prices

Visitor friendly way to see the harbor and Sydney suburbs!. The Sydney Ferries are very visitor friendly and go to most all of the suburbs of Sydney on a regular timetable. They are very clean and are used by many of the locals as transportation to and from work in Sydney. You can purchase a ticket for all day use which is very reasonably priced. The all day ticket allows you to hop on and off any destination for a 24 hour period. We found this an enjoyable way to see the beautiful harbor and suburbs of Sydney.

Great way to get around the harbour. We caught both the Manly Ferry and the ferry to Watsons Bay.They are regular and reliable services and its like going on a harbour cruise without the big pricetags.
A Great Way To See The City. Clean efficient well run gives a different prospective to the city
Easy to use. Very easy to use and enjoyable to just sit and take in the views.
A great way to see the harbour. Easy to get on and off all around the harbour. On a sunny day its a very pleasant way to see Sydney's water side.

The best way to travel to see Sydney. We enjoyed the wind and sun on our face. We took this transportation every day. We purchased the one week all inclusive ticket for trains, buses, water taxis, ferry. It was the best money we spent, because we could see everything this way, very cost effective
Great with a multi pass. Get a my multi pass and it includes all the ferries great for sightseeing on the cheap.

A great experience. Once again like the rest of Sydney the most expensive transport in Australia. Sydney is over priced in most things Australian compared to the other states however, it has it's own history to enjoy. The ferries are just part of this history so take the trip and the photos.
Fabulous!!. We have travelled on all ferries & visited all destinations....it's a MUST do!!

Easy sight seeing and no hassle ticket. Buying a week's ticket is a great way of seeing all the harbour and city. The system is efficient and the boat to Watsons Bay was a sight seeing trip in itself. Try several of the ferries, especially the one to Parramatta.
Use the ferry service!. The ferries were a wonderful, fun way to get around Sydney harbour! They are cheap and efficient and the most fun way of getting around! We loved using them!

Great ride and value. Although no transportation (that we found) in Sydney is any way low cost, certainly the ferry's are economic and a convenient way to get around in a lot of Sydney, it's great for tourists.
We felt safe at all times and they were quite punctual at least when we were there over Christmas holiday.
you can't miss a trip on Sydney harbour. The history and the beauty of one of the worlds prettiest harbours is there to be experienced on the ferries.
Good value for money. Anyone would prefer a cruise, of course, but the ferries give you great views for a very reasonable fare.
Pretty much covered this. On time and go everywhere.. Liked everything about their system. Offer slow boats and fast boats and go and go and go all day long....

To Manly Beach. Easy access from Circular Quay in central Sydney Harbour. Friendly staff who let us through even though the ferry was just about to leave! Wonderful way to see Sydney Opera House from the water. Great photo op. too! Manly Beach good for diving, or sunning on the wide sandy beach.
Travelling on Ferries. We took an afternoon tour of the Harbour and one to the Torango Zoo

great. This is a great way to see the harbour. Very convenient way to get from Balmain East to Circular Quay or Darling Harbour or the many other routes the Sydney Ferry service has to offer. A bit pricier than the bus but much more delightful
The best way do get around Syndney. Get a MyFerry Pass. Ride all the buses, trains and ferries you like for a week for one price. Mine paid for itself in 2 days!
Not cheap but great way to potter about the Harbour. Very simple way to see the Harbour, get your bearings and pass a half an hour.

A must to do. Very handy, smooth and on time ferries, you ve got to try that every day, it s free on sundays for family with kids. From Circular quays, City center to Manly beaches, that is an amazing way to discover Sydney. Very useful to go working too and not too crowded. It s getting more and more expansive though.
Sydney Ferries. Very easily acccessed and prompt. Staff very helpful with information.
Fantastic way of seeing the Harbour. Cheap, reliable, easy, the ferries are a fabulous way of seeing the entire harbour.
Variety of ferries. Sydney has a variety of ferries from large to small, slow to fast.....take a trip to Manly or the Zoo
On time. The ferries run on time and are a cheap and fun way of getting around. Its great being out on the Harbour too.
Old, run down and too expensive. Compared to virtually everywhere I have been in the world, Sydney ferries are the worst maintained and the most expensive.

Sydney by water... the way to go!!. No other city in the world is as much defined by its natural harbour as Sydney - the water is everywhere, and the best way to see Sydney is from the water. Sydney Ferries operates frequent commuter services from Circular Quay to many harbourside suburbs - Manly, Watsons Bay, Double Bay, Rose Bay, Parramatta, Mosman, Taronga Zoo, to name just a few. It is well worth to buy a one day ticket that allows you unlimited travel on Sydney Ferries, and roam around the excellent ferry network. The boats are fast, clean and efficient, and will take you to places that are not easily approached by car.
Ferry to Darling Harbour. Offers a panoramic view of the harbour, opera house and bridge. Well worth it and is cheap and cheerful. About $6 one way.

Great way to travel in Sydney! Beautiful views. Sydney Ferries are the best way to travel in Sydney, as you get the magnificent views of Sydney Harbour! We went from Circular Quay to the Zoo and also to Manly on the ferries, and the views were amazing, lots of seating room on the ferry and they run regularly, smooth and on time!
Go to Manly. We went yo Manly and had a super day there easy walking round the headland.
Good way to view harbour cheaply. great way to get around by a day pass and travel all you want
Sydney ferries. Such an easy way to get around the Harbour and visit different places.

A different view of the city. We took the ferry from Manly beach back to the city, at dusk and it was great. Take the slow ferry for a few dollars and take an easy trip to see the beauty of the bay. You'll get some great shots of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Well worth the experience. Note: Get on the boat early as the seats infront are quite limited and fill up quite quickly. If you can't find a seat on the 2nd floor open seating area, try going down to the first floor where we can stand for the short 30 min ride.
great way to get round. we shuttled around and even went to the zoo. we saw sights in the Harbor that we wouldn't have seen like the Opera House from the water.

What a great way to get from A to B. Particularly on a sunny day, the Sydney ferries are an attraction in their own right, not just a mode of transport. Whether you're going to Manly, Watsons Bay or Parramatta, the ferries are an enjoyable experience and a great way to spend a Sunday afternoon.
Great way to travel. Loved the ferries . Always seemed to be on time. Friendly staff and great harbour views on your journey.
Best & most leisurely way to travel around Sydney. Such a relaxing way to travel around Sydney. Ferries are frequent and inexpensive.
Best way to see Sydney. Take a ferry from Circular Quay to either Manly or Watsons Bay to take in the harbour sights and the amazing real estate! Most economical way to see the best of the city.
Great way to get around. Reasonably priced, run on time, great views of iconic landmarks from the vantage of Sydney Harbour
Don't leave Sydney without riding the Sydney Ferries. We went to Manly, Watson's Bay for lunch at Doyle's, Darling Harbour, and Luna Park. Very Clean and Very Efficient!

More than a ride!. Taking the Sydney ferries is a great way to get around some of the lifestyle areas of Sydney as well as to explore the harbour, away from the more touristy options. Take the ferries from Circular Quay to places like Manly (for a great day at the beach), Watson's Bay (for a lazy lunch of seafood), Balmain (for cosmopolitan shopping, great cafes and traditional working class architecture), Sydney Zoo (self explanatory) for day trips that are sensational. Best months to do this are February to April, December, and if you are not interested in swimming, August.

Great Views of the Harbour.. One of the cheapest ways to see the Sydney Harbour is by ferry. There are a number of different routes to choose from. The best is the Sydney Zoo ferry because it brings you to the doorsteps of the zoo and it glides right be the Opera House. I must have taken 100 photos as we passed by at various angles. Depending on which ferry you take the rides are not that long (so young kids won't get antsy). There are a couple of things you HAVE to do in Sydney. Riding a ferry is one of them. You can also purchase a MyMulti ticket (one day or weekly) which allows you to travel the trains, buses, and ferries for one price. If you are going to be spending time in Sydney, or prefer mass transit to walking, I would definitely look at this option.
Sydney Ferry. Be sure to ride the ferry at sunset for pictures and take a trip to Manly.
The way to get around Sydney. Don't pay for a harbor cruise, buy a ferry ticket and enjoy the fantastic views of Sydney from the water.
Travel with Harbour views. How can you loose. You get to where you need to go and can check out the beautiful harbour as you go. Fantastic outing on a sunny day.
All the way to Manly. Great views, photo opportunities - most expensive pizza ever!

Tired and dirty - but on time. Sydney ferries does need some attention. Many staff very good, but the Parramatta River ferry "cats" are now in ned of some tlc.Pricing strategy also needs some attention as it can get expensive - however good means to see the City.

Not on a rough day though.. Always love a ride to Manly on the Sydney Ferries. It can get a bit rough going past North/South Head if the swell is up, so be prepared for seasickness if you are prone to that. Personally I love it. Good views of Sydney Harbour Real Estate and also cliffs and parks along the way. Recommend to any tourist in Sydney

Buy day pass - take you to many places!. We bought $20 a multi-pass that is good for ferries, trains and buses all day! We took a ferry to end station of the river, jump on to a train to south beach, back to the city for night cruise to see Opera House and bridge at night. Best Deal in town - just start early and plan ahead where you want to go!

Ferries on Sydney Harbour. The cheapest option for seeing Sydney Harbour from the water. The ferries are old but this gives them character and the route towards Manly and Tarong Zoo allows for wonderful views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. Bring a waterproof coat if you like to stand on the outside as the water spray can be ferocious depending on the weather.
manly ferry. great short trip across the harbor. walk along manly corso to the beach. nice half day trip.
Great way to get around. The ferries are a convenient and pleasant way to get around. Note that there is a reduced fare for seniors.
Easy Peasy!. It is so easy to buy tickets and pick up and understand the timetables. Good value for money and all the ferries were on time and clean!
Great modes of transport. Always clean and on time. The ride to Manly beach on a ferry and the river cat down Parramatta river are worth doing for their own sakes.
A Must. Took us everywhere from Downtown- The Rocks, Opera House, The Bridge. Very scenic ride .
Feedback for the Ferry. Went to Watsons Bay on the ferry, cheap and fast worth every penny just for the trip alone, Watsons Bay is worth spending a few hours walking around

I took it many Times, it s a must and cheaper than the tourist boat.. I took it from Sydney to Manly. It s Good alternative to the touristique boat and it s much cheaper for the same result. There is a great view over the bridge, the opéra, the overseas passager terminal, the circular Quay the City of Sydney and the highest buildings. Ifs a must
Modern yet old. Some have been around forever like the Narrabeen etc look old on the outside but with refurbishement on the inside

Don't grab a cab if a ferry will do.... Too many people hop in a cab without checking ferry locations. Many visitors to SYD often don't realise there are commuter ferries! For the low price of $5, you can get to many of Sydney's waterside suburbs with an amazing view of the harbour, bridge, opera house and Barangaroo thrown in for free!
